reviews.review: Best day ever. We went on the extraordinary elephant day trip. We had a fantastic day starting with a prompt pick up in a luxury mini bus for 7 of us onto floating market, bridge over river kwai, lunch then onto the elephants it was an amazing experience. A ride on them first then into the river we went on a elephant each the fun we had was sooo good if you fall in they pick up by their trunks you will get wet Thanks so much for taking fab pics and a video we are still laughing at. I would recommend this tour and company to anyone.

5 star treatment! Champagne taste on a beer budget!. Driver was waiting for us a few minutes early (bonus points) in our hotel lobby -luxury van ready to roll for our private tour! Actually because of the price we thought it was going to be a group tour. Driver was great and we picked up wonderful guide "Bow". Did the floating market (tourist trap) and they let us cut that short because at the last minute my wife wanted to see the baby tiger! So for a very small adder we were whisked off to play with and feed a baby tiger. Then on to the elephant camp where riding bareback and getting wet was the highlight of our entire trip!!!I suggest booking with these guys - you won't regret it. Next trip I am considering hiring their van and driver for custom tours because it is first class all the way!

Floating Markets and Elephant Trekking...Awesome Tour Guides Kent and Joe!!!. Can't say enough good things about this tour. We did the floating market and Elephant trekking. Wow, wow, wow, is all I can say. Such an awesome experience, a must do and worth every penny. Kent and Joe were our private tour guides and driver for the day. They picked us up at the hotel and took us to the floating markets, then to the bridge, afterwards we were taken to have lunch and then spent the last part of our trip with the elephants. Riding the elephants on their back backs was such an amazing experience. You feel nervous and excited all at the same time. Kent and Joe were amazing as they also became our videographer and photographer during the whole excursion. Thank you for making this such an epic trip, definitely the highlight to our entire trip in Thailand!!!

Epic day with big cats and elephants. We booked the tour based off reviews and our trip far exceeded expectations. We got to walk a tiger and play with baby lions/leopards in the morning. Then taken to a great lunch before off to elephant park. Spending the afternoon riding the elephants and swimming with them in river was an amazing experience. Our tour guide and driver were top notch and we couldn't have asked for a more epic day!

bespoke elephant trip. This tour operator was very accomodating to enable us to do a full elephant experience on our one day stop over. Arranged it all in UK by email and deposit transfer. They have a standard tour inc bridge over river kwai and a market with hotel pick up. We arranged for airport pick up (off redeye from london) then drove straight to the elephants 3hours as this was our priority. A great elephant sanctuary. we rode and swam with our elephants with mahouts. had plenty of time with them in the water bareback. Top tip: dont worry what you look like wear a thin shirt and trousers. there are showers so a complete change of clothes and a polly bag does the trick. i also wore light dive shoes for grip. Elephant hair is wire like and if you are up close it could hurt you legs for the rest of your holiday. My elephant Ma, held me on with her ears when we went downhill into the river. our guide spoke excellent english and told us all about culture and took great photos for us. it was just us 2.

Elephant/ Tiger Tour. We booked this tour extremely last minute and they were grateful enough to facilitate our request, which was a major benefit. A deposit of 4000THB was required through PayPal and the next day they picked us up. The tour included the feeding of leopard Cubs as well lion cubs which was more than worth it! Followed up by a quick safari tour of the reminder of the animals and giraffe feeding! It included breakfast (sandwiches and chips) and a traditional Thai lunch. In regards to the lunch, everyone has a set menu which was extremely delicious but I guess that could be a problem for some. Lastly for the elephant ride, the bonus of the tour is that we walked straight to the front of the already growing line and proceeded with our elephant ride. Life changing to say the least. I don't see how anyone could mess that up to be honest. The only issue with this tour is that it's 2-3 hours away from Bangkok, but on the plus side they take you everywhere you need to go. If you can't handle really long car rides, I would give this option a second guess.

A feast for the senses.. This was a great day out. Speeding in a boat to the floating market. A sensory overload. Great lunch overlooking lily ponds. Show with traditional dancing, fake fighting and Asian elephants (cruel). Mai Tais on a slower boat on the return leg to central Bangkok. Overall very good

Elephant Ride and Tiger/Leopard feeding . Awesome tour!!!! Our personal driver Tom was excellent in every way!!! Our personal guide Bow was above and beyond anything we had imagined. Now was not only knowledgeable and friendly, she took the extra effort to take hundreds of pictures on our phones of us enjoying the tour. It is a 2 hour ride from Bangkok to the first attraction, then slowly work your way to finish with the elephant riding. The ride back is 3 hours but the van is comfortable and we were able to recline and nap. Overall outstanding value for a lifetime of memories!!!

A must do tour. This was a great Tour great driver amazing Tour guide. If I could go back id do it again especially if I could get the same guides. Thank you so much Bow and Tone for such a memorable experience.

Tigers and Elephants. This was one of the best days of my life! I have dreamed of holding a baby tiger since I was a small child and that was the reason for coming to Thailand. I was able to walk an 8 month old tiger on a walk around the jungle and then was able to hold Chanel (baby lion), Gucci (baby leopard) and the highlight for me. Miss Louis Vuitton (baby tiger)! I was able to feed them each a bottle and then play with them. It was truly a magical day for me. We then went to an elephant camp and I was able to ride an elephant and then play with the elephant in the river. I was scared to death to ride the elephant, the elephant trainer and my guide were very kind and patient and let me get off when I was ready. The elephant tour ended and I was able to feed and pet a baby elephant. My guide and driver were fantastic, I couldn't have asked for better. Truly, an amazing, beautiful experience! I can't recommend this tour enough!!

Tour guide Green and driver joe made our day the best!!. We were a family of four adults . very well organized . The van was comfortable . floating market was intresting .Bought old english music cds being sold at the kwai river , then off to the elephant camp was the best ...THE BEST !! .Lunch was tasty .Green and Joe God bless BEST TOUR GUIDES!! . we had the best time . was deifinately worth it !!

Damnoen Saduak floating market and Ayutthaya temples. My husband and I booked this tour on our last day in Thailand and were very happy with the experience. Our guide was wonderful and very informative. This tour does have a good amount of drive time (90 minutes to the markets and then two hours from there to the temples and another hour or so back) but the drive was pleasant and the van was comfortable. This floating market is mainly tourists, but that was fine for us since we still needed to get gifts for people from home, but if you are looking for an authentic Thai experience then you would probably do better at a weekend market. The tour includes 3 ancient temples, two of which are mostly ruins, so if you want glittering gold this is not for you but if you're more into history then this is perfect and you can still see a lot of art details on the 1st and third temple.

Not for those who care. Transfer service was private and great, brdige over river kwai was great to see and floating market was good fun. Lunch was also good although drinks arent included (which at over £100 pp is a bit silly). However the elephant experience itself is not something I would repeat. I was concerned about welfare before booking this but booked based on the positive reviews (no mention of neglect), hoping that the fact the trip was quite expensive would mean the elephants werelooked after and not just constantly on the go. I didnt see neglect per say but definately not what was expected - elephant ride itself was very short and just through clump of brush nearby so not really a trek. Was most looking forward to bathing the elephants - but this was just the mahouts giving the elephants commands over and over again to dunk us and spray water etc. I wanted to just spend some time with these fantastic animals, a bit more naturally, but didnt get the chance. We also only got about 25 mins with the elephants in total rather than the 1 hour advertised. I brought this up and recieved a partial refund but then had issues as the amount came through to my account was significantly lower than that agreed and on bringing this up was not recieved very well. Give the elephants a miss - you will feel better for it. And if you would still like to see the market etc there are other trips that can be booked for 1/4 the price.

Don't do the tiger cub feeding or elephant ride!!!. I booked the elephant riding and tiger cub feeding tour, which had the cemetery and train track included. I was very disappointed with this tour, especially because it was so expensive.Although Ken came to pick me up on time and I had the cab to myself and it was air conditioned, within 10mins of my journey, I was told that I would not be feeding tigers but leopards. Ken then spent the next 30 minutes, trying to convince me to feed the leopards, but I refused to settle for something that I did not pay for. Eventually he called through to his head office and they agreed to let me feed the tiger cub. Great right! (keep reading).Once at the safari park for the tiger cub feeding, I was given a bus all to myself and I could feed the giraffes too. As we drove through the safari park it was dry and bare. The animals that were there looked sedated as they just laid in the sun unmoving. Ken said it was because they were too tired, but the big cats and bears looked sedated to me - I could be wrong. The giraffes scared me (I can laugh about it now). Four giraffes came in the bus to get the food, I thought they would attack me - they didn't, but Ken laughed at me which wasn't very helpful - but I'm sure it was funny.The Safari park was quiet and Ken made a point to mention that people from England don't usually come on the tour anymore and that the tours have been quite quiet - don't go, I wouldn't advise anyone to go, from England or anywhere. I saw one baby tiger; he was on a leash the entire time I was with him. I fed him for about 2 minutes and then walked him for about 2 minutes. The handler was there at all times. He took pictures of us which were very nice, but I felt sorry for the tiger, he looked unhappy and he had no freedom. His handler was quite mean to him too.We then went for lunch and Ken left me to sit by myself, whilst he sat with the other tour guides and drivers, which was fine, but I didn't like the food that much and I still had to pay for drinks, as drinks were not included in the tour - which I thought was poor because the tour was so expensive already.Next we went to the elephant ride. I urge everyone not to do this!!!! The elephants were old and looked tired. As I got on the back of the one I was riding, I saw to holes in his head that looked like injection holes. I was not impressed. I didn't like the experience of being on the elephant either, so I took pictures and then got down immediately. I wish I went to the elephant sanctuary in Chiang Mai like a friend of mine did. You don't get to ride the elephants but you get to play with them and get up close and personal. One thing I learnt from the elephant sanctuary was that the elephants needed mud on them, as a form of sunscreen. Unfortunately, the elephants here had no mud on them and they were in chains. As you wait for an elephant to be available to ride, there is an elephant in a pen who is there for picture purposes. He looked very unhappy and had no space to roam. He was stuck in this tiny pen unable to move around. All in all, it was a horrible experience and I don't think the animals were being treated well. I'm not the biggest animal lover, but any injustice and unfair treatment/cruelty to animals makes me feel uncomfortable and that is how I felt all day on this tour. If you want to experience tigers and elephants, I would say go to the places in Chiang Mai, I had friends that I met in Bangkok who went there and they loved it and from the pictures the animals looked happy. If I didn't book this tour in advance and paid so much money, I would have gone to Chiang Mai, but you live and you learn. I would not recommend this tour or using Bangkok Day Tours either for animal tours, I think the animals are unfairly treated and if people continue to pay for these tours, I doubt the treatment of the animals will improve. It felt like everyone just wanted to make their money, they didn’t appear to care about the animals at all.Ken was very pleasant and tired his hardest to ensure I had a good day, but I couldn't help think he was covering up for the company and their mistreatment of animals.

Elephant Tour . We pre booked this trip as a 60th birthday gift for my husband. What a wonderful experiences with many happy memories for us to talk about when we get home. After an early start of 7.00 am pick up by our driver Tong we drove for approximately 1.5 hours to the floating market in Dumneon. Unusual way to shop and not as busy as the canals in Bangkok. Picked up a couple of bargains after bartering for a good price. Next stop was Bridge over River Kwai. A must see on a trip to Thialand. We were lucky to watch a train arrive at the station then travel over the bridge. Has become very commercialised and probably spoils the memory of the bridge . Next a stop for traditional Thai lunch at a roadside restuarant . Good food but too much . We then headed off for another 1hours drive into the mountains for our trip to the elephants. Our tour guide H tried to teach us commands for the elephants during the drive up. We decided to ride bareback on the elephants. It was a bit scary at first and thought we would fall off with every step the elephant took. Managed to relax and hold on for the 30 mins . Mahoot travelled with us and guided the elephant round while H (tour guide ) took control of our camera with many memorable shots . Finally arrived at the river and spent about 20 mins in the water with mahouts and elephants. Fantastic experience .

Memories for ever....... We booked the floating markets, Bridge on the River Kwai and Tiger Cub, Wildlife Sanctuary Safari tour for my wife, myself and town kids (14 & 18) and it was a great experience.Mixed emotions of the three elements, the culture of the market, the depth of feeling of the bridge and the care at the wildlife sanctuary.The day started from our hotel in Bangkok at 7am met by our guide Bo and her driver. She was very knowledgable throughout the tour and made it feel that it was 'our day'.The floating market was a cool experience not to be missed, if you take pictures you will love the backgrounds and the faces.The Bridge was an opportunity to understand the sacrifice of so many and to pay respect. Possibly too touristy now but recommend watching the 'old' film with Sir Alec Guiness either before or after a visit.After this time for lunch which was great traditional Thai food and most enjoyable in nice surroundings.Then on to part which surpassed everything! The wildlife sanctuary and the leopard Cubs plus more! The most impressive thing here is the animals are cared for and looked after in a good environment. The opportunity to play with the Cubs and get down close with them was a once in a lifetime experience we will never forget. But then to take the bus through the park and have the photo opportunities was unreal!But the cherry on the cake was the giraffes, up close and personal to feed, the leopard Cubs are cute but these guys are big and gentle!Fabulous day!

Time of My Life!!. I never write reviews, however, because of the phenomenal tour this was, I HAD to!! My girlfriend and I had Na(tour guide) and Jo(driver). They were so incredible that no words could do justice! Na loved to take photos and she's great with camera settings, angles, lighting, etc. She captured some of the most memorable moments for us! She was very informative and taught us a variety of interesting things! She truly worked her tail off in making us feel important and doing all she possibly could. Jo was absolutely incredible and provided water, snacks, AC, and let us sleep on the drive without any interruption. The adventure itself is beyond anything I could describe so I sure hope you find out for yourself! Enjoy!

Amazing day tour. We had tour guide Molly who took us for a day to the floating market, bridge over River KWAI and to the elephants to bathe then.These memories will last a lifetime.The floating market was fun, we bought my little girls some dresses, a purse and some gifts - we negotiated at least half price for them.The bridge was inspiring - we saw how they worked years ago to build it and we saw the memorial - this is just a tourist trap place but if you are in the area it should be seen.Final stop was the elephant sanctuary. First I was scared as they elephant was so high but they took me a show me how that the elephants were safe and happy and told me on 28years they never had anyone fall off. So we went ahead and bathe with the elephants. The elephants were so happy. They were flapping their ears. No miss treatment here!! No mahoots hitting elephants or the bad stuff- that was great.Super enjoyable!!Thank you Molly and driver you made our day!!

Best time at Bangkok day tours with Na!. We decided to to the animal sanctuary with Bangkok day tours. What a fun day! They came and picked us up at our hotel at 8am and drove outside of Bangkok about 2 hours, picking up our tour guide Na on the way. She was a riot! So much fun and full of interesting facts and info. We first toured the bridge and learned some history about it. Na took so many pictures with our phones, she's an excellent photographer and knew all the spots for the best shots. She basically took over the picture taking so we could enjoy the tour. Following the bridge, Na took us to a great complimentary lunch at this little hotel on the river. It was so tranquil And peaceful, and the food was amazing! We got a couple beers there too for a little extra baht. Then we drove over to the sanctuary and got in a little safari bus to which the animals come up to eat the food provided by the tour. We saw giraffes, deer, zebras, lions, tigers and leopards. The last three we didn't feed. Then at the end, you have the option to feed the baby Cubs for an extra 300 bt a pop. We decided to feed the baby tiger and the leopards.. Which were definitely not at all sedated, which was good! I was happy to see the animals treated respectfully! The Cubs were sooo cute and definitely wild, but we were not scared! We fed and played with them for a while with Na taking photos and the handler keeping watch. One thing I didn't know was the Elephants you see in all the photos in the water with people, is a totally DIFFERENT tour and if you choose the sanctuary, you do not see the elephants. I saw they had some you can ride there somewhere but we didn't do that so we didn't see any. Next time I would love to try the elephant tour. Huge shout out to Na for being so awesome! Tipping is highly recommended as well for the guide and a little something for the driver.

Burma-Thai death railway- a must day tour! . Fantastic day tour. Guide had so much information to share. War cemetery & museum, Train ride, hell fire pass, lunch & air conditioned van! Absolutely a must! Our guide Ken was fantastic Thankyou

Must Do!. Our guide, Bo, and driver, Joe, were waiting for us downstairs before our pick up at 7am. They took us to the floating market, River Kwai, lunch stop, and then to the elephant camp. They were both very nice and accomodating... stopping to let us use the bathroom when needed, as well as to get some coffee & thai tea. The restaurant we ate at in the country had thee BEST food we ate in Thailand. Although we had to fight off a million flies for it, it was worth it. They also got plenty of photos and videos of our experience. Would definitely book another tour with them. This was one of the best experiences we had while in Bangkok!

A must do tour!. We went on a tour that included the tiger feeding, visiting the bridge over the River Kwai and Elephant riding. Our tour guide, Ken was so nice and informative. Since it was a private tour, we didn't feel rushed at all. Make sure Ken orders you the Tom Kha Gai for lunch, it was one of the best soups we've ever had.

Elephant bare back . My friend and I went on the elephant bare back tour. We got picked up on time and were told we were the only ones on that tour! Perfect! The driver was nice, didn't speak a lot of English but he prepared some snacks for us and plenty of water through out the day. We picked up the tour guide after the floating market, who spoke better English. He was very knowledgable when telling us about the river Kwai. The elephant part was amazing! The best day of my travels yet! If I got the opportunity to do it again, I would go with Bangkok day tours!

Safari Day Trip. Had the best time with Bangkok Day tours! We booked the day trip to the Khwai Yai River, Floating Market, and lastly the Safari. Being able to experience feeding Cubs and actually engaging with an adult tiger was unbelievable. This trip was made extra special by our tour guide, who was an absolute gem (plus a wonderful photographer)!

Trip #1118 Floating Market, Tigers, Elephants. Molly and Joe (driver) gave us an exciting day. They promptly picked us up from our hotel and took us to floating market. Molly was great at giving the sellers a stern look if they tried to sell something too high. She guided me on things to try and eat. We arrived early on a Saturday and market wasn't busy. On to the Tiger Temple. Not a temple to visit and I isn't see any monks, but we bottle fed a 5 month old tiger, went on a safari ride and fed deer, giraffes, and zebras from a truck. That was the most fun!Lastly, we rode the elephants in the jungle. A bit scary at first, but handler was great.Molly always had a bottle of water and snacks ready in the van.Good trip.

Dameon brown . Great tour , trip was booked a few months in advance ,our driver tong pick us up at the hotel at 7 a.m first stop was at the floating market boat ride is included in the package make sure to always negotiate the price in most instances its between a 40 to 70 % off the initial asking price for items .Our tour guide Bo was picked up a short time later she was very knowledgeable about the local area ,next stop was at the bridge lot of history about that area then off to lunch make sure to have the local currency as drink is not included in the meal and they dont accept foreign currency. Next stop was the elephant sanctuary you get to ride your elephant with a guide in the river ps. Tip your tour guide well you wont regret it the photos she took was amazing and also tip you elephant guide preferably in local currency .

Amazing Day in Thailand . I booked this trip for myself and my 18yo daughter who just graduated from high school. We have done animal encounter before and really enjoyed them and chose this company based on the reviews. Initially, we were disappointed to find out that the Tiger Temple was closed (out of their control), but the tour company contacted us immediately and gave us another tour option. So, our tour consisted of the Safari Zoo petting the lion, leopard and tiger cubs, walking with the older leopards and the giraffe encounter. And we visited the Elephant Farm in the afternoon. We were picked up at our hotel promptly at 0600. He was very friendly and spoke decent English. Along the way, we picked our tour guide, Na. Wow. She made the tour even ten times better. I am an avid world traveller and she is the BEST tour guide that I have ever had. She was beyond knowledgeable and took over my iPhone for the day. It's like paying a professional photographer and animal trainer to tour with you. And it was a private tour with only the two of us. By the end of the day, I had hundreds of photos and videos of memories of our trip. And she handles the animals so beautifully. I could go on and on but I can finish by saying that you will not regret booking one of their tours.

Best part of our stay in Bangkok!. My husband and I were recently in Bangkok for ~4 days as part of the 2nd leg of our honeymoon. We had booked Tour #1118 - Floating Market, Bridge over River Kwai, Tiger Temple, and then the Elephants. We loved our tour guide, Ken, who shared his knowledge on Thai culture/history during the drive, and seemed genuinely enthusiastic about everything. He took great care of us and made sure we got plenty of pictures at each attraction. Often times he even offered to carry my purse for me so I could roam about freely. Ken asked us our preferences and let us know that if we wanted to spend more time at a certain attraction, then he would cater the tour to our needs so we could spend more time with what we were interested in. The tour started off with a ~1.5 hour drive out to the Floating Markets. We got there early enough to avoid the crowds and leisurely enjoy the paddle boat ride throughout the market. Ken also asked if we were interested in getting some photos with snakes and a cute little lemur monkey, and of course I volunteered! After the Floating Markets it was another ~1 hour drive out to the Bridge over River Kwai, where we walked across the bridge and then had a nice Thai buffet lunch. Ken created a sampler plate of Thai desserts for us to try, and everything was so delicious! We got coconut ice cream cones to go. From there, it was about another 30-40 mins to the Tiger Temple. Again, Ken made sure we got plenty of pictures. Then finally, we had our last stop of the day with the elephants, which was about another 30 min drive from the Tiger Temple. It was a 3-4 hour drive back into Bangkok (we stayed at The Peninsula), but luckily our SUV car was very comfortable so my husband and I both fell asleep during the ride. We would highly recommend this tour to anyone planning a trip to Bangkok, and definitely recommend Ken as your tour guide!

Best Day in SE Asia. Of the 17 days I spent in SE Asia, the day I spent with Bangkok Day Tours was by far the best! My tour, arranged on short notice, included the floating market, the Bridge over the River Kwai and elephant "experience". The floating market was interesting and from a historical (and beautiful setting) perspective, the Kwai River Bridge is just a great place to see.My guide Bo (photo attached), was most knowledgeable of every location and charming/engaging. The excellent driver, Mr. Ho and his vehicle/large van, great for touring. The elephant ride and river swim was probably one of the most unique "life's experiences" ever. Outstanding mahout and thanks to Bo, great photos/videos of my elephant ride/swim. I cannot recommend Bangkok Day Tours any higher, just the best.

AMAZING DAY/EXPERIENCE Recommend for anyone. I was happy and smiling all day from ear to ear with our English speaking guides Joe and Na!Itinerary: Extraordinary Elephant Day Tour. *note this is actually a private tour for how many are in your party when you book it...something I didn't realize until we were picked up by our driver in the morning. Highlights/Pros: 1) Private, large, comfortable van and English speaking tour guides the entire day (no changing of tour guides along the way). 2) Experienced tour guides who gave us tips on how to make the most of our time/day at each location, took our photos quickly, efficiently, and knew how to take the photos to make the most scenic, beautiful and memorable ones with our personal devices.3) Meeting, bathing, and riding the elephants at the end of the day. Things to note that I didn't prior to booking:1) each destination for the day can be quite far from each other...anywhere from 1-2 hours of driving, and then at the end of the day it's a straight 4 hours return to Bangkok. Come prepared with a book, or something to do if you can't hold conversation or enjoy scenery/music along the way.2) This is a private tour for you and the number that you book it for. So you won't be meeting up with strangers like a normal "tour" company does. Things to know in general:1) There are ways to charge your personal devices in the van if you need to, in addition to tour guides having portable power bank chargers. You may just have to bring your charging cord with the USB on one side.2) if you're a snacker, bring or buy snacks at the floating market to last you the day.3) drink plenty of water, the van will always be stocked with water in the mini cooler. and use sunscreen.4) When at the floating market, the boat driver will stop at certain kiosks, you will be pressured into buying something. If you don't want to buy it, just say no thank you and ask your driver to move on and vice versa if you see something you want to eat/buy.

Tiger Temple Breakfast + Elephant Ride & Bathing (Code:1511).. My companion and I spent 10 days touring Thailand, and this was easily the highlight of our trip. I cannot sign enough praise for our tour guide, Na. She was positively amazing!! Our tour started in the very early hours of the morning (getting picked up at 4:30 am) but she was teeming with energy and excitement from the moment we met her all the way until we were forced to part ways. She was exceedingly knowledgable about everything we did, such as the history of the Bridge of Kwai River. Beyond that, Na could be a professional photographer. She spent the entirety of our tour together with both our camera and our phone (at the same time!!) snapping pictures and taking video, and we came out with some breath-taking pictures to help document such a wonderful day. We never felt rushed or pushed to do anything, and Na made sure we got our fill of everything that we possibly could before moving on to the next step. As we went on other tours in other parts of Thailand, my companion and I couldn't help but compare these other guides to Na and always feel that she was far superior. We wish we could have taken her with us everywhere! Thank you Na, for making such a wonderful trip even better than we could have dreamed.

Best day tour we've done! A "Bucket List" Trip!. My husband and I booked the day trip that started with Kateyada (nicknamed Nuch?) picking us up at the hotel with the driver (Mr O). We asked how many others were on the trip and we were the only ones! So we effectively got a private tour! The Floating Markets were the first stop. Kateyada took loads of photos of us both all day. Mr O was lovely too - quiet but with a great sense of humour that came out about an hour into the tour. We then headed to the Bridge over the river Kwai. Again plenty of pictures and walked across the bridge. Then wonderful buffet lunch in a fabulous floating restaurant. Best lunch we've had on a tour I might add! Then the complete highlight of the day. The Tigers. Wow! If you do nothing else in Bangkok you MUST see these. The most amazing experience of both our lives - with half my phone's memory taken up with photos of us with them. We walked one to the photo area then got pictures with us behind (ie touching) about 6 or so of the different tigers. Then on to the Elephants - which were great but unfortunately the Tigers were so amazing that we found the Elephants a little less interesting because of it. But we had a ride and then fed our elephant a bucket of Bananas as thanks. The trip with Bangkok Day Tours isn't cheap - but I can tell you it is worth every penny. They take fantastic care of you, ensure you are comfortable and go that extra mile all day. They provide cold bottles of water, some snacks if you want them, lunch, hold your bags while you sit for photos, provide lots of info all day long. Kateyada even had a phone charger that charged up my phone half way through the day to ensure it was full for photos all day long. She was a complete delight and I thoroughly recommend both Her, Mr O (our driver) and BDT's if you want a great unforgettable day.

Amazing day with the Elephants. We booked our day tour with Bangkok Day Tours and our guide was Molly. From the pick up at the hotel to seeing the Floating Market, Bridge, lunch and the Elephant ride, Molly was amazing! She has thought of every detail from hand wipes to snacks and even small bags to put our wet clothes in after our elephant encounter. I could have not enjoyed my day more! Thank you Molly for an amazing experience in your country.

Unforgettable Experience. Through Bangkok Day Tours we booked the Tiger Temple Breakfast + Elephant Ride & Bathing (Code:1511). Booking was seamless and all the information was there easily accessible and understandable. We met our driver and our guide Sally in the lobby. Sally was fantastic, very knowledgeable and a very talented photographer! We have some of our best photos (as a couple overall!) thanks to Sally and they're still in frames and albums everywhere. That was really great, she captured our enjoyment perfectly.The Bridge and the River Kwai was very sobering and interesting to see. We even got to stand on the side as a train went over! It was en enlightening experience.The Tiger temple was great fun. Being able to experience donating to the monks was a treat. The tigers from babies to full grown adults were mostly well behaved (there were some cheeky nippy ones!) and so adorable. Truly an experience I'll never forget. I'm very glad we did this tour as part of being able to get there early, we washed them and played with them and walked them. It was unforgettable.The elephant ride was great fun if not a little scary at the beginning. The handlers were fantastic. I couldn't believe they'd take us down to the river and we could splash around with them! They threw us around with their trunks, sprayed us, sloshed around with us. Some of the most fun I've ever had. The vehicle and the drive was very comfortable. Thank you Sally and Bangkok Day Tours for an experience I will never forget!!

Amazing Day. We did the River Kwai, breakfast with the Monks, Tiger Temple & Elephant Tour today and it was amazing! We were a little disappointed that there were no tiger cubs (they have not had Cubs for 9 months) but we still got to feed the younger tigers milk via a baby bottle which was lovely. Lots of photo opportunities and really enjoyed playing with the Tigers in their enclosure. Felt absolutely safe the whole time - the volunteer Thai women will protect you at all costs!! We must say though that the highlight of our day was swimming with the elephants - what amazing creatures they are - gentle giants. Our Tour Guide for the day was Bo - what a delightful young lady she is. Bo made sure that we did not miss a thing and she is the BEST photographer. It was like we had our own private photographer for the day. Jo was our driver and he was extremely good at it. We had the van all to ourselves and it was so comfortable. It had all the mod cons and we were able to watch our videos of the day in the car on the way home. The tour wasn't cheap but we feel that it was totally worth every cent.

Bangkok Royal Temple Tour. Highly recommend this tour, especially our guide Sompit and driver. She was full of knowledge about the places we visited and looked after us very well. She's also a very good photographer.

Wildlife santuary tour. I loved our tour. The driver and guide were both awesome. Our guide was Na (I think that is how she said it) she was amazing. I have never had a private tour before and she went above and beyond. She knew where all the good picture spots were. And she had an eye for taking pictures. She took hundreds when we climbed in for feeding some baby leopards. We also got to feed some giraffes and elephants ( $ extra) I don't have any pics of the giraffes but it was awesome!I had so much fun! Can I go again tomorrow? If we had more time in Bangkok I would do more tours with them and request Na.

Ayutthaya and Kanchaburi Anzac Day 3 days. Cannot speak highly enough. Bangkok Day Tours are highly organised, deliver exactly what they say they will and the accommodation and restaurants they engage are top quality. Our guide Molly and driver Non were exceptional, and they ensured we were exactly where we needed to be to get the best vantage points and seats for the Dawn Service. Would recommend their tours without hesitation.

DON't MISS! River Kwai Bridge, Breakfast at Tiger Temple, Elephant Bathing/Riding INCREDIBLE EXPERIENCE. First class tour operators all the way. Selected the triple-play tour #1511 which covered an early morning visit to The River Kwai Bridge, then a full 3-4 hours with the monks and Tigers at Tiger Temple, and finishing up the day with an elephant ride and bathing/playing in the river. Realize the this is a 4:30 AM start so be prepared since you are covering a lot in one day. Based on previous TA Reviews, requested 'Bo' as the Tour Guide. Perfect choice. Great command of English, friendly, knowledgeable, and was a tremendous help acting as a photographer for me since I was a solo traveler. Can't thank her enough for that as the pictures are outstanding. the van driver Tong also was super, courteous, and kind.The day started at 4:30 AM. Tong was waiting in the hotel lobby right on time. Pleasantly surprised to find I had a mini-bus completely to myself very comfortable and spacious and great air conditioning. We set off, picked up our tour guide 'Bo' along the way, and in 2 hours we were at the River Kwai Bridge. We took photos, walked the length of the bridge, then started our journey to Tiger Temple. Tong had purchased a small pre-breakfast for me as well so I had some extra food to eat before the Tiger Temple.At Tiger Temple we enjoyed buffet breakfast with the monks while surrounded by Tigers. We were able to bottle feed the 6 Tigers in the Temple here and take loads of pictures up close. We then took turns walking a Tiger to their bathing spot and each person had a chance to wash and hand feed them. We then walked an adult Tiger (over 2 years) down to their pool/play area where we each got our 'head in lap' photos. After this, we watched 4 Tigers jump, swim, and play in their pool before heading to the Elephant Park. Awesome stuff!At the elephant park, we started with a bareback ride down into the River Kwai where I was lifted several times by the elephant's trunk and dropped back into the river. What fun! I even was able to stand on the elephants head and jump off. I then rode the elephant out or the river and around the park for 15 min.The day finished with an excellent buffet Thai lunch around 1 PM before heading out on the long journey back to Bangkok (3 hours).Do yourself a favor and spend the full morning at Tiger Temple. Much more interaction with the Tigers. Also, assuming you are fit enough, take the bathing portion of the elephant experience. Playing in the water with them adds loads to the overall experience rather than just taking a ride. Thanks again Bo, Tong, and Bangkok Day Tours for an experience of a Lifetime. I will be back for sure.

Great Tours. We did two tours. The Bangkok Sea Restaurant Tour which was a boat ride through the canals to a sea resturant where we ate a feast.Thanks to Molly our guide. The second tour we did was the Bangkok Temples and Canals Tour, where we visited the reclining Buddha and the Grand Palace followed by a boat trip through the canels, then we finished off with a great lunch. Thanks to Kate our guide. Both tours were great.

War Museum, Death Valley and Elephant Fun!!!. The day trip was excellent and very good value for money. The shuttle to Kanachuburi was relatively smooth and we visited the war museum which was small but interesting. The Bridge of the River Kwai was impressive and the train journey through death valley and the surrounding area was hot but interesting. After a lunch at the local restaurant we went to the Elephants which was incredible. The elephant rides were fun and the opportunity to bathe them and get showered constantly by these such beautiful, gentle giants was humbling. Excellent day, excellent guide, Excellent Value.

Excellent day tours in Bangkok . Excellent cost benefit. We had two day tours with Bangkok Day Tours, they were both amazing. We had a fantastic stay in Bangkok and we highly recommend the city and this company.

EXPERIENCE OF A LIFETIME. Bangkok Day Tours was awesome! We opted to have breakfast with the monks, tiger temple and bathing/riding elephants. It was every bit of what we expected. We were surprised at how well trained the tigers and elephants were. Our tour escort did such a phenomenal job taking pictures throughout the day. You can't go wrong with Bangkok Day Tours.

Floating Market, River Kwai, and Tiger Temple Day Tour. We had a great day with our private guide and driver going to the floating markets, the bridge at the river Kwai, and the Tiger Temple. Our guide was very knowledgable and helpful when it came to bargaining for souvenirs and what to do at the tiger temple. Tour was a little pricey based on what we paid for other tour companies on the other days of our trip. Van very nice and comfortable.

Amazing experience & service. Used BDT for an amazing day to floating market, tiger temple & elephant ride.I was a little dubious as to how this would be as you hear the horror stories of animal mistreatment etc. But I should not have worried.Our guides & drives were Jo & Na, I requested them after reading other reviews, they were amazing, alway on time, never left our side & super informative. Floating market was an eye opener with sights & smells new to us, saw an 11ft albino anaconda & dos some bartering for goods then back to our air conditioned can to head to tiger temple. The whole time we wee kept comfortable with drinks & snacks all free! Tiger temple was amazing, yes I am sure there are horrible ones in Thailand but this was not, the animals mainly roamed free apart from the older tigers which were on long chains, not drugged & very responsive, we got to fee a baby tiger & play with them in a pen which was fun. We then headed to the elephant farm by a large river, we ride them down & played in river, washed them etc. This was a truly amazing day, picked up at 7am & dropped off at 7pm long day but we will never forget it!

Great Day Out. Four of us (2 couples in our 50's) went on a great day out with Bangkok Day Tours. We were picked up promptly at our hotel in a very luxurious minibus with huge seats, just for us 4 on this private tour.  We firstly went to the floating market, where you hop into a little boat and stop off at different stalls and other floating boats where they sale all sorts of things.We then went to the Bridge over the River Kwai, a great photo opportunity. There we had a lovely buffet lunch with a good choice of lovely Thai food. After lunch we travelled to go on to the highlight of the day, the Elephants, where we all rode bareback on one Elephant each. Firstly we rode down to the river where we got in with the Elephants and absolutely soaked each other. Then a trek around the grounds still on the Elephants back, but joined by my wife on the same Elephant.....a great memory that we will never forget. I would like to pay a special thank you to Bow, our tour guide, she was just so lovely and Mr Lim our driver.A fantastic day out of the busy Bangkok area.....Highly recommended.

Great company. We did the elephant day trip with the floating markets and river kwai , there is a lot of travelling in between the places but worth it. Very comfortable transport and good tour guides made our day very good. So pleased I had the experiences I had with the elephants.

Fantastic Day! Extraordinary Elephant Trip. This was the most memorable experience from myself and my boyfriend's time in Bangkok! It is advertised on the website as a group tour but when Joey turned up at our hotel it was just us on the trip. We had a lovely air conditioned minibus to ourselves with water and snacks provided for the journey. Joey did all the driving and he was very polite and accommodating. We drove up to the floating markets first which were about an hour and a half out of the city. It was still early in the day so nice and cool, we had our own little boat and spent about half an hour paddling around. The vendors are very pushy and there is no room for escape but a smile and a small shake of the head will usually deter them. For this part of the trip you must try the coconut pancakes cooked on one of the wooden boats floating around! The noodle spring rolls are also very tasty. The food is probably the best bit about this market, the rest is just the the usual tack. We then travelled up to the River Kwai which was another hour in the minibus. Along the way we picked up our guide Bo who spoke very good English and was extremely friendly. She answered all our history questions about the building of the bridge without any hesitation! This walk around was then followed by a thai buffet at a restaurant on the river - authentic and tasty. We rounded off the day with another hour and a half drive up to the elephant sanctuary. This was the best part of the day! We played with the elephants in the river and Bo took lots of photos on my camera for us. There was lots of driving involved but it was all worth it for the elephant experience. The operators even had a video made up and dropped off at our hotel a few days later - all included in the price!

A GREAT TIME. reading reviews, one name keeps coming up : Jo. after spending a day with him, i knew why. he is thee best! a very kind man and makes you feel comfortable. great level of care and hospitality. as we were driving, he pointed out the agriculture and temples of the local area and asked if we were comfortable. my daughter had a great time. very expensive, but worth the money.

Excellent service above and beyond highly recommended . We did the Water market , river Kwai and elephant trek. The people who drove us and gave us the tour Marlee or could be Molly and our driver Joe were the best. They made our trip. The market was so fun. Our guide gave us excellent advice. Then off to the river Kwai. The buffet lunch was fabulous. After we drove to the elephant trek with river experience. I am not a huge fan of animals in captivity made to work but my girl seemed happy. I was injured and she was very gentle. The guides seemed to genuinely care for the animals. The entire day was a great experience. They went out of their way to drop us at a clothing store. Joe used his phenomenon driving skills to maneuver through tight alleys. Great tour!

Worth Every Penny. We did two tours with this company having read various trips people had done on Tripadvisor.The Bridge over Kwai ,Tiger Temple, and elephant trecking was one.Pick up was really early at 4.30 in the morning , but our driver and air conditioned 6 seater turned up perfectly on time . Lovely smiley chap who didnt speak much English but explained we were picking our guide up en route and assured us he did speak very good English.A packed breakfast was given to us and he showed us how to adjust the seats if we wanted to nap on the way.The transport was excellent.This trip was quite expensive at about £220 each but must say was worth every penny.We spent a little time at the bridge over the river Kwai, we got there really early because the day was crammed . Our guide was fantastic, he spoke English, not great English but we got by as he was only talking to us two not a large group.We had quite a laugh with both the guide and driver and found the whole experience very comfortable.Tiger Temple was amazing .We bottle fed the young tigers had a Thai breakfast in the temple which was very unusual. Some things were tasty some quite hot but was a perfect opportunity to try different foods.We played with the tigers, fed the tigers, walked with the tigers and watched them playing in the water.All the time our guide took both my camera and husbands mobile and took loads of photos and videos.Elephant trecking although a little scary, (we were bare back and very high up) was also a fabulous experience.My husband loved being ducked in the water by and elephant.A buffet lunch at a cafe/bar was provided and this was very good with plenty to eat.The other trip was just as fantastic. Same service , excellent guide, fab driver.This was to the floating market. grande palace and Wat Po .This was about £110 each again well worth it.My camera ran out of charge , the guide took us to a camera shop asked the camera shop to charge for a small fee while we all went for a coffee. If it hadnt been for her the photographs would never have happened. She was a fantastic and again took over the camera to get some fantastic shots.The lunch at a Thai restaurant was the best meal I had in Thailand. The guide ordered and we tries loads of delicious things we would never have ordered.Cant recommend this company enough and is worth saving that bit more for a personal service

Memorable and Exciting. From shopping at the floating market, to walking tigers, and riding on elephants; we couldn't have asked for a more exciting day. We were a group with three kid (2 to 8), and the kids had the most fun! If we enjoyed ourselves on boats, bringing back souvenirs, we were in awe of the majestic tigers. Feeding elephants and riding on their backs, was the best finale. What what it all perfect, was tour guide Molly! Friendly, charming, and so helpful, she was the soul of the day trip! If we ever went back to Bangkok, we'd do the tour again. This time we would also ask for Molly specifically.

Tiger temple & elephant tour (1511). The pick up was good . Our tour guide could not do enough for us (thanks bo)it was amazing . worth every penny . We was with all walks of life the hole day was long but went so fast . We got to sit with the monks and have lunch . I even fed the Tigers ( that is a must ) It is an experience of a life time Once again thank you bo

Tiger temple and elephant bathing (1511). Brilliant day, very early start but well worth it. Spent quality time with the Tigers at the temple where the people there were more than happy to capture every moment with our cameras for us. A rare time to be able to feed,bathe,play with Cubs to adult tigers, not to mention riding elephants into the river Kwai and having amazing fun. Bo our guide was very friendly and helpful. Yet another fantastic trip. :-))

Our tour guide, Molly, was awesome!. The tour was well organized and informative - and there was great food. The best part, though, was Molly, our tour guide. She was friendly and funny and made the whole trip more enjoyable.

1503 Death Railway Wang Pho Viaduct . Excellent organization, good tour program, comfortable minivan and well informed and friendly guide (Kent, who spoke an excellent english). Also good and fast responses on email enquiries.The death railway tour allows you to see something different to Bangkok and the beaches. We had nothing to claim, totally recommendable.

Bangkok Day Tours-Molly Local guide. I had the great privilege and pleasure to have Molly, a Bangkok Day Tours local guide for two different days while on vacation in January 2016. Molly was extremely knowledgeable of the Bangkok sightseeing sites and she genuinely cared about my welfare while in her care. Molly would closely listen to what was important to you and then tailor the day so that your wishes were accomplished. Molly has a wonderful and silly personality. She is also very talented with picture taking and she is more than happy to help you get some great angles and perspectives. I highly recommend Molly and Bangkok Day Tour for your sight seeing needs. So if you want an easy going, caring, and local tour guide who likes to joke around, Molly is your local tour guide.

Tigers and Elephants and Monks, Oh My. Oh wonderful!. I highly recommend Bangkok Day Tours and especially Tour: 1511 Tiger Temple Breakfast + Elephant Ride & Bathing. This company is provides great service, is prompt with their replies and we loved our guide. It is a private tour so you have the entire comfortable vehicle to yourselves. At 4:30am our driver was waiting for us. He asked if we had a change of clothes and we assured him we did. Along the way we were provided with a substantial snack and then picked up our guide Na. She is one of the best guides we have ever had. Best yet, the photos she took of our trip were excellent.The first stop, as the sun was rising, was The Bridge Over the River Kwai. Na explained the historical significance, took some pictures of us and we continued on to the Tiger Temple.It was interesting to take part in putting food in the monks begging bowls. Both Na and a temple volunteer explained the proper etiquette to us. Na took our cameras and took lots of photos. While the monks went inside to pray we got to bottle feed the tiger cubs.Next was breakfast with the monks. We didn’t actually eat with them but in the same building and off to the side. I chose not to eat and got to pet a deer that walked right up to me!It was the most amazing time. I held a cooked whole chicken and had a tiger eat from my hands. Then there was there was play time with tigers, shampooing the tigers and then a chance to walk them to the river. The tigers were very rambunctious at the river so we had to stay behind a fence for that part.One of the big tigers was trained to put his head in your lap. Only one person in the couple can have cats head in their lap but the other can pose. Again our guide took lots of great pictures.After leaving the Tiger Temple we were driven to the Elephant Camp. On the way we were provided with more snacks.When you ride the elephant you sit in a basket on their back. The mahout rides with you through the forest. After the ride you can change into clothes you will wear in the water. That was when we discovered we had forgotten our extra clothes and towels. No problem as there is a store there that sells inexpensive clothing and bathing suits. Bathing the elephants was one of the best, most fun experiences of my life and I am 65 years old (husband 69). Na took many pictures and videos on our cell phone and camera. She is quite the photographer. She was constantly yelling out instructions to the mahouts and to us. The river was very clean and I felt the mahout was careful to make sure we stayed safe. I still find it hard to believe I was sitting on the elephant’s trunk getting sprayed with water. It was a lot of funny playing in the river. When it was time to leave there were very comfortable change rooms and places to rinse out your clothes. Na found us plastic bags for our wet clothes.There was a stop next for an included buffet lunch. Beer etc was extra but reasonably priced.We got back to Bangkok in the late afternoon tired but happy. This was a wonderful day and the highlight of our trip!

This tour should not be missed while in Thailand. We were in port for 2 days as part of our cruise itinerary. Riding an elephant had always been on my bucket list-so imagine my excitement when I came across Bangkok Day Tours-not only could i ride an elephant but I could play in the water with one as well. Bangkok Day Tours was quick to respond to my emails and customized our tour as to what we wanted to do to give us the best possible experience. Because we were so far from the cruise ship port we had to spend the night-the tour company arranged for a lovely resort on the river Kwai. All meals were included and excellent. Molly our guide was fantastic, she was funny and knowledgeable and added little extra touches to our tour. The tiger temple was amazing however the experience at the elephant camp was phenomenal. A friend of ours that came along with us was skeptical at the beginning thinking were were going to ride around in a circle on an elephant. This however was not the case-we were given ample time in the water and on land with the elephants. He was pleasantly surprised by the experience-and admitted this was the best tour we did on our vacation. We were the only group of 4 there so we felt like we received extra special attention. On day 2 we went to the floating market and Grand Palace in Bangkok then had a delicious Thai lunch on the way back to the cruise ship. I cannot say enough about Bangkok Day Tours except that if you do not book with them it would be a big mistake.

Nah was the best tour guide ever! EXPERIENCE OF A LIFETIME!!. My wife and I booked a day tour with Bangkok Day Tours to Bridge of the Kwai, Tiger Temple and Bathing and an Elephant experience. Joe, the best drive ever, (we mean that) picked us up promptly on time from our hotel in downtown Bangkok. I'm not one who loves long trips in the back seat of cars because of motion discomfort so I was a bit hesitant to book this trip in the first place because of all the driving. Let me state for the record that Joe's van was no ordinary van; it was the most comfortable and luxurious van I had ever been in! I would compare it to a luxury limo on the inside! Never once did I feel sick and there were many hours spent in the climate controlled, luxury van! A Joe was very friendly and understanding, he even made a custom video of our elephant experience, put it on a DVD and mailed it to us. It arrived 1 week later at our home in Maui! Nah, who was our tour guide who sat up front while Joe drove, took care of us from start to finish and could not have been more thoughtful and considerate. She greeted us with a huge smile from ear to ear and made us feel very welcome. Aside from being exceptionally knowledge about the history and animals of the places we visited, she doubles as your very own professional photographer!! She wheeled our iPhones, GoPro and Canon SLR like she had been using them for years and turned out some of the best photos my wife and I have of each other today! Really nice to be able to fully enjoy the moment not having to deal with cameras but still wind up with the shot that will surely be your next Facebook profile photo! The tiger and elephant experiences were on the up and up and professional. As animal lovers we had a keen eye for any mis-treatment or malnourishment of the animals. We were happy with what we saw and experienced. If you're thinking of a day tour outside the city of Bangkok and want to see Tigers and Elephants then this tour is a must and PLEASE ask for Joe and Nah!!! you'll be happy you did!

Elephant bathing trip. What fun! Picked up from our hotel at 7 am in our own private luxury people carrier..big enough for six people! First stop was the floating markets...hilarious but expensive..you can try and barter with them but they tend to stick to their prices...Onward then to bridge over the Kwai...lovely... Lunch is included and this is in floating restaurant at side of Kwai.Last stop is the elephant camp where first of all you have a bareback elephant ride around the camp.. Hold on tight! Then, if your brave, you ride the elephant down to the river and get squirted... Dunked and generally play with the elephants... Such a laugh. A lovely day out but a lot of time in car as big distances to cover. Worth it though.

Bo-Dacious Day. We had Bo for a tour guide and she did everything she could possibly do to make our tour enjoyable. She helped me find anything I wanted at the Floating Market at a great price, was always there to pick us up when we were done, took lots of pictures of us with the elephants, and she spoke great English. Our driver was Joe and he couldn't do enough to make us comfortable. The time with the elephants was the highlight of my trip. Have a Bo-dacious time and book this tour!

Amazing!. I went on a day tour with my family to the floating market, visited the River Kwai, and spent a day with the elephants. Our tour guide was Bo and she was awesome. Our driver was also so friendly as well. She provided us with information about Bangkok and the history behind the River Kwai and the bridge. Bo was so friendly and spoke English very well. I must also mention she was an excellent photographer when it came to visiting the elephants. She took the best pictures for my family! I highly recommend this tour and requesting Bo as your tour guide. The experience of this trip was unforgettable. Visiting the elephants was the highlight of our trip.
Your wishes come true!. Everything was as promised: On time, confortable vehicle, great service, good tour guide, good driver and great planning!

Temples and canal private day tour. We had a fantastic time during this tour! Nuch was our guide and we cannot thank her enough for the attention to detail provided, she is fantastic. They picked us up early in the morning from our hotel and drove us around the temples in a private car with AC (very much needed in Thailand). The canal tour was very nice but beware of the amount of smog (coming from the engines of the long tailed boats) you will encounter in the canal, my boyfriend got a bit sick from the smog. The temples visited were breathtaking! Nuch made sure we got some amazing pictures throughout the tour, we felt as if we had hired a personal photographer. We definitely took special memories home. Overall, a very nice tour, worth the money spent!

Tiger temple and elephant bath trip. Our tour guide Kent, was very friendly and make this trip a very memorable one for us. Tiger temple visit followed by elephant ride and bath was the highlight of our entire trip to Thailand. The pictures you get to see on web site will match with the experience you will get when you sign up for this trip.

Fantastic tiger experience, but questionable value for money. We did the tiger and elephant-riding tour. We absolutely loved the tiger temple experience. It was great to engage with the tigers through feeding, walking, washing and playing. We would recommend visiting the tigers during the morning session (we had about 20 people, whereas the afternoon reportedly has in the hundreds). The elephant-riding was enjoyable, but we were unsure how well looked after the elephants were at the camp. It seemed a bit like a factory, and many of the elephants were obviously distressed by their chains and/or enclosures. A bit of a downer compared to the tigers.In all, we payed 18,000 baht. I do not think it was worth this much. Our recommendation would be just to do the tiger temple in the morning without a guide. It would likely be much cheaper, and avoid visiting the sad elephant enclosure.

Best Travel Experience So Far!. This is the tiger experience and elephant bathing. We are a young family of four. Booking was a breeze. Did all the transactions thru email. They respond fairly quickly. I suggest you pay thru credit card even with the 5% surcharge. You will save more versus paying in cash - the exchange rates at the airport will negate any savings. The tour guide (Na) and the driver were so friendly. Their command of english is good. Na was tireless in taking our photos and she knows the best angles. Bring comfy slippers as there is fair amount of walking. extra clothes for swimming as well. It was such an amazing experience. Would highly recommend this tour.

Elephant bath trip.. Me and my wife had and excited elephant bath, it was our first time riding on elephant's back, they are really docile and intelligent animals, the staff was very friendly and did everything to help us to be comfortable in this trip.Our tour guide Bow with her explanation in english helped us to understand a lot about Thai and Adul (the driver) with his good sense of humor always making fun of everything, make our trip even more funnier.We definitely recommend it.

Khao Yai National Park Tour -- Single day private tour. I can't say enough good things about my experience with Bangkok Day Tours on the private, single day tour to Khao Yai National Park Tour. This trip was a last minute decision I made before leaving the States and I booked it for the day after my arrival in BKK. The entire booking process was efficient and secure and I appreciated that Bangkok Day Tours sent several emails confirming the booking and giving detailed information on what to pack and what to expect. My driver and guide picked me up at my hotel on time and during the ride up to the park, my guide went into great detail about the history of the park, conservation in Thailand, what flora and fauna to expect in the park, climatology, geography, Thai history and much more. She also ensured she pointed out things of interest along the way as well. Since it was a private tour, I had the opportunity to customize the trip to my interests and linger longer where I desired. We altered the set itinerary a bit since I had wanted to see waterfalls and due to the abnormally dry rainy season some of the falls were not as full as others. I appreciated her insights and guidance on this and the falls we saw were breathtaking. We also saw monkeys, deer, squirrels, and even saw an elephant on this trip! Seeing an elephant in the wild, by far, was the highlight of the trip. After our time in the park, we stopped for lunch outside the park and then I was returned to my hotel in the evening. It was a perfect way to see some of the beauty of Thailand without having a car or transportation of my own. I highly recommend the trip and this company! Enjoy! (note, it was also about 15 degrees cooler at the park than in BKK and in a forest so dress accordingly--bug spray, long pants etc).

Bare back elephant tour. Where do I start...I was looking forward to this tour the most while in Bangkok and it did not disappoint. The tour guides were on time and spoke very good English (Boa was awesome).We first went to the floating market. I thought it was going to be a quick stop there because all I wanted to see were the elephants. Boy was I wrong! The floating market was absolutely beautiful. Seeing Monks and locals riding there boats and selling items was cool (can negotiate the best here). I wish I would have waited to buy stuff here because literally the cheapest. Then we headed towards the bridge/ lunch. The food was so good! it was buffet style and I came with an empty stomach. After about 45 minutes there we finally headed to the elephants. We first got on our elephants and walked around in the forest and camp site for 20 minutes (don't worry they take plenty of pictures for you). Then came the fun part. We got onto our elephants and went into the water! we had soooo much fun. The elephants would fill there trunks with water and splash us and we took a lot of pictures there also. Overall I would say this is well worth the money. My friends and I had a blast and a day full of adventure.

Elephants and Tigers...AMAZING experience!. I've never written a review on any kind of site before this, so I just want to say how much my 5/5 means...I wrote a review to explain how awesome the elephant excursion with the Tiger Temple really is!This was such a wonderful experience that I know was definitely once in a lifetime. Bow was our tour guide for the day and she was PHENOMENAL! She spoke beautiful English, was very knowledgeable in the tour/experience, and was a joy to be around. She honestly made the day even better than it would have been on its own. We started the day by going to the Tiger Temple and serving food to the resident monks. She helped get us a set at the first table, thoroughly explained what we were to do, and then took our phones/GoPro to capture the whole interaction. Next we went to the temple to feed the baby tigers and eat breakfast with the monks. She encouraged us to hurry along so we could be first in line at certain points and when to hang back at others so that we could have the best experience with the tigers. She again took our phones/GoPro and filmed/took pictures of the entire process. Bow could honestly be a professional photographer! At the elephant encounter, she was so great at taking pictures and videos of EVERYTHING! The whole day was simply amazing and I highly recommend this tour--especially if you can request Bow!

Elephant ride- bareback!. We were transported and guided by two fantastic people who represented the company. Our guid was very informative. She was certainly people friendly. We ended up swimming with our elephants- something to remember forever. Our "bucket list" is empty again. Thank you so much for the experience.

Spectacular Trip. We had two trips with Bangkok day tours. One to Ayutthaya other to Tiger temple and Bridge Kwai. Both were excellent and well planned . Molly was an excellent person to explain the tour and the driver (I am sorry i forgot his name) was calmness personified on the busy streets of Bangkok. My daughter and wife took a liking to Molly and their conversations brought out other interesting highlights of Thailand which were not a part of the tour.The Company provides luxury vehicle at our disposal and for 3 people we had a huge van for ourselves.The rates were justifiable considering their service, but this tour would not be recommended for people on budget travel. I am sure there are cheaper options available.

River..tigers and elephants. My tour with Bangkok Day Tours was excellent...as good as I expected. Very well organized, from the hotel pick up ..to snacks on the way. Loved the bridge stop..and the memorial park. The Tigers were amazing..and the elephants the highlight...I didn't get to bathe the elephants though..unsure why as time was plentiful! Arrived back at hotel 90 minutes earlier than predicted. Although I don't usually do yours..and not a fan of animals for human pleasure I think that they are extremely well cared for..and our of poachers hands! Quite expensive but worth the cost. And my guideTanya was awesome!

Waterfalls and tigers = Epic day out!. Second time we have used Bangkok Day tours and again we were delighted with their friendly service which makes for a relaxing day. Our guide Molly and driver Joe, were brilliant! Well appointed van, snacks and lunch included, which provides a base for a sensational atmosphere. We asked if we could stop to grab a coffe as it was a 6:00 am start, which Molly and Joe obliged, therefore set the tone for the day - which was its all about us! Needless to say the waterfalls in the national park were awesome and to touch and feed tigers was special. Thanks again to Molly, Joe and the team at Bangkok Day Tours.

Best Day Ever!. My hubby and I backpacked through Southeast Asia in late July of 2015. As an animal lover, naturally, I wanted to pet tigers and ride elephants. This was the coolest, once in a lifetime kind of experience! We loved our tour guide Na who captured some really great photos for us, and our driver Adon and my husband really got along great. We spent the day with them as they drove us from Bangkok, to the River Kwai first; here there is a bridge that is historic for the Thai's and we enjoyed learning and listening to Na tell about it. We then went to Tiger Temple for the Breakfast with the Monks tour, and then we got to ride elephants in the river. The whole day was an unforgettable experience! Our recommendation, make friends with Na and your driver because they are so helpful and provided invaluable insight into Thai culture. We were able to practice our Thai with them, and they taught us new words and phrases! We enjoyed our day with them!

Elephants, Tigers and River kwai. Possibly the best day ever. Great guide that picked us up in a luxury two seater (more like thrones) minibus. Very informative and friendly. You spend plenty of time doing each activity. I would highly recommend this tour

Wow...an unforgettable trip. We booked online the 1515 Tour - Tiger Temple breakfast with Monks and Elephant Training Tour. It also included stopping at the Bridge over the River Kwai. We were picked up from our hotel at 4.30am and driven towards our first stop. Just before it we arrived at the bridge we picked up Nga our tour guide for the day. She pretty much kidnapped our phones off us and took 100s of photos of us on the bridge, with the tigers and then the elephants. This meant we could just enjoy the day and know someone was grabbing photos of us without issue.On the minibus was water and light snacks. After the tiger temple we stopped for a buffet lunch. Soft drinks were an extra charge, but water tea and coffee was included with the food. Nice set-up.Nga's spoken english was good and she kept a running commentary throughout the day.The highlight was going into the river on the elephants. I think they enjoyed it as much as we did!An expensive trip, but so worth it. You really feel these animals are being cared for and not just dragged out (or drugged into submission) for the tourists.

Tiger Temple Tour. Third Tiger temple tour, 2014 & 2015 tour with Bangkok Day Tours.Na (tour guide) and Joe (driver) were both awesome. Na's knowledge and photography skills made ourday that much more enjoyable.For all those people that criticize the tiger temple saying they are mistreated and drugged, its all false. The tigers are well treated, fed well and looked after by caring staff.The elephant trek and swim was also great, they are such gentle giants.I would like to thank Bangkok Day Tours for our enjoyable tour and would highly recommend them to any one wanting to enjoy their holiday.

Amazing Birthday with Elephants. We booked this as a birthday experience and it was definitely a memorable and fantastic way to spend it. Our tour guide Tanya was very helpful and arranged a special birthday cake at lunch and also helped us to get medicine at the pharmacy when one of our party felt sick. The road transport was also very comfortable. Washing the elephants in the river was a memory we will have forever and Thanks to Tanya we have lots of photos and video to remember it by. The one recommendation I would give is to definitely wear long trousers to ride the elephants! We all were left with rashes/ bites on our legs that we still have 3 weeks later.

Tigers and Elephants!. My daughter and I choose the morning tour to River Kwai, Tiger Temple, and Elephants. This tour is a must do for animal enthusiast who want to get up close and personal with these majestic and beautiful animals. The tour picked us up promptly from our rented apartment in a luxury van. We expected a group type tour, however we had our own private driver and guide for the day! Feeding the baby tiger was one of the highlights of this tour- absolutely amazing! Our guide (his name was Eight) was knowledgable, professional, and funny - he kept us laughing all day! Highly recommended!

Unforgettable Bangkok ( and beyond) experience.. Caroline and the team at Bangkok Day Tours were amazing! They made our trip to Bangkok totally unique and unforgettable. On all 5 days of our Bangkok trip ( 25 in the tour party) we involved Bangkok Day Tours, from picking us up and dropping us back to the airport in a VIP coach, to a bespoke tuk tuk adventure around the city which included ring side seats to Muay Thai, to a temple tour of the Grand Temple to the amazing trip north of Bangkok to the floating markets, lunch on the River Kwai underneath the bridge, followed by patting and walking tigers to the amazing bathing and playing with elephants in the water. During the entire week the team at Bangkok Day tours attended perfectly to our wishes, they picked the needs of the group giving us the right amount of history and information for our attention span at the time. they were relaxed and very welcoming. The elephant bathing was the highlight and a once in a lifetime experience full of fun and laughter. From the planning phase to seeing the last of us off at the airport Caroline and her team were totally professional and a joy to do business with. For anyone with a spare day in Bangkok I thoroughly recommend Bangkok Day Tours.

SPECTACULAR ELEPHANT DAY TRIP!. We booked the Extraordinary Elephant Day Trip with Bangkok Day Tours and it was one of the best decisions we made. This trip was easily one of the highlights of our Thailand vacation.The process to book was easy and Caroline was very friendly and communicated promptly. On the day of the tour, our guide Bow was waiting for us on time at the lobby of our hotel and she then introduced us to our driver Mr.O. Bow was super sweet and friendly and explained everything in advance. The first stop was the floating market and afterwards she welcomed us back with some delicious snacks and cold water. Of course, the elephants were the highlight and she took soooo many pictures. We gave her our phones and camera and she took lots of pictures and videos on both! Yes, the tour can be a little on the costly side but it is soo worth it! We loved everything about it and the elephant riding was one of the best highlights of our trip! Do it!

Probably the best part of the trip. We got picked up at 7 am from our hotel and taken to the floating market, followed by lunch buffet. After this we were taken to the elephants where we got to ride them bareback as well as go into the water with them. We got back around 6 PM.Our tour guide Bow was amazing! Very nice, was able to answer all our questions, took some great pictures for us, and got us some discounts at the market. Highly recommend this !

Taking a tour. Went to Bridge over River Kwai, Erawan National Park and Elephant Ride. We are a family of four with kids aged 12 and 7.We were collected from our hotel 'bang on time' for the journey - and the driver pulled up to collect some goodies on the way. Very professional and courteous people (the driver and guide). We stopped for a brief visit to the Bridge were the guide was very knowledgable - kids wern't really interested and I realise I should have given them an insight before we went. Next stop the stunning 7 tier waterfall- where we swam with the 'sucking' fish and jumped from rocks - great fun. At the elephant ride we were given a choice whether to ride bareback or not (which we chose) and immediatley regretted as we didn't feel safe with the kids and the balancing. So we had seats put on and went for a ride. Fantastic scenary on such a majestic creature. Once back to the camp the seats were again removed for the elephant bath and it was amazing being 'dunked' and 'dunked' again. My little girl joined us again at the point and felt safer in the water. All the staff were brilliant with her and we take some fantastic memories back home of a brilliant day trip. Thanks to Na (guide) It wasn't the cheapest trip, but a quality one and very much recommended.

This excursion made our trip!!. We did the breakfast with Elephants tour and the tiger temple. Booked this trip because of the high reviews on here and we are so glad we did!!! We had a great driver (Joe) he spoke enough English and then we picked up our tour guide (Tanya) an hour or so later.
