They had cold water and snacks waiting for us in the car and would stop anytime we needed to, bathroom, coffee, whatever. Stopped briefly at the Bridge of the River Kwai for a picture and then off to the elephant farm! Wow!! What an experience! They had a yummy breakfast for us wen we arrived. The mahouts were great with the elephants and driver and tour guide took tons of pictures and videos for us. They even had soap and shampoo for us to shower with after swimming (the only thing they didn't have and we didn't think of was a towel) but other than that they were prepared! Even had extra adapters so we could charge our cameras! Then we stopped for a nice Thai lunch and then off to the Tiger temple. Wow! Just a cool experience all around and wound up with TONS of great pictures! Highly recommended this tour and this tour company! Thanks for taking such great care of us!

Elephant day trip. Went on trip with guide Sally.Was 15 minutes early at our hotel with very fancy mini van, cool air conditioned and cold water. She waited in lobby for us.First to floating market. We were expecting a tourist trap but it was genuily nice. Get in a boat (no guide) and it rows to different market stands. Okay they do try to sell you stuff (its a market, what else should they do..) but its nice to bargain and look for some souvernirs.Next up bridge over Kwai. Very interesting. She took some pictures of us on my own cellphone. Excellent quality. We have lunch next to the river Kwai. It was buffet. Good food but drinks not included in price. Not too expensive.Last stop, elephant farm! You each get to ride elephant in the river and play with it. (sit on trunk,...) it was really nice!! After the river you get on 1 elephant (2 persons) and take a little walk bareback. Super! Sally took like 100 pictures of us.Negative points:Very very long car ride, expensive, drinks at lunch not included, official elephant picture not included in price (optional purchase, it should be included for this price).Positive points:Luxurious van, good guidance, good food, free water on the road, elephant trip = unforgettable.
Fantastic!. What a wonderful day! Could t be more happy, Our tour guide Na was amazing and everything was smooth, worry free and all in all an amazing experience!

Good value, no frills. I had a free morning and have wanted to go to the floating markets to get out of Bangkok. I found this online after getting a very expensive quote from the hotel. It was easy to book and my voucher came a bit later. The driver was a 20 minutes late from the 6:15am pick-up time so I wish I had taken a bit more time to get breakfast! Otherwise, it's quite a bit of time in the car as you pick up other passengers for the tour and then you split into your different van. For the price I didn't really care... I should of brought a book though. And don't drink too much water! The van is comfortable. Then we were on our way! I took a paddle boat to get the view from the waterways of the markets. I wasn't really interested in buying tourist crap which my paddle boat driver worked out very quickly. I bought a coconut ice cream and was happy cruising/ taking photos so she drove me in a scenic way through. After that, I walked the market from the ground and then met up with the tour for the long-tail boat. Not much to see here but saves some of the driving time. Then it was back to Bangkok. My only suggestion is that for the first people picked up to be the first to be dropped off... we were in the car the longest! It was a nice way to spend the morning and love my photos.

A day full of excitement!. Right from the minute we got picked up in our own private minibus to the minute we got dropped off back at the hotel, every part was simply amazing! We got picked up on the dot at 0700 from our hotel and had the luxury of our own minibus with reclining seats and amazing air on just for me and my friend. They provided us with snacks and water for the journey. Our first stop was at the floating market. We had about half an hour there and were not rushed at any point. Personally, I think half an hour was enough time. As you go in the morning, you miss the busiest time so it's much more chilled. From there, we went to the memorial bridge and went for lunch at an all you can eat Thai floating resteraunt on the river. Beautiful location. After some beautiful food we then went on the the elephant. BEST till last! We started by bathing them in the river and having so much fun with them and finishing with a small trek with them. I am massively against animal cruelty and was a little bit hesitant about seeing the elephants, but they genuinely seemed happy and well looked after. The only downfall about the day tour is the amour of time spent on the road. All the locations are atleast a 1-2 hour drive away from each other dependant on traffic, and then a 4 hour journey back to the hotel. But you're that tired from excitement that you just end up sleeping the journey. Be sure to go with Bangkok day tours and not day tours Bangkok! Hope your enjoy :)

Fantastic!. Booked Tour 1118 with the floating market, tiger temple and elephant ride. We were picked up by a friendly tour guide who guided us the whole day. Just the two of us, not a whole group or something. She told us interesting things about Thailand in general during the ride ( in a luxurious van). During the entire day she made sure we would have the best pictures from our trip. And we got plenty of them. Can definitly recommend doing a tour with them.

Excellent service, and the tour guides were so lovely. I just finished the one day elephant ride, floating market and Kwai bridge tour. I am so impressed with this company, of all the tours I have been globally am extremely pleased with Bangkok Day Tours. First they pick up at 7am from the hotel you're staying at, and then take you to your first stop which is the Floating Market where you spend an hour. From there you proceed to your next stop about an 1-1.5 drive to Kwai River where you get to walk across the bridge where WWII happened, and get to have lunch buffet at the floating restaurant. You will not be disappointed by the choice of buffet they have prepared for you. After lunch a 30+ minute ride takes you to the Elephant camp, where you get to play and have an amazing experience. Our guide Sally was awesome, we gave her my phone and she takes all the pictures/videos for you as you play away with the elephants. After an hour you depart back for your hotel, ride back is 3-3.5 hours depending on traffic.Also there was no other tourists in the van they picked us up in so we got to enjoy, recline our seats and catch up on some zzzz's on the way back.It's money well spent with a great tour company and ask for Sally, she is sweet as pie. Thank you Bangkok Day Tours for such a great day without any hassle or fuss.

Awesome Day Trip. We recently did the Tiger Temple and Elephant trip through Bangkok Day tours and it was absolutely amazing. Transport was really comfortable and we had a car to ourselves, which was an unexpected bonus. Our tour guide, Na, was friendly, helpful and wanted us to have as many photos of the day as was humanly possible (over 700 in total, it turns out). The bridge over the river Kwai was beautiful, and a nice stop on the way to the temple. The temple itself was well run and playing with the baby tiger was incredible. We generally felt really safe but you need be aware that these are tigers (some of them absolutely huge) and you're not hidden from them behind a barrier or screen so there is a certain element of risk, if tigers scare you I do not recommend this tour.  The breakfast at the temple with the monks and volunteers was unexpectedly tasty and actually one of the culinary highlights of our whole trip.  The afternoon session with the elephants in the river was better than I had imagined it could be and is something we will remember for a very long time.You need to take good sun screen and a change of clothes, if possible I would also recommend some shoes that aren't flip flops as Flip flops, wet and slippery from washing tigers, makes it hard to move at speed away from the tigers, which is sometimes required.I would like to add that when we went on this trip I was concerned that there would be some level of cruelty evident, but that we never felt like the tigers and elephants we saw were being mistreated.I would recommend this trip to anyone not afraid of large and potentially lethal cats.

Amazing Elephant Tour!. I have to start with a disclaimer - if you're on the fence about this tour. This is a MUST DO before you leave Thailand. The tour started off with a pick up at our hotel, we were guided in a nice luxurious van with comfortable seating and cooling refreshments. I was pleasantly surprised to find that our tour was completey private. I personally think the tour guide makes or breaks your experience. And Bo definitely made this tour an amazing experience. She was friendly, informative, and all around, so sweet! We first went to the floating market where we sat in a boat and were rowed to different vendors and had the opportunity to buy little souvenirs. Bo then asked us if we needed to buy anything in particular because she knew the specific shop owners and could get us the best deals. We went to the river over the bridge next and had a nice buffet in the restaurant nearby. The buffet was absolutely beautiful and had all the delicious thai food you could ask for. The lunch was included in the tour except for drinks although I would've paid for it regardless. We then drove to the elephant camp and Bo informed us she would be taking pictures and videos for us. They give you an option of riding on a chair or going bareback. We chose to ride bareback to get the full experience and I did not regret it. We then got to go into the river to bathe the elephants. They also give you an option of sitting on the elephant's trunk while it dunks you in the water. I must have ended with over 300 pictures and 5 different videos of our experience that I will definitely be showing off to my friends. I'm so happy with this tour - they honestly make you feel like VIPs. For what you pay for, it is so well worth it. Thank you Bo and Ton, our driver for making this an unforgettable day! Ton, you are awesome! Drove us around for about 6-7 hours roundtrip with a smile! What a trooper. I will recommend this to anyone that comes to Bangkok!

Elephant day trip. A lovely day out and away from the city. Floating market at Damnoen Saduak was a good opportunity to take photos, the bridge over the Kwai was set against a beautiful backdrop, unfortunately we went on the weekend so very busy and being a photographer I would of liked to photograph the bridge empty and spend a little more time here. The buffet lunch included was very good, we had plenty of different dishes to choose from and the restaurant sits over the river. The journey from the river is about 1 hours drive to the elephant park. On arrival loose elephants was just walking around and munching, the elephant ride was enjoyable, slow and steady. Not like riding my horse. Fanta what a beautiful old lady. After a walk around the park we made our way down to the river. Wow...what can I say, this was fantastic just take a look at the pictures on here, what a great experience, thankyou bangkok day tours.

You've gotta do this tour, if you're into activities. I'm so overwhelmingly happy with this tour that I don't even know where I should begin. So here goes, whatever come first.1. The best pricing for is amazing value2. Since our incredible experience was greatly influent by the staff, I must mention them by name: Joe, our driver, and Tanya, our tour Director3. We were picked up right on time, with the greatest smiles, and best, the greatest van, which can comfortably accommodate up to 9 travelers, thigh this vehicle, I believe was designed to take 16. The AC is strong, the music system is fabulous, the party interior is amazing if you have teenagers among your group. 4. Tanya has great personality, very friendly, helpful, and accommodating5. Joe is the safest driver, but he won't slow your trip even in constant heavy Bangkok traffic jams6. The Floating market experience was great. Prepare your camera and batteries and micro SD storage. Chances are you'll wish you have now7. The buffet luncheon at the Floating restaurant on by the Bridge over the Kwai River was INCREDIBLE in not only delicious authentic Thai food selection but also the friendly staff8. The Bridge over the Kwai River added a very historical sense to the whole itinerary. Our day was perfect weather-wise, allowed us to take some breathtaking pictures 9. The last activity, and definitely the most memorable activity capped of the best tour : elephant ride and bath at the famous Mahawangchang Elephant Camp. We had roughly 30 minutes riding the elephants (2 persons and the handler). We have done elephant rides probably 3 to 4 tones in various Asia destinations, but none was like this one: we sat directly to the elephant bare back, no secured bench, no rope to hang on to, and after 5 to 7 minutes, the handler dropped to the ground, walked in front with our phone, verbally commanded and took numerous pictures. We'd never thought this was actually happening. We got a huge kick from this. On the elephant bath, I'm afraid my words will do injustice to the incredibly fun experience that you'll have, so. ..you've gotta trust me, and take the tour to find our for yourself ;-)

Elephants Amazing 5 Stars, Tigers Disappointing 2 Stars. Did the 1508 three part tour, a real experience to remember, the tour is incredibly expensive but if you don’t want to sit with other people in the bus it's worth it. We were collected promptly by our driver Joe in the smartest minivan I’ve ever seen. We drove at break neck speed to our first stop and collect our guide called ‘8’. Quick stop at the River Kwai which is a must to say you’ve ‘done it’. Then a further speedy drive to see the elephants, it was somewhere along the motorway I thought our driver mad missed his calling In life and really should have been a fighter pilot. The elephants were amazing, the guide and driver thankfully took millions of pictures and the experience was something I'm unlikely ever to have to opportunity to repeat. This was my high point of a 3 week holiday, the elephants, in my opinion were ‘happy’ and I was quite apprehensive initially that I’d take away a lasting sad memory but no. When we got off the elephants they were happy to sniffy you and be petted, I'm guessing if they were unhappy they wouldn’t have been as animated and friendly as they were. Take a towel as you need a shower after the swim and they don’t have any there.We left the elephants and headed to a restaurant for a buffet style lunch which was ok, nothing exciting.Then on to Tiger Temple. Personally I wouldn’t recommend this the place struck me as a bit of a tip and I see it as a money making operation, unless I missed it I didn’t see anything about where the money goes or any conservation projects. For your entrance fee you get to walk along with a tiger for 5 seconds and have your photo taken, then you can pay a hefty fee extra to have another photo taken. Whist I know it's hypocritical of me we also did the tiger cub feeding, on a plus point my girlfriend and I spend a good 10 minutes in a cage with 3 four month old tigers, that was an experience, if the tiger cub feeding hadn't been available as numbers are limited i'd say you'd be incredibly disappointed, but on the whole it left me with a bitter taste.Then back in the minivan and a 3 hour drive back to our hotel. River Kwai was good, Elephants were amazing, skip the tigers.

Amazing Tour and Amazing Guides!. Our tour of the River Kwae, Tiger Temple, and Elephant Camp was totally unforgettable. Our guide was friendly and informative, but not overbearing, and let us have the experience as a couple for the most part. She took tons of pictures so we can relive the magic whenever we'd like. The tour was efficient, but also allowed us time to enjoy and we never felt rushed. I would 100% recommend this to anyone! Bangkok Day Tours blew us away!

Unforgettable Day!. Our guide and driver picked us up on time in a very comfortable, new, and lavishly equipped 10 seater van and started our journey. First stop was the floating market where our guide first explained what sort of prices should be bargained down to for popular goods before sending us on a 30 minute boat ride around the little channels. We were there well before the big tourist groups and while it was still relatively cool making this a very enjoyable experience. We then went on to the River Kwai, which was excellently timed as we were there just in time to take pictures with a train passing over the bridge.The Tiger Temple as well as the Elephant Riding/Bathing were unforgettable experiences, and the guide took so many great photos of us during all the activities - we can highly recommend Na as the guide. While the tour was relatively expensive, most things, including a very nice buffet lunch and snacks and water in the car were all provided - but with or without that the overall day was simply fantastic.

Elephant Day Trip (Code 1506). We had a great day and an unforgettable experience, but the Elephant Camp let it down. We were picked up from our hotel in an air-conditioned van with big reclining seats. Our driver was so friendly; he gave us bottled water as soon as we got in the van and again, along with a big bag of snacks, after we'd finished at the floating market. Later on in the day he stopped by the side of the road to get snacks which he let us try - they were deep fried sweet potato things and deep fried coconut bananas and absolutely delicious. The driver and the tour guide became like friends on the journey and we had a real laugh together. The market was really fun - you're pressured to buy at every turn and its hard to get the guy controlling the boat to move on but it was a good experience none the less. If you see the lady making coconut pancakes in the walkway to the dock definitely buy some - they're amazing! We also bought the best mango we've ever had from a fruit boat. We picked up our tour guide and went on to the Bridge over the River Kwai. He walked over the bridge with us, took photos and was really informative about its history. We then went for a buffet lunch at a restaurant overlooking the bridge - you could have as much as you wanted and it was all included in the price of the tour so pretty good value! The food was pretty good as well. The experience of riding the elephants and playing with them in the water was incredible, but it's the element of the day that would prevent me from wholeheartedly recommending this tour to others. The mahouts were friendly but I'm not sure their treatment of the elephants is very good. On the ride around the compound we saw an old elephant chained up in the distance, with no tusks and no eyes - they ignored us when we asked if he was okay. The water was full of elephant poo and there were flies everywhere - we spent the whole time stressing that we were going to get ill! The mahouts who accompanied us had sticks with little spikes on the end; I don't know if they were used (the elephants didn't look as if they had been maltreated) and as we were already there, the only thing we could do was make the most of it, but the whole experience left a bit of a sour taste in our mouths.I would recommend the company as the tour guides were great and made sure we had a really good experience, but I perhaps wouldn't recommend this tour in particular.

Floating Market Tiger Elephants Day Tour. My wife and I booked the Bangkok Day Tours visit to the Kwai River, the Tiger Temple and elephant rides. The guide was very friendly and knowledgeable, and taught us about the WWII history around the Kwai River. The Tiger Temple was a once-in-a-lifetime experience, and it is definitely worth the extra money to feed the tiger cubs. The elephant ride was fantastic, and we got to play with a baby elephant. The drive is a few hours outside of Bangkok, but the private van is one of the most comfortable I have ridden in. They also showed a movie on the way back to Bangkok about the Kwai River Bridge in WWII, which was a great way to tie in the history with the sight.

Amazing Day!. I have a longer description of our day under the "Extraordinary Elephant Day Trip" category but wanted to add a brief one here as well for additional exposure about our amazing day. Molly, our guide, was amazing. Our day was wonderful and there is nothing at all I can think of that would have made it a better day. While quite costly we knew this going in so certainly can't count that as a negative. Wonderful, fabulous, fun, and a day we will always remember.One thing I forgot to mention in my other review... you can leave extra items in the van when you tour. So in addition to bringing bathing suits, you can bring towels and leave it all in the car. You can take a quick shower after your time in the water with the elephants so having a towel will be handy.

Elephant swim and ride. Also visit floating market and old WWII BRIDGE.. 100% Awesome.my wife our 1 year old and I loved our tour. Most fun was playing with the elephants. The handlers were very good and made sure we enjoyed our time. We will definitely have this on our to do list next time we return to Bangkok to visit family. I seen a few negative reviews on here and not sure why. Maybe they were the type of people that you just can't please. I had a great time. See attached pictures. Thank you Bangkok day tourThanksLindley family

Bangkok Day Tours - better tour guide pls!. Service vehicle and driver was ok; cooler with ice-cold bottled water thoughtfully provided for us, given the 7-temple tour we took. Lunch at the seafood restaurant by the river was good and filling. Overall an OK experience -- but would have been a more wonderful one if the guide assigned to us was more interested in doing her job well. I don't know if it was the oppressive heat, or that we were touring on a Saturday, but it felt like she was doing the tour guide service as a tiresome routine, and therefore seemed lackluster and lacking in enthusiasm. There were several times that my husband and I attempted to ask questions about what she was talking to us about, but she deliberately ignored us and kept on talking as if delivering a well-rehearsed, mechanical spiel. Maybe it was because she wasn't that comfortable talking in English and therefore avoiding having to converse in English, but I still found it very rude... and definitely not consistent with the value (cost) of the private tour guide we paid for!

Bangkok Day Tours CODE 1511 (TIGER TEMPLE + ELEPHANT BATHING TOUR). A great all day event especially with kids 7 years up, this tour code provided by Bangkok Day Tours is excellent! Tour guide Na and Driver Jo are absolutely wonderful, and they made this day the highlight of our entire trip.  We were received by a cheerful Jo at 4;30 am at our hotel and then drove straight for about 2.5-3 hours till we got to our first stop - the bridge on the river Kwai. The bus is luxurious, flat-reclining seats, disco led lights on the ceiling (ha!) - the works. Very comfortable and we pretty much snoozed the whole way. Before we reached the bridge, we pick up Na - a local guide who has grown up in the area, loves its history and has a wealth of information on everything she is about to show you. She enters the bus with a bag load of snacks which my daughter is happy to see:) The bridge is a small stop, about 10 minutes. It is good to read up a bit about the history of this strategic bridge before you go as it enhances the experience. Took a few pictures (watch out for a small buzzing bee hive on the right side of the bridge!) and we were off for the main excursion of the day - the Tiger Temple.We arrive into the tiger temple around 7:45am. the first thing we do is feed the monks. Na has already brought the food with her, which we then open up and put in the monks bowls as they walk by us. If you have any food left at your station, you are to give it all to the last monk in the line, as they will only eat what is collectively put in their bowls. Extremely efficiently organized, respectful and in full silence, this was a great way to begin the day! Wear appropriate clothing, no tank tops or shorts for the ladies.We then enter the Tiger Temple. Na is familiar and knows practically everyone, cheerfully greeting everyone around. It may have been the reason we were picked first for nearly all the activities;) You go up the temple, and there are about 7-8 tiger cubs in different stages of growth all around you, surrounded by a multitude of volunteers, local and foreign. The cubs are extremely playful, you get to feed them and play games with them and its quite amazing to have a tiger cub in your lap! They are really frisky and the volunteers are constantly warning you to look behind and be wary as the cubs, although on long leashes, may attempt to playfully grab your leg or arm, not realizing their own strength. Don't wear long flowing skirts or wide leg pants - if any cloth flutters the cubs wanna grab it! The volunteers want no injuries to happen inadvertently, so continuous warnings are shouted out. The cubs fall sleep quite quickly too, kinda like puppies and kittens at home once they've finished eating...It is really adorable! Click as many pictures as you like, take videos etc. Soon it is time to walk them on leash to their home - they run, poop, fight and squabble on the way and quite a few of us hard a hard time keeping up with them. You then get to bathe a one year old tiger. They are really big and the whole activity is quite scary but surrounded by volunteers who constantly steered us around the tigers, we got through! (Meanwhile, the size of the tiger paw up-close is just freaky!)We then say bye to the cubs (I saw one hop on to the lap of a volunteer and nuzzle up - a sight i will probably never see anywhere but here!) and we get to the big boys! This is where the fear really sets in. You can smell the tiger, see it looking at you... no way do you want that flimsy rope leash to snap off! Even though we are assured by all that the tigers here do not see humans as "food", naturally, if a tiger does decide to jump, we got nothing;)You get to walk this majestic beast to a water body area in turns (never get in front of the tiger they keep reminding you). Its a lot easier than walking the cubs and you are NEVER going to get to do this anywhere else, so swallow the fear and grab the loose leash! (Also a good time to remember how low humans actually stand on the food chain, the god's-gift-to-earth chain and the beauty-of-nature chain)  We are then herded into a cage and the one/two-year old tigers are free in the water body. It is a magnificent sight! We get to see them jump, play, swim and spar with each other. It is absolutely breathtaking to see them this way. What hits you is the silence. They are so so quiet that many a times, one would sneak up near the cage and we wouldn't even notice! All in all - this visit made our trip. We do not believe in keeping wild animals in captivity. I did not know what to expect when i got there. I wanted my daughter to touch a tiger and this was the only place where i knew it could happen. I was completely taken aback with what I saw, the surroundings and the initmate tiger-human relationship. The place is serene & calm (you can hear monks chanting from time to time) and you have access to this incredible, beautiful beast at such close quarters - a real unique combination. When we asked about how they manage the tigers' well being, they told us that tigers being solitary animals are kept in isolated cages when they grow up, are well fed through the day, walked, watered, looked after (none of them were skinny or malnourished like we see in some zoos). We asked the 'are they ever drugged' question point blank to the supervisor and got this answer: No drugs, not de-clawed, exposed to human contact immediately after birth, all born and brought up at the temple itself, trained with a tap on the nose with a wooden stick if one went too far, no accidents (yet!) and a genuine love for these animals. Even though its a bit steep price wise, recommend this 4:30am version as by 11am, the tigers had been fed and were pretty drowsy. if you come in the afternoon, not sure if you get the same experience.The elephants at Kanchenaburi were fun too (going into the water with them is not for the faint-hearted or those with vertigo!) but hey...nothing beats having a baby tiger on your lap;) You get back to Bangkok by about 5pm - so its roughly a complete 12 hour day. Take your camera, wear walking shoes and appropriate clothing as you will meet monks. It will be a day to remember!

Tiger Temple and River Kwai. Overall the experience was amazing and I had a wonderful time! Everything was as advertised. Our tour guide was extremely friendly and gave us private time as needed. The time that we arrived at the River Kwai was perfect as there were no other tourists around. We were the only ones to cross the bridge and we were able to get pictures of the area without the presence of other people in the background. The tiger temple was an amazing experience and I enjoyed every moment of it. I left a separate review for the tiger temple at the Tiger Temple page as I felt like BDT had relatively little to do with that experience apart from securing us a spot in the morning tours and driving us to the temple. The lunch that was provided was actually quite enjoyable. It was buffet style at a floating restaurant on the River Kwai. There was a good variety of food available and there was a beautiful view of the bridge. The only reason I am giving BDT 4 stars is that I do believe that their prices were excessively high. $265 a person for the River Kwai + Morning Tiger Temple experience is a lot!However, it is definitely an experience I am glad I took part in because I am not sure when else I will spend a day in such close proximity to tigers from cubs to adults.

Great Day for families with teens. We booked the Extraordinary Elephant Tour shortly after arriving in Bangkok. The booking, confirmation and payment process was seamless. Our family was in the hotel lobby about 10 mins early only to find out our tour guide Sally was already there. Our journey to the floating market, The Bridge over the River Kwai, lunch and Elephant Camp included stops at clean bathrooms and our guide provided everything we needed for our long day. Not only did Sally give us tons of information she was a great photographer too. She captured great photos and video footage of our 16 & 17 year olds laughter at the right times.When traveling in Bangkok we highly recommend booking an excursion with Bangkok Day Tours.

Awesome. We had the pleasure of using this company to provide us with private airport transfers and also day tours whilst in Bangkok and they are a extremely professional company on time excellent vehicles drivers and guides we will certainly use them and recommended them in the future

Highlight of our trip. This tour was AMAZING!!!!!!! We went on the Tiger Temple Breakfast + Elephant Bathing (Code:1511) tour. There aren't enough words to to say how happy we were with this tour. Our driver and guide picked us up from our hotel on time and we drove to the Bridge on the Kwai. Our guide gave us a good history on the bridge and took many pictures for us. Then, we went to the Tiger Temple where we first donate to the monks, then went into the tiger temples. We had so much fun playing with the baby tigers. Then we got to walk them and play with older tigers, too. Later we took a picture with a 5 year old tiger and we got to watch the big tigers play in the water and jump off a huge rock into the water. Throughout the entire experience, they took amazing photos of us. It was like having a travel photographer with us. Overall, it was a very fun experience.Then, we went to the elephant compound. First, we road on the back with a trainer. He made us a leaf and flower hat which was quite cute and a nice touch. He took photos with us on the elephant. Again, it was like a personal photographer. Then, the real fun began. We went swimming with the elephants. It was like an amusement park ride and one of the best experiences of the trip and possibly our lives. It was so wonderful. Our guide took pictures of us on there, too. This is also where going on the private tour is well worth it.  You can go on a tiger temple and elephant riding tour with a large group, but you won't get to swim with the elephants. This was the best experience of the trip and I REALLY recommend shelling out the extra money to do this. It was so much fun and I really can't say anything more positive about it.Also, wear bug repellant.

Was not happy at all! Beware!! Phone was stolen!. We ordered two separate tours with Bangkok Day Tours since my mom wanted to go to the palace and me and my son wanted to do the nature tour.They sent me a driver who spoke no English and finally picked up our guide after 2 hours driving in an unknown place with my 6 year old son. The guide was very young and didn't really do anything. We went to waterfalls and I became very unwell. The tour guide was helpful during this experience. At this time I had to rely on the driver and tour guide to protect my son and my personal belongings. When returning I was unable to find my phone and they informed me that when I was laid on the ground that many people were around and they think someone went into the van and took my phone. This doesn't seem reasonable as one of them should have been looking out for the van or locked it. Also my mom was sent a driver and tour guide that spoke minimal English and knew very little about the Temples/Palaces. My mom has traveled all over the world and was able read more than the tour guide was able to explain. Be careful when booking. They have lots of tour options but seems that they subcontract their work and don't consider the client during this process. Also they want full payment first thing when you get in the car! This was very sketchy and now after both of our experiences we see why because they didn't deserve what they charged us.

Extraordinary Elephant Day Trip Was AMAZING.......... Let me start by saying that this was by far the best tour (attraction) that we have ever done. I will start by saying my tour guide Na was an amazing person and an even more amazing tour guide, she was wonderful and so nice. Na and the driver Jo were the perfect combination. They picked me up at 7:00 am in the hotel in a beautiful Mercedes Van and drove us away for our 1-day adventure. We first stopped at the floating village for a bit and then head out to the elephant adventure. I new by the reviews that it would be a great tour, but never expected for it to be the best adventure we ever had. Na was so great with my spouse and made us feel so comfortable. Best of all she is a great photographer. She took some amazing pictures of us, i mean really amazing. I would like to extend my thanks to Na and Jo for the great, once in a lifetime experience. All i can say is don't think twice about this tour and especially, Na and Jo.........Thank YouTony & Maria

Great tour guide/driver - One time Experience!. This place had really great reviews (better than the ones in Koh Samui) which is why we decided to go with them. We booked the elephant tour with stops at the floating market and River Kwai.Our tour guide Bo was very friendly! Loved her! She was young and very knowledgeable about the River Kwai, Thailand culture, etc. She answered all of our questions confidently. She was fun and so was our driver! Because of their great customer service, it made the trip that much better!The pictures on tripadvisor are accurate. We seemed to get the same experience while bathing and riding the elephants. The ride on the elephant wasn't as exciting as I thought it would be. I had more fun with the bathing part of it. It was still a fun experience overall. It is a drive away from Bangkok - nearly 3 hours to the elephant camp. If you prefer not to ride, and just bathe - Check out Elephant Nature Park. http://www.elephantnaturepark.org/ It was a great first time experience, but would not do it again.

Well researched and planned trip. We did the overnight private tour to the Helfire Pass, River Kwai, Tiger Temple and Elephant park.Our guide Nan, and driver Ton were excellent in many ways. Knowlegable, friendly and helpful. The trip was attraction filled, but we bever felt rushed at anytime to have to move on. We fed the tiger cubs, and had the opportunity to get closer to the bigger cats, which we declined because of their size. Rode the elephants and Nan took many great photos, of this and other times. Everything was well organised by Nan and Ton which made for a fantastic trip. If you wish to go to these places then Bangkok Day Tours are the masters. Ask for Nan as a guide and you will only need to relax and enjoy the sights and scenes.

Awesome and amazing tour!!. We booked a elephant/bridge over river Kwai/ floating market day tour and it was absolutely amazing. There were 5 of us and the van was very luxurious and comfortable the whole experience was amazing. Our tour guide Molly is the best highly recommend and ask for Molly to be your tour guide she has been doing it for 25 years. The bridge river Kwai was a great addition to the tour.

Ok but felt rushed. I did the private day tour to Hellfire Pass and the River Kwai with a stop at the Tiger Temple. The guide was friendly and knowledgable but the tour felt rushed. I was interested in Hellfire Pass/ River Kwai and not the Tiger Temple but the guide kept mentioning we only had limited time at the stops because we had to get to the tiger temple so we would have time to walk with the tigers. I mentioned the parts I was interested in and that I wasn't interested in walking with the tigers but the push still seemed to be the tiger temple. Very disappointing considering how much you pay.

A Day To Remember. What an experience we had, travelling and attending the Anzac Day Service at Hellfire Pass, and then back to Kanchanaburi for the Wreath Laying Ceremony. The entire day was organised by Bangkok Day tours, who made the experience so memorable, from the great driver to our fantastic guide Kent, who could not do enough for us. They arranged for us to have a wonderful breakfast at a restaurant on the banks of the river Kwai, and lunch on The Floating Restaurant on the same river, all up, it was a fantastic day, and "hats off" to Bangkok Day Tours. The planning and implementation of the day is what you dream about. I can not praise this company and their employees enough, and should we ever return to Bangkok, we definitely us this company....William & Lesley from Perth
Friendly Staff, "Love our guide Bou". Great tour, treated us so well the entire time. Great price for all the stuff you get to see and do. I would book them again.

Market and tiger temple bridge . Had two tours with this company.and Sally looked after us,she was so lovely and knowledgeable.it was like going out with your best friend. So thank you Sally your are the best.barry and Diane plumb.

Tiger Temple & Elephant Encounter Awesome Tour. Best day ever for me and my 9-year old son! Hotel pick-up and drop-off at our Bangkok hotel right on time. The tiger temple and elephant camp were about 3 hours away from BKK in Kanchanaburi. Unique, fun, entertaining, awesome!

Most incredible tour. I found this tour because I was interested in seeing the bridge on the River Kwai, riding elephants, and seeing some tigers, and this tour was the only one I could find where I could do this all in one day. The elephant riding was wonderful, and I just LOVED the Tiger Temple. My guide, Sally, was the best, she kept me on schedule so I could have the chance to sign up for the cub feeding at the Temple - a must do. I was able to pet and take pictures with the large tigers for about an hour, and then I spent 45 minutes playing with cubs. It was such an incredible experience, and if I return to Bangkok, I will definitely book this tour with this company. It is a day to remember. When I was booking the tour before arriving in SE Asia, Caroline, the Head of the Department of Tours, was very fast at responding to my questions via email, which was very much appreciated.

Shocked and disappointed!. Going by the fantastic reviews of the company on this platform my husband and I got ourselves booked for the floating market/tiger temple trip(code 1117). When the pickup arrived at my apartment with the guide- we found that we were the only people on the tour that day and were happy thinking that we would have sufficient time for sightseeing...it being a Saturday as well and traffic being less.But the guide-Molly, dashed our hopes and made it a miserable trip. Even before starting she demanded that she and the driver needed to be tipped at the end of the day. At each location she hurried us, not explaining things claiming that a 15 minute delay in starting could delay us for the tiger temple. The only relaxed time she allowed was at lunch! On the way back she slept off and by 4pm we were back home...... Thoroughly shocked at the rude behavior of the service provider and disappointed with the journey!

Tiger Temple and Elephant Bathing. My husband and I had the most amazing day on this tour. I can't even put into words how fantastic this trip was. Our tour guide (Sally) was wonderful and took the best pictures. This is definitely something you shouldn't miss if you're traveling to Thailand. I still can't get over the fact that I played with baby tigers, hand fed/bathed large tigers, and rode on the back of an elephant. The company was so wonderful: we were sold when we realized they took care of all transportation, lunch, and pictures. Our tour guide even provided us breakfast foods, snacks, and water throughout the day. If you're on the fence about this tour, the answer is yes, a million times yes. You don't want to miss this.

Anzac Day 25/4/14 Hellfirepass/Kanchanaburi War Cemetary. As Anzac Day to Australians is a Sacred Day Bangkok Days Tours did a magnificent job.Their organization showed how professional this company is and made my day one of the most humbling and emotional I have ever had in my life.I would particularly like to thank 'Bow' the tour guide and 'Lert' the driver both a credit to their company. They made me feel so relaxed and enjoyed their company.I will definitely use Bangkok Day Tours again and highly recommend them.Once again thank you Bangkok Day Tours for a most memorable day.Peter Scheer

'Extraordinary Elephant Day Trip' - unforgettable!. Myself and my boyfriend had the most incredible/unforgettable day. We were lucky enough to only have the two of us on this tour which made it very special. This tour picks you up from your hotel, and first takes you to the floating markets. This was a great little stop and we had a lot of fun on the water! Next we went to the bridge over the River Kwai which was amazing - the tour guide was both informative and helpful. After stopping for lunch (delicious), we went to see the elephants. The highlight by far was bathing with the elephants in the river, we had so much and felt as though the elephants were having a lot of fun too. The elephants were treating with care and attentiveness. All of the elephants that were ridden were bathed in between every ride to help them cool off. This was a fantastic tour and I would recommend to anyone. It is more expensive than some other tours but this means the elephants are treated well. Our tour guide was brilliant and I would recommend this trip to anyone.

Tour not to miss - Tiger Temple. We booking the tour (Tour 1510) on the recommendation of family and were not disappointed. We were a couple but this would be fab for family with older or teenage children, there is a height restriction you must be over 100cm.The tour had a very early pick up from the hotel 4:30am, this was necessary as we were traveling for 2 1/2 hours to get to the Tiger a Temple. The morning tour is the one to do not the afternoon one as you only get to see the Tigers not to play with them.Were we gave food donations to the Monks. The guide told us the protocol to follow with regard to giving the offerings.We then went to a special enclosure to feed milk via baby bottles to baby tigers. Once the babies were fed we played with them whilst the Monks chanted and prayed in the background. Once the Monks finished their morning devotions, we were invited to have a buffet breakfast with the Monks. The food was delicious, all Thai of course no continental After breakfast we washed the older tigers (teenagers) and hand fed them chicken. We then played with these tigers, they are exercised several times a day. Once the tigers were exercised we left that enclosure and went and walked yet bigger Tigers down to the canyon were there was a swimming hole. This was great the tigers and handlers were in the water, tigers were jumping for the toys. We also had our photo taken with the head of one very large tiger on our lap. This is a very special place, if you book for three or more people you also get to go to see the elephants which our family did. Lunch is at a beautiful Thai restaurant located alongside the bridge over the river Kwai. This is something special and like my family who recommended this to us, we would recommend to all.

Elephants, River Kwai, Floating Markets Tour. This tour was brilliant. Mr T was attentive but flexible as we had our children with us. The highlight was riding the elephants into the river. We highly recommend this tour. It was well organized, on time, fun and educational.

Fantastic fun. We booked with Bangkok day tours and had such a fun filled day.Our driver, Adune met us at the hotel on time, he did not speak much English but knew enough. It turned out he had a very good senesce of humour and good driving skills.The floating market was somethingI have never experienced and we got to it nice and early. This was good as it got very busy.We met the other guide Piyawan at lunch and she spoke English well and told us all we need to know. We had fun and lots of laughs.I would recommend this for a fun day out.Enjoy

Incredible Company with an Outstanding Guide. 3 - Day Kachanaburi Tour - PrivateWe booked the three day tour out of Bangkok and we spent the extra money for the private experience due to my husbands health. We needed the flexibility and organization this company provided so we could ensure my hubby could rest when needed, start late if needed, or end our day early if needed.We got so much more than flexibility; we got the most amazing tour guide and crazy but very fun driver too.Pros:1- Our guide was truly amazing. Honestly, she made the Tiger Temple experience so much better than other guests experienced. She immediately guided us and created opportunities to connect with almost every baby and young tiger present. She dynamically showed us how to connect and then went around the temple seeking out new experiences for us. We reflected on how other people in larger tours basically observed the Tigers from a distance as our guide placed us perfectly for a special interaction. I wound up with a baby in my lap sleeping after being bottle fed. I skipped the meal to have more time with the babies because of her diligence and creative approaches to making things happen. I even had another guest lean over and say the obvious: "Your guide is so fantastic. My guide is talking with her friends while yours is running all over the temple. How did you find her?"Guides Name: Sally (not sure of her Thai name but this is how she liked being addressed.)2 - The activities were exceptional except for one which I will address later in the cons section. Salty carried such a reverence and respect when crossing the river Kwai with us that we couldn't help but feel more deeply the gravity and emotion connected to the history of the railroad. Her ability to not only share her knowledge but also highlight the cultural impact on Thai people moved us very deeply. 3 - Erawan N.P. - Not to be a broken record but once again, Sally made a stunning hike up seven tiers of a waterfall even better by telling us how to do the natural water slide and taking pictures of us as we enjoyed each moment. 4- Caroline from the main office who handled our booking and the hotel issues that ensued was incredible. She was the model of professionalism and made our concerns feel heard and valued regarding the hotel. She has been a delight from the very beginning. We would never work with someone else when booking tours in Bangkok. Cons1- The Elephant Walk to the River - After visiting Patara in Chiang Mai, you recognize there are good and not so good ways to create experiences connecting with the elephants. Patara Elephant Farm in Chiang Mai was amazing and did this so well with the elephants well being at the forefront of every interaction.However, the 2 1/2 hour included elephant interaction in Kanchanaburi with this 3-day tour should be reconsidered and possibly offered to a better company. I enjoyed the walk to the river and playing in the water, but I was concerned after observing how they treat the elephants. A young baby elephant (still on milk bottles) had a chain attached to his leg and he was in a very small pen. He paced back and forth and was clearly in mental distress. After visiting the other elephant farm in Chiang Mai a week later, they expressed that elephants should be with their family units for life. We observed babies crying for their mothers in Chiang Mai and watched the mothers run to them. The baby elephant in Kanchanaburi was alone in a pen with a chain on his foot separated from his mother when he was brought to this farm. When I asked about this at this farm in Kanchanaburi, I was told the baby has to be separated from the mother for training purposes. This situation was heartbreaking, and the great pics simply remind me of the baby attached to a chain in a small pen. I am not an elephant expert so I can only report what we observed and then heard when we asked questions. You will need to decide what is right for you. This did not feel right to us. If we all request to have an experience with a farm where families are still intact, I bet these types of elephant farms will be forced to change how they do business. You as a tourist will need to use your conscience to decide what is right for you and your family. Not everyone will agree with my perception about the treatment of the baby elephant, and I accept that. I challenge you to ask your own questions and do your best to ensure the animals you interact with in any country are cared for in a fashion that reflects current research-based practices and a strict adherence to respect and compassion. This was something I want to do better in the future and take more responsibility regarding these issues. I hope you will join me. 2- Hotel Room Issue - The Royal River Kwai Resort was a decent resort, and with Sally's incredible help, the evening meals she helped us order were good. That said, we tried to change our room, and the hotel told our company they had no more regular rooms. We had paid an upgrade price for a room with a tub so my husband could take a bath which helps his severe headaches he gets from a congenital brain issue. The bathtub was very, very, very tiny, or maybe, we're just too big. I'm 5'10 and weigh 187 lbs, and my legs would only fit in this soaking tub. LOL! Regardless, the tub wouldn't work, but the hotel refused to change the room because they didn't want to part with the upgrade fee (3,000 baht). It was a hefty fee but we did not receive the intended benefit. This was strictly meant to support my husbands well being. Caroline and Sally saved the day and made this somewhat right, but the hotel could have just changed our room. I don't believe the situation required so much time and effort. The hotel was almost empty so they looked rather dishonest when they claimed to have no rooms. When they did switch us, they claimed to only have a room with two twin beds, which seemed more of a punishment. It seemed petty and ridiculous to us over an upgrade fee. We recommend you consider when booking to ask for a different hotel for this and other reasons. There are many great options in the area. We are still shocked they did not return the entire fee. Caroline handled this incredibly well and did the best she could to make this right. Again, she made us feel like she was on our side and demonstrated this by speaking to the hotel manager for us. In the end, we never got the full fee returned and we spent the other nights in a separate bed. Our list of pros could fill the Internet about this company and our personalized experience. Bangkok Day Tours was an incredible route to create fantastic memories that were worry free! Sally is a truly professional, highly intelligent, and wonderful guide! If you are lucky enough to get her, you are assured a great experience no matter the itinerary. Lastly, it would help tremendously if the company provided some guidance on tipping. The article I read said ten to twenty dollars per day, and we tipped $60 for our three days. However, it simply did not feel like enough for us. We wished we knew the right parameters in which to work, because Sally was top notch in every way! The company should direct tourists in this affair, or their hard workers may not be honored properly for all they do. We were giving the very top of what we believed to be the tipping range, but we still aren't sure. Safe travels to all of you! You cannot go wrong with this company. We will never forget our time with them and hope Caroline and Sally know how grateful we are.

Not in Bangkok. Although the trip was enjoyable, we did not realize that the tour included a three hour trip out west to the border of Thailand and Burma. On the way out there we hit the bridge over the river Kwai and the floating market. However, on the way back we didn't make any stops. The actually elephant riding was great, there was a swimming portion and a riding portion. Ask for Molly, best guide!

Tour from Laem Chabang to River Kwai. This was my very favourite tour of our whole trip. Trip (Code:LC2111) with Bangkok Day Tours - sensational.Yes, it was a very long drive from the cruise port ....... and would I do it again? Undoubtedly!!! In a heartbeat!! The tour surpassed the long drive and Molly, our guide, was the perfect guide - a little bit of sharing and a bit of quiet time. She was awesome - her sense of humour was cheeky, the snacks she had on the bus for us - yummy! and the air-conditioned 9-seater was very comfortable. The Tiger Temple was absolutely sensational. What a privilege to be able to view and touch these mighty animals. Our group was lucky enough to visit fairly late in the day so after the crowds had gone we we able to watch these amazing creatures jump, play and swim and have lots of fun and exercise in their pond.One tiger was enjoying himself so much he resisted following the others when they left the water. He had to be encouraged out and then when the trainers weren't looking......there he was back in the water again! We were only a wire fence away (only mid height and very much like a toddler's play pen) from these big cats as we watched them frolicking. Was I crazy???? Oddly it seemed very safe at the time and I didn't even consider it being anything else. Would I do it again? Yup!We also had our swim with the elephants. Loved this activity! My elephant kept dunking me! Our group enjoyed this as much as it seemed the elephants did. Molly was great in that she took lots of photos while we were playing.We were able to walk over the Bridge at the River Kwai. Memorable and lots of great photo spots.Such a great tour and the Company was a delight to deal with from my very first email. They always answered promptly and were just lovely. I really recommend this company and tour.

This is a review for the Tour Company not the actual Tiger Temple. My husband & I wanted to treat our daughter, son in law and 3 grandchildren to a day trip where we could see River Kwai, Floating markets for us and tiger cub feeding for the 3 girls aged 5, 9 & 11. The Bangkok Day tour company, especially Caroline, were fantastic & responded to my emails before we arrived in Bangkok as well as when we confirmed once we arrived. We did a private tour for 5 in a beautifully airconditioned mini bus driven by Joe & were picked up promptly at 7am. Sally was our guide and she was informative and lovely explaining everything on the way. Our organised lunch at River Kwai was delicious, floating markets was very interesting. However, I was appalled at the state of the Tiger Temple and wished I had done more research on this place. The adult tigers looked drugged & so bored just sitting for ages while everyone got their photo taken with them. The handlers pulled them around like "puppets" to get photos. The cubs were very cute and we spend 45mins with them where the children could feed them and play with them. However, they were only 2 weeks old and I couldn't understand why they were taken from their mothers so early because I thought if they were returned to their mothers they would be rejected because they would smell of humans. When I asked a keeper this she just avoided answering. Where were the mothers? I now believe they are taken away just to sustain the tourism industry. Please don't go to this so called "tiger temple" but use this tour company because they can't be faulted.

A MUST-DO in Bangkok!. Our Day Trip with BDT's was the most memorable part of our entire trip.The visit to the Tiger Temple and Elephant experience was more than a 10. We took hundreds of pictures but more than anything, walked away with incredible memories from the day. The pick-up is early morning but that is a good thing in order to miss traffic, etc. Our two teen kids loved the day and our family had an incredible experience together.Handling tigers...riding elephants...and truly spending time with these animals was incredible. And something not possible in most other countries.

The Temple and Canals Tours was a great introduction to Thailand. For a jet-lagged first day in Thailand traveler, this tour is a great way to get a feel for the culture of the city/country while being stimulated enough to keep you away. Our guide, Ken was very knowledgable, friendly and informative. The bus was modern. All in all, a great trip. It's important to note that the initial booking fee could be paid online by credit card, but they want to balance on the tour in cash. Could be tough if you haven't exchanged currently. I would definitely recommend Bangkok Day Tours.
Great BKK day trip. We booked our day trip for BKK. It was so exciting to discover almost attractions in this city. The guide was very helpful and funny.

A terrific day tour!. Everything went perfectly with our tour. We are a family of 5 and went on a full day tour and were very well taken care of by Na and Joe. (floating market, Bridge over River Kwai and bathing with the elephants) When booking, I was concerned that it was a long tour- 7 am - 7 pm. The time went by quickly even though it was a long day and the transportation in the air conditioned van was much appreciated. Na was very knowledgable and definitely helped us seek deals at the floating market. A great day for our family and good to see the countryside outside of Bangkok.

Tiger temple and Kanchanaburi from a cruise ship. A group of us from the Celebrity Century booked the Kanchanaburi + Bangkok two day tour (LC2107). There were two Celebrity ships in Laem Chabang port that day and our guide and driver were waiting at the wrong ship. This minor issue was soon sorted out and we were on our way. Our guide "just call me green" and our driver were fabulous, we were really well looked after on our tour especially by our guide. It is a long drive (over 4 hours with comfort stops) to the tiger temple near Kanchanaburi. I honestly don't know how I feel about this place as the tigers looked drugged. We were told this is not so and that they were sleeping in the sun after being exercised and fed. The ride on the elephants was fantastic and feeding the baby elephant was the icing on the cake. Our hotel in Kanchanaburi, Royal River Kwai, was lovely and quiet, clean and the food very good. Early next morning we were taken to the Bridge on the River Kwai and as it was early we more or less had the bridge to ourselves. We then had a 10 minute stop at the war cemetery, If you take this tour and you are either Australian or British please make a short visit to this very emotional and well maintained cemetery.It was then on to Bangkok where we were given a lovely buffet lunch on a floating restaurant before a visit to the Grand Palace and Wat Pho reclining buddha.All in all I can safely say if you want a great tour from your cruise ship at less than half the ships tour price, then I can highly recommend Bangkok Day Tours.Thank you "green" for taking such good care of us.

Best tourguide ever!. Part of the tour was the floating market wherein we enjoyed sweet mango with sticky rice. Next stop was bridge over river Kwai and lunch. Highlight was the elephant ride and bathing of the elephants! We enjoyed it soooo much! Special thanks to our guide "Na" who took fantastic photos and making our trip so memorable. She is also accomodation and it really shows that she loves her work. Our driver "kit" was equally good as well dodging the Bkk traffic. Kudos to both of you! I'll be getting the same tandem when we go back and visit the Tigers

Absolutely AH-MAZE-ING!!!. My husband and I did the "feeding/walking tigers & bathing with elephants" tour. It was amazing! Our guide and driver were exceptional! Couldn't have asked for a better day -- the Tigers were all very lively and clearly well taken care of!! The "caretakers" were so nice and inviting and gave us clear directions on what to do/not to do. Bathing with the elephants was an unforgettable experience as well! I could write for days about how great this tour was, but instead we suggest you try it out for yourself! Cheers!

Bangkok Temples and Canals Tour with Bangkok Day Tours. Our guide Ken was terrific! We thoroughly enjoyed our time with him. He picked us up at the port. He was on time, spoke clearly, provided all the expected guide information and was very personable. He also gave us cultural information to help us better appreciate Bangkok. The colors of Bangkok must be experienced to be fully appreciated. We recommend both Bangkok Day and Ken. He is a super ambassador for Bangkok and the Thai people. This was not our first private tour but it was definitely the BEST!

Wonderful trip. my wife and I took the extraordinary elephant trip and had a wonderful day. It is not a cheap trip but worth every penny. Picked up early by our driver adnan and we had the luxury minibus to ourselves (having seen the minibuses other companies use you want to go with Bangkok day tours) it was very easy to relax in the reclining seats and drift away as the scenery whips by, Adnan does not like to hang around! We stopped at several locations along the way to see some interesting sights (the salt flats with locals recovering the sea salt were really interesting). Then you get to the floating market where we were given as much time as we needed to travel round the market as we needed. Yes it is a very tourist aimed market but it is one of the things you think of when you think of Thailand and well worth a visit, really glad we did it. And best of all you get to see it before it becomes chaotic later in the day! Then off to the bridge over the river Kwai, collecting our guide Bow on route. Again a wonderful visit with Bow very knowledgable and willing to answer all questions. Nice to see some people still respect the sacrifice our troops made during the war, not always the case back home! Here we also had lunch at the floating restaurant where the food is lovely and you have a stunning view of the bridge. Then finally we made our way to the elephants and had a wonderful couple of hours being thrown about in the river by them. This really is an experience worth the money. The elephants are very well looked after and really enjoy themselves playing with the guests. Bow took loads of photos and even when our camera was full she was happy to use her phone and send the photos by Facebook back to us which we are very grateful for. Then finally the long drive back to Bangkok but again Adnan is no slouch and has back in under three hours while we dosed in the back of the van! Our thanks to both Adnan and Bow for a truly wonderful day. Something I would advise anyone travelling to Thailand to do.

MOST INCREDIBLE EXPERIENCE. This was hands down one of the best moments of our lives! The whole tour was incredible but was capped off by the AMAZING HOUR we spent playing with the elephants in the river! Bow was an amazing tour guide and very accomodating, she spent most of the tour taking incredible photos of us! We rode a well maintained van and ate incredible thai cuisine! We also went to the tiger temple which was a good photo op but didn't compare to the elephant experience! We are pretty sure our lives peaked this day in Thailand!

Best. Day. Ever.. My friends and I recently traveled to Bangkok and did the Extraordinary Elephant Day Trip with Bangkok Day Tours. Everyone agreed that this was probably the best day of our lives, including the couple that just got married. Na was an awesome and friendly tour guide, and a more than willing paparazzi. Seriously, I think we ended the day with over a thousand pictures that she took for us. The highlight of the day was definitely bathing with the elephants, check out the videos Bangkok Day Tours has put online to see how much fun it is. One thing I was really impressed with was how much Bangkok Day Tours took care of our comfort. The van we rode in was really comfortable, they had a really extensive movie selection to keep us entertained, and most importantly they provided SNACKS!

Excellent tour company. My family of 4 took the Dumnoen Saduak Floating Market, Bridge over the River Kwae, and Elephant Camp tour. Our tour guide was Na and our driver Joe. It was a long day (more than 12 hours) and I didn't really feel that we needed a guide, but she definitely was helpful and knowledgeable, especially at the elephant camp where she took a million photos and negotiated our activities. The floating market was really amazing- it is definitely for tourists, but we didn't mind. It was about 1.5 hours from BKK. We rode in the boat for about 30 min and bought some souvenirs. Na had told us the prices beforehand and showed us that prices were lower on land. We then drove maybe another 1.5 hours to the bridge. We arrived at midday and it was extremely hot. There isn't much historical info on site. We loved the buffet lunch looking up at the bridge. We then drove maybe another 1.5-2 hours to the elephant camp. We first rode 2 people per elephant around the camp and then changed into bathing suits to go into the river. At this point, we were bareback on the elephants with an elephant and guide for each person. It was a little nervewracking! Once we got used to it, though, it was amazing! The elephants sprayed us and played for a while in the water. It took 3-4 hours to return to BKK. We were very pleased with the company - they were very responsive by email and quite attentive during the tour. Joe was a safe and careful driver. I was able to install the kids' carseats and we all had working seatbelts. The van was large and roomy and on our return we watched a movie (no kids movies though). Overall, it was an expensive tour, but we believe it was worth it, as it covered 12+ hours, many miles, and a once in a lifetime experience with the elephants.

Klong Mahasawat Agro Day Tour + Video Upload Warning. My friends and I took a private Klong Mahasawat Agro Tour thru via Bangkok Day Tours. The jump-off point of the half-day canal (klong) tour was just an hour and 30 mins to 2-hour drive from Bangkok. It allowed us to visit a variety of properties along the canal such as an orchid farm, a fruit orchard, a community that produces rice-based chips and a lotus farm. The private tour itself was a great experience! Our very knowledgeable guide helped us understand Thai culture more and this tour gave us a glimpse of the rural life in Thailand. She even had an assistant who had a camera to document the trip for us by taking photos and a video. Bangkok Day Tours later provided us a CD containing our photos and video. What came as a surprise was the unauthorized uploading of our video in Bangkok Day Tour's You Tube channel. After we complained to Bangkok Day Tours, they apologized and immediately took it down. So, unless you want to be part of the company's marketing campaign, I suggest you inform the company in writing that you want to maintain your privacy and will not allow them to use your photos or video for their company's tour promotions.

Fantastic tour and service!!!. We decided to go on the Tiger Temple VIP experience and the elephant bath tour with our daughter and her partner. Our driver Joe arrived promptly armed with breakfast and a smile. We had a very comfortable drive and collected our guide Na on route. Our day was just fantastic!!! Na was brilliant, making sure we had a special experience and taking lots of photos with our cameras to make sure we didn't miss anything. I can't thank Na and Joe enough for ensuring that we had an extremely special day that we will never forget.We would highly recommend Bangkok Day Tours as the service was econd to none.Thanks Joe, Na and Bangkok Day Tours!!!!

Memorable birthday trip!. My friends and I selected the 3 day Kanchanburi trip with Bangkok Day Tours. We had tour guide Na and driver Joe. Na was very knowledgeable and more than happy to take over our camerasAnd take hundreds of pictures of us with the Tigers, elephants and swimming at Erawannational Park, Joe was a very competent driver and had a really cheery disposition.The car we were touring in was quite luxurious and we were treated to the movie "Railway Man"On the drop down screen. This was a prelude to visiting the Kanchanburi War Cemetery andThe Bridge on the River Kwai. Na helped find the grave of a prisoner of war and his nameIn the book so photos could be taken for elderly relatives in Australia. The Erawan National Park is absolutely beautiful and Na took many photos of us swimming at waterfalls 2 & 4,The Tiger Temple was a dream come true and we were able to feed the Cubs their bottles,Walk the older tigers, helped wash and play with them and watch the big boys play in theCanyon. Along with a photo with the big tiger. Our elephant ride was exceptional as well, whatBeautiful animals to spend time with and have water fights in the river with.Tour 3100 combo A is highly recommended.

Best experience of my life!!!! ❤️😻❤️. My boyfriend and I booked the full day tour toTiger Temple and elephant bath AND IT WAS INCREDIBLE. Worth all the money you will spend. We thought a lot about this tour as it is the most expensive package available. But we don't regret it for sure. It was the best experience we had. We arrived at the temple very early and we still stopped at the bridge and World War II square to take same pics. Sally and the driver brought us something to eat for breakfast so that we could spend more time with the Tigers <<❤️>> There were less than 10 people there. So there was at least one Tiger for each couple always. You can get very close to them and have a private experience.The elephant bath was a nice surprise. I couldn't imagine I would love it so much.Be sure to go with a guide. In our group was a guy by himself and while we had Sally to make wonderful videos and pictures he was making selfies and there wasn't anyone to look after his bags.After all, they drove us to a nice (simple) restaurant with a very very very nice food. Home made food (even Thai food not being my favorite).We just have one complaint about the agency that we had a misunderstanding with the office that told us to wait on the lobby at 4 am but the truth was 4:30 am. But Sally arrived 10 minutes earlier so we didn't wait that much.

My perfect day!!!. We have a wonderful day!!! Everything went very well! The guide Bow was awesome with us. And the driver Kit was so kind. I highly recommend!!! The best company to make tours in Bangkok in my opinion! They have the best options. Thanks a lot Bangkok day tour.

Brilliant Day. I just wanted to write a short review of the brilliant day we had spent with Bangkok Day Tours and our guide Molly, who was so helpful, evening managing to stop on the way to the floating market to get some mosquito cream for my wife which really helped. The floating market was interesting and we spent about an hour here which was enough, we then travelled to the bridge on the river Kwai and had lunch. This was such an interesting place but we felt not enough information was provided about the history of this, no fault of our guide we just thought there might me more information. Then we went to the highlight of our holiday the afternoon with the elephants, this was such a mind blowing experience, Molly took some brilliant photos of our time here. Thanks to our driver who was brilliant and thanks again Molly for giving us such a lovely day and fantastic memories....

Amazing Day. We did the floating market and elephant camp, both of which were great. Your do spend the majority of your time driving since both things are not in Bangkok, but the scenery was great. Our Driver was very friendly, and this was a private tour. My family of three had the minibus all to ourselves with full control of the air conditioning ☺ part way through the day we meet up with our tour guide Bo. She was great, super friendly with loads of great info and facts. They take loads of pictures for you and we're overly accomodating to anything we needed, you just had to ask. I would highly recommend this tour.

Excellent experience. We were promptly picked up at our hotel at 7 am by Andook, a very nice gentleman. We went straight to the floating market, it was a 90 minute drive. We Were able to explore the market for about an hour, with Andook looking after our purchased goods. We then went to pick up our tour guide, Bo and headed to the bridge. Bo is very kind and knowledgable. She took a lot of photos for our family the whole day! We had a lovely buffet style lunch, included in the price of the tour- but the drinks will cost you money, even water so come prepared. At the elephant ride, we bathed the elephants first and Bo took our camera and took a lot of great pics. She was sure to get good angles and asked the elephant handlers to stop or move to ensure a good picture. I don't swim well, and asked the handler not to have me dunked, but my family was swimming in the river with them. Beware you will be completely wet and swimming is involved unless you state otherwise. Bring a change of clothes as well. A waterproof camera would also be great to take pictures up close but again, Bo did amazing! The handlers were great, we had fun with them.On the way home, Bo had snacks for us, cold wash clothes and cold water waiting. It was a very amazing and unforgettable experience. Well worth the money! Take- extra clothes, extra money to tip the handlers. We also tipped Bo and Andook who spent the whole day with us and were so great. Waterproof camera or go pro if you have one. Also, beware it is a long day and drive from Bangkok to the elephant camp...about 3-4 hours. It is broken up nicely with the market, bridge and lunch. The ride home is long though but we enjoyed the drive as it is a nice way to see the country. Thank you for the great day!

With bangkok day tours. My wife and I did this trip with bangkok day tours to the tiger temple  I can't praise them enough they looked after us from the time they picked us up at 4 30 am till they dropped us back at our hotel at 5 pm There were only 4 couples at the temple which meant we had lots of time with the tigers we were lucky that there were 4 week old cubs we cuddled and bottle fed the staff loved the tigers and we're very protective of them none of the tigers were drugged or ill treated in any way and we're played with and encouraged to play with each other we had a fantastic timeAlthough this trip was expensive we felt well worth it

Must for History Lovers. We did the temples tour, the temples we have visited were: > Royal Palace and Temple of the Emerald Buddha: The temple dates back to 1782 when Bangkok was founded and an interesting place to visit. > Golden Buddha - is the world's largest solid gold statue, with a weight of 5.5 tons (5,500 kilograms). It is located in the temple of Wat Traimit. Amazing Statue and a peaceful place to spend some quite time. > Wat Pho - Wat Pho is one of the largest and oldest wats in Bangkok and is home to more than one thousand Buddha images, as well as one of the largest single Buddha images of 160 ft length and Reclining Buddha. We were Amazed to see the size of the statue. The coin dropping tradition wa also good for my kid. > Wat Arun - Temple of Dawn") is a Buddhist temple and is among the best known of Thailand's landmarks a beautiful and iconic place. After the temple visit, we had some light local street food/snacks in lunch which were good and hygienic. Later we have visited the local market and enjoyed local Thai delicacies in some good restaurants. The tour was quite pricey I thought but it was ideal for us to see these sights.

Was one of the best days I have had. From start to finish we were amazed with the great standard of service from this company, the driver was funny and would crack jokes, the pick up was a lovely bus with TV, WiFi, free water and cooler to help make the long journey more comfortable. The dinner was a lovely buffet over looking the bridge where we met our very informative guide who explained a lot of history to usThe floating market is something to be seen and admired as it is such a odd thing to experience The elephant tour was also amazing and me and my girlfriend played with the elephants in the water, we understood how gentle they were and our guide would arrange photo ops for us which helped create lasting memoriesThe whole day was amazing and we felt that we were truly looked after by the company, this is one thing to do in Thailand I never usually post reviews but I believed that this day deserved a outstanding one 10/10

Unforgettable day. My boyfriend and I booked the floating market/river Kwai/elephant bathe one day tour. Our lovely driver, Adul, and sweet tour guide, Bow, were promptly waiting for us in a roomy air conditioned van. An hour and a half later we arrived at the floating markets where a half an hour canoe ride was included. We then had time to walk around at our leisure (we ended up getting a photo with a massive python). The bridge over the river Kwai was next which was definitely a sight to see but lots of tourists! Had a nice buffet lunch right on the river which was also included - but not drinks. Going to see the elephants was the best part of the day!
