As soon as we got there we went on to our elephants bareback (with a guide too) and straight into the river! The elephants were amazing. Spraying water at us, flinging us into the water - it was awesome. Bow is an amazing photographer so thanks to her we have great photos to remember our fun experience by :) Adul is an excellent driver and we felt very safe with him driving while we had a nap on the way home! He is also hilarious! I could not recommend Bow and Adul more highly. They were so friendly, warm and approachable and even though our day was fun from the activities, they made it so much better.

A very good tour. We did the temples tour and that took in the highlights - the Royal Palace and Temple of the Emerald Buddha, Wat Pho and Wat Arun. Then we had lunch at a Thai restaurant by the river - very good Thai food. Then we went on a long boat on the river and canal. There only was our party on the tour so a private tour really, which meant we went at our own pace and our tour guide personalised it - he learned my son liked the tuk tuks so we had a tuk tuk ride added in.The our was quite pricey I thought but it was ideal for us to see these sights.

Best day ever - def not to be missed. Such an amazing experience! Great itinerary, super friendly and knowledgeable staff, and just overall an unforgettable journey. Our guide Bow and driver Adul (maybe Arun? apologies, I didn't hear the spelling very clearly) were there at 4:25 for our 4:30 pick-up and the day was off to a great albeit early start. After passing out for 90 minutes we stopped for a bathroom and coffee break before heading over to the River Kwai. Quaint place it is during that time of day. Bow and Adul even bought us water and snacks, even though we were getting breakfast at the elephant camp later. Which was, of course, a splendid experience. While we were waiting for breakfast to be cooked, we stopped by to see the elephant show. I was immediately called up to join the show and proceeded to get a nice elephant massage plus a big, wet, elephant smooch. Then off to a delicious breakfast, followed by the land portion of the elephant experience. After banana time for the 2 gals, we went down to the river for some more fun. Pro tip: wear heavy-duty pants -- it may sound odd given it's hot and you're going into the water, but do this or face the wrath of spiky elephant hairs. It's been 20+ days and my leg is still recovering from those stings.Lunch was at a pre-set place with a pre-set (but included) buffet. Nothing special, but not bad either. Definitely for tourists. Then it was off to the Tiger Temple, where our highlight was playing and feeding with the 1mo and 3mo tiger cubs. Such cuties, some who were very sleepy, some who were very playful. This, though, was also the one part of the package that was not included nor well-explained. Bangkok Day Tours will charge you 1500 baht pp for the cub feeding, while it's 1000 baht pp at the Tiger Temple. They charge this commission b/c apparently the sessions get filled up quickly...though when we arrived we definitely still saw people getting tix for our session. But overall, amazing trip. After the tigers we passed out again and then were promptly dropped off back at our hotel. Definitely would recommend!

Elephants. Our guide, Na, was very informative about local history and could anser any questions we asked. We found some good bargains at the floating mảrket and the buffet lunch at the bridge over the river 'kwai' was êxellent. But the highlight òf our day was riding the elephants bareback into the local river. While in the river we were tossed over the elephants back and flung up with thier trunk. Riding the elephant was also a good ễxprience.I would recommend thís one day tour for anyone.

Best thing we did was booking this tour!. Booked a 3 day tour in November 2014 with Bangkok day tours. Sally picked us up from our hotel in Bangkok with our driver Mr T. Over the course of the next 3 days we would enjoy experiences that are truly unforgettable.Day 1 we visited the elephants. We got to bottle feed a baby elephant and also take time to feed some of the adult elephants. We then rode on 2 elephants down to the river were we played with the elephants in the water, after they brought us back to the main building we got to feed them bananas (take money with you so you can do this (1 bunch is 50 baht) you can also tip the mahouts) when you ride the elephants at this stage you just ride on their back with only the mahout, however later on you ride on another elephant around the site in a seat on their back ( husband and I together)Day 2 we were supposed to visit the Tigers but instead went to the Erawan national park to trek up the waterfalls. Sally decided this last minute but glad she did as when we went to the waterfalls we had them all to ourselves! You have to get up very early on this tour (leaving 6:30am each day) but it is worth it as you get a much more personal experience at each activity, by the time we had done our trek the waterfalls were very busy as lots of other families and tourists are there throughout the day. I didn't realise how much I would enjoy this day, there are 7 waterfalls in total to trek upto so it is quite hard going as you get further to the top, I made sure I went in each of the waterfalls just be prepared for the fish nibbling your feet! It tickles!Day 3 we visited the tiger temple, there was only about 20 people on the tour so again you had a really personal experience handling tigers one on one. We held tiger cubs who were 5 weeks old then spent time doing activities with older ones (5-8 months) then we went into a canyon where we had our picture taken with a fully grown tiger and then watched them (6 adult tigers) play in the water together. It was a fantastic experience, reading previous reviews we booked this tour so we could go in the morning when the Tigers are more alert, in the afternoon when the majority of people come it is very hot and cats naturally sleep at this time, in the morning we could see them playing and interacting with each other. When we have got home people have asked us whether the Tigers are drugged particularly when we show them our picture with the adult. I honestly don't believe this is the case as minutes later he is running and jumping in the water, not at all tired!We were told that the purpose of the temple is to raise funds to build a reserve where the Tigers can live, Josh one of the staff said that this is not an ideal scenario for the Tigers but in the wild they are at risk of poaching, we hope that the work that they are doing at the temple can help save Tigers.We also went to the floating market and to the death railway, war cemetery and bridge over the river Kwai. We enjoyed the floating market but felt the historical sites to be sad, we are glad that Sally took us to see these places so we could learn about the history of these events and appreciate what the Thai people went through at this time.I finally just wanted to add about our accommodation and food while we were on the tour, the hotel was the Royal River Kwai resort which was lovely, beautiful gardens and surroundings, the room was clean, only issue is my husband and I are both 6ft and the shower is not adjustable so I had to kneel down in the bath to wash my hair! The food was excellent, the staff could not do enough for us, my husband is vegetarian and both the staff and Sally worked together to ensure he was also catered for.Thank you again to Sally for such a fantastic trip, we have and will continue to recommend you to others!

Tiger temple and elephant ride... lifetime experience!. This attraction was one of our last activities during our Honeymoon trip to Asia (December 2014) and in our view was an extraordinary lifetime experience. We booked with Bangkok Days Tours, a very serious firm with an incredible service from our tour guide Sally. Any trip to Thailand should include this activity.Tiger’s temple was awesome. The incredible experience of interacting with tigers with all ages (from 2-week born to 5-year old) makes the whole trip worth waking up at 4:00am.Sally was clever enough as to provide us with breakfast during the road in order to have more time and play with the cubs.The elephant ride was something really special too. Riding elephants and playing with them in the river is a lifetime experience.The only point of improvement is the lunch provided at a very simple restaurant with limited food options. Nevertheless, despite this the whole experience and service deserves 5 stars without a doubt!

Excellent!. Wasn't expecting much but was extremely happy with our tours and tour guide. We did the elephant tour and tiger temple, with Poh who was great took a million photos for us, explained what we were doing at the start of the day and made sure things ran smoothly. The floating markets were fun and got a souvenir picture they printed for us for only 100baht, the bridge on the river Kwai was interesting to see but not much information around to tell you about the history, lunch was yum at the restaurant nearby. The tiger tour was amazing, the bridge again in the morning but at a different light so gave a different affect.. Arrived at the tigers and was excited to play with the babies straight away to get you used to them, was calm the whole tour and the tiger seemed to be really cared for. Lunch and snacks were provided both day and bus/4wd was comfortable. Would definitely do again when in Bangkok.

Worth the money. you definitely need to book a tour @bangkok day tours. They are worth your money! We had a really good time going to the floating market, floating restaurant and elephant riding/swimming. Tour guides took care of us and always made sure that we are having a good time.

Tiger Temple with Angie. This was my second time with Bangkok Day Tours, and I was lucky enough to have Angie as my guide both times. Booking was very easy and communication was very good. Angie is a great guide, she explained each stage of the day to us and ensured that the day ran smoothly. Angie also took plenty of photos for us. I highly recommend the Tiger Temple - Breakfast with the monks, followed by the elephant bathing.Thanks also to our driver Lim.

The best ........ We set out on our tour with very low expectations but boy were we wrong, the day was fantastic. We booked to go to the floating market, the bridge over the river Kwai and the tiger temple - there were 3 in our party; a teenager (hates everything), her dad (who hates tours & anything cultural) and Mum who loves history and visiting new places! Something for everyone right? We had an Early start 7am, so already the moans and groans set in but we got up and we were met by joe our driver, he told us no-one else had booked so it was just us & our 1st stop was the floating market 1.5 hours drive from our hotel in Bangkok (que moans & groans). The mini bus was fab, equipped with drinks, mini cinema and disco lights! Joe gave us some information en-route but we just slept mostly. 1st stop the floating market - didn't buy much as the prices are inflated & it's just tourist tat but it was great fun, try the coconut pancakes - yummy! Next stop 30 minutes away - lunch at the River Kwai, great thai style buffet - food was exceptional and the view to die for; here we met Na our guide for the River and the Tiger Temple, she said let's come back to the River & do the temple earlier than two as you 'll get longer time with the Tigers and she was right! All through our time there she was pushing us along to get the best pics and slots with the tigers and I can honestly say she made the whole trip for us - I have done a lot of tours all over the world and this far exceeds any I have done up to now and I am sure it was because we had Na there to show us the ropes. Also, the cub feeding was A-mazing. After this we headed back to the River which was beautiful and again Na was full of information and information. The drive back to a Bangkok was 3 hours (ouch) but we put a film on, the seats back and chilled. I know it's been a good day when I don't hear any moans or groans from.my family and especially when there is a huge smile on my teenage daughters face after a full day and a 3 hour drive home!! I highly recommend this trip but most of all I highly recommend our driver Joe and our tour guide Na.

The highlight of our stay in Thailand. I was actually hesitant in booking with any tour companies at first, but I saw excellent reviews for Bangkok Day Tours and thought it could be worth the risk. And guess what? The risk yielded fantastic results! The guide, Bo, and their collections officer were already waiting for us at the lobby even before our committed time, 7am . (Like I said, I was hesitant so I only paid for a quarter of the entire amount online and paid them in full before we started the tour.) We didn't even have to call them for confirmation the day before. So I had one less thing to worry about. We started the tour shopping at the floating market. We had quite a haul. Be sure to haggle a lot though. Since we're also from Asia, we had a pretty good idea how much we can haggle these things for. If you don't have an idea, you can start haggling from 75% off and work your way from there. After shopping, we went to the railroad bridge over River Kwai. And had a good meal on a floating buffet restaurant (included on our tour cost). After lunch, we headed straight for our elephant ride. Our first activity with the elephants was bathing in River Kwai. It was the most fun of the entire experience. We rode their backs on the way to the river and made our way back to the camp after bathing. We fed them bananas as tip. Then, we went on another elephant ride (now with seats and they're different elephants) around the camp. Then again, we fed them as tip. :) We changed into our dry clothes and went back to the hotel. The camp is about 3-4 hours from the city center.

Best Day Ever!. We spent a few days in Bangkok and, while there, we were looking for an elephant experience. What we got was so much more -- seriously, probably the best single vacation day we have ever had! Well worth the cost. We were picked up at our hotel at 4:30 a.m. and didn't return until about 7 p.m. We were driven in a private van to the Tiger Temple and after giving the monks an early morning breakfast (provided by the tour company), we spent a half day playing with tiger cubs and interacting with the large tigers too. I never expected to be able to see these beautiful animals this close -- let alone hold and feed the little cubs! The monks and volunteers at the temple are doing an amazing job with these rescued animals. We have many photos our terrific guide, Na, took as memories and to show our friends just how unique it was! Then, we drove to an elephant camp and had another incredible experience. My husband and I each got onto an elephant and rode into the river for a little water fun. Each of us had a young Thai elephant guide on the back of our elephant for part of the time (who was making sure all was OK), but we were "bareback" on the elephants, without a saddle of any kind, and just enjoying playing with them in the water. It was pure joy for us animal lovers. I realized later that the river water probably was not great to swim in with them, but they did provide a shower afterward and we had no ill effects. The whole day was magical. I highly recommend this company and this particular tour. You won't be sorry!

Bridge over the River Kwai, Tiger Temple and Elephants. From the moment we were picked up from our hotel at 4.30am we had a fantastic time. Sally our guide was courteous and friendly, our private minivan was extremely comfortable and water and a packed breakfast was provided. We arrived early at the River Kwai at around 6.00am when the early morning mist was still on the river and it was magical. Only 2 other people were there so we could look around and experience the place in near solitude.We then went on to the Tiger Temple, bad reviews abound about this place which made me wonder whether to book this trip. All I can say about that is - spend the extra money and go on the morning tour when you can see the place properly and experience the Tigers from feeding the babies and youngsters up to 4 months, walking the 4 month old tiger, bathing and feeding the 1 year olds followed by playing with them in their enclosure- scary but we were well looked after. We then walked the big guys to the river, photo op with head in lap and watched the Tigers playing in the pool. The guides at the temple are pleasant and professional. You may not agree with tigers in captivity however anything that can be done to highlight these magnificent animals can't be all bad.After the temple we went for a delicious buffet lunch then it was on to the elephant camp for an enjoyable ride on the elephants with my husband acting as a mahout for some of the time.We can't fault our day it was brilliant and I would recommend Bangkok Day Tours unreservedly for their professional and friendly service.

Amazing Day Out!. Our guide Molly was incredible, she updated us with Thai history and kept us on our feet throughout the whole tour. We started with the floating markets and went onto the river kwai followed by tiger temple and elephant riding. All four experiences were amazing and we were given options as to how long we wanted to be there and what we wanted to do first (tigers or elephants). Wouldn't have gone without this tour as it was good value for money and we got everything you can get out of it - Sorry we were not able to tip you Molly!! Hope this makes up for it..

Very very special day. What a amazing day...from pick up at our hotel in Bangkok at 7 a.m. until almost 6 p.m., our guide (the wonderful and charming Sally) led us on day that we will never forget. We visited the Floating Market in Ratchaburi (a must see...be prepared to barter), the famous bridge over the River Kwai (where we had a buffet lunch in a floating restaurant) and then on to the elephant camp. My husband and I will remember this forever. Sally took loads of great pictures for us as we rode the elephants into the river for some soaking wet fun. I think the elephants enjoyed it almost as much as we did. I should also mention that our van driver was very skilled at zipping in and out of the Bangkok traffic and got us back much earlier than we had thought. Highly recommend Bangkok Day Tours..First Class.

Best trip ever!!. Asia is very famous for its historical and unique heritage but sometimes you don’t get time to know about your own continent! Thanks to Thomas Cook for showing us superb places of Asia and especially its culture! The best part for us was that our tour manager arranged for us some really delicious and authentic vegetarian Asian food- which is rare to find. Your tour manager really helped us in knowing more about these wonderful places and experience them up close!

Best Tour Experience thanks to Na and Bangkok Day Tours. Being an avid traveler- we typically take 3-4 vacations a year. I have never been inclined to write a review, until I met Na from Bangkok Day tours. We selected to do the Tiger Temple and Elephant bathing tour. The driver was prompt and we were given our own vehicle. When our tour guide, Na got into the van an hour later I was confident this was going to be a great day. Her pleasant demeanor and friendly attitude was immediately contagious. We stopped briefly at River Kwai Bridge for photos. We did not even ask and Na was telling us how to pose and snapping pictures with every device capable! The bridge over sunset photos came out PHENOMENAL! When we got back into the van, we saw Na and the driver bought a light snack for us which was so thoughtful! Listen, I have had my fair share of great tours but the human factor and the thoughtfulness was truly touching. When we got to the Tiger Temple, Na was always scurrying ahead to make sure we got the best views, the best tiger etc. She snapped over 1000 photos for us. When she was not allowed in certain parts of the program, we later realized she convinced workers to snap up close and personal pictures of the adult lions- about an inch away from their face. This just says about the professionalism and thoughtfulness of this amazing person. Instead of sitting around or chatting with other tour guides, she was running around in the heat and taking pictures we did not even know about just so we can enjoy later. This was the best money I ever spent. I regret not using them for my other 3 tours in Bangkok. Thank you Na and Bangkok Day tours!

Couldnt rate them an more highly. my best friend, her boyfriend, my boyfriend and I booked the river kawai, tiger temple and elephant bathing with bangkok day tours.We were a bit concerned when we saw the 4.30am pick up time but was totally worth the early morning wake up!We came down to our hotel lobby at 4.30 where our driver was ready waiting for us.We were thrilled that we were the only 4 on the van with all seats reclining and super comfy so we could nap on the 3 hr car ride.We picked our tour guide up on the way and she was delightful spoke perfect and clear english.We got to the river kawai bridge before any other tour so we got to enjoy it all to ourselves. She was very informative and knew the best spots to take photos.We got back into the van and were given some breakfast food to tie us over until a bit later when we were served a proper breakfast at the tiger temple.Through out the day at the tiger temple and again at the elephant bathing our tour guide had our camera all day and got the best photos and we could just enjoy the experience! By the end of our firsy day I ended up with 950 photos on my camera alone! So wrapped she captured every moment on camera for us!Between the tiger temple and elephant bathing they had more snacks, cold water and refreshing towels for us.Once we played with the elephants we were quite dirty from the lake water. Our tour guide pulled out shower gel from the back of the van and showed us where the showers were. After that we were taken to a lovely restaurant where it was buffet style and the food was delicious and fresh.On our long trip home we were able to watch a movie in the van, view our photos from the day and have another napAll in all I could not fault this company and wouldn't hesitate to book with them again

Bridge over the river Kwai and Tiger temple. After seeing temples it was great to get out of the city. Best way is with a private guide. Our guide was knowledgable, and enthusiastic. Whilst it is a long drive each way, 2.5 hours, with the commentary and ability to ask questions the time goes quickly. The mini van for the four of us was extremely comfortable with reclining seats. Recommend going into the museum at the war memorial as gives greater insight. Tigers were well worth it. With everything you just need to remember there are a lot of people everywhere. I would use this company again, but the destination is only a once only destination.

Bridge over the Kwai and Tigers. The tour was amazing, we went to Bridge over the River Kwai on 11/11/14 and it was truly insipirational. our guide was fantastic, she was really knowledgeable and informative. We had early lunch so that we could get to the Tiger temple early. I had read some bad reviews about the tiger temple and possibility of the tigers being drugged so I was a bit dubious.....although pleasantly surprised. Our guide made sure we were at the front of the queue and helped us to get some awesome photos of the tigers. We had also chosen to feed the baby tigers which was just magical! I would recommend this tour to anyone visiting Bangkok although if you have never been to Bangkok this is a long way out of the city and a full day tour, and there are other things to see in Bangkok like floating market, wat pho, grand palace etc if its your first visit. This wasn't for us thats why we chose to do this trip and it was definately worth it! I also have to mention our driver, he was fantastic.....driving in Bangkok is a bit hair raising but he did a fantastic job and we felt completely safe throughout the 4-5 hours of driving on this tour. All costs were included in the tour so we had nothing else to pay out on the day.

Tiger Temple and Elephants. Amazing tour. Good speaking English guide. Floating market - new experience. Tigers was amazing - the best part of the tour. Elephant ride - so exciting. Totally recommend this tour!

Amazing!!. We had such an amazing day with bangkok day tours. We visited the tiger temple and spent the afternoon with the elephants. We had a driver pick us up from the hotel at 4:30am and drop us back at 5pm, we had a lovely tour guide who was so nice and helpful. Couldn't recommend bangkok day tours enough!

Can't wait to go back. A co-worker recommended a tour group while in Bangkok. Bangkok Day Tours has a wide variety of tours. From feeding baby tigers to visiting the floating market, riding elephants to visiting all of the Royal Temples. They will send a car directly to your hotel in Bangkok, many other tour groups charge extra for this, and an English speaking guide will accompany you along the whole trip.Read more about my trip here: http://www.redheadroadtrips.com/international-travel-trips/thailand-post-under-construction

Wonderful Day!. We traveled to Thailand with our children ages 6,4 and 3. They loved the Elephant Day Tour. We all were able to ride the elephants. But our girls were not big enough to bathe the larger elephants Our wonderful guide Bow, made arrangements for our children to bathe a 1 year old elephant which was so cute! She watched our girls and took pictures of my husband and I in the river with the elephants. Our guide was friendly, helpful, knowledgable as well as the driver. I would highly recommend this tour.

An amazing day!. What a day!!! From being picked up from the hotel at 7 am to being dropped off again in the evening we were really well looked after all day. Our guide Na was fantastic, full of interesting information and unbelievably enthusiastic and helpful.We did the floating market,river Kwai and elephant camp trip and the whole family had the best day ever. Yes, the floating market is touristy as is the river Kwai but they were still great if you've never been.As for the elephants, an absolutely unbeleiveable experience and something all of us, especially the kids (teenagers) will remember their whole lives. Na took a load of photos and videos on our phones while we were bathing and playing with the elephants in the river. Whatever words I write won't do justice the the amount of enjoyment we all had from this activity.If you get the chance just do it. It's a very professional company and you will have a day you'll never forget.

Elephant Day Tour. We took a private tour to see the floating markets, the tiger temple and the bathing with the elephants. This tour was not only the highlight of my visit to Thailand but one of the highlights of all of my travels around the world. I fed baby tigers and slid down an elephant's trunk over and over (she would then pick me back up with her trunk) in the river. This is a must do. Molly was our tour guide and she was wonderful!

Elephant Bathing & Tiger Breakfast Two Day Tour. Tour guide arrived early. Spoke English very well, very friendly, and very knowledgeable. They provided a private car for our group. Amazing price for what the tour included. We had a couple questions for the company before our trip and they were extremely responsive. It was such an amazing experience with how interactive we were with both the tigers and the elephants. I would highly recommend them and definitely use them again if I ever get the opportunity to go back to Thailand.

Bridge on the River Kwai, Tiger Temple and Elephant Ride.. I echo those comments of Cindy G. This was an amazing day's tour--one of the best I have ever taken. The tiger temple was an amazing experience: we got to play with and feed baby tigers, to wash and shampoo older ones and to walk and observe the very large ones--up close and intimate. The elephant camp was great too--completely as advertised. We each got to ride our own elephant, sitting behind its head, with a mahout behind us. We rode them into the river and the mahouts got off, and we got to spend a lot of time playing with and riding on and swimming with these wonderful creatures. The van was ultra-luxury and the driver and guide were great. The trip included lunch and a restaurant. The guide took our cameras and took non-stop pictures while we interacted with the tigers and elephants. This was a day neither of us will ever forget!!

Floating Market, Bridge over River Kwai, Elephant Ride. Words cannot explain how pleased I am with the service that they provided. Na, our tour guide, was knowledgeable, passionate, and did everything to make the moment special for us. She took over 400 pictures of us riding the elephants and was an absolute delight from the moment they picked us up. We had a bit of an awkward schedule (needed to get back for suit fitting) and Na and Joe developed a schedule that got us there at the perfect time. They are a knowledgeable staff and using anyone other than Bangkok Day Tours would be a waste of time and money.

Half day Temple Tour. Booked mine via asia wed direct online and they were booked to Diethelm Travel which i think is their partner. I think visiting the temples are a must especially for first time travellers in Bangkok. Tour included Golden Buddha, Emerald Buddha and the Grand Palace. Better get a tour service to save you time from asking around and hailing a ride around... Also queuing in line for the ticket.Slather on suscreen and bring a hat and sunglasses! You will be under the sun most lf the time.

Bridge on the River Kwai, Tiger Temple and Elephant Ride. Did the day tour where you visit the Bridge on the River Kwai, Tiger Temple and the Elephant ride.I really done know where to start. It truly was an amazing day.We were so well looked after with cold water, food, the guides even knew where the cleaned toilets were.Would highly recommend this tour for a wonderful day out an a experience you won't forget.

Eager to please. I had a private tour of the Ridge on River Kwai and Hell Fire Pass. The guide and driver were punctual and extremely eager to please. The car was clean and comfortable. The guide was flexible to our preferences adjusting the length of time spent at different stops whilst keeping to the overall timeframe. It is a long day but worth every minute. The meal is simple but tasty and filling. Pick up and drop off to the hotel door. Snacks and drinks were provided.

Awsome Elephant Experience. We took the pack "floating market - kwai river bridge - elephant bath" and it was amazing!Really punctual, great guide and driver. We have really beautiful photos thanks to the guide.The bath with elephants was something that I wont never forget it.I totally recommend it!

Excellent 2 day tour of Thailand. My family of 4 booked the 2 day trip to the elephant ride in Kanchaburi, the bridge over the river Kwai, and the Floating market. Our tour guide and driver picked us up from our cruise ship in Laem Chabang on time and we were very happy with the ability to speak English by our guide, Tanya.We boarded a lovely air conditioned van on our way to Kanchaburi. We made a quick stop in Bangkok, to pay for our tour, and load up on snacks for the trip. The owner was very accomodating and nice. I enjoyed the personality of everyone involved.On the way to Kanchaburi, we stopped for lunch at a restaurant on a river. The food was included in the tour and was very authentic. I, personally, don't enjoy Thai food, but my husband LOVED the food offered. I think he wants to move here.We got back on the road, and after a short gas/petrol stop, we continued into the mountains. Our guide maintained a stream of information about each area that we traveled into. I really enjoyed all of the information about Thai life and the areas we were traveling in. We reached the Elephant camp around 3 or 4 in the afternoon and proceeded to meet the trainers of the elephants. We ran into a situation in which my 8 year old daughter would have NOTHING to do with the elephants. She woudn't ride them. She wouldn't pet or feed them. Nothing. I was very obviously upset that she wouldn't interact with the animals, and the trainers took note. They tried everything to get her to pet them, including making one lay down on it's side! She was NOT having it!I stayed behind with my youngest, and let my husband and older daughter take the ride through the jungle. Then the elephants were led down to the river and I joined them.It was sooooo amazing! I mounted the elephant in the river off of a tree trunk. The elephant proceeded to dunk me in the river, and then retrieve me from the depths! Hilarious video accompanies this!After our amazing time, we were driven to our resort on the river. I can't imagine a more picturesque resort. It was so well landscaped and beautiful...until we got to the rooms... The rooms were quite shabby, and the beds were similar to cloth-covered boards. OMG! I didn't sleep a wink! Dinner was great and well serviced! We were disappointed that the pool closed at 8:00 p.m.... :(The next day we started soooo early! We trudged to our van and boarded for the stop at the Bridge. The stop was brief, which was great. We bought a few souvenirs, and then headed to the floating market.The floating market is amazing! We boarded a small boat and traversed the market, buying a myriad of items. I had a really good time.There was a long trip back to the port, but they allowed us to stop for some fast food. I enjoyed that enormously, since I was starving. I don't like Thai food, and this was very welcome!We were dropped off on time!I would HIGHLY recommend this company. I was extremely happy! The total cost, for food and accommodations was around $1400 USD for 4 people. A little pricey, but worth it!

Elephants River Kwai and floating market. We are a family of six with 4 boys aged 9, 16, 18, and 22. They all absolutely loved the whole day. Well done bangkok day tours. You truly understand your customers. Started at 6pm. Our driver was Jo. Friendly and safe. The Toyota people mover was like new. Very comfortable leather seats and good sized tv and dvd player. A long drive to the floating market. The water was quite clean and no smell and the boats are safe. The vendors had plenty of unique craft items we had not seen at other markets. A little pricy but Ok if you barter. It was far better than I had expected. The bridge over the river Kwai was amazing. Buy the book to read the story for about 200 thb ... it is history which must not be forgotten. Our guide Nam was very passionate and knowledgeable. Her insight added enormous value. Went to a local restaurant for lunch. The mango rice was very good. The elephants. ... wow!! Had been on a trek before but this way surpassed our expectations. Within 5 minutes of arriving we were each on top of an elephant head ... no seat and heading to the river. All a little anxious but the mahout (trainer) was always in total control. Into the river and before we knew it sliding down the trunk, squirting each other, standing on their head and jumping into the water only to be retrieved safely by the elephant every time. They always knew where you were and would simply slip their trunk between your legs and lift you effortlessly out of the water again. The river was very clean and flowing well but always in safe reach of the elephant who are at home in water. Nam took many photos on our phone cameras while we had an a absolute hoot for a good 1/2 hour. I can't remember the last time all our boys laughed so much. We then went for a 20 min walk on top of the elephants with a seat. I had a massive 50yo male elephant with enormous tusks. A gentle giant. Nam also took a video which she played on our return trip to Bangkok and will make available to us on youtube and dvd. Git back to the hotel around 7 pm. The video and a movie on the way home with snacks and drinks supplied made a long day very comfortable and we'll worth it. A lasting family memory we will treasure always. Special thanks to Nam!!!Thank you.

Bridge over river Kwai and tiger temple tour. WOW what an absolutely amazing experience. We were extremely lucky to have the wonderful Na as our tour guide and the super Joe as our driver ! We started at the bridge over the river Kwai at sunset and then to breakfast with monks followed by tiger temple and swimming with elephants . There is not one single part that I could say I liked more, the entire day was something I will never forget. From the tiny 2 week old tiger cubs wanting nothing but cuddles to the naughty teenagers who want to play all the time, to the offering to the monks to swimming with the elephants and using their trunks as water pistols against each other. Na has given us so many memories of video and photos all on disc and I don't think she missed an opportunity. Joe has the most amazing van including karaoke , movies and luxury leather seats. They both showed us nothing was ever too much trouble. Thank you so much for the most amazing memories. Please be sure to ask for Na and Joe as they are fantastic. Kelli , Wes , Jen, Dave and Chloe .
excellect attaraction. This is wonderful place to visit with family. Enjoyed sightseeing. The sight seeing you will enjoy with view of the city.

tigertemple & elephant trek was by far the best decision ever made !. We highly recommend anyone to do a tour with these guys , we can honestly say it was the highlight of a whole holiday . Sally was lovely and spoke great english .We didn't like the floating market experience as the people there grab your boat and try to hassle you into buying things but thankfully it only lasted about 20mins. there is about 30mins drive to each event . We stopped for toilets breaks regularly , water & snacks were provided .Tiger temple was amazing !! get your picture taken with all the tigers and we payed extra to feed and play with the cubs which was great price for how much time you spend with them - beware thou even the little cute ones can be rough and bite , my fiancé got a nice bite on her leg by one but said it was worth it ! once they are fed they become very playful but tired - a must experience !! the elephant trek is great too ! the whole day just left us feeling amazed

The Best day of my life. We did the Elephant riding trek which was absolutely amazing. They picked us up at our hotel, took us to a floating market, which was an incredible experience within itself. We went to a local restaurant for lunch which was surprisingly delicious! Then we went to the elephant park. While we were riding the elephants, our tour guide took our phones and cameras and took literally 1000's of pictures. We have so many great memories from that day!

Elephant, Floating Market and River Kwai Tour (1506). We are a UK family of 5 with 3 girls aged 16, 14 and 9. We considered the Tiger Temple Tour but the Tiger Temple visit itself got mixed reviews and was considerably more expensive. This tour was perfect for us as it had something for all of us. The stops broke up the 3 hour journey to the main attraction - the elephants. Mum particularly wanted to see a floating market while in Thailand. It felt very touristy but kept her happy. Dad (me) wanted to see the Bridge Over the River Kwai. I found that highly emotional - my parents were young adults in the war and so it has always been a factor I have been aware of. The war felt very close when we were walking across the bridge. The kids particularly wanted to do elephant bathing and that lived up to their expectations and exceeded ours. It was definitely worth paying the extra to go bathing - we also did the riding which is still fun but much more passive than the bathing.The other thing that made our long day - 7am pick up 7 pm return - was the quality of both the service and of the van. The van was spacious and very comfortable. It also had excellent comms facilities so we were able to watch a harrowing but ultimately uplifting film about Eric Lomax (a PoW of the Japanese) on the way there, and then a complimentary disc (video and photos) of our elephant bathing on the way back (which was delivered to our hotel the next morning). All that combined to make the journeys easy.The service came from Na our guide and Joe our driver. Na was highly knowledgeable about both the River Kwai - she is from the area and used to work at a hotel there - and about the elephants. She knew all the mahouts and elephants individually. And when my camera's memory card got full she offered me hers. Highly recommended - ask for NA and Joe if you can.

A must do experience in Thailand. I was very keen to do a trip whilst in Thailand and after lots of research picked Bangkok Day Tours and I'm so glad we did it! We did the early morning pick up which was a hard start at 4.30am but so worth it. The elephants were definitely the best part of the trip and such an amazing, fun experience! We didn't realise how much time we would spend with them and I highly recommend it for anyone looking to do any elephant excursions. Just a warning you will get completely thrown in to the water and you will see some lovely elephant poo float past you but it is completely worth it. The elephants were so so beautiful and clever and we got to ride them by ourselves for a really long time and spent ages in the water with them washing them, being thrown around and spraying water! Our guide was so attentive and took so many pictures and videos for us that we will definitely treasure forever

AMAZING!. If you are in Thailand, this trip is a must! We went on trip 1512 Breakfast with Elephants: Elephant Camp. Included in that trip is also a quick visit to the bridge over the river Kwai and a few hours at the Tiger Temple. Our tour guide Sally was amazing. She asked for my camera when we got to the elephant camp, and by time we left she had taken over 200 pictures and videos. I always hate asking people to take a lot of pictures but she volunteered to be our photographer for the day :-) We rode bareback, fed them, bathed them and played with them in the water. We were provided breakfast and lunch, and we were also given snacks for the car ride. I had pre-paid the entire amount on a credit card before we left, so all I had to worry about that day was a tip for the trainers, our tour guide and driver. The whole day was incredibly well organized and I can honestly say it was the most memorable experience of my life. :-)

Amazing. I booked this trip in May as a surprise for my partners birthday in august. Little nervous as a private tour to see elephants 3 hours outside Bangkok felt bit daunting....the day arrived and all I cam say is Wow Wow Wow!! Our driver was lovely Oh who arrived on time, picked us up in an A/c SUV and the drive didnt even feel too long,a packed bag of goodies was even on baoard for us to nibble on. We picked up Bo our tour guide who was super. She took ownership of our cameras and took amazing shots. The river kwai was peaceful then nearly 4 hours with elephants on them and playing in the water was the best experience ever (300 pics and videos taken). We left then for a yummy traditional lunch onto the tigers which were super cute and heaps of them to see. This trip was worth every cent and the pictures are memories we will have for years. MY TIP; You will need likely two well charged cameras/phone, definately swim gear is needed you will be fully in the water and last of all remember to tip your driver and tour guide.

Amazing experience. A great thing to do with kids - the day mixes up lots of diverse activities, so there is bound to be something for everyone. The floating market was a unique experience for us, and the elephant walk and bathing was more fun than we could have believed.When you book your tour, ask for Na and Jo - they provided outstanding service, were friendly and efficient, and took great photos and video footage. Really, a pleasure from beginning to end and an unforgettable day!

A must for those wanting a truly close experience with elephants!!!. Having had a few excursions in the past ( when the kids were slightly younger) with " elephant riding", " elephant feeding" etc we deciding to book this excursion as it seemed to be slightly more exciting and intimate...... And the kids are now older teens! What an experience!!!!!! Not only did we ride the elephants bare back ( with and without the Mahouts) BUT we were given the fantastic opportunity of playing with 5 majestic beasts in the water!.......and boy, do those elephants like to have fun!!!! Definitely a trip for those who like to get wet and who adore these amazing creatures. My family have not stopped talking about it since! Thanks so much to Na, Bo and Jo the driver of a " groovy" vehicle! A brilliant, unforgettable experience!

Floating Market, River Kwai Bridge and Tiger Temple. This is an amazing day trip. From start to finish we enjoyed every minute. Ken, our tour guide, was warm and welcoming and his knowledge of each of our stops was insightful and truly helpful, his tips and experience as a tour guide allowed us to make the most of eah part of the trip. The highlight of the day for us was the Tiger Temple and feeding the tiger cubs. Recommend this trip and Bangkok Day Tours 110%. Two extremely satisfied customers.

Day trip, Floating market, River Kwai and elephant ride. Really well organised, very professional, very well thought out, simple things like having snacks and taking photos and videos, putting on a disc and being delivered to the hotel the next day.Floating market, tourist attraction to be endured with only occasional flashes of the the real thing, elephant ride/ wash was highlight of our holiday

Extraordinary Elephant Adventure. Firstly I would just like to say thanks to Na who was our personal tour guide gfor the day. She was amazing. We did a little research on elephant trips and floating markets before we went and this company had some great reviews. We paid upfront by card before we went and I was a little unsure about doing this but it was no problem at all !We were collected about 7am and drove out of the city which is bonkers busy and takes about 90 mins to get to the floating market. This was interesting but hold your ground if you don't want to buy anything. It's all pretty much the same old stuff. But I do like to visit these places. Go straight in at 60% off the price of what they say you will get it. Next you drive to the restaurant near the Burma boarder which takes another hour and the lunch was great. Best banana fritters and chicken satay. Then another shorter trip to the elephants. So this is the high light of the trip. You get to feed the baby elephant so buy some bananas and some soya milk bless it's great. Then a ride on the back of the elephants on a seat. We got out of the basket and swapped with the elephant trainers and had a go at driving on the neck. Next we got into our swimming gear and then went into the river and washed and played with the elephants. I have done a few great experiences with animals like dolphins and tigers but this has to be my favourite of all. They are so soft and clever and the best fun ! These elephants are so well looked after and the guys are really great fun too. This trip is so well organised. You have your own privet minivan with reclining seats. Do it you won't be disappointed !!

Fantastic Day. My husband and I did Tour 1511 with Bangkok Day Tours which was Tigerk Temple and Elephant Bathing, we were promptly picked up at 4.30 and started our trip first stop was the Bridge on the River Kwai, very picturesque and we walked across the bridge and was told a lot of history by our lovely tour guide Tanya, we then proceeded to the Tiger Temple where we offered food to the Monks before feeding the baby cubs which were delightful after there feed we walked them to an area where we gave them a bath which was great, we then went into an area with the junior cubs to play with them not that they were that small in fact for at least 20 minutes to half hour, after that we went into the big tigers we were put into a safety cage and they we're let off to run around and play and frolick in the water amazing. We then departed the Tiger Temple and proceeded to the Elephants this was definately a highlight riding into the river with them and splashing around again for about half hour and then we went on a small trek before returning to Bangkok. I would certainly recommend this tour. We were also given breakfast to eat while traveling from the River Kwai and stopped for lunch which was included in the cost

River Kwai and Elephants. This tour was excellent , i have not mentioned the floating market because for me and my family this part was an utter waste of time and we felt harassed and unless you want to buy 'Tat' i would encourage you to get this part swapped or taken out.However , the trip to River Kwai and one of the cemetery's(which we asked to do and it was not an issue!) was excellent , a little shame that the bridge has become a little commercialised , the sombre feeling as you walked around the cemetery reading some of the inscriptions helped you overcome this commercialisation .Lunch was superb and plenty of it! Especially the banana fritters!We then went to the Elephants and wow was it worth it , we trekked around the camp by the river for about 30 minutes and then swam with them (had lots of frolicking fun!) for about 45 minutes and our guide took around 400 photo's of this and we had a DVD also.We were collected on time and delivered back exactly when we expected.DO NOT expect a short journey to Kanchanaburi , it is not far but takes time to get there and frankly in the comfort wagon we were transported in it is hardly a chore and you can watch films or if sad enough have a karaoke on the way back! You will be tired!I am pleased to recommend them!

Golden reclining Buddha. Half of our day was spent in seeing the attractions of Bangkok, Thailand to educate and inform us of their culture, history, beliefs, dances, and most of all, their buddhas who they considered to be their god. Though there were a lot of them, the most interesting was the golden reclining buddha that represents historical Buddha. The rest of the day was for shopping. Prices were reasonable but we still huggled and got the price/s we wanted. Their goods were and stii are fashionable. Like our triicycle, they had tok-tok, which was a bigger version of it. Food was spicy.

Elephants great. Floating markets interesting.. It is a lot of driving for this trip but good to get out of the city. Got picked up in the coolest van that was pimped on the inside. Very comfortable too! Lims wife owns the van (!) but he is a good driver. Elephant encounter was great as we swam with them. Would be good if the handlers spoke a little English but there was only Tania our tour guide and she stayed behind. Floating markets interesting but feels like everyone is trying to rip you off. Lunch very good. Day kept all 5 of us happy from age 10,13,20,43 and 52!

It's all about the elephants. We took the "extraordinary elephant day tour" and what great day it was.Our driver Joe was waiting for us in our hotel foyer right on time at 7am.Our first stop was after 1and half hour at the floating market.As we were the only 3 on this tour this day Joe acted as a bit of private guide.Another hour or so Joe stopped and picked up another guide (Bo) for the rest of our trip.Next stop was the bridge on the river Kwai. Bo explained the significance behind the bridge and it's use during the war and today.Lunch was next, while not great it was good enough for us.Next came the highlight and the main reason for the tour, elephants!First it was a change into swimwear for bathing with the elephants.30mins of frolicking in the water with elephants is worth the price of this tour in itself.After the bathing comes a ride on an elephant for a short trip through the forest ( be careful of mud puddles).Sadly the day comes to an end with a 2and half hour drive back to Bangkok.Overall as I said at the outset, " it's all about the elephants"Daz

Na (Nakwan Looknew) & Joe. BEST Tour Guides EVER. Our 1st trip to Thailand June 2013. We arranged Bangkok Day Tour #1511 via the internet before we left Australia. We were hoping to have great tour, but little did we know just how Awesome it would be. We were picked up at our hotel around 4.30am by the delightful Joe and his amazing techno van. Along the way we picked up Na - our tour guide for the day. Na is such a deligtful knowledgeable person. We were provided with breakfast treats enroute to the bridge on the River Kwai. Due to our early start, we arrived early - thus beating the crowds - so we had the Bridge to ourselves. Such an eerily / beautiful feeling as we walked the Bridge.Then we headed to the Tiger Temple to offer food to the monks and later enjoy breakfast with the tour guides and volunteers. Also photo opportunity with the tiger cubs. Na certainly kept us moving :). All the time Na and Joe capturing every moment for us on our cameras.After bathing one of the cubs and feeding it chicken mince, we walked a juvenile tiger down to the canyon and had photos taken with the larger tiger. Then we headed off to elephants.The bond between the elephants and their mahouts was a pleasure to see. We enjoyed ourselves immensley. Then came the Absolute HIGHLIGHT. Swimming with the elephants OMG. Awesome :). Na & Joe capturing every moment for us on our camera and video camera. True pros, and the mahouts made sure we had a Fabulous time with their beloved elephants. After having lunch at a local riverside restaurant (yum) we were on our way back to our hotel. Joe played our video in his van so we could sit back and relive the Fabulous day we had just experienced. We cannot recommend Na - Joe & Bangkok Day Tours Highly enough. it's just over 1yr ago and we are still raving on about it.Lifetime memoires captured by Na & Joe. Peter - Jenny & Jenelle Benham From Melbourne Australia

Na & Joe Were Awesome!!!. Because I love elephants, my husband booked this trip for me for my 30th birthday. It was an amazing experience!!! Joe picked us up at our hotel, right on time, and I was amazed at how well he navigated the busy Thailand roads. He was very helpful and provided lots of helpful tips when stopping at the floating market. Na was an amazing tour guide and was always willing to share some great information with us and snap some photos. She took some amazing photos of us on the elephant tour just using my iPhone. The food at the Bridge on the River Kwai restaurant was delicious and there were plenty of gluten free options.The van was extremely comfortable, and on the way back, we were able to doze off and enjoy some movies.Would highly recommend Na & Joe and the elephant tour to anyone!

The most amazing experience you'll ever have. Our tour guide, Na was amazing. I went on the elephant experience with my boyfriend, by the end of the day we were so speechless and could not get over the events of the day. We got picked up from our hotel at 7am by our driver who did not speak much English but was friendly. We drove all day and saw the floating market which was not something I was expecting but was a nice enough detour. We continued driving after being given some snacks and water by the driver and picked up Na. Eventually we arrived at the bridge at the River Kwai and had a lovely tour with Na who took some fantastic pictures of us and was highly informative. Then we had a buffet meal which was traditional food of the region and also free/included in the price (drinks not included). By the time we arrived in kanchanaburi for the elephant ride we were tired and a bit sweaty but as soon as we saw where we were and the elephants wandering around we were overwhelmed. We were both astounded by how different the landscape was and how beautiful the elephants were. We swam in the river with them for an hour or so and had the time of our lives. Na took quite literally 500 photos and videos of us on our phones and made it so memorable that we could not be more thankful. Then we had a ride on another elephant who we think is called "Chung Chung" and was able to ride it without the trainer through the jungle! Animals seemed very happy and very we'll looked after they were able to roam around and do their own thing, they seemed to be very attached to their trainers. Even though it rained the entire time it did not affect our day and we will talk about it to anyone who will listen! Experience of a lifetime, must do if you can spare a day at a really modest price. A lot of driving but totally worth it!

Elephant/Bridge over River Kwai. Highlight of our trip! Our tour was amazing and Nu (New?) was the best guide ever. She took so many pictures that as I was looking at them, I could imagine I was back in the water with the elephants. The first stop at the river market was fun at first but got a bit overwhelming as most of the prices were over inflated and we felt very "cheated" but this is not the tours fault at all - just part of the tourism industry. We then picked up Nu and went to the bridge. Sad but beautiful place. Lunch was very nice at the buffet. They saved the best for last, the elephants! The baby elephant was as funny as Nu described and playing in the water was fabulous. Would recommend this to anyone!

Unbelievable!. Tanya and Joe Bond were our tour guides, and they were awesome!!The tour included riding/bathing elephants, stopping at the floating market, and the bridge at river Kwai. Tanya was full of information, and she and kid were super accommodating. I would definitely book a tour with them again, and if you're looking for an amazing time Bangkok Day Tours is your company!

Tiger Temple with Na & Bangkok Day Tours. A fantastic trip to visit the bridge on the River Kwai and the Tiger Temple. This really was one of the best days I have had in a long time. Na, my guide for the day, captured every moment of a fantastic day. Her explanation of the history of the bridge, guiding me through local customs and explaining the subtlety of the language was really valuable and made a memorable day even better.I was picked up from my hotel at 4:30 in the morning in an air conditioned 4WD vehicle and was provided with a nice light breakfast on the way. The meal at lunchtime was really nice - though now I have to figure out the recipe for the deep fried banana! Delicious.I really recommend Bangkok Day Tours for their excellent service, and their friendly professional manner as well as their enthusiasm. When my partner and I come back to Bangkok we will definitely be going back to see the tigers with Bangkok Day Tours.

Wonderful two days with Elephants & Tigers. Used Bangkok day tours for our return airport transfers. Excellent, except for a little confusion at DMK airport - but not the tour company's fault as there is very little parking for drivers! Had a wonderful two days with our guide Tania and "Mr Joe' our driver visiting the floating markets, train market, elephant sanctuary and Tiger Temple. What amazing animal encounters we had, riding and playing with the elephants in the River Kwai, feeding the baby tigers and walking the adults at Tiger Temple. The resort they put us up in was lovely - possibly the best dinner we had in Thailand. A shame it was only for one night! Highly recommended destination and tour company. 12yo daughter was thrilled and thought these two days were the highlight of our entire Asia trip!

Whirlwind tour!!. Amazing and really fun. Our tour guide Bo was great and our driver was the best. The elephant camp is beyond thrilling but seemed too short, we wanted to stay longer with the elephants and play in the river! The only negative is the floating market part of the tour, we felt like 'marks' for the vendors since we were trapped in the boat. The Kwai river bridge experience is also 1st rate. I would insist on this trip for anyone with a full day to devote to seeing these places and experience the elephant camp!!

Anzac Day with Na. We experienced Anzac Day dawn service 2014 as a tribute to our late father who was a POW working on this infamous railway lineThe tour was an absolute moving experience with a tour guide I would rate the best tour guide I have ever hadShe was well spoken and very informative as well as friendly, her name was Na and if you ever book a tour with Bangkok day tours do yourself a favour and ask for NaI can not express how grateful we are to Na for fulfilling a once in a life time Anzac Day that we will have treasured memories foreverWhile Na was our tour guide our driver was Chai who was a real character and a pleasure to travel wit hFull credit to Bangkok day tours who we will definitely tour with again if in Thailand again

Two day stay at bangkok. This has been a magical two day visit to bangkok, we travelled there by voyager of the seas, Caroline from bangkok day tours was excellent in arranging and communicating in the preparation of our personally tailored tour, we arrived at the port to be met by Molly our tour guide, she was beautiful and she went out of her way to show us bangkok, Kip our driver was great, we visited some temples, floating markets, long tail boat ride, the elephants (a must do). They arranged for us to stay in the heart of bangkok for the night, Molly made sure everything went to plan, and there was no rushing to go from place to another, Molly answered all the questions we had and explained them in great detail, we had a wonderful experience and we would recommend bangkok day tours, Molly as the guide and kip as the driver to anyone, the van was magnificently fitted out, clean washed and very well cared for, a massive thankyou to Caroline, Molly and Kip it was great to have a magnificent tourLove Anne, Geoff, Joshua, Daniel and Lauren xxxxx

Amazing Hellfire Pass and Bridge over the river Kwia tour, great hosts, great driver. This trip was booked from home and coincided two days after the Anzac Day memorial service. We were met ten minutes early at the hotel by our guide Kent. Kent was informative, relaxed, funny and gave an outline of the day.Right on time, our personal SUV turned up, looked more like a limo than a car and off we went. Hellfire Pass was the end destination some three hours drive. We we entertained the whole way by Kent.We got a history of Bangkok, a stop st a war memorial and the bridge on route to the pass. On each occasion, we were given great info, interactive questions and as it turned out, Kent was a very handy photographer!!!!The memorial was respectful and well kept, the bridge was a great experience only topped by Hellfire Pass.The drive took a while but the tour driver was great and made it feel a very safe trip. Hellfire Pass means a lot to Australian and their allies. The memorial is not commercial, very clean, professional and respectful. As we walked to the cutting, Kent gave great insight into the history and significance of the cutting.There were flags and personal momentos from Anzac Day which added to the day. Kent wished at the start of the day that we weren't disappointed, and we weren't. I would recommend Hellfire Pass to anyone with an understanding of history and the significance of sacrifice.The tour ended with a lovely Thai lunch at a nearby village and an informative drive back to the hotel. Thank to the driver and to Kent who was great. A special well done as Kent hurt his back on the bus getting to the hotel and he soldiered on the whole day....Highly recommended company and tour, a highlight of our trip to Thailand.

Professional, punctual, personable!. They escorted us to/from Tiger Temple and managed all the details effortlessly. Great guide and excellent driver handled all our requests! Reservations were easy to get. Recommend reservations be made well in advance. This is the second time we have used this company. We highly recommend them!

Glad we went- River Kwai and Elephant Sanctuary!. The booking process and pick up from the hotel was flawless. The 4x4 was v comfy, and it was just my husband and I, our driver and guide from the River Kwai. Mr O. our driver was great- I wasn't feeling well and he reassured me any time we needed to stop (for the loo) just to let him know-means alot when you find car journeys stressful! I found the floating market a little too touristy- would expect that from a coach trip, but not with a private tour such as this. The floating market we were taken to seemed to be set up just for tourists- with each stall selling the usual tourist bumpf. I was expecting something more 'authentic' with locals shopping-but no-just boatfuls of tourists being pulled to each stall by the holder with a long pole trying to sell you mass produced goods. In contrast the River Kwai Bridge was fascinating thanks to our insightful guide, Angie. Lunch was good, and then on to the elephant sanctuary, which was an amazing experience. The elephants appeared well looked after and happy- We both were torn about whether it is an ethical thing to do...but I guess in England we ride horses...and elephants are much stronger! Angie took numerous photos for us. We snoozed with happy memories of the day for the 5.5hr drive back to the hotel!

River Kwai 2 Day Shore Excursion. Group of 8 travelling on Voyage Of the Seas for overnight in Thailand booked with Bangkok Day Tours to go to River Kwai. Excellent Guide "Green" and driver "Zac" who really showed us Thailand..Accommodation was great and all food stops were perfect. This is a perfect trip for those that do not want to do "Bangkok" and see Thailand. Included was Elephant Ride, Tiger Temple, Walk over the Bridge and Floating Market..try the swimming with Elephants you will not regret it.

What a trip!. We did the elephant day trip. we started with a floating market where we were able to shop at our leisure. We moved on the the bridge over the river Kwai our guide Tanya was an excellent source of information very professional then it was lunch and on to the elephant ride! The best part after a short ride with many photo ops our guide even took pictures for us! Awesome we took the elephants into the river and had a really fun time splashing around and playing games.. Well worth the money and time great organization really wanted to thank Tanya for her services! She was great.

Exceeded Our Expectations. My expectations started off low even with the high amount of positive reviews. I had unfortunate issues booking my tour from the start. I wasn't pointing fingers at the tour company but naturally my mood was low since my card had trouble going through to make the required reservation payment. Surprisingly though, Bangkok Day Tours responded more than timely to all my email messages to help me get the task done. Next came more issues though. My friends and I arrived a day late in Bangkok thanks to an unfortunate travel delay which forced me to request Bangkok Day Tours to change our reservation date to the next day instead. They surprised me again with their quick email response and no hassle, the date of our tour got changed last minute with no issue. Wow, not what i expected judging from past experiences with other companies. So then came the tour, we chose the Extraordinary Elephant Day Trip. Our transportation was a real nice, big van that more than definitely satisfied our comfort needs. We went to a Floating Market, had a great lunch, got to see the bridge on the River Kwai, and hang out with elephants in the river! It was all amazing fun! So many memories made that we will keep from the countless pictures and videos that were created.Special thanks to our tour guide Tanya and our driver Mr. Jo for guiding us through an amazing experience in Thailand and helping with taking some of the pictures and videos while we were in the river with the elephants!Special thanks to the whole Bangkok Day Tours company for exceeded our expectations and making it all possible! Definitely will consider this company again for future trips to Thailand! - Nolan, Will, Chris, and Miguel

Exceptional tour company. My husband and I used this tour company to visit the floating gardens, River Kwai and the elephant camp! They exceeded our expectations! We had a great escort and tour guide. The elephants are a must to see and will be the high light of your tour! Our guide took several pictures/videos while we were enjoying our selves with the elephants in the River and to that I am very grateful. Well done!!

Tiger Temple Thailand » Breakfast with Monks at the Tiger Temple. Wow - what a fantastic tour! We popped into Bangkok on the way back to Perth from skiing in Japan. The flights are particularly inconvenient for this route so we thought we'd spend a few days resting after a tough ski - This tour really appealed to us but of course usually it's one thing to read the marketing literature and another when you get there - but not this one.We were collected at 4.30am from our hotel (they were early), a private & new minibus. Just the 2 of us on the tour (that's usual apparently). They had some food & drink for breakfast for us if we had wanted it. Sally, the guide and Mr T the driver were perfect hosts.After visiting the Bridge over the Kwai, we arrived at the Monastery at around 7am. There was a total of 4 couples doing this tour - after the ceremony of offering the food to the Monks we were into the Temple and there followed 4 hours of fun with tigers - 2 of them were newborn, just 2 weeks old.This is probably the best tour we have ever experienced on a holiday. Full marks.

One of the best things I've done so far. Three friends and I signed up the day before for the 1 day elephant trek. Not only was the tour group able to accommodate us at the last minute, but they were fantastic. Above and beyond! The van that picked us up was so plush and the driver Joe was very friendly. The guide Na was like a surrogate mother to us the whole time. She made sure that we were always comfortable and taken care of. She ran around taking so many pictures for us! Most importantly, you could tell that she had a really good rapport with the people who ran the lunch restaurant and the elephant village mahawangchang. Our trip included the private van, snacks, a boat tour of the floating market, lunch on a floating restaurant by the river kwai and a little tour of the bridge, a ride on elephants, and then the highlight--bathing with the elephants! So cool! They lifted us up and splashed around. It was fantastic. And for something around $120 US per person. Can't recommend it highly enough. Do it!

Bangkok day tours. Absolutely awesome we took tour (1512). Joe and naan our guide helped to make our day perfect taking photos of us and couldn't do enough to make our day special for the six of us. The Elephant ride and bathing was the highlight for us and our kids loved the tiger cub feeding. Highly recommend tour with this company.

Best private taxi driver and nicest guy I've met in Bangkok. Tan is a very friendly and outgoing driver. Very dependable, honest, and reasonable pricing for any trips or tours you may need in Thailand. I've always called him for pickup and now my friends depend on him for their vacation or other Thailand tours and trips.

Great Day Tour!. Our guide met us promptly at the Shangri-La Hotel and we had about 5 hours together on our recent visit to Bangkok. Tu, was our guide and she did an excellent job of making sure we got everything in. Our driver was very good too.We rode in a TukTuk and also did the river boat ride in a long tailed boat. We ate lunch in at a buffet style restaurant. We went to all the Temples and saw everything on the list. It was a very busy day.If I had any complaints at all, it would be that we had a little trouble understanding our guides' accent. Her English was very good, but the accent was difficult to understand, but we found this to be true in most of the Asian cities that we visited.One other complaint was that at the end of the tour, we were taken to a big gem store, shown a film and tossed out into a giant showroom. After speaking with other cruise passengers, it appears to be where everyone "visits" - LOL. The pressure was minimal and the store had some high quality stingray wallets, purses, etc, so we did spend some $ there. After visiting all the ports, it turns out that we got the best price and the best quality on these items, so I cannot complain too much. Just be aware that if you mention shopping, this is where you might end up!We highly recommend this company.

Bangkok City and Temples Tour. This tour was part of a pakage deal with accomodation with Flight Centre. The tour took about three and a half hours. The guide was very knowlagable and polite. Had a nice little airconditioned bus. Very interesting and well worth doing. Very highly recommended.

Excellent Tours!!!. After our cruise in Asia, we decided to spend a few days in Bangkok. We searched TA for tour companies and Bangkok Day Tours had good ratings. We decided to book two tours with them. As our trip was approaching, we learned about the protests happening in Bangkok. We were concerned and we contact Bangkok Day Tours to see if we can get our deposit back if the protest got out of hand. We were rest assured that we would not go through where the protest was happening and they even sent us a video of recent tours they did where they went around the protests with no issues. We were still uneasy, but after reading their terms and condition, it clearly states that no refund is issued due to political unrest. This is unfair, but it is spelled out. In any event, we did not cancel our tours with Bangkok Day Tours. Thank goodness we didn't. On the day of our tours, we were met in our lobby timely, our tour guide (Green was her name) was personable and spoke English well. Our van was clean and spacious (there was 4 of us) and our driver was good. The tours that we booked were the Floating Market & Grand Palace Tours and the Ayutthaya Palaces & Lunch Cruise Tour. The fee paid includes all tickets and lunch. Both of these tours did not even come close to the protests.The only time we came across the protests, which was peaceful by the way, was when we went on our own to MBK, Central World and the other shopping centers around the area. Green, our tour guide, gave us suggestions what to avoid and how to take the sky train to avoid area.

Great experience!. Statement: I am an animalist and really concerned about how animals are treated. After cancelling elephant tour with another camp (saw some bad treatment), I made a booking with Bangkok Day Tours. I contacted them prior to check how they care about animals' treatment and ask them to ensure me that there will be not mistreatment on the camp we are going. They explained to me how things are working and I booked the trip (read details about all tours since there are significant differences in activities: I suggest the morning trip to the Tiger Sanctuary and elephant ride and bath, tour 1511).First, the organization is very good; I was picked up from my hotel on schedule; the driver and the guide were there waiting for me. The car (minivan for me) was clean and in a very good condition; they had water and soda for me and later on, a little breakfast. They prepared as well food to give to the Monks, which is a part of this tour. We had sensational visit at Tiger temple. This tour offers the exclusivity to participate (in a very small group) in all morning activities with tigers (from babies to adults). I could feed babies, play and walk with young tigers, give them a bath and play with adults. Those moments were just extraordinary.After the tigers Sanctuary we went directly to elephant camp (in the morning there are only few people so you have a sensation of privacy). I took a ride (chair) and we spent quite a long time to walk and stop in the forest. The elephant was allowed to stop and eat fresh leaves from the trees. I did not see the elephant's guide mistreating the animal at any time (if the fact that I have told him that I would not support the mistreatment helped, it is even better, we participated in their education). The sticks they carry should be used only if there is a problem (elephant could have an unpredictable reaction, it is a wild animal after all). After the ride, we changed the elephant and went to the bath in the river (no chair); I must say that sitting directly on the elephant is a great experience. The second elephant guide was great too: he used only voice to guide the elephant and we had a lot of fun; again on both ways the animal was permitted to eat and stop at her convenience.Having said all that, I am very pleased with the tour and all my concerns were addressed. Do not hesitate to inform the agency about your concerns and they will take good care of them.We had our planned lunch after all activities which allowed us to have more time in the morning and especially have less crowd around us at all times.I do recommend this tour if you want to have a great experience with tigers and elephants in very decent conditions with all respect to animals.

An Unforgetable Day Trip. We opted for trip Number 1506 which was a trip on the floating market, the bridge over the river Kwai and the highlight a trek, including bathing with Elephants.The trip to the floating market was an experience even to those of us who don't do markets. It was hectic and right in your face, in a nice way. It was a reflection of heavy manic tourist trail sales. But it was an extremely good experience to see the Thai people working hard to make a living. The bartering is all part of the experience as well. Be prepared to expect to do it and enjoy.The Bridge over the River Kwai was a moving experience if you know your history and are of an age when you remember how the bridge was constructed by POW'sWe stopped for lunch which was part of the overall cost, in a typical roadside restaurant where the food was plentiful and fresh. every strength of Thai curry was available to sample.The on to the highlight of the day with the elephants. We started with a reasonable trek with the elephants and the handler's were very supportive and patient encouraging us to get right on to of the Elephant's neck, which is a considerable height from the ground. We got the opportunity to feed the Elephants a basket full of bananas which was an amazing sight to see him crunch and swallow them skins and all.Then it was down to the river to swim and bathe with the Elephants, what an experience this is. they threw us off of their back's into the water and allowed us to use their trunk as hoses to spray each other. They were obvious used to doing this as they seemed to do it in unison with each other. This was all done with the aid of the expert handler's.Our guide was amazing, she looked after us very well and operated our cameras and took the best pictures and short videos for us.It was a day which we all agreed we would treasure.All included in this deal were refreshments, light snacks, lunch, A tour guide and transport from the hotel.

2 Day Bangkok tour from cruise ship. Excellent two day trip in Bangkok, our tour guide "Green" was very good and tailored the itinerary to suit our ships arrival & departure times.
