We had a very comfortable vehicle for our party of eight.We particularly enjoyed the trip to The Sanctuary of Truth which was very interesting.I would certainly recommend the Bangkok Day Tour Co. LtdKind regardsSteve Bennett

Mistreatment of Elephants. On the website, every elephant tour says you ride an elephant through the jungle. The tour we went on took us to an elephant park where the elephant walks in a circle all day long. The ride was about 15 min, not exactly what we expected. Additionally many of the pictures on the website shows people riding bareback- not an option we were given. All of the elephants at the park had chairs strapped to them. While our tour guide was very nice, I wouldn't recommend this tour if you have a conscience.

Nice trip to Kanchanaburi!. My friend and I did the one day Kanchanaburi tour with this company. Upon being picked up at our hotel, there was a little mix-up over which tour we were supposed to be going on. However, after a quick phone call, our tour guide, Kent, straightened everything out and we were on our way. The tour company was also good about emailing me and apologizing for the minor mishap. We were transported around in a nice air conditioned SUV with reclining backseats, which made the long drive nice and relaxing (and allowed time for a little nap). The tour consisted of a morning trip to the Bridge Over the River Kwai and the memorial cemetery with lunch at a local floating restaurant. After that we headed to the infamous Tiger Temple for an afternoon tour. Since there was some initial confusion over which tour we would be going on, Kent quickly jumped in to make sure we had tickets for everything we wanted to do at the Tiger Temple (feeding the baby tigers and walking the adult ones). He was really helpful with knowing how to optimize our time at the Tiger Temple too. Overall it was a very enjoyable day and well organized tour.

Wonderful day, fantastic experience. We booked the day trip to Bridge of the River Kwai, Tiger Temple and Bathing the elephants with this Tour Company and what a fantastic day. The mini bus was lovely and comfortable and we could watch our video in the bus on our way home after the trip. Our Guide who was Nah (not sure if I spelt this right) and our driver Joe, were absolutely fantastic. We had the time of our lives and it is definitely one off the tick list. From start to finish Nah took control told us everything we needed to know, took amazing photoes and nothing was too much trouble. We went to the Bridge first as Nah advised no one goes early and she was right, by the time we had walked it visitors were arriving, but because there was only us there Nah took some lovely photos of us on the bridge with no one else around. From there we went to the Tiger Temple, which was amazing to see them, feed them play and wash them. The handlers were great and put you in the right places and stayed with you . We then went onto the elephant camp where we bathed the elephants, or should I say they bathed us, so much fun and my favourite animals, big gentle giants. We had a really lovely day which we will cherish and thank you to Nah for making it memorable. Would recommend it, as it is something special.

Floating market and elephant ride/bath. My mother and I booked this full day tour on our last day in Bangkok. It was convenient and easy to book and the company was good about communicating via email.On the day of the tour we were picked up by a driver and taken to the floating market a few hours away. The floating market was essentially just a ride in a boat for a half hour or so, which was perfectly fine. It would have been nice to have a guide present who spoke English. All we had at this point in the tour was a driver, we didn't actually meet our guide until almost lunch time. We met our guide and stopped at the bridge over the river Kwai on the way to lunch, which was a cool stop but essentially just a photo op. Part of the reason we booked this tour is because after having heard that some of the elephant experiences were a bit inhumane, the idea of the elephant bath sounded better. In retrospect that was probably a poor assumption. It seemed okay but not particularly elephant friendly. The elephant portion consisted of a ride (in a chair strapped to the elephant like you see in all the tours) with a trainer present, all of whom were carrying and using bull hooks. The elephants seemed decently happy and would stop and snack during the ride, and the ride itself was pretty fun, with our guide taking lots of photos for us. I was, however, somewhat disappointed with the "bath" portion. I was expecting to swim around next to the elephant and wash it a bit. It turned out to be more like a circus performance, with the trainer yelling at the elephant and jamming the bull hook into its ear to make it do tricks and poses for pictures. It made for good photos but wasn't really what I wanted and I ended up just feeling bad for the elephant.This was a decent day tour, but if you care about booking an elephant experience in which they are well treated, I suggest trying one of the elephant sanctuaries elsewhere.

Amazing!. I booked for the Bangkok temples and canals tour and could quite believe when my own personal driver and tour guide turned up at my hotel! They took such care of me and the comfy air conditioned minivan was much appreciated! My tour guide made it his business to make sure I was enjoying myself, taking many photos of me in front of all the landmarks (a bonus when travelling alone and have to rely on the selfie!). His knowledge of everything was quite something; I formation overload but just what I wanted! Lovely Thai lunch before an eye opening canal trip. Even the Bangkok traffic couldn't dampen our spirits on the journey back! Thanks for everything!!

Bangkok Day Tour Tiger Temple Elephant Ride. This tour was probably one of the most memorial days of my life. Defiantly one for the books. We were picked up very early, and driven to the Bridge over the River Kwai. We saw the bridge and the memorial before heading up towards the Burma border for the tiger temple. Once there we offered food to the monks, and received their blessing to enter the temple. That's when the fun began. I got to bottle feed a baby tiger, play with one. Walk a grown tiger, bath one, feed it, and then play with it. Defiantly an enlightening experience. After than we went to the Elephant camp and rode elephants into the water, where we played with them and had some great photo ops. We then dried off, and rode them around the area for a few more minuets. Once we left we went to a buffet in the local area (it was paid for by the tour), and had an amazing day. Really it was the best amount of money I ever spent on a day tour. Everything about them was professional and courteous. I would recommend them to everyone.

The most amazing day!. We were picked up at 4:30 am in a gorgeous luxury mini-van, just the two of us. Relaxed and napped until we arrived at the River Kwai for a very beautiful and quiet time, there was only 2 other vans from Bangkok Day Tours there so we had the area to ourselves.Then it was onto the Tiger Temple.First we offered the morning meals to the monks.Then, it was on the the tiger area.It was a beautiful experience, the guide and attendants there took so many many pics with our cameras, got tons of great shots...feeding and holding the cubs, washing the older ones, walking the full sized ones and playing with them in their playground. It was beautifully managed and well organized...by the end of our time we felt we'd had the best experience possible.The tour offered by Bangkok Day Tours was well done, very personal and well worth the money, definitely a once in a lifetime experience!

A day you'll never forget!. My partner and I booked the one day tour (1512 breakfast with elephants) Just incredible.Picked up from our hotel in a luxury mini van just for us at 0430 by Jo, our very friendly driver with the coolest van in town! Endless supplies of complimentary bottled water provided in an iced cool box along with snacks for the journey at no extra cost! We stopped in Kanchaniburi to collect our tour guide for the day, his name was Aek (pronounced a bit like ?eight). We couldn't of asked for a nicer, more knowledgeable or friendlier tour guide. He was ideal for us. We then drove a short distance to the bridge over the river Kwai and watched the sunrise, words do not do this day justice.Then all four of us traveled to the Chang Palace, private breakfast included in the tour here. we watched the elephants perform a little routine, although many were chained they appeared well looked after, a concern that we had was gone. We then went on a solo bare back ride around the camp, with mahouts to guide by foot, we had learnt from Aek a few commands but the mahouts helped out when our elephants stopped to graze! We had our own elephants Fen and Fanta. Beautiful animals. We then rode them to the river Kwai where they walked straight in with us on their backs. We got to play with them and even gave them a wash. After we brought some bananas and fed them. Photos constantly taken by Aek on our cameras, brilliant! Take a change of clothes and a towel as there are shower facilities here, you'll need them after a soaking in the river! We then drove to the death railway and hellfire pass, walking on this railway is just amazing. Off for lunch at a little restaurant, meal again included in the tour.Time for Tiger Temple, I won't spoil it for you, but this is just as breath taking as the morning with the elephants. Lots of photos and even the chance to walk with a tiger. Ladies must wear appropriate temple clothing and both men and women must wear non bright clothing, unless you want to be a tigers lunch!The only added expense of the day was for some of the souvenirs and a small tip for the mahouts as a thank you for such an unforgettable day! All in all this day is an absolute must. We would not have changed a single thing. Loved it. The memories will last for ever.

2 day Kanchanaburi trip is excellent. We had a great 2 day trip which I would definitely recommend.Day 11) War Cemetery2) Bridge over River Kwai3) Nice lunch nearby4) Tiger Temple - awesome, feed the baby tigers, it's well worth it5) Death railway6) Overnight at Royal River Kwai Resort which is beautiful with a large room and an amazing pool over looking into the river. Great dinner and breakfast here.Day 21) Hellfire Pass Museum and walk, don't miss this2) Elephant camp including a ride and a swim and play in the river with them, prepare to get wet!Really professional and well organised. The only minus was the poor guide who had limited English and couldn't really provide us with any information about the war and railway.

definately tour with them!. We did the floating markets, tiger temple and cub feeding tour. This company was very professional and our guide was so friendly. There was a lot of driving which I was not aware of before hand, however we really didn't mind because they really tried to make us as comfortable as possible. The cost was high, however it is worth it. We also did a much cheaper tour and it really does change how your day plays out. This was our favorite tour in Bangkok and I highly recommend this tour company.
2 days in bangkok.. Thanks to our tour guide Napha Ploykrajang we had excellent experience with the culture and people of Thailand.She is the Best. Alex and Albina. Yura and Dora from New York.

Full day safari world tour with lunch Bangkok. In this tour we brought back Life long cherishing memories with my two nieces ( 4 yrs and 16 months respectively) . Dolphin show was THE BEST. Birds collection is awesome . Feeding GIRAFFES made is our tour Extreme memorable.Indian food was good .

One day - River Kwai, Tiger Temple, Lunch, Elephant Camp. This tour made my girlfriend and I’s trip to Thailand unforgettable. First stop was the bridge over the river Kwai, ideal timing the bridge was a bit dark when we first arrived but by the time the history had been explained and questions answered it was bright enough for a photo opportunity. We then went on the morning trip to the tiger temple (where we gave the monks food in the morning) and it was by far one of the coolest things I have ever experienced in my life. We got to play with the 3-4 week old tigers and bottle-fed the 1 month-1 year old tigers. I was playing with the 1month old like I would a puppy. I had a leash and would place it just out of his reach and he would jump at it and attack it. After playing with the tiger cubs we walked them over to a washing station where we struggled to wash them (because they kept walking around in circles). Then we got to feed them some chicken. The whole time the staff was very helpful getting the tigers into great photo opportunities and taking photos with your camera. Then it was off to play with some of the bigger tigers. We got to have these noisemakers on sticks and play with the tigers just like big cats. It was incredible the tigers were so happy jumping after these colourful cardboard boxes filled with noise-making things. Then we got to walk with the fully grown tigers down to a canyon. The one we walked was about 220kg and stopped at one point to scratch up a tree. Then we got a chance to have one of the biggest tigers in our lap. At one point he yawned and right up at me and I admit I was a little frightened but all of the staff members kept the tigers away from any potentially dangerous situations. After the tiger photo they had 6-7 fully grown tigers playing together in this small canyon and they were fighting each other and chasing each other around the area. They were so playful and having fun there was no possible way they were drugged. In fact as playtime was winding down one of the tigers got out of the enclosure and the rest chased after it and the staff had to go get them back on leashes and control the situation. Though they are large dangerous animals staff make you feel safe and comfortable around the animals. They show the animals respect them and are content in the level of domestication.I think where some of the negativity comes from is the people that just see the tigers in the afternoon when they are stationary and being put on display for hundreds of people getting photos and touching them. We paid a little extra for the morning tour but it was absolutely amazing and if I ever go back to Thailand I would 100% do this tour again. Staff at the tiger temple explained the tigers are generally calm animals during the heat of the day and more active during the night (note when you go to the zoo tigers are laying there doing nothing) and more nocturnal animals. The same 220 kg tiger who happily rested his head on the laps of all 14 of the visitors, was up and running around fighting and jumping instantly when he knew it was playtime. The tigers are very used to human contact but it is reasonable to have rules and follow the instructions given. They are wild animals and will do what they want (for example stop and claw a tree while being walked) but it just adds to the experience. Not only did BANGKOK DAY TOURS have a private air-conditioned van for the 2 of us but we also had the best English-speaking guide out of all the other tours that were there at the same time. SALLY was very knowledgeable about everything throughout the entire tour and we never had any communication issues. Sally answered every question we asked thoughtfully (and trust me we asked everything we could think of). She also took photos with our cameras as well as her own camera to ensure we had plenty of quality photos. We received our photos by email the very next day. The photos are unbelievable amazing. We did not once have to think about taking our own photos and missing out on enjoying the experience. Lunch was wonderful and had both Western and Thai options. The elephants were in the 2nd part of the trip. We did a quick walk around riding a seat on an elephant together. We then each got on our own elephant without a seat and proceeded to go right into the river with them. The manhout (spelling?) had the elephants trained so well that they would pick us up with their trunks and dive deep into the water giving us the ride of our life. We got to stand up on the elephants as they raised themselves out of the water and we got to jump off. We could go on and on about how amazing the entire tour was. We would do the tour over and over again. The tour may be more expensive done this way but don't cheap out and go for just the temple or just the elephants or without a guide (she helped translate and instructed us on getting the best experience for us all day and throughout our stay in Thailand in general). The fabulous tour, did not disappoint. Thank you BANGKOK DAY TOURS and SALLY for giving us some unforgettable memories.

What a wonderful memory - What a fantastic service !. We booked a Tour with Bangkok Day Tour in order to get a nice memory for our children to spend a nice moment with the Elephant. We start with a nice floating market, then the Kwaii bridge (nice to see) and then the fantastic bath in the river with the Elephant. We have 2 kids, 6 and 9 years old and that was from far the best memory from their Holiday. This company is very very Professional and so kind. The service was not 5 but 6 stars. Really. We want to thank once again our driver Jo, and our guide Naa fot their kindness and also Caroline for all what she is doing. We fully recommend you to take Bangkok Day Tour for your visit in Thailand.We will go back again and for sure will make other visit with them. Kop Khun Kaa for everything !!!Claudia, Daniel & Kids

Floating market and tiger temple. My wife and I went on the trip to the Floating Market and Tiger Temple - including the cub feeding (13,600 Bhat). The price is a little expensive in comparison to everything else in Thailand, but not expensive considering what you get. We received a call from the company with in 5 minutes of booking to confirm which was comforting considering we booked online. Our driver picked us up from our Hotel at 6:45am (scheduled for 7am) in a luxurious van. It was a spacious 5 person van for just the two of us. They provided unlimited bottled water for us and gave is snacks. After about 45 minutes of driving our driver stopped for a coffee and bathroom break. Then after another 45 minutes we arrived at the floating market. Our driver set us up with a private boat which brought us around to all the different vendors. Really cool because they hook your boat to pull you closer so they can try and sell you there merchandise. It's mainly touristy goods and you have to bargain! End up paying about 25% of the original starting price. After this we got back in the van and drive about 30 more minutes, picked up our English speaking guide and went to the bridge over the River Kwai. Once there we walked the bridge, took pictures, ate lunch and bought a jade bracelet.This was followed by a 45 minute drive to the Tiger Zoo. Our guide brought us everywhere which made things easy and convenient for us. We took a few pictures with the adult tigers - our guide held our back pack the whole time so we weren't bothered with it, then went on to feed the cubs (3 weeks old and very cute) and also got up close with 6 month old Tigers (although young they are the size of a Great Dane!). We then left the zoo, drove 30 minutes and dropped off our guide, then another 2 hours back to our hotel. Impeccable door to door service, very comfortable ride, very friendly staff and definitely worth it. Would highly recommend!

Overpriced for a 12 hr tour with a guide for only 1/4 of the time. We booked a day tour with bangkok day tours based on the positive reviews. The problem was that I overlooked the details in the itinerary and didn't see that we wouldn't be meeting our guide until 1115am (picked up from our hotel at 730am). This was a surprise as I thought that given the expense of the tour we would have a guide for most of the day to learn about the area we were driving through. Our driver couldn't speak English but put us on the phone to the tour company where they informed us we would only have a guide for 3.5 hours!!! What the?! It's a 12 hour tour and an expensive one at that. To the company's credit they offered us a full refund of our deposit and promptly took us back to our hotel.We then arranged a private tour through our tour desk at our hotel. A delightful driver and very friendly English-speaking tour guide arrived 30mins later and took us on the same tour for HALF the price. She was fabulous and the tour was the highlight of our time in Bangkok. Highly recommend saving your $$ and organising this way.

Tiger breakfast and elephant swimming. This company is very professional and their service is amazing. My daughter (who is 9) and I chose the Tiger Temple tour where we fed young tigers, played with a tiger cub, splashed in the water with tigers and watched the big cats play. We also went for a ride on an elephant and had our own elephant to swim with in the river. I cannot thank the staff enough for the wonderful memories and photos we have. We booked and paid for this tour from Australia and Caroline was very helpful organising our tours (we also went on the Floating Market tour - can also highly recommend this tour). When we come back to Thailand we will organise our next trip with you.

Amazing trip to Tiger Temple!. My husband and I booked a trip through Bangkok Day Tours to see the bridge on the river Kwai (not the movie, the actual bridge!) and the Tiger Temple. We were 100% happy with the trip, and especially with our amazing guide, Sally, who saved the day numerous times!!When the SUV came to get us from our hotel at 4:30 a.m., we were a little confused: We had the notion that we would be taking a crowded bus filled with other tourists to our destination. However, we had the spacious SUV all to ourselves, Sally, and our driver! That was a very nice surprise.After about a two-hour drive, we reached the bridge on the river Kwai, where Sally gave us a brief history of the place and explained that, although it was early and quite chilly, we had come at a good time before the usual throngs of tourists showed up. We got to walk across the bridge and take scenic photos just as the sun was coming up, which was very beautiful. As we headed back to the SUV, Sally and the driver (I forgot his name, I feel awful about that!) hopped into a nearby store to pick us up some breakfast. Sally explained that, although we were set to have breakfast with the monks at the Tiger Temple, for the past few days the tours had included record-breaking numbers, so we should at least eat a little bit in case there wasn't enough food at the temple or we had to wait in a long line (she was right about that!). We ate the provided food on the way.When we got to the Tiger Temple, Sally found us a spot to give the monks their food offerings and provided us with our tickets. She gave us a rundown of what to do when the monks passed us, and even took a few photos for us.Inside the temple, Sally led us to the best spots to get prime pictures with the baby and young tigers while most of the other tourists ate breakfast (see, told ya she was right!). During this time, my husband and I realized that our camera battery was dying and we hadn't brought another one (such a rookie mistake!). Sally happily offered to take our pictures with her cell phone camera, and she even emailed them to us afterward!With Sally leading the way, we got to spend quality time with the tigers. She explained to us the history of the temple and how volunteers help run the place. We even talked about the controversy surrounding the temple and how so many people think the tigers are drugged or abused. Let me make myself clear on this point: I am an avid animal lover. I am aware that there is a serious problem in Thailand regarding the treatment of elephants, monkeys, and other animals. However, after seeing the situation with my own eyes, I do NOT think the tigers at the temple are drugged or abused. As the owner of two cats, I can tell you that the tigers behaved so like tamed house cats that it was astonishing. They sleep after they eat (and basically just when they want to, which is often), they enjoy being petted on certain areas of their bodies (some even like tummy rubs, like my cats!), and they love to play. They get cranky when tired, and sometimes they just want to be left alone. The workers and volunteers at the temple make sure that human visitors are protected from the wayward swipe of a tiger's claw, but for the most part, they're not bothered by humans. They've been raised by and with humans their whole lives, and unlike tigers in the wild, they don't see humans as prey (unless provoked!).In any case, the day at the Tiger Temple was amazing. Our friends and family were blown away by the pictures we showed them of us feeding and playing with the tigers (all thanks to Sally!), and we had the experience of a lifetime! I'd absolutely recommend this company to anyone traveling to Bangkok!

Great day with the elephants. Bangkok Day Tours was very good, they picked us up from the hotel, drove us to the floating markets, then the bridge over the River Kwai, then to swim with the elephants. It was an amazing experience made better by the driver and the guides, they took so many photos for us and a video, couldn't recommend these guys enough.

fun with elephants. Pros: Very good english speaking guide (Tanya) and friendly elephants. Cons: quite a long drive in proportion to the time with elephants. This was due to traffic of course, but also because of the visit to the Kwai River Bridge and floating market. The lunch provided was passable. Overall though, I think this was one of our best days in Thailand and I would heartily endorse this as a great day trip.

best day of my life. seriously.. I did this tour with my family and there was 8 of us altogether, so we ended up having a private tour with just us! It was incredible. Tour guides and driver were fantastic, did everything they possibly could to make sure we had an amazing day. We saw bridge over river kwai and tiger temple and the old train tracks (can't remember what its called), and did the elephants in the water. The elephants are so happy and the mahouts are awesome fun too. Honestly such an amazing experience, being so close to those elephants, its indescribable. Great that we had lots of photos taken of us too so that we can cherish the memories forever.Honestly I think the elephant part of the tour overshadowed the rest. Tiger temple I wasn't too keen on - I've read too much about how they are drugged etc and I found the tigers to be very sad and unhappy. The elephants however were full of life and loved having us climbing all over them in the water.Do it do it do it for the elephant part. You will not regret it. Absolutely perfect!!!!!Thank you Bangkok day tours!!! I am planning another trip to Thailand at the end of this year and will definitely be doing the tour again !!!!!Oh and ps the food was amazing!!! Sooo much food!

TRIP OF A LIFETIME. This was such a wonderful experience from beginning to end. We had a party of 6 and this tour was so accommodating to our party. We had our own van pick us up at our hotel. The van has reclining comfortable seats for everyone and also a cooler for snacks since its a long day. The pick up time was 4:30am since it was quite a trip, but we all fell asleep very comfortable in the van on the 2 hour trip. Our tour guide was amazing. She knew exactly what to do at each stop so that we maximized our time. She made sure we were first to each station so that we didn't miss any opportunities including feeding the baby tigers and getting our picture taken with the large tigers. She also brought us a lunch so that we didn't have to waste time eating there and missing the opportunities to see what we came for. We would absolutely do this again and couldn't imagine going all the way to Thailand and not doing this tour. It was the best day of all of our lives.

Wonderful day!. Thank you Bangkok Tours!! We had a wonderful day with our tour guide, Green, she totally took care of us. Visiting the memorial, Hell Fire Pass, Tiger Temple, and the Bridge. They were on time picking us up, early even. The Van was awesome! Lunch was incredible and we had the restaurant all to our selves! The money is worth spending. It is a solid tour.

Fantastic All Our Friends And Family Are Envious. We wish we could be more original but we echo all the positive reviews. Trip of a life time. Everything perfect. Guide Molly and driver Joe outstanding. Vehicle modern, comfortable and very cool. We were concerned about the safety aspect of the elephant riding but Caroline assured us it was perfectly safe and she was absolutely correct. Picked up on time, safe driver, beautiful van, informative guide.The elephant ride was fun as was bathing and playing with the elephants in the water. We watched an elephant paint a picture of flowers (that was better than anything we could paint) and bought the masterpiece for 50 Baht. There were clean showers to use after bathing so we could clean up and change into clean clothes  The Tiger Temple was truly amazing. Viewing and petting the big tigers was a thrill and playing with and feeding the cubs is beyond description. We ended the day with a visit to the Bridge of the River Kwai which was a nice way to finish the day. Molly and Joe surprised us with a "disco" light and music show in the van on the way home. Molly was quick to get the tickets to play and feed the baby tigers which was key because we were the first group in and had quality play and feeding time. As we were leaving, the cubs all went to sleep so subsequent groups might not have had the same experience. Molly and Joe also got us to the elephant park early so we were the first people there and had the place to ourselves most of the time. Molly and Joe used our cameras to take super pictures which have made all our friends and family jealous. Joe ran the entire way while we were riding the elephant so he could keep up. The buffet lunch was just right. Thanks Caroline.

Experience of a lifetime!!!!!!. We had a fantastic day with BDT! Anda was our guide and he was awesome! Our driver did not speak English so we don't know if he was just as awesome, but he was a great driver. We were always safe and our belongings kept secure. We did tour 1118 which included the floating markets, jungle elephant ride (no bath as we did not want to get wet), tiger temple and bridge on the River Kwai. It was phenomenal! The elephant ride was perfect, about 20 minutes long and the mahout took great pics of us on the elephant whose name was Happy. The tiger temple was absolutely unforgettable. We paid to feed baby tigers, but it was sold-out by the time we got there. But our guide Anda is very well known and respected at the temple, so he was able to get us extra pictures with tigers, including us holding a 6 week old cub. Priceless! He also helped us get first in line for everything because he knows the way the temple works so well. He took great pics of us and his humor helped us enjoy the day even more. He also provided us great history and culture on Thailand. WHat a nice guy! I highly recommend BDT and this tour and Anda!

Once in a lifetime experience--tour 1506 Extraordinary Elephant Day Trip.. Riding into the river on an elephant's neck is a once in a lifetime experience which, for us, was made possible by a tour we booked with Bangkok Day Tours. The entire process from booking to being dropped off back at our hotel was easy and professionally handled. We made the reservation online, where our questions were answered via email, and we made a deposit with a credit card. The balance was due in cash when the driver picked us up at the hotel.The driver picked us up on time in a fairly new large van. He was very pleasant, and more importantly (during approximately 7 hours on the road) a safe driver. Snacks and cold drinks were provided. We went to the floating market first, which is fun to see. If you want to buy something be prepared for some bargaining, or you will pay way too much. Our guide joined us on the way to our next destination, the bridge over the river Kwai (okay Khwae). This was interesting, though nothing like the bridge in the movie. It was fun to see the old train come by.We expected to eat lunch at the restaurant by the bridge, but apparently it was full so we went to another place on the way to the elephants. This was the only disappointment of the day, as the food was mediocre at best. We looked forward to some real Thai food, but instead the buffet consisted mainly of not-very-good western food, such as spaghetti.Then off to the elephant park, where we each hopped on our own elephant (with mahout behind us) and walked down into the river. Riding on these enormous beasts was an amazing experience. They don't just sit there, they rear up on the hind legs and then splash down under water, they squirt you (or your companions if you aim their trunk), and the mahouts will have you stand on the elephant's head or ride on its trunk, if you are feeling adventurous. All the while the staff took pictures for a DVD (included) and our guide took pictures with our camera.After that, we watched a brief elephant show (dancing Gangnam style!) and hand fed an elephant bananas. Next was the "jungle" ride in a two-person saddle on an elephant's back. This was a bit of a let down after the river experience, and the jungle was more of a loop around the housing area for the compound. It was still neat to experience an elephant close up, but if possible get the river experience.Then it was time for the long drive back to our hotel in Bangkok. This took almost 4 hours, but the driver did a great job. The picture DVD did not make it to our hotel before we left at 2:15 am, but Caroline Boonsong mailed it to us free of charge the next day. And that says it all about Bangkok Day Tours, efficient and customer oriented. We recommend them unreservedly.

Tiger Temple and Elephant Bathing. Myself and three friends were visiting Bangkok from the States. We decided to take a day excursion outside the city and found bangkokdaytours.com online before we left. We booked the Tiger Temple and Elephant Bathing tour. The day of the excursion, we met our driver in the lobby of our hotel, and we had a mini van all to ourselves. The driver went over our itinerary for the day, had snacks in the car, and made sure we had everything we needed before we started the trip. We drove about 2 hours outside Bangkok, then picked up our guide for the day, Na. She was amazing. Such a friendly and knowledgeable guide, who explained everything in great detail. When we made our first stop at the Bridge over the River Kwai, Na took control of my camera and started taking pictures from all over the place. She would suggest backgrounds, then get us together for group photos. She even taught me a thing or two about my camera. Once we got to the Tiger Temple, Na knew all the best seats and angles to get things on camera, as well as, get the best views of the tigers. She was a huge help and I cannot speak highly enough about her. She did the same thing when we got to the elephant bathing, and we beat the crowd for the lunch spot we stopped at. Na even brought us a special entree from the chef.If you're going to Bangkok and want something outside the city, I would highly recommend Bangkok Day Tours, and I would highly recommend requesting Na as your guide. I've never had an experience like this one, and it was the highlight of our trip.

(1 of 9) Bangkok Weekend Floating Market Tour 1006. I booked 9 tours from home (U.S.) over the internet; 2 tours are custom, and 2 others I altered by adding or deleting stops, and the remaining 5 are as is. The booking process was easy and Caroline Boonsong, the person I was corresponding, was very patient as my interests would change and I altered my trips. Truth be told, I was uneasy booking all the tours from abroad, but I did my reasearch using Tripadvisor and felt as comfortable as I could.Yesterday, all fears were put to rest. I took my first tour and it was amazing! Molly was my tour guide. Just to be safe, I arrived in the lobby 10 mins prior to the arranged meeting time; Molly was already there! She introduced herself and within 5 mins, I was so at ease, I felt like I was traveling with a friend. The car that showed up was a large van. It was clean, comfortable and spacious; comparable to what I would find back in the U.S. I am 6'2" (~188 cm) and had plenty of room.As we were driving, I told her, yesterday, when I was on my own, I tried to walk to a flower market but got lost and didn't make it. I'm not sure if the set route was to to take me through it, but we ended up there. I guess she could tell I was very interested in it (by me struggling to take pics of the flowers from the moving van,) so she asked if I would be interested in walking to the pier, thru the flower market! I jumped at the chance! This is just one example of how Molly tweeked/adjust the itinerary as she learned more and more about me. She is the definition of excellent customer service! As we went throught the flower market, she pointed out how individual items were made, why they were made and the local significance to the economy. I could tell she was listening to the questions I asked, and taloiring the information to match my interests. She also made the tour interactive by asking me questions and joking with me. I won't bore you with a step by step account of the day, but I want to spell out what else I did. Once we reached the pier, we traveled to Wat Arun (which I climbed,) took a private long-tailed boat to the Taling Chan Floating Market, where we had lunch, and rode the van back to the hotel. It was amazing day! Everywhere we went, Molly offered to take pictures of me with my camera. This was a huge deal for me. As a solo traveler, it can be difficult to get pictures of myself traveling. I tend not to ask strangers because I don't want to impose; very early on, Molly made sure I didn't feel this way :) As I said before, this is the first of nine tours I booked (I hope to review them all.) If Molly is the norm at Bangkok Day Tours, I will be having an amazing trip!

Bangkok, the city that never sleeps.... Bangkok , full of sensations , smells, emotions. A city so alive and beautiful ( the real meaning of the word deep ) with people so friendly , peaceful and with an atmosphere that is hard to catch the words. I admit I did not expect anything else but total chaos and misery struck me . Bustle of the city combined with easing people have made ​​me not affect pronunciation. It's all so natural in Bangkok : A Thai massage , street vendors who cook every street corner prostitutes Nana you hang on a second, tailors fabrics that invites you to their " firm " tuk tuk - Ar that chick you " freeend maaa " and ladyboys that you can not decide what's sex based , and many many more . There is much to do in Bangkok . It's been, that's for sure , it's gone as the " sights " , and the streets , neighborhoods , bars , boat, in temples, is a city to be beaten or tuk tuk foot , to catch all the flavor .For us time in Bangkok was relatively short , I was able to taste the flavor of the city as much as allowed us . After the 4 days we head towards the next destination of Phuket.

Elephant Trek and floating market. We were picked up at 7am promptly from our hotel and met our driver and guide (Nam). She was very friendly and spoke good English. We were in a mini van to ourselves and expected to be picking up others, as there were meant to be 5 other people on the same tour that day, but never did and ended up having our own tour guide and driver to ourselves the whole day.We had about an hour and a half drive to our first stop which was a floating market. Here we met another girl who was on our tour who also had her own car with driver and guide.The floating market is very interesting and is quite an experience going round haggling while in a boat. You get in a boat taxi and get rowed around the market by the driver, who takes you up and down most of the "isles" time permitting. You have half hour on the boat and then a further half hour walking around the hardstanding bit. If you show any interest in the goods being sold then the sellers tend to grab your boat to stop you being rowed away. If you do wish to buy anything then haggle down to about 30% of the original price! My gf bought 2 scarves which started out at 950 baht for one and eventually got 2 for 900 baht and thought we had got a good deal! We asked our guide later who said you should pay about 200 baht for each scarf! Haggle, haggle, haggle!After the market we went to the River Kwai which was another half hour or so driving. The bridge is still used as a train line and we were fortunate to be there when a train came along and watch it slowly chug over the bridge. We walked along the full length to the other side and back and got lovely views on the bridge and down the river. Quite beautiful.After this half hour stop we went on again, ten or 15 minutes to a little restaurant for lunch. It was a buffet style and looked a nice place. However, as I was pouring sugar into my coffee I noticed tiny little bugs crawling around in the sugar jug. Yuk! That put me off everything unfortunately and I watched other people go up and use the sugar oblivious. We also used the toilets here which were not great. We were able to leave whenever we were ready so just had a brief 30 minute break then jumped in the van to be whisked away to the highlight - the elephant trekking.This was another 30 minutes or so in the car and when we arrived we could see the elephants already walking about carrying people. It looked amazing!We had a short wait until a queue of people had been and during this time were able to see 2 baby elephants and stroke and feed them.When our turn came we both got on the basket atop an elephant and began the tour walking around. All the while our guide, Nam, was on the ground taking lots of photos on her camera for us. Our guide on the elephant also kindly took photos using our camera and then did something we were not expecting. He got off the elephant and told us to get down from the basket and sit on the elephants head to control it. We both took turns of this and he took dozens of photos of us and gave us things to feed the elephant with. It was amazing and it seemed no-one else was being given this chance to sit on the head. He was obviously after a tip but he deserved one as being in control of the elephant while it was walking along was incredible.Eventually he jumped back on and we finished the circuit. It was about half hour I think that we was on the elephant but if we had not stopped for so many photos while we were on the head then probably would have been over much quicker as it was not a big circuit.Then as soon as we got off the elephant they told us to get ready to go down into the river to get wet! We got on an elephant each directly on its' neck and went down to the river Kwai.They have an area that is enclosed so there is no current and it is shallow so you can stand up pretty much anywhere in it, except for further out. The river is brown and dirty and we both had a bit of earache the next day but it was so worth it! We spent 21 minutes in the river with the elephants which seemed forever! They let you climb their trunks and you get thrown in the water over and over again. Very enjoyable and energy sapping! We stood on the heads and jumped off, anything you want to do really. The whole time Nam was taking photos from the river bank and another man also took photos using our camera. It was brilliant and I would recommend to anyone. If you didn't do this bit then it would be a bit boring.After we had finished here they gave us shower gel and led us to where we could shower. However, it was a big water butt situated in the corner of a very small room that we were both in and the water looked as dirty as the river we had just come from. Plus we had to use a bowl to pour it so it wasn't a shower as such. We gave it a miss and just dried and changed but it was funny in a way and showered when we got back to hotel later.Then we had a 3 hour drive back to Bangkok to end a great day.The next morning a DVD was delivered to our room from Nam containing hundreds of photos that she had taken of the day. We almost had every second of our water bath with the elephants captured as still images! And at no extra cost! Impressive service.I would recommend, excellent trip!

Bangkok Day Tours - Tiger Temple Tour. We recently engaged Bangkok Day Tours to take us to the Tiger Temple and were fortunate to have Por (Guide) and Jo (Driver). Although an early start 4.30am we soon discovered it was worth every lost second of sleep! They picked us up in a luxurious van and we made our way to the first stop (River Kwai) - Por ensured we got a good coffee at a stop (needed!) and provided rain coats and umbrellas as it was pouring down. She also provided some lovely food to eat before we arrived at the temple. Once there Por ensure we were clear on the process of feeding the Monks and had her camera at the ready to photograph our every move that day (such a great gesture). The Tiger Temple did not disappoint! It was simply a wonderful experience to not only see and engage with the tigers but to also hold them and feed them. We were lucky enough to cuddle a 3 week old cub. On this tour you get to do so much with the tigers and do not believe the stories you hear about the tigers being drugged. There is no way these little fiesty fellows were. My husband and I were very happy with the whole trip, in particular when Por left a CD of all the images of our wonderful experience at our Hotel Reception the next day. I TRUELY recommend this tour and ask for Por and Jo. FABULOUS!

travelling solo. I would recommend Bangkok day tours to anyone. As a woman travelling alone they were wonderful. They provided a woman guide so I would feel comfortable and she couldnt have been more happy and helpful. I did the morning tiger temple and elephant bathing tour. I was picked up right on time (4.30am) and the day was truly wonderful. Full of information and lots of laughs which is great when you are travelling alone.They took hundreds of photos with my camera then after I arrived home I received an email with a heap more she ( Im sorry to say.. I have forgotten her name..my apoligies) had taken with her own ! I was taken to a lovely place for lunch then on the way home we stopped at a roadside stall where she jumped out and came back with treats for me to try. I have to say I wasnt that fussed on one and she looked so disappointed we both cracked up.It was a lovely personal day tour and I cant thank them enough. :)

Amazing. We had an amazing time. Our guide Sally and driver Mr T made it s feel like VIPs the way they took care of us. Sally is a fantastic guide with wonderful English. She was very friendly and no question we had went unanswered. She has an obvious love for her work. We did the Tiger Temple Tour morming program. Quite literally a once in a lifetime experience. The staff at the temple were welcoming, friendly and fun. No way are these animals drugged like some negative feedback I have seen. Thank you for a great day Bangkok Day Tours. Will definitely use you again if we come back to Bangkok.

Amazing!. We had the best day ever. Sally the tour guide was fantastic and spoke good English. The floating markets, the river kwai and of course swimming with the elephants was the highlight of our entire holiday in Thailand. Thanks for the amazing experience.

Jam packed day. We spoke to Bangkok Day Tours before we left the UK and explained everything that we wanted to do around Kanchanaburi. They drafted a personalised itinerary and agreed to pick us up from our hotel in Bangkok at 4:30am.After picking us up our guide Tanya explained that in order to visit places when it was quietest, we should reorder our activities from what was originally discussed - fine by us. We got to the bridge on the River Kwai around 6am and were the first tourists there. We then went straight to Erawan Falls and again we were the first people into the park. This meant we could see each level without any other people around which was great. As we made our way down coach loads of Russian tourists began turning up so I'm really glad we made it there before the crowds. We then went on to Hellfire Pass, had some lunch, fed some wild monkeys, visited the death railway and bathed elephants in the river. Tanya made sure to explain everything as went along. We got back to our hotel at 7:30pm. Tanya made sure that we got the most of our day and although paying for a private tour was relatively expensive, I believe being able to do everything we wanted was worth it. PS Don't go to the Tiger Temple - it is cruel and exploitative

Amazing Day. Was traveling with 2 friends around Asia for a month and this was probably the best day (this was in mid-September). Our guide was Kent, who spoke great English and was very nice. Our driver was also very nice. We went to the Floating Market, Bridge Over the River Kwai, Tiger Temple, and bathing with elephants. All were great, but bathing with elephants was by far the best. It was tons of fun. You sit on an elephant with an elephant trainer right behind you and they take you into the water. For about 20-30 minutes you play with the elephants, they throw you around with their trunks, you jump off their heads, etc. And the elephants are really nice and responsive to the trainers. Also, a different Bangkok Day Tours guide (forgot her name) was already at the elephant camp before we arrived and offered to take pictures for us from her own camera while we were bathing with the elephants. Our own guide took video from our phones, but kind of screwed it up because he didn't really know how to work the phone. But the other guide was great and delivered the pictures to us at our hotel the next day on a CD. It was really nice of them and the pictures were great. Overall - an amazing day and definitely worth doing for a day trip in Bangkok.

Lovely service. We booked online elephant swimming tour and got very very good service from the Bangkok Day Tours. Everything was spot on time and exactly as promised. Guide spoke very good english and his guidance was much better than expected. If and when coming to Bangkok again, will use them again for sure. 5 star service. Well done!

Absolutely Amazing. Visited the Floating Market, the Bridge over the river Kwai and then went bathing with the Elephants. All of it was beyond expectations.The good service started from booking, booked the tour the day before on an impulse. The personal tour bus turned up beverages and snacks were provided for the journey.Anjee our tour guide was great, very informative and friendly. Highly recomend booking a tour with this company

Best birthday !!. Picked up in a beautiful vehicle we had a fantastic guide Tanya and a superb driver Gun. We visited the floating markets, the bridge over the River Kwai , the very moving military cemetery, we rode on elephants and then had the best time with the Tigers at Tiger Temple !! Nothing was too much trouble. Tanya was fun and very knowledgeable. She took photos of us on the elephants and arranged playtime with tiger cubs. It was a whole 12 hours of a fantastic trip. Would recommend Bangkok day tours to everyone.. Thanks for making my birthday so memorable !!
Amazing experience. Unforgettable day with Floating market, River Kwai and Elephant experience - proffessional guides, comfortable van and good service!!

Safari World is brilliant. Anyone who visits Thailand has to visit this place, it is simply one of its kind where apart from seeing animals from white tiger to Rino to polar bear you can enjoy Orangatun Show, Amazing seal show, Fantastic dolphin show and not so great cow boy show. the open zoo is outstanding as you can see zebra actually crossing, lion, tigers , sambha, deers, giraffe, along your side.

Extraordinary animal experience - elephants and tigers!. My wife scheduled me for a special weekend of "adventure training" with Bangkok Day Tours and it was fabulous. I flew from Washington DC, arriving on Friday night and returned to DC on Monday. On Saturday, I did the Extraordinary Elephant Day Trip (also listed as a separate entry in Trip Advisor); on Sunday, I did the Tiger Temple. Both of these allow up close and personal contact with the animals that involves some risk to the visitor but will always be memorable if you survive it! The elephant trip included a brief tour of the floating market and an unremarkable lunch but then an amazing experience with the elephants including riding like a mahout on the elephant's neck; riding an elephant into the water and then being tossed, submerged, and showered; feeding the elephants while we rode; and feeding the baby elephants. There was also an elephant show. I was the only one with Bangkok Day Tours and was able to spend several hours just with the elephants. The Tiger Temple tour started with an early morning stop at the infamous bridge over the Kwai River and an up close sighting of a large monitor lizard, presumably a Komodo Dragon, that swam up to me on the shore before dashing away. At the temple everyone lined up to provide food to the monks which we later shared with them for breakfast. We then experienced a remarkable sequence of activities including, playing with baby and yearling tigers in the temple, walking the older (2+ yr) tigers, bathing the tigers, feeding chicken to the tigers, playing with larger tigers with lures on the end of long bamboo rods (my tiger finally got the basketball and absolutely demolished it in his jaws), and watching a demonstration of the superb leaping power of the large tigers into a small pond. The tour ended with a late lunch at a good Thai buffet at a floating restaurant next to the bridge on the Kwai. My tour guides, Por and Sally, were excellent and provided running commentary about the sugar cane and teak we were passing on the road, discussion about the many temples, and lots of Thai history and culture. My driver on both days, Tong, picked me up and returned me to the JW Marriott and was a masterful driver in traffic that would be a challenge even to a Bostonian. He also made sure I was provided with endless snacks, from a bunch of small Thai bananas to sandwiches and roasted ears of sweet corn, and made sure I was well hydrated. The cost of these all included tours was very reasonable; it was a great experience and these were unique opportunities especially for a zoologist! I would use these Bangkok Day Tours again and will return with my wife for some tamer temple and palace tours.

Trip #1506 Extraordinary Elephant tour. We booked this trip online through Bangkok Day Tours. I must admit I was a bit apprehensive about booking online with a company I had never dealt with before, but I had read reviews on Trip Adviser beforehand, so I felt more comfortable about it. On the day, our driver (La) turned up at our hotel on time and introduced himself to us. He asked us to waited outside the hotel door whilst he fetched our transport. We had a luxury van all to ourselves (leather reclining seats, air con and DVD player-the works!). He explained that we had to travel quite a long way and to relax. We were provided with ice cold water and snacks along the way. Our first stop was the floating market where we were introduced to Por, who took photos with my camera and her own. After this we went to the bridge over the river Kwai, picking up our tour guide Na, She was really chatty, spoke really good English and was very knowledgeable. We had lunch at the floating restaurant which was very nice. Then we went on to the highlight of the day which was elephant trekking and bathing with the elephants. Na took my camera and my friend's video camera and ran around taking photos and videos of our jungle trek. She wore me out watching her! Then we swapped elephants and went into the river to play. We all had a brilliant time, again the crew taking the video and Na with my camera and Por reappeared with her camera snapping away like a demon! The next day a package arrived for me and when we returned home, we had over 1500 pictures which were complimentary (Ok, some of which were on my own camera, but Por had taken over 800 pictures of us bathing with the elephants-how many companies would do that for free?). Then we fed the baby elephants with bananas provided by Na (again, free). It was a long day and we were driven back to our hotel by La, who had driven over 400km's during the day. All in all we had an experience that we will never forget and I would not hesitate in recommending Bangkok Day tours to anyone!

Elephant riding. This was this best experience. It was a long ride to get to the elephant park but once we were there it was well worth the trip. I enjoyed every bit of riding on the elephant back. It's a must do. We had Thiland food at a local eatery. Be careful because everything was very spicy. The tour guide spoke very good English and the van we rode in was very comfortable.

Wonderful Tour. We booked Tour: 1511 Tiger Temple Breakfast + Elephant Bathing. It was amazing!!!! Our guide was Na and she made sure we got great pictures all day. In addition, 2 other groups booked the same tour that day, so an additional photographer, Por, joined us and took pictures of everyone (for free). We got over 1500 pics, 800 of which were from Por, who delivered them on a disc the next day to our hotel in Bangkok. We took two cameras, which worked out great. The driver picked us up on time and they always had enough food and water for us. I spoke to another couple on the same tour and they said the paid $600 each for this tour. My husband and I paid about $650 for the two of us together. I don't know if the couple booked through a travel agent, but it sounds like you should book directly through Bangkok Day tours to get the best price. Just go to their website, and fill out the booking form. We paid in advance with our credit card, so it was very easy.I have read mixed reviews on the Tiger Temple, but I thought it was wonderful. We did the morning tour, so we got a ton of interaction with the tigers and saw the them awake, happy, and playful. The staff was also very friendly. There were only 16 people there the day we went, so everyone seemed to have a tiger to cuddle with. The elephant bathing was also amazing. I will say, that you should not expect clear, clean water like I have been reading about in other reviews. The river was very muddy where we were, and right before my elephant stepped into the water, my husband's elephant pooped in the water right in front of us... a lot. I waited until I stopped seeing floaters before I would get off the elephant and into the the water. Yes it was gross, but totally worth it! The nice thing was that they waited until we were the only ones in the water before they started our program. So the pictures turned out great... with only us and not a lot of other people in the background. Thank you Na and Por for a wonderful day!

Elephant Day Trip - Code 1506. This trip was part of my wife's 50th Birthday. We were picked up at our hotel by "O" and were given a snack bag and water. The floating market was very good and we were given time just to wander. En route we picked up our guide "Anda" who said his job was to make us happy and boy did he do his job well!. Our stop at the Bridge Over The River Kwai rekindled some memories for me as I had been there some 20 years ago when I was in the Army. We had lunch there and then went on to the Elephant's. Not just a walk round a track, but much more. We went on a circuit through the jungle and then from there we then changed and had an elephant each along with the Mahout and took them down to the River Kwai. For the next 40 mins we had a great time in the water, just us! A memorable time and as Anda had promised, we were very happy. Anda also doubled up as the photographer and took some great photo's. If this is what you want to do in Tailand then go with this company and ask for Anda and O. They were great!

Elephant Day Trip with Bangkok Day Tours. Had a FANTASTIC time in Bangkok, Thailand this week. Ou guide, Kent, took GREAT care of us. We booked the Extraordinary Elephant Day Trip (Code:1506) and were pleasantly surprised on how well organized, the whol trip was.Stand by, Pictures will be uploaded soon!DON'T FORGET YOUR SWIM TRUNKS AND TOWEL!
Temples & Floating market. The Wat Trimitr tour is amazing and the Golden Buddah is a real wonder to see. The floating market is another attraction mixed with the nature and enjoyed very much.

Extraordinary Elephant Day Trip. Awesome and worth every penny. Bangkok Day Tours took care of everything, including taking photos and videos of your romp with the elephants so you can look back on your adventure. It was surreal - spending time in the water, jumping off of elephants, getting swung around on their trunks - simply incredible! To this tour - I spent a month in Bangkok and this was BY FAR the best day and experience of my time there.

Bangkok City & Temples plus Grand Palace. This tour includes three of the most unusual Buddhist temples in Bangkok: Wat Trimitr with its invaluable Golden Buddha (5 1/2 tons of solid gold). Wat Po, the most extensive temple in Bangkok, with its colossal Reclining Buddha and the Chedis of the Kings, and the striking white marble structure of Wat Benchamabophit.The Grand Palace was the seat not only of the king and his court, but contained within its crenellated walls, the entire government administration. The architecture is vibrantly Thai though there are some European designs as well. Brilliantly colored and gilded, and decorated with intricate detail, the overall effect is dazzling. The palace served as the official residence of the kings of Thailand from the 18th to the mid-20th century.The most famous building on the palace grounds is Wat Phra Kaew (Temple of the Emerald Buddha), regarded as the most sacred Buddhist temple (wat) in Thailand. Construction of the temple began when King Rama I moved the capital from Thonburi to Bangkok in 1785. Unlike other Thai temples, it does not contain living quarters for monks; rather, it has only the richly decorated holy buildings, statues, and pagodas.The main temple building is the central ubosoth, which houses the Emerald Buddha. Though green in color, the Buddha is actually carved from a single piece of jade, and though only 17 inches tall, is the most revered object in Thailand. Also within the grounds are several palaces, used for various occasions: the Funeral Palace, Reception Palace, Throne Hall, Coronation Hall, and the Royal Guest House. The majority of halls and palaces can be viewed from outside only, but the exteriors are captivating enough to please.

The most amazing tour. We did one of the most amazing tours from Bangkok.The tour group Bangkok Day Tours had the best facilities to make the tour comfortable.we had our own air conditioned van which was really comfortable with reclining leather seats etc.The first part of our journey was a Tour of the floating market even though we had shopped so much & weren't really interested in seeing more of the same stuff we found this was such a relaxing shopping experience. We did this early in the morning so it wasn't really busy apparently in it really busy as the day goes on plus it goes into the night.Then we visited the famous bridge over river Kwai for lunch on the floating restaurant.We continued to ride on the spectacular elephants which was a great experience but that was only the start.When we got to ride the elephants down to the river and bath with them the trip changed from great to amazing. We felt we really connected with the elephants and the elephants loved it as much as we did.Do not forget to visit the Bangkok Day Tours website when you go to Bangkok. www.bangkokdaytours.com

A perfect day trip. My husband and I went to the floating market, the bridge of the river Kwai, and the tiger temple . We had a guide and a driver and a very comfortable minivan for the two of us . Our day trip was very well organized, no rush we had time for the visits . Sally our guide was very friendly and devoted and gave a lot of information about the different places we visited . We had a long drive back to Bangkok and we had a very good and efficient driver . We enjoyed our trip and we highly recommend Bangkok day tour . I had the trip directly organized by email from France, I had precise demands since I had been there before but my husband hadnt and we did exactly what I had asked for.

A wonderful memorable day. Celebrating our friends 50th we organised a day tour with Por and Joe our driver. We could not fault the organisation and friendliness of them both and they were so informative about any question we asked. Por knows all the tricks about getting the best out of the day and it was like she was on the tour with us as one of our friends. Her hearty laugh and smile just makes you want to hug her. The Bridge over Kwai was very moving and we had the opportunity to see one of four trains a day pass us on the bridge. The tiger temple was peaceful and well organised by the monks and volunteers. Got a few little nips by the babies but only because they were playful. I'm not one for elephant rides as I think they are out of their environment but after it was explained they had been rescued and really well treated by their handlers I appreciated how the Thai people have this bond with them and love them as family. It was an extremely memorable day and it was all down to the friendly and passionate approach of Por and Joe (an unbelievable confident driver in sometimes mayhem traffic). The 4.30am pick up is the way to go as you beat all the 'day tourists' and you experience the peace of the Thai countryside. Our photos and video delivered to us the next day are a tribute to Por's professional photography skills. Will highly recommend this company and will never forget our wonderful guides. Skates and McGinty's - Australia

Amazing, totally must do day - tiger temple breakfast. We heard about the tiger temple whilst touring Vietnam and booked this last minute and WOW it was so amazing. The 4:30 am pick up is hard work but the mini van has large comfy seats that recline fully and you have it to yourselves so you can get some sleep on the way. I saw that someone said they didn't get a guide - this is not true - we picked up the local guide about 20 minutes before getting to the Bridge over the River Kwai. Tossapon was fabulous, she knew all the history, all the best positions to get really great photo's and brought breakfast to eat in the van so that we wouldn't waste time eating when we could be playing with tigers. It's a gentle start walking across the bridge and then you're off to the main event. Fortunately I had a spare memory card with me as Tossapon (and I think other guides do this too) brought a second camera and so during the visit there are pictures being taken from every angle and videos too. Again she was amazing as a guide as she positioned us to get the maximum time interacting and advised us how to handle the youngsters so they relaxed and simply fell asleep in our arms once they had been fed and had a little play. The whole experience is truly fabulous, tigers of every age and if you think they are drugged (as some posts imply) I cannot see how, the large tiger who is clearly well trained for the head on your lap photo was up chasing toys 5 minutes later and jumping into the water area and they were jumping up and playing with us in the water too. All the animals we saw were in excellent condition, lovely coats and bright eyes and the staff and monks seemed to know each one individually and were always watchful of tourists but also encouraged interaction under their guidance. I have maybe 1500 photographs from the day plus video's and most are from the tiger temple. After you have followed the morning programme (I think well worth for the interaction with the small tigers and the bathing) you head over to ride an elephant (we didn't wash them) this is still a brilliant experience and again they are in nice condition and the location is very picturesque (for me the tigers overshadowed it a little). After the ride you go to a pleasant restaurant for lunch which is a set menu, the food was very good and the restaurant was certainly popular. You can then snooze for the 3 hour ride back to Bangkok. The service and guides were top quality and the whole package magical.

Anda not Panda. This tour was amazing. For a reasonable price we had a full day planned with a private driver and tour guide included. The day started off at the floating markets where we took in the sights and sounds of this interesting location. Next we went to a scenic restaurant on the River Kwai where we witnessed a girl accidentally get her leg stuck in the tracks and our tour guide Anda saved her from certain death. Next we went on an elephant ride where I was molested by a medium sized elephant and later got thrown by a much larger elephant into a river while the Thai wranglers laughed with delight. In all honesty this was a great tour and our guide Anda was amazingly helpful, knowledgeable and fun. I highly recommend!

Bangkok City - culture style life people destination. Bangkok - The city of Life, true to it's tag it is a city of life every one who visit the city will agree that.Few years back I had a different 'dark' opinion on Bangkok, mainly because of its night life and pub culture, but over the years I saw it transforming with the changing world, The city managed to cope with rapid globalization, In the begging it was only a tourist destination and tourism was the main source of revenue for Thai People and government, but now things are changing the city has become a hub to many MNCs of various sectors around the world. Providing better employment for locals, this in my opinion reduced dependency on tourism industry and people depending on this, resulting better hospitable conditions for tourists and healthy competition among the locals. My observations in comparison with other major cities of ASIA.(Beijing, Shanghai, Delhi, Mumbai,Chennai,Hyderabad, KL, Singapore,Taipei, Seoul, Manila) Transportation :Bangkok got organized transport system, Sky Train - MRT, Good roads and better road decency compared to above cities, heavy traffic though but vehicles don't over cross each other creating grids, mainly no one horn the vehicles even there is a rush. As an Asian I prefer to live and work here. Less pollution. River taxis are unique and better way to go places. People: People are decent but their decency varies based on their profession, You will experience pure hospitality in a Hotel and same (some) time it will be a nightmare with a tuk-tuk or a regular other guy in a shop or a pub. It all depends on once capability of handling things. Cost of living :Bangkok is relatively cheap, but you have to look at the right place. You can find food ranging from 25TB to 2500TB, same for hotel and accommodation.City is know for its best bargains, but things are changing most of the shops and malls these days are tend to go for a fixed price concept.  Over all for visitors:Bangkok is a place to chill and relax with exotic food-drinks and Thai Massage, For visitors who prefer site seeing & temples its a one time visit.

Once in a lifetime experience!. We had a wonderful day with Mr Ricky who was our tour guide and Mr Ra who was our driver. Mr Ra was a fantastic driver, very smooth and considering a large part of the day was spent on the road navigating Bangkok's busy highways, he did a spendid job! Mr Ricky was very professional, giving us information along the way, and allowing us to take the day at our own pace. The Tiger Temple is amazing, just wish we had more time with the tiger cubs, I could easily have stuck one in my bag and taken it with me! Bangkok Day Tours are very professional, we were picked up on time, as promised (at 4.30am!!). We were very pleasantly surprised the next day when there was a parcel for us at reception, which was a CD with photos and video of the day taken by the tour guides. What a great gesture. Thank you everyone for a truly unforgettable day! Best Regards Melina and Lawrence from Sydney xx

Tiger Temple Breakfast + Elephant Bathing (Code 1511). Magnificient, wonderful, awe inspiring and full of fun. Great, great tour - highly recommend this tour company above all else. My son and I took this tour in early August 2013 and it is by far the single highlight of our visit to Bangkok. Our tour guide was "Por" who was just wonderful, very, very friendly and always helpful. She looked after both of us so well and joined in the fun that we had. She was more like a friend travelling with us than a tour guide and this made the whole experience even more special and enjoyable. The 'bathing' of the elephants has to be one of the best times of my life! The whole time Por was always around, taking pictures and video's so we could just have fun and still have a great visual record of our experience. The following morning there was a CD with some 650 pictures and more than a dozen video clips waiting for us in our hotel reception. Lunch was amazing too. No hidden expenses at all - everything is inclusive although a donation to the Muhouts for sharing with us their wonderful elephants was something we didn't hesitate to give. Thank you Por for giving myself and my son an experience we will always treasure. Kathy and Nathanial

Tiggers and Efalumps. Awesome day out with a really great guide (and lets not forget the driver) ! We left Bangkok very early to take breakfast with monks at the Tiger Temple. We were introduced and given a quick briefing but the first couple of hours were quiet so we could all sleep a bit more. When we stopped at the Bridge over the River Kwai Sally (our guide) told us we stop there early to avoid the crowds later in the day. Indeed we did, hardly a soul there and the bridge and river were SOOOO serene. We had breakfast in the car as Sally told us we'd have more Tiger time if we did not need to eat at the Temple. Everything else from then on was just amazing from feeding months old cubs, handling 6 week old cubs, bathing, feeding, and playing with the younger tigers. Ending with an amazing display of some of the lunatic Thai folks playing in water with 200+ kg Tigers!We'd followed that up with a visit to an Elephant camp where followed by a short walk on elephant's back my 3 teenage boys and I went into the river for a swim with the elephants. More lunatic Thai's had the elephants comically ducking us, throwing us off and spraying us with their trunks. Very funny and enjoyable!Ended the day tired but with some great memories and super photos taken by Sally and staff at the tiger temple. Even had a video of the elephant swimming to add to the collection!

Everybody must do this!. We had an incredible tour to Kanchanabury. We had a 3 days tour, visiting Floating market, River Kwai, Tiger Temple, Elephant bathing, Erawan waterfalls. What a fantastic tour! We were able to see sights not all can see, and the timing of the activities was perfect. All due to our guide Na and our chauffeur who made this trip out of this world. If you should do one thing, do this. And, get Na as your guide :)

Unforgettable day with the elephants. my wife and i really enjoyed the entire day with Bangkok Day Tours. I don't like normally spending too much money on touristy things but was glad i did this. Firstly the van we travelled in was very comfortable and it needed to be for the long journey. Then the guide we had was wonderful, positive and polite. her english was not perfect but we got by. the floating markets and the River Kwai were interesting and the food at the river Kwai bridge was adequate. not spectacular just ok. the highlight of the day though was the elephants. i could have just opted for a ride but actually that was the least interesting part of the experience. we were behind a group of british girls who were busy giving strict instructions to the Mahouts that they did'nt want to get their hair wet. riding the elephants into the river and playing with them their was an amazing experience that i will never forget. The elephants were gentle and playful. i was doing bombs of the back of the elephant, grabbing its trunk and squirting others and generally having a great time. i looked across and saw the british girls who had abandoned all hope of keeping their hair dry and were in fits of rapturous laughter. i had such a good time i slept all the way back to Bangkok. i left some things in the van and the Bangkok Day Tours staff dropped it off to my hotel the next day. wonderful lifetime memory created

Tigers and Elephants. Booked the tour with Bangkok Day trips based on reviews on Tripadvisor and I was not disappointed.Highly recommend this company and our guide Ricky was fantastic. He took loads of pictures and was always at hand during the whole day

Time of my life!. This was the most amazing experience of my life!We did a full day tour that was incredibly well organised by Por and all the wonderful staff at Bangkok day tours. Our group of three were picked up from our Bangkok hotel in a luxury private van. We first stopped at the Original Bridge over the River Kwai, then continued on to the Tiger Temples where we participated in the morning routines of feeding, bathing and playing with the tigers. After which we went to the elephant camp where we played in the river with the elephants and trekked through the jungle. The people at Bangkok day tour were lovely and the service was second to none. Por (the lady that organises the tours) and our personal guide Rikki went above and beyond for us and Por even took a huge number of photos and videos for me and had them dropped to my hotel the morning after the tour as a birthday gift.All meals were included in the tour, the staff were amazing and the animals were very well looked after and happy.Best day of my life!Thank you Bangkok day tours

An Unreal Experience!. From the moment you are picked up to the time your are dropped off you will experience things you just cannot experience anywhere else. We did the Tiger Temple tour which also included a stop at the Bridge Over the River Kwai, lunch, and a brief ride on an elephant. Our guide - Sally - took care of our group all day (including breakfast!). Sally gives you just enough information without being intrusive or too detailed. Sally also takes fantastic photos and takes care to be sure she includes everyone and watches over your phones and cameras all day! The Tiger Temple is unlike anything anywhere and can be a bit uncomfortable at times - but where else can you be this close (and I do mean this close) to tigers. Hard to express in words what this experience was really like and lunch was great as well (off the beaten path local place - fantastic!).

Unreal Experience. This was the most amazing experience - I have been on another elephant tour a few years ago and the animals were treated so badly but here they are are awesome.
