I can't describe how amazing it was to bathe with the elephants after the jungle ride, you have to do it to really know what it's like. We were picked up from our hotel by tour guide Sally and a driver in a beautiful Toyota 4x4 - leather interior and everything. I asked when we were going to join everyone else and Sally explained that we were the only ones doing it - I didn't realise we were getting a personal tour for the cheap price we paid so I was blown away.Sally was amazing and you will know what I mean if you are lucky enough to get her as your tour guide, her english was great and she always had interesting facts to pass on as we drove along. We never had to wait for anything and she got us the best spots for lunch and even took photos of us in the water with the elephants so we could just enjoy the experience and had so many amazing pictures to take home with us. DO THIS TOUR - you know you want to :)

Most AMAZING Experience EVER! Once in a lifetime for sure!!!. We had a small group of 8 who took the Bangkok Day Tours tour: 1511 Tiger Temple Breakfast and Elephant Bathing. This day was a once-in-a-lifetime experience worth every penny! It is a bit more costly than some of the other similar options and it's a long day, but if you're able to designate travel funds for it, you'll be so happy you did! The excursion started with an early morning stop at the Bridge Over the River Kwai before any other people were even on the road to start tours. Peaceful, and a great opportunity for photos of the bridge with no one around. From there we went to the Tiger Temple where we were privileged to serve breakfast to the monks before getting all involved with the tigers - we fed the young ones from bottles, took them on walks, exercised and played with them, bathed them, walked the adult tigers down into the canyon for their water activity time, and took PHOTOS, PHOTOS, and more PHOTOS. My concern prior to booking this tour was that all the Tiger Temple photos made the adult tigers look drugged for photos with visiting tourists and I wanted no part in an experience that involved any mistreatment of these animals to serve our purposes. Well, having had this time all morning with the tigers, I can assure that the tigers in the photos are not drugged nor mistreated! These staff members care for these animals with all the love they have for them. The tigers may be tired from their morning water play and the heat, but they are not drugged. We took our photos right after their play and as witnesses, we know they weren't. One more addition is there were even a couple of two-week old tigers at the temple which we were only able to photograph due to their very young age.As if that weren't enough, we then went on to one of the elephant camps where we again bottle-fed the babies, rode the elephants bareback (not in a basket!) through the jungle, and then bathed them in the River Kwai. How many people can seriously say they've ever had the opportunity to have such an experience?!? The elephants lifted us on their trunks; we had water fights using their water-filled trunks as hoses, and just had great fun! I can't say enough about this whole day, this entire experience! Everyone with Bangkok Day Tours was terrific - from Caroline who booked the tour and took care of all the details beforehand to Po and our other guide as well! They took photos and videos all day and delivered a CD to each of us at our hotels the next day so we'd all have copies of everything! How's that for awesome customer service?!? I would recommend Bangkok Day Tours in a heartbeat and I'd encourage anyone even considering the possibility of this tour to spend the extra money for the FULL experience .... you won't regret it!!!

Fantastic. I googled elephant tours and stumbled across these guys, read the great reviews so I called. Caroline was more than happy and accommodating to take me the next day. The online booking was easy, safe and secure. My driver Po (silent P) and tour guide Anda (not panda) were great. The overall day was nothing less than fantastic. I was on my own and put full trust in these people and they proved it very well. The cost was worth every penny, with lunch, cold water and a snack provided after the elephant ride, be sure to take extra money for tipping the mahout (100 baht min). I will definitely be back to do the tiger temple.Regards.

Exceptional. I've been a large number of tours in different cities and countries but Bangkok Day Tours were better than any of them. I booked three different tours over three days.When I turned up I expected to be part of a small group but, in the event, I was the only person on the tour. I was assigned a tour guide, Kent, for all three days, a brand new Toyota Landcruiser for one day and a comfortable minibus for the other two. A lot of tour companies would have found a way to cancel or 'persuade' me onto another tour but, to their credit BDK went ahead.Kent provided more than enough information to explain where we were going and what we were going to see. To be fair this wasn't particularly in depth but it was sufficient. The logistics of the tours were perfect and, as mentioned in other reviews, the company pre-empts requirements with cold towels, drinks etc. Lunches were good, especially on the last day when the usual buffet was replaced by a choice from a menu.These tours are not cheap. In fact they cost more than one might expect to pay in Thailand but I cannot fault the service and I would thoroughly recommend the company.

Excellent day!!. Just came back from Bangkok day tours Tiger temple and Elephant experience. Had a fantastic day. Our tour guide Sally was just great and the day just went smoothly beginning to end. Well worth the money for this unique experience. Highly recommended.

Tiger Temple & Elephants - Great day. Right from the word go, Bangkok day tours were helpful and well organised. Our guide Sally was wonderful and went out of her way to take photos & answer any of our questions weather they related to the tour or not. Everything was catered for from cool towels after the tigers to ice cold water. What we loved about it was that we didn't have to ask or look for it, it was pre-empted which shows good customer service. We did the tiger temple with the monks in the morning, and there is no way that these tigers are drugged. They played like domestic cats & dogs and it was a joy to see them up close & personal. The Elephants were a highlight of the trip & bathing with them in the river is an experience we will never forget. I have no hesitation in booking through them again if we were in Bangkok.
Ok. But very busy with tourists.. I expected more locals buying and selling from boats. A big smelly and goods over priced. Rather tacky wares to buy.

Bangkok day tours. Family of 5 ages of children was 14,14 and 10. Have travelled extensively and this tour was the best l have ever done. The staff went out of their way to make this tour unforgettable in all the right ways. Highly recommend making them a part of your holiday.
very good, very enjoyable. that's good very excellent, very enjoyable, we have seen alot things, is very nice I love it, it was most amazing days for us,

Tiger Temple Breakfast with Monks (Code:1510). One of the best tours I've ever been on!Day started at 4:30am pick up from our Hotel. Our tour guide, Sally, was right on time! All their tours are private so it's literally all for your group/party. Sally was great! She had brought some snacks for us. First off, we had a 2 hour drive to the Bridge over River Kwai. Took some pictures and walked a bit before driving another 30 minutes to the Tiger Temple in Kanchanaburi. Before entering, we had to present breakfast offerings to the Monks (which was also provided by Bangkok Day Tours). First thing we did was play with the Tiger Cubs. The younger cubs were as big as your regular full grown pet cats at home. The older cubs were pretty much the size of a medium-large sized dog. After playing a bit, we had breakfast. Tried some new fruits like Mangosteen and Rambutans.Next up we washed and shampooed the Tiger cubs before feeding them some chicken. After, we walked the bigger tiger cubs through the Canyon. At this point, we were given large dangling toys to actually "play" with the cubs. (Sort of like the dangling toys you have for your cats at home...but a BIGGER and noisier!). There were consistently a bunch of tiger handlers to accompany you. Watching the Tigers chase the toys and chase each other was exhilarating! They're so fast!After, we took turns walking a full grown tiger and had the opportunity to take a picture with a full grown tiger's head in our laps! After everyone got a chance, we were told to stand in a fenced area where we could watch the handlers play with the full grown tigers. Got a chance to watch the full growns duke it out with each other.Once that was complete, our next destination was to the Elephant rides. Had a great opportunity to exchange seats with the elephant handler and actually sit on the elephant's neck and lead the way!After the ride, we had lunch at a local Thai restaurant before our 3-4 hour trek back to our hotel in Bangkok.Overall, it was a GREAT trip and Sally was an amazing tour guide! She was very informative, warm, and loves what she does! She also helped us take hundreds of photos on our camera and hers as well! Had a blast and would definitely recommend others to the same trip!

Best day ever. This was the most amazing day ( the Kwi bridge, tiger temple and elephants ) and it was all down to the excellent service provided by this tour company. Well worth the expense and total value for the money. Our day began at 4.30am, picked up at our hotel in a high tech people carrier by a pleasant guy who was the most considerate driver. His smooth driving allowed us all to sleep comfortably in the reclining chairs. On route we later picked up our guide, Na, who was so informative and organised. Na explained how we would get the best and most pictures, what exactly we should do when meeting the monks and how to get the best experience with the tigers ( choose to go with the big cats ) and elephants ( we rode the elephants bare back instead of choosing the baskets ). Na stopped off to get us memory stick allowing us to use her camera, provided snacks, fruit and water. Lunch ( included ) was gorgeous and timed perfectly during our trip. Through out the day she shadowed our party and got the most amazing photos, not missing a single thing, she was amazing. This lovely kind lady made our day and provided the best record of our memories and made sure we got the best experience ever.

how many times can you say you rode a elephant. our guide was po, she picked us up at the hotel with the driver, in a pimped out van :) we went to the floating market, had lunch at the floating restaurant, walked over the bridge, and then played with elephants. They had snacks, and a cooler full of water and wet wipes available.We had a great time, would def do it again, and want to go back to do the tiger tour next time.po was great, she even dropped off a cd of all the pictures and videos she took to our hotel the next day so we could have them.

Service at its best. Our group of four friends took the tiger temple and elephant camp day tour. The company confirmed our pick up the night before and were politely waiting for us as we met in the hotel lobby at 4:30 AM. The tour guide and driver were wonderful and helpful (even patient enough to drop by an ATM to finalize payment). We had the high tech van to ourselves along the long morning drive, which was amazing.Our first stop was a photo opportunity at the bridge at the river Kwai. We then drove to the tiger temple and it was better than expected - both in terms of access to the animals but in terms of everything we saw during the day. The elephant camp wasn't quite as nice, largely because the "ride" was essentially just around the property without any real direction (we spent more time as the mahouts let the elephants eat around 200 yards from the camp). Luckily the time with the elephants in the water was fun and helped recover the experience. I originally had been a bit nervous about seeing any animal cruelty with the elephants but other than a few minor markings from the mahout's tool, the largely used voice and hand control to guide the elephants.The lunch they had arranged was quite nice and then the ride home was restful. The driver allowed us to show our pictures on the van's flat screen in addition to watching a movie. Also, the driver and guide were open to dropping us off at the first train station to help save the drive time at rush hour to the hotel (probably saving at least an hour or more). Again, this was a first rate organized trip and the service provided by our guide and driver was worth the higher than average cost.

Great Value for Money. A group of us Australians wanted to go to Hellfire Pass in Thailand for Anzac Day 2013. We decided on Bangkok Day Tours which proved to be a great decision.Our guide, a lady named Na, was excellent as were all the arrangements and food. One of our group member's father had been in Hellfire Pass and regrettably he lost a leg in that campaign. So this trip was especially important to that man.This tour was well organized and professionally run. I have no hesitation in recommending the Company for those who want to pay respects to those who were imprisoned on the Burma Railway during WWII.Les

Visit to Wat Pho , The Canal tour in the LongTail boat and The Pak Klong Talad (Flowers and Vegetable Market). This was an excellent tour Organized By Ms.Aom of Thai Tour guide . The lunch at the Navy club and then off in the boat along the bustling Chao Phraya River. Here we got to see the scenes of Thai River life. It was a hot day and we were taken care of so well by Ms Aom who was always ready with cold water and fresh wet cold towels to refresh ourselves. The boat was just for us and the cruise was fun . As we cruised we saw the Wat Arun which is another temple on the shore. We were given bread to feed the Fish in the river on the temple banks . So many Fish in the river which were huge . They were cat fish . Our Tour guide had got for us" Thai Dessert after lunch to be eaten after we reached the shores . That was real sweet of her . This was Thai mangoes with sticky rice and the sweetened coconut milk . That brought us to Pak Klong Talad ( the flower and Fruit market ) . This was so good. The flowers Like orchids in different colors were so welcoming and beautiful to see. My guide was so gracious to buy me a bunch of the lovely dark magenta Orchids . I loved it. Then saw the fruits and veg of different kinds , all so neatly assembled for sale . After that we went to Wat PHo another temple -The recling Buddha temple. This was so peaceful and so many stupas and oldest temple in Bangkok . Our day finished with this last temple and our guide took us back to our hotel . It was such a wonderful , fun day out . Ms Aom made us feel at home and so comfortable in her company .

Tiger temple morning visit.. 4am start from the hotel. First shock rep was on time and smiling. Long drive to bridge on river quay first, lovely food provided. Then onto tiger temple. Incredible day, just perfect. 20 people, 20 tigers. Out guide Kate, so lovely. She took hundreds of pictures for us, kept us informed, oh and was so cute my wife wants to keep her! Ok so here is the thing , review on here for this place range from brilliant to terrible - with little in between. Well it's simple - morning visits ( get up you lazy git) brilliant. Fewer people, happy tigers, very awake tigers, great day. Afternoon, could be 1000 people, same number of knackered, hot, tigers - totally different experience. If yo can't get up- dont go!Ok, then on to ride elephants, then for a lovely lunch. Finally, the drive home ( back to the apartment) we slept much of the way. Kate pictures emailed to us within 24 hours, and they were great. This trip was not cheap, but worth it for us.

What a day!!. Wow! We did the Tiger Temple Morning tour, followed by an elephant ride and lunch in a cute local Thai restaurant. We had a really early pick up - 4:30am at our hotel! This was more than worth it, however, for the morning we had! Even though it was just myself and my boyfriend, we were picked up in a VIP mini-van, with fully reclining seats. These were very useful, as we started with a 2.5 hour drive to the bridge over the River Kwai. We arrived there just as the sun was rising, and it was really interesting to hear the history of the place and see the beautiful river flowing in the morning light. Our next stop was the Tiger Temple. Our tour guide, Sally, was absolutely amazing and clearly enjoys her job. She helped us prepare some food donations which we then gave to the monks as they passed by in a procession. We then went up to the temple (ladies, make sure you're dressed appropriately) and got to bottle feed a tiger cub straight away! We had over an hour playing with the cubs, some of which were only 3 weeks old! It was an amazing experience, and the staff were all helpful and friendly, and clearly knew how to handle the cubs. We then got to walk a cub on a lead, wash an older cub, feed it and play with them in their enclosure. After that, we got to walk a fully grown adult tiger - this was a little scary, but an experience!! We had our pictures taken with an adult tiger and then watched the adult males play and fight in the water. This was truly an amazing morning! There are native English-speaking staff there too, so everything is very clearly explained as you go. We then went to our elephant trek. This was the only disappointing part of the trip, as our 'trek' was more a 30 minute stroll through the car park and areas surrounding the mahout's huts - not through jungle at all. All in all, Bangkok Day Tours were a brilliant company - professional and friendly at the same time. Sally wanted to get to know us, and was constantly taking photos for us! Little touches, like a cold can of Coke when we had finished at the temple, were great too! I would definitely suggest using this company for the Tiger Temple tour, but perhaps give the elephants a miss. You can visit the temple in the afternoons, but it doesn't give you as much hands-on time with the tigers as the morning program does.

Wonderful Experience!. Going to Bangkok meant shopping and the usual sights. Bangkok Day Tour made it a memorable experience aside from the ordinary! We were picked up promptly by our driver Jo at the hotel. He is a careful driver, made sure we were comfortable in the spacious van and that our Floating Market experience was a pleasurable one. We met with our guide Na, who explained much of the history of the Bridge over the River Kwai. The buffet lunch was delicious! The highlight was riding the elephants and bathing them in the river. Na made sure we had plenty of pictures to take home and she and Jo took great pictures of this memorable experience! The elephants were well-taken cared of by their trainers in the camp, they love to bathe in the river, and were so playful! I HIGHLY recommend this tour, after all, how many times in your life can you actually ride and bathe with elephants? Kudos to the well-organized and courteous staff of Bangkok Day Tours especially to Jo our driver and our wonderful guide Na!

Bathing with elephants! Great experience!. We took the private tour to the Floating market, had lunch by the Bridge on the River Kwai and swam with the elephants. Private guide Na and driver Jo were excellent. Great service, travel in style and comfort, worth every cent. I've been going to Thailand for years on business and hardly got a chance to do anything touristy. Swimming with the elephants is a must! The elephants are playful yet gentle and it brought out the kid in me. Will definitely make time to do bathe and swim with the elephants again in a future trip to TH and will go with Bangkok Day Tours again!

Once in a lifetime!. This was an amazing experience! Photos to prove it along with a video (compliments of our driver and private guide). They made us feel welcomed and showed us around to everything that needed to be seen!We did the elephants and tigers (stayed overnight)Highly recommended

Terrific Organizer. Ever wondered getting lost or wondering what to see especially when you are in a group?? Don't worry about it. We were in the same boat. But we had an awesome tour guide who made it all look very simple & easy for us to plan. Ms.Aom was our personal tour guide and didn't at any moment let us feel lost in the beautiful country. She understood that we had very little time at hand and catered to every need of ours. She took utmost care to find out each of our preferences and ensured that each of us had a fun time. She didn't seem to mind that we broke her personal record by spending more than 4hrs at the Royal Emerald Buddha Temple. And she didn't complain at all. The van was well equipped with ample supply of water and wet wipes just to ensure that we felt fresh before our next stop. All in all it was an excellent tour and Aom made it memorable for us. We promised to come back for more and use her services to see the rest of Thailand.

Most memorable experience of our trip. We are from the United States and it was our first time visiting Thailand (first time visiting Asia period!). We booked the Extrodinary Elephant tour the night before, and they were super nice and accommodating. The car picked us up right on time and drove us to the floating market, Bridge on the River Kwai, and the Kanchanaburi War Memorial, all of which were extremely interesting and only added to my great experience with Bangkok Day Tours!! Our meal was a large buffet, which was delicious!! Our time with the elephants was truly a one in a lifetime opportunity!! We ended up being the only people on the tour, which only made mine and my boyfriend's experience personal and unforgettable!! Our guide, Ricky was absolutely amazing! He was very friendly, knowledgeable, spoke English very well and snapped so many wonderful pictures, I'm just having a hard time picking out which ones to frame!! I also want to commend everyone at the camp for their humane treatment of these beautiful creatures, as it was important to me they were treated well. Absolutely breathtaking!!, Icannot recommend this trip, and Ricky, enough! If you are in Bangkok, it is well worth the time and the price!! Thanks so much for an unforgettable experience!!!

Recommended in every way--an excellent experience. While in Bangkok with my boyfriend and two friends, we took two day trips with Bangkok Day Tours. The first was the "Extraordinary Elephant" tour, while the second was the "Tiger Temple" tour. First--the booking process was extremely simple, and I received confirmations right away. The person managing the emails was responsive and easy to work with. I was extremely impressed. Our first tour, the Elephant day tour, was excellent. Our guide was right on time, and our driver was efficient and safe. The van was air-conditioned, and fully stocked with movies, water, and snacks for us. We really couldn't have asked for more. We went first to the Floating Market, which was a great experience. Our guide taught us how to effectively bargain, and had lots of tidbits for us about the market. We then went to the River Kwai, where we enjoyed an excellent lunch. Again, our guide couldn't have been more helpful. At this point, she realized that we had accidentally signed up again for the River Kwai tour the next day, and she took the time to call her office, and have them ensure that we didn't repeat the trip. We were so pleased--she really went out of her way for us! We then went to the elephant camp, which was incredible. Just an amazing experience, and our guide made sure to take plenty of pictures, which was much appreciated. This was honestly the best planned and most efficiently executed tour I've ever been on. Our guide could not have been better. The next day, we had a different guide for the Tiger Temple tour, but she was just as effective. Again, the van was fully stocked and the driver was great. Before the tiger temple, we went to the cementary, a famous cave, and to lunch, which were all fantastic. At the temple, our guide was very effective in showing us around, taking photos, etc. The temple has less for the guide to do (since the staff does a lot there), but we were still very pleased with our guide. Even more impressive: after the tour, our guide took the time out of her night to show us where Asiatique (the riverfront), and to help us find a great Thai restaurant (where she ordered in Thai for us to make sure we got what we wanted). She literally rode the BTS over with us and everything...we couldn't believe that she was so willing to go above and beyond to help us. Overall, I would recommend Bangkok Day Tours to anyone. We couldn't have been happier with the two tours. This is a five-star company, and the tours are worth every penny.

Day spent at MBK. Your typical day can start at MBK, where you can get a great bargain for almost anything under the sun. There are five levels of shopping in two zones, A and B. this means a lot of legwork. There is a TOPS supermarket at ground floor and an amazing foodcourt in the 5th and 6th floor. A must visit in Bangkok whether you want to shop or not , just for the amazing experience.

Bangkok the easy way. My friends and I were on the cruise ship Celebrity Millenium which docked in Laem Chabang.From the Port it is a difficult 2 hour drive to Bangkok. We booked a tour with Bangkok Day Tours before we left home. We were met at the ship by Tanya. I was a little put off that we had to pay the balance of the tour in cash on the spot. There was a portable ATM that dispensed Thai money. The tour turned out to be really terrific and totally worth the money. Tanya was a wonderful guide. We had booked a hotel room in Bangkok so they dropped us off there and picked us up early the next day for more adventures. Then back to the ship. A tip for Bangkok, Ladies must wear long skirts for certain attractions so be prepared.

Glorious 2 days With Bangkok day tours. Highly recommended. We booked a 2 day tour with Bangkok Day Tours on line. We were collected from the cruise ship terminal at Laem Chabang by our wonderful guide Green and the driver Oh in a comfy airconditioned mini van. The tour took in all the main attractions in Bangkok and so much more. We visited the Grand palace,floating market,did the long tail boat trip on the klongs , which is not to be missed, great Thai lunch on the river bank and the absolute amazing Train market. Our guide Green introduced us to local delicacies bought at the street markets ie sticky rice and mango and grilled banana and many other fantastic local delicacies and local treats. We also walked through the flower market which was beautiful. Green and Oh did everything they could to ensure that our trip was unforgettable. Thanks guys!!!!

Highly recommended. We booked the extraordinary elephant day tour (see reviews), through Bangkok Day Tours, based on all the very positive reviews on Trip Advisor. The booking process and deposit was made online through a secure website and a confirmation email was received very quickly with details of the pick up time, agenda and helpful tips to maximise our enjoyment. We booked our trip 48 hours in advance.What we loved about this company is their professionalism, their efficient and timely communication and the fact that these are private tours with prices based on the number of people. Our guide Na was knowledgable and enthusiastic, our driver Jo exercised caution and the vehicle was comfortable and spacious. During our day we did come across bus loads of tourists at the floating market, the bridge on the river kwai and the elephant camp, and we were glad that we chose to experience this day on a more personal basis, away from the crowds and with such a wonderful guide who explained so much and shared some of the amazing and sometimes heart wrenching history of this beautiful country. It will cost a little more but believe me you will be glad you chose Bangkok Day Tours.

Tigers, elephants and river Kwai bridge. Our first trip to Thailand and booking the tiger temple tour with Bangkok day tours was based on trip advisor reviews - no need to be nervous - Por and Joe gave us an unforgettable experience. The trip itself was fantastic but made 10 times better by the way these two wonderful people looked after us Por even purchased some medication for my daughters nasty mosquito bites suffered in Bangkok - it worked wonders! - If you want the trip of a lifetime book with these guys and if you want great photos to remember it by ask for Por she was incredible with the camera and gave us over 600 photos to take home - thanks guys - unforgettable.

Just an awesome experience that we will never forget. Our group leaders were Na and Joe. Two of the nicest thai people we've met on our trip. Na was very knowledgeable about the history and background details of our tour, telling us about vegetarion as we drove past and explaining everything to us. Funny, cool, informative; she became a friend. The bus made us feel like VIP's, all leather with reclining chairs and TVs on which we could watch a video and photos Na and Joe took as we rode and swam with elephants during the tour. So awesome. Insanely great value. I just cant say enough good things about this trip. We all feel very fortunate to have had such an experience

Tiger temple morning group.. I did the tour this morning it was amazing. I was on my own and my tour guide Sally was amazing. Very comfortable transport. I got some amazing photos and had a great time. I would recommend the VIP morning program to anyone there was only 16 in total there so we each got reasonable time with the tigers unlike the afternoon program were its apparently a lot busier. At 12000baht its not cheap but definitely worth it.

Floating Market/Bridge on River Kwai/Tigers!. I went yesterday on my own on this tour. The car picked me up promptly and I went first to the floating market, which is super touristy and most items have the special tourist price, but it was fascinating and I got some fantastic photos. Next Er drove to Konchonaburi, where I met my guide, Ricky, who was fabulous and really cares about showing his hometown. After a tour of the Konchonaburi War Cemetery, I visited the Bridge on the River Kwai and had lunch at the floating restaurant below, which was relaxing and peaceful. Finally, we headed off to the Tiger Temple--I highly recommend the cub feeding program! What a fascinating opportunity, assisted by both buddhist monks and volunteers at the temple from around the globe--i have a renewed appreciation for these gorgeous, but wild (although well-socialized) animals, and my zookeeper friend who worked with tigers at the National Zoo in Washington, DC is now considering going. What a rewarding experience! Five stars!

Breakfast with the Monks, Tiger Temple and Elephant Bathing!. I was very worried at first with booking online and paying via credit card but everything was great! The reception staff were fantastic with helping me book this! We were picked up in an air conditioned mini van just for the 2 of us. Our driver and guide were both fantastic - our guide was Anda. He took our camera for the day and took some great photos as well. The experience was great and I highly recommend the tour with the elephant bathing. The price is quite high but very very worth while. Bangkok Day Tours are Fantastic and I will highly recommend them again. I couldn't fault anything about the whole day! This was the best thing we did in our whole two week stay in Thailand :)

Fantastic Experience. It is without any doubt that We recommend Bangkok Day Tours. Sally was our guide and she was totally fabulous! We did the 2 day Amphawa Floating Market Tour... Nothing was ever too much trouble and felt like we had a new friend by the end of the weekend ... Thank you so much Sally for such a wonderful time, we certainly will be rebooking with you next visit to Thailand!!

Tiger cubs, floating market and bridge- tour 1117. I highly reccomend Bangkok Day Tours. We just returned from an amazing journey with Na and Jo. They were early but not rushed and we departed in a plush van with DVD, surround sound, and disco lights which of course thrilled my children. Through our entire trip, Na cheerfully showed us local sites and answered all of our questions. Our first stop was the floating market. Na showed us around and got us on our way in a boat. She showed us local fruits and foods and helped us negotiate prices on items of choice. Great lunch and history lesson at the bridge with plenty of time to walk across. Final stop was the Tigers, incredible! I have heard from some that they think the tigers are sedated, after seeing for myself I strongly disagree. The monks and caretakers know these animals, their mannerisms and routines. Awwwe is all I can say about the tiger cubs. We were allowed to play with them, and we're instructed to correct them with a light thump on the nose if they got rough. This is where their training truly begins. After play we fed them and most of the cubs fell asleep, prompting a lot of cuddles from the guests. Once again, Na kept everything organized and on time. She instructed us as to where to go and kept us first in line as to get the best experience possible. She even acted as photographer and got some great close up shots..Our driver, Jo , was fantastic. He was always waiting for us with a smile and got us to all destinations quickly and safely. He kept the kids entertained and always checked that we were comfortable and happy. A special stop was made for my older son. He mentioned that he would like to try sugar cane. They knew where to go and got him a full bag that was ready to eat, he was thrilled. I cannot say enough about this tour group, specifically Na and Jo, worth every penny!

Elephant bathing was the experience of a lifetime. Bangkok Day Tours elephant trip was worth every single penny (http://www.bangkokdaytours.com/tour.asp?tid=57). It was unbelievable. I can't think of any one experience in my life that felt more remarkable than bathing with the elephants. I would recommend it to anyone. I went with my mother who is 70 years old. She is pretty healthy and agile for her age, but I she didn't get as much out of the trip as I did because she was worried about her agility and, in particular, she was worried hips that wouldn't repair themselves should her agility fail her. The ride in the basket was bumpy and made her nervous about the bareback ride down to the river. I actually found riding bareback much more comfortable than riding in the basket, but she was too nervous and so she didn't ride an elephant down to the river with me. She walked down with our guides and watched me swim with the elephants from the shore. One of the mahouts had his elephant go over and squirt her, which was fun, and he brought his elephant to the shore to lay down and pose with her and be pet by her. In hindsight I realized that I probably should have asked if they would let mom just wade in and sit on an elephant in the water, gentle bathing. It seemed the mahouts encouraged them to buck and be playful, but without that encouragement, they would have been fine for mom. That is something to consider if you end up going with someone who is scared to ride the elephant down to the river. But, even though mom didn't get into the water with the elephants, she was absolutely delighted by the entire experience.The rest of the trip was top notch as well. It was a long ride from Bangkok (about 3 hours), but the van was really comfortable (and even equipped with DVD player and a light show!) and our driver Joe and tour guide Na were excellent company. The floating market was fun (but really touristy) and I enjoyed the buffet at the place they took us for lunch at the bridge over the river Kwai. Also, they were great cameramen and I got the best vacation pictures ever.Since mom and I are both adults, I indicated that we are traveling as "friends", rather than "family" because it looks like family implies either young children or teens.

Tiger Temple morning session and Elephant ride/swim. Bangkok Day Tours were very helpful and organized in planning our tour. Every email was replied to, and all questions by phone were answered on the spot. Our group did the Breakfast with Monks/ Tiger morning session. We were picked up at 4:30 am from our hotel lobby, which is exactly the time we were advised. Our driver was Jo and he was very friendly. He introduced himself to us and made sure that we had everything for the trip before we even left. Jo reminded us to bring extra clothes for the swim with elephants. I should note now, the van Jo has is fully pimped out. Reclining seats, a flat screen tv, and aircon vents that made it seem like each seat had its own climate control. There were only 4 of us in a van that could seat 10, very spacious.We drove for about 2 hours, then we picked up our tour guide Na. She was also very friendly and was always smiling. One of the things we didnt expect was Jo and Na provided us snacks such as sandwiches, cookies, and cakes. This was a pleasant surprise as we didnt have time for breakfast at the hotel.Our first stop was the Bridge over the river Kwai. This stop was very short, really only for a photo opportunity. Na told us some history about the place and took us to the spots which were the best for photographs. We even had to move aside as a train rolled past. Plenty of photos taken and then we moved on to the tiger temple.The Tiger temple was simply amazing. We initially had to make our offerings to the monks. Na taught us exactly what we needed to do, how to Wai the monks properly and what we would do if we ran out of food to offer. Once this was done, we entered the Temple. We moved to the main building on the grounds where we were brought up to feed the tiger cubs. This part was pretty awesome as the cubs are are like your normal house cats. The staff and monks then had breakfast which you could join, but since we had food from Na and Jo, we decided to keep playing with the tigers. They had a range from cubs to very young tigers in this building and as the monks and staff were eating, we had a good 30 mins of alone time with the cubs and young tigers.After this, we walked the tigers back to their enclosures, unfortunately we couldnt get the big tiger, which wouldve been great, but we had a decent sized young tiger. Once at the enclosure, we were asked if we wanted to play with the big tigers or the small ones. Obviously we said the big ones, I would highly recommend this as you can get photos of the tigers jumping 4m in the air right in front of you. The whole group was put in the playing enclosure and you will be in there with a lot of tigers. Dont worry though as the staff are there with you and they know how to make the tigers jump. (They play like house cats, they like noise and movement). At no time did we ever feel we were in danger.Then we went to get our photo take with a BIG tiger on our lap, the tiger was very tame, didnt really move much but I wouldnt say they were drugged as after this photo op, the staff took these tigers to the water enclosure and some of the guys (aka Tiger Man) went swimming and playing with them (this is when they became very active). We even got a few roars from the tigers. After this part, the morning session ended, but it was well worth the money. I would also say to who ever says the tigers are drugged, you must have a look at the morning session. There is no way drugged up tigers and jump and move as fast and as high as these guys. That was one of the best experiences I have had. Na and Jo took us to lunch at this local Thai restaurant and we had some really good food, both spicy and tasty. One of the best meals we had while in Thailand..The second part of our tour was the elephant ride and swim. The elephant ride was a bit dull, we just really walked around a track, through some trees, not really seeing much and nothing really exciting other than riding an elephant. The excitement really started when we were told to get changed to our boardies and get ready for the swim.They gave us an elephant each and we rode on its neck all the way until the river. Once in the river, the mahout told my elephant to take some water and spray me with its trunk (I really should have know that when the elephant pointed its trunk at me). Then the fun began, my elephant dipped me in the water, I jumped off and got on its trunk. My mahout then got the elephant to raise me up with its trunk. The first time i did this, I didnt know what to expect and I went flying in the air behind the elephant. It was very good fun. Basically the mahouts take good care of you and show you the fun things to do while swimming with the elephants.After that it was back to Bangkok. The trip back is about 3 hours due to traffic, but Jo's car as I said in the beginning has a TV, and he even provided DVDs. So the three hour drive back home was basically 2 movies which we didnt notice at all.Overall the tours and the tour company (especially Na and Jo) were excellent. I would highly recommend these tours and Bangkok Day Tours any time. We always felt like VIPs and well looked after, and at no point did we feel unsafe. Really, how many times can you say you played with about 20 tigers (unchained) and swam with elephants?

Tiger Temple Breakfast and Elephant Bathing (Code1511). I cannot praise this tour enough, and i think our tour guide Na and driver of our car Mr Jo made the experience even more worth while.. they were absolutely terrific, ensuring we got to do everything we came to do on that day. During our time at the tiger temple you get to bottle feed the baby tiger cubs, well you get a baby tiger amoungst 4 people. Once they have been fed, everyone else goes off to have breakfast whilst the tiger cubs are left behind. Na was amazing, she gave us breakfast in the car on the way to the tiger temple so when we got there we had already eaten so we skipped the breakfast with everyone else and therefore got to play with the tiger cubs for longer, which meant we got to socialise and play with more then just one tiger cub, and we also at this time got cubs to ourselves which was just absolutely precious!!! Na had our camera this whole time and snapped so many amazing shots for us, telling us how to hold the baby tigers to get the best photos possible!!! After our time with the baby tigers we got to walk the tigers to the canyon where they have there 'play time'. Here we Bathed a year old tiger, got to hand feed it chicken and then we got to choose between playing with the one year old big tigers or playing with the tiger cubs again. We played with the one year old tigers as we had already had lots of time with the tiger cubs (again thanks to Na), which meant we got to have the best amount of time with the tigers of all ages... After also watching the adult tigers play in there pool, watching them jump off rocks and tackle each other we were off to the elephant camp. Here we did a half hour trek around the forest area which surrounded the camp!! It was great as the elepahnt trainer half way along the track gets off the elephant and lets you sit on the neck whilst the elephant walks and he takes photos of you!! they also make them pose with there trunks up etc which makes for some cute photos. Once we did the trek, Na made time for us to watch the elephant show. Here the elephants dance, massage people, paint paintings, spin hooler hoops and more entertaining things. My boyfriend dave really wanted to be massaged by the elephant so Na made sure that that happened, i also wanted to buy the painting the elephant had painted whilst we watched the show and Na also made sure that i was the one that bought it. Then for the best part of the entire tour, bathing with the elephants. I was with my boyfriend and another couple, we were the only ones doing the bathing and we each got our own elephant to swim with (also an elephant trainer per elephant). It was the most magical half an hour of my life, the elephants were ducking you under water whilst you sat on there necks, throwing us in the air with there trunks, letting us sit on there trunks, we were jumping off them, they were rolling around and it was just amazing. No words can do it justice!!! Na the whole time was taking pictures for us, making sure we all got some very awesome action shots, whilst Mr JO took our video camera and filmed the whole thing :) I cant express it enough, if you are going to bangkok and are keen to do the tiger temple and elephants, MAKE SURE THIS TOUR IS ON YOUR TO DO LIST. it was a little more expensive then other tours but without a doubt worth every cent, it was worth even more to me. A day in my life i will never forget thanks to bangkokdaytours, and made even more memorable by Na and Mr JO.

Breakfast with monks/ tiger temple and elephant bathing. We were picked up at 4.30 by driver and picked up our guide about an hour and a half ater as he did not live in bangkok. This gave us a chance for a snooze the way in the comfy leather reclining seats. We saw bridge over rivet kwai at sunrise magnificant then went to tiger temple. Food is provided to offer to monks then you go and bottle feed tiger cubs play with week old babies and take phtos with them our guide anda made sure we were first for everything getting a volunter to look after us he took our cameras and he took one and gave another to volunteer and they took photos tons of photos of us feeding them posing etc. next we walked the.tigers up to washing area again anda taking photos after washing you get to play with young tigers scary but fun guides were not allowed in but when we looked up anda was leaning on edge of fence taking photos no other guides did this after that we walked big tigers down to canyon and got photos with them then watched staff play with them in the water this was fantastic. We were then offered snacks and cool towels and asked lunch or elephant we chose elephants we went for short ride thru jungle in basket on back came back and changed then bareback ride to water and getting very wet elphants go completely under squirt you with trunks and even pick you up with trunks heaps of fun and again anda was taking tons of photos he basically was our personal photographer all day. I was a bit sceptical booking this off line but was so glad i did if you like tigers do the morning trip for sure this was also the only place i could find outside of chang mai that you could swim with elephants. Reccomend this tour and anda he was fantastic made our day it was the highlight of our time in bangkok.

Review of the tour company - not the destinations. We were picked up exactly when they said. We were in a car with a driver who never spoke a word all the way to Kanchanaburi. We stopped along the way to meet two reps from the company who handed us snacks, took the balance of money and left. Our guide met us in Kanchanaburi and while he was a nice enough guy - he spoke very little interest and didn't know an awful lot about the attractions. He seemed to be as much to help the driver find the places as he was to show us anything. We saw the bridge on the River Kwai, had a meal, saw elephants and tigers - all great attractions arranged by the tour company but their involvement pretty much stopped at getting us between locations. I would have expected some local stories, background information etc but it wasn't there.

Breakfast with the monks - tiger temple tour - absolutely amazing.. We had the most amazing day visiting the Bridge on the River Kwai, Tiger Temple and elephant trekking, thanks to Bangkok Day Tours. We booked tour number 1510 on their website http://www.bangkokdaytours.comEvery aspect of the tour was amazing.We were picked up from our hotel at 4:30 am by our lovely driver in a luxury mini van. He was a wonderful driver and we all reclined our seats and went to sleep, which made the two and a half hour trip pass very quickly!Just before our first stop at Kanchanaburi, we picked up our guide Ricky. We can't say enough positive things about Ricky! He was fantastic. He was very kind and thoughtful and made us feel right at home. He took the time to make sure that we understood all customs at the tiger temple and we had the best day possible.I would highly recommend the morning tour. The groups are small and you get a never to be repeated opportunity to spend time with the tigers. The baby tigers are absolutely delightful and it's wonderful seeing the staff interacting with the animals.It's very obvious that the staff have a strong bond with the tigers and it's clear that they are treated very well. I have read previous reports that the tigers are drugged and that's why they can be interacted with, but it's very obvious with the morning tour that they are not. They are very, very active during their exercise sessions. I think they just get worn out in the heat of the day.One word of advice however - this tour is only for those who are relatively fit and healthy. It would not be an appropriate tour for anyone with limited mobility. There is too much walking on uneven surfaces.Following our time at the tiger temple, we went elephant trekking and then had lunch at a lovely restaurant in Kanchanaburi. Bangkok Day Tours is a truly wonderful company to deal with. Ricky and our driver were so helpful. I can't say enough positive things about our day. Thank you Bangkok Day Tours!

Holiday highlight - well worth he money. We had an amazing time this week with Na and Joel from the Bangkok Day Tours team on the full day Damnoen Saduak floating market, River Kwai, Tiger Temple & Elephant Safari tour. After what was been a hectic holiday schedule for us and our 2 children (boys aged 8 & 12) we were hesitant to undertake what could be perceived as huge day. However Na and Joel ensured we had the most memorable and relaxing day of our trip to Thailand so far.The Tiger Temple exceeds all expectations, so many tigers. And thanks to Na so many photo opportunities. We and he kids were amazed.The Elephants were also a highlight for the kids as was Joel's pimped out van which came with Tv, dvd's and funky lighting.The markets and River Kwai visits also deserve a mention as we're also great fun hanks to Na.I really cannot imagine visiting these sites any other way. Bangkok Day Tours gets 5 stars from us.

Morning tour was amazing. After reading reviews on this attraction before we left, i decided to book our tour through Bangkok Day Tours Co Ltd or http://www.bangkokdaytours.com If anyone wants to do the tiger temple, definitely recommend the morning tour…. It is more expensive but only 40 tourists at the temple that day where in peak season they said the afternoon tour is up to 500-600 people. The morning tour you get to do breakfast with the monks, feed baby cubs (we fed ones that were 1 month old), walk tigers, wash tiger cubs, go in the water play area (kinda scary), and have photo with adult tiger. The afternoon tour you only get to do the photo with adult tiger and line up in a huge queue if its peak season. However i would definitely recommend this morning tour even though more expensive, and the time with them seems very rushed in each activity mainly to have your turn get a photo and next person to have their turn. The tigers were not drugged, very much awake and happy to play and it was such a hot day that i don't blame the tigers just wanting to sleep in the shade in the heat of the evening program. Our tour was through Bangkok Day tours and was the breakfast with the monks at tiger temple and elephant bathing http://www.bangkokdaytours.com. The company was great, we booked before we left home and they were very prompt with email replies. Our tour guides name was Por and she was amazing, she took over 300 photos for us at the tiger temple and elephants which we weren’t expecting at no extra charge, so we gave her a nice tip. I am so grateful she took photos because the majority of our tiger temple photos got lost, not sure what happened but the temple workers take your camera a lot to take photos for you, we think maybe one of them accidently deleted ours because we didn’t realise until we got back to the hotel. But our tour guide had a dvd waiting at our hotel for us with all the photos she took before we flew out the next day. It was a very long day, but well worth it and will be definately recommending this tour company and tour to our family and friends

What a Holiday in Bangkok. This was my first trip to Bangkok and I wanted to see what type of tours i could do. I saw on Trip Advisor a tour company call Bangkok day tours and OMG they were great. The first tour i took was the Floating Market, River Kawi, and Elephant ride. Well all three were great to see and do mostly because i had the best tour guide in Sally and driver in Tong. They made my sightseeing tour so good. Sally told me all about Bangkok and Thailand also how and when the Floating market started and that the bridge on the River Kawi was the second bridge to be built there after the first one was bomb during the World war 2. She also took so many great pictures of me on my tour. In the Market on the River Kawi and while i was riding the Elephant. It was a great way to start my day in Bangkok. Then on my second day I went to the Tiger Temple, which is a must do. I email Caroline who runs the tour company and asked her to have Sally and Tong be my guide and Driver for the Tiger tour. And she did that for me with know problem. And again Sally was so greayt at taken my cell phone and taking some great pictures of me with the Tigers it was such a great day with them. Oh and my driver Tong what a driver he is. I was born and raised in NYC and Tong drives like a NYC Cab driver lol all good. Anyway if you ever go to Bangkok make sure you book your tours with Bangkok day tours and ask for Sally as your tour guide and Tong as your driver you wont go wrong with them.

Floating market.tiger temple.elphant washing.bridge.cemtry.river cruise. A really nice day out floating market first buy some fridge magnets very interesting even tho a little smelly..walk thro the cemetery of the builders of the death railway..then walk across the bridge over river kiwi..then lunch in floating restaraut..tiger temple feeding tigers and playing with cubs teenagers and fully grown Bengal tigers scary yet exciting.then on to wash a elephant in the river lots of fun water fight ect..then back to bangkok to pick up a river cruise dinner on the river then back to hotel exhausted..a trip defo worth doing miss it miss out

River Kwai. This was a moving and fascinating experience and worth doing. The day trip is offerred in combination with other attractions in the area such as the Tiger Temple or Elephant Reserve or travelling the Death Railway. It is an early start from your hotel but the Thai's are very efficient in organising their tours and the tours are well priced. Lunch is included and each time we found it to be very enjoyable. Water and refreshing towlettes are frequently offered and it is great to get out of the bustling city and take in the countryside.

Tiger Temple - Monks Breakfast + Elephant Washing - An Excellent Day Out. ------original review------- Subject: Tiger Temple Thailand Tour Location: Kanchanaburi, Kanchanaburi Province, Thailand, Asia Title: An unforgettable trip ID#: 145124397 I booked my trip to the Tiger Temple - Monks Breakfast on the internet about a month prior. The trip was booked with Bangkok day tours.Yes the trip is expensive but in my opinion (if you like Tigers) worth every last Baht. My tour guide was a lady called Sally - I called her Super Sally because she was a fantastic tour guide. Very good English and very knowledgeable about the Tiger Temple and surrounding areas. A prompt pick-up at 4-30am set the day. The Luxury 5-seat mini bus, including cold bottled water and nibbles was superb. Reclining leather seats in air conditioned comfort made it easy to nap during the journey. Unfortunately my digital camera was of the old variety. Sally had a modern high-speed digital camera and suggested I put my Flash card into her camera - magic. It is worth mentioning that some of the Tiger action is "fast and furious" (BUT VERY SAFE) when the cats get into the water. So a fast action camera will help capture the action as it happens. Sally became my personal photographer - brilliant. Yes you do get "up close and personal" with Tigers aged from 9 days to about 3yrs old. However, the more people on the tour the less time you get to yourself with the Tigers. This is no fault of my tour organisers. There are a number of companies who do this trip. I saw no evidence of cruelty towards the Tigers. I DO NOT believe they are drugged as has been suggested. They are far too active when they are in the water - and their body temperature lowers. The inter-reaction between the head keeper (An Ozzie from QLD) and the cats is unbelievable. The Tigers just play like domestic cats - chasing, leaping after toys - incredible to see. The lunch on my trip was on the floating restaurant on the River Kwai - next to the famous bridge at Kanchanaburi. The food offered consisted of European and Thai dishes and was first class. Also worth a mention is the Leopard which can be found between the bridge and the war museum. A small shopping complex - you can have your photo taken feeding the Leopard for 100Baht. After lunch I went Elephant washing. Brilliant fun. A scrubbing brush is provided and a great water fight with the Elephant is guaranteed. Again Super Sally took the photos for me. For me I would give my trip 12/10. I hope you get as much enjoyment from your, Tiger Temple - Monks Breakfast as I did. Cheers for now C :-))

Tiger Temple Breakfast Experience. What a great place to visit if you love tigers! If you truly want to get the most out of this experience you should do the morning breakfast program which starts around 7am-10am. Why? Because of all the interaction you get with the tigers. Cost 5000THB per person (as of November 2nd 2012). There are tour companies that go to the temple as well as other locations like what we did http://bangkokdaytours.com/tour.asp?tid=82The day begins by giving offerings to the Monks before you are allowed to enter the temple. Once inside we were able to feed baby tiger cubs ranging from 2 week old to 9 month old cubs. At all times you are with a tiger handler who use your camera to take the photos. They instruct you were to stand and what to do. I never felt un safe because of the people i was surrounded by. The great thing is there would have been ~20 tourists in the morning program so not too many other people so you never feel crowded.Next the Monks pray before everyone eats breakfast. After breakfast in small groups you help walk the tigers down to the bathing area where you give them a bath and feed them boil chicken. After they are washed its time to play by using big sticks with toys attached to the end the idea is to get the tigers to jump. The final part of the morning involves walking an adult tiger down to the tiger canon. We were given the opportunity to have a photo with a big adult before they were let loose and we observed from behind a barrier them playing with a tiger handler. The tigers are very lively and you can truly appreciate and understand what a powerful and majestic animal they are. If you really love tigers this is definitely worth the early morning to see them in a way you probably will never get to experience any where else. 5 stars. One thing i can tick of my bucket list :D Plenty of photos from others- mine look the same but gives you a great idea of what to expect.

Great day, Organised and professional staff. Tong and Sally came and picked us up at 0430 from our hotel and we traveled by a very comfortable van.. They had water available and we headed towards the tiger temple as we Organised the morning tour "breakfast with monks" we stopped at the river Kwai bridge and it was a gorgeous sunrise and because it was early it was empty so we got some gorgeous shots... Then we headed to the temple we were offered breakfast croissants in the van as Sally explained it would be quite busy at the temple and we may not get much.. So this was generous.. We arrived at the tiger temple and the guides Organised the food offerings for the monks so we completed this ceremony, then we had a chance to bottle feed an play with the youngest cubs. After this we washed and played with some older ones. At the end we had photo opportunity with the full grown tigers and watched them play in the water.. It was a full on 3 hours with non stop tiger activity.. Sally took heaps of great photos and was super sweet.. We went to the elephant village after the temple and went for the ride in the jungle/forest.. We had a really busy day but it was really fun and ill never have an opportunity to get that close to a tiger again.. Thankyou to tong for driving safely and getting us there and back in comfort. A big Thankyou to Sally who was knowledgable on all our questions an was a really great tour guide...

Tiger Temple, Elephant washing, Floating Markets and Grand Palace. Every tour was excellent, from many emails to organize from Sydney to the staff and tour guides. All wonderful. Por made our trip to the Tiger Temple the best experience ever. Each tour was in nice aircon vans with friendly guides and drivers who would go out of there way to make sure we had the best of everything. Highly recommend this company and cant wait to get back and visit them all again.

Tiger Temple and Elephant Camp - a truly amazing experience!. I travelled to Bangkok after attending a wedding in Koh Samui. As I was travelling alone I sought a day trip which would meet my needs. Bangkok Day Tours were amazing, my driver Jo and Guide, Na...were great and were intent on giving me the best experience... she pushed me to the front of everything and then took charge of the photo taking. The morning program at the Tiger Temple seems to be the best experience..there were less than 20 tourists there that morning. I believe that the afternoon program is completely different., many tourists and the tigers are worn out by the morning activities.Riding and swimming with my elephant, again...so amazing! A late Thai lunch and then back to Bangkok in the airconditioned van and watched a Movie.Well worth the money...all covered and I prepaid prior to the holiday.

city tour. What a bargain. Bought this tour at the airport info desk. Had a guide and driver, they spoke great english. Hit several high lights, great explanations. helped us navigate the city for the next several days

GREAT DAY. We were picked up at 7am by Sally and driver to go to the Floating Markets, River Kwai and Tiger Temple.We were collected in a very comfortable air conditioned van. We stopped at he Floating Markets and were taken around which was an experience. When entering the van we were give nice cold refresher towel and drinks, much appreciated as was a hot morning.We then carried onto the River Kwai and to have lunch there, then onto the Tiger Temple.We would really recommend this company as were east to deal with regarding the booking and on the day were very good.

A truly amazing day that we'll never forget!. My partner and I booked a trip from Bangkok to take in 3 sites, first was the bridge on the river Kwai . We were picked up at 4AM in a beautiful leather seated, air conditioned people carrier which we had all to ourselves! Water and croissants were provided and we set off to pick our tour guide up. She was AMAZING, she knew the area and took full control of everything from talking to people to having full control of our camera (she took some fantastic shots). Next stop was the Tiger Temple, again our dynamic guide rushed us to the front of every line and literally dragged us to the front of some so that we were certain to get the best pictures and first go at anything offered. On to an elephant trek where once again we didn't need to lift a single muscle as the dynamo had got us the best of everything and also the first of everything. Unfortunately her name escapes me but she was a young lady who we picked up and dropped off around 2 hrs from Bangkok. She went so far above anything that we expected and really did make, what would have been a fantastic day already, a truly amazing experience. Thank you so much . Roy and Emma

Floating market and River Kwai. To be looked after and shown around with a personal guide was a god send. A little bit of pampering with cold refresh towels when we returned to the air conditioned comfort of the car was really appreciated.We were the guest and while we accepted their recommendations, we could have altered the day's program and seen alternative sights, had we wished.So nice to travel with a personal touch. Would certainly trust them again.

Ampawa Floating Market and Firefly show. This is another place to see if you have the time to spare, it is about 90 mins away from Bangkok, and whilst it is classed as a local market, it is also geared up for tourists, when you get there it is basically a market selling local + tourist produces on each side of the river, and down some back alleys. Whilst you are walking amongst the stalls you see the long tail boats coming + going, and I think a small ferry boat going across the river, but just as it is getting dark you get on your designated boat (ours had a total of 11 persons which included the chap that actually steered the boat), and for around an hour or so you are taken around looking at the fireflies hovering in the trees, and bearing in mind by this time you are in complete darkness on the river, although other boats are all around you, it is quite impressive. The total cost for 2 persons was 2600 baht, and glad I went

Absolutely Fantastic - Tiger Temple Tour!. To celebrate my 40th B'Day my huband and I travelled to Thailand - Bangkok specifically to visit the Tiger Temple and wanted an experience of a life time. I did an extensive amount of research and decided to book the "1510 Breakfast with the Monks Tiger Temple Tour" through Bangkok Day Tours Co Ltd (thank you to Caroline for making this an easy transaction), what a great decision it was.We hit the jackpot and was provided a wonderful tour guide "Por" who was absolutely fantastic.The Breakfast with the Monks and Tiger Temple tour was an experience of a life time and Por made it so special; ensuring that we enjoyed ourselves every minute, taking great care of my husband and I. Por took heaps of photos for us so we could capture every wonderful moment, ensuring that our fantastic memories were captured and at no extra cost. Por ensured that we had the best experience and was more than happy to provide an excellent service.Por was so kind and generous; in the morning I had a bad cough, without asking Por stopped and brought cough medicane without asking for any money; my cough stopped instantly. Por also stopped and brought us coffee and snacks along the way, catering for our every need. Everything about this tour was wonderful from the beginning to the end, the driver we were provided was also fantastic, both Por and the driver made us feel so comfortable and ensured we enjoyed and ourselves and made it a fantastic experience. The transport provided was so lovely and comfortable.The breakfast with the monks was unbelievable and as for the Tigers, what an experience. We got to feed, bath, walk and play with the Tigers, the Tigers were well looked after; they were so gentle and playful. This was the best experience of my life and would highly recommend this tour with Bangkok Day Tours Co Ltd who made this tour a great experience. I would definately re-book my next experience with Bangkok Day Tours Co Ltd and highly recommend Bangkok Day Tours Co Ltd for your next tour/s. Please visit: http://www.bangkokdaytours.com - to book you next tour; you want be disappointed.Once again a huge thankyou to Por our guide, who made this a fantastic experience.

Tiger Temple/River Kwai?War Cemetery tour. Our driver Tong and guide Sally were excellent! Also thanks to Caroline at Bangkok Day Tours for fitting in the War cemetery too! we all had a wonderful day - the Tiger Temple and feeding the babies was the absolute highlight of our whole trip, the war cemetery was an emotional experience and a wonderful tribute to our soldiers, the Bridge on the River Kwai was inspiring and the shopping and lunch was great too! We highly recommend this tour company!!!

You simply must do this at least once in your life.. We also did the early morning behind the scenes tour with our family of four. It was simply fantastic and a once in a lifetime experience. Pay the extra money and get up early and do this tour, not the standard tour later in the day. This one is when you get up close and personal and play and bath the tigers and you can see that they are not sedated as alleged by some. They are just tired from playing all morning with the behind the scenes tourists by the time the normal tourists get there.One tip though, don't make this trip on your last day in Thailand as we did and get dropped straight back to the airport to catch a flight to KL. We stank like nothing you have ever smelt before when we hopped on the packed Air Asia plane and we could see the other people on the plane physically cringing at the smell of us. (Sorry fellow passengers. lol).

Amazing amazing amazing!!!!!. First of all....a HUGE thanks to Por who was our wonderful guide on the Tiger Temple Tour!!!!!The Breakfast with the Monks trip is absolutely worth it and Por looked after us every step of the way including taking photos for us so we could enjoy every minute!!!!Everything was wonderful including the food and transport, from start to finish, and even though I took an unexpected float down the river during our elephant bathing, this is just the nature and unpredictability of animals and Por was right there to help us.As for the tigers....once in a lifetime!!! Just amazing and you get soo much time with them. We had the pleasure of walking the cubs as I was with my nine year old who was too small to handle the larger tigers, but that turned out to be a special treat as she got to play with them one on one and hand feed them chicken.Do not even hesitate about doing this tour....it is absolutely 100% worth it.

Khao Yai National Park Day Tour was Fantastic!. We really enjoyed our day tour to Khao Yai National Park with Bangkok Day Tours (http://www.bangkokdaytours.com/) on 9th June 2012. The guide (“Mr Mike”) and the driver (“Mr Wat”) were both wonderfully polite and helpful people. They were punctual, well organised and took good care of us. Mike spoke very good English and was very knowledgeable and Wat was a very good driver so we felt very safe with him. We saw amazing scenery and wildlife (the Black Giant Squirrel was a highlight). The lunch was delicious (we are both vegans and Mike made sure we were well fed on delicious veggie food) and was included as part of the price.All in all a great tour. A big thank you to Mike and Wat.

Tour of a lifetime. We had Joe and Koy for our day tour and they both made it an unforgettable experience. Joes van was a luxury air-conditioned respite from the heat, fully stocked with ice cold water cold towels and snacks-and Koy provided a wealth of information and humorous anecdotes. Would highly recommend this company for private tours in Bangkok.

Morning sun sees Tigers sparkle. Completed a full day tour Bangkok Day tours to see Tiger Temple and also to bathe with Elephants. Arrive home totally exhausted but totally happy. Caroline and the driver both took very good care of things both on the way and at the two locations. Caroline made sure we had special attention when needed, even prompting staff at temple to make sure we had best of care. Appreciated the lots of little things they did to ensure it was the best time.After reading different reports, felt that the morning was best time to see tigers active versus the afternoon nap typical of their routine. This proved to be the case. Played with young, medium sized and got to wash and walk grown up Tiger then see them playing in canyon pool. Left with some great memories and plenty of fantastic photos (thx Caroline) to go home and make friends and family jealous they missed out...! haha.  Thanks again... :-)

Amazing Bangkok. While writing this travelog on Bangkok, the fact that many of my readers must have visited this place not once but many times, made my job much tougher. What differentiators can I introduce to my readers and moreover this was an official trip wherein time management was key for the sight seeing plans. Before I allowed that thought to overpower my brain, I made up my mind to write about this amazing tourist destination called Bangkok, the City of Angels or Krung Thep as this city is known locally.I reached Bangkok at 5:30am and the airport, which always gives the tourist a first glimpse of the city did not disappoint me. Since I had a business visa, the immigration was a breeze and it took me hardly 15 minutes to clear the process and come out of the airport. The Suvarnabhoomi Airport can be compared to any top international airport of today. What also struck me is the name of the airport (meaning Golden Earth in Sanskrit), roads and places that sounded Indian. Thailand had strong roots with medieval India much before Buddhism prevailed in this land. The airport terminal opens up to a large statue of Amrit manthan (churning of the ocean) as depicted in our Dasha Avatar. Tourists cannot miss this gigantic statue before they move on to the respective gates. I had asked Poonsuk, the taxi driver to pick me up from the Airport. Poonsuk nicknamed “Funsuk Wangdu” by me, was referred by a friend in India especially since he spoke good English. In Thailand, the local populace hardly speak good English. One has to use hand gestures or use calculators to communicate especially in the local markets or even in the Malls. Poonsuk played latest Bollywood chartbusters while on my way to the Hotel. I could see very few people on the road and asked Punsuk about it. He laughed saying Bangkok wakes up at night while people sleep in the mornings. Bangkok roads are notorious for the worst traffic jams in this part of the world. However the early morning ride was extremely smooth and it took us just 30 mins to cover a distance of 20 miles, whereas the same journey takes not less than 75 minutes during normal traffic hours. On the way, I was very impressed with the infrastructure especially the roads considering Thailand is still a developing country coupled with political turmoil at regular intervals. The country is ruled by the 86 year old monarch, who also happens to be the world's longest reigning head of state. The current Prime Minister, Yingluck Shinawatra exiled her borther Thaksin before taking over the premiership. She is the youngest Premier at 44 and looks more like a model than a Premier. Thai citizens actively follow politics and have a strong opinion on the leadership. Incidentally the Yellow shirt movement started during my trip but the Thai Police never allowed such a movement to affect traffic or tourist activities. This shows how much importance this country gives to tourism since it earns them the highest revenue percentage in terms of GDP. The weather at Bangkok was very balmy, humid and not too comfortable especially after you step out of the air conditioned hotel or mall. Maybe May-June is not the right time to visit thanks to the south west monsoon and high humidity. But that did not seem to deter the high inflow of tourists to Bangkok especially from India, perhaps used to this type of weather. The flights were full, the airport, streets and shopping malls were choc a bloc with tourists from all over the world especially Indians. Lady Gaga had visited Bangkok a few days before I reached there and seems the Bangkok crowd went gaga over the Lady. During my trip another world renowned celebrity, Aung San Suu Kyi visited Bangkok to attend the World Economic Forum. She made headlines on all 3 days she was at Bangkok, who is passionately called Mother Suu Kyi especially by the Burmese migrants in Thailand.The country once called Siam with a pseudo name “Land of the White Elephant” is today the fastest growing economy in the ASEAN region with heavy focus on the tourism industry. The male-female sex ratio is about 0.98 with a high literacy rate. The Thai Baht currency is strong against the Indian rupee (1 Thai Baht is equal to Indian Rupees 1.8). I was told that the buses running in Bangkok are free for general public and even the tourists. They were not luxurious but seemed comfortable to ride, atleast from the outside. The Sky Train is the most popular mode of transport in Bangkok and can be relied upon to reach a destination on time. The crazy road traffic at Bangkok can always play a spoilsport to your well designed plans. Sky trains are cheap (Thai Baht 15 for shortest destination), quick and convenient. The Tuk Tuks (akin to the auto rickshaws in India) are also popular among tourists but the fare needs to ne negotiated well before you take the ride. The glitzy shopping malls are a good place to shop for clothes and electronics especially the Indra Market and MBK. However most of them close after 9pm and if you still wish to shop till late night, you can look for night bazaars around MBK Mall open till dawn. Food is not a problem for Indians. There are lot of Indian restaurants but I preferred to taste the local Thai food which is now the rage in India. The MBK mall offers Global cuisine at very reasonable rates and I strongly recommend this place. For the adventurous ones, Bangkok streets offer roasted cockroaches, locusts, crickets and other insects. I also sighted mangoes and litchis being sold in the market but I was drawn towards a fruit called “Rambutan” which is covered by a thick red thorny skin but very sweet inside.My stay at Four Seasons was extremely memorable. Please refer to my Tripadvisor contribution for more details --- http://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g293916-d301884-Reviews-Four_Seasons_Hotel_Bangkok-Bangkok.html I was amazed to see people still using traditional ways of welcoming a guest (folded hands like our Namaste in India) with a warm greeting called “Wai”. I rarely shook hands during the entire trip and perhaps that’s the most hygienic way of greeting people, which we Indians have forgotten this practice. The Hotel is situated close to the Sky Train station and that was a great advantage. Due to high humidity and heat (it was around 38 to 40 degrees Celsius) I preferred to avoid long walks. Poonsuk was my guide during this trip and he strongly recommended that I take the river cruise to reach the Temple of Reclining Buddha. The high speed boats takes you through the canals of Bangkok and it’s a ride one should not miss. You can see the floating market and also feed shoals of fishes waiting to be fed bread crumbs. The so called guides around the Reclining Buddha temple can be very misguiding.
