I was told that the temple was closed for the day and while I took a chance to see if the temple had really closed, I was surprised to hear that temples in Bangkok generally remained open until 6pm everyday. Also one needs to be careful of pick pockets and thieves, who target tourists. One of my colleagues encountered a very bad incident when some thieves on motorbike snatched her bag, which contained money, cards and passport. The Reclining Buddha statue is 15 meters high and 43 meters long with his right arm supporting the head with tight curls on two box-pillows of blue, inlaid with mother-of-pearl. The temple is also known as the birthplace of traditional Thai massage. Thai massage is not to be missed but you need expert guidance to choose the right place. I then visited the Golden Mount temple of Buddha located on a hill. By the time I reached the top of the hill after climbing some 200+ steps, the dark clouds hovering in the sky suddenly opened up. The weather was much cooler now and the view of Bangkok from the hill top is just breath taking. On the way back you can see the grand Palace, where the King resides. On the last day, since I had time on hand, I opted for the Safari tour. The Safari World is located close to the airport and far away from the main city. This is perhaps the only safari, where private cars are allowed inside the main park. Here one can see the zebras, rhinos, ostriches and even the lions and tigers at kissing distance. I had never seen a large group of giraffes before, where we can feed them directly from a platform built for that purpose. At an extra cost you can get photographed with a tiger cub or a pair of orang-utans. Inside the park there are several shows that happen during fixed times. I watched the Orang-utans boxing show, the Sea lions show and the Elephant show. I had never seen an elephant paint a picture before and it was just amazing. The safari also has a Egg Museum and they show the entire lifecycle of a bird right from the time the egg is hatched. And this is live!! An enthusiast can spend the entire day at Safari World but I had a flight to catch and hence could not enjoy all the other remaining shows. But I just had time to meet the white tigers, polar bears, seals and walruses before saying Goodbye to the Park.Since this was an official trip and I was travelling without my family, I dropped my plan to visit Kanchanaburi Tiger Temple, Bridge on River Kwai etc with a promise to return again very soon. Amazing Bangkok, it was.

Swimming with elephants - you will get more than ' a little wet'!. We found this tour group by checking on the internet the afternoon we arrived in Bangkok. It was about 3pm. By close of business we were booked for a tour the next morning to go to the Floating Markets, River Kwai, Kanchanaburi War Cemetery and to bathe/wash elephants. It was the most extraordinary day and unforgettable. The driver who met us was actually just filling in for his friend, the usual driver, and he did not let his friend down. He was wonderful and linked us up with Koy, our guide for the day. It was just the 3 of us + Koy and Cho but it made no difference - the pace was set by us and it was a wonderful time. The bathing/washing and swimming with the elephants was an unforgettable experience. The whole day ran smoothly and Koy was great fun - her English was very good and we laughed all day. This is a brilliant group to organise a tour through - a little bit pricey but worth every single cent: Bangkok Day Tours http://www.bangkokdaytours.com/

bangkok safari world. myself and wife are just back from bangkok and went on a trip to safari world with asia world tours our guide was Noo a local tour agent who spoke good english the tour was a private one so cost a bit more but you get a private car and guide to yourself meaning you can pick and choose what you want to do. the total cost for the day was 3000 bhat each dinner was included in price and i must say it was worth every cent a very enjoyable day with a great tour guide highly recommend this trip. you also get an chance to feed the baby tigers and giraffes great fun.

Tiger Temple breakfast with the monks.. We had read some pretty bad reviews about this place, but luckily read one that was very positive, and talked about going in the morning, so we found this tour company, http://www.bangkokdaytours.com/ , and booked a morning tour. Morning it was, 5am start, but without a doubt, one of the most amazing days of our lives! I don't know what tigers these other people see, but ours were amazing. After handing out breakfast to the monks, we went up to the temple, and they brought out quite a few tigers, ranging from 2 week olds to 2 year olds, I think. The bigger cats were chained to the verandah posts, the cubs were free to walk around to anyone. My twin 13 year olds spent 20 mins nursing, playing with and bottle-feeding 2 week old tiger cubs - omg! We then had brekkie with the monks, then walked the tigers to their enclosures. My tiger decided he was in a hurry at one point, and nearly dragged me off my feet - don't loop the lead around your hand, these animals are very powerful!The feeding and washing is very controlled, but these are big cats, and I guess they have to be careful we don't do something wrong and upset one! It was still great, but the best was yet to come. If you go, wear something that can get wet, because we ended up at the side of a pool, while these amazing animals frolicked and leapt in the air, trying to grab the rags/plastic bags we held above them on bamboo poles. Then, we walked them down to the quarry, where they continue to play and wrestle. The staff are fantastic, and obviously love these animals, I watched one monk sit with a tiger after breakfast, and start boxing with it and wrestling with it. They are obviously very close!After the tiger temple, we went on an elephant trek, and while washing the elephants, swam with them, jumped off their backs, climbed back on, had a ball! Then, to the River Kwai bridge, and the best seats in the house on the floating restaurant. Our guide, Por, was absolutely fantastic, and our driver, Joe, was great. Don't miss this tour, it is fantastic, but get up early, and do the breakfast tour, while the tigers are most active.

Tiger temple breakfast with monks (tour 1510). We took a morning tour (for about 20 visitors) with a company called Bangkok Day Tours http://www.bangkokdaytours.com/ which we found searching the Internet. Having spoken to people on our last visit to Thailand they, having done the morning tour, seemed to have a totally different experience to some of the reviews on here. What a wonderful day. The morning is full activity and seeing the tigers in action playing and yes you get to walk, wash, play and feed large tigers, it is no wonder they want to sleep in the afternoon. Don't all cats? It was a bit of a shock being picked up at about 4.30-5.00 on the morning of the trip and a long journey but the tour company provided a snack and plenty of cold water. The transport for my wife and I (we did not pick anyone else up on route) was a spacious air conditioned mini bus and english speaking driver made the 2 1/2 journey as pleasant as it could be. We were accompanied from Bangkok by a trainee guide and picked a very informative and attentive local guide (Koy) nearer the venue. You arrive in time to be briefed by the staff and be provided with food for the monks, this was included in the tour price. You then get to present the food and offer respect to the monks before joining them for a short prayer and then breakfast. Not a full English as you might imagine but a traditional Thai and quite spicey. You then get to bottle feed some tiger cubs, ours were about 4 months old but of course this will vary. We were also able to pet a couple of 12 month old tigers which might sound young but they are nearly fully grown by this age. You are given specific instructions and are warned about how to approach the animals, although cute these are still essentially wild animals and still have their reactions. Following this you get to walk the tigers and the guide was able to ensure that I got to walk with one of the larger tigers with clear instructions that if they stop so do you and if they run then likewise, although walking with the cubs looked fun as they would break into a run and chase coconuts, apparently normal balls don't last particularly long. You then get to wash the larger tigers and as a treat for letting us do all this we get to hand feed them cooked chicke, I must admit to dropping my piece a little prematurely! Better safe than sorry in my book. Then comes the really fun (and scary) bit the group get to essentially play with about 8-10 very large 12 month old tigers. This involves using long bamboo poles with bags on the end to stimulate the animals. This takes place in a bathing area and a tiered waterfall with the tigers playing and running free. Each visitor has a Thai girl with them that are used to working with the tigers and shouting instructions at tourists. It was exhilarating and a little unnerving to be so close to such large cats. With every will in the world it was impossible to keep an eye on all the tigers and occasionally one would rush past me from behind and attack my 'toy'. It was possible to just watch this activity from outside and behind a wall or from inside, as my wife did, with her Thai 'minder'. During all this your camera is entrusted to one of the temples staff who took some amazing pictures of us. There are plenty of opportunities to avail yourselves of the free cold bottled water which was very welcome as even in the morning it was very hot. The next activity is to stroke a fully grown tiger and of course further photographs. You then go to another pooled area where the keepers stimulate by play fully grown tigers. They are free to join in, clim rocks or simply play with each other. I have read other reviews where they have described the visitors being in a 'cage' this is in fact a waist high metal fence and just stops us from wondering off and means they just have to keep an eye on the tigers. That brings a four hour visit to an end. We were taken for a vey nice Thai meal which was included in the tour price although drinks had to be paid for but were extemely cheap. With most tours you break for lunch and then have the opportunity to return in the afternoon with the other hoards of visitors who have usually combined this with a morning at the River Kwai. We instead chose to visit an elephant camp but with a difference - you get to bathe with them in the River Kwai. This is as every bit as brilliant as it sounds. I have yet to compile a list of thing to do before I meet my maker however on that day I surely crossed off two. On the way to the camp the guide stopped and purchased some fresh fruit for us to enjoy on our arrival. Included in the trip is a quick stop at the Bridge over the River Kwai although as Koy explained this was not the original bridge but a similar one brought in from Singapore and is about 200 metres from it original location. However as we were so close it made sense to pay a visit but as Koy explained to really appreciate what it was like to have worked as a POW you need to visit the passes that were cut by hand and the cemeteries, for another visit I am sure.I can thoroughly recommend both the tour and the tour company Bangkok Day Tours, apparently there are several using similar names so be carefully or use the website http://www.bangkokdaytours.com/

Reliable Tour Guide, Napha Ploykrajang (ploykrajang@hotmail.com). It is a great help to us to get : Napha Ploykrajang as our tour guide. She handle our tour in a very professional way. We only have 3 days in Bangkok. Amazingly she can arrange our tour such in a way that I can get all what I want ... Siam Niramit show, lady boy show, dinner on exotic river cruise, Damnoen Saduak the floating market, Chatuchak the biggest market, The palace including original thai massage in the palace, night markets, eating in the famous hawkers, flowers market and still we have enough time to do shopping.Everything is done nicely and whole heart ... We all are amaze in how can we get so much only in a very little moment of time we have .... And she charge us with a very fair guide fee ... I give "5 stars" for professional kind service and another "5 stars" for value for money ...

Feedback ~ Bangkok Day Tours. Just a short note to recommend Bangkok Day Tours.1) My son and I thoroughly enjoyed our 3 day trip to Hellfire Pass for Anzac day with Bangkok Day Tours.2) The team at Bangkok Day tours realy helped us with my sons Peanut allergy and the trip was made without incident.3) Bangkok Day tours allowed us to postpone our original trip from 2011 until 2012 without penalty or problem.4) The front of house team of guides Sally & Por and driver Tong were very friendly,helpful and knowledgeable and nothing was a problem.5) The 3 day Kanchanaburi trip gave us everything from visual stimulation / History / Excitement plus good company and great food.I have no hesitation to recommend these people on the basis of honesty / Ethics and delivery.

Tiger Temple. Bloody brilliant!!! Money worth spending. Ordered online while in Australia. Was heaps cheaper then flight centre day tour prices. Picked up from hotel, taken to te tiger temple and played with tiger clubs in the morning. Full on hand experience.then walked, washed and played eith the tigers, what an experience!!! Highly recommend this tour. It takes a whole day and is 21/2hours drive from Bangkok. Only small groups are in the morning. There was about 18 people when we went. Recommend you book this tour to ensure you get a spot.

Personal Handling. We came in on the Diamond Princess and opted for a smaller tour group to see the Palace. We were picked up on the pier, there were 5 of us, in a very comfortable air conditioned van. Our guides spoke excellent English and gave us a continuous discussion of the country and the city. They had answers for everything. They had made some goodies, local food for us to try. We were a little concerned but finallu submitted. It was an interesting way to try something homemade and different. We toured the Palace, they made sure we saw what we should along the way. We did not feel rushed as we hit all of the high spots. We ate lunch on the river in a huge hall where many other tour groups ate as well. Nothing special but very efficient. They also had a person along to take pictures of everything we did, so if we missed it on our camera they captured it on theirs. They made all the pictures available to us after we got home. This was a wonderful way to experience a different culture.

BREATHTAKING BANGKOK. Temples, Green Curry, Shopping and more Shopping... When you hear these words, one would always know which country is being described.This is what we've experienced during our trip to Bangkok, Thailand to celebrate our second wedding anniversary. It was marked by unforgettable moments with April, Ate Nadine and Jhay. It all started with just a wishful thinking during one of those late night dinners we usually had at Le Meridien. Being myself, I was excited with the idea and immediately researched on the promotional offers by all the airlines. Needless to say, it all paid off because after 6 months of waiting, we finally went to Bangkok and had a once in a lifetime bonding experience. This trip was very well-planned coupled with a lot of online research. We definitely made more effort on this one since we wanted to get the most out of our trip. Not just that, we also wanted to make sure that our friends would also enjoy their first group out-of-the-country trip with us. Bangkok is more than just your usual developing country with all the traffic congestion, street vendors and what have you. Surprisingly for us, it offered a lot of spiritual sanctuaries for Buddhists. Apart from this, it also offered tons of shopping malls with bargain prices on almost all of the items your eyes can gaze upon. The night markets were really on top of my to-do list and it didn't disappoint me at all. Bangkok is definitely a shopping haven for all the shopaholics. Given the opportunity, excess pin-money and valid reason, I would love to visit Bangkok again. Sawat-dee!

Great tour a must do. We did the 9 hour bicycle tour and visit nice places.
Is easy to do even for the less experienced and cyclists as long as you can bike.

Cycle your way off the beaten paths of Bangkok. My partner and I were in Bangkok for the week end and decided to do the morning 5 hours tour, through China town and the outskirts of Bangkok. I signed us up only the day before and immediately received a confirmation email with clearly written directions on how to reach the office (inclusive of address in Thai that I could show to the taxi driver). The service was really professional. There were a lot of people at the office and we were clearly told which group we were joining and told where to go. We were helped to choose a bike. All bikes were in good condition. Our group had two guides. We were took around Chinatown first - being relatively early in the morning, riding around was not too difficult. After a few hours in Chinatown and Thonburi, we took a long boat and were taken out to a green, less developed plantation area. We cycled in the plantations and were also shown a very authentic floating market. On the way back, we stopped at a restaurant for an early lunch. The food was excellent.One of the bikes had a flat during the ride in the plantations. One of the two guides took the bike and got it repaired while the rest of the group continued the tour. I was impressed by how professional and friendly the guides were. I fully recommend the tour. I think the one we did was a perfect combination of town and outskirts/canals.
Fantastic!. Pobi and Lingling (i hope the pronunciation is right) are great guides en showed us another side of Bangkok in a very entertaining and respectful way! It was great!!

Awesome cycle ride best activity in Bangkok. This was the best part of our visit in Bangkok. We did the 5 hour tour and it was awesome. We saw a lot and even went by boot to the other side of the river where most of the thai in Bangkok have their home. The two thai girls from Co van Kessel spoke very good English and told us a lot about Bangkok and thai culture. We had lunch at a very nice place with a good view at the river.I highly recommend to do a tour at Co van Kessel!

Highlight of my trip to Bangkok. I highly recommend a cycle tour to anyone who can ride a bike and wants to see the real Bangkok that tourists never get to.I was sceptical when a friend recommended this to me. Biking through traffic jams in sweltering hot, polluted Bangkok sounded like my idea of hell. Giving it a go was the best thing I could have done ! Our tour guides, Lily and Jenny expertly directed us through a maze of alleys offering a shady, breezy way of snooping into shops and houses, bringing us into the cool of an enormous flower market. After a meander amongst the fruit and flowers and a snack break...well, I'll stop there as it's all described on the website! I will just say that it was 33C the day I did the trip and it never felt that hot as the easy cycling provided a breeze with little exertion. My advice, JUST DO IT! YOU WON'T REGRET IT !!!

Unforgettable evening!. This is one thing everyone must do while visiting Bangkok! My husband and I had a wonderful 3h bike trip - guided by kind, smart and funny Sandra, with the invaluable help and gentleness of "superman". We left at 6pm, after receiving the main instructions of how to cycle in a group. The company makes groups of 8 people - a number that is more than ok for the two people who escorted us. We rode through the historic area of Bangkok, including Chinatown and the Flower Market - and even crossing the river with the bikes in a ferry. Sandra explained a lot about Thai culture and some of the Bangkok history. The tour stops briefly twice for refreshments (included). At 9pm we were back to the starting point. Highly recommend - and, if possible, ask for Sandra and Superman - superfun!!!

What a great adventurous way to see BKK. If you are up for an adventure and some exercise, take the 5 hour long tour! Wonderful guides, fun and active. Don't expect much of history or explanation about the city. This tour gives you firsthand view of how BKK people really live.

A Wonderful Afternoon. My wife and I recently did the Co Classic Tour. Our group was 14 people (includes 2 guides) and the tour took just over 3 hours. The bulk of the tour was spent riding along narrow back streets with a few short stops at temples and markets. The bikes were not exactly performance machines but they were comfortable, in good condition and were more than fit for purpose. The trip is a great way to see a small part of the city and we had a terrific time. This tour is warmly recommended and we'd gladly do it again if we ever find ourselves back in Bangkok. All in all a wonderful afternoon!

Best introduction to Bangkok!. We really enjoyed biking with Ko van Kessel! It's one of the best ideas to do on your first or second day in Bangkok. We took the 5-hour tour which offers a nice divers program of cycling, sailing, eating, and sightseeing. They show you places most people normallly wouldn't have gone. Only the price might be a little bit high, but I think it was definitely worth it!

Bangkok Behind the Scenes. We did the 5 hour tour including boat trip. We had a big group but there was plenty of time for everyone. This tour should be part of everyone's time in Bangkok. You get the best of local life and the crazy Bangkok Vibe. One note: if you don't know how to ride a bicycle well this tour might be a great way to become a professional. A lot of small paths above water, bumps, crossroads and tiny corners. Crew is great and keeps you going. Next we visit Bangkok, we take the full day!

Two sides of Bangkok. Me and my wife experienced this tour at october 28, it was absolutely attractive to ride a bisycle in locals streets, bazaars and see temples and see the other side of bangkok. Our leader was a so friendly and nice girle. Lunch was good . Recieptions was so friendly and every thing was on time. We enjoye it !

Such a great experience. Been to BKK a hundred times for stop over or business but never saw the city like I saw it while taking a biketour with this company. Went with my family. Total 13 persons incl kids in the age of 9-12. Trip was safe and very well guided. Two guides accompanied. Very friendly, spoke good english and had a great sense of humor. Take this excursion! You will see places you normally dont see. Completely not exhausting but very relaxed.
Top!. Nice bike tour through Chinatown and the 'real' Bangkok. More than just a bike tour. Thanks to Nuna and colleagues we had some amazing experiences!!
Night ride. Great tour, got to view the temples at night. And got to see areas that we would not have known about. Tour guides were fantastic.

We loved it!! Great Tour to hidden corners of Bangkok.. This was an amazing tour - we saw corners of Bangkok we would never have dared to go to without the Biking tour. We can definetly recommend it, but you really have to be a good biker (very narrow alleys, lots of People and traffic). Not adequate if you want to do an historical tour - this is more about culture and Lifestyle.

Boat tour, a must do, highlight of our trip! . We did a five hour boat tour, including rocket boats in the canals of nonthaburi. Suzie and Im were brilliant guides, very knowledgeable. Lots squeezed into the five hours so great value for money. Would definitely do again!

Unique way to explore . Awesome way to explore the city and see/do things you wouldn't normally see. We did the 5 hour bike/boat tour. Very relaxing and non strenuous biking. Fun time riding on the boats. Meal provided was not bad either.

Truly Fantastic !. We had a great day tour at Co Van Kessel (around 5 hours, from 7 AM to 12:30 PM) The staff are professional , helpful, knowledgeable and most of all - compassionate. Their English was very good. The trip really gives you a chance of feeling the authentic Bangkok culture and heritage, engrossing beautiful paths and trails that I bet most people in Bangkok know nothing about. I truly recommend going there, and trying it out. Very popular with Dutch tourists. The downside - price is a bit steep - totally worth it, looking back. We really experienced something special. With love, Ido Emanuel, Israel

Fantastic and well organised. This bike tour was a highlight of our stay in Bangkok, was so well run and the tour guides were such wonderful people We travelled through places you would never get to see and hopped on boats, through Chinatown and temples and schools. The lunch was unbelievable, the food was delicious and plentiful, really a first class tour and many thanks to all staff

Four boats, endless enjoyment!. Co Rocket Boating 5-hour Multi-Boat TourWhat a brilliant way to spend an afternoon! First of all a short walk through Chinatown to see some of the sights and smells, including a lovely temple and the market. Then we took a longtail from the River City office up to the canals of Nonthaburi. This was a great way to see the city from the Chao Phraya, with all of the sights pointed out by our guide. Once in the canals proper, we switched to a rocket boat. There were only four of us on the tour which meant we had a boat per couple. These things go very fast indeed and it's a thrilling way to get around. Our driver though would always slow for interesting things to see and so we could take in the life on the river. After a stop at a floating market for some lunch, and a painful/enjoyable massage, it was back on the rocket boats, through the lock and onto the main river itself. The drivers opened the throttles and it was an amazing ride down the river. If a little scary!After another market walk and a short rickshaw ride, we got on the commuter boat back down to River City. There's not a lot to say about this tour other than it's brilliant. Our guides, Susie and Im, were knowledgeable and always ready to answer questions. The sights were things you'd struggle to see on your own. And the rocket boats were brilliant fun. Thoroughly recommended.

Long tour 9 hours. Today we did the long all day tour.Coocky, Cupcake and Bob, many thanks, you all are doing a great job, we had a perfect day. This is a good way to see bangkok and the parts that tourist don't see or know.Erik & Natascha

Awesome Bangkok Tour!. Would advise everyone to do this trip!My girlfriend and I enjoyed the 9 hour tour incredibly much. The ladies (Noon and Kuong, if I wrote this well) who led the tour where fantastic and really showed and let us taste the real Bangkok!

Best 5 hours in Bangkok. We had 48 hours in Bangkok and we took advantage of the 5 hour afternoon cycling trip so we could see the highlights of the city in a fun active way. We were not dissapointed. It took in the Flower Market, Old Town Bangkok, trip in a long boat with our bikes, farming areas and finished with a great late lunch at a typical Thai cafe on the river. We were accompanied by a very capable and engaging guide as well as an assistant who ensured we go across busy roads safely. There were 8 tourists in the group which made it very manageable. It was a relative easy ride and the bikes were in great condition and come with helmets and a basket. We are 2 women in our mid and late 40s. I would highly recommend this tour.

Bangkok by night. Must do tour while in Bangkok!Staff/ guides are super friendly and very helpful! They do look after you and security of their group is a first thing!Want to see how does Bangkok back alleys look like? Then join the tour.... :)

excellent full day bike/boat tour. i had a full day tour for bangkok city starting from an hour biking , train trip, 1.5 hour biking lunch ,boat trip, rickshaw ride, sky train. trip was awesome their guides jenny and sheli were very good in commmunication.

The thing to do. We arrived and we had a choice of free drinks then when the tour started we had a smiley energetic briefing and safety talk. We finished the talk and had a choice of a city bike or a mountain bike. Once you had chosen they raised and lowered your seat to your needs and did a full check of the bike including pumping up the tyres. We got started passing through markets with all different items, smells and colours. Then we arrived at the train station where we loaded the bikes onboard the train then went and found a seat for a 45min journey into the agricultural part of Bangkok, which i did not realise even existed. So we got on our bikes and headed off, this time on narrow paths with no handrails right next to a river sort of thing. We left that and went onto a dirt road with small rocks, because it had been raining over night, they had really big puddles that you could not go round, so you had to slowly peddle through so you did not get too wet. After that we got to a small shop where the guides bought snacks and drinks to do the last leg before lunch. We got to lunch where we had a Thai meal for an hour then we headed back out for another 20 mins of cycling, then swapped the bikes for a boat. Next we went to a temple and then the boat took us down stream to where we took the sky train and tuk tuks to get back to the office. Over all, the day was a great day, I am 12 and I really enjoyed it. The cycling was quite calm so even my 10 year old brother could manage it. The staff were very smiley and had good knowledge and loved a laugh. I would definitely go again if we ever went back to Bangkok just on a different tour. These tours are for all ages and a great family day out.
Must do Bangkok tour. World famous tour. Enjoy the city and its surroundings by bicycle. Morning tour is best because the city is just waking up and the temperature is still mild.

Varied, fun and exciting biketrip, highly recommended!. Lilly and Peace were our great guides on the five hour bike trip. What great trip it was! From biking through the markets and tiny alleys of Chinatown to the longtailboattrip through the canals of Ayutthaya it was all very exciting and definitely one of the most memorable days of our trip in Thailand.Don't worry if five hours sounds like a huge workout. It's not actually. You only cycle a limited amount of kilometres in total and the boattrip, visiting a temple and also a great meal takes up the rest of the time.You won't be disappointed; Co van Kessel takes you to places you'd never find yourself when you are just like us first time visitors of Bangkok.

Highlight of our trip!. We did the night bike tour and it was amazing! A wonderful way to tour the city! We left around 6 pm and returned at 9:30 pm. Pong was our guide and he did a great job. We visited the flower market, sampled goodies in Chinatown, visited the grounds of Wat Pho and saw it all lit up, and had some yummy street food. It was raining a few hours before, but luckily the rain stopped by evening. We only dealt with a few sprinkles and the tour provided ponchos. The bike riding wasn't too strenuous, and we stopped several times, but you should be comfortable riding a bike if you do this tour. Some of the terrain was uneven and we went through narrow back alleys (which was really fun!). Highly recommend, it was one of the best activities we did on our trip!
Family-friendly off the beaten track. Great immersion into the city... comfortable city bikes and easy-paced riding rythm. Friendly tour for the whole family.

Wonderful Tour in the backyards of Bangkok. We were really happy to see part of the real live in Bangkok. Very interesting, funny and in the same time we learned a lot about the culture. Thank you very much Pekky and Lin Lin for guiding us and treating us so well!!!

A great way to see and experience Bangkok. We did the 5 hour bike ride and had a great time. We saw a very different Bangkok than you'd expect when walking in the city center. You can see the real way of living for most locals. When you're riding through narrow streets and see people do everyday bussiness in tiny small houses you can really feel, taste and see the local culture of this city. The two guilds of Co van Kessel tours that went with us did a great job taking care of us and showing the way of live in Bangkok. And then there was the trip on the longtailboat, back to the co van Kessel HQ, that was a fun way to end this tour.

Great way to see the real Bangkok. We had a wonderful time on this tour! This is more of a cultural tour than a historical one. At first I was nervous about booking a bike tour in Bangkok, given how crazy the traffic is. I'm so glad I listened to the other reviews and booked this! We spent most of the time off the main roads, darting through small alleyways and passages that wouldn't be accessible otherwise. Tammy and Jenny were excellent guides! They stopped to point out key points of interest, answered all our questions, and always made sure we had water and were comfortable. Highly recommend!

Excellent way to discover Bangkok . We chose to do the 9 hour tour and we're delighted! The staff was extremely nice and taking care of us. We had 2 guides (one biking in the front, the other one in the back)- we went to very small streets and saw the real life of Bangkok, then also out of town. Both guides explained the culture and habits of Thai people- very sensible to do the tour at the beginning of the stay as it gives a good overview! Strongly recommend!

Fantastic fun way to experience Bangkok. Our family of five did the three hour bike ride, My husband, and 3 children aged 15, 13 and 9. We did get a little lost following the map they provided us to find the starting office, after catching the metro, but a local helped us find the place right in the nick of time. It was such a fun experience for all ages and abilities, it wasn't hard at all, most of the places we stopped were in the shade. The bikes were very comfortable and did not hurt your bottom. Our guide's Mai and Sandra were very friendly, knowledgeable and nothing was a problem for them. I fully recommend this experience in Bangkok.

Look no further! The ultimate, genuine bike tour in Bangkok!. Simply amazing! We took the 5 hour tour; biking at leisurely tempo on actually comfortable bikes (no saddle pain; that's a first ) very good tour guides; speaking English well no hassling and most importantly: you do see Bangkok in a way you can never see it by yourself!! Charming markets; small streets; biking the densely populated areas safely and with time to look around. We took the 5 hour trip; but pedaled for about 2 hours or so; we also visited temples; markets; a canal boat ride (a must-do) had lunch etc! Don't leave Bangkok if you didn't take this tour!!! Can't recommend it enough.

Wonderful tour. We decided to do this tour based on the reviews on TripAdvisor and we were so glad we did! This is the most fun way to experience the real Bangkok. Cycling though markets, alleyways, across bridges and seeing how the locals live is truely a fantastic and eye opening experience. We really enjoyed cycling through a school where the kids came running out to high five us as we rode through. Our guides were lovely and everything was very well organised. The lunch they provided was so tasty and very authentic. We enjoyed it so much. They also provided plenty of water as it does get hot. We loved seeing the biggest Buddha in Thailand and ringing the huge bell for good luck. The long tail boat rides were so much fun and it was great to sit down and relax for a while after all the riding. We saw Komodo dragons by the sides of the canal and also swimming in the water. The fish feeding was fun too. We would thoroughly recommend this tour to everyone visiting Bangkok. Thank you to everyone involved for a fantastic day!

Say yes to Co Van Kessel. This tour was a very nice experience to me! I've done this with my friends and all three of us enjoyed it. The tourguides are very friendly and funny. If you only have one day in Bangkok and you want to do some sightseeing. This tour is ideal! You get to see allot in a short amount of time. Ideal is to go in the morning, but do take in mind there will be allot of traffic jam as well. Me and my friends were very late because of it and the Company Co van Kessel waited for us the whole time. I can recommend this tour to anyone.

Absolute must do when visiting Bangkok!. Awesome experience! You get to see Bangkok in a way you would never see it as a tourist. Great tour and a special thanks to Tammy, our guide for the day. Friendly, experienced and a lot of fun! The bikes are in great condition.

One of the hi-lights of Bangkok!! . Ok, so we thought it was going to be a tuk tuk tour of Bangkok at night when we saw it in our itinerary. Imagine our surprise and initial horror when we were told it was to be a cycle tour ... In Bangkok... In the heat and for three hours!! But guess what? It was the the most fun we had for ages!! All of it was brilliant. The guides were fun and energetic. Roads not so busy from what you see during the day and the opportunities to see the temples and city lit at night is not to be missed. The tour itself is perfect with loads of interest and unusual hi lights. We had an impromptu show under a bridge .. And the tasty treats along the way just added to a great experience in an amazing city.

Fantastic tour with a fantastic guide. The lady in charge and Coke at the back made sure that the whole trip was well organised and really took care of us. She gave so much extra background information, you just needed to ask. Took us to the corners of Bangkok that you would never find by yourself. Worth it's while!

Short & Sweet tour. Did the 3 hour nite bicycle tour.Pre tour briefing was informative.Tammy/Watermelon & Superman was our guide & they are very knowledgeable bout the local scenes.Cycled through Chinatown,Market,Wat Phor.

Best way to explore Bangkok. It is the best way to explore Bangkok we think. Fantastic activity at night when it is cooler and less humid. Visiting one of the temple at night was our best experience of our stay in Bangkok.

Good but expensive . We had a fun 3 hour tour with Luna and Tini and got an interesting impression from Bangkok. We paid around 25€ each and we find this for a group tour of around 15 people quite expensive.I would say it was fun to do but not necessarily a must-have in Bangkok when you don't have so much money available.
Original way of toursim. Wonderful experience biking with Van Kessel trough Bangkok. Amazing experience that I will never forget. Thanks for this wonderful activity Cookie & Peace ;-)

Fantastic out of the box activity in Bangkok. We took this tour based on the warm recommendations on tripadvisor and what a gem it was! A very unique way to see Bangkok - it started with a bike tour of the alleys and chinatown market, went into small industrial shops, continued in a boat ride (with the bikes on the boat) into the small channels of Bangkok and suburban West Bangkok. The trip continued with the bikes in the small alleys of this neighborhood and a lunch at a local restaurant to see the real life of people in the surrounding neighborhoods of Bangkok.The kids loved this activity and so did we.

Unique and Engaging. What a fun way to tour Bangkok! The tours are well-organized, small enough to feel included but large enough to cut through traffic, and a wonderfully unique way to see Bangkok. It was our first time in the city and we both really enjoyed cutting through the crowds, crossing the river, learning from the locals, and seeing a few hidden treasure along the way. The office is centrally located along the river and was easy to find. Highly recommended!

Wonderful day cycling. We did the 9 hour day trip, with Jenny and Gung and it was just wonderful. The trip was 25 kms long and while it didn't feel like a long distance, the heat made it tiring. On this tour, half the time you are cycling along a jetty, which is along side a river. It's about a meter wide, so be careful not to fall off, of the crocodiles could get you! The path constantly has bridges that are not smooth, so it's sometimes necessary to get off your bike and walk your bike over. I was in a group with Dutch people, so they were experienced and I felt we moved quickly! We started with a ride to the train station and we took a train to the outskirts of Bangkok. There were drink stops along the way, a yum lunch, a temple visit, a boat ride, quick market visit, local taxi bus, sky train - so really all bit of everything. Jenny and Gung were just wonderful, answering all our questions, giving encouragement along the way!

Distinctly uninteresting. We did the 2 hour canal boat tour, thinking that even in a relatively short space of time, we would get at least a taste of the sites and temples Bangkok has to offer. However, despite the efforts of our guide, there was very little to see other than endless rows of wooden houses on stilts, so there was very little for her to tell us about.We could have stopped after the first 10 minutes because apart from 1 stop at a temple (not a particularly impressive one either) we didn't see anything else of note after that point. In fact it got to the point where the only highlights were whenever we spotted the large monitor lizards at the canal edges.Hopefully their other tours have more to offer. Had it not been for our guide, we probably would have rated it slightly lower than 3

Great way to see real life Bangkok. Decided last minute to book the 3 hour bike tour of Bangkok- bhat950!we only had 2 full days in Bangkok so didn't want to do a full day tour. If you ring ahead you can book in for the tour that morning, ours left at 2pm! The girls Tammi and Mimi our group leaders were great, fun and very informative. We started the your just quick briefing with other members of tour(9 ppl) then we head off on our cute yellow bikes with baskets to Chinatown but not on main roads you travel through narrow streets of Bangkok passing many self sufficient locals and street markets. You visit a Chinese temple and you can go in and have a look.. I must admit we were more interested in the aircon at that stage as we were cycling in 35degree heat. We cycled some more along the river and came to a Thai temple where we climbed up narrow steps to an area where you do a Thai ritual for good luck then climb through a narrow gateway where you are "reborn"! Again wasn't out kinda thing but was interesting! Along the way a local person gives you bottles of water then you stop at a 24hour local "shop" where you can pick anything you like and get a soft drink.. It's very quirky. Finally you get a ferry back across the tube and finish the tour back at the office. Great day and fabulous way to see the city!

Great way to experience Bangkok. We did the 3 hour trip with our 6 yr old son in a child seat on the back, we cycled thru Chinatown and across the river. It was a great way to see Bangkok in a different way, even though we have been to the city many, many times. It is completely safe, most cycling is done thru pedestrian areas, across markets and thru small alleys. There is a guide in front and one in the back. When crossing bigger roads, they help stop traffic to guide you thru safely. There are a lot of stops at temples, markets etc. They offer drinks and snacks and you can try some food at the market. The excellent guides offer great insights into Thai life and customs. Next time we are in Bangkok we will definitely book another trip.

Great activity and unique way to experience Chinatown. We joined the short tour as the longer one already was fully booked. We had a great afternoon with the group and our two guides Jacky and Lily. Cycling through the most narrow alleys in Chinatown, seeing the daily lives and activities in neighbourhoods and shops, touring the various markets by bike and by foot. It really was great fun. For all your non-Dutchies out there, this is a must do while in Bangkok! Seriously something you don't want to miss.

Fantastic! . Thanks to Puna and her colleague! Great trip through the hidden corners of Bangkok (Chinatown etc). Places you would never go as a tourist! Highly recommendable. Great service. Thanks again!

Fun!. We did the 3 hour tour with Co van Kessel. It was fun to cycle through the narrow streets of Bangkok and even taking the watertaxi to the other side of the river.3 hours is enough for a nice tour.

Incredible adventure around Bangkok. We had the full day tour, it has been an amazing experience .... we followed a new path so we took the train and boat first, visit the temple and then ride back via very narrow cycling path close to channels, narrow bridges, small stress and even in the jungle …Very funny and interesting way to explore the country side around Bangkok. Then we tried to catch the local train but the train guy told our guide that train was full and a new one was arriving 15 minutes later …. In reality one hour and 15 minutes later ….Never mind we had good time waiting for the train and then experience a “night tour” in Chinatown to return to the office.A great experience … highly recommended.

Unique experience . Me and my family took the afternoon tour with Co van Kessel and I must say I was blown away. Biking through the backstreets of chinatown, small alleys I would not have dared passed, seeing the local people in their everyday life and realising my prejudices were totally wrong. Although the streets can be busy, I felt quite safe biking. After chinatown we took our bikes on a longtail boat and went to see the plantations at the suburbs of Bangkok. Again a wonderful route. Concluded: I would strongly recommend this tour!

Best way to explore different view on Bangkok. I booked whole day trip and enjoyed every minute - great guide (thank you Sundee) narrow streets, busy markets, smiling people, train-school bus-long boat ride and even hot moments in salt panes.Bring only good will, hat/cap and sunscreen or some light long sleeve shirt (or you will get burn like me and all other Dutch companions;-))

This bicycle trip is really recommended!. This is a unique opportunity to see the real Thai daily life and culture as well the markets and the workshops. See the small villages and cross the Chao Praya river several times by boat. All combined here. There are different options 3 h, 5 h or daly trip. I did the 5h and the 3 h trip. If you have enough time, I would do the 5h trip or daly trip (I will try next time).

The best way to see a big piece of Bangkok in a relative small time frame. If you would like to see how the Thai really live in Bangkok and only have a few hours to get yourself around definitely book this tour, we've done the 3-hour night tour with 2 kids which was great! Taking the ferry to also see the other side of town and seeing the skyline and the small streets including the flower market was a fantastic experience!! Definitely worth the investment of money and time!

A must if you want to go off beaten track. Well worth it to see the inside of Bangkok. We did the 3 hrs tour and although hot and humid it was worth it and doable. Water, refreshments and fruit provided to keep you going. Thanks to 'Temmy aka Watermelon' and 'Ling' - great job and we'll done with the Dutch language.
MUST DO! . It was my third or fourth time but everytime it is amazing! Nice to see bkk in a different way. As co was the first of doing these bike tours.. You should go with them.

Perfect 5 hours in and around bangkok. when our tourguide told us we would ride a bicycle in Bangkok we ware very affraid that iT would be very dangerous and stupid, but is turned out to be the 5 best hours of our trip. Cycling, flying in a longboat, great.

I fell off!. Really lovely tour guide with a great sense of humour! A great way to explore some of the less-travelled parts of the city by boat and bike. Enjoyed the lunch. Lovely to get out to more rural areas and cycle along some narrow paths around people's back gardens. When I fell off and landed in what can be described as a swamp the staff were very helpful as were some kind locals who hosed me down! One of the best things we did in Thailand and definitely the best in Bangkok!

Great experience friendly staff.. If you have little time in Bangkok this is a really good way to feel and experience Bangkok. You feel, live and breath the day to day Bangkok life including the narrow streets and markets. Staff is really nice and spoke a little Dutch too. I would surely recommend to do this. Book in advance. We took the 3 hour tour which was enough.

9 hours bike ride, magnificent. Great tour, straight through the busy city like you in a Jason Bourne movie in a chasing scene. Went outside the city by train, more biking across fields and rivers, ended up in a sweet boat ride.Tired but satisfied! Definitely recommend also because of the great team and their preparations.

Half Day tour. Best way to explore Bangkok - by bicycle!We loved the combination of trying different food, riding through different markets, experiencing temples.. and riding the canals by boat.Great leaders and a really lovely way to spend a short amount of time in Bangkok.Great for people on a time limit in this city!!

Bike tour Bangkok . I took the three hour afternoon tour. It was a mix of families, couples and single people. It was brilliant. A great chance to see parts of Bangkok that you would never see. The guides were caring and informative. I truly recommend. Thank you very much.
see the REAL Bangkok. It was just great! Great way to see Bangkok in "REAL". An unique way to explore Bangkok at its finest!
Very nice tour. We did the 5 hours tour with our 2 children. It is a nice route throughout Bangkok. Small alley's, busy markets. Absolutely a must if you visit the city for the first time.

Bangkok in a different view - awesome. This trip is really great. You will explore Bangkok from a different side, not the skyscrapers and the busy city. You will cross the river and bicycling in a very calm and nature area of Bangkok. It's not only bicycling, you will go as well with the longboard boats through the canals. It's a great and recommended tour.

Excellent way to experience Bangkok. Best way to see some excellent sites in a short period of time. We did a half day tour (which we think is more than enough) and recommend the morning trip. I know, it starts early but it is but it is better than cycling around when it is 35 degrees. You see some excellent sites of bangkok and the old city. As some commenters said, some you can also see these on your own but the challenge would be to find them. The Co van Kessel tour nicely mapped them out and ensurss you get to them safely. With plenty of drinking breaks along the way and a nice boat ride as well as a tour through the countryside this os a great tour and a highlight on our south east asia trip. Worth every penny!

Great tour with our girls . Excellent tour with our girls of 8 and 11. Our guide Tammy was super together with Tua. Experienced the real chinatown which we would never have seen without the tour. Recommend to all.

Just do the tour!. Our splendid guides Sunday en Gita showed us Chinatown. Alleys so small, only one bike could pass. Flower, fruit and vegetable market, which were really beautiful. We also visited a temple and learned the 3 ways to hold your hands during prayer. After a longtail-boat ride we got to plantations with bananas, coconut and just quietness! Amazing that this environment is so close to the craziness of BKK! The only reason we don't give the 5 stars is the lunch. The river just smells bad and to have a lunch on a terrace above the river just isn't great. The lunch itself was ok.

Brilliant way to see the real Bangkok!. From start to finish this was a professionally delivered package. The English speaking staff were great fun, safety minded and very knowledgeable. Poi and Bobby both came from Bangkok and looked after our group of 15 or so like we were VIPs. I would recommend this excursion if you want to get to know the main areas of Bangkok in a uniquely Thai manner. We did the 3 hour trip, which was plenty of time to fit in a ride across the river, a visit to the largest Buddha in Bangkok, a lunch snack and a cycle through China Town and the Flower Market. Just great.

Excellent way to discover Bangkok!. We can recommend Co van Kessel to anyone who wants to discover the many sides of Bangkok. Especially nice for families with (small) children!Mayke & JonathanNetherlands

Great but not what we expected. This was a fascinating way to see Bangkok. The staff who accompanied us were very friendly and helpful and spoke very good English. We covered a lot of ground and saw a great deal of the real Bangkok. What was unexpected was that we were brought down alleyway after alleyway, through areas of appalling poverty. It was actually very difficult to manoeuvre through crowded alleys, avoiding cats, dogs, people cooking etc. It was a fascinating insight into the city. We stopped at the flower market and at a beautiful temple. The tour is worth the money but it wouldn't appeal to everyone.

A unique way to see parts of the city. Three and a half hours on a bike tour through the back streets and alleys of Bangkok was a great way to see things we otherwise would not have seen. The tour showed us a totally different side of Bangkok to the markets and shopping malls.The guide was interesting and funny and gave us good information about the temples and other points of interest. A great way to spend an afternoon.

Bangkok adventure trip. Best experience in Bangkok.Check the weather forecast before you book the morning or afternoon trip.Skilled staff and good organised.You can bring children and get helmets. It's very safe.

9 hour bike tour, a must on your first full day after landing in Bangkok... This incoming bike specialist touroperator is certainly not the cheapest in town. But its definetely worth every penny or Bath. Good and friendly guides, nice equipment, suited for everyone. BIking through the busiest streets of CHina town and taking trains and boats to see Bangkok and its surrounding beauty is not a bad choice to start your holiday. Co van kessel tours delivers a beautiful experience.

Fun ride with longboat and bicycle. Really nice tour through Bangkok on bike and long boat. We did the 5 hours tour and it was never a boring moment. The trip ended in a very good restaurant next to the river with authentic Thai food. Highly recommended

Go with Co!. If there's one way to experience Bangkok it is with a bicycle tour with Co van Kessel. It has become serious business to arrange these tours, however Co does it perfectly. We had a great tour through nice Bangkok alleys and were able to experience daily life of many Bangkok citizens. During the tour we visited the Royal Stuppa and had a refreshing drink with fresh rambutan in China town. To me the absolute highlight was visiting the flower and vegetable market. What a display of color and scents. Thank to Pi and Ling Ling we had a great time!

3 hours bicicle tour of "Bangkok". I must admit my disappointment with the Tour. Firstly we seem to have spent too much time only in "china-town", secondly the time spent on the "long-tail boat" part of the tour was rather uninteresting and hardly fitting in to a "bicycle tour" except if you were interested in knowing how you could fit a good number of bikes and a group of people onto a boat. I also found that, unless you were Dutch, you had difficulty of feeling part of the tour as the great majority of the participants were Dutch and the only 2 other persons were just tagging along and were never made to feel part of the same experience. All in all I would not recommend and would not repeat.

So much fun!. We did the 5 hour tour, and it was really fun! You're in a group of about 20 people, with one guide in front and one guide at the back. The guides Tammi and Prim/Pimi were very nice, helpful and funny. In our group were families with small children, and teenagers but also couples and everyone got along really well. The guides speak Thai and English perfectly, and they speak a bit of Dutch as well(since there are many Dutch people who do this). During the tour you bike through places you would never come on your own, we saw parts of China town, we went on boats, we biked through fields. You would think a 5 hour tour is tiring, but it is definitely doable. You make lots of stops, to drink or when the guides show/explain something. Water, sodas, a fruit snack and lunch(at the rooftop of a building with a beautiful view) are all included. The lunch was delicious, and there was a vegetarian option. The tour was amazing and definitely a must if you want to see the real Bangkok. Thank you!

Amazing!. In january 2016 we did the 5 hour bike & Boattour. It was an amazing experience. It's Bangkok "off the beaten track". Starting in China Town and biking through the smail Streets and crossing markets, away from the busy roads of the city centre. You see the real life in Bangkok. The included boattour was also great! Our guides did a great job in explaining everything!After the tour I left my action-camera mount on the bike and after a few mails it was found and the staff was able to deliver it at the hotel where friends of us stayed. Great service!When you want to do something special in Bangkok I highly recommend Co van Kessel!!
Bangkok experience with CoVan. The best travel group it was a great time we been travel with them to places that we will never find our self !
Gave fietstocht met Eeva8 en Una5Achterop. We had a lot of fun! Would-be happy to do it again. Great way to see the city and it's people. Thanks to Peggy and her bodyguard.

The real Bangkok experience. When my husband pulled out the brochure for a 5 hour biking and boating trip of Bangkok, being not very fit, I was a bit hesitant! But actually it was leisurely and allowed us into the real back ends of Bangkok that a normal tour wouldn't see. The guides were very knowledgeable and patient with my 9 year old who struggled a bit through the very narrow alleys - one recommendation would be that they invest in some decent bikes for smaller people as she had a rather old, gearless road bike with dodgy brakes! The boat section was also great - got to see how Thai live on the river. I did unfortunately take a tumble off my bike (my fault) but the guide helped me clean off the mud and cleaned and patched up my wounds and I was able to continue despite a big bruise on my leg and a bigger bruise on my ego! The tour ended with an amazing lunch at an authentic Thai restaurant - a lovely break after all the site seeing.My only other recommendation would be to give groups the option of paying a bit more for a private guide as the group was quite big - as I said my younger daughter struggled and at one point my 12 year old ended up with the big group ahead of us and was a bit tearful when we finally caught up as she didn't know the rest of the group and felt a bit insecure. Although on explaining this to the guides they split us off with our own guide who took us on an easier route so it worked out in the end. We appreciated them hearing us and accommodating for this.Despite my fall I would definitely recommend this tour as an authentic way to see real Thai people going about their days.

Must Do in BKK. We did the afternoon bike tour in July, it was very warm but an absolute "must do" when you want to see parts of the city you would otherwise not see. Organisation is OK, I found the waiting along the tour a bit annoying. "Lunch" was eventually at 4.30pm. The boat trip as part of the tour is really nice but also took quite long. All in all great experience but not if you have a wobbly stomach :))

night tour - right temperature. Just to figure out that a "dutch" bike tour was the top rated attraction on TA.And I have to agree on this, well organized and a full program. It is amazing to drive true the little alleys and road, which you would never find yourself or would go true yourself. And see how the people live here. China town was nice, visit flower market get some fruit snacks, visit Wat Pho, a quick tour around the huge Royal Palace, river crossing to arrive outside Bangkok, and indeed the life is a little more relaxed on the other side of the river, did some street food snacks and a drink, all perfect organized. Our guides Jenny and Teddy. It was very clear that they have a lot of Dutch tourist coming to them, a lot of words spoken in dutch! Keep up the good work! I will be back for another tour for sure. Can recommend. Needed butt massage after......:))

Fantastic tour, average city. Loved the tour and our tour-leader, Puna, spoke perfect English and even some Dutch! We took the 9-hour tour and really enjoyed it, but I'd recommend the 5-hour tour as it's quite intense. Personally I like other Asian capitals more, but this is the perfect way to see some interesting things of this huge city!Tour: 5 starsCity: 3 stars Overall: 4 stars

Amazing experience. We would recommend Co van Kessel to everybody. The 5-hour biking tour showed us what Bangkok is really like. Everything was taken care of. For example, during the trip my girlfriend had a headache and a asperine was arranged within a second. You really feel part of the city and understand the different ways people in Bangkok live.Cycling in Bangkok may seem chaotic, but the two guides Will make sure everyone feels safe. I would recommend Co van Kessel to everyone. It is a must for every first Bangkok visitor.

Great way to get around the city and experience the real culture. My friend and I have taken the tour of 5 hours and have enjoyed every single minute! With the group you bike through little streets and food markets. Sjaakie was our group tour and was extremely helpfull, friendly and funny throughout the whole tour, and was able to talk a bit dutch which was very funny:) Lunch was served at a very cute Thai restaurant next to the river and the food was very good. Would highly recommend this tour if you want to see the city in a short time.

Cool experience!!. We booked the 9 hour tour and it was definitely worth the money! You can choose whether you want to ride a city bicycle or a mountainbike. we've seen parts of Bangkok that we never would've seen were we on our own. Really fun way to experience the city!!

5 hour bike tour a fantastic way to see Bangkok. This was a fantastic tour to do as a family. Boys age 10 and 13. The tour involved bike riding and long tail boats. The riding was all on flat no need for strenuous gear changing. Took us through the Chinese markets, to a Buddhist temple and through agricultural areas. The bikes would then come on the long tail boats while we travelled down the river. A perfect Thai lunch provided along the way. Would definitely recommend the 7am trip as did get hot towards the end of the tour. Fantastic way to see parts of Bangkok that you wouldn't see yourself

Really Nice (dutch) Bycicle Tour!. We did the 3 hour Tour. Sandra and eve were the Tour guides. They really knew how to get a Nice vibe. They take you to small streets and places you wouldnt see on your own! And they tell you all kind of facts about Bangkok and Thai. During the Tour you get enough water/fried bananas and chips. If you go to Bangkok this Tour is a must do!!!

Excellent family activity in Bangkok . We did the 3 hour bike tour with kids aged 12 and 9. Cycling is the perfect pace to see some of the less touristy parts of the city, and a great way to keep the whole family entertained. The tour was varied and interesting with snack and drink breaks which also support local businesses. Guides were attentive and good fun. We also did the 5 hour tour a few years ago when kids were 9 and 6 and they could ride on seats on the back of parent bikes. 5 hour tour included a lovely boat ride and tour of farming areas right on the city doorstep.

Nightly bike ride . Fun tour with kind guide! We rode through the alleys of Bangkok to Chinatown, the temple with the lying Buddha, took a boat and had a small diner at a festival that was going on. Really a fun thing to do when you want to discover parts of Bangkok you normally won't see

Another fantastic 5 hour bike tour!. We've now done the 5 hour bike tour 2 years in a row and both times were an absolutely wonderful experience! The best way to see the city (and parts of the city you'll never know exist)! The guides are awesome too! Thank you Henry for arranging another great tour of your buzzing city ... can't wait to get back there for another adventure!

Amazing tour, great way to see Bangkok . The tour was amazing! It was a great way for travellers to Bangkok to explore what Bangkok has to offer. We went into temples, explored the flower market and cycled through the hustling Chinatown. The tour was extremely accommodating. We weren't the most confident of riders but Dow was the best! She was so considerate of our lack of ability to navigate and ride on Bangkok terrain but was always there to assist us whenever we need it. Definitely something all visitors to Bangkok must do.

Great day for all. We had a great day with Amin and Dawn guiding us around Bangkok by bicycle. A definite highlight of our holiday going to places tourists don't usually venture and seeing things not normally seen. An absolute credit to the tourism in Bangkok and a definite do. We were 2 adults and a 10 year old plus 7 other adults and all were catered for. Worth the effort.
Visit rural Bangkok. Highly recommendation for this adventure! Special thanks to sandra and nadia for the unforgetable afternoon.

A great Sunday with Sunday. Our guide Sunday revealed his home country to us on a warm Sunday afternoon in June. We've biked on holidays with our kids (10 & 8 year old girls) in other busy destination and loved the close encounters this type of tour offers. Consequently we booked online thinking that we were going on a bike AND boat tour (the website is too busy and rather confusing). We soon discovered we were without bikes. However we weren't disappointed. Bangkok is after all "the Venice of the East" (one of them at least). Our adventure had us travel on 3 different boats. The first a 10-12 long boat (apparently also ridden by Michael Jackson & Angelina Jolli - not simultaneously). The boat was stylish and shaded and a nice start to the day. We headed down the Nonchanburi tributary and transferred to 2 "rocket" boats. These things fly and were heaps of fun. The smile on hubby's face was priceless. Our last boat was a ferry service.We covered a lot of ground/water on our trip and saw the real Thailand. Along the way we stopped at markets and temples. Sunday was a wonderful guide. He pointed out landmarks, bought Thai delicacies for us to try. He even sourced cucumber to rub on our daughters' burnt faces (due to too much unprotected time in the pool at our resort). I'd definitely recommend the boat tour (especially after seeing the bike tour groups schlepping through the tight packed spaces in markets and temples the next day). However, do take plenty of sunscreen and a sarong/sulu to act as a sun shade in the rocket boats. Thank you Sunday for a great Sunday!

Really nice bike tour!. We loved to get a bije tour through Bangkok. You cross some streets of Bangkok and Chinatown you would never see on your own. I also felt really safe. The tourguides were so nice and funny and they enjoy what they do. Definitely a must-do in Bangkok!
perfect morning!. we booked the 5 hour trip and it was amazing!! i can recommend it to everyone. our tourgide was called ee??! he was perfect! loved every minute

Bangkok highlight. This was the highlight of our trip to Bangkok, Tammy our guide was wonderful , very knowledgeable and fun. We choose to do the 3 hour night tour just amazing you get to see sites you would never experience. A must do in Bangkok.

Best and most fun way to see 'the other Bangkok'. We did this tour with a group of friends and had a great time. Very interesting to see the little backstreets and markets that you would otherwise not see. And a very fun way of transport too, especially to interact with the kids along the way who were giving us high fives. Very well organised, good guides. You get water but bring sun screen and a hat. Bit of cycling experience is required and wouldn't go with very small children as you need to cross a few streets and the roads are sometimes a bit bumpy.

City cycling tour. Great backroad tour to the hidden treasures of Bangkok. Multiple markets temples and less touristic neighborhoods. Be surprised by the greetings you'll receive from the locals as you cycle by.

Absolutely great! A must do!. This is a must see when you're in Bangkok. I've missed out on two opportunities to do this (shame on me), but finally I took the three hour classical cycling tour straight off the plane. It was amazing cycling through China Town. The colours and smells. You are literally cycling to peoples backyards. People waving, smiling and saying hello. Every inch is cramped with something, those Thais are so inventive and creative!If you cross the river you will notice that it the pace of thing are slower and less cramped. Even the air is better. The guides are very kind, aware and knowledgeable about the sights and temples you see. Cycling s a great way to see the city and get to know more about Bangkok and Buddhist ways. I can definitely recommend this!

Fun and well-organized - an afternoon well spent!. The tours are very professional and took us too many places in Bangkok that we would otherwise have never seen.We joined a fun, international group of people. The 3-hour tour contains only a few kilometers of actual cycling, and makes many stops (such as at temples and markets). The tour guide gave explanations and let us taste the local fruit and chips.The tour also took us on a ferry to cross the river. These short boat rides were a fun bonus to this bicycle tour.If you don't ride a bike regularly, it may take some time to get used to the maneouvering at the small streets and busy markets. But there is always a guide at the front and at the end, taking good care of our safety.Overall this was our favorite activity during our stay on Bangkok.
Great experience . My son and I joined the 5 hours tour with Co van Kessel. It was a very nice tour, interesting and relaxing. The two guides were very professional and spoke fluent English.

A different take on Bangkok. Loved this trip! Would highly recommend this company. Staff were great and gave a great insight to local living. We went onto the west side of the river on a rural tour, on the river taxis, through the tiny alleys of the markets and a lovely lunch at a local restaurant.Highly recommended!

Best way to explore Bangkok!. This was the most amazing way to see Bangkok! You could see so much in just a few hours, and things we would never see if walking the streets by ourselves. The guides was so skilled and we felt safe all the time and they teached us many interesting things about Bangkok. After the trip they also pointed out several other things to go see in Bangkok. PS! We recommend the morning trip, because the heat (and moist air) is extreme in the smal and narrow streets and alleys!

This Tour is very hard work, but u can see some real, simple BangKok.. This tour, especially morning one, is very hard work. if u drink yesterday night, I will not recomend this type of tour. Anyway, u want watch real BangKok's life style, Let's join this type of Bike tour. U can get somthing good feelimgs. thx.

Great fun, a must-do when in Bangkok. Had heard so much about this tour, both from family&friends and via Tripadvisor-reviews, so expectations were high. And surpassed, had the best time and got to see a whole other side to Bangkok.We'd had a private tour the day before, with a guide, showing us all the temples, let's say, the 'touristy stuff'. Looked forward to another view of Bangkok.As it was low season, we were lucky with just a small group of 6. After instructions (do not photograph while biking! - which we all did, of course) we left. Our guide was A (at least I hope that's how you write it), and guide-in-training Men. A spoke wonderful English, and proved to be not only very knowledgeable, caring for the environment and wise, but also very funny and a great person who clearly enoyes his job, and sharing his knowledge.Started with a bikeride though the smallest of 'streets' (sometimes living quarters of families, who didn't mind at all but called out cheery goodmornings as we passed), over market and though the Chinese part of town, and stopped at some temples. Proceeded by crossing the river, and found ourselves in the midst of lush, green plantations. Wonderful! Stopped for some lovely coconut-icecream along the way. Had a great boattrip with a longtailboat (which took our bikes as well!) along the river. What a great way to experience Bangkok, so quiet and peaceful!On the way back stopped, with the boat, at a small home-restaurant where the table was laid and we got to enjoy some great Thai food - even considerately cooking with tofu for me as I'm a vegetarian. We simply loved this tour, and were very happy we choose to fit it into our full schedule. Felt very safe at all times as A biked in feont, and Men at the back. They literally stopped traffic for us when we had to cross. By all means, don't hesitate, book it and have fun!

Very friendly staff and excellent tour with longtail boat. Considering the very high temperatures and humidity - we went for a small boat tour instead of the much more popular bike tours with Co van Kessel. We chose "Co Canaling 2-hour Longtail Boat Tour"Reception was professional (although the team was pretty busy) and our guide Tammy was welcoming, warm-hearted and very well well informed about the city, the klong and it's inhabitants. She found an excellent mixture in letting us gaze at the endless impressions and giving us interessting details about the surrounding we were gently passing.The team finally arranged a disembarking at "Saphan Taksin" which was very convenient for us in order to directly take the BTS Sky Train.

Bangkok like you've never seen. I have to be honest and say that when my friends booked the 9hr bike ride in Bangkok I was a bit hesitant to go. As it turns out we have seen parts of Bangkok that I would have never visited by myself. Our guides Nuna and Earn were great and especially Earn deserves a spot in the formula 1 pit lane at the speed in which she repairs the different bikes that have flat tires or break down. Though it was a long day I did not get bored and really enjoyed myself. We were with a group of all Dutch speaking tourists and even Nuna speaks some Dutch. All in all: nice bike ride on a wonderful day, good food, many laughs and great memories! Thank you!

9 hour tour. We did the 9 hours tour with "A". I highly recommend this tour. We got off the beaten track, A took us to meet some local families along the way. On and off trains, escalators and boats. We were in a small group of 4 but I understand in peak season groups can be near 20. Excellent food, enough drinks provided along thr way, excellent value for money. A day well spent. The company website does not recommend children for this tour and I would completely agree! Negotiating bikes through crouded train stations, up and down escalators is a challenge. It would not be safe with a child or fair for the rest of the group to be held up to accommodate the movement of a child through the icy obstacles. This was our second co van Kessel tour. Our first was with our children - 4 & 12 years at the time. Our children are excellent cyclists, cycling up to an hour at home daily as it is our main trainsport. We did a private 5 hour tour with the children. That was perfect for a family! Thanks A and Co Van Kessel. We will continue recommending your company as the number 1 thing to book in Bangkok!

The real Bangkok. We have booked a 5 hour canal boat tour with CVK in bangkok. Turned out to be our most unforgettable experience in Thailand. We saw the real Bangkok, the real people doing things by the canal, the real water market but less the tourist crowd. Our tour guide Andy (who is a girl) is fantastic and full of knowledge. We travelled on different types of boats, because other bigger boats cannot go through smaller canals. Also make sure not to miss out the James Bond boat.

I'm Bangkoker and think it's cool. i went with my dutch friends ..the tour guide na is super nice to me , we bike along the path that didnt appear in maps which is real bangkok:) i'd go again if some friends visit me in bangkok

Amazing experience off the beaten path! . My boyfriend and I only had one day in Bangkok and wanted to see all that we could! The 5 hour bike/ boat ride was absolutely perfect! We got to see so much more than the wild hustle and bustle inside the city. I cannot recommend this tour enough! Tammy was our tour guide and was absolutely amazing. She was so sweet and charming! Thanks Tammy!!

very nice 3-hour bike ride with Tammy. We booked this 3-hour bike ride through chinatown/skyline/flower and fruit market in Bangkok. Bikes were all in good condition. We were a big group but Tammy was very good in guiding us through the 'crazy' traffic in Bangkok. She could tell us some interesting facts at the flower market, and showed us the Lotus flowers. She bought some Thai fruits, which we tasted during a little break. We stopped in a little park for a drink and a short break. We all enjoyed the bike tour a lot. I can recommend it to everyone!

Fun must do experience in Bangkok. My husband and I recently did a cycling tour around bangkok. It was very hot and i was worried about coping with the heat. It was not a problem at all. We had an absolute ball. Our guides Becky and Bobby were fantastic. If we had another day in Bangkok we would have signed up for another tour. Great for all ages and we packed in a lot over the tour.
Worth it! . I did the 5 hour tour, it was very interesting. The tour guides were great, bikes were in good condition, good food, interesting parts of Bangkok. Worth it!

3hour bycicle tour with Mr. A. Super Tour, super guide and we got a Great impression of Bangkok, saw really nice parts of it and simply enjoyed the 3 hours! Mr. A is a really cool and nice guy and tells really good and interesting Stories about bangkok history and Culture.

2 hour klong tour perfect for small children. We had a private boat for our party of 7. Our guide On was very knowledgeable and enthusiastic. When she heard the drums of a Chinese lion dance, she moored the boat and made time to watch this great spectacle. When the kids were thirsty, she got ashore to buy water. We had a great time on a beautiful new long tail boat and know much more about Bangkok and the Thai thanks to On.

Absolutely spectacular. My partner and I did the 5 hour cycle/boat tour and we were blown away. The sights were wonderous and the each of the little back alleys we were lead down were more enchanting than the next. Our 2 guides, On and Natalie were great, very friendly and warm. A few twists and turns aside and a ferry across the main river, we were in our own canal boat, what a great way to see a different side of Bangkok.
