The lunch on the stop was delicious, with accompaniment of water and soft drinks. Off out into the farms and suburbs of Bangkok before one last boat ride back to town. Absolutely awesome day and would definitely go back again!

The real Bangkok. This bike tour is great. Not a great deal of effort is required so if you are not big on bike riding don't worry. The area is flat and easy going. This way you get to see the real Bangkok passing through home style shops and even what looks like a recycle area for suspension parts on trucks and engines. You also go through the market and if you have a week stomach this could be hard for you. I would not hesitate to do this again when I return to Bangkok
Nice ride through chinatown in Bangkok. It was a nice experience biking through Bangkok with my 3 kids of 10, 13 and 14. We did the 5 hours tour with a very good lunch and nice boatrides.

Highly recommended. We booked a boat tour with Co Van Kessels during one of our days in Bangkok. Their mainly known for their bike tours but with the heat, we decided to opt for something a bit more relaxing (still really hot). The tour was about 5 hours and our guide Tammy was really friendly and knowledgeable. The tour takes you on 4 different types of boat, my favorite was the rocket boat. The 1st stop is a small local town that's pretty far from all the tourist activities. It was interesting to see local life in Bangkok. We sampled a couple small snacks through the town and after about 30 mins we hopped on another boat to explore the back canals of the city. During our ride down one of the canals, we spotted a older women selling Pad Thai on a boat. We immediately jumped on the opportunity to try it and it was one of the best Pad Thai's I had.If you want to explore more of the local culture I highly recommend this tour!
Great way to discover Bangkok the non-tourist way. It was fantastic to see Bangkok the way locals see. We did a 3 hour tour but definitely will do a longer tour or night tour to see more of Bangkok.

Fantastic short tour of the canals. This was one of our highlights in Bangkok. Not a great deal of walking, and mainly checking out the canals. Boat driver was great and the whole thing was very well organised.

A very nice way to explore Bangkok. For me it was the third time to join one of the tours and I really like it. This time it was the Co Combo 5 hour tour in the morning. The tour starts in China town and takes you through the busy streets and alleys. A great way to explore but maybe a bit challenging if you are not used to ride a bike. My partner felt that it was a bit difficult to keep up the pace and have the opportunity to fully enjoy the interesting areas we went through.After crossing the river the biking is more easy and the beautiful Wat Kalayanamit temple was the next stop. The long tail boat ride that followed took us into a green area biking on narrow elevated paths through fields of banana trees. We had a stop at a local floating market before being guided to a local restaurant for an excellent lunch. After lunch a we had a short longtail boat trip back to the starting point. I really like the tour. It is a very special and different way to explore Bangkok and other areas that are not often visited. During this time of the year I would recommend to book the early 7 AM tour because it gets very hot during mid-day.Highly recommended!

Good way to discover Bkk. Were Dutch so why not ride a bike in BKK. Co van Kessel Tour is the place to be.We took the 3hours tour along with our guides Tanny & Erin.It was so nice to see the small ways, how Thai people live, the flower and fruit/vegatables market, cross the river by boot. It was a great way to discover BKK. We took the Tour at 08:00am cause I think in the afternoon is too hot to handle.Thank you for this experience, later on I'll show my video on my YouTube channel; Lifebylien. Feel free to watch

Disappointing.. Joined the tour here as I join bicycle tours in every place I go. Even I did a bicycle tour in Bangkok before which was so much different (better) than with Co. I came here since I wanted to try another place and was interested in the china town area. Also I was surprised by the amount of reviews here on TA but honestly I think most reviewers are first visitors to Thailand. First of, Cycling is always fun. It doesn't matter where you are but exploring a city by bike cannot go wrong in my opinion so it is a companies job to make a bike ride special and memorable. I found the welcome kinda cold at the office from Co, the office itself looks good but there was no personal attention from the staff to the customer. They were only talking to each other and left the customers waiting without any coffee or water (water was free to get yourself but is this service?). Just when I talked to a few other customers we got split up onto different groups so we had to start again meeting people but without and introduction round, the whole tour gets like an individual ride with strangers rather than a fun group of cyclists.The bikes were the worst ones I've seen on all my bicycle tours.. I don't mind paying premium prices but for that I am used to get a decent quality bicycle. The guides English was so-so, not fully understandable by many customers. We even had a crash on the long tail boat ride with another long tail boat. If that was not enough, our boat driver got in reverse to start a verbal shouting match with the other boat driver.... very unprofessional and dangerous. No apologies from the 2 guides as they were busy playing their phones at the back of the boat.The lunch was good en extensive but already served when we got there which made me wonder... how long was it there in the heat and with the flies. I try to write mainly positive reviews but I just left here feeling disappointed.... For the same price there are so much better companies to chose from. Like I said, I understand all the good reviews since cycling is fun anyway and if you have no comparison you would probably rate Co better than I did but my tip is to look further.

You should try it!. We did a 3 hr night tour around Chinatown (Yaorawat) with our guide Jenny. She was great and knows exactly what she was doing.The path we took are area you will never step into in your life unless you are a local or you sign up for this package.We made a few pit stops at a few places. One of which is the Wat Pho in the night. Seeing it in the day was already awesome. But being here in the night is magnificent! We were exposed to different parts and corners in BKK and river crossing by the boat to Wat Arun. A pity that it is under re-construction. It still looked good from afar.Tried a few local food recommended by Jenny. I thought stopping by Chinatown to try the food there will be good as well. If you are bored from all your shopping in BKK why not give this a try?I need to declare that I do not know if this is a fixed route for every one. Nonetheless the route Jenny took us was great!Will recommend anyone to this experience. Sorry if I don't take very good photos.

Round city via bike. Loved the tour. Everything was perfect. We saw the real bangock throgh narrow meows. The only thing negative is the guide voice was low so I suggest to have microphone so every one can hear the information.
So much fun. We had so much fun with Jackie as our tour guide. She was so friendly and knew a lot about Bangkok. Loved the boat tour definitely recommend this.

Fantastic (but hot!!!). We did the 5 hour tour and as we only had one full day in Bangkok this was a brilliant way to cram in loads of sight seeing.It was great to go from the hustle and bustle of China town to the very relaxing boat trip along the river then cycling through countryside. The guides were great and speak excellent English. The lunch we had was brilliant so much food loads of variety and all lovely.We really enjoyed the whole experience but it was a relief to get back to their air con'd office as it was insanely hot by the end of the tour!!Highly recommended.

1 - 6 pm bike tour. My brother and I booked this tour from home (England) after reading the great reviews. So glad that we did. Definitely the best thing we will take away from Bangkok are the pictures and memories from doing this. The guides are excellent at their jobs and always so happy. (Sandra was our lead guide. Great personality and very knowledgeable)We rode to places we never would have even thought about going to and ate at a great small restaurant that we will never be able to find again, where the real thai food was amazing. The boat trips down the small canals are great to. Thanks very much guys Iain and Alex.

cycling through Bangkok. When you go to Bangkok or already are there don’t hestitate to visit CO VAN KESSEL TOURS to make one of their discovery tours in Bangkok.Why? By taking one of their tours you will see the true face of Bangok.We did the 3-hour tour where you among other things cycle through narrow streets or residential areas, visit a Chinese temple and visit the flower and fruit market. A very nice experience that we recommend to everyone.

Absolutely fantastic experience. We really loved the tour. We had a lot of fun on the 5 hour long bike/boat trip. By lunch time we were tired and ready to rest. With the mid-day sun, it was also starting to get hot, so we were happy we chose the morning trip. Riding through really narrow alleys and right through the heart of China Town and the markets was interesting and wonderful. Our guides tried to stay off the really busy streets, but had to cross a few. You have to pay attention so you don’t bump into something or hit a pot hole in the road. But, all ‘n all the biking portion of the trip was great. We got so see areas of Bangkok that I don’t think you’d be able to see without a guide.The boat rides are also well organized and timed, they load your bike on longboats and before you knew it we were experiencing Bangkok from the water. The canals were fascinating with all kinds of houses built on the riverside. Watch for the water lizards sunning along the river…they come in all sizes…from under one meter to over three meters. The meal for lunch was very good. It’s at a cooking school/restaurant. They kept coming back and asking if you’d like more. Many different choices of food and plenty of it! Overall, a very pleasant and above all well-organized experience. If you are physically able I would recommend this tour to anyone.

Great fun, Great Sightseeing and great staff. We have been coming to Bangkok for many years and we always book a tour with Co van Kessel. The bikes are good, the tours are nice and the tourguides now their city. If you want to undertake a very good cycling tour, look no further!

HIGHLIGHT IN BKK. Just to see the city in its insight was absolutely awesome, for me was a highlight riding good bicycles around different sites, alleys, corners of the city where I will never have gone if it was not for booking this tour. THANKS!

A different view of Bangkok. Two of our family group (four adults) had done a Bangkok cycling trip with CVK before. Tammy and Susie were friendly, informative and thoughtful guides and helped us to experience an aspect of Bangkok that's off the main tourist track. It was a bonus that we did this during the Songkran Festival - more than happy to be squirted by water pistols as we rode around in the heat! The bikes are basic and look a bit battered, but mine had a very comfortable seat - my main concern! Also, I think riding through on a shiny new bike would be very insensitive to the circumstances of the people whose homes and businesses we rode past. Kudos also to the CVK charity, which I understand donates bikes to kids to encourage them to ride to school.

Excellent tour! . Ofcourse as dutchies you gotta go biking in Bangkok! What a trip was this it's amazing to see Bangkok from a bike. You see things as tourist walking around you dont see. You see the locals beautiful temple and the banana fields. On the road locals greet you and lunch is served thai style even for me as a vegetarian there was plenty of food! Highly recommended!

Brilliant day out, superbly organized.. Had a day out with Co Van Kessel. It was fantastic! (Tour 5 - all-day, 9 hours)Very impressed with their organization. We had two guides - one would lead and the other stay at the back to keep an eye on us. Group safety is their priority. The way the girls dealt with the traffic was like military precision.We started off cycling through Chinatown, then boarded a train out into the countryside. Cycled alongside the canals, which was both beautiful and peaceful.Then stopped for lunch. All too often day tour lunch stops serve up somewhat bland food to cater for delicate tastes. The place we stopped at served wonderful Thai food. Absolutely delicious. Variety of dishes included meat, fish and vegetables. They continued to serve more food until we had enough and to ask them to stop!After lunch, more cycling by the waterways, visited a wat, then on to a canal boat for a leisurely scenic cruise. Finally, on to Skytrain for the ride back to their office. A long day, with plenty of activities, but not at all tiring.So good, I'm going with them again in December. Very cheap day out, considering all the activities, and all costs are included in the price (2100Baht). Even regular free water/soft drinks throughout the ride.Highly recommended!

Best start in Bangkok. We heard a lot of nice stories about the cycling tour, so we decided to try it. It was really worth it, we had a really great experience!! We joined the 5 hour tour at 7 am and saw so many lovely thing with te nice staff. Also the lunch we got was really great and way too much! It is really nice to start your trip in Bangkok with this tour, so you get to know the city a bit.

Must do this day one!. Bangkok is an amazing city, but it can be overwhelming to do on foot or in your own. We took this tour upon arrival and it passed almost all the areas we wanted to visit, then we were able to go back and visit areas and attractions that we didn't spend enough time in. Tammy was so sweet and so Thai. So she gave us some good insights into lifestyle economics and food they eat. Wonderful experience travelling in alleys and markets and drinking thai coffee and tea in a local neighborhood :) Thanks would highly recommend. Not hard just wore flip flips

TOP VALUE BIKE TOUR. We had previously been to Bangkok so did the 5 hour bike tour starting early morning, the whole trip was fantastic, from cycling through the markets, temple stops, other places of interest, out into the rural areas and on boats, a superb lunch at a out of the way local restaurant, we highly recommend this. Our guide was amazing and the bikes were great. We booked this from home before we left and paid following the excursion. Do it!!!!!

Not fantastic. Had high expectations because of many recommendations and was a bit disappointed.Did the 3 hour biking tour. The first hour of the tour takes you through the Chinese market and the flower market. You get to see some parts of town you would otherwise probably not have seen but most of the time your busy manouvering your bike through way too crowded market streets and wishing you'd had just come by foot to slowly walk around and actually enjoy the market.Our guide was friendly but the tour didn't include any stops for explanations/stories/backgrounds on the city or whatever it was we were seeing. There was one water-break between the 2 markets.Then we crossed the river and stopped at a temple which was nice and there we did get a littlebit of background info. After that we continued for a ride in the old capital and then a break in a garden where our guides bought us soft drinks and chips (and some original Thai chips) which was nice but again- nothing too interesting there.Overall it felt like we were just biking around and didn't learn anything new except for at the temple maybe. And also, they say on the site that while biking, there is a nice breeze so you don't get too hot but we took the 14:00 o clock tour (in April) and were veeeeeeery hot..

Great way to see Bangkok. Co van Kessel bike tour is a must do in Bangkok. Local professional guides take you on a bike trip through Bangkok China Town and surroundings.A whole day to see the city by bike. The guides have a lot of knowledge and tell a lot. You cyscle around, get a few longtailboat trips and see a lot.
Perfect way to explore Bangkok!. Lovely organised 5 hour bike tour, got to see the small streets of Chinatown which was an amazing experience. Would recommend this to everyone!

Night bike tour at its best. We booked it upon personal recommendation 1 day in advance, a family of 4 with 2 daughters aged 12 and 14. What an insight view into Chinatown nightlife flower market. Had Wat Po and Wat Arun almost alone for our group of 13 participants, mainly Europeans, had local food on a local night market near Wat Arun, crossed the Chao Phra River by ferry with our bikes, great guide, Have seen corners and little streets which we wouldn't have seen otherwise. One of the best tours and experiences in Bangkok, if not even Thailand! Would take part in days tours next time, Good quality bikes!

See the real Bangkok in the cool of the evening. This tour was amazing. Picture the sunset over the river with a Chinese temple glowing at your back. Feel the breeze as you zip through back lanes and Soi that you didn't know existed and would never find again! Smile at the many wonderful local people who greet you on your ride. Taste the flavours of China Town and be dazzled by the light and colour that embraces you. Smell the scent of thousands of flowers at the flower market as you weave through the stalls. Marinate in the silence and stunning beauty of Wat Pho by night. Experience the river crossing with your bike and whisk off on the other side to touch old Bangkok under the shadow of Wat Arun.This tour was special and unexpected. This is the ideal tour to see many of Bangkok's attractions away from the hoards of tourists. Truly, we felt like VIPs! Peace, our tour leader, ensured that we were safe and comfortable, could stop for photos as we wanted and was a fun and happy guide. Thanks for a really special evening!

Best tourist activity of Bangkok. I had a really great unforgettable morning cycling through China town, flower market, crossing the river, go to Chinese and Thai Buddha temple, through Chinese markets, local neighborhoods, canals and have a some sweets and drinks in a beautiful garden. You are really good taken care of. All with endless photo ops of everyday life. A day you will never forget.It was really amazing to cycle through all these little alleys and see all these different people, smell the different scents of the markets and enjoy all the different views. The bikes were really comfortable. We had really great guides, Ms ON, who got us safe and sound back where we started and took really good care of us during the tour. If you have the opportunity to go on this tour, please do!! It is really a fantastic experience. Staff friendly and helpful, we saw many sights that we would never see on your usual toor and a variety locations. The tour it's self was a relaxed pace and no hill climbs or strenuous activity. I would recommend this to anyone who is comfortable riding on tow paths on canals, you don't need to be an expert rider, I spent the whole ride with my camera in one hand (hopefully that give you an idea if how simple an dun-technical the ride is for anyone who is worried. I will be back to do it again! Than for the 5 hours tour.Overall, if you want to get a view of the real Bangkok and see the things that other tourists don't get to see, do this tour!!

Fantastic way to see Bangkok!. My husband and I did the night bike tour which was roughly 3 hours. Co van kessel appears to be a very organised, well run tour group with lots of staff and everything was like clock work. Staff were super friendly. Our group of about 15 people had Pam as a guide who was wonderful, so friendly and helpful and spoke English very well! I was nervous to go on the tour through Bangkok streets as traffic is so crazy and it's so busy but surprisingly it worked well. The only place it was a bit hectic was the flower market. Thai people are very tolerant of the bike tours and seem to just go about their life despite the tours being somewhat of an inconvenience (eg having to move out of the way in the back alley of your house so 15 tourists on bikes can pass when otherwise there is no traffic!) we saw lots of Bangkok that we wouldn't have seen and we loved the food stop for pork mince and rice. My favourite part was riding over the bridge at night with a cool breeze and looking at the lights as well as having a look around a temple at night which was so quiet and peaceful. Thanks for a great tour!

Underbelly of Bangkok. Thoroughly enjoyed the 5 hour bike and boat tour to parts of Bangkok you would never go see on your own. Was a very fun adventure through Chinese markets, local neighborhoods, canals, to temples, waterways, with endless photo ops of everyday life. A day you will never forget. Highly recommend.

Wonderful tour through Bangkok guided by two very fantastic women. We had a really great afternoon cycling through China town, flower market, crossing the river, go to a temple and have a some sweets and drinks in a beautiful garden.It was really amazing to cycle through all these little alleys and see all these different people, smell the different scents of the markets and enjoy all the different views. My children (7 years) got on their own bike and were absolutely thrilled by the whole adventure. We had really great guides, Peggy and Eran, who got us safe and sound back where we started and took really good care of us during the tour. If you have the opportunity to go on this tour, please do!! It is really a fantastic experience

Excellent 3 hour bike tour!. Thank you to the guys who took us out on a 3 hour tour, it was well organised, staff friendly and helpful, we saw many sights that we would never see on your usual toor and a variety locations. The tour it's self was a relaxed pace and no hill climbs or strenuous activity. I would recommend this to anyone who is comfortable riding on tow paths on canals, you don't need to be an expert rider, I spent the whole ride with my camera in one hand (hopefully that give you an idea if how simple an dun-technical the ride is for anyone who is worried. We will be back to do it again! Thanks

One of the highlights of the whole trip. Well what can I say.... This was one of the highlights of our whole trip in Thailand and anyone who visits Bangkok, I would recommend you going on this tour. We signed up to the five hour bike and boat tour that kicked off at 7 am in the morning. As long as you can ride a bike, you'll be fine. It's not too strenuous, as everywhere you go is fairly flat and you go at a gentle pace so you can take in all the sights of Bangkok... So why did I love this tour so much? You get a glimpse into everyday life for a lot of Thai people living in the capital, driving through the narrow cobbled streets and markets first thing in the morning. After a decent rude, you board on long tail boat that takes you to west Bangkok and again taking in lots of the non touristy sites of life in Bangkok. After 45 mins, you're back on your bikes riding through a more country terrain of plantations before stopping off for a lovely authentic Thai lunch with a couple that prepared it all. Overall, if you want to get a view of the real Bangkok and see the things that other tourists don't get to see, do this tour!!

Fantastic day in Bangkok. We did this cycling trip in January 2016. It's a great way to see the other side of Bangkok, fantastic organisation and guides. Cycling and boat trips are the excellent way to experience the city. Highly recommended

5 hour combo bike and boat. We had a great time on this tour - we cycled through the narrow alleys of Chinatown and visited a couple of temples before heading out the more rural areas of Bangkok by boat. It was fascinating to go past the village houses - and we even saw some crocodiles!The lunch was very delicious with a range of local Thai food and fresh fruit.The riding was very flat and easy, although you need good control of your bike to avoid falling off the narrow canal paths and into the water!The guides were fantastic too - a great way to see a different side of Bangkok.

Engaging experience of Bangkok. Gini and Pim did a great job showing us around Bangkok. You definitely see a bit of everything as you wind your way through the streets and canals. We took the 5 hour tour from 1-6pm. Here is how the tour works: You meet at the office a few minutes early. We took the boat. If you do, get ready to get off the boat well before you get to the N3 stop because we did not and had to walk back from the next stop. No big deal, just be prepared. The office staff group you up by language and fit you with a bike. Our 9 year old decided it was too much right away and stayed behind with an unlucky adult volunteer from our group. This was maybe the most precient move of the day. The 5 hour is NOT good for anyone less than 12 (IMO). There are a couple of demanding sections that size and ability on a bike are a factor. It's possible that a young Lance Armstrong could handle this. I suspect a 3 hours might be better for younger kids. The group of bikes wind single file through the narrow streets of Bangkok. I'm not going to ruin the surprise by being too descriptive but you are going to ride a bike in places you never thought you would ride a bike. You alternate between riding a bike and loading a bike onto a long boat and riding through the canals of Bangkok. A meal was provided around 1615 and was quite good. Local dishes but nothing too bananas. Only the pickiest eater would fail to find sustenance. We had one toppled bike and one bloody nose and the guides took exceptional care in both situations. Thanks Gini and Pim. This was well worth the cost. If you pay with credit card there is a 3% fee. If I return to Bangkok, I would try one of their other tours.

Had a great time. We loved our tour. We saw so much of Bangkok that we would have never seen on our own. Our guide was Pam and she was great, so friendly and informative. We were so happy we had her as a guide, she even gave us ideas of what to do in other places we were visiting throughout Thailand. We had a wonderful lunch and they made sure to keep us hydrated and snacks along the way. So glad we booked with this company.

Great bicycle tour!!. We did the 5 hour bicycle tour. Although it was very hot (38 degrees celcius), doing the tour was the best decision ever! We saw different sides of Bangkok than just the city center and the tourist places. The food was incredible. All in all a perfect day

A very nice way to discover Bangkok . My first thought was : how are we going to survive on a bike in this city ! But all went well and it was really a nice way to discover the city. The tour guide was super friendly. I would definitely recommend it !

An hour too long. Everybody has an opinion and here's mine...I took the night tour and saw all the excellent reviews. I love bike tours in cities I visit as well as countryside tours so I scheduled this tour and it was fine. I got to see places in Bangkok and neighborhoods I would never get to see on my own however I felt that we spent too much time going down narrow little alleyways just for the fun of it in the twilight. No helmets were offered. We stopped for food which I wasn't at all interested in nor could I tell what the ingredients were, so being a vegetarian, I didn't eat anything I wasn't sure of, and wasn't hungry anyway. IMHO it could have been quicker and more concise, and I probably would have loved it, but it was just ok.

Boat Tour of Canals. We didn't have a tremendous amount of time but wanted to see more of Bangkok outside of the glitzy main streets. We took the two hour canal cruise and enjoy it very much. The ride was cool in comparison to wandering the hot streets and our guide was very friendly. The only down side was the challenge of hearing our guide while the boat was running.

Fun experience!. We did the bike - boat combo in februari. It was great, although the boat part of the trip was shorter then advertised. Fantastic experience to ride trough the narrow streets of Chinatown and the green environment of the old capital. Guides were very friendly and kind (tanx Peace and Mr. Mai)

Amazing end to our stay in Bangkok!. I booked the 5 hour bicycle/boat tour around 2 months before our trip, we didn't have to pay a thing until after our tour was finished (which was an added bonus).Myself and my girlfriend haven't even touched a bicycle for about 10 years but thankfully the tour isn't too demanding, don't get me wrong there is PLENTY of cycling which was awesome, but this tour welcomes beginners to experienced riders. everyone sticks together and enjoys the beautiful sites, the alleyways, markets, temples, the various boat trips speeding up the river, and finally seeing how the local people live rurally (around 40km out of Bangkok) we stopped for food outside of Bangkok which was lovely - soup, chicken, veg, omelette and rice. They also supplied us with plenty of bottles of ice cold water to keep us hydrated. We the rode back on raised concrete platforms between houses, rivers and plantations which was beautiful to look at.Our guides were Peace and Becky who were very helpful and looked after us very well, ensuring the trip was 100% safe.I only downloaded the trip advisor app to read reviews - after this trip I felt i had to leave my first ever review, thank you!

Wonderful day. This was a very nice way of seeing Bangkok! You have a comfertable bike and the tour leader is very good at guiding the group through the fuzz of the city. Did not feel scared or bored, perfect balance in keeping the group together but still not going too slow. Would recommend to everyone wanting to see more of Bangkok! Includes a trip by longtail boat and lunch.

5 hours Cycling Tour of Bangkok . A week ago we did the 5 hours Cycling Tour...our guides were Earn and Peace. This tour was one of our highlights of our vacation in Thailand. On this tour we cycled through parts of Bangkok you would normally not come and gives you a really good impression of how the people live in Bangkok... especially because we also did a part of the tour on a long tail boat on the canals (the Asian version of Venice).The lunch we had, contained of many Thai dishes... very delicious! And last but not least our guides were very entertaining!We recommend this tour to all who wants to explore more of Bangkok!!!

A Good Mixture of Activities . The tour was great! We had a nice mix of activities: biking, taking the (longtail) boat and walking a bit into the rural areas. The tour guides ( A and Bobo) were fun and very kind. A nice way to discover a local way of living.

A tour of Bangkok which takes in none of the sights, but is very enjoyable.. We went on a nine-hour 'alternative' tour of Bangkok on bicycles. Not all the time was spent cycling(!) - we stopped for drinks and for lunch and also had a train ride out of the city, a boat ride and an excursion on the Skytrain (with our bikes). Much of the cycling was on canal-side elevated concrete paths, which were not wide and had the occasional obstruction. I had not ridden a bike for 45 years, so my adrenaline flowed freely at times. we also rode through the Chinese quarter and the fresh food market. A fascinating day which left us with all our sightseeing still to do. Well worth it though.

Better than expected. Really enjoyed. I've been to Bangkok a few times but had never previously done this bike too mainly because I didn't think it would be practical to be cycling in the heat and the busyness of a highly populated city that doesn't seem bike friendly. However; it was the complete opposite. Even when we took our bikes through narrow paths in a busy market, it was fine. A great way to see the city and you'll definitely see things that you would not had otherwise seen. Our tour guide was Pam and she was lovely and like most Thais, very sweet. (Kept referring to herself in the third person which was very cute). Enjoy the tour and my tip which I'm reluctant to share; try to get to the very front with the tour guide. You can ask questions easily and it's more relaxing knowing that you won't get left behind so you'll enjoy the tour and Bangkok more :-D

Fantastic way to see Bangkok in a different way!. If in Bangkok, take a day for joining this bicycle tour. It is fun, active and shows a side of Bangkok that you'll not experience so easily when you're in town for only a few days. It is well worth the price and time. We did the 5 hour tour, the combination bike and boat, but I would have enjoyed the full day tour even more. We had a lovely lunch/dinner just at the right time. Tourguide Andy was great. Thank you! I'll surely do this trip again next time I am in Bangkok.

This Should Be On Your List Of Bangkok 'To Dos'. Although we have been to Bangkok a few times, we had never done a bicycle tour and decided we would try it! This was absolutely WONDERFUL!!!!! We chose a five-hour tour that included a couple of rides on long tail boats, a fabulous lunch and routes that we never in our lives could have found!!!! The bikes are well maintained and I was able to get a smaller sized bike which was perfect for my height! You have to pay close attention while cycling as the paths are very narrow with water on both sides or just very narrow in the city! It's amazing how someone could organize such a tour! This is truly one of the best things to do in Bangkok. Our guides, Aorn and Dow, were so kind, well-organized and kept all of us safe with their expert navigation. In order to miss the heat of the day, do book the early morning tour and enjoy every minute!!!

One of the highlights of my Bangkok trip. I stayed in Hua Hin the first few days of my trip to Thailand, and at a cooking class another traveler strongly recommended Co Van Kessel Bangkok Tours. Based on their feedback, me and my friends also decided to try. We made a booking the night before, and received a quick confirmation. The tour guides (Water and New York) were awesome, stopping at sightseeing spots or at a market for us to try Thai snacks. We even went on a boat with our bikes. It was an incredible experience, and I can highly recommend it to any else planning their trip!

I really hate guided tours.... I really hate guided tours. But since this one was highly recommend by many friends so we tried it anyway. And it was great! Besides going to places that you would never find yourself the best thing about this tour are the guides. Guided tours are often 'betuttelend' as we say in Dutch, meaning you don't need to think yourself and you're treated as a small child. This is really not the case here, it's no-nonsense with super-friendly guides.

A different way to see the city. We greatly enjoyed the morning bicycle ride through the small streets and markets of Bangkok. This trip was recommended by many friends, relatives, and reviewers online and was definitely a good choice. We cycled through Chinatown the day before Chinese New Year; the area was very busy with preparations for the holidays and we felt lucky to see the neighborhood in full color. The guides were very competent in keeping the group together and ensuring that nerve wracking street crossings were safe (no small feet in Bangkok). A short ferry ride and time spent in Thonburi, a more residential part of the city, were a lovely bonus. Lovely variety of sights during this tour and you notice the friendliness and openness of the Thai people. Kudos to the tour guides and organization of this operation. Note: this tour may not be appropriate for inexperienced bikers simply because of the high level of attention to traffic, riding through very narrow alleys, dealing with pedestrians, that is required. Without years of experience bicycling through crowded streets in the Netherlands, not sure if this trip would have been so enjoyable. We noticed a few members of the group struggling to stay in control of their bikes, perhaps a quick practice session of extra instruction for novice bikers before the tour departs?

Great way to explore the city. Great guide, good bikes (also for tall people) and a nice route to China Town, a banana farm and other cool places. We did the 5 hour tour including one of the best dinners we've had in Thailand.

Amazing bike tour around Bangkok. My boyfriend and I booked the 5-hour Bicycle/Boat Tour online before we arrived in Bangkok. We started off in the back alleys and then went through China Town. It was a wonderful experience, and got to see many things that we never would have seen on our own. We ended up taking 3 long tailed boat rides, which was a nice break from riding and gave us a chance to see the city from the water. One of the boat rides took us away from the city centre and that is where we had a very nice lunch. The food was great and restaurant was right on the river.The guides were very friendly and made sure everything ran smoothly. We were provided bottled water and on one of the boat rides they gave us with a small snack which was a nice treat. I would highly recommend this tour for anyone and it is nice to do something that is a little less touristy.

A must!. Guided bike tours from 3, 5 and 9 hours through downtown Bangkok and surroundings. The 9 hour tour is not that intensive/tiring, my wife and I are far from cycling experts. A good combination of cycling, 1 hour train ride to the outskirts of Bangkok, 1 hour lunch, half an hour long tail boat and a ride on the BTS skytrain. Filled up with cycling and a proficient guide, Andy. You get to learn a lot! Drinks provided during the tour and included in the price, as well lunch. Guides adapt as well their program to the people joining the tour, age, experience....

Definitely one of the best things I did in Bangkok. The location was easy enough to find and I managed it using maps.me (offline mapping app) as I know the taxi / tuk-tuk drivers seem to find it impossible to find anything in Bangkok. The office is modern and up-to-date, as you would expect of a company originating from the Netherlands. The bike was modern and I was offered a cycle helmet - which I accepted, thankfully!Our guides were Sandra and Mine and they were both wonderful. We were offered water / soft drinks throughout and saw a side of Bangkok that we could never have hoped to see alone. I found the five hours very difficult due to the narrow paths bordered by swamps; I wish I had been warned that this would be the case throughout the ride as I would have chosen a easier / shorter ride; I walked much of the way. The riverboat ride was fun; they went super fast on the way back and my theme park thirst was quenched. The meal they provided was traditional thai food and excellent.
What an amazing experience. This tour was incredible. Mr A was the best guide and so knowledgeable. Great street food experience and amazing sites along they way. The only way to see Bangkok.

Easiest 5 star ever. The whole concept feels so natural. See the city in the way that is unobtrusive, engaging and connected. Our guide was super knowledgeable - we did the 3hr night tour but it ended up being 4hrs as we stopped to sample street food, chat with traders in the flower markets and marvel at the deserted temples. Best tour I've ever experienced, memories that will last forever.

Best of Bikes. After reading so many positive reviews about CVK, I decided to book an all day bike tour. I do not regret it at all, as it was such a wonderful experience.It was an exciting and serene all in one. The bike-riding was so exhilarating for me, and rewarding! The scenery was more green and lovely than an urban Bangkok. We learned more about a less explored city about 45 minutes outside Bangkok. Their service is tremendous. For my tour, they had two lead bikers so it made me feel secure no matter where I was in our "caterpillar" line. They always made sure that we were well hydrated and were always flexible to make sure our needs were met. For example, they made sure that there were vegetarian options for those that opted for it. They are also unique to Thailand unlike other bike tours, so I felt that the tour was full of passion and heart, and stayed true to their mission.Tips: even though they keep you well hydrated, I would bring an extra water bottle just in case. Come early so that you can have enough time to pick a bike that is comfortable for your fit. Bring sunglasses/sun hat as you will be in direct sunlight a lot. Overall, I highly recommend - it was one of my favorite experiences in Bangkok!

A terrific, scary, interesting and unforgettable 5 hours!. Started VERY early but found it worth getting up for for later that morning. The place is hard to find and our taxi driver got lost several times! Luckily they waited for us and we got nice bikes and a fantastic guide with the biggest smile in Bangkok. She was a true blessing and her English was very nice, her co guide was unfortunately not as good and tried compensating by speaking very fast - no success! The bike ride was a fairy tale. Practically riding in the middle of family life/breakfast/lunch in the most narrow "streets" I ever saw. As we got into the more "not so urban parts" of Bangkok the narrow, concrete streets in the middle of a jungle keep you focused - you do NOT want to fall on either side as I could see nothing but green water/mud and one can just image what lives in it!

Nice route, poor information. We really enjoyed the bicycle tour with co van kessel. They have a very nice route, so you can see the beautiful part of Bangkok. Unfortunately our guide's english was pretty bad, so we didn't understand everything he tried to explain. In general he didn't give many informations. That was a pitty, especially as the price is very high, so we expected a professional guide. But it was a nice half day.

A must do in Bangkok. Me and my girlfriend did the 5 hours tour (bike, boat) and we enjoyed it a lot. Nice way to meet the city quickly. You'd better do it already on the first day, so that you can visit the nice places afterwards again. You'd also do this best in the morning, to avoid the heat.

Scary but Terrific. We were the oldest people on the three hour bike tour by far - most were millennials and one, a mother of a college age student. It was really scary in some areas because it was so narrow that there was no room for a missed turn. I stayed toward the rear and sometimes lost track of the group, but the Vietnamese people along the way pointed in the direction I was supposed to go. My husband and one of the guides named Earn followed me. All the people along the way were really friendly - obviously, they are used to having the bike tour pass through. Lots of kids - the toddlers had shirts on but no pants, elementary kids with school uniforms on, and then older kids wearing sports uniforms, many of them putting out their hands for high fives. We really saw the picture of how the common people live - mostly in dark hovels. Tour leader Tami provided cold water which was super refreshing and much needed. We biked through Chinatown with the tight narrow streets and people everywhere. Different streets marketed different items, for example, a shoe street, flower street, etc. We actually abandoned our bikes in the main flower market and walked through as Tami provided commentary about what the flowers were and what they were used for and/or signified. She gave each of us a lotus flower to hold on to until we went into the Buddhist temple. So many flowers makes it seem impossible that they could sell all of them. She said they keep them for twelve hours, then compost what hasn't sold. Many of the arrangements were detailed and exquisite and were used for different spirit purposes: good health, well paying job, etc. She also showed us the three ways of greeting - straight fingers in prayer with thumbs at chin and then bowing, up by eyes - can't remember for what purpose, and then on forehead as part of prayer. I noticed at the airport how many people greeted each other with the straight arms and hands and bows. We biked to the river where we boarded the ferry to cross it which was a great experience. Then we went to the oldest temple in Bangkok with a 16 meter high Buddha. Unlike in Myanmar where gold leaf usually covers the Buddhas, this one was painted gold but was still impressive because of its size. She showed us how to turn down the leaves of the lotus flower to make it a symbol of good luck, then explained how to pray, after which we placed our opened flowers in the offering area. Outside the lovely temple was a huge abandoned construction mess of rocks, concrete, and trash. Sad! We rode through some more local shopping streets (not souvenir kinds of things) until we stopped at another local snack place where Tami offered Thai snacks, another pleasant interlude. All the there on the bike tour were from Holland except for one couple. They asked us which southeast Asian country we would recommend and I said Myanmar because it's still so culturally pure, not yet sanitized. Another ride back across the river on the ferry and we were back at the office. The guides thanked us with a cool wet cloth and we were on our way. I recommend this company to anyone up for an adventure.

Great, but as it is legendary, I expected even more.. We got to places we wouldn't dare enterring alone but were almost sorry for bothering locals in the narrow streets at their homes in China Town. Anyway, the first part was the most fun. Unfortunately, we had the localizing app off for the first 30 minutes (re the pic attached).It was a lot of fun and interesting; yet as it is so legendary I must admit I expected even a tiny little bit more of it... :-)

Friendly, funny, and fascinating trip. I cannot recommend these guys highly enough. From the funky website to the convenient office location at River City, it was a pleasure. A mate and I did the 2 hr long tail boat tour of the canals, ably led by our guide Aorn, who was funny and informative and really looked after us. It's a different side of crazy Bangkok, and a small glimpse into how the city would have looked 50 or 60 years ago. I'm looking forward to doing one of Co Van Kessel's cycling tours next time I'm in Bangkok.

Awesome bike ride.. Today we've toured Bangkok per bike. It was an awesome experience, excellent tour guides Amin and Cookie. Multiple ways of transportation, bike, longtail boat and walking. Really delicious local lunch fresh prepared. Visiting places you would never go to. Highly recommended.

Fantastic tour company. I originally booked the night tour and had such a good time I booked one of the day tours too!The night starts by taking you through China Town, following the leader through the backstreets. It can get quite narrow and twisty, and low visibility - something to bear in mind if you aren't a confident cyclist. Our leader was lovely and took us through the flower market in foot , stopping to let us try some of the foods on sale. She recommended the day tour which started early in the morning (to avoid the heat) and I am so glad I did it! On the day tour you start in the city but then go out into the country and see a different side to Bangkok. Plus you get a ride on a long boat which is fun! The lunch they provided was excellent too.On both tours my leaders were good fun and took us on some interesting routes. As an introduction to Bangkok it was perfect. Great for solo travellers too!

Loved it!. Wauw this is a must do when you are in Bangkok.I forgot the name of the man who showed us around but i can remember the name from the girl it whas Cookie.It is a must do! This way you see another side of Bangkok and the tour guide (man) knows a lot does a great job telling us al lot!

Speed round Bangkok's canals like James Bond & eat like a local in floating markets & Chinatown. We took 2 tours with Co Van Kessel and both were fantastic ways to explore Bangkok. 1. The 5 hour boat tour - we went on ferries, longtails & "James Bond" rocket boats. We sped along the main canals and explored deep, dark corners of outer Bangkok, we ate some fantastic dishes at a floating market and visited a temple where the monks specialise in helping you achieve "extra lives" by praying inside a pink coffin. There were 5 of us on the tour which meant we could wander around without calling too much attention to ourselves as "tourists" although i think the locals took more photos of us than us of them !2. The 2 hour walking tour of Chinatown - it was just my 8 year old & I on this tour so we had our wonderful guide to ourselves. I absolutely loved this tour, we went down a million alleyways where I would never have dared to venture alone. We ate at various street stalls, talked to locals, visited a Chinese maker of "funeral origami" and wandered into temples & markets. You dont see the "typical" sights of Bangkok but its a real "behind the scenes" tour for those who can see the typical sights by themselves. Totally recommend both tours.

Completely changed my view of Bangkok. I took my 3 girls,ages 9, 8 and 6. My 6 year old joined me on the back of my bike while the older two cruised the streets of Bangkok with ease. If your kids are comfortable on a bike I wouldn't hesitate to sign up. Co Van had a variety of bikes of all different sizes to accommodate all ages and abilities. We enjoyed the boat and bike combo tour which had more than enough water and refreshment breaks. Very fun and informative way to experience Bangkok!
Good services. Surprising me. Thank you for the perfect tour. I take tour 1 : co combo. Experience by cycling and longtail boat ride through Bangkok's canal.

Excellent!. We did the Co Van Kessel 3 hour night bike tour for the second time in January, having also done it in October 2014. It really is a fantastic tour. The staff who lead the tour are friendly and helpful, and make it really interesting. Although it's 3 hours, there is lots of stopping and a boat trip so it doesn't feel strenuous, and we felt safe on the roads throughout. Snacks and local street food were included in the price. I'd highly recommend this tour to anyone looking for a different way of experiencing Bangkok - it took us to places that we certainly wouldn't venture to or find on our own. Thank you Co Van Kessel for another great evening!

Great to see hidden parts of Bangkok. This tour is a great opportunity to see parts of Bangkok that you wouldn't normally venture into. We did the 5hr bike and boat tour and it went by quickly and is not an intensive workout. It's interesting to go through the little alleys, through China town, along the river, into the old capital and around the city. Although you see a lot, it's difficult to know where you are or what you are seeing because there are 10 people in each tour, in a single line and unless you are right behind the guide you cannot hear what they are saying. My recommendation would be for them to do smaller groups or provide speakers on the bikes.

A great day out. A great 5 hour trip through Chinatown, the quieter west of the city and rides on ferries and long tailed boats.This has to be one of the highlights of our trip, would recommend to anyone.I would not risk a young child riding on the narrow causeways through swampland! Thrill seekers infers danger. This is a leisurely 5 hour journey, but does require concentration.

Inspiring and sporty trip!. After a short introduction and safety instructions we started our great tour on the bike. We are from Holland and are used to go by bike. This tour trough the real Bangkok inspired us and made it possible to visit a lot of places in a short period of time! The instructors managed the group on a friendly and professional way. The kindness and respect of the Thai people is really admirable and inspiring. This is a tour I would recommend all the people who want to see/experience a lot in short period of time. We went on the Co Classic but the next time I will choose a more extended tour! Well done Co Van Kessel :) Only one remark/tip: Why is there no bell on the bike? In Holland it is mandatory to have one because of safety. Or is your experience that all the enouing tourist will use it and make the locals angry? However I didn't needed it because the instructors made sure that the way was safe and clear of obstacles.

Fun, but not enough interaction, mostly cycling. Pleasant enough bike ride through parts of Bangkok and the surrounding farm lands that tourists wouldn't often visit. I especially enjoyed the rides on the long boat through the canals surrounding the city, very relaxing and a welcome reprieve from the heat of the ride. My favourite part was feeding the catfish! I have quite a few friends and family who have visited Bangkok; none of them have even heard of feeding catfish, so definitely a special activity.However, the 'tour' part is a bit lacking; there was only one time when our guide volunteered some information about our surroundings - when she discussed the farm land we were looking at - and the rest of the time she only told us where we would be going, nothing about why they chose this place, or the history. It's great to tell us we'll go through the flower market, for example, but tell us about it! Not sure if it was the large group size (14) or that it was Sunday and the markets were packed, but we got separated quite often, and the leader didn't seem too worried about ensuring that everyone made it through - a couple of times we almost lost sight of the riders in front, and had to rely on the guide at the back of the group to tell us which turn to take next.I also found it quite difficult biking on the very narrow cement paths, with their old style bikes that were hard to control. A number of our group wobbled around a lot, though thankfully no-one fell off.

With 6 and 9 years old it was easy and nice. We were very glad today with Peace and Suzy.Nice humor, good organisation, with love for this city. Bangkok alternative, different, amazing.Highly recommended!

Recommendable to everyone!. It was a really nice bicycle tour that I would recommend to everyone who is visiting Bangkok! The enthusiastic guide (mr. A) guided us through Bangkok and showed us the different places by cycling through the small streets of Bangkok which was really nice to do. Besides, we visited a market with food, fruits and flowers in Chinatown whereby he let us try different Thai food.

Love this. If you want to do something else, when you are in Bangkok, then this is the right thing. We took a trip for five hours and didn't regret for a second. But please, van Kessel: Buy some new bikes.

All the fun that everybody promised. We had a great day with our guide Earn at Co van Kessel tours. We did the long tour and it was definitely worth it! The ride around Chinatown was very nice, but especially the other side of the river, the boat ride and the outer parts of the city were so much fun to explore. Our guides were very nice and due to the still great number of Dutch participants even spoke some fun Dutch words.We also had a very tasty lunch and got more than enough water (3x) during our tour.So go and book this, it's worth the money!

Great way to explore Bangkok. Nona and Cola was great guides for our trip. Great route, funny and answered all of our questions. We did the classic or original route, 3 hours was just perfect. They provided soft drinks and snacks. We visited a temple, two different market areas, china town, a nice park and best of all cycling around where the people of Bangkok lives. This is a must do when you are in Bangkok.
get an idea of the real Bangkok life. this is a great experience, biking straight through non-tourity Bangkok. loved it. doesn't show you the sights, but gives an impression of life in the city.

Very nice tour. We enjoyed the daytour of 9 hours very much. A very nice lunch was included and also some local snacks. We visited areas which we would never have found our-selves. Quality of the bikes is outstanding and also the service of the tour guides is great! Thanks Nahm and Bobo! We enjoyed every part of the tour very much and we would like to recommend this to everybody else! We definitely would do the tour again next time in Bangkok.

Another side of Bangkok. Did the 5 hours morning tour. Started the tour with miserable rain which quickly faded away and the tour was great - good speed, not too slow and not too fast, staff were super nice and could tell intresting facts and not just the obvious stuff, graet places to visit which you will never end up going to on your own, good lunch break. Recommended!
Bangkok Night tour. We did the Bangkok Night tour, was very nice to see Bangkok with the view that was shown by the tour guide. Cycling through the living areas of the Thai people was lovely

A bit disappointed . We didn't really enjoy our bike tour, I think our group was to big. We've read a lot of good stuff and we kinda missed this. No information, 'stupid' stops. I expected more for the money. They do have bikes with seats for little kids. We had some contact with the company afterwards and they apologized for the bad experience.

Perfect way to start your trip in Bangkok . Our tour guide was Tammy. We concluded our long weekend with the 3 hour tour. I wish we would have started our long weekend in the city this event. The sites and the smells of Bangkok were brought to life. We had a micro view of all the major tourist sites. The tour was easy with frequent rests so everyone could keep up. I highly recommend theIs tour as a starting point to a vacation in the city. It's reasonably priced (despite what some claim on the reviews). My 2 main suggestions are to come early so you can pick out a decent bike and take the morning ride ( I can't imagine the heat of the afternoon ride - but maybe that's just my preference for cooler temps).

Perfect day in Bangkok. We booked the bike tour the night before, they were very flexible.We found the place easily and were greeted and placed in the appropriate group. The tour was great: We saw spots in Bangkok that normally wouldn't be accessible by tourists. From temples to private little back streets, various tours with longtails on the river, a drive through the Bangkok nature part, a delicious and generous lunch by the river, 2 very nice tourguides... we are definitely booking a tour again in march!There is half-and full day tours. Great value for money too since you spend all day and get food and water.

Great afternoon. Thoroughly enjoyed our half day tour on the bikes riding round the narrow streets of Bangkok, we had two great guides Nunu and Cookie who were informative , amusing and both spoke good English , they certainly made our tour special , thank you

Great way to see the city and the real life of Thai people. What a great excursion! We think the price for this tour is really reasonable: for 1650 bath (42 euros) per person you bike for maybe 4 hours, go by ferry boat twice, twice by long tail-boat, have a great lunch and most important: you see places you never would have seen by car or bus.More on our blog OUR BIG MOVE

Remarkable. We booked the 5h tour from 13:00 - 17:00. Was absolutely awesome! The mix exploring Bangkok by bicycle AND using the Longboat makes this trip truly remarkable. It's worth to spend the money for!

Expensive but so worth it!. For Thai standards, this is a costly tour but it was truly something special! You get such a great glimpse into the 'real' Bangkok, not just the touristy stuff. I did the 5 hour tour. You don't have to be in great shape to do this tour, but there are some parts where you're riding on a thing concrete path between swamps so it'd definitely for the adventurous type. The tour guides are so sweet. The only thing they can improve upon is more description of what neighbourhoods we were in or information about what we were seeing. all in all, a win!

Get on your bike and enjoy. Coming from a country full of bikes (and the place Co originated from: the Netherlands) it was a must-do to ever take Co's bike tour around Bangkok a place I have already visited for a few times. The trip takes you to some typical spot in town (China town) and quickly get's you to more rural suburbs. The well attentive staff really take care of you when busy streets have to be crossed. Parts are done by a jetty (boat) that gets you to the sawas bordering the city. Really want to warn that you have to be comfortable on a bike and be able to drive convincingly on very narrow road with sometimes difficult twists and corners. One of my group bikers fell and had some serious wounds.

On your bike!. Started positively however the leader expected everyone to keep up irrespective of their ability. Through the extremely busy and dangerous streets with vehicles, drivers, bikers, motorcyclists, buses, trucks even humans coming at you from all angles, you had to keep up or sit out! So cycling through China Town with cats crossing your path was adventurous to say the least! However the day (expensive) included local lunch (yummy), train and boat ride to reach the other side. Biking in Bangkok on narrow canal paths was for me tricky but I revel in adventures and new experiences.

Great tour of the klongs. Had no idea what to expect on the Klongs tour and fancied doing it with a tour company rather than just via the long tail boat punters at taxsin pier. There were 5 people on our tour and the guide was fantastic. We were lucky to be there at the weekend when the market was running so also got to taste lots of lovely Thai dishes. Thoroughly recommend for a different view of Bangkok!

Highlight of the Bangkok experience. If you are going to visit Bangkok, this is a must do for everyone! See the other sides of the city by riding on a bike. The guides who are taking you are very professional and friendly and try to show you some beautiful parts of Bangkok which you would normally not see as a tourist. Try to book the five hours tour, you will go on a longtail boat as well!

Bangkok in the different aspect, plus great workout and excitement!. My friend and I took 5-hr bike/boat tour and it's fantastic! Highly recommended.If you can bike and balance yourself, I believe you can join this tour.Our tour leader was Mr.A. He explained things very well and was so nice to us and people along the way (he bought Thai banana for us when the farmer passed us). We biked from the company at Sipraya to China town in small alleys, passing a few fresh markets, and we saw local people doing their routine, cooking, selling foods, delivering stuff with cart, giving foods to monks, etc. We made stops at temples (both Chinese and Thai), local people's houses, plantation, and also noodle shop for breakfast! Even though, I'm Thai, I feel like I want to do this again. :)

Good ride through back streets of Bangkok . We took this tour with our family and 4 year old. We took the general 3 hour tour in the morning. This was one of our favorite things in Bangkok - we got s good overview, the riding was fun and easy, we went to the markets and even had a boat trip back across the river. We contacted the tour company later and they were responsive and helpful - it was very easy to book. If you have half a day certainly give it a shot and take the kids - good bike seats on back of adults bike.

Unique way to get to know Bangkok backstreet. We did this tour the first day we arrived in Bangkok with ouR 3 kids 2 6 and 10 years old. The tour is very nice going through the the small street, discovering the Bangkok country side and very nice staff.

Each new comer should join this trip, it will change the way you look Bangkok. This is my second time to join this fantastic trip, it always gives me feel excited and energetic. They have many different style and duration which you can choose your favorite easily. The bike riding is really easy for almost everyone, the speed is not fast, but the leader will take you to the small lanes or alleys, you can see way different life style in Bangkok. Jumped on a commute boat and off after few minutes, you will get into a green and peaceful world, which can make you feel totally relax. Overall, if you have half day off, try this journey, you will not disappointed.

Good boat tour. This tour company seems to be best known for its cycling tours of the city. However, we went on a canal tour with them and it was very good. The guide we had was very friendly and mostly informative regarding what we saw. The tour was through some of the canals and allowed us to see how some of the people of Bangkok live (including some of the wildlife that live alongside them). While it may seem a little voyeuristic the people we saw didn't seem too bothered and we're happy to wave and smile. The tour also allowed us the opportunity to see an orchid farm which was interesting.

See the REAL Bangkok. If you want to see how the real Bangkok lives, take this tour. We did the three hour night tour which involved riding through some slums, Chinatown with about a million people out and about, through (yes THROUGH) the flower market and a walk through of the Reclining Buddha compound (the temple itself is closed at night) and over a couple cool bridges. You can't say you know Bangkok until you've seen these things! Beware, you need to be at least a 3 out of 5 on a bike to do this...if you haven't ridden in years, this will be a bit intimidating. But for me, this was the highlight of our stay in this vibrant city.

The best way to see Bangkok. I visited Bangkok a few years ago with friends and used Van Kessel and found it to be a great experience. Now having returned with both family and friends we decided to give it another go and as I expected it was superb.Without a doubt the best way to see Bangkok as you travel via a combination of bike and boat. Takes a little bit of time to build up your confidence as you weave your way through the streets of Bangkok, but once you have your confidence you can then spend more time taking in the views that surround you.Great to see such a brilliant company flourishing and giving so much more back to the community whilst providing a great experience for any traveller who wants to see the real Bangkok in a slightly different way.

The other Bangkok. Want to see Bangkok a different way? Take a half day cycling tour and you will see a completely different Bangkok than mosr tourists will.Chinatown as well as the Bangkok accross the Chao Praya river will show you how ordenary people live their Our English speaking tourguide has been very informative and knowledgeable about the sites visiting during the trip!
Review. Thanks Jimmy for the awesome tour and for helping us find a restaurant afterwards.  Very enthousiastic and always smiling guide, highly recommendable!

Good way to tour and experience Chinatown. My family enjoyed the 3-hour bicycle tour. A big heartfelt thank you to our knowledgable, kind and helpful tour guides, Puna and Bobo. It was a tour that we will remember, and wondering how come we have missed this tour in our previous visits to Bangkok. It is a small adventure for the family traversing the alleys, markets, paths next to canals and you really get to see a different side of Bangkok and how the lifestyle of the local folks. Keep up the good work Puna and Bobo!

Enjoyed the 3hr bike tour. The 3 hour (original) bike tour was one of the highlights of my visit to Bangkok. It is a great way to see intriguing parts of Bangkok (i.e. Chinatown) that you would not otherwise. It was well organized and the riders are very nice as well.

So glad we booked 3 HR bike tour. My wife and I only had a day and a half in Bangkok and last minute decided to try the 3 HR bike tour. So stoked we did, we got to see so much of Bangkok we would have never seen on our own. From major streets to tiny back alleys and water taxis. Our guide Andy and her "bodyguard" were great, really nice and knowledgable. I highly recommend this tour for anyone who wants to experience Bangkok in a short amount of time.

the other side of Bangkok. it was great to cycle through busy Bangkok and see the other side of town. Even our children enjoyed. Guides friendly. Let us taste fruits etc and more then enough to drink and eat during the tour.

Best tour in Bangkok. Myself and my husband spent 5 days in Bangkok. On the second day we booked a private tour of the city with a driver, it took 6 hours and we only saw the grand palace, a small flower market and ko San road. This was something we could have done ourselves. I really wanted to see the real Bangkok so after reading the great reviews booked co van kessel 3 hour bike tour. It was extremely easy to book online and didn't have to pay a deposit. When we arrived we were in a group of about 10. Our guide Nona was amazing, she was very funny and informative and made the ride really enjoyable. We cycled though so many places that you would never be able to find on you own. We took regular stops. It wasn't a difficult ride, it was all flat, I wore flip flops and that wasn't a problem at all. I would definitely do this ride or a longer one if in Bangkok again. 100% worth every penny! Thanks!
Great tour!. Awesome way to see a different side of Bangkok that you wouldn't normally get to. I'm not a cyclist (normally hate it!) but really enjoyed myself on this trip.

Different side of Bangkok. At the last day of 2015 we decided to take the bike tour from Co van Kessel trough Bangkok. We took the 3-hour tour. Early in the morning when it isn't that hot (advised for people who are not used to ride a bike that often). The tour was amazing. Trough alleys, indoor markets, peoples homes, temples and more. You will see a different side of Bangkok. Things you don't normally see if you keep on the "tourist path". It's also pleasant that if you don't have that much time, you will see a lot of things in just 3 hours.The guides were friendly and explained allmost everything they know about Bangkok. A good thing was that oure guide was Dutch, so the English was perfect, and it was nice for us to get explaining in our own language. If you want to see a lot from Bangkok: this is the place to go!

Great guides and a very easy pace. We thought the guides were great. The cycling really was mostly coasting. Personally we would have enjoyed more real biking. The sites were good and it was a good way to see a lot. The canal and river tour was probably the best part. Lunch was also very good.

The best way to see Bangkok. This is by far the best way to experience so many different parts of Bangkok. From temples to small alleys to markets, this tour has more than I expected to see in 5 hours. It's it not strenuous at all and provided and amazing meal. We took the morning tour (7am start) which was well worth it as you gotta got to see the markets in full swing. Highly recommend to anyone wanting to do a tour of Bangkok.
Really fun. I had one of the best experience in my life cycling with Co Van Kessel. 3 hours in a mix of history, fun, beautiful views, ugly places and reality life in Bangkok. It was amazing!!

Bangkok in the blink of an eye. Promoted as a five-hour cycling tour, but pedalling a mere 15km, you are guaranteed not to have a gruelling time. There are an abundance of sites to visit: a Chinese temple, a wet market, a Buddhist temple, canals, villages, a fish feeding spot and the restaurant for a Western-tailored lunch. Our guide, On, was cheery throughout the tour, offering explanations and insight and easily answering any questions that we posed. As an avid cyclist, I enjoyed the busy streets, dirt paths, alleys, elevated paths through wetlands, the highway (against traffic for a couple hundred metres!), even crossing the river on a ferry and navigating the labyrinthine canals in a long-tail boat. Unfortunately, an annoyance that was entirely avoidable was the 45- to 60-minute wait for the locks to exit the canal and enter the river. This is a rapid and pleasant way to see and experience Bangkok in a flash.

Great tour! . Co van Kessel is a perfect way to see Bangkok. We did the 9 hour trip and had a great time. You get to see so many different tipes of Bangkok. The group was maybe a little bit to big. Because some times the guide had to tell a story 2 times. But she didn't mind. The bikes were ok and the track was awesome. The place where we had lunch was beautiful and the food was perfect. Don't hasitate and just do the trip!

Best tour to do in Bangkok!. The tour is simply amazing! They take you to so many places, and many beautiful temples! When you arrive at the temple they tell you about it, and that gives a lot of information! The best part is that it feels so good to have this trip on a bicycle! I liked one part very much, it is that once in a while there are little mountains on the road, and when you go down you can feel a nice breeze, and it makes you go faster! I really recommend this tour, because it is a nice way to discover the old part of Bangkok, riding through tiny streets and meeting kind locals, it is absolutely very fun! I was in the red group, and Tammy (the tour head of the red group) is a very nice, informed and good leader! Go for it!

Great hospitality and amazing guides!. I joined the classical tour of Co van Kessel. I missed the right pear with the Satsuki so I was too late and arrived some where I lost my way to the office of the tour. The office called me to ask if I was on my way and the group waited for me. I was very happy and the guide told me the integration I missed and took the time to help me out a little bit. So nice and helpful. I enjoyed the your very much, it was very well organized with drinks and some fingerfood. The girl who guided us was very very good informed about all the touristic sightseeings and told us a lot interesting things about Bangkok and her history. Thank you very much for this tour!!!

Thrilling cultural adventure. Co Can Kessel's 3 hour bicycle excursion through the narrow gritty but colorful alleyways of Chinatown, the flower market and Thongburi was a wonderful fast paced experience. I took the tour on Jan 1st which was easier to navigate as most of the shops were closed down for New Year. A bit less urban flavor but certainly an advantage as the bikes were a bit wobbly and I had not been biking for a long time. Our guides Noona and Cookie were great! I would highly recommend this tour to everyone. I live in Bangkok now but saw so many new areas with so much flavor in such a few hours. A banyan tree encroaching into more than 2/3 of a super narrow alleyway was a fun challenge. Great value! Great cultural immersion into what living in Bangkok is outside of CBD.

Best value trip I've ever taken.. Mr A is in a class of his own! What a guide! We expected a trip of 2-2.5 hours but were actually out for 4 hours. So informative and funny about China Town and then the far side of the river which is a world apart from modern Bangkok. Lots of photo opportunities and refreshment stops. Not a lot of shade on the long tailed boat so, if you feel the heat, take a sarong along to cover up.

9 hours tour and enjoyed every minute . I usually pack as many activities into my limited time in country. Although not an easy ride, I really couldn't recommend it more highly. The tour guides were great, especially the lead guide. I wish I remember her name, but she rode at a nice steady pace. Joking along the way, we ate a great Thai meal, ice cream and visited a temple. Took the local train, river boat and skytrain. How they herded us along is a true testimony to the organizational skills of Co's Tours.

Lovely tour, highlight of out trip. The bike riding was so much fun, showing us a side of Bangkok that we'd never seen before. The temples were so lovely and awe-inspiring, and the longboat rides were lots of fun. The food was incredible and better than any other restaurant we'd eaten at on our trip yet. The best day!

Awesome day... Don't miss this experience!. After reading the great reviews we were not disappointed. This was a highlight of our 3 week trip and our favourite tour for our family of four. A great way to see Bangkok. Yes, it was a long day and a hot one! (we did the tour on the 29/11/2015-sorry for the late review) The bikes were great, a loose chain was promptly fixed and nothing was too much trouble for our fantastic guides. Thanks Miss Water and Tom Tom. Plenty of drinks, snacks and lunch provided. No hidden extra's along the way. The sights were great and our 11 yr old managed to do the day without trouble. However I must note that there are some lifting of bikes up/down steep stairwells for the skytrain and some of the paths are narrow. A shorter tour would be worth considering if this could present as an issue or if you have time restraints. Just book one if you are undecided....The friendly staff and the well planned (FUN)day made for an unforgettable experience.

Fairly Enjoyable ride. RideIt was nice to go biking. We did the 5h package. It is more like 3h ride. 1h food. 1h on boat. About 1/10th of the ride the smell is quite pungent. Few blocks had cats and dog poops. The bikes that my husband and I had were quite wobbly and at times difficult to control. Not the best of bikes but then again it was only 1650 a person so cant ask for much.Tour guidesOur tour guide didnt speak English very well. At times I had trouble understanding. We have had other guides in different types of tours and didnt have any problems. It was odd that for snacks after 2.5h ride was a bottle of water and one tiny fried banana. There were 10 riders but the guide only bought 8 muffins so my husband and I were never offered one and no one bother to apologize to us. If we had known we would have brought our own snacks. FoodThe lunch was okay. Nothing to remember by. 6 dishes so lots of food but just not very good. Only the curry and chicken balls were good. The soup was odd. The views were interesting. Something to do when you are bored.

A must do when in Bangkok. We nearly didn't have time to do the night tour but I am so glad we pushed our schedule to make it happen. It ended up being our favourite thing that we did in our whole 2 week trip. Pam our guide was funny and informative, she lead the way through the backstreets of Bangkok showing the group a different side to the city. It was a remarkable experience and one I wholeheartedly and throughly recommend. The route was perfect and the bike were very comfortable to ride.

Enjoyable ride through Chinatown alleys and "Venice of the East". We took the 5h tour through the alleys of Chinatown and the West side of the Chao Praya river. On the west bank, you will be taken through lovely green 'suburbs', country side (yes!), several easy-going temple compounds without other tourists (but many chickens, cats and dogs), which includes several long tail boat rides, several refreshment stops and a good lunch. We loved it.

Very good bicycle and canal tours. Joined these tours two days in a row during one weekend; one for the classic tour, 3 hours, and one for a canal tour, 2 hours, with a focus on the Thonburi. Andy, Amy and Benny - the tour guides - were all terrific.
