Awesome tour!. Seriously, I hate those typical touristic things, however I was convinced by a friend to go and try this. Well, it was so cool, I'd totally do it again!! Special thanks to tour guides Andy and Suzy. I can recommend this to everyone: families with young kids (a Belgian couple with three kids were in my group, they all loved it!), couples, elderly and solo travelers like myself. The tour went through the narrow streets of Bangkok that I never would have gotten in to! If you have the time, go for it, you will not regret it: promise!!

Well worth it . You're seeing places in BK you'd never think of going to or even know they were there so close within the city limits. I joined the 7-noon tour that included biking through china town, going on the long tail boats and going out west of the city biking and seeing people live in the country. The 5hr tour was 1650bhat. Well worth it. This included guide, all transport (river crossing ferry and long tail boat), water and a great sit down meal.

Good entertainment !. Easy to book (online and no advance payment) and reasonable price for this nice attraction in Bangkok.We took the morning Classical Tour (3h). 2 excellent guides took us (group of 14) through a maze of small, very small and big streets and across the river. Well organized, well timed and accessible for all who can ride a bike. The bikes themselves were a bit dated but in good working order and well maintained. Anyway, you don't need a 24-gear mountainbike for the trip you make !A nice alternative for the classic sightseeing tours. Affordable and nice entertainment. Recommended.

Money well spent!. We had a lot of fun participating in the 5hour long bike/boat trip. Because of the temperature i recommend choosing the group that starts at seven in the morning. Riding literally right through markets in chinatown, through really narrow aleys and highfive-ing every local kid that sees you coming. I really really loved it. The boat rides are also well organised, they load your bike on a longboat and before you know it you experience Bangkok from the water. All kinds of houses are built on the riverside and it's quite confrontational to see the difference in prosperity. The meal that you will have is very good. Many different kinds of food and plenty of it! Overall a very pleasant and above all well organised experience, keep up the good work people of co!

Very nice. We did the 5 hour bike and boat tour, and had a great time. Most impressive was the first bit through Chinatown and the countryside after exiting the boat. The part biking through the suburbs felt a bit pointless. Had a great lunch, which isn't always guaranteed as a vegetarian when doing a tour.Would recommend this tour! You need some bike handling skills though if you don't want to go for a swim in the countryside, paths are quite narrow.

funny enthralling bike tour. my family and i (husband, sister, and 3 teenage children), took a bike tour through bangkok. we were weaving in and out of streets, down tiny narror alleyways and it was overall a fantastic way to get a first hand view of bangkok. it was definantly exciting. our tour guide was very funny and interesting, and kept us captivated. the only down side is that if you want an informative tour, this may not be the one for you. we did not stop every five minutes to find out something new - however this was good for us because we got to view life in bangkok first hand

Adrenlaine pumping and entertaining for those who know what a city bike tour consists of!. This was the highlight of a trekking journey to Thailand. We chose the 5 hour tour. Who would've thought that urban biking interspersed with loading your bike on a Thai long boat racing through the waterways of a mega city (18 million), would be so much fun? This company and our guide (Ninna), was top notch. You'll find yourself peddling through China town and the tightest market streets possibly but it all works out. The Thai's see this group coming and are so kind to let you pass....(possibly due to the fact that your a foreigner and who the heck would this besides an adventure seeking western tourist!!). You'lll continue by boat out to the rice paddies still belonging to the Bangkok periphery. It's a great way to see the city and different regions from the steel workshops to the spice and fish markets, to temples, etc. The lunch was a true delight with a husband and wife team the welcomed us overlooking the waterway.A few things to take note of:1. Be confidant and comfortable on a bike. Yes! The Dutch have an advantage here! ;-)2. Take your time and go slow if need be.3. Don't expect a stop and go explanation tour. This is a bike tour but you do stop and regroup at some points. 4. Tip your guide and be compassionate for having had the chance to be well led.

A Must !. A Must when you are visiting Bangkok, don't be afraid as it avoids main roads and mostly goes via back alleys, that's what makes this tour so much fun ! You will see Bangkok in a whole different way. No taxi's, tuk tuk's or buses can get to the places you will be cycling thru. You even cross the river by carrying your bicycle on a boat....
Great way to see Bangkok!. Perfect way to see Bangkok! Combo of bike and boat trip enables ALL different sides of Bangkok in five hours only!

Bike ride O K for Seniors. I was concerned about my ability after having both hips replaced. No problem. Narrow paths and many tourists so BALANCE is the key to the ride. The guides were very accommodating, the lunch was delicious and after a week in Bangkok this was my high light. Definitely a thumbs up.

Unusual Bangkok. I went on a 5-hour combo tour in the morning and it was a nice combination of cycling through busy China Town and quiet suburbs of Bangkok. Plus, the tour includes parts where you board a long-tail boat and see life on the canals. The tour is a nice opportunity to safely ride bicycle in Bangkok and see places that you don't see during regular tourist tours. Guides are great, friendly and knowledgable. I highly recommend this tour!

Great way to see the main sights . I booked the night bike tour online a few days ahead, communication was great via email. They have a little shop near the river which is easy to find with a free drinks fridge. They fitted everyone out with a high vis vest and you could choose between mountain bikes and single speed bikes. The tour was great, taking in the main sights while it was cooler and not crowded with tourists. In fact I enjoyed this much more than seeing the sights in daylight the next day! The trip felt safe, there are a few narrow alleys but nothing too challenging and the trip is quite slow so was easy to keep up. There's a tour guide at the front and back so no one gets lost. They provided water and a couple of snacks throughout (bananas and a packet of chips). I was hoping for some snacks from local street food vendors but perhaps that isn't realistic in those locations at that time of night! Would definitely recommend, was a great intro to Bangkok

Brilliant all day bike tour!!. And I don't even like cycling! :) But seriously - it has it all. The guide and his right hand helper were fantastic - never felt unsafe in a bike crossing mental Bangkok traffic, navigating China market etc. You get to see truly off-beaten places - china town, slums, canals, local communities, great lunch, great snacks on the way all 100% local. LOVED it and cannot recommend highly enough! Thank you guys!

Would have been a 5!!! . There were so many highs and lows of today's tour... All of the lows were completely out of our guides control but the company should have researched particular closures due to the massive bike ride on in the city. The guides noona and York were great. And did everything in there power to make a rubbish situation better. Unfortunately we had a member of our ride fall and break his arm so we waited for the guides to get him comfortable and sorted, they dealt with the situation like complete pros. This put us a little behind and we had to try and make up time. The amount of food and drink you are given on the tour is insane, not just water but snacks, ice creams, coffees etc and the lunch was fab, they brought more once we'd finished the first lot, then fruit for pudding. We then began our journey back and there was clearly some problem at the gate as this put noona in a bad mood and we had to wait to get to the platform, it turned out that the second train we were due to get wasn't even running, I would have thought the organisers of the company would have known this?! So God only know how but the guides directed us through closed streets, having to deal with being stopped by police men and wardens. But without much problem noona managed to talk our way across town and back to the shop, were we got more drinks. xkx

Dan the Man. We did a 3 hour tour with Andy yesterday from 2-5 pm. I totally loved the whole route, wending our way through all the fascinating alleys of Bangkok. I thought it was very difficult to understand his English and when we did stop at times he failed to make sure that all of us could hear him. There are many bike tour companies in Bangkok so perhaps take a few minutes to look over the Trip Advisor reviews before you decide.

Do it!. I did the 5 hour tour and I totally recommend it! You get to see Chinatown and the countryside of Bangkok. And the lunch is just delicious! Also the people there are very nice and enthusiastic.

9 hours of eating, oh and cycling. . Firstly to respond to some points made on the last post I'm seeing about the 3 hour tour. Your points are valid but let's look around. There are no hills in Thailand. Unless you have chicken legs you won't need anything besides a single gear. I wasn't that happy with my bike but that's cause I usually ride a Scott scale 940 hard tail. They gave me a trek hard tail with some gears. Never fell behind, was never uncomfortable, only used two gears over 9 hours. The weakest looking person in our group took the single speed with a basket and same thing. She didn't struggle at all and no one was every left behind. Had Mr Ay at the back cracking the whip, just jokes. He kept the group together always. Personally I should have taken the single speed. Don't have to worry about anything then except for breaking around right turns. For the 9 hour tour our guide Tammy did do some explaining but not that much but I felt it was fine and she did say we must stop her and ask if we had any questions. She did make the ride feel personal ( we were a group of 7 - I've heard the groups can get bigger) We were doing the 9 hr ride though. Riding along the canals is so peacefully and beautiful I didn't mind. We did stop ALOT to taste the local food which was awesome. In fact don't eat breakfast if you're doing the 9hr trip. We arrived after 6:30 which was 9:30 trip and didn't notice any speeding up at the end. (Hope Tammy and Mr Ay don't get into trouble for that comment seeing the last guy mentioned they were on a very tight schedule) I would have been very irritated if I was told to move faster or not take photos etc like the 3hr guy mentions. The standard of the bikes isn't the highest but I think it's got to do with what you are used too. But taken into account I did 9hrs I can totally see how your response is plausible and I would be very upset if I arrived to a bike with flat tires!!! If you're scared of doing the 9hrs don't be. It's so chilled you won't even break a sweat, there literally are maybe 2 hills. Don't know what the other cycle tours are like so can't compare. I have a friend who did the 5 hour with the same company and it sounded slightly similar. everyone in our group loved the day cycling through the city and outskirts. Thanks to Tammy our guide and Mr Ay. You were awesome!

Great day. We did the 9 hours tour and it was great! We saw different aspects of Bangkok. Our guide Namh was really nice. The drinks and food provided during the ride were really nice.The change between bike, train, boat and skytrain was a good combination!

Unique view of Bangkok and A Must Do! . This was one of the most pleasant surprises of my Bangkok visit! Nuan "mouse" (young Thai guide) was excellent and very friendly. She took care of us thru the night ride and got a feel of how Bangkok denizens live and a real feel of the city! I can say I have literally been all over the city and the various markets we covered on the 3 hour night tour.Side note -Europeans please tip the guides decently.

Best way to get around!! . I did the 9 hour tour on my first day in Asia and Bangkok. What an amazing experience! The staff was really nice and helpful, which made me dive right into the culture and whereabouts of the Thai people. Great bikes (says a Dutchman) and great route! Would definitely recommend it to everyone if you visit Bangkok! Worth every penny:)

Best way to see bangkok. We went on a night biking tour with an 8 and 10 year old and it was one of the highlights of our trip to bangkok.The trip brings you through back streets and major sites that tourists should visit. The views of the temples and grand palace at night was great. The trip even includes a ride across the river on a ferry.The staff were very friendly, patient and caring. They assigned a staff just to take care of my two kids and ensure that they were safe. Most of the paths taken were back lanes or bike paths that were free of traffic. When we had to cross the road, the staff would stop the traffic in both directions so we could all cross safely. There is a short section where you have to ride along the road so you have to be a steady and confident rider. There were adequate breaks and drinks and a snack provided. As we rode during the Loi Krathong festive period, we could stop to enjoy live cultural shows of thai dance, martial arts and singing. The flower market was also vibrant as the people prepared for the religious event. It was an eye opening introduction to thai culture.We thoroughly enjoyed the biking trip and highly recommend it.

Fantastic!. This the best way to see Bangkok and surroundings. We joined the 5 hours trip, next time we'll take the full day trip. Excellent ride. Great food and a unique experience. The staff is very nice and friendly.

OK tour. My wife and I did the CVK 6-hour bike/boat tour and I overall I would describe it as “OK.” We got to do a lot of biking around and sightseeing through both rural and urban areas of Bangkok, and I enjoyed being outdoors enjoying the sights and smells of the city.However there was very little dialogue or explanation of where we were and what we were looking at, which made it difficult to really appreciate the scenery. The view was nice but with not dialogue or information the tour seemed way too long. What am I looking at? What are people doing here? What kind of neighborhood is this? These questions constantly popped in my head but because we were all on bikes and it was a fairly large group (~10 people) it was difficult to engage the guides. In retrospect I would not recommend this tour due to the large group size and lack of dialogue. Certainly it did not meet my expectations -- perhaps the walking tour would be better.

One of the finest tours possible - really! . Most of my friends who visit Thailand regularly claim that the bike tour was their single best experience in Thailand. I wasn't excited about the tour but booked it on the basis of such positive feedback from virtually everyone who experienced it. Having been on the 5 hour bicycle and longboat tour yesterday (24th Nov afternoon session) I can now join the chorus of praise for a fantastic package. It is broken into a number of experiences with biking, photo-op breaks at opportune moments, learning how to open a lotus flower, visiting temples, Chinatown and the bustling flower market, feeding fish, a superb late lunch and the at times peaceful and other times thrilling Longtail boat. But the best thing was the two tour guides - very genuine, pleasant and helpful. There wasn't a single false note to the experience!I had my 5 yo daughter sit in the backseat very cross for the first 10 minutes but she loved it later.
The best thing I ever did in Bangkok. Very organized, they looking after you, take several stops, it is also great for families with children

Great way to explore Bangkok. We took the 3-hour morning trip (from 8-11am). The bike tour is a great way to explore Bangkok, you will see places that you would not have explored on your own. We had two very nice and cute guides who showed us around.
We paid 950baht per person for the 3-hour trip. Money well spent :)

Last minute boat tour - AWESOME!. Due to a change of plans, we submitted a request for a 2 hour boat tour at 2am for a 10am tour on the same day. It was a long shot and I was certain that they would reply with a nice, thanks but sorry email. I was super surprised when at 8am I received an email confirming the booking! wow! We arrived at their office and were ready to go. We took a very short walk to a dock and we were on our way! The tour guide was very nice and very knowledgeable and took in stride our constant "what is that and what are those?" questions. We stopped at a small floating market with "on-land" market close by. The food was amazing and very clean. There is nothing like seeing Bangkok by boat, it was an amazing experience! We had a fantastic time and at the end, wished that I would have booked the 5 hour tour instead! Thank you Co Van Kessel Tours for a awesome tour and taking such good care of your customers!

Best tour we've ever been on - AMAZING!. This tour far exceeded our expectations. It was like no tour I've ever been on. Seeing Bangkok from the native's perspectives, eating a delicious meal, and enjoying biking as well as a boat tour - this is a MUST in Bangkok. A highlight of our honeymoon and a memory we will never forget.

A must do ... Even if only 1 day in Bangkok. Luckily we are longer in Bkk than 1 day ... But this was a super unforgettable experience. You get to see such a variety of places from busy city center to tranquil outskirts of bangkok. All is perfectly organised, drinks, activities, food and all with a sense of humour. Sandra and Paksoi were the best hosts. The places you get to see are impressive and make a big impression. Don't doubt ... Really do it. It is an early start but we recommend the morning session... Markets are open and temperature still ok :-)

Best way to experience the real Bangkok. We did the evening tour, a lot cooler and only 3 hours in duration. Great fun activity to do and a good way to get off of the main tourist routes. Safety was reasonable, we were provided with high visibility tops and lights for the bikes (as we were cycling after sunset). We were not automatically provided with helmets, but were quickly given them upon request. Slightly chaotic but fun tour, lots of hazards to watch out for on route specifically pot holes, stray cats and sharp corners; choice of bikes provided - would highly recommend that you choose the mountain bikes for better functionality! Tour guide was very enthusiastic and led the group, a second employee rode at the back of the group to ensure no one got left behind. Tour took us to China Town, smaller temples, the flower market, Wot Pho at nighttime (really cool) and the other side of the river. Regular stops are provided and refreshments provided on route as well. Really enjoyed this tour, one of the best things that we did in the city, but bear in mind Bangkok is not the safest place to cycle so be vigilent and be safe and you'll have a great time! Note - we stayed on Khao San road, struggled to get to the meeting point for the start time by taxi so took the boat, so make sure you give yourself plenty of time to get there.

Wonderful !. I had a great experience at Co Van Kessel Bike Tours. I was traveling in Bangkok alone, had fun with two young couples and our fabulous tour guides. on the 3 hour Night Tour. Saw fascinating sides of the city, in a leisurely ride, in the flower markets, temples and side streets. Well paced, and informative. This is an absolutely "Not To Be Missed" experience.Thank you!!

Must-do in Bangkok! . I was advised to do this tour by my sister and she was totally right! This is awesome.. You get to see so much more of Bangkok and the experience to drive a bicycle in those tiny streets is very cool! I suggest you take the 5 hour tour.. you never cycle to much or too long.. the tour has many stop along the way!

I know a bike tour sounds pretty boring, but....!!!. When somebody tells me; 'If you go there you should do a bike tour!' Then I would think that person is crazy, like there is nothing better to do..?The answer is simple: there is nothing better to do!!!! Did the 3 hour trip, and my butt found that enough time on a saddle. But it is really a must see!!!

Co Co loco. We have been to Thailand and Bangkok a few times, but this was news to us and we would have to say that it is a brilliant way to see some of Bangkok that you would never find. Went with adults and teenagers in a group of 10, so quite small and manageable.rode through Chinatown, down winding narrow streets, through crowds, on a long tail down canals, through plantations, in traffic, all over the place.So should mention the two guides were excellent, informative, attentive and made sure everyone was safe and together.Easy riding as it is all flat, they provide free water whenever you need it.It is a really fun and interesting way to see Bangkok. Even if you never ride a bike, it is so simple. Just bring a hat and sunscreen, and rainy days are no problems, as you know the storm will pass in a few minutes and a bit of rain on you will be a welcome relief. Plus they give you ponchos if need be.I was sceptical before going but am a big fan. Everyone loved it.Oh and the meal at the end was fantastic!!!!

Klong boat tour. Great way to spend a morning. Starting at the shop we took a short walk through china town's back alleys and then onto a longtail for a klong tour and stop at Talin Chan floating market. The tour was just the right amount of time and the guide was very nice and helpful; she even purchased food and drinks at the market and street stalls for us to try. Overall I felt that the guide wanted to show off her city and culture which made for a great time had by all.

The 3 hour Night Tour. We did the 3 hour night/evening tour. It started at 18 o'çlock. It's fine to be there 10 minutes before. Taxi can drop you of at River City Shopping Centre and from there you will see it directly.The organization will make sure you get enough drinks during the tour. Alhtough the company has a dutch founder, all the guides are talking English.Be sure you ask them a lot, because they can tell you nice stories about Bangkok.The three hour tour will bring you to China Town, a Chinese temple, the flower market (which is open 24 hours), memorial bridge, Grand Palace and Wat Arun. You will tak a ferry twice.Have fun.

Great tour in some areas of Bangkok you would never get to see by yourself. We had a great time on this tour. My father - who was visiting - and I signed up for the 5hr bike/boat tour (afternoon) because we both know Bangkok well and thought we'd do something different this time.The directions to find the place were very clear and we had no problem finding their office. The reception area was a bit chaotic when we arrived because of all the tours they run, but once set up with the rest of our group, no problem. There were 10 people in total in our group, so it is an ideal size. The tour was well organised and our guide was very good. The bikes were comfortable - they do not have bells though, and the company does not give any helmets either. We set off in the small alleyways of China town (small being an understatement), and then took a boat to head to the other side of the river to carry on cycling over there, and we came back after dinner by boat again. The tour includes water and food, and has enough breaks so that you don't feel too exhausted. If you choose the afternoon tour, be aware that it gets very hot and so some people might find that challenging.Also if you are not in great physical shape, this tour might not be for you.Overall, a great experience. A bit pricey maybe, but something different to do, for those who want to find themselves a bit out of the beaten track.

Nice but to expensive for what you get . We did the 9 hours tours and it was nice. A whole day out, with more that enough drink stops, snacks and a good lunch.Amy our guide was a very nice lady. The trip itself was nice, you see a lot of sides from Bangkok. The MuslimArea is great, green and has a Lot of canals. The boat tour is nice as well.However, to our opinion it's not worth 4200 tbh/ €120,-. It's a lot of money for both Thai and western standards and it's way to much money spend for what you get.

Too overprice for what they do. I did this tour because I was recommended and we read good posts about it. Me and my friend were very disappointed as the guide didn't explain almost anything, we spent too much time on boats and what they show is very easy to see for yourself if you rent a motorbike. I have been trhought southeast asia many times. If you are a frequent traveller avoid this tour. The price is incredible too high for thailand. Not recommended at all!!!!

Had a great time, but some advice. The tour is very well organized and our guide was super friendly and entertaining.However, I don't think this tour is for everyone. I've seen people with young kids and I don't think this is advised (I'll explain). Also, it's a bit obvious, but this is Bangkok, if you're not comfortable riding a bike in slightly challenging situations, you may want to reconsider.The tour takes you through some very poor areas, which are interesting to see and learn about. We also rode through very narrow alleys where locals sit around or run their businesses. Like in any really poor area, infrastructure is not very good and you don't want an unskilled person falling into filthy canal waters or biking on local's toes (it almost happened to me). Again the tour is super nice and organized, you just have to be a bit fit mentally and physically and you'll have an amazing day in Bangkok.

Amazing experience - a must do!!!. We did the 3 hour morning tour which was perfect as the heat got heavy at the end. The bikes are not best in class but ok. Our guide was excellent, funny, some explanations where needed, well organised and a second guide at the end to ensure nobody gets lost. Great service with drinks and snacks. The tour was amazing through tiny paths in chinatown, felt like biking through the living room of the people living there. Nice stop at the flowermarket, temples, crossing the river - great views. The best experience everyone can have - a MUST do !!!

Amazing bike tour through Bangkok!. We hade an amazing tour through different parts of Bangkok. It is a surprising tour, and we have seen parts of the city/Bangkok's sub area that we otherwise would not have seen. Our tourguide had a lot of knowledge about the culture etc. If you have the opportunity, I would definitelly advise you to book this tour! You shouldn't miss the opportunity to view Bangkok this way!!

A side of Bangkok you usually won't see. Our enthusiastic guide Tammy showed us a side of Bangkok and the surrounding area's we would not have come across on our own. The bike are well maintained and comfortable to ride. We did a half day tour which includes a boat ride and a very nice lunch and local snacks.

BEST night bike tour!. We loved our night bike tour of Bangkok. Our tour guide "A" was really fun and took us through lots of back streets and alleys in Chinatown. Festival was a bonus. Really fun to check out the city at night, highly recommended!

Do it. Let me start by saying, I nearly never write reviews. This trip was special. The guides were kind, funny, and informative. Riding through small alleys while Bangkok began its day, followed by a longboat ride, ride through plantations, past many temples, a great lunch, and finally a high speed longboat ride to finish by noon. The riding is not particularly strenuous and it's easy to casually look around and take in the sights, sounds, and smells (good and bad). It really was "the real Bangkok". Please go on this trip you won't regret it.

Discover a secret side of bangkok. Great tour with good guides. You see lots of small roads and markets you wouldn't ever find in your own. Absolutely worth it! You get a delicious thai meal during the ride! Everyone liked it!

The best way to spent an early morning in Bangkok. Interesting, exiting and fun. Tammy and Ginny were good spiriten guides that made our day. We visited markets, canal areas and residential areas all in the same morning. Great!

A "must do". After traveling globally for 13 years, this Bicycle tour is definitely in my "top 3" of all times. It's absolutely great to take a deeper look into Bangkok. After being here for the 10th time, nearly everything I saw was new. The long-tail boat trip was a gift which I didn't foresee. Absolutely a GENIUS concept!

5 hr combo tour. Perfect way to see Bangkok, Nuna our guide did and excellent job taking us to places you would never get to, both in the city as well as outside. Visited the small alleys of Chinatown, the bike paths through the fields and the canals with a longboat. Visited a local floating market were we tasted local specialties and had an excellent Thai lunch..... definitely something to do again.

A magical tour. Embarked on a magical 9 hour tour which quickly escaped the madness of the city. We rode along amazing elevated paths along the river and country roads. It felt like like a journey back in time. Our guide Noona was amazing, the prefect host! The pace was gentle, yet the time flew by quickly. Don't let the 9 hour tour scare you away, a 3 hour tour would only be a teaser! A magical trip!!!

This is a must!. I really recommend this bike tour! The guides were really friendly and interactive. We saw the smallest and darkest alleys in Chinatown. Cycling through the plantations was beautiful and relaxing. The lunch they provide was amazing! I didn't expect much because on the website they mention a light meal but the whole table was filled with different dishes. The boat trip was fun too and you get to see how people live at the river.

Perfect for seeing some of Bangkok on a stop over.. If you go to Bangkok and only have a day or 2 and you want to do some sightseeing you must check these guys out.This is the 2nd time we have joined their tour, the first time was 8 years ago and just 2 of us, this time it was our family of 2 adults and 2 kids aged 5 & 7.They cater for all ages with bikes being able to accommodate baby's to 5 year olds still not 100% confidant.The tour guides were awesome and due to our family being a little slower they did not show any frustration and actually ended up guiding us via a short cut that was a bit easier for our 7 year old - very accommodating.We saw lots of back alleys that you would not visit normally as well as markets, busy streets, temples and along the river with a longtail boat ride included and a yummy lunch.Awesome tour and made our Bangkok stopover lots of fun - even if it rained most of journey, not so bad on such a warm day.

Wonderful evening on bicycle in Bangkok. We had ordered in advance and I was not sure what to expect. My three kids on bicycle in BKK? It is safe? We all loved it! We had one bicycle each. got a helmet and lights. We had two guides with us on our 3 hour tour, on in front and one in the end. We went on the narrow paths between houses and visited both the flower market and China Town. We even stopped for a meal on one of the street restaurants. So if you want to see Bangkok from a different angle, book a trip with Van Kessel and ask to have Maouna as your guide! I can fully recommend it . Enjoy!

Good way to see other parts of the city. This was not my first time in Bangkok and I wanted to do something a bit different. The tour was near to my hotel (Holiday Inn Silom) - about a 30 minute walk. I did the 5 hour morning tour (cooler) which included at least 1.5 hours on boats.  I used to bicycle a lot - around 20 years ago - and they say you never forget how to ride a bike. Well, yes and no. I could balance, but I found it quite tricky to bike thru the tiny alleys and markets and over speed bumps (to keep the motor bikes from going too fast. I spent a lot of time with both myself and the locals in peril. I stayed at the back of the group and the tail end staff member looked after me very well - we did not always ride with the rest of the group. And also, because of this, I missed much of the commentary.All that said, I am really glad I did it. I saw bits of the city I would never have seen otherwise, particularly the bits further out, the areas with fields which were a lot closer to the city than I would have thought. I enjoyed the meal which we had at the end as I did the morning tour. There is a bit of bicycling after the meal to get from the boat landing back to the office - around 10-15 minutes.This would be a great tour if you were a competent cyclist, and is still a good tour if you are not.

We really did see a crocodile !. Ok a 6am start across the city was not a great way to begin a Sunday morning but once we arrived at the offices to be met by Meen & Ginny who were our guides for the 5 hour cycle & long boat trip , it was like we had been invited into Bangkoks biggest secret ! At times we couldn't believe it was possible to take a bike around a fish market in Chinatown or be allowed so close to the locals homes and always with a smile . A not to be missed tour and thank again to our two guides nothing was too much trouble for them ...

A true highlight of our trip. We saw some of the reviews on TripAdvisor about this cycling tour and decided to give it a try. We had a fantastic time. We booked the five hour (3 hours of cycling and two hours on a boat) and had a great time. Our guides Top and Earn were wonderful. This tour takes you through some very narrow lanes and streets stopping occasionally to view temples and markets. We were able to try some of the local produce including the pink duck eggs (black inside) which was interesting. After a boat trip we were out in the countryside riding on very narrow paths with drops on each side (tip of the day - don't try to take selfies while riding here). We had a wonderful meal at a local restaurant along the way before getting back on the bikes and then back on a boat again. If your not an experienced cyclist it's not a problem because it's not a fast pace and every level is catered for. Great way to see the local side of the city.

very good. nice cycling trip. good to actually cycle, most cycling trip takes forever with not a lot of cycling.. worth doing for the price. good guide also. would recommend if you are a confortable on a bike.

Great way to get to know the city (somewhat). I went on the 5 hour bike & boat tour, on the first day of my visit.What a great way to get a view of the city, and see how the average Thai lives!Enjoyed every minute of it, including the brunch. The cyclng was nog too hevay, especially for a Dutchmen like myself.

Fun! And not too scary if you're not a super-experienced bicycle rider. My husband and I did the 3 hour tour and loved it! Honestly, I was nervous about biking around the busy streets of Bangkok in the middle of the summer heat. Although I’m a generally fit person, I do not bicycle often and I get anxious having to navigate crowds and traffic on two wheels.That said – this tour was wonderful!!! There were a few points requiring some careful maneuvering around stray cats and a few crumbling rocks, but the tour guides were very careful with their guests. I especially appreciated that they employed 3 staff riders with each group – 1 leader, 1 in the middle, and another at the back of the pack. When we approached busy intersections or corners, the middle guide would block traffic and/or ensure that we all were able to cross safely.The tour itself was very enjoyable. We did cover a fair amount of ground – biking through different areas, seeing the fish markets, etc. We had frequent breaks to get off our bikes and wander through the temples and the markets. Although it was HOT, it wasn’t nearly as uncomfortable as I had anticipated due to the frequent breaks and the fact that coasting around can really cool you down.

Can experience adventure in center of Bangkok . Location of the bike shop is little bit difficult to find but if you can take the shuttle boat properly, that would be easy. I took the 5 hour tour with 3 families so my group was consisted with children and mid ages. The tour guides who guided us was pretty friendly and patient and careful. The tour was fun and I could experience the hided real life of Bangkok citizens. The one thing I want to tell you that if you are not good at riding bicycles on the narrow road or easily scared of some situations, then think twice. I thought that I could ride bicycles well but it was wrong idea. If you good at riding bicycles, then you can find the hidden Bangkok with this tour.

Interesting. We booked the night tour last minute and the team was very flexible and friendly.Amy,our tour guide, is a very charming and nice person! We enjoyed riding a bike for a change.bikes were in adequate condition and helmets were available. Tour was well thought and had several stops. U get an evening meal at the street (we didnt feel well for two days) Pro: u get around faster than walking, sight seeing spots are nice and less crowded at night. Con: since u are driving through the narrowest side streets u can think of u have to concentrate a lot to not cause any accidents and dont have less time to look around and enjoy!

rekindle your adventure sprit. 1)this is a bicycle tour to the rural and some urban places of bangkok, where normal tourists never go.2)must do for travellers who loves adventure.3)the whole day tour is the best, it involves, train ride, sky train ride,snake boat ride, visit to temples,local market visit,ect,. All this time the bicycle is with you. There are four guides always there with you,guiding you.4) visit their website for more details.5) they take you to a hotel,in a very rural area. The food and ambiance was just awesome.

Off the beaten track . This was the best way so far to discover this vibrant city! I joined the "Bangkok at night tour" and didn't regret it any second. We had a great tour guide, the bikes are okay and I'd never discovered the hidden alleys and corners we were shown today. Thanks a lot!

Awesome Longboat Tour!. My wife and I opted for the 2hour longboat tour of Bangkok. We were only in the city for a couple of days and thought this might be an excellent way to see life along the canal system that is so much a part of the city. We were not disappointed! We saw all types of homes, from lean-to’s to mini-mansions. We saw many temples too. You see a lot of people too along the way who were all very friendly. At one point we stopped at a local market. Our guide gave each of us a loaf of bread to feed the catfish in the canal. They were enormous! Some were perhaps 30 inches in length. All had quite the appetite for bread! (Tip – do not throw bread near your boat unless you are looking for a catfish-induced splash-bath!) By the way, our guide was very funny and friendly and knowledgeable about the area. I wish I would have remembered her name. She was a positive endorsement for the Co Van Kessel tours. We continue on our journey through the canals until we arrived at a small market. We got off the longboat and our guide took us through the market to various food stalls so that we could pick out our lunch options. This was a local market. You could not get more authentic than that. As soon as everyone was full we got back on the long boat and completed our journey through the canals. At one point we encountered a coupled of the flat-bottom speed boats with the big V-8 engines on them. They are little speed boat that are reminiscent of the boats used in an old James Bond movie. Eventually we were back on the Chao Phraya River and back to the dock near Co Van Kessel’s office. We give Co Van Kessel top marks for this tour. A perfect way to see the city if you are on a time budget.

Amazing tour & Guides. We Dutchies love to cycle, so we went and did the 9 hour tour through Bangkok, including a trip on a skytrain, boat and train. The tour was amazing, our guides took good care of us and showed us, in my opinion the most beautiful parts of Bangkok, our guide Andy told us all about the different areas we visited. I definitely recommend this! Would love to come back to do a night tour!

Good tour of the canals. This was a good tour of the canals. Lots of different types of,homes built over the last 100 years. Get swarmed by hundreds of catfish including the elusive albino catfish. I did not like getting out of the boat. We did so twice. I thought it was expensive given 4 people paid 1200 baht each.

Not just best activity but best day in Bangkok. Took the Co All Day bike tour with my family. It's probably a Dutch thing to take a bike tour through Bangkok since all participants were Dutch except one and that's a shame. It's suited for anyone who likes to see Bangkok in a special way. This tour in my opinion is the best way to see Bangkok and made up for the best day of my last few holidays. You get to see the narrow streets and alleys of Bangkok's Chinatown, bike along a canal, through ricefields, see a more rural way of living, watch people living along the railroad and visit a temple. During the day you travel by bike, train, boat and skytrain. Truely a day to remember.

Adventurous Bike Tour. I was initially hesitant on booking a Bike Tour through the packed streets of Bangkok. However, my fears were quickly erased as soon as Mr. A, our tour guide assured us we were in safe hands. Mr A and Mr York were the best tour guides you could ask for. They were knowledgeable, humourous and provided quite a fun tour. This is one of those tours that doesn't require you to be super fit. Trust me, I am definitely not in shape and I was able to keep up with the group, no problem. There are plently of breaks in between the ride so you are sure not to get tired out, and they provide plenty of water in the humid weather. I especially enjoyed the boat ride as it gave us time to see life of people living around the river. A delicious lunch is included so you will definitely not be hungry. I highly recommend this tour as it gives you a nice insight to people who live in Bangkok. You will not regret it!

FANTASTIC WAY TO SEE A DIFFRENT BANGKOK... What a find, i don't normally go on group tours or review things but this was fantastic,i have been to Bangkok many times and ive never seen the bits , alleyways and parks and markets they took me to ..Our guides Jackie and Ahmed [i think.... the local Bangkok guy...}were Brilliant, the trip caters for all ages and we stopped many time on our 5 hr tour on bike and boat..Great lunch stop and away from all the crowds..i highly recommend this tour to anyone who thinks they know Bangkok and have a day to kill on a stop over , its the best thing you can do...We were with our teenagers and our selfs....They even loved it....

Awesome bike tour. Feel and taste the atmosphere of Bangkok areas. The tour guides are really friendly and funny. Just go jump on your bike, enjoy and follow the rest. Really good price with everything included. Also drinks and snacks.

Best way to see Bangkok. An amazing experience. You will see the canals of Bangkok and the back roads of bangkok. You will not see on your own. This tour takes to the nooks and corners of Bangkok. I ll do this again!

Very nice tour through the local streets of old Bangkok.. Lovely way to get a sight behind the scenes of real live and work in Bangkok. Relaxing bike tour through china town, other old parts of the city, some less well known temples etc.

The most amazing Bangkok experience, EVER.. My friend who lives in Bangkok, suggested this for me to do as a good way to experience the city in a way you never thought possible and he was right. I have done nothing but brag about this tour to everyone since I got back home. The tour guides were wonderful, happy, friendly girls. They were proud of their job and happy to talk to you and answer questions. They made sure we were safe and kept on the right path. The story of the origins of the tour is really touching. The lunch was not only fantastic but it also helps the local community you are touring, by using local restaurants and produce. Any food that isn't eaten goes to the children or the monks in the area, so nothing is wasted. The long-boat ride was a surprise, as was the bike ride through the market. If you have to take a camera, your phone is fine, or a small digital. You'll need your eyes on the job, trust me!! Everything about the five hours was a sensory overload. Five hours may seem like a lot but it goes so quickly. I'd also recommend the early morning tour and try a weekend. That way, it's cooler and there's not as much traffic. You absolutely MUST do this tour. It's an experience you will never forget and you will brag to your friends about it too. I can't recommend it enough.

Definitely worth the money. This is the second time that I've done the bike tour with Co Van Kessel. The first tour was just as good as the second. Jackie was our main tour guide and she was both funny and helpful. My recommendation is to do the early morning tour on either Sat or Sun. I will do another tour with Co Van Kessel.
Do this your first day in Bangkok!!. Fun, friendly, entertaining and worry free. Really gives you a good starting point for your adventures in Bangkok. A first day or any day really MUST!

Best experience in Bangkok for me. These people will bring you a truly great experience. Wasn't sure about how biking could be fun but they take you through the whole town. We went through markets, biked next to the water, went on a boat, train and a sky train. They will also buy food now and then, next to the great lunch break and other breaks they already serve. Keep up the good work!

The greatest tour untill now. I did the 9 Hours tour with another couple and we were all Dutch .So the gide we haved Amy she was magnificant she spoke many Dutch words that was very nice .She explaned a lot of things during the trip we have many drink and snack stops and a wonderful lunch in a very nice restaurant .The tour is easy to bike for everyone it was of the nicest things i did on my vacation .So if you are in Bangkok do one of the tours you wil not forget it

Seeing Bangkok in a different light. My friend and I arrived for a weekend in Bangkok night. We booked for the Saturday 2pm tour. The tour started off at the main offices of Co Van Keseel where we were put into groups. Our group was with 15 people ( some children who rode on their parents bikes) We were given a quick safety talk and tried our bikes. Each bike adjusted to fit the rider. Helmets are available to all and are optional. The tour was very well organised. We had two guides - 1 leading and 1 staying behind the last rider.At no point did I feel rushed or crowded within our group. The tour takes you on a 3 hour discovery of the old bangkok town, kneeling buddah, flower market and China town. I would say that starting in the old town would be best as they run the other group at the same time going to China town first. China town is extremely busy and doing it later in the day maybe wiser than doing it first.The old town is gorgeous - hardly any cars and small walkways /allleyways . Totally different than the bustling city that you see when you arrive from the airport. There is water given out along the way so no need take your own. If you have a big bag you can leave it at the office for your return.This was a great afternoon out and well worth the money. I recommend this for everyone. You do not need to be overly fit to do this tour. It is a leisurely ride.

Fascinating long boat tour . Awesome tour exploring bangkok by boat. Pam was a great guide with great knowledge on the area. We were lucky enough to have just the 2 of us in the tour so it was very personalised to wamt we wanted.

seeing local life. the co van kessel tour was great! Our tourguide was really nice and even knew a few words dutch. She told a lot. We went to see kids at a local school, i really liked that part. You really see the local life in this tour. The route is nice and you don't have to in good condition to participate.

Good to see local side of bangkok. We liked to cycle through the small roads and markets you would otherwise not have seen walking around yourself but in general rather expensive for what you get.. The staff was really friendly and competent and the bikes where comfortable

Fantastic tour!! Do it for sure if in bangkok. Me and my 15 year old son did the 5 hour thine/boat tour and it was fantastic. You get to see all of the "real" Bangkok... Not just the standard tourist sites. The tour guide Tammy was great and she provided very interesting background on each of the sites that we visited. The biking portion was about 3 hours and the boat was about 2 hours. I was originally concerned about 12of us biking through Bangkok traffic however Tammy and her assistant York would coordinate at every intersection to get us through safely. They stopped and got us water every hour or so and at dinner time we had a huge meal at a local restaurant that was part of the price (although I don't think that's the case for the 3 hour tour. The only downside is that 5 hours can be tiring in the summer heat of Bangkok but we made it through and if you are able to do so I would suggest this one. You get to see the best parts of the city all at once.

Bangkok by bicycle. The experience to see more of another side of Bangkok. They start in Chinatown and let you see some of the alleys there. You will experience also a nice boatride and cycling in amazing Bangkok islands.

One of the best cycling experience ever!. I really enjoyed this cycling experience. It was really one of a kind. I even wrote a blogged about it here:-https://shamscookedwithlove.wordpress.com/2015/08/11/bangkok-on-a-bicycle-an-extraordinary-tour/

Fantastic afternoon bike ride. We were recommended to do this tour by friends, and we weren't disappointed.We both have been to Bangkok many times, and live in Asai, however we were definitely not bored riding through the back streets of Bangkok, and thoroughly enjoyed it.We did the three hour classic tour , and it was the perfect balance. It is a leisurely ride, that is flat. No exertion required.There were 15 people on our tour, it was not overcrowded.We had read that the tour get crowded and that multiple groups converge at the same points. Although 3 groups of 15 appeared to set off at the same time, we only passed one other group, who did the route we took, in reverse.The tour guy Mr A, was excellent. He made sure that everyone was aware of the rules, about photo taking etc, and also remindered people again at stops. This ensured that there was no issues, as expectation was set at the start. Tommy the guide at the rear was also really good. Don't expect to stop every ten seconds to take photos.Although we were travelling, in narrow passages and sometimes crossing busy roads, both Tommy and MrA were in control and I felt totally at ease.Get on the bike and enjoy the ride.Definitely would recommend and would try other tours the company has available in the future.

A must do tour in Bangkok. One of the highlights of our stay in Bangkok. We did the 5 hours boat/bike trip with our three kids (aged between 7 and 11). Although the trip is not very difficult, it was a good decision to have our 7-year-old take a backseat. He enjoyed it very much, as did his older brothers and it made the trip more relaxed for us. We were taken through the narrow and noisy streets of China Town and as soon as we crossed the river, we found ourselves in quiet and relaxed countryside. Our guides were good fun and professionally and safely guided us through the traffic and alleys of Bangkok. I highly recommend this trip for anybody visiting Bangkok...even if you're not Dutch

Must do. Really let's you see the real Bangkok.You will cycle through small streets and it's a great experience. Very good Thai guide who speaks good English. A lot of nice extra's, like a little break where you eat different kind of nice Thai fruits are included. Can definitely recommend this.

Great 5 hour tour. Great tour through Chinatown and after that through the plantations in the outskirts of the ancient Bangkok.If you are planning to make a tour, I recommend you track your tour by GPS so you can see where you have been. It make it possible to visit the markets you see during the ride afterwards.

Very crowded tour. A Co van Kessel tour is a good way to see Bangkok by bike but the groups are big (20 persons) and sometimes there are three groups in the same route. Lunch with 80 persons (4 groups) was also pretty crowded. I would suggest a tour with a business at smaller scale or with small groups.

Great way to see local life. During our stay in Bangkok we decided to book the 4 hour tour at Ko van Kessel for different experience and to see more of the real Bangkok. This way a great trip, taking the bycicles through small streets, cycling over busy markets (and this appears to be very normal judging from the locals reactions), taking a long tail boat out of the city and cycling back. A great experience and worth every Bath. Very highly recommended during your stay in Bangkok

Very disappointing. Maybe our expectations were too high, but the afternoon 3h bike tour from Co van Kessel was a big disappointment. We had heard and read good reviews of the activity, labeling it as one of the best things to do in Bangkok.The moments when we were actually cycling were nice, but most of the time you are more or less walking with a bike between your legs. The streets are too crowded and small and the other people in the group kept using their cameras while cycling (despite instruction by the guide not to), which made moving in a nice flow even more difficult. The first stop of the tour was at a random temple. Instead of telling something about the impact of Buddhism on Thai life or the rituals the Thai people perform at the temples, the guide was preaching about his interpretation of what's good and what's bad. The second stop was at the flower market, where you get 15 minutes of time to wander around before trying some Thai fruit. This took up more than 45 minutes of the 3h-tour biking tour. After that, we walked/cycled through Chinatown back to the office. Basically, what the tour does is show you some parts of Bangkok without putting it in context. The information given by the guide is very, very limited. That's a shame, given there's so much to tell and explain. I would recommend anyone who is interested in discovering and learning about Bangkok and Thai culture to do a proper guided tour. If you're looking for just a gimmick - bicycling in Bangkok - then you'll probably have a good time.

Top tour. I did the tour with my girlfriend. We had the 8u tour. We saw a lot of the unknow of Bangkok. We also did a tour outside Bangkok. That was great, we came back with a longtailboat, that was quite a experience :)

Second time biking in Bangkok and still loads of fun!. Although biking through the busy streets of Bangkok would seem somewhat of a challenge at first sight, it is actually highly feasible and really worth your while. The guides of Co van Kessel showed us another side of Bangkok whilst biking through narrow alleys, walkways etc. The tour was even easily done by our children of 10 and 8 years old..

Mongkhol. It is one of the best thing that you must do when you are in bangkok I would like to recommend it to everyone,biking in bangkok to see some where that you never expected to see before,it is so easy to get there you can go by sky train and thake tho express boat to sriphraya pier

Excellent tour, 3 hours. The first day we visited Bangkok we did this 3 hour bike tour. It was a fantastic way to see Bangkok. Our guides, On and Joei were really sweet and funny. They explained everything and showed so much off the city. Thanks!!!!

Visit the real back alleys and life in Bankok - 9 hours. Took the full day tour (9 hours) that went thru the back alleys and outskirts (suburban) areas of Bangkok. There are points along where alleys are too narrow and bridges too steep that you'll need to hoof it (ie: walk your bike). Speaking of bikes, don't get the mountain bike, opt for the traditional hybrid / granny bike instead - it has cushioned seats with spring suspension; your butt at the end of the day will love you for this. Perhaps bring cut off biking gloves too. I took a spill and \the gloves saved my hands!! Wear shoes / maybe sandals, but not flipflops. The included sit down lunch in a village in the middle of a rice paddy out in the middle of nowhere was sumptuous - unlimited food. I think you had to pay for the drinks at lunch, but they were very cheap. There were included drink rest stops along the way, and you will also visit a temple.This tour is not all bike riding, this also includes a boat ride, and old train ride, and finally, the modern metro to get back into town, so there is sufficient rest in between and suitable for ages 10 and above.Our tour guide Andy definitely loves her job !!! Thanks for the memories !BTW, this tour is limited to ~10 riders per group, if there more, then another group is formed, due to busy traffic conditions and small alleyways - not easy stopping traffic for 30+ bikes to go by.

Excellent tour. When visting Bangkok again i definitely would do this again. It is fun biking around in chinatown, take boat thru klongs, have some afternoon lunch. We had the 5 hour tour and it did not bore a second.

Great way to see Bangkok. We loved the classic 3 hour bike tour. We took the morning tour and our guides Top and Esme were fantastic. We saw so much in 3 hours and learnt a lot about the city and the way of life from our guide. Getting about by bike meant that we could see more in the 3 hours than we would by foot, but it still felt close to the action. I think we would have missed a lot of hidden gems on a bus tour. We probably wouldn't have tried cycling around Bangkok on our own as the traffic can be so busy, but the route that the guides took us on avoided most of the traffic and felt perfectly safe. I'd recommend this for anyone visiting Bangkok who would like to get a real feel for the place and likes a bit of energy.

A must for all visiting Bangkok. After more than 30 times to Bangkok I was recommended Van Kessel Bike tours - the 3 hours tour. That's the best thing I have done for years in this amazing city. I absolutely recommend this trip as a "Must Do" in Bangkok. The tours are very organized with a highly dedicated, motivated and professionel staff. All bike tours have 2 guides and they takes you through interesting parts of Chinatown, Flower markets etc. I have now done it 2 times and next time I will for sure try the 5 hour tour.
excellent but pricey. The trip itself was excellent but was a bit expensive. This does seem common for excursions in Bangkok though.

Great tour. We (2 adults and 2 children aged 8 and 11) really enjoyed our cycling outing through Bangkok. Its a lovely way to see a different side of the city and very doable even for kids with no 'city cycling' experience. We did the 5 hour tour which left at 7 am and believe this is really the best option: not too many participants and the weather was not too hot yet.All in all a great experience. Our thanks go out to Top and the rest of the team.

Must do in Bangkok!. We did the 3 hour bike tour and it certainly belonged to the highlights of our trip through Thailand. You get to see a completely different side of Bangkok. Noona, our guide, was the sweetest person ever and told us a lot about the surroundings and Thai culture. It's not the cheapest tour but the money was all worth it. Next time I'm in Bangkok I'm doing the 9 hour tour!

Expensive long day. We were half an hour too late. We still did te 9 hour Tour but missed tr best part. So we only saw a lot of green Bangkok; not the Chinatown and market part which is the best part. Too expensive for what you get.

A must do while in Bangkok. Great guides, fun routes, good lunch and memorable places to visit off the beaten track. Very well organised tour. Be prepared for some narrow paths but overall suitable for all ages.

Fun way to see Bangkok. A was such a good host! Outside of showing us the inner chinatown without tourists, he teached us all about Thai fruit and how to peel and eat them. I would like to recommend the bicycle tour to everyone.

Best part of our trip to Bangkok. A great way to see Bangkok. The tour takes you around some great of the tourist track areas. Gives fantastic insight in other parts of the city including some countryside. Cycling was straightforward and not difficult at all as routes were carefully chosen

Just do it!. We were so glad that we've done the tour at Co van Kessel. It was one of the highlights of our holiday in Bangkok. Cycling through Bangkok really provides you with a different and close-up view of the life and way of living of Thai people in Bangkok. It is a fascinating and very colorful tour which will guide you from small streets with clothes and fabrics to streets with shops full of 2nd hand car & motorcycle parts to beautiful temples across the river and fruit markets. We've done the tour with our kids (8 and 11 years) and it was very relaxed; the roads and the pace was easy to follow. You hardly encounter any traffic, as you're cycling through small roads, streets and tracks away from the main busy streets. The tour guides are very professional. We really recommend this tour to everyone who's visiting Bangkok. Just do it, you will not regret it.

Again a great day :-). This was the second time we did a bike tour with CvK tours. We did the 9 hour tour and it was great. Nuna, Eddy and the other girl (can't remember here name, sorry) were great tourguides and showed us the real Bangkok. Also the lunch was exellent. This is a "must do thing" when you visit Bangkok.

Riding a bike in Bangkok made easy. Fantastic tour with professional guides. They really do their best to make you feel at home in Bangkok. Makes riding a bicycle in busy Bangkok look easy. Great trip!

Best tour in Bangkok!. We did the Co Combo 5 hour Bicycle/Boat tour and it was one of our trip highlights! We had so much fun weaving through Chinatown and all over Bangkok on a bicycle. The tour rides at a pretty slow pace because you are with a group, following one another down small alleys, crowded streets, and through busy markets. It does take some concentration to make sure you don't hit anything/anyone, but that just adds to the adventure. We got to see so much of the city that we wouldn't have been able to on our own. The bicycle tour also reaches areas that are not accessible by tuk-tuk or car. Same goes for the boating portion of the tour. We wouldn't have had time to get past the city limits without this option. It was a really great experience navigating through the narrow klongs, exploring a small floating market, and riding bikes by lemongrass and galangal farms. The tour also includes a delicious riverside lunch to fuel you up for the last biking portion.Our tour guides were knowledgable, personable, and funny! They really added to our experience. This combo tour is the perfect option if you are looking to get an authentic Bangkok city experience as well as a taste of the countryside nearby.We can't recommend it high enough!

Very nice Bangkok experience!!. Very good experience, we had bad luck with the rain but it didn't get the spirit of the guides down. They told us a lot about Thailand while we were sheltering. There were a bunch of small kids who held us back quite a bit, I would advise every parent to wait until your kid is capable of cycling through narrow paths to go on this tour. The guides were patient and experienced so this wasn't really a problem. Thanks for the tour!

Best way to experience Bangkok. Good guides, good english, good speed also for the kids. The neighborhood you cycle through are normally not a place to go for by foot as a western, you will feel ashamed, but by this bike tour it is ok (maybe Kessel is sponsoring the people in these areas?) Nice combination with a long tail boat trip (don't miss the hugh monitor lizards sitting alongside the river).

A must when you visit Bangkok. We took the 5 hour tour and this is really a must when you visit Bangkok. You get a flavor of everything.First, it is not that you are sitting 5 hours on your bike pedaling at a speed of 19km/hr. No it is a slow paced trip with a lot of variety in scenery but also in how to move through the city.You will be taken through very narrow streets in very poor areas but also to the more rich areas. You will be cycling through markets but also through rural areas. You will cycle , walk and transported by the local boats. We got all of this under the perfect guidance of Eve and Earn. Eve and Earn thank you for making this nice trip, perfect.

See the real Asia!. A friend recommended (and joined me as she lives in Bangkok) on this tour for myself and my 9 yr old son. We'd already a spent time visiting temples etc and doing the normal touristy stuff but this was so different. For one thing, great to do with a child. Tour guide really friendly and go out,on Dutch type bikes exploring through the tiny back streets of Chinatown. You are taken to places you would never dare explore yourself and see how people in Bangkok,live and work. Sadly, in a lot of poverty but opens your eyes to what it is like for many. Get to visit a market and a temple and lots of stops for snacks and drinks on 3 HR tour. One of my fav things I did in Bangkok and highly,recommend!!

Experience exceeded expectations. At first we were afraid it could not live up to all the enthusiastic and positive comments we had heard prior to making the booking. Indeed, this experience definitely exceeded all our expectations. Our guide, Nuna, is professional and speaks fluently English in a clear way. She pays close attention to the wishes and needs of the group. In the beginning we thought the group was too big, however Nuna and her assistant managed easily. All in all, we had the best bicycle tour possible and we can recommend it to everyone.We choose to do the 3h bike tour. We would consider doing the 5h or even the 9h bike tour if it wasn't so expensive. Don't get me wrong, when comparing it to other bike tour operators this one is the cheapest, but for us it is simply too expensive to do it twice.

Fantastic cycling Bangkok experience. This is the way to explore Bangkok in an alternative way. You will visit places and streets where you would normally not go. Especially in and around Chinatown and the 'other' side of the river. We had a lovely time. Also with a four-year-old girl sitting on the back of the bike (waving to all Bangkokians) this is a very nice tour.

Best way to see Bangkok. Did the 3 hour trip with noona a couple of days ago with 10 year old and 13 year old. We had only arrived in Bangkok the night before and we're getting used to the heat. Loved the trip and the chance to see the other side of Bangkok that we probably wouldn't take our children by ourselves. Parts of the cycling is pretty narrow but the Thai people just waited for us to go through. Loved it and thoroughly recommend booking.

A great way to see the other side of Bangkok. My friends and I opted for the five hour bike/boat combo tour and we had an absolute blast. Our guides were extremely friendly and knowledgable about the local area and we felt completely at ease throughout the tour. The places the tour takes you are more or less inaccessible in any other way apart from by boat and bicycle which made it feel even more special. I'll come again and bring the family on this excellent adventure!

What a way to explore Bangkok!. We did a 5 hrs tour by bicycle and boat and had a great experience. You see Bangkok from a different angle. You explore Chinatown in an unique way and the bicycling is very easy to do.

Good Tour and Glad We DId It. This is a decent tour. I had a hard time deciding between the 5 hour and 9 hour tour. We chose the 9 hour tour. It was a good way to see areas you would never see. We rode our bikes through narrow alleys and spaces and shops that seemed to go on for forever. It was really cool to see everything. My favorite part was the first hour going through all the shops. We got on a train to head out of the city for 45 minutes. It was an old train and that was kind of cool. We rode our bikes along canals and a meter wide path where if you fall off then you're falling 10 feet down into water. I'm not sure if you do this for the 5 hour tour but you need to have a little level of fitness and be somewhat confident on a bike to do turns and pass mopeds on a 1 meter wide path. There were normal paths too. We saw some nice sights. Lunch was excellent. There was plenty of food and they catered to different eating restrictions. We always had water and snacks on the trip. Our main guide was upbeat and playful and fun. There was no talking from the guide really about culture or the buildings. Two of the guides didn't really speak English. If you were in the front, you might have heard her say things. By the end of the day, it was exhausting riding the MRT back to the Tour Company. The boat ride was nice and a nice perspective to see all the people on boats and see a lot of houses along the river. So it is a good tour. I'd give it 5 but there was not much talking from the guides when we went past certain areas or when we stopped so we really didn't learn much other than seeing the sights. If I were to recommend it to my friend, I'd tell them to do the 5 hour tour unless they really wanted to see it all in a long day. Bring your sunscreen. Water was plentiful from the guides. Get a good bike seat because 9 hours is long.

Awesome!. Discover Bangkok by bike! Ride through China town and the old city, visit some highlights and sometimes its like you almost ride through peoples houses! Very cool experience and you are taken good care of when it comes to drinks and snacks from the excellent tourguides!

Night tour is a must do. If you only have one night in bangkok, you should spend it on the night tour. I learned more about Thai culture from Jackie, our guide, than in my previous week in Thailand. She showed us Buddhist practices, fruit markets, flower markets, and the local lifestyle. The biking is fast enough to warrant bikes, but slow enough to look around and take in the sights. All around super fun.

Five stars for the best Bangkok experience. We did the 3 hour tour and had the best time ever. Saw places of Bangkok we never even knew existed. Exceeded our expectations. Our guide, Noona was the sweetest and most helpful guide who was able to tell us many things about the culture and our surroundings. Recommend it to everyone!

2h long tail boat tour very worthwhile!. We did the 2h longtail boat tour in July 2015. Clear recommendation, it was very interesting to see the new historic part of Bangkok, on wooden house built at the little side arms of the Chao Phraya. Also it was really fun going on the boat. We were 2 families, 9 persons altogether, which fit nicely. Our tour guide called "M" did a great job, very pleasant, friendly and knowledgeable guy. Only he could have explained a little more by himself, maybe. We also brought a two year old infant along, no problem. He enjoyed being on the boat, and fell asleep during the course of the ride (even though the boat is not going slow at all ;-) )!

Must do in Bangkok!. This bike tour was fantastic! Great route, you see a lot of different places in Bangkok like the markets, some temples and Chinatown. Cycling through the narrow streets was so much fun! This is a must do in Bangkok!

Fantastic tour but parents read first!. I did a lot of research and chose this company because they were extremely flexibile and offered the exact tour I wanted- a 5 hour bike tour that combined a long tail boat tour and that also went to floating markets (not the big touristy one but a small local one). They allowed me to pay a supplement (equivalent to another 2 adults) so that the 4 of us could go on a private tour and start at 9am instead of 7am. I have 2 daughters aged 9 and 10. I had read another review where 2 girls of similar age coped with this tour. I have to say that although the company was fantastic in every way and provided great bikes of appropriate size and helmets etc, riding in Bangkok is not easy even for an adult let alone a child! Within 5 minutes of starting and riding in narrow laneways which twist and turn and trying to avoid people, animals and scooters my younger child was crying and couldn't continue. One of the two female guides we had took 2 bikes back and brought my husband a bike with a little seat and my daughter sat behind him for the rest of the tour- problem solved! It was a little difficult for him but she is only small so they managed. The other daughter gritted her teeth and continued but once we went in the traffic (yes main roads with trucks, cars, scooters, tuk tuks driving within inches of us) my heart was having palpitations and I was questioning my parenting skills. After a while you do realise however that whilst we aren't used to this kind of chaos on the roads, the Thai people are and somehow it works :)After leaving the backstreets of Chinatown you cross over the river and ride through coconut plantations riding on 1m wide concrete paths over water with no barriers - again causing palpitations for the adults let alone the children. We also boarded the long tail boat (bikes and all) and went to a floating market trying food along the way. We ended the tour with a gorgeous lunch in a little restaurant by the river. Despite being hot and scared at times, we had the best time ever. We saw so much that we never would have otherwise and Miss Prem (our main guide) was informative, kind, patient and very professional. We will definately do a tour like this again when we visit Bangkok and highly recommend it but just be mindful of children. Whilst our girls can ride bikes competently in Australia (although probably don't ride as much as the average Aussie kid) it is very different doing so in Bangkok.

Excellent. amazing bike-tour. It took about 9 hours and the guide took us to very nice places around Bangkok. Cycling through a crowded market, rice fields or on the concrete paths between the villages, it was lots of fun.Thanks.

Fietstocht van 5 uur. We did the 5 hour biketrip, starting at 7 o'clock. I think that's the best time to start because the temperature is still nice and you start in Chinatown which will be more busy if you take the tour in the afternoon. The bikes are in a good condition. Our guide M did a good job, his English was good and he could even speak some Dutch words. You need to have some skills to ride a bike in the narrow streets you sometimes go through, so would definitely recommend this for Dutch people. The nature you go through with this tour is beautiful, you will never discover this by yourself.

Unique way to see Bangkok. Not for those with balance issues, but a great way to experience Bangkok in a unique manner.Our family of four got to ride through crowded Bangkok and into the countryside. The riding can be a bit technical at times as paths are narrow, but as long as you know that going in, you'll be fine.Highly recommended!

Bike boat tour of 5 hours, very good value for money!. I did the bike-longtail boat trip of 5h with the Co Van Kessel organisation which I booked on the internet the day before. Overall, the organisation was very professional. Our guide, "Mr M", was a local who spoke excellent English. The bikes were in a good condition. It is a great way to go off the touristic tracks and discover another Bangkok. The trip by boat through the klongs in Thonburit was a great experience, as was visiting the Chinese market and biking along the plantages... I can fully recommend it!

Different cultural exposure, amazing, professional, worth the price. We booked this bike tour very last minute. Our tour guides were amazing. I would recommend this organization to everyone who visits Bangkok. It is absolutely worth every baht! Just look at the picture and message me for more details if you want. Do it! Even the other tourist said that this tour was better than alternative bike tours.

Great way to see Bangkok. We are an athletic family of 4. Two teenagers with parents in their late 40s. We have hiked the Inca Trail, climbed Mount Kilimanjaro, and all of us have run half marathons. This was a blast. If you are not moderately fit, this might not be the tour for you. If you have a GoPro attach it to your helmet rather than trying to record from your cellphone. Definitely take an optional helmet!We rode the bikes through Chinatown, through no less than two markets, including the flower market, along the river, through the Canal Zone and negotiated numerous 90 degree angle turn with nothing but swamp to fall into. Along the way we visited two ways, made our own lotus flower offering, ate ice cream, learned how to properly sit and pray in a Buddhist Temple. And had a tasty lunch. In addition to that we rode in a long boat along the river. All in of this in a 5 hours time. The total ride was just under 11 miles, per my Strava biking app.All of us thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Our guides Jackie and Tom were helpful and knowledgeable. They were very concerned about our safety. We gives this ride 2 thumbs up! Highly recommended!

Fantastic. Friendly and knowledgeable guide accompanied by two more discreetly caring staff for a group of 12. Exciting discoveries off the noisy, busy and hot streets. Ingenious mix of biking, sightseeing, cruising on water roads, temples, local market life and food. Highly recommended. We'd preferred the mountain bikes but it works well with the city version too. Next time again as still a lot to discover this way

See Bangkok, that others do not !.. Having some hours to pass away before going home, we decided to book a 4 hour cycle ride to see the Chinese Quarter. We went from the shopping mall where the tour starts, and our guides give us an explanation of what we will see, so we go down some very narrow, winding alleyways, to the small " taxi " boat on the Chaopraya river, crossed over to Wat Arun, and began our tour of the Chinese Quarter. Now this is something a lot of tourists will not see, a system of narrow streets, with small " home style " businesses of every description, car/van / lorry repair, fruit/veg sales, clothing, baking, etc. We stop at a Temple for refreshments, and to look at the decorations that adorn the temple, we were lucky, because in two days time, they were about to celebrate the Chinese New Year, and everybody was running around, getting things ready for the big day.
