Again, we meander thru the narrow, winding streets, stopping at various points for refreshments and a chat with the guides for points of interest.We cycle back to the river, cross over, and make our way to the Chinese Flower Market. This place is massive, it is where all the flowers come in from China, Vietnam, Cambodia, to be sold to other markets, hotels, restaurants, but the sale of the flowers takes place in the very early hours of the morning ( about 02.00 ), so we see the preparation for the following early morning sale, lots of people pushing barrows, carrying baskets, buckets of ice, water EVERYWHERE !, and of course small food stalls ( stir fried crickets with chilli was a favourite of mine, yum yum ! ) .Back on the bikes for the last lap of the tour, down narrow streets, and eventually, arrive back at the shopping mall, for cooling towels and a drink.This trip is about 4 hours long, and it takes you to places that you will not ordinarily see in Bangkok, the pace of the tour is relaxed, not the Tour De France, it is a look at a community that has established itself over centuries, but has kept itself private to itself.Well worth the money and the experience...DO IT !.

Amazing way to see a Bangkok!!. I've been to Bangkok a number of times for personal & business and always thought about doing this Bike Tour. Wow! I should not have waited. It was a great way to see different aspects of the city; Chinatown, temples, canal boat rides, plantations and a good meal on the 5 hour combo tour. The bike ride was at an easy pace, away from busy streets with well organized and informative tour guides. Dress for the heat/humidity but the tour guides will keep you replenished with cold water throughout the tour. I'm planning on going back to Bangkok next year with my kids and other family members. Taking this bike tour again is a given.

Great five hour family biker ride. . If you have some time to spend and want to experience something spesial, join Co Van Vessel bike rides for a tour. Joined the five hour tour today the 24.06.15 in Bangkok. Decided at 1100 hrs, was on the bike at 1300 hrs. My 13 year old daughter and 17 year old son loved it as well. My son said it was the same fun like riding a waterscooter, which pretty mutch says it all. He rode a bike witch had a monkey bar steering. Gave him the laid back style he wanted. And gave me a lot of laughs. And my daughter loved when we entered a primary school, speaking with the pupils. My wife was also enjoying, even though she didnt ride a bike since last summer in Norway. I really liked the small back alleys riding though where the locals live. I was wondering if the rating was to good to be true . But it wasn't, it really is a must and a good chance to go clear of all the shopping centers around. Tip: Use a ekstra minute to adjust the seat and finding your perfect bike.

Good but could be better. This is the 2nd bike tour we have done in Bangkok. It was well organised and the guide was enthusiastic. It was also great that there was two guides - where one rode at the back incase we lost someone throughout the busy streets. The tour description was accurate and so overall we enjoyed the tour.However in comparison to other tours we have done throughout asia - we felt that the guide could have provided more information on the areas that we rode round and I would have preferred a helmet.The highlight was the Long-tail ride up the canal - I had never seen this side of bangkok and this was my 5th trip!

Amazing, fun and informative tour!! Must do!!. We did the 5 hour bike and boat tour today. We have 2 daughters 14 and 17 years old. It was the best way to see the real Bangkok. We saw things we would never ever have found by looking ourselves. We cycled through alleyways viewing dwellings of locals, through markets seeing local workers doing their thing. We travelled by bike, ferry and longboat to explore this amazing city. We ventured into the green belt of the city to view some farm land. Poverty, middle class and a touch of wealth is seen. We visited a school and temple and travelled along the klongs.... It's like 5 tours mixed into one. AMAZING!!! Our guides spoke fabulous English and were a pleasure to spend half the day with. Thank you to Andy and Tammy. I would recommend this to anyone who can ride a bike.

Diffrent experience in BKK. If you have one day free time at Bangkok and you like ride a bike or do alternative sight-seen it suits to you.I enjoying doing different way to visit the city, and the day pass very fast, nice combination of transportation.

Wonderful way to experience Bangkok. Enjoyed every single minute. Just watch where you go, and get ready to sweat and drink lots of water. Also get ready to enjoy some fantastic sights, not only on the bicycle but also on the canal boats. It is a fantastic way to see the Bankok that lays behind the main streets, and see everything there is to see on the canals, from floating kitchens, to derelict houses, to luxury. The stop for lunch will be a very welcome respite, not only because the food is great, but because in all likelihood you'll be tired, starving, and happy. Our guides were very friendly and I thoroughly enjoyed all the info they had to give. The tour is very well organised and the team there obviously take pride in the name the company has built for itself.

had a great adventure. If you want to escape the city and are a bit tired of temples and want an adventure, take a tour with Co Van Kessel. I took the 9 hour bike, boat, train tour around eastern Bangkok and had a great time. Tour guides, Nam and BoBo were absolutely wonderful. One of our group had a flat tire and you should see these ladies in action. Great job! Included are snack stops water stops, lunch and afternoon snacks. I learned how to load a bike on a train, escalator and up three flights of stairs. We road on concrete elevated walkways over canals with no guard rails in some places- scary!

A great way to see all the ins and outs of the city!. A group of friends and I took the 5 hour bike and boat tour and it was outstanding!! You get to see all the little back streets of Bangkok that you might not normally venture into. The boat ride was great fun and the bike ride through western Bangkok was absolutely beautiful! Top it all off with the most amazing Thai dinner and it makes for a wonderful way to spend a day. (A tip-- eat something small before you go because the dinner is not until near the end of the 5 hours.) Our guides Ami and Thop (sorry if I spelled it wrong!) were also super informative and entertaining! I highly recommend this tour for anyone looking to see Bangkok from a different angle!

Amazing day!!. I was in Bangkok on business with one day off so decided on the 9 hour tour to cram as much in as possible in the time I had and boy this was the way to do it. I saw things there is no way I would have done otherwise and the tour guides, Bam & Bobo were awesome and really made it a special day. Typical of Thai people they were helpful, friendly and kind. Couldn't have had better guides or a better experience!! If you're in Bangkok your really need to look up Co van Kessel!!

Amazing experience . We did the 9 hour tour on bike. The guide showed us the eastern part of the city. You see things that you never had found by yourself. After biking in our around the city we went with a old train outside the city. The train was kind of old but completely fine and we enjoyed the ride. We ate a very delicious meal at a restaurant(very spicy). After we biked alongside the canal and went with a longboat back to the sky train. The last mentioned was a little bit boring. Finally we biked back to the meeting point. I can recommend everyone to do this trip if you want to see more then the most popular places.

Great way to see the real Bangkok and suburbs - 100% customer service. Do this tour - 100% value for money, 100% servicemy husband and I had 2 days in Bangkok, we wandered around the first day and recovered from jetlag, I'm so glad we spent the second day on this tour! We did the 9 hour tour -cycling, canal and trains.It was well worth getting up early for, our two tour guides were excellent, Jackie and Miss BoBo, they were both very interesting and gave us lots of information throughout the day, it was worth it to spend the day in their company - top service (and I never say that).We saw temples, cycled around the narrow streets of Bangkok, I never felt nervous cycling as the guides ensured we were safe throughout (you only need to be moderately fit), we got the train to the suburbs, cycled along the canals and got insight not how the locals live, we had the most beautiful lunch in a little countryside restaurant, as it was so hot they encouraged us to rest after we ate - the guide and landlady put out cushions for us to lie down on and we had a 20min snooze on the patio! I felt like royalty we were so well looked after. Ad hoc toilet breaks and water stops were no problem. I also like the ethics of this company, they hire trainee staff and give them the opportunity to learn English on the job so they can be promoted to guides in time.

Great afternoon discovering hidden Bangkok. We decided to go for the 5 hours tour from 1.00 to 6.00 and really loved it ! Our kids aged 10 and 8 managed it thanks to the great support of our guide.We cannot recommend enough that tour. Beautiful small streets, non touristic temples, nice boat trips,....Just Do it !

Speedboats in the klongs. We did on May 20th the 5 hours boat tour. Different boats for different tracks. It was a very nice experiece. The speed boats went very fast but stil safe anough. A very nice lunch was also include, more than some snacks!We also did visit a temple and a school. Aspecially the school was extraordinairy nice because of the exercise the children did to learn how to marche.The tour is with a guide per couple.

Best tour of hidden Bangkok !. Waouwww ! Amazing bike tour with Co Van Kessel ! We knew bangkok already and loved the city but loved it even more since we discovered the tiny streets of Chinatown, some very hidden markets and houses.... if you have 3 hours available don't hesitate! Bangkok backstage !

Best Thing We've Done in Bangkok!. We did a private tour, family of 4 with a 12 year old and 4 year old (in back seat). We flew in the night before, so the kids were tired. The bike seat for our 4 year old was so good, he was able to have a sleep along the way. The places we were taken too blew us away. Non touristy temples and back alleyways we would never find our way back to. We wanted variety, explaining a combination of country and city. A tailor made private tour was organised 3pm until 8pm. Perfect timing and variety. We cycled out of the city, took a longtail boat up the river and through the water villages to the green belt. Cycled through various plantations, had a sensational Thai dinner, cycled some more. Back to the longtail boat to the city. We fed fish in the river and performed a prayer in the Chinese Temple - things we wouldn't have felt appropriate to do without the help of our guides. Pacsoi and Top were our guides. They were so good with the children and looked out for our family so well. Pacsoi is one of the most joyous people we have ever met. Will certainly return and do other tours. Can't speak highly enough of the entire experience!

best 5 hours spent in bkk.. 5 hours of well organized and interesting tour to see the real bangkok. appropriate breaks and taking boat transfers, going through non-touristy chinese temple and thai temple, school and many many back alleys and fields. the guides are really sincere and friendly, definitely concerned about ensuring everyone is well hydrated. lunch provided was simple yet delicious.Definitely recommend to anyone visiting bangkok!*all drinks and food provided. you need not fork out another cent. no scams, none of bringing you to tourist places

Best tour we did in Bangkok. At the beginning we weren't completely sure about doing this tour because of the prices - compared to other things in Bangkok it is not that cheap and our budget was limited. But 30€ is not that much so we gave it a try! We took the 5 hour bicycle/boat and it was the best thing we did in Bangkok without any doubt! Everything was perfect, from the arrival at the meet point (which looks pretty nice) to the smily guides, the awesome places we visited that you will never go alone, things we learned about Thai culture, food we tasted...awesome!

A must do tour in Bangkok! Wonderful!. This was one of the highlights of our trip, we did not have high expectations for our time in Bangkok and only spent one full day in the city. We heard about this tour from some people from Holland we spent time with on another tour in Chiang Mai. Our guide "A" was great, very helpful and really seemed to care about supporting the local people especially the ones along the tour route. We went all through Chinatown, saw how people live there. Then toured a little way outside of the city into the plantations where is was amazing to see all of these small farms right inside the city and how the families that run the plantations live. My wife and I are not into the nightlife aspect of what Bangkok has to offer, and this tour EXCEEDED our expectations significantly. We were lucky to only have a group size of 4 people, which made it even better for us. I would highly recommend this tour, we did the 5 hour tour that started at 7AM, helped us to beat the heat a little bit and gave us the rest of the day to explore Bangkok a little bit on our own.

Best Bangkok Experience . We did the 5-hour bike and boat tour and it was a wonderfull experience. Peng was a great guide, very clear and funny. The tour was well organized and perfectly planned. Good bikes, enough stops to drink or seeing highlights and a great lunch! Furthermore the tour with the long tail boat was amazing. Do not take to much luggage with you, water is included and our guide gave us some extra clothes for entering the temple.

see the locals and navigate through lanes and markets. I found this bike tour to be relaxed , fun and a good way to see some local character of Bangkok.There were about 15 of us , ranging from 16 months old to me ( 50 something!) .We biked through back lanes , stopping at a flower and vegetable market , two temples ( one with the largest sitting Buddha in Bangkok ) , saw a tower of children ( 5 on each others shoulders ) and dragon parade in Chinatown. Short stop for refreshments - no charge , and free bottled water all the trip.Easy to find the meeting place ( I took a Taxi there from city , but came back via the train which is a short walk Hua Lampong ).
Very nice tour.. With two kid, age 5 and 7. The 7 year old one on his own bike. No problem!. Great tour, a must in Bangkok

Great bike tour. This was one of the best things we did in Bangkok. The guide was really good and route was a mix of hidden back streets with a few big sites thrown in. I loved seeing the back streets at night, and the flower market was fun. Highly recommended.

Best Thing we did in Bangkok. You have to do this. We did 3 hours, and that was perfect. "A", our guide was fabulous. Fun, informed, and relaxed. Highly organized, no concerns about safety....we had 3 kids along.

Awesome (and very Dutch) way to explore Bangkok. With the heat I was slightly concerned if I'd enjoy biking around for ~3 hours, but I have to say we were happily suprised how much fun this was. It's an absolutely amazing way to explore Bangkok. The very experienced guides know every small little alley and show you a beautiful view of Bangkok. This is a must do recommendation for everyone visiting Bangkok - assuming you are quite comfortable on a bicycle.

Must do bike tour!. Absolutely loved this bike tour in Bangkok. I booked in advance and had my hotel write the address in Thai for my cab driver. You get a free drink (water/soda) when you arrive. Our tour guide spoke great english and took us off the beaten path. It was a great way to see how those in Thailand truly live. Make sure you know how to ride a bike because I was definitely not at the top of my game. At one point we rode in the opposite direction of traffic but no need to worry. No one has the opportunity to speed or drive fast since it's so congested. I learned when walking the street to just keep the pace, drivers/motorbikes will stop for you or go around you. If I'm to visit Bangkok again with family or friends I would make sure to do this tour again!
Great ride. Amazing views and very friendly guidance. The food was great, and the experience is something no (Dutch) person should miss out on. We love Peng!

A feel for the real bangkok. Fun and refreshing!. Awesome tour! The great way to see Bangkok and a highlight of our trip to Thailand. This company was very professional and knowledgeable and fun! Thanks for the great time! Would recommend to anyone visiting Bangkok.

Boat tour. My folks, fiance and I went on the rocket boat tour. Our guides were Andy and Boo. It was only the 6 of us, which made it extra special. This was my fourth trip to Bangkok, but I had never seen any of the things Andy showed us. 5 hours and three different boats.They offered us snacks to try through out the trip, and and bought bread for us to throw at the cat fish. We stopped off and Andy bought us noodles for lunch which we thoroughly enjoyed. Getting in and out of the boats was not as easy for the folks as it was for us, but Andy and Boo were always there to assist and it really wasnt a problem.The market was an eye opener for me, but I was glad I finally got to see a "live" market like that. I was glad Andy and Boo were there to explain to us what we were seeing. Going to places where it felt like we were the only tourists there was an absolute highlight. Walking around shops that had no english on the glass panes, and seeing the wooden houses along the klongs made me feel like we were seeing the true Bangkok.We couldn't have asked for better guides to see these attractions with. Andy is really special and Boo(Crab) is going to make a wonderful guide soon. It felt like family.I will recommend this tour to anyone visiting Bangkok. You are in for a treat.
Bike & boat tour was exceptional value for money. The route was great to areas that most tourist would not see & the lunch that was included was superb.

Must do trip in Bangkok. 3hour biking trip through the hidden secrets of Bangkok, places where you would never come without a this guided biking tour. The two guides were very friendly, explaining things about the history of Bangkok, buildings, places etc.

Co All Day Tour. We had a very fun day on the bikes with our guide Em, we were well taken care off and he even spoke some Dutch :-)We really liked the combination of modes of transport, ofcourse the bike, but also the train, the longboat and the skytrain. We would recommend this tour to everyone who is not afraid to get on a bicycle and to explore Bangkok.

Surprising. I did the 5hr Tour at 13:00 with Luna. She is a very sweet and happy girl and a great tourguide. It was very relaxed and diverse and included nice (and vegetarian) food. You'll discover Thailand from a different side that you will normally never see.

Great Intro to Bangkok!. My husband and I did the 9 hour tour - which is quite the workout but gr8 way to get all aspects of Bangkok. Jackie and Mr. York were amazing guides and the whole Co Van Kessel team was an absolute treat!! We had to move our date and I also hoped to receive pictures taken during our tour. They were prompt I'm responding and accommodating. Wish we would have done another trek with them. A Definite thumbs-up!!

A different view of the city. Had a great time on this tour which shows a different side of the city and mainly Chinatown. Going through streets only a little wider than the bike itself the tour took us through places you normally wouldnt find. We went on the 5-hour tour which is very doable for anyone. The included lunch was very good also!
Great tour. This 5 hour tour was fantastic.We could to see so many great things. The boat ride in the klongs was also great. The lunch we had was outstanding. Big recommendation

Outstanding fun!. We did the 5 hour tour on the morning after arriving in BKK. Great solution for the jetlag. K. Em is a great guide and with K. Tammy bringing up the rear the group stayed together. It was an exciting tour through and over the highways and byways of Chinatown, through alleyways and the fishmarket. Brief tour over the river and canals and continue biking through the country-side. Some of the paths are just 1 meter wide so basic bike-skills are a bonus, plenty of interesting stops, foto moments, refreshments and a delicious lunch! So, of you do anything in BKK do this tour. Get out of the shopping malls and get down amongst the Thai. See another part of BKK, you won't regret it!!

Was Skeptical, had a great time. Didn't think this would be all that great. Had a really fun time. Prim was our guide and she was friendly and informative. We weaved through china town alleys, took a couple long boats, saw temples, went through rice paddies, at a great lunch on the canal served by a really nice family. Would not have had a view of Bangkok and the canals in this fashion if we hadn't done it this way. Bikes were good, totally safe and fun. Prim was great, ask for her.

Great adventure in Bangkok. I chose the 9 hr full day tour, and was very satisfied with everything. The guide Mr. M was so nice that he kept checking the situation of the members because it was really hot. As we felt thirsty, he provided the cold water and freeze tissues. The tour requires skills and brave to ride on the narrow path above the canal. It also requires energy to ride under the heat. It was challenging and I am satisfied of this exciting adventrue. It would be more infomative if we could have more stops for introduction.

A must . We have just finished the five hour bike and canal tour, we choose the morning departure due to heat and the fact that we went with our children 12,11 years and a 8 month old. They had a bike with a baby seat for him. I would recommend the morning tour due to heat defiantly if your taking children of any age.The tour was great I highly recommend it. We all enjoyed it every part was fantastic, it wasn't to hard but you do want to know how to ride a bike.

5 Hour Multi Boat Tour. As my daughter's enjoy travelling around Bangkok on the rivers, we selected the 5 hour multi boat tour. There were only 4 of us on the tour as well as a guide. Our guide was very helpful throughout and once provided us with an excellent insight into each of the places we visited.

This is a must do!. At first a 5 hr bike and boat trip might sound too much under the Bangkok heat, but it's a must. At the office, the staff are very helpful and friendly and speak good English. The guide, a young thai girl was an asset to the company. The bikes are acceptable and you go through all the areas that you probably wouldn't go and would definitely get lost in if you did. You are taken to the other side of the river and it is really easy and comfortable on a pushbike, so you don't need to worry about keeping up with everyone else, because trust me, you won't be the slowest! The canal trips are a welcome relief from the heat and the food when we stopped at a local restaurant was a good standard. We even stopped at a local primary school and the kids try out their language skills on the tourists which was a breath of fresh air, which reminded you of an age in England in your childhood when you didn't have all the politically motivated sickos thinking the worst. Of all the places and people who deserved a contribution in my travels in Thailand, this school was it, but no-one asked and I didn't offer because I thought they might no offended, my friends thought the same. Id rather tip a worthy cause than a drug addled moronic tuk tuk driver! Please do this trip, I know I will when I go back again. Take a hat though

Don't miss it!. We did the 5 h bike/ boat combi and it was amazing! You will get an unforgetable experience cycling through Chinatown and on sometimes narrow streets our of the centre of Bangkok. Some stops at tempels where we learnt a lot from the 2 funny guides Backpack and Andy.Also the trip with the longtail boat through the canals and on the river you will never forget again!A delicious lunch and drinks are included.

Best Trip Memory in Bangkok. If you are in Bangkok and have time, book a bike tour with Co Van Kessel. I did the 5 hour bike/boat tour and it is one of the best experiences from my trip to Southeast Asia. If you have not ridden a bicycle in a while, you might want to practice (it had been 50 years for me!). Most of the tour is on flat surfaces, but the pathways are narrow and I did walk some of the tour, just because I was a tad wobbly. The tour is well-paced with good breaks, and the canal trip is fantastic. We have been home for two weeks now, and my friend and I are still talking and laughing about everything we encountered and learned. We bypassed traditional tours of the top tourist attractions to do this bike ride and are glad we did.

We did the 5 hour bike and boat tour on the 23rd of march. The tour was very nice . You go on a bike and visit the 'other' part of Bangkok. We went thruogh small streets, markets, jungle and temples. The 2 guides were funny, informational and gave us a safe feeling in a busy city like Bangkok.The longtail boat rides were also a nice change of transportation.The tour was well organised with enough food, fruit and beveridges.Is was a very positive experience and can advise this to every one

Absolutely brilliant - a fabulous day out!. We booked the James Bond Half Day Tour for four of us and have to say it was the best decision we've ever made! We are regular Bangkok travellers so wanted to do something different and this trip delivered on all levels.You meet at the office (which is buzzing) and met our tour guide Amy who was absolutey wonderful - I cannot praise her enough. She was really helpful and informative and seemed as if she really enjoyed our trip also (which I thought was impressive).Our trip should be highly recommended - we particularly enjoyed the visit to the food market in northern Bangkok, so much so we will go back ourselves next time we are there.We had a most wonderful time and cannot recommend this highly enough - the canals via the James Bond boat was truly exhilarating and not to be missed!

Great experience!. We booked the 5 hours bike tour for this morning. Our youngest two kids (1 and 5) in a child seat and the oldest (7) on her own bike. What a great tour it was! Two lovely guides, everything super organized and the most important thing, a great view on Bangkok by bike and boat. Even for our daughter it was easy and safe.

A MUST-DO in Bangkok!. This tour was absolutely one of the best things we did during our entire trip to Thailand. We had our two teen kids with us and we all absolutely loved it. Riding bikes through the narrow alleys, streets, twists and turns of Bangkok was incredible. This tour is a great way to see "true" Bangkok and get you out of your shiny hotel to see how the city operates. The markets were incredible and Co Van Kessel does a great job of making strategic stops along the way to sample food, drinks, etc. Make this tour a priority during your visit to Bangkok!If you / your family can not ride bikes, this is not a tour for you. But if so, you will be SO glad you did this tour.One suggestion...to find them, take a taxi to the Sheraton Orchid and just walk down two blocks to Co Van Kessel's location.

One word...Fantastic!. Did the 5 hour tour on March 16th with my partner. Led by Emmy and Tami we had the most extraordinary experience. They showed us the most beautiful parts of Bangkok. Biking through Bangkok is a wonderful experience none like we had ever had. You will see things you wouldn't normally see, the true hidden treasures of Bangkok. The included boat ride shows you the wonders of the "Venice" of Bangkok. Please do not hesitate to take this tour. You will not regret it!

Our best decision for Bangkok!. We did the 5 hour combo tour at 1pm. We really liked it, it really was off the beaten track. We biked through a lot of small streets. We did stop quite often to take pictures or to walk around a bit. Often they offered us bottles of water. The lunch stop was great, we stopped in a small local restaurant and got lots of food. Our guide was very knowledgeable, she explained a lot, about the environment, about Thailand in general and their habits. She was quite funny too. Luckily they also have bikes with good kid seats, as we didn't want our 5 year old to ride around in a busy city. The tour was safe, but we didn't want to take any risk. We only stayed a few days in Bangkok, and we are so glad we took this tour. It really showed us a different Bangkok then what we discovered on our own.

Well worth the early rise!!. The combined boat and bicycle tour ("Combo") was well worth the early rise. We did take a taxi from our hotel at Sukhumvit 30 minutes ahead of time at 6:15 and he had to do quite some searching and asking, so we arrived 7 minutes late which was not a problem. Taxi price however still only 120 Baht (some four dollars). The combined boat and bicycle tour is great, the boat trips are part of the full tour and you take the bikes with you on a fast river boat. The tour takes you to temples, Chinatown, market, narrow streets, but also a couple of kilometres through a more agricultural area. Lunch was included and top notch at a small mom and pop shop along the river, Pensri restaurant (not separately listed on TripAdvisor). Sufficient water was also provided along the way. Bicycles were in reasonable state, it is worthwhile to make sure your tires are hard enough before departure.Our guides Aorn and Jinny were cheerful and got along well with my two young adult children. A little bit more explanation of everything we were seeing along the way would have been possible, but overall this was an excellent way to see something of the real Bangkok.

Amazing!. Wow, what an amazing day! With my mother I booked the 5 hours bike & boat tour. Andy, our guide was so relaxt and enthusiast and showed us all the nice little streets in Chinatown, but we also went to the more quite places like the farm area just outside the city centre. Their English is really good and they even know lots of Dutch words. The boat tour was amazing, you get to see al the house from another point of view. No doubt, just book! P.s. The atmosphere in the office looked great so If you have a job for a Dutch girl, please give me a call :)

Amazing full day bike trip. Ms. Water took my girlfriend and I on a great and exciting journey in this 9-hour bike tour of Bangkok and the countryside ! Right after checking in at the office, you select your bike then... it starts immediately ! No transfer needed; we liked that a lot. First is an exhilarating ride through Chinatown's streets and alleys; it feels like you get to see the "real" Bangkok. Then a train takes us to the countryside where we rode next to a canal next to which the locals live. We got to visit a quiet temple and taste delicious local food. Finally, a long-tail boat brought us back in Bangkok and we finished the ride in the city. Ms. Water provided excellent factoids about our various stops and was eager to answer our questions. She was also very helpful when my girlfriend experienced some trouble during the ride and we felt very secure with her at all times. We highly recommend Co Van Kessel's bike tours ! The 9-hour one felt a bit long for us, but there are shorter versions available.

Must do tour.... If you want to see whole Bangkok, you must join this tour. In addition to see a lot of cultural and interesting places, the guides and their professional manners were excellent. Do not miss it...

An "off the beaten track" must do tour. As all Dutch people are pretty much born on a bycicle, this tour appealed to us very much. And we were not disappointed. After having found the Co van Kessel location, you are welcomed in a really friendly way. Given a drink and introduced to the rest of the people that you will be riding along with on your tour. You get to pick your bike of choice which is either a normal citybike or an all terainbike. We chose the latter. This one has no place for your belongings so make sure to bring a daypack. However, the thick tires will proove to be more stable to some extent while riding through gutters and such. 2 tourguides will acompany your group. You ride through bikenarrow alleys, along sleeping Thai and playing children. Traffic is insane but you'll be fine. After a while you get to a jetty where a longtail boat takes you across the river. Enjoy the peace and quiet there. Enjoy a great early dinner which is served some time later. This, I think, is pretty much the ONLY way to get a feel of what Bangkok really looks like. Away from the malls and tourist traps. If you can ride a bike, do so and book this tour. Book ahead of your stay as it trends to fill up really fast. You Shall not be disappointed as this is by far one of the best tours we've done in years. If this review was usefull for you, please let me know by clicking "usefull" so I know I was of help to you.

Amazing tour through Bangkok. I was doing this amazing bicycle trip wiith my sister and parents and we all agreed that this was one of the best experiences on our vacation and something that we really will remember for the rest of our lifes.Cycling through the neighbourhoods, markets and narrow alleys in the city was really exciting. The tour lasted around 5 hours, but don`t worry, it was not too much, even for my parents who are almost sixty.The guides was very good as well and took good care of our safety and provided a lot of information along the route. We also had lunch at a small local restaurant along the river which was fantastic.I can highly recommend this tour for everyone and I will for sure do another one when I return.

Best day ever!. I loved every minute of the 5hr trip. The narrow path above the water was a bit tricky and maybe more suitable for the experienced cyclist but it was a really nice area which I am sure I would never have been otherwise. The guides were lovely and all the little children along the road giving us enthusiastic high fives just adorable. The food was delicious and the overall ambiance was great. Co van Kessel tours was recommended by many friends of mine and it did not disappoint. Truly my favorite day during my week in Bangkok.

Fantastic! Highly reccomended! . Did the 9 hour tour through Bangkok and it was truly amazing! Our guide, Amy, was amazing and she took this already excellent tour to a whole other level. We got to see plenty of different sceneries and tasted a lot of fruits and other local foods. We travelled by train, boat and skytrain and this provided some nice moments to sit back and enjoy the view. 9 hours is long, but there are plenty moments to rest and get a drink. We never did a tour that was so impressive and in which we felt so well taken care of! Well done amy and co van kessel tours! Thank you for an amazing day!

An absolute must whilst in Bangkok.... What a fantastic 5 hours. Great way to see many parts of the city most tourists wouldn't see. Riding through the alleyways first thing in the morning was truly memorable. We chose the 5 hour bike and boat tour from 7am to midday. Our tour guides "On" and "Ginny" were so fantastic and friendly. We stopped for a lovely lunch with plenty of gorgeous Thai food. This was my first visit to Bangkok and this tour enabled me to see so much more than I originally expected to due to it only being a two day visit. 3300bht for the two of us, in my opinion good value for money. Couldn't recommend it highly enough, if we had time we would have done the night tour to explore other areas too!
Perfect way to discover Bangkok!. Had a blast with this tour! Andy was our guide and she showed us Bangkok on a bike. It is kinda expensive, but all worth it!

Best Way to Get a Taste of Bangkok. We did the 7:00 am until noon bike and boat tour. It was a 'behind the scenes' look at Bangkok. We wound through narrow alleyways of Chinatown, into a huge wholesale market, selling flowers, vegetables, fish and more to small shop owners. They even had a group exercise class going on in the middle of all this activity. We stopped at a beautiful temple, and a market where our guides bought local treats for us to try. The boat rides took us through an extensive system of canals, unseen from the busy streets above. We navigated concrete bike paths through banana groves and residential areas. The tour also included a delicious lunch of traditional foods. All ten of us couldn't say enough about this incredible experience!

Now we have really been to Bangkok!. The three-hour tour was one of the highlights of our visit - we got to see the real Bangkok. Thanks to the friendly and expert guides we were able to cycle the hidden back streets with confidence and never worry about getting lost! So much to see and plenty of stops for looking closer, taking photos. We really saw the life of the city exposed and vivid to all our senses. I cannot recommend too highly and would do it again tomorrow.
A big joy to bike in Bangkok. Everybody can do it, the bike tour. It is great fun. You see places, houses, people you would not meet otherwise. It was great.....

Definitely worth to do! . Really nice tour and the people there are so friendly! Forgot their names but we had a very enthusiastic girl and guy as a tour guide. Their English was outstanding compared to all other Thai people I have spoken to at my one month Thailand trip! It was nice to see that cycling was interspersed with two boat trips and lunch. So if you are doubting, please do it! You won't regret, I promise!

Even better than I expected. I read a lot about Co van Kessel's tours before booking and now that I've done the tour I can only say that it is an experience we'll never forget. Me and my girlfriend did the 9-hour tour and it was amazing. They truly show you a side of Bangkok you don't get to see, or maybe even know about, if you haven't done the tour. 9-hours might seem like it's a long time spent cycling and that it might be difficult, but there's quite a few stops. Some in the form of a visit to a temple, or just a quick drinking/snacking pause, and of course the train ride, boat ride and lunch (which was really good and at a very nice location in the middle of some rice fields). We had a very good tour-guide as well who could tell us all the details on the places we visited and was very kind.

Great experience . Great tour of Bangkok. Guides takes you through the narrow streets of Bangkok as well as to the outskirts where life is very different from Bangkok city. Longtail boat was great, a nice way to see the real Thai life from the canals.

Dont miss this!. Without a doubt- the best thing we did in Bangkok. We took the three hour bike tour and had a blast. The tour guides were a lot of fun. We had a crazy bike ride through alleys in Chinatown so narrow the bike barely fit. Visited a huge wholesale flower market and crossed the river to visit a temple and have a snack. We learned how to open a lotus flower to leave at the temples, and our guide introduced us to our new favorite treat- the egg banana. More biking through the canals and we were done. So much fun!

Must do!. This was allready my third time.. But everytime Bangkok and this tour amaze me! With great guides you will see the otherside of Bangkok! I would highly recommend this to everybody! Jacky was a great and funny guide!

Excellent guide made all the difference. We completed the 2 hour Chinatown tour. It was fabulous. Seeing parts where no tourist would enter. It's certainly worth paying for a tour to Chinatown as you can then make the most of the place. The tour was very professional. The guide exceptional. I only wish we had time for their bike tours too!!We will be back. But next time with an empty stomach as the food in Chinatown looked devine!

The coolest thing we did in Bangkok. I´d hate to think of our 4-day visit to Bangkok without this excellent 5-hour bike tour. There were approximately 25 of us at the outfitter and we were divided into smaller groups of about 8 people and two guides. From the start we were lead through a labyrinth of backstreets and saw parts of the city where most tourists probably do not venture. It gets a bit narrow and crowded and at a couple of points we had to either dismount from the bike or be extra cautious in order to navigate through very congested areas. But what fascinating urban scenery! Along the trip, there were a few noteworthy stops to visit temples, etc, which really rounded out the experience nicely. You eventually reach the end of the road - quite literally -- and switch briefly to river boats - bikes and all. From there, it´s a fascinating trek through the jungles of Bangkok and often you are pedaling on a somewhat narrow strip of cement in a sort of residential jungle, with daily life happening all around you. Lunch was a decent, relaxed affair and a nice time to make smalltalk with the others in the group. Our guides were super-friendly and competent. Cannot recommend this experience enough to those who appreciate a more active, adventurous way of getting a closer look at things.

Bike and walking tour Van Kessel. During our stay in Bangkok, we decided to take a 3 hr bike tour on our first day and since it was so good, we booked a walking tour for the day after. You ride through area's of Bangkok and you visit places which you would never find out on your own. During both, the staff gives you every opportunity to take pictures and all the time they give you lots of background information. The walking tour through China Town is in the oldest part of Bangkok. Thanks to the guides ( they are very communicative and extremely friendly - and funny) we learned a lot of the ancient part of this huge city.Thanks !!

Chinatown by bike. Amazing how quiet a mega city like Bangkok can be when you are exploring on a bicycle! We were with a group of 10 cycling through the old narrow streets of Chinatown. Markets, temples, people's backyards you can just cycle anywhere. We did both sides of the river and there is a fabulous cycle path along the river. Wonderful guides and well organized 3 hour tour (classic) Highly recommended

Fantastic experience on the Khlongs. We spend half a day on the khlongs with our fantastic guide Noona! She showed u around on the local market, giving advice and lots of information, thereafter we had a fantastic tour on the khlongs. Very well organised and exciting tour. You see the other side of Bangkok.

Great unusual bike tour!. Great biketour to see Bangkok from another, more local, view. The classic tour takes you to places you wouldn't go yourself. Both pace and atmosphere are relaxed. Guides luckily don't talk much they just lead the way. Great experience! M is a funny and good guide!

Fantastic experience. We spend our xmas and NY vacation with the family in thailand . Stending a few days in bangkok around Xmas , we had planned for an afternoon bicycle tour with the kids . Not nowing what to expect and a little bit concerned how to manage with the young kids .This was a great experience for all of us . We were perfectly coached be Nuna and Eef . They showed us around and toke care of all are needs . We discovered many suprising places and the lunch on the way was fantastic . The combination with the longtailboot gave us also the opportunity to see things from the water .The kids loved it .A big thank you to Nuna and Eef .We will do this again sometimd

Super Fabulous . Would never have seen this side of Bangkok without this amazing tour! Hidden, much more intimate side of the city for sure. Took the 5hr tour - bike and boat. Was a good pace even for non-cyclists. Guide was happy and informative. The tour was a little hectic at times, but made it exciting rather than negative. Raised sidewalks in the countryside were amazing. Early dinner was very delicious, just make sure you eat lunch before you go!

Co Van Kessel Bike Tours. Me and my husband did 5 hour bike/boat tour and it was the best tour. We enjoyed it thoroughly.We are vegetarians so for lunch they did provide vegetarian food as well. Local guides were speaking English and were very friendly. i would recommend it highly. Money well spent.

a great way to see Bangkok secluded from the touristic attractions.... We did the 5 hour bike + bout tour with a group of 5 of us. We did this together with 2 guides (one was Jackie a young quirky very enjoyable lady) and 3 dutch guys. So our group had a nice size as we learned throughout the tour.The bikes that were provided were in perfect condition.Now biking through Bangkok might sound like an adventure for westerns and.......well it is. But I felt safe throughout the tour.One point why we chose this tour was because we had already seen the main attractions of Bangkok and now wanted to see the more rural parts. We sure saw this as well.Food was provided on a boat, nothing overly fancy, normal thai but sure tasty. Also water was provided at the start as well during the breaks. (free)The 2 guys in our group (we were 3 girls, 2 guys) were a bit suspicious when we introduced the idea of this bike tour to them but were really happy to have done this afterwards.As was me - happy enough that we are going on another tour when back in Bangkok (which will be in march ;) )

A must do!!. I booked a 3 hours Co van Kessel classic bicycle tour just 1 night before on the internet when I was already in Bangkok. I did the tour with my 2 year old toddler, who was seated in the back of the bicycle in a toddler seat. The tour takes you through the very small alleys of China town where you never ever go by yourself. They take you to a very nice market where you walk around a little bit, they buy fruit for you you dont know to try, and you go to a temple, then you take the ferry to the other side of the river and stop at another temple and a nice park. The tour was so nice (my toddler liked it too) that I was sorry I did not take a longer tour! This tour was really one of the highlights of our visit to Bangkok! Next time I definately will book a longer tour! Thanks also to the 2 guides that were really nice with my toddler!

must do in bangkok!. if you wanna see the real bangkok this is the best way to discover. we did the whole day tour and it was great. on the way by train, boat, skytrain! make your own experience ;) and also love the team!

Must do when in Bangkok!. Great people, lots of fun, beautiful sights, lovely food! Do it again this feb or mar. We had some great tour guides that made lots of fun with us and were very enthousiastic about Bangkok AND biking. The boattrip included was more than worth it. Even saw a crocodile! Amazing for every age!

great way to see the city. We did the six hour tour which was half biking and half boat trip. We went down narrow, little alleys in China town, along concrete paths that wound their way past pandan rice leaf fields, rode in a long boat and had a wonderful Thai lunch. Our two local guides were courteous, friendly and made sure we were safe in the traffic. I felt un rushed and had plenty of time to enjoy the scenery. We saw a side of Bangkok and the surrounding area which we would never have found on our own. It was an inspiring day and we would recommend the six hour trip to everyone.

Fantastic half day trip, a must do!. We found Co van Kessel via the internet and it was the best day in Bangkok ever. It was an early start to the day because the tour starts at 07:00 but it was worth it. You are not going to get a better sightseeing tour peddling your pushbike through Bangkok. The eclectic mix of what makes Bangkok terrific is exactly what this trip gives you an insight to. Chinatown, longtail cruise through the canal and river, rich and poor suburbs and plenty of temples and other sights is just a small part of what's been imprinted into my memory. If you don't take this trip then you are missing out. Our compliments to our guides: Mr Paksoi and the lovely Dream made it a special morning, thanks guys!

Must do when in Bangkok. The 5 hour bike/boat tour was fantastic! It was a thrilling experience to cycle in Bangkoks Chinatown. Visiting the fresh market, temples, a great lunch and full speed on the Chao Phraya river! You don't have to be fit to join in, as the pace is very low.Just do this tour, you will not regret it!

We are really disapointed... We did this 5 hours trip by bike and boat.the positiv point was the tour is very well organized and the guides are friendly. but the tour is boring, you don't see very nice places. they told you, that you will see places that you never will find on your own. that's true. but this places you don't need to find. It wasn't nice or beautiful places. You are cycle around in outskirt, where is nothing to see. in our opinion, this isn't the money or the time worth.

Sights I would have missed otherwise. Great experience, the sights during the bicycle tour were awesome, it really gives you a different impression of what Bangkok is. They take you through many alleys in Chinatown which I´m sure I would have never seen otherwise. The bikes were in very good condition and in our group there was a three year old girl with her mom and the attention of the staff to accommodate them was amazing.
Amazing . Absolutely a must for Bangkok! See the real city, bike through crazy small streets with the best guide ever! Paksoi is what we had to call him! Enjoy this awesome ride

Great fun. This is an excellent and fun way to see different aspects of Bangkok. We did the 5 hour combo trip - approx 3 hours cycling and 2 hours long tail boating - and booked directly the day before via the web-site. You don't pay in advance. The web-site describe in detail the various trips on offer. We did the early morning, which I recommend as it is cooler. The trips are suitable for all age groups and you don't have to be an experienced cyclist - just a bit brave. Path are in places very narrow, unguarded and 'obstacles' are frequently in your way. The pace is slow and the terrain flat.The guides very lovely, helpful, funny and informative and the lunch included at a local restaurant was very tasty.The reason for not giving the event an 'excellent' rating is that the bikes could have been a bit better maintained and helmets should be offered.

Bike and Boat Tour. I was visiting Bangkok for 2.5 days with a friend. We wanted to explore the City with all its different aspects, so we liked the idea of the combo tour. After a nice welcome and the first free drink we got our bikes. The tour started at the office and led us directly to Chinatown. We took small roads to a Chinese temple and to a market hall where we tried funny but yummy food. Cycling was fun and safe cause the two tour guides took good care of us leading us through the traffic. After a while in bustling China town we crossed the river with a boat. On the other side we cycled along the river. Shortly after we arrived at the temple with the huge sitting Buddha. Later we got on a long tail boat and enjoyed a fast ride through the small canals of Bangkok. The trip took us to a more rural area where we got on the bikes again. After a beautiful ride we got a great lunch at a small bar next to a canal. We took the boat back to city centre and cycled back to the office. It was such a relaxed and atmospheric way of exploring the different faces of Bangkok. We do definitely recommend this tour to everyone who wants to see and experience a lot in a relatively short time.

A lovely sportif sniff of Bangkok. Had the pleasure of discovering a bit of Bangkok's innercity, it's surroundings and public transporation on a bycilce day tour under the guidance of Luna and York, two of Ko's excellent guides.A MUST DO, no physical training required, just an open mind and eyes all over :)

The best way to discover Bangkok. It was my second tour with them. Last year I did the 3 hours tour which was great so I decided to go for the 5 hours this year. It was simply amazing. The boat trip is great, the visit in rural Bangkok is surprising, full of colours and tastes. The lunch provided was excellent. Some friends did the 5 hours tour 3 days later and it was different to mine which means I'll do it again next time I have the chance. This is a must.

Great! Would do it again. An awesome tour, you see Bangkok in a really different way. You see how the locals live and see parts of Bangkok you'd never discover by yourself. The tourguide was really nice, told us a lot, so learned some things about their way of life and traditions. Did the 3 hour tour at 2:00 pm. It was warm but not too warm, because you're moving and the wind is blowing down your face a little. You're not biking very fast, so you're not sweating because of the physical effort. If you're an early bird; ofcourse, do the early one! We got some free water when we left, on the way we got some water and in the end got a soft drink and little snack.A little pricey but certainly worth the money!

Must do in Bangkok. My wife and I did the 3-hour night tour, and it was well worth it. The guide was informative and fun, but the really pleasure was in getting amongst the locals, cruising sidestreets and alleys, dodging cats and dogs, and getting a glimpse of life that tourists rarely see. If you only have 1 night in Bangkok, do this!

Incredible tour!!!. My friend and I participate to the classic 3 hours tour and it was AMAZING! We just loved everything, cycling through the small streets of the city and visiting spots that you would never see if you try to go by yourself! I felt very secure because the guide new his way and we had another person at the end of the line avoiding people to get lost. The tour guide was funny and he spoke quiete good english. They gave us 3 drinks and also food. Sometimes was a little difficult to ride in veery small streets were the floor is not regular. I'd give a 5 for the difficulty levelbut I definitelly recommend this tour!

Great tour!!!. My friend and I did the 5-hour tour on the 20th of october. We've seen a lot of Bangkok: Chinatown, small streets, nature etc. The lunch was very nice, longtailboat great and the travel agents from Co van Kessel were so kind. If u decide to go to Bangkok, do the tour!! Its really a must!

Fantastic!. My girlfriend and I took the 9-hour bike tour last week and it was fantastic! We were lucky that we were the only members of the group, so we had a private tour. During the tour we went through the narrow alleys of Chinatown, went on a train outside the city where we biked through the countryside. We received complimentary drinks and snacks at many occassions, including Thai lunch in a nice restaurant. On the way back we put the bikes in a longboat, which brought us back to the city.The tour guide was very enthousiastic and had great knowledge about many aspects of the city. I would encourage everybody to take this tour because it is a great way to explorer the city of Bangkok. It's definitely "off the beaten track".

Absolute must!. We booked this tour as it came recommended to us through various friends. It was absolutely wonderfull. We booked one day ahead through their website and everything was super organized from the get go. Biking is just a great way to see some parts of the city as you just buzz through. We booked a 9h tour so we also got to go to the outskirts of Bangkok. It was super relaxing as well as beautiful. We stopped often for the much needed refreshment and had an amazing lunch near a rice field. The guides were very thoughtful and we were well provided for. Little local snacks here an there made for a wonderful experience. Bangkok is beautiful and this trip is an absolute must if you want to see a little bit more than the tourist routes and would like to get away from the frenzie. Again, absolutely wonderful.

City bike trip. Great city bike tour that takes you in the real city life, through the smallest streets, the busiest markets and ancient neighbourhoods. See China town, smell the food, hear the local language and get surprised by it all. Our entire group and my friends who advised me this loved it.
Wonderfull way of discovering bangkok :-). You see bangkok from a complete different side ! Cool & fun. Small streets, boat, cool stop with local food. (3h tour)

Great way to experience Bangkok. The manager of the hotel I was staying at in Koh Samui recommended this bike tour and Im glad I did.A guided bicycle tour in Bangkok Chinatown and its all of its hustles and bustles, and through working class and middle class neighborhood, canals, temples, and outside of the main Bangkok, I think its West Bangkok, the rural farm areas. Its sounds crazy, but this tour is FANTASTIC! This tour takes you places, and parts of the city you would probably never go by yourself, and shows you a side of the city that is very different from the big tourist attractions. We went through ridiculously narrow alleys, busy streets, sharp turns, avoiding the obstackes and market vendors, elevated narrow road, that if one quick mistake will get you down to the embankment - there was a few times that afraid I might fall in the water. I was so surprised how we went from the dense urban houses to the suburbs and to the farm fields. The pace if quite exciting and fast especially when we jump off into a long boat and the ride through the canals of Bangkok, It like a scene from a movie. The tasty lunch that was served was very tasty, the outdoor eatery by the canal was authentic tasting. Some of the best meal Ive had in Bangkok. Prepared by a very nice, friendly couple. Its just how I imagined local people eat. This was one of the best 5 hours tour Ive ever taken. It went by so fast, that I didn't want it to end. The group was rewarded with a great view of the sunset and the Bangkok Skyline. Thank You to our tour guide Amy and Yung. Very knowledgeable and professional. I really enjoyed them showing us their city, and sharing it with the group. I would definitely will recommend this to anyone visiting Bangkok. It is a MUST! Looking forward to my next trip back. I will try the 9 hour tour next time.

5 hour tour was amazing . The 5 hour tour through China town, the sub urbs and the longtail boat ride was really interesting. We had Great food and saw many temples. You see different stuff than being a tourist.

Awesome bike & boat tour in BKK. Me & my husband + my best friend & her husband travel to BKK 2 weeks ago & we would like to do something difference than just shopping in BKK. We joined the 5hrs bike & boat tour at Co Van Kessel. This is such a great idea to visit the heart of BKK with the bike & boat, we had a lot of fun even most of the road are very narrow or we hv to go thru. the busy China town & flowers markets & so on.....but this made the tour very challenging! We'll recommend to everyone who is going to visit BKK to join the tour.

Bike Tour in Bangkok. What a great way to spend 5 hours. We started in China Town and then crossed the river to Thonburi which was the old capital of Thailand. We made out way through small streets navigating the canals on one side and plantations on the other. We were afforded a rest as we took a long tail boat ride through the canals and had lunch at a small restaurant overlooking the river. The organisation and guides (A and Jenny) were excellent. They also pointed out restrooms when they were available. Great value.
Great fun ride. I think this is a great way to see parts of the city. I did a 3 hour ride and saw a lot. I would recommend it, some roads and paths are narrow but all in all a good time.

Do not miss this tour. Good experience, interesting tour and I saw things I would not have seen on my own. Every single bath spent is worth. Our tour guide was lovely, thank you Andy. The concept of this bike tour is great.I did the 5 hrs tour combining China Town and the canals of the west side of Bangkok. We even had a lovely meal on the side of a canal in a very clean and charming restaurant. As I said, DO NOT MISS YOUR TOUR.

Great experience. Had a great 5 hr afternoon riding around the back streets in Bangkok' through China town and along the river. Then we loaded the bikes onto a long tail and had a cruise along the klongs to the inner west suburbs in Bangkok and rode through a few villages in the suburbs. Great experience, not for the faint hearted though, riding along narrow concrete paths through the fields with no barriers on the paths, care needs to be taken not to come off as water on either side with lizards and possibly many snakes amongst the dense watery growth on either side.The two guides we had were very entertaining and knowledgeable.The only concerns I would have would be the fact that there was a thunder storm with lightning that was very close, I think this could be very dangerous, especially seeing we were riding along side the water when the lightning was striking.Would highly recommend this trip to anyone.

Fabulous way to see Bangkok. We had only two days in Bangkok, and the cycling tour had been recommended by a Dutch friend - we went on our second day, figuring we'd have a better idea by then how early we'd need to be up to travel to Co Van Kessel's offices where the 5 hour tour was to start at 7am. We arrived with plenty of time to spare and were glad we took the morning tour - not as hot as later in the day and the hustle and bustle of the market we visited on our trip was a delight. We were also fortunate enough to see the beginnings of the Chinese Vegetarian Festival. Our guide took us to all sorts of interesting sights which I gather change day to day and so the tour is always a different experience. We loved cycling through tiny alleyways, crossing the river on the ferry and then heading off on the long boats to then explore farming regions. A delicious lunch was had late morning and then back for more cycling and another thrilling boat ride! The 5-hour ride seemed daunting but it's an easy ride, mostly very flat save for a few small bridges (just hop off the bike and walk it!) and it really is the best way to see Bangkok. I can't recommend this activity highly enough!!

Great experiance! . This tour is a great way to see a whole lot of Bangkok! A great Dutch invention with thai guides who speak lil Dutch words because of all the Dutch visitors and origin. We did the 5-hour cycle and boat tour and we went to the vegetarian festival, veggie and flower market little india and a farm. You see a whole lot and cycle through streets and alleys you'll otherwise never see! The boat trips are very nice and a great way to get some fresh air and rest up a lil.The trip comes with a couple of cold bottles of water and a very tasty thaimeal, witch are well needed and deserved! Our tour-guide Andy was enthusiastic and fun! And spoke good english! The only thing we missed during the tour was more explanations of the places we have been. Make sure you ask a lot of questions and let them tell you whats going on! It helps being in front of the group near the guide! Book this tour!! Absolutely recommended!!
Must do. ... the early hours are the best. The trip through Chinatown is amazing. After with a boat around the 'new' town.

Just do it!. this was a fabulous way to see a different side of bangkok and we all loved it - 3 50yr women, 1 50yr man, and two young men - 21 and 18. It was a challenge keeping up with Noona, our guide as she ducked and dived through alleys and around cooking pots and squawking chickens but what was truly fab was being off road for 5 hours. We cycled down alleyways and along canal paths, went out into the jungle and market gardens outside Bangkok, through middle class suburbs and put our bikes on ferries and longtail speedboats. We visited off the beaten track temples and had a late lunch in a rickety street restaurant on stilts. A brilliant way to see traditional bangkok and stay off the roads and away from the traffic.

Great tour on the bike. This tour is amazing to do.On your bike you will ride between houses , narrow streets , take a longtail boat with the bike on board and have a nice lunch.Numerous great views and you get a great impression of Bangkok surroundings

Just do it! Co All Day. Fantastic experience, Bangkok behind the scenes! Some reluctance to go on a 9 hour Group tour, but as it involved the bike, boat, train and sky train it looked diverse enough. September, we had a group of 5 participants and 2 guides. So special attention all around from Pang and Andy, great and chearfull guides! First you were 'fitted' a bike, great to make sure you were comfortable riding it the whole day. The variation on this tour is exceptional, 'inner Bangkok' Town, Chinatown, Green zones via the ride by train (where the bikes needed to enter the train through the window), boatride and the continious care for the inner person. More than enough food and water was provided. Lots of fun and laughter, cultural awareness and a bigger picture of Bangkok. Thanks Andy and Pang!

A Great Way To See Part Of Bangkok. I decided to take the 3 hr tour they offered to see Bangkok from a different perspective. They offer a 3 hr, 5 hr and all day tours. Because I had not taken one of these before I felt a good way to start would be the 3 hr one. They offer regular city bikes as well as the 10 speed ones. Two people go along with you. The lead and someone in the rear to make sure you don't get lost. You go thru little back alleys of Chinatown, the flower market and eventually go across the river with your bike to explore the city on that side also. It was an informative, fun packed morning. They supply plenty of drinks also so you don't get dehydrated. No special skills are required. Just the basic knowledge of bike riding.

Excellent!. We did the 9 hour daytime tour. It started right at 9am as advertised and the tour guides Nuna and Jenna took us right into some really cool authentic Bangkok neighborhoods. They were both friendly and informative.. The tour goes thru some really narrow streets in several different sections of the city, a train ride, sky train, and a lot of river neighborhoods...even the lunch was at a very cool place...I would recommend to anyone visiting Bangkok to take this tour if you want to see the real deal..

Night tour in Bangkok with kids!. Great experience: a 3-hour tour from 6 to 9pm, through Chinatown, over the Chao Praya river, in Wat Po and Wat Arun by night (no queue no sun and night lights). I did the tour two times, and the maces were different but always interesting.Highly recommended for families (kids of 8-9 minimum).

A Bangkok must. This is a must do for anyone going to BKK. I had heard good things and I wasn't let down. The staff was great, the bikes where good, with several choices of styles and sizes. They had someone there to adjust the seats ect so you will b safe and comfortableThe tour itself was amazing, going down back alleys and along paths on the river. Seeing things you would never find yourself in a dozen visits. The group size was small and we had two guides, our main guide made things seem fresh even though I am sure she has done this hundreds of times. Getting to see the inner workings of this amazing city and the day to day lives of residents in areas you would never find on your own was fantastic.This is a very professional operation, with fun staff and a clear mission to show you "their bangkok"I am going to be in BKK again this year this time with a first timer friend and I look forward to taking then on this tour. If you only have time to do one thing in BKK this should be it

Great way to see Bangkok. We just want to say thanks to Jacky and Dream for the great 9 hour tour we did at Wednesday 27/08. They did a great job and it is the best way to see Bangkok. We came at spots in and outside Bangkok where we otherwise would never come. The guides were really enthusiastic!

Highly Recommended!. This is a brilliant way of seeing a side of Bangkok you’d never normally see on your own. Even if you did, you would not glean as much from it as you do from the friendly and informative guides who are in charge of your enjoyment and safety for five hours on this tour! You cycle through the fascinating alleyways of Chinatown, cross the river to Thonburi, see markets, temples and a local school, enjoy a freshly prepared, delicious Thai lunch, take a boat along some canals, feed hundreds of protected fish, and cycle through villages and market gardens. The ride is pretty easy and well paced too, so if you want to experience more of the ‘real Bangkok’ and see some local houses and lifestyles, this has to be one of the best ways to do it - it's fascinating!

Awesome bicycle tour . Best thing we did while being in Bangkok. You have to get up early in the morning but trust me, it's well worth it! The tour takes you places you would never go on your own. You go to flower markets, drive along alleys and visit beautifull hidden temples. It's such a amazing trip, you have to take it! The guide is very friendly and speaks English very well!

Great way to get to know Bangkok!. We enjoyed a 30km bike tour starting around 7 in the morning. It was a 5 hour trip including a great lunch. The guides were very professional and we visited places where you cannot go bij car or taxi.

An amazing journey. With 5 friends, we made the tour of 5 hours and we have not noticed the time passing. Accompanied by two adorable guides with perfect English and good humor, we traveled in Bangkok on bike and boat, tasted delicious Thai dishes, visited a school and walked through beautiful patches of nature. Even for the less energetic, the ride is really quiet. Only negative: it was not long enough!

The best way to really see Bangkok. We were recommended to do this tour in Bangkok by a Dutch traveller and we were glad we did. We only had time for the three hour cycle tour and it was fantastic. Great directions to the company's office and had the most brilliant tour guide called Jackie. Her English was brilliant and she explained everything for us showing us the real old quarter of Bangkok. The ride itself was very leisurely and we felt completely safe despite being in a group of 20 with 2 guides. We stopped off in the Chinese quarter first and went to a Chinese temple. We got tonight incense and explained the difference between a Chinese Buddhist temple and a Thai one. We then went on to a beautiful market and then a church. We later gently pedalled to a Buddhist temple with a 16 metre statue.What I liked was how we were explained how and why the Thai people pray at the temples and I got to find my fortune too! I hope it comes true because it was good :)I have found that a lot of Thai temples are a bit boring because we don't know what is going on, not having Jackie there to explain really helped. We crossed the river on a ferry and later stopped at a park for refreshments. We were given by the guides a bag of crisps and a soft drink which was very kind. After that we had a gentle ride back to the ferry and then onto the company to return lie bicycles. It was nice how when we were riding along the streets the locals would smile and wave at is, not all of course but a lot. There were even children high-fiving us which was cute. The tour was not strenuous but it was a very hot day so you do not need to be super for to do this. I definitely recommend this attraction as it is a wonderful way to see the real Bangkok and not just the hustle and bustle of taxis and business men. Ask for Jackie!
Great way to see Bangkok. I biked with them 5 years ago and when I was back in Bangkok this year it was the top thing on my wish list of things to do. Recommended!

Amazing experience. Being in BKK for a conference, i had little time to go sightseeing. Taking the bicycle tour turned out the best choice possible. We took the 5hr morning tour and it was great from start to finnish. I recommend this tour to anyone: it is a must do!

This is amazing. DON'T visit BKK WITHOUT having done this bike tour! It's really well done. The team is passionate and professional, the 3h tour (which we did) just envies you to come back for an even longer one! The real BKK life, China Town, veggie markets, the full monty!

Cycle tour - 3 hours. Met at their office at the River City Shopping Centre to collect our bikes and introduced to our guide "Jacjoy" and his assistant ( Dutch student ). We thoroughly enjoyed our ride around the tiny alleyways and side streets of Chinatown. The friendly of the locals was amazing. The reason I give it 4 and not 5 is - I did want to stop and take photos along the way, but our group was quite large and although I shouted I wanted to stop the guide at the front could not here us, and the guide at the back had to go back to base as she had a puncture and no kit to fix it.

Bangkok by Night. As a Bangkok resident I like to do touristy things now and then. It does not matter how long you've lived in a city as vibrant as Bangkok: There is always something new to discover.I enjoyed the Bangkok by Night Tour very much and can recommend it to residents and visitors alike. The cycling is easy and the vistas wonderful.My only recommendation is that helmets should be made available to the tour's participants.

Great way to explore another side of the city. We had the 5 hour bike/boat tour. Great way to explore different sides of the city. Biking through backstreets and peoples backyards, so it feels. See how the people live and work. But the residents are always friendly and wave and smile. Cold water included, aswell as a nice hot meal. This was the highlight of our trip to Bangkok!
Great experience. Really nice to see the other side of bangkok. Good food, real nice sites etc.You should go in the morning though, the afternoon it is getting way too hot.,

A great Bangkok experience!! a MUST do!!. We did the 5-hour tour, which offers a great deal of variation in what you will see from Bangkok and surroundings. We enjoyed it to the max. You'll pass through busy BKK-streets, followed by ultra-narrow alleys in china town after which you head for the outskirts which are surprisingly green and quiet. Lunch, bikes, breaks, guide, all perfectly taken care of. My compliments and I will definitely go here again when I am in Bangkok.

best bit of the bangkok trip. Did the 5 hour combo. Me , wife and 19 yr old son. The wife wasn't confident so after about 20 mins the guides got her back to base in tuktuk and we carried on. The two guides were really good one very chatty (Japjoy) and a quiet lady. tour takes you in and out of chinatown, over the river, into a monastery, out into the countryside, a boat trip for about an hour around the canals. The meal (street food) was really good and plentiful. Best time to do the trip is early morning as the markets not too manic. At first seemed quite expensive (1500 baht) in bangkok terms but well worth the money. go for it.

Check out a video preview of the tour. This was a fantastic tour with Jack and Andy. I did the 5 hour bicycle/boat tour combo. I shot a short preview of the tour with my GoPros, check it out here: http://ow.ly/yJhd9

Excellent guides. After the boot tour we were very enthusiastic, therefore we also booked a walking tour through China Town with them. The guides were informative, enthusiastic and knowledgeable and took their time to answer our questions and we had enough time to take pictures.

great guides, great fun, incredible insights. I booked the 5 hour combined bike and boat tour and I have to say it was the best thing that I have done in Bangkok. Our guide Pakchoi (?!) was highly motivated, incredibly funny and showed as a Bangkok totally different from what I had seen before because we took all the small and narrow pathes you would never be able to find yourself (nothing for claustrophobics though ,)After cruising a while in chinatown we had a really delicious local thaifood lunch and afterwards an exciting speed boat ride.All in all great fun and worth every penny of the reasonable price !Do it

I loved it. I took a tour with Andy today and it was amazing. We were in a group of three people so I guess we had a lot of personal attention :-) we learned a lot about Chinatown, buddism culture and they took care of us providing drinks, chips and a poncho. I recommend this tour for your first day in Bangkok because you'll get a nice overview of a substantial part of the innercity. Also, if you're staying near khao san road, i think the (orange) river taxi is the cheapest way to get to their office. Phra arthit pier to si praya.

Geweldig!. M, Evi en Eddie Thanks for the wonderful day! We enjoyed the trip so much, because of the great guiding, wonderful areas of Bangkok, the lovely lunch on the waterside and all of you did a great job! You're kind, enthousiastic, a good help when someone is stuck with the bike, and enjoying your work. So we hope everyone who is coming to Bangkok, is choising the tours on you!

Absolutely amazing!. We did the 'co-combo' 5 hour bicycle tour and could not recommend it more! It started at 7am so we got to see the hustle and bustle through Chinatown as everyone was waking and getting ready for the day. We saw lots of glorious sights and lots of eye-openers - things we would never have seen had we not heard about Co Van Kessel.We visited temples, river markets, little villages - lots of places! And each was as exciting as the last. We also had the boat trip which was great - a nice welcome break from cycling in the sun (!) and an opportunity to see things from the other side.At the end we had a gorgeous relaxed lunch which was included then headed back to return our bikes. Our tour guide was fantastic and really interesting. I was travelling with 4 friends and it was just us and a family of 4, which made for a great sized group.Just a tip, the cycling isn't particularly strenuous, however add the 35c degree and it can be! So make sure you bring water (you are also given some a long the way) and eat breakfast before you go. You also have some challenging little bridges and footpaths to get through so not for the faint hearted!Overall a fantastic experience - highly recommend it!

Bike tour 3 hour. This is the second time we have been on this bike tour average age of our group was 59, we all enjoyed the experience again, on the bike side of things a mountain bike would be preferable for the narrow alleyways, more control than the road bikes where some have very narrow handle bars, guides are informative and you feel safe in traffic at all times, would we all go again definitely.

Great tour. With did a 2 hour boat canaltrip with Jackie which was great.Its a fantastic and special way to see bangkok from the canal! We had 2 breaks in which we visited local temples. Jackie is a great tourguide. She has a good sense of humour and has a lot of interesting information. It was a great oppurtunity to have a deeper going conversation with a lovely local person. We defenitely recommend this tour!

Thank you Jackie food/shampoo/photo. We (Teun and Aafke) did the 3 hours tour at night with Jackie. We had a great time, we saw China town, wat pho, wat arung, flowermarket and many more and offcourse we tried some good! We had lots of fun with Jackie, she is hilarious.
