Thank you for the great tour! We will do next time the 5 hours tour with boat and we hope to see you again!

a new Bangkok that you did not know about. aha great daytrip this one ! friendly bike tour guide and great routes. good to see another side of bangkok that you dont normally see as a "tourist". we can recommend !

Super Experience - CVK's 9-hour Bicycle Tour. If you have a whole day this is worth trying. I've been to bicycle tours in BKK and other countries and this ranks right up there.You get to ride, take an old train, a new train (BTS), canal boats, etc. Lots of refreshment stops, sumptuous lunch, wonderful guides... what else can you ask for?Our group of 8 strangers was fun and reasonably fit, so pace was fast! You need to be reasonably healthy/fit as it is 9-hours; fortunately I did it in January when the weather was not too warm.This has to be one of the best bicycle tours I've taken, and I will do it again when I am back in BKK!

See Bangkok in another way. Very good organised trip, you see Bangkok totally different. I can recomand iT to every one!. The trip is not only in Chinatown but you go out of the city where the people live.

Fantastic full day. Booked the full day with guide Jackie. Excellent organisation with plenty of drinks and good lunch in a nice restaurant which of course you will never find yourself. Great mix of busy Bangkok (Chinatown) and quit ride along the canal.Jackie was extremely friendly and helpfull.Simply a must do while in Bangkok. Thanks.

Must see tour of original Bangkok. Fantastic sight of authentic Bangkok wich tourists never get to see! Narrow allees, local markets, a temple, rivercrossing, beverages, the classic 3 hours tour has it all. Really an amazing experience!
Excellent activity to do in Bangkok. Our family did the 3 hours classic tour and we all loved it. Great guide, This is an activity you cannot miss when visiting Bangkok

Wonderful full day tour!. We did the full day tour and had an amazing day!! We saw so many interesting things, houses, temples, met interesting people from different religions on the roadside and our guide Jackie explained a lot and had an answer to all our questions. It was very inspiring and fun. During the tour we got plenty of drinks and snacks, you don't need to bring anything yourself, and the included lunch was very tasty. Highly recommend this tour and this organization!!
Excellent tour. Great tour. Great guides. Very friendly. Highly recommend this tour for anyone wanting to see tge real bangkok

Brilliant Day. Started off the day as usual taxi driver not actually sure of where they are going in this huge city, but we found it, rather large bright yellow shop front, thank god. Complimentary bottles of water and a quick run down of things to do and not do, please test run your bike, I didn't I went to the rest room, when I came back, one of the guides said did I want to have a quick spin on the bike to see if it suited me, I said "no I ride a bike all the time", so I let everyone go in front of me because i was the oldest in the group, jumped on the bike and then realised I was a pre world war ll but I need a basket to put my gear in so thats why I chose it. After a bit of wobbling and the guide panicking, I managed to stay on. So pick a mountain bike and take a backpack. The day was absolutely fantastic riding down tiny little alleyways u would never normally go by yourself one guide in front and one at the back, good english and knew everything about the area. We all then jumped on a ferry then a longboat more riding then the lunch, which was divine. A tiny little restaurant that I would not dream of going to on the canals, the feast was fresh and full of flavour by far the best food I had eaten this trip. Back on the bikes more sightseeing another longboat, the ferry and back to the office. I can't recommend this company enough :) .

An amazing 5 hour ride really sights / sounds and smells of Bangkok!!. I took the Co-Combo 5 hour bicycle / boat ride this morning. I was told to be at their office at the River city Mall @ 6:45 a.m. I was there on schedule. I had done a walk in reservation and did not pay a single penny before i embarked on this tour. Our Guide for the day was Andy and she was really good at briefing us. We were a ver small group if 7 people. The bikes provided were of decent quality and no frills attached. We first rode into China town and stopped at the Chinese Flower market. On the way we passed through narrow alleys and back roads of Bangkok which one would probably never see in any other tour. We stopped over for 15 minutes in the market and were able to roam around and take pictures and enjoy the sights. We then left for the crossing over to the west side on a local ferry which took about 10 minutes. We were then on the road again and were riding into the back alleys and the fields on the outskirts of Bangkok city. The scenery is worthwhile so are the smells and sounds. after riding for about an 30 minutes we were taken to a small mom and pops restaurant for a meal [brunch] the food was delicious and they even accommodated my Vegan request. Post brunch and a short ride later we were on the boat again for our ride back into the city on a boat.total trip time is about 5 hours approximately. If you love riding bikes and like seeing the flip side of any city then I would recommend this.Andy the guide / leader was really great. She keeps one and all very entertained. I think even kids can do this trip. Its a great activity for a family. Ample food and water was provided. Andy was also good at stopping at proper rest areas so people could use the facilities.

The only way to really get to know Bangkok!. Great guide, great tour, great sightseeing! Including nice food and a lot of non touristic places. Especially the green area's are beautiful and unexpected.

If you think you saw everything of Bangkok.... ... book a trip at Co van Kessel Bangkok Tours! That was the advice I received and it was so true! Furthermore, I really enjoyed the guides Jackie and York: they understood the type of humor of the Dutchies and they made the trip really amazing with all the extra stories and jokes in between. I definitely recommend this agency to everyone who's in for another style of Bangkok!

Nice tour. We did the 5 hours tour in the afternoon. Nice ride and good guide. You drive trough Bangkok's smallest streets (I assume) but also outside in the suburbs. All in all a very nice way to explore Bangkok.Ps: be prepared for many Dutchmen :)

Amazing experience!. Great tour, great people, great sights! Tour in small groups with English speaking guide, Amy was great. Enough to see and experiennce the non touristic parts of bkk. Thai lunch was the best I had in Thailand

A must do when in Bangkok. We really enjoyed this activity. The tour takes you to places in Bkk where you would normally never come. It shows the big contrasts the city has to offer. Our guide was really friendly, knowledgeable and spoke English very well. Besides that the tour is a good way to meet other tourists/backpackers.

Absolutely a Must-Do in BKK - also for Thai-Veterans. Well, we have been in BKK for several times and it is our Goal every time to explore new Sights and Views of this Vibrant City. And we can tell you, a Bike Tour with Co van Kessel (yes, originally Dutch Company, what is a good Omen to have a Bike tour :-) through the tight alleys of China Town and through very peaceful parts of Thonburi (other side of River) is just fantastic. We did the 3-hours-Bike-Tour, visited China-Town, Temples, the biggest flower market and so on. We had time to Rest in a beautiful and quite park and we saw Bangkok from a totally different point of you. Every Second of this trip is worth it. We have been a group of 8 people and two guides. The guides were fantastic too.And the flexibility of customer service is unbelievable too. I wrote them an E-Mail at 11.30 a.m. to book the trip at 2 p.m. and everything was fine. Great!

Great bike tour through back alleys. If it wasn't for this tour we would not have gotten a glimpse of real Bangkok street life and living conditions. Soon after leaving the trip gets interesting and this never stops for the full 3 hours. Highly recommended. If the bikes would have been maintained a bit better (tyre pressure and chain lubrication) and the cycling speed would have been a bit more this would have been a 5 star rating.

A must do in Bangkok. This group offers several tours and we chose the 5 hr bicycle/boat combination for 1500TBH ($50 AUD). It was fantastic- taking us through areas we would never have seen as a tourist (particularly original Bangkok city area, flower market & Chinatown). We were initially only staying overnight in Bangkok as we are not shoppers at markets or retail stores but friends had visited recently and did (2) Co Van Kessel tours as the enjoyed their 1st one so much. Our group was small with 6 active people so pace was easy for us 55 & 60 year olds. "A" was a happy, friendly and outgoing tour leader who returned us safely back without any spills. We chose the 7am start before the heat and traffic.

Bangkok comes alive!. I have visited Bangkok several times so was surprised by the variety in the 5 hour combo tour. It was wonderful, our excellent guides took us through market areas and lanes with stops at temples before boat trips (ferry and long tail boat) along khongs which provide another view of Bangkok altogether. Lunch was simple and tasty and my favourite part was the ride through rural market gardens. Green and lush vegetation with farmers at work as we rode by, Highly recommend this well organised tour.

Multi Boat Tour. Due to the protests in Bangkok, we decided to do this 5 hour multi boat tour and stick to the Riverside area for the afternoon. The best part of the tour for me was the walk through Nonthaburi. I wish I could have done a bit of shopping but we had just started the tour and I knew my hubby wouldn't be happy lugging bags in and out of boats! People were extremely friendly, many would wave at us, kids would show off their diving/jumping into the river skills. We saw how they used the river for washing themselves, laundry, dish washing. Lots of water spinach grown by the side of homes. We did stop at a beautiful Wat and our lovely guide Audrey explained some of the customs and protocols of visiting a temple. The boat rides were good fun although we were a bit sun burned and wind blown by the end. Water and snacks were provided by Audrey along the way as well as toilet breaks.I wish we felt more confident cycling as I would have preferred to have gone on a combo tour with them. It was a lot of time on a multitude of boats with some stopping and some walking.

Great inexpensive Tour of Bangkok. My husband and I decided to spend our last morning doing the Co Classical 3-hour Bicycle Tour. We really enjoyed winding through the small streets of Bangkok and getting a sense of the local Thai lifestyle. Over the course of the tour we stopped at a large flower market where they were preparing for their yearly Loy Khathong festival - it was absolutely beautiful! Additionally we cycled through their Chinatown, went to a temple, took the local ferry boat to cross Chao Phraya – it was a great, inexpensive way to see Bangkok for a local’s perspective. I recommend this tour if you have time.

Hellish at the time, amazing memory afterwards. Let's not kid ourselves. If you are from the UK or similar then you have no business being on a bike, in this humidity, in the heat, in a crazy city like Bangkok. On the flip side, if you don't do all of the above you are crazy. This cycling tour of Bangkok was one of the worst and best things I've ever done. Worst because of the 6am start, the heat, the smells (wait till you see where they take you) and the hard toil of cycling about. Best, because we got taken down the narrowest alleys, between peoples homes, through people's businesses, down into the underbelly of the REAL Bangkok. The place were incredibly poor people do what they can with what they can and smile, wave, say hello and generally make you feel like every woe you ever thought you had in your life was just plain dumb! These Cycle Tour people aren't messing around. THey will give you a nice long taste of the real Bangkok and you'll walk away a better person for it. intrigued if this is for you please feel free to drop me an email.

Just do it! Don't miss it!. We did the combo with four of us and had a great day.Our managing director miss Jacky was a perfect enthusiastic guide, and we had a lot of fun.Already everything has been said what you see and where you go on the bike or by boat.We had a very good lunch and the combination of biking, boating (with bikes in the boat), sightseeing with people all together from all places made a wonderful day.Some want more breaks to photograph, other less.Really one of the highlights of our four days Bangkok visit.Take this trip in the first days of your stay here.The founder Co van Kessel had a bright idea! Dutch .......Thank you Jacky!

Really nice!!. Really nice biking tour through Bangkok. You discover lots of beautiful places at the river side, in local areas, the city center..i did the 3h tour. Great Service, professional and super friendly Guides! Thanks for a lovely Day ;)

Too many breaks and too little cycling. Nice guides and a nice little stroll thruogh china part and the harbour area, plus on the other side of the river. Not a lot of cycling though and lots of breaks all the time. Too many breaks and hardly any cycling. I would prefer to cycle more and walk around looking at sights less.

must do in Bangkok is the nine hour tour with Co.. This is a must do in Bangkok!! the things you see of this city this way is unique. and even after 9 hours of trip (not all by bicycle !! ) we hoped it was not over. we will do this tour next time again and again. thanks team Co van Kessels. for another great trip around Bangkok. by the way the fee is worth every penny of it

A closer look. Excellent way to get of the main streets and see how the poorer locals live and make their money. On our way through little alleys we saw little shops that sell auto parts, pig heads, ruins where people were still living in, indoor vegetable, meat and flower markets. On the day tour we also saw a lot from locals living at the edges of Bangkok. Figherman at the canals, slums and agriculture. All together a complete and impressive experience

Super way to explore Bangkok!. Very friendly staff, good bikes (take the mountain bike, it gives you more stability and you don't feel all the bumps in road), excellent routing through Bangkok: busy streets, jungle like surroundings in another area, temple visit, nice dinner, nice boat trips. We did the combo.

Cool and fast way to see parts of Bangkok. Good bikes, splendid guides and a scenic route. A must do when you have only limited time in Bangkok. Guides speak perfect English and multiple other languages (Dutch in my case).

nice sightseeing. Perfect way to explore Bangkok. We had a nice and funny guide, he took especially care of our youngest daughter (10). The tour was variated and not to difficult. It was a good way to meet Thai and see Bangkok a bit more from the inside. We booked the tour with biking and boat (5h).

You've GOT to do this!. Honestly I was too tired to bother. And Bangkok is not an easy city to get around so maybe we should not do the Bangkok bicycle tour we've booked? OK, the wonderful person at the equally wonderful SSIP Hotel says we can take the ferry from nearby Thewet ferry wharf to Co Van Kessel and we do that. The ferry is marvelous but there's more. The bike ride is just the best thing imaginable. Forget being tired, this will give you energy. We travel through narrow lanes seeing Bangkok as if we lived here, then across the river and through the countryside. Saying Hi and Hello to adults and kids as we cycled past. Then a long tail boat ride through a canal (klong) followed by a marvelous lunch and more cycling (harder after lunch!) finishing with an exciting long tail trip back to the city. It is great.

Beyond the lonely planet. Our evening bycicle tour through the hustling and bustling streets of Bangkok was an amazing experience. The places we saw are beyond the lonely planet. Our guide (Pak Soi) did a terrific job in guiding us safely through the narrow streets and chaotic traffic. A must-do in Bangkok!

Loved my day out in Bangkok by bike!. A great trip, just the right length, saw all sorts of stuff as a civilian you could never access or even find. Very interesting. Loved the klong ride, restaurant there, the farm island -- all of it. Great guide. Bikes good. Guides excellent. You need a little bit of confidence as some of the paths are narrow and have tight corners but our group mostly was composed of inexperienced bikers and everybody did just fine. It's 5 hours but you stop a lot, are on the boat, at lunch. Everybody enjoyed it a lot. Would have gone next day to the evening tour but got sick. Will recommend and go again when back in Bangkok for sure.
Fabulous tour... Must do in Bangkok. One of the highlights of our trip to Bangkok. Great guide, exciting tour, tasty lunch... Highly recommend. Be sure to book.

No. 1 thing to do in Bangkok!. A great way to discover the hidden places in Bangkok: on a bicycle you discover all elements of the city: markets, tiny streets teeming with people, cats and dogs and everything that is sold on the streets. Extremely busy and noisy, but so much fun! You also see the more rural part of the city, quiet and green, with fields with all kinds of vegetables and herbs. Take the 5 hour tour, with a combi of boat and bike, and lunch included. Simply fantastic to experience!

Must do!. It was so much fun, cycling through markets and the outside areas where most of the Thai live.We did the 5 hour tour with longtale. You cycle around 2 hours of that. No need to worry that it's too long, 'cause you make quite a lot of stops to see great things like a school. Therefor, start the 7am tour (yes, that's early ;-)). In the afternoon you'll have the best Thai lunch you will ever get.It's worth the money!

The best way to see the real Bangkok!. My wife and I did the 3 hour bike tour. We are so glad we did it. It was one of the best things we did in Thailand. It is also the best "tours" we have ever done. The tour takes you all over Bangkok. We stopped at Temples, Muay Thai rings, Huge markets, neighborhoods, small restaurants. We had so much fun. You need to be at least a mid level bicycle rider. It is not a physically difficult ride, but you will be squeezing through some tight places and making sharp turns. This tour is a must do while in Bangkok.

An exciting and amazing experience, not to be missed!. This gentleman has done an amazing job on finding some daring but amazing routes straight through Chinatown and the rest of Bangkok. Narrow roads, under parasols, whizzing past food bowls, cats and dogs. We had a tour through the flower, meat and vegetable market, i would have never known about it, but I felt it really gave us an amazing experience we will never forget. We took our 10/12/5 year olds(one in the back) and we would have never thought of it, if the travel agency hadnt told us. I am so glad we went! I will recommend this to all my friends!!

Best day-trip ever. If you're looking for something more than the standard temple tours, and are able to keep your balance on a bike, this is a must do. It was the most fun city tour that I have ever done. I did the full-day tour (9 hours), but it's not sitting on a bike the entire time. We saw things that I never would have seen if I didn't do such a unique tour. And the staff is great. They were knowledgable and interesting. I will definitely want to do it again when I go back.

fun but a little dangerous. I really enjoyed my all day bike trip. The staff is upbeat professional and well organized. We started riding in back alleys, narrow streets and sidewalks making sharp turns and avoiding obstacles. Crossing busy streets, they had one staff member stop traffic for all of us to cross. We had 3 staff people for 8 riders. We took our bikes on a train ride to the country, on the subway and a klong boat. They were always stopping to get us soft drinks and bathroom stops. We ate lunch at a lovely outdoor restaurant with some of the best food I had in Thailand. This trip is not about exercise. It's going at a slow pace of coasting along. It's just about being at a relaxed pace and enjoying the day. The worst part was we waited 45 min for the train to leave to take us to the countryside and about a 45 min train ride. The narrow path along the canal took concentration. One person fell in. My finger got caught in the subway door (last person with their bicycle on). We saw an unusual Chinese temple. The whole trip was highly enjoyable but not for the faint of heart.

Great experience. We chose to do the three hour Bangkok by night tour. This was booked in advance. The welcome by the staff was very warm and pleasant. On our tour there were only 6 people booked and two of them did not turn up. We did wait as long as possible for them but this did not make us take off late and loose time on our tour. Our guide was very pleasant and the route chosen through China Town and then over the river to Thonburi was magical. The snack announced on the trip programm was in fact a hot meal taken in a street restaurant. This was a pleasant surprise. We very much enjoyed the fabulous atmosphere of Bangkok by night. Chinatown was like being transported back to 19th century China. Amazing.The only thing that stopped me from giving a full excellent evaluation is that our guide could improve a little on English (but her motivation did make up for that) and we would have appreciated more short stops for taking photos. It is very difficult to take photos of the tiny alleyways in Chinatown while cycling. We do recommend the tour and will probably go back there!

Must Do in Bangkok. I'm usually not a big fan of 'guided tours' but this is a good example of how you can do it right.We did the co-combi bike and boat tour with no reservation. Great experience, both the cramped streets of Chinatown and the outskirts of the city were very nice to see. Good pace, and good well-maintained mountainbikes and 'ladybikes' :-).Also, the lunch contained some of the best Thai dishes I've had over the holiday, at one of those nice non-descript, 'outdoor shack' style restaurants in the bangkok suburbs.It's not cheap considered Bangkok's relatively low price level, but worth it.

Wauw!. Great guide! We did a whole dat tour. Seen amazing things and places we would not have seen on our own. Just a great experience. You have to be in a good shape but if you are familiar with cycling the biking part is easy.

Super Bangkok experience!. Fun trio through Bangkok with an excellent guide. English is very good, no problems here. We did the 5 hr trip which included two boat trips and a lunch. Would definitely recommend this option.

Best day out I've ever had in Bangkok.. I did the 9-hour tour with Co Van Kessel. And I have to say it was easily the best day out I've had in Bangkok. The whole experience was so far above and beyond what I expected, I would happily go again. Our main guide Meen was brilliant, great sense of humor too. The two support staff were also superb.  We cycled around China Town, through markets, through temples. We took the train out of the main city and into the area which consists of canal and narrow, raised concrete walkways. Cycled through the walkways, under bridges, into a school, played volleyball with the school kids. Fed the HUGE catfish at the temple. Loaded the bikes onto a longtail, rode through Bangkok as the sun was setting.   Really, REALLY great day out. Highly recommended.

Fun and memorable bike tour. I took the nine-hour bike/boat/train tour and it was amazing. What a wonderful, memorable experience. We got to see and experience so much of Bangkok, from the busy, vibrant city to rural life, all in one day! I would never otherwise have got to see many of the places we visited. The guide was knowledgable, interesting and spoke good English. The small group size meant it felt more like a private tour, which was also good. If nine hours in the Thai heat is too much for you, try one of the shorter tours but if you are reasonably adventurous I would recommend this tour.

Fantastic!. This tour was more than I expected! Our tour guides Eyes and Andy were great and spoke perfect English and even Dutch! They told some personal stories which made it even more interedting. I would recommend everyone who is visiting Bangkok this tour. Take the 9 hour tour, it will take you to places you wont expect from Bangkok!

Best tour in Bangkok. I took the 5-hour tour with 6 friends and was totally pleased! Our guides Nonna and Jack were excellent. They brought us through mazes of small alleys and back roads, and kept us safe and entertained. The lunch was superb and plentiful. One of my favourite outing in Thailand. I recommend it to anyone who is reasonably fit

Great tour, great people, great lunch!. This trip takes you to the non-touristic places of Bangkok through small streets and rice fields. I woulh highly recommend to take this trip. It's a bit expensive, but great value for money! One of the best experiences of my whole trip to South East Asia.

Excellent. We did bike tour in the morning, first through Bankok's Chinatown, then to a marketplace and after this you cross the river by ferry and transfer to a longtail boat. After a good lunch you bike back through nature and Bankok's outskirts and finish by boat again. Worth every penny, guidance was good, so was the tour and the food. This is something you should do when in BKK!

Easily the best activity in Bangkok.. I had family visiting last week who had been to Bangkok on numerous occasions and were looking to do something a little different so I booked the 5 hour bike/boat combo tour. What an absolutely brilliant adventure, I have lived in Bangkok for 2 years and would never get to see such parts of the city that we saw on the tour, you get to witness such beautiful parts of Bangkok that you probably didn't know existed, sleepy little villages, life on the canals, fruit plantations, I think I may have even seen a rice paddy!!!We stopped off for lunch at a little restaurant on one of the canals, the food was plentiful and so delicious and the lady who was preparing it was a superb host, the food just kept coming and coming.The staff were fantastic, our guides were Khun Water and Khun Mee, both great fun and really informative and so friendly. I will be recommending this trip to everybody, not only tourists who are visiting but also my friends who live in the city, its a great day out.Thanks to all the team at Co van Kessel for a wonderful experience and I will for sure be back to enjoy another tour sometime soon.

Best tour of my life. The 3 hour tour was so great that I came back and did the 5 hour tour. Both were stunning and amazing. Bangkok is a hard city to get to know at first because the main downtown public spaces are built for cars and not people (think Downtown Miami). This tour gets you off the massive roadways and into the dense, colorful back neighborhoods. It takes you to places you would never ever go and it's awesome. You get to see the real city.I have been living in Bangkok for several months, and when my tourist friends ask me what they should see and do in Bangkok, they immediately get a text message: "CO VAN KESSEL BIKE TOUR!!!" A dozen or so friends have taken this tour at my urging and all have loved it. Most of said it was the favorite part of their entire SE Asia tour. It's that amazing. The tour is very easy physically and enjoyable for cyclists of all ages and abilities.

A fantastic tour of the Bangkok you'll otherwise never get to see. We took the 9 hour bike tour by Co van Kessel yesterday. It was a fabulous experience. The guides took us through very small narrow streets in Chinatown. Afterwards we took a train to the west side of Bangkok where we continued by bike through the countryside. They led us to a cosy little restaurant where we had some of the best food we had eaten so far. The tour showed us a face of Bangkok which we would've never seen on our own. Congrats to the guides!

Good experience in Bangkok. Two week ago we did the full day trip (9 hours) and it was worth every minute. We enjoyed the trip togethermwith another nice coupke from Belgium and we had a magnificent guide in the person of Paksoi. He led us through the small streets of china town (we never realised there was this world behind the big buildings), in the train, through the fields near Bangkok, over the narrow bridges and runaways over the many waters, in the longtailboeat and finally at the skyway. Even when one of us failed a bridge and ended up in the water, we still enjoyed this fabulous way of seeing Bangkok and we can advise everyone to take this tour in your itinerary. Well organised by a prifessional organisation. Many thanks. Jolande and Leo Bakker, Kudelstaart, Holland.

Great sightseeing Amazing tour !. I did 2 tours with Co van Kessel both where AMAZING !First i did the 5 hour tour wich had amzing features a knowlegble tour guide and simple a great group.6 weeks later i did the 9 hour tour with The man off the hour Ai ! a perfect guide and the tour was also amazing I would recommend this one the most ist adventureous and a lot off fun ! We cgot plenty off drinks and awesome food on both tours without paying anything ! it was GREAT !

Good tours. We took 2 tours with Co Van Kessel when we were in Bangkok, a walking tour of China town and a longtail boat tour. We were with our 2 children, and we found that the guides really made an effort to keep the children entertained (which is always a plus). The guides seem to really love their job, and the tours show you a side of Bangkok which you would otherwise probably never visit. Recommended.

Wee gem!. I did the 3 hour afternoon tour with some friends who live in Bangkok and it was great! I agree with some of the previous comments, that the guide doesn't talk with you when cycling from A to B, tell you where you are, history about the areas but in all honesty, it would make the tour longer, you would stop often and it would make the tour less fun! I loved cycling through the narrow alleyways, down oneway streets, by the side of the river where my friend decided to wrestle with a tree (and she lost...! p.s. it was great that we stumbled across another group when she fell as the tour guide of the other group carried a first aid kit which was needed!) you truly do see how the real Bangkok people live! I saw parts of the city which I would never venture out to see or go down such narrow alleyways had I not been on this tour. We were a group of 9 so it was nicely sized, some people on our group were not so experienced riders and we always felt safe even if you were the straggler. Our guide Bak Soi was a great character and kept us interested at the few stops we made at temples! All in all, it was a fab day and we all enjoyed it! Looking for our next tour already! :) Thank you Co Van Kessel!

The best tour till date!!!. My friends and I had been to Bangkok in August this year. It was our first trip together outside India and were very excited, with a lot of expectations! One of the biggest apprehensions, for a first timer, is, of course, How, What and Where do we tour in a new city?! But, a BIG THANK YOU to Co Van Kessel Tours (and my friend Prakyath, for booking the tour) for that!!! We had the time of our lives cycling through the suburbs of Bangkok. We had booked for the cycling cum boat tour. It started at 1300 hrs from the Co Van Kessel office in Rivercity mall and lasted for about 5 hours. We cycled through the busy market area called 'Something' in Chinatown and also the beautiful Flower market. After which we stopped for a delicious Thai lunch. We then continued our journey on a 45 min boat ride, which allows you to rest those aching thighs. The highlight of the tour was the ride through the suburbs and interiors of the city. It shows you the REAL lifestyle of the locals! And, before we knew it the tour came to an end! Our Guides, Ms. Waters and Mr. Dee, were amazing!! They added to the excitement of the tour! :)It was one of the most memorable holidays and I would love to go back only to try another one of their tours!! Kudos to Mr. Co van Kessel for pioneering such a brilliant idea! :)

Most memorable tours. We booked the full day tour online thru the website. Everything in our tour was wonderfull and well planned. Our guide Amy was friendly and gave us insights in history and culture. The tour takes a full day and a travers a lot of kilometers but its all done kind of relaxed (no rush at all). We travelled thru differend parts of Bangkok by bike, Train, MRT and boat. Lunch was delicious at a local restaurant in the middle of rice fields. I visited parts of Bangkok i would never have found on my own, this was an experience i will remember!

Highly reccommended!!!. Hi, I am 30 years old and i have seen a lot of the world already. But the experience the Co van Kessel tour gives you is one in a million. It takes you through Chinatown by bike and takes you to places, which you will never see if you go on your own. It is an affordable excellent experience and a must do for each western tourist!!!!We took the 5 hour combination of the bike/boat tour. Up until 40 years old i would advise this one.

A Must Do!. My husband and I did the 3 hour biking tour in the morning and really wish we had booked a full day! This was one of the highlights of Bangkok for us! We had awesome guides, M was the leader and he was so wonderful. I really genuine guy with a true Thai smile! We did this on a Sunday morning and since school was not in session we instead stopped at a monastery where kids were attending "Sunday school". The 3 hours went by in a flash but it was such a great way to experience the streets of Bangkok! I would absolutely do this adventure again and everyone who has watched the GoPro video my husband took of our biking tour has said that they want to go to Bangkok to do it too! http://tinyurl.com/mjtyjka

Loved the bike ride. I highly recommend this tour- I thought it was a fantastic way to see parts of Bangkok that we otherwise would not have visited during our stay. We did the 5 hour tour and it did get a bit long. I don't know if the 3 hour tour takes you to the same places (Chinatown was awesome!) but we could have done without the canal tour. Although I would do it again regardless!
Co van Kessel biking Bangkok. 05 hours biking, boating and lunch with funny guides exploring some fantastic parts of Bangkok! Absolutely stunning!
A different view of Bangkok. We took the 5 hours trip on bike and boat. This trip brought me a different experience and view about Bangkok. It's definitely worth to a go!

Best choice for Bangkok. I had to convince my partner to go cycling, but once he was on that bike, he loved it! We took the 3 hour tour, which was long enough for us and we got to see the real Bangkok. It is a great way to explore (parts of) the city and the experienced guides really know where to take you. Do't worry about the traffic, you'll be just fine.

To see the 'every day and real life' in BKK. I did this tour for the 3rd time. This time I brought my two sons (13 and 15 years). Of course they were very sceptic of 'cycling' in the heat of BKK. Afterwards, as expected, they had to admit that is was a wondeful experience.The Co van Kessel Bangkok Tours is a very proffesional company and they really put all their best and efforts to give you a wonderful BKK experience.Very much recommended.
The real Bangkok!. This bike trip brought me to places I'd never have seen on my Bangkok trip. Ko was a great guide! A must do in Bangkok!

Amazingly fun tour. The staff that led is great, the teamleader is an enthusiastic girl, who knows to make the trip fun for everyone. The logistics are 100% correct and the food is really really good. Thumbs up for this tour.
good trip!. decent look into the everyday life of people in bangkok! No helmets provided for cycling, could be a point for improvement

Awesome!. I had a super time on my cycle tour of Chinatown. Be warned though - you have to cycle in some very narrow alleyways with people and scooters and stalls all around you, I found it quite challenging!

Just when you think Bangkok is not for you.... We booked the 3 hour bike tour with Co Van Kessel after people on 3 separate occasions recommended it to us and it was just in time. This tour takes you behind the scenes of Bangkok to get a first hand look of how the locals live. Forget about the unappealing side that you first encounter when you step off of the train into Bangkok, this tour will make you fall in love and realize why tourists come back. Our guide, "Em", was amazing. He pointed out certain things throughout the ride and answered any and all questions we had - no matter how random (i.e. the process of becoming a monk). Although we were athletic enough to take it up a notch, he made sure to keep a pace that the entire group could keep up with. He brought us to temples, through alleyways and across busy streets - all safely. When we entered one of the many markets, I mentioned to Em how we had wanted to taste durian (the King of fruit) and he bought some for the entire group to try later on - in addition to the small snack and drinks they provide. We gained much perspective of the city that we otherwise would not have and did it all on a comfy bike!

A great way to see parts of bangkok. A bit of an exercise while seeing parts of the city!.... The 3 hour cycle was a breeze..suitable for all ages.. Our guide jimmy and his assistant beer was funny, helpful and accommodating. It was laid back. We opt for the evening ride, which was perfect to avoid the humidity but then half way through, it was poring cats and dogs....we were all given a rain coat..and we were soon off cycling again....it was fun!!!!! Now I think in any city I will try and do a bike tour! Try it and enjoy!

My best day in Bangkok. I thoroughly recommend the biking tours offered by Co Van Kessel. I did the full-day tour last month and it was wonderful! We biked through laneways and markets, canal paths and the backstreets of Thonburi. An opportunity to see parts of Bangkok that would otherwise be off-limits. Our guide, Amy, was excellent. A thoroughly enjoyable experience - next year I'll do China Town by night!!

Highlight of our days in Bangkok. The Van Kessel Bike Tour was excellent and an excellent value. A surprise at every turn. Great tour guides and fun international group that we were paired with. Bring sunscreen and a hat if you are there during hot weather. Must do when in Bangkok.

Best way to get a whole new few at Bangkok!. I loved it! Very nice guides, every tour they do is different so that it will be exciting for the guide too. They took very well care of everything and everybody, the whole trip I felt very safe.I did the 9 hour tour and was very pleased with it: we started to cycle through small alleys in Chinatown, very beautiful (smell, sights, people). Then we took a train for 45 minutes to get to the outdoor areas of Bangkok (we went to the East). Wow wow wow!! Very beautiful, rice fields, water, green everywhere and all the people in the villages we went through were very nice. Having a wonderful lunch (we could eat as much as we wanted), started to cycle to a temple. After that took a small boat and our bikes on it, again awesome. At the end we took the skytrain and cycled to Co van Kessel again. They bring enough drinks for everybody!Conclusion: Wonderful tour, glad I did the whole 9 hour tour, the wind will keep you cool, a beautiful sight of Bangkok you will see. Just do it!

Extraordinary experience. It is a real great way to see Bangkok and its surroundings. Riding a bycicle around chinatown small alleys (unforgetable experience for the eyes and the nose...), ride around some of the more than 400 temples and getting into a boat and go to other unexplored areas of bangkok (including riding in the countryside rice plantations). All of it was brilliant! Do choose the 5 hours trip as you get into the countryside as well.

Best way to experience Bangkok for couples/friends/family (best hangover remedy). went after a big Songkran nightout in RCA. Then turned out to be the best day for a bike tour. Just a 2 of us team we got Patti and Nam to guide us (lucky ratio). I wasn't a great bike-rider myself (been over 7 years away from bike). the quiet city traffic during Songkran and having 2 lovely guides were the best combo.Love the service, exploring BKK from a totally different perspective. Explored Chinatown, both sides of Chao Praya River and saw some beautiful architectures from different religions and neighbourhood. Plus a great hangover cure with good quality bike gear. Will recommend this to anyone.

Excellent way to explore some hidden sights of Bangkok. During a company event in June 2013 we had the opportunity to do one of the classic Co van Kessel bicycle tours in Bangkok. The tour guides took us during the 3 hour ride (relatively easy - anyone should be able to participate) through small streets in Chinatown, to shopping areas, flower and vegetable market(s) and across the river to visit temples.Excellent tour, highly recommended !

Super experience. Exploring the little streets in chinatown by bike makes you want to explore these parts even further. Flower market was colourful and the fruit tasting delicious. After a short sail with the long tail boat we got lost in the old capital but it remained one of the highlights of our trip through Thailand.

Yea it's okay - worth a try.. We had an alright time cycling around chinatown. It's definitely a different view of the city that one would never experience otherwise and so from that perspective it was great. If I could go back in time, I would do it again. Would I do it a second time? Absolutely not. Would I recommend to a friend? Sure, especially if you are in town and just wanna see something for the day.

Book this tour if you would like to see another side of Bangkok!. Very good organized tour, which gives you the possibility to see another side of Bangkok. The real life of local people and farmers, around the waters of Bangkok. Friendly and enthousiastic staff. The five hour tour includes drinks, a good local lunch and a boattrip in a longtailboat. A bit pricy, but worth the money.

Visiting Bangkok is not complete without a Co van Kessel bike tour. Today we did the 5 hour tour of Co van Kessel bike tours and it was soo worth it! For me it was the second time but i would do it over and over again... The lunch we got was amazing. Jackie, Jack and Mr. Amin were super guides and very friendly & helpful. I would recommend this tour to anybody.Biking with Co van Kessel tours is the MUST-DO experience of your Bangkok trip!!!

The perfect way to discover Bangkok. When you have limited time, and still want to get the best possible impression of the real life in inner city Bangkok / Chinatown / Thai town, then I can highly recommend the various bicycle / boat tours organised by Co van Kessel's team. The perfect way to get an insight in its narrow, but very lively small streets and allies, full of colours and (often very nice, sometimes not so nice) smells and crowded with mostly very friendly people. These people are busy doing all kinds of stuff, like repairing completely worn out motor engines, cooking for erveryone who wants to buy some very enjoyable food for almost nothing, or putting together flowers to serve as offers in the numerous Buddha temples and places etc etc. Unlike e.g. Amsterdam, where the locals would take you off your bikes when you bother them too much, the Thai people remain friendly and smiling towards these interfering tourists. I would definitely recommend to e.g. take the 5 hour bikeride combined with the boat, which shows you the liveliness on the canals, the canal sides and some of the countryside of outer Bangkok. The tour guides may not know everything about the history, but they are 100% caring and committed to see everybody safely back home gain. The food and beverage underway is splendid as well. One of the best things we did in Bangkok in the last two weeks..

Highly recommended to see the real thailand that you wont find in a guide book!. Varied cycle route, through tiny streets, markets, in the countryside. We are not " tour people" but i did find this very enjoyable tour that took us to places which we would never have seen especially when you dont have so much time in a city. Really nice lunch, and they provide water on arrival, so the only things you need to bring are subpnhat, suncream and an extra bottle of water! there are city bikes with baskets if you do bring a bag, or mountainbikes. The tour has a mix Of boat and cycling and at an easy pace so i would imagine would be suitable for most abilities- unless you are a bit wobbly on a bike as some of the paths near water are a quite narrow

Co van Kessel is TOP!. We did (me and two other students) the 3 hours tour through Bangkok! You see streets were you never comes, if you do it by yourself. It was a nice experience and we don't forget this! We recommend this tour, also for people that don't love to ride a bicycle. The 3 hours tour is long enough and there are many stops during the tour. SOOO go to Co van Kessel and jump on the bike!

OK bikeride but horribly overpriced and bad guide. We were with 4 people, and we had the 3 hour 8AM-11AM tour. The tour was rather nice, taking you through the very narrow streets of Chinatown and across the water. However, both guides were, although friendly, not real guides; they didn't share any information about the surroundings, lost (and retrieved) group members on several occasions, and worst of all: were constantly on the cell phone speaking Thai! All of that wouldn't matter if not for the price. A 3 hour tour was 900+ Thai Bath (25 euro's) per person. We were in a group of 10, that is a very quick 250 euro's for Thai standards. I suggest cutting the price in half and retraining your staff in being actually motivated to make their guests have a nice time!

Excellent trip. 5 hour cycle and boat tour. Great value for money. Fantastic lunch. Far more than you can eat. Tour guides fun and welcoming. Thoroughly recommend to see parts of Bangkok you would normally miss.

very nice guided bicycle tour. We did the co combo tour of 5 hours biking and traveling by boat on the 29th of April 2013. First of all, we really enjoyed our tour with our guides; Amy and Nuna ( hope i spell it correct).On their website, which is very clear about what to expect and think about, you can find the description about how to get to their office in Thai. If you don't speak Thai i highly recommend to print it and show to your taxi/tuk tuk driver. Nice touch to put this on the website!The tour itself starts with a route through small alleys and streets in Bangkok, including chinatown. After a short stop at a temple you cross the river with a ferry and continue on the other side. Eventually you will have a ride in a longboat which is a nice way to see some of the rural life in Bangkok from the water. You will also bike through the greener part with all kinds of plantations. After another longboat ride, a ferry and ofcourse more biking you get back to the main office.Overall i would definetly recommend this tour. If temperatures are expected to be high then i also recommend to take the early tour. You might have to wake up a bit early but it's worth it!

Great tour, Jackie was amazing!. We were the only two people on the full day tour and we had a fantastic day with Jackie en 'Mr. Yong'. They could tell a lot about Bangkok, about the sights and the Thai life. Besides that they were incredibly funny! we laughed so much ... We really enjoyed going through the small streets of China town, into the local train and then the east of Bangkok. Different World! The lunch was great, they had especially for us, arranged a vegetarian meal! After that we biked for another hour or so and then took the boat (after feeding the fish at the temple!). That was a new and again totally amazing view of the Bangkok life! We would defenitely recommend this tour but then again, we were probably really lucky with this kind of private tour.

Amazing insight in the real Bangkok. What a great tour this was! Comfortable bikes, lots of water and the route is soooo beautiful. Our guide Andy was great, very friendly, funny and her english was great.Would 100% recommend this tour

A Great Morning. Thoroughly enjoyed cycling around parts of Bangkok and getting into places that you can't get to by car. The staff were friendly and made sure everyone was catered for. Would recommend that anyone of any fitness level give this a go.
Great tour. I did the night tour. I had a lot of fun... cycling through narrow streets, visiting monuments, trying some street food. The staff is very friendly and the driving always very safe!

A must!. I was visiting Bangkok with friends, and of course we went to all of the party spots and saw a lot of the nightlife, but this bicycle tour is something that was much more meaningful. We took the day tour, which was about 5 hours, and had Patty(sp?), who was wonderful. Hopefully you'll see another side of Bangkok, as I did. Everything was great, just go and do it already!

Yulia Gvozdeva. I was recommended to do the bicycle tour by a friend and didn't regret for a moment. It is a whole new way of experiencing a city, being the part of it opposite to a traditional touristy way. We visited places that are normally hidden from a visitor's eye - temples, markets, residential areas. Our guide Andy was very helpful, informative and caring so we felt safe and entertained. I was lucky as this time it was only two of us taking the tour and the attention was all ours. I would definitely recommend this experience to anyone who is up to doing sightseeing in an unconventional way and wants to discover hidden treasures of Bangkok while riding!

Great fun.. We travelled with our two children to Bangkok and were recommended by a colleague to do the bicycle tour. We booked the 3 hour tour and had a really great time. In fact, my son (11 y/o) liked it so much that he wanted to do it again the following day! The staff at Co van Kessel are professional and informative and overall this tour was an excellent way to experience Bangkok in a different way.Highly recommended!

Not as good as it was before.. We did our first bicycle tour with Co van Kessel 3 years ago. Because we had an incredible nice day that time we booked the same 5-hour Bicycle/Boat Tour again. But this time things have changed. We were disappointed because our group was much larger than the first time. Three years ago their groups had a maximum size of 8 participants. Since then they changed their policy and they allow a lot more participants. This time we were with a group of 17 and (only) 2 guides from Co van Kessel. We also missed the ride through the narrow streets of Chinatown. This time we only stayed on the bigger streets, maybe because of the larger group. We love to bike through Bangkok and its surrounding areas. We would never do this on ourselves. We made a long boat trip to the outskirts of Bangkok and biked new roads and paths. But here we also missed the extreme small bicycle paths we did the first time. Our guide in front of the group (see pictures) sometimes stopped to explain things we saw along the road. But she started talking when the first participants arrived. By the time the last ones were there she has finished her story already. When they want to do the tours with large groups they should take care of this.We booked this tour with lunch included but half way we discovered we were in the group without lunch. This was not a big problem, we only became a little hungry, but the first time the lunch was one of the highlights of the trip. Despite the fact we love to bike in and around Bangkok we would not do this tour with them again.

Fast ride through back alleys. I've been to Bangkok before and even went through the spots we toured on the bikes (Chinatown and the other side of the river known for its canals) but I didn't see them nearly as well as with the Co Van Kessel 5 Hour Bicycle/Boat Tour. We went down some ridiculously narrow alleys (considering we were on bikes) and it was great to get a behind-the-scenes view. I was also surprised how quickly we went from dense urban houses to suburbs to farm fields - it was an interesting perspective.The pace is quite fast and at some points when we jumped on and off the bikes/boats, I felt like I was in a getaway scene in a movie. Quite fun.

Magic Bangkok by bike at night. I couldnt recommend more to do the cycling by night instead of during the day. It feels like magic, you get to see places you would never walk or cycle through yourself. It feels safe and the temples etc look amazing at night (no other tourists...). We just loved everything about it. My parents (60+) also found it easy to cycle so no worries about cycling difficulties. We did the boat tour as well in the morning but if you have to make a choice, go for the cycling at night. An experience you wont easily forget.
Nice tour!. Great tour, great and very tasty lunch, friendly staff and best of all: a unique visit of bangkok. Youll see places where no touristbook would send you. It's pricy but worth the money!

Different way of investigation Bangkok. I did the 5 hour bicycle tour and this was really great fun, I must do when you want to see a different way of Bangkok. We had a wonderful guide his name was "M", so friendly, gentel and told us a lot about the life and people in Bangkok. It was very hot, but there are plenty of upportinities to stop and have a free drink ( price is including the tour). Even we went twice with a longtailboat, which was great. Better if you charge a boattrip as a tourist, you will pay a lot of money. Five hours of fun it was a very nice afternoon.

Very well organized cycling tour. A must do!. We took an all day tour. Our friendly guide showed us the secrets of Bangkok's China Town. By train we went out of town and cycled along the canals. Every now and then (just at the right moment) there was a beverage or ice-cream treat. And of course an excellent lunch. It's really worthwhile to make this tour. You won't regret it.It was recommended to us by friends and I recommend it to you!That is if you can bike.

Best thing to do in Bangkok. Want to see a different side of Bangkok! Do this tour! We did the 5 hour cycling / boot tour. You do not have to be a Tour de France participant, as the cycling is very gentle with many stops in between! This tour was one of the highlights of our trip to Thailand, as you get to see the unknown. The tour is run very professionally and shoes you around China Town, Temples and the outskirts rice fields of Bangkok! Worth every pound!

Great fun. Recently did the three hour night tour as a family, very fun. We wanted kind of an adlib tour and requested a stop for a bowl of noodles half way through. Our guide Andi had no problems accodating our wishes and was great. We saw everything we wanted to see, ate some noodles and felt very safe with our kids. Great job.

REALLY fun, unique family adventure!. What a fantastic 14th Birthday present for our son! We did lots of research, and we felt this would be a very unique view of Bangkok, in which our family could see the true flow of such a dynamic city. We were ALL incredibly impressed (My husband and I, and our 3 boys. Ages 15, 14, 11). A must see for any age. You see it all, in just a few hours. A true gem! The staff were incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. Especially Andie. Definitely book this tour!

Amazing!. Having only one night in Bangkok as a stop over, I wanted to see the City a different way. I've done bike tours before and happened to stumble across this company by doing a google search! Thank goodness I did as the tour was great. It was a group of 6 of us and we wound our way around Chinatown, over the river, through the markets and around to temples. The tour guides were brilliant and had lots of local knowledge. We also stopped off for some street food/drink inc in tour price.When I return to Bangkok, I would certainly book a tour with this company again. Highly recommended! ******

Fantastic! Marvellous! Great!. We enjoyed the bicycle very much. Professional team and guide is super! We were travelling for two month, but this is the best experiece of our holiday. Do it you won't regret. It's really nice, when you like biking.

Excellent bike tour. Have been trying this bicycle tour more than ones and can only give my best for that.Seeing Bangkok from eye hight and seeing a very different Bangkok hidden away from the shopping malls and all the fancy tourists tuff. Depending of tour, you start in chinatown and driving trough markets and small streets, taking long tail boats and driving through fruits fields..Excellent tour!

Great way to experience Bangkok. My sister recommended cvk to me after she had a great trip with them a few years ago. It didn't disappoint - you experience things you wouldn't otherwise and cycle at a relaxed pace following a friendly guide. I feel like we saw the real bangkok; chinatown, flower market, longboat trip, countryside... its really interesting to see people going about their business outside the tourist hot spots. Good drinks and snack stop but not much choice for vegetarians in the lunch. You just shout if you want to stop for photos, someone in our group stopped and bought beautiful flowers at the market. This is a great way to see bangkok, even if it's not your first visit to the city. Highly recommended.

Great way to experience Bangkok Chinatown. A guided bicycle tour in Bangkok 's Chinatown sound maybe a crazy thing to do. But this tour is fantastic. It takes you through areas of the city you would probably never go by yourself and shows you a side of the city that is very different from the big tourist attractions. This trip can be strongly recommended

Great adventure, but not for beginners. I consider myself to be quite the adventurer but sadly, I am not very graceful on a bike. I read somewhere that the bike/boat tour was great for all levels so the adventurous side of me decided to throw caution to the wind and try it. The tour begins in the very busy area of Chinatown, through really tight back alleys congested with vendors, tourists, dogs, scooters, women, children...you name it. There were a few stretches of of the bike tour that included wider, less congested paths but not many. The boat portions of the tour were a huge relief to me, very relaxing with great sights along the way. The bike portion back took us through a jungle-like area with more narrow paths & many turns but with a small drop-off on either side of the path that led into the water. I ended up walking my bike for a good portion of this trip. Although the tour took us through many picturesque sights, our particular tour leader was not very informative and didn't give us too many opportunities to stop along the way for photos. There was another staff member who stayed at the back of the pack and I was grateful for the fact that he was patient with me and stayed with me while the more advanced riders sped ahead.

Nice tour. We did the three hour tour. The bikes were very comfortable and in good shape. The guide M was very friendly and likable. What I liked best was the rhythm of the tour that had a good mix of cycling, breaks, access to drinks. And of course giving you a nice view behind the scenes while you ride through backyard alleys which almost feels like doing a parcours. Just well done. I can highly recommend without any caveat.

Bicycling Bangkok’s Brilliance. In our previous 5 trips to Bangkok we have not come across a better experience than our 5-hour tour with CVK. The crew at CVK are friendly, professional, knowledgeable and passionate about biking in Bangkok! The guides are attentive to customer needs – on and off the bicycle – catering the tour to the abilities of the group. Whether it was navigating the bustling allies and markets of Chinatown or the narrow walkways and paths of Thonburi’s plantations the guides were there to help everyone enjoy the tour. Our 21-month old daughter had a fantastic time strapped in the child seat on my bike. CVK grouped us on a tour with other families – several kids on their own bicycles – which made for a great family atmosphere for our tour. Touring Bangkok on a bicycle is a novel way to experience this Amazing, Beautiful, Crazy, Dynamic, Ephemeral, Frantic, Gritty, Hectic, Intense, Jubilant, Kitschy, Lewd, Magical, Noisy, Orgasmic, Placid, Quaint, Resilient, Sultry, Tasty, Unique, Vivid, Wild, Xenophobic, Yearning, Zany city. If there is a better way to see and experience Bangkok, I have not found it and the folks at CVK do it right! The tour route mixes all that Bangkok has to offer – Khlong rides on the canals, Chinatown madness, Thonburi green spaces, wats, temples, and churches, a Thai market. The extraordinary thing about CVK’s tours is that you get to be a part of the city and interact with ordinary Thais going about their normal business. All this without the hassles of Tuk-Tuk drivers and scammers! Along the way the CVK guides provide narration and refreshments: snacks, water, fruit, and a delicious all-you-can-eat meal. This is not just a bike tour it is a Khlong tour, a cultural experience that happens on a bicycle. If you do only one thing on your visit to Bangkok make sure it is a tour with CVK!

Great overview of Bangkok!. This was one of the best city tours O have ever had. We first bikes through the back allies of the inner city, seeing little markets, food stalls and the crammed living of the people living in Bangkok. After that, we took a long boat and had a great tour over the river to the more outer parts of Bangkok. There we saw the other way of Thais living. Very interesting. We then enjoyed a typical delicious Thaise lunch and went back by the long boat. The only disappointment was that we biked theough a lot of temples but we never went into one. I heard from people who did this tour before that they went into two temples.Overall, great tour with very friendly staff.

One of the best trips ever made. OK, when I saw several top-10 and top-20 things to do in Bangkok, to my surprise I was that making a bike trip was very amusing. This sounded very strange to me: very hot, humid, and extremely polluting traffic. However, after having read dozens of reviews I was convinced to join a bicycle tour. Problem 2 was that I only had two days and I also wanted to do a canal tour, so when I saw that Co Van Kessel organized a bike-and-boat tour I was extremely interested and decided to give it a go.Booking this tour was very easy and I got an immediate confirmation. Payment is only after the tour. I arrived on time at the China Princess Hotel (in Chinatown) and pleasantly saw that I was the only Belgian in a group of Dutch tourists. The bikes are basic: no complaints about the brakes and saddle, but limited height. We left on time and first went through some alleys in Chinatown: unbelieving! Children playing, women cooking outside and shops everywhere. In fact it was very easy to go biking and I didn’t really have any problems with the temperature and the traffic. After a few miles, we took a ferry to the other side of the river and after some additional kilometers we went on a long tail boat to discover the canals of Bangkok. We even ended up with our bikes near some outskirt farms. Later on, we went back through the canals with the long tail boat and enjoyed lunch near the finish. I would definitely book again with Co Van Kessel, a very reliable company that only uses small roads for your comfort. I did the morning tour, which is I believe easier than the afternoon tour (the temperature, you know…).So if you really want a great bicycle, book with Co Van Kessel!

Great bicycle tour through back alleys and rural Bangkok/Thonburi. My girlfriend found this tour company online and booked the 5 hour boat and bike tour for us. What a great way to see Bangkok! The tour starts off at the Grand China hotel in Chinatown (very easy to find on Yaowarat Rd). The tour guides are very informative and pay close attention to every detail that makes this tour so successful. One guide leads the tour from the front of the group and an assistant rides in the back of the pack to make sure there are no accidents and that all riders are accounted for. Our tour took us initially through parts of Chinatown and we experienced the many sights, sounds, scents of what makes Bangkok such a special city. We encountered many local children whom were all charming and excited to greet us as we zoomed by. There are some areas where you have to be really careful on your bike, narrow alleys, bridges, the occasional local dog in your path that you have to avoid hitting. The pace of the tour is accomodating for everyones skill level so you don't feel like you will be left behind. There are plenty of water/rest breaks. The tour guides are great about interacting with the riders so everyone feels at ease and has a good time. You see some amazing sights on this tour. Really one of our top experiences in Bangkok!

Nice way to see more of Bangkok. We did a nice 5 hr tour. Starting 13:00. After leaving the busy traffic we got on a boat a went through the outskirts of Bangkok by bike and boat. At around 15:00 we had a tasty local lunch and some more cycling followed. We had regular drink and toilet stops.Overall a nice day. Do not expect any information from the guides, they just show you the way to go. We had group of 14 people with 2 guides. If you had any questions you could ask them, but it was mostly just cycling. But the good thing is that you go places you wouldn't go otherwise. And i liked the parts in the longtail boats, having a rest in the breeze. I would recommend this tour.

Must do, even if you have only one day to spend in Bangkok. A friend recommended us this tour company, and we are so happy he told us about it. We are only 1,5 day in Bangkok, and wanted to have an idea about the real Bangkok. Thanks to our cycling trip we discovered a lot of places where tourists never go. We decided to go on trip 1, which takes 5 hours, and which includes two longtail boat trips. We changed our booking from the afternoon to the morning, and were very happy we did this. The morning tour starts at 7 and it is still cool in the morning hours. The group was not too big, which is good when cycling through very narrow streets and paths. They were very friendly, and the quality of the bikes was allright. They often stop for drinking and sightseeing, and it's an easy ride.Really a must do! Next time I'm in Bangkok, I'll try another of their tours.

Fabulous!. As a family of 4 we enjoyed the combined bike/boat trip very much! Maybe it was the highlight of our Bangkok visit. Riding through small backstreets of china town, we saw how and where people are living and working. Crossing the river and moving into a more rural Bangkok showed us a side of that city nobody would expect, when just knowing that busy areas suspectely most travelers just learn to know. We booked a private tour which was conducted by a fluent english speaker (Paddie), who explained everything we wanted to know. That Co van Kessel -Tours are worth every Bath and each minute (although they are not a real bargain).

Highly recommended!. We did the tour on Jan 3 in the morning and we loved it! We saw parts of Bangkok that we would have always ignored otherwise, places where you see the real life in Bangkok. Despite what we read in the most recent comments, we loved biking through the narrow streets and the markets. But I guess it's just a matter of preferences. The staff was friendly and was telling many stories behind the history of the places. It included two long tail boat tours of about 30 min each. I would recommend it to anybody! One last thing, it lasted 5 hours, but was not tiring at all.

Disappointing. We just finished Tour #2 this afternoon, and were both very dissatisfied with the tour. Rumblings from a few of our fellow riders echoed our own sentiments. We spent three hours navigating narrow residential alleys/corridors visiting markets and temples that all looked the same. Seriously, if you left the tour after the first 35 minutes you wouldn' have missed a single thing. The only people that had a clue as to why we stopped to look at something were the first 2 or 3 riders after the tour lead; everyone else was left in the dark. Again, in this tour it's not a big deal because you're only seeing markets and temples (of which we had already seen plenty of on our own). We just did 2 bicycle tours in Hoi An, Vietnam, and both were fantastic. Maybe we were expecting too much from Bangkok and Co Van Kessel Tours.

Biking through Bangkok-Chinatown. I recommend the biking tour of Co van Kessel. We biked for 3 hours throught China town and crossed the river (the Co classical trip, check the website for more info). Excellent guides and an biking experience you will never forget!

Nice way to discover Bangkok. I did the bicycle tour by night, which was a real eye-opener for me. We passed through tiny streets and alleys, took a boat across the river, saw the flower market and visited Wat Pho in the dark (definitely the highlight of the evening). Te whole thing was well organised and planned and the pace was just right so that everyone could follow easily.I would most definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Bangkok.

Worst Day in Bangkok. I booked the 9 hour trip, from the hotel starting point we weaved our way through narrow alleys around Chinatown to the train station where we caught a slow train out to a rural area somewhere out near the airport. So far okay then we find ourselves on these elevated pathways no more than 4 feet wide and elevated about 2 metres above water mostly both sides, I have never been so scared of falling in the water. What made things worse was to hear that at least five guides have done just that in the past. It really is not very safe and with motorbikes sharing the narrow path I felt ill most of the time we were on these paths. We visited a nice temple before taking a longtail boat through the canals back to the skytrain station. We had to carry our bikes up stairs and escallators and back down again which was a bit difficult. I never thought that I would be saying that the best part of the bike riding was on the busy streets of Bangkok. We stopped for drinks and had a lovely lunch all included. I ended the day battered and bruised and so tense that not even a massage helped.
Good fun. Good fun and good way to see other side of BKK!!! I can recommend you doing this bicycle tour....3 hours could have been 5!

Don't miss the easy bike tour. Being Dutch a bike tour sounds okay though BK may give 2nd thoughts due to the heat. NO PROBLEM. We started at 9:00 and back at 12:00. Prem showed us the other sight of BK - mostly China town with all the foodmarkets ( fish, vegies, flowers and even freshly cut ginger- imagine the smell...) and also crossed the Chao Phraya river twice. The speed of cycling was up to us, enough stops in between with water / crisps and clean toilets. We have seen a Burmees football show (Takra), the sitting Budha, a cat lady and so much more. I have seen a side of BK which would not have been possible without Prem. Great experience.

great tour but you need to be an experienced rider. My husband and I took the boat-bicycle tour 1 in mid November. The trip was very professionally run and the combination of biking in the city and a more rural area, and a long tail boat ride in the canals was a great mix. We opted for the lunch option which was delicious. My only warning is that you really need to feel comfortable on a bicycle. I think of myself as an experienced bicyclist having ridden several thousand miles, but I quickly realized that my experience was all relatively high speed on open roads. A lot of this biking is low speed in narrow alleys, markets and on narrow concrete walkways. The walkways are only 3 to 4 ft wide and the consequences of falling off are somewhat dire. If that makes you very nervous (like me) you should just take up the rear and walk your bike when things get dicey. I was amazed by how well the other participants (all Dutch) handled their bikes at slow speed!.

It was worth the money!. A couple of people from Holland recommended this tour. I booked the bike-boat tour from the heart of Chinatown to the gardens of Siam with a meal. The ambiance in the group (mainly Dutch people) was very good and the people who led the tour where very nice and spoke good English. They provide bottles of water and ponchos for the rain.I have seen another side of Bangkok that I wouldn't have seen without the tour.At first I doubteld if I should book the tour, it is not very cheap, but it was worth the money!

an unforgettable insight never to be forgotten :-). These guys on two separate tours gave me an insight to life that I will talk of and recall for all my days. I feel privileged to be given an inside track to the real working cogs and cycle of Bangkok life. You don't get this on a bus, taxi or other type of tour believe me. If you are faint hearted forget it, if you want to really know how life there truly is then bite van kess hands off. Very well organised and blended in to their way of life.Yet again its like being invited in to a way of life that people greet you with so many warm smiles and faces, when life what you witness is is so hard and tough as you bear witness too.Do it :-)

Great tour around Bangkok.. You will get to see the city in a different way. The one I took, was the combo trip with bicycle and long tail boat ( 5 hours ), so as well as seeing most of the China town, you will get to see how people live along the canal. Very well organised. They split the group, so max 5 ppl + 1 guide, which makes it safer when crossing the streets of BKK. Since it is company founded by Dutch guy, and it is very popular among Duch ppl, very likely you end up being the only "foreigner", if you are not Dutch yourself  But it is not a big deal.Do it while in Bangkok if you want to see more authentic side of the city.

Very nice tourguide on a very nice tour. Unless a bit rainy, still a very nice and well organized tour. (The short one = 3 hours) discoering places you wo'nt find so easy. Will come back to do the longer tour

Unforgettable experience!. My husband and I are visiting Bangkok for a few days while on our honeymoon and decided to take this tour as recommended by my parents. Definitely exceeded our expectations!!! We will never forget this for the rest of our lives! Coming from Canada this was just amazing to see, you get to see the real Bangkok and how people live. Our tour guide A was awesome! You must do this tour if you're in Bangkok!!

Best way to see Bangkok - fantastic cycling tour. I joined one of the Co Van Kessel tours yesterday, and must say it has turned out to be an amazing experience. Very kind guides, easy cycling pace, and a truly unique route that took us to small back alleys of Chinatown, the huge market place, and a fun boat stop that brought us across the river for more cycling in the greener area overthere. Have been in Bangkok several times and this is the best experience ever, the perfect way to see a part of Bangkok you would otherwise never see. Highly recommended. I took the classic tour (nr 1), including the thai lunch, in the afternoon.

A not to miss experience!. A really cool way to see the city. The trip was very well organized with good guides and a nice lunch. We loved the cycling through the busy heart of Chinatown, the local markets and the calm outskirts of the city.I think everybody should go on one of their tours, it is a great way to experience the real Bangkok.

Cool! Bangkok as it is!. The trip was a whole entertainment, the girls very friendly! We actually were late for our tour and one of the girls brought to a group using a shortcut, excellent! Suggestion would be to: either stop less or stop, explain quickly and keep on going! I definitely recommend the china town tour!

Loved the 'real' Bangkok!. After we arrived in Bangkok in the morning we went on a cycling tour with Co van Kessel in the afternoon and it was a great experience! You really get to see parts of Bangkok which you otherwise would not see by yourself! It was good fun and the Thai lunch was really tasty as well! Would recommend this tour to anybody who wants to see more of Bangkok then just the Grand Palace!

It's worth every baht!. We really didn't expect an experience like that. In a group of only four people, we had a great guide, who was talkative and friendly. She led us trough dark spots of Chinatown with a smile and nearly showed us the living room of some locals. With seeing Wat Pho and Wat Arun in their bright night illumination, taking the ferry to the other side (with bike) and finally good meal at a local corner... We just enjoyed every minute!

The Best Bicycle Tour in Bangkok. As airline crew we visit Bangkok quite regular.I did the Bike tour with CoVanKessel four times already.Every time it was different, but every time it was very well organised.An absolute must for Bangkok travellers. They take you through narrow alleys and hidden markets, behind the Shopping Mall / Hotel facade. You will have a true Thai lunch, out of town in the countryside.Your hair will be a mess after a hi-speed trip in the power-boat.You will experience Bangkok from very close-up, especially the smell (haha).I did it once in the rainy season, got soaked - even with a poncho - , but we had a good laugh.Check it out!

terrific tour. Our family did the 5 hour morning bike tour and it was just fabulous. Our boys are 13 & 16 and they moaned about having to do a bike tour but at the end of it, they said it was great and a highlight of staying in Bangkok. We rode through food markets, flower markets, fish markets, chinatown, took the bikes on a long boat and cruised through the canals and rode through small alleyways where people lived. Went to a couple of temples. Very easy, flat riding. A definite must do tour. Highly recommend it.

Excellent!. Simply the best way to discover Bankok! We did the whole day tour that includes taking you bikes on the train and a longboat so you also get to see the suburbs of Bankok. It was really awesome!
Amazing. In one word... AMAZING! Fantastic guids,alot of thnx to jackie and mr mee!! Great and delicious lunch! My vacation wouldn't be the same without doing this!

The Bangkok you will never see, without a bicycle. This afternoon we spend three exciting hours (enough breaks and drinks are included) with our guide to the narrow alleys of the great city of Bangkok, the places we have been, with a ferry to the other side of town, the smells (good and bad), the nice local people (sometimes you think you are cycling through their living rooms) and all the great sounds have been a treat to us!Don't be afraid of the dogs, they only sleep or bark occasionally. :-)
