Wonderful way to see the "real" Bangkok!. This is the second time in five years that we've done this bike tour and it was as impressive this time as it was the first. Friendly guides, very safe conditions, fantastic view of the behind the scenes parts of Bangkok you really can't see any other way. A few quick tips: - definitely add the lunch option to your tour; it is one of the very best Thai meals you will have on your visit to Bangkok; really fantastic- if it's raining on the day of your tour, go ahead anyway. The guide will give you a lightweight poncho and the tour will still be great; it rained during parts of both of our tours and it didn't even slightly dampen the fun of the tour- in my opinion, the morning tour is more interesting because the Chinatown morning markets are in full operation and it's one of the most fascinating parts of the tour- -

a great experience. If you want to see Bangkok from a whole new perspective, book a bike tour with Co van Kessel tours. A very friendy guide told us a lot about the life of those who work on the fish markets or in one of the shops of Chinatown.
Excellent!. The tour with guide Patty was very nice! We've seen so many nice places in Bangkok. Patty showed us various places of the city, places which you'd never explore by yourself.

A Really Great Day. Did the full Day Tour 5 and it really is amazing, the whole day from start to finish was very well run and the two guys from the company really made it. It was a great way to see parts of the area that you would not expect to be able to see and the included lunch and endless supply of water was really appreciated.I would though make one observation about this tour in that it is a very full day that involves lots of riding along the raised walk-ways by the sides of the canals so it might not be for everyone. If not do go on one of their other tours you will not regret it!!

Nice way to see Bangkok. We took the boat and classic tour and had heaps of fun. Great to see Chinatown like this, with hidden things in every corner. After Chinatown we took the boat to the other side of town, Thonburi. Here we saw the other side of Bangkok, plantations, small quieter streets and temples that not many tourists frequent. Several small boat rides and after a few hours we had dinner far away from the bustling streets. The food was really tasty and much needed after we had been rained on.Be aware though: only dutch people seem to do this tour...

Best tour in town(or even in Thailand!). What a blast we had on this day, the most amazing trip in bangkok! We travelled with our 2 kids, age 6 and 10, the oldest being on his own bike. We cycled from 13.00 to 18.00, and it was just prefect. Though we had high temperatures, it was fine on the bike. Chinatown was amazing, driving through small alleys, even shops, it was incredible. The boat travels were nice again, and it s amazing to see nature at such short distance of Bangkok.The tour is more than you expect, the tourguides are wonderfull, very friendly, and open. Thank you Prem, and Mr Ang, the kids still remember you fondly!After being in the south of Thailand, having seen and done amazing things(elephants and such) this was defintely, for all of us, the highlight of our holiday!

really nice tour!. 2,5 years ago we did the cycling tour of 5 hours with Co van Kessel and we really liked it! It's a great way to see a lot of Bangkok. Our children were 3 and 5 years old at that time and they liked the tour too. This year we did the walking tour of 2 hours through Chinatown. We liked this tour too. It's a great way to see the ordinary life in Chinatown. We couldn't have done this on our own because you easily get lost in the small alleuys. And we didn't want that to hapen with our two children. The guide takes you through the mall alleys and shows you the real Cina town. Amazing!

Wonderfull. We had the Bangkok by night tour and it was just great. Great tourguide Pak Choi, great alleys with wonderfull people drinking and cooking by night. Walking through the Wat Pho grounds with nobody there is a great experience. All in all just a must do when you have an evening to spare (or want to warm up for some Khao San drinking).

Highlight of my visit to Bangkok. Our family took the 'Night Tour', from 6 - 9 pm. It was a unique experience to bike through the narrow streets of Chinatown, people waving and kids high-fiving at us. Seeing temples illuminated and crossing the river by boat and bridge. The guides were excellent, the tour organisation perfect. It is not cheap, but certainly worth the bahts! The tour requires good biking skills though! We were with an all-Dutch group, being used to bike in heavy traffic, it was no problem, but if you never rode a bike, don't start on this tour.... For me it was one of the highlights of my vacation in SE Asia!
Not to miss experience. As a tribute to Co, my kids (5&8) and me went on the 'classic' cycle tour. It was great! Dazzling short cuts, alleys, sights and all in a super relaxed pace. #justdoit

Great day in Bangkok!!. This morning at 7.00 o'clock the trip started, a beautiful time to start in China town! Our tour guide Petty was really lovely and enthusiastic to guide us! It was a great tour and nice to see Bangkok and the surrounding by boat and bike. Shortly say a must if you like to see more of the city of Bangkok!!I have to become a bike tour guide too!!

Very enjoyable ride through the city. We did our trip through China Town, which was very enjoyable as we didn't know that part of the town very well. The cycle tour is nice and easy with the best part being cycling through tiny alleyways through the market. I had my 8 year old sitting on the back of my bike which meant she was free but children can easily cycle as part of the group as well (with 20% discount).It was nice to do something apart from shopping so I would recommend it.They supplied water, crisps (chips) and a soft drink during the middle of the tour and the guides were both really nice.

Great atmosphere, great vibe!. Yesterday we took the all day tour and it was an amazing experience. Our (thai) guide was funny and straight-forward. He was fluent in English and was even able to speak Dutch (tegenligger!). Mister 'Chop Choy' showed us Bangkok (and its surroundings) like we could never see on our own. A must...

Boat tour. We enjoyed the boat tour very much (tour number 9). Very different from the cycling tours. The old east of Bangkok with the wooden houses in the river. The very kind people. And the colourful market. Also the use of different types of boats was fantastic. Keep on with the good work. I will be back. Kind regards Gea

Bicycle tour 1 Bangkok. Yesterday morning we did the Co van Kessel bicycle tour through Chinatown and the Klongs. Parents and two kids 11 and 14 years old. We did the morning tour because the temperature is better and the traffic is somewhat lesser when starting. Great tour, through parts of Bangkok never to be seen with other means of transport, through real life Chinatown and real life of Thai just outside of Bankok. The tw rides on long tail boats are interesting, going through the Klongs, but cycling there is even better. Good service (drinks etc.) on the way. Where ever you pass, people are friendly, are also a little bit puzzled about the strange (mainly Dutch) people on bikes. But waving and really friendly people everywhere. When in Bangkok a "must do".

co van kessel classic tour. We, a dutch family of 4, (children 13 and 15), had a fabulous trip, guided by jacky and Singh(?). We were together with another family of four and 2 guys. The group was plessant company and the guides were outstanding. Good information and they guided us save through the traffic, markets and on the boats and ferries. This tour was with no doubt the best money i've spend. In Bangkok. This way you really experience Bangkok instead of just see it, and you use all your senses.

Everybody should go for it!. Today we did the boat/bike tour 1 with "van Kessel Tours".We did a private tour. That means we did it with two persons and a guide (we didn't care to pay for four). We like to have the experience by ourselves and not to be bothered by others. But that's our thing.Our guide named Emmy (or Amy. She listened to both calls.) was a darling. She knows "everything", "everybody" and everybody knows her. A very trustworthy and very save guide.We went through Chinatown etc, etc. This will be a repeating of former reviews. So I stop here by mentioning: Bicycle, Chinatown, temples, Klongs, Longtailboat and a warm guide: VERY GOOD.Really, GO FOR IT, you not Dutch-speaking tourists (because there were a lot of them. Luckily we were on our own.)Emmy: See you back on our next visit to BKK.Paul

A must do in Bangkok!. We took the 5 hour cycling tour through Bangkok, including ChinaTown and a klongtour in a longtail boat. We felt really safe with the 2 tour guides, DiDi and Aong. They were fun and gave a lot of information about sites, and Thai culture. Plenty of stops during the trip with fresh water and toilet opportunities. During the trip you experience the real Bangkok, with quiet back alleys, local markets in China Town and the countrysite part was also fantastic. Just make sure you check your bike (breaks) and have a solid breakfast because the lunch will be rather late (4pm). The lunch is extensive and very good! We ate so much that we didn't ate during the evening.

Amazing experience!. 4 years ago we booked the Chinatown cycle tour with Co van Kessel, super fun experience, today we had a similar fantastic experience riding bikes through Chinatown, visit the smallest hidden markets, serene temples. The cycling is sometimes a bit challenging, even for us Dutch, and we are born on bicyles, but so worth it! An absolute MUST when you visit Bangkok. In 4 years the service is still very good, our guide as wonderful as 4 years ago, excellent tour!

No words can explain. No words can explain but I will try with just a few that say it all... Fantastic, great, awesome, must-do, must-see... Shall I continue or did you get that we absolutely loved today. We booked tour 1, Inside Chinatown and klongs bycicle tour.

Bike tour Chinatown (ca.3 hrs). We booked the bike tour in advance at the website. Everything was very well explained on the site. The bike tour began at 8 am. We could choose between a city bike or more sportive bike. During the ride guide Andy told us everything about the places we visit throughout whole Chinatown, it was amazing all the markets we saw! wonderful to visit all those places. there was enough time to relax during the tour with the drinks we were offered. Also a ferry tour was included to visit some temples on the other side of the river. Andy was a very good&enthusiastic guide. A real must-do when you're going to Bangkok!

Great Bangkok bike tour for both adults and kids. The four of us took this tour in June 2012. The youngest, 5 years, on the back seat with daddy. The oldest, 7 years, on his kids mountain bike guided by his mom. With two guides for a group of 8 we cycled across markets and old parts of China town. Across the water we went for a less busy part of Bangkok. Great sites that no other tour will take you to. The tour offers two breaks with drinks and snacks and multiple stops at markets and temples. Great ride and memory for the whole family. My kids will never forget the friendly Thai waving from every streetcorner. Having two blond sons also means that they need to be protected from Thai trying to toutch them all the time, but that's a downside I can digest. Try it, you'll love it.

Excellent bike-boat tour. Very much fun half-day bike-boat tour. Started with cycling through very narrow streets in China Town. Then we crossed the river by ferry and did some nice cycling at the other side. Visited a Temple, then boarded one of the fast local longtail boats to go to the plantations. Recommended!

Night cycle was great. I was surprised to see only one other person booked on the tour, but it meant very personalised service. The guide (sorry, can't rememeber the name) was friendly and informative. The bike was comfortable, although the breaks could have been a little stronger. The route itself was great, avoiding the main roads generally and showing a very nice side of Bangkok. The next day I went on the Bangkok jungle tour with Spice Roads. I think the 2 companies are much of a muchness.

Don't hesitate!!!! Do it, its great!. Really really enjoyed it.I took the 5hr tour and there was not a moment that i was bored.You see a lot of nice places and people and a other side of Bangkok. The guide was very friendly and tells a lot.What i already wrote.....Don't hesitate!!!!Don't forget your camera (there is also time and a safe way to make some short films/clips when cycling)Andy Rotterdam (april 2012)

Amazing. My sister and I really liked the Bangkok combination tour,you have a part in the boat, where you see all the characterful houses.And another part you are cycling to the small and lovely little streets.The guides are very good, answer all your questions and can even speak a little bit Dutch,the bicycles are nice, the trip is more safe then I expectand you see a lot of different views from Thailand. :) Perfect!Tonight I am going to do the 'Bangkok by night'-tour with my parents. I am excited!

Very cool experience. A great way to see Chinatown and it's surrounding areas (I did a 3 hr tour). Going through narrow back roads and riding through several different markets is an experience onto itself. Add that with visiting temples off the beaten path and u have a pretty unique tour.Not having ridden a bike in many years, going on this tour perhaps wasn't the smartest thing I could have done. But a few knocked over pedestrians and a some scratches on my arm are worth the experience.

View of the otherside. This is the ideal way to get a an impression of "the how the other half lives" in Bangkok! You enter narrow alleys which you would otherwise never consider going into, as well as get to see large area of the city you wouldn't be able to cover in such a short period. We were well looked after by knowledgable guides.

fun bicycle tour!. went the 4 of us. wife, kids ( 10 & 12). It's fun to bike trough backstreets of BKK and see what you don't see on the regular sidewalk ( is there any in BKK ;)?) bring sunblock and a hat, because it can get hot. My advice is: take a short trip, max 3 hours and skip lunch. 3 hours will do and is just long enough to have fun......I've you take a long trip it might get to hot to cycle.

Awesome, scary at times,. A very well organized trip through China Town, on to a ferry crossing the Chao Praya, visiting temples and one of the few Roman Catholic churches in Bangkok (only open on Sunday), then on to a long tail boat for lunch, and then more biking on very narrow pathways with motorcycles/bikes/peoples and many many many dogs! Water and food is provided. The trip is amazing even though at times your balance is tested. You really get to see how development is encroaching on farmland. Definitely recommend it. They also have kid bikes from ages 10 and up and bikes with child seats for youngsters but I would be quite scared at times biking through narrow streets and paths with a kid in the back!

The best way to see Bangkok in 1 day. This was a real highlight of our holiday, a truly unforgettable experience. We booked this at the last minute as we only had a 2 day stopover in Bangkok. The staff were friendly and obviously knew the city well, taking us to hidden places we would never have seen on a "usual" tour. An added bonus - the food was excellent, served in a local cafe beside the river. We covered so much in 1 day it was well worth the money. Thank-you.

Unique interesting tour, but my daughter a bit scared as brakes didn't work!. My son and I loved the Boat & Bicycle tour - riding down narrow alleys in Chinatown, crossing the river on a local ferry, riding the concrete paths through the green, swampy Thonburi, blasting down the canals in a longtail - a great different side to Bangkok. Unfortunately my daughters bike didn't have working brakes and that, with the traffic (both pedestrian and vehicular) on the early part of the tour put her off, which ruined it a bit for my wife as well. It was our fault we should have checked the bike more carefully. One section was a little scary - riding on the hard shoulder of a busy road the 'wrong' way, but was no big deal for any experienced cyclist. Good food and drink stops, rests on the boats, friendly & happy guides. Got to see a whole different side to this great city! All in all we boys loved it!

Good biking tour!. It was pouring rain that day, but the tur was still good, you just bike through the backstreets of Bangkok (chinatown), almost feels like the backjard of people's houses. It's some very narrow streets, but funny to be biking there. You also take 2 different boats and see how the thai live on the smaller canals along the main river. Nice lunch. Good guides.

A different way to experience Bangkok. Co gives you a great bike tour trough Bangkok. You will bike along places which you would have never found yourself. So if you would like to experience in a different way....A must do!

Not to be missed - a brilliant day!. I have been to Bangkok numerous times before (this time was only a 3 night stopover) and wasn't particularly looking forward to the usual program of shopping and concrete walks. Due to our late arrival time I was unable to prebook my tour but the following day rang the office at 7.30am and successfully booked for the 9.00am full day tour on that day. Utilising four modes of transport (bicycle, longtail boat, local train and skytrain) who would have thought you could experience such a great and varied insight into the true Bangkok lifestyle. The frenetic sight, sounds and smells of the many local markets we cycled through was quite a contrast to the peace and serenity of the temples and mosques we cycled around.Cycling through neighbourhoods, small alleys, fresh markets and temples allowed you to get close to the local people and experience their lifestyle away from the usual tourist sites.There are plenty of drink, snack and restroom stops throughout the tour including an enjoyable lunch in a non-tourist restaurant. A great bonus of the tour was that all drinks, snacks and lunch were included in the price so that you only needed to take your camera with you.On the occasions where we had to cross a busy road I was amazed at the power of the yellow caps waved by Amy and Mr Ahm that stopped the flow of traffic to allow our 9 cyclists to safely negotiate the road!This is a perfect way to see Bangkok away from the usual tourist haunts. My only disappointment was that my wife (a non-cyclist) didn't get to enjoy the wonderful experience I had with a very professionally run company.On my next trip to Bangkok the first thing I will be booking is another tour with Co van Kessel Bangkok Tours.

awesome canal tour. we booked the tour at 1.30am for the same day 2pm and were happy that they were felxible enough to adjust the schedule to our needs. Plane was delayed and therefore we had to postpone 2 hours and I appreciate that they handled that even on such short notice so customerfriendly. Anyway, we did the 2h canal boat tour and enjoyed very much to see a variety of quiet neighbourhoods away from the busy and crowded downtown area. I would recommend very much this company not only if you need to fill some free hours of a short stay in Bangkok.

Great trip. Great trip (maybe the guides could have given a little bit more information), straight through markets, bikes on a boat, nice boattrip, biking through the ‘countryside’ and plantations outside Bangkok. Lunch was superb, great food in a great ambiance. Worth every bath

No better way to see the real Bangkok. I didn't have high expectations when we started but boy was I in for a surprise. This trip (No. 1 on the website) was amazing. It is truly the best thing I can think of that will introduce you to the real Bangkok. It instantly became the highlight of our trip. Truly delicious lunch too!Some tips:- No need to be in good shape (or to be Dutch), this is trip is very very easy. It is all about what there is to see around you, the bike is just a means to give you this experience.- They even have bikes with child seats at the back. In our group there was one couple who brought 3 young kids. They both took one on their backseat and the third one was happily taken by our guide - not a problem at all.- Bring your camera - there is so much to see that you will want to keep it some place where you can get to it quickly
Test your balance. Excellent tour to test your balance over miles of cement walks. Travelling through China Town was quite an experience.

Very exciting! A lot of fun, with professional guides. Must do!. We did this tour a few days ago. I was impressed by the professional and kind guides and by the concept itself (how does one come up with this simple plan and execute it this well?). We had lots of fun while biking through the narrow streets and markets of Bangkok. Hundreds of new beautiful pictures in my head. A big compliment for Co van Kessel and his staff. Many many thanks for this wonderful experience!

To see th real Bangkok you must do a bike tour.. I've been to Bangkok four times, but this is the best thing I've done. I did the short 3 hour trip and it was great to see the little narrow side streets in Chinatown where all the crazy commerce is underway, and then across the river on a barge to see the very different lifestyle in Thonburi including a stop at a lovely temple, and drinks and snacks also.

Co Van Kessel Tours is great to see real Bangkok. After an early start shuttle service pickup from our hotel, my wife and I met with our two lovely tour guides Audrey and Bobo at the Grand China Princess Hotel for 7am departure on the Chinatown and Gardens of Siam Tour. A quick orientation of the bikes, and then into the real Chinatown for a fascinating ride through the streets and narrow laneways, and close mixing with the locals as they go about their daily activities. Biking through this area was exciting and hectic, particularly the crossing of the streets, but the guides made sure everyone was safe along the way. Local ferry across the river, and we entered a slightly slower area and stopped at a local market, which was great to see. A long tail boat ride (with bikes) took us along the canals to rural areas, where we rode amongst local houses and gardens. As indicated by others, the concrete pathways are raised above the ground, and are fairly narrow to navigate without a good bike. This leads to our only complaint, being the women's bikes which have only one gear. This makes them hard to handle in the narrow Chinatown laneways and the raised rural pathways. The operators need to provide new geared bikes for women, similar to what are available to men. We stopped for a top quality authentic thai meal at a local restaurant, and then via another long tail boat ride back to our starting point. In all, I have no hesitation in recommending this bike tour so you experience the true sounds, smells and vision of the real Bangkok and nearby rural areas. Thanks to Audrey and Bobo for providing this very interesting and careful tour.

The one and only original bicycle tour in Bangkok. Having done this tour already a few times it is about time to write a review. This is one of those things that one has to do when visiting Bangkok. We were welcomed at the Grand China Princess hotel with a fresh cup of coffee and a short briefing. Then choose the bicycle in the parking of the hotel and off you go. First explore the maze of Chinatown, amazing how they got to know this routing and find their way through small alleys, fresh markets and local temples. Then the bikes are put on a boat to the outskirts of Bangkok. A huge difference in just a small distance. Outside of the concrete jungle is a beautiful green area with fresh air. Biking here is pleasant, no traffic and a relaxing speed. Plenty of time to see the surroundings and take some pictures. I found bicycling one of the best ways to get close to the local people and see their local lifestyle. Further regular stops are made to refresh yourself with a cool bottle of water. Highly recommended, just do it!

Simply great fun. We took Co van Kessel's Chinatown & Gardens of Siam tour with our family of six, and were accompanied by Jenny and Online (no free wifi while biking, but a friendly little girl watching our backs). The trip is simply great fun. Amazing to see that while you pass through tiny streets, food and fish markets, and in the western outskirts of the city actually right along people's dining table... everyone seems to enjoy saying hello, kids handing out high fives, and so on. The included longtailboat tours, the excellent lunch and everything else all makes for a perfect half day of seeing Bangkok from a totally different perspective.

Bangkok Bike tour. The bike trip consists of a ride through Chinatown and around Bangkok. This is a fairly easy ride, you don't go very fast (because you never really can) and there are lots of stops. We went to two different temples, one Chinese and another Thai. There are also a few long boat rides. The include water and a drink in the trip, you'll need the water as it is very HOT.Chinatown was neat but the streets are narrow and there are a lot of really sharp, short turns. When we were outside of China town it was fun, we went to a small floating market. The paths were narrow and sometimes had dangerous drop offs.All in all it was a very cool experience, we saw a lot of stuff you wouldn't see on the tourist trail. The guides were nice and spoke good english. I would suggest you check out your bike before you leave on the ride, some are in better shape than others.

Amazing Tour by Angmo. Booked a tour with Angmo after a friend recommended her after she stayed in Bangkok for a day long layover. It was a great choice! Angmo took my partner and I through Bangkok to see many sites and get a taste of true Bangkok culture. Angmo was amazing at explaining everything, she had an answer to every question I asked. We had a private van that had ice water and cold towels whenever we got back in which made it easy to brave the heat. Would definitely recommend Thai Sabai Life for any tour in Bangkok.

Amazing Country, Trip & Guide. I have travelled through Thailand on several occasions with different company. Tommy has always been our guide. He is knowledgeable, smart and funny, best part is, He loves food! you will always end up eating at the best restaurants and having an experience of a life time!When we come back to Thailand, we will choose Tommy to be our guide again!Thank you for some amazing trips!

Great food recommendations for meals and snacks.. Had tour guide Tommy. He was amazing! We went from Bangkok to Sukhothai to Chiang Rai to Chiang Mai. In addition to the planned itinerary, Tommy showed us some off the beaten path places on request. My favorite unplanned side stop was boiling eggs in a hot spring for a snack! I have been on guided tours in other countries but this was by far my favorite! A good guide really can make a trip special. If you can get Tommy, it will be a great tour no matter what you pick.

Wonderful day at Ayutthaya. Our guide was Tommy. I forget the driver's name. Both were very friendly, prompt and helpful. Tommy took us to the highlights of Ayutthaya, a UNESCO world heritage site, but even more he took us to things we couldn't have seen or some without him. We also enjoyed being carefree and letting Tommy but smacks and lunch. Plus, having water and cold towels waiting in the can was stuck a valuable perk! I'd absolutely recommend this tour.
Graduation Gift. This was a trip of a lifetime, every place we visited left us in amazement. They out did themselves, we would do it again 10+++++.

Great time in Bangkok. Tommy is a fantastic tour guide. He picked us up in a "disco" van and showed us the highlights of Bangkok: Wat Pho, The Golden Buddha, The Flower Market, the canals, a floating market and a wonderful lunch. He's funny and charming and we all loved him. It was a great start to our trip in Thailand. He even hooked us up with 2 hour ($15) massages at a place next to out hotel! I highly recommend him!

Honeymoon Trip Tour of Bangkok. We are on our honeymoon in Bangkok and booked Angmo for a day tour. She is a very nice funny and easy going lady and looked after us well. Angmo helped us get medication at the pharmacy as my husband had a soar stomche. She also took us to the bus station to get our bus tickets to travel down to Koh Tao - Angmo managed to get us VIP bus which was very good and only an extra £4! If we got the normal bus it would have been a bad experiance for us as they are very cramped and rubbish air condition. I would recommend this tour as it is very intresting and lets you explore Bangkok in a safe and luxury way.

Best Tour Guide in Bangkok!. My husband and had 2 days in Bangkok while on a cruise. After much research, we booked both days with Thai Sabai Life tours. The booking process was simple, communication was great, and payment was easy. When we arrived in port, our Guide, Tommy, met us as we disembarked and let us to a very comfortable private van with air conditioning, cold water, snacks and cold wet cloths when needed. We toured the flower and produce markets - incredible color and variety of flowers and food. We then visited the Wat Pho temple with the huge golden reclining buddha and the grand palace, took a canal ride, and had an amazing lunch with our guide. Leo, the driver, was terrific - he got us up close and was always there to pick us up when we were done. Note - his van was the best transportation we had on our two week cruise - the only way to tour Bangkok!The next day, Angmo met us at the port with Leo and the van. During the hour long drive out to the markets, Angmo told us about Thai history, the current king and his ancestors, and sang some songs about elephants and the name of Bangkok - one very long word. She also stopped at a traditional Thai house to show us how Thai people lived - simple and beautiful, open teak wood rooms that were cool and comfortable. Our first market stop was the Train Market, where the train moves through a very tight space and the vendors pick up their goods to let it pass - unfortunately the train was not running, but it is still a fascinating place to see. On the way back to the van, Angmo bought some pork satay from a street vendor, and we ate it on our way to the Damnoen Saduak floating market; she assured us that the food was fine, which it was, not to mention incredibly tasty! When we reached the market, we boarded a longtail canoe and went into the market. It was quite an experience, bargaining with people from the boat. Angmo gave us some tips before we left the dock, which made the experience a little less intimidating. At the end of the floating market, there are additional stalls on dry land, with some beautiful textiles and ceramics. Angmo bought us some cold drinks, and took some pictures of us. On the way back, we stopped for lunch at a small restaurant that served up some delicious Thai food, then we stopped at an elephant ride place - we did not want to ride, but I wanted to see the elephants up close. She took us to a place where we could feed them bananas and touch them - exactly what I was hoping for. As we were heading back, we asked if she could take us somewhere to purchase a USB drive to back up our pictures; she drove us to a large department store, helped us find the electronics section, translated our needs and questions to the store employee, and helped us check out. Not something most tour guides would take the time to do! We then headed back to the city, and tried to get to the Jim Thompson House, but the roads were blocked by a bicycle race, so we went back to the port. I can't say enough about this tour. We booked a two day 'custom' tour; we told them what we wanted to see and they arranged for us to see it all and then some. They were prompt, helpful, never pushed for time, provided luxurious and comfortable transportation, filled up the drive time with education and conversation, were attentive to our needs and wants, and made sure that we had exactly the visit that we had envisioned. Angmo was delightful - professional, sincere, knowledgeable, and fun; the perfect tour guide, and the best we have ever met. Tommy, our guide for the first day, and Leo, our driver for both days, were also professional and fun to be with. We would highly recommend their services - and suggest that you should book early if you want Angmo - she is in high demand, and worth the wait!

Amazing tour guides!. Tommy picked us up promptly at the hotel lobby. We had a day full of amazing adventures. He took us to many places outside of Bangkok. A beautiful floating market, where we tried lovely sticky rice with mango, a visit to orchid, lotus, rice and fruit plantations, he showed us how they make coconut sugar, we saw elephants and had an amazing encounter with tigers!!! He also took us to a very local market where we had lunch with a stunning river view. My husband and I are very happy we chose this tour company. They really care about us tourists. They take the time to welcome you and make you feel at home. We highly recommend it. Thailand is a beautiful country and its people make it even more beautiful, Tommy and Angmo are the perfect example of this. Tour guides by heart that love what they do and want to share it with the world.

Two days in Bangkok from cruise ship. Driver was waiting for us at cruise port. Drive was about 1 1/2 hour from port. Picked up our guide in Bankok and never stopped! Tommy was an amazing guide. He really cared about making our trip special and made sure we saw everything that we wanted to see, and more. From seeing a ceremony of a man becoming a monk, touring the palace, tuk tuk ride, walking the flower market, fruit and vegetable market and Chinese market, riding elephants, seeing the reclining, golden and jade Buddhas, taking a picture with a tiger, eating with locals at a rural market lunch, snacking in all of the markets, beautiful surprise gifts from Tommy, having Dim Sum in a local restaurant in Chinatown, visiting the floating market, and more. Tommy made sure we were happy. We had large air conditioned SUV with a sweet driver. We can't wait to return to Bangkok and have Tommy show us more!

Bangkok Day Tour From Cruise. Such a great tour with a fun loving, delightful, energetic Angmo. She delivered everything plus that we wanted. Filled us in on local fruits and vegetables on our drive into Bangkok from cruise port.Transporation was a beautiful new plush van with our driver Sweetie, great guy. She tried to avoid crowds , and Chinatown was our first visit, fascinating and we got to shop. We also did the tour of the canal and fed the fish, went to the reclining Buddha temple, beautiful and walked to flower market. She was very helpful with one of our group who had walking difficulties, but made it effortless for the rest of us. We all took TukTuk's for our dinner at a local restaurant which was excellent and included in our pricing. For your perfect tour from your cruise ship this is the company to deal with, Olaf, is the internet contact and Angmo is the fabulous guide. Never go to Thailand without Sabal Life Day Tours.

Bankok tour from cruise ship. We were a group of 8 passengers who arrived on the Volendam,February 12, 2016. One of us arranged a full day tour of Bangkok with Angmo. She greeted us at the port and we had a fabulous day. She had a great personality and gave us lots of information. She was with us the entire day as we toured a temple, China town, the canals, had a wonderful dinner in a canal side restaurant among other things. We had our private van plus driver, a private boat for the canal tour and even a tuk tuk ride. We had a great day and I'd highly recommend Thai Sabai Life Day Tours. Look no further!

Father - Daughter Duo in Bangkok. My father and I had two fantastic days with Angmo in Bangkok! She has such personality and makes her tours fun and enjoyable! Her passion for sharing Thailand history shines through in how she plans her tours and the ways she educates tourists. Her storytelling style is very engaging and her vast knowledge of the culture makes you eager to hear more! Angmo runs a superb operation and you will not be disappointed in selecting her to make your trip memorable.

A wonderful way of getting to know BKK!. My family and I (4 adults) travelled to Thailand this Easter. We only had one day to visit BKK, so we searched in the internet for a tourist guide and we found Thai Sabai Life. Even before our arrival to BKK, they were always amazing regarding our (many) questions about the best way to really get to know the best of the city. While in BKK, our tour guide was Angmo and we really enjoyed her kind, professional and friendly companionship. We visited the main temples, the flowers market, chinatown, the Queen Sirikit Museum of Textiles...we had lunch at a very nice restaurant she recommended us and also tried the Thai coffee while visiting a street market :-) Angmo was always giving us as much information as she could about the places we were visiting and also about the Thai lifestyle and Thailand as a country. The car we made the tour in was also amazing and very comfortable. A wonderful experience, I strongly recommend their services!!!

Can't miss them! EXCELLENT TOUR GUIDE!!!. We travel with our two kids to Bangkok and had a great experience using THAI SABAI LIFE TOUR. They are very serious, responsible, knowledgable and FUN!!! You can not miss their company, they will make the whole difference on your visit to Bangkok. VERY RELIABLE!!!

Fantastic Tour Company! Use them if you want an AMAZING experience in Bangkok!. My friend and I arrived via cruise ship with an overnight stay. They picked us up at Laem Chabang port (as well as taking us back the next day). We decided not to do the ship's excursion and because our time was so limited (1.5 days), we wanted to be able to set our own itinerary and not the cookie-cutter tours that the ship offers. We ended up inviting 2 people from the ship to join us so it ended up being 4 rather than 2 and there was a slight charge ($30pp per day) but I was fine with that for a last minute change in our agreed upon # of persons and plans.Admittedly, we didn't have too much time for research but we had a general idea of what we wanted to see but not a fully planned agenda so we just sort of made it up as we went along. We had Tommy as a tour guide and we had the best time! Tommy was great and was so informative and had the best ideas on where to take us. I'm certain I'll miss some places but we went to all of the Temples, reclining Buddha, and Grand Palace, took a long tail boat along the river, had the BEST lunch at a local restaurant (not touristy at all!), walked around local markets, went to 2 floating markets, a local farmer's market that lead out to another market on the railroad tracks (SO COOL!). We'd planned to go to Chinatown but timing-wise by the time we were going, they were closing for a break and Tommy offered to come back to our hotel a few hours later to take us back but we told him we could go on our own (he was so sweet and accommodating to offer!) Tommy gave us tips for navigating while we were on our own that were really useful. He was a such an excellent guide!!! They provided water, cold towels, and snacks along the way. Their mini bus was wonderfully air-conditioned, well-equipped, and really comfortable. The driver was also really nice and navigated his way around all areas really well. We never had to wait for him upon pickup. Dealing with Olaf through the reservation process was also really easy and he was very knowledgeable and thorough with his advice. Without hesitation, I would recommend using Thai Sabai and Tommy as a guide!. Thank you so much for making our time in Bangkok so WONDERFUL!

EXCELLENT BANGKOK TOUR GUIDE. Our day tour of Bangkok was EXCELLENT. Angmo is very professional, friendly, knowledgeable, caring, fun, and charismatic. She is very generous with her wealth of information on the top highlights of the city. She also knows the ins and outs of navigating through the huge crowds. Her knowledge of history is amazing. We highly recommend her for your tour in Bangkok. She is the BEST.

Perfect Tour Companion!. My wife and I had (unfortunately) only 1 day to see the Bangkok highlights, and Angmo ensured we had a terrific time. She was very open and friendly, knowledgeable about the local culture and history, and willing to entertain our hundred plus questions, while we drove/walked/took a boat ride between the major attractions, Angmo was very patient with our many stops for photos, as well as taking some of us. As previously mentioned, she provided bottles of water and cool towels (which you'll appreciate in the Bangkok climate!) I had every intention of researching Bangkok before we arrived, but ran out of time. But no worries - Angmo was a true guide, in every sense, and shared her Thai hospitality and insight, which we would not have obtained from any guide book. We hope to return!

Best tour guide. Angmo is an outstanding tour guide. She is knowledgeable, professional and very personable. Best of all, as a private guide, she was able to show us all of the important sites and also figure out what extra things we would enjoy and show them to us.

Wisdom & Beauty. My time in Thailand was amazing because of Angmo at Thai Sabai Life. Angmo is such a beautiful, authentic tour guide - she is so wise and philosophical. Angmo not only knows Thailand deeply, but she knows people deeply - she knows how to share of herself. The heart of Angmo is like the heart of the Buddha - open and kind. I cherished every hour with Angmo, from being with an elephant in the river near Kanchanaburi to bowing before the Buddha deep inside a temple cave. Angmo is one of the most amazing people I have ever met, I cannot wait to travel with her again! I love you, Angmo! Love, Sirpa in Michigan

Private 2 day tour in Bangkok. My wife and I were privileged to have a 2 day tour with Angmo in Bangkok, including the floating market, Royal Palace, Chinatown and various other interesting spots. Angmo is a delight. She is knowledgeable, warm, funny and a lovely person generally. Can't recommend her enough.

One Day In Bangkok!!!. Totally fabulous day spent with Angmo. She was so knowledgeable, friendly and made a memorable day even more special. During the van ride, (which by the way, was the most beautiful and comfortable van I've ever ridden in), Angmo had posters to explain to us the various native fruits, and even had samples for us to try. There was a super interesting poster of the Kings of Thailand and we learned a lot of history. I very definitely recommend this tour!

The Best Days of our Trip to Asia!. Since our first contact by e-mail with Angmo and Olaf, which was quickly replied, we knew that we would have a memorable experience in the magical Bangkok. But we could never imagine that it would be SO memorable. Not only Angmo gave us lots of information about Bangkok and Thailand in general, but she also took us to some of the best experiences we've ever had in our trips around the world. The boat tour through the river, for example, brought us some images that we'll never forget. As well as the great lunch in the restaurant where she took us; the street foods she gave us to try; and the great explanations we had inside the main temples.There's not enough words to express how grateful we are to Angmo and Olaf. We had two days of fun, beautiful scenes, great tours, music and lots of conversation. We definitely recommend Thai Sabai Life!

Great Day in Bangkok with Angmo. As another reviewer said, it was like spending the day touring with a friend. Angmo modified her 2 day tour for us due to our timed time in Bangkok, showing us the key attractions in her city and getting my wife and I to all the things we wanted to see in our first visit to Bangkok. The next time we will plan more time so we can spend multiple days with Angmo, visiting a friend and seeing the many things we did the first time. If want a fun and informative time in Bangkok, book one of Angmo's tours.

FANTASTIC 3 DAY TOUR WITH ANGMO. We just returned from Bangkok where we felt privileged to spend three days with Angmo. We were very appreciative of her attentiveness and we had a most enjoyable time. She showed us all of the highlight of Bangkok and outside and brought us to little seen attractions such as the Tiger Preserve where we were able to interact directly with Tigers. This was one of the highlights of our trip and is not to be missed.I would recommend Angmo highly and would like to think of myself as a sophisticated and experienced traveller. I will definitely use her again on my next rip to Bangkok and so will all of my family and friends.

Like spending the day with a friend. We received the gift of a Thai Life and Countryside private day tour for our honeymoon. From the start, months before our trip, Angmo and Olaf were in touch to make sure the dates we wanted were available and that our tour would include everything we wanted to see. Our guide, Tommy, was fabulous. Our focus was on the countryside outside of Bangkok, and he oriented us well to the district we headed to. We spent the day in an orchard, trying all kinds of fruits; and on a long tail boat going to a lotus and an orchid farm. It happened that we had some overlap in plans (two of our tours were to include the Grand Palace and we had already seen it by the time Tommy picked us up), so he skillfully shifted the itinerary around to drop it and something else. The highlight though was going to the local market, where Tommy suggested many kinds of delicious sweets to try and took us to the best meal we've had so far in Thailand: lunch at a local place in the market. We were surrounded by Thai families out for Sunday lunch and shopping, and eating incredible food, and chatting like friends spending the day together about travel experiences, favorite TV shows, etc. Tommy also gave us some great tips and advice on smoothly transitioning to other cities on our tour, which we greatly appreciated. The van was clean, comfortable, and cool and our driver friendly and helpful.Afterward, Angmo followed up to make sure we had been ok with the itinerary and that our day was a good one. It couldn't have been better.

The best!. We went on a "design your own" two-day overnight tour to Kanchanaburi from Bangkok-- floating market at Damnoen Saduak, railway museum, Bridge on the River Kwai, swimming with elephants, Wat Tham Khao Poon, and Erawan Falls National Park. We feel so very lucky to have been with Angmo, our tour guide, who was absolutely professional, impeccably organized, deeply knowledgeable about Thai culture and history, and flexible and responsive concerning our options for the couple of days. She is also pleasant and super interesting to talk with-- just so good at her job! Thanks to her, our Kanchanaburi trip was memorable, educational, tailored to our wishes, and really fun. Thai Sabai Life rep Olaf took care of pre-trip communication and was clear, timely, and informative. Can't say enough positive things about this experience... many thanks to Thai Sabai Life for memories of a lifetime!

Perfect visit to Bangkok. We were very lucky to have Angmo as our guide in Bangkok. Everything was perfect. Angmo is very profesional, she has everything very well organized and on top of that she is nice and funny. A must if you want to have a nice and smooth visit in a crazy city like Bangkok.

Best tour EVER. What a fantastic tour we had of Bangkok with Angmo She made the experience the best we have had of all our tours in the Far EastIt was fun informative and a never to be forgotten experience with Angmo visiting the best sites and always managing to avoid the crowdsand lastly taking us to a wonderful Thai restaurant for fabulous food guiding us with our choices Our driver was not only safe and experienced but his vehicle was new, air conditioned and extremely comfortable( cold water regularly and even mints to cleanse the palate.Angmo shared her amazing knowledge with us and gave us memories never to be forgottenThank you Angmo we really picked the best you were AWESOME!

A private four of Bangkok. Our ThaiSabai private tour ranks as one of the best tours we have ever taken. We had a party of 7 and nothing was too much trouble for our guide. We arrived in Bangkok on Ride for Dad day and many roads were closed but our guide managed to negotiate back streets and other forms of public transport to take us to see the sites she promised. Angmo was so knowledgeable of Thai history, culture and religion. A rewarding experience - I am so glad Angmo was referred to us.

A day tour with Penny. We had an amazing day trip 100 km far from Bangkok. We visited very nice sites such as the coconut fields, the swimming markets, the train market. We experienced how to ride on an elephant, how it feels to snuggle with a snake or a baby tiger!! What made the tour something special was the nice and warm contact with Penny, our guide. She told us many extra details and stories about the country and its people. She is a really nice woman and we had a very pleasant time together. Our driver also was very attentive and drove us resp. picked us up wherever we wanted and moreover provided us with fresh drinks and refreshing tissues at any time. This tour is more than recommendable and more than worth the money. Although, home again, we are somewhat still caught in this extraordinary trip.

Best in Bangkok - from Boating to Buddha. Had the most enjoyable time in Bangkok touring with Angmo. We visited all the sites, experienced some of the best tastes (Thai Fried Chicken and iced coffee!!!), had some serious laughs, and made some incredible memories. Best Day Tour ever! Angmo and our driver were so attentive, fun, and knowledgeable. Thanks Angmo & Thai Sabai Life!

The real name of Bangkok. rKrungthepmahanakhon Amonrattanakosin Mahintharayutthaya Mahadilokphop Noppharatratchathaniburirom Udomratchaniwetmahasathan Amonphimanawatansathit Sakkathattiyawitsanukamprasit.Yep, it's all one word and the longest name of any city in the world. Angmo has us singing the song Thai children learn so they know Bangkok's true name. It was lots of fun.

Day trip outside Bangkok on October 21, 2015. Sorry for the late review. We just got home from our extended trip to Thailand, Vietnam, Cambodia and Korea that included a river cruise on the Mekong River.Our day tour with Angmo and driver Leo were truly one of the highlights of our trip. As we were in Bangkok for two days already prior to joining Angmo, we asked to be taken outside the city. We were driven in Leo's luxury van :) to a local market stationed alongside a railroad track, where we were the only non-locals, it appeared. Very colorful and unusual. We also went to the famous floating market where we toured it by long-tail boat, which got us truly into the middle of the action, rather than just wandering the stalls onshore. My favorite stop was at a tiger zoo, where we got up close and personal with a five-month old tiger cub, feeding it a bottle and lying on the floor with it. You can't do that just anywhere! Also we stopped at an elephant encounter where we fed the elephants bananas. Angmo treated us to various local snacks along the way, and dropped us off at a neighborhood restaurant for local food for lunch. We also stopped at a teak workshop, local homes, and I am embarrassed to say it was such a full day that I can't remember the other stops. All along the way we were provided cool towels and cold water upon returning to the van. Also informative and interesting cultural background. Thank you, Angmo and Leo, for making our trip so memorable.

Best in Bangkok Guided Tours. My wife and I have taken many private tours over the years of travel, and this one experience with ThaiSabai in my opinion ranks as the top guided tours of Bangkok, an absolute excellent experience. Our guide, Angmo, is very knowledgeable of Thai history, culture, and religion. That, combined with an exuberant personality, made this a unique experience. In my opinion, it is matter of time before ThaiSabai will be ranked at the top of private Bangkok tours. My wife and I would not hesitate to use her for any future trips to Bangkok. We did quite a bit of research on private guides in Bangkok, and were very happy to have found someone with such knowledge, integrity, professionalism and excellent English.

Fantastic Day in Bangkok!. This is one of the best tours we have been on. Angmo, our guide, and Peter our driver were the very best. We were treated like family. They were early to pick us up, and the van was very comfortable. I would highly recommend them for anyone visiting Bangkok. The day was busy, but not rushed. We were able to visit many of Bangkoks highlights and Angmo was well versed in the history of her country. We had a great time!

Wonderful Day in Bangkok. Wow! The tour we took with Thai Sabai Life was amazing. Angmo picked us up from our hotel at 9AM (actually the front desk informed us that she was already there earlier so she was incredibly punctual!) and the fun didn't stop all day.We were in an amazing van that was over the top swanky and very comfortable. She gifted each of us in our group with a special souvenir and learned all of our names immediately! Right off the bat, Angmo started giving us history and culture lessons about Thailand. She had informational posters about the royal line and the Thai alphabet. Our first stop was the Grand Palace. We spent time in the Queen's Museum and then saw the rest of the grounds. Angmo told us all the history and information about what we were experiencing. She added a depth to our time at the Palace that we couldn't have experienced otherwise. (We actually had some people trying to tag along to our tour and hear all that Angmo was telling us but Angmo handled them perfectly!) Next, we went to the 24 hour flower markets. Angmo continued to regale us with history, traditions, and facts as we walked around this vibrant area of Bangkok. She also got us all delicious fried chicken, Thai iced coffee, and a mini crepe type of dish so we had an experience of authentic street food. After this, we stopped for lunch. We went to a restaurant that seemed to cater specifically to tourists BUT don't worry, the Thai food was definitely authentic and incredible. We were on the waterfront and had time to relax before our next experience- a "James Bond" boat ride. We boarded our boat and took off after lunch. Wow- this was incredible! We got to see the city from a different angle and enjoyed being on the water. Then, we hit some street markets to do last minute souvenir shopping and then we saw the amazing Royal Temple which is home to the reclining Buddha. Again, Angmo faithfully informed us of the history and facts of everything we were seeing and doing. We were so sad when our time together came to an end, but on our ride home Angmo continued to tell us even more about Bangkok, history, jokes, etc. She told us about our day of the week Buddha and gave us each a parting gift. This tour was a highlight of my time spent in Thailand. Our group learned more about Bangkok than I ever thought possible! I highly highly recommend this tour and if you have more than one day, take advantage and book a two or three day tour. More pros:Angmo was energetic, kind, and incredibly knowledgeable and professional. On top of all that, she was also very sensitive to our group's needs. One member of our group wasn't as mobile as the rest of us, and she made sure she was well taken care of. Angmo also made sure we got to stop and shop which was a special request. She seemed well-known and in the loop everywhere we went, so we felt as though we got special treatment.After every stop, our driver gave us waters and wet wipes to cool off and clean up! The pace and activities of the day were perfectly spaced and planned. We really had a five star experience. And, this trip was very reasonably priced. Do yourself a favor and see this city the right way!!! Book a tour with Thai Sabai Life. You won't regret it.
Thailand . Our guide was excellent. She made our tour day fun and interesting. She went out of her way to ensure we had wonderful experience.

Two days spent with the most AWESOME tour guide!. This was our first time visiting Thailand, and we were overnighting on a cruise ship. We were so lucky to have found Angmo online, and everything was organised via email.We were collected from the cruise terminal by our driver and were met by a smiling Angmo on the way to Bangkok. We spent a fabulous day visiting many highlights around Bangkok as well as enjoying a thai lunch in a local restaurant. We decided to go back to the ship for the night, however another option is to stay in Bangkok overnight.Day 2 we headed out to an elephant camp in Pattaya, where we got to ride elephants and Angmo taught us the "Elephants Song". We enjoyed another wonderful Thai lunch, this time at a seafood restaurant on the beach.I would highly recommend Angmo to show you around her beautiful country. She is extremely knowledgeable, and felt like a member of our family from the moment we met.

Fantastic day - one day in Bangkok. I found Angmo based on reviews and couldn't be happier! We were 6 women traveling through Bangkok and wanted to see the important sites on our 1 day lay-over. Angmo was so personable - felt like she was one of us almost immediately. She knows so much about Bangkok and passed along so much more than what I would have expected from a "tour". I would recommend her to anyone, and I hope to get back and to do the multi-day tour she offers. Big vote of approval!

Lay Over Tour - Fantastic!. Our guide, Angmo, from Thai Sabai Life, was just wonderful. From the moment she picked us up at the airport - we were greeted with a warm smile despite our delay getting through immigration. Our tour hit the highlights of Bangkok for us - the grand palace, the relaxing Buddha, flower market, long boat tour. Angmo was very knowledgeable and pleasant to be with. Also, the van they use is extremely comfortable. I highly recommend touring with Angmo!!!

Great day exploring the highlights of Bangkok. This was my first visit to Thailand and as you can imagine, Bangkok is an overwhelming city. Angmo did a wonderful job of showing me around and introducing me to the city. We spent the day exploring the highlights and also taking me to a mall so that I could buy fabric as a gift for my mother. She definitely knows her history and culture and I could tell she loves to share both with visitors. I will definitely make sure to contact her again the next time I am in Bangkok.

Two days of Wonderful Memories. A 2 day experience throughout Bangkok and the surrounding countryside. After over 50 years of travel, one of the best, satisfying and memorable experiences ever in life.Angmo and Leo have all access to the best spots, the best transportation in order to meet your every need. Incredibly flexible..which is very helpful.We visited the Grand Palace and Temples. When you do this ladies, dont forget to cover your legs and head out of respect. Bring your camera, Angmo will show you all of the best places for the greatest photo ops. On the first day, focused on Tigers, Elephants and the Floating Market. This is nothing like a regular shopping trip or a trip to the zoo. It is incredible. You will meet the local people out in the countryside. Have an opportunity to see how Thai people live. Thai homes, farms, crafts, and all sorts of food. The best of the best.

One Day in Bangkok with Angmo - EXCELLENT. A friend and I had one full day in Bangkok and wanted to learn as much as possible in that short period of time. We had a full day tour booked with Angmo and we were not disappointed at all. Angmo asks a lot of questions to determine your interest level in culture, history, markets, tourist attractions..... Then she plans out the day to meet and exceed your desires. We hit the Grand Palace, Markets, River Tours, Wat Pho, more markets, and a tour around the City all in our private transportation van. There is still more that we wanted to see; but did not have the time due to our own schedules. If we were on our own, we would not have been able to see much of the above. Angmo is excellent and I highly recommend her services. I look forward to our next trip back to Thailand and hope she is free for more excursions.Aaron - Colorado, USA

just simply great. It was so good that even hard to write review :). A lot of small details, like welcome gift, nice smile, luxury van, real care about how do we feel, what we want to see, where we want to go next, flexibility, excellent English etc. etc. - all that makes You feel so good as if You would be not with a guide but with Your best friend in the city. And all that combined with deep knowledge about history and monuments You do visit.Angmo is rising bar so high, that from now on any tour guide we will use (and used so far) in other cities will be compared to Angmo and - unfortunately - I would guess very few if any will match Angmo.During our trip Angmo even managed to learn some Lithuanian words surprising how fast she can manage it (and - shame on us - we were much worst on learning Thai :) ). We have had big fun singing together Thai and Lithuanian songs when in van - looks like our quite "Nordic" and reserved character was really softened by warmth of Angmo.Really best experience and best way to learn Bangkok or entire Thailand. 100% recommended.

Great tour with a charismatic guide!. We had a fantastic time on our tour! I was traveling with a grumpy work colleague who was not that enthusiastic about doing any kind of tour, but his attitude changed after spending a little time with Angmo! She has charm and charisma to burn, we both loved her! She did a wonderful job at showcasing the beautiful and mysterious city of Bangkok! My next trip to Bangkok I will absoluty book with Thai Sabi Life again! Truly a wonderful experience!

Worth Every Penny!. After reading several TripAdvisor reviews, I got in touch with several of the top rated tour companies for a private tour for our family of four (husband, me, two teenage boys). Thai Sabai Life was not the cheapest quote we got, but we decided to book it based on the reviews and the proposed itinerary. This tour was worth every penny!Olaf was responsive and easy to contact on email, and Angmo was the perfect tour guide. We enjoyed every minute of the tour with her. As the other reviews have indicated, we found her to be knowledgeable, enthusiastic, personable, flexible, friendly, and well prepared. All of the arrangements from the comfortable cushy van to the stops we made during the day at the market for traditional Thai coffee and tea, to the temples, museums, and lunch at the restaurant complete with a dessert of local fruits picked up at the market earlier in the day were first class. The cold water and towels stocked in the van, along with our driver (never had to wait for the van) were welcome respites from the Bangkok heat.Angmo took many pictures with our phones, and her own phone - and later emailed them to us. She seems to know everything and everyone - we learned so much about Thai culture and the temples. Angmo was fun to be with and her English was really excellent. All of us really enjoyed spending the day with her. We cannot recommend Tahi Sabai Life highly enough - you will not regret booking a tour with them.

Angmo loves what she does!. I have used Thai Sabai Life twice for Bangkok day tours. Both times--wonderful experience! Olaf responds quickly and answers questions thoroughly by email; Angmo (who was the guide both times) truly loves what she does--really positive personality and speaks great English. She also takes amazing digital photos of you during the day and then emails them to you (at no extra charge) within 24 hours! Both drivers she used drove very calmly and safely, and their vans were very nice inside. Thai Sabai Life is very flexible--you can ask them to suggest an itinerary or tell them what you would like to see or anything in between (you pay extra for the fees associated with what you choose to do that day). Angmo will pay the fees upfront during the day and then give you a list at the end of the day of what you owe her.

Wonderful day☀️✨best memories. We had a amazing day with Angmo in Bangkok. We glad we find such a good funny interesting person to guide us and spend our first day in Thailand . Thank you so much and hope to see you next time. We highly recommend her.

A thorough Bangkok tour in 8 hours!. My friend and I were scheduled for an extended layover in Bangkok and we wanted to do some sightseeing. After seeing Angmo's welcome video, I felt comfortable booking with her. She was a ball of energy! Making sure that we saw all the key sights, Angmo was a wealth of knowledge about the city, culture, people, and food. We especially enjoyed the street food tour with her. She takes special care to steer you away from food which may not be safe for a "Westerner's" stomach. The vehicle in which we were transported was comfortable, and temperature controlled at all times. It was also secure, and allowed us to bring our luggage along. In the van she also has snacks, cold wash cloths, and iced bottled water - a welcome in the extremely warm Bangkok weather. She took excellent photos on her cell phone and emailed them to us promptly! The next time I am in Thailand, and I'm sure I will visit again, I will definitely book another tour with Thai Sabai Life and Angmo!

Fantastic Day!. We had a terrific time with Angmo. She took us to all the sights and gave us a wonderful overview of Bangkok. Angmo was fantastically knowledgeable and educated us about the history and politics of Thailand. We highly recommend her!

5 star tour for the Thrid time !. Thai Sabai once again exceeded expectations , had a very good 6 hour tour of Bangkok , custom made and saw the sights I would otherwise have missed 11 out of 10 and thoroughly recommended
Foodtour. We had a great time with penny the food was delicious and we had a lot of fun. Thank you very much, kob khun ka penny

This is what a tour should be like........ Angmo provided the perfect day as I explored the history of Ayutthaya. Angmo has superior communiucation skills presenting history and insight in a clear manner and she responds to specific questions with the kind of detail that travelers remember long afterwards. The day was orgnzationally planned out at a good pace and was truely enjoyable.

Great time in bangkok!. Angmo was a truly great guide, very knowledgeable and always willing to make any schedule changes and answer any question with a smile. We leave Bangkok happy to have had her as our guide and will always remember the amazing time we had here. Thanks Angmo and we hope to see you in the future! Emilio and Maria Jose

A fantastic day in Bangkok. Angmo was superb. Her friendliness and enthusiasm was contagious. She made our day in Bangkok fun, informative and educational. Her choice of places to visit went beyond the traditional and better known landmarks which made our tour that much more intersting The choice of restaurant was great, the river ride exciting and the tuktuk short ride good fun.Lastly, her choice of driver and very confortable minivan enabled us to confortably navigate through the Bangkok traffic and make the most of our one day in Bangkok.We definitely recomend Angmo to anyone that is planning to visit the beautiful city of Bangkok.Angmo, keep up the good work.Joe & Rose L.

Fun day in Bangkok with Angmo. Our family of 3 retired siblings with our spouses spent a wonderful day in Bangkok. Angmo has us laughing and seeing the wonders of Bangkok's Ewrawan Museum, Sampling local foods and treats along the way to see the flower market, China Town, Had a delicious lunch along the river bank restaurant. Took us for a long boat ride along the famous canals among many local houses, At one point on the long boat ride, we get to feed the local catfish in the canal. She's the only tour guide that I know will take pictures with her own cell phone camera and email the pictures to us before we return home. By the way, we were on a cruise stopping at Liem Chabang port and her driver meet us at the port. She's the most friendly guide that I've used. I've used the service of Tours by Locals several time over the past several years. A job well done Angmo, I'll highly recommend using her as your tour guide while you are in Bangkok.

So much fun!. Angmo was the warmest and most welcoming guide I've ever met. She took four jet-lagged grown-ups and treated us to a day of fun, history, food, and sight-seeing. Our tour started and ended at an airport hotel, which meant a lot of time in the (lovely) van. Angmo had us laughing within minutes of meeting us, and kept us busy and entertained throughout the day. For example, on the way in to the city she taught us a pop song about the true very very long name of Bangkok. She knows Bangkok and its history, and she knows how to help a group make the most of it. Getting in and through some of the big attractions was made effortless. We got to enjoy lots of yummy street food and saw parts of Bangkok that we would not have without her help. It was a great day, and all because of Angmo!

Excellent. I contacted ThaiSabaiLife a week before going to Thailand. Not only was Olaf prompt and helpful with his responses about the tour, he went the extra mile to give me advice and recommendations for plans I wanted to do on my own too.The tour was flexible and adapted to whatever we wanted to do, transportation was super comfortable and our guide Wassana was friendly, spoke English well and gave us lots of insights on the best places to buy things and Thai life.Thanks for everything Olaf!
Absolutely the best!. please realize that she will adapt to your needs and wishes. A the end of the tour I knew not only that I had had the best guide but that I now have a new friend!

what a fabulous day!. We toured Bangkok with Amor for a whole day. She filled us with the city. She gave us such a wonderful overview of the palace, and every thing else that had to be seen. She was a treasure!

Impressive experience with this company!. My husband and I took a day tour with Thai Sabai Life to visit Bangkok during a long flight layover. Given that we had a fixed schedule and would be traveling with some luggage, we needed a company that could provide flexibility in the schedule and also provide us with a vehicle where we could stow our luggage during our tour. Thai Sabai Life was one of the few companies that agreed to willingly provide us with this accommodation. Further, they were able to communicate with ease in English and also provided total flexibility in the itinerary, allowingus to select the exact places of interest to visit, while also offering helpful advice in planning the itinerary. They were highly responsive to email and it was a pleasure communicating with them to plan the trip. They linked us with Mr. Nikoon for our tour, who was patiently waiting for us at the predetermined location upon our arrival at the airport. As promised, our air conditioned van was waiting for us, which was a lifesaver given the heat outside. This allowed us to travel to multiple spots throughout the day without suffering from heat exhaustion. Mr. Nikoon provided insightful guiding throughout the day and was a pleasure to have as our guide. With ease,he took us from site to site, ensuring both our safety and caring for all necessary logistical details. Perhaps the most impressive aspect was his ability to seamlessly negotiate the timing and length of our visit at each site to ensure that we got to visit all of our points of interest within our limited time frame (so that we could get to the airport in time for our flight). I felt we were in very good hands with Mr. Nikoon and he took care of any possible need we had throughout the day. A special great thanks to Olaf and Angmo for their outstanding handling of the planning of the trip/itinerary. I would highly recommend their guides and company for a visit to Bangkok!

Super-interesting, wonderfully flexible. Angmo is a GREAT guide. She was incredibly responsive to our interests, putting together a perfect (and a little off beat) two days in Bangkok. Plus, she is so much fun!

Private tour of Bangkok for the day. I would like to start by saying we had an amazing time on our tour of Bangkok with Tong! When he arrived he went over with us places we should visit and catered to us every step of the way. We started out visiting The Grand Palace followed by Chinatown and the flower market. We stopped for lunch where he gave his recommendations on the best thai meals. We ended the day visiting Wat Pho and another market. Throughout the day we sampled Jackfruit, fresh pomegranate juice, thai desserts (Tokyo) and breads. We got to experience a little piece of Bangkok during the day! Highly recommend this tour with Mr. Tong!

Once in a lifetime Bangkok experience. Not just the beautiful temples of Bangkok, the guide made sure we had the trip we wanted. Not only the highlights we asked for but also including the small streets behind the temples, where everyday bangkok life is visible. Which was superb to experience, we had lunch at a small, nice and excellent china town restaurant and as we enjoyed the city our guide told us interesting facts, history and stories about our surroundings. We spoke with locals and strolled through the small alleys. Our guide was open for any suggestion and even my son of 14 loved the relaxed way the tour was organized. Relaxed even though we saw so much of Bangkok at the same time.By tuk tuk and boattrips on the amazing bangkok river we visited local markets but also the wonderful amulet market and ofcourse buzzing chinatown. Our guide helped us pick the right food stalls to eat local snacks, loved it!Still feeling a little bit homesick, wanna go back soon!Thanx Thai Sabai Life for showing me the real Bangkok!

Best Tour Ever. Angmo is the best tour guide ever. She is professional, knowledgeable and absolutely a delightful person. She was extremely accommodating and very flexible in organization our tour. Angno looked after all our needs, from providing cold water and towels, to looking after entry fees, to taking pictures, to making entertainment bookings, and even providing us with a personal memento of the trip. Bangkok is an incredible city and we were indeed fortunate to have such a great guide to enhance our enjoyment of the city. Furthermore transportation was provided by a luxury van. We were a group of 3 couples who toured with Angmo in Bangkok. Some words to describe Angmo are: attentive, energetic, knowledgeable, conscientious, intelligent, enthusiastic, considerate, adaptable, fun-filled, and humorous. We saw many sites and thoroughly enjoyed our private tour. From all of us, thank you so much!

my amazing trip with my wonderful tour guide. We went to Thailand in October and had a fabulous time, thanks to our wonderful guide! My daughter wanted a custom tour to Bangkok so she looked up "tours by locals" and found a lady name Angmo. We told her we didn't want a tour of temples and stated what all we wanted to see. She picked us up at our hotel in an air-conditioned custom van. We were able to see everything we wanted and only visited two temples. They knew how to get around and planned our trip accordingly. I love green coconut drinks but didn't care to risk getting sick. Angmo knew where to get us the drinks and even street food that were safe for foreigners. Thai coffee at the flower market beats any coffee we have ever tasted. She and the driver went way above and beyond to accommodate our wants and schedule. If I have more time and space I would recount to you how amazing this team was to us. Traffic in Bangkok is terrible, getting to all the sights by public transport is not possible and taxi gets stuck in traffic for a long time. If I have to do it again I would definitely go with "tours by locals" in general and with Angmo and her driver specifically.

Excellent Custom Bangkok Tour. I had a truly enjoyable experience in Bangkok thanks to my custom 2-day tour led by Angmo. We went to all the best Bangkok attractions and she was very knowledgable about Thai history and culture. We were constantly surprised with little treats like mouth-watering street food snacks, locally produced Thai coffee, and local fruit and flowers from the fresh market. She helped us find the best deals in the floating market and took us to reasonably priced restaurants with some of the most delicious Thai food I've ever eaten! Her customer service far exceeded our expectations and her driver was always courteous and helpful as well. We highly recommend this tour company should you ever find yourself in Thailand. These custom tours are better than large organized group tours and she offers tours anywhere in Thailand! I would definitely contact her again if I return to Thailand.

Best tour ever.. My wife and I just returned from our quick trip to Thailand. We had booked a full day tour with Thai Sabai Life since we were so short on time in Bangkok. We had arranged for a driver to pick us up at the airport and take us to our hotel the first night and then the city tour with Temples and Palaces and then we were heading out of Bangkok to visit the floating markets and other cultural highlights. We met Angmo in the lobby of the Renaissance hotel where we stayed at 9am on the first day. From this moment on we felt like we were being given a tour by a close family member who just happened to know everything about Bangkok, Thailand, Buddhism and any other topic we asked about. We loved all the personal touches. Also not having to figure out how much Baht to carry was very helpful and helped relieve some of my wifes anxiety. Angmo pays for everything and you just pay her back at the end of the tour. It was also nice to have her taking pictures of us as a couple. Many times i look back at the photos from a vacation and it is like I'm not even there. This time I received an email from Angmo on my arrival home with many pictures of us as a couple and even a few sneaky pictures taken when we were just enjoying the scenery. We enjoyed meeting many Thai people who seemed to enjoy talking with us and sharing their culture. In the title of my review I say that this was the best tour ever. I say this after many countless tours. i have now been to 34 countries and most of the states in the US. (I;m a traveling consultant.) Never have I felt so comfortable and informed on a tour. Don;t even ask me about the food. Heaven.

Great day tour of Bangkok. My wife and I had a wonderful day tour of Bangkok with Angmo. She took us to many interesting places including the Grand Palace, Wat Pho, a lovely trip on the canals, a tasty Thai lunch and very enjoyable trips around the markets. Angmo went out of her way to look after us and was very informative about Thailand and it's history, religion, people and politics. Thanks for a great day!
