va group. we went to thailand for 2 days via cruise, and angmo was our tour guide, besides the tour guide part which was nice, nice and very nice, we developed personal attachment with her, she was fun,caring and a lovable individual, as bao-er (a guy in our group) said we love you! Amao, we had so much fun with you and will treasure the time we were together. way to go!

So much fun!. We just got back from our tour. Mr. "Nick" Nipoon was our guide! He was so knowledgeable about where we were, where we were going, and everything Bangkok! He took us to places where we would never find if we didn't have him. The Floating Market was amazing and the kids loved the elephants!I would highly recommend this tour to anyone!

Fantastic!. Comparing Angmo's tour with other peoples experiences, i can honestly say ours was the best. I felt that we saw everthing we wanted and more,we learned meany interesting facts that you wouldnt normally learn. The whole day was fantastic. Ihave since recomended Angmo to friends and to my salon clients.

Fantastic Day Out. Only having 1 full day in Bangkok we were thinking that we wouldn't get to see many of the sights. We need not have worried - Angmo was brilliant and she put together a day where we saw everything that we wanted and more. Also there were other surprises along the way including fresh flowers and coffee at the flower market. We can't praise Angmo enough - it was the highlight of our holiday. Thank you again xx

The best tour ever!. These guys - Angmo and Olaf were so great! We travel often and take many tours - this was the best ever - in any country! It was so personal, and so much fun! We all felt like family. Other friends who have traveled to this part of the world never experienced the wonders that A & O shared with us - food, religion, tigers, boats, markets.... They will be friends forever. If you travel to this part of the world and do not tour with these guys you will be missing a lot!

Wow!!! What wonderful experiences!!!!. Angmo and Olaf - you two were super. Our group can't stop talking about our wonderful tour with you. Your gifts of flowers while visiting the flower market, samples of your favorite Thai coffee, sharing new Thai food flavors..... it goes on and on. We had such an incredible adventure with you. Thanks for adapting to our requests. We had the great river boat tour to the market, the railroad market, the tigers - oh my!!!! You've made our trip so much fun. We can't say enough. Please feel free to use us as a reference. Best to you, Debbie

Angmo - your personal Bangkok ambassador. Angmo has been a top professional from the e-mail inquiry to sharing the finer details of Thai culture, politics, history, philosophy, art and its incredibly diverse gastronomic offerings. She efficiently organised every detail, flawlessly incorporated specific instructions, was extremely focused and still added 'signature surprises' to add fun and lightness to our full itinerary. An inspiration to any person involved in the service industry. kaub-koon krap!

Tour of Bangkok - Food and Cultural. Awesome private tour with the best guide in Bangkok! We booked a custom tour to see authentic Thai food and some of the main cultural sites in Bangkok. Angmo knew where to take us for unbelievable local food - that no tourist would be able to find on there own. We also learned an amazing amount of information about Thailand's history and cultural sites. We have been to Singapore, Vietnam, Spain and France - but this tour was the best one we have ever been on!

River and Train Market Adventures!. I only had one full day in Bangkok, and I'm so glad I had Angmo! She was fantastic!! The main highlights of the tour were the train market and floating river market, but she also took us around to see local craftsman and purveyors, food markets, elephant farms, and a great lunch. I felt like I saw everything there is to see! I didn't even mention the luxurious car ride in between the markets where Angmo talks about Thai culture, history, and cuisine. We were lucky to see the train go through the train market... it really is a sight to see! The floating markets are worth the trek out of Bangkok. We cruised through the canals on a little boat and bartered for wares, and had a blast. The best part of the tour was Angmo, herself. She is friendly, helpful, and very funny. She'll take great care of you. This is my favorite tour that I've ever done!!

Hassle free!. Excellent use of time, worth every penny, Bangkok is a very busy city and one could spend hours just fighting the traffic. Angmo made this a pleasure rather than a hot a sticky temple trudge! Articulate and flexible. Tell her what you would like to see and she will custom. I Don't think you can do this yourself!

Fantastic Day Tour in Bangkok. We booked a private all day tour with Thai Sabai after reading the favourable reviews on Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed at all. We have visited Bangkok before but this time we took our children, aged 18, 20 and 22 and decided that to get the best out of our short time in the City, a private tour would do the job. Angmo was professional, courteous and friendly. We had a large brand new van which was beautifully cool in the searing heat, and was well equipped with plenty of water and cool towels.The trip was tailored to exactly what we required; we visited the Royal Palace, the flower market; had a great lunch, followed by a longboat tour. Angmo was very accommodating and informative and she also took photographs for us and emailed them to us later that day! She also recommended other places for us to visit that evening. We went to "Asiatique" night market which was a great mix of fabulous waterside restaurants, bars and speciality shops. We would have no hesitation in recommending this tour and we would like to thank Angmo very much for making our day memorable!

Great Tour. My partner has never been overseas and when she chose Thailand I was surprised. We were told to use Thai Sabai as they were very professional and we were not let down My partner gets tired easy and having our own private driver and guide was the best thing we did. We were spoilt with cold water and fresh cold towel every time we got back in the car. Angmo's knowledge was great and I'm not sure who enjoyed the tours more my partner for the history of Thailand or Angmo for telling a client who was really interested in it. She was also funny and smiling and didn't get annoyed me taking heaps of photos. I would recommend this tour group for any tours in Thailand and the prices are good. It was money well spent. Thanks again Angmo for a great time and wonderful memories.

6 Hours in Bangkok. This Tour can be custom made to suit your time in Bangkok , Angmo is the perfect guide with an excellent command of English and excellent knowledge of Bangkok .The transportation service is first class , I would say the best I have ever had for a tour The major benefit of booking this tour is that they will customise the tour for you , so where I had already seen some off the major sites in Bangkok , I just told them where I had already been , they made new suggestions of places I had not visited then organised an itinerary for me , Wat po , Canal Boat ride , Flower Market , China town . Recommended to anyone who wants to see Bangkok either for the first time or a returning visitor .

Thai Sabai tours. We had a great day in Bangkok with Angmo from cruise ship at Klong Tooey. She cared for us as family members, took pictures of us and shared by email. She helped us get to Holy Redeemer church for Mass after seeing the highlights of the Grand Palace, Wat Pho and the flower markets. We would highly recommendher services to anybody. DRC

Hands down - the only way to see Bangkok!. Angmo was a fantastic guide- 5 stars/circles isn't enough!! Instantly, she was more like a personal friend showing us all of her favorite local spots! She showed us a side of Bangkok that we would never have the chance to see - without her amazing guidance. She was very well organized, professional, knowledgeable (and she can sing!), flexible with our needs and very attentive to make sure we had the best visit for our 2 days in Bangkok. We can't thank her enough -- we recommend her again and again!

It Doesn't Get Any Better!. We have done a lot of travelling but I must say, Angmo is probably the best we have encountered!She is friendly, helpful, charming, informative, attentive to details and well spoken and she has a great sense of humour (and pretty). She is proud of her country and wants to share as much of it as she possibly can. We loved every minute we spent with her! Job well done Angmo. Friends forever. Jack, Leona, Doug, Marg, Ted and Sandy from Canada 5555

wonderful trip with Angmo in Bangkok. We shared a day with Angmo in Bangkok and she was more then wonderful. She is a great guide, and very helpful in every respect. She gave us information about anything we asked and her charming personality made our trip better then expected.We can highly recommend, this company, if you want to enjoy Bangkok. Edith and George California

wonderful 2 days in Bangkok with Angmo. Spent 2 fabulous days touring Bangkok and the surrounding areas with Angmo as our guide. She was very flexible with our itinerary and managed to fit in all the highlights as well as some fun things to personalize our experience. We did everything from the temples to the floating markets and everything in between. She was willing to take as much or as little time as we required. She is an excellent guide who makes your Thai experience both fun and memorable.

VERY IMPRESSED WITH THIS COMPANY. We just returned from a Asian cruise. One of the many highlights was being shown around Bangkok by Nikoon from this tour company. Our day consisted of a visit to the railway market, and the beautiful floating market nearby, followed by a ride on an elephant. We were able to plan with this company only the things that truly interested us and had an amazing time. An added bonus was visiting beautiful temples with Nikoon who was full of knowledge and was able to provide us with lots of insight into the Thailand way of life.We were also very pleased with the place they picked for us to ride the elephants which was an experience of a lifetime, and the animals showed no signs of distress,unlike the elephants that we'd seen in Ko Samui. For anyone who's planning a trip to Bangkok and wants a reasonable and reputable company with English speaking guides...this is the company for you.You won't be disappointed.

Bangkok day tour. We enjoyed a wonderful tour of Bangkok with a very excellent guide. Her English was terrific. She knew the answers to all of our questions and always had a smile on her face. Our authentic Thai lunch was enjoyed by all 9 of us. I would tour with this company again whenever I am in this part of the world.

Give Angmo 6 STARS. The five star ratings were wrong. This wonderful lady should receive a 6 STAR rating. It is difficult to describe how good she is. From the very beginning of our tour she made all 8 members of our group feel welcome and involved in the tour. Her knowledge of Thai history and culture is outstanding, but we probably could say that about a lot of guides. What separates Angmo from the rest is the way she imparts this knowledge. It is hard to describe how she involved our group in her "lecture," so that we all felt like we were a part of it. Her attention to detail regarding our needs was done so smoothly that we felt everything proceeding as though it was a walk in the park. She adapted to our unplanned requests with ease and without any complaint, even when it caused the tour to last about an hour longer than agreed upon. She is a very professional, knowledgeable and engaging lady. When using her services, let her recommend an itinerary based on what your interests are and she will not disappoint you.

Great tours in Bangkok. Thank you so much to Olaf for organizing such great tours for us while we were in Bangkok. Everything was very well organized and we had a great time. Olaf was wonderful about keeping in touch via email before our trip and helping us to plan the best tours for our family. He was very flexible and we were able to choose exactly what we wanted to do. We used the service for airport transportation too and that was perfect. The driver met us at the airport with a nice van and brought us to our hotel. He was also there at 5:00am for our return trip to the airport. Our tour guide was Nikon and he was wonderful. He was very good with our two kids and helped us find places in the city that I could never have found without him. I would highly recommend Thai Sabai Life if you are looking for a guide in Bankok.

A great private guide, very knowledgeable, pleasant and helpful.. In January of 2013 Angmo lead us on a two day tour of the Bangkok area. She arranged the tour around the places that we wanted to see and was flexible in unplanned stops along the way. She met us at our hotel and helped us arrange an early check in so that we could eat and get started. My wife and I were impressed with her knowledge of Thailand's history and the Buddhist customs and traditions. We got to see all the major wats (temples), the palace, floating market, flower market, train market, additional side trips and long tail boat rides. We also had the use of our own well equipped party van and a very competent driver. We apologize for the delay in this review, but thought it was important to add it to her other great reviews. We highly recommend her.

2 thumbs WAY UP.. Everything you want in a tour guide... friendly, helpful, informative, fun. She goes out of her way for you. An all around great experience. Most highly recommended.Angmo started helping my family before we were even in Thailand. My eldest daughter (23) wanted to get some custom tailored clothes in Thailand, and I had her contact Angmo about whom she would recommend as a tailor. When Angmo heard how long we would be in Chiang Mai and Bangkok she recommended that we use a specific tailor in Chiang Mai, where we spent a day longer than we spent in Bangkok, so that the tailor could do a better job of custom tailoring the clothes.We had 2 days with Angmo in Bangkok, and it was a lot of fun... temples, boats, markets etc. Angmo was at our hotel early each day, and had a full itinerary planned for us. The first day we saw the sites I was interested in seeing, while we left the second day open for Angmo to show us around. She is a very helpful, friendly and informative person, and is nice to be around. I most highly recommend her.

Fun + Knowledgable + Friendly. From when we started booking the tours Angmo and Olaf were incredibly responsive and helpful. Even before we had our plans finalized they'd gone above and beyond with ideas for what to include during our couple days in and around Bangkok as well as ideas for entertainment outside of the tours (shows, nightlife, etc.). Consequently, our group of 6 went in with high expectations for our two tours (one in Bangkok one in the Kanchanburi province) and our expectations were definitely met - and exceeded. As you can imagine, in a group of 6 there can be lots of different interests but the tours were created perfectly around our individual preferences and we also had the flexibility to change/adapt plans at any time. Not only were Nikoon & Angmo super knowledgable but they were also just lovely to spend a day with - you could tell how much they cared about their customers and how much joy they got out of sharing some of Thailand with us. Many thanks Angmo!

The Perfect Introduction to Bangkok. We had a 2 day private tour of Bangkok and surrounding area with Angmo. She is a very knowledgable and personable tour guide with a great sense of humour. My husband and I learned and saw more in our 2 days with her than we could ever expect with a larger group tour. The cost of a private tour was worth every penny. We would highly recommend Angmo as a guide to anyone visiting Thailand. Steve and JeannieOttawa, ON

A day to remember!. Even though our day with Angmo was a very rainy and wet it felt like a day of sunshine. Angmo brought fun and education to our day as we toured Bangkok. She was on time at our hotel and even had a driver so that she could talk to us as we were driving to each place around Bangkok. We did things that I never expected, so each place we went was a surprise to my husband and I. We had a wonderful Thai lunch on the River then off to do more exploring. By the end of the day we had formed a wonderful friendship!! We highly recommend Angmo if you want to learn the history and excitement of Bangkok, not to mention making a new great friend!Deb and Larry Shamhart,

The only way to see Bangkok. From the initial discussions of what we wanted and the ideas that Angmo and Olaf suggested we ended up with a fantastic day in Bangkok. Having never been before we wanted a day tour to see the real Bangkok, a bit of culture, a Tuk Tuk ride, a boat ride and of course a fab Thai lunch. The communication before the day was excellent and the advice given re clothes etc. useful. The day itself was everything we hoped for, after being picked up at our hotel the coordination with occasional cooling breaks in the Minivan and the cold towels just added to the day. Angmos knowledge of everything was fab and so interesting. But I must also not forget the photos, it was actually our 25th Wedding Anniversary on the day of the tour and Angmo took photos of us together at numerours locations. These where emailed over to us later that night, such a special memory. We also received recommendations of places to visit for the rest of our holiday which were very useful. Excellent day, well organised. Would recommend to anyone.

Excellent!. I'm so glad I chose Olaf and Amour for our tour to bridge over river Kwai and hellfire pass. I looked at and contacted quite a few companies, but by far the best communication came from Olaf (Tours with Tong-what a waste of time!). He allowed us to tailor make the tour to what we wanted which was perfect. It probably was a little more expensive than some of the others, but I thought it was worth very penny (or baht!). Amour, the guide, was excellent - she was very knowledgable and helpful and took lots of photos of us, which she emailed us and even give us a few gifts too! The driver was excellent too and we felt very safe. Cannot recommend this couple enough - don't hesitate, just book them!

Fun and Educational. Used Angmo's service thrice on two separate Bangkok family trips. She was a great hit with both sides of our family. Everyone just adored her. She's very flexible with scheduling and will do everything to accommodate her group. Even the packaged tour can be tailor-fit to whatever itinerary would best suit. Case in point: during our last trip, the heat was just atrocious, making us reluctant to proceed with the China Town walking tour part of our package. Instead, Angmo helped most of our party schedule traditional Thai massage sessions at Wat Pho (the centuries old Thai Massage school), while bringing myself and my husband to a nice cool mall where we could relax and shop.Touring with Angmo is as relaxed or exciting as you want it to be. She knows when to leave us time to rest and when to give us interesting insights into Thai history and nuances of Thai culture. Her tours are also pretty luxurious for the reasonable price she charges. The comfortable air-conditioned vehicles, cold towels, and iced water she provides as part of the tours is definitely heaven-sent after each trek in the tropical climate. The free snacks and assistance in shopping at the markets is another of the highlights of Angmo's service. My husband still craves for the sweet roti she treated us to in Ayutthaya. We started out booking a tour guide, but left Bangkok having gained a friend.

Our Best Tour Guide Ever!. We have travelled quite extensively over the world ,and use private tours quite a bit,But Angmo was the best guide we have ever had! She is very well spoken,Knowledgeable and Professional.Also she really does care that you have an outstanding experience!The best part was, she brought an i pad with her to take pics of us.and emailed them..Never have we had that done for us,,which is a big bonus,because its usually a pain asking strangers to take a picture for you...We will be back to visit Thailand soon,and wont hesitate to call her to design a tour for us,,,,hoping she goes to other areas of Thailand!!! We do miss her!!!!

Book a trip with Angmo.. Angmo is realy the best guide we ever met, Angmo is professional, extremely well organized,well spoken, a wealth of knowledge, and bubbling with energy. Angmo arranged for our pick up at the port and then took us to the "must see sights" for our 1 day in Bangkok and then arranged for our transport back to the port to meet our ship. Angmo is delightful, entertaining, very knowledgeable, well-spoken, punctual, and full of energy!!! She provided cold water for us in the air conditioned van as we traveled from place to place and entertained us with her many stories. Her informative tour provided us with a deeper understanding of Thai culture and history. As an added bonus, Angmo took lots of fabulous pictures and emailed all of them to us.  I highly recommend Angmo as a guide for your visit in Thailand!!  PLease, book a trip with Angmo.

The Best Tour Guide!. Angmo is a very knowledgeable, thoughtful, kind and professional tour guide who clearly goes out of her way to ensure her clients are having the best possible time and most comfortable traveling experience. We booked her for a trip to Khao Yai park north of Bangkok for three days. We were greeted at the airport by this woman with a massive smile who led us to an absolutely luxurious and spacious van. At stops along the way there she would buy us the local food and explain it to us and other Thai customs. She is very friendly and gracious and her English is flawless. She made our trip memorable and she also made sure we got the best park guide when we hiked through the bush. In all, if you are looking for a guide in Bangkok or the surrounding areas (she might go to other parts of Thailand too) I would highly recommend her.

Best guide ever.. Do not look further.Angmo is realy the best guide we ever met. She know so much and tell you stories about everything. We traveled with her to Kanchanaburi, the erawan waterfalls, see the inside of Bangkok.She can show you places you will never find.She make you feel so comfortable and relaxed. We realy miss her.

Luxurious, Exciting and Educational!. This was the most luxurious, exciting, spontaneous, fun and educational tour I have ever been on. I've toured in England, Finland, France, Spain, Vietnam and all over the US and I couldn't believe how much fun this was. Such a great value for the amount of attention and information you get.Hands down - the very best way to see the city is to book with Thai Sabai Life. Angmo listens to what you want to do, makes recommendations to make the most of your time and really shows you the real Thailand. You get a better understanding of the people and culture. My tour was a half day city tour of the main highlights of Bangkok and an afternoon shopping tour to pick up all kinds of crazy things for my friends and family. I had a list a mile long of things I wanted to see, eat and buy. OMG - we covered everything!! I even got to sleep in late?! We were able to zip along from place to place in a huge, air-conditioned mini-van that was really plush inside. I always had water and wet towels to cool off which was appreciated. Angmo was also a great photographer - snapping shots of those great moments I would've forgotten about later. She was thoughtful, always finding me things to snack on (cause I seriously love eating my way through countries) and she was funny -- always sharing background stories on the history of her people and telling jokes -- which caused us to burst out laughing in the middle of Wat Pho!I was blessed with Holy Water, paid my respects to Buddha, took amazing pictures with the monks and even silly pictures with a statue of Ronald McDonald. Anything I wanted to do, no matter how silly or crazy it sounded - Angmo was up for it. Her energy stayed high and when the sun was a bit too much, we would duck into a coffee shop or pop back into the van to cool off.She even presented a little Tuk Tuk keychain as a souvenir since I mentioned I liked them so much. The little thoughtful things were amazing and I felt like I was touring Bangkok with my sister. Thai Sabai Life tours is A+++, Angmo and her driver (Mr. Ed!!) really deserve 6 stars and all I can say is don't wait, BOOK THEM RIGHT AWAY!!

Wonderful trip to Bangkok. Angmo is the best guide ever!! She arranged for our pick up at the port and then took us to the "must see sights" for our 2 days in Bangkok and then arranged for our transport back to the port to meet our ship. Angmo is delightful, entertaining, very knowledgeable, well-spoken, punctual, and full of energy!!! She provided cold water and towels for us in the air conditioned van as we traveled from place to place and entertained us with her many stories. Her informative tour provided us with a deeper understanding of Thai culture and history. As an added bonus, Angmo took lots of fabulous pictures and emailed all of them to us. Two in our group decided at the last minute that they'd like to attend the Thai kickboxing match that evening. Angmo arranged for them to get ringside seats and had a representative meet them to escort them to the arena and their seats. What unbelievable service at a moments notice!!! As we parted, she had individual gifts for each of us to remember our time in Bangkok. We all wished we had had more time in Thailand with Angmo!! I highly recommend Angmo as a guide for your visit in Thailand!!

No regrets, Angmo - Thai Sabai Life. Thai Sabai Life, Angmo is well spoken, friendly, fun, full of life and full of knowledge about her country, be it Ayutthaya, Sukhothai, Chiangmai, Phuket, you name it, she has the answer for all (or most) of your questions. Angmo is professional and punctual with her appointments. There is never a boring moment when Angmo's around, as she sure has a way to keep her guests entertained. I would highly recommend Thai Sabai Life, Angmo to anyone who is looking for a tour guide in Thailand.

GOOD VALUE ~ FOR BOTH TIME AND MONEY. You will be in for a treat when booking a trip with Angmo. Angmo is professional, extremely well organized, well spoken, a wealth of knowledge, and bubbling with energy. We had one day in Bangkok and wanted to see the floating market and visit the bridge of the River Kwai. Angmo arranged to pick us at our hotel in a very nice a/c van and made the most of our time. We thoroughly enjoyed our long-boat ride through the market, the museum, the bridge and a very nice lunch at the floating restaurant on the River Kwai. The day was very good value in terms of both time and money. We would not hesitate to recommend Thaisabai Life, Angmo, to our friends. We are only sad that we did not organize our entire trip to Thailand through Angmo.

Our tour in Thailand in 2011. Our trip in 2011 was the second time we were guided by Thai Sabai Life. Angmo deep respect The helped us with their very broad en deep knowlledge of Thailand and the people. Also her practical travel trips and being backup by Thai mobile telephone while when we traveled almosts indepent and safely through Thailand North East Chang May river Kwai region and Bangkok (with Ampawah market . I can recommand her to let her organize your travelplans in Thailand. she know how you would travel what accomdatios is fit for you ans your company. You ll never forget your trip and the giide who made it a succes

Thank You. On the recommendation of my fiancée, we booked our tour with Angmo in September to see the Richness of Ayutthaya. From the start, Angmo demonstrated the warmth and friendliness of Thailand with a huge smile and hug for my fiancé, whom she remembered from last year, and me. Angmo was prepared for every moment of our tour. She had handouts for us in the car and explained the meaning of the handouts, which always had something to do with Thai culture, history or religion. It made us feel like she put a lot of thought into how to keep her guests entertained and informed at all times. These moments were great ice breakers because they helped us get to know her better. Our actual tour with Angmo was fantastic. She introduced us to various methods of transportation, the history of each location and what it meant to the Thai people. We really appreciated how knowledgeable she was on culture, history and religion, and how she tied everything back to how proud she was of her country. By the end of the tour, we felt as if we had known Angmo a long time and the whole day was like spending it with an old friend. I can see why my fiancée recommended we book our tour with Angmo. I would also recommend booking your tour with Angmo. She is the perfect person to introduce you to Thailand.

Great Day in Bangkok. We booked Angmo for a one day trip in Bangkok, including a visit to the train market and one of the floating markets.It was a really pleasant experience, having a guide made it possible for us to get the most out of our day. Angmo is the perfect guide. She told us a lot about thai life, answered all of our questions (we had a lot of them) and made sure our day was spent in the best way possible.Since I am interested in thai food and like to try new dishes she made sure we tasted everything we had not tried before and took us to a really nice thai lunch where we shared different dishes. She also helped out when shopping at the market ensuring we got the right price.My girlfriend really wanted to go to the Siam Niramit dance show in the evening (http://www.tripadvisor.se/Attraction_Review-g293916-d656519-Reviews-Siam_Niramit-Bangkok.html). which turned out to be a great show, don't miss it !!! Angmo booked tickets for us and event sent a driver picking us up at the hotel.During the whole day we traveled comfortably in a air conditioned car. There was always cold water available and even a cold refreshing towels when you got back from some time in the heat ;)I strongly recommend hiring Angmo as your guide in Thailand.Thanx for a great day

Dont hesitate, just book them. We heard from ANgmo via friends. Made contact and arranged a tailormade first week in Thailand. Must say it was perfect. Angmo is friendly, good sense of humor and practically know everything about life/places to go in Thailand. We got a luxurious minibus with a skilled driver (Mr. Ed), cold water, towels, candy etc...Angmo showed us Bangkok, Ayuthaya,Kanchanaburi and learned us about local habbits and traditions. She bought strange fruits to try, lovely pancakes with something sweet (forgot the name). All these things you dont try when you are alone. Marvelous.If we visit Thailand again next year, we will definitely ask her to join us.

Perfect Bangkok trip. We had the pleasure to have Angmor as our guide in Bangkok. It was only a day trip, but we learned and experienced a lot. The tour was well arranged. We wished to go to the Wat Pho and The Grand Palace. Angmor arranged this, as well as a nice boat tip on the Chao Praya River and visiting Wat Arun . Angmor picked us up in the morning and drove us to the sites. The places for coffee, lunch and dinner were all lovely and well chosen.Being on the temple sites, Angmor taught us a lot about Buddhism, the Thai culture and history and the Royal family. She knows very much about all this and took the time to answer our questions.It was very interesting and we are grateful that we learned so much and saw all those beautiful things. We received Buddhist Blessings and joined the prayers and gave donations at the temple. We felt like we experienced the Thail life a little more. We were surprised to see so much in one day, but we never felt like we were in a hurry. It was a perfect tour in Bangkok and very ‘Sabai’!We ended our day with a delicious dinner at Bang Poo.Angmor is an intelligent and easy going person. She loves to tell you about her country and culture. We enjoyed the whole day. We will definitely recommend Thai Sabai Life to our friends.

Incredible experience. We spent two weeks in Thailand in February - March with help of Angmo and Olaf from Thai Sabai Life. They have taken us to places we would never get by ourselves. Terrific tours of street food and markets ( where we were only farangs). Authentic experience of not touristy, but true Thai life. The most of operators I have contacted just gave us offers of standard tours. It was different with Thai Sabai. Angmo inquired first what our interests are. Than they payed a great deal of attention to make our experience to fulfill expectations. Very reasonably priced. Punctual. Flexible. Would do it again with them. Every bit of their advice was useful.

Nice 1/2 day tour in "the jungle". We really enyoy our bike ride in Bangkok with our guide, Best. He showed us another side of Bangkok and was the perfect guide for us. He get to see both different things in the city and then by boat to "the jungle" Very nice day and we will really wish for others to have this experience.

Exploring a new side of Bangkok. We were diving into an unexpected part of the city. We enjoyed eyery minute. The scenery was changing often. We recommend to wear Sneakers - there is a lot to walk. And don't forget your camera. Our tourguide was Best - he is very dedicated. After the hike we enjoyed the rickshaw ride.

Colors of Bangkok a special way to discover undiscovered Bangkok. On a sunny afternoon i had the great experience of exploring the City of Bangkok by bike. Tourguide Ben brought us to places where you as tourist never should come and even you did not realize that such wonderfull places in a major city even exists.Not only showing around but also give a lot of extra informatie Ben made this excursion to a really special one. Although the tour takes about 5 to 6 hours it really don't feel this long. The way Ben tells about things to be seen and done made it a special afternoon.Not only in Bangkok you can have this special experience there are other cities where you can make these special bike rides.Also a good reason to visit and explore Thailand (land of Smiles) on a special way !

A Great Way To See Green Bangkok. We (two adults, and a 14y/o) took on the Bangkok Paradise all day tour. This was a wonderful experience encompassing not one, not two, but three boat rides and approx 45km of cycling. We saw villages, temples, a market, klongs, fields (yes fields!) and lots of wildlife (including a very large water monitor). Most of the route is away from traffic, with much of it being alongside klongs or through urban villages. A 40min boat ride up a klong took us to the countryside and a restaurant for lunch - with more cycling for dessert! This is truly a full day tour, and we were back at base by about 5:30pm - tired, but happy to have seen a completely different side of Bangkok! I fully recommend the organisation, and this tour - we would go again!! This would have been a 5 star review, aside from the following minor points (sorry RBB, we didn't put these on your form as these points came from our discussing after we left your office) - most importantly MORE WATER (this was our fault as the guide, Amm, asked us to shout if we wanted water and we didn't shout enough!! For reference, it was a hot day and we drank 5 small bottles - in hindsight we probably needed twice that), softer seats (one bike had a thin, hard, 'racer' style seat and after a full day in the saddle it was very unpleasant!), better hand grips (one bike had hard plastic hand grips with large diamond patterns cut into it - the sharp edges of this pattern resulted in blisters after a full day of riding). Don't let this put you off, as these were small things and the day was excellent.Finally, a 'shout out' for our guide Amm - who guided us safely through the tour, accommodated the different paces and abilities within our group, was knowledgeable and friendly. What more could you ask for....

want to see real bangkok? this is it!. first of all thanks to ben the tourguide. he made this tour to a very special experience. not only his english is very good but also his knowledge of the city and the culture is special. "colors of bangkok" shows not only how the bangkokians live but also a city away from hassle and stress. a city where people look happy and where people greet when they see you. a city with green parks and fresh air. its the other bangkok. thank you ben! you gave me a wonderful experience and i will definitely come back and do one of the other tours too.

Cycling through Bangkok . We had a great time cycling through Bangkok with our guide: Sean. It is a good way to explore Bangkok and see a different side of the city. Sean was very knowledgeable and gave us more insights into the Thai life. Altough we passed some busy roads, Sean took great care of our safety. If you are in Bangkok for a coupe of days i would really recommend this tour!
Bangkok biking tour. This was an amazing day.We got to know Bangkok on another sidenOur gide Sao was very friendly and helpful. We would recommend this to everyone!!Greetings from Belgium
Best tour in Bangkok. Very nice tour! Was our best tour in Bangkok. We saw parts of the City which we never came across before. Good guide, nice Group.

Great views on a Great tour. We booked the Colours of Bangkok-Tour which started at 1 pm on a Sunday and it took approximately 5-6 hours. The Tour Guide was very nice and he took a Video of the Tour with the help of a GoPro and afterwards we got an Email with a youtube link to watch the Video ( cool Movie about the day with funny music).All in all the Tour made a lot of fun and we saw some interesting places. A Thaimeal is included and in case of bad weather rain capes are provided. It's definitely worth it.

Bike Tour Colors of Bankok. Amazing and fun bike trip! Our Guide, Kik, told us a lot about the culture and about Bangkok. During this half day tour you get a great impression from Bangkok and its surroundings. Especially after de short boat trip, when you leave the busy streets of Bangkok behind you, you see a complete different site from the city. A 'must do' when you are in Bangkok!

Colors of Bankok Bike Tour. Guide knows everything, could speak a little bit beter English. Not for little children! Beter to go in the morning because its not so hot. If we ever go back to Bankok we will do it again!

Wonderful bike tour 'Colors of Bangkok'. Amm was our great tour guide in bangkok. He really knows a lot about the life in bangkok. Spectacular. Beautiful. Exciting.We've really enjoyed the bike tour, thank you so much!

Amazing bike trip through Bangkok's secrets - Colors of Bangkok. Seeing Bangkok from a bike is an experience on its own, especially when you leave the busy streets behind and find yourself in the narrow streets of the people that live there. After the boat ride, the environment is totally different and that's awesome to see. Smiling people everywhere! Our guide Ben, was really nice and took the time to tell us whatever we wanted to know. He was able to tell us a lot about the people, districts, nature and Bangkok itself. There were more than enough drinks during the ride.

Evening cycle tour. Excellent way to see the real side of Bangkok. Got to taste the local food and fruits from the markets. Lots of back alleys and side roads made for an interesting tour. Also got to see the palace at night, very beautiful lit up in the dark, and the plus side... no tourists. Our guide, Marz, was very interesting and knowledgeable with regards to the local history.

Nice exploration. Efficiently responding customer's booking. We hastily submitted the online booking close to the mid night, but unexpectedly received the confirmation from company in the next day early morning. So that we were able to join it in the afternoon finally. Moreover, Saen, the tour guide was very responsible and capable to lead us to have a fruitful trip and riding safely. We got more understood about Bangkok. Thanks so much and hope to see you again!

Great way to see Bangkok.. We did the morning tour, and it was really great. It took about 3 hours, but with many nice stops. Ben, our guide told us nice recent and old stories. It's really an adventure to bike through BKK.We really loved the market and the Lumpini Park.Als very nice to get everything by film, which Ben made during the tour.Thanks a lot.

A different but adventurous experience to see Bangkok. It’s a good idea to see Bangkok during sunset and at night from different perspectives, not only resort hotels, spa, shopping or sky bar. We have never had such unique bike riding experience along the riverbanks of the Chao Praya River, streets, alleys, food stall markets, local residential neighbourhood and 24-hour flower market in the Thonburi side of Bangkok. Thanks to our tour guides Mas & Dom, my family (my husband and my 13-year old daughter) had an adventurous & awesome experience in exploring Bangkok through this Sunset Bike Ride! Fluent in English and detail-minded, Mas explained to us patiently about the local history, stories culture and interesting things along the way and at the scenic spots. The night views of the Temple of Dawn, the Grand Palace and the Wat Pho were stunning, but quiet. Unlike daytime, we felt really relaxed to visit the temples and take photos without competing with massive crowd of tourists. We have a lot of fun and impressive memories during this bike ride!

Great experience of another side of Bangkok. We didn't expect anything just booked on recommendation of our hotel "Colours of Bangkok". Everything was well-planned and we had a great tour guide: Saen. He showed us places of Bangkok that we never would have seen as "normal" tourists. Very impressive. He took care of our security when we crossed the big roads, explained very well in a real good English all the things we visited. During the tour he served water and organised a real good dinner for us in a restaurant we would never have found on our own. In the temple he explained the basics of Buddhism which was very interesting. Do that tour with Saen and you will have a great experience of another side of Bangkok.
Great Tour!. My girlfriend en I really enjoyed the morning tour. we visited different kinds of areas and meet a lot of nice people. i would recommend this tour!

Another point of view. With our tour guide Sao we set out to explore parts of Bangkok you don't usually look for or find as a tourist. Doing this on a bike allows you to take in a lot more than you could from a bus or a taxi. We enjoyed the ride itself and of course also Sao's comments and explanations. A highly recommeded tour for all.

It's really FUN!. It's fun joining the tour...meeting other people and taking a glimpse of Thailand in real world. It's a great new experience. If I'll go back again,.....i will join again the tour. See you again, Thailand.

Great way to see the essence of Bangkok. My wife and I and 2 daughters aged 10 and 12 participated in this bike tour. It was a fantastic way to see and experience the true essence of Bangkok, touring through the back blocks on pathways that allowed us to see how local people lived and worked in their communities.

Fun, of the beaten track, ride around Bangkok . Great fun! Booked a private tour as we didn't know how the kids would take to it (2 and 4), Was absolutely brilliant, rode around the back streets visiting places rarely seen on the tourist trail... not for the faint hearted as some parts are a bit hairy (narrow and elevated). Great guide - Saen - and fun day! The Kids absolutely loved it and we felt it was just the right amount of time spend on the ride!

Colors of Bangkok Bike Tour. To take some time to experience Thailand and Bangkok on bike is a precious and very special experience. The bikes have comfortable seats (typically dutch bike seat) - a place for your water bottle - and all the gears you need. My guide Sean was extra-ordinary - took great care to speak all the things we were seeing - the neighborhoods you first bike thru, the park, the temple, the bikeways, the flora, the farm and especially his detail on Buddhism spoken from the heart... "it happens and let it go" will stay with me for ever. This company and the tour is well run by andre and dave - with dutch precision, attention to detail and great care - the long tail trips across the river provide a unique perspective - and biking in the green after a days in busy Bangkok center was good for the soul and spirit.if you want to see a "different" Bangkok and aren't afraid to get on a bike - this trip of you (well do it even if you are afraid to get on a bike - it is simply a must do experience - and you'll have a great little video to show your friends and family)

Colours of Bangkok bicycle tour. We booked a private bicycle tour with our family (2 adults and two kids) and were taken through bangkok with our great guide Kik.We stopped at a school in the slums were we bought chips from a local vendor for all the 60 kids!After that we went on a longtailboat to an island in the city were we continued the tour, we had lunch there and visited some temples.Great day to experience bangkok from a different angle.The "aftermovie" that wa sent by email is very nice.

Bike riding through the 'lungs of Bangkok'. Had the best time on the Colours of Bankok tour bike riding with this group. 7 in our group with Amm as our guide. He was excellent with very good English. Very friendly and went out of his way to find out information if he did not know the answer straight up! Visited a kindergarten which the group sponsor in a poorer part of Bangkok then over the river in a longboat to the jungle for more riding. Fantastic insights into another Bankok off the usual tourist track.
Fantastic biking Experience!. We booked the Colors of Bangkok tour in Bangkok. Our tour guide made an short video that brings us back some good memories. We really would recommend this to others!

Very nice alternative way of discovering Bangkok. With the 4 of us, 2 adults and 2 teens, we really enjoyed this Color of Bangkok bike tour. An nice alternative for our teen two discover other party of Bangkok. We really would recommend this to others, including our guide Sao.

Fantastic biking adventure!. We booked the Colors of Bangkok tour in Bangkok. My family and me had so much fun on this trip. It was really one of the highlights of our Thailand trip.Our tour guide Saen made an short video that brings us back some good memories. Saen is a perfect guide, he's nice, polite and always safety comes first.I would everybody recommend to make a bike trip in Bangkok.

Great experience. We had a private tour of half a day with guide Ben. Our oldest son (8 years) had a bike, our younger children had a seat.The bike trip was wonderfull. 95% of the tour is via bike/walk-roads. In total we drove 22 km.

Different Side of Bangkok. We had a great experience doing our bike tour. Our guide, Ben, was really sweet and knowledgable. It's quite a long tour, so set aside like 5 hours to do it. But the whole time was really fun, and the time passed quickly. You get to bike through a more rural area just across the river from Bangkok. It's really cool. If you have super young kids, make sure they're relatively proficient at biking because there are some pretty narrow pathways with ledges that you have to bike on.

Interesting and different view of Bangkok. Our tour guide Khaen was very friendly, we were with a group of other Dutch people to cycle through Bangkok and the park on the other side of the river. The river crossing was an interesting experience as well, would recommend to take this tour if you love cycling and want to see a different side of Bangkok.

Another look at Bangkok. Sympathetic tour, nice alleys and paths where you would not come as a tourist. Tour through different districts of Bangkok from all walks of life. Nice lunch. Nice enthusiastic good English speaking guide (Saen), 3-4 hour cycle is quite long for small children. Families have private tour so you can stop whenever you want. Recommended.

Biking through the nature, narrow streets. Biking through the narrow streets was a great challenge! We cycled along the big buildings of Bangkok and also we literally cycle through the houses of the local thai in slums! Interesting contrast. If you want to see the way the local thai live, you should do this tour!! We saw rich and poor, crowds and rest and city and nature:in short the colous of Bangkok! The excursion has been a succes due to our great guide Saen who guided us safely,and in a fascinating way.

Biking through Bangkok with kids. IT was a Great experience bikini through small alleys of bkk seeing a different part of this heftic city. Our 8 yr OLd was able to bike by himself and our 3 yr old was comfortable in THE back seat.Thanks Ben, as he guided us through the traffic safely.

Very nice tour to see the other side of Bangkok. It was a nice ride through the greener part of Bangkok, but it also allowed to ride through some smaller paths and discover how the locals live and work.
'Fantastic tour'. The biking tour was fantastic! We saw slums and temples, we passed the river with a boat and had a very good guide called Khaen who explained a lot about the culture.

See a different Bangkok. I would definitely recommend doing a biking tour in Bangkok, and Recreational Bangkok Biking is a good organisation to book your tour with. We've done the Colours of Bangkok tour, which meant seeing another side of Bangkok and crossing the water to the 'green lung'. We had non-stop rain while we were on that side of the water but to be honest, it didn't matter. It was still a lot of fun. Good guide, nice things to see. They take good care of you with drinks and lunch. Don't miss it.
It was really nice. It was a lovely ride. We've seen a lot of nice places and had a good guide. This really was a ride we won't forget easily!
Authentic tour. My tour guide Kwang was awesome! She made feel like I actually saw the real Bangkok and not the tourist version. I it was the best bike tour I have ever been on. Highly recommend!

A wonderful, happy afternoon spent cycling around Bangkok. We did the Colours of Bangkok tour, with our 2 boys, 11 and 9 years old. We simply loved it as we got to see places and spaces that we would definitely not see otherwise. Our guide, Kwang, was fantastic. She was relaxed and worked well with the kids. Her english was very good and we could easily understand. The bikes are regular town bikes but they do the job and thankfully the terrain is all flat and easy to ride. It hardly felt like the 25km that it was. We cycle at home anyway, so were quite fit enough. I reckon a bit of fitness would go great lengths to make the afternoon more enjoyable. The narrow, raised paths in certain places all added to the sense of adventure and even though we rode through the traffic, we never felt unsafe. The office is not visible from the main street. When you get to the street number walk into the alley about 50+ meters to the end and it will be on your left. We would happily recommend this tour.

Super!. Enough is said about the nice trips you can make. But what about the service they offer!!! We were with a party of 8 of whom the youngest is 3 and the eldest is 85.... We had Amm as our guide and nothing was too much to ensure a good time. A scooter, a riksja, everything for grandma to join!!!! Great time and special thanks to Amm.

Worth the money. We decided to take this tour instead of "ko van Kessel" because this one was less expensive. We really enjoyed it! Small groups, they speak good english & nice food! TIP: bring DEET or anti mosquito! I didn't.. So I have maaaaaany bits.. :(

The tour was great and our tour guide Khaen was excellent. He showed us as well the differnt. Our tour was great and our tour guide Khaen was excellent. He showed us as well the different colors life in Bangkok can have when you reach the city with empty pockets and need to make a living. We can happily recommend RBB. By the time we got back to the hotel we found ourselves already on a nice youtube video......a great surprise. Kop kun krap Khaen

Colors of Bangkok. Phantastic!! Very good guides(Ben&Kwang)We can reconmend this to everybodyvisiting Bangkok....It's a must-do!!!!Thank you for the great tour!!!!With our best regards from GermanyHamda&family&friends

Loved the tour. As start of our 3 week rondtrip through North-Thailand with our parents we did the biking tour 'Colors of Bangkok'. It was a beautifull way to meet Bangkok and Thailand for the first time and we all loved it, from the age 25 to 62! It's something everybody can do.Our guide Best was thé best guide. He rides very safely and takes good care of everybody.The YouTube-video you get is also fun to watch afterwards!Thank for the nice tour.

Awesome city culture biking tour!. We chose the city culture biking tour and it was truly great! Our guide knew the answer to all questions we had and showed us many different sides of Bangkok. The slumps were impressive as was the more business area. We had a great time!

Colours of Bangkok - Very , Very Good. it was a really good exprience! You could see how amazing is the not touristic side of Bangkok. The Nature, the food for Thai people, the Small neighborhoods with narrow streets and the real life.

Great tour, great staff, great experience overall. Recreational Bangkok Biking offers great tours for those seeking unconventional tourism experiences as to see the real life of Bangkok.During our tour of Colors of Bangkok, we could see how similar some areas not so far from the center, are actually very similar to the Mekong Delta. We had the chance to bike within a slum offering us a view otherwise not much promoted. The tour of Colors of Ayutthaya was perhaps a bit more touristy given the cultural and historical value of the location, but it is a must do anyway. We definitely enjoyed the whole day a lot with good food, nice places to visit, temples and ruins as old as 600 years and even en elephant camp. The staff was very friendly, attentive and responsive to all our needs and questions. This made the experience even better and making us want to enjoy other of their tours some day we would go back to Bangkok.

Another great tour with RBB. Already on February 1, and after doing already several biking tours with RBB in the last years I again did a tour with RBB, this time together with a friend from spain. It was the Bangkok Paradise Tour lasting a whole day and around 45 kilometers in the outskirts of Bangkok. Off the tracks and in the middle of daily thai life we did enjoy a tour with many highlights as a long tail boat trip, temples, markets and other hidden treasures. Our tour guide Best did not leave any question unanswered and it also was just fun having him as a guide.

One of the highlights of our holiday. We chose the colors of Bangkok tour, a five-hour tour in the back alleys of Bangkok, through parks, jungle, slums and fields. Not too much traffic but fabulous experience. We toured with our three kids, the youngest 5 year old in the hottest part of the year, but bicycling is truly fun and surprisingly refreshing. 25km of great fun. A big thank you to Arm, our guide, who even uploaded a GoPro movie of our little adventure. Worth every penny as parts of the proceeds go to a school funded by the tour company. Thank you for a real good time !

Truly great way to explore Bangkok. If your looking to discover Bangkok outside the tourist areas the Bangkok Paradise Tour is for you. You get to see locals going about their daily lives outside the city and visit some temples where no other tourists will be. If you cycle at home or even if you dont that much it doesn't matter. Altough you do 50K's it doesnt feel like it as you stop so often. Cycling around the canals and through the narrow streets, passing little shops and houses really shows you the real Bangkok. Our guide Amm was brilliant and gave us lots of info about Thai way of life, the temples, buddists and lots more. There was only myself and my wife on the tour so it made it even more personal. You also get to stop off at a little Thai restaurant where the food is really tasty Thai, cooked by locals and full of flavour and spice. From canal boat rides on small traditional boats, to river rides and cycling through city and country this tour ticked all the boxes for us.I can't recommend this tour enough, forget sitting on a bus and going to the usual tourist spots, do this for a real informative eye opening adventure. Thanks again to our tour guide Amm who made it such a good day out.
cycling through living areas of bangkik. Great tour, especially to get to know how the normal people in Bangkok live, away from the tourist centers and shopping malls.

Cycling through the green lunge of Bangkok. The tour was very cool with cozy bikes, nice lunch, small tiny streets, a boat trip and some sightseeing. The guide was very friendly and helpful, the bikes in very good conditions (I had very bad ones in Vietnam, so I can compare a little bit) and the office looks very professional, modern and light. You will see the green side of Bangkok and you don't need to be in a good condition doing this tour. Perfect for all couples, friends, singles and families. They offer kids bikes too.

Top!. Did a Sunday-Bicycle Tour and enjoyed it very, very much. The day went over so quickly and we returned the bikes totally happy with memories, that will last for very long!Thank you so much for that wonderful experience!

Uncover the real Bangkok . Great way to experience otherwise undiscovered corners of Bangkok. Gina our guide was knowledgable and really interesting to talk to during the tour. In addition part of the fee for the tour is donated to a local slum school which you visit during the colours of Bangkok tour, a real eye opening and moving experience. Highly recommended for anyone wanting to see beyond the glittering palaces and bustling night scene. This is the real Bangkok.

A different way to explore Bangkok. A very good way to explore Bangkok. I'd recommend this to anyone. This tour is a great way to explore the city. We were a bit unsure about riding the bikes in Bangkok traffic but the tour guide got us through without any problems and made us feel well taken care of.

Great experience, a lot of fun and insight. We took a private tour as we have three little kids. It was a lot of fun, we came to places we would have never visited. The guide was knowledgeable and friendly. Our youngest son is 8, the tour was no problem for him. Highly recommended!!!

Something Different To Do in Bangkok. This was a fun way to do something a little different in Bangkok. The Colors of Bangkok Tour was the perfect length (half-day) and went around through a part of Bangkok I would have never seen on my own. Physically the route was not challenging. It was mostly flat, not strenuous, etc. It turns out, however, that I am pretty much an awful bike rider and this trip did include biking down quite a few narrow alleyways, skinny bridges, etc. If you are super uncoordinated like I am, it might be a bit tricky, but the leader was good about making sure everyone was doing ok and helping to solve disasters (for example, I accidentally cycled off a sidewalk and into some rough terrain, causing the chain to fall off my bike--she easily fixed this without making a big deal of it). A nice way to spend a morning in Bangkok.

Done more than expected!. This trip also included a food market visit, rixshaw ride, boat river crossing. And I found it especially interesting that along the way you also saw locals who normally not cycle on a bike. Funny to see.
Fietstocht door Thailand, excellent. couldn't be better. It was a different way to view Bangkok. We had a nice lunch during the tour. Just simple, nothing to complain.

Great way to see the parts of Bangkok you would normally miss. Andre and his team were great. This is the original and the best. Don't miss it. I am resident of Bangkok and we took friends visiting from UK. Teenagers boys and girls. They all loved it. Don't forget your camera.

Great experience in Bangkok!. We joined the colors of Bangkok tour in December 2015. We did a private tour because we were with 2 small kids. The bikes were good and the kids were comfy at the back. The tour was quite divers, showing you different parts of Bangkok. Crossing the river in a small boat, feeding the fish in a lovely park and maneuvering the bike through small alleys or over obstacles made the trip exciting also for the little ones.Our guide was very friendly, helpful and made a nice movie to remember the tour (will be placed on YouTube, which could have maybe been mentioned before). Don't forget mosquito repellent and a hat! The tour also included a nice lunch break at a small eating place and drinks. Would recommend the private tour when you're joining with smaller children.

Colours of Bangkok. It was great fun, cycling with the family. We enjoyed the trip, out guide pointes out very interesting things, we cold look inside a school - which was very interesting for the kids.

EXCITING EXPLORING. Short trip across busy road and then you get into a real neighborhood behind the scenes of the city. Definitely worth every penny we spent for this bike trip which brought us to places we never would have seen on our own. The guide was always checking to make sure we were close by and, if we wanted to stop and explore or catch our breath, he made sure we had time to do that. The bikes were fine and the paths that we followed required very little shifting since it was flat ground. All in all, a wonderful experience.

We keep coming back for more!. One of the highlights of visiting Bangkok is to take a tour with RBB. Various groups of clients, colleagues and friends from all over the world have enjoyed the various tours organized by Andre and his team on at least 7 occassions. Each time we go to Bangkok, (usually to meet at a trade show) we make the time and book appx 15 of us for one of his tours. Last visit was in Oct. 2015! Tours are always well organized, fun, varied, and the guides are friendly and professional. Cant wait for our next visit to BKK to go on another fun bike ride with RBB. Thank you Andre and RBB team for the great memories!

Nice experience. If you do not fear to ride on the backyards and through - what we would call - living room of the inhabitants - it is nice. We saw a train cemetry, 2 parks, warans, it was always safe and the guide was friendly and well informed.The bikes were o.k. and you get a little video-link with some sequences, the guide filmed on the tour.

Great afternoon. Andre and Eye did a great job. We experienced a great bike riding afternoon off the beaten track. We went through small alleys and lush green areas. We met nice people and had a great spicy lunch. We can definitely recommend this trip!

Quite the experience!. Definitely an exciting way to see the different areas of Bangkok, from beautiful parks and skyscrapers to poor huts. Cycling along the busy main streets and some of the narrow paths are not for the faint of heart, yet that challenge is offset by the tranquil parks and visiting parts of Bangkok that most tourists do not see. Our guide Kwang did a masterful job navigating us through the different terrains and making sure we had an enjoyable experience.

Unforgettable impressions. When one moment you see sky-scraper and trains passing over the city and another moment you see people living in poor huts in jungle swamps - no one do not remain indifferent. Unforgettable experience from where tourists rarely encountered.

Amazing Bangkok Sunset Tour. What an amazing evening we've spent yesterday with Am and Tom!We discovered the deep and real Bangkok going through the smallest paths, guided by Am and having Tom keeping our back. We can't name the best moment of our evening... Was it when we saw Thai people live and cook in the streets looking so relaxed and happy? Was when we got to walk through peaceful temples areas at night free of tourists? Was it when we had great diner at a "Thai only" restaurant? Was it when we discovered the flower market still full of life at night?Am was very knowledgable about Bangkok and Thai culture in general. He is a very interesting person to exchange with and has often a nice discreet humor. Tom helped us a well through the intense traffic and we fully trusted both of them with our safety.By far our best experience in Bangkok, we recommend this tour for whoever what's to discover the city differently, still completely safely.Françoise & Mélanie2 French women

Bangkok by bike. Went on this for something different & it was . Went riding on the busy streets of Bangkok , something I never thought I would do easy . Went down lots of backstreets you would never see useless on a tour like this . Put the bikes on a longtail boat , so we could ride the otherside of the main river that flows though Bangkok . Lunch was supplied & drinks when ever you needed them .
Great trip, loved our guide Ben!. Great trip, it really showed us the other Bangkok. Lunch was great and we loved our guide. Kids (10, 12 and 16) loved it as well!

Delightfully different. We had a really interesting day visiting the slums and the jungle. This was a day of great contrast wandering through some very basic and simple housing to visiting some fabulous local temples. Everyone we passed, from groups of school children to families having lunch were very friendly and welcoming. Our guide, Am, was great. He talked at length about Thai life and had a great local knowledge. We stopped for a delicious Thai lunch and thoroughly enjoyed our rickshaw tour of the area.
Great experience. We made this tour on our first day in Thailand and it was a great introduction to the various aspects of Thai culture

Excellent tour. My friends and I took a bicycle ride through Bangkok temples, markets, parks, and slums and the tour guide (a Dutchman) was always helpful and explanatory all the time.I would totally recommend it.
Beautifull biking. We went to severall places where you normaly not come. Yhe guide was very enthousiast. We liked it very much to see the local live there. The busy trafic en and the quiet nature.

Interesting experience. It was very interesting trip. Actively you can see different faces of Bangkok.You will get to places that you never get by other communcation kind. You can talk to local people of different status. You can see theiur real life. Besides that everything is well organize (refreshment, food, rest, even WC-visit possibility). Cooking after that together and having meal together - was also very nice idea!

An extremely interesting different view of bangkok. We have come to Bangkok numerous times in the past 20 years and done all the most common sightseeing trips, but this is truly quite a different experience. Walking through those slums and being greeted by extremely friendly people, very unusual! The jungle walk was interesting too, although a bit longish; altogether we probably walked for more than one hour and we feel we should have been told to bring walking shoes along. Our guide, Tantan, was very friendly and knowledgable, pointing out interesting aspects during temple visits. The rickshaw drivers were very nice and the lunch was tasty. To sum it up, a great experience and good value for money.

An unforgettable experience. Friends recommended me doing the Colours of Bangkok bicycle tour and I am very grateful for this recommendation. In a small group you are being shown a total different view of Bangkok. The guide was very good and the bicycles were perfect. There is even a small movie clip made as a souvenir. Strongly recommend to do this tour when visiting Bangkok. Not suitable for children under 16 though as you need to ride a small part of the tour on the busy roads of Bangkok.

Colors of Bangkok. Wow, the cycle tour was really great.We got a feeling about the different people where and how they are living. Afterwards we enjoyed the beautifully environment.The guide was very friendly and explained all details about habits and rituals. The coffee break in a small local shop was excellent. We can strongly recommend to book a cycle tour through Bangkok…

Colours of Bangkok. Excellent tour. Lovely to see so many different parts of Bangkok and variety. From slums to a lovely park. food was good, tour guide was good. I would recommend this tour however the Hua Hin one was better.

The real Bangkok,.... Our guide was tourism student 'Eye' and she was lovely and brilliant at guiding us through narrow alleys and the Bangkok khlongs. The bikes RBB uses are all very good and appropriate for heavy duty. Trek-bikes we had, the real deal. We saw the most old temple of Bangkok, went through small alleys and livingrooms of people, visited a nice local market, tasted all kind of things, bought some stuff, we all ate at a very local restaurant which was really good. We crossed the Chao Praya river by longtail and the people that saw us were really nice and cheerful. We also fed some (maybe say a lot of) fish in a beautiful park. Afterwards we received a hyperlink to our Youtube video she made of our trip. Brilliant. Our 6-year old son was placed in a childseat on the back of a bike. That was the way to go. Kids from 8 year old can really do this by themselves. Just make the ride!
Cycle tour. Really interesting and informative cycle tour. Guide was great and places we visited we just wouldn't have seen any other way.

Great! . This tour (color of Bangkok) came recommended from a Bangkok thai friend and did not disappoint.It's both interesting (discrepancies between rich and poor) as well as an escape from smoggy city since you take the boat to the island, also called the green lunges of Bangkok.The tour was exactly as described on the website - so just check the stops online. We loved the cycling around a lot and would definitely do another tour.

Recreational Bangkok Biking. We had a great guide called Best who took excellent care of us. We enjoyed the bike tour and saw many highlights. The main difficulty for us was finding the location. Two tuk-tuk drivers said they knew where it was & we showed them the map but then took us to the wrong biking company (twice!) so it was stressful as we were more than an hour late and on the completely wrong end of town. Also we were cycling with a 5 year old and it was quite hair-raising in peak hour traffic but we fortunately had a second guide accompany us for the hair-raising part of the journey which was really nice. Would recommend this activity.

Excellent way to experience Bangkok & Thailand!. We did the 2-day "secrets of Siam" tour. Professional & very friendly guide / staff. Good bikes. Well chosen tour. Lots of impressions of day-to-day life of Thai people. A slow and authentic way of experiencing the country.If uncertain about doing the tour at beginning or end of your Thailand vacation: do it at the end - as you'll have some sun tan before, and will be exposed to some hours of sunshine on the bike.If uncertain about which length of tour you should choose: We did the half-day tour some years ago, which was excellent, but could easily have been longer, as we were so enthusiastic about all what we saw. So: at least go for a full-day tour. If you can somehow plan for a 2-day tour, it's definitely worth it: more to see, city and suburbs, a night market in the evening, locations you'd never get to see otherwise as a tourist. You should have biking experience, as a good portion of the bridge ways are a bit narrow, with water left and right. Yet, no reason to be afraid … just bike with attention & concentration, and enjoy an exceptional trip!

You must have done that if you want to say, I have seen Bangkok. Just a wonderful way in seeing Bangkok. Probably completely different from the things you did up to this date in the Oriental City. Perfectly organized, great tour leaders, interesting and fascinating new views, easy to do for everybody. Do it and you will never forget, guaranteed.

Fun day out with a difference.. Living in Bangkok has afforded me the opportunity to enjoy many of the tourist attractions Bangkok has to offer. I was looking for something different to do with my young visitors (teary twenties) and I discovered the Rickshaw & Hike the colours of Bangkok tour. The booking process was handled swiftly online and the confirmation processed within 24 hours. We had a great time exploring a different part of Bangkok and also the rural part of Samut Prakan. Our guide, Best, was knowledgeable and enthusiastic about showing us a different side to Bangkok. We enjoyed a walking tour followed by a Rickshaw ride through the streets. The Rickshaw ride gives you an opportunity to see into the daily lives of the inhabitants in the area. Soi dogs seem to enjoy watching the passing show as much as we enjoyed winding our way through the streets. Lunch is served at a Thai restaurant on the riverside. The food was delicious and our vegetarian visitors were well catered for. After lunch we took at short walk through the market area and then headed pack to the pier to catch the boat to the end of our tour. I highly recommend this as a fun activity for teenagers, adults and pensioners who would like to see a different side to Bangkok and also enjoy some beautiful greenery.

FANTASTIC BIKING TRIP. Nov 15th we had a halfday bike tour and it was fantastic. Very nice guide eye and excellent trip through the slumps of BKK and with longtailboat to other side where you bike in the bush ...Book this bike trip you will love it. We will do it again when we will be back in Bangkok. Thanks a lot bangkok Biking for a marvelous afternoon. And a great thanks to eye our private guide.....

Bangkok on bicycle: what a crazy and wonderfull Idea. It was a wonderfull experience to see Bangkok on a bicycle. We saw corners of the city we would never had seen without the tour. Don't be afraid: after 10 minuts in the normal Bangkok traffic, you get away from ist and it's very easy and relaxing with a lot of shade. almost a countryside feeling. We highly recommend this tour to anybody who wants to see some unknown corners in Bangkok. you just have to be abel to cycle 4 hours in a very slow speed. Also possible with children. Susanne and Manfred (51/61 Y)

Great experience. Colours of paradise bike tour is very well arranged gives enough time to look around, good guides. Good lunch. Gives you an idea of the "other" Bangkok which is very interesting, good experience, recommend it to everybody that would like to see Bangkok in a different way.

Tranquility in BKK. Since we had a 6 y/o we were recommended to take the private half day tour, and it did not disappoint. The tour co was very responsive to pre-tour inquiries, and day of the team was very helpful getting us all saddled up and on our way. There is a brief stretch of riding through city traffic but the guides stressed safety throughout. After crossing the road and loading our bikes on the boat, we crossed the river and proceeded to a day of exploring another side of BKK, one of forest and calm. The equipment was good, the guides attentive and very nice people, and the scenery was beautiful. The distance was manageable with frequent breaks and a stop for lunch (included). I'd highly recommend this trip as a mini escape and to see another side of BKK.

Amazing experience! . Amazing! From the service to the cycling - everything was fantastic. I tried to book the colours of Ayutthaya bike tour but none was available for the day I wanted. Dave from RBB responded to me within 10 minutes and suggested another date or Colours of Bangkok. I decided to do colours of Bangkok and it was worth every penny! Experienced staff. Very professional. All English speaking. If you don't do one of their tours you are definitely missing out!

Very different... very good!. We would have never seen those parts of Bangkok in our short time visit. The friendly people, the green lung of Bangkok, the boatride with the bikes... it was all an adventure! Don't miss it! And our charming tour guide Sao! Thank you for this experience!

Eye opening trip throughout Bangkok. A great family experience of looking at the different faces of Bangkok. For the kids it was really a great way of experiencing a big city! If you have the time, certainly go for it!
Fantastic and unique experience. It is always nice to go and experience a day of tourism. I have done a few trips now already with RBB and each time it was very well delivered and taken care of.
Great way to see Bangkok!. This was a great tour. Very easy pace and you get to see parts of Bangkok that you would otherwise not see. Highly recommended!
Great bike ride!. We had a great morning with the tourguide Kenny during the Bangkok city culture ride. Glad we did the ride in the morning beause the temprature was still nice. Very much fun!

Fantastic tour of Bangkok and outlying areas. We had a brilliant day in November 2014 on the ride - it was great fun, really interesting and easy even for someone who is not fit like me - well worth it highly recommended
Wonderful tour. We went there in January 2014 and it was a very nice tour. When we come back to Bangkok we are looking forward to make this tour again!

Bangkok By Bike. Very nice way to explore Bangkok. I've bin to Bangkok many times, but some of my best memory's are from this trip. provided Gear is sufficient and the guide professional.Did it with my daughter of 12 and we bough had no trouble with the hot weather or humidity. Dutch owner is also very friendly. Will come again !

Avery enjoyable bicycle ride. We have been to Bangkok many, many times and decided to do something different this time with my wife whilst on another break. So we joined the bicycle ride as we are outdoor people and like to be adventurous. Well organised and a great way to see other parts of Bangkok and the real Thai way of life................ and there are surprises on the way.

The Real Bangkok. Loved this tour - we did the half day afternoon tour and got to see how many of the locals live. We went on narrow pathways in shanty towns and on raised pathways through the swamp dwellers. Lunch in a beautiful local restaurant, and stopped at a temple, salt factory, and sweat shop. None of these places would have been accessible as tourist we just don't know where to find this as its not in any guide book. So, so glad we did this - I'll never visit a city without doing a bike tour again.

Facsinating look at Bangkok even if you live there!. There is lots of variety on this tour- from slums to stilt houses via elevated paths and big highways, there was something new round every corner. I particularly liked that we set off from the RBB offices rather than a suitably scenic location as this way we saw how real people live not just the photo opp ones

A fabulous day out!. See and explore the other side of Bangkok! Firstly you experience the busy roads of Bangkok, and though its an experience, I never felt unsafe. You then explore the slums and see the children in a small Kindergarten which is supported by the Recreational Bangkok Biking company alongside other charities.
