You then make your way to the river and after a drink, you cross the river by long tail boat into the Green Lungs of Bangkok. After exploring the park, plantations and feeding the fish, you eat a delicious lunch and visit a local temple. Ferry back to the city side and a short visit to an outdoor boxing school before heading back. It was a fantastic day out and our guide Amm was excellent!! I would recommend this trip!

An amazing day seeing the real Bangkok!. If you're like most first time, inquisitive visitors to Bangkok, you'll first do the touristy thing and then want to learn more about the people and the culture. For the latter, I completely enjoyed my experience with "Rickshaw & Hike the Colors of Bangkok." My guide for the day Amm, was extremely knowledgeable, polite and showed me Bangkok through a native Thai's perspective. From temples, to boats to urban terrain, Amm gave me an in-depth tour of Bangkok -- a truly amazing experience! And they made this killer video of my experience. http://youtu.be/STLZIaZqluY. Thank you!!

A completely different view of the beautiful city Bangkok!. In this trip you will see some different sides of the life in Bangkok. From the slums to the busy streets in the city: Bangkok has it all. Our guide Amm shows more than the busy city to us, also we saw a part of the nature from Bangkok. He explained a lot about the life in Bangkok. We can recommend this tour to everyone!

Most fun I had in Bangkok. We had a really fun time with our guide Amm who spoke excellent English and could respond to all our questions. He guided us safely through Bangkok traffic which really takes a lot getting used to (especially the left handed traffic if you are from Germany). We visited interesting and often beautiful locations and enjoyed the best thai food I had the whole vacation. Since Amm was so good with the English language we could chat about the differences between our cultures and we learned a lot about Thailand in the process. If we had more time in Bangkok I would probably have taken other tours,too.

Very good trip. This trip is perfect to see some sites of Bangkok you would not see if you just go to the city and drive around with a Tucktuck. The guide is very friendly. The price includes also a little snack, several drinkes and a little boot trip to the other side of Bangkok.

Perfect communication and booking & handling procedure. I was deeply impressed and I am felt in good hand because of the perfect communication and the booking/handling procedure. Fast answering of mails and requests. Perfect Service. Thanks!

Money well spent - Colours of Bangkok. We've done most things in Bangkok and honestly this is the best. It's amazing that within such a short space of time you wouldn't even know the city existed. Our guide, Sao, gave us basic instructions at the start and we were off, meandering through busy city streets before getting in to the alleyways. The local people we saw along the way were friendly and offered a welcoming greeting. Sao stopped whenever we wanted to take a photo and also had s lot of local knowledge. The "green lung" of Bangkok was peaceful and the pathways over the swamps were great although it wouldn't be fun if you fell off! Lunch at a local restaurant was good before we headed back to the city. Recommendation- don't go on the weekend as the parks are crammed with people.Overall, this tour is really good value for money, is really well organised, and if all the guides are as good as Sao then you can't go wrong.We'll be back for sure!

Fabulous tour. It was my second time I have done this tour and I loved it. Great staff, they lead you through Bangkok traffic on a safe way. We rode through the small villages in Bangkok and met nice locals. And crossing the river was also a nice experience of seeing Bangkok from a different angle.

Bangkok by bicycle. This bicycle tour is a must for every Dutchman visiting Bangkok. You will see this city in a way you never would otherwise. From traffic jammed streets via the narrowest of alleys across the Chaow Praya river and straight into the Green Lung or 'the jungle of Bangkok', as our guide called it. A great Thai lunch is part of the experience. Highly recommended!

Great way to See Bangkok. What a great way to see Bangkok. Of course Dutchies are known to be comfortable on a bike, it remains a very exciting way to see Bangkok "of the beaten track". Moreover, Best was just a great tourguide ! To get a Go-Pro movie at the end, was a excellent surprise.

Seen all the colors of Bangkok. We visit with our family, two teenagers 16, 19 years and mum and dad Thailand. What an experience! One of this was a cycling tour "colors of Bangkok. With our guide Tom who show us Bangkok as we never had seen before . Wonderful tour with even so much challenges. Biy bike, by boat. etc .Impressive was visiting a school with very young children in their uniform . The Thai boxing shool. Thanks for this very nice morning of July 2015.

Diverse trip through Bangkok by bike. The trip had it all. Cycling through the hustle and bustle of the city (very exciting as there were no other bikes to be seen). Then off to the suburbs, where you could see a great difference with the nice apartment building that was situated right next to the suburbs. After that we went by boat (with bycicles and all) across the river, where we cycled through the jungle. We were part of a nice group and our tour guide made it a great experience to remember.

Best side og Bangkok. Great way to spend half a day in Bangkok. You easyly get enough of Temples and copy-products, but here you see something authentic, you cover a lot of ground and you have a nice guide who loves what he's doing. Don't miss it...

Enjoyable different Bangkok. We did the Colours of Bangkok tour and enjoyed it very much so. You see a different Face of Bangkok, move away from traffic, get to see community People, explore Bangkok's Green districts and can be active for half a day with a nice guide. Our son (10) loved it.

Great way to see different sides of Bangkok!. It is very nice to see the contrast between different parts of Bangkok. First you bike through the wealthy business district, after which you go and discover the slums where people live in very small "houses" with their whole family and animals, they were so friendly when we passed. Then we went on a boat with our bikes and got to see the green area of Bangkok, very beautiful nature and it is certainly worth seeing!!

Good tour in hidden Bangkok. The Colors of Bangkok tour combine city road, narrow slams, river crossing and rural area at the other side of the river.The office / meeting point is far from BTS or MRT, so you must take a Taxi to get there.We were 6 participants all together. I was surprised that we didn’t need to sign any form, declaration etc. nor forced to use helmets.To my opinion we had an inexperienced (young) woman guide. So we received the bikes (in good condition) and we started the tour (right on time) with no much explanation.The river crossing is not well organized since only 1 small long tail boat is crossing first the people and then the bikesAfter all this, the tour itself was very good and I do recommend.

Fantastic hidden treasures of Bangkok. We arrived in Bangkok and wanted to see something different than the usual tourist spots. A bike ride was the order of the day through some different areas including slum, rich and the green lung areas that we didn't even know existed. Our guide Ket was fantastic and full of lots of local information and very mindful of our safety at all times. We would certainly recommend this bike ride to anyone that would like to see something a little different - a very enjoyable half day.

Fabulous tour through hidden Bangkok!. This was definitely the highlight of our trip to Bangkok - the wonderful bike ride through Bangkok's green lung & other spots off the beaten tracks can be highly recommended! It was hot, but when you drive the breeze helps + water is supplied throughout the trip & breaks are frequent. Our guide was very lovely too, a bit more infos about the areas would have been interesting but all in all it was a truly perfect experience!

Colours of Bangkok!. I attended the colours of Bangkok tour. I was really tired after late night out. I was the only one on the trip as some others had cancelled late previous night. Well , I got a private tour with guide Sand and it was hilarious. Like two friends going biking in very beautiful and interesting scenes. It truly was great! I would recommend this tour to anyone. You cycle through slum, in the forrest, have a cool long boat ride that is operated by locals etc. Lunch was good too!

Perfect way to see Bangkok. Last Monday my boyfriend and I arrived at Bangkok and today, Tuesday, we wanted to see the best possible spots from Bangkok. After some research we found this biking thing. We started at 8 am and were finished around four houres later. Khet was our guide and honestly she did an amazing job. Showed us the most incredible spots by bike, the jungle, a temple, poor neighbourhoods and also the better ones. She really cared for our safety and did make sure that we would be able to keep track with her. She knew her way in Bangkok very well, never got lost. Her English was good and very understandable. The group was very small which was very nice. So, we absolutely recommand a cycle trip!

wonderful tour. I did the colors of Bangkok tour. This was a great experience with a really nice tour guide named Kat. I can highly recommend this tour as it shows you Bangkok from a totally different perspective. I would definitely go on another tour with this company.

Colors of Bangkok. RDF, "Impressive tour"We enjoyed the "Colors of Bangkok" very much, because we could see parts of Bangkok which are definitely not on a tourist map. We passes through a migrant worker community, a Chinese community with a small family-owned T-shirt factory and a visited a Kindergarten sponsored by RBB. We took a ride on a small boat to the other side of the river to cruise through a jungle area on narrow concrete pathways. The bikes were extremely comfortable! Our tour guide named Kob was well versed in guiding us through the traffic and into the narrow and shady lanes of Bangkok. Kob is incredibly nice and knowledgable. It was a great pleasure to explore Bangkok with him.

Great tour. We enjoyed a morning in Bangkok with Recreational Bangkok Biking. The bikes were good, the tourguide was knowledgable and the tour showed the Bangkok from many different angles. We started at 800 and returned at 1PM. Great experience. Robert and Brigitte

Highly Recommended!!. This is must do !!! Colors of Bangkok!! Cycles are good and guide will help you throughout to make you understand Lifestyle of Bangkok and you will be able to see all new city with different perspective!!! You can really explore in and out of the city!!

Unique view of Bangkok. The "Colors of Bangkok" tour gives you the opportunity to see parts of the city you would not see otherwise. The bicycles are in good condition and you are given a good cycle helmet as well as plenty of water during the tour. Our excellent leader, Amm, took great care to negotiate the busy traffic. The cars and motorbikes were considerate as well. We were given the chance to see one of the poorer neighbourhoods and stopped off at a nursery school which is being sponsored by RBB. The cycle tour on the other side of the river was a great contrast and really enjoyable.

Another great bike Tour of RBB!. I did THE colours of Bangkok Tour again (second time) and was super again!Pur guide Amm did a great job pointing is out THE interesting facts of the scenery and temples we visited along the way.If you're in Bangkok this is a 'must do' outing you can not miss!!!Tip: if you can: do THE colours of Bangkok 'weekend edition' this is THE same Tour as I did now but with Some extra places to visit... As THE name says, iT only goes On weekends... I did this Tour also before and iT is surely worth THE extra time;-)Keep up THE good work André, and my next Tour Will be Hua Hin I hope!

Native Bangkok by bike. With Kob as our guide, we saw different parts of Bangkok.Without this trip whe had no Chance to see such interest things.Kob was the best guide we've ever met.Thank you for this amazing tour and the very good Explanation of the different art of live in Bangkok.

Colors of Bangkok. A must do experience if you're in Bangkok. It is a very interesting tour. You can see Bangkok from a completely different perspective and I can recommend it to anyone. Your guide will take you to places that you would never see and you're right in the real life of Bangkok. Highly recommended.

Sunset Ride-Great time. We did the Bangkok Sunset Ride with Amm. Definitely a different side to Bangkok. We had a great time. Rode through the back alleys and streets (even past an outdoor movie setup a couple of times!). We did have to do some riding on the main streets, which was a little harrowing, especially near the end of the tour at the flower market, which was very busy.. The local restaurant where we had dinner was really, really good. I would not recommend this tour for inexperienced or con-confident riders. Also, you are lifting heavy bikes over barriers and up and down stairs several times. We loved it, but it would NOT be for everyone. The temples we visited were nearly deserted, and had a wonderful peaceful vibe that is completely missing during the day. Amm and Tom were terrific and did a great job stopping traffic. Give this one a try if you're in good shape and a fairly confident biker. You'll see a totally different side of Bangkok. Thanks!
Bangkok - different!. Away from the main sights, a look behind the scenes! A special experience, an unusual way to discover BKK! I can only recommend it and will do it again.
Perfect trip!. If you like to enjoy something different and special in Bangkok - choose this! Bicycling in Bangkok is something I would do definitely again!

Another view of Bangkok. For those who've seen all the main sights of Bangkok, this trip will show a completely different face of Bangkok: daily life of Thai-people, nature, Buddhist habits, ... . Recommendable!

fantastic insights in the "unknown" Bangkok life. Unusual and highly interesting trip across labyrinths of residential areas, crossing the river with longboat, and even a nice ride through the jungle on a small path, guided with superior ease by a local guide, absolutely recommendable

Nike The Colors of Bangkok.. We have done the Colors of Bangkok cycling tour on Feb 14 2015, it was wonderful experience to do it. it is highly recommended. The guide we had was super well her name is Puiy. Puiy thanks for your great explanation you're the best. Greetings Sjannie and Sjef Hoepelman

Beautifull cycling tour. You see een part of bangkok and after boatride you cycle through the green part outside bangkok.Very good tour guide and afterwards you get many pictures by email of your tour.We made the trip with our family of five people.

Competent Tour guide and interesting part of Bangkok. Opportunity to get to know unknown parts of Bangkok. Very competent and charming tour guide (Por Che) and easy tour for even elderly people! Would do it anytime again!
Fastastic Experience. Fatastic Tour to unknown Bangkok. Very good bikes. Unforgettable impressions within the Bangkok "Jungle". Very nice tour guide (Preaw) with very good experience.

Fantastic experience!. Our friends (in Belgium) found this bike tour and booked it for us (we are from the USA). We went today and it was truly a wonderful experience! We were supposed to be picked up at 8am at our hotel. At 8:04 our guide actually called the hotel to say he'd be a little late due to traffic! Once he arrived it took us 1.5 hr to drive to Saduak. The tour was called Colors of Damnoen-Saduak. We started with a coconut drink, then boarded a long boat to visit the floating market. Our guide bought us some sticky rice and mango with coconut milk. It was terrific!He showed us how every part of the coconut is used by the local people. Then we loaded up on bikes and rode through the palms. We stopped occasionally for explanations about village life, housing, etc. He kept us well supplied with water along the way. There was a nice breeze and we were shaded from the sun by the trees. Lunch was at Pailin River Terrace and it was WONDERFUL!! Really exquisite Thai food!After lunch we rode our bikes to see some temples in the area and headed to the car. On the way back we took the bikes on a river ferry. Much shorter return trip to Bangkok (1 hr) because less traffic. Over all this was an A+ trip! A great value for the money!

Not too impressed. I know I know, there are so many raving reviews about this tour, however I must say it did not live up to my expectations. In many ways it was an OK tour for both our two children (10 and 12) as four adults. We did the Colors of Bangkok weekend edition. The pre-school on the way through "the slum" area was closed as it is every Saturday (suggest to take that out of the program). The floating marked is not really the floating marked I expected, but rather a normal marked with parts boardering some water, but do not expect the floating marked on the river with boats that one often sees in pictures. We did not sample any food there and our guide did not point out any local delicacies. The lunch was so so, when in Thailand why not have authentic Thai food, this was the most bland Pad Thai I ever had, even our children had to add some chilly powder. The Thai kick-boxing was also closed, it really is just a boxing ring, it is open on weekends in the morning and early afternoon, hence closed by the time you get to that part of the tour. Our guide did say we could take a photo in the boxing ring, but we did not want to wake up the 3 men sleeping in there. At least it was next to a kiosk selling ice cream as this would been one of the tour highlights for our boys. The salt factory which is mentioned in the program is premanently closed - again suggest that the program is revised. On our return trip across the river, we were one life vest short. Everyone from age 10 to full grown man were given same size vests, needless to say that the smaller people in our group would be in more danger using the oversized vests than none. Our guide was nice and kind, but not very informative. It would have been nice with a few bike instructions before the ride. Please note that front and back breaks are opposite compared to European hand breaks. We learned it the hard way! Also suggest that each participant is given a bottle of water to bring on the bike. As said there are many nice touches on this tour, but the low rating is based on the disappointments of the elements that were not there (despite in the program).

Awesome ride!. Once again an awesome bicycletrip from RBB, they never disappoint me. This was the fifth tour we did with them, and again they had a nice ride with our guide Tom. He had enough knowledge and decent info on the attractions. If you are looking for the best rides in town, go with RBB!

The quiet side of Bangkok. Today we had a lovely bycicletrip in Bangkok. The start was early, but the temperature is a little lower in the morning. We saw a totally different part of the city. Green and quiet. Little streets through communities and narrow paths through the green bush. We went across the river in a little boat, visited a school and had a Thai lunch.It was very worthwile seeing this part of the city. We enjoyed the trip very much and recommend it to all visitors of Bangkok.

Disappointed!. Tried to book on to the Bangkok paradise tour but we were told that they could not take us as there are only two of us! By the time they had let us know this is was too late to book anything else. I had been really looking forward to doing this tour and have seen many other tour groups advertising that they will run as long as there is one person. Not so for Recreational Bangkok Biking. So for reasons out of our control we were not able to experience the other side of Bangkok. I would recommend not booking with this company and instead going with a company that responds quickly and runs tours despite not filling their maximum numbers.

Must do in Bangkok. Although I'm a regular visitor of the City of Angels for almost 20 years, this was the first time I explored it by bicycle. Great and surprising tour through little soi's and never seen neighbourhoods.if you like to see something about real Thai life and skip the touristy spots, this is an absolute must do !We did the Colors of Bangkok Weekend Edition tour and that took us about the whole day. Bikes are good quality and easy to handle, even for less experienced cyclist, like myself.Tom, our Thai guide explained a lot about the Thai way of life and the ThaI way of thinking.Very interesting !!

Good but there is lots of traffic on the mainland. We went as a family private tour. It was great to see parts of Bangkok you wouldn't normally see. Especially the local communities who are ever so friendly. Tour well run and flexible. The biking on the island is great but unless you are super confident you need to stop at each corner on the walkway or else risk falling off!! Practically two other points. 1. There is a lot of walking / getting on and off your bike owing to narrow paths. 2. Getting from the office to the boat pier can be nerve wracking as some of the cycling is on the main Rama 3 road. So I'd recommend only for older kids. Overall great to see parts of Bangkok not exposed to mass tourism. But not so great unless you super confident or don't mind getting on/ off your bike lots!

Fantastic Bikeday. We went on The weekend edition of "Colors of Bangkok" IT was a great day with more dan we could hope for!We learned about a different part of THE city with The Boss André himself : also THE photo's he took sturing THE ride.....amazing!
Dont miss it. What a day!! If you go to bangkok dont miss it! We saw so many beautifull places that we would never see by our own! our guide was Por and she was very nice!

Amazing tour guide. We had a great time with the biking trip through parts of the city. It is a great way to see a different side of Bangkok. The tour guide was really informative, nice and helpful.Jonnie and Thérèse Boer

Amazing Tour. Excellent experience in Bangkok with a great tour guide and very good organization! You will see another side of Bangkok which you would probably not find alone. They also offer a transport from hotel and you will visit a very yummy authentic Thai restaurant during the tour.100% worthit if you visit Bangkok for more than 1 day!

Relaxing Backstreet Bangkok. We took the weekend Colors of Bangkok as a family of 4 (kids 12 and 15) with Amm and it was our highlight of our 5 days in Bangkok. What to expect:Engaging guide with great willingness to share history, culture and personal storiesPhotos - Amm took and shared about 30 photos during the tour which was wonderful. Even the Rickshaw driver know to overtake our other carts so we could each take photosVariety of environments from city suburbs to community living and the lungs of BangkokBest pad thai lunch Slow relaxing pace - nothing strenuous at allA market tour that explains the mysterious fruits and snacksGood quality well maintained bikesSome of the raised pathways are about 1.5 m wide so you do need a bit of bike control - or just go nice and slowIf you take the Rickshaw be ready to tip (your guide can advise on how much as we had no idea)The start point for our tour was about 30 mins from Khao San Rd so allow time and 120B taxi fare (if you can find a metered taxi).All in all a great trip, my only suggestions to improve would be more tastings at the market and perhaps to make the link between your tour and the support for the local kindergarden in the community more clear. These "sustainable tourism" models are very popular and more could be made of this.Thanks for a great day, great memories and showing us another side to Bangkok

Amazing tour through the jungle of Bangkok!. It was an excellent bike tour through places of Bangkok which I never saw before or even could imagine them being right in city center! Just within a few meters you feel like leaving the huzzle and buzzle of Bangkok, entering the jungle of Vietnam. The guide has been very friendly and helpfull, and made sure you never stay thirsty or hungry. A great experience for everybody who wants to see more then shopping centers and night clubs!

Like no other!!. Only in Bangkok could you do a tour like this. We went thorough the poorest of neighborhoods and yet were met with only the warmest of greetings. This is an experience not to miss! It is the exact opposite of the glitz and glamor of Siam. If you like the adventure of Indiana Jones movies,the touch and feel of a very special lifestyle and the warmth of the Thai culture.....if are tired of temples and all then touristy stuff and curious about what is happening backstage, THIS IS YOUR TOUR!!! Our guide Praew was friendly, informative and professional. She worked hard to make sure all our needs were met and took us to very interesting places. The pace was good - not rushed, not slow. If you have a Go Pro camera, bring it!!!!

put biking in Bangkok on your 'to-do list'!. Taking a biking tour through Bangkok is a must when you visit Bangkok! It's a great way to see a different side of the city. Recreational Bangkok Biking is a great company with good bikes and good guides. I really enjoyed my tour with them!

A great way to see local Bangkok. This was a really fun 22 km trip through parts of Bangkok that you might not otherwise visit. The tour guide was fun, informative, and helpful. Although Bangkok is quite flat and easy to bike around, there were some tricky spots. We did see that they had an itinerary for a family with small children - but definitely tell them about the needs of your group - not all trips are for everybody. Overall, it was our favorite thing we did in Bangkok.

Cycle and get another view of Bangkok!. It was a vey nice experience to discover Bankok by bicycle. Thanks to our guide Peach we saw a lot of interesting and diverse places such as a big local market, a salt factory, 2 different kinds of parks etc. We also discovered local life and could take pictures everywhere. Because of the traffic in Bangkok, we wouldn't dare to cycle on our own but with our guide it really was easy and relaxing. Excellent idea! Thanks again,Peach!

colours of bangkok tour. today we had a great day on our bikes, thanks to dave our tourguide. we have seen fantastic places on the bike from the jungle, high way till other places in bangkok.it is a different view of bangkok
Perfect. The guided tour colors of Bangkok Is very interesting and Our two adolescents really enjoy it.Preaw Is an excellent guide and so nice

Great fun!. My friend and I did the Bangkok City Culture Tour about a month ago and it was a great and unique way to explore the city off the beaten track. Andre guided us in a entertaining und professional way through heavy traffic, small alleys and literally through people's living rooms. We had a great time and enjoyed the trip so much, that we kept up riding bycicles in heavy Asian traffic while traveling through Myanmar.

Fantastic way to see the real Bangkok. One of the highlights of our stay in Bangkok!!!Pleasant, unique and unforgettable! Our guides, Mas & Tom made this excursion the perfect combination of cultural and culinary experience. Their knowledge and concern for safety made this outing one that I will remember for the rest of my life.Merci beaucoup Mas et Tom.Marc, Renee, Stephanie and Bailey

Amazing Experience. I have been living in Bangkok for 8 months and getting familiar with the city, but booked the Sunset Ride tour when my parents came to visit from Canada. It was absolutely amazing and I saw Bangkok from an entirely different perspective. Very pleasant ride with Mas and Tom, excellent guides, very friendly, enthusiastic and informative. We had a nice Thai meal and they really took care of us. We learned about the history of Bangkok through temples and markets, and saw the real Thai lifestyle that not all tourists get to see. Very well organized and thought through! I highly recommend it to anyone who wishes to get off the typical beaten track and do something more original.

Highly recommended!. This was one of our favorite tours around Bangkok, when in need to get away from the busy bkk life and a little tired of the tuktuks and taxi's, take the bike to experience it from a whole other side, and get a totally different view from the town.Our tour guide, Aam, was very friendly and could practically answer all our questions ranging from culture, politics, nature and local habits. We took the 'Colours of Bangkok' Tour which started in the higher residential area, with a 10 min ride trough the heavy traffic, which was not evidently but due to the excellent guidelines and sign languages during the ride it went pretty well.After that the ride went along to much more bike friendly roads, trough the communities and then towards a little boat that took us to the 'jungle of Bangkok', which was absolutely amazing, biking on a small pathway surrounded by the beautifull nature, who could imagine there was such a lovely, relaxing place in bkk.We were offered a very tasty meal during the break, got drinks during the tour and a local snack.After the break we visited a temple and rode on trough the middleclass area, and visited the smallest kickboxing school in bkk. In other words, an interesting Tour with a lot of variation, Aam guided us excellently with all the information we wanted, and allthough Thai roads are not fully prepared for people who love biking, tis tour was fitted exactly to make it a bike-friendly experience.This was the perfect antidote to get away from the heavy traffic, overcrowded busses and boats, noise and smoke, and to enjoy the nature, people and culture in bkk, with the entire family! (Note: we took this with our two kids of 6 and 4, there was a smaller bike available for the oldest one and a very safe seat for the youngest, and they where all quality bikes).While at first, a little prejudice about riding a bike in big bkk, i now recommended it to everyone.The photos Aam took during the trip was also a very nice way to experience the ride once again afterwards.

Day trip to explore outside of Bangkok. We were visiting for a work trip and really wanted to explore beyond the city to experience some other aspects of Thailand. After doing some research we came across Recreational Bangkok Biking. They were able to tailor the trip for us given there were just two people. Picked up exactly on time as expected and looked after extremely well all day. Our guide Amm really took care of us, and it was the little things like buying some of the market food for us that we would never have chosen. He also took the time to explain different things along the way but didn't over burden us with talk. This was a relaxed 30km bike ride. Neither of us have ridden a bike in years and we just took our time at a relaxed pace through the plantations. Extremely pleased with the service, attention to our care and fun / friendly experience we had in Thailand. Thank you!

A private Colors of Bangkok tour by our guide Tea. We had a private tour including guide Tea. It was a fantastic way to explore a different way than the traditional sights of Bangkok. Our guide Tea was very enthusiastic and adapted well to our condition with cycling. He also paid attention to our safety in busy Bangkok. For anyone that Bangkok has not yet been discovered by bike, I want him and Recreational Bangkok Biking Ltd. recommend.

biking with Mr Tea. It was my first time in Thailand so before I left Belgium, I did a little research on what to do and came across RBB and I'm glad I joined in on the half day tour in the morning. Biking in Bangkok is an experience on it's own but with a fun and friendly guide like Mr Tea it all went smoothly. Going through the eye-opening slum, interacting with the children there, helping a hand in the salt factory, feeding fish at the park, visiting a temple...enjoyed every bit of it! It's even crazy how the greenest part of Bangkok is just a short boat trip to the other side, but loved biking in it. Yummy phad thai lunch in a very pleasant setting. Overall the tour is definitely worth doing again and anyone can join in! Too bad I didn't get to do another tour in Chiang Mai, but that's for a next time.

Colors of Bangkok Tour - more colors than you've ever expected for Bangkok. This is my first bike trip and I'm really impressive it especially my tour guide... Mr. Tea who took care all of members very good and politely. He is real expert guide with advance skill for biking tour. Great to consider the guest's abilities and well balance to provide services smoothly in order to make all guests feel happy and enjoy the trip as much as possible.In term of program, I had a chance to see Bangkok in different aspect even though I am Bangkokian. So many things and lifestyle that I've never seen or it's quite far beyond from my daily life so it was a good experience which would be memorized and shared to other people in further step.With this biking trip, I could touch and prove that Thailand is still LAND OF SMILE which is our spirit and unique character since most of people keep smiling and say "Hello" with me all along the route.Just try it once a time in your life if you have a chance to visit Thailand and you will get the new experience for traveling here. .

Recreational Bangkok Biking. Amm was a wonderful knowledgeable guide - I am so glad they contribute to the kindergarten. I good luck at another side of Bangkok. Cheers Amm I enjoyed the tour with you. cheers Jacqui W
A must do. Had a great morning! It is worth it! 7th time in Bangkok but saw a completely different part of the city

Very funny experience!!!. We join the Color of Bangkok half day tour. It is a special experience we have in Bangkok!Riding in the jungle, feeding the fishes, going through the slum areas are very interesting and full of fun.The tour guide is friendly and helpful.We are definitely recommend to you if you want to see another side of Bangkok.

Great experience to explore Bangkok from another perspective. We're happyto know that the bike company contributes to the slum kindergarten. The tour guide Amm was excellent. He is the one that made this experience special: His genuine caring for the kids and people in the slums, his knowledge and his patience with questions and generosity with time. The colors of Bangkok are highly recommendable. And the ones that get Amm are the lucky ones!

Total different view on Bangkok. Our bike trip was wonderful. We leave Bangkok with a better feeling we came here. We did learn a lot about the culture, their belief and the city itself. Special thanks to our guide, Amm, who was really friendly, helpfull and interesting to listen to! We did learn more from him during 5 houres than we learned on our whole trip.

Bangkok Sunset Ride - great way to see Bangkok at night. This was my third bike trip with Recreational Bangkok Biking and yet again, it was exceptionally well planned and organised. Aam (tour guide) and his team of two looked after us really well throughout our trip.They were engaging and very safety conscious. Easy cycling, and pedalling through the quieter roads and back lanes of Bangkok with interesting glimpses of Bangkok family life. The itinerary included a number of interesting stops like,The Pagoda at the Chinese Chee Chin Khor temple complex; Santa Cruz church; Wat Arun; Wat Po, which looked beautiful at night and totally devoid of day time visitors and Pak Klong Talad (Flower market). Halfway through the evening we stopped at a local Thai restaurant for a selection of delicious dishes. Bikes were well maintained and had front and back lights. Crash helmets and florescent cycling vests provided. Thoroughly recommended. Looking forward to my 4th cycling adventure with Recreational Bangkok Biking.

Again an excellent biking tour of RBB!. This was the 3th time that we took a bike tour with RBB and again the tour was perfect! We took the full day tour that starts at the floating market. after that we visited a Coconut farm and also a few tempels that we passed on our way.The cycling itself was very relaxing and the landscape that we passed was rural and you could see the true Thai lifestyle. Included was also a Thai lunch that was very tastfull!Also a big thumbs up for our guide Amm. He did a great job by guiding us!When in Bangkok, taking a bike tour with RBB is a must do!Keep up the good work André and the whole team of RBB!

Splendid. We have done a lot of trips in the past, but never a biking trip. It was really splendid. We saw indeed a totally different Bangkok as seen in tourist-books and magazines. We enjoyed it very much n specially our tour guide Mas was very good, thanks a lot Mas for this special biking trip.ทักทายจริงใจ Tinus, Christina ns Tanja

Great experience for a sunny day in Bangkok. After carefully selecting the various offers to do biking trips in Bangkok we selected this tour ( Bangkok paradise tour for a full day). Our day started with lots of sun and a well organised transfer in the morning to the tour office. Our tour guide (Aam) welcomed us and provided us with drinks and bikes. The bikes looked very professional and functional. The following couple of hours ( until lunch time) we did a relaxing tour to various areas around Bangkok, across the river with a long tail boat (great fun!), through narrow pathways of the canals and oath rough food and veggie markets. Aam planned various stops for us to have a drink and to explain to us a little bit about Thai culture, the villages and the meaning of symbols and religious artefacts. We also visited two temples on our way. For lunch we stopped at a little restaurant outside of the city. The food was ok. We continued the tour and took two more times a boat ( through the canals and over the river again) and arrived at the tour office around 17:00h. Again the transfer back to the hotel has been organised for us. Summary:Gat experience. Very professional team. Our tour guide (Aam) was a really nice guy knowing a lot about the area and the Thai culture. Very much to recommend. Even for those people (like me) who normally do not like biking at all ;)
Must do experience!. Really loved this biketour. You get to see things you dont see whenever you visit Bangkok on your own. Natt is enthousiastic en helpfull.

AMM was awesome! Must do in Bangkok if you enjoy biking!. I heard that biking in Bangkok was fun, but where to go? The city streets are so busy! This tour takes you through the suburbs of Bangkok and the unseen side of the city. You also get to see the "Jungle of Bangkok" and bike through some amazing coconut farms. What really made this tour stand out for me was Amm, our tour guide. He was funny, intelligent, and really knowledgeable about Thailand and Thai culture. I learned a lot on this trip and had a great time. He also took some amazing pictures. Thanks AMM!!

Great tour whit Peach. One day trip in Bangkok Paradise has enabled us to get to know the real life in this city. Our guide Peach organized everything perfectly. Even the rain did not thwarted our plans. It was great.Thanks Ewa and Piotr

A fun way to discover another Babgkok. We were a group of 10 (adults and kids) all family (thais and belgians). We all really enjoyed the tour and we would highly recommend it! Our guide, Tea was very dedicated, funny, good with kids, ... All very positive!
Bike tour of Bangkok. Great time, well planned. See part of the city that you would never see if you did not do this. I would recommend.

Do it on one if your first days in Bangkok. We did the colours of Bangkok and we are happy we did it. It permits you to see the back of Bangkok. Natt our guide speaks English very well and is very good at explaining life in Bangkok and its people. Highly recommended.

Colours of Bangkok. Bangkok is a very large city with many faces. This trip shows some of the crowded and poorer urban areas. We cycled through narrow winding alleys, sometimes almost through living rooms, where life goes on without being disturbed by the farang passing by. Then a river crossing and the green heart, or lungs, of Bangkok. Narrow elevated cement paths criss cross the coconut plantations and offer views on very lush swamps and gardens with a few houses and temples. There is very little traffic, plenty of shade and fresh, cool air. This area is very relaxing and a perfect place to recuperate from an overdose of traffic fumes, noise and near misses with cars. Our lady guide, Peach, was knowledgeable and charming. An excellent tour, highly recommended !

fantastic experience. This was a fun and insightful trip. Initially I thought that this was quite a lot of money but then it is the whole day long and I can't think of any other way we would be able to see Bangkok, the real Bangkok. Our guide, tea, was absolutely brilliant! Clear, funny, honest and so kind, he made this whole experience so much fun. This trip involves rather fun cycling, through areas that are proably inaccessible by any form transport. It is off the beaten track. The variety is great; slums, salt factories, markets, jungles, temples, boats, it really covers everything. You do not need to be particularly fit to do it, but some confidence on a bike is helpful to navigate some corners at speed! Would definitely recommend to anyone; such a great trip!

Colours of bangkok. On the 27th of September we did the colours of Bangkok tour in the afternoon. Peach was our tour guide. We were lucky because it was just the two of us so it felt like a private tour. We really enjoyed it because you get to see a complete different Bangkok than the touristic Bangkok. Peach is a great guide. Her English is perfect and she was able to answer all our questions. Though the tour took 4 hours, it was never boring or too long. We stopped at several places like a salt factory, floating market and a Thai Boxing school. Also the lunch we had was delicious. So if you want to see a big city like Bangkok in a different way, we really recommend to do this tour.

Good but way to long. 4 hour Colours of BKK bike trip is a great way to really see the poor areas of BKK, but was way too long. After 5 hours in the heat, 3 x oldies on the trip were near heat stroke. Suggest for the tour guide to keep checking on group, especially when kids and oldies and offer taxi option if they are struggling. Good way to have a bit of adventure, you do get to see everything.

Rickshaw and walk. My husband and myself experienced this this month whilst in Bangkok with Mr Tee.We walked through the streets and slumb areas which made us both feel sad and lucky for what we have the people were so friendly despite there circumstances. Moving on along the river and across in a boat to the jungle Mr Tee was very informative and a great guide.Moving on to the Rickshaw ride was great fun and a good way to see Bangkok. We stopped of for a meal in a local cafe eating local food..Returning back on another boat to Bangkok again was good with Mr Tee looking after us all the way..Overall this was a great trip with Mr Tee as a wonderful guide. Definitely a must.

Bike tour... do it!. Second time I took a bike tour through Bangkok and it is the best way to come to places you will never get without a bike and guide. We had great bikes, good guide and lovely tour.This is a 'must-do' when in Bangkok. When cycling the wind will cool you down.

"Bangkok Paradise" Bike Tour. At 8am we were introduced to our 3 guides (Tea, Amm and Peach), given two excellent bikes, and an unforgettable day commenced with a small ferry taking the five of us across the river. The three guides spoke English very well and explained everything we saw, heard, and tasted while we explored this other side of Bangkok. We biked through neighborhoods, through farmer- and fish-markets, alongside canals, past fish farms and coconut plantations. We stopped along the way at small stores for drinks and snacks, visited two Buddhist temples, went for a boat-ride along one of the canals, had a terrific Thai lunch, and had a look at an incense 'factory'. We biked and biked and biked some more while enjoying the remarkable nature surrounding the concrete city of Bangkok. Our guides knew all about the flowers, fruits, fish, birds, and other plants and animals we encountered along the way; and their stories about the Buddha and explanations at the temples were enlightening. When dark clouds gathered above us, we were provided rain coats so we could continue our tour without getting wet. At 5pm we were back where we had started. When we arrived at our hotel, an email was already awaiting in our inbox with a link to photo's that were taken during the tour. This was by far the best experience we had during our 10-day stay in Bangkok. We saw a side of Bangkok that most tourists don't get to see. Thanks Tea, Amm and Peach!

Colours of Bangkok Tour 23/08/14. Myself and two friends went on this tour and were joined by two other people. One of my friends was delayed and the guys at Recreational Biking couldn't have been more helpful, allowing her to come and meet us at a point later on in the tour. Peach was an excellent guide, she gave clear instructions which kept us all very safe and she was very informative about the different things we saw. One of my friends isn't very confident when cycling but it wasn't a problem at all. We saw a lot of Bangkok that we would never usually have the opportunity to see which was great! The only thing that I would recommend is taking the tour in the morning as when we set off after lunch, the weather was so hot.Overall it was a fab day with an excellent guide and we will definitely be going on another tour.Thanks Peach!

Nice bicycle tour to see some more of the real life in Bangkok. On August 23 we made a 4 hour biking tour (colors of Bangkok) and saw a lot of Bangkok that you will not able to see by car. We biked through some very small "streets" between the houses of the local people and got a good impression how they live. We also had a look in a salt factory and the guide explained the process. It was also fun to navigate to the semi-island by a small boat. On the island we biked through a natural park and had a look at the way the local people have their vegetable gardens. We had a very tasty lunch in a local restaurant. We stopped by some other interesting places.We were wondering how we could bike safe through the rough traffic of Bangkok. However our guide, Peach, was taking very good care of the safety. She gave clear signs for attention, stopping and slowing down. And at cross roads she sometimes even stopped the cars so we had a safe passage! We really enjoyed the tour. And about good service all the photo's that were taken during the tour were put on the site and we could down load them for free:)

One of the best experiences in my stay in Bangkok.. I highly recommend this bike tour, although I took the most basic, Colors of Bangkok. It was a 5-hour journey through the unseen parts of the city. It was so fun for me, and relaxing, like I left all my worries when I rode that bike. There were much carrying of the bike and the heat can be too intense.The location is about less than an hour from Siam where I stayed and can only be reachable by taxi, but they give you a map in Thai which the taxi driver can read.Our guide, Nat, was proficient in English, compared to my other experiences in Bangkok. Also he was very nice and he will adjust to your pace.They offer refreshments along the way, and lunch. They also will hail a cab for you after the tour.Overall, I would definitely try their other longer tours when I get back! I think getting away from the touristy spots, and not fearing any scams or people trying to get money from you, seeing how local communities and how they go about a normal day is a worthy experience. The guides know the place very well and the communities you'll pass are safe. It was very hot but surprisingly I felt tired after, not during the tour.

Great bike tour executed via this company!. We did this tour under excellent guidance of our guide Tea. I really recommend this company.They pick you up when necessary from the hotel and guide you through Bangkok and see it in a different way then the usual touristic tours.Tea knows a lot about Bangkok and you can also ask him whatever you want.I can only say "go for it"

The other side of Bangkok. Because my brother and I were the only two persons for that days group tour, we got a private tour with our guide Tea. His english is a lot better than most locals and he had a lot of interesting information to tell us! The tour consisted of 1h biking in BKK and then 3 hours in 'The lungs of Bangkok' , a forest at the other side of the river. Very beautiful and interesting to do by bike ! We both were really glad we took the tour and I would recommend it to everyone.

The true colors of Bangkok. Biking in Bangkok ?? Yes !After a little bit stressing first kilometer (riding a bike in one of the planet most crowded city), we discovered a totally different Bangkok. A city "back scene", far away from the stereotypes, with truly friendly people in their daily life.Our great guide Natt took us Inside a small community, a salt plant, across the Chao Praya in a long tail boat, through a jungle, and inside a lovely budhist temple, where he taught us about budhist culture, prayers and wishes.A definitely high time of our family holidays in Thaïland.

"Colours of Bangkok" - Amazing trip with Amm. Been to Bangkok several times and wanted to do something different on top of the usual shopping and dining. Was not disappointed.Joined the half day tour and experienced a side of Bangkok that the usual tourist would not see. Visited a shantytown which had a kindergarten full of adorable kids, took a boat out across to Bangkok's nature parks and saw one of Bangkok's oldest temples.Our guide Amm took good care of us and was extremely knowledgeable on the sights that we visited as well.For a half day tour, this was more than what I have expected.

Colours of Bangkok biketour. Great tour,we had a great time on the 5 hrs biketrip with our guide mr. Tea. We saw a different side of Bangkok, we could not have explored on our own. We visited all the sites mentioned on the website, had a good lunch, the guide was friendly and spoke English rather well. The tour was fun relaxed and safe. I would definitely recommend this tour.

biking city culture tour perfect for our family. Our Bangkok biking tour with Tea was just perfect. We really enjoyed our time . He showed us many different less known area's of Bangkok. Our children loved the stories of our tour guide.This is a must do when you are in Bangkok.

biking with mr james thrue bangkok. on our first day in bangkok we did a bikingtour with our guide James.He showed us the many variaties Bangkok has the green hart of bangkok to the slums .When you come from a western countrie and never been to Asia a great experience !!We have been to places which we would noet have experienced on our selves .We recommend this tour highly to everyone !

Colors of bangkok - cycle tour - just perfect !. Expectations more than exceeded. This trip was far more than a couple of hours biking in a city. Tea - our guide - guided us through some less know area's of Bangkok. At a relaxing pace with at the right moment some helpfull, interesting or funny stories. Our children loved it. Especially crossing the river when we were heading to the longs of Bangkok. I would recommend this half day trip to everyone who likes to do something different. Especially with kids. Thanks Tea!

Bangkok by bike: a great experience!. This is absolutely a "must do" for everyone visiting Bangkok. Hidden spots you would never discover otherwise. No tourist show: the real Bankok life behind the scenes.

"The real life". Great experience!!! A visit to Bangkok in a way, a standard tourist will not have the same satisfaction. With our enthusiastic guide Peach, we discovered the "real life" in Bangkok. She gave a lot of explanation about the way of living of the people of Bangkok + about the places visited. Recommended !!!

colours of Bangkok. We all enjoined our biking tour throughout the slumps and jungle of Bangkok. Our guide Natt informed us well about the places we have visited and we never had found by ourselves. He knows a lot but, speaks English very well but above all: he is a very nice guy! We like to thank Natt for this experience and can recommend every visitor of Bangkok to join this cycling tour.
Bangkok Biking. Very nice biking in Bangkok with our super friendly guide Matthew!We would recommend this to everyone!

Best ever seen. The past 15 years i visited bangkok every year. But this year i have made the best experience of my past trips. After that bikingtour i can say, now i have seen bangkok. i would recommand this bikingtour every visitor. you can fell this city with all your senses. GREAT!

Exciting cycling tour through Bangkok!. We have had a great time with Natt on our Colours of Bangkok cycling tour. He was well aware of the fact that we had our 7 years old daughter cycling with us. Great guide aswell and an expert in creating stars our of a straw ;-). The tour went through small alleys, slums and stunning jungle. We have had plenty of stops in between to make pictures and have a refreshment. It was something we would immediately recommend to anyone who is planning a trip to Bangkok! Thanks Natt, for the great experience!

Bangkok Paradise: Biking in Bangkok. We very much enjoyed the cycling Bangkok Paradise tour, which kept us busy for the whole day. Thanks to our very nice tourguide Amm we had a great time. He spoke English beter than any other Thai we met during our vacation trip and was very knowledgeable. This tour was not cheap, but definitely value for money.

cycling in Bangkok. It was a great experience cycling in Bangkok and the mangrove forest in the lung of Bangkok.Under the inspiring guide Metthew, we had a beautiful and interesting tour.At first our kids (9 and 12) did not want to cycle in Bangkok. But they found this one of the best tour of our holiday.

Amazing trip. The 4 of uw went in the colors of bangkok cycling tour. Our guide Jim knows what he's doing. This was the third bike trip i've made in thailand. Still it was amazing. I would recomment it to everyone i know.

Experience not to miss. Nice trip through exciting but busy and crowded Bangkok.Slums visit was impressive but also the jungle of Bangkok one should not miss.Our guide Matthew showed us all the nice places and provided us information in a humorous and nice way.The Included lunch in a local restaurant was with good food and a nice cold drink.A trip to remember for the rest of your life.

Unforgettable experience in Bangkok, seeing places you would never see on your own!!. Discovering Bangkok in an unusual way. Today we took a biketour with RBB, that brought us to places like a kindergarten, a muai thai school, through the 'jungle' and the homes of the ordinary local people. In one word: unforgettable!A special thanks to our guide Tea, who took care of us in a knowledgeable and safe way.JT Wiltschek

A must for everybody visiting BKK and can ride a bicycle. This bicycle tour is called Colours of Bangkok. You tour a few minutes in the crowded city, then you enter a narrow street, which entrance you would never discover by your own. From there you cycle along (through) the small family houses and see how most people of Bangkok live. After that you cycle through the plantages and commumnities with their own temples and crossing by longboat the Chao Praya.Our tour guide Tom, a Thai himself, could explain and tell us a lot about he culture, Budishm and the history. He was able to give answer to all our questions. He guided us perfectly and everything was very well organised. This is such a great tour to discover the other beautiful side of Bangkok.
Great experience. It was a great day, easy biking with a great guide Peach. A tour around Thailands local life, boat trip and bangkoks green lung, and boxing school.
Best guide ever: Tea!. Wunderfull experience visiting the not so well known parts of Bangkok. Tea did a great job showing us the outskirts of Bangkok.

Special bike-tour!. Today we had a very special bike-tour with our guide Peache. Colors of Bangkok it's called. We visited the slum houses of Bangkok, took A short boattrip across the Chao Praya river to the greenest area of the city. We also visited a temple, a salt factory and an elementary school, sponsord by RBB. We ended the tour in a Muay Thai school (kickboxing) where Peach arranged a training for us.It was a very nice trip with a very nice guide who told us a lot in a pleasant way. We really enjoyed it. Thank you Peach!

The tour was all we had expected and more!. A great city with a lot of history and beautifull sites. Tours like this always heavily depend on the company you pick and the guide you get. We had a great time. I believe going on bicycles is the perfect way to explore! We were with 3 small children and felt safe whole time! Special thanks to our guide Am , from all of us!

Fun and amazing bike tour. We had van wonderful trip with our guide Amm. He was our private guide and showed us a lot of the city Bangkok. We had a great time biking and sail true the city. We also met the kind dutch owner and because we are also dutch we went together to see the world cup match of Holland in Bangkok. Amm became our friend with his great biking skills, after the trip we called him: Weelie king ;).Bye, Mitch en Mike.

Escape the city and go for a bike tour. What a wonderful afternoon bike-tour with our guide Natt. Crossing the river by boat with our bikes, riding through the jungle outside Bangkok, having a fantasting lunch and meeting nice and friendly Thais along the way. Natt told us a lot about Buddhism, the food and culture. The 4.5 hours (about 25km) went by very fast, we recommend this also to families with older kids. (Some narrow path)

An amazing experience. We had a lovely, almost 4,5h tour through Bangkok. We saw the slums and jungle, had lunch and met with some local people. Nat was our guide, he knew a lot about the surroundings and was good to have as an interpretor. He made is bert comfortable and when we were tired or wanted to take a picture that wasn't a problem. Great experience!

Different side to Bangkok. This tour was very fun and our guide M was caring and informative. We did colors of Bangkok which toured the countryside and it was awesome while a little dangerous! Just be cautious and keep in mind you level of comfort riding in a busy city/rural area and you will be fine. The tour itself is very laid back, though and not strenuous in the slightest. Would do again!

Paradise on the other side of the river. If you want to escape from crowded Bangkok the 'Colors of Bangkok' is a perfect opportunity! The bicycle tour starts near the river passing along narrow streets experiencing the true life of Bangkok. After crossing the river on a small boat you will enjoy the unexpected beaty of the green park and see how near the jungle is. Our guide named Tea was very friendly and tought us the most interesting stories in a perfect way; thanks Tea!Total distance appr. 20 km on flat but sometimes narrow paths with water on both sides.

A very different afternoon. During a couple of hours we enjoyed a very different part of Bangkok which we discovered as the tour went on. It was 1 big surprise as we didn't study the details of the tour before booking it.Recreational Biking team has clearly established relationships within the city & beyond to offer us an exclusive biking tour. Personally we would have loved a little more emphasis on the local culture & lifestyle, with insights on the history and the nature we discovered throughout the biking tour.Overall it is a nice activity and certainly a fun way to see beyond the classic tourist sites. If you fancy a tour in the suburbs and the 'jungle' of bangkok to break with the 'wat's' all around, definitely recommended.

Colors of Bangkok. In june we took a biketour through Bangkok with Recreational Bangkok Biking. It was very good organised and we had a very good tourguide Matthew. It's something you really should do when you go to Bangkok. You get a splendid look into the real Bangkok. It's a terrific experience when you are touring through the slumbs and also through the jungle (on a suprising good bikepath).

Original biking tour through Bangkok. If you are looking for an original way to discover Bangkok, book a tour with this company called Recreational Biking. We started at 8 Am with a group of 6 bikers. First our Guide Suzie gave us bikes, they looked like city bikes but actually have thicker tires and are of good quality. We cycled through little alleys, big streets, visited a salt factory and had a soft drink before taking a long tail boat with our bikes over to the other side of the river. There we continued to bike over concrete platforms (1,5 meters wide) in between the houses and we arrived at a park where we fed the fish. On to the floating market where we were served a simple but local and authentic lunch. This tour gives you the opportunity to see Bangkok from a different angle, and I had a lot of fun. Our guide Suzie was fun and informative and we were able to ask her all our questions about Bangkok, the people, the temple and the different things we saw. We returned to our starting point about 5 hours later, full of impressions. If you have a bit of a condition that this is the tour for you. All drinks and the lunch were included in the cost of the activity.

Seeing Bangkok in a non touristic way. Loved the tour! I have lived in Bangkok and visited many times, but this bike tour was something completely new! I can recommend it to everybody! The tour guide is super friendly and told us interesting stories. Thank you!!
Colours of Bangkok...super!. Very good biking trip through Bangkok. See the city life from another side! Had the tour at 13:00 and it's easy riding. Just remember...it's warm! Very good tour!

A great way to see the 'real' Bangkok.. Our guide Tom was friendly and knowledgable. We did the Colours of Bangkok tour. It was great to cycle through residential areas that you wouldn't normally go through. The boat trip across the river was fun, and most of the journey is around green parks and paddy fields, which are beautiful. The temperature was high, (35) and although this is obviously not the company's fault, we wonder if the tour could be adapted a little to include more water stops, especially in the middle of the day. The last hour was challenging. Overall though I'd really recommend this tour- memorable and fun.

Bicycle Tour Colors of Bangkok 12.05.2014. We really enjoyed our bicycle trip around Bangkok, which showed us many places which we haven't seen as tourists without the tour. Our guide, Amm (Amarin) was great and told us many interesting stories/details from Bangkok and Thailand. We recommend to all tourists, who want to see another side of Bangkok a bicycle tour with Recreational Bangkok Biking and we want to say thank you for the wonderful day.

A special Way to see Bangkok. We started at 8 in the morning during rush hour in Bangkok. Our guide James took us safe through the traffic without ever getting dangerous or uncomfortable. We were surprised that we could bike so easily. And once we got on the narrow paths through the slums it was a Bangkok we have not seen before. Also going through the jungle was amazing. So close to the city. We enjoyed it even more than expected.

Colours of Bangkok - Songkran. Great experience to see the other side if Bangkok. The Thai children were so sweet saying hello and hi-fiving us. James our guide explained everything to us so well and it gave us a taste of the Thai culture. We had been in Hua Hin during the celebrations of New Year and were lucky enough to celebrate them again whilst cycling through a province in Bangkok.

Interesting way to see another side of Bangkok. This was a very good way of touring Bangkok. I joined in the Colors of Bangkok tour and visited the 'green lung' across the river and it was quite an interesting experience. Recommended for those who want to go beyond the typical touristy itinerary. Food and drinks were provided, very convenient.

Amazing educarive experience that will get you to places an average tourist will not see.. Two days ago and still enjoying this wonderfull experience. I would like to thank Matthew for being a great guide. If you are in Bangkok you should really do this tour. Not only to enjoy yourself, but also to support the school in the slum.

Another Bangkok. Today I cycled with a small group of other travelers through Bangkok, under guidance of Tom. I highly recommend this tour, for a short while you cycle through the city which sounds adventurous but it's safe. After that we cycled through slums, middle class living areas, an old salt factory, some temples and through the Bangkok 'jungle'. You'll cross the river on a longboat as well. You wouldn't find all these spots yourself. Along the way there are plenty of stops and water is provided and a nice Thai meal.
Colors of Bangkok. The best way to see the other side of Bangkok. They have great guides. No need to bring food or drinks. Everything is taken care of. Thuis was our second tour. Need I say more?!
Colors of Bangkok. A great journey where we saw a Bangkok that you don't find in the travelling guides. But this Bangkok is very interesting. Presented by a high professional guide.

The green lung of Bangkok. First we cycled through a slum quarter and we visited a school for young pupils - sponsored by the tour operator of our bike tour. After that we were taken across the Chao Phraya by a small boat. Then we rode through a jungle area of Bangkok for more than three hours. We cycled on small concrete paths. It was fantastic. Our guide Matthew was excellent.We didn’t know that such a jungle area near Bangkok downtown exists.

Bangkok from a different angle. I did the Rickshaw & Hike the Colors of Bangkok tour with Recreational Bangkok Biking. It was a great experience to see Bangkok from a different angle. I know most of the tourist places in Bangkok already, so it was very nice to see places that were not even written about in my travel guide! We first visited some places (old salt factory, slum area, temple) on the Bangkok side of the river and then did a short long-tail boat ride over the river to the so-called Jungle of Bangkok. It was very refreshing to get out of the always congested city and to walk through lush nature and plantations. After coming to a park where we fed fish we continued the tour on a Thai rickshaw, had delicious lunch, visited another temple and walked over a fresh market. It was very interesting to listen to the guide's stories about Buddhism and Thai traditions. I would recommend it to everyone who would like to see a clearer picture of Bangkok and how it actually really is, far away from any tourists.I can also fully recommend the Colors of Bankok cycle tour wish I've participated in as well. The area that we cycled in was quite the same as in the Rickshaw & Hike tour, just that we used bicycles. I can only say - what a different and great experience to actually cycle through Bangkok. I would have never dared to do so when I was by myself, but since we had an experienced guide cycling in front, I did not worry one second. Also, we didn't cycle through traffic but took small sideways through a slum and the Jungle. An amazing and fun tour that everyone should do when in Bangkok. You will not regret to book with Recreational Bangkok Biking. Very professional and friendly staff/guides and totally worth its money!!

Colors of Bangkok. We were 5 people and did this great half-day bycicle tour. Mas was our guide. It was absolutely interesting. We saw a lot of Bangkok (nice houses, houses of poor people). We also cycled through a jungle (we saw a big monitor lizard, fed fishes...), saw temples and had a very good lunch in a nice restaurant. Mas was fantastic. She is very funny and she told us a lot about the people and the country. We also visited a little salt factory. Everyone who comes to Bangkok should book this tour. Mas, thank you for that wonderful trip.

The best way to enjoy Bangkok. Want to see the city in a way you'd never be able to see it by yourself? Then this is the place to be. We decided to book a tour of Bangkok after recommendations from friends and we did not regret it one bit. We saw the hidden side of Bangkok and came places we'd never heard of in any guide. Our guides English was very good and he was very knowledgeable. It was truly an unforgettable experience and I recommend it to anyone willing to do something a little bit more adventurous.

Great Bangkok experience. We decided to follow the great recommendations on tripadvisor and did some biking in bangkok. it was an absolutely great day and you are able to see different sides of bangkok. our guide was amazing and it was one of the most memorable days of our 4 week vacation. in our opinion it's an absolute "must-do" once you visit bangkok to do this tour.

Great way to see the inside workings of the city. This trip is not for the timid the biking is very tricky. Very narrow passageways through the city. Would not recommend for young children. Most of the pathways were 4 foot wide concrete pathways. Just be awareBesides that the tour was amazing. Our tour guide, farm, was a very charming and professional around locals and driver. The locals knew the tour company and were very respectful to all of us and always said hi. It was a great way to see a different side of Bangkok! We took the colors of bangkok Tour.

One of my favourite parts of my trip.. Would strongly recommend trying out the Colors of Bangkok tour. Get to see the alleys , the business areas . go on a short boat trip and cycle through a jungle area. . Plenty of drinks provided , snacks available and a meal at a restaurant. Tour guide was great felt safe the entire time , spoke great English. Some sharp turns throughout the trip , cycled on the road for a bit as well. I think it made it even more enjoyable.

Great way to see Bangkok. My friend and I recently took a tour of Bangkok with Recreational Bangkok Biking (Colors of Bangkok). The tour was great and allowed us to see a part of Bangkok I didn't know existed even though I lived there for seven years. The guide was very knowledgable and fun to be with for the tour. I would highly reccommend this tour to anyone who lives in Bangkok as well as those visiting the city.

Colors of Bangkok by bike. A must-to-do in Bangkok! A full of contrasts views of the city and surroundings. Mas our guide was very nice,always smiling and gave us good explanations on different subjects.A well organised tour that I will recommend to my friends.

Highlight of our trip!. This biking tour was truly a highlight of our trip! I don't think I would have appreciated Bangkok to the same capacity if I had not gone on this tour. We got to explore parts of the city we would not have been able to otherwise, since much of the tour is spent riding in areas that cannot be reached by car or even by tuk tuk. There were some very narrow alleys and raised biking paths to navigate and at first I rode a little nervously. However, the route was well worth it and I wouldn't have changed this aspect at all because I think it added to the fun and adventure, as well as allowed us to see so much more. Not only did we get to ride through busy city areas, alley neighborhoods, and visit factories, we also took our bikes on a boat to an island with a gorgeous jungle landscape. It was beautiful and didn't even feel like we were in the huge city of Bangkok anymore. The tour was kept to a small group and our guide was also great. I would recommend this tour as something one must definitely include in their itinerary when visiting Bangkok! (We did the Colors of Bangkok tour)

Very good. This tour is really nice! We liked it a lot. While you cycle, you see a lot of interesting things you did not expect to see in a big city like Bangkok (like nature, park and the local life). If you like cycling and like to see other things than the wellknown highlights of this city, you will like this tour, like we did. The guide was perfect, spoke perfect English. We make a few stops for drinks en a Thai snack and lunch at a local restaurant. Highly recommended! Estella and Hans

Great bike tour through real Bangkok. The tour was very good fun and extremely well organised. There were 12 of us in a company group on the tour. Our guide, Mas, was excellent. Always friendly and knowledgeable. The trip took us through poor neighbourhoods as well as a large natural area which was surprisingly tranquil and we visited a very nice market which was hardly frequented by tourists.Highly recommendable! Nicolas Frank

Excellent bike tour, the other side of Bangkok. This bike tour is great fun, riding through the little sois (small side streets) and seeing real Thai life. A good guide (ms. Mas) who explained and answered all questions. Then a little boat ride with a drink before and surprisingly another side of Bangkok, nature with good biking paths close to the city. A friendly tour, you just need to know how to ride a bike. Can be done with children who bike and not a racing tour just recreational. I recommend this tour to all people who are really interested to see how the majority of Thai people lives

Great opportuniy to see real Bangkok. It was one of the most exiting experience we had during our 14 days visit in Bankok! It was definetly different from all the other tours organised for tourists. I would highly reccomend it if you are interested to see real Bangkok!
Just do it! It's a beautiful way to see another side of Bangkok. Great experience with another way to see the city of Bangkok. A tip for everyone who want to see a other side of Bangkok.

A must when in Bangkok. We got this tour adviced by several friends, and will definitely do the same.You see the real Bangkok, away from all the touristic places. You see that Thai people are good people, and not the people trying to scam and fool you (like in Kao San area). You bike through the very poor (slums) and very rich neighbourhoods. Most of the time you are on a little island called the green lung or Jungle of Bangkok. The guide is excellent and could answer all the questions we had. We got deep insight in the Bangkok society.

The Colours of Bangkok, rickshaw ride and walk. A great way to see some different parts of the city and the life of its people. A short taxi ride from our hotel took us to the offices where we met our guide Tew. We then walked 5 mins. To a salt factory and then along paths through slum dwellings. the people were very friendly. Then on to a dug out/canoe with a very old motor took us across the river and we landed on to a concrete jetty sticking out of the jungle, no handrails, above the water channels. It was fascinating to see peoples farms and houses, cut into the jungle. Then it was to a well kept park to feed the fish, then on to rickshaws for an hours ride through the area. Lunch was at a great riverside restaurant, food was very fresh and good. Finally a temple and then another public taxi boat back over the river. A fascinating day with many different sights and experiences to savour. Celia and Jim, Feb 14.

A very different day in Bangkok. We agree with most of the reviews here, that this is a great way to see places in Bangkok you would otherwise never discover. Slum, jungle, "snobby lane", market, temples and a good lunch all in 6-7 hrs. At at a very comfortable pace.Our tourguide Farm guided us safely and slowly through traffic and in the concrete paths in the jungle and was very friendly and with good knowledge.The bicycles were modern and comfortable street bicycles with enough gearshifts :-) They were in good condition.We definetly recommend people visiting Bangkok to drop shopping for one day and take this tour. It is not only for the very fit...

The other side of Bangkok. We made this cycling trip on January 27, 2014 with friends, all in the age of 65+, and enjoyed this "colors of Bangkok" trip. It shows a complete different view of Bangkok you will normally not encounter when visiting Bangkok. Our excellent guide Farm during this trip took us to undiscovered parts of Bangkok (slums) to see how these very friendly people live. We visited a primary school and salt factory in this first part of the trip.The second part of the trip went to the Bangkok jungle, which is totally different from the very busy Bangkok city, although so close by. Here we visited a temple and had a good fresh lunch served. To reach that jungle we crossed the river, together with the bikes, by a long tail boat.Although we as Dutch people are used to ride a bike, we did not encounter any problems, so is easy to do for anybody who is used to ride a bike now and then. The bikes were well maintained, also low frames were available for the ladies. Our excellent guide Farm, communicated in good English and took several pictures which were placed on Facebook the next day. Frans Verhoeven.

Very interesting guided tour. After being picked from our hotel by the owner of the tour company, we went for a walk with our tour guide Amm trough the slums of Bangkok, we also visited a temple and the oldest salt factory in Bangkok. After that we took a long tail boat to get to the other side of the river, where it was completely different, like being in a very different place, a real jungle with mango, banana and coconut trees. We hardly see anyone else. Rickshaws were waiting for us and took us for a nice and very relaxing and fun ride through villages. We had a beautiful lunch by the riverside. Everyone was very friendly and the guide Amm is very professional . I recommend this tour.

A different view of Bangkok. A great way to see some alternative views of Bangkok. Our guide Mas was excellent and explained everything in very good English. We visited back street slums, factories, a temple, the jungle, a school and even had a couple of quick river crossings and lunch! The trip was about 4.5 hours but well worth it.

Excellent way to see Ayuttaya. Jen and I took this trip as part of a boat/bike package from Bangkok.Good choice of well maintained bikes - nice step through frame for Jen. Helmets provided.Route is very flat, just a couple of steep bridge ramps to negotiate.We were met by our helpful, friendly guide Matthew and toured around some rice farms and rural areas mostly on quiet roads and paths. We took in a good temple area to see. The lunch was very good in a peaceful restaurant by the river. Using the bikes was an excellent way of touring the very extensive ruins.It was a bit exciting getting the bikes on and off the ferry near the end..Matthew was brilliant and we learned a lot about the Thia way of life and Buddhism.

A great way to see many sides of Bangkok. We went on this trip after it was recommended by the concierge at our hotel.
