Our guide, Jane, was quite new in the company, but very professional and were able to answer all our questions.The trip took about 4 hours, and this included 2 boat trips across the river, lunch and a lot of great sights!Of our 3 weeks in Thailand, this was our best excursion!

Alternative way to see Bangkok. We have been to Bangkok for past 20 years and know the place reasonably well. Friends told us about sightseeing Bangkok using bicycles. Being an avid cyclist - we did.Ann was our tour guide and we did have a lovely ride and saw unexpected sites. Don't want to spoil the adventure and give away what we saw and thus no pictures.JUST DO IT!!!Ton and Linda

The Best Day in Bangkok. We had the best day riding bikes with our guide and owner, Andre. It was so interesting to see Bangkok from a more "up close" perspective. The day started with riding through small alleys and streets. We then moved on to a quiet and lush area, had a wonderful lunch, and finished back on the busy streets of a Bangkok. We would definitely do this again and cannot recommend this company enough.

Great way to explore Bangkok. We've done Colors of Bangkok in the early morning. We started at 8 am while the weather was still cool. We really enjoyed cycling through the tiny streets and the neighbourhoods. This is completely different from the city center. While cycling, you see that Bangkok has 2 faces. The face we all know and the really Thai way. Our guide Mas was lovely and explained a lot about the things we saw. This tour is amazing and I would like to recommend it to everyone.

Biking thru downtown Bangkok. We enjoyed a very nice biking tour with our Thai guide Farm and a group of 8 people (6 Germans, 2 Dutch). Farm showed us around tiny little streets and neighbourhoods where everyoine seemed to be cooking, talking or doing laundry. Well, it was almost Christmas so that's probably why. All the while riding on bicycles that were well maintained and easy to adapt to our different sizes. At some point all the bikes went into a longtailboat, we in another and full speed across the river to BKK's jungle we went. There we cycled through a huge jungle-like park, fed the fish and visited the Sunday floating market where all kinds of fresh foods were cooked and tasted. In a word: a supernice trip and be well advised to take it.
Nice tour!. Great to see the other sides of Bangkok... Nice guide, cool tour. It wasn't to long neither to short.... worth to try!

One of the highlights of our holiday !. We've done colors of Bangkok in the afternoon and it was an amazing trip! The things we've seen were very interesting, very beautiful and educative. And Matthew was a lovely guide! Highly recommended!

rickshaw and hike tour. This trip was very great. We enjoy the silence during the trip. There was not the hurry we felt on the other trips with the bus. We felt very safety during our trip through the slums. The boottrip to the other side of the river, the walk through the jungle and the drive with the rickshaws was also very nice. Lunch we had in a restaurant near the river, so we had a good view on the river and a big bridge. We can only recommend this trip for all, who want to see a other Bangkok as with the bus-trips :-)

Splendid Cycle Tour. You are'nt allowed to miss this event. You will see Bangkok from all sides- Mr. Fram as our personal top Tour gide showed and explained us in flewently English Language the real Bangkok. We allways felt very safe with him and learned a lot about this huge City. We recomend this Cycling Tour to everyone- we'll keep all the impressions in mind- hopefully meeting again during the next Thai holidays

biking through Bangkok. If you like biking, don't leave Bangkok without this unique experience... it's a MUST! You are able to see and feel the more 'unknown' parts of the city in such a pleasant way. Our guide Farm was great. The founder helps out and supports e.g. primary schools in that area so it is a very sympathetic organisation.

An absolute must do when you visit Bangkok/Thailand. We had a blast cycling with RBB. Our boys 7 and 9 yrs had the ride of their life and so did we, thanks to our wonderfull guide Matthew. A real must do when you go to Thailand :-)
Colors of Bangkok. The best way to see the real bangkok in a relaxed atmosphere. I was a great experience and one of our highlights on our trip to thailand.

Fun and unusual. We found out why a return participant highly recommended Bangkok Biking - as do we. One gets taken on a highly unusual tour of Bangkok and shown sights not offered by conventional city tours. The backstreets and by-ways are fun; the numerous communities most interesting and friendly. Then take some of the hotel half-day sightseeing offerings to the conventional attractions. Great genuine Thai food lunch ordered with our input - not the usual set meal designed for tourists that one finds with most tours. Cold water purchased at a number of rest stops. Try this if you have a day to spend.
We loved it! Great ecperience!. Cool experience! I would deff. do this bike tour again!! :DOur tour guide was very sweet and the rest of the group was kind! :)
We enjoyed it. A very interesting trip throughout unkown parts of Bangkok.Our guide Mas was very sympathic and competent.We have seen yery much of original Thai life.

colours of Bangkok. interesting tour with a very friendly and smart tour guide throughout the slums and jungle,fish feeding in recreational park including boat trip and delicous food and beverages. The bikes were excellent and the tour guide always took care for our safety.

Colors of Bangkok. We took the colors of bangkok tour. It experience different sides of bangkok on how people live differently in bangkok. The tour went through modern bangkok, low-mid income living areas and slum living areas. The food offered during lunch was really delicious and was better than many other food outlets we ate during the trip for thai food.As a food person, more food and snacks during the trip could be better. Or there could be a food tour offered.

Unconventional but very worth while. This was a trip quite different from the normal sightseeing one does in a capital city - it focused on the way poor people live, nature and the river, everyday temples and their uses, etc. It included a delicious lunch at a riverside restaurant, where curious young cats rummaged in my handbag. The rickshaw ride was pleasant and the walk through the "jungle" good exercise, we saw several animals including a green snake.The park and fish-feeding was not as interesting to me as some of the other parts, such as the salt factory and homes we saw nearby.The information about the trip was not very clear about what to expect, but we were not disappointed. The guide was very nice and cheerful, and knew the area well. Our small group of four tourists had an excellent time, and the company sent me some nice photos he had taken the very same evening.

Biking in Ayutthaya, Thailand. The biking trip was good, planning fine, and the guide knew the area history. We went abt 25 k although it was hot. I miss although more detailed information abt the biking route when booking. But in general a great way to explore Ayutthaya and not the last time we have used RBB . Henrik G-N .

Sightseeing up close. Excellent ride around bangkok city outskirts. Probably about 20km ride, go through city, slums, across a river, to a temple and back. Bikes were ok, decent, guide was able to give us excellent information about things on the way, he also took some good photos. It actually started raining during our ride, the guide handed out plastic ponchos for us to wear. You dont have to be extremely athletic to ride the basic tour.
Ayutthaya. Fun trip and a great way to see the temples and sights of Ayuttaya. The tour guide took good care of us and knew a lot about the places we visited.
Great experience. On our last day in Thailand, we went on a half day bike trip with Recreational Bangkok Biking. We enjoyed it very much. We saw a very different Bangkok than we were used to.

The bike tour was awesome as it definitely shows you the non-touristic places. We enjoyed the ride through the car jungle and the small suburbs which usually no tourist will visit being in Bangkok. The tour guide knew a lot about the places and was a very funny entertaining guy! Some of the highlights were an incredible old salt factory and the narrow paths through the swamps.
Biking thru kitchens and livingrooms. we took the 10.00-16.00 sunday tour. great experience how the citizens live in their towns,can recomend it to everybody, not the ordinary sightseeing tours.

Great! Must-Do while you are in Bangkok. This biketour through Bangkok will show you parts of the city that most other tourists don't see. You get impressions that you will not forget. After a bit of a rough start on the main roads with all the cars and tuks tuks, our guide took us to an area where the poor people of Bangkok live. It was very interesting and shocking at the same time. Afterwards we did a boat trip and biked through Bangkok's jungle. We also visited a temple and a kick-boxing school. At the end of the tour we got some nice lunch.Overall it was a great experience and we saw areas of Bangkok that we would have never seen. Definetely recommended!

Perfect bike tour in Bangkok. We took the half day biking tour in Bankok. Our well spoken guide Amm showed us the city in a different manner. Biking through the inner parts of Bangkok and providing us with real nice background information. The tour was very well organized, drinks, a small bite, a boat transfer and feeding of fish in a park made the tour a very nice experience.

Amazing Bike tour through bangkok. We took the bike tour as part of our bangkok experience and it was amazing. our Tour guide Ann was amazing and she had lots of knowledge of the area and a lot of back ground information about the things we saw. if you want to experience bangkok in a way that you would otherwise not do book this. you will not regret it.
Colors of Bangkok. It was a perfect visite of Bangkok, we saw an other Bangkok. Our guide was perfect and funny!Thank you for allDelphine and David

Colors of Bangkok, weekend edition. This was the 6th time we visited Bangkok and by participating in the "Colors of Bangkok" tour we were able to see Bangkok in a way we had never seen it before. Bangkok was always a very loud and lively city to us and this tour has shown that even within Bangkok there are many quiet, green places that are not crowded by tourists. Our Guide Rubin was exceptional! He speaks English very well, was patient, answered every question we had, gave very detailed information about the things he showed us and informed us about the different regions we drove through before entering them so we knew what to expect. To our mind this is the only way to REALLY see Bangkok and we can highly recommend it!!!

Great tour!. We would defenitely recommend this trip! Our guide Matthew took us on a tour and showed us areas of Bangkok that we wouldn't see otherwise. He gave us interesting information, and answered all our questions. We also got enough drinks, and a delicious lunch. Everything was very well organised and bikes were in very good shape.

Great opportunity to see areas of Bangkok that you would not get out to see on your own.. I was able to drop in directly from the airport and they were very accommodating and let me join the tour that was heading out. Our tour guide Farm welcoming was good about letting us know what each area was like before we were riding though it, and provided info for each of the places we stopped. The Thai people, even many who lived in the slums said "Hello" and smiled at the group as we rode by, many children even came out to clap hands with us. This is a great reminder that happiness does not come from things and can be as simple as greeting someone new.Two boat crossings, lunch & regular water stops ran smoothly. The route was well planned with limited time on busy roads. Bikes were in good shape easy to ride. I was really happy with the service on this tour and would highly recommend it!

Great way to see the bits you probably wouldn't see otherwise. 8am start on a Saturday. Met by Mas, our guide for the following 5 hours. Tour takes in a few slums, a clothing factory and most fascinating for me at least, a salt factory. If you think you have it tough ever, go and see this. A small veggie snack, and over the river the green space and cycling on raised narrow pathways with one or two stops on route. Then back across the river and back to base for lunch, some of which we cyclists prepared. A good lunch it was too.The cycling is essentially flat but you have to concentrate as it's either through very narrow alleyways or 1 metre high walkways about a metre wide. We were a party of 5, all late forties plus, and we all got round, so it can't be that difficult. Mas, our guide, was great, very informative and chatty. All in all a great tour and I highly recommend it if you want too see the less tourist heart of bangkok.

Great way to see Bangkok. Did this at the start of September on our way home from the islands. It is a great way to see a different side of Bangkok. We got to see how the locals lived and worked away from the tourist stuff. The guide was excellent gave us loads of info on Bangkok and answered all our questions. It was also great to just pay them at the start and then you didn't have to reach for your wallet through the whole tour which involved ferry, food and bottles of water all included in the price among other things. Cycling at the start of rush hour was exciting too. Would definitely recommend doing this if your in Bangkok.

Highly recommended!. To be honest: one has to be brave and a little crazy to bike in Bangkok. But the tour is worth every cent for those who want to see more than shiny sky bars an shops. The guides are very nice, the tour is well planned and offers you an insight of how the ordinary Thai makes a living in this town. The homes, the school, the salt an clothe factory as well as the "green lung" of the town and a little cooking class in the end - we enjoyed every second of the trip thanks to Mas, our friendly guide. We went with our two children (16, 11) and didn´t have any problems. Start early an wear a hat and you will have a great day!

An other way to experience Bangkok. In November 2012 I was in Bangkok. Freinds of mine had told me about biking in Bangkok so I look around and found 2 trip with RBB that suited me.One ½day trip in the weekend and a full day trip on a week day. Both the trips were wery well organized and the guide (it was actually the same on both trips) was very good. He was very easy to understand, knew a lot about Thailand. On the weekend trip we went to a marked where he all different kind of local food so we tasted a lot of different tings :-)Only disadvantage on the weenend trip was to girls that was not very familiar with bike riding, so that delayed the trip.But otherwise very recommendable.

Great tour on the different faces of Bangkok. You get a well maintained bicycle wich can be adjusted to your size/length. The tour leads you to different places in Bangkok. Our tourguide was a very friendly, English speaking Thai with a good sence of humor. After the trip we got a fantastic, comprehensive lunch (we even got a little cooking class). Great experience!

Inspiring tour through a crazy Bangkok. The words of Matthew (our gide) still lingers in our hearts and made this interesting tour a magical one! Explaining the way Bangkok people live in the slums, get together in the school, work in the salt or textile factory, relaxing in the park, telling us about the rituals of Boeddism really gave us the feeling we learned about their lifes and turned this bicycle tour into an inspiring lesson in life.... Thank you, Matthew!!

Best way to see the "real" Bangkok. The tour was very interesting and we enjoyed seeing another side of Thailand, apart from the usual tourist attractions. Biking through slums, jungle and parks, crossing the river by long tale boat and visiting schools as well as factories was an impressive experience. Mas was a really nice tour guide, and she told us a lot about culture, history and actual life in Bangkok. We would definitely recommend the Colors of Bankok tour to anyone visiting the city!Best regards,Alexandra

Great!. Great way to see de non-tourist side of Bangkok.( Colors of Bangkok) Great for kids (14, 11), the narrow pathways in de "jungle of Bangkok. The slums are a good way to see the other side of Bangkok. During the trip we always felt safe, our guide spoke good English. It was our 2nd day in Thailand and we ate our first Thai food, Pad Thai kung...... lovely. We had a great time..
More than we expected!. Simply a brilliant tour with our very nice tourguide Farm!Felt safe all the time and even our kids (12) liked it very much and enjoyed the narrow pathways!

Great way to see the countryside of Chiang Mai. This company offers tours other then in Bangkok and we chose them to do a day tour of the Chiang Mai countryside. We were picked up at our hotel and taken to the location to pick up our bikes with helmet and water supplied. Of we started and it wasn't before long we were riding through rice paddies, stopping along the way to visit small home business such as rice crackers, a bakery and pottery. Our guide spoke very good English and gave really good information. IF he found out that you liked a certain fruit or interested in sometime he would take you to show you if not to far out of the way. It was a long day and we covered over 50kms but there was lots of breaks and we were always able to get water and drinks when needed. A different side to Thailand that I didn't experience anywhere else in the country.

Great adventure!. I would recommend this trip for those who want to see non-tourist side of Bangkok. Guide was excellent and professional.It is better to book this trip on a weekday so all places you visit will be opened as on weekends it is closed.It is a very nice attractions for families, we had a great time!

Great way to escape from hectic Bangkok. We are a family with two kids (age 4 and 6) and booked a private Colours of Bangkok tour.The youngest was in a safe seat on the back of one of our bikes, the eldest cycled herself. It was not strenuous for her, because there are plenty of breaks and because of the route you cycle at a leisurely pace. We were a bit apprehensive about this beforehand, but she didn't complain even once. Kids were full of stories that night of everything they had seen:Very short bit at the start through heavy traffic, where guide guides you through.First stop at a quiet buddhist temple with some explanations about thai buddhism.Then through the slums with great atmosphere. If your kids are cute&blonde like ours, be prepared for everyone waving, giving handshakes and high fives...Then a short boattrip to the other side of the river, where you follow cycle paths through the "jungle", banana plantations. A nice stop at a big park where you get to feed the fish, back to the river for a boattrip again, a very short but fun lesson in thai boxing and then its only a couple of minutes to get back to starting point. Also some breaks in between with (soft)drinks and a meal. We were offered this thai meal at the start at the nice lounge area of the companyoffice, where the kids helped making a thai salad. Tasted good.

Great trip!. Great way to explore the parts of Bangkok that you probably wouldn't have seen without this tour. The guide was very friendly and he could tell us many interesting things. The nature was absolutely wonderful. We travelled as a family (2 children 14, 16) and we recommend it!

not below, and not above expectation. Taking a bike to see some other parts of Bangkok is certainly recommended, even though you could argue that the price for such a trip is quite high for thai standards. Biking route and guide were quite ok. Of course you'll have to experience some of the actual Bangkok traffic before going into the more quiet areas, but that's no major problem.Our main comment on this trip was that it seemed there were too many groups riding at the same time. We had to wait considerable time when crossing the river by longtail boat. Also, we expected to visit a thai boxing / training place, but we never visited one, this was a bit of a disappointment. Probably due to time constraints.

Colours of Bangkok bike tour. Very nice bike tour! We have done this for the second time and again it was great! We visited places where you normaly never would come. The guide was very nice and the hole trip was very good organized.

colours of bangkok bike tour. excellent bike tour, trip through the poorer parts of Bangkok. Tour guide was knowledgeable and showed excellent ability to lead and showed compassion. His english not that good but understandable.The tour itself was excellent it even included a stop off at a house for some local noodles. I really experianced the true side of bangkok on this trip.

Not with this company. Too expensive, not worth the money. In the webpage it is said they offer you a meal in a local restaurant, but it is at the end of the excursion (which is nonesense) and you have to pay for your drinks (much more expensive than anywhere in Bangkok).The local guide is a very nice guy, but the european management not at all. So: good for doing something outdoors, nice views and good nice spots. But at the end, this company has not a very thai accent so feel a bit disppointed.

You have to do this!. It was an unbelievable experience. Cycling around Bangkok was a trip that we will never forget.We visited places where you normaly never would come. The guide was very nice and the hole trip was very good organized.

A must do visiting Bangkok. A very good organized tour with interesting stops and beautiful sights along the way. Bangkok Recreational Biking is a trustful tour operator with well maintained bicycles and friendly and informative tour leaders.
The real site of bangkok!!. Very nice tour, you see bangkok on a different way.When you go to bangkok you have to do the bicycle tour.

Breath taking Biking in Bangkok. There are many ways to get close to Bangkok. This biking tour must defintely be one of the most attractive ones. We are a family of 4 (kids 17 and 14). We are used to biking in Denmark. This tour was a great experience. Our guide was simply amazing - knew all there is to know about Bangkok and was very passionate about telling the stories and facts of the way of living among the various Thai-people. During the tour we got close to both middle/upper-class areas as well as areas where the inhabitants had less means to finance the daily life. We literly met hundreds of smiling faces on the way and handed out a lot of high fives to Thail-children on the tour (keep your balance on the bike here!). The good connections of the tour company - or the guide - allowed us (a Group of 9 people from Belgium, Holland, and Denmark) to see two types of factories from the inside (clothing and salt production) and to pass through very dense pouplated areas close up to daily day life among the Thai-people. The tour can definitely be recommended. The guide was very observant of everybody feeling good during the whole trip - and we had several solid breaks with refreshments. During the tour we also got the experience of going by boat with the bikes twice. In order to get the full enjoyment of the trip you need to feel comfortable on a bike - and be alert in the traffic. If we went to Bangkok again, we would defintely return to this company for another tour in - or around the city.

Bike tour with children in Bangkok. This morning we had a great Bike tour with Bangkok Recrational Biking.We took along our two daughters (7and10 years old) and were advised to take a private tour in order to adapt to the needs of the children during the tour. I thought this was a good advise because you drive on some narrow pathways through the bush in which you might have to coach the younger ones somewhat.The bikeride starts for the first 10 minutes through some busy but generally slow driving traffic,After that the tour continiued in the low traffic areas of Bangkok. Without giving away all the amazing and impressive things you will see during the tour I can say it was very well worthwhile.We certainly consider to come a second time and take one of the other tours that are set out by this company.ps the lunch served after the morning tour was wonderfull

Awesome biketour through the real Bangkok. This was definitely one of our highlights in Bangkok! You 'll visit a lot of places from temples to the slumdogs. However, we didn't understand the guide at any time, but he did knew a lot to tell. A great experience, which I surtainly would recommend!!

Amazingly authentic view of Bangkok; eye-opening. This bike tour was my favorite memory from Bangkok. There are many beautiful parts of BKK, but I felt like I got a much better feel for the true side of Bangkok after taking this tour. The route takes you through a really cool park, you see an awesome kickboxing training, there's a great lunch at a local place, you get to go on the water in the longboats, but the part of the tour that has stayed with me the most is biking through the slums. It gave me a much better appreciation for what the citizens of Bangkok live like. I really like that Recreational Bangkok Biking takes the CSR (Corporate Social Responsibility; click the CSR link on their website to read about how they've donated millions of baht to a local school). Another aspect of the trip that I enjoyed was that a good portion of the route we biked felt was either on this elevated sidewalk (over the river/marsh) or through the dense housing. It felt like a James Bond movie. The people in the community were very nice and friendly. I kinda wished we could have stayed and heard more about their lives.Lastly, RBB was very well-managed, answering all my questions prior to booking the trip. I highly recommend this tour. Fantastic experience and memories.
I definitely recommend it!. You will see a side of bangkok that you didn't know existed. The guide knew a lot and had a lot to tell. I would definitely recommend it.

A super biking tour around bangkok. This was a super experience!!! Even it was quite hot, hou visit places where you as a tourist never come! So this was an unforgetable experience fort both US andere tour son 10 years old land daughter 12 years old!

Exploring the City from a different perspective. An amazing way to explore the City. Guide and staff are very nice, and the organisation is perfect. The bicycle are in very well maintained condition.The route through Bangkok is interestingly prepared and about 80% of the route guides you through green and not packed areas...very convenient and nice conditions, even for non-professional cyclers ;)Highly recommended activity and a slight different but very interesting way getting in touch with the people and another view from the town.In between beverages are always available and a lunch is also organised and included...perfect!

A different and exiting way to explore the city. We saw parts of Bangkok we never knew existed. With narrow paths through the park, and through the local areas and temples we saw a great combination of nature and culture. And with the help of great english speaking guide that lead us safe through the busy traffic, over the river by boat, through the park and local housing area with a great sense of humor.We really enjoyed the trip that were the highlight of our Bangkok trip

Excellent tour - also with kids. My husband and I went biking in Bangkok with our 2 girls (6 and 7 years old) and we had an amazing time and an experience we will never forget. Everything was dealt with in a professional way by the guides - and we will recommend this to everyone. Thank you Bangkok Biking

Bangkok Biking March 2013. Bangkok biking is definitely fun and great way to see Bangkok from a different and unique side.I did the tour 5 years ago and this year again. Actually I live in Bangkok. Anyway do the tour with the guides from BB is absolutely worth every Baht. Try it.Tom

Bangkok daytour by Bike. We had a very lovely and interesting day on bike in the Bangkok area. The bikes were good, the daytrip was about 45 kilometers and took from 8 AM to 9 PM. A very nice and good informed guide who knew the history and his Language (English in this case). Drinks were taken care off. And the lunch was real excellent (more than enough, but most important, very tastful). So nice biking, relaxing, some walking, 3 boat trips (from which one the canals) and beautiful nature. And of course a lot of Bangkok city surroundings and sight-seeing. If you are staying a couple of days in Bangkok and if you want to try something exciting not everybody else does, this is the trip.

Great experience to discover Bangkok in another way!. We have been the 2nd time in Bangkok and wanted to see something different than the usual tourist sights. So we booked a half-day tour with Bangkok Recreational Biking.It was such a good experience! You get to see so many things you normally would never see such as small streets and the life of people living there as well the "djungle" of Bangkok - a big park on the other side of the river.Our guide Polly made this tour even more special. Thanks again for it!

Expect the Unexpected!. Our bike tour with the excellent tour guide ***** was the highlight of our BKK visit!Good bikes, very well organized, very experienced guide ...!!Many interesting sights and sounds you'll never find on your own ...Whenever we will visit BKK again --> this is definitive MUST!

What a way to see a part of Bangkok. We took our kids --- 12 and almost 16 --- and we had a very good and interesting time. Especially great were our guides who took super good care of us. An unexpected surprise was one guide's very moving talk on life and happiness in a small old temple from the era of Rama II in the "green lung." The lunch at a roadside spot was tasty.

Interesting afternoon. I would never have realised there was such a quiet island right in the heart of Bangkok if I hadn't done this half day tour. It also took us into a section of one of the slums. The guide assured us we were welcome as the company supported a daycare there for working parents and, admittedly, the people we passed smiled and waved, but I did still feel a bit like I was intruding and chose not to take photos there. I felt that it was enough that I'd seen how so many people lived, something you don't see in the tourist areas of Bangkok.There was no one working out at the Muay Thai training area when we were there (quite late in the day). The bike riding was easy enough and almost all flat. On the island we rode on raised walkways and quiet roads, and the area through the slums was also pretty light on traffic. However, the start and finish point of the tour is just off a really busy road so there's a lot of fast-moving traffic to negotiate through. The guide was great but I wouldn't recommend it for little kids even though the traffic is generally pretty aware of bicycles. It's something different and well worth doing, especially if you've been to Bangkok before as it shows you a very different side of the city.

A Different Alternative to Sight Seeing for Active Travellers. I've been to Bangkok before but our bike tour presented Bangkok completely differently. We did the half day tour that goes through the city, across the river, the forest, the temple and the boxing ring (I think our guide said it is about 40km). This bike ride was the highlight during our time in Bangkok. I think we enjoyed the tour so much because of three things: a) the bikes are in good condition and very comfortable, b) our Thai guide spoke perfect English c) the ride is a bit rough. My friend and I are quite fit/athletic and the tour was great exercise. I don't think you need to be in top physical condition but probably make sure you are comfortable on a bike - you go through some parts that are quite narrow and bumpy. The only thing that let the trip down a little was that the 'lunch' that was provided was served at about 10am so we didn't really eat much and then were starving later. But this was a minor. The tour was lots of fun, we enjoyed doing something athletic for the day and seeing beautiful parts of Bangkok that the cars/scooters couldn't go. Wear a hat and lots of sunscreen!

A great experience for all of the family. We organised a tour for our large group of 12 which consisted of 5 children on bikes. Tom, our guide was terrific. He allowed time for us to spent at places of interest - Muy Thai, kindergarten and even bought us a pink egg to try when we asked about it. He also at our request stopped at a street vendor to buy coconuts. We found the route manageable and well organised. The tour was easily handled by the kids (aged 10 - 13). In all a great and memorable day out in Bangkok.

Different side of Bangkok. I have been in Bangkok a few times, but this was the first time that I went on a bike. You get to see very different areas than you normally see. You get close to where people live, without the feeling that you are disturbing them. You don't need a very good physical condition, but the pathway was very narrow with water on both sides at some points. Fun, but not if you are not used riding on a bike.

Best way to discover Bangkok. There is no better option to learn more about Bangkok within a couple of hours. You go to places you definitely wouldn't see a "regular" tourist. Our guide was brilliant and spoke perfekt English. Best thing you can do in Bangkok!

Third Tour. This was already my third tour with recreational Bangkok and as usual it was a highlight of the Bangkok visit of my friends. Everybody loved the tour as this is a unique way of seeing parts of the city that you would never visit on your own. The bycicles are top and very well maintained. Top tour guide as well. I look forward to my next tour!

Excellent way to see Bangkok. This is a really good tour to get out of the hustle and bustle of Bangkok and see aspects of the city that you might not otherwise see during your standard tourist romps. Our guide was very friendly and knowledgeable. The cycling itself is not especially strenuous but some parts of the ride will have you riding on raised concrete paths over wetlands so if you are not a confident cyclist it may not be ideal for you.
Great tour.. Great tour, highly recommended. You needn't be a good sportsman to do it because it's quite relaxed. Almost all the route was on a cars free roads and we visited some interesting places.

Exciting tour to an area standard tourists will never see. My husband and I really enjoyed the tour. Our guide was very nice and helpful. Certainly, one has to take care of where you go with you bike. But if you are just a bit cautious, it is totally ok. The tour covers areas one will never experience if you are just a standard tourist, but it is an important aspect on Bangkok's life. I would really recommend it as you are supporting schools within the slums as well.

I am happy to have survived. I think the name should be changed to Extreme Bangkok Biking. On the main webpage it states, "As the tour was developed by Recreational Bangkok Biking Ltd., recreation combined with the highest levels of safety standards, remain our top priorities." I do not think whoever wrote this took the tour. If they did they would find numerous dangers. Many people have given this tour a high rating, which is why my friend and I booked it. Our tour was on February 12, 2013.The first issue seems to be that Soi 71 is a hard to find place. We left in plenty of time (7am for an 8am tour) from Rambuttri Road, but our taxi driver could not find it (even with the map printout from the website) and had to ask three times for directions. We were an hour late and amazingly they were still waiting for us. There were two girls from Switzerland also on the tour. They said taxi drivers refused to take them there because it was too hard to find. They ended up having to take public transport to as close as possible and then they were able to get a tuk-tuk to take them the rest of the way. I spent most of my time on this tour concentrating on not wiping out. The alleyways in the slums are just too narrow for safe biking and there are a number of holes in the concrete. You are better off walking your bike through these areas. My friend crashed a couple of times and ended up with a nice sized cut on his right elbow and a big bruise on his left forearm. Biking the raised platforms above the water is not safe either since most of them do not have guardrails. I thought I was going to get through the tour unscathed, but on a sharp L shaped turn on the platforms I had to jump off my bike as it headed for the water. I had to slow down too much and when I turned I did not have enough speed and gravity took over. I grabbed a signpost to prevent a bath and my left leg went into the water above my sock. The bike was wedged on the signpost and did not go into the water. However, my left foot was soaked and covered in mud. I was able to finish the tour, but had to pitch my sneakers for a new pair when I got back to the hotel. It also says on the webpage that 95% of the tour is not around traffic. However, it sure felt that we spent a fair amount of time on the busy Bangkok roads. This tour would be great for The Amazing Race. Now I did enjoy the boat rides and you do see an area of Bangkok most tourists would not see. I liked feeding the fish at the park. The lunch at the end of the tour was also good. However, this is no casual European bike ride. I was totally exhausted at the end. It felt more like an extreme adventure and I was glad it was over. I should mention that I own a mountain bike. At least I had an interesting story to tell after all this. If you live life on the edge you will probably love this tour. If you are looking for a casual bike ride to see some sights this is not the tour for you.

Buyer beware. This bike ride does take you through parts of Bangkok that you will never see on your own and the guide was very knowledgeable. But it is important to understand that this ride is not a relaxing cruise on back roads and I would never take any young kids. We rode in traffic - on extremely narrow paths with jagged fencing and best of all the ride on cement pathways, about 3 feet across, with 4 ft. drop-offs on either side and no railings at all. We ran into a traffic jam on this pathway with a motor bike- one member of our group ended up falling off the path and after flying home discovered he had cracked a few ribs. All of us who went on this ride are experienced road cyclists - I would just strongly recommend you understand whether this ride is right for you.
Unforgetable experience!!. We did the tour, and loved it! Its very relaxed, and you come at unforgetable places! Its a must do in BangKok!!!

Don't Miss this Experience. We did the bike tour in Bangkok and Chiang Mai, and each tour was truly a trip highlight. We did full day tours in each location and they were completely unique adventures. I feel like we were able to take in more sites on the bike tour than would be possible in a month of independent travel. I can't say enough good things about the setup of the tour - you can tell a significant amount of research and planning was involved to pull the route, stops, and attraction choices together. We actually we back to many of the locations after the tour just to take in more of the fun.All the positive reviews are 100% accurate - good food, great people, lots of fun. The tour is a "must do" if you are visiting Bangkok or Chiang Mai. Our tour guides were both wonderful - very informative, attentive, well-spoken, and generally fun people. In addition, we got a sunburn on the first tour (the guide offered us sun screen several time but we declined) and the company was very accommodating to reschedule our second tour so we had some time to recover. I will take the tours on my next trip to Thailand - they are that good!

excellent biking in Bangkok. In jan this year we spent a day with Paulie of Bangkok Biking. There were 6 in our group all different nationalities. From the moment we started it was fun all the way. Paulie had tremendous knowledge on the area and there was plenty to see. The real Bangkok! It was the best day of our trip. We were treated to a fabulous lunch and finally a visit to a Muay Thai gym where my husband had a free lesson. I highly recommend this trip to anyone. Very Professsional and reasonable price. i am not a cyclist and my husband is an avid one and it suited us both. We will definately do this again.

Sweet with delicious food, drinks from a good guide. I found the bike tour through Bangkok very nice. It was really fun to participate in this bike tour. Our guide was excellent, we felt good. We drove through the slums, to put at the orphanage, where a portion of the harvest must of this trip is going. We looked sweet with delicious food, drinks from a good guide. Every thing was good but I think there should probably adjust the below down a little price would be better.

Should have 2 guides. We did the Colors of Bangkok morning tour. The owner was accommodating in switching dates for us. The company is very well organized and we saw during the tour that they gave a substantial donation to a local school. We especially enjoyed the part of the tour after crossing the river which was much more serene than riding in the city. We would encourage the owner to have 2 guides ride with the group: one in front and one in back. We were separated from the guide at one point when some of us got cut off by a dog in an alleyway and the guide had turned the corner. At another point, someone fell and we had to shout out to the guide to stop. The guide was in general not overly attentive to the group while riding.

Best activity at Bangkok (Colors of Bangkok weekend tour). If you want to have an honest and good view on the daily Bangkok life, than this bike tour is a excellent start. Great mix of locations and activities.Jack, our tour guide really made the difference. He was super enthusiastic and you could ask him anything about the life in Bangkok and Thailand.He speaks very good English which makes it more relax on longer conversations.Definitely try the thai-boxing initiation at the end of the tour.

Colors of Bangkok. I joined "Colors of Bangkok", which was the very of the title. During the tour, I visited such places that the foreigners or even the local people usually visit, slam areas, thai boxing gym, Phra Pradaeng District acros the Chao Phraya river, and so on. The traffic in the city is so chaotic that you might feel riding a bicycle is stressful and fearful at first. Tour guide is familiar with the traffic so just follow them!Besides, the guides explain us about each of the spot well and we can get familiar with them.If you're boring with ordinary tours, it's worth tyring!

If you want to see the real Bangkok. A great way to see the real Bangkok. The poor neighbourhoods, the jungle, a smaller temple, local food, a Maui Thai training area, a local kindergarten, etc...A 3 to 4 hours ride with lunch and 2 nice boat rides. Really worth it!!!

very nice. had a great day with recreational bangkok biking and its tour "colours of bangkok". different (and relaxed) experience of this busy city !! absolutely worth it; nice staff and guide who gave me lots of tips for my further itinerary !!

Do the Bangkok Biking Tour!. Have done both Colors of Bangkok and Paradise a few times.And will do it again next year.Always fantastic. Good tourguides, easy going, fun, a lot of inside information, genuine Thai lunch included. Anyone who can sit on a bike can do the tour.Just do it, you won't regret if for a minute!Johan

Colours of Bangkok - worth doing. This is a bike ride suitable for non-cyclists and was taken at a very leisurely pace. Good way to see some of the better parts of the city eg parklands, temples.. Good value. Great guide (Sugar Cane). Bikes were in good condition.I didn't particulary enjoy the ide through the slum area but maybe some people would want to see that. Also, the meal we had was a quite average. There was some unavoidable riding on the busy main roads but don't be put off by this.

Colors of Bangkok. We booked our tour "colors of Bangkok" an we did not regret it! We have seen an unforgettable view apart the usual footpath of the normal Bangkok traveler (like a view "behind the scene"). This biketour was easy for us and can be done by any who can ride a bike with basic skills. What impresses us most was how happy the people in the slums are; We think it's the result of the donation Recreational Bangkok Biking is spending with every booking.We can recommend this tour to everyone who ist interestet in the real Bangkok. Thanks also to our friendly and interesting tourgide.
Highly recommend the colours of Bangkok, weekend edition. We had a fantastic time exploring the back streets and green wedges of Bangkok. The guide was knowledgable and thoughtful. We will be back!

The Other Bangkok - Great Human Experience. Took the half tour with my wife and were very pleased with our excellent tour guide Ms. Anne. Perfect English as well as very nice. Always carefull and ready to help you. Cheerfull always.

fantastic. Hi the bike tour was fantastic and cobvered most of BBk that you would not normally see i would trecommend it to anyone and you dont have to be a fit to last the pace as it was a fast as you wanted.scott

Bangkok at first hand. Me and my family live in Bangkok for more than a year and I have already discovered many interesting, beautiful places in this overwhelming city. Now I have done my first biking tour with Recreational Bangkok Biking and started with the half day tour "Colours of Bangkok" and have to say that it was great. We had the best, most friendly and perfect english speaking guide you can imagine. She guided us through a "jungle" into the smallest neighbourhoods / communities, crossing big roads, the Chao Phraya and safely back to our starting point. It is a great chance to get to know another part of Bangkok... the less touristic ones. I just booked a second tour with my husband ;-)

Different, interesting and very well organised. One of the best ways to spend a day in Bangkok, in particular if you know already the "classic" attractions. Communication and organisation were amazingly good and explanations by the guide excellent and insightful. I strongly recommend it.

Two Dutchies Biking in Bangkok!. If you want to come back with a different story of Bangkok from all your friends that have been there, then this tour is for you. It's a very different experience from your usual guided tour. Going around seeing the real people of Bangkok in the way they live their everyday existence and far away from hotels and tourists. You get to really soak in the atmosphere of rural Bangkok. We we're led by an experienced guide and passed several city hotspots, biked through the slums and got in contact with the local people living in real poverty. Then we crossed the Chao Praya river by boat and left the hectic city life in order to explore the beautiful gardens of Bangkok. A good lunch was included in his 4 hours trip and there were plenty Kodak moments.For those who might be put off by the physical part, don't worry, It's an easy cycling trip and you can stop whenever you're tired. The guide was very attentive and he was quick to respond when I had a flat tire. All in all an unforgettable experience which I would recommend to anyone who's able to ride a bike!

Fantastic way to explore Bangkok in a different way. The bycicle trip was great, the guide very good as well. She could speak perfect English and really took her time to explain everything. Well organized and very safe. I will definitely book another tour with them.

A different side of Bangkok. We had a great time. Our guide was very knowlegable, and friendly. The first part of the ride is a bit nerve racking as you do have to watch out for Bangkok traffic, but once we got underway it was great. We have been to Bangkok several times so we were looking for something different and this was a good option for see.

See a different side of Bangkok!. This was my second ride with Recreational Bangkok Biking and it was just as enjoyable as the first time. I look my sister from Melbourne who was staying a few days in Bangkok and she loved it. This is a great way to see a different side of Bangkok. As soon as you cross the Chao Phrya river you enter a green, peaceful, traffic free environment with clean air. It's hard to believe it's part of the same city! As before, we had a delightful and knowledgable guide who got us round the circuit safely with a number of stops en route; local school, fish feeding, temple visit and an excellent lunch at a local restaurant.

Fantasic guide and professional service. I joined alone and 5 other people was in the group, 4 of them were skillful riders and I was a bit worried of dragging on with the group. My guide Ann was really looking after everyone so well, telling me what to do if I am not condifent and gave very clear instruction on every route going to ride. I successfully did it and I would recommened to every travellers if you want to see an all rounded Bangkok with fun.PS. I was lucky to have the trip on Sun which has a lot less traffic then weekdays

Brilliant Tour - so much fun. I did the Colours of Bangkok tour - BRILLIANT. I love riding off the beaten track and this far exceeded my expectations. From riding on the elevated pathways, winding our way through people's homes, being amongst nature and high fiving all the kids along the way, it was a terrific day. Our guide was awesome and knowledgable and even volunteered to demo for the Muay thai boxing. The length of time we were on the bikes was great. I wish I'd had more time to do more of their tours. But now I have an excuse to go back to Bangkok :)

Lovely day exploring bangkok and its surroundings.. We had a wonderful half day cycling through Bangkok . Out Guide " Sugarcane" did a good job, and the tree boys ( 11, 9 and 5 years old) had their own bicycle, and they loved it. We had a special tour for the 5 of us and saw very different sites of Bangkok. Including a training for the boys from a world-champion 2009 in Thai Kickboxing . Next time we will do the Chinatown tour !

Not to be missed!. We did the colors of Bangkok weekend edition, including visit to floating market. The trip is great, and warmly recommended. You get to see parts of Bangkok that you don't usually get to see. Most of the trip is free of traffic, in very varied surroundings, including slums, farm/swamps, parks etc. Even in areas with traffic I was surprised by how respectful drivers were of cyclists. We've been to Bangkok a few times already, and a bike ride is likely to become a recurring event for future visits. Many thanks also to our guide Am!

Lovely afternoon in Bangkok. We had a very nice bike tour afternoon. Our youngest is 7 years old, for him it was a bit tough so we decided to skip the last part of the tour and stay a little longer feeding the fish. I can recommend this to everyone who wants to enjoy Bangkok and visit (poor) parts that you normally would not enter.

Great way to explore Bangkok!. We had a great time cycling through Bangkok in the weekend. Our guide Tom Tom was fabulous! He speaks English very well and is fun to be around. Sadly we needed to stop halfway because my Thai niece couldn't handle it any more. (Health problems) Our guide took good care of that problem so we took a very short route back to the starting point.Bangkok is very diverse and colourful. Exciting and full with energy. It has many hidden places like Phra Pradaeng. An Island that I never knew about in the many times that I have visited Thailand. Not to mention the local market we visited in this tour. It's very nice with lots of delicious treats that I love.I and my boyfriend would love to do this trip again and finish it!We hope to see Tom Tom again (hopefully to be our guide again!)

very good. Real good saturday weekend tour. See bangkok in completely different and active way, without getting to tired. Visit a genuine saturday market and the poor thai at their home.Well organised, safe, good service, social responsible

The best I have ever done on my many trips to BKK. A biking tour through BKK.....My friends were looking at me like I'd be out from another planet, when I told them I would go on a Colors of BKK biking tour. Well let's just say when I came back from this amazing tour through the BKK you wouldn't imaging in your best dreams, and I was telling them about, they all were stunningly surprised. I mean from the beginning to the end all was perfectly organized in a way you not feeling like a tourist rather then a person who belongs to the colors of bangkok. Just very briefly; A MUST DO WHILE IN BKK. A special gratitude to our perfectly english speaking bike tour master guide Matthew. Never experience anything like this in my last 35 years of travelling. Thank you very much from all my heart. Clemens Woody Zehender

Good change of scenery. After many days of the hustle and bustle of central Bangkok, I decided to try something a little different and booked onto the Colors of Bangkok tour. Booking was relatively straightforward, with prompt replies from Andre and the staff and finding the depot was a little difficult but the taxi driver eventually found it. The tour was everything I had been looking for in Bangkok. it took you away from the typical Bangkok that most tourists see into the depths of the villages and outter suburbs that are bustling with life and interest. Guide for the trip was very good. Bikes were in good condition. Suitable for all fitness levels. Definitely recommend if you want to see the other side of Bangkok.

A biking tour should be a 'must do' for all visiting Bangkok!. We had a really great biking trip with André Breuer's staff!! This way you see a different side of Bangkok, a side you wouldn't see on your own. The cycling is easy going and flat, so enjoyable for all ages. Regular stops are made for drinks and cooling down, so no worries about that. The pleasant guides (two; one in front and one at the back) speak English well. My children (13 and 15) rate the biking trip as one of the best trips of our holiday! One tip: wear a cap/sunhat, even if it's cloudy!!

Hiking, the colours of Bangkok. We have recently returned from holiday in Thailand where one of the excursions we did was 'Hiking the Colours of Bangkok', operated by Recreational Bangkok Biking. This was our third holiday to Thailand and we like to do excursions that take you off the beaten track to see the real way of life of the local people. This trip was excellent and our guide, Ann was really good and knowledgeable. It was hard to beleive that the area visited was so close to the city as it was so peaceful and beautiful. We ate some good local food at the market and had quite a long rickshaw ride from the market to the local water taxi, stopping at a temple on route (although I did feel a bit sorry for the men driving the rickshaws). We stayed at a hotel on the river front and a taxi from the hotel to Recreational Bangkok's office only took 15 minutes and cost just 80 Baht.To sum up we had an excellent day out visiting parts of Bangkok that we would have missed if we did'nt do this trip. So if you want something a little bit different while visiting Bangkok I would definitely recommend Recreational Bangkok Biking.

Colours of Bangkok bike tour. This was a huge highlight of our trip to Thailand. We had a great tour guide and the tour showed us a side of Bangkok we would never of be able to see on our own. Highly recommended!

A marvelous tour through the inner circle of Bangkok. A marvellous experience in the inner circle of Bangkok.Staying with my wife and another couple in Thailand we started in Bangkok.I knew about the possibility of a biking tour in Bangkok.So I started in our hotel a search at the internet "Biking tours Bangkok" that shows me there are several organisations. And I find out that Bangkok recreational Biking was founded by André Breuer a Dutchmen. As you all know the Dutch eat, drink and sleep , bikes.I made a reservation the night before we would like to go. No problem. We had to be there at eight in the morning. We had to go from our hotel (Navelai) to the north east part of Bangkok. I think it is about 15 km. Take your time, 60 min it took, to bring us there by taxi (50 bath). Finally we were late .But no problem we were just with the four of us. At the office we met our guide "Ann" a Thai Girl who spoke fluently English. We got 4 excellent bikes with suspension in the front and well performing brakes.The tour took us by traffic lanes, slums, crossing the river , a park, a kind of jungle, and most interesting of all we went through a parking garage. After about 5 hours and including lunch we remembered an astonishing tour we never expected to have in Bangkok.Ann thanks for your your detailed explanation, your patience and your humour well done!You can find in august 2012 a registration on youtube "Monusdemanvandemaan" .André good luck and succes with this very original idea.Wim, Melinda, Jolanda en Elan

another side of Bangkok. After several minutes of bike maneuvering city traffic at the beginning and end of the trip, (I felt totally safe, but it was city traffic-yipes.) We explored the back alleys, huts, condos, and parks of a quieter side of ordinary life in Bangkok. This is a step out of the touristy side, into what is the everyday Bangkok. I loved it all. We ate great paht thai in a realistically common home. The local tour guide was professional, friendly and informative, and totally fluent in English rather than the other Thai tours I had been on in barely passable English. (my fifty year old body was a bit sore after a few hours of pedaling.) We had a small tour group of three, which to me, was preferable to many more: me- a middle aged American woman and a young Dutch couple. A fun way to spend an afternoon or morning seeing a more commoner's side of the city. I enjoyed going out into the river on the short river taxi. When I first went into the office about half an hour before the tour, the place was dark and deserted, but a thai boy turned on the lights and let me in. I thought: where the heck am I and what have I gotten into? But the tour was highly recommended to me by a prominent Thai citizen and friend. So I relaxed,slept in a chair until the place came to life. The taxi drivers can never find this place, so be forewarned that you have to call and get directions. It can be found with a bit of time and directions. worth the effort. This is off the beaten path, but very convenient location, not far from major hotels.

Great experience!. The cycling tour showed us parts of Bangkok we would've never seen otherwise. We passed through small streets, saw & high-fived local people :) and cycled through beautiful nature. Our guide, Matthew, was very friendly and attentive. All in all a great experience we will never forget. We would recommend everyone to take this tour: it will definitely be a great addition to your stay in Bangkok!

Bangkok biking June 2012. we arrived in Bangkok the 1st of June and did the Bangkok Biking trip the second day. i normally do not enjoy big cities and i wasn't a fan of Bangkok but thanks to the biking trip i did see the beauty of Bangkok.it was the best experience i had in Bangkok.especially the green area over the river was amazing to cycle through.our guide Jack was very nice and did a great job showing us around.i would recommend this to everyone! even if you are not the greatest cyclist. the pace is relaxed and easy to follow.
Great Experience. It was an awesome trip! The guide was so nice and the tour was very interesting. We visited areas we wouldn´t have visited on our own. Really recommandable! Love it!

The highlight of our stay in Bangkok. My husband and I visited Bangkok for the first time as part of our honeymoon trip in March 2012. I booked the Colours of Bangkok bike tour about two weeks before our trip. The booking process was easy and I received various emails from Andre confirming details and answering any questions I had. We booked the morning tour and arrived nice & early - to our suprise, my husband and I were the only ones on our tour so we had our tour guide 'Geak' to ourselves. It was so wonderful to see different sides of Bangkok and go places that we just wouldn't have gone on our own. Going through the poor area was so interesting and everyone was incredibly friendly. We took a boat trip across the river to the jungle area and also visited around the King's park. We stopped at a school and met the children and had lunch in a house restaurant. We also visited a local temple. The guide provided us with water and the lunch was simple but lovely. My main worry before the trip was that we would find it too hot to cycle around Bangkok - quite the opposite in fact, being on the bike kept us nice & cool as we constantly felt a breeze, it was only when we stopped that we noticed the heat! The only thing I would say is that it says that anyone can take the tour, no matter their experience on a bike. I definitely think you need to have an element of competency and confidence on a bike though as a few parts are on busy roads and others through tight alleyways etc. I would absolutely recommend this tour to anyone visiting Bangkok, the experience was the highlight of our trip and incredible value for money. If you're thinking about booking it, do it, you won't be disappointed.

You don't want to miss Recreational Bangkok Biking!. This is truely a unique experience that you don't want to miss! During this bike tour, you will see a wide variety of life and how people live and see much of the variety that Bangkok offers. The tour takes you through the slums of Bangkok and shows you how they are making a difference by supporting a local school there. Next, you are taken on a short boat trip to a part of the city that feels like a Thai jungle; it was magical. We also past through a Thai park, a neighborhood wat, and enjoyed some Thai food at a local restaurant. The guide was very infomative and funny. It was one of the pretiest and most enjoyable bike rides I have ever been on!

A great biking experience. I highly recommend this tour to people who wants to see Bangkok from a totally different side.Starting in the middle of the city, the tour brings you to the surroundings, visiting some local villages and continues with the jungle trails and two short boat rides on the river. The guide is very good and the lunch in a local family restaurant excellent. Don't miss this great experience!!
great discovery of hidden places. the Colors of Bangkok tour is a great tour because of the many different locations that you get to see, very surprising.one of the best things you can do in Bangkok.

You think, you know BKK? Try this one .... When we decided to go on the Bike Trip we considered it to be a bit unusual, as anyone else. Above, I was pregnant and not up for big (sportive) adventures. Finally the afternoon with the bikes and our guide (there were just the two of us this this) turned out to be a wonderful way of discovering a different side of buzzeling BKK. In fact, it was almost relaxing! Try it, you'll see :-)

fantastic bike tour. The bike trip was fantastic. The bikes were very comfortable and of excellent quality. The tour guide was fluent in English and had a great sense of humor. We got a view of the city which we would normally not get. Lucky (??) for us we biked through Bangkok on the first day of Songkran....very refreshing, indeed!

The sound of silence versus dazzling Bangkok City. I really liked this tour becaurse it was not only biking the whole day. Before you get bored there's another change of scenery or activity.The professional guides smoothly led us through the day, providing us with their local knowledge, safety and a lovely lunch.Being solo in the group wasn't a problem at all.I really can recomment this tour.

How really to indulge Bangkok. I was in Bangkok on business and had a day to see Bangkok. On recommendation I decided for a biking tour by Recreational Bangkok Biking. It was great, good bikes, a very nice guide and an amazing tour. Through rich and poor residential areas, often nextdoor neighbours, crossing the river twice, 'feeling' the heat, the scents, the food everywhere. Getting lunch at a restaurant which I was unlikely to have spotted myself was the best decision I could have made for my one day tourist experience.

relaxed tour. We enjoyed the tour a lot. We booked the tour to have the opportunity to see more from the local people and culture. And indeed, the tour took us almost thru the front door of the little houses in the slums. The tour had unexpected variety as we also got transported to the Bangkok "lung" island. Very peacefull island with rafthouses and exciting trails thru the forest and the swamps, the transportation to and from the island with a long boat. We felt very relaxed but we can also imagine that the tour is a challenge for older people, who have difficulty to keep their balance. Our group had nice chemistry and that makes the trip even more enjoyable. The lunch was in a local family eating house near the street, simple but very enjoyable with our group of people, open for eachothers lifestyles. So yes, for us the tour is one of the highlights of visiting Bangkok.

Great way to spend a day. Nice ride through city and jungle. The tour of the floating market was fantastic. We had a great lunch at roadside eating house. This tour is not for the weak, some parts are on city streets with traffic, others are on elevated jungle trails but overall it was the best thing we did in Bangkok.

great ride. These guys are good. Good tour. Lots of information. It rained- they were ready with rain jackets. When we got back to the shop--he had already called a taxi. Handed me a towel to dry off and into my taxi. Can't say enough good things about this company.

It's a nice ride. Well, since this trip started in the slums, it made us very uncomfortable to know that we didn't even stop at these people to support their local economy, we had to keep going on not to slow down the group. The tour lead us through the laid back and colourful parts of Bangkok, which was lovely.After a short boatride we were brought to the 'lung'of the city, very calm and relaxing, the bike path was quite narrow, so eyes on the road in order not to fall, for non experienced bike riders there is a point, since if you have to watch te road and be careful, you miss some of the sights, since the tourleader is carrying on like there's no tomorrow.After the tour, which we liked, all over, we returned to the HQ and saw the owner, with whom we have been in contact via email more than once, unfortunately he didn't even come over to ask us what we thought of his tour, to us this was an arrogant attitude, it felt like that anyway.So, to resume, the tour was very nice at some points, the tourguide was very nice too, for the rest it didn't give a professional idea, being enthousiastic can be a trigger to a better review....

Bangkok Biking, and Chiang Mai too. I read a review about a Dutch guy running bike tours in non-touristy parts of Bangkok and thought it sounded like my sort of thing. It was!! I spent a lovely morning getting some exercise, seeing BKK in a way I've never seen it before, and felt totally comfortable with the wonderful guide. In fact I liked it so much that I did a similar half-day tour with the same company up in Chiang Mai. As you'd expect, this was rather different, but again it was a great tour, with a fabulous guide.Highly recommended!!

Great way to spend a day. What an excellent way to experience the city. I did this on my own one day while my husband was on business and totally loved it. It was so interesting to really get close to how some of the locals live and see parts of the city that you just wouldn't get to otherwise experience if you are on a bus, or guided tour or even by exploring on your own. The guide was brilliant, spoke excellent English and had a thorough knowledge of the places we went and gave us some interesting history as well. On top of all that - it was super affordable and I got in some exercise! What else could you ask for?! I loved it so much we did a similar tour by the same company while in Chiang Mai. Highly recommended

Colours of Bangkok...Very colourful indeed. Whenever possible on holiday my husband and I (both in our 60's) try to find a bike tour. It is a great opportunity to see the other side of a city. We joined the half day tour and had a great time. We worry about being the oldies but very accommodating. Met other travellers, shared their stories, picked up their tips etc. All whilst enjoying a great tour. The company very professional,booked online before leaving home had pre printed receipt and map. No problems finding office. Our guide was a full of info for us took us to some incredible places never seen before, great lunch too. Will definitely ride with them again. It is something to do when you are all templed out.Chris.

So much fun!. The half day tour was highly recommended to us and did not disappoint. Despite not having been on a bicycle for some time both my wife and I were just fine with navigating the course. I would suggest the morning ride as come midday it is very hot to be riding a bike! Although I guess it depends on what you're used to.

Colors of Bangkok. Cycling with Recreational Bangkok Biking (in Bangkok or Chiang Mai) is a good idea to get an impression of Bangkok/Chiang Mai by bicycle. You see really much more than usual and you will come much further. Reliable in reserve, good bikes and usually very good guides on safe roads. Good food. Highly recommended.Marianne Kok

Colours of Bangkok,- a magnificent half day bicycle tour in Bangkok!. Due to our very good experiences with RBB in Chiang Mai we did the half day tour Colours of Bangkok beginning of February `12. We’ve had unforgettable impressions especially during the first kilometres on Bangkok’s busy streets as well as on the narrow concrete path. The bikes were well-conditioned and Auddy our tour guide on this day made this tour interesting and very entertaining. The bicycles tour is beside Bangkok’s main tourist attractions ideally suited to gain an insight in the daily Live of many of Bangkok’s citizens.

A different Bankok. Colors of Bankok tour brings you on a bicycle in parts of town you would never see on your own. Cycling in and around Bankok is an interesting way to see the city, its richness and its poverty. We were surprised to see how people live outside of the glamour of the city centre, and nevertheless seemed to be happy. A trip in a longtail boat is included, as well as a good and authentic Thai lunch. We do think that the whole day tour can be tiring for older people (certainly in this heat and humidity) and you must have definitely some experience in cycling. It would have been nice to have a map and to see where we actually have been.

Great biking trip in Bangkok with a 4 year old!. We had done it before, a biking trip through GREEN (yes that is possible) Bangkok, but this time we brought our 4 year old son. As Dutchies we really like to bike and we booked a private tour. We did a 4 hour tour which was perfect for us and our son. The change of scenery, the hustle and bustle of the streets and change of mode of transportation (bike on the boat) made it a very exciting and entertaining trip for all of us. We had a lunch break at a simple restaurant where Pad Thai was prepared on the spot and our son just loves rice and noodles, so really happy. The guide was very flexible and considerate. Our son had a proper seat on the back of my bike and was wearing a helmet.

Bangkok dream trip!. Best way to get a view to Bangkok, if you don't have much time! We only had 1 and 1/2 day and it was the way to come along with the jetlag. We made the 1/2 day trip and that was really really excellent. Our guide Auddy was very friendly, funny and careful. You don' t have to worry about making a trip through Bangkok streets. We saw areas, what you dont see if you go on your own! We crossed the river by longtail boat, very funny! Had a look at some temples, feeded the fishes, we drove through the jungle. Best time in Bangkok! If I ever make a city trip again, I also would make a biking experience again! our kids/teens also loved it!

Very nice. We were in Bangkok Dec 2011 and we made a Colors of Bangkok excursion. It was a really nice beautiful and exciting bikingtour. The bikes were in good condition und the guide was very considerate.!!!!!

Whole day tour too expensive. Two years ago we did the halfday tour, which was great. Yesterday we did the whole tour, but that is not your money worth. It is only 2 hours longer and you pay double the half day tour !!!The tour is interesting, but almost the same as the halfday and to do not follow the program written on their site. No mushroom, no sojabeans, no bamboo no coffee...Partialy because of the season, but you visit the same number of attraction in the half day tour as in the whole day tour.A bit disappointing.
Colors of Bangkok is a good way to see a very different city.. Nice time. Bikes were in good condition. Must be confident in riding on busy streets and narrow walkways.

Off the beaten track - on a bike. We enjoyed this tour tremendously. First, we were happy that they were willing to run it with only three of us. Second, our guide was very helpful and informative. Third, we saw parts of the city that even as frequent visitors we hadn't seen before. The whole thing felt like a custom-tour made just for us. Among the highlights: loading our bikes onto a narrow boat and being ferried across the river; cycling on suspended concrete paths over rural swampland; seeing a floating market designed for locals rather than tourists; enjoying a simple but delicious lunch of chicken noodle soup; being ferried in a rickshaw; taking a shortcut through a supermarket carpark; seeing a street-level thai kick-boxing training camp and of course a lot of friendly smiling local residents. Our guide told us the tour operator provides assistance to the communities we cycle through (sometimes at very close range!) and they certainly didn't seem to mind our presence. All in all a great day out and one that gave us all a great appetite for dinner.
Very nice and good Trip. The bike tour was very nice. You get a lot of impressions and another in Bangkok to see. I can only recommend this trip continues.

Biking in the Bangkok jungle. and this does not just refer to the sometimes chaotic situation on the roads, but to the fact that this metropolis actually has a large section of jungle to explore.André and his team of local guides have a unique operation. It may be a typically Dutch thing to consider: exploring a city on bike, but it is well worth the effort!As the guides know the city inside and out, they take the unexpecting cyclist on the most amazing tour of their home turf. Avoiding the main tourist attractions, the tour includes sections of the city that normally do not see tourists (certainly not on bikes!). The routes chosen are mostly away from the main streets, so no need to worry about the roaring traffic. Alleyways, footpaths, supermarket car parks, anything goes when it comes to chosing the most convenient way. And the locals don't mind! In fact, all the children we saw would come out running to us, and the number of high-fives we had to give.... Our tour included a short boat ride across the river to the Sri Nakornkuenkhan Park. The ride in this part of the jungle is on concrete, raised foot paths, and very easy. A stop half-way for lunch was included, and the food and hospitality were excellent. All in all, a highly recommendable, easy and fun way to explore Bangkok!

Beautiful experience, a must do when you are in Bangkok!!. We went by taxi to the starting point of this bike tour. Very good bikes for the whole family. Seats were easily adjusted.The guide was really kind and explained everything very well.We biked through places in Bangkok where you normally would not be able to come a a tourist.Food and drinks underway was great. We experienced a huge shower while biking but the guide had raincoats ready for everybody.We did this trip with our 2 sons of 12 and 13 at the time and they also enjoyed it very much.This is a MUST DO when you are in Bangkok.

Great way to experience a different side to Bangkok. We chose to do the morning 4 hour trip of Bangkok which was perfect for us, before the weather heated up. We had a lovely female Thai guide (sorry can't remember her name) who was very informative and helpful to our family. We took the private tour which meant we could stop whenever we wanted to. We all enjoyed the experience of riding around the streets of Bangkok, down tiny alley ways and on the island on narrow raised walkways. We saw an area of Bangkok that you wouldn't see without a guide. The Thai boxing school stop might seem a bit corny, however our 10 and 12 year old boys loved the dressing up in the shorts and getting some instruction from real Thai boxers. Great photo opportunities. Overall we found this a very professional and well run tour.

A great way to see another side of Bangkok. We did the Colours of Bangkok tour which was a lot of fun but very fast paced. We started off at 1.00pm so it was quite warm but it wasn't long before we reached the slums and there was some protection from the sun. The only issue we had with the afternoon tour was that the sweatshop was having lunch and the school was having nap time so we only had one minute stops, looked in the door and off again. The greenest part of Bangkok was really wonderful and certainly a side you don't normally see which was appealing. The paths you ride along aren't overly wide so balancing on a bike is important but you can take your time, just make sure you let your guide know as ours just kept riding.

Biking in beautiful Bangkok. It was great bike trip true the city Bankgkok, You can see an other part of Bankgkok on the bike. You come on places where you can not come with a car. And there was a good lunch. We had he Bankok biking weekend edition from 7 hours. it was Great.
Amazing. I suggest this to everbody who visit Thailand / Bangkok. Its a nice way to explore a part of a big city and the guide show you place what we never find by ourselve.

Rainy day. In october 2011 I joined the Bangkok Biking tour, colors of bangkok. As the weather this time of the year was not that good and the were epxecting floods, I was not expecting a lot of it, but I was wrong. It was really great.Our guide was showing us another side if the city, which I was not expecting to see. He took us to a part of the slums, so we were able to see, how poor people can be. When we passed the slums we arrived in a huge park, compare it with Central Park, with palmtrees and benches to enjoy the serenity of the park..
