After this stop the guide took us to the local market and tried to let us taste local food and candy...Despite it was very rainy, it was a very nice trip, which I can recommend to anybody, to see Bangkok from a different point if view.

Geweldige manier om kennis te maken met Bangkok. Deze trip was mijn kennismaking met Thailand en Bangkok. Op een heerlijke relaxte manier door het prachtige Bangkok gefietst. Ik heb genoten van het gezelschap, de stad en de hartelijke mensen die we tegenkwamen.

Must do trip to view Bangkok through different eyes. This was a very cool trip. I did the one that was set for the morning for 4 hours or so. We went through Bangkok, to the slums, then we went to an island where we fed fishes in the park, then went around and saw the island. We rode the bikes on these 1 yard trails that winded through what looked like a tropical forest. Of course, it was just the woods of the island and a prior coconut plantation. The island was interesting and we visited two different temples on it. We stopped past halfway through the trip and had lunch at a local joint of pad thai. They offered chicken and shrimp but the shrimp made me and another girl sick, which was a reason why our trip was slightly shortened. The water provided was bottled but it tasted like water and dissinfectant iodine. The guides were nice and helpful. I had the biggest smile on my face riding around. It was alot of fun. I would do it again but I'd do the shorter trip. After a while of riding in the sun you get very tired. And I'd definitely skip the meat alltogether, if you dont want the chance of getting sick like I did.

This is a must to see the real Bangkok. If you are visting Bangkok you must to this. Not only do do you get to ride a bike in Bangkok, you get to taste interesting Thai fruit/food, stop at the markets, see interesting sites that you would not otherwise. The guides are also brilliant.

Fantastic tour, beautiful scenery, top notch professional team. We had heard about RBB and the Chiang Mai bike tours from a hotel and decided to try it out. But first we sent numerous messages to the company email to learn more about choosing a ride for our family with three young kids (gas 5, 9, 11). Andre was superb with detailed and speedy answers to all our questions. Yes, they have helmets, yes they provide water, yes the ride in CM is flat, yes there are kid seats for the bikes, yes the bikes are in good (actually excellent) condition. We booked and then awoke in the morning of our tour to find our oldest sick with the flu. We were all bummed but the folks at RBB took it in stride and allowed us to rebook with no penalty; they earned our trust before we ever met any of the team.The instructions on how to find their office are spot on and the location is easy to find. We geared up speedily and off we went into the southern fields of Chiang Mai on the Colors of Chiang Mai tour. The bikes worked just fine and there were no technical problems at all. Our two kids on their own wheels each spilled once (their own mis-steps, nothing to do with the tour) and our tour guide (Yo, a real superstar with good English and great CM & Thailand lore to share) was all over them each time with careful attention and concern for each kid's safety. Most of the path was on either paved or dirt roads through villages and fields. For several short distances the ride follows a secondary road with vehicle traffic. We felt very safe on all surfaces and all parts of the ride. The stop at the family bakery, orphanage (where lunch is provided) and candy factory were fantastic. The ride was relaxing, entertaining, enjoyable, fascinating and down right fun. Really a highlight of our 2 months in CM, I highly recommend this trip and this company.

Such a great day with Auddy. Was nervous as I'm not an experienced rider but I had such a brilliant day. Lucky for me I had a personal tour as two people couldn't make it. I highly recommend the afternoon tour at 1pm. Auddy was a great tour guide, it wasnt a strenuous ride and the views were beautiful.

Nice tour, but NOT 95% traffic-free. We made the tour in June this year. The tour was interesting and we had a very good guide (Susan). The problem was that the tour was not 95% traffic free (as promised on the web-site).

What a great experience to see more of Bangkok!. We didn't had much time in Bangkok, so we really wanted to do something nice. We were so happy we did this during our time in Bangkok! It was amazing to drive into the small 'streets' and almost enter somebodies living room with your bike. But also the green and the silence we experienced were amazing. The guide was good and funny and took very good care of us. We left our bag at one of the stops and I never new that a Thai guy could ride faster on a bicycle than a Dutch one. The stops were good, got water everywhere we came and had a lot of fun. We really had a great time!

A great way to get straight into the real Bangkok life. the bike tour was safe, interesting and fun.our guide was very cautious and caring and we got to visit little corners of the city we wouldn't been able to do on our own.it was certainly good value for money and a great way to get into Bangkok real life...

An easily accessible and fun tour. I've done the Colours of Bangkok tour twice now and had an excellent experience both times. The small size of group was a plus.The tour guide was humourous, informative and reacted to the interests of the group. It's a great 1/2 day tour is an efficient way (3-4 hours) of getting a varied picture of Bangkok. It includes key aspects of life in Bangkok: jungle, city living, architecture, simple tasty food (included in cost) & friendly locals. I really liked it which is why I will continue to take my visitors on it.

Biking in Bangkok. A great day out exploring the quieter areas of Bangkok with an informative and friendly guide. The route we look had been well researched and we encountered very little traffic, which made the cycling even more fun. An excellent lunch was included in the cost and compliementry water was provided. Don't forget to bring a hat and plenty of sun block

The Real Bangkok. We did a Colours of Bangkok bike tour with a group of friends, 9 of us in total. We had a thoroughly enjoyable day. Our guide Thom was great and showed us many aspects of Bangkok that we would not have normally seen. My only small critisism would be that the tour was advertised as 95% of non road biking, however we did seem to go on quite a few very busy roads which were a bit scary at times. All of our children were above the age of 11 but had they been any younger it may have been a bit more of an issue. Having said that I would highly recommend this tour, giving you a chance to do something a bit different than the usual tourist stuff.

Fabulous way to see a hidden Bangkok.. This tour is a great way to see Bangkok from the inside. You will experience a wide variety of different things outside the typical and be instructed by a very knowledgeable tour guide. The cycling itself is not for the faint hearted ... I found many parts of it a challenge and at times struggled to keep up but all in all well worth it.

a tour on roads less taken. The team at Recreational Bangkok Biking is professional and very prompt in their services, my email query was attended to within 1 working day. Reservation was definitely convenient and hassle-free.Although Bangkok offers many different bicycle tour operators, the ones by RBB seem to be really affordable and value-for-money. The guide was professional and friendly, and it helps that there were only 3 of us that day (myself and another couple), so alot of personalised attention was given to each of us. We had a good day on the roads, which were a mixture of some trails as well as the usual busy streets of Bangkok. I think what really appealed was that I got to see a different side of Bangkok that I never saw / would easily get to see. Never knew Bangkok offered such sights (think slums settlement, the Greenest Part of Bangkok, trails etc.) I loved the Muay Thai gym too! Well done RBB!
Wow, every time again!. It was my saecond time withe the guide from Andreee and it werse two differnt tours. I always can say: it wer one of the best tours we had have in thaland all the years.

A must in Bangkok!. We spent 4 days as a family in Bangkok. The things to do and see in this exciting city are obvious; the bike tour through Bangkok must belong to those things too. With good-quality bikes and an excellent guide, we could experience Bangkok in a way that would never have been possible otherwise. During more than 5 hours (weekend tour) we could experience the not so affluent parts of Bangkok, the jungle, the relxing park of the emperor, a local market and two journeys across the river. The guide made regular breaks (including lunch) and made sure that we were always open for all the looks and feels of Bangkok. The bicycle tour through Bangkok is a must, also for people not usually riding bicycles! A family from Switzerland

See the city behind the city. A fabulous tour led by a friendly guide on sturdy European bikes through the lanes and alleyways and parklands of Bangkok. A MUST for anyone that is sick of the shops and bars and noise of this exciting city.

Well organized Bike Trip in Bangkok. Friendly staff and well organized. You come on spots you would never go yourself. It's worth the money, don't worry. We did the morning tour (+-3 hours). Nice to see a different part of Bangkok.

Great experience. It was a very nice experience with a completely different side of Bangkok to see, with a good guide who speaks English well. I can really recommend anyone! Pity we can not have come along the sweatshop.

One of the highlights of our stay in Bangkok. We booked the half day Bangkok cycling tour for our family of 6. At first we were a little worried that our youngest (9) would not be able to complete the tour. But it was absolutely no problem at all. Staff was very helpful and skilled. Problem with a flat tyre was solved quickly and efficiently. We loved the variety of the tour and the scenery. It was nice to have a few breaks along the trip and taking the boat with our bikes was a highly appreciated part of the tour (by our kids1!). Cycling experience is a must.
Lovely tour :). Somebody say biking in Bangkok ,that's crazy,If you like Biking than you Will love this tour

The other side of Bangkok. If you want an impression of Bangkok that will stick with you for a long time and is different from all the other sightseeing one normally does; arrange a biketour. The one with the most enthousiastic guide, Ann, is Recreational Bangkok Biking. The bikes are great, the route is extraordinary and the price is low. And altough the price is low, still a part of it goes to a local school, which you visit along the way. You see parts of Bangkok you would never go to. You cross the river twice, you will be taken through the jungle; you wouldn't believe this is Bangkok! A stop is made for lunch and you will never be short of drinks. The only thing we regret is that we took a tour for half a day and not for a whole day! This is absolutely a "must do"
Intersting tour in less touristy Bangkok. Interesting tour, where you cycle through parts of Bangkok that are not listed in any travel guide.

The other side of Bangkok, very great biking tour. In juli 2011 we booked a biking trip (the Colours of Bangkok) with Bangkok Biking. For me and my friend it was the 2nd time. For my parents it was the first time. We really enjoyed the trip. The group wasn't to big, we were with 6 people.It is very great to see Bangkok on the other side. We went by bycicle into the slums. But it isn't dangerous, the people are very friendly. Waving, say 'Farang' and 'Hello' and always smiling when you crossed a road. Our guide was very friendly and polite. He told us a lot about the Thai culture, the city Bangkok, thai food and nature. We asked him so much and we had a nice time. For refreshing we get cold towels and a lot of water (or Coke) . It's good to take sunprotection with you and wear trousers. I really recommended this tour/company. Also my parents - they weren't so enthousiastic about Thailand - they really enjoyed the trip.Book this trip if you want to have some adventure and meet Bangkok at a diffrent way!
Wonderful bike trip. The bike trip was really wonderful and well organized. It was very interesting to see and feel a different side of Bangkok!

Excellent trip, also for Families with young Children. In july 2011 we did the colors of Bangkok private tour with Bangkokbiking. It was a fantastic experience! We were with 2 children in age of 10 and 8 years old and they also loved it! Our enthusiastic guide showed us Bangkok in a different way. Especially the ride trough the city park on the small concrete paths passing the lagunes and characteristic local living communities. The trip was full of surprices, with boattrips, visiting temples, parks and a market, picked up by rickshaws and having a wonderfull Thai meal. We thought the cycling tour was very safe and a perfect day out. It is a trip we would highly recommend! Don't hesitate and book the trip....you'll love it!JW Spanjer

Fantastic tour through colorfoul Bangkok!. When you are in Bangkok it's hard to believe a good trip by bike is possible with your family. Bussy with all the cars and motorcycles......and driving at the left side of the road?! It looks crazy but it was fantastic and very surprising. Great guide (Nat!) and really a good way to discover Bangkok in many ways. Even the lunch was very good......After this tour we booked allso the trip in ChiangMai at the same company. Allso here it was really fantastic! (For the dutch people: boek gewoon op de site! Via 333 is het VEEL duurder.....)

Fantastic way to see the city - unique sights & experiences you would otherwise not get to enjoy. A great day out, thanks guys! This tour is a winner, Andre and his enthusiastic staff are a pleasure. We did a private tour as travelled with our 11yr old son - we all had a great day. Cycling is such a great way to see and experience a city, and local guides share a wealth of information about their lifestyle. Thomas was a great guide - thank you!

a hole new experience of Bangkok. In july 2011 I did the colors of Bangkok tour with Bangkokbiking. It was a very nice experience! There were 7 persons in our group and one guide. We saw a lot, especially things you normally wouldn't see when you're visiting a city. We biked through the slums, nature, we feeded the fish in a park, we crossed the klongs in a boat, visited a old wat. We saw a variety of things and this was a hole new experience of Bangkok! During the tour a meal is provided, all water and other drinks where free and our guide told us some things and answered a lot of questions. I would definitely recommend this tour, because it will give you a nice day and show you an other side of the city!

Best activity in Bangkok. We did the afternoon tour of Collors of Bangkok and it was really great. There where 8 people in our group and we had a fanastic guide Tom. During my 3 weeks in thailand there wasn't a better speaking thai I have met.We cycled true areas with a lot of poor people, but they where so friendly. A lot of smiles and some children wanted a high five! You see the real bangkok! The most part of the tour we cycled in a jungle area across the river wich was really beautifull.We liked also the visit of the school, thaiboxing school, temple, fishpond and pad thai at the local restaurant.If we go back to Bangkok we defenitly do the longer tour, because we liked it so much!

Super Ride. Great inside to the unexplored streets of BKK. A world opens up where you won't see a foreigner except the ones biking next to you. This is a great opportunity to see BKK and TH's local life. Definitely worth the bike ride!

Overwhelmingly wonderful!. If you enjoy biking you will love this. There were just two of us booked in for the pm ride. The tour was varied and interesting and our guide Ahm was obliging and helpful, but not having ridden for many years, I found the first 2 hours quite nerve racking as we manoeuvred through traffic initially and then down many narrow alleyways with tight turns, where the Thais were saawadeeing and waiving to us everywhere we went. Even though there were many stops along the way for drinks and a stop for a yummy pad thai snack made by a very animated Thai lady in her home, the pace was fast and it felt quite arduous in the heat (33°C) after the 3 hour mark. Enjoyable, fascinating, insightful, exciting and challenging. A must do if you want a change from the regular tourist scene. You won’t see another farang anywhere on this tour. The highlight was definitely the children running out to us along the way.Tip - do the Bangkok Food Tour first then this second.

Great way of seeing a different side of Bangkok. The whole trip lasted about 4 hours and took us through quite a variety of landscapes. We met lots of friendly locals, visited a kindergarten and ate pad thai at a small local restaurant. It also included a short boat trip across the river. What a nice way to get acquainted with sides of Bangkok you probably never would get to see on your own! Water and food is supplied on the way, so you don't have to carry anything special. This is not a physically demanding trip. Although the route mostly follows quieter roads and allies, at the beginning and end the traffic is a little more dense. I would therefore not recommend it to families with very young children who are not yet mature enough to handle a little bit of traffic hassle. But as soon as they are secure enough on a bike they will love the experience.

Fantastic!. My husband, son and I did the Colours of Bangkok Bike Tour in July 2011. It was simply awesome. We were greeted by our tour guide and given our bikes to try out before we started on a wonderful adverture. The adenture led us through some places we would not have experienced if not for this tour. We visited a creche, factory, local restaurant , and the different ways of life on the river, etc. The guide was friendly, patient, accommodating, informative and you could actually see that he enjoyed himself. It is a trip I would highly recommend, although not cheap - it is certainly worth it! We will be back next year!

the most fun you can have on 2 wheels. we booked over the internet and no problems, very effecient. and the trip well 3 aussies and 4 europeans. we had a ball every one got on well and couldnt stop laughing. tour guide was brillant. i felt safer riding around bangkok on a bike than driving around any city in australia. throughly recomend it to any one young or old. ITS A MUST IF GOING TO BANGKOK. will do it again

Relaxed trip in one of the most crowded cities in the world. Nice variating trip through the centre of Bangkok with small groups and a guide. Except for some crossings most of the route is free of cars, very safe and comfortable! Especially the Ride trough the city park on the small concrete paths passing the lagunes and characteristic local living communities is a nice experience! Included is a good Thai meal with a beautiful view on the Bangkok river.

Great different view of Bangkok!. Did the Bankok Biking Tour early in the morning at 08AM, just before the 'real' heat.It's fun and beautiful to bike through Bangkok!The trip takes you to see a whole different side of Bangkok. No honking taxi's or tuktuk's, but the real 'slumbers', boat trip and parcs. Very nice to see, people are very friendly en parcs are beautiful. Especially the crossing of the river by Longtail boat with the bikes on board. Very good and friendly guiding aswel. Afterwards the arrange some rest, cooling and a taxi if you need.Good trip! Surely take the Bangkok Biking tour when you have the chance!!- Wesley

A 'must do', great crew, Bangkok biking is the best!. The crew of Bangkok biking is great, professional, entertaining, safe & enthusiastic! You will see a different side of Bangkok, the crew knows so much & tell you a lot during the tour. Joined already twice, with friends & husband and will do more biking tours in the future, it's always fun to explore the city on a bike & do some exercise. I visited Bangkok a lot of times and tried different biking companies, Bangkok biking is the best! Small groups, perfect bikes, very nice tours including super nice food & drinks. Book a tour & enjoy, you'll have great day for sure! Have fun, Jeanine.

outstanding. I strongly recommend this very special bike tour trough Bangkok!after only 500m on one of the famous Bagkok traffic roads, you get the feeling of beeing on a north Thailand country road or so.... Hard to belive - unless you have seen it.It's great fun and easy to do! Just Go for it !!Fredy Fischer, Switzerland ( and 10 of his airlinecrew!)

Bangkok from its other side - a trip that you shouldn't miss. It is a tremendous experience which i already joint twice on my second trip to thailand and bangkok ... these different trips should be on everybodys plans ... check it ... you won't regret ... pascal from switzerland

Memorable biking excursion through off beat Bangkok.... Recreational Bangkok Biking (RBB) was a very memorable tour to spend half of the day which provided a unique glimpse into the Bangkok you don't typically see. We took the morning tour which lasted almost five hours - started biking in am rush hour traffic (I remember thinking who does this?) then meandered through the city "slums" - poor neighborhood yet people were always smiling and saying hello to us as we passed through. Stopped by a kindergarten class - kids were singing christmas carols in June - so we sang along with them! Biked through a park and fed the coi fish, had lunch on the riverside and crossed the river. Enjoyed the narrow elevated pathways through the "forest" in the middle of the city. Even though the temperature was +25 C, the pace wasn't strenuous and as promised we had lots of pit stops for water breaks. Highly recommend this tour!

Awesome insight into the "Real" Bangkok. On a recent trip to Bangkok we decided to join the “Colors Of Bangkok” Cycle tour, it was the right decision the trip was fantastic the guide was also full of local knowledge that other otherwise a Farang would miss out on, the trip gave you an insight into tiny infant schools, houses over the river, true cottage industry factories and also saw you riding on main inner city roads shoulder to shoulder with trucks and motorbikes laden with Guys, Grannies, Kids and Dogs! You also had the opportunity to experience the might of the Chao Phraya River as the boat weaved across through barges and heavy industry ships! Once off the boat we tiptoed through meter wide platforms over the swamps and through shacks and luxury houses to the beautiful national park where we fed the fish in the stunning ponds! The trip was finished off with a trip to a local eatery with river views.This is a trip you should not miss out on, remember to take lots of water and suncream and an open mind!

A great way to experience the non-touristy side of Bangkok!. At the very last minute (morning of) I decided to book the half-day "Colors of Bangkok" bike tour - mostly because I had a bit of free time on my hands and my TA app said that it was an attraction close to my hotel. But I was so glad I found it. We spent the afternoon (I think about 5 hours) biking through parts of the city that I most definitely wouldn't have seen otherwise. We biked through many residential neighborhoods, then crossed the river on a longtail and continued our bike ride through the jungle (who knew?!). We passed local schools, parks, and fascinating neighborhoods. And even stopped for a delicious meal of Phad Thai along the way. Our tour guide, "Ah", though new to the company, did a fabulous job, was extremely informative and tons of fun. Thanks for a great introduction to the city of Bangkok!!

Our best and most interesting experience in Bangkok. If you enjoy biking you will love this experience. Our guide was well informed showing us the side of Bangkok one would never see otherwise. They took us off the regular tourist route.For the most part traffic was not a problem.

See Bangkok from the back of a bicycle: it will bring you to unexpected areas of wonder and beauty.. Exploring Bangkok on a bicycle? My friends declared me crazy. Given the state of the traffic in Bangkok, you need a very good guardian angel, or so they told me. Little did they know that Recreational Bangkok Biking has cunningly explored the by-ways and back-alleys of the City of Angels to give you a safe and wondeful biking experience."Colours of Bangkok - Weekend edition" will guide you through quiet roads, vibrant local communities (ignorant people will call these "slums"), a large piecride a mountain bike, be driven around in bicycle-rickshaws and cross the river on both long-tail and taxi-boats. All in all, you travel more than 30 km.The bicycles are European sized mountain bikes, so our long farang legs can be easily accomodated and RBB can adjust the saddle of the bike so your Thai girlfriend will be able to use the bike as well and keep up with you.Regular stops are planned and enough water is provided so you will not suffer thirst. Included in the trip is a lunch at a local floating market where you can partake of the real Thai food.No special training is needed. The pace is leisurely. Any moderately fit (young or old) adult can join and enjoy those magnificent Colours of Bangkok.

fantastic sightseeing on the bicycle. We had a morning trip, 4-5 hours and it was great, we're with another person en the guide Ann, totally with 4 people. It's was quiet on the roads in Bangkok, because Songkran was there, but it was fantastic and see a lot. We take the longboat and we had a beautifull skyline of Bangkok. There was the green jungle, amazing, only a short trip over the water and than so beuatifull green bicycle tour and the slob's were also good, everybody is so sweet en friendly. Ann was so nice en speak very very good English, nice to met her, she told us a lot of information about Bangkok and Thailand!!

Beautifull experience. In June me and my 2 friends went to Bangkok Biking..It was perfect; You go to places you would never see on your own and our guide was so involved. He wouldn't stop talking about what we saw en about the land and their habbits.. He was very enthusiastic to tell us all about Thailand. I've learned and seen a lot that day. It's also great to see that they sponsor some of the places that we go to; Like a day-care in one of the poorest area's of Bangkok.Also everything is included; You get drinks along the way, something to eat and some Thai specialties; Like a coconutleaf wich included coconut and sugar. I would recommend this to everybody who goes to Bangkok!Sanne den Dubbelden, The netherlands,

Just ride a round Bangkok with a bicycle..... It was a great ride with nice guys around the world during bangkok. It is a "must have" to do this on your stay in bangkok. The guids are very good and funny , too. It was also a great expirience for us. Just do it and enjoy it.... ;O) Thanks again and best regards from Germany....CheersJenny and Florian

Excellent way to explore the real Bangkok! Hop-on bus, pack your bags!. Bangkok as it is really is, from hidden peaceful nature places to the busy hive, from the poor to the rich areas living besides each other, from the slums to the villas.It was a breathtaking trip with an excellent guide that really understood and spoke English very well. She explained a lot abouth the Thai way of living and thinks ans apart from a lot of information we all had a laugh during the whole trip.I thought it would be heavy biking in warm weather but even that was good arranged, the bikes are easy and light to use and there were enough stops to take a drink and a breath. I recommend every tourist to do the trip!

Great experience - a must for tourists in Bangkok. We went for the Colours of Bangkok biking tour, with two kids (14-16). The tour took 4,5 hours, during which we saw many highlights Bankok has to offer. Temples, a beautiful park, scenery and small tiny streets where ordinary people live. Our guide Auddy was great and showed us the little ordinary pleasures the city has to offer. No way you can experience this by car, taxi or walking. And, in spite of the heat and smog, it is a must for all tourists visiting Bangkok.

Great easy bike trip outside of Chiang Mai. This was a great little biking tour around the less crowded areas of Chiang Mai. The ride was easy and that was good due to the heat and humidity. Our guide Aon did a fantastic job. He took us though farming areas, to a bakery (where we got to sample some donuts, yum), a pottery factory, a leper colony, to an ancient temple, a local market (where we got to sample native fruits) and then lunch at an orphanage. It was a perfect way to spend the morning. The only gripe I would have was getting there. It required a lengthy taxi ride and many stops for directions even with the map provided. After talking with the other biker in our group, I found out he was picked up by the operator. We were able to ride back to our hotel with them, but not sure why we were never offered the pick up.

Colours of Bangkok half day guided biking tour. I have been to Bangkok many times and I still found this tour great as it gave a different perspective to the City.The guide was informative, the route was well planned and the meal was yummy. We didn't spend too much time on the roads as promised, and as the route is fairly flat it isn't too difficult.This tour gets my thumbs up.

Off the beaten track, real view, not for popular tourist sights. The day was great fun and easy going. We had a great tour guide, who spoke English well and made sure we were all safe on some of the busier roads. We saw some truly interesting sides of Bangkok and appreciated the real life information from the guide. Not for those who are wanting to see the bigger, more popular tourist sights, but if you've got extra time or prefer a less busy tourist experience you'll love this opportunity. The highlight was the bike paths through the farm lands! Thanks Mon you gave us a lovely day in Bangkok! Gary&Bron

into the labyrinth of the real Bangkok. If you want to come back with a different story of Bangkok from all your friends that have been there, then this tour is for you. its a very different experience from your usual guided tour. Going around seeing the real people of Bangkok, the way they live their everyday existent, far away from hotels and tourist, you get to really soak in the atmosphere of rural Bangkok. for those who might be put off by the physical part, don't worry, i have to say that their bikes is a well oiled machine, literally. its very well look after and very easy to ride. the guide (Ann) was very attentive and she was quick to response when my mum had an accident (mum is a bit rusty on the bike, no fault of RBB). thank god nothing is injured and we all had a good laugh about it over a plate of pad thai somewhere in rural Bangkok.great time

Avoid at all costs. The guide was great but nothing else lived up to the hype. It was dangerous riding against city traffic, had to ask twice for helmets, which had to be fixed with a staple gun! The base of operations is City Center and is risky at best to get into the short but enjoyable countryside. The operation should be moved a rural location. Not sure the local residents in the shanty towns appreciated a tour group riding through their front yards, nursery school and kick boxing were not available to view as advertised. Lunch, long boat and floating market were enjoyable but then the ride back through the city in the afternoon was hairy for Moms and kids. Nothing about the trip was safe. DO NOT BRING YOUR KIDS ON THIS TRIP!

Bangkok on Bike - different fascinating view of the city!. We had been taken this trip end of Feb.. We booked this already from Germany - which was no problem at all.Luckily, our group (afternoon) consisted only 2 people (us) and our female guide.She was really great, she could tell a lot about the city, habitants and daily life, which was very interesting. Her english was very good as the has studied abroad.The pure ciclying was good, not very exhausting and with a lot of breaks. Also, we very much like the stop at the "local food" for having lunch - this was fantastic and interesting to see.I can recommend this trip to everybody, you come back with sooo many impressions, and Andre and his team was really great!
Great tour. It is a great and original way of discovering a different Bangkok. Not to be missed!

It's very nice to experience other sides of Bangkok.. It's very nice to experience other sides of Bangkok. Sides that you probably wouldn't be able to explore on your own. You'll be driving in quiet lanes 95% of the time, so don't worry about the traffic. The guide was pretty fluent in English, which is quite rare in Thailand.

Double Bangkok jungle. On this side of the river, you'll be biking through the metropolitan Bangkok jungle: Serpentine paths in poor neighbourhoods (contrarily to the slums I know in my native South America, you'll be smiled and "hallo"-ed by dozens of people as you ride past their "living rooms"). You'll stop to see a kindergarden that you are helping to finance with the excursion fee (The owner of this business do understand good marketing!).On the other side of the river, just 10 min. away by boat, you'll be biking in a jungle in the stricter sense of the world. Amazing.Mon, the guide, was fantastic. For example, she flexibly responded to the challenge posed by my shopping binge in the market by buying a baggage rubber band to attach the plunder to my bike's luggage rack.On the whole you'll be biking around 25 kilometers. You'll have time inbetween to chill out in a market and while being carried to and from it in a rickshaw. The jungle part is a bit dangerous to do with children, as in some parts you'll be riding on unfenced, elevated, one meter broad platforms with water to the right and left, and they may end up taking an unwanted bath.

Bangkok Biking "A Must". This was really an impressive tour through areas you will never visit on "tourist bus tours".Perfect organisation and a professional helpful guide made this tour to an unforgettable event.

A must for anyone looking for something off the well beaten tourist path. My wife and I have been to Bangkok several times, and were rather tired of the same sites. We took the trip and it was exactly what we wanted. You won't see many other tourists on this trip. I only wished we had signed up for one of the longer rides. For those of you still not temple'd-out, there are some on the ride. Excellent value for the money. So, if you're wondering what to do with an extra day in Bangkok, give it a go. The bike company is well organized. Our guide spoke excellent English, and really knew the area.

Be one with Bangkok through biking!. If you love riding your bike for transportation and are used to riding within city streets this bike tour is for you. Bangkok streets can be a little crazy on a bike but when you ride in a good size group - power in numbers! Be prepared for non-stop sights of beautiful people, amazing country homes, tasty food, and a great workout. You will not regret it!

An unforgettable 'must have done that' experience. We took this bike tour on my daughter's advice and she joined for the second time. Led by an experienced guide, we passed several city hotspots, biked through the slums and got in contact with the local people living in real poverty, crossed the Chao Praya river by boat and left the hectic city life in order to explore the beautiful gardens of Bangkok. A good lunch was included in his 4 hours trip and there were plenty Kodak moments.This excursion gives an opportunity to visit places within the Bangkok area you might not see otherwise as well as getting in contact with local people. All in all an unforgettable experience which I would recommend to anyone who's able to ride a bike!

Great experience. I've joined the bike tour last december. It was a great experience if you want to see bangkok out of mass tourism and to discover hidden places.The tour is guided by local guides. The tour last about 5-6 hours. You don't have to be trained, they drive a comfortable tempo. You are provided with water and one meal.You see the temples, small thai neighbouhoods, local thai communities and will be provided with a background of it all.Will come again!

Best you can do in Bangkok!!. You will expect what you can see on a biking tour in Bangkok.It was unbelievable for us that you even can bike ther!!We enjoyed very much the colors of bankok tour with our nice and helpful guide. We've seen places and people we would not expect to see.It's really great. Don't miss it!!

Bangkok Biking - When you are in Bangkok next time, just do it!. In October we did our third Bangkok Biking tour. As usual is was fantastic. We did the Paradise tour this time nd it brought us again to places we had never seen or dreamed we would ever see. The bikeride, lead by super nice guides, leads you through the back alleys, living areas and sometimes even -houses of the locals. We were a group of approx 10 people and did the long tour. Starting 8 am , back to the rental shop by 430pm. Sounds a long day, but because of the recreational relaxing speed, the good biking materials, the impressions and things to see, the regular breaks for sight seeing (temples, churches, markets, banana plantations), drinks and lunch and also the rides in the long-boats, time just flies. It can be accomplished by anyone who's been on a push-bike before.I bet we went through parts of Bangkok even the locals don't all know about. You wuld never imagine these places exist if one only knows Bangkok downtown.The absolute best way to spend a day and absorb the city.Would recommend it to anyone.

The highlight of our Thailand trip. If there is one thing you should do in Bangkok, this is it! You get to see some of the city, you get to see how the people live, you get on a boat, you get to eat a gorgeous local lunch and you get to cycle on some of the most amazing little alleyways. Loved it so much we did the Colours of Bangkok trip again the next day in Chiang Mai. this too was just amazing as well.

Great way to see the other side of Bangkok. Although Bangkok is already an amazing city to visit if you just stick to the standard touristic highlights, doing this bicycle tour gives you an unexpected and very interesting view of the other side of the city. With a very friendly and helpful guide, you'll cycle throughout the neighborhoods where locals live. In fact, you will cycle right through their living rooms! We did the Colors of Bangkok tour, which is about 25km's. Although it seems far, it is in fact over before you know it. Given the non-existence of mountains in the area, the tour is suitable for all ages and levels of fitness. And there are enough stops on the way where you can buy water or just relax and see the sights.

Everything about this bike tour is right (Colours of Bangkok). For us this was a tour that had everything - great co-riders, an incredible journey, wonderful sights, brilliant local food (at no extra cost), two adventure filled boat rides, the two Australians in the party (ie us) stacking it and quite simply the nicest and most graceful guide (in Mon) that you could possibly be lucky enough to meet.We felt a great sense of welcome as we passed through the various fantastic Bangkok and Green Zone communities that we explored- at various times going through, in and around people's homes. We were even lucky enough to quickly visit the fantastic kids at the Mercy School - what a school and how fantastic the support that Andre and his team give them! We can't wait to get back to Bangkok to take another ride, and we intend doing the Colours of Chang Mai as well. Every time we have told any friends about the ride, they say the want to come along with us next time too. I can think of nothing better.

Colors of Bangkok an experience you'll never forget.... Before you start Andre explains the do's and don'ts of biking in Bangkok and how to avoid problems in the traffic. After a short ride before entering the 'slums' he gives a clear explanation what you can expect and that this trip is absolutely 'save'.One thing even he didn't expect was the level of the river water half way the first part. The point of no return was passed so everybody was biking through two feet of water.During the ride Andre stops several times to explain about the life op the people, the 'sweat shops', the school and the eldest temple of Bangkok. Not only the sums but you also bike through the 'Lung of Bangkok' a beautiful combination of wild nature and a peaceful park.The trip includes a bottle of water, a lunch and the ferry that takes you to and from the lung.If you have luggage you can leave it safely at Andre's office.It was really an experience we'll never forget!

How to see what Bangkok is really like. My wife and I, with our four children, took this excursion and loved it! What a terrific way to see how Thai people really live. Our excursion began through some of the poorest of Thai neighborhoods where we practically rode through their living rooms. Across the river (via boat) was another world of more relaxed and spacious neighborhoods and parks. I can't imagine a better way to see and meet the people of Bangkok. Booking was easy and our guide was terrific! We took the morning ride and they even arranged an excursion to an elephant park for that afternoon where we saw a show and rode the elephants. What a spectacular day!

Amazing. We had a Weekend edition of Colors of Bangkok tour in January this year. The guide, Kai, was really cool, we got to see such amazing sides of Bangkok, of which you are usually not aware of. Beautiful... We are really under impression, we surely want to check out the other tours via these guys, this was one of the highlights of our trip. We wholeheartedly recommend the WEEKEND edition of this tour!

Cycling in Bangkok - It's great. The idea of cycling in Bangkok may seem strange but this tour is fabulous. I went with my teenage daughter and we cycled aroung the south of Bangkok in areas you would never otherwise see as a tourist. We went to a local produce market, Buddhist Temple, orchid farm, fish farm and rode around areas where people live on canals. In fact I have a friend who visits Bangkok every year and he has never been to the places we went. The bikes are hybrids with fat wheels so easy for anyone to ride although you do need some skill in places. Only very small portions of the tour involved riding on roads and the tour guide was very good at negotiating traffic and taking inexperienced cyclists safely through the traffic. In the whole tour we spent maybe 5% on busy roads so this is not an issue even though you are in Bangkok. You also get a boat ride around a residential area based on canals which is fun. I would do this again, or more likely, try one of the other cycle tours offered by the same company.

Wonderful Family Outing. Taking a family trip to Bangkok? Recreational Bangkok Biking is a unique way to experience Bangkok. Our trip was tailored to meet the needs of my 8 and 9 year old children and we enjoyed a day of biking and sightseeing that we will always remember.Our tour included biking through neighborhoods and parks, a boat ride across the river and a lovely lunch of Pad Thai served from a local restaurant.Our bikes were in good condition and the tour guide was extremely accommodating.

Fantastic experience!!. We had a fantastic bikingtour around Bangkok. Our gide Kay was terrific. He told us a lot about the surroundings and was very attentive to us. We had enough food and drinks.You don't have to have a great condition to do this bikingtour. You get to see a side of Bangkok you won't see if you take a taxi.
an different way to see bangkok. It's a nice way to see bangkok in a different way. We would do it again. The guide knew very good english and she was very friendly.

A fantastic Bangkok experience. We went on the Colors of Bangkok tour with our two sons aged 8 and 10. As they are under 12 years old, the company arranged a private group so that the tour could be absolutely tailored to the speed, energy and biking ability of our group. We could not have had a better time. Our guide Kai was knowledgeable and considerate, with a great sense of humor. He ensured the safety of our group at all times (only a very small part of the tour is on roads with heavy traffic, but he guided and guarded our children well!). We saw many parts of Bangkok that we might never have seen, including affluent villa areas, slum areas, park land, lush farm land and a number of schools. Our lunch at a local roadside restaurant gave us some of the best pad thai noodles we have ever eaten in Thailand (and that's a lot).We would definitely head back for another tour next time we're in Bangkok, a great experience for all of us.
Unique - and no masstourism. On this tour you will get impressions you'll never forget. Bangkok can be different fou you - when you book this tour.

Great day in Bangkok. We have visited Bangkok for 4 days and we did the Colors of Bangkok at the 2nd day.We have started the tour at 8 in the morning and it took about 6 hours, we had a small group of only 4 tourists. It is a easy going tour. It was a great way to see the Non Touristic part of Bangkok. Most impressive was to enter the slums were the people are friendly. The tour was well organised and we'd liked every minute of it. It took us about 50 min. with the taxi from our hotel, after the tour they were very helpfull to find the best way to our next destination.

great experience. We visited Bangkok for the first time and choose this tour to see another side of the city. The tour with the nice and competent guide, Mon, did not disappoint us. Would recommend it to everyone who could sit straight on a bike for about 4 hours (you need not be a spotrsman, it its easy). Andrea and Richard from Vienna, Austria.

See another side of Bangkok. Highly recommended. This was one of the highlights of my trip to Bangkok. The tour took us through the back streets and out of the way areas that you wouldn't normally get to see. We visited a local pre-school. This was followed by a boat trip across the river and then a pleasant ride through a semi-rural area called the "Lung of Bangkok". It's hard to believe that there is still a farming area so close to Bangkok. Lunch was provided at a local open-air cafe along the way. The trip also visited some temples on the way. Our guide (I've forgotten her name) was very helpful and knowledgeable.All up a very enjoyable day.Also getting there was easy. I caught the train to BTS Chong Nosi station and gave the printed directions - supplied by RBB - to a taxi driver, who took me the rest of the way.

The BEST way to see Bangkok!. We spent 2-3 days in Bangkok, and although we wanted to see the sights - floating market, temples and the city itself - we were looking for something a bit different. Searching Trip Advisor brought us to the Colors of Bangkok and what an experience we had! The trip was well organized - the group was small - about 6-8 people. Intimate enough to really enjoy the tour and the commentary. Our guide (Guy) was super friendly and funny. I loved cycling through the slum areas, it really opened our eyes, and the people were so friendly and hospitable everywhere we went. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone - as long as you know how to ride a bike. We had one beginner in the group and that was a bit of a drag...but it was kind of funny when she rode into a parked car - and she did laugh at herself too!

A ride in to Bangkoks past. Having been to Bangkok on many occasions and thinking I have seen it all, I was happy to say after the tour I hadn't.The tour takes you away from towering sky scrapers and gives you a real insight to the Bangkok of the past.Colors of Bangkok just re-inforces why Thailand is called the Land of Smiles and this is not to be missed during any travellers itinerary.I can honestly say that

Wouldn't Recommend. My girlfriend and I took this tour through Bangkok. I had earlier taken a tour from either the same company or similar company through Chiang Mia. that I thought was A++++ fantastic and one that I would do again just because of how much fun it was. This one.... not so much. To start, we didn't get the pickup that most tours give you from your hotel. It wasn't an easy place to find. My girlfriend's bike didn't fit her properly and the bikes weren't in great condition. We also didn't like the tour guide or the tour itself for the following reasons: - She went too far ahead of us several times. There were only two of us on the tour so she should have been more mindful of where we were.  - We never really got to stop if we had a question because she was going so far ahead, as if she didn't like us and just wanted it done as fast as possible. - The tour guide almost never stopped to explain anything. We kept passing by and through some fascinating places. The tour guide in Chiang Mai took a lot of pride in his explanations of the scenery. This tour guide did not. It turned the whole experience into just a scenic bike ride rather than a 'tour.' - Bangkok has a lot to offer and I did this tour to help show off the city's nuances. For this, it was a waste of time and money.

Great way to get off the beaten path in Bangkok. My girlfriend and I took the half-day tour from 9 AM to 1 PM. It was the highlight of our time in Bangkok. Our tour took us to a pre-school, a muay thai school (which was closed unfortunately) and the greenest portions of Bangkok. The tour was very well organized and the staff was highly professional.Positives: I got to bike around some parts of Bangkok that I would never see otherwise. I highly recommend the morning tour because the temperatures were getting pretty high by the end of our tour but were perfect in the beginning. The tour was very well organized. When it was time for lunch, our food was waiting for us at the restaurant and still piping hot.Negatives: Safety could be an issue for people who are not experienced bike riders. We drove through some heavy traffic and areas where a fall could cause serious injury.

Excellent view on unknown parts of Bangkok during an exciting biking tour: Colors of Bangkok. I was surprised about the views and hospitality unknown parts of Bangkok have to offer to visitors, visiting those parts by bike, in a very varied, well organised and accompanied program. Next time in Bangkok, again I will discover parts of Bangkok by bike.

very nice trip, lovely guide. When in Bangkok my wife and I like to explore a bit. We liked to go biking with Co van Kessel. This time we decided to visit the other side of Bangkok and made a walking/rickshaw trip with recreational Bangkok Biking. Like the trips with Co this was really a very nice experience! We do recomend this trip. Next time we are in Bangkok we will certainly try one of the other trips.When you try one of these trips and you meet the very nice guide named "Kook" ask her for the meaning of her name :-)Bob and Cecilia Bekaert from Holland

A MUST DO in Bangkok. We spend an in transit day in Bangkok and did the colours tour from 1pm to 5pm. What an incredible way to see the "real" Bangkok!The cycle takes you through an amazing variety of areas you would never be able to go to otherwise (go to the website for a description). It's a flat ride and easy if you are reasonably fit. Our guide was incredible (Mon). She was extremely knowledgeable on all the sights and full of enthusiasm. A highly recommended afternoon!

If you are in Bangkok, don't miss this. RBB gives you the possibility to see Bangkok from another site. You come on places where you normally don't come as a tourist, you meet local people. By doing this ride, you also supporting these people. You can choose for a half day (bike) or a full day (bike+boot). All you need are sport shoes and easy fitting clothes. RBB provides lunch and water during the trip.Don't forget your camera. They present the same program in Chiang Mai.
i get a nice overview over the city of bangkok. nice and friendly guide, nice boat trip, im allowed too change the saddle :-)greatings to the duch girls ....

Bangkok, same same... but different!. I've been to Bangkok 6 times, this bicycle tour was by far the most interesting I've ever done here.. You start at the biking base, owned by a nice Dutch guy, and from there you will be guided by nice Thai tourguide. Their English is good, and they tell you a lot about the areas you'll be guided through. The tour takes you through authentic Thai neighbourhoods, the people who live here donot have a lot of money, but the difference to us Westerly people is that they are truly happy - even without all the materialistics we seem to need in our world. The tour lasts approx. 4 hours, including a lunch at a typical Thai restaurant. Good food, nice people again. It's not only biking, you will be ferried across the river 2 times, in typical Thai longboats. Big fun. I recommend this to everyone who wants to see more of Bangkok than just markets and nightlife.

Great bicycle trip in and around Bangkok. We highly recommend this trip! We had a trip for about 5 hours, and went from the poor parts of Bangkok to the jungle right outside of Bangkok. The bikes were in great state and the cycling was mostly thru parts with little or no traffic at all. Great for taking pictures and seeing parts which you'd normally never see.

biking through bangkok. We did the bike tour in November 2010 in Bangkok...we´ve been four people and we all totally loved it...it was really worth it and the most beautiful thing we have done in Bangkok...It is really to recommend if you wanna see something different than shopping centers and smog :))) you feel like in another world during the tour...you see so much different things...go for it!

Great time with a Great Guide! Looked after my kids well with patience and love!. i went on a Colors of Bangkok Weekend edition with my kids (6 & 8 years old) and my wife last Saturday.This from the moment we arrived, to getting the kids sorted on their bikes. Then having kiddy rider chairs attached to our bikes in case the kids gave up half way (which i am glad they didnt), and just having everyone being really considerate, caring, and looking out for us all the way!The tour was wonderful! I know my kids had great fun! Khun Kai, our assigned guide was wonderfully patient with looking after all and I am glad that we managed to search out Bangkok Biking to spend a day with! When i arrived home yesterday, my daughter was still recounting the experience of the ride and talking about the meal at the floating market which she enjoyed vividly!I certainly look forward to more adventures with the crew the next time I am in town! i would recommend this trip for a different side of Bangkok.

Highly Reccomended!. It was our first time to Bangkok and I had spent a number of hours reading reviews on Trip Advisor as to what to do whilst there. I wanted to do something different and fun that would also allow us to see parts of the city that we wouldn't have neccesarily discovered ourselves. I read reviews about the bike tour and proceeded to book it and I must say it was one of the highlights of our time in Bangkok. The booking process was simple and quick. On arrival we were greeted by a friendly tour guide Mon whose English was really good. She was very sweet and gave us a lot of information whilst taking us around parts of the city. The tour itself wasn't too strenious and is suitable for most ages. The only negative is that I think we should have been given the option to wear cycle helmets as we rode on the main roads which was a little hair raising at times. Overall a great day out, good value for money and definitley a great way to see the city. Especially as we were in parts that were far away from where the usual tourists hang out.

One Great Adventure through city and nature!. One word: fantastic! In just one bike trip we've seen a lot of different types of neighbourhoods, people, nature, animals and more. And it's 100% safe because the guide uses small roads.

A Bangkok Must!. We did a private tour "Colors of Bangkok - Weekend Edition" and had a great day! Even our one and half year old daughter enjoyed it very much.As the tour was private we could go at our own pace, which worked out well for our daughter. Our tour guide Kai was great, very friendly, helpful and patient. I would recommend the weekend trip, firstly because the traffic is much less (a small portion of the trip uses main roads) and secondly, my favorite part was the floating market (which is only on weekends).

new experience in Bangkok. we took the afternoon tour.It was agreat and exciting experience for everybody.All together we were eight in a group which is a perfect size.Our tour guide was very helpful even explaing details during our bicycle tour We made 24 km during thisn afternoon, manageable for every body. To escape from noisy Bangkok its a must to discover Bangkok by bike

Excellent experience...a must do in Bangkok. We enjoyed the Colours of Bangkok bike ride very much but would advise as an older rider (over 55's) you must be a confident bike rider as some of the sections of the ride are along narrow paths and you have to be able to manouver through narrrow sections. Roads & pavements in Bangkok are not as smooth & even as they are in Australia. We were a group of 6 plus our wonderful guide 'Mon' and it was an amazing experience through the most interesting parts of Bangkok.Thankyou Mon for being the best guide and thanks for patching up Anne when she had her spill!One of the highlights of our trip through ThailandJulie from Melbourne

If you can only do 1 thing in Bangkok, make it this.. Out of all the trips I've taken this year (11 so far), biking in Bangkok is my favorite. Andre, the owner of Recreational Bangkok Biking, was our guide and he showed us a side of the city hidden to most of the world. I think it's fair to say you haven't seen Bangkok unless you've done this tour. We did the colors of Bangkok tour and rode past immaculate villas, through "slums" (for lack of better words) - which was my favorite as the people race over to see you and say hello while the kids high-five you as you zoom past, in and out of parks, and through the jungles. We even got on a long-tail boat w/ out bikes at one point! One of the things I like most about Recreational Bangkok Biking in comparison to other biking companies is that Andre only uses locally owned businesses during the tour (for the boat ride and the lunch) and he also sponsors a much needed preschool for the underprivileged kids. Overall, I wouldn't just recommend this to people, I would insist they do it. It's that good.

best tour in bangkok !!!, away from the avious tourist things.. We didn't think it was possible "biking in Bangkok" but boy were we wrong!it's not difficult, it's not extremely hot, it's not heavy en tiring ...==> It is a absolutely fantastic and a beautiful experience !!!You ride 15 minutes away from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok and arrive in a totally different world off peace, orchid farms, rich and poor suburbs, . . .You see daily thai life enfolding before your eyes.You stop frequently for drinks, not in 7/11 but local shops, nice!The guide that is going with you is a nice, friendly, funny thai professionel.We recommend this tour's to all people who want more dan the standard things to do in Bangkok.Go and explore the other beautiful side from Bangkok by bike!mr. Ben Van Doninck & mr. Wim KeysersBrussels - Belgium.

SURPRISES all around!. It all started when my Mum came to Bangkok to surprise me whilst I was travelling around with a friend. I had booked a tour with Andre and couldn't wait to do the tour. Little did I know my Mum had also booked on the same tour having Andre keeping this well kept secret. The organisation of the tour was fantastic, our guide 'Guy" was fantastic and very entertaining! We enjoyed our leisure stroll through the "Slums" of Bangkok and our Rickshaw ride through the outskirts of the city. The lunch was beautiful and I can find no faults with this company. A BIG thank you to Andre and all who work for him. This truly is a credit to the integrity they entail. Well done!

Biking with a good conscience.. Hi everyone, I know it is a jungle out there and finding a good place to go and finding the right sightseeing tours is so difficult. the holiday is always too short and you don´t want to waste it on silly mainstream things. I was so lucky to find this little company offering sincere and great sightseeing on bike. It was all the way through a great experience, our tourguide was very sweet and the bikes were looking great. All in all I have had a great experience and it is not the last time I have used recreational Bangkok Biking.
Colours of Bangkok - fantastic. Have done two trips with this company - 1 bicycle tour and 1 rickshaw tour. Great time both tours. Highly recommended. Great guide - "Guy."
Awesome. Highly reccomended for outgoing people. Not reccomended for soft lazy people. Be mindful there is a bit of riding through Bangkok traffic but was a real buzz for me.

Nice welcome, great guide, a real must do in bangkok!. Hello,We stayed in bangkok in september and we did the weekend tour with bangkok biking. It was a real experience, you see the real bangkok and things you would not see if you didn't take a bike tour! Our guide was very friendly and had quite good knowledge of the city and it's customs. We took a tour thru the green heart of bangkok and the slums. In a few words: A real recommendation!Thanks again for the nice time you gave us! If we ever come back to bangkok we would take the tour again...greetings from belgiumDaisy and Jason

Daily life view of Bangkok. This day cycling through Bangkok was a great experience! I have now seen parts of the outskirts of Bangkok, where tourists are a rarity and which are really worth seeing. After having seen the Grand Palace, the temples and the other highlights, this tour shows the face of Bangkok of the people that live there now and who are not part of the royal family.

Bangkok Biking july 2010. It was really nice to see the city by bike.You will see an other part of Bangkok than normal, especially a green part.Sometimes it was exciting because of the space you had for your bike, but it was nice.We had to bicycle behind the guide, sometimes it was going very fast so you had to make your photographs while you was bicycling. But the photographs are very nice and give a good show of Bangkok.

Very impressive tour through bangkok. Very fast response to email enquiries.Very flexible appointment handling.You start, when you are ready, even 15 minutes before planned.Very good guides (I made two trips with two different guides, both very very good).The tour itself was veeery impressive to see in very short time, many different parts (colors) of bangkok.Anytime again. Thank you.

Fantastic trip - see the "secret" Bangkok. When in Bangkok, dont miss the opportunity to go on a bicycle ride with Recreational Bangkok Biking, its really value for money. You get away from all the turist traps and see places that you dont read about in the turist guide books. Also you get some execise :-)When going to Bangkok again, we will for sure take another bikeride.

Bangkok Biking - Loved It!. It was great being taken away from the usual tourist traffic to see the real Bangkok. Having seen some of the poorer parts of Bangkok and a working factory unit we headed to the river where we experienced a mini cruise at speed to the other side. Once there we cycled through the jungle on pathways used by locals, we passed local houses, went to a Thai country estate to see the million fish in the pond and then on to the floating market.The market was wonderful and our guide bought us various local food samples to try (which we would never have tried on our own) before we headed back to the jungle to a small restaurant/cafe for lunch. After lunch we headed back towards the city, stopping at a few wonderful temples on the way. Our guide could not have been more friendly and helpful and the Thai people (as you find everywhere) were wonderful. This really was a great day out and excellent value for money.

Worth every Baht!. We did the Colours of Bangkok Tour along with our 2 year old son and it was one of the highlights of our trip.We have been to Bangkok several times but on this tour we experienced a whole new side of the city. We will take another tour the next time as it was a real pleasure!

remember Bangkok forever with this bicycle tour. I made the trip Colors of Bangkok twice in one year; the first time with a group of about 10 colleagues, and the last time with only my wife (during the unstable political situation). The bikes were perfect, with 21 gears, comfortable saddle, just what you want when you are used to a good bike at home. After a short tour in the slums we crossed the river and biked through the "jungle", i.e. plantations with paved roads and concrete paths through the swamps. Regular stops with drinks and a lunch were included. The pictures and movie on the website offer a good impression. The guides were very enthousiastic and their explanations of the special features were to the point. Also they took good care of the group as a whole to guide them back through the heavy traffic (driving left can be a special hazard!) to the starting point. Too hot to ride a bike? definitely not, because the wind cools you down, but head protection and sunblocker are a must. Rain? no problem, we found shelter when a tropical storm hit us, and after 15 minutes we could continue the trip. Our advice: don't just visit the many temples and tailors when you visit Bagkok, but plan a bicycle too. It will be one of the highlights of your trip, nad certainly one of the days you will still remember years later.

Top Tour!!!. My teenage kids loved this trip. Excellent value for money and a real eye opener on the "real Bangkok". Excellent tour providing a good insight to the broader aspects of life in this great city. Highly recommended!!!

Possibility to see real Bangkok. Amazing.. We were only 3 days in Bangkok and this trip was possibility to visit such places that we would not find if we spend there 3 years. And with maximum safety. Thank you very much for real colors of Bangkok.

An adventurous trip in a beautiful city. I booked the trip on two separate visits to Bangkok. Each trip was an adventure in itself, and both times I experienced both the city, the big park, the river, friendly people, and so on. What I remember most from the first trip is feeding the fishes in the park. On the second trip the guide and I encountered a procession for a young man who was due to become a monk. Tips: wear good shoes, use sun tan, don't be afraid of the traffic!
A different view on Bangkok. Most people know Bangkok as a bussy city,but on the other side of the river is a complete different Bangkok to discover. Using a bike is the perfect way

Take a peek behind the curtains of Bangkok. Bangkok Biking was one of our best experiences in Bangkok! It's just amazing how many different aspects of Bangkok you pass through in just a few hours. People living their daily lives, children going to school in their uniformes, villas of the rich but but also the houses of the less wealthy, nature so close to the city.... If you want to see another side of Bangkok and you enjoy to ride a bike, this is the thing to do!!

Just great and exciting!. I did the tour the 2nd time and it was as great as the first time. I just can recommend the tour to everybody. It is exciting to see another side of Bangkok by bike and with the guidance of well trained people this trip is worth the money.I just can say - do it if you have the chance!

A SIde of Bangkok I Have Never Seen Before!. I have been to Thailand many times, but Bangkok has never been one of my favorite destinations, Ive always considered it an aggravating place full of touts, tuk tuks and dreadful traffic. Well, I am so glad I did this tour, because now I have seen a totally different side of Bangkok. Everyone we met all day was so friendly, a fantastic reminder of why people call Thailand the Land of Smiles! It was so refreshing to get away from all the tourist traps and meet the real people of Bangkok. Our guide was Gai, he is really awesome, his English was totally fluent, and he was full of fascinating information on all the places we went. He was very contientious of our safety and comfort at all times, there are plenty of rest stops and he always made sure we had plenty of drinks and snacks. Because you are cycling, you never get too hot because the air circulates around you, the only time I felt a bit hot was when we stopped. The biking is not too strenuous, unless you are extremely unfit you should not have any problems. There is no pressure to rush, you can take your time and go at your own pace, or stop at any time for photo opportunities.I know many people who have gone to Bangkok, gone to all the tourist traps and come back with a bad impression of the city that it is full of scams and touts. This is a real shame, I would recommend this trip to anyone who comes to Bangkok, to see the real Thailand. Next time I am in Bangkok I will definately be doing a longer tour with the company.

The other side of Bangkok, quiet, green, excellent, the perfect end of our honeymoon.... While this time was for most of the people from Bangkok and Thailand a very hard time because of the strikes and the violence in May 2010, we can say we were very lucky doing this trip with a personal, friendly and very helpful guide of Recreational Bangkok Biking. By the time we did the trip, the strikes were just finished.The very last day of our honeymoon, we did this very nice trip and saw things you wouldn't believe you're in the capital of Thailand, one of the biggest metropoles of the World. Most of the trip was in the district of Thonbury, the other side of the River. A landscape you shoud believe you're in the coutryside far far from big towns, industry and shopping malls. Biking on narrow streets you cross green lush gardens of the never ending friendly people of Thailand, pass schools and temples while having all the information you need to understand the way of living.This trip is more than worth it. When we come back to Thailand (hopefully), for sure we book one of your other trips.Thanks for this and congratulations for your company !!!Bart and Lore,MoorsledeBelgium

Bangkok by Bike - a unique experience. We really enjoyed our half-day trip (Colours of Bangkok) by bike trough Bangkok. We experienced the true Bangkok accompanied by wonderful and helpful guides. Even though there is a lot of traffic in the city, we took quite and charming roads and tracks. 100% recommendable

Very impressive tour. I did this tour with Bangkokbiking in March 2010. The instructor was very nice, spoke really good English and didn't hesitate to answer all our many questions. It was also very interesting to listen to her when she told ous storys about Bangkok's population.We were a group of about 6 persons. The bikes were not the latest ones, but the breaks worked very well and they were comfortable.What i liked most was the ride through a/the slum of Bangkok.It's really fascinating!!!!!With this tour you see corners of Bangkok where you won't go to as tourist!!When you are in Bangkok and you have time, do this tour!It's really recommendable!

One of the best things to do in Bangkok!. I definitely recommend Bangkok Biking. It's the best way to see Bangkok in a different way. Booking is very simple and Bangkok Biking responds very quickly. The lunch, the guides and the bikes are perfect.

Highlight of Bangkok. I did this trip a couple of weeks ago, only getting around to doing the review now. I did the weekend colours of Bangkok day trip. I emailed the offices the night before to see if there was any availability and I got a promt reply to confirm there was. I booked my place and wondered how they were going to fill 6+ hours cycling.I turned up at the office the following morning, being my first time in Bangkok I got a taxi. I was the last of our group to arrive. There was only 4 other on the tour, an American and a Swiss couple. Our tour guide was Mon and what fantastic guide she was. She was so enthuastic and seemed to be enjoying herself as much as the rest of us.We left the offices and the first few minutes (and return journey to the office) were the only busy roads we cycled on. After a short cycle we were going down small alley ways into where the locals lived. It was hot but cycling kept us cool. There was plenty of stops for water on the way. We put our bikes onto a boat and crossed into the green lung of Bangkok (I think thats what it was called)! We cycled around a park, fed the fish, went to a market, tasted the local food, got on a rickshaw, had lunch, visited a temple. The whole time Mon gave us a detailed commentary of what we were looking at, answered anything we asked and took a genuine interest in the people on the tour. I personnally chatted to her on the return cycle for about 30 minuted telling her about Ireland and it's history. I can't praise her highly enough.My enthusiasm for this trip probably doesn't come accross in the review but all I'll say is if you're in Bangkok you must do this trip. It's fantastic. I even left business cards in my hotel reception to try and spread the word! Don't be put off at the thoughts of cycling for hours in the heat, it's not like that at all. One of the ladies on our tour was about 6 months pregnant and it was no problem to her. All the bikes are in super condition too. The highlight of my time in Thailand. If you get Mon as your guide, even better!

Bangkok by bike: A total different sightseeing tour!. We bokked the trip in March 2010 as we heared about Bangkok biking. When we arrived at the office of Bangkok Biking our sympatic tour leader Thomas welcomed us very friendly. We could choose our bikes (which were in a very good condition!) an together with another couple an the tour leader Thomas an a second member of the team (which was always driving at the end and reassuring that nobody lost his wya) off we went. The trip through districts you never see as a "normal" tourist as amazing. We drove between small houses (like little villages), crossed the river with a boat and passed through quaters near the river (houses and streets on stilts, all people were smiling, saying and hello: AMAZING. we got an total new impression of the other "real Bangkok live, it was like driving through land villages. Very funny, safe and interesting. Just go on the webpage of bangkok BIking and you find good fotos of the trip such as a good description. We would recommend this trip by bike through unknown districts of Bangkok to ervery visitor!
I did this tour on my fourth trip to.... I did this tour on my fourth trip to Bangkok and Its showed me a completely different side to the city. Fantastic tour. I highly recomend it

Do you want to do something special..??. We made a biking-tour in Bangkok, with the crew of Bangkok Biking. Booked the trip via Internet. Service and contact was good.At the day itself, at the office in Bangkok, the receptionist welcomed us by heart. Very pleasant. We joined a group of 8 persons. All Dutch. next time when we visit Bangkok we will make another tour, but than a private one.We had a very nice guide. Told a lot of things during the trip, made me feel safe, in htis metropole. He took the resposibilities, and made us feel comfortable.And for most of all we saw Bangkok in a different way, than when you go by taxi, or tuk-tuk. We really enjoyed it.We can recommand the Bangkok Biking tour. After. we came back, we were asked how the trip was. Crew was interesed in there guest.thank you......

Great day seeing all aspects of Bangkok. We had a lot of fun on our tour. Our guide was very friendly and happy to answer any of our questions. We did the Colours of Bangkok half day tour and we definitely saw parts of the city that we never would have seen otherwise. Peddling through the slums and waving to all the little kids was great, and then riding across raised walkways through dense jungle in the lung of bangkok was very interesting. We did the morning tour, and I'm glad we did because by the time we got back it was getting very hot. Thankfully we were well supplied with drinks, and an ice-cold towel upon our return. I would definitely recommend this trip :)

Colors of Bangkok trip. My husband and I participated in the Bangkok extended day weekend trip and also the Chiang Mai day trip. Both were superb! The guides in both cases were informative and our small group experience was just plain fun. We do like to ride bikes while at home, but we're not what I would call "avid cyclists" so these outings are fine for a wide range of people who want to explore to the outskirts of a community to see areas they wouldn't normally see. Safety issues were dealt with competently and we appreciated the diversity of the tours. This company was recommended to us by friends who had traveled with them before and I wouldn't hesitate to do the same. Thanks so much for two great days!

want to see a different part of Bangkok?. Together with my family, including 2 older people and a one year old, we made a great tour with Bangkok Biking. It was my third time in Bangkok and I wanted to surprise my family who had never been there before. It was a great tour and even I was surprised to see parts of Bangkok that I had never seen before. It was nice to catch some fresh air and we really enjoyed feeding the big fish. The bikes were great and the tour guide was very friendly. The food in the restaurant near the bridge was not so good but I would still recommend this tour to anyone.

See Bangkok the different way, must-do!. We did the Colors of Bangkok-weekend edition. We did not know what to expect, and it was absolutely one of our highlights of our holiday in Thailand! By bike (very comfortable modern city/ATB-bikes) touring though the slumps of Bangkok, the jungle (The Lung of Bangkok), places where we as Europeans ourselves were the attractions, local markets, boattrips. We got the chance to see the other side of Bangkok! Hard to actually write down all, something you just need to experience. A must-do, when you're staying in Bangkok!!! We were guided by a local guy, Tao, very friendly! He lives in the Lung of Bangkok (the jungle and local market). Next year we plan to go to Chiang Mai, and since Bangkok Biking also has a Chiang Mai-biking, we will certainly do the biking in Chiang Mai as well!!Andre, thanks!!
Very interesting tour through a Bangkok you would not have seen otherwise. Friendly scout and very good tour - we really saw a different side of the city.

Take a Ride. Wow, we did this the second day in Thailand with our 2 boys aged 10 and 12, fabulous the experience stuck in our minds as one of our highlights of our month long trip.
