Kai our guide was enthusiastic and no request was to difficult, it certainly gave us an insight to the real Bangkok also great valus for money compared to alot of the things we did throughout our travels. Go Bangkok Biking

Try this great biking tour. I booked online for the Colors of Bangkok half day tour. I received a friendly response and confirmation within 24 hours. On the day of my tour, no one else had booked so I had a private tour. The guide spoke excellent English, and was fun.This is a really interesting biking tour. If you read thru previous reviews you'll see the highlights, such as riding thru the narrow alleyways of the slum areas, stopping at a school, T-shirt factory, crossing the river on a longtail boat with the bikes, and riding thru an amazing green area of Bangkok. It's wonderful to see these places that are so different than the tourist areas of Bangkok. The people we met along the way were all very friendly.There are stops during the tour for cool drinks (provided), or photo stops when you want. A delicious lunch is also provided at a restaurant next to the river Chao Phraya.You don't have to be an expert cyclist to do this tour. I'm in my 50's and at home I only ride short distances occasionally, mostly on flat roads. There were a few places that I didn't feel too confident, so I just walked my bike until I got through those places (such as a very narrow alley, or a sharp turn on the concrete path in the jungle area). The guide is very good about leading through the traffic areas, but I did feel a bit nervous being in Bangkok traffic with my limited biking experience. The guide made sure I got through safely.I highly recommend this tour. Don't be afraid to try it. You'll really enjoy it!

BKK Highlight. A few months ago I traveled to Bangkok and Laos with my teen-daughter, it was not our first time in this region we have seen and done a lot already. Having said so, the half day Colors of Bangkok was an unexpected highlight: Professional and enthousiastic guide, well maintained bicycles, good local food during the trip and so exciting to see the 'real' Bangkok from a bike-perspective !

Great experience for entire family!. Our family of five, including three kids ages 13, 13 and 15, did the Colors of Bangkok Tour while visiting Bangkok for the first time. It was a wonderful experience for all of us. Although I was initially worried about the heat, it turned out to be much cooler riding the bike in the daytime (the breeze generated) than it was walking around Bangkok at night. I won't go into detail about all that you see with this tour as other reviewers have already done that, but I will say that it really does show a side of Bangkok that you wouldn't otherwise see. And the Thai people are absolutely wonderful - smiling, welcoming even as you are practicially riding right through their living rooms.I will also say that the bike ride is not overwhelming, if you can ride a bike you can do it. Loved this tour, and have to also say that our guide, Mon, was fantastic. She taught my 15-year old how to count from 1 to 10 in Thai!

something very special. A really interesting and fascinating way to discover the green as well as the urban life of southern bangkok . Next to the hussle and bustle of a huge city , areas where probably most average Bangkokians have not discovered as yet.

Highlight of our trip to Thailand - a wonderful experience. My husband and I had such a great time cycling around Bangkok for the day. We saw places and experienced things we would have never seen left to our own devices. Our guide Mon was an absolute delight. For anyone travelling to Bangkok this tour is a 'must do', you wont regret it!

THIS 5 STAR EXCURSION***** IS WORTH E-V-E-R-Y BATH !!!. Just Do It !Two days before our rountrip thru Thailand, we heard of "Colors of Bangkok". After some quick mailtraffic with Andre Breuer, we could make a reservation to go for a ride on our first and only "free" afternoon in Bangkok. After touch down in Bangkok and two hours of rest, we went by cab to the "Colors of Bangkok" address. We met Andre and our guide for this afternoon named Mon. She explained the "rules". She gave confident to us. At 13.00 hrs. we left on almost new bikes (plus gears...you need it !). The ride was FLABBERGASTING. Riding thru all kinds of Bangkok quarters, a longtail boatride along river Chao Praya (incl. the bikes !), a meal in a local restau, villa's of the rich, riding thru the living rooms (literally) of the slum houses (super friendly people), small temple, a stop at a thai boxing school, you can participate in a fight if you want...(not us), riding over 1,5 mtrs above the water lying bicycle paths, all was great. And that almost avoiding all the crazy motoring traffic, very good route. Our group was only seven people, so good to handle for Mon and easy to communicate with all the participants. Please be sure to wear sun protections (hat, cap and maybe even long sleeves as the sun is BURNING here, even if it's cloudy). Thank you Andre and Mon, we enjoyed every meter of this tour and if ever coming back to Bangkok, we will enter again. Best regards, Sam, Hanneke, Fiona, Jasper.

An experience you shouldn't miss. Last January my friends and I went on a biking tour in Bangkok with "Recreational Bangkok Biking". It realy was a fantastic experience, no one should miss when you are in Bangkok and have a day or half day to spend. They take you to a very special place, at the other side of the Chao Phraya river. It's a green oasis, with concrete cycle paths, you don't know this could even exist in the neighbouhood of such a huge metropole. It's also called the green lungs of Bangkok. The escort is realy reliable, you don;t have to be afraid of traffic on your way to the river, they know how to get there without crossing too many busy roads. We had a tropical shower on the way and were able to shelter with a local family, they were very hospitable, had a great time. So, if you are in Bangkok and you would like to see a part of Bangkok you never could reach by car or tuktuk, just book a tour with Recreational Bangkok Biking!

Best way to experience real people of Bangkok. Coming from Holland, biking is our routine but in Bangkok it's becomes a real experience again. Away form the hussle and bussle of the city center, we visited the slums with very small alleyways, traveled bike in long tail boat to the wetlands and had a feast of nice Thai food at the floating market. People were friendly and didn't even mind that we almost ride straight into their homes

a great highlight of our Thailand holiday. With our great experience in Bangkok, we also did a tour in Chang May. In The Netherlands, we already booked for Bangkok Paradise and Best of Bangkok to make sure we could make both trips.We have not regretted it. With a friendly and knowledgeable guide we made a beautiful trip through the water area on narrow paths over the water and through the slums, with lots of beautiful nature and nice boat trips through areas where you as a tourist will never come.It was a great great experience ! The second day we were treated after a morning cycling on a delicious typical Thai aromatherapy massage in one of the best spas in Bangkok, a very pleasant relaxed exclusive knowledge using the traditional Thai massage.We can heartily recommend everyone Bangkok Biking, you should not miss this if you stay in Bangkok for a few days, it's really a must to book one or more tours ! Frans & Hanne, Deventer, The Netherlands

The best way to see the real Bangkok. If you are in Bangkok - don't go shopping, but grab a bike and see the real city. See how local people live, work, eat. Smell the parks, not the cars. See little markets, not international shopping malls. Ask your individual tour guide whatever you want. Cross the rivers on boats, see the skyscrapers from far remote. Take home some incredible impressions, which you will never forget.An absolute must!

An insider to the other side of Bangkok!. My bf and I absolutely enjoyed the biking trip as we saw a side of Bangkok we never thought we'll see! My favourite part is cycling down the tiny alleys and meeting and being greeted so warmly by the locals and of course the boat trip to an island for a feeding fish frenzy, the local food setting and the temples tour were really fun:) I guess the only flaw of the trip was the butt ache after being on the bike but it was a great work out nonetheless!

Great Experience!. My wife and I saw more of Bangkok in 6 hours than we could ever expect to see in the three days we were there. Our guide took us to so many great locations that we never would have thought of had it just been the two of us. The ride was leisurely paced with several opportunities to stop and enjoy the scenery, which was breathtaking. The boat rides were refreshing, the local foods were eye-opening and delicious, and our guide was overly accommodating. I took a lot of great video on the bike/rikshaw/boat ride. I recommend this tour for anyone who wants to see the true Bangkok and everything it has to offer.Rod

the highlight of our vacation. This was the best trip we ever made, you get so see bangkok in a very different way, it's just very impressive, this company has very experienced staff who will guide you all the way. we made this trip 2 times and next time, when we visit bangkok, we will do it again.for us, it was the best way to discover bangkok.My advice is, just book it and enjoy !

A Great Adventure with a great Guide. This 5 hour tour was a fantastic way of seeing parts of Bangkok that give you an insight on how the locals live away from the tourist centres. The ride is comfortable and would suit anyone with a modest level of fitness. Our guide was polite, helpful and allowed us to mix with the locals in a friendly and courteous way.

It does what it promises to do: biking off tourist tracks. When you are in Bangkok for leasure or business (like I was) it is highly recommended to go for the recreational biking tour 'Colors of Bangkok'. You see places you wouldn't go to when being on a traditional tour. You don't need to be a sportsman at all to follow the group. Furthermore, for me it was important to notice the 'corporate social responsibility' policy of the company.

Wet & soki! Nice tour.. De tour was great, specialy the guide performing was really good. He was the best English speaking Thai i've meet in Thailand.The boat tour with the bikes over the river was nice too.Beste Regards,Jurre Kruse

A great way to discover Bangkok. Do you think a Tuktuk is THE way to discover the Thai capital? You're wrong! Bangkok Biking offers an 'true' experience in different areas of the city, that are for sure not often visited by tourists. I even sang karaoke at a local market, a great experience! We enjoyed it a lot! Great Pad Thai for lunch, what else do you need?

Wow!! What an adventure!! Recommended!!. My wife and I took this tour after seeing how high it was rated on Tripadvisor's "Best BAngkok Activities" section, and I'm SO glad we did - what an adventure!! Initially, my wife had two concerns - the heat and the distance - so I feel those points are worth addressing: Once you are on the bike, the breeze is great, and you're much cooler than standing still in the shade. As long as you remember to drink water, have a hat (or hair I guess) and use sunscreen, you'll be comfortable. After the tour, we both agreed that heat was not a problem at all (our day was 38c and humid). As for the distance, the pace is absolutely relaxed, and appropriate for a non-cyclist. There are no hills, and no sprinting, just easy cruising with frequent stops. Being in traffic was not a problem at all (you're only in it for a few minutes)...we just followed the guide, signalled when appropriate, and everything was fine...though traffic can be heavy, Thai drivers don't seem to display the same aggression that I see here at home - everybody just makes things work, so don't let a little traffic put you off - it was fine, and our guide took charge when necessary to make sure everyone was safe. Our guide J.J. (and new hire Thomas) were both fantastic!! Helpful, easy going, with a great sense of humor. I absolutely recommend this tour as an adjunct to the more usual temple visits, street markets, etc. (a couple of days of that was enough for us). We got there by taxi, but on the way home, we just took a short taxi ride to the BTS station and rode it to our hotel. Either worked fine. I'd recommend booking ahead, but for us it was a last minute decision to go (fortunately they had room), so when we called from ourt hotel, they faxed us a map so we could show the taxi driver where it was - that was very helpful. This tour was fun, informative, educational, and allowed us to connect with wonderful, interesting people, and for me that's what travel is all about. Do it!

Don't be afraid- just do it!. I'm not a huge cyclist. My husband is. He begged me to go on this 5 hour tour of Bangkok on a bicycle, in the afternoon in February. I thought it was crazy, but I said yes and was secretly looking forward to hating it and collecting brownie points from the hubby. I was so wrong. This tour was fabulous. We went with one other couple, our guide JJ (he was so great- and funny!), and Thomas, a guide in training (also great). Like the other reviews we saw the slums, sweatshops, river crossing on a long tail boat, national park, jungle, and a great dinner on the river. The best part was the people you meet... riding 2 feet from the door of their houses and they all smile, wave, say hello, little kids running out to high five you and say "hello". It has left me with a completely different impression of this big noisy city. The bikes were comfortable with quite an upright seated position (I'm used to riding a mountain bike at home) and the route was very flat. The few minutes that you are in traffic are very safe and organized. JJ did a great job of keeping our group together. Bring a water bottle, your camera, and an adventurous attitude. You will not regret it.

Super Bangkok trip on a bicycle!!. It is the best way to discover Bangkok a different way than usual! On a bicycle with Bangkok Biking I saw Bangkok in a complete different way and enjoyed it very much. The bikes were super, the guide was very good and also very informative and I saw loads!We cycled through the busy city, the jungle, slumps and great neighbourhoods! It was fantastic. Bring water, your camera and enjoy it all. You can even take bicycle trips in Chiang Mai aswell for several days. Bangkok Biking has different lengths of trips. Check them out!!!André, thank you very much!

Biking in Bangkok. In December we booked a bicycle Tour through colors of Bangkok. It was a great experience. We made a half day tour through Bangkok Slums and then to the other side of the river through the green surrounding area of Bangkok. We had a great time and enjoyed it a lot. It was the most relaxing and enjoying thing we did in Bangkok. Something very special which do just a few people. We had the afternoon tour and were alone with a tour guide. It was so much fun for a reasonable price. For everybody who is looking for something else than the tourist attractions this is the thing to do.

Bangkok Paradise - Fun Adventure. This was a really great bike ride to see a different side of Bangkok. Much more of a cultural expereience and interesting to see how locals live. The ride included many stops with unique refreshments. Our guide, Mon, was great.All in all it was a great way to spend our last day in Thailand and Bangkok. We felt we saw a much different side of Bangkok than the typical tourist attractions.

amazing for the experienced traveller. Although Im not a big bicycle fan i must say that i thoroughly enjoyed my bicycle trip with Bangkok Biking.The reason i would choose Bangkok Biking again is that it didnt feel like i was joining any group tour. Got a very exclusive feeling (although i must say we took the private tour). Bikes were perfect and the trip was wonderful. First we went through the slums, then crossed the river in a longboat and then we rode through the almost jungle like backyard of Bangkok.Most amazing was the friendliness of all the people. After having done almost everything else in Bangkok and travelled all over and living in Asia for a long time this was definitely the highlight of our trip.

Get to know Bangkok. It was really interesting to make a trip to the other and very different side of Bangkok. As a tourist you mostly only see the loud and busy side of the city. With the biking tour you get to know a green, quiet and traditional side of the city.Our guide was a really nice guy, who introduced us to the bright colors of Bangkok. I still can smell the different scents and they will always be burned into my nose.

Great experience - a complete different view of Bangkok. Booking the biking tour we never expected to get through Bangkok alive (considering traffic). But we experienced a wonderful bike trip with a great guide showing us some real nice spots (park and nature) but also the "non touristic" parts of the city where people have close to nothing to live from but still have a friendly smile for the bikers coming by. I can definitely recommend this tour.

Unique Bike Tour of Bangkok. I had a great time and a unique experience on a bike tour with Colors of Bangkok. While I took other tours of Bangkok I got the chance to see parts of Bangkok that I would normally not have been able to see. We went into the neighborhoods ( rich and poor ones) and where able to see what life is like for the people who live there. Our guide explained in great deal what we were seeing. Some of the neigborhoods across the river in the jungle showed me a lifestyle that was a very different and I know I would not of had that experience without this trip. We also saw parks, shrines, schools and other interesting place.It was very relaxing. With moved at slow pace. It was a great way to spend the day for me

Just do it!. We really enjoyed this biking tour. The tour takes you through a variation of culture, mankind and ways of living, through the slums, through the developed districts but also in a very pieceful green part in the heart of Bangkok.We started at 8am when we left from the office of Bangkok Biking and returned around 1pm. One advise... smile... smile the whole trip long. Every where you go, you see people smiling and yelling: sawadeeee... Our advise is: do it!

Cycling in Bangkok. When I told friends that I intended to go on a cycling tour through Bangkok they must have thought that I finally went nuts. Notwithstanding natives wearing mouth masks to escape pollution, left-hand traffic and loads of vehicles following their direction but hardly any traffic rules this tour really openend my eyes to understand a tiny bit of Bangkok. You get to see places you hardly see on tv, you are explained each and every question you have, you are accompanied by open and friendly travellers and you sit on very comfy Dutch-style bikes. And if you are the scary type: it's not as dangerous as it sounds - we went off the big roads most of the time and faced the crazy traffic for the last 20 minutes only. Not to be missed!Karin from Berlin

Bangkok - the real view. If you want to see the town, the people and the beauty of Bangkok beyond the usual five-star-comfort-trips then you have to join the perfectly organized biking tours through the small and quiet places of Krungthep. Great places, excellent guides and many beautiful memories are guaranteed.

Experience Bangkok from a different perspective. During our relatively short stay in Bangkok of two days, we decided to do the highlights of Bangkok the first day, which means visiting the Grand Palace and some other temples. The second day we wanted to do something else, so we decided to do a full day cycling tour in and around Bangkok (Colours of Bangkok weekend edition with www.bangkokbiking.com).Our group consisted of 3 people with one English speaking guide. The tour was very well organised. We received new drinking water and other drinks many times and there was enough time for a lunch. My personal highlight of the day was visiting the market where we tried different Thai snacks and fruits. I also tried to ride a rickshaw which was more difficult than I thought and quite heavy although I didn’t have a passenger!The cycling was quite easy. Bangkok and it’s surroundings are quite flat which in my opinion means that everyone who can cycle can do this tour. You only have to get used to ride on the left side of the road (to which we are not used to as we are Dutchies). Moreover the bicycles are of good quality, if I hadn’t got a good bike at home I would definitely want a bike like this!

seeing the real bangkok. we had this ride named colors of Bangkok , we enjoyed it a lot, it is very mild and any one who can balance on bike would do it smoothly, a nice sightseeing, our guide called Mon did a great job and she was very friendly and professional.

Great biking experience in Bangkok!. We had a lovely day with a guide who was excellent. Kind of private tour. We sealed the deal by email from Holland prior to the trip. If you want to experience Bangkok on a different level, this is a great way to do it.

Cycling in Bangkok an experience you need to explore.. You might think twice before taking a cycling tour in the middle of Bangkok city, but if you just take common sense it will be an experience of a life time. Me and my wife took the tour with Bangkok Biking ( www.bangkokbiking.com ) and the guide clearly explained what to expect and which route he was planning to take. As we jumped onto the bikes entering the heavy traffic of Bangkok you immediately get the feeling that you’re entering another dimension. Although the traffic around you seems chaotic, it all falls into place when get part of it and the traffic is not as chaotic as it might seems. Enjoy this moment, because before you know it you already leaving the main roads and you entering the city behind the scenes. As we entered a small alley we entered a complete different world, a world you might have seen from up above while looking out of your hotel window. What seems like some suburbs is actually a peek into the real Bangkok. The people where really friendly and you can see that they work hard to make a living. Children especially welcome you by running onto the street, “Hello, Hello” “Bye, Bye” hoping that you give them a high five. We had several stops and you can just relax and enjoy looking around see how life is made. And with the help of our guide we’d even got into contact with the locals and there profession. A lot of the clothes are sewed within these suburbs while factories provide them the pre-cut fabrics. Even the government offers them orders to sew the clothes of the military. As we leave this beautiful environment it makes you realize that although live is hard it’s still pure, and honest.By ferry “small wooden boat” we now on our way to the artificial island to visit the park. As you cycle within the mangrove on the small elevated tracks to keep them free of the water the scenery is astonishing. We’d never expect to see this within Bangkok, but it was a welcome relieve to enjoy the silence and to smell the senses of forest and nature. Finally we managed our way on the small tracks and entered the actual park with beautiful ponds with lot of fish. The park is mainly visited by the locals in the weekends, and we’re there on a Tuesday and had the park to our self’s. As we left the park we visiting some temples and made a wish wile pressing the gold leave on the sleeping Buddha. Again we crossed the river by small ferry and again entered busy Bangkok and had lunch at a riverside restaurant. Lunch was great and it may sound unbelievable but I do love Asian food, even in the morning I enjoy every bite. After lunch again hopped onto our bikes to visit a boxing school, these schools prevent children of the suburbs to get off track and give them something to do, as we do like football. Although the school seems small and not like any sport school we might visit but still the initiative is great and should be sponsored by the government.On our way back through several small suburbs, where we were again welcomed by the locals we already knew that this one those trips you’ll always remember. As I write this it has already been two months sins we visited Bangkok, but this trip seems like yesterday.If I can give any advice, Don’t only visit the beautiful temples and palaces of Bangkok but also plan at least one day to get onto the bike and experience the real Bangkok.It was pleasure writing this and hope to visit Bangkok againDanny and Claudia

Biking in Bangkok. You bike though Bangkok and though the "lung" of Bangkok. You see a different Bangkok then you would ever image. You will see the thrue face of Thailand. The kindness of the non-tourist related people. You will see some slums and visit a local school.It's really a great tour to do!!

Different views of Bangkok by Bike. We had a really great time, riding through Bangkok on our bycicles! It really showed us the city from a different point of view, the quiet and relaxed one, with its lovely and warm citizens who waived at us (and gave us all way in the stormy traffic!) at every street corner.Also, our guide was terrific, watched out for us and told us many interesting things about the city and its people.
great day with a superb group. we had a really great day, a real new perspective of bangkok and at least we had a lot of fun.thank you for this day.diane and andi

Biking in Bangkok, Thailand. Just got back from Thailand, my last stop was Bangkok. Excellent trip. But the best part of being in Bangkok was the 1/2 day bike trip we took in the morning (to hot in the pm). We experienced the real back roads of Bangkok I would have never seen if not for this bike trip. Everyone travels to the major attractions, but that gets boring after a while. I wanted to experience the real side of the city and surroundings.There are many bike companies to choose from, but we chose the "Recreational Bangkok Biking" E-mail= [--],I forgot what the name of the tour was, but it was the one that road to the back villages and then took the boat (with bikes) over to the other side of the river to the national park & country villages.I highly recommend this if you want to see what life is like other than the typical city attractions.JR

Great experience and real culture. Was a fantastic tour of the temples, markets and food in Bangkok by night using a tuk tuk. The drivers were great, our guide Jib was amazing and made the night so much fun, and so knowledgable . The flower market was a highlight and the pad thai, also trying some different local foods at the market was great fun. All with a great tea, guide and place, don't miss this tour! Thanks you guys we have some great pictures

Great tour and really nice guide!!. I went on this tour because I had a 9 hour layover in Bangkok. Even though I was traveling alone, the other tourists in the group were really nice and I had a great time! We visited a local marked, saw temples and had the best Pad Thai in town. The guide spoke English very well and had a lot of interesting facts about the city.
The best tuk tuk ride. We did the tuk tuk night tour and we had the best time.We got to go to the main sites and actually learned a lot.

Tuk Tuk Food Tour / Rattanakosin Walking Tour. We (two adults and a 14y/o) did two tours with Expique. These were the Tuk Tuk Food Tour and Rattanakosin Walking Tour.The tuk tuk tour was excellent - visiting the local favourites of the Expique office team and their families. All eateries were clean and none too 'adventurous' for anyone willing to try something new. Expique say "come hungry" and they are not kidding - we certainly has enough food! Between food stops is the excitement of riding a tuk tuk (still one of my favourite things!). Our tuk tuk had a clear roof, which is a great idea! The tuk tuk routes avoid much of the traffic, but do go past some of the tourist sights - giving a unique nighttime view of these. If tuk tuks and food aren't enough, there are also a couple of opportunities for a relaxed stroll to stretch your legs and let the food go down! We were back at our hotel at about 11pm - and the time just flew! Fully recommended, and lots of fun!The Rattanakosin Walking Tour starts early in the morning at one of the Chaophraya Express piers, and there is nothing like a ride in a fast boat to start the day! The tour covers an area around the Grand Palace, but focuses on some of the sights that would otherwise go unnoticed. Our guide was Esso - and what a guide! With a deep enthusiasm for Thai history, an engaging manner and casual style his presentation of the tour is informative, entertaining and enjoyable. The time just flew past! This is not a strenuous tour, and the pace is gentle - so should be accessible to all.Simon, the owner of Expique, joined us for the tuk tuk tour, and met us for the start of the walking tour. It was great to hear his plans for 'different' tours in Bangkok - and we'll likely be back to try more!

One of the best tours we took. This was a great way to spend an evening viewing the sights of Bangkok in with an experienced and funny tour guide (Esso), and good Tuk Tuk drivers. The sights look so different at night.

Bangkok Night Lights - Great Fun. Bangkok takes on a totally different personality during the evening, as opposed to the city during daylight hours. Once the automobile traffic starts to slacken a bit, the Expique tuk-tuks come alive and the fun begins.One of the highlights was blasting around the streets in a light drizzle (ponchos provided) and watching the city lights flicker on the damp pavement.The late night stop for Pad Thai at Thip Samai was perfect. Lines of late night diners standing under open umbrellas waiting for a table inside to sample the World's Best Pad Thai (that's what the award covered walls say).This is a 'must do' if you wish to enjoy a memorable evening in Bangkok!

A "don't miss" tour for anyne visiting Bangkok.. I'm so glad that I took this tour, and highly recommend it to anyone visiting Bangkok. I had one evening free while visiting Bangkok for work, and so found this tour as one that had been highly-rated on Tripadvisor. I'm so glad that I went! I was a little nervous as a single person on a group tour, but the other tourmates were great fun. Tour visited market for snacks, Wat Po, the Great Swing, an amazing pad thai restaurant, the flower market, and Chinatown. The King has just passed away so tour guide Esso was able to provide lots of context and history. It was warm, but not nearly as warm as during the day, and the tuk-tuks make the tour especially fun. A five star experience and incredible value for the money. I'm so glad I did it - definitely the highlight of my trip to Bangkok!

A fantastic time on teh Bangkok Night Lights Tuk Tuk Tour!. My wife and I took the Bangkok Night Lights Tuk Tuk tour and had a fantastic final evening in town. With all the conflicting commentary on renting your own tuk tuks, this was a great, safe alternative that allowed us the fun experience of riding around in a tuk tuk paired with an informative, cultural and delicious tour!Our tour guide did a fantastic job all evening of sharing information about Thai culture, specific landmarks, etc. She was absolutely on point in keeping us all together and touring through busy markets, but still found quiet spots for us to stop, ponder and discuss. Very professional and fun at the same time!The food stops were quite delicious - little snacks in various markets, a stop for some good pad thai at a local famous restaurant and dessert and crafts at the end. While I wasn't stuffed by the end of the night, I was certainly well fed and happy.Would thoroughly recommend this tour as a great way to see the vibrant city of Bangkok in a unique way at night. The tuk tuks are fun, it was awesome to see Wat Pho at night (although the reclining Buddha is not accessible then) and it was nice to have a guided tour through some of the madness of Bangkok markets.

Great tour for short stay in Thailand. Our guide, Natt, was very knowledgeable of the history of Bangkok and gave us full understanding of the culture. He spoke fluent English and was welcoming as were most Thai people. The whole tour was well organized and orderly, so it ran smoothly. One of the best parts of our night tour was that we were able to get a return ride back to our hotel and see the nightlife. Natt also made sure that our driver knew exactly where we were staying before he left us which was a nice touch.

Awesome tour - Bangkok Night Lights Tuk Tuk tour. This is an awesome tour. Don't hesitate. This was my second visit to Bangkok, I was travelling with 7 people from my family ranging in aged 5 - 70 years. So I felt a private tour maybe best. We had 4 Tuk Tuk's and the drivers were great, so friendly and having fun with us as we went along. Our tour guide "A" was fantastic, she was vey informative and had great English. She had a good cultural and historical understanding and was able to provide us with lots of information and answer all our questions. The tour takes you to places we would have never got to on our own, and gives a good range of experiences. Very well structured itinerary, the perfect introduction to Thailand for my family group. Everyone loved it.

awesome tour!. really enjoyed trying the street food and hearing about the history of bangkok. we went to markets i wouldn't have know to try as a tourist, and got a very authentic sampling of the city. well worth the money!
Well worth it. As a way to visit some of the more unusual and interesting places on a classic mode of Bangkok transport, this tour is well worth the money.

Awesome tours!!!. Highly recommended tour company!Friendly staff, smilled drivers and unique experience -especially food tours!!! Rare opportunity to try carefully selected samples of local cuisine and street food.Will use your service again guys, That's for sure!
Simply amazing!. I loved my guide, she told me stories about every place. I did the private night tour and was amazing! I highly recommend this tour.

So much fun . There were only 4 of us, so 2 tuk tuks which allowed our guide to spend more time with us, switching between our vehicles. The flower market, a night market, the temple area on a full moon night, dinner, snacks, a very full, fun evening!

Food Adventure. Great evening ! Full of fun and food! We went to different local restaurants in and around the Old City and China Town as well as stopping off at a few historic monuments. The ride in a tuk tuk was enjoyed by all. The whole trip was well worth doing.

Tuk Tuk Night Tour of Bangkok. This was a great last-minute outing. After touring around all day, this was a perfect end to the day. Our guide, A, was great. She was very knowledgeable and was a great guide. She made the evening. Seeing the various sites and tasting the local cuisine was great! The tuk tuk drivers were also fantastic and courteous. I highly recommend this tour !!!

Tuk-Tuk tour by night. Loved this tour. So fun to zoom around Bangkok in the cool of the night on a Tuk-Tuk. The food was great. the sites amazing in the night lights, the guide was wonderful and my Tuk-Tuk driver was fantastic. It was an absolute blast!!

Great adventure for "True Foodies" Evening Food and Tuk Tuk Adventure. This is a must do tour for true foodies. Simon and his guides (Tida(sp) and A) take you to some of the most popular among the locals as well as their own favorite street food vendors and restaurants. We did not do the typical Thai dishes found in America, we did traditional Thai dishes, as well as some other surprises! Along the way, we learned much about Bangkok while riding in the famous Tuk Tuks and we also loved our drivers! Overall this was an amazing adventure for a first time visit to Bangkok and I strongly suggest it for true "foodies!"Thanks to Simon and his wonderful guides and drivers at Expique! This was the best part of our trip!!
Night tuk tuk tour - fantastic!. Great tour. Ai was a fantastic guide and the whole tour was very professional. We really enjoyed it!

Fun experience! Would recommend night time food & temple tour.. We took this tour to make sure we could experience as much of Bangkok as possible during a quick two day trip. The unique thing about this tour is riding in the Tuk Tuks all night. It was a really fun way to see the city all lit up and yes, the ride did feel safe!We stopped at several major attractions including the giant swing and a beautiful temple. We also stopped for an authentic pad thai dinner and delicious orange drink. It was quite tasty. Our guide was really friendly and knowledgeable. I would have liked a few more food stops along the way to try some more unique street food, but other than that wouldn't change a thing. Definitely a good value!

Great tour! highly recommended!. We booked this tour as we had only 2 nights in Bangkok. Natt was great --- we visited some night markets, temples and had amazing pad thai! Highly recommend the night tuk tuk tour! :)

Excellent Bangkok experience. Thanks for the great Tuk Tuk tour and corteous service. I had the pleasure to chat with Simon, who runs the company and received us by the BTS station and then Jib, our lovely tour guide took care of us and showed us Bangkok using their Tuk Tuks. The drivers are excellent, always smiling and provide bottles of cold water, excellent for the hot Bangkok nights this time of the year. Simon and his team deserves all the success, thats the way tourists should be treated. I'll return and look for their tours again. (After the tour I received a lovely set of Flowers but it was late and I left it at the Tuk Tuk... just to let you know it was because I was really tired! Noticed when I arrived at my room... too late, but I really appreciated it)

Best in Bangkok!. Spent two days in Bangkok and this is definitely one of the highlights. The tuktuk drivers are very courteous and professional, and our tour guide (Esso) was fantastic! Was able to see many well-known locations at a time when practically nobody was around. By the end of the tour, I was SO full. Great way to experience the local culture with great company. Couldn't be more pleased!! Thank you Esso, and expique!

Don't miss this!!. This is a fabulous tour particularly if your only visiting Bangkok for a short time. We saw places we would never had time to visit and the temples at night where just breathtaking. Our guide Bee was excellent as where all the drivers very courteous and kind. Take this tour you won't be disappointed and for a very reasonable price your driver will take you back to your hotel in the tuk tuk.

Great way to see Bangkok at night. This was my first visit to Thailand. I only had one day in Bangkok and thought it would be good to spend my 'One Night in Bangkok' on this tour as I was travelling alone. I can heartily recommend it. We were lucky to have a really small group of lovely people and a fabulous tour guide called Gip. My favourite stop on the tour was when we got to see Wat Pho lit up at night, and whizzing around the streets in a Tuk Tuk was just great fun. Ate a lovely vegetarian Pad Thai and got to try some snacks along the way. It was a really nice evening.

Excellent tour guide. We only had 1 day in Bangkok and this tour helped us to see all the main sights plus taste the food. Our tour guide 'Net' was a fantastic guide, who spoke excellent English, had good knowledge of the sights visited and was friendly and fun. The Tuk Tuks were great fun whizzing around the city and we felt really safe with the driver, who took really good care of us. We saw a really mixture of areas which we couldn't do on our own. The food wasn't the best that we had on our trip to Thailand but was still good and the 2 restaurants chosen we clean and had clean toilets. Great tour and would recommend to anyone.

Awesome. It was a very enjoyable and informative tour. We were little bit late and they waited for us.It was raining and we thought it will be a problem for the tour.but they have organized everything so nicely that we enjoyed the rainy night tuktuk journey :) The guide was very friendly and shared a lot of information about the visited places. he also sang songs for us :) All the tuktuk drivers were very friendly.It was our first night in Bnagkok and we really liked the package a lot .

Interesting way to see Bangkok. We had the night tuktuk tour last Thursday, and it was one of the highlights of my trip to Bangkok. Our tour guide Net was an awesome guide, telling different stories and sharing new information about each place. It was also a great way for tourists to experience riding the famous tuktuk for a long period. Having the tour at night gives visitors a different perspective of the city, and it's not as hot compared to a day tour. I highly recommend this tour, and other tours by Expique!Thank you Simon, Net, and the entire team for a job well done!

Fantastic Night Lights Tour. I took the Bangkok Night Lights Tour. The meeting point is simple and clear, but due to it being my first night at Bangkok- I found myself stuck in traffic and being horribly late for the tour. I rang them up and they were very helpful, giving clear instructions on how to get to the point as quickly as possible. I was 30 minutes late, but a member of staff had stayed back at the meeting point to escort me to catch up with the rest of the tour- which was above and beyond really.Esso, our tour guide, was super friendly and professional and he was very easy to get along with- I could not recommend him enough.The tuk tuk part of the tour is brilliant and it was a great way for me to see Bangkok and gives it an even more authentic feel. There are cold bottles of water constantly being replenished in the tuk tuk and the cold towel mid-tour is a great touch. The food is really good, already organised for you when you arrive so no waiting around/queuing up which is often an annoying part of food tour. The food/places gave you a proper taste of Bangkok and were places I would never have found myself. Great company, wonderful service and a well-thought out and organised tour. I would 100% book with this company again!

We Love Natt!. Greatest evening tour ever! A memorable and fun experience that we will never forget. The food was amazing, the tour guide was flexible and the experience was unforgettable! I recommend the private experience as they truly take care of you from start to finish.

Best Tour in Bangkok. My tour guide was Net and she was absolutely amazing. She is so positive and bubbly with a whole lot of knowledge of all the places we visited. It was so fun exploring Bangkok on a tuk tuk. Doing the tour at night was definitely a good option. The streets were quieter and the temples looked Amazing at night. And it wasn't as hot!Having all food included was a treat so you don't have to get your wallet out all night. Someone even lined up for is at the busy restaurant so we didn't have to wait. Great choice of locations to stop at. I would never have seen them if it wasn't for the tour. All staff- guides and tuk tuk drivers were super friendly. Exceeded my expectations. Very fun night!

"Roller coaster" Tuk Tuk ride with great eats and sightseeing. We had a great time with Bee our guide on the "Bangkok Night Lights" tour. Although we felt very safe in the Tuk Tuk, there were some white knuckle moments as the drivers made quick turns and accelerations to maneuver through the Bangkok traffic! We toured several street markets, tried all kinds of street food, had a "VIP" (no waiting and prime seating) dinner at the legendary Thip Samai restaurant, and visited several temples and palaces during the tour. Fabulous introduction to street foods and Thai culture in general. Bee was great! Even with a sudden torrential downpour of rain she was unphased and the Tuk Tuks were ready with ponchos, umbrellas, and zip down rain protection to keep us dry. Highly recommended!

Excellent evening tour with tuk tuk. Well designed tour taking a small group with tuk tuks around local markets, food stalls, temples in night lighting. Good guide, friendly and safe drivers, good food and interesting sights. An evening well spent.

The best conducted tour in Bangkok. This was clearly the highlight of my Bangkok trip. Esso, our tour guide was outstanding with genuine enthusiasm , great sense of humour and ability to take people along, both literally and figuratively . This is a Must Do in Bangkok.

Night time tuk tuk tour. We had a great time with Esso and the tuk tuk drivers during our night tour of Bangkok. We went to some great places and had some great food. Wat Pho at night was fantastic and Esso was an excellent guide.

Good job. Great experience and the kids loved it. Drivers were very friendly with plenty of cold drinks on hand, we participated in a Buddhist ritual. Food was really good and plentiful. The guide did a great job as well.

Night tuk tuk tour - too long. I was in the 'night tuk tuk' tour. The guide, she was REALLY NICE and she did a really good job!!!!! But the tour took a little bit long time, made some of us sleepy at the end. I think the course should be re-organized.

Over Impressed and Too Much Fun. So, I can't talk too much about the trip because I don't want to spoil it for you. It was well organized, and fun. Jib was a great guide. Our driver made sure we were well taken care of. When our bottles of water got low, they would swap them out while we looking at a site. Oh yeah, and the food... don't think extreme, but interesting. I wish they had more tours :( They did a really good job. I would recommend them to anyone.

Nighttime Tuk Tuk tour. Had a private tour for our family, our tour guide was Jib and 2 super friendly drivers. Absolutely fabulous!! A highlight.We went to there temples and had so much food. Street food from the market, sit down dinner that was so good, we got desert to go as our 3 year old fell asleep.This was so fun, and entertaining and informative at the same time.I would really highly recommend. We went for a private tour as we had a 13 year and and 3 year old with us and lucky we did as baby fell asleep at the end of the evening in the Tuk Tuk.I cannot recommend this enough to any family traveling to Bangkok!!!

Unforgettable introduction to Bangkok!. I initially only signed up for the tuk tuk night tour but when I was unable to find any other company that was available, communicative - or really just nice - I asked if they would do a private tour for my parents and I of various places we wanted to see. Simon responded quickly. With his own input, we agreed on a schedule over 5 days and I don't regret my choice. I can't recommend their guides (we were with Natt and Esso) and drivers enough. Their knowledge, professionalism and all around kindness were felt. Simon's too. My parents are older and Esso really took this into consideration when taking them around. It was a great introduction to Bangkok and the main attractions. If you can though, I highly recommend the Diversity and Harmony tour - we enjoyed interacting with the locals and getting to know more of a side of Bangkok that's likely unknown to the majority of tourists. And whatever you do - Ayutthaya is a must see. Thank you Team Expique!

Bangkok night lights. Loved our night Tuk Tuk tour With Dip A great way to see the city. I spent my days walking and getting on the subway and boats to drive the streets in an open Tuk Tuk made the experience so visual and fun. Was nice to try local food and getting around.

What a good evening tour!. What a great evening! Have just completed the Expique TukTuk tour Bangkok by night: Markets, Temples and Food! A very diverse range of participants from Costa Rica to Arkansas! The guide Be was brilliant: helpful, informative and just downright professional!I did this as a solo traveller in his sixties! The itinerary was well thought out, the TukTuk drivers so helpful even providing water and refreshing towels along the way!The food was good and I felt I had the chance to see and experience things I would never have done alone!The ride back to my hotel was an event in itself: rather like a roller coaster ride but for real. Thrilling!I can only recommend it!Very well done to all!

Total Professionals. We had 3 guided Bangkok tours with Expique, all were well structured and were professionally run by expert guides who were passionate about what they were doing.We particularly liked the fun interactions between the guides and the locals. On the last tour, because there were only two of us, the guide was more than willing to adjust the itinery to suit our requirements, We visited 3 extremely interesting floating markets, all off the normal tourist track. The seafood food was incredibly good, as were the snacks that we tried at various street vendors. The guide's knowledge and fun demeanour made it one of our best days out. .The other tours -the night Tuk-Tuk and the Diversity tour were also first class. Well done!

AWESOME just AWESOME. This tour is amazing and certainly gives value for money. Travelling by Tuk Tuk is fun and gives a safe and different perspective of this amazing city. The guide was great and so knowledgeable and the progressive dinner at different venues was fantastic.

One of our favourite nights in Bangkok!. We were looking for something a bit different. There’s so many tours in Bangkok, but it can be hard to find something out of the ordinary. Then we came across Expique with their Mystery Tuk Tuk Night Tour. It was an experimental tour, for a special price - for them to experiment with new routes and get feedback from their customers.This was exactly what we were looking for. Food, temples, Bangkok at night, zipping around in a Tuk Tuk. It was really lovely. The tour took about 4 hours or so and we explored a lot of local markets and street food, also on the other side of the river - an area you don’t usually come as a tourist. We tried all sorts of stuff, from chinese pastries and suki yaki and fried sticky chicken to glutenous sesame-seed desserts. No green curry and pad thai here. For our experimental tour we had multiple guides, and they were all lovely. Knowledgable and good english. More importantly, they were all happy and friendly and seemed genuinely excited to be hosting the tour and explaining things and answering questions.If you're a foodie or feeling adventurous I would definitely recommend their Mystery tour, we're looking forward to trying their our tours as well.

We Loved our Tuk Tuk Night Tour. My family and I (two adults and two girls aged 8 and 10 years old) absolutely loved our private Bangkok night lights tour and thought it was worth every dollar and more. My wife and I have been coming to Bangkok for years but this tour showed us a fabulous and diverse side of Bangkok's food, markets and temples that we had not previously experienced. Our girls loved the flower market and making garlands. Thanks guys and thanks Ai (our tour guide).
Night tour . Great way to see Bangkok. Esso was great. Tuk tuks and our drivers were a ton of fun! You see some of the highlights of the city and have a fun small dinner with the group.
Great Tour. A great way to know more about Thai culture and history. Definitely outside beaten path. The guide, Esso, was super knowledgeable and introduced us to some great street snacks too.

Wonderful way to experience Bangkok by night. We are a family with 3 teens and when I told them we are going on a Tuk Tuk Trip at night....well, you know teenagers! We arrived at the meeting point and met Esso our guide who told us that we were going to have a private tour!! Yeah!! Esso made an instant connection with our kids and the way they were smiling the whole time, told me that they were enjoying their selves despite their initial reluctance. Bangkok at night is magical and it is so much fun riding around in the tuk tuk's with the clear plastic roofs. I think the highlight for me was visiting the Temple of the reclining Buddha. We were the only ones there. It was an amazing, almost mystical experience! Imagine being in a city of millions of people and having a private night tour of one of the most holiest places of Bangkok! The whole trip was fun and we enjoyed the food. Do not eat before doing this tour!!!Thanks Esso, we had a fabulous time. The Tuk Tuk drivers were super too. This is the way to see Bangkok at night!!

Bangkok by tuk tuk. Temples and food what a great trip and worth every penny. I've been to Bangkok may times but on this to with my son I though I would let somebody else make the choices. Nice easy meet at train station so no traffic to worry about. Our own 2 person Tuk and be small group. Tried lots of different food, night time access to Wat Pho which was magical. Great guide and a super 4 hours. I would recommend for anyone

Fantastic way to see the real Bangkok!. Expique tours takes you up close and personal to see sights in Bangkok that you will never see with other tours. Natt, our guide, was experienced and knowledgable about the city and Thai traditions. He mixed facts and humor with his enthusiasm and passion as he told us about each stop on the tour. Imagine strolling the grounds of the Reclining Buddha Temple at night under the stars, leisurely admiring everything and appreciating the peaceful feeling that comes with touring at night with only a handful of others there. We tasted delicious local food as we walked through the markets and were lucky enough to tour the flower markets the last night before they were moved inside. Riding in the tuk tuks was fun and provided a much needed cool breeze. Before taking this tour my description of Bangkok would have been a busy concrete jungle. But Expique introduced us to the sights, sounds, tastes, and people of Bangkok.The city became personal.

not to be missed magical & fun night tour Bangkok. This night city tour is not to be missed!Very well organized, great locations visited in one evening, super street food, colorful markets, tranquil temples, nice anecdotes narrated by the knowledgable guide, Expique has got it right... top standard of tourism... tucs even took us home after a long and exciting night tour

Fun Tuk Tuk tour. Booked a tour of Bangkok with Expique and what a fantastic time we had! Our guide was Bea, Bangkok native and extremely knowledgable about her city. Fluid in English, Bea took us to places in Bangkok that you might not find in a guide book or on a walkabout. Our drivers in modified Tuk Tuks were friendly and exuded the Thai hospitality. The Tuk Tuks had clear covered roofs that gave great views above. I won't spoil the fun by taking you through the itinerary, but all I can say is Bea is a fantastic guide and you'll have lots of fun. If you're going to do one tour, if you're only in Bangkok for a day or two, book on to this tour!

Amazing Tour!. I highly recommend you take a tour with Expique We did the Bangkok Night Lights tuk tuk tour. It was definitely the highlight of our Bangkok trip. It was easy to find the meeting location our guide was great and food was amazing!!!

Excellent tour and great value. I first took the Bangkok by night tour. The meeting place was easy to find, and the tour started right on time. When members of the party were late, they had a staff member an a tuk tuk stay behind and wait for them, and then made sure they caught up with the rest of the tour. The night time sites were fantastic, and Esso was a fantastic guide. Knowledgable and really focused on providing us with a cultural overview --in other words, he gave participants an understanding of the cultural significance of different sites for the Thai people. in addition, this tour did a handful of food stops which were great and also gave us a chance to meet and talk with fellow participants. I enjoyed this tour so much that I decided to do the Food Mystery tour. We went to numerous spots to try street food and Thai specialties. Really great food at a diverse set of spots throughout the city. There were thunder showers and they supplied us with umbrellas and ponchos. The tuk tuk experience was fantastic. I cannot recommend this company enough. Fun, relaxed, and really substantive tour. I never felt rushed or herded from site to site. That was really what made these tours so great. I would sign up for another tour with them in a heartbeat.

Fantastic Tour - Not to be missed. We had an overnight layover in Bangkok, and decided to try to see as much of the city as we could that evening. This tour was so much fun and we really got a feel for the city, all lit up so beautifully at night. Even though we were late to meet up with the group (transport issues), we called to let the company know, and they were very professional and accommodating. Someone was still there to meet us at the train station, and our Tuk Tuk driver drove us to meet up with the others. Jib, our tour guide, was friendly, welcoming and knowledgeable - we felt lucky to get to learn from her. Riding in the Tuk Tuk was super fun, we learned a lot about Bangkok and the temples and culture there, ate some delicious food, and it was cool to get to meet some other travelers from all over the world in our group as well. We would highly, highly recommend this tour!

Tuk Tuk Tour. My wife and I took this tour on Saturday evening and it was fantastic .We worried about the meeting point and need not have done .Getting to the meeting point could not have been easier from the hotel using the BST.We visited a market and had some biting food, some was good and some not so.We had a good drive round in the Tuk Tuk and visited some good places , good to see at night as we had visited during the day.Had some very enjoyable food and finished up in China Town to enjoy sticky rice, mango and coconut foam?Our tour guide could not have been friendlier and was very knowledgeable about the places we visited .Did you know the word Bangkok in Thai is a collection of 28 words. On a final note the Tuk Tuk driver took us back to the hotel through the flooded streets for only 150 Bhat .All in all an enjoyable trip.

Great tour, great guide, great food!. I've been on these type of tours in many cities in the world and this was one of the best. I did the Night Lights tour with a close friend as part of a long weekend in Bangkok. The experience was very local, involving visiting markets most tourists don't know about and tasting amazing street foods I wouldn't have been able even to identify otherwise. Our guide, Jib, was a real gem- upbeat, enthusiastic, knowledgeable, accommodating, patient and overall lovely to be around. She truly made the experience for us. The tuc tuc drivers were courteous, helpful and the transparent tops were great for seeing the sights from the tuc tuc. The tour takes in many of the key sights of the city and is a great way to get the lay of the land and taste some authentic food on your first or second night, then plan what you'd like to do the next day based on what you saw. Expect that it may rain a bit and carry a cheap poncho or umbrella just in case. If I come back to Bangkok I'd definitely do another tour with this company. Well worth the money and time.

Fun evening tour in Bangkok. I signed up for the Expique tour after watching a Youtube video on Bangkok. I have to say that this was a very worthy and enjoyable way to experience some of the night life in Bangkok. Met up with a group of tourists from various regions and we were introduced to Nat and Esso, who were our guides for the evening. Nat and Esso were very friendly and professional and made the effort to mingle and get to know you as a traveler. I also appreciated how they tried to break the ice and get us as strangers to interact with one another. I know meeting a stranger far away from home can be a little intimidating, but I think that helped make this evening tour a much stronger and social experience. What made the tour even more fun was riding around town on the back of a tuk tuk (motorcycle taxi) and seeing all what Bangkok's night life looks and feels like along with the extreme night humidity. The sites were interesting, Nat was good at telling stories and I enjoyed the snacking and eventually having a good Pad Thai dinner at a long-time Bangkok restaurant called "Thipsamai" We eventually wrapped up the evening in China Town with a Mango and Sticky Rice dessert. It's a very fun way to experience Bangkok. If you're a first time visitor to Thailand, I highly recommend it even more.

Walking tour and night tuk tuk tour. A great experience! It was our first time visiting Thailand, and knew that Bangkok might be slightly overwhelming. So we thought the tour would help us to take in our surroundings, which it did. I don't think we would have discovered as much by ourselves, it is definitely worth the money as you don't want to miss anything when you're travelling so far.
Bangkok by night tuk tuk tour. Bee was a great guide full of information and fun. Nice to see Bangkok without the intense heat. Tuk-tuk's a great fun too.

Super fun tour that feels like an adventure. In short: You must try this if traveling to Bangkok. In Long: this tour was so much fun. Often cities really come alive at night and if you miss the chance to see Bangkok at night then you haven't seen Bangkok. I was a traveling alone and wanted to find some ways to occupy my nights safely. We meet up at a metro stop which makes things easy. There I was greeted by a You Thai girl. we then met out tuk tuk drivers and fellow travelers. I had read horror stories of being alone in a tuk tuk, so this was a perfect way to experience. So we get started by zipping through the streets of Bangkok, we stop at a local food market snd try a few quick items. I loved the chance to try the food in a small dose. Next stop was a few temples, beautiful to see lit up at night then headed to local restaurant for PadThai and fresh oj. Dang this place was hoppin and the food killer, and I'm talking the kind of delicious u dream about. Sampled exotic fruits at all night fruit market , a quick stop at the all night flower market and wrapped up with some sticky rice and mango. Mmmmm,This tour had a great combo of food and fun.

I'd go again in a sec!. This tour is high on the list of things to do for very good reasons. Our wonderful guide, Ai (Eye), was friendly, knowledgeable and fun. This was a tour of the many sides of Bangkok.....markets, restaurants and temples, which I had not seen in my many prior visits. The tuk-tuks are a perfect way to get around, while negotiating the back streets almost free of traffic, all while having a great time in the open air of the night. The evening is interesting and enjoyable, and passes much too quickly.Like I said, I'd like to go again.

Bangkok by night tuktuk. Was a highlight of our trip. Excellent value for money. Friendly guides excellent English and knowledge of area. Travelling as 2 females it was ideal as we would not have gone to most of these places alone at night, however felt very safe on the tour.

Well informed Tour Guides. Esso and Nat were amazing and did a good job in entertaining and touring our group, 10 of us all, whilst giving us info about the history of Thailand. I highly recommend them!

Diversity Walking Tour. We had the diversity walking tour this week. It was a unique opportunity to walk in a historical part of town. After living almost 4 years in this city, it was a great chance to see unique icons, learn about history and visiting places with practically no tourists at all. Our guide, Eso, knows the history very well about these places, it was very easy to understand his English as well. The tour was at a very nice pace. We had a chance to take many pictures and try unique Thai food snacks. I highly recommend it if you are in town and want to see streets, temples out off the beaten path.

One Night In Bangkok, best night in Bangkok. This was better than we could've ever hoped for. So great to have a guide to sow us the foodie side of Bangkok on it's most iconic forms of transport, the Tuk Tuk. Esso and his team of Tuk Tuk drivers were beyond friendly and professional. They actually love what they do. Everyone should try this tour. And your Mom!

Great way to spend an evening in Bangkok!. I really enjoyed this tour - it was a great (and different) way to spend an evening in Bangkok. Our guide, Cheap (sorry about the spelling!), was engaging and warm and shared lots of interesting info and stories about the city. Her English was excellent. The tuktuk drivers were all very polite and everything was really well organized. Would suggest that you don't eat too much before you go on the tour as you get LOADS to eat (including a full serving of Pad Thai!) Everything we tried (all included in the price of the tour) was very tasty and there were plenty of unusual fruits, snacks, flavors etc that I had never tried before. My only constructive criticism is that, at just over four hours, the tour is quite long. Even though I really enjoyed it, I think it could perhaps be condensed into three hours - particularly given that it starts quite late in the evening. That said, it is overall a great tour and I would highly recommend it if you are looking for an interesting and fun way to spend an evening in Bangkok!
Wonderful experience!. The tour was very interesting and well organized. The guide was wonderful, friendly and polite. Love mainly to visit the temples at night and to walk safely by tuk-tuk.

Tuk Tuk night Tour. I recommend the Tuk Tuk night tour for anyone who would like to see a different part of Bangkok.Our tour guide Bee was very informative & patient.our booking was done online hassle free.We ate different kinds of local food which we normally wouldn't .

Great Night! Bangkok Night Lights Tuk Tuk Tour. Had a really great time on this tour, my husband and I booked on Viatour and was very happy with the experience. It was very well organized and curated exceptionally. Our tour guide Natt was amazing, super enthusiastic and informative made the night! Highly recommend this tour when your in Bangkok. It's a great way to experience authentic food markets, learn about Thailand and Bangkok history, see the flower market in it's prime and walk around Temple grounds at night without the crowds. The tour ends in Chinatown highly recommend you stay in the area after on your own to explore further.
Expique : the way to see Bangkok at night. great guys from guide to Tuk Tuk driverslots of things to see and do can't all be done in one tour though..bangkok has too many layers to see all in one go

Excellent, fun and informative night time tour of Bangkok! A must do for visitors!. Booked a 4 hour night time tour of Bangkok. Online reservation was a breeze and I received a confirmation in just a few hours. Directions to the meeting point were very clear. We were met by Simon (the owner) and Esso (our guide) and spent the next four hours exploring Bangkok at night. The sights ranged from local night markets to temples (spectacular at night!) and public spaces. We tried all sorts of foods at various stops, both familiar (Pad Thai) and the more exotic (Pandan custard and Durian). Esso was a delightful, funny and informative guide. He genuinely enjoys what he does and loves showing off his city to visitors. The four hours flew by so quickly, and we didn't want it to end. A must for any visitor to Bangkok.Side note: At the end of the tour there is an option to have the Tuk Tuk driver take you back to your hotel for a fee of about $5. Take it. While technically a taxi would be cheaper, it's almost impossible to find one in Chinatown (the final stop) that's willing to go by the meter, and they charge upwards of $10. Besides, it's almost midnight, and the open air ride in the thinning traffic is refreshing, relaxing and fun, even when we went, in April, which is the hottest month of the year there.

Great vibes!. After taking a few tours in Thailand there's something a little bit different about this one that was hard to put my finger on at first. It was really fun! You won't be driven around in silence somberly looking at landmarks and having brief interactions with dour staff who just want to get the job done and go home. Our guide Ai was super cheerful and so were our Tuk Tuk drivers. The owner Simon also imparted a great spirit and attitude to get us started. I think this an area where many tour companies fall flat but where Expique excels. If you want happy customers BE HAPPY! Great experience thanks!

Brilliant tour. Had an amazing time being guided around by our guide Ai. She is very bubbly and knowledgeable. Everything was sorted out professionally. The tuk tuk drivers were very friendly, mine was Mr Buddha. Food was amazing and the sights breathtaking at night.

Our favorite memory from our trip to Bangkok!. What a phenomenally fun way to spend an evening in Bangkok! Expique is a lovely company with exceptional service. The owner, Simon personally met us at the start of the evening and set the tone for a truly fun night. He introduced us to other group members, our tour guide and our tuk tuk drivers. The enthusiasm of both Simon and our tour guide was contagious. All the food we had was delicious, especially at Thip Samai- what an unforgettable meal! It was such a unique way to learn about the city and see attractions that we definitely would have otherwise overlooked. Our guide could not have been more kind and knowledgeable- the tour was undoubtedly our favorite memory from Bangkok. Wholeheartedly recommend a tour with Expique!

Excellent experineces !. It is very well planned and nicely organized tour. I enjoyed and would recommend the same to the tourist. It is the best way to know local culture, food and also to see Bangkok at night. The guide and Tuk Tuk driver were very co-operative and took care of me from start to end of the tour with a smile. :)

Hassle free and fun. We arrived a few hours earlier so decided on this tour as a way of getting straight into it. It was great not having to work it all out, just jump in, listen to the stories, get into the thick of things, and eat. Hearing about Thai culture/history from our great tour guide was definately a highlight.

Well worth it!!. Esso was our tour guide and he did a great job!! He was very knowledgeable and helpful. We made several stops along the way and he was able to try a lot of different foods. He was great taking pictures for us and answering all of our questions. We were really tired and thought about cancelling the tour, but I am so very glad that we did not. Seeing Bangkok at night is a MUST!!

Such a fun way to see Bangkok!. This was a super fun tour, and although it's not billed as a food tour, you'll also get to sample plenty of local foods. The tour had just the right combination of eating, sightseeing and just speeding around town in a gang of colorful tuk tuks - the drivers were awesome, as was our guide! There were several couples, and 3 of us solo females - great group!

Night Lights of Bangkok travelling in a Tuk Tuk. A fun 4 hours of evening delight from a tuk tuk. Natt our tour guide was most informative, varied and included some great eats. The unique opportunity to visit Wat Pho by night was amazing. I suggest you dress comfortably, as you are in and out of the tuk tuk many times over the duration of the tour. The walking is at a comfortable pace, but suggest comfortable shoes. It was a lot of fun and we were fortunate to eat at the famous Pad Thai restaurant - Thipsamai. I recommend this tour, which was very reasonably priced. Thank you Expique.

Tuk Tuk night tour fun. Nine of us including adults, teens and a 10 yr old we're all kept entertained on this great tour. Good organization, a friendly tour guide and great stop-off points from the night flower market to the reclining Buddha. We will be taking all our visitors on this tour in future.

Bangkok Tuk-tuk tour by night much different. Simon, the owner, introduced the tour at the Skytrain station and our guide for the evening, Esso. The food was wonderful. But, the best part was seeing parts of Bangkok at night that you only see during the day, such as Wat Pho Temple. The lit temple without thousands of people was far more enchanting. Our tuk-tuk driver was kind and helpful. Esso provided background on the neighborhoods and the food. The flower market was filled with vendors and their families eating and keeping their children entertained.

Bankgkok Nightlights by Tuk Tuk. We took a taxi to the meeting place which was a train station, easily met with the tour leader Natt, and the Simon, the tour company owner. We were divvied up by twos and met our Tuk Tuk driver for the evening. We were impressed by the "team" approach Simon took in introducing the drivers and our guide. The tour was well organized and although the temples we visited were closed, many of the grounds were open for other functions and we were able to walk about which was a nice change from visiting during the day when the crowds were overwhelming. This was a food tour as well and our appetizer, which came from a street cart, tasted much like fried dough. The main course came from Thip Sanai, the most famous and original Pad Thai place in Bangkok. It really was excellent. Finally we finished in Chinatown for dessert of fresh mango and sticky sweet rice, another delicious treat. Our Tuk-Tuk driver brought us back to our hotel. A terrific way to spend an evening.
Go on the tuk tuk night tour!. I believe this tour was our highlight of our short trip to Bangkok. It was so much fun! Esso was a fantastic guide and tried to keep everything fun and enthusiastic.

Must To Do Tour in Bangkok!!!. The tour was very well organized, as I got a confirmation fax sent to my hotel the day before about the time and the meeting point. Met up with the staff, gave us a info and a mini map about the tour. Very informative. Food quantity was more than enough, pad thai was very authentic.

Another fantastic tour - thanks!. We have been to Bangkok many times, it is a place that continues to fascinate and delight. We loved our night time food and tuck tuk tour last year with this company so tried a morning "Diversity and Harmony" tour which was fascinating and fun. The booking system had changed but was just as easy. Simon came along at the start of the tour to welcome us as he did last year and that is a really good touch. There were only 2 of us on the tour and Esso was an excellent and very knowledgable guide and the walk was a great balance of sightseeing, snacks, stories and sitting.Despite the heat (which I think had put others off) the tour was not demanding and was nicely paced and we got to see some quieter, less touristic parts of the City, including watching locals in a beautiful park doing Thai Chi and others playing Chinese Chess. Esso links the stories to really bring the tour to life and it felt like having a very knowledgeable friend in Bangkok.Simon also gave us great tips for restaurants in easy reach of our hotel which enhanced our 3 night stay in Bangkok, much appreciated!We will book another tour with Expique next time we are in Bangkok.

Tuk-Tuk Night Tour . We did the Tuk-Tuk night tour with Expique!! It was amazing!!! We had a fantastic time, everything was very good organised. From the first contact over email till the trop off at our hotel after the tour everything was perfect !!! Jib our tour guide was lovely and she knew everything!!! Thanks so much Expique-Team for such a great experience and a fun and interesting Tour!!!! We had an awesome time!!!!

Discover off beat gems of Bangkok. This was my 4th visit to Bangkok so I really wanted to see something different and took the Diversity and Harmony Walking Tour. I learned alot about the history, diversity and multicultural side of Bangkok and really enjoyed exploring the authentic neighbourhood of Thonburi and the Chinese shrines, churches, mosques, temples and original communities. I loved the street food snacks on the way too and the enthusiasm of our guide. A perfect respite to touristy Bangkok!

Best Tour. Booking a night tour with Expique was the best thing we did on our two week trip to Thailand. It's a sure way to beat the heat during the day. Our guide for the night was Jib and she was full of energy and you could really tell she has a passion to share her knowledge with others. There were only six people in our group. More people had booked the tour but we were split off and the others had another guide. Jib was funny, entertaining and very knowledgeable. The tuk tuks used for the tour are very clean and have a see through roof. They were so nice that when we were stopped at a red light, a random tuk tuk driver leaned over with tuk tuk envy, said wowww and gave us the thumbs up. The tour started conveniently at a transit station and we visited many places that we would not get to ourselves. For me, the highlight of the tour was a visit to the flower market. Other tours and guides had always pointed it out from afar like when on a boat in the river. But to actually visit was awesome. Apparently it's open 24 hours a day. I had no idea that it was so big and they had the absolute freshest produce you could find. It's amazing to see this in action, especially coming from North America where grocery stores are a super-sized one stop shop. We also visited a local market which used to be the train station in town, the giant swing close to city hall, and wat pho at night (sure beats the crowds and heat). Of course I'm forgetting all the delicious food we ate, including the most famous pad thai restaurant, Thip Samai. The restaurant takes a long time to get a seat but the company had a guy waiting in line for us. Wow, what service! The restaurant is quite famous as it has many newspaper article less written about them from all over the world. The tour ends with some Mango sticky rice in Chinatown. Who doesn't like Mango sticky rice?My wife and I took a bunch of tours over our two weeks in Thailand and this was my favorite. If there's one thing you do while in Bangkok I would absolutely recommend this tour. Side note, the tour ends around 11pm in Chinatown. The company has negotiated a flat rate of 150 bhat for the tuk tuk to return you back to your hotel which was extra convenient.

Amazing way to get to know Bangkok. Super friendly tour guide, cool spots and definitely worth the money.For us and our first visit to Thailand and Bangkok this was the perfect way to learn more about the city and visit places at times which we wouldn't have down otherwise. Thank you Expique and a definite recommendation!

A must do in Bangkok. Our tour guide was very funny, amiable and informative. He took the time to speak to us individually as we were whizzing from place to place. Simon even came to meet us originally and his communication before hand was awesome. The Tuk Tuk drivers were really nice and gave us water and cold towels. Seeing Wat Poh at night was incredible. He gave us a wide variety of food to try like Thai sausage, peanut crackers and green custard as well as many other delicacies. He recited the whole name of Bangkok which was impressive and the flower market had a great atmosphere whilst the story behind the giant swing was fascinating. We had a great night and will be recommending this to our friends.
