Very Highly Recommended. Amazing Experience.. Just got back from Bangkok last week. Did the Diversity and Harmony tour and the Night Tuk Tuk tour with Expique. What a fantastic experience. This was my second trip to Bangkok in the last few months and we did tours with Expique both times. Esso was our guide on the Harmony and Diversity walking tour and we really really enjoyed his knowledge of history and his ability to show tourists a "behind the scenes" look at Bangkok. I think one of the most valuable things a traveler can experience is to see a city or place through the eyes of a local. That's exactly what we got. There is no way a tourist is going to have an experience like this on their own. it's one thing to "see the sights" and snap a few photos but entirely another to have a backstreet experience with a local explaining all the historical and cultural nuances.The night Tuk Tuk tour was brilliant too but for different reasons. First off if you've traveled by Tuk Tuk before you'll know that your vision is quite limited due to the fact that you're under a pretty low roof. The Tuk Tuks that Expique uses have transparent tops that allow you to see much more of the city as you go whizzing through it. We really loved that. We also loved the fact that we could cover so much ground in the Tuk Tuks in such a short time. There are also benefits to doing a tour like this at night, temperature and crowds (or lack thereof) being the most notable. Finally, we stopped at a fantastic restaurant for some top notch Pad Thai (apparently voted best in Bangkok) and didn't even have to queue up for hours out front as Expique had previously arranged our booking.We did all our booking online. It was fast and easy and they were very professional in terms of punctuality and customer service. Based on my experience (4 tours on 2 separate trips) I'd recommend Expique to anyone that really wants to get a deeper experience than the normal tourist checklist would provide.

Amazing Night Tuk Tuk Tour. Our tour guide "Esso" was fantastic. His English was great and he made the whole evening really entertaining. Everything that we did and every place that we visited was beyond our expectations. It was also so much fun traveling by tuk tuk in the evening. Bangkok and the attractions looked so different at night. The food also that we had was really good, especially the noodles. If your in Bangkok I'd highly recommend this tour. Lots of fun!!

Brilliant!. My friend and I booked a private evening tour. All the arrangements were done perfectly by Simon via email and a confirmation phone call was made to our hotel on the day of the tour. Our lovely guide, Cheep, met us at our hotel and escorted us to the pick up point via the BTS. The tuk tuk was clean and the Perspex roof meant the views were excellent. The driver was polite and drove at a safe pace. We were offered cold towels and water throughout the trip. We visited a number of food stalls and famous Bangkok sites, the highlights bring Wat Po (only us there and beautifully lit up) and the flower market. We were dropped off at a destination of our choice at the end of the evening. A lovely touch from Cheep when she presented my friend and I with a lovely bunch of purple orchids that we had mentioned to her that we liked when walking through the flower market. The driver had bought them when we weren't looking! What a lovely surprise. Highly recommended and will be booking again when I return to BKK with my husband in November.

Night time in Bangkok. My husband and I took the Bangkok night lights tuk tuk tour with expique and had an amazing time! We were met at the meeting point by a very smiley Namo who was our guide for the evening. No trouble finding the meeting point, the details of which were communicated very clearly through email. It was nice and easy to find and get to, being at the sky train station! While we waited for the other group members to arrive (there were 7 of us in total) Namo explained the plan for the evening and gave us little maps which explained where we were going to go. Some of our group were stuck in traffic so we set off and met them at the first stop. We were shown to our tuk tuks and introduced to our drivers. They had cold bottles of water in the tuk tuks which they offered to us throughout the evening which was a nice touch. Over the evening we zipped around Bangkok in our tuk tuks and visited all the places mentioned on the website. We went to Klong San Market where we tried some street food which was purchased by our guide and we were all given some to sample, some savoury and some sweet. We went to 2 temples - Wat Prayoon and Wat Pho. We had been to Wat Pho during the day and this was a completely different and amazing experience. It was so peaceful at night! We also went to the Giant Swing and the 24 hour flower market. The tour also included dinner at a restaurant which serves the best pad thai in Bangkok (and it was delicious!) and mango sticky rice in Chinatown for dessert. Namo was a great guide. She had a good sense of humour and was a wealth of information! She made sure we were all having a good time and eating lots of yummy food so we would go home with full tummys! This trip was a highlight of our time in Bangkok and I would highly recommend it

Wow! A night to remember! . My husband and I were part of a tour with 7 other travellers along with Esso as our guide. We were warmly greeted at the bts station by Simon the owner. We really liked this touch- it shows the pride he takes in this very special wee company.The tuk tuks with the transparent roofs were great and the drivers were extremely professional. Whizzing through the streets of Bangkok was simply exhilarating. Esso was a fabulous guide. Really warm, friendly and fun. He is a really intelligent and knowledgable guy.The tour was a brilliant combination of sights and food. You get a lot to eat! We went to a food market where we sampled lots of little snacks and a great local restaurant.But this is WAY more than a food tour! Seeing the temples at night was an amazing experience and I loved the flower market.Finishing off with sticky rice and delicious mango in china town was the perfect end to a great night and we were dropped off st our hotel by our tuk tuk driver for just 150 bhat. This was a wonderful tour which we would highly recommend.

A great way to experience Bangkok!. It is EXTREMELY hot in March during the day, so this was a great way to tour Bangkok without dying of heat exhaustion. Our tour guide, Ai, was absolutely adorable, and had great energy and knowledge throughout the entire 4 hour trip. We definitely recommend Expique for a tour that is really convenient, doesn't last all day, not too expensive, and get to try some great traditional Thai food!

Great tour of the Rattanakosin Island. Esso was a wonderful guide for a 2 hour early-morning tour of the old city. He is knowledgeable, interesting, and provided a thoughtful guide of this important part of the city. Highly recommended!

Highly recommended!. Our tour guide, Ai.. was very accommodating! She made the tour very pleasing and informative. And oh.. aside from seeing the Bangkok in a different light (TEMPLES ARE WAY AWESOME AT NIGHT).. we also never got hungry 'cos the snacks and the dinner were fulfilling! A must! :)

Bangkok by night tuk tuk. This was a great way to see Bangkok and cooler in the evening , food and flower markets , food was great and we visited temples and our tour guide was great told us anything we wanted to know about Bangkok.

The best way to see Bangkok . I went on the Bangkok by night tuk-tuk tour, it was 8 stops in four hours around Bangkok sampling food, sights and history. Really enjoyable time had by everyone. You are met at sky train station and met by owner, family, guides and drivers and are made really welcome. You then are presented with a little leaflet of tour and Thai sayings. The guide that we had Ai was very knowledgable but some things lost in translation (especially as I am brummie..lol) however she was funny and tried hard to ensure involved all of our group-7 people.You go to a number of markets and historic places and eat some really nice snacks and food along the way. The tuk tuks are really good fun, I thought that they would be smelly and horrible with fumes but the best way to see Bangkok in 4 hours, we were only there for the weekend and best choice that I made was to book this and see Bangkok from a different perspective. It was a nice touch to be dropped off back at your hotel (for 150 bath) The next day a group of 40 swedes had booked a private tour so this company is well known and reliable. Recommended to my friends who are coming next year.

Amazing tuk tuk tour!. My husband and I decided to go to Thailand to celebrate our wedding anniversary, we prepared everything in advance using viator.com; we took the night tuk tuk tour and just loved it! The guide was friendly and nice, he would explain every single thing calmly. We visited several places that would had been very difficult to reach by foot or taxi, we had appetizers, dinner and dessert so do not eat anything before going. I definetely recommend you booking tours since Bangkok is a very big city and the distances are long between the tourist attractions.

Tuk Tuk night tour. Excellent tour. Our guide Atichart (Esso) was extremely helpful and very interesting. Our drivers Sompong & Panya were wonderful and helped us all the time. As we are a bit older and my husband has leg problems nothing was too much trouble for our driver Panya. Sompong drove our daughter & son-in-law and was also very helpful.

A must-do in Bangkok! Awesome staff, original ideas and secrets spots in the city. I've done the tuk tuk night tour twice now and love it. It's perfect timing, at 7pm, when you're tired of your explorations of the day. Then you just have to sit in the tuktuk and follow the guide. The staff is very friendly, show things we would never discover by ourselves (anecdotes, local secret spots, local food, tiny alleys, a little bit of history...). + I love the little attentions such as the water, the constant smile of the staff, the food on the night market...

Excellent evening tour. After meeting at one of the Skytrain stations (very easy to find), a great evening of driving, eating and the sights of Bangkok. Esso, our guide, was very friendly and knowledgeable and the tuk-tuk drivers were also great.The tour length was an ideal duration and afterwards we were whisked back to our hotel in our tuk-tuk, completing a fun-filled and well-organised tour.

Amazing night in Bangkok. A fabulous experience!This was my first time in Thailand and Bangkok and the tour gave me a magical memory. Our tour guide Sue was wonderful and we visited lots of incredible places. One word of warning don't eat anything before you go. There is an assortment of nibbles from a local market all freshly cooked. Then the Pad Thai was delicious and eaten in the most famous Pad Thai restaurant in Bangkok. We certainly had VIP treatment (and the orange juice was to die for). Then there was even more nibbles followed by the famous mango and Sticky rice. Our Guide Sue made the evening extra special with little extra touches. If you have the opportunity to do this tour i can highly recommend it.

Terrific Tuk Tuk Tour. We had a wonderful evening of sightseeing as well as eating on this Tuk Tuk tour. Our guide Esso was the best - answered all of our questions and provided running commentary throughout the trip!
A Fun Tuk Tuk Tour. A well organized tour with plenty of tasty food, a sightseeing tour that let us see Bangkok from a different angle that we would recommend to others.

Night Tours with Jib. My family consisted of 10 people with a mixture of two extremity; young teenagers aged 15 years and old adults aged 50 years and above. Due to our large crowd, I decided to book a private tour with Expique in particular the Bangkok Night Tuk Tuk Tours.The pre-trip correspondence with Simon was full of ease. He was kind and helpful. My family and I enjoyed the short time that Simon spent with us to ensure the safety of my family.Overall, the tour was well-planned and it was worth the money. My family and I had no complaints and even wished that the tour could be extended.The main tour guide, Jib, was the best. My siblings could not stop raving about how great she was. She was able to attract the attention of both the young and old. Her stories on the history of the attractions we visited were truly remarkable and interesting. Not only did we learnt something new, all of us had fun and it was a once in a lifetime experience.Jib not only displayed a high level of knowledge but she was also sincere in trying to get to know each one of my 9 other family members which is truly amazing. She is the epitome of a great tour guide and I highly recommend her to everyone who books the tour. The trip was great because we had a great guide!

Funtastic!. We were 7 adults and 1 child; did the night tuk tuk tour last Friday and we had a great time. The guide, Jib, is a funny lady who is very accommodate. I think the highlight of the tour was the pad thai (I would say the mango sticky rice had we not have that at 11PM when we were already full with food). The tuk tuk drivers are very polite and helpful. I would recommend Expique to all travelers who are interested in taking a night tuk tuk tour.

Definitely the highlight of my visit to Bangkok!. This tour was so much fun! Our guide was really terrific and had lots of interesting information to share. Every place we visited was fascinating! One of the best parts of the tour was seeing the temples at night - when the crowds are all gone and the temperature outside is more bearable. Each stop we made was really interesting - and probably not places I would have visited on my own. The markets were fascinating - especially the flower market, which was definitely my favorite. The food we tried was terrific but what made it more special was the context. This was definitely the highlight of my visit to Bangkok and highly recommended.

Bangkok Night Tuk Tuk tour. this tour exceeded all of our expectations, it was such a fun night which all 7 of us enjoyed! our tour guide esso was a great guide, he had so much energy even after doing 2 tours before us! and his knowledge was really good, he made the tour extreemly fun for us all, if we come back to Thailand we will definitely be booking one of your other tours!

Fantastic Tour with professional Tuk Tuk Drivers!. We thoroughly enjoyed the night lights Bangkok tour by Tuk Tuk. An amazing way to see the city by night.The tour guide was informative and the Tuk Tuk drivers were kind and entertaining!We were taken to a highly acclaimed pad Thai eatery with absolutely amazing food! Despite queues lining down the street and a police officer having to do crowd control our tour guide managed to get us a table almost straight away!This tour is a must!
Amazing Tuk Tuk Tour!. Our Tuk Tuk tour with Expique in Bangkok was fabulous. Very informative, lots of yummy food and heaps of fun.

Bangkok night tour by tuk tuk. What a great way to explore Bangkok! A small tour, weather was great .. much cooler at night, and no traffic jam. Tuk tuk was clean and spacious for 2 people, water provided. Our guide Natt was very funny and shared fascinating insight of Bangkok. The 3.5 hours tour took us to the local market to try some local street food, quick stop at the temple (very different ambience at night), dinner at Thipsamai (best pad thai in Bangkok!), walk around the famous flower market and more food in Chinatown .. mango sticky rice, yumm!! They even took a few photos of the tour participants and emailed them out to us. A must do when in Bangkok!

Interesting tour. This tour was very interesting. The guide had excellent knowledge of the several parts of the tour and gave us very much historical details. Things we didn't know before and that information made the tour even more interesting.

Awesome Way To See Bangkok!. We booked the night time TukTuk tour for our first night in Bangkok. The staff were great! The drivers were fun! We really enjoyed ourselves while learning about Bangkok's history and culture. This was a great way to start the trip and helped us orient ourselves within the city. It was also very cool to see the temples at night (when it isn't busy and hot!) Would recommend to family and friends!

Even kids loved it !. To Simon, Esso and the team,I, my husband and 2 girls would like to sincerely thank you for giving us a great time during the tour and I must say that it was the highlight of our 5-day trip. My eldest daughter could not forget about the different types of food that Esso bought for us at Khlongsan. We tried to look elsewhere for the sausage wrapped in pancake that we ate at Khlongsan but we were unsuccessful. My youngest liked the tuktuk ride so much that she bought a tuktuk model afterwards as souvenir. Esso was so great at keeping the 2 girls entertained and attentive during the whole trip from the long-tail boat to the tuktuk ride.

Great night tour, very professional. We really enjoyed the night tour - Simon and his team are very professional. Visiting the temples at night and zipping through the streets after dark is a great way to see Bangkok. Highly recommend.

Highly recommended!. Jib, our tour guide gave us a very informative insights about the history of each tourist spot. The food tripping was good and our tuktuk driver is really friendly and accommodating. You can request a street food you want to taste apart from the food ordered by the tour guide.

The best tour EVER!. As a seasoned visitor to Bangkok, I booked this as a good way to introduce my travelling companion to the delights of Bangkok. Bee, our guide, was a happy soul, as were the whole team really. The drivers were considerate and careful. The destinations chosen to give a super introduction to the sights, smells and sounds of this rapidly changing city. Don't hesitate, include this in your itinerary. Small group numbers mean there is an intimacy to expique tours that large coach tours just cannot match, making you feel valued and cherished as a visitor to this beautiful land of smiles (which given the amount of sour faces at arrivals at the airport, I had worried might have changed since my previous visit). I look forward to returning and joining a few of the walking tours for more insight into all things uniquely Thai. Thank you Expique - long may you flourish.

Great tuk tuk tour at night, food and temple tour fantastic fun!. We had a great time tonight exploring food, markets and temples in a small group of 6. Our guide Bee was full of information, the tuk tuk drivers friendly and drove us back to the hotel end of the evening. Do this tour in the cool of the evening it was great I highly recommend

Great introduction to Bangkok. Booked this tour knowing we would be sleep deprived having arrived the same morning from uk. It was the perfect introduction to Bangkok. Only 8 of us in 4 tuk tuks guided expertly by Bee. Having never visited south east Asia before we were nervous of eating street food so for our first stop to be a market where Bee bought and talked us through the delicious food was fantastic, we didn't look back in sampling many yummy snacks throughout our stay after her introduction. We went on to visit temples, including Wot Pho, the fowler market, had our main course at a fabulous pad Thai restaurant and finished with mango dessert and a bunch of orchids. Don't miss this tour.

Highly recommend it!. Bangkok night lights tuk tuk tour was good. It was the third Bangkok trip but night tour of temples and did tuk tuk ride was the first time. The historic sites of th night was quite and peaceful and beautiful. In this tour, my favorite was the dinner at Thipsamai street restaurant, vist to Wat po in the evening and riding in a tuk tuk. Lastly the flowers given as a gift. I would recommend this tour especially to people can speak english because I did speak broken english inconvenient failed to smoothly communicate with guide Mr. Esso but he did best for us. He was very friendly and bright. One more thing, Please don't eat beforehand because you'll get to eat snaks and tasty Pad thai during this tour.Highly recommend it!

3 in 1 - unexpectedly good combination. If you want to combine food tasting, a little bit of history and a must do tuk tuk ride, this is the tour for you.The tour lasts about 4hours and besides the tasty food, a lot of places are seen.We especially liked the night walk at Wat Pho temple. It was amazing to see it during the night and with no crowds around. Our guide Ip was very charming lady and very well organized.We liked the flower and vegetables market.And I still remember the taste of the special pad thai that we tasted without waiting on a queue, mmmmm....

Best night out in Bangkok. I did this tour because as a single female traveler I did not really want to wander the streets of Bangkok at night too much on my own. this was simply great FUN. The tuk tuks are comfortable, you can have as much water as you need. The tops are see-through, there were 2 persons to a tuk tuk and the places we went to were GREAT. The flower market is spectacular as was the first local market. Our guide spoke very good English and was very cute and knowledgable. She loves her city. The snacks she bought for us were delicious and on my own I would not have dared to buy them. This way you are introduced to things you would normally just look over. The dinner was very good too and all in all everyone had a great time. One of the tuk tuks drove me to my hotel after the tour which I found very considerate. I would highly recommend this tour especially to single travelers.

Amazing 2 days in Bangkok courtesy of Expique. We knew we were coming to Bangkok and had little knowledge of what to see and do so we got in touch with Simon and his team who were such an amazing help and organised a few private tours as well as the infamous Tuk Tuk night tour. They answered all emails promptly and gave us great advice even about what to wear to the temples etc to ensure that we didn't get caught out. On the first day we were met at our hotel by Simon and Esso our private guide who was going to show us the sights and sounds of Bangkok. Esso was friendly and fun and really well informed and made the 2 days fly by! I would strongly recommend booking a tour with him. On the first day which was a private tour we went to all the main temples including Wat Pho, The Grand Palace, Wat Arun etc. It was amazing and Esso picked us up nice and early so we beat most of the crowds. They really are beautiful and well worth the trip. We then went and did the river sights and a canal tour which was simply amazing. Taking a long tail boat through the canals and seeing the local life really did allow us to see the non tourist side of Bangkok and experience real culture. We also went and had some terrific food as a local restaurant on the river and Esso ordered us a variety of food to try and needless to say we fell in love with some of the tastes!! Especially the soups! After that Esso escorted us back home on the sky train which was another experience altogether!! After a quick nap we then headed out for the Tuk Tuk nighttime tour which was led by Yin and she was fantastic! It is clear she has a love for the city which changes so drastically at night time compared to day. We explored some quirky markets, saw local people cooking and selling street food, saw the temples at night and had an amazing meal with delicious Pad Thai and the most refreshing orange juice in the world! The Tuk Tuk itself is such a fun experience and as you whizz around Bangkok with the wind in your hair you definitely feel like you are on holiday! We picked up a lot of knowledge that night that you simply can't pick up by reading a guide book. It finishes around 11.30 and then we got the Tuk Tuk back to our hotel. The next day we were up bright at early and left at 7 to explore the floating markets. We went to a couple that day. The first was a quieter traditional one where local people buy and sell fruit, vegetables and other foods and to float by on a boat and watch local children play in the river and dogs running around was lovely! It felt like we were people watching on an everyday weekend ritual. The next was the famous damneon which was simply the opposite. It was much much busier and full of tourists however good to get the contrast with. Snakes, monkeys, spiders were aplenty for you to have photos with and they sell a lot of clothing and market type souvenirs aimed at tourists. After a delicious lunch of more traditional Thai food on a river side restaurant it was back to the hotel before an early morning flight.The private tours had all transport, food and drinks included as well as the guide and were extremely good value for money. Esso was excellent and had funny stories and such a great manner about him that I wish we could have done more! Thanks Simon and the team for making our first trip to Thailand such an amazing start!

Professional and High Quality Company. Dealing with Simon and Expique is s pleasure. He goes to great lengths to accommodate and be informative. Rarely have I seen a Tour company or any business for that matter go out of their way so much to make sure the clients are satisfied, all questions answered, and details understood. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Great night tour of Bangkok. I had no set expectations when I joined this tour but let me just tell you...it was awesome. Namo, our guide, was funny and chatty. Riding around in a tuk tuk is awesome. The stop at the market was fun...loved the delicious Thai sausages. Also great to see a temple after dark when the crowds have dispersed. A very chill experience. We got a tuk tuk with a see through top which was great. Loved the flower market stop. Cold bottled water provided throughout and plenty of bathroom breaks if you need them. Well-organised and well-executed. FUN too. Bravo.

A custom tour for the 3 of us. My husband, sister, and I wanted a basic walking tour of Bangkok and we were pleased with our experience. We are in our late 60's early 70's but in great physical condition so the walking was great. Saw sides of Bangkok that we had not seen before. Our guide Esso was perfect. Explained a lot and was very friendly and safety conscious.

Great Night Out. We had a great time on our night time tuk tuk tour. Our guide, Natt, was knowledgeable and friendly and we enjoyed visiting different parts of the city. The food was diverse and plentiful and it was fun to see what Natt was going to bring us next. It was so nice to leave all the planning to someone else and just enjoy the experience. Highly recommend!

Unforgettable experience. Tuk-Tuk tour conducted by expique is excellent and one of must do's in bangkok.Everything is very neatly planned and execution is perfect.Guide Natt is very knowlegable,patient,accomodating and simply fantastic.Though bit on pricier side ,its defenitely a must do experience.

Very Enjoyable. This was a great way to see Bangkok and experience things that are probably a bit too hard for the average tourist - markets, temples and festivals by night and good street food (though it is not a specialist food tour as such). It is well organised and friendly. The tuk-tuks are part of the fun and good way to get around in the cool of the night. The only negative was that the tour maybe starts a bit late and therefore it was almost midnight by the time we got back to out hotel.

A Night on the Town. When in Bangkok book a tour with Expique! Our tour guide Esso was welcoming, fun, and knowledgeable. We were able to see lots of main attractions and ate at a few popular places where the food was excellent. This tour gives you the great opportunity to see some popular Bangkok locations at work and lit up at night. We highly recommend it!!

If you have "One Night in Bangkok", take Expique's "Bangkok Night Lights". I this tour on January 7th and was so glad I did. While I had already taken a city tour earlier in my trip, I still learned new interesting facts and history of Bangkok through our well-spoken and personable guide, Jib. All of the food stops were clean and absolutely delicious and for the trepidatious, all of the food selections were not too challenging. Lastly, the tour was well paced and the tuk tuk had the welcome modification of a clear roof top so you could actually see this beautiful and vibrant city by night.

Highly recommended!. Really enjoyed this tour and would highly recommend it. It was great to see some of the sights lit up at night and our tour guide Jib was brilliant. We were in a group of 6 people and went on this tour on our 2nd night in Bangkok which was a good intro to the city.

Tuk Tuk The Night Away!. Terrific tour by a cracking company, simply first class all round. Booked after reading positive Trip Advisor reviews. One of our group fell ill on the day of the tour after we had already paid in full and we failed to turn up. We assumed that would just be the end of it and wrote it off as just one of those things. However, we received a very polite email from boss Simon enquiring if there was something wrong that had put us off going. After reading our explanation about the illness he very kindly agreed to rebook our trip and only asked for a very reasonable administration fee and boy are we glad that he did as we thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience. Jib, the female guide was fun, welcoming and extremely knowledgeable speaking fluent English and answering detailed questions with real authority. We got to see lots of main attractions and were fed until we could face no more food. Full marks all round and a great big thanks from two extremely satisfied customers!

Great Intro to Bangkok. We really enjoyed this tour. We were able to see the major monuments lit up at night which we wouldn't have done on our own. We visited two markets which was very interesting. The food on the tour was excellent. I loved that we went to popular places with excellent food. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone that is looking for a fun night assisted by some great guides.

Great idea for a night out... Great night out.. get to see loads of great places.. nice food.. Tut tut is great fun.. The team go out there way to make sure you have a good night.. Thanks Sue and Simon..

Exceptional !!. I worked with Expique tours prior to our arrival to organize a night tour with 3 tuk tuks for six of us to celebrate my husbands 70 th birthday. I can not adequately express how fabulous the whole experience was ! Our guide Jib was delightful, fun witty and very knowledgable. We were picked up at our hotel and the spent the rest of the evening visiting a street market and sampling delicious food Jib selected for us, visited several temples that were magical at time all lit up with no one else around, we toured the area of the giant swing and were treated a beautiful light display from New Years, ate at a fabulous pad Thai restaurant, and also got see the evening flower market and Chinatown . All six of us absolutely enjoyed the whole evening. The whole Expique team went beyond and above with special touches and attention to ensure my husbands 70 th birthday celebration was of the best. If you do not experience an Expique tour you will miss out on what I guarantee you will be one of your highlights to a visit to Bankok !
Tuk tuk tour. Very nice evening tour with interesting stops (Wat Po by night, flower market, local market, China town). Very good first impression of Bangkok in case you just arrived.

Highlight of our trip to Bangkok. My family of 4 took the evening Tuk Tuk tour and were all very impressed with the service of this company. The owner met us at our pick up location and assisted us on the Sky Rail to the starting location for the tour. Eso was our guide for the evening and he did an awesome job in insuring we all enjoyed our evening. The tuk tuks made frequent stops along the route to view and taste the highlights of the Bangkok nightlife. All food, including a tasty Pad Thai were included in the tour. The tuk tuk drivers were friendly and drove us back to our hotel at the end of our tour.

Bangkok by Night - Christmas Tuk Tuks. I was a little anxious that I had overpaid for a Tuk Tuk ride, but this tour is well worth every dollar spent. It was a 4 hour night tour on Christmas night. All drivers were dressed as Santa and the Tuk Tuks decorated. It made for a fun tour. The temple other sights and food were terrific. Jib was an awesome tour guide. The street food was better than what we envisaged (being a bit wary of it previously). It is a must do when in Bangkok as it gives such a different perspective.

Bangkok Night Lights - Great Tour. We did the night tour of temple/food tour and it was fantastic! I loved the caravan of tuk-tuks going to different sites. We took this night tour our first day in Bangkok. They take you to many temples at night and it was beautiful to see. Later, we went back to the temples during the day (so when we got home we had day and night pics of the same temples). The first place you start Klong San Market. This is a great market to shop for clothing (although not much time to shop on this tour). We went to a different market later and the Klong San Market was a better market. When you book this tour, please look at all their stops. They do follow exactly what is written on their website. The night we went, 2 girls were furious that we were going to the flower market because they went to the flower market during the day. So check all the stops. They feed you along the way and it was more food than I could possibly eat (included in the price). Everything was great. The guide was great and they even emailed me some group pictures of our night tour in Bangkok. I highly recommend this tour.

Best Night Tour in Bangkok!!!!. If you are looking for a fun way to explore Bangkok at night with your family or friends...look no further! We took our boys age 11 & 18 on the Night City Tour during our last holiday. We all learned some great Thai history and culture, ate amazing food and had a lot of fun along the way. My husband and I lived in Thailand for a few years and it was great for us to explore our old home in a new way.

Bangkok by Night . This tour was a great experience. Simon and his team do a terrific job to make sure you are taken care of and enjoy Bangkok during the dark hours. Initially we were extremely late (first night in Bangkok) and got there thinking they had left without us, but to our surprise, they were nice enough to wait for us. We do recommend leaving your hotel early enough to make it on time, specially if you are new to the Bangkok transport system. The rest of the night was amazing, a lot to see and take in. The food was really good! I have a lot of food restrictions but Simon and the team worked very hard at providing different options for me. Overall, this tour is a must do if you stay in Bangkok!

Excellent tour - Highly Recommended. We really cannot recommend this tour enough! After meeting Simon and our guide Jib at an arranged time at a train station, we set off in our Tuk Tuk (after an hilarious welcome from the drivers) to markets, temples and other landmarks...don't eat beforehand because you'll be very well fed! Our guide Jib was an absolute sweetheart who was very knowledgeable, friendly and welcoming....with a lovely gesture for the group at the end of the tour. Cannoy recommend this tour enough! Liam & Lauren

A one of a kind night tour. I lived in Bangkok for 2 years ('00-'01) but never had I visited the places Expique took us to. Our tour guide Esso made the tour very interesting telling us cultural stories about a local ghost, funerals (as one was being conducted at a temple we visited), about the Thai religion and beliefs, and food. Bangkok is so lively at night so you get to see all that's happening (especially the flower market!).I would recommend this tour especially to young adults - maybe not the elderly or young children as the Tuktuks can be a bit bumpy.

Fantastic Tour. Loved being a part of this tour. Bee was a fantastic guide and our tuk tuk driver was great too. He slowed down for us to take photos and we felt completely safe. Bee was so informative and we enjoyed hearing about Thai culture and traditions. Being at night the weather was pleasant and we loved eating our way around. We recommend this tour for all ages. You would be missing out on something special if you didn't do this tour.

Excellent Tour of Bangkok sites!. This was an excellent tour and a great value! My only suggestion to the tour company is to tell people to come HUNGRY since there are several opportunities to eat on the trip, all of which are covered with the fee that was paid. Our tour guide, Nom (sp?), was excellent. He is from Bangkok, was passionate about sharing the city and it's sites with visitors, and speaks very good English. I really don't have a single complaint!

Tuk tuk night sights. Fab time last night seeing the sights with Bee and friendly tuk tuk driver. Great snacks from the market things we wouldn't normally try and lovely pad thai meal. Loved getting the tuk tuk back to hotel later. Would highly recommend this trip.

Do it. Fantastic way to experience city and its culture. Wow. What a great evening. Did this on our third night in Bangkok and wished we had done it on our first. Great way to see around the city. Our guide Bee was able to share more than just history and facts with lots of info on Thai life. The drivers were friendly and the tuk Turks comfortable and safe. If you're almost 6 foot tall like me these tuk tuks with transparent roofs are the only way you'll see anything. Visited markets (ate our way round) and sights and got to spend time in Wat Pho in the evening when lit up. So much more pleasant than fighting for space with other tourists during the day. Food was great and we were fed and provided with water all through the tour. I'm a huge fan of small group tours (our tour had five couples in convoy in our tuk tuks) and this one didn't disappoint. If you're looking for a tour this one is highly recommended.

Tuk Tuk night tour. Excellent night tour of Bangkok. The tour covered quite a bit of the city and areas that many tourists may not have time to see. Really enjoyed getting to see the city from a Tuk Tuk and the guide made the tour fun and interactive. Would definitely recommend taking the tour.

See the otherside of Bangkok. Expuque's Tuk Tuk toursrs are justifiably popular, but any tour with this local company is informative, properly quirky, and great value. You will truly enjoy the exposure to local life and snacking on delicious carefully chosen street foods. Do not hesitate sign up. The guides are awesome.
Awesome experience. I thoroughly enjoyed the Bangkok Night Lights Tuk Tuks Tour and had an excellent time discovering Bankgok sights at night. Bee, our guide was great!!

Brilliant tour. I did this tour and would highly recommend it. Jib, the tour guide was brilliant, very knowledgeable. The meeting place was easy to get to and the stops along the way were good. The tuk tuk drivers were very professional. If you have a spare evening in Bangkok then this is a must.
One night in Bangkok.... Simon, Bee and the expique team of tuk tuk drivers provided a fun, tasty and insightful perspective of this crazy city...

Must do. I tagged along on this tour with friends and it turned out to be a great decision. Our guide, jib, was the bestest! I usually tune out most of the guides on tours, especially the ones in thailand because they can't go beyond 2 senteces without making a sexual reference, but Jib was so informative and relatable. Despite time restrictions she did her best to let us take in the sites and even do a little shopping. It was hot as hell the day I went but they went out of their way by giving us cold waters and cold packaged face towels. Jib's english is absolutely perfect if that is also a concern. So basically if you decide to reserve this tour try to get jib as your guide. I would definitely recommend this tour.

Tuk Tuk Rain or Shine!!. The rain poured hard but this did not stop us. All spots were interesting, the food was just right. We went to the famous Pad Thai restaurant that was featured in No Reservations with Anthony Bourdain, called "Thipsamai" for dinner (see our group photo- seated at center is Nett-the tour guide). The Pad Thai was excellent. There was a long line to eat at this place, but we had reservations waiting! Very good at considering this restaurant as Pad Thai is the hallmark delicacy of Thailand. The tuk tuk drivers were very gracious. Very considerate especially with the hard down-pour. The tuk tuks were easily identifiable (good points for safety), important in the rainy dark streets. They have the tour logo in the back and they line up with their different colored lights while they wait; ours was blue. Our tuk tuk also took us to our hotel after the tour. Great job Expique!!! I will definitely recommend and/or do this again on my next return to Bangkok.

Bangkok night tour by tuk tuk-fun tour. My friend and I did this night tour in Bangkok. it was a blast and well worth it. Expique's empolyess are very professional and want to make sure you are having a good time. They take you to some of the night markets and areas that only the locals go to, along with an excellent Thai Restaurant know for their Pad Thai. I did not realize how much food we would be eating, it was worth every penny and took us to areas that we would of not known about or gone to on our own. Bangkok is so big and hard to get around on your own so this was great, loved every minute of it.

Great way to experience the highlights of Bangkok . Excellent night tour. Very accommodating given we accidentally booked for the wrong date. The tour guides were highly knowledgeable and had a good sense of humour. Seeing the temples and other attractions under the night lights with an engaging guide was a unique experience. The food was next level - bring your appetite!
FUN!. I took this tour in October on my first night in Bangkok. Esso was very fun and nice. It is a blast riding in a Tuk Tuk at night. It was a great introduction to a wonderful city.

Bangkok streetfoods and sights at night. I took the tuktuk night tour as a solo traveller so I was much relieved to meet 2 others who joined the tour by themselves also. Our guide, Esso, was perfect for the job. Genuinely friendly, offering everything he knows about the places we visited, picking some awesome streetfoods for us, offering to take our photos, and helping us cross the busy night streets of Bangkok without getting killed. Everything from the meeting place up to the restaurants and the desserts and the drop off at the end was well planned. It certainly felt a lot shorter than 4 hours, which is good because it meant I enjoyed the tour a lot I didn't notice where all those hours had gone to. The reason I didn't give it a perfect 5 is because I didn't think the itinerary particularly highlighted the best that Bangkok had to offer.

Night Tuk; Best Tuk!!. Phenomenal experience on the Night Tuk Tuk tour. Come with an appetite as there are so many delicious treats along the way.Great to experience the city alive in the evening in all it's glory. Walking Wat Pho at night was awe inspiring even having seen it the day before. Lots of fun local real life stops in the flower market and train market.Jib was a great guide with just the right amount of information to consume and such a great job connecting with all people on the tour.Of special note is just a real quality of details from cold water to cold towels to special gifts along the way it is impressive to see a company pride itself on true customer service in this type of industry.We enjoyed it thoroughly and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone wanting to tour just a little differently.

Wicked - Must Do Tour. Wow, full on tour, you never stop for 4 hours. From the minute you get into the tuk tuk you are well cared for , never left alone and helped throughout this fantastic tour. Our party of 9 were thrown together and all really enjoyed this fast paced trip. Every stop is so different, from the peaceful temples, to the busy markets and the food en route is fab. Jib the tour guide is interesting, fun and spends time with each guest, she's a real credit. A MUST DO tour whilst in Bangkok.

Bangkok at night. Even if we didn't get to try the local food and see beautiful temples, getting to see Bangkok at night was worth it alone. What a great city. All our Tuk Tuk's had seethrough roofs which were brilliant. Our guide Jib was a fountain of knowledge and we ate far too much delicious street food and pad thai. I would definitely recommend this tour!

Interesting and varied tour. enjoyable tour of Bangkok at night. Informative guides and friendly tuk-tuk drivers! lots of opportunities to enjoy delicious food whilst learning about the city, as well as seeing some of the highlights such as Wat Pho at night and the night flower market. Very enjoyable - would recommend to others

Great tour. It was a great tour, very informative, learnt a lot about Bangkok's history, tuk tuk were a great way to travel, tasted different Thai food, our tour guide was every helpful, it was a hot night & they supplied us with water & cold hand towels though out the night, we had a great night out

Amazing Tour!. We booked this tour for our last night of a two and a half week trip and it was one of our favorites by far! The guides Jib and Bee were absolutely fantastic and so funny! We were fed so much delicious food - our favorite pad thai of the entire trip! Were able to visit the Grand Palace at night - so serene and quite it was just beautiful versus all the chaos and heat during the day. A definite must!

Great tuk tuk tour by night. My friend booked this tour so we could see different parts of Bangkok by night and what fun it was! We had two lovely enthousiastic tour guides, who knew a lot about the things we went to see. The meeting point and the guides were easy to find. The tour took about 4 hours and took us to markets, the river, different monuments and temples, amongst others the Wat Po, so beautiful by night! Along the ride we got some Thai food tastings and a nice pad tai dinner in the most famous pad tai restaurant. For around 150 Baht the tuk tuk driver will bring you to your hotel after finishing the tour. We can recommend Expique, everything is organized very well.

"AMAZING Bangkok Food Tour by TUK TUK!.. The food was absolutely delicious (Aroi) the tour guides were welcoming and full of knowledge I would definitely recommend anyone visiting Bangkok this tour is a must see.
TukTuk and night lights. Enjoyable variety of tasty foods, A quiet time in temple grounds, away from the daytime crowds all with a knowledgeable and friendly guide.

Bangkok on Tuk tuk by night. We really enjoyed our guide Jip with her very informative but fun comments. She made the night most enjoyable,The Tuk Tuk driver was very considerate to us as older persons and was very good aat his job.

Best tour in Bangkok. After research on TripAdvisor we chose this tour and mighty glad we did!! It was so well run, to precision, from the initial booking (Namo) to the end - everyone was very friendly and professional. Our guide 'Jib' did a fantastic job. What a credit she is to the organization. Not forgetting our drivers. One passenger had slight mobility problems, but the driver did his utmost to park his tuk tuk with care and easy access - most appreciated. The walk through the markets (including the flower market) - tasting snacks on the way - to the Wat Pho by night, peacefully - to the lovely dinner - to Chinatown for sweets. A perfect night. Our party of 4 loved it and thoroughly recommend it and well worth the cost. (Loved the transparent roof on the tuk tuk)
Excellent night tour on tuk-tuk. Excellent night tour on tuk-tuk of the places known and loved by the local people. You will get a feel of the city and people who live in it
Bangkok by Tuk Tuk. An excellent way to find your way around Bangkok. Highly recommend it. Nat knows his stuff and Simon is very proud of his business.
the best tour of BKK. If anyone wants to smell and taste BKK, this tour would be it.Great follow up and well organized. Even the drivers were well trained.

Wonderful evening tuk tuk tour. The service offered by Expique is exceptional. From initial contact to the excellent tour with Jib. It was lovely to see a few sights of Bangkok without hordes of people. So beautiful all lit up. Jib took such good care of us and the snacks we had were interesting. The dinner of phad thai was stunning as was the mango and sticky rice dessert in Chinatown.Would highly recommend.

Bangkok Nights Tour. Bangkpk Nights tour by tuk tuk was a unique and great way to see Bangkok after dark. We went to places that I would not have thought to go to at night. Wat Po was particularly beautiful at night and had such a different atmosphere without all the tourists. The food choices were delicious and gave me a chance to try things that I probably wouldnt have tried outside this tour. The guide Esso was very friendly and informative, taking the time to explain things and also answer every ones questions. I would definitely recommend doing this tour while in Bangkok.

Fun way to see some different night sights. I went on this tour with a group of 12. The tour guide, Khun Jib, was friendly, attentive & had interesting informative stories about the areas we went to. The guide-in-training Khun Yin was also friendly and nice to chat with in the tuk tuk between destinations. Our tuk tuk driver was polite, attentive & a good driver. Expique, the tour company, uses a network of reliable tuk tuk's and drivers that they can trust & count on.I have lived in Bangkok for a long time so I thought 4 hours would be a little long for this type of tour for me, But I could not believe how fast the time went, in fact it was closer to 5 hours & the time flew by. It was great fun to ride the tuk tuk to several markets, landmarks & food stalls/street restaurants to see a different aspect of Bangkok at night. My favourite was the dinner at Thipsamai Street Restaurant & the visit to Wat Po in the evening.All in all it was a great tour and I look forward to doing it again.

Superb night tour!. Our guide was knowledgeable, patient and fun! Everything was VIP. Picked us up at our hotel, two tuk tuk's delivering to the front door of every destination. No lines. Esso was a fountain of information, and was great with our two kids... quizzing them on what they were learning as we went along. Seeing the temples at night is a completely different (MUST DO) experience. It's quiet (only two other people on the grounds of Wat Pho when we were there). This tour group is top notch all the way. Thank you Esso and team!!

Bangkok by night. We have just returned from our two week Thailand holiday and although this was my third visit to Bangkok, this tour was undoubtedly our biggest highlight! From start to finish the service offered by Simon and Natt was exceptional. They accommodated all our last minute requests, changed our meeting point (at our request) at the last minute because we were stuck in traffic, and displayed such friendliness and patience throughout. We opted for a private 6 person tour with some special requests and they made it happen without a fuss. Seeing the sights at dusk, zipping around the city in three tuk-tuks, being enthralled by Natt's condensed account of Thai history made for a magical, fun and thrilling evening. I can't recommend this tour and this company highly enough. I thought I had seen all that Bangkok had to offer, but this personalised tour left us with some precious memories and fresh perspectives. Thank you so much, Linda Fookwe and family:-)

Great fun and new sights - even for a Bangkok resident!!. I've lived in Bangkok for over two years and was surprised at how many new sights and curiosities the night time tuk tuk tour introduced me to. We spent time on the Thonburi side of the river which rarely gets tourist traffic - it was interesting to see different out-of-the-way places. They've clear done great research!Jib was a fantastic guide - informative, friendly, fluent in English and easy to understand (not always the case with Thai guides!) The tour was very well organized, they thought of all the little details and it made for a great night out - even as an expat!!Thanks Expique!!

Bangkok beauty in the later hours. This was a great tour. Seeing this busy city at night is quite the experience. You visit temples, markets, are fed local cuisine, and taught about how the city came to be. It's a crash course with no literal crashing along the streets of Bangkok. Our little sparrow guide "Jib" was sweet and her English was great. Also, she had another guide along to field questions and keep the large group informed. All of the tuk tuk drivers were kind as well and made sure that we were dry when the rain started pouring.

Would highly recommend the Bangkok at Night Tour. The nighttime Tuk Tuk Tour was really special and showed us a part of Bangkok we wouldn’t have seen on our own. Esso is a great guide! He’s nice, knowledgeable, and quite funny. The whole tour was super fun and the parts that stand out are the pad thai at Thipsamai and the tour of Wat Pho. We went to Wat Pho at daytime a week earlier and it was jam-packed with other tourists, of course. It was a real treat to explore the temple grounds without the crowds so that we could truly take in the beauty of the temples and architecture. It was an amazing time and we’d recommend it to anyone visiting Bangkok.

Gand tour of Bangkok. We did the grand tour of Bangkok for a whole day, starting with biking and finishing with the Night Lights tuktuk tour. Essentially it's two different tours in a day. Since we only had two days in Bangkok we really wanted to make the most of it and the tour was a fantastic start for our trip.We were afraid it would be a bit too long, but the time went by flying with the two amazing tour guides we had and with everything we saw. A fantastic day in Bangkok overall giving you glimpses of very different parts to of the city.

Great way to experience Bangkok by night. We booked the Bangkok Night Lights Tuk Tuks Tour and had a great time. Even after visiting Bangkok a few times already we had a fantastic time, saw some new places and learnt some great new things about Thailand and Bangkok.The guides and Tuk Tuk drivers are very friendly, the snakes and food provided was all great.I only booked the tour via the web site the night before and after business hours, but communications was prompt and clear. Highly recommend.

Magical evening around Bangkok.. What a lovely evening viewing Bangkok from a Tuk Tuk with a happy driver. The food was gorgeous and we saw so much of Bangkok in only 4 hours. Our guide Esso was really pleasant and happy. This evening made me fall in love with Bangkok, which I thought prior was to busy and stuffy. Recommend to any traveller. Thank you :)

Brilliant tour. Joined a group of 6 as a solo traveller. The whole experience was great from the interesting stories to the snacks and dinner provided during the trip. Esso is a very dedicated and professional guide and made the whole tour very friendly. Especially enjoyed the seeing the tombs at night. Attention to details (eg. water, wet towels when we got hot) from the organisers is very appreciated.

Best tour ever!. As a female solo traveler, this was a great way to get acquainted to Bangkok and see some amazing sights. Esso was absolutely the best guide and incredibly kind and funny. The food was great, and it was so fun touring around at night by tuk-tuk. Seeing Wat Pho with no one else around was a dream. And Expique was so accommodating and helpful. I highly recommend!
Bangkok night lights Tuktuk tour. Just a fantastic tour and a great team work. I had fun discovering corners of the city that I wouldn't ever find alone

Fantastic way to View the City. We went on this tour on the first night to get a good look at Bangkok - it was fabulous. The team, Jib and Namo, were both wonderful girls who really enjoyed their time showing you the city.Tea was at this amazing Pad Thai place, you have to try the orange juince, it is like nectar from the Gods!They take photos throughout the night and email them to you the next day!Great night!
Bangkok "Awesome" Tour. You should try this tour if this is your first visit, or second or third etc you would never regret joining this tour...

Fantastic!. I did the Tuk Tuk tour at night! It was excellent and I would do it again when I am in Bangkok! Our guide was very knowledgable and very friendly! There was ALOT if food included so don't eat before hand! The trip was very well organised and the meeting point was easily accessible by sky train! After the trip the company email some pictures which is great as their pictures were much better quality than mine!Must do for a night in Bangkok!

Perfect introduction to Bangkok. I can't rate this tour highly enough- if you want a quick crash course on Bangkok look no further. It's clear Jib and Namo love their jobs and this city- I found them to be knowledgeable, friendly, funny and incredibly warm. Plus their English is amazing and had patience with this Australians poor Thai pronounciation! Tuk tuk with the clear roof is perfect to enjoy the scenery, and the drivers always had a smile! Jib and Namo filled us to the brim with streetfood, snacks I wouldn't have dared try on my own, world famous pad Thai and sticky rice. Plus they bought us anything at the markets that we hadn't tried yet (local fruits etc). I loved the lotus flower folding- we ran into a friend of Jib's who taught us at the flower market. I mentioned my birthday was coming up and the girls even got birthday candles for me. I even got an impromptu motorcycle ride back to the station.Do yourself a favour and book this tour before everyone catches on.

Great Tour of Bangkok. If you are in Bangkok you must do this tour! It was a lot of fun. The food is great, the sites spectacular (especially Wat Pho at night) and Nat was great at telling you the history of Bangkok! They even send you an email with some pictures of your tour. The Tuk Tuk drivers were on hand with umbrellas when necessary and took me back to my hotel for a reasonable rate!

Night night. Good informational tour and great insight on local favorites. Loved riding the Tuk Tuk......the temples were great to view at night, calming and the tour guide had great stories to tell. You can tell he enjoys his job.

Tuk Tuk Tour. We were 4 ladies doing the tuk tuk tour and thoroughly enjoyed our Tuk Tuk tour. We were meet by Esso and Nimo at the BTS who were friendly.Our guide Esso was very knowledgeable and polite. We enjoyed all the sights they took us to and all the food we tried. The Pad Thai is definetly the best we all have tried. The tuk tuk drivers were polite and friendly and drove safely. We would recommend you do this tour.

Fun and interesting way to see Bangkok. We booked a private night tuk tuk tour with Expique since we had 17 people in our group. Simon, I believe the CEO of Expique, was very gracious in accommodating all of our needs (kids, vegetarians, etc.) throughout the whole booking process. We were picked up by 2 vans from our hotel, and our guides were Natt and Namo who were both super friendly and just delightful. There was some traffic plus it was raining that day so we were a bit disappointed about that, but once we arrived at the drop off place and saw all those colorfully lit up tuk tuks, we were just amazed. There were 7 tuk tuks all parked in line, and each driver had the same uniform shirt and cap, and holding umbrellas for us! They even provided us with ponchos! What a great service and organization. We were so impressed that they were so prepared! So off we started on our tour. The air while you're riding in these open tuk tuks was just a great break from the morning summer heat of Bangkok so it was refreshing, plus the lights of the city were fantastic. Since it was raining, we didn't really get to get out to see the big swing, but we did pass by it. We ate at this hidden local restaurant that is behind this dark alley where they were cooking the food outside, and the food was just delicious! The food was a good portion. Like I said, we had kids so of course there were some picky eaters and drinkers. Namo was so sweet to even go out to get some juice for them because the restaurant did not have any. The tuk tuk drivers also had cold water and refreshing towels for each one of us after we finished Wat Pho. They were just amazing! We ended the tour eating mango and sticky rice at Chinatown, and Natt and Namo got us extra plates because some really loved it. They gave the women and the kids a flower bracelet each from the flower market as their token of appreciation, and that was just the topping on the cake. It was great that we also had the vans to take us back to the hotel because the kids were pooped out. Overall, it was an amazing time with Natt and Namo and the drivers, and we would definitely recommend this. Thank you again Expique for the wonderful time!

The highlight of my time in Bangkok!. Myself and my girlfriend booked this tour just the night before having read about it on a travelling blog – what a great decision it turned out to be! The meeting point for the at Krung Thonburi BTS station. Here we met Jip (pronounced Jeep), our guide for the evening. There was to be 8 people on the tour and with two people per tuk-tuk, we set off as soon as everyone had arrived. Our first stop was Klong San Market. Jip guided us through the market, giving us its history and pointing out interesting aspects of everyday life in Thailand. About halfway through the market she stopped to talk about the food being sold by one of the vendors. Unexpectedly, she ordered some for each person and offered it around! I had not expected the tour to literally include a taste of Thai culture so this was a great and very pleasant surprise! After the market, we drove to the riverside where Jip gave us some of its history and offered us some bread and green custard – an odd combination to those (like myself!) who are not used to it but very tasty nonetheless! We then moved on to Wat Prayurawongsawat where we unexpectedly happened to witness the burning of paper as an offering at death. Following this we moved on to the Giant Swing and the to dinner at Thip Samai. it's proclaimed to be the best Pad Thai in the world and it certainly didn’t disappoint!After dinner we moved to Wat Pho which was incredible to experience while deserted in the dark of night. This was followed by a trip to the flow and vegetable market – a maze of colours where once again, Jip bought fruit for everyone to sample for dessert! We finished up in Chinatown, where along with the fruit, we were served mango and stick rice for dessert. Afterwards we were give the option to hire our tuk-tuk to take us back to our hotel for a (quite reasonable) fee. I cannot recommend this tour enough, both for the very different experience of Bangkok that it provides and the exceptional friendliness of our tour guide, Jip, and all staff involved!

Best tour experience. Tour with Expique offers unique experience, with our handsome and informative guide. It is full of surprise right from the starting point till the part where we bid adieu to each other. Brilliant idea, we have lots of fun taking tuk tuk for this tour, for an up close and personal experience. This type of tour shows the real deal, not your typical boring tour experience where the guide mostly by heart try to remember what he read from guide book, their guide tells you the story and simplify complicated long history for u to understand. Highly recommended!!!

Bangkok Night Lights Tuk Tuk Tour - A Thumbs Up Experience. Indeed, it was an extraordinary way to see the beauty of Bangkok at night. I love the transparent roof of their tuk-tuk. It made the tour more fun since you can see the night lights through the transparent roof. Natt, our tour guide is highly commendable. We learned a lot from him. The tour offers free local Thai snacks as well as eating at Thip Samai, which I must admit had the best Pad Thai in Bangkok.

Amazing tours and great Staff. Professional guides and also so friendly. I highly recommend Expique not only for tourist, also for people currently living in Bangkok.They will lead you to unexplored areas of the city and you are always informed about the places you visit.The tuk tuk tour at night it is just a great experience that I´m sure you will enjoy it even if you have been living here in Bangkok for 10 years.
Bangkok tour. Great tour. Fun stops around town to learn about the culture, history and current events. Good food and guides

Want to escape the Bangkok heat and mass crowds then this is a must!. So, so, so many tourists in Bangkok. Great way to see spend an evening. Jib was a very funny and entertaining guide. The temples we visited at night were stunning and we had the whole grounds to ourselves.We did the tour on a Monday night and, yes, it's misses out on "Thailand's best Pad Thai" but the restaurant we went to instead was really good. It was a small place and super busy (with locals) located down the back of an alleyway. We tried about 6 - 8 different dishes which were delicious. I really liked the variety. Another good thing about Monday is that because it varies from the normal itinerary a bit there were only 5 of us so a small group.

Tuk Tuk at night. One of the best tours I have been on in Bangkok. Beautiful, professionally driven tuk tuks with a vinyl roof were heaven for us tall people who only normally see very little in this mode of transport. Natt was a delight, funny and informative. Seeing the temples by night was a revelation, totally empty and serene. We will be back. (did I mention the orange juice??)

Tuk Tuk at night. A great evening on the Tuk Tuk tour. The host was perfect and really kept the evening going. The mix of sweet treats and a proper dinner made the tour a nice surprise. Going around BKK in Tuk Tuks was great fun too! I totally recommend this tour, do get involved - it's lots of fun!

Great fun, recommend. We had a great trip, on a private night tour with Natt. We travelled in 2 Tuk-tuks, with our two teenagers and had a lot of fun. Lots to see and better in the evening when not quite so busy and hot. Natt told us a great deal about Bangkok and its food, customs, way of life in a fun interesting way and would thoroughly recommend the tourMany thanks to all

Not great for foodies. This is a good tour, if you goal is to sightsee temples and some of Bangkok's sights. Not a great tour if your primary objective is to sample many kinds of street foods as possible. From previous reviews it appeared that there was a lot of food tasting, but this must have been cut down, because our tour had very few.The best dish was the Pad Thai, we had this in probably the best restaurant for this food in Bangkok, Thip Samai. The other food we were offered was bread with pandan sauce, a peanut biscuit and sticky rice with mango, all which were sweet and I expected a lot more savoury tasting. Out of the 4 street food tours in 3 countries, this unfortunately was the most disappointing. If temples are you primary reason, then you would probably enjoy this tour, if it's food you are after, look elsewhere.

Keep on Tuk Tuking!!!!!. We recently went on the night time Tuk Tuk tour of Bangkok. What a great experience we had and the tour was perfect. Zooming around Bangkok at night in a Tuk Tuk must be experienced. All the major sights were visited and the food we ate was very good. Our guide Natt was brilliant. I recommend this tour to see the temples at night which are very quiet, experience china town, the river, eat the best pad thai etc. Wonderful experience.

Private Tour. We were first time visitors to BKK and thought the Tuk Tuk Tour at night would be the perfect way to explore BKK.And wow, we were right!The team of Expique cared a lot and did everything they could to provide an excellent tour for us (2adults, 2 children)We can totally recommend Expique Tours! And for sure, on our next visit to BKK we will choose one of the other tours they provide :-)

Tuk Tuk away with this awesome tour. We were only in Bangkok for the weekend and had one full day to play so we thought we start with a day tour and end with a night tour. In the beginning, we thought this idea would either be awesome or crash and burn. Fortunately, it turned out to be awesome. :) Jib was our tour guide and she was super fun and friendly. All of the stops were awesome and there were a few surprises along the way. The food was SO GOOD and there is SO much of it! No need to eat before hand. Highly recommended!

Excellent tour, even in the rain!. I currently live in Bangkok, but wanted to take visiting family site seeing. I contacted Expique and Simon was able to arrange a private Tuk Tuk tour to accomodate my elderly grandmother who would be moving at a slower pace. From start to finish, Expique was responsive, courteous and professional, a refreshing contrast to many customer service experiences in Bangkok. Although it rained the evening we arranged the tour, we were still able to make every stop. Our tour guide Esso was friendly, knowledgeable and had lots of high energy. He greeted us each by name, which shows the care and personal touch Expique places into arranging each tour. Our favorite moments on the tour were being able to experience the temples without large crowds and also dinner at Thip Samai. There are always extremely long lines for a table to eat their famous pad thai, but with Expique you are treated as a VIP. We had a wonderful experience and your and I would encourage all visitors and expats to take the tour to learn more about Bangkok.

Great tour! Highly recommend!! Ask for Esso!!. This was such a great tour with lots of little surprises thrown in! We had were vacationing with a 7 year old all the way up to a 22 year old--it was fun for all ages!! Lots of snacks and treats along the way, always a bottle of water waiting for us in our tuk tuk, a great dinner of Pad Thai at the famous Thip Samai restaurant!! The flower market by night is amazing! We saw things that we would have never seen on our trip thanks to this awesome tour! Professional and friendly drivers. The beauty at night is worth the tour alone--the lights of the temples are just stunning and no crowds!! We had the whole What Pho to ourselves!! Esso was a great tour guide and I highly recommend him--very professional, friendly, knowledgable, and fun! If you're in Bangkok book this tour! You will love it too!!

Great to see Bangkok by night in a Tuk Tuk. If you want to see Bangkok by night this is the best way! In a Tuk Tuk with a transparent roof. Simon and Esso (our tour-leader) did a great job. Many information about the history and cultur of Bangkok. During the tour you get all kind of local food which is delicious. The drivers of the Tuk Tuk were great and brought us to our apartment for a friendly price. Simon & Esso thanks again. Next time we will do it again with Expique. We did it with our family with 4 kids. They loved it.

Amazing Night TukTuk Tour in Bangkok!. Myself and a friend were only going to be in Thailand for a 12 hour layover. We wanted to leave the airport and explore Bangkok and get the most out of our time here! This truly was the best way! Jib was our tour guide and she was amazing! We did a private tour and it was worth it! Just us two, and it felt like we were really getting to see Bangkok like a local- at the markets and local eateries! The food was also amazing! We couldn't eat it all, but she sent us back to our hotel with some, which we ate for breakfast! I would absolutely recommend this tour to anyone and everyone, especially with Jib as your tour guide!

Best tour in Bangkok. The night TukTuk tour was the best of the 3 tours we've taken so far in Bangkok. Jib and Nemo were personable, knowledgeable and accommodating. Good choice of stops and restaurants. A stop at Wat Pho was magical. If you can only do one night activity, this is the one to do.

Great for your first night. My wife and I had a fantastic time. Our guide Nat was awesome and very informative. His English was difficult to track at times but to be expected in my opinion. He answered all of our questions with detail, taught us how to say hello and thank you, and introduce us to delicious street food as well as the best Pad Thai in Bangkok. Everything mentioned is included in the price of the tour. Great way to see the city at night, especially with the clear roof Tuk Tuks. Riding around in a Tuk Tuk is a great experience

Great for your first night in Bangkok. We had an excellent time. The flower market with a guide is an entirely different experience, and the restaurant was the best noodles we have had by far. Our guide,Nat, was very friendly though it was difficult to follow his 'history stories' because his English is pretty rough. The tuk-tuk was perfect for the night and the night viewing of the resting Buddha area was awesome. A bit pricey in my opinion, but we enjoyed it

Fun tour with lots of food. I really enjoyed our tuk tuk tour with our tour guide Jib. She was friendly and informative, and made us feel like we were getting an insider's view of the city. The tour was a great way to see Bangkok, and how the city comes alive at night. My husband and I only had a couple days in Bangkok for our honeymoon and I enjoyed being able to zip around to several of the must-see sights. We mostly chose Thailand because of the food, and this tour did not disappoint - we had delicious snacks, dinner and dessert.

Great Introduction to Bangkok. I had one day in Bangkok and wanted to get a taste of the city. As a young female travelling on my own, I found Bangkok quite intimidating and was nervous about going out at night. The tour provided a great opportunity to experience the city and the food with the safety of a group and tour guide. Esso was great, happy to answer any questions and has an excellent knowledge of Thailand.Overall, I had a really great night!

Walking tour in old China Town. My mother and I took a walking tour called Harmony and Diversity; it was a very interesting tour through the older residential areas of China Town. It was a great way to go to places you just wouldn't find by yourself and have someone around to answer questions about Thai culture or history.

Worth every minute of it! A new insight to the wonderful buzz of Bangkok :-)!. I have been to Bangkok several times but seeing it at night and with the tuktuk group was simply amazing! There were just 6 of us, with one guide, Esso who speaks perfect English, is witty, engaging with his constant quizes and ghosty & historical stories. We had wonderful dinner, juice, snacks I would never even dare to order but that were delicious!!! One of my definite favourites was to see Wat Po at night and hear Esso's stories about the history of the place... It is a program I would recommend without any hesitation!

Fun and professional. My husband and I had the pleasure of taking the 4 hour night tuk-tuk our with Nat our host and "Nemo" the tour organiser. Had a great time driving around the City with frequent stops at lovely locations, seeing tourist attractions at night, eating at the local stalls (don't have dinner before you go on this tour, you'll be stuffed :) ). - A great way to orientate yourself with Bangkok

Highlight of Bangkok Visit!. My friend and I booked the "Bangkok by Night" tour. We were in Bangkok for only a few days and wanted to get a feel for the city at night without having to venture out on our own. Booking this tour was the best decision ever! We loved every minute of it! Our guide was so knowledgable and so much fun. Riding around in the tuk tuks was a wonderful way to explore the city. There were so many sights to be seen and new foods to be tasted. Others passengers on our tour commented how wonderful it was to visit the sites without the daytime crowds. In some cases, we were the only ones there! I honestly can't say enough great things about this tour and the company, Expique. The owner even took the time to meet us at the starting point, which was easy to get to via public transportation. My only concern as I booked this tour was the late ending time 11-11:30pm, but we were given the option of having our tuk tuk driver take us back to our hotel for a very reasonable fee. What a wonderful tour! Highly recommended!

Best tour of Bangkok. I took a private tour, Bangkok Night Ligths Private Tour, and had the greatest time. It was so great. My guide, Jib(?) was so thorough and great. The TukTuk driver was a great guy and it was Value for Money. I was picked up at hotel and brought back and got a great taste of Bangkok in many ways in a short time. Go for it

The only way to see Bangkok!. With only 36hrs in BKK I was a little stuck when planning an itinerary for my friend and I, as my friend had never been to Asia before.I handed over the reigns to the team at Expique, and in no time at all we had a personalised day tour set up.Our guide Esso arrived on time (in fact early) at our accommodation, and for the next 8 hours we were buzzing around BKK, seeing all of the key sights, trying delicious food and drinks, and having a great time!From the moment I first emailed Expique to enquire about a personalised tour, to the moment we returned to our hotel after the tour, every aspect was faultless. Even the follow up email was a nice touch, and included photos of my friend and I on the tour.I cannot praise highly enough the energy and enthusiasm of our guide Esso. I'm not a fan of tours normally, but I feel I have learnt so much more about a country I thought I knew quite well, with the added bonus of experiencing it with a local.If you're even remotely considering a tour, go with Expique. You'll be glad you did, and the memories and photos will stay with you forever.

Good and cool way to start in Bangkok. This tour is a great way to start your stay in Bangkok. It has tuk tuk, it has food, it has night markets, it is not crowded. Good way to get your bearings and ask your questions about the city. The young guide was enthusiastic, but frankly he could have been more informative in my opinion. Overall, tour was OK, not the best. It did give me a taste of the city and what's in for us in the next days to come. So, if your expectation is an introduction to Bangkok at night time (during considerably cooler weather) then, you will be satisfied.

Temples Tour & Tuk Tuk Tour a must!. We performed a Temples & Tuk Tuk tour earlier this month and had a blast. Esso (our tour guide) was very knowledgeable and considerate. I appreciate all the efforts Simon & the team went through to ensure the customized tour was to our expectations. I definitely recommend Expique to anyone wishing to tour bangkok from a unique lens.

Night tour Bangkok by TukTuk. What an awsome way to see the city. Natt our guide was knowledgable and friendly. Quick with a joke and always professional. I have experienced a number of tours and this has to be one of my favourite.
