Fantastic Night tour. My wife and I did the night lights tuk tuk tour with our guide Taum! At first we were not sure the meet up location was correct. But once Taum found us we loved the tour from start to finish. Bangkok at night by tuktuk to visit temples and the 0flower markets plus Chinatown was fantastic, especially the pad thai and the desserts. Taum was a terrific guide and we were a small group so he was not spread to thin!! We would highly recommend this trip to everyone and I mean everyone.It was just great. Fantastice evening.

Tuk tuk tour. My wife and I did the night lights tuk tuk tour with our guide Esso! From start to finish we loved every minute! Travelling through Bangkok at night by tuktuk to visit temples markets and Chinatown was awesome,as was the padthai and desserts. The drivers were great and Esso was a terrific guide!! Would highly recommend this trip to everyone

Bangkok Night Lights - Private Tour with Guide Esso. Awesome experience with extremely personable and knowledgeable guide Esso. Driving around Bangkok to visit markets and sampling local delicacies, to the incredibly riveting history and conversation with Esso was one of the highlights of the entire 2 week vacation. Definitely add this tour to your itinerary if you visit, and request Esso for sure.

Fantastic!. Jib was a fantastic tour guide! We really enjoyed this tour and learning all about the city. Definitely would recommend this tour. You get to see all the major sites with less crowding and without the hot sun.

Fantastic tour!. Jib was a fantastic tour guide and Simon was extremely professional when it came to re-arranging my tour date. The food was amazing, but what I really liked about the tour is the balance between the food and the cultural aspects of the city. So really it's a a two in one tour! Highly recommend it.

Beautiful by night. My group of several 20-something travelers had the pleasure of touring Bangkok at night under the leadership of our fantastic guide, Jib. Even our moderately severe jet lag could not dampen the splendor of the illuminated temples or the sparkling riverfront at night. Our tastebuds were continuously awakened by various tasty street foods including squid eggs, noodle dishes, and durian (!). Jib even picked up a couple extra dishes when we expressed interest, which were not part of the planned tour. In between munching, Jib educated us about some of the history of Thailand, the royal family, the establishment of Bangkok as the most recent capital, and the regional religions. Toward the end of our tour, we were particularly charmed by the sprawling nighttime flower market. Dozens of beautiful blooms in vibrant colors lined streets for blocks, and we got to speak with a few of the vendors. Throughout the tour, Jib answered all of our questions and really stimulated my interest in the country and culture of Thailand. The tuk tuk drivers were great, and it was a cool way to get around. Thanks Jib for an awesome experience!

Really an excellent Tour. I took the Tuk Tuk night tour.I really enjoyed it and it was quite awesome to see Bangkok from a totally different angle.The Tour guide, which named Jib, was very professional and her English was very good and I was quite impressed with her knowledge.In general, this tour is taking you to several major sites in BKK along with a Tuck Tuck, which are escorting the group thought out the whole tour - which was very comfortable.At each point, in addition to hear about the site and his history, we had the chance to taste some local food as well, (which are also included in the price), such at the one of the best Pad-Thai in China town.I could not expect for more, it is highly recommended !!!

See Bangkok in a different light!. As someone who lives in Bangkok, I thought I had seen it all... until I went on this tuktuk night tour! The route was well planned and the number of places we went to was just enough for the 4-hour tour. We had plenty of time to understand the story behind each place and we didn't feel rushed taking pictures or eating. I especially loved the beauty and calmness of the temple at night and the hugeness of the flower market! I still can't get over how inexpensive the roses are! Thanks to the Expique team (Simon, Esso and the tuktuk drivers) for showing me another side of Bangkok! :)

Interesting and Fun Night in a Tuk-tuk. Friends we were travelling with suggested this as in interesting way to spend an evening, it had great reviews so we gave it a go.It pretty much lived up to the great reviews, it was good to see the temples lit up at night which was not something we would have otherwise done, really enjoyed whizzing around on the tuk-tuk. The only downside was that sometimes when we stopped we couldn’t hear the guide’s information as the traffic was too noisy. It would have been better to have moved away somewhere quieter.A very good tour, could be excellent with a few adjustments.

Great night!. We booked this tour after a suggestion from a friend and were glad we did. We had a few issues getting to the BTS station (meeting point) because the skytrain shut down about an hour prior to the tour start due to a tree had falling on the track from a bad storm. I was feeling pretty defeated as time ticked by and almost returned to my hotel, bummed. Just then, at about 710pm (tour started at 7) I received a call from Simon explaining that he knew about the skytrain issues and while most of the tour was leaving, he would wait. We were so grateful for this! We finally arrived at about 730 and were off. Simon gave us a quick market tour with zero pressure to buy anything, and we then caught up with the rest of the group. Esso was our guide from there on out and he was so knowledgeable about everything Bangkok. We walked along the river while having a snack, went to the flower market and learned how to 'fold' a lotus, visited Wat Pho (amazing at night!), and zipped through the streets of Bangkok in tuk tuks, adn so much more. The tuk tuk rides were exhilarating but I never felt in danger. Our driver was very friendly and accommodating. We had dinner at a world renowned pad Thai restaurant and felt like VIPs as there was a huge wait that we immediately bypassed. The night ended in Chinatown after we tried some traditional Chinese desserts. I can't say I enjoyed the desserts but I am glad I got to try them as I would've never known what to order on my own. Do the tour - you won't regret it!

Fantastic!. If visiting Bangkok, this is a must. The tour itself was constructed very well. I have been put off tours as some in the past have become boring and mundane and take you to places where you are expected to purchase goods from their associated vendors. This is not the case here. Every minute of this tour is interesting, exciting and informative. The Tuk Tuk was comfortable but you aren't stuck in it for too long anyway. There is way too much to do & see. I came away from this thinking there is no way I could have seen so much in one night if I tried this on my own and this is seriously the only way to see Bangkok at night. Now the big plus here was our guide Jib. Wow what a wonderful asset she is to this company. Not only her knowledge, but her bubbly personality is enormous. Jib made this whole experience one that I will be telling everyone I know who comes to Bangkok that they MUST do this The food was excellent and there is so much of it. Upon returning back to our apartment we collapsed into a food coma. We did have our driver take us home ( in our great disco Tuk Tuk) which just made the whole night end perfectly. Thank you Expique. This was an experience to remember.

Even as a long term expat, I still learned new things!. Having lived in Bangkok for the best part of 4 years, I wasn't sure I would see anything new. The trip certainly found ways to impress me and go beyond my expectations. If it was seeing new areas or simply old areas with new eyes, it certainly made for an educational and fun evening! Definitely a unique experience... as the name implies! :)

Highly recommended!. I booked this tour originally just to see different parts of Bangkok at night but it turned out to be so much better than that. We had Jib for our guide who was awesome! She knew so much about Thailand and Bangkok's history which was great to know. In addition to bringing us to Bangkok's most famous Pad Thai restaurant she picked up snacks for us to try out along the tour. This was great because I had wanted to try new foods but didn't know where to start. I would definitely recommend this tour to someone visiting Bangkok for the first time. And if you do go on this tour I hope you get Jib as your guide. She was really great!

What an experience!. 4 of us joined the tuk tuk tour with Esso and His trainee Eye. We loved Wat Po at night. No crowds,and everything lit up. Stunning. Esso had so much knowledge and answered our questions easily. Another highlight was Thipsamai where we by passed the long queue waiting to be seated and ate some amazing Pad Thai. The flower market was an eye opener. The amazing thing about this trip is that you didn't see other tourists besides our trip attendees and this made it special. We got to sample different snacks during our trip and amazing desserts in China town. We never would have tried any of these foods on our own. The tuk tuk drivers were also so friendly and added to an amazing experience. It was exhilarating and quite scary at times . Loved every second of it. 150 baht gets u back to your hotel after the trip with your tuk tuk driver. Well worth it.I highly recommend this trip. We all enjoyed it thoroughly. Esso and Eye made it special.

A Great short and sweet Tour of the City... Tuk Tuk Style.... I called up SImon on the very day of the our and he was happy to fit me into one of the tours at night. I tried my best but was late by 10mins, for which I felt very bad. But the guys were great. We had a wonderful group. I also has a small suitcase with me, as I got carried away by shopping earlier in the day. The Tuk Tuk guy took care of it. The tour gives you a very good insight into the history of the city. You become a more knowledgeable traveller and not one simply taking photos of abstract buildings without knowing what youre seeing. The snacks along the way were great and the Pad Thai dinner was awesome. I would recommend this tour to all who are short on time and would like a beautiful insight on the history of Thailand.

Very Cool Way to see Bangkok at night!. The Night Lights Tuk-Tuk food tour was great. It was a very fun way to see Bangkok and some of the sights that you may have missed if you went on your own. The guides were fun and knowledgable. I had scheduled our tour for our first night. I got sick on the first day and was not able to get out of the room. Expique was very flexible and able to move my tour to another night when I felt better. They were easy to get a hold of and very accommodating. I highly recommend taking this fun tour. My young adult son came with us and also really enjoyed it. You get to see the real Bangkok at night through local guides. And they were very generous with feeding you throughout the tour. The orange juice is the BEST I have ever had in the world and I travel a lot.

Loved our tuk tuk tour!. I don't usually write reviews, but wanted to go out of my way to thank Expique and our guide Esso for an excellent evening. Exactly how a tour should be. There was clear communication, good explanations, fun on the tuk tuk's, interesting sights made easy, great pad Thai and snacks. There was never pressure to buy things and no being dragged around to souvenir shops. (I HATE those kind of tours.)Esso was on-the-ball, friendly and fun. There were 10 on the tour and by end of evening we were all friends. This tour made our first trip to Thailand well worth it! Thank you for getting it right!!

Amazing way to see Bangkok. This is an amazing way to see Bangkok at night and gave me a taste for parts of the city I might not have gotten to on my own.PROS- The guides (Esso and Eye when I took the tour) were amazing. Super knowledgeable, funny, excellent English. - The tuk tuk drivers were also great. Very professional and friendly. - It's a little cooler in the night time so it's nice to see the city not in the midday heat. CONS- Really not any I can think of. I only wish the tour had been longer and I wish we had some more time at the flower market. FAVOURITE PARTS- Wandering around Wat Pho at night was beautiful. - The flower market is spectacular to see. Heaps upon heaps of flowers. - Dinner is the best pad thai in Bangkok. I wholeheartedly recommend this tour.

A unique Bangkok Experience. I had been to Bangkok a few times but never joined any local tours since I always like to explore on my own. Since this time I was with my family I decided to join this tour as it looks interesting and was rated excellent in TripAdvisor.I'd never regret joining this tour as it's really a unique way to explore Bangkok. It's an evening tour so it avoids the crowd, avoids the traffic and avoids the heat. The guide not only arranged for food and transportation, she's also a story teller and told us a lot of stories behind the scene. Night view of the temples were fantastic and the trip to the Flower market was also interesting.Last but not least, travelling on tuk tuk was exciting, though a bit scary sometimes.Thanks Simon and Moo. We did enjoy the night.
Night in Bangkok. A really fun evening. While it started off slow it gained great momentum and was fun, informative and enlightening. Worth the evening.

Wonderfull tuk tuk tour experience. I wanna say a big thank you to Expique for the wonderful tour we enjoyed, tasting Bangkok on night hours, everything was very well organized and our guide Natt has been excellent!!!!!

Super way to discover Bangkok. We decided on the Bangkok at night tour and arranged for our guide Esso to meet us at our hotel although using the Sky Train it would have been easy enough to meet him at the designated meet point. It was just the four of us on the tour and right from the start Esso seemed like a friendly and knowledgeable guide. First stop was Klong San Market on the south side of the river which was very much a local market with food stalls and clothes. It was lovely to experience a local market without the tourists. There was a time for a bit of shopping while Esso was picking up snacks for the journey Next stop Wat Prayoon temple, again on the south side of the river on the opposite side of the Memorial Bridge to where we were this morning. The temples themselves are closed at night but beautifully lit up and the grounds are so peaceful. We sat here to eat our snacks, Palm sugar rice cakes and bread with this amazing green dip ( must try and remember the name!) Back then to the north side and up to the Giant Swing which was actually a giant swing used up until the 1930’s when someone swung a bit too much and fell to their death. Now it is just the frame. I’m really not quite sure why they don’t take it down.  Our supper was at Thip Samai, the place to go for Pad Thai and still made to the original recipe. With queues of people outside, we were lucky to have a fast track ticket (Esso) but any wait was more than made up for by watching the guys cooking. This place was a treat and the food delicious - definitely worth a trip! Then it was onto the lovely Democracy Monument and Wat Pho, home to the sleeping Buddha. Again the actual temple containing the sleeping Buddha was closed at night but the site was so peaceful with no one around and looked stunning lit up. It was then back to the Flower Market which at 10.30pm was still not reaching its manic peak (about 3am) and then our final stop China Town for our desserts and where we found the most amazing fresh pomegranate juice.This tour is a great way to experience the city especially if you have limited time and we'd definitely recommend our guide Esso

Bangkok by night. I am writing to thank Simon and nat for giving my parents a wonderful experience of Bangkok at night. I gave my parents a Bangkok tour as a 40th wedding anniversary present to them. My parents loved the food, and the experience of riding a tuktuk. It was a great adventure. Thank you very much

Tuk tuk tour. We had with 2 adults and 10 years old daughter the evening tuk tuk tour. It was very well organized. Thank you Simon!! We changed the tour to another date, Simon was very helpful!! We visited the temples in the night which was very nice, no people and not so hot so a perfect way to see this!! Also the local food was very nice and of course china town! A good way to see Bangkok at night!! Must do! The tour guide was very good!!

'The Thai Job', by tuk tuk. This is a fantastic way to experience a taste of Thai culture. By travelling at night the experience is heightened by travelling in a caravan of tuk tuk's, and historical sites witch are usually packed with tourists by day, and empty at night.The tour also includes visits to the flower markets and chinatown, both of which are fascinating.This is a must do in Bangkok.

Excellent way to spend our first ever evening in Bangkok. This was an excellent way to see Bangkok on our first trip there. We arrived in that evening and had booked a private tour that night. We had shortened it a little due to our time constraint, which was my only regret about this tour and entirely of my own making!.Our guide, Jib, was very helpful and informative, without being over bearing. We really felt like we were being given a tour by a very knoweldgable Bangkok resident, rather than a tour guide watching the clock.Absolute Bangkok lets you see all these wonderful places at night, when the crowds have left, so expect to see stunning temples lit up for the evening, the flower market in full swing, and lots of activity around Chinatown.Though we visited several spots, what I found most memorable was wandering around Wat Pho, just the guide, myself and my mother, disturbed by nobody. It was a really beautiful and sureal introduction to Bangkok. The flower market was also great fun, and an amazing experence, like nothing either of us had ever encountered. Throughout the evening, our guide Jib introduced us to a side of Bangkok we would never have sought out or stumbled upon ourselves, and she judged the tempo and energy levels just right. Highly recommended for all ages.

A fantastic taste of Bangkok!. I was in Bangkok for business and only had one evening free. As it was my first time in Thailand I wanted to make sure I made the most out of my free time. A co-worker recommended the Expique tour as a great way to experience the city in a short amount of time. I was not disappointed. This is seriously the best tour I have ever been on. It combines culture, history, food, and shopping all in a fun and friendly package. My guide Moo was amazingly personable, after only an hour I felt like we had been friends for a long time. I couldn't believe how much of the city we covered in just a few hours. The tour is full of thoughtful little touches; a cold bottle of water, snacks, cool towels, and souvenir photos. Thank you Expique for making my time in Bangkok memorable!

Fantastic tour! A must do!. This was my first time in Bangkok, and I highly recommend doing this if you are a first time visitor. It was such a fantastic introduction to the city, and even better that it was done at night time so not a lot of other tourists crowding the few places we visited. Our tour guide spoke excellent English and was very entertaining! He gave us great historical background on how Bangkok came to be, how some of the temples were built, and many other historical details I would have never known. Not only that - but he was funny and engaging, even when we peppered him with random questions about the city (both historical and current)! He kept the tour very interesting and never once harassed us on giving him tips (as I heard many other tour guides tended to do). We were with one other couple, and we very willingly tipped him at the end of our tour as he was so fantastic. The tuk tuk experience was really fun. Our driver was so courteous and professional, and even offered to take pictures for us as we were near some areas. Like the tour guide, he never once harassed us on tipping. He took us back to the hotel after our tour for 150 baht, which I had no problem paying as it was around 11:30. We found out (by asking) that these drivers works everyday from 7 AM to Midnight, yet they still had a smile on their face the entire tour. I really appreciated that. And one last item that was really near and dear to me - my boyfriend who came with me is lethally allergic to peanuts, and I had made a note on that during confirmation. We were so worried about eating the pad thai as well as other street food (which btw was absolutely the best!). The touring company saw my note and wrote me a personal response indicating they will ensure no peanuts are on the tour, and went to a great lengths to confirm with the restaurant that no peanut oil was used. The tour guide made sure the snacks he brought were all free from peanuts. I know it doesn't sound like much but no other touring company during our trip made such a great effort. They were so attentive to us, that I felt like a personal guest for a family. That really made me feel good about this company as they care so much about their customers.I highly recommend this tour and I will definitely go with this company again for another tour the next time I am back. Thanks, Expique!

More like family!. Took this tour with the guide Natt and Simon. They were both very informative. As it was our first night in Bangkok it was handy to pick up lots of tips. We whizzed around Bangkok on the Tuk Tuk and it was fabulous. Stopped off at numerous temples for photos and as it was evening, there were no crowds so it was perfect. Simon took us to a restaurant for delicious street food and it was as though we were a group of friends rather than on a tour. I would recommend this to everyone. Thank you Simon for such an enjoyable first evening.

Terrific Tuk Tuk Tour with Expique. We only had a couple of days in Bangkok but fortunately elected to spend our first free evening with Expique. It was terrific. Our guide, Natt, was energetic and knowledgeable and we learned a great deal about his country, its religion, its food and its people. Plus it is a heck of a lot of fun beetling around in a Tuk Tuk. We also enjoyed our small group of travelling companions - 6 nationalities in the 9 tourists and one guide. They all were very conscious and worried about us old folks. I should also mention the drivers were extremely polite and helpful. My wife has had a knee operation and wherever possible the driver would pull up alongside the curb or some other raised surface so she had less distance to step down or up. Greatly appreciated.Being able to see the temples and palace grounds at night when it is cooler and without crowds is a definite plus. We also ate delicious food and treats, most of which we would not have ever tried on our own. We were also given a small sheet with half a dozen very handy Thai phrases (like "thank you"). A nice touch.One additional item, Simon was extremely helpful in advising on our other itineraries, even though they were not with Expique. A rare courtesy in any country.I really wanted to rate them a 6 out of 5.Kenneth G

Great Way to Experience Thai Culture!. Wonderful tuck tuck adventure to learn about Thai Culture, Food and History! Something interesting and different from usual way of experiencing Bangkok by Night!

Bangkok at night by tuk tuk - Do it!. Simon and Jib made this a GREAT experience. Traveling alone can feel odd when with groups & this was not the case at all. Great tour, saw so much, tried foods I would have never considered. Jib, our guide, was fantastic. Thank you!!

Superb. I loved it!! Natt and Simon are the best!! I had to change dates and they we' re really helpful. I'm a female solo traveler and it was my first night in the city. It is an excellente opportunity to get you to know an overall side of Bangkok. The only thing that I have to say is that they should start earlier and finnish later :-) It was remarkable, specially because it was my first time in the city, actually in Asia, and I learned a lot about everything. Excellent opportunity to get to know a lot of people. It's a must go if you're planning visit Bangkok!

Night tour Bangkok in Tuk Tuk . We've just moved to Bangkok, we did the tour with friends visiting Thailand.The tour was amazing, little insights into Bangkok and Thailand. Wat Pho at night was breathtaking. Great value for money, the tour guide Annt was fantastic.A highlight of visiting BKK. Thank you again Annt and Simon.

Tuk tuk night tour. Did the tuk took night tour. Great to be able to go to the temples at night - much cooler and none of the crowds, compared to visiting in the day. Also got taken to some interesting markets and the price includes heaps of food and drink throughout the night. No risk of going hungry on this tour. The small size of the group is good. Guide full of energy.

Unique and interesting night tour by tuk tuk. We only had a few days in BKK and wanted to see as much as possible. This tour definitely stood out to us, visiting places at night when no one is around that are normally packed with tourists every day. You also get to taste some of BKK street food which is interesting. Anyways you meet your guide for the evening at a designated spot easy enough to find. On our night we had guide Esso he was great and full of knowledge. He took care of us and gave us time to look around and take photos , never felt rushed at all. The flower market was awesome and great to see Bangkok so alive. Going around from place to place in tuk tuk is great and Esso made it a point to ride in each tuk tuk. and talk to us all. The only small disappointment was that we thought we would be stopping for pad thai at Thip Samai but we didn't, perhaps that's changed now which should have been indicated. Anyways our group was small only 6 persons in total which means you get more of a personal touch. I would highly recommend this tour if your in BKK and you want to do something different than the normal touristy routine. Well done Esso and well done expique we had a great time.

A great way to see Bangkok quickly. I contacted simon on very short notice after our plans for the evening fell through. Within 45 minutes we were at the meeting spot and greeted by Eso and another friendly guide. They were both very professional and gave us time to stop at the nearby ATM. We took the BTS from our hotel at the Pileon Chit stop.Soon we were on our way whisking through the bangkok night traffic. We stopped at a local market Khao San, where we visited a temple with a statue of the most famous monk in Thailand and the back story behind him. Eso even tells you how thais check to see if someone is a ghost or human being. I've heard similar versions of this technique in Nigeria! Fun! You get 10 mins free time to walk through the market....an of course I ran straight for the street food stalls. I'll eat anything, anywhere, anytime! My wife visited a few purse shops and we haggled away!Soon we were on our way on way to the river, saw some masive stupas, the local flower market, drove by the grand palace and more. Your night ends in china town which is fantastic on its own. We ended up spending a few hours walking around and taking in the sites. Overall, we really enjoyed this tour and Eso was just great to talk to. He is a well informed man and clearly well read.

Great Tuk Tuk Bangkok by night Tour. We really enjoyed this Tuk Tuk tour! Our group was small (only one other couple) which was nice. Our guide Esso was very friendly, professional and had interesting stories to tell at the different stops. We had really nice snacks/food on different places and were also introduced to one of the best Pad Thai of the city. Besides the food, the Tuk Tuk ride was fun. It was a very easy way to transport to the next stop and on the same time allowed us to look around in this fascinating city. One of the things that we also really liked was the visit to the temple Wat Pho by night. We already been there during the day, but than it was crowded and hot. With this tour, we walked around in this temple area by night (it is open all night). The light on the temples/stupas was really pretty and since we were the only visitors it was a quiet and peaceful place in the busy city. We really liked this tuk tuk tour and our guide Esso and can recommend this to anyone interested in Bangkok and that wants to try some of the best local food.

Excellent Tour. This was a last minute booking that ended up being the best part of my stay in Bangkok. Initially a bit concerned to do a Tuk Tuk Night Tour, but all my hesitations disappeared when I met with the Tour Guide, Tip, and her helper (whose name has slipped my mind). Tour guides were so friendly and sweet. Tuk Tuk drivers were nice too! What a change from the other Bangkok taxi/tuk tuk drivers! Locations are pretty cool. They provide you with a number of snacks, that you probably wouldn't try on your own. Take you to the "most famous" pad thai restaurant where you eat the most delicious pad thai wrapped in eggs (omelet style).I really have to give Tip kuddos for being so energetic and friendly throughout the whole trip. It can be so exhausting and she was so excellent the whole time. They take pictures and then send a shared album via email. Thanks!!!Since this particular tour ended up on Chinese New Year, they were not able to drop us off at the usual end point, being China Town, where my hotel was. The Tuk Tuks took us as close to China town as possible and the tour guides actually walked me to my hotel to make sure I got back safe. Wow! That was awesome. Cannot say enough good things about them! Mary

Bangkok at Night by Tuk Tuk. This tour lasted 4-4.5 hours and effectively combined slow pace walking and riding in a tuk tuk between each place visited. Several tasty snacks, a meal, and a dessert were included, all Thai, of course. Guests could choose vegetarian if so desired. The tour guide, Esso, was very friendly, courteous, and knowledgeable and provided a lot of interesting information. Wear comfortable shoes and clothing, and be prepared to have a great time because I think you will. Extras such as cold bottled drinking water and a cold, wet washcloth made the tour even nicer.
Awesome tuktuk tour!. Tuktuk tour was really nice. Interesting places and stories about the tempels etc. Super nice guide Esso, very professional and informative. I warmly recommend this company.

Great interesting tour. Thanks to Simon and our Guide Esso. We had a great trip exploring the waterways and back streets of Bangkok, and the pace was just right for our 3 children. The team at Expique were very keen to please and help in every way.Thanks for our great trip.
Awesome!. We went to the Tuk Tuk Night Tour last night and had a wonderful evening! The tour was well organised, professional and fun! Thank you to K. Jip and the rest of the team there last night.

Fun time, anytime.. Far from the massive temples & palaces is a walk through the old side streets of Bangkok meeting ordinary folks in their simple way of life. En route we saw dilapidated houses & structures some dating 50 to hundred years old. Instead of marbles, tiles, gold & silver, some structures and buildings are adapting contemporary style as the new Bangkok. On one side are tall 3-storey buildings with pastel colors but on the other side are lumber & bricks in plain colors. On our first stop it rained hard so it took away our 1st 30mins of the tour. But it was ok since we had a chance get to know our guide Ms Jib. She’s a local but has been to the Philippines & USA so communication was smooth. Part of the tour is visiting a market. It is quite small but clean. We also saw some hawkers selling fresh fish, noodles & fried snacks. We stopped at a local seller to buy some candy shaped like fruits & some sticky rice. We went through old warehouses with spices, buffalo skins, etc. Part of the tour is to see various small churches, mosques & temples of different religions since these form part of the Thailand’s diverse culture. The Chao Phraya experience was only short. There are other old landmarks we could have visited but we missed some of them because of the rain. We were also trying to catch the sunset over Wat Pho by 5:30pm. Still we missed it as it was cloudy. (aargh!)

Night tuk tuk tour was great!. We would recommend this company as it was very well organised and all staff we had contact with were helpful and informative. Nat our guide was lovely and charming. The tuk tuk tour has some great highlights and the pad Thai was a good experience. Our driver was fabulous too.

Best Intro to Bangkok. This is a great, easy and fun intro to Bangkok or a one-shot whirlwind if your time is very limited. With only a day and a half in Bangkok, we found this night tour on TA and it was perfect for our Arrival night. Only two or three people to a Tuk Tuk (great fun way to get around), so my wife and I had one to ourselves, as did every other couple. Basically you whiz around the city in an open air taxi caravan making half a dozen stops with a guide or two to narrate, educate, entertain and even feed you (typical snacks, and a good Pad Thai in a very busy, colorful place). Our tour went by many landmarks, to a couple of temples (only half open at night, but uncrowded, cool and well lit), an old market and the Wholesale Flower market and Chinatown – plenty to see, photograph, taste and absorb in 4 hours. The tour is probably not appropriate for small children as it's late; even the jet lagged adults were tired by the end, but worth every minute. Finally, I highly recommend the small surcharge to pick you up at your hotel, taking you by public transportation to the start point, especially if it’s your first time to BKK. The elevated trains are crazy busy during rush hour and traffic (car/taxi) seems to never move. You will also want the Tuk Tuk to drop you home at the end of the tour for a modest taxi fee (about $5 USD). Bravo.

Well organised and great fun. I booked this tour at the last minute the day before we arrived in Bangkok while we were still at the beach. The response was very quick and booking was easy. We met Jip at the BTS station as arranged and went off in our convoy of 3 tuk tuks. Jip was great fun and her English was excellent. We enjoyed lots of food tasting and the visit to the flower market was unforgettable. Being able to see Wat Pho at night without the crowds was also magic. A great night, highly recommended!

Tuk tuk foodie night tour, yeah!!!. We were a group of 7 that went on the tuk tuk foodie night tour with lovely tour guide, Jeep. What a wonderful insight into local life and traditions of the Thai people. We had loads of fun zooming around the streets in the tuk tuks and it was so nice to have a local's recommendation on what to taste from street vendors. We went for dinner at the most famous Pad Thai place in Bangkok, where the queues were down the street! We walked straight in! If you enjoy food and want to learn about Thai culture, then this tour is for you! We loved it!
Bangkok Night Tour. I really enjoyed this tour. We ate lots of fun foods and visited places that I have never seen on previous trips to Bangkok. The visit to the Grand Palace was especially nice.

Excellent way to get a feel for Bangkok!. We booked this tour as we wanted to get a feel for the city and experience the sights and food by night! We met our guide Moo at the meeting point and off we went into our Tuk Tuks! The drivers and our guide Moo were very friendly and great fun throughout the tour! The tour itself was very well priced and comprehensive! We really felt like we had a great feel for the size of the city. Seeing it by Tuk Tuk, hopping on and off was great fun and made for some great photos! Moo brought us for the best pad thai we have had on our trip so far! You get to skip the crowds and head straight into the seating area! Another standout moment was seeing Wat Pho with no crowds, it was so beautiful!There are lots of tours for Bangkok but for us, this one was perfect for us as it ticks all the boxes! Book if you want to see the sights without the crowds, get some great food and have a fantastic guide to make the Evening fun! Another cool thing is they iwll send you the photos the guide takes of you throughout the night, which was a lovely touch!We totally recommend doing this tour if you are ever in Bangkok, as you see a totally different side of the sights to that of the daytime crowds! Thanks Moo and team!

night lights of Bangkok . My husband and I did this tour at the end of January and had an amazing time! This tour isn't just about seeing Bangkok, it's about experiencing Thai culture. I would highly recommend the night tuk tuk tour, our guide had lots of stories to share and I felt very safe in the tuk tuk. Simon is also very professional and communication is fast and responsive. thanks for a great time, can't wait till we come back! - Nat & Andrew

Bangkok at Night. This was a great way to see another side of Bangkok - at night when it is a bit cooler, less crowded and the temples are all lit up! I would definitely recommend this tour for an introduction to Bangkok if you've never been. Even though this wasn't our first time here, it was well presented and very enjoyable. You are introduced to a few of the must-see sites by night - and get some key points on their background and history. We were also given several photo opportunities we otherwise wouldn't have had throughout the evening. Although the temples were closed, we actually were able to look around the grounds of one - the magnificently lit Wat Pho Temple where the Reclining Buddha is located. The visits to a few of the local markets - especially the All Night Flower Market was great! Our guide Taum did a great job of introducing us to several highlights of Bangkok - and Simon, the owner of the company came along for a most enjoyable evening. They both did a great job looking after us, introducing us to our Tuk-tuk drivers and making sure we were safe and comfortable during the tour.We enjoyed different local foods that we might not have taken the opportunity to try otherwise at the local night market at Klong San, and later during our trip, to a famous noodle shop, and for dessert, to Chinatown.My only disappointment came at the end - when our tour was over. Four hours went by very quickly during this very enjoyable and interesting tour! We all had such a great time, we didn't realize it had gotten so late! Luckiy, Simon and Taum had made arrangements with our well marked Tuk-tuks and drivers to stick around and get us safely back to our hotel for an additional fee, but that was really worth the few extra dollars at that hour!This was a very unique half day tour at a very reasonable price - something we could never have done on our own! Yes, I would highly recommend it!

Tuk tuk tour at night. My husband and I started this tour with an agent from the tour company picking us up at our hotel. She took us on a ferry and taxi all within 30 minutes arriving right on time to meet the other 4 travelers. This tour was fast paced and we visited at least 8 different locations. It was a different experience to visit some of these sites, especially the temples, at night when there were no other tourists around. If you are expecting a traditional tour than this might not be the tour for you. But if you are looking for a different experience than this tour is for you. The tour guide was very helpful and the owner of the company was also on tour. Both worked hard to make sure we got what we needed from the tour. The tuk tuk drivers were also super nice and helped to make it fun. Overall great tour.

Great Tuk Tuk Night Tour. My Brother and I booked the Tuk Tuk Night Tour during our visit in January. It was great seeing the city at night when there was less traffic. The tour was well planned and organized. If you're in Bangkok don't bother looking at other tour companies, book with Expique.

Unique views of Bangkok!!. We organised a unique night tuk-tuk tour of Bangkok with Expique. Of the many highlights, a couple to note included having the best pad-thai in Bangkok, visiting popular tourist sites with no visitors to spoil the view, walking through the bustling flower market and darting through BKK on tuk-tuks. We were provided a great introduction to BKK and had a fun evening out on the town!

A wonderfully different view of Bangkok. It was marvelous to see the city by night. I’ve made various visits on my own in the early hours, but it was good to have the company of three entertaining Canadian ladies who were enthralled. Our guide Esso was great company and he clearly likes his work and presents it well. I think the night tour is an excellent idea because you get a totally different perspective of the city when you aren’t elbow-to-elbow with tourists. Wat Po was totally deserted except for ourselves and it was entrancing. The girls even had the chance to have a photo taken with a monk, although Esso had to step in quickly when one of them wanted to put her arm around the monk. The pad thai restaurant was superb. It was good that Expique were able to book (not the rule, Esso told us) because it was packed and there was a fair few people waiting.An excellent experience, thank you, and one I can't recommend highly enough

Best and most authentic way to see Bangkok!!!. We booked a Bangkok by night Tuk Tuk tour for six people and it was absolutely amazing! Simon and his experienced team really crafted a very unique tour combining Bangkok's highlights with hidden gems.For us there where three main reasons we liked the tour:Unique places combined with must see's - We visited well known destinations such as Wat Po and the flower market but also really local sights such as the hidden shrine inside a market. Seeing Bangkok by Tuk Tuk also added to the ambiance. Our group had both first time visitors and locals, all of them had a good time!Great local good - At times it seemed that a culinary tour was thrown in for good measure which was delicious with "Bangkok's best Pad Thai shop" as a standout. It also gave us a glimpse of what the Thai love to eat. You will definitely not be hungry after this tour.Insider knowledge - Simon and his team really went the extra mile in providing some background to the city and "unlocking" treasures. The private tour of Wat Po by night was truly unforgettable!The price is very attractive and lower than some other toys they were less good.I would recommend anyone coming to Thailand to take an Expique tour and we look forward trying one of the other tours Expique offers.

Great evening!. We have been to Bangkok many times, it is a place that continues to fascinate and delight. The Expique web Site and reviews looked right up our street and the tour was as good as we hoped. The booking system was really easy Simon came along at the start of the tour to welcome us. Jib was an excellent and very knowledgable guide and the evening tuk tuk tour was the perfect balance of sightseeing and food. There were many high spots, including the night market, wondering around the temples when hardly anyone is there, visiting the local fruit, veg & flower market and also not having to queue for the Pad Thai was great, the queue was massive! We do eat local food but got to try many things we had not had before, all the food we tried was great and interesting.The tuk tuk drivers were friendly and professional and as there was only 3 of us on the tour it was very personalised.We will book another tour with Expique next time we are in Bangkok.

Simply Wonderful!. I've been coming to Bangkok for years and have spent a considerable amount of time in this fascinating city. It never ceases to amaze me and is never boring. In all these years I've never done a guided walking tour, which is surprising as I've done them all over the world, so I was very excited to sign up with Simon for his Tales of Talat Noi - Bangkok's Chinatown Walking Tour. It was a great experience - very relaxed, very informative and very interesting. There was a nice, easy-going small group of people and we walked through amazing, off-the-beaten-tracks of old Bangkok - historic, atmospheric buildings; wondrous, colourful Chinese temples; and glorious river views. Detailed explanations of the history of Bangkok brought the unique area to life. We stopped for tasty drinks and snacks along the way - all included in the price. It was so good that we went back ourselves a few weeks later to relive the experience, and we will be back again.That was so good that we just had to go on another tour and joined the Diversity and Harmony Tour in Thonburi, just over the river, yesterday. Well, that was even better, just loved it. It's the place of the old capital of Thailand, before Bangkok on the other side of the river. It's largely forgotten now - we didn't see a tourist in sight. There are no tall buildings. The locals live in old wooden houses at least a century old. The streets are a maze of alleys. Shop houses everywhere and still traces of the old Portuguese, Moslem and Chinese communities. Everyone is so friendly and it was just great to be among them. Esso, our guide, was excellent - he used to live there and his grandparents still do - so it was a privilege. We stopped at an amazing family bakery with 2 tables, where the one cake they produce is based on an old Portuguese recipe. Now we can't wait to go on another Expique tour!

Excellent evening. Superb hosts and great tour at night time to see a different side compared to the day visit. Visited places and street food/restaurant that we would not have stopped at. The tuk Tuks were fun.

Exhilarating way to experience iconic sites in Bangkok at night!. If you love food, markets, temples and want to see Bangkok in action at night via Tuk Tuk and walking (which is a really fantastic way to experience Bangkok) I would highly recommend the Tuk Tuk evening tour. Jib, our guide, was friendly, super knowledgeable and kept everyone together and engaged at all the stops.This tour was one of the highlights of my trip and was a great combo of sightseeing, riding the tuk tuk and meeting interesting vendors at the night market.Next time you are planning a trip to Bangkok definitely sign up!

A great way to see and learn. We took the diversity and harmony walking tour on our first day in Bangkok. Natt our guide was very informative and we enjoyed the opportunity to wander streets and areas of Bangkok we would not have tried on our own. The tour helped us to understand the cultural history of Bangkok and it was a great way to meet local people, try local food and to hear local stories. Highly recommend it.

Definitly recommended. We had a very short time in Bangkok and we did the Tuk Tuk Night Tour when we had just arrived to Bangkok. We saved a lot of time with this tour. It was a great experience to see the city at night, the night market, flower market and other sites. The dinner spot was chosen very well, exotique and mostly with locals inside. Our guide Jib was also very nice, she was polite, kind and gave too many tips for us for the rest of our stay in Bangkok. On the other hand our Tuk Tuk driver was extraordinary compared with the regular tuk tuk drivers in Bangkok. Overall very professionally managed tour.

Excellent Hop-on, Hop-off around Bangkok. I won't repeat all of the good things that others have already shared - I can only affirm that they are all true. I took the tok-tok night tour on my first night in Bangkok and had a great time. What I liked most about the tour is that they took pictures throughout and then e-mailed me a link with photos of the entire group. I'm a single traveler, but they did an excellent job pairing me with a great family and I had a wonderful time all around. Kudos to Simon and his crew.

Simply WOW - Night Tuk Tuk Tour. Can't say enough good things about my experience with ExpiquePre-trip - I found Expique's website when I couldn't book it over Viator (Night tuk tuk tour offered is Expique's tour but because of some glitch, it only lets you book for 2 or more) and googled to find the home page. Booking was easy and payment was secure over PayPal (this isn't the case with many Thai tour company)Night time Tuk-Tuk tour - On the day of tour, Simon informed me there was no one else signed up but they would either gladly give me a private tour at no extra charge or refund me the fee and invite me over for Thai-Christmas dinner with his friends (how incredibly kind is that?!). since I was on a schedule, I opted for the private tour. I met my tour guide Jib with no issues at a Sky Train Station and started our tour. After a long day of sightseeing and jet lag kicking, I wasn't feeling my best. My tour guide was so attentive and tried her best to keep me as comfortable as possible. All the sights you'll see are simply breathtaking and my guide was incredibly knowledgeable, which kept the tour very interesting. (The tour was on Christmas Eve and Expique Tour was kind enough to decorate the tuk tuk all Christmasy! It was all around awesome) The tour starts at a local market where you get to meet the locals who are genuine and kind. The temples at night time will take your breath away as well! After the temples, we visited the flower markets which was such a great experience. The tour finishes in Chinatown for delicious dessert. My hotel was far out of the central area but the tuk tuk driver and tour guide were kind enough to take me home at a very reasonable price. To summarize this wasn't your boring "let's haul these people in a tour bus" kind of tour. It was an experience of being immersed into Bangkok for the night in the most fun way possible (riding in tuk tuk is simply awesome!). If you're heading to Bangkok, you absolutely need to check this tour out! Thank you, Expique, again so much for the unforgettable Christmas eve in Bangkok!

Fun Time Filled With Great Food, History and Culture! <3 Esso. With 2 nights in Bangkok, we didn't have much time to waste in touring, but I'm so glad we chose the night tuk tuk tour. Esso is FANTASTIC. He is incredibly knowledgeable in Thai history and the city of Bangkok and he's very down to earth, funny, and approachable (and is fluent in English). The best part was getting VIP entry into the Thip Samai for the best pad thai I've ever had in my LIFE.. and I am a pad thai connoisseur. There seemed to be a 20 to 30 minute wait into the restaurant, but Expique arranges a table for you immediately. We of course rode around in tuk tuks for our entire trip in Thailand, but with this company, you get to tour the stops and the tuk tuk is waiting for you to take you to your next destination once you're done. We also got to see Wat Pho at night. Let me just say that we saw Wat Pho the next day during the daytime sun and with all the crowds, and it was literally a difference between night and day. At night, there was a tranquility and peace among the grounds and it offered better picture taking opportunities. I loved the city of Bangkok, and if I do get to go back, I would book for this tour and any other tour that Expique has to offer. They are really very good at what they do and I loved Esso as a tour guide.

Great diverse tour. Lovely tour, showing a bunch of different locations. You'll discover things you probably wouldn't have found on your own. I did the tuk tuk tour (being in a tuk tuk without getting scammed was quite the draw) and I'm convinced the walking ones are of equal quality. You see stuff that looks really cool at night, have some nice food and hear the history from qualified guides. It's small groups with a friendly atmosphere. Highly recommended!

Hidden gems of Bangkok. I've lived in Bangkok for a number of years and took the "Diversity and Harmony" tour to see and learn about some parts of the city that are unknown to most tourists and residents. The sites were fascinating: old warehouses, hidden mosques, ancient Chinese temples, narrow alleyways, a wonderfully peaceful park, and a Christian community that produces special snacks, with friendly locals providing some Christmas spirit. All of it in one easily walkable tour near the riverfront, with a knowledgeable guide who had all the interesting backstories. Even though I expected a lot already, I was surprised how much diversity was really to be found in this small area. I recommend this tour highly for people who want to get to know Bangkok better and like places off the beaten track.

Wonderful night discovery tuk tuk tour. We did this night tuk tuk as a group of friends, including children and everyone loved it. Impossible to get bored during this tour, as there are many stops with different things to discover each time. The guide is fabulous: he makes the right balance of historical, cultural and fun explanations. Some of us live in Bangkok, and we did learn new things about the city and the history, and discovered temples at night and some areas like we never saw them before. Traveling in tuk tuk is so much fun! There are some food stops to relax a bit. I strongly recommend this tour to tourists who want to get a great overview in a few hours, as well as Bangkok residents who want to rediscover with new eyes.

Night Tour -A Must Do !!. We did the night tuk tuk tour on the 18 dec with our amazing and very knowledgeable guide -Jib.We were shown so many different sides to Bangkok. Great to experience the food, markets, the river and of course some of the temples which had to ourselves.That was something we will never forget !!Simon thank you for reimbursing the full payment for my wife who fell sick and was unable to go our tour!Most companies wouldn't do that so thank you again!

Fantastic - A must do in Bangkok. What an amazing trip!! We met Jib our guide for the evening who outlined the Tuk Tuk route and highlights and then we set off. This trip showed us so many sights we wouldn’t have seen if we did our own thing, these included many temples, some night markets and lots of snack stops along the route. We sampled some spicy fish balls, Nutella on toast (local teenager treat) and 1 of the nicest Phad Thai’s and not forgetting our dessert stop in China town!! During the trip Jib really made the effort and gave us so much information and made us feel so welcome! It’s a great way to see the city by night and something we recommend.

Must do!. This tour is simply amazing. They take you all around the city and it's very personal. Do it on your first night as they help you with where to go and what to do. Also teachers you tips and tricks to get around the city. Jib was our tour guide and she was so helpful and polite. Must do tour for Bangkok!!

Great Tour. The Bangkok Night Lights tour on tuk tuks was a great way to see some things we wouldn't have known to do otherwise, particularly visiting Wat Pho at night. Our guide was very friendly and knowledgeable, and the tour was well-paced with a nice variety between riding, walking, and eating.

Another side to Bangkok. Despite having lived in Thailand for over two years and travelled around Thailand for more than six, the Bangkok Night Lights tour by tuk-tuk with Expique was still an eye-opener. The tour really shows a different side to the city, with some hidden secrets that I had no idea lay waiting. Highlights for me included exploring Wat Pho in the dark - when it is totally empty and simply stunning - and catching a glimpse of the glimmering white chedi at Wat Prayoon. Highly recommended!

A Fun Tour, A Learning Tour with Great Photos To Boot. I travel a lot and had been to Bangkok many times. I have seen "the sights" and wanted a more intimate look at the city. On other trips, I picked up the habit of taking a photo tour because you often see things standard tours do not cover.I contacted Expique to join their photo tour on the weekend but, due to short notice, they did not have any available. The owner, Simon Philipp offered to put a variation of two of their tours together and asked a very reasonable price for a personal tour. He said he did not have a photographer to lead the tour but a very knowledgable guide who could point out interesting sites and able to talk to people to make them relaxed for photos.Natt was my guide. He was friendly, personable, and spoke very good English. Although Natt was not their "photography guide", he told me he had earlier been a wedding photographer for five years. He was most helpful on a couple of technical photography issues.He was most helpful as we walked the first road in Bangkok and explored the alley ways connected to it. We saw a major temple, a major shrine, a mosque and the first church in Bangkok . As we walked, Natt told me the history of the structures and the history of the people connected with them, i.e.the Portugese were the first to visit Bangkok and set up a church.Best of all were the photos. Natt approached people, smiled and explained why the strange foreigner with him was pointing a camera at them. Everyone was so friendly which made the photos nicer and more genuine.The tour was great, the highlight of my trip. I got to see a totally different side of the city and had a unique tour / photo experience. If Ihad more time, I would take another tour with Expique, a first rate , totally professional company. But, that will have to wait for next time ...and there will be a next time.

New View of Bangkok. We have been to Bangkok many times. This afternoon we took the Bangkok walking tour through Thonburi with our guide Esso. We have seen Bangkok through new eyes. We were taken to places that we would never have found on our own. We met some remarkable people, saw beautiful parks and learnt much about the local area. Our tour experience with Esso was more of a conversation than a guided tour. The Booking was easy, the meeting point worked well. This tour is highly recommended.

See the different side of bangkok. The walking tour in China Town was very interesting and fun to do.We got to see things you normally wouldn´t see on a `standard tour´The guide, food, beverages transport and even insurances were including in the rate.This is the first time that you get a complete package. With other tourcompanies things like these are not included, and come on top of the price, so you might be suprised at the end of the tour.Overall, really happy with the service, and would book them again!!

Awesome evening walk. Khun Jib, the tourguide is really nice and helpfull person. Very touch with the hospitality of Expique team.The evening walk tour along Chao Phraya river is highly recommended to see truly Bangkok resident.Susana

Great Tour From a High Integrity Company. I met Simon while I was in Thailand on an extended holiday, and he had be "guinea pig" two of the tours that he was designing with his friends and co-workers. It's really clear that he is building a team that is trying to connect travelers to Bangkok and teach them about Thai society while eating some good food, and seeing some intersting stuff. We went out to a temple on the night tour and got lucky and witnesses a Chinese-Thai funeral happening with a fire ritual. I had been in SE Asia for nearly a year and never saw anything like that. That just gives you an idea of the carefullness and specialness that these guys have put into creating great experiences for visitors. There are a lot of tour companies in Bangkok, and most of them feel pretty routine. I like Expique because they really try to do a nice job. Hope you enjoy.

An unforgettable experience - thank you!. From the first email till the end of the tour, we were treated like family. I wanted my little family to experience the true Bangkok on the very first day and we were not disappointed! Moo (Intra) is the sweetest guide ever and she brought alive the history and sights of Bangkok. It was a seamlessly planned tour and Bangkok by night, by tuk tuk and 'hosted' by a guide who treated us like a family friend was truly an exceptional experience. Thank you Expique!

Awesome way to see the city. We booked an tuk tuk tour an hour before it started. I've been to Bangkok many times and it was great to see a different side of the city. Drinks, snacks and dinner was included and all were very good. Tried several things I would have never, ever tried and they were all surprisingly good. Our guide was very good and often made solid jokes. It was also nice to ask here questions about the every day lives of thai people. Highly recommend to the amateur or experts of Bangkok.

Great night time Tuk Tuk Tour. We spent a really enjoyable and informative time on the night time tuk tuk tour experience with Expique. Even as residents of Bangkok, we enjoyed the different kind of experience by seeing a number of historical sites and areas during the night time, with interesting commentary and background from the guide. The tour is professionally run with polite and assured drivers, and crosses the Thonburi area, the river, and the Wat Pho/Chinatown area really well. The dining experience is very middle-of-the-road and tasty (you're not offered anything "exotic"), with a mixture of sweet things and a great Pad Thai venue at which the crowd speaks for itself. The tour was really well run and the guide's passion for Bangkok, its history and her client's enjoyment shone through. Would recommend the experience to anyone seeking a different look and some information on a couple of the main sites, touring without suffering the heat of the day, and some great photo opportunities.

Tuk-tuk tour of Bangkok. An exciting tour through night markets and monuments with stops for some of the best food in Bangkok. I would definitely recommend this tour and tour operator. I'm looking forward to my next excursion with expique!

Tuk Tuk Fun. My friend and I know Bangkok pretty well so we wanted to get off the beaten track and see something different. This well run and organized tour was great for two ladies of a certain age. All the info and bookings were handled smoothly and there were no problems. The owner is an Englishman who is in the hospitality industry and he is providing a really good product. We especially enjoyed a tour of the flower market late at night as well as the Pad Thai dinner provided. We didn't have time to do the walking tour but that would be on my list for another visit. Simon got us back to our hotel in our tuk tuk for a reasonable surcharge.Highly recommended..

Tuk tuk tour. We were welcomed by Simon and his team at the Thonburi Krung BTS station. Then we boarded the tuk tuks and started our journey thru wide roads, back alleyways, with great historical briefings at every stop. We were given local snacks to taste, cold water. Then we stopped for dinner at one of my favourite places in Bangkok but I will keep that as a secret. Delicious food. We continued our journey( I could never retrace my steps) and ended in China town for a delicious local desert( no, not sticky rice and mango). All in all it was fun.. I would definitely recommend this tour for your out of town guests to see parts of Bangkok at night.

“Walking Tour of Talad Noi -- The other Bangkok Chinatown”. It was a great experience. The owner (Simon) and his employee guide (I regret I forget his name) took us to see a neighborhood that is not included in the usual Bangkok Chinatown walking tour, which is also worth doing. The guides know the area and its people remarkably well and have cultivated relationships with people whose businesses we stopped at along the way, adding an extra dimension to learning about the area and its people. This should be experienced as well as the standard Bangkok tourist experiences.
Exquisite tour . Different side of Bangkok. More relax and humble experience . Very friendly and fun tour guide . Highly recommended. :)

Tuk Tuk by Night!!. From the moment we were met by Jib our guide for the night I had a great sense of how exciting this Tour would be.  We started off in our Tuk Tuks and headed to the old Train Station which is now a bustling market frequented by the "younger generation"There were 2 highlights for me which were visiting Wat Pho and the Flower Markets.Wat Pho was so quiet and Serene that it was a shame when we had to move on. I could have wandered around forever.The Flower Market was alive and buzzing with stallholders collecting and setting up the flowers, vegetable orders for the next day. Children drew and played while their parents were busy at work.  Dinner was included and snacks were also purchased for us. Jip was a fun loving lady who made sure we all had a great time while exploring a great many sights. Her insight and knowledge hhelped make this Tour so "SPECIAL"  Chinatown was alive and the crowds were a little thinner on the ground.This Tour gave such a great insight into how Bangkok functioned during the night.  Great work EXPIQUE...I HIGHLY recommend this Tour for Families,Couples and Singles.

Chao Phraya Riverside Paths of Thonburi. My husband and myself went on this walking tour yesterday met by our tour guide Jip and the owner of expique at Saphan Taskin station which is the starting point of the tour. Our guide Jip was very friendly and had a wealth of information about the areas we were walking. We got to taste some typical thai street food which consisted only of their sweet treats,would of enjoyed more variety in the food tastings but the sweets we tried were delicious. The pace of the tour was very easy and would be easy for anyone to do. The tour shows you the way people of different nationalitys coexist together and the different culture of each group. As I live in Bangkok at the moment I really enjoyed this insight to the real thai lifestyle not the one the tourists see. Throughly enjoyed this tour and would recommend it to anyone.

Night tour- Words cannot describe how amazing this tour is. My husband and I did the night tuk tuk tour with Jip. We have beem to bangkok many times but this was like nothing we ever experienced. Pure magic. if you do one thing in Bangkok in your life than this is it. It is like meeting a friend who lives in bangkok where they take you on this off the beaten track romantic and delicious tour. You will meat many locals, eat yummy street food (that won't make you sick) and see incredible sites at night. It includes dinner as well and is of exceptional value.The tour is extremely professional and was easy to book. Don't think about it, just book it!

Great introduction to Bangkok. I did the night tuk tuk tour on my first day in Bangkok and what an introduction! There were only 4 of us in the tour and it was nice and relaxed. Lots of fun riding in the tuk tuks between destinations. There was lots of great food included, some of which I doubt I would've tried if I was on my own. I would highly recommend it!

Night tour by tuk tuk. We had no trouble connecting with Simon and Ron for an incredible tour of Bangkok at night. Our tour was during the slow season, end of September and Ron was new to the tour, so the two of us had two tuk tuks and 2 guides. We enjoyed the Grand Palace illuminated and no crowds. We enjoyed this visit more than the one the next day with the tour of Thailand group we joined. Our time spent at the food and flower markets were quite interesting. We sampled several different things at the food market, which we probably wouldn't have on our own. Our tour was during the vegetarian celebration so our dinner was at a family run, 24 hour place that was serving only vegetarian meals. Very good, street food was one of the reasons we took this tour. We were supposed to end the evening in China Town for dessert but we had some sticky rice with mango earlier in the evening so we opted out of China Town. Would certainly recommend this tour.

Original and amazing tour. This is an original way to discover Bangkok... By night, by Tuk Tuk... Very well organised and the guide was very nice and friendlyI recommend this tour. A bit expensive (THB 1,650) but very nice experience

Best way to get to know the city. Best tour I did while on Bangkok.First of all, the experience of moving around in a tuk tuk, is great.Second of all, doing it during the night, makes it even a better experience.You wont suffer the extreme hot weather that you get during the day.I loved how well organised was the tour. The guide was excellent, with a great english level, she would explain every piece of history in all the stops and landmarks.What I also loved, was the food she chose for every stop.It was delicious (And, whats more important, it was included in the tour).I totally recommend trying this tour, it`s worthy.Thanks for everything!Greetings from Argentina.

Off the beaten track. I visited Bangkok in April 2014 and was able to get onto an Expique tour at the last minute. I have done official tourist tours in the city before and this was definitely off-the-beaten track with a good range of visitors and we saw a lot more character across the city than usual. It was very well organised, interesting and manage-able given the split between boating, walking and the time spent at different sites. Recommended!

Amazing Tuk Tuk tour!. Me and my girlfriend took the Bangkok by night tour and it was the best part of our entire trip. The guide was knowledgeable and we learned a lot of things we hadn't on other larger tours. We saw and ate unique things and had a great time with the tour guide and owner. Will do it again when we come back!

You should not miss this. My friends and I had decided to go for the Diversity and Harmony Tour offered by Expique. This experience was truly symbolic of their company name "experience --> unique".Our guide Ms Jib was wonderful in her explanation of the places we covered and definitely did her best in making us feel comfortable. Besides walking through the back lanes of Bangkok and seeing the way of life of the locals, the tour also covered religious places including a mosque, Portuguese church, Buddhist temple and Hindu Temple. This tour was simply amazing and our guide was always extremely helpful in taking pictures for us without any complaints. She had never once made us patronize any tourist traps along the tour too.I guess our only complaint for this tour was the relentless heat from mother nature which made it all so fun when all of us were crumbling under the scorching sun (even our guide was dying too).A definite must go!

Professionalism is weatherproof. The rain poured down but we still enjoyed the tour of all sites in the itinerary. It is an adventure to have slight changes on itinerary due to weather but it pulled though in the end. Tasted great food and seen great sites that are prettier at night.

Absolutely Fantastic, Highlight of the trip. I was lucky enough to go on both the night Tuk Tuk tour and the day walking Diversity & Harmony tour. Booking was extremely easy and organised and the tours themselves were simply FANTASTIC. To see the different/local side of Bangkok was fascinating both by day and night and the information given by the guides and route taken was just brilliant. Thanks "Esso" for introducing me to lots of street food i would have otherwise walked past every time!! Quite simply un-missable! Thanks for the great time!

Experiencing an Adventure. What a great experience we had tonight on the Bangkok Night Lights tour. Our guide was "Esso" and he made the experience all that much more enjoyable. I think he had as much fun and laughed as much as we all did during the tour. I am hard of hearing and it's difficult for me to understand heavy accents but Esso was clear and concise to me. The Tuktuks were fun, clean, well maintained and a great and easy way to get around the different sites. Book this tour for fun, interesting sites, and good street food. Do not eat before you go on this tour......you will be full of good and different foods which are all provided by the tour company.

Great way to see the non-tourist side of BKK. I took the Bangkok Walking Tour: Chao Praya Riverside Paths of Thonburi and it made my entire trip to BKK. It was great walking around a part of Bangkok that is off the beaten path, being given Thai snacks to sample--coffee with FRESH milk, sticky rice cakes with an assortment of toppings, smashed, fried bananas with palm sugar, Thai marzipan, and a Portuguese-inspired cake. My guide was knowledgeable and fun and i didn't feel rushed at all. If you don't mind walking (probably around 2-3 km) and you want to go off the beaten path, this tour is something you should try.

A very nice way of seeing Bangkok with a different light (and much cooler!). My husband and I did the night tour of Bangkok a couple of weeks ago with our two sons (14 and 10) and we all enjoyed it. We were worried about it being too late (from 7 to 11 pm), we expressed our concern to the company and they were very acommodating. We were able to star an hour earlier. Our guide, Natt, was wonderful, kind and very knowledgeable. All in all, a great way to see the bullicious, hot and noisy city of Bangkok in a more pleasant way.I would definitely recommend it.

Diversity and Harmony tour. It's a fantastic tour and really interesting! You meet wonderful people and learn a lot about the area. Definitely recommend! Esso was so knowledgeable and patient, especially with me wandering around, snapping photos everywhere. He happily answered our multitude of questions and gave us little, fun "quizzes", asking if we could spot things in the temples and such. We met some lovely locals and tasted really delicious local treats that we probably wouldn't have seen otherwise. Simon met up with us at the beginning of the tour and talked with us about his life and asked us questions about ours. You can tell that he puts a lot of thought and care in to developing and perfecting the tours, and it shows. Expique is a great tour company. They are a small operation and relatively new, but their efforts to create personalised and unique experiences are very successful.

Spot on - some truly memorable moments. We were in Bangkok for just one night, flying in mid afternoon one day and out first thing the following morning. Never having been to the city before we wanted to experience some kind of tour which would enable us to leave feeling that we had got to grips with what makes the city tick, insofar as this is possible in such a short time!The Tuk Tuk Night Tour did just that. My wife and I came away buzzing, albeit pretty tired when we finished. Our 13 year old daughter loved the riding about and the proliferation of cats on display, although she maybe found some of the facts and historical information a little heavy going. But not so for my wife and I - Natt is truly an enthusiastic, deeply knowledgable resident of the city and his experience and insight made for a remarkable and fascinating night out. Thank you to him and to Simon. I highly recommend this tour, especially if, like us, you are limited for time in this extraordinary city.

exceptional tour. I recently did the harmony and diversity tour with Simon and Esso of expique tours. I took this tour because it was available on a Sunday but it turned out to be one of the best tours I have experienced. After a short boat and ferry ride we were lead into the daily life of the Bangkok people on the other side of the river. We shopped with them, ate with them, even played games with them. As the tour unfolded we became more and more immersed into the every day life of these lovely people. We saw how they live, how they cook and eat and how they worship. We met and talked with the locals. Simon and Esso opened up this area for us as though it was beautiful flower...slowly petal by petal until it appeared for us in full bloom. All thanks to our sensitive, intuative kind and caring tour guides...this really was an amazing tour..I went home with a new appreciation of Bangkok
Tuk Tuk tour is great. Had Tuk Tuk tour with Expique, thanks for showing me the new perspective of Bangkok and some hidden gem places. Staff were nice and well prepared. Keep up the good work!

Wonderful Way to Spend an Evening!. I recently had the pleasure of taking a tour with Taum & Simon. I more than enjoyed myself. This tour was a great way to see a more peaceful side of Bangkok. Seeing the city lit up at night was quite an experience. Beyond the tour itself, I was especially impressed with the staff's helpfulness and willingness to make my experience great. I was the only one signed up for my tour that night and they could have easily tried to switch me to a different day to save time on their end but they didn't and I ended up with a private tour of the city at a group rate. Big win for me! They were wonderful, very kind and always ready and willing to answer any questions I had. They went out of their way to make sure I enjoyed myself and it was greatly appreciated. They were even incredibly accommodating for my gluten allergy and never treated it like an annoyance. It made my experience that much better! Thank you guys so much!

Pleasant surprise!. Having frequent Bangkok almost every year , it was really a pleasant surprise when Expique reveal this charming side of Bangkok that we never imagined exist! Taum, our guide fuelled us with info. About the city that are probably known only to the locals .. We had our best pad Thai at the oddest time ! It was truly an experience queuing with the locals , watching the preparation process which mimic a production line! My mum just couldn't get enough of the late night market tour .... Dad was particularly fascinated by the temple tour.. He took one of his best picture of wat pho without being distracted by other tourists ! It had been a fun night for the entire family! We will definitely recommend it to anyone who is visiting Bangkok!

Exciting new sights. Living in Bangkok I keep taking friends and family to the same places. However, when I joined Expique's diversity and harmony tour their great team showed us inteteating places I had never seen before. Very much worth checking out. Thanks Expique team!

Excellent custom service. We contacted Expique on short notice and they put together two days of interesting, varied, off-the-beaten track experiences. The staff are both knowledgable and friendly and the time felt less like a tour and more of getting to know a neighborhood through visits with friends. I highly recommend Expique.

Fantastic walking tour. I did the walking tour with a friend and I'm so glad I chose this tour. We met with our tour guide Esso early at the BTS and started our tour with a short ferry ride. Esso was/is a great guide for this tour, his personal knowledge of this area of Bangkok as well as his learned knowledge is fantastic. I had a million questions and he knew them all. The tour went for approximately 3.5 hours and it was really well paced to be interesting and not too hot. We tried several local foods and discovered an entirely new side of Bangkok. Gone is the glitz, the flash and the trash and hello to beautiful little streets with amazing architecture and friendly people who actually want to say Hi. The tour takes in several attractions as well as learning a lot about Bangkok's Chinese, Portuguese and Persian heritage.
