This tour was worth every cent and I highly recommend it to anyone who wants to see an alternative side of Bangkok.

Great night time tuk tuk tour. I Recommend the night time tuk tuk tour. Great fun and our guide Nat was excellent and our driver was very good.Great tour for the first timer or repeat visitor to Thailand.

Love Walking Tours. And I loved this one as well! Everyone who does 2 minutes of research knows you need to visit the Grand Palace and the Reclining Buddha. But what happens if you want to see more?Take a tour with Expique. I did the Harmony and Diversity tour, just a short boat ride and you are on the other side of BKK. It is a world of difference. The pace slows down. The locals smile more often.There is no crazy beautiful landmark that will jump out at you but that is the magic. And that is why you need a local guide. If I did this walk on my own, I would not notice and see the subtle landmarks and attractions. But the guide is able to bring these things to life with stories and landmarks. If you want to see, learn, and experience, go on this tour.

Great off-the-beaten path tour in Bangkok. As a repeat traveler to Bangkok, I truly enjoyed the 3-hour Diversity and Harmony Walking Tour of Expique despite of the summer heat. This is definitely a great walking tour for fit people who want to discover an off-the-beaten path destination in Bangkok without the need to go to far flung places. We explored the Thonburi area in depth with Expique's energetic guides Esso and Namo. It's great to experience the laid back lifestyle of people on the other side of Chao Phraya river. I enjoyed watching the day to day lives of local people unfold, hopping from one temple to another and walking around the charming back alleys of Kudeejeen. Local snacks and cooler drinks provided were good, perfect to cool off from the heat during the pit stops. Thonburi is definitely a great place to immerse yourself with the local culture in depth without the chaos and scam artists typically present in major Bangkok tourist sites (ie. Grand Palace). Do not forget bring your umbrella for a more comfortable walking tour. If you will be on a private tour during summer, it maybe a good idea to request the start time of the tour to be earlier than 8:30am to avoid the mid-day Bangkok heat.Detailed review and more photos can be found here: http://asiatravelbug.com/blog/thonburi-back-streets-with-expique-tours/

A real gem!. Have done two tours now with Expique and they are excellent for both visitors and BKK residents (like me). Lots of things you did not know about Bangkok, snacks and food, quirky areas, hidden treasures and flawless organization. A big thanks to Simon, Matt our guide and everyone involved.

@EXPIQUE Bangkok: Diversity and Harmony Walking Tour Photo Essay. EXPIQUE provides unique tour experiences in the less travelled parts of Bangkok, like the Kudeejeen area with the street art above.My favorite parts of this tour were the long tail cruise, the walk around the Kudeejeen area (especially the street art eskinita), and the discovery of the Thanusingha Bakery.The tour was a bit long and the first part somewhat dragging. Shortening the tour to 3 hours or less would make this a more awesome experience. I would recommend this for travelers who have been to Bangkok before and looking for ways to discover the hidden areas of the city.Here's a photo essay of our Diversity and Harmony Walking Tour of the Modern Thonburi area, with the cool guys of EXPIQUE...Read More:@EXPIQUE Bangkok: Diversity and Harmony Walking Tour Photo Essay #AmazingThailandhttp://www.ourawesomeplanet.com/awesome/2014/06/expique-sunrise-tour-bangkok.html

Definitely a Unique Experience. It was our first visit to Thailand and we are so glad we booked the Bangkok Night Lights Tour with Expique. Everything was amazingly planned - from the Tuk Tuk ride, the food and drinks, the sites, and, of course, the knowledge of our guide Natt - who gave us information that made us understand the culture and history of Thailand (including Bangkok). This is a wonderful company that aims to promote a beautiful cultural view of a very bustling city. We plan to book all our tours with Expique the next time we visit.

Diversity and harmony. I did the Diversity tour with the wonderfully charming Natt. Although it was an open tour I was the only one on it so got undivided attention - seriously though more people need to do this tour. You get to see the secrets of old Bangkok and how for many years this wonderfully diverse city and it's inhabitants have lived peacefully together with love and acceptance. You get history, some food, meet some unique people and see great sights. Expique is a new company and they deserve more people using them.

Exellent night tour to discover Bangkok. The tour was really cool to see Bangkok during the evening, when there are no tourists anymore on the touristic points to visit. Furthermore, the guide we had was a young guy that studied history (Esso), so he was able to answer every questiin regading culture and history about Thai culture.Totally recommended!

Brilliant 2 days. In April 2014 I booked 2 days of private Foto-Tours with Expique. I had several mail contact to Simon for him to find out what I am interested in and I am expecting to see. Simon, Gim (photographer) and myself met at the trainstation in Bangkok for some first pictures of the travelling people. In the mean time we discussed where to go next, which possibilities we have in the rest of the day, so the route could be set upon my wishes and timing - very flexible. After a walk through Wat Traimit and Chinatown we stopped our session for lunch break to meet later with Esso. Esso grew up in the area of Talat Plu with some nice, intresting stories about this part of Bangkok. For a night shooting we met agaoin with Gim to do some night shots at Wat traimit. The second day Esso picked my up early in the morning to get to Ayutthaya. As he was studying history he could tell a lot of details and stories about the old city and the temples. He showed the famous places of Ayutthaya and he knew intresting things to all temples and ruins that you can visit. The day ends with some shots after sunset in Wat Chaiwatthanaram. (see attached picturs) Resumed: 2 absolutely great day with the team of expique!Thanks to Simon, Gim and Esso for the time and to share their knowledge!

Night lights tours. Unfortunately I found this company late in my stay at Bangkok.I wanted to have a ride on a tuk tuk but got sick of having to haggle outside my hotel every time I went outside, then I found Expique!The Night lights tour far exceeded my expectations. The guide Esso (apologies if misspelled) was an absolute wealth of information, humor and gave 100%. He was obviously passionate about his job and sharing knowledge on Thailand. The tours was was very informative and gave a totally different perspective to places I had visited during the day ... being nighttime, the traffic was not nearly as bad as during the day.If I had more time in Bangkok I would examine their other tours. I suggest if you travel with them you cant go too far wrong

Half Day Diversity Walking Tour. The Half Day Diversity Walking Tour in Bangkok was a memorable trip through the streets and alleys along Bangkok’s western bank of the Chao Praya River. Thanks to our informative guides, Natt and Esso, we got to learn history and explore the diverse Thonburi district of Bangkok. Along the way, we were able to sample some local snacks and treats while we went on a 3.5km trek full of historical and cultural sites that aren’t on your regular tourist map.We found ourselves walking through a maze of back streets and some alleyways only big enough to fit a single motorbike. In just a short distance, we checked out a variety of religious buildings ranging from a shrine, to a mosque, to a church, and finally a Thai temple housing a giant Buddha! Be sure to wear some comfy shoes and be prepared to sweat through the Bangkok heat!

Nighttime whirl through Bangkok. It was a madcap nighttime tour of Bangkok with our amazing guide Esso. I'd never been to Bangkok before so it was a great way to see the city - whizzing around in our tuk tuk, stopping at the night and flower markets, temples and crematoriums … lots of fun. Late night pad thai at a local joint with the best orange juice ever! Esso is boundlessly enthusiastic and there wasn't a question he couldn't answer. When I come back, I'll be sure to arrange another outing with Expique.

Get under the skin of Bangkok with Expique!!. Simon and guide Yaya took us on a private tour of the floating markets as well as to the flower market in the wee hours of morning the next day. They are a great company if you want to do the same touristy stuff with a different twist ... or if you want to do something new! Yaya was very friendly and knowledgable not only about the places she took us to but generally about Thailand as well! So it was all in all a 1. Fun and unique experience 2. Lesson on Thai history and politics! Simon, the owner is a very friendly British guy who loves Bangkok and will ensure you do too :)

Lovely Bangkok Walking Tour. March 30, 2014 took a 3-hour walking tour other side of the Chao Phraya river with Simon of Expique. I've been living in BKK 8 years already, so was mainly to meet some interesting people. Pace was unrushed and good opportunities to chat with some new faces. Went through some very interest neighborhoods, including a mosque, church and a couple temples. Was fairly hot time of year, but plenty of shade. Afterwards, some of us went to a rooftop bar for a drink with fantastic view. All in all a lovely afternoon and evening.

One unforgettable night in Bangkok. The trip was totally unexpected and last minute since we only had a stop over in Bangkok. We sent a request to Expique who happened to be so responsive and professional we decided to give it a go and we'll be forever grateful! What a fun night! the tour is far from lame (I have been to many), perfectly taylored to our timing and interests, stunning food, incredible places... I don't think we'd ever had seen so much in a whole day! It was more an experience than a tour and it was perfect!! we simply cannot wait to go to Bangkok and have a whole tour with Expique again! Thank you guys!!!

In a city with tours that are a dime a dozen, these guys stand out above the rest.. Short version: Take the time and do the Bangkok Night Lights tour. It is well worth the unique experience. Longer version: We got back into Bangkok later than we expected and had not made any plans to do a tour this evening. While doing research for night tours a stumbled across Expique. I called in hopes of making a booking for this evening...a long shot, but I am glad I did. I talked to Simon and he said it probably would not happen because all of the guides were busy. I asked if he knew of any other options. He said, "You know what, I can take you. I will be at your hotel at 8pm." This was awesome. The owner of the company taking us on our own private tour. I can assure you that most tour company owners would not take a last minute booking and personally take you on a tour of the city. Simon arranged the tuk tuks to take us around town to various locations while provide great information on the sites we visited around the city. All while having an amazing time. I will recommend this tour to all of my friends and family. Thanks again Expique!

Beyond the usual. It's run by very friendly people, and a great alternative to the usual "Top Ten" tours. We took the Harmony and Diversity tour, which was a fascinating walk through neighborhoods we hadn't visited in our previous 3 visits to Bangkok. Well thought out, it provided a sense of the diversity and everyday life of the city. If you've run through the synoptic guidebooks, or are interested in looking beyond that sort of venture, I'd definitely recommend trying out Expique.

A Great Afternoon. I really enjoyed the Harmony and Diversity tour and would recommend it to visitors and expats alike that would like to see a side of the "real" Bangkok. There is so much more to this great city than Khao San Road!The tour was well thought out and engaging. The tour leaders will informative an friendly. I felt that they wanted me to have an unique and memorable experience.I also like the fact that the engage and support the local community.I live in Bangkok and spend a lot of my time exploring the city by bicycle and on foot, but was excited to see things from the perspective of others.I hear great things about their night time Tuk Tuk tour as well!Great job Simon and company, keep up the good work and keep exploring!

A unique Experience. Having been to Bangkok previously we decided we wanted a different experience so finding Expique, Experience Unique seemed sensible.We first booked a tour to Ayuttaha. The pick up at our hotel was on time and in a very comfortable vehicle, suitable for 2 couples. We immediately got on well with our guide Or who was charming and very knowledgeable. Through the Bangkok traffice to pick up another couple, with whom we had much in common. It did not take too long to get out of Bangkok with Or adding explanations whenever we wanted.Our first stop was at the Royal Summer palace. This was beautiful, with marvellous houses and gardens. Or gave us a vast amount of information in just the right way. On to the ancient capital of Ayuttaha. Once again Or's guidance and commentary wase xcellent. Or and our driver then timed things perfectly to get to the boat which took us back to Bangkok. Indeed this departed within 5 minutes of our boarding and Or taking us to our reserved table and an enjoyable meal. A very relaxing way to travel. Once we landed in Bangkok our driver was waiting to take us back to our hotel. An excellent day out.The next day we enjoyed Expique's Harmony and Diversity walking tour, with an excellent guie. This took us to parts of Bangkok that we had not previously explored and we were fascinated by the different communities and cultures living closely together.We are certain to recommend Expique to our friends

Best way to visit flower market & temple: at night. Its a great tour. The staff is extraordinary friendly. Best buy for a tour. Before the tour we visited almost same sights but doing so at night is a whole difference. Cross the river by boat, visit the temple, eat phatai at best local place, flower market and tuktuk. All at night and for an excellent price.

A different side to Bangkok. We really enjoyed Expique's Harmony and Diversity walking tour. We’ve been to Bangkok many times and visited various sites both on tour and independently. This is the first time that we’ve ventured off the beaten path and really experienced the living history of Bangkok. We were amazed at the cultural diversity, felt very welcomed by the local residents, and were fascinated by the temples, churches, mosques, and traditional homes that are rarely seen by foreign visitors.Mout was a very congenial and knowledgeable guide - really enjoyable to spend the afternoon with. Capping the day watching the setting sun over the Chao Praya was a perfect end to a fun, fascinating tour.

Real Bangkok. This tour showed me much more than that i have experienced before whilst staying in Bangkok. I really enjoyed seeing the real city-experience, tasting working, praying, eating at the heart of Bangkok life.

See Bangkok in a different light. I recently had the pleasure of experiencing the Bangkok Night Lights tour with Expique and really enjoyed myself! They managed to pack so many different things into one exciting evening and it really allows you to see some of the highlights of Bangkok in a different way. It's also quite pleasant to be able to avoid the heat of the midday sun. Particular highlights were the flower market (which really comes alive at night!) and having some of the best Pad Thai in Bangkok. Highly recommended!
A great city tour. The Bangkok night tour is a very interesting city tour in the evening. Beautiful places in cool, evening atmosphere and a touch of local life. A pleasure indeed.

Uniqueness guaranteed!. We did the walking tour where Muslims, Christians and Thai Buddhist live together around few blocks nearby the river. The history and uniqueness of this area was really mind blowing. We have lived in Bangkok for a while now and this tour showed us once again how alive and culturally rich city it is.Expique has really showed us something unique and unexpected. We did it together with our 4 years old son and he enjoyed it pretty much. He even got the chance to play with some local friends during one of the few breaks on the way. Got some really enjoyable pictures!

Exactly What I Wanted!. I was in Bangkok this past week for work. I had only one day and half to be a tourist. I am pretty picky about how I play tourist. I travel a lot and so the run of the mill tour experiences just do not work for me. Unfortunately, the options that my hotel presented were exactly those - boring, generic, herd mentality. Not at all what I wanted.I searched online for "unique day trip Bangkok" and Expique is one of a handful of results that I got. I shot an email off to each of them explaining that I wanted a personal tour that was somewhat spiritual, involved nature, involved some activity (e.g. biking), and got me outside the city. Expique got back to me right away and worked with me to create a day that worked for me. They crafted a day tour that was not even on their standard menu but that was perfect for me. Exactly what I had hoped for. My Thai tour guide was excellent. He spoke perfect english, was very engaging, very knowledgeable. I learned just the right amount of information to make the activities interesting and meaningful without becoming academic, like being in a classroom. That is really an art on his part. He took me to some important landmarks, but also to some out of the way spots, which is always great. And he was just fun to be with all day. Also important.In fact my personal tour day was so good, I signed up for Expique's "Diversity and Harmony" walking tour the next day. That was also a good time. They took us into some more off the beaten path, but incredibly interesting and photogenic, neighborhoods. Exactly the kind of glimpse into the real life of a city that I love. One of the guides had actually grown up in one of the neighborhoods, which made it extra special. This company knows what they are doing and enjoy it. I highly recommend them.

Once in a life time. I took the grand palace tour ( which if you are in BKK it's a must) the tour guide (tony) who spoke good English was extremely knowledgable about his country and King and showed great passion . I had an extremely excellent day and would recommend this company to all people in BKK and Tony thank you for a excellent day

Amazing time.. We decided to go with friendlygointer after we had exchanged many e-mails. We did a day tour to Ayutthaya and the other day to the floating market. We had an amazing time and they made our experience unforgettable. Chen picked us up on time by a comfortable Camry car. He was a delight, easy going and explained all the interesting parts. His knowledge was outstanding and his photography skills were excellent. Lunch was included and Chen made perfect choices. If we return to Bangkok, we would use friendlygointer and ask for Chen. A lovely two days spent with a very knowledgeable guide. Thank you.

Unforgettable tour. We booked our tour just a week before we arrived in Bangkok and it successfully worked. We told our travel manager a tour planning, hotel and flight details then she helped us arranged everything. We went to visit the grand palace, some temples and the floating market. Jenny, our guide punctually picked us up at our hotel and we enjoyed the day out very much. She took care of us so well, felt really safe and received so much knowledge. We were given plenty of time to look at things and to take photos. We were so glad to book the tour with them and would definitely contact them again when we come back to Thailand. Absolutely fantastic guide and a great unforgettable day that we'll never forget.

Couldn't be better. We took a tour to the grand palace&temples early this month with Jenny. We were picked up in our hotel by a good size luxury a/c car. Jenny was an excellent tour guide, happy to answer all our questions about the places we visited. She provided a lot of interesting information on the Thai culture and tradition. She also made every effort to make us comfortable and at ease. We spent time in each site without rush. Jenny tried her best to get us to know Thai history that we can compare with my country's history because we come from the same region. Her good command of English allowed us to appreciate and enjoy the tour very much. I would highly recommend Friendlygointer and our guide for those who want to visit Bangkok.

Wonderful experience!. My boyfriend and I have just returned from our holiday in Thailand. During our 3 days trip in Bangkok we did a tour with friendlygointer to the floating market, Tiger feeding and Elephant bath that I want to share our experience.Floating Market was an amazing experience. We took a paddle boat through many canals around the market where Thai people are selling things. We were also had chance to try a wonderful duck noodles soup&ice cream from food boats along the canals. Spicy and nice!Take a photo with tiger and spend time with them were very exciting and exhilarating things we have done on our holiday. Generally tigers seem to be happy and lively. They're not drugged, chained or tortured. It's really incredible experience and the highlight of our trip.Elephant bath was brilliant, but for us this was my great experience. We got excited as it's our first time to ride and play with such a huge animal. It was fantastic sitting on his back and got him splash water over us! The whole time with the elephant was my unforgettable moment.The day was a long day, but it was a day we will never forget. Every part of the day was brilliant. My guide Mr. Chen took care of us so well and watch our belongings when we played with the elephant. We can not recommend the tours highly enough. We very much enjoyed our package tour and spent a perfect day out!

Seriously unforgettable!. I and my family had the only one free day left in Bangkok before travelling back to Vietnam and we decided to book a tour with friendlygointer to the grand palace, temples and canal tour. We were promptly picked up as promised by Chen. He spoke good English, was knowledgeable about the history of Thailand and explained to us insights into Thai culture. It was a hot day but the package we took was really interesting and fun. Chen offered us more tours but it's sad this was our last day.We enjoyed my personal tour very much and it is the right way to explore Bangkok. If we had had more time, we would have done additional tours. Thanks so much for special memory not to be missed!
Market Tour with friendly Go Inter. The Floating market trip and Railway market trip was wonderfully organised by the team, Sofia was very good guide. I would certainly recommend them for anyone.

Highly recommend.. I had Tawee as my private tour guide to the floating market. He was very helpful and knowledgeable. The market was interesting with many souvenirs, food and drinks. I didn't encounter any issue when I traveled. I tremendously enjoyed the private tour with friendlygointer.
Great tour. We had Tawee as our guide for our 2 days tour. He is very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Everything went perfectly. I will highly recommend to everyone.

Great private tour. All the tours we did with friendlygointer were arranged perfectly with great service. We had Chen as my guide. He's very attentive and knowledgeable. Excellent service, accurate and friendly guide. We took the Temples, Palace and Canal tour and had an amazing time. Our tour guide Tawee was amazing, very helpful and friendly. Perfect tour with Tawee. Great memory back to the past. We booked the tour via e-mail with friendlygointer and was not disappointed. Excellent service..... Just had a tour with guide Tawee this morning to the ancient city of Ayutthaya. He is very knowledgable and gave great insight into the history of Ayutthaya. Excellent ratings are proven. Strongly recommend. I was so lucky to have Chen as my guide for my memorable day in Bangkok. Thorough and professional customized service. We had 3 days private tour with Friendly Go Inter Tours early February. Our tour guide was Tawee and we covered Bangkok in two days and floating market and Ayutthaya on third day. We learned in depth Thailand history and culture from Tawee during our tour. The hidden treasure in Bangkok. We booked Ayutthaya tour with friendlygointer.com and got picked up on time at our hotel by a private comfortable mini van. Less than one and a half hours to get to the first stop at Bangpain summer palace. Chen our guide explained the cross culture from various style of buildings like Spanish, British, Chinese and Thai style buildings in this magnificent palace. We love seeing different forms of architecture and these buildings were absolutely incredible with good information by our knowledgeable guide. Long tail motor boat around ayutthaya island showed us the 3 main religions in Thailand that can go well with one another. Beautiful houses, temples and how people live by river side are really worth visiting. Walking around the world heritage, learning lots of Thai history by professional guide who speaks fluent English with excellent lunch menu at the restaurant by the river. Everyone in our group was totally happy with the great day out and perfect photos which worth every penny. We would highly recommend friendlygointer.com and plan to do another tour with them on our next visit to Bangkok.

Floating market. We decided to go to the damnernsaduak floating market with friendlygointer as lots of good reviews, good price and is supposed to be the biggest floating market. Jenny picked us up at our hotel on time. She spoke good english, punctual and knowledgeable. We enjoyed the unique floating market, the unique way to see the stalls, thai culture and long tail motor boat which took us to the market gateway. We really enjoyed the paddle boat ride option that the guide told me this the only way to go back to the Siamese's old day. Paddle boat was great but sometimes we're stuck deadlock with many paddle boats in the same canal. It would have been more fun if we had left our hotel earlier and had taken a paddle boat when other tourists haven't arrived. Highly recommend this tour with friendlygointer when you traveled in Bangkok.

Considerate and attentive service. My mom was in Bangkok for medical treatment. I thought it would be good to take her out to somewhere other than a hospital. She also assigned a staff (Tawee) who was with us from the time we got off the vehicle until the end of the cruise. We enjoyed the cruise. The presence of Tawee played an important role as we did not have to worry about anything. He was there all the time - he was very nice, patient and helpful. It was very much appreciated.

Enjoyable trip with knowledge.. My Wife and I booked two days tours with Friendlygointer to city tour and the floating market. Am was very responsive and knowledgeable. Very interesting and friendly. I would defintely reccommend this tour, they know what they are talking about and know how to communicate in a friendly manner.Don´tmiss out this opportunity of a great day in Bangkok.

Friendly, prompt and honest. We booked a part of our tour with Am, who was a champion in the way she managed to sort out all our tour needs. Floating market. We had a wonderful experience with friendlygointer. Everything was settled before I arrived in Bangkok. Very impressive.. We booked the tours to the floating market&pattaya with Am. Everything was confirmed and went smoothly. We were impressed and love both days. Come back to bagnkok again, will contact you again.

Tawee is the guide. Just came back from Ayuttaya one-day tour. So lucky that Tawee was sent to us. He is not the kind of guide u r always faced with. He is not that talktive, nor energetic. Tawee called before the tour to identify our needs. And they sent a van because my father was a bit big. Thus the 1.5h drive (one way) was very comfortable. Tawee's never been pushy. He let us take time. He was good photographer too.Lunch included was nice by riverside. Ayuttaya was one place u would love to hang around for long. Am, the agency boss, was responsive, highly efficient and informative all the time. They offer private tours indeed worth the prive.

Highly recommended tour agency. We all really enjoyed the tours, the service and tour guide, Tawee, was really great, so nice and courteous - very professional.We learned a lot about the Thai culture and got to see and do a lot with the tours.We also appreciated that they were accommodating and were able to arrange last minute extra tours for us.

Great private tour. I located this route company here in TripAdvisor, and I had a great experience. My tour included the Jim Thompson House, a few temples, and the Grand Palace. I would definitely recommend this tour agency.

Value for money. I would thoroughly recommend this tour for anyone who wants the best Bangkok&floating market tour. Chen was truly fantastic tour guide who spent time showed us around. He's always on time and also the real historian who made my trip in Bangkok&outside more exciting with knowledge and fun. I was satisfied with the money I paid for and felt I picked the right company. I would recommend him without question. Thanks very much from my heart for the great tour you well arranged for me.

Fun and educational :) worth every penny. We had a good time with Tawee! He shared plenty of information about the people, culture, temples and Buddha. Mr. Tawee is a true profesional, very punctual and courteous. He also kept on reminding us that we need to be careful especially when crossing the streets and with our belongings. Excellent trip. Am my travel agent did a great job organized a tour planning for us in Bangkok. Our guide, Chen was very knowledgeable about history, also speak fluent English. Awesome experience.. . Visited Bangkok with my girl friends. Highlight of the trip was the private tour with Tawee.. This guide made the trip very enjoyable.. We got Tawee as our guide for the first day. A pleasant time in Bangkok. We were in Bangkok for the the first time and had a pleasant time with Chen in Bangkok city tour and Ayuttaya. He's the best guide I can ever imagine. I cannot express how impressed I was with my private tour!. My brother and I only had a few days in Bangkok and really wanted to see the amazing temples that Thailand has to offer. The best to know Bangkok. It was wonderful experience to travel with friendlygointer tour. We had a most enjoyable day with Tawee our guide who introduced us to Bangkok city tour and it's culture. Amazing tour Bangkok&Ayuttaya.. It's wonderful experience to travel with friendlygointer to Bangkok city tour and Ayuttaya as there were simply the best tour experience. Personal Service at its best!. Am is a true professional and her services are outstanding. Palace, temples and Floating markets.. This was an excellent 2 days. Our guide, Tawee, could not possibly have been more helpful or informative. Excellent experience: Floating Market, Wat Pho and Grand Palacce. A solid way to see the historic attractions of former capital of Thailand. We booked and attended the Ayutthaya day tour by bus and boat (return trip). We're happy to share with the rest of the TA community that we were very pleased with the trip! Staff courtesy and tour organization was top notch.The start time from the hotel was very manageable. We boarded a bus northbound about ~65 km to visit the popular palace grounds, the famous ruins, and several other historic wats. I think the best part about the day trip was that each stop on the tour offered a little something different (oftentimes, the various drop-offs on tours I've taken in the past begin to feel alike.) You'll see.Feel free to shop from some of the eat/drink stands and/or the great artists posted up at some of the attractions. They were not a nuisance but colored the experience even more. By the time we boarded the cruise back to Bangkok, I wasn't even hungry... my fault, but even so, the buffet aboard the cruise was so tasty. I listened to the cruise narrator the entire time and I'm glad I did. There are just so many interesting things ini the city along the river.Overall a very recommendable way to see Ayutthaya, and also Bangkok's Chao Phraya.

We're happy with your arrangement. A big thank you for our amazing tour team in Bangkok. We had a great time with good photo shot. We felt perfectly looked after from the first day till the last day. Great Experience: Grand Palace, Temples and Canal Tour. We spent a very enjoyable and interesting day touring around Bangkok with Tawee (he suggested we call him Tony). Interesting tour of the famous temples of Bangkok. Special thanks. I would like to give special thanks to the whole friendlygointer's team who made my family trip in Bangkok very memorable. Thank you very much for the excellent services. Knowledgeable team.. I have enjoyed the trip to Ayutthaya on my private day trip. It was my first experience with Friendlygointer.com and they did good job with excellent services. Excellent Trip. The company responsed our queres very quick and clear. We booked for a one and half day tour with them, half day for temple & palace and one day for Safari world. We just told her what we wanted and flight detail then she came back with perfect tour planning. thump up! Kai was our guide to city tour and floating market. She speaks very good english as she's been a guide 20 years. She always told us everything regarding her country with her fluent english so that made us understood her culture and her hometown very much. We learnt a lot in two days. I highly recommend anyone who wants a smooth trip arrangement.

Grand palace. The grand palace trip with friendlygointer was excellent. It started with the tour guide who's puncutal and polite. I was little late from traveling bangkok by night but the kung my guide was so patient waited for me and my wife. The vehicle is comfortable and once we got the palace our guide explain me everything we should know. This is a simple vacation that we do need but unforgetable.

Half day trip. Can not fault how professional and on the ball AM was when booking the trip. Our tour guide was very knowledgable and extremely passionate about his country and the history. Please be advised though on a negative when you believe the tour is over they will try and take you to a jewellery factory it's a real scam and I knw from previous experience also if you are doing a narrow boat be advised boarding and disembarking is very hairy and difficult and the water is rough, not a trip for the infirm.
Day Trip. Went with Friendly Go Inter - Good organisation and punctual day private trip for elephant ride and Damnoen Saduak floating market. Enjoyed the trip very much.

Deep Understanding Thai Culture and Tradition. Thanks to excellent language support, I could reach much about Thai culture and tradition. His guide and explanation at each site, often times, turned into a discussion about religion or history of Thailand that gave me common bases to my country or slight differences from us. That was a fun.Times were well organized and spots and sites also well selected.More times, I could have talked with laai khon Thai of town with interpretation of my guide.I will try it for the next time for another findings in Thailand.

Couldn't have picked a better guide!. From response times, friendliness, professionalism and even a great price, you cannot go past booking with this company as they are absolutely fantastic.In a place where it's hard to find a decent english speaker i was impressed with not only the translation but also the in depth knowledge about the history of thai places, i could see i was given more details then all other tour guides showing other people around, i even learnt a few things to show off.Price is excellent for what you get and i will definitely use this service in the future when planning my next getaway in Thailand, thanks for a great time and i look forward to seeing you guys soon!

Great and reliable. I loved this agency and their tour guide Tawee. I worked with them for 6 days and they always delivered the best service without the slightest problem. Tawee created a great program for my group which skillfully combined sightseeing, recreation and entertainment. You can rely on this agency 100 %. I do and I will continue to trust them.Leonid Ryji

Friendly, Knowledgeable and Trustworthy!. My experience with Friendlygointer started with Ms. Ampasri. She was always prompt with responding to my numerous emails. She suggested the best tour considering my limited time. Tawee was my private guide for the 2 days of tours in Bangkok. He was always on time, very knowledgeable and a real gentleman. My tours were supposed to end around 5pm but Tawee went beyond the call of duty. He was very accommodating and made a lot of helpful suggestions. I definitely saw a lot more that what was planned. I was alone in Bangkok and Tawee gave me his number and told me to call if I needed anything which gave me a level of assurance as if I had a family member available to call on. I would most definitely refer anyone to Friendlygointer.com! Thank you so much for your service Tawee! I thoroughly enjoyed my stay in Bangkok!

Much more to Bangkok than LED lights!. Me and my partner did the afternoon cycle tour with On (not sure if the spelling is correct) and she was a fantastic tour guide! So knowledgeable and super, super friendly. I felt like I learnt more with her in one afternoon than I had done being in Bangkok for the first 5 days. We got to see different sights to Bangkok, so much more to see and explore that goes beyond all the LED lights and signs for bars, massage, souvenirs and of course 7/11s! I thoroughly enjoyed it and found it absolutely barmy cycling on the crazy roads of Bangkok traffic but also quite enjoyable and exciting. I always felt safe and comfortable with On, absolutely fantastic tour guide with impeccable English and full of interesting information. Highly recommend going with ABC for a cycling tour around Bangkok! Thank you once again to On and thank you for the photos, they are much appreciated.

Great way to explore Bangkok. I did a half day trip in the afternoon, from 13:00 - 17:00. Unfortunately it was raining, but my guide Edi (not sure how he spells it) and I still went out. Being from the UK, I'm used to the rain. So we headed out in our ponchos onto the streets of Bangkok. I found it really interesting hearing about the different cultures and exploring the different neighbourhoods.I caught my first ever long boat across the Chao Praya river. I don't know how they managed to get the bikes and passengers on the boat without it tipping. We travelled across to the green heart of bangkok, cycled the paths through the coconut and banana trees. It was a totally different world to the hustle and bustle of Bangkok.Thankfully by the time we got across the river the rain stopped. Even with the rain this was a brilliant day out and I would highly recommend the tour to people travelling to Bangkok. I'll be back in November and hopefully the weather will be a little kinder, but I would definitely do it again.

5 HOUR CITY AND GREEN TOUR. Excellent tour today; met up with individuals from the US, Norway, Switzerland and Holland. Plenty of bikes and sizes to choose from, excellent tour guides. One at the front and one at the rear to keep us all together. Markets, back streets, places I wouldn't have gone to normally.Not strenuous but you need to be careful across the narrow elevated pathways when on the green side (Long tail ferry taken to cross the river to the green side)Plenty of food and water provided, stops, toilets etc... Highly recommended.

Super afternoon Biking in Bangkok! Dont wait but book this tour!!. I had a great afternoon tour with the owner Michiel Hoes, a Dutch guy who lives over 30 years in Bangkok. You cant imagine seeing yourself on a bike in Bangkok ? Just do it and enjoy. Look also at the foto's. It is absolutely safe (if you can ride a bike).We went also into the so called 'green lung' A district where you find (palm) trees and where the quitness is super after the busy , dirty roads.When you book this tour you will enter places beyond imagine (meaning that as a tourist you will never do or find this, so expect the local experience) Did you think the Thai people are laughing all the time ? It's more than all the time, so friendly !And what about coffee? Well that's another story: the coffeemachine was bought 32 years ago and still is working perfectly! So Starbucks or other coffeecompanies: Eat your heart out, this is not to be matched.As you see, my review is very positive so I will give my only negative comment of this tour: We had to stop at the end of the day!Enjoy it guys!! (and girls :-)

Great bike tour with great guide. My fiancee and I did the weekend and local floating market tour, led by Marcel. He was an excellent guide--I can't recommend him highly enough! For food-obsessed travelers who love to bike, this was pretty much a perfect itinerary. Early on, we took a series of small alleyways to the Khlong Toei Market, where we picked up some fruits that we snacked on later. Marcel did a good job of keeping us together and protected during the portions when we had to go through the crazy Bangkok traffic on busier streets. And when we went across the Chao Phraya River, it was beautiful biking through the jungle on the wood paths. Marcel bought a huge range of little snacks for us to try at the floating market, and then we biked more through the plantations, stopping for lunch at a little restaurant, and then headed back across the river. Throughout the tour, Marcel was both charming and knowledgeable. And the bikes were good quality and well-maintained.

A thoroughly enjoyable tour of the countryside.... in the middle of Bangkok...!. Did a day tour with Marcel, and enjoyed it immensely. The trip took us through an interesting mix of markets, alleyways and (busy) main roads to a quay side boat, which ferried us (and our bikes) across the river. There we had a good view of the city for a while, turned a corner and then spent part of the day cycling through the countryside, crossing bits of jungle and various villages. Sometime in the afternoon, we turned another corner on a jungle-path and were amazed to see the Bangkok skyline across the river.... Throughout the tour, Marcel kept us well informed about our surroundings, paying close attention to our safety (and wellbeing) at all times. Thoroughly enjoyed this tour and would strongly recommend it.

Fantastic bike tour. A must do whilst in Bangkok. This was fantastic. We had a great day. Michael was very nice and showed us sights you just wouldn't see. The slum areas and the jungle across the water etc. Brilliant afternoon, thank you!

Just do it.. Everything I hoped for. Rode on busy Bangkok streets, through narrow busy and quiet lanes, through alleyways not much wider than the bike, felt the hustle and bustle, and friendliness of many locals, ferried in a longboat to an another world on the other side and rode through a maze of concrete boardwalks and roads in a jungle like area, all so close to the city. Adi (sorry if I spelt that wrong) was our guide for the half day tour and was a really friendly, informative and likeable guy. Well done Adi.

Highlight of our trip to Thailand. It's hard to believe that it has been nearly 10 years since my daughter and I did a private bike tour with Michael (the required date selection does not go back far enough!). We have never stopped talking about it. We saw the old Bangkok that still exists under the new Bangkok that grew up around it. Michael introduced us to mangosteens at the market and other delectables from a food cart. We saw babies being bathed in washtubs, Thai boxing, a Walmart glove "factory" with 5 employees (!), and many laughing, playing children among many other things. My son is in Bangkok now and I told him not to leave without doing a bike tour with Michael's company!

Weekend 5 hour tour of Bangkok and Bang Mot. Tom was an awesome guide. He was fun to talk to and was able to tell us what it is like to live in Thailand. We went through Bangkok's largest market, traveled through the city among traffic, went in to the jungle across the river, and ate great Thai food from a local market. It was a great experience and I would recommend anyone who is in Thailand on a weekend to make time for this adventure.

Great experience also for kids. ABC organized a personal tapas tour for us because we brought two kids; 6 and 9 years old. They loved it! We saw during this tour the real Bangkok and tasted the real thai streetfood. I definitely recommend this trip; it is a real adventure with the whole family but it was well orginized by ABC. Special thanks to the guide Marcel; he shared good information and the kids felt very save with he during the chaotic Bangkok traffic

Amazing experience . This is an amazing day event I would recommend to every one. Such beautiful scenery and so much fun to bicycle in Bangkok surrounded by crazy traffic and big cars.. I felt safe all the way,.. The owner was our tour guide and he was the best guide ever, taking things slow to let everything sink in, and taking time to explain the culture to us.. I loved this tri, might have been the highlight of our holiday..

Best experience in Bangkok. This was the best thing we (family of 4) did in Bangkok. Really discover areas you would never visit when you're on your own, including China town (the back streets) and the Bangkok Jungle. Very enthusiastic and friendly guide!

Amazing Bangkok cycle tour !!!. We often visit Bangkok, but have never before done a cycling tour. This time we deciced to do one and fortunately landed up with ABC Amazing Bangkok Cyclist. We had such a friendly and welcoming reception and felt right at home from the start. At first we were a bit unsure about cycling in Bangkok, but our guide, Michiel Hoes, was excellent and guided us safely through the city traffic.This tour is just awesome. We learnt so much about Bangkok, its people, traditions, culture and history and saw places that you will never see when travelling on your own. We even had a crash course of the most important Thai words to know, which made the rest of our trip even more pleasant.If you do one trip while visiting Bangkok, do this one. This company is great, with good bicycles in tip top condition and guides who are serious about your experience and safety.Ones whole life is made up of memories, thanks for the memories you helped us make Michiel.

Private Cycle Tour in Bangkok by Michiel Hoes. For the 2th time Michiel Hoes was able to suprise us (family with 2 daughters of 11 and 8 years old) with an unique private tour in Bangkok, in which we again gathered a lot of new experiences of Bangkok (and visited some evergreens like the jungle). Michiel is able to create a tailormade tour where he is able to tell a lot on Bangkok, Thai soceity, - culture and - traditions. As such Michiel is an unique linking pin between Bangkok, its people and the western tourists. I was impressed as well by the safe, pro-active way in which he guided us (mainly our 8 year old daughter) through the traffic.

Awesome !. My son (12 year-old) and me joined the morning biking tour (8 am to 12 noon) guided by Michiel Hoes yesterday. This was a real amazing biking experience we ever have before. We cycled from the busy Sukhumvit town to the local villages and to the Greenfield backyard of Bangkok City. This biking tour needs to cross a river by a motor boat. A lot of fun and a lot of things to realize when you pass by their homes (like what type of Siam village people used to live, eat and use).
Great experience. Of you want to see Bangkok in a way you Will never see on you own. Please book a trip with this company. Good bycicles and great tourguides. Is is a must do item in Bangkok.

Marcel is the best tour guide. The full day trip to the jungle and floating market on the other side of the river is an excellent way to spend a Saturday or Sunday in Bangkok. ABC is a reliable, trustworthy company with good bikes in excellent condition. Marcel is a super tour guide: he is enthusiastic, friendly, conversational and fun to ride with. I enjoyed myself thoroughly. You will see a very different side of Bangkok if you take this trip. You'll see how real people live in villages and also in the city. Marcel will take you down hidden alleys and courtyards, narrow streets that you could never find, and into the places that most tourists never see. If you've had enough of tourist attractions and shopping malls, and you want to get some exercise while you encounter the real Bangkok, then there really is no better way to spend a day than ABC. I was really impressed.

Marcel is the best guide i Bangkok. Amazing Way to experience Bangkok. Marcel was the best, a loyal and wise guide. We felt completely comfortable all the way through Bangkok's narrow streets. Thank you for an awesome day and the best coffee in Bangkok.

amazing experience!. I did the 'weekend & local floating market' tour. It was a very amazing experience, because maybe without the guide, I would never reach to such a wonderful local market outside Bangkok. And the guide, she'll always take care of you and your bike perfectly so never worry about anything, just enjoy.

Fun and informative trip. Had a great time with Marcel where he managed to find a really good balance between providing insights into the local areas, foods and so onGot to so see so many parts of Bangkok which we never would have found on our own

Fantastic tour of Bangkok and Bangkachao. A lovely experience with a great guide, Tom, and a fun tour of Bangachao, little Chinatown, and other Bangkok sites. I'd highly recommend this tour and this company. Thank you!

Great way to see Bangkok!. This tour highlighted parts of Bangkok we would have never seen in our couple of days there. Tom was an amazing and fun guide and introduced us to the sights and tastes of Bangkok and Thailand. A great intro to the city! Thanks yall!
Must do!. Great way of seeing Bangkok in a different way. Cycling is doable for all levels and guides are knowledgeable and friendly.

A Really Good time. Took the weekend local market and Bangkok tour, was an amazing experience. On is a wonderful guide funny, sharp, and thoughtful. The shop is conveniently located off Sukhumvit road. The tour itself takes you through the streets of the real Bangkok away from the flock of tourists. A short boat trip to outside of Bangkok through the jungles with a nice lunch in local restaurant. Overall a good and healthy way to see Bangkok. 5 out 5. Definitely recommended,

31/05/16. My favourite day in Bangkok so far. Great day out. Got to see a different side to Bangkok. Fun, friendly tour guide, delicious food and beautiful sites. I'd definitely recommend doing the day trip

Excellent Bangkok experience. A great trip for seeing Bangkok from a different perspective. Our guide, Tom, speaks 5 or 6 languages fluently, and was knowledgeable about what we were seeing and where we were going. A lot of fun overall. The bikes are nice Trek city bikes and well-maintained, so we had a comfortable ride too. The trip is quite expensive for a bike tour, but I'd say that given the options in Bangkok, you get what you pay for.

Best way to see the city . Best way to see the city and the parts that you normally don't see. Owners is full of jokes and a really nice guy. Our guide was very friendly and spoke and communicated alot. Excellent trip would definitely recommend

A day well spent . First of all, our guide On was truly amazing. So full of humour and life, eager to tell us about Bangkok and it's people. The bike trip was entertaining, and you really got to see the hidden side of Bangkok. Throughout the trip I felt safe - even when riding the narrow concrete bridges in the jungle. And when Jeppe fell in, On was quick with the first aid needed. If I make my way around to Bangkok again, I will definitely contact ABC again. On, if you are reading this: Hope the night toilet story amused your friends.

Great Experience to See Bangkok in a New Light. ABC Cycle was a great experience to be able to see Bangkok in a new way. On, our tour guide, was great at explaining local Thai culture and the way things are done in Bangkok. It was a great learning experience! Thank you On!

Wonderful 5 hours!. Had a wonderful day cycling around BKK and BKK Chao. saw the city from different perspectives like I could almost feel like a local and experienced a rich culture. When on lots of twisted and narrow roads, it was like I was out for an adventure in a jungle. I thought my day would pass ordinarily but this was the most special bike trip I have ever had. Though this is Songrek festival season in Thailand, it didn't affect this trip! In fact, it created a joyful environment to ride around since the traffics were also not heavy. City bike is really comfortable, too. Thanks, ABC and Aong, for this wonderful experience.

Great day out. Me and my boyfriend went on this bicycle tour round Bangkok. Location was easy to find, we got there super early and left out big backpacks there while we went and grabbed lunch. The guys running the place were so friendly and funny. Definitely worth doing as you get to see a whole different side of Bangkok. The cycle routes was good and we stopped for some snacks and a drink which was really nice. Great people, good fun. I defo recommend!! Thanks Marcel!!

Great day Out. A welcome break from the crowded streets, landmarks and markets of Bangkok. Saw places we wouldn't have seen on any other tour. Also out tour guide, Michiel, was very knowledgeable and fun.

Whole heartedly recommend!. Our tour was fantastic, I'm not a confident bike rider but was absolutly fine, even on the narrow roads through the plantation I didn't feel like I was going to fall in the water! Our guides were really brilliant, so friendly and spoke perfect English, they knew every answer to our questions and even taught us some useful Thai! We were 40 minutes early and they made us coffee (the best we've had so far in Asia) and sat and chatted with us. You see a really interesting side to Bangkok down the narrow windy streets that I wouldn't have otherwise seen and the plantations are so peaceful and refreshing compared to the city! It's hot work on the bike but actually much cooler than walking around because of the breeze you get! Whole heartedly recommend! The bikes are really comfy too!

Always Great. I have ridden with ABC about 20 times. I take any friends visiting Bangkok on this tour as you get to see parts Bangkok you wouldn't otherwise see. The bike riding is not strenuous (dutch bikes on flat roads and pathways).

Awesome way to see a different side of Bangkok. . I went on the full day tour with tour guide, Marcel. Fortunately for me, the other group members did not attend so I had a private tour. My guide was very knowledgable and I felt I learnt a lot about Bangkok. It was a really neat bike ride as you get to see 'real life Bangkok' and not just touristy stuff. The river boat crossing was really cool.. (At first I was pretty nervous! But it was cool!) and people every where along the trip were so friendly. We stopped at a local place for lunch, which was really nice.I really do recommend this trip to people travelling to Bangkok as you get to see a whole new side to the city. Thanks ABC. It was a great day. Krysti

Great tour of Bangkok . We did the half day tour of Bangkok from 1pm till 5pm. Awesome people and great service very friendly. They take you where you don't see many tourists! It wasn't too hot and you stop a few times for water, toilet and snacks. You also go to the other side of the river by boat.
Great way to experience Bangkok!. Interesting way to see daily life in Bangkok, and learn about the many people we met on our way. Tom is a great - especially with children.

A must do in Bangkok!. What e great way to experience Bangkok - on a bike and with a local guide telling you a ton of stuff on the way. Cycling through "the Green Lung og Bangkok" was amazing.I´m thrilled I decided to go on this trip. Will do it again next time I´m in Bangkok.

Great way to see the other side of Bangkok. The tour takes you to places you don't normally see in Bangkok, and our tour guide Tom was extremely knowledgeable and funny. Highly recommend for anyone and if you can try and get Tom as your tour guide.

Great way to get off the beaten track in Bangkok. I went on the weekend floating market tour and found it a great way to see more of the real Bangkok which is hidden away amongst the sky scrapers and shopping malls down the back streets and alleyways. Fascinating to watch the locals go about their daily life, especially in the local markets. The best part of the trip was crossing over the river to cycle around in the "green lung" and trying out all the thai snacks at the weekend market where we were the only tourists. Our guide bought lots of the different snacks for us to try and ate so much that didn't really need the lunch that was provided at a local restaurant on the way back!I would definitely recommend the trip to others although you do have to be a confident cyclist as you are sometimes cycling along and crossing over 6 lanes of traffic on the way to and from the river and the concrete paths in the green lung are narrow and raised off the ground with some tight corners!My only slight criticism was that I arrived in plenty of time for the tour and then we had to wait around for others that were late so instead of starting at 10am it was 10.40 before we actually left. Also a basket on the front of the bike would have been handy.

Cycling Bangkok- great way to spend the day!. I did the ABC weekend and floating market bike tour and it was awesome!!! First off, our tour guides were fantastic. Knowledgable and funny. They made the day really enjoyable. Secondly, it was a relaxed and easy pace. With a number of stops to drink water or have a snack. Water, lunch and Thai snacks were included. Biking through the back streets of Bangkok was great. As well taking a small boat to the "green lung" of Bangkok. It was peaceful and beautiful. The floating market was so amazing..I felt like it was an authentic thai experience. Not alot of tourists at the floating market. I wuld highly recommend ABC biking for a great way to spend a ay in Bangkok.

wonderful experience to see the different faces of Bangkok !. We really enjoyed this biking tour with Tom ! We saw very different areas of Bangkok, from the busy streets, to the quiet jungle, from the small houses near the klongs with all smiley and happy people, to crossing the river with our bikes on the boat ... A great experience with a very nice small international group, very comfortable bikes and Tom, our guide ! Sense of humour, information, attention to all the members of the group ... Just Great ! A very nice and amazing way to discover Bangkok - different sides of it - differently !

The tour is great but the guide takes the cake . The bike tour is something anyone can join at any cyclist level. It includes a part of Bangkok that you would not see otherwise. You get to see the slums of Thailand and not to mention Bangkachao (cycling in the jungle) and much more. I would also like to mention Tom, our tour guide that really made the tour interesting and funny. I highly recommend this tour and make sure Tom is your guide.

A different face of Bangkok . We went for the half day tour with partly cycling in the jungle. All in all it was a great experience! The guide (called T-Do?) was thai and explained us anything about thai culture and todays living we wanted to know. He spoke fluently english, plus he was very entertaining with a great sense of humor but this might also be a personal thing ;)The tour itself took us through some more non touristic parts of the city and then into the jungle. Cycling on the busy roads was an adventure itself but we were safely guided. The jungle itself was not a movie like scenary if you and visit the rest of Thailand but it was a nice change to the busy and noisy city.

Amazing trip!. We questioned whether or not to do this trip for a while, but we are so glad we did! Our tour guide Marcel was awesome, he took us to loads of cool places and gave us an insight into the Thai culture as we went along! I would definitely recommend this trip to everyone!

Bangkok in a different way. For the save traveler of Bangkok, this is a valuable addition to see the "other" side of this great city! I live here for a few years, but WOW, what an experience. With the guided skills of Michiel and his crew, we had an absolute blast enjoying areas which you normally would go to or even think of seeing when touring any city for that fact. Great experience, thank you Michiel!! Thumbs up!!

Highlight of Bangkok . Amazing trip!! I was a bit unsure whether to do the tour as I'm not 100% confident on a bike but it had been recommended, and I'm so so pleased I did. It was just me and another couple with Michael, our guide, and we cycled round the many busy lanes of Bangkok then through to the poorer areas of the city which really opened our eyes to how the Thai people are really living. It was so humbling and informative. Everyone was extremely patient with my cycling skills which put me at ease! Michael was great providing so much information on the city and its people. Highly, highly recommend. You'll see the real Bangkok, not just the parts on show for tourists, and you'll appreciate the city 1000 times more!

Great way to see Bangkok. We had an excellent guide, On, who took us out of the city, across the river and into the jungle. Riding was at a good pace and lots of stops along the way. Saw a very different side to Bangkok and even managed to cycle through traffic safely on the way back. Highly recommended.

top!. just the four of us and a guide: what a great way to see a different Bangkok! through narrow streets, cross the river with your bike on a boat, see the green part of Bangkok.Marcel our guide told us all we would know about Thai and Bangkok. The bikes were excellent.note: it is not possible to take luggage with you on the bike. so be prepared when you like to take your camera with you.

Great tour and the best way to discover Bangkok!. The best way to discover a city is per bike. And especially with this biking tour company. Good bikes, responsible and super friendly guides, great tour. Our kids (8 & 12) loved it. Again, since we did it last year as well with the same company.

Best Thing I Did in Bangkok. It's a 4 hour biking tour through the backstreets with an amazing guide who is funny and speaks excellent English. There are two short breaks during the tour, cold water and chips are offered. You get to see parts of Bangkok you would have never seen on your own. Your guide shatters some illusions people have about the way people live in the slums. So insightful. I'm not a super sporty person and was not looking forward to this and it ended up being the best part of trip. Warning: you're biking in a group and if you're a bad bike rider, you're going to hold up the group. You certainly don't have to be better than average but don't be a bad biker and choose this adventure...

Fun day seeing areas of Bangkok you would not see otherwise!. We really enjoyed this bike tour. As an active family of 4, it was a good way to combine exercise (not strenuous!) with seeing the city. I will say that I am glad we have a lot of biking experience (especially for our girls, ages 12 and 9), as parts took us right though and across the main busy roads of Bangkok!). Our tour guide was very good, and very safe. The tour took us through the city, and then across the river (by boat), to the bike trails and a totally different bike ride- it was nice to get both city biking and "country" biking. The trails in the country biking were a little harrowing, as they were on raised, narrow paths, so you really had to pay attention! Overall, this was a great tour, and very fun!

Morning tour. Was very nice to bike with our tour guides Michiel and Ed. Michiel provides some information on the history of some of the neighbourhoods in the back alleys and Ed adds some more color to it if you ask him. The best part is when you cross the river and you reach Samut Prakan. You leave the traffic behind and biking there is very nice. The bikes are in ok shape, not much selection for smaller children <12 years old. The traffic is heavy in the Bangkok side, dangerous for smaller kids and unexperienced cyclists. We asked for helmets; a small investment and should be a must for any operator of a bicycle tour company, but the request was dismissed on the grounds that there are no good helmets available, esp. for kids... Any decent bike shop in BKK has them in stock! Overall a nice trip and we all enjoyed it.

Definitely worth doing! . This tour was booked for us through an agent back in the UK and we were glad we did it! You get to see lots of sights and also have a nice trip through the jungle with a complimentary pit stop en route. Amazing young guide (Tom and Eddie I believe-not 100%) both full of knowledge and kept interacting with the group throughout. First tour I have ever been on ever which provides helmets which obviously is a necessity! Thanks for the tour guys!

Fun, exciting for all ages. Personally I don't like visiting too many temples and palaces, but prefer to see the real life of a city. Plus I'm Dutch so I like to bike. Bangkok is such a huge overwhelming city, it's impossible to really get to know it in just a couple of days, but this bike tour is definitely a huge help. You get to see markets, nature, and wealthier, middle-class and poor neighborhoods. The guide knows the answer to every question you might have and keeps you safe in the crazy traffic (which really isn't that crazy if you follow your guide's instructions. The scarier part for me was biking on the narrow paths across the river. You don't want to fall off those paths! Make sure to put on plenty of sunscreen. I don't think it really matters whether you go on the morning or afternoon tour. They're both hot. That's Bangkok. But it really isn't that bad. You stop for drinks and snacks along the way. Overall, it was a great tour that kept the whole group (including our 3 and 5 year-old kids) entertained and happy. Time and money well spent!

Best way to see the "real" Bangkok behind the scenes. Thanks to Sea at ABC to make this tour an outstanding experience which was completely different from what the "normal" tourist get to see...Take it easy and enjoy a wonderful bike ride through the green parts of Bangkok, experience narrow little alleys and quite trails as well as heavy traffic and the fact that you always feel save as your guide is taking care....i would do this again, for sure.Thanks again for a great afternoon.

Excellent introduction to Bangkok life. See Bangkok from perspective only bike can access - along narrow paths between houses, over rickety wooden bridge, on boat and along raised concrete paths of the green lung. Learn cultural nuances from experienced guide, meet people from around world and have a laugh!

Great way to see Bangkok. Went with the ABC-tour and an amazing time. You experience Bangkok from another view than other tourists, when you do it by bike. The tour was guidet by a dutch guy (can't remember his name), and it was clear that he had done his homework.

Amazing. Absolutely worth it to do the bicycling tour! We went to many different places in Bangkok that you normally don't see. Our tour guide Tom was very enthusiastic and explained a lot. We had a lot of fun and we would defenitely recommend this trip!

Weekend Floating Market Tour with On. Took the weekend floating market tour with On as our guide. What an incredible guide!! She took us all through the markets and back streets of BKK. Then we took the long boat across the river and sampled some local foods at the market!! Awesome time. I would highly recommend this trip!! Must do!!

Fantastic off the beaten track city ride. I have visited Bangkok on more than one occasion and felt I had seen many of the major tourist attractions, undertaken Thai cooking classes (very good by the way), and walked many miles exploring. I just wanted to experience something more about Bangkok, hence booking the cycle tour, with promises of not passing one major tourist attraction. Three of us choose the ABC Day tour (10:00 to 15:00) along with 9 other tourists. We had a great initial brief with owner and our tour leader Michiel Hoes, he broke the ice with us all to understand what we could expect from the day and teamed us up with our bicycles; loads of choices and well maintained. We started off around the back streets close to the office to find our feet and then on out into the more back street areas and tiny workshops; watching shoes being made. We also cycled under motorways through tiny narrow alleyways leading past a multitude of small shack-like homes and some amazing local (what we may incorrectly call slum-like) backyards experiencing local Thai smiles and waves everywhere. We cycled through a fresh market, the colours sights and smells were incredible then across the river with our bikes and cycled out around the lush green plantations on concrete raised "footpaths", stopping for a local delicious lunch cooked for us and then wending our way back again. Cycling single file we were encouraged to just stop and take photographs whenever we wanted - a guide is provided at the front and back of the tour, so that no-one gets lost or left behind, it was well thought through, from many years of experience. The day we cycled was very hot for me (35 degrees C) and humid, whilst most of the ride was in shade I would personally reccommend a light hat that gave you some sort of shade protection (not one that makes your head heat up underneath). Water was provided to us on the ride and a welcome cold drink and frozen hand towel on arriving back. On the couple of times we cycled briefly on city roads I was surprised how safe it felt, as a driver from another country I always felt the roads here looked a chaotic place but actually when you're on it you realise the drivers are not pushy and inconsiderate - there's just lots of them, it was big lesson learnt for me. You are not allowed to carry any bags or backpacks with you on the tour itself (they are all locked in the office) - I guess to not have any incidents with dropping them off or you loosing your balance when cycling the platforms through the plantation, so I would reccommend a very small light nylon bum bag or neck hanging nylon 'container' for your phone, camera or small sunscreen tube. You don't need any baht on the tour itself as everything is included unless you need to stop and buy some more water. The tour was 100% flat and easy cycling for any level. The three of us really enjoyed experiencing "real back street living in Bangkok", it was one of our parties 4th cycle tour here and the paths are slightly different every time. Loved it and would really like to try another one.

Morning trip with Tom (..without Jerry). Totally worth it! You will see Bangkok from a different point of view. Go for it! My group did about 16km and it felt like 5km, time flies with Tom - the guide. He's amazing. Job well done
Adventure in Bangkok . Great way to explor Bangkok and have a day of fun. Best weekend market tour with Tom :-) our guide. Definitely of the beaten track trip.

Amazing . This is the second time we make this bicycle tour and it was amazing !This Time we organized a private tour with 22 friends and for all of us this day was engraved on our memory.We saw BKK from another angle, through the little "soi" , we took the boat, and we crossed the river for the jungle.We had a nice lunch, very simple but just perfect.I recommend this tour to everyone!!!

Excellent tour!. We should've done this tour the day after we arrived! Thoroughly enjoyed it, conducted by Tom who did an excellent job! Really good sense of humour and great knowledge of the area. I learned so much in the 4-5 hours which the tour lasts for; not just the basics and essentials (this is our first time in Thailand) but also a great deal about the culture and some background history about Bangkok. I would highly recommend ABC; if you want to be treated well and meet new people, learn new things, have fun and do something a bit daring, then I'd definitely do this again (perhaps a different route though as to not see the same thing twice). Tom is a great guy, speaks fluent English (if that was ever a concern), basically it was a pleasure to be part of the tour!

Best way to see the real Bangkok. We went on the ABC tour after it was recommended to us by a friend. If you want to get off the beaten path and see the real Bangkok. Feeling completely safe while riding a push bike on the busy city roads, through the skinny paths of the klong toey slum, crossing the river on a longtail boat, and navigating along concrete bridges zig zagging through the jungle greenery. We did the morning tour with Marcel and it was cool and comfortable. 5/5 would highly recommend and do again next time

Fourth time, still amazing!. Joined the cycling tour for the fourth time, and it was just as amazing as the first time! Staff is highly experience and therefore there isn't a single route the same! The amazing scenery you get to see is really worth every penny and would recommend this tour to anyone who has a afternoon or more in Bangkok!!

A must do to in Bangkok. The tour was the thing that i enjoyed more of my tour in Bangkok because i had the opportunity to see the non touristic part of Bangkok thanks to the really expert guide a dutch guy passionate about Thailand with a deep knowledge of the city and the culture.I will recommend this tour to everyone is going to Bangkok!!!

A thrilling ride through Bangkok. My husband and I enjoyed this thrilling ride through Bangkok. We saw parts of the city we would never have seen otherwise. During the first part of the ride we meandered through back streets - sometimes very narrow back streets - where we saw all different types of homes, businesses etc. When we reached the river we, and our bikes, were loaded onto a boat to be taken across to a very "rural" and green section of the city. On this side we cycled along "country" roads and over a series of narrow raised pathways. These paths were a bit unnerving for me but added to the adventure. There were no hills - all flat pedaling so the ride was easy from that standpoint. Michael our guide was very friendly and enthusiastic. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone who wants to see another side of Bangkok.

What a way to see Bangkok!. My friends and I thoroughly enjoyed this amazing bike tour of Bangkok. You ride through parts of the city you wouldn't normally travel to experiencing the day to day lives of many who live in this busy and vibrant city. The entire tour was brilliant and interacting with the locals as well as riding through the green lung were definite highlights. A big thanks to our guide Marcel for a perfect tour!

Must do for travellers to Bangkok. We did the day tour lasting around 5 hours, a brilliant experience - perfect for first time (or even frequent) travellers to Bangkok. Despite the fact that we arrived in the middle of a thunderstorm and heavy rain, we set out with our great guide Michael and embraced the weather. Unfortunately the others who were booked in for the day had decided against showing up due to the rain, but this didn't affect our experience in the slightest! Definitely learnt a lot more than expected and saw a side of Bangkok that we didn't really know existed. Cycled for a few hours but wasn't any more than moderately challenging. I would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Bangkok, whether it's their first or tenth time.

Really enjoyable experience!. The bike tour was a wonderful way to explore Bangkok. I really loved visiting the local markets and going across the river to the Green Lung. But best of all was the food! We had a great time sampling several different delicacies.

Amazing biketour. Just had a lovely afternoon with a wonderfull bike tour i Bangkok! Great experience for both my 2 girls's age 9 and 11, my wife and me. Many thanks to our guide Tom for a safe and memorable trip :-) Michael from Denmark.

Great way to see the city !! . Had a great afternoon tour just the two of us as the other pair didn't make it! Slightly crazy bankok traffic but felt totally safe with our guide Michael !! He was also very knowledgeable and showed us places that you wouldn't necessarily go or explore on foot but it was really interesting. Nice to get out of the main hub into the more rural area too! Considering we didn't really know where to start with bankok its was an excellent way to explore and get a feel for the city! Would 100% recommend.

Great way to see Bangkok!. I had a really great time, driving on the bike in the big city but also in the jungle! Great way to see how de locals life and where the buy there food! We also had a really nice guide, Tom! Really funny and told us a lot about the places we had seen and speaks really good english! Also cool that he took pictures off us and the were online with in two hours!The average tourist will never see what we have seen today!I did the day trip and it was amazing! Nice way to end my vacation in Thailand!

Great morning seeing lots. . Morning is cooler and less chance of rain. Great tour and Tom the guide was perfect. He had great English and we spent the whole time chatting and cruising around Bangkok and then on a longtail boat to the far side of the river. Here we rode around the jungle looking at wildlife and taking in the sights. Really quiet and relaxing over the river. We were done by midday but I felt I had really seen somewhere new.

Different Look at Bangkok. We did the Bangkok city tour which is about 3-4 hours long. This is a leisurely ride that anyone can do. Michael and Tom were our guides and they showed us areas of Bangkok which the average tourist would never find. We rode through the back streets snaking through narrow alley ways where the locals live. It is a fascinating experience to see how other people of a different culture live. This is a memorable way to spend a few hours other than just shopping.

Half Day Morning Tour. We had a great morning riding around. We saw some great things (& not the tourist type sites), felt like we saw the real Bangkok. We had great company and our tour guide was knowledgable, friendly and helpful. They have a great set up and thought of the little things; the bikes were great also.

Great experience. We booked a day tour with them and it was great.
