Boys are 9 and 8 and were totaly able to keep up, since we took "grown up" bicycles with lowered seats, they only have up to 18 inch for children - ours are used to 24.The experience was really sth else, opposite to turist areas and famous temples. Rural, local in the " Lungs of Bangkok". It's a must if you have more than just a day.

great experience, we loved it. really nice and different way to explore bangkok and environment. Tom, our guide, was just great, our teenage children loved his playful way of guiding, and the info he gave was very good. nice pace, really nice he took us to the local market, and gave us litterally a taste of it! lunch was local and nice!

Biking in Bkk. Our Bangkok highlight was going on a bicycle Tour together with the lovely guide "On" from ABC. Just an amasing eksperience. Don't hesitate going, there is no better way to spend half of a Day in Bangkok.

A different view.... A great way to explore and discover Bangkok from another angle. A different way to undertake a city-tour. It gives a nice insight in daily life and takes you to places where you only would get by coincidence. Usually people would not necessarily pair BKK with bikes. I've been to Bangkok many times and have done several sightseeing tours. But this really tickled my fancy. Also our guide Tom was really great.

Magical day.. This was by far the best thing we did in Bangkok. The day was just fantastic. We were able to get a taste of the real Bangkok; meeting locals & seeing back streets & residential areas. We learned about Thai culture from our guide who went above & beyond to make our day enjoyable. She was just outstanding. We were able to cycle around the city & stopped off at several local areas. Getting the boat over the river & cycling through the jungle park was also fantastic. Can't recommend this trip enough!

Really amazing experience!. Went on the bike tour for the third time and it keeps me amazing how much more Bangkok has to offer besides temples and bars! This is really a must for anyone visiting (or living in) Bangkok!!

To go or not to go. Thank you for a wonderful day. I don't usually write reviews but I will today. We were very concerned about riding on the roads with a 12yo and. 9 yo, both girls. While some road crossings seemed a little scary this shouldn't stop you from enjoying a great day exploring a different side to Bangkok. I'm glad we chose to go as we would not have experienced and made the memories we now have. Our guide Aon was very informative and ensured we were safe. It poured with rain twice but this did not impact on a good day. I would do this again, in fact my 9yo said she no longer wanted to go to kidzania again she'd rather do the bike ride again instead. If you aren't a confident rider I would not recommend this but if you can ride like a 9yo, have a great day :)

Awesome bike ride 👌🏼. The guide Ja is a very funny, smiling and kind person who know much about the local vibes of Bangkok. We drove around Bangkoks center, visited a floating market and drove into the jungle. It was a very good trip.

Best bike ride 👌🏼. Ja is the name of the guide, she's the best most smiling and kindliest guide you can have And the tour was awesome. I can definitely recommend it, you get to see Bangkok and a food market and the jungle and try some exotic fruits yum yum

Amazing Cycling Tour. Best experience in Bangkok. Our tour guide, Ong (don't know if I spelled it correct) was fantastic. Told us a lot about Thailand and Thai people and she has a great sense of humor. No problem with the distance as the tour is flat, and we were told to pay attention at the narrow paths in the green area. Thank you for an exciting and fun tour.

Tour "Last Flight Captain Jack". Dear Tom Eddie and MemeThank you for just everything!!! We had so much fun and you guys made this day unforgettable with your kindness, sensibility and humor. The Mushroom Killer is still out there somewhere but I'm sure we will catch him sooner or later....All the best and hope to see you soon again for another adventure!Greetings from SwitzerlandSusannePS we think of you and SMILE ;-))

The other side of Bangkok. Great trip through the back streets and the rural areas but still so close to Bangkok City. Some riders struggled in the heat (Consider a night ride) and on the elevated pathway (reasonable level of cycle skills are required) but I found it a great afternoon exploring.

The other side of Bangkok. After having been in Bangkok so many years, I wont se the other side of Bangkok, if I have not booked this trip. The trip into the smallest "sois" in some areas where you normally would not go, bring you to greenery part of Bangkok and a shortly trip on boat cross the river.Overall nice, cozy and educational trip.

Amazing city tour with personal touch. When my husband and I arrived at the office of ABC Amazing bikes we were warmly greeted and made to feel welcome. We did the Bangkok and local floating market tour with just the two of us and our guide. It was amazing. Such an experience biking through the streets and sampling local food. A totally different experience of seeing a city and great to do it with a guide who knew the best places to go. Would totally recommend it!!!

Behind the Curtain. My wife and I had a great time on the ABC tour while we were in Bangkok. It was a great chance to see more of the city and get an idea of the real Bangkok. Our guide was On and she was awesome! We loved her sense of humor and she provided us with awesome information about the city and the Thai people. I really recommend the tour because its a great day out. You get some exercise, some good intel from the guides, you get to see a different part of Bangkok (aside from glitzy malls and street markets), you get a great lunch cooked at a local restaurant. Overall it was a great experience! Thank you!

Hard work but worth it. I was dreading the cycling because I'm not very good with busy roads, high traffic areas, however I was pleasantly surprised to find that we would also be going through quiet places and the jungle! Our guide tom was just so welcoming and just all in all a pleasure to be with, aside from his friendliness he also managed to manoeuvre us very safely through the streets with a smile on his face at all times! The jungle was also an anxiety for me as I found that it's was a thin concrete elevated path that we were cycling on, yet when I got there it wasn't as scary or difficult as it seems! I now feel I understand the amazing contrast of the city Bangkok, from skyscrapers to the shabby city under the bridge , city to jungle in minutes! An amazing trip I would recommend to anyone!

Great way to see the city and great guide. I had a wonderfull time. My guide was Tom. Very smart and funny kid with impressive language skills.This tour is the best way to see more of what Bangkok is other then big shopping malls, temples and busy streets. A must do even if you only have a day in town!

The best way to see the real Bangkok. Thank you Tom! We were lucky enough to have just the 4 of us for the morning tour on April 1st. The tour took us through areas of Bangkok that a tourist would not usually get to see. In 3 hours we visited Little China, Venice, 'the Hood', the jungle and had a couple of long tail trips across the Chaopraya. We would thoroughly recommend this tour to anyone considering it. Tom as a tour guide was great fun and kept the compliments coming to keep the oldies going. Great fun and great host.

Fabulous bike tour!. Yesterday, my husband, 13 year old daughter and our two friends went on the day tour with Tom from ABC cycle company. We had such a great day - Tom guided us through the city and then weaved us through markets, narrow alleyways, communities living under bridges, over the river and into the beautiful jungle landscape on the other side. The ride can be challenging if you are afraid of busy traffic but having said that it is also very manageable and Tom took really good care of us. He is a very funny guy and we loved his company almost as much as the bike ride. There were lots of nice extra touches in the day and it is truly a fun way of seeing Bangkok. Everyone had a lovely smile or a cheery wave for us - we really loved the day and Tom gave us lots of interesting insights into the Thai way of life. Definitely pick this tour - you wont regret it! Emma

A different way to see the city. A great day cycling the crazy streets of Bangkok! This tour takes you through all areas of the city from the newer sky scrappers and out into the country. A few stops along the way for refreshments and looking round different towns, a couple of heart racing moments cycling back into the city at rush hour traffic so maybe a morning tour would be better!
Very good. Very nice bike tour. Exelent . Liked it very much. If you would like to see the real Bangkok go with ABCAdy

Fantastic, and unique !! . This tour is absolutely brilliant for seeing parts of Bangkok you may not necessarily see by yourself. The tour myself and my partner done was away from any temples or museums, and instead we got to see 2 very different sides of Bangkok. 1st we cycled down the back streets, and it was very interesting to see how the local people actually live. Along the way our tour guide brought us some very miniature bananas from a locals market stall, and half way we were able to stop off and sit down and enjoy them. The 2nd part of the tour was a very short boat ride across the river to a very beautiful island which was full of nature ! Seeing this island and being able to cycle around it is something I know I would never have found without this tour! So it was great! :)And finally, our tour guide Marcel was an absolute pleasure to spend the day with! He was full of useful info and even taught us some Thai language !Highly recommended :) Thanks for a great day!Becky and Carl x

Fantastic! . Went today with our guide "Tom"... Amazing guy who too good care of us all the way. Great day - all my best recommandations for ABC and especially Tom. Take care... Cheers Kenny & Maria (DK)

Do it!. I've recently been on the guided bike tour with 17 of my friends and it was amazing! The guide, Marcel, was a joy to spend the day with and he knew a lot of weird and fun facts about Thailand, the people and the capital. He took us out on an island, still in Bangkok, and we road our bikes on a concrete 'road' that was only a meter wide but raised about 1,5 meters above the ground. It was fun to see the big contrast of the busy busy Bangkok streets to the nice Bangkok nature where you could actually hear the birds sing! I loved it and will absolutely recommend everyone to do it! :)

Not your traditional tour, and a great way to see local life in Bangkok. If you are expecting to see monuments and temples or any of the top Bangkok sites, this is not the tour for you. But if you've already seen all that and you are looking to learn more about the people and how they live, then this is perfect. We cycled through Bangkok "slums", markets, the old China town and Bangkok's Green Lung by crossing a river on a small boat with our bikes. We did stop at one of the less popular temples (not popular with tourists) where we got to see a mummified monk, hear his story and learned about the proper ways to show respect at Thai temples. There were opportunities to stop at a clean toilet and our kids (ages 9 and 12) had no problem cycling the 18/19 kilometers, it was an easy ride. Bangkok's traffic was not a problem, our guide was very efficient and knew how to guide us accordingly. This was no problem for our young family. ABC's is a very efficient and reliable company. Our bookings were done with no problems and our correspondence was promptly answered. I would absolutely book with them again.
Great fun experience. 2 times we enjoyed the bike tour tru the nicest part of bangkok..absolute to do...we spent a beautifull day cycling and experiening the local life...

Nice tour. Our tour guide was great, friendly and very helpful throughout the ride. I enjoyed getting out of the city and riding through the jungle of Bangkok. Since I live in Bangkok, the tour guide even gave me directions on how to get back to the floating market in that part of town. I would recommend them to anyone visiting Bangkok.

Worth it & highly recommended . A wonderful eye opening experience. At first, visit of some BKK neighborhoods that the normal guest will never reach alone (ie the former Chinese enclave). To follow with a public market selling most of food stuff and other merchandise at incredibly low prices. Loved the attitude of Thai people having a bunch of westerners biking among their ... legs while being quite accommodating to this hassle. Biking through a slum, built and nested under a bridge, met some wonderfully smiling local faces with the purest of intentions. Great choice to include this part in the tour. A pleasant short boat trip to the other side (probably the West Bank south of BKK), visiting Bankkachau area where we tried delicious Thai food and recommended dim sum. Lots of interesting souvenirs, typical local foods and plenty hawkers and buskers amidst green surroundings. Biking was quite relaxed and amusing passing through at times an interesting 1m concrete trail on top of river-water surrounded by lush vegetation.This is a wonderful eye-opener biking tour in areas the average guest to BKK will not catch on his own.I kindly suggest the explanation of the tour be given at the beginning and not the end of it. I also politely advice that useful info is shared when all the guests are present as in the case of 9 guests if you happen to be the last you may lose some interesting knowledge.It is certainly a well organized and highly recommended "using-a-bike" tour. We loved it!

Happy honeymooners. This was a great idea we had for our honeymoon. We cycled in the city but the best bit is when you hit the jungle. The cycling paths are thrilling, because they are very narrow and if you don't be careful, you might fall like in a muddy scary watery area. So if you are a regular cyclist or a fearless person it is fine. Otherwise you are going to annoy the rest of the group who is up for any challenge. Having said that, the pace is very slow, so it is very enjoyable for non regular cyclists. The market that you cycle through in the city has some weird stuff such is dead frogs being sold. The one in the middle of the jungle is lovely and get to try some really different nibbles such as Miang kham (I think that is the name)! We loved it! The guide, Tom, was by far the best English speaker of all the tours we did. He also takes lots of pics of the group along the way whilst still cycling on his bike! It came handy for my husband and I who broke our camera the day before the tour! The only thing we got a bit disappointed is that we thought we read in the tour description that we were going to cycle past a floating market but we didn't. Apparently this time of the year it is all very dry for it. Other than this, it was fab!

Just another 5 star review for ALL. . Awesome tour. It definitely deserves it's 5 star rating. The cycling was very relaxed, very easy pace, comfortable bikes, stop whenever you want to take a photo. Also the tour splits about half cycling and half looking or eating. Just right I thought. Your will definitely get a real introduction to Bangkok. Recommended for all who can ride a bike.

Wonderful experience!. I for my self can't say anything bad about this bike ride! My boyfriend and I joined another group with two girls -also from Denmark, a girl from Germany and two guys from the Netherlands. Our guide was oh so sweet (Aon) and told us about the attractions we stopped to see, and took us around Bangkok, seeing both rich and poor places, markets etc. I never thought I would be able to say that I've tried riding a bike in Bangkok city - but now I can, and I'll never forget it! So if you go to Bangkok, I would certainly recommend this trip!Thanks to Aon, and to the group - it was a pleasure! :)

Excellent - Do this when in Bangkok. A bicycle tour is a fantastic way to see and gain a better understanding of the holiday destination you are in and having taking part in one in London and loving it, I was keen to do the same in Bangkok. ABC Amazing Bicycle Tours Bangkok did not disappoint - in a word the tour was excellent. Ja was our guide for the day which in the afternoon was a relatively small of only 6. What a fantastic time we had. The route itself was fantastic and allowed you to see many different parts of Bangkok which you simply will not see if you stick to only taxi's and trains. Ja was good fun and very knowledgable and at our various stops along the way explained to us the area and the type of living that occurred in that area. The trip is great for all ages. I went with my 14 year old son and we both equally enjoyed it. During the trip you ride on roads, paths, through markets, through a jungle area and take part in a very pleasant river crossing by boat. There are plenty of opportunities to take photographs. A snack break takes place at a local eatery. All in all, this was a very enjoyable 4 hours and well worth the money spent. I recommend ABC to you. Their high rating on Trip-Advisor is well deserved.

You get to see a unique side to Bangkok and work off some Pad Thai!. Our guide, Tom, was funny friendly and informative, I couldn't recommend this tour enough. Particularly loved the boat trip to the rainforest outside Bangkok!

Favourite Activity in Bangkok. This is honestly such a cool way to see the city, you learn and see so much in such a short amount of time. The guides are local Thai women, so you get a firsthand perspective of different parts of the city.I did the 8 am trip, it ended up being longer than what they said so give yourself some extra time after. Super interesting to see the different classes lifestyles, especially cycling through the tunnel slums! So cool. You get to cycle through a market and eat lots of yummy fresh fruit! There's lots of water and other beverages provided so no need to worry about bringing stuff. Super going going through the jungle on these narrow little lanes, all the while learning so much about the inhabitants of the land and the nature around. The guide takes a tonne of pictures, so you have lots to go back on, they're posted on their fb page right away too which rocks. So cycling is pretty mellow, even when going through super busy streets in Bangkok the tour guide is just an absolute pro so it's no problem.The only reason I'm giving very good instead of excellent is because I ended up being the only single person in a group of couples. I know, kind of a vapid reason but I really wish there would've been a way to pick a group that I could have mingled with more. The group was still great though and I still thought it was a blast.

One of the best adventures. I can't say enough about our morning bike ride. I ended up doing a private ride with me and my girlfriend as we didn't wanted a group tour. This was one of the best excursions we had on our entire trip to Thailand. Besides having an amazing tour guide we went through local neighborhoods and markets and saw things from a different perspective. Being one on one with our guide we were also able to get some really great information about Bangkok. The bikes were perfect and very comfortable. If you're slightly considering to go with this company I hope my post sways you as they were amazing. Who would have ever thought a bike tour could have been so amazing. My memories from that tour will last me a long time.

Great fun. We recently did the afternoon tour with Marcel and it was great. We got to see a different side to Bangkok than I have previously experienced and Marcel was very knowledgeable and friendly through the trip, his English was also very good. Was a great afternoon, would highly recommend it.

One of the best days of our trip. This tour was so much fun. Our tour guide was Marcel, so friendly and helpful. Definitely recommend this if you are in Bangkok a great way to see many different sides of the city in a small amount of time. We did the 10am tour which included the fresh market, so interesting and eye opening. The tour guide took photos of us which are free to see on the Facebook page.

Practical Advice. Amazing, must-do tour in Bangkok - the highlight of our visit. While in Thailand I wanted practical advice for each day, so here begins my contribution:1. Wear comfortable athletic clothes that wick sweat, sunglasses, shoes that stay on.2. Can choose cruiser bike or mountain. Cruiser is obviously easier to pedal.3. Guide is a rock star! Bring plenty to tip her with because she is the best. Made the best cup of coffee I had in the entire country. She will also provide T.P. (Western style toilets). 4. Guides provide plenty of snacks & drinks. 5. Guides will keep you safe! I was apprehensive due to the traffic, but immediately felt taken care of. 6. Biking is easy, but there is manuerverability required on the raised sidewalks. If you are a nervous driver simply walk the corners!7. Keep an open mind and enjoy truly seeing the city.

You have to do this! . This company has definitely earned the right to include "amazing" in its title. I can't begin to tell you just how incredible the trip was from start to finish. I don't know if you'll read this elsewhere, but even the coffee served prior to the excursion was top notch! You don't need to be an athlete to make the trek - you just need to enjoy light exercise and the great outdoors. You'll see some of the most spectacular sights in all of Bangkok! Please don't skip this "amazing" adventure!

A really enjoyable day.. Really enjoyed this tour, something out of the ordinary for Bangkok where you get to see the stuff that you usually wouldn't as a transiting tourist. We took the morning tour which lasts about 4 hours, that takes you through a myriad of residential areas, underpasses, bridges, rivers, before hopping on a ferry and travelling through some of the jungle/farmland across the river. Id highly recommend this tour. What i wouldn't recommend is staying out till 2 am the night before in various bars and then attempting the 4 hour cycle in searing heat with a hangover. That part didn't work well for me.

Great Bicycle Morning Tour!. This was the 3rd time I did the tour, I always recommend any family members and or friends who come to Thailand, to this tour (preferable Morning Tour) with ABC.It's a great way to explore Bangkok and to see things which you otherwise wouldn't notice while you're in Bangkok.I love the part where you cycle through the small Soi (streets) of Khlong Toey, all the people there are so friendly, and you see where and how the live.After crossing the river by boat you will cycle over small concrete road/bridges in the Green Lung part of Bangkok.Before I forget to mention they do have very nice guides, which speak good English and even a bit of Dutch.For sure I will come back to ABC but probably to do any of the other tours the offer.

Great way to spend Saturday afternoon on my business trip. I have visited Bangkok many times on business - easily over a dozen visits in the last 5 - 6 years. Normally, I fly in on Sunday night and am gone by Friday. I see the office, the hotel, and a few restaurants for supplier and team dinners. This trip I was moving on to Singapore & Myanmar on Sunday, so I decided to try a different tour experience - I had already seen the Palace, temples, etc.The afternoon bike tour was the best ! Ja is a fantastic tour guide, but also a great representative of Thai hospitality and culture. I never knew we could get from the city to the rain forest in by just crossing the river. Great contrast in lifestyles and conditions. Got me away from the concrete jungle and traffic of Bangkok without having to travel north or south a great distance. HIDDEN BENEFIT - 14 km's of exercise bike time !!! No need for the hotel gym on that day.This is a great way to spend 4 hours in Bangkok. Would highly recommend it to anyone here on a business trip with a morning or afternoon to spare. Beats hanging out in the hotel checking emails. Give it a try.

Unexpected treasure!. As the previous reviews suggest, a fantastic way to explore BKK. Our tour guide was Ja, she was great fun and very informative! The bikes were comfortable and the route chosen was safe but lots of fun. Especially liked all the delicious street food smells en route. The pace was not too strenuous but it was nice to stop and have a drink midway through. Would highly recommend.After we were finished we went to a really nice noodle restaurant on the corner of the street which Abc is on (sorry forgot the name) which was delicious and very cheap.

Really fantastic. Amazing to see the differences of Bangkok, we had a afternoon tour which ended up to be a private tour. The tour guide Jay (sorry if misspelled grandma) is the most enthusiastic guide ever, really friendly, spontaneous and made sure we had an unforgettable afternoon.This was my third tour in ten years and still amazingly! Thanks!

Best way to see Bangkok - loved it!. Had a wonderful time! Tom was a great guide and filled the group in on culture, food and was very entertaining!!I was slightly nervous about the narrow pathways at the last stage of our ride, but Tom slowed down the pace for me - much appreciated.Definitely worth doing if you are in Bangkok, affordable, fun and where else can you ride with no helmets amongst buses, cars, pedestrians on footpaths and thousands of motorbikes??Thank you Tom!!

Fun!!. this is just a fun activity to do!cycling doens't seem like an obvious or safe thing to do in Bangkok, with all the motorcycles, cars and busses, but during the trip I never had an unsafe feeling.Just follow the guides and you will get to see things you would otherwise not see.from busy, hectic city life to quiet garden life and back again with excellent (and fun) guidance.

Unnerving if you're not a confident cyclist. Well organised, decent bikes, our guide Tom spoke excellent english. Enjoyable informative trip. The only downside for me were the raised narrow paths through the forest which frequently had 90 degree turns and mostly no side rails. Although I do cycle I found this part of the trip made me very nervousFor the majority of people on our tour, it was one of the highlights of their Bangkok trip. If you are reasonable competent on a bike & physically confident, do this tour. If you are a bit nervous like me, don't.

Day tour with Tom. Excellent way to see other parts of Bangkok that you would not normally see. Everything from poorest neighborhoods to restaurant in the jungle and high adrenaline ride when riding together with Bangkok car drivers and of course some cultural sights to see. Great job Tom

Amazing. My wife and I just got back to the hotel after a teriffic 6H tour with ABC and Michell, our Dutch guide. Michell is excellent in english as well as thai, so we got good value. We started out by biking in Bangkok, and enjoyed 2 different markeds where Michell got us some tasty snacks, different but good. We had a nice lunch at a quiet thai restaurant, and afterwards we cyckled back. We had so many good experiences, cant describe them.. it has to be experienced!

Bangkok Must-Do!. This tour is a lot of fun and a great way to see Bangkok from another point of view. Tom is a street smart guide with an excellent sense of humour, who can provide you with tips on where to eat, have a fun night out etc. I will recommend ABC to anyone I know going to Bangkok!

Great Way To Experience BKK. We had an entertaining afternoon exploring BKK by bike. We always felt safe as the tour guides kept us away from an any trouble and Thai people seem to be very disciplined and accommodating drivers. Highly recommend this tour!

Excellent hair-raising fun. Booked on to this tour through Bamba and it was a great experience of a side of Bangkok we probably would not otherwise have seen. After cycling along (and straight across) some of Bangkok's major thoroughfares we were taken through a variety of local neighbourhoods. After this we took a long boat across the river to the protected plantations. This ride required us to ride on a narrow raised path with a swamp either side. Pretty difficult to take pictures and stay on the path!We then recrossed the river before the heavens well and truely opened on us. Rain coats were offered but we hardy souls battled on becoming absolutely soaked. There were 2 stops on the tour for toilet breaks and refreshments, which were provided by the guide.All in all a really great afternoon and a different way to see what otherwise would have remained a hidden side of Bangkok.

One of the best tours I have been on!!. This was one of the coolest tours I have ever been on. Our guides were incredible and they took us to parts of Bangkok I would have never seen otherwise. Great time :)

Off the beaten track. For anyone looking for a comfortable bike ride visiting parts of this vibrant city that you wouldn't normally get to see, I highly recommend ABC Tours. Our guides Marcel and Cee (Sea) were very competent and not only looked after us well but were a valuable source of information about Bangkok's way of life. It was clear Marcel was well respected by the locals given his command of the local language and his years of experience traversing the streets. Cee's looks defy her age and she was extremely polite and full of charm. As for the ride itself, it was mostly flat terrain, through back streets where possible. The ride on the peninsula once we got across the river by boat was very relaxing and technically straightforward. I would say this half day tour was one of the best ways to see this city for those with a few hours to kill. Thanks, Paul.

Awesome way to explore BKK. We had friends visiting and decided to see see something else than malls, restaurants, and temples. We booked an afternoon bike tour with ABC. It was an easy relaxing 16km bike tour that lasted 4 hours. The guide, Mr. Tom, was nothing less than fantastic. He made sure everyone had a safe and fun trip. We took many small stops where he would talk a bit about the areas and Thai culture. He also made sure that we got plenty of water as well as a little snack half way through. The tour takes you through narrow streets, busy streets, and the "lung" of Bangkok or the jungle if you like. You pass the river in a small boat to get to the jungle. That was a perfect short rest before entering some really cool bike paths in the jungle. We were a group of 8 and everyone clearly enjoyed the trip. Anyone fit for a bike can do this trip. 16km sounds like a lot but it is spread over 4 hours with plenty of stops so don't worry about it.It is quite expensive though but well worth it. Thank you Tom.
Amazing Tour. A fantastic expericense to discover parts of Bangkok where tourists rarely come together with a very good englishspeaking and humoristic guide. Thank You, Tom.

Bike On The Wild Side. Wife & myself booked the Weekend & Floating Market Tour which went from 10am till around 4pm. The majority of the 20k route was pancake flat along paved roads and probably suitable for most levels of cycling experience. The only hair raiser for me was braving the Bangkok traffic for very short parts of the ride.The ride took us through some interested backlanes, Klongtoey market, across the Chaophraya and onto a nature reserve just across from Bangkok Port where we stopped at Bangnamphu, an authentic floating market frequented by locals and a sprinkling of tourists.The English speaking guides Jai & Eddie were very knowledgeable, professional & friendly. Wouldn't hesitate to say that we had a great time and saw a side of Bangkok not normally associated with the bars & shopping that the city is famous for.Get on your bike!

Fantastic!!!. Booked this tour through Bamba prior to leaving for Thailand- so glad we did!My boyfriend and I were booked to do the tour at 8 in the morning, however due to some hotel issues couldn't make it. Despite the late notice the operators said it was no problem for us to attend a later tour so we popped over there for 1 p.m.As it is the low season just now only my boyfriend and I were on the tour, which was great as we had the tour guide, Tom, to ourselves for the whole trip. As others have said, the tour takes you out onto the busy roads of Bangkok (scary at first but Tom ensures you are completely safe) before guiding you round various areas of Bangkok, sights, attractions and the jungle. It is a fantastic opportunity to see areas of Bangkok that you would never find or think to explore without a guide. Was so impressed with Tom who took time to get to know us and explain about Thai culture, life in Bangkok and its history.The tour includes regular stops for pictures, information, refreshments (fresh fruit, drinks and snacks). Tom also recommended good places to visit, for example the best places to go for street food and what to try (go to 38th street near the ABC offices for mango with coconut milk and sticky rice- it is absolutely stunning!!) A truly great experience- don't miss out!!!

Great day, new things to see!. ABC bike tour was prebooked for us as part of a tour booked in England. Wasn't sure what to expect but when we arrived we were welcomed by Michael, offered a drink (even though we were late!) and chatted about the plan of the day.We had a group of 5 of us and Michael took us straight out into the city traffic, despite us being apprehensive beforehand he knows the traffic and is very safe at getting everyone around the busy parts of town! We rode through china town, some local inner city housing areas, a Buddhist funeral ceremony, and crossed the river to the jungle (didn't even know it was there!) where we cycled on the boardwalks, saw a huuge monitor lizard and rested whilst we played Michael's favourite 'bottlecap game' (don't even try to win, he's too good). Michael himself was very friendly and got to know us all, locals were constantly waving hello to him and we also learnt about his family. All in all a great day away from the bustling streets and great way to see new parts of Bangkok. (P.s I'm trying to bite my nails less Michael).Jack and Nicole

Best Bangkok Activity! . Myself and my boyfriend did the tour in mid September. Being a quieter season in Thailand, there was only ourselves and another group of 3 on the tour and it was fantastic!!On arrival, we were offered cold water and a coffee whilst we awaited the others, chatting with the tour guide. We were also offered suncream and mosquito repellent - highly recommend both!We were all offered a choice of bike - a 'city bike' or 'mountain bike'. Ladies - the city bike is much more comfortable and believe me - you'll need it!! Please note you don't get helmets - and I advice wearing something very comfortable and lite - I've never sweat so much in my life, but it's worth it!We cycled down busy main roads in Bangkok, which was pretty scary, but the guide ensures we keep together at all times. We would stop on side streets and discuss the city living, and had many great photo opportunities. The guide got us some fresh, local fruit to try and it was delicious! We also got regular cold water which was well needed!When crossing the River, the tour changed and we explored a side to Bangkok I didn't know existed and never would have! Jungle, swamps, little lonely wooden houses and silence but the sound of nature. Incredible! These cycling paths were fairly narrow, and being raised with a swamp the other side I certainly took my time around the many 90 degree corners. It was a little tough but well worth it!All in all, the day was fantastic! I had not rode a bike for years, and I'm far from fit! But through all the sweat it was the best tour we experienced in Bangkok! Highly recommend to couples, groups of family! (Ps prepare for a sore bum for a few days lol)Thank you so much for putting up with me being the 'slow one' at the back! Thanks for such an amazing experience!! :)

What a well thought out tour!. This tour made enough of an impression on me that I am compelled to write about it a year and a half later! My wife and I took this tour in February of 2013 during our honeymoon.The tour took us through the back streets of Bangkok then across a river via longtail boat where we rode around on elevated walkways over a flooded plantation. What an experience!The pace was perfect to keep a ramshackle group of tourists together. Our guide, Marcel (I still remember his name so many months later, he was that good), was very informative about the areas that we were riding through and day to day life in Thailand away from the tourist traps. The stops were well timed. We had a flat tire at one point and Marcel had us going again in under 5 minutes.The ride through the plantation was by far the highlight for me. It was fantastic to see the temples and homes scattered among the mostly fallow "fields" of the plantation.Thank you for the great memories, ABC. Sorry I took so long to share my experience with others.

Good trip.. A great insight to Bangkok life. Our tour guide, Tom, was charismatic and knowledgeable. The tour was a bit pricey but you seriously couldn't see as much in a short time otherwise. Biking through some of the places was an experience we couldn't have found elsewhere.Recommended.

An off the beaten path adventure. I'd already been to Bangkok before and I was looking for something to do that was a little bit different since I'd done all the required sites the first time around. Even though there were just two of us Tom was patient, entertaining, and it was truly a great time. I loved it because it was a part of Bangkok I never would have seen on my own. Seriously do it, it's worth it. Thanks Tom (aka T-fresh)N-Dawg from ATL

Bicycle bliss . We had a great tour because our guide,Jya, had great local knowledge and a very enjoyable tour route. We saw Bangkok from many angles including local markets, street life, river travel and a grand tour of stomach island park and free space. Jya lead our small group of 4 around with a grand smile on her face and a lively zeal on her heart. Thank you Jya and ABC.

Truley amazing cycle trip with Tom. We went on a morning tour with our guide Tom.We visited different sections of the city itself as well as a jungle plantation on the other side of Chao Phraya river.Since the paths we took were not always very wide, at least some cycling experience is required to enjoy the tour.Since we did a private tour the experience may be different when in a large group. However, we realy recommend doing this tour if you want to experience Bangkok in a not so usual way.

Great way to see another part of Bangkok. We (family of 5 - three kids of 16, 14 and 11 years old) did the morning bicycle tour with ABC and we loved it. You'll not see the most famous sites of Bangkok on this tour (which I guess it the point), but you'll get another view of Bangkok - the less travelled roads by tourists and the poorer parts of town. This is a great way to move a round the city and our guide was very knowledgeable and friendly. Please keep in mind that while most of the tour is on quiet roads without much traffic, there are a few stretches with quite a lot of traffic - so if you do this tour with younger kids, they should know how to bike in traffic.

fantastic-the highlight of our Bangkok part of the trip!. for us , joining the ABC cycling trip was the best thing we have done in Bangkok! the tour takes you through various parts of the city life and enables yiou to see both "green lungs" and city neighbourhoods. it is very enjoyable -the guide we had was outstanding and i really recommend taking one of the companies tours even if for only a day or two in the city!

Great backroads bike through Bangkok! . I went on the afternoon bike tour today with Marcel. The bikes were great and the service was excellent. He took us through the backroads of Bangkok, away from the chaos of the city. We got to see how the people here actually live and get a taste of another world than our own. We then crossed the river and bikes through the jungle a little and through a beautiful park. The whole time Marcel was very funny and kind, giving us water and snacks along the way. I would really recommend this to people who are looking to see a more realistic view of Bangkok!

Great morning tour. This is a fantastic tour if you want to see parts of bangkok off the beaten path. The tour guide, Ja, is fantastic! She knows alot about the city and has lots of funny stories to tell. The best part of the tour is crossing the river, before riding on the walkways through the jungle - awesome!

Great Tour of Bangkok. My guide Tom was fun, easygoing, and professional. The other people for the tour never showed up, so I got a private tour. Very interesting views of Bangkok. If you are adventurous, check out ABC tours, I had a great time.

Unexpected sites of Bangkok. A wonderful trip by bike passing unexpected sites of Bangkok. Guide Marcel leads us under bridges, where people live with their pigs and dogs, through little streets, where normal live goes on, though markets and over the river to a green area, where it is quiet and cool. He makes enough breaks to drink or eat some fresh fruit. The bicycles are comfortable and nearly new. A trip you may not mis, when you visit Bangkok!

What a way to discover Bangkok. The best way to experience the true hidden Bangkok. The bikes are in good condition, the tour guides and explanations are friendly and easy to understand. Even a flat tire kept us stranded for only about 10 minutes (well done). The tour is versatile, you drive on busy roads, small roads, walkways, backyards and sometimes it felt like driving through the people’s living rooms. Another highlight is the crossing of the river with a long boat. Recommend it to anybody who is not lazy to ride a bike.

A great way to see the contrasts in Bangkok!. From start to finish we were very well looked after by Michel. He had fantastic knowledge of the city and the people. We got to see lots of Bangkok that we wouldn't have found ourselves and it was great to see how people live within the city. We especially enjoyed crossing the river and visiting "Bangkachao" and seeing the contrast from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. We were always kept stocked up with water/drinks/snacks and Michel even took a video of us cycling on our camera for us! Would definitely recommend!

Amazing day. We had a wonderful day seeing a different side of Bangkok. We haven't stopped talking about the day and would recommend it to anyone visiting the city. Great guide who gave us lots of information about the day to day life of people living in the city. Lovely food on the way, including a snack in the morning. It was great to go over the river as it was an incredible contrast to the busy city. I cannot recommend this trip enough!

Great tour of Bangkok. Great way to experience the city, with guides who live here. Not only showing a very different side of Bangkok, but also explaining about the day to day life. Good bikes, a fun group - not too big, not too small, and a very manageable bike ride. Excellent lunch at one of the local road side stops. Definitely a must do when visiting here.

Best tour of Bangkok!. I had afternoon tour with my family. Everything was perfect. The guides(Tom and Eddie) were joyful and kind. And the course had various scenes.Jungle tour was fantastic. I can tell mango trees with the help of Mr.Eddie.Because my wife is poor at cycling, so we fell behind from the group at the start.But the guide man Mr.Eddie helps us to finish the course.I and my wife express our gratitude to Mr.Eddie for his kindness and help.
Great to experience Bangkok. Good bikes, good guide and great places to experience. Especially at the other site of the river is an area of Bangkok I have not seen before.

Very cozy. We went to to a lot of nice streets,where we normally dont come! Or if we come there, we were lost. Haha. Very cozy streets and nice people on or way. A funny instructor. And also a kind one! I see it was wonderfull. ( sorry for my english ;) )

Another Bangkok...even for Residents. A friend and I, who have both lived in Bangkok for many years, thoroughly enjoyed our morning exploring hidden corners of our very own neighbourhood, Sukhumvit, and then breathing some fresh(er) air on the other side of the river. Our guide, Marcel, was very professional and considerate and I would really recommend this adventure to visitors and residents alike.

Perfect beginning to travels in Thailand. I only read four reviews to make my decision to do this tour & I'm so glad I did.From being given precise instructions on how to get to the office when you book, to the frozen towelette at the end; very professional service, you don't have to worry about anything & most importantly it was lots & lots of fun.I would recommend doing this at the beginning of your visit to Thailand as they give you little tips on how to enhance your trip while visiting Thailand such as phrases to use & a little insight to their traditions. I found it helpful.I would not hesitate to do this tour again.

Fun adventure out of the city. The starting point for the tour is located just off Sukhumvit Road - about a 5-10 min walk from the nearest BTS Station. We had no issues finding it at all. You then meet your guide and group upstairs. We had 'On' (I hope I spelt that right) - an excellent tour guide who loves a chat and good laugh. She speaks great English and was very helpful throughout. She also ensured we were safe on any of the busier roads. We did the 'Day Tour'.The tour goes through a number of suburban streets just outside of the city. You get a good look at locals living their everyday lives.The highlight for me was the market visit. It was amazing seeing the way things are done at their market. I won't list everywhere we went after that, but will mention that the lunch was also fantastic.I can highly recommend this tour.

wonderfull afternoon seeing the real Bangkok. Dear Michael and Tom,You gave us the best afternoon in Bangkok. Cycling through Bangkok on your very convenient bycicles gave us just a wonderfull and amazing insight in the lives of the people in the original Bangkok districts. But also the quiet ride on the concrete road structure through the plantation after crossing the great river, was amazing, showing how to escape from the Bangkok hustle. Keep up the very good job!Leon and Annemieke

The Wanderer returns. This cycle tour is great and three years on, I return with my husband who had missed out previously. It was just as good as I remember and Michael we can report your staff are doing a wonderful job in your absence. On this tour you get to see such a variety of Bangkok life from back streets, that you would never find on your own, market areas, river life (loading the bikes on the boat and crossing the river is great) through the cool green forest on the other side. The fact that the concrete paths here are narrow and on occasions high up, with some tight turns means you have to concentrate, it adds to the excitement and they haven't lost anyone yet off the path :)It is hot cycling at this time of year but the bikes are easy to pedal and the breeze cooling. There are plenty of breaks and water and snacks provided.Do not miss this tour!

Fantastic backroads tour of Bangkok. I can't recall who recommended ABC to me, but I'm very glad I went on one of their tours. They are quite hard to find - located down a little alley off Soi 26, but they are very friendly and informal and the Dutch guide (unfortunately I can't remember his name!) was very knowledgeable and welcoming. Its terrific value for a chance to see a slice of Bangkok away from the usual overcrowded tourist sites.
Great experience!. We had a great experience with Ja! She made the ride informative and fun while sharing with us stories about the Thai culture!

Highly recommend this tour!. I have just finished this bicycle tour and it was fantastic! Our Tour guide Ja was excellent and so friendly. Lots of information and a great way to spend the morning. Thank you Ja!

Great Fun! . I went on a morning tour with a friend I am travelling with. The tour guides were exceptionally kind and speak perfect English. The tour was a lovely flat ride that is suitable for all ages. The great thing about the tour is that you get to see the REAL Bangkok as they take you through areas you would not venture through on your own. The tour included bottles of water/coffee, a light snack and a soft drink. Really was a great way to start our day and our trip! Thanks guys!

20 June Morning Tour. What a fantastic way to see a wide variety of living in Bangkok. Fantastic guide! Very relaxed morning. We stayed at Centra Hotel. If using taxi leave in plenty of time to make 0745 check-in. Rode with a great group of people. Top rate experience.

best tour in Bangkok woth best guide since two months. We did the morning tour with Jaa, a dynaic, super friendly and very knowledgable young lady. She was the best guide we had on our whole 2 month trip through southeastasia.The tour takes you through three very different quarters from high to low class. Additionally, you cross the river by ferry and cycle for about one hour in the jungle.All in all this was an amazing experience and is totally recommendable!

Amazing day trip!. Brilliant day trip cycling around Bangkok, going on a boat trip and cycling around a jungle, we got to see a different side of Bangkok! Tour guide was really great and friendly, providing us with water, sun cream, cold drinks & snacks.We also got the opportunity to try some thai food from a market along the way.I'm not very confident on a bike but I found it quiet manageable and was made to feel comfortable.

As a Thai person the trip has opened my eyes !!. I went with a group of foreigner friends and I was so impressed of what I have seen and enjoyed places that we went. At beginning I was a bit worried of the traffic and safety however later of our trip we had no issues and no more concerns. Michael started to lead our group into these side streets of Sukhumvit road in Bangkok, we started to see many different things which we could not or be able to find these interesting places on our own, starting from the shoes factory in the small commercial building, a tuktuk fire truck stands by, Klong Teoy wet market, through the low rise small houses and later we all put our bikes into to the longtail speed boat accrossed the Chao Praya river to the other side which is green opened area. It is such a contrast scence from busy Sukhumvit street to this peaceful place, biking along the vegetables fields. I end up recommending the ABC Amazing Bangkok Cyclist to many of my foreign friends, some as a couple and some with their kids. I had few couples who came to Thailand for their honeymoon and they told me that the biking trip was the highlight of their honeymoon. Strongly recommend !!

Fabulous afternoon with Tom @ Jaa. What an experience we had with them both absolutley brilliant and very knowledgeable ,were very very lucky to have only three of us on our tour .Took us to places never knew existed in Bangkok and would never of known that were there and places that we would never of gone on our own, saw a different side to Bangkok to the houses under the highway and then to the jungle ,YES there is a jungle in Bangkok.Anybody thinking of going you must! was a fantastic afternoon would definitely go again if we come to Bangkok.Thank you all at ABC.xx

Fabulous Street Food Tour. My friend and I went on a street food tour with Beau. It was a highlight of our visit to Bangkok! We had such a great time riding through interesting neighbourhoods and seeing the local residents and their families enjoying the evening together. We loved trying amazing Thai street food at places we knew would be safe because of our guide. Beau was a joy to follow around town and I highly recommend this experience to anyone looking to see a different side of the city and enjoy an exhilarating evening! This was my second tour with ABC... I won't miss doing another one the next time I visit!

Fantastic experience, amazing your guide!. My partner and I had a great time on the ABC day tour. We saw a different side of Bangkok than we would have otherwise, and what better way to do it but on bikes! Ohn, our tour guide, couldn't have been more polite, informative, friendly and helpful! We really couldn't have wished for anything more! Highly recommend!!!!

A different view of Bangkok. What a great, self contained day's entertainment, giving a different view of Bangkok and some of the adjoining jungle across the river. Can't recommend it highly enough. Well informed guides, all-found in terms of water and snacks. We loved it and will recommend it to all travellers!

No decay after a decade. We first went on the abc tour in 2004 and loved it, especially the slow pace in hectic Bangkok and the easy company of Michiel.Returning after 10 years with 3 kids, we thought we'd see if we could do it again with little ones.They found some bikes with kids seats and whilst their smallest bike was a bit bigger than our 5 year old was used to, a few runs up and down the quiet alley soon had him right to go.We had a great day with our guide Onn, visiting the new and old areas of Bangkok, with our children the usual highlight of local attention.We'd definitely go again although might ask the wife not to give the 5 year old such a big push next time, he fell off.

Awesome. I went on the bike ride a few months ago and I keep thinking about this particular tour. My friend and I had a lovely tour guide (unfortunately I have forgotten her name) who was very informative and rode at a good pace. We were worried about our riding skills prior to this trip as we're were told about a narrow path but once we started we didn't look back.I loved it and recommend anyone who goes to Bangkok to do this ride and to take your camera (:
Different experience . It was so much fun and a different view of Bangkok. Will definitely never forget it. The tour guides made it even better with knowledge of the city and culture.

Such fun!. A really great experience . We took the afternoon tour with Marcel . Luckily its true that you never forget how to ride a bike although at times there were a few wobbles especially in the narrower places. Cycling through areas where tourists would seldom go meant you got an idea how "real" people live in Bangkok. The second half of the tour was over the river in a green rural area- a lovely change from the city. We had no problem keeping up with the 20year olds.

Nice tour to see more of Bangkok. We did the morning tour and did see a bit more of Bangkok. Nice neighbourhoods to ride through. The guide was friendly and informative. We also visited the plantations south of the river. Nice tour and exactly as stated before we booked.

Very Unique. Just finished their 1 day tour with Marcel. He was an excellent guide, knowledgeable, pleasant, and witty. The tour takes you thru some very obscure neighborhoods via a maze of narrow lanes and byways--definitely places you could never find on your own. As such you get a feel for the life of the ordinary citizens of Bangkok. Before crossing the river you also experience a large open market in a very intimate way. The scenery after the crossing is totally different, quiet and almost rural. All in all, very interesting and enjoyable.

A fab day out!. We did the afternoon tour and u really enjoyed it we cycled round a lovely green area which you would not expect to see in Bangkok! We saw loads of wildlife and it was a welcome change from the busy city!our guide was lovely and made a real effort to chat to everyone. Overall a really good day!

Excellent day trip. I really enjoyed myself on this excursion. There were 8 people including myself & the guide. We rode through one of the large markets and back streets of Bangkok where the guide took time to explain to us what we were seeing, bought us snacks at the market, and provided insight into the local way of life. We then took our boats on a ferry trip across the river and rode our bikes through a rural area and had a great lunch at a local restaurant. A very pleasant way to spend the day; I'd highly recommend this to anyone interested in seeing a different side of Bangkok. This ride is aimed at the casual bike rider, with frequent breaks for water and rest.

Highly recommend. I would highly recommend, taking this trip. My husband, another couple traveling with us all agreed it was the high light of our Bangkok experience. The bikes were in great shape our tour guide was fabulous, showing us around, we seen things that most visitors to Bangkok do not get to experience. Our lunch and snack was delicious and we were offered seconds if we wanted. No one in our group had road a bike in years but had no problem keeping up.

The best trip we did in Asia!!!!. We had heard from friends about the bicycle tour and they specially recommended ABC.When planning this Holiday with my husband and two kids (6 and 12). we decided to make time for this trip on our time in Bangkok. The e-mail was replied so quickly and to all my questions they had an good answer with explanation, you can see they took time for this. Expecially for the youngest kid I was slightly worried in Bangkok traffic but they assured me it would be fine.We booked the weekend tour with the local market hidden in the jungle. When we arrived a bit early we were about 30 minutes early but, this was no problem at all as Marcel, the manager I think he was make the best coffee from Bangkok for us. We were introduced to another smiling lady which her name was Djaa. She would be the tour guide for today. There was another family from Holland of 4 but just before we left a couple from Belgium came walking up who wanted to join the tour. As this would make the 10 of us total Marcel didn't make a problem at all and joined us on our trip to make sure everyone was safe and well taken care off. We cycled through the city and saw placed that we really never would have found by ourselves, the fresh market was a real highlight about the city part but also the huge differences between the big fancy buildings and the wooden shacks under the highway. Also for the kids this was very education and entertaining to see different lives of the people. On the way Both guides provided us with some interesting information but not too much, they made a lot of jokes which made it a fun experience for everyone. After we crossed the river we came into the green jungle. No cars anymore just peaceful green surroundings. we made our way over the pathways to the hidden market in the jungle. Here we parked the bikes which apparently don't have to be locked? as they assured us everything was safe here. On the market they give us all different kinds of tastings which even the kids liked :) they were truly delicious and with the Thai karaoke on the background is was a great experience without any other tourists around us. After the market we went to a nice local restaurant where we had some delicious lunch before making our way back to the boat. On the way back my little one was getting a bit tired but luckily Marcel noticed this and took my son at the armand so helping him making our way through traffic. Marcel up front and Dja cycled ahead to block the traffic to make sure we all could pass safe every intersection which gave us a super safe feeling. When we got back at the office we were all four tired but very happy. The kids loved it and we as well. Marcel and Djaa took great care of us before, during and after the tour. they made sure we were with a group. We exchanged e-mails with the Belgium couple and Dutch Family and shared some great pictures for this memory!We traveled with the four of us in various countries but this was definitely the best thing we did. Well worth the money!!Visited, December 2013
truely amazing. Fantastic tour, a awesome chance to see a other side of Bangkok really close up! Great staff to guide you, great humor, good energy. thank you for the best day in Bangkok

Great day trip with Bangkok Bicycle tour!. Did the 4 hour long cycle of Bangkok in January whilst travelling with a friend - we booked at our travel agents in England but were so glad we did! The tour guides were lovely and very inciteful of the city and spoke good English! We saw different ends of the scale of Bangkok from the slums to main roads. Also went over a river boat to an island we didn't know existed and saw a beautiful mosque! We had a great day very relaxed ride for any fitness level and free water was a bonus as it was boiling. Would do it again and recommend to anyone wanting to tour the city!

Great food tour in disguise. I love biking through cities when I have a limited amount of days to sightsee. We went on an ABC tour on our first full day in Bangkok. We didn't really know what to expect but were excited. The tour guide, Boom, speak very good English and was easy to understand. Our tour group was pretty big but we were able to stay together pretty well. The tour doesn't take you through the main tourist attractions of Bangkok, instead it takes you through the different sorts of neighborhoods including a bit through the "poor" area under the bridge. The highlight of the trip was definitely the floating market across the river. I'm not sure we were still in Bangkok honestly, but the food and merchandise in the market was so awesome. The tour also visits the Chinatown market that people say is 24/7 with its busiest time at 1 AM in the morning. This was a great little site, but extremely frustrating to walk around with a bike. The road is very tight and there are people everywhere. After a little boat ride across the river, we rode around a narrow path that was above water with very tight corners. It was honestly a very stressful little bike ride around this path, but we needed to take it to get to the floating market (which by the way...does not float. This tour does not take you to the well known floating market in Bangkok. It takes you to a local one). Looking back at this tour, the best part was all the food we ate during the day. We got to try some of the local fruits and snacks - it helped us on the rest of our trip around Thailand. But again, do not expect to see any tourist attractions - no temples, no famous sites. You will be riding around as a local.

Amazing. Thank you so much ABC for an amazing experience. Absolutely the best way to experience Bangkok from the local point of view. Cycle through local neighbourhoods and see what Bangkok is really about. Thanks to our guide Marcel who took care of us in Bangkok traffic all the way.

Crazy but fun!. Not for the faint of heart. The first part of the trip was through side streets of Bangkok. Got a real feel for the neighborhood and places you would not have seen without ABC Cyclist. However on the way back it was a straight shot back, by that I mean no side streets. Just a group of crazy tourist on bikes riding along motorcycles, buses and cars. Everyone got back safely, the drivers on the road are very aware of motorcycles, in turn they were aware of us bikers and gave us room as well as the right of way. Not a long trip back but not something that you would do never do by yourselves for sure. Have fun and see the real Thailand.

Bangkok in real life. This is a surprising trip and a great way to see Bangkok from a totally different side. Everyone visiting Bangkok should attend this bicycle trip and get a New perspectiveThanks Marcel for showing us something not expected.Best regards Tina and Jan Sørensen, Denmark

Cool relaxing ride into the real Bangkok. Nice leisurely ride to see a side of Bangkok you would otherwise not get to see. Getting greeted by the bemused but smiling and waving locals was worth the price of the ticket alone. Also got to see some mad wildlife in the form of a lizard the size of a dog and a wild boar living under the highway.
great tour. easy paced ride gives the experience time to soak in friendly and knowledgeable staff. would recommend to all. thanks!!!

Great day, new experience!. We booked a full day tour in Dec' 2013. It was really entertaining and cognitive. Our Thai guide was great: knowledgeable, simple and friendly. A lot of stories about her and Thai people, how they live, what they like, what try to achieve etc. what added extra emotions to cycling through places where we would never be unless we took that tour. Definitely must do thing in Bangkok. Not suitable for fastidious people though:) But hey, why you want to know the real Bangkok then?:)Thanks a lot to our guide and ABC!

Very nice experience. Would recommend this tour, especially with children. For Sure you'll get a diffferent perspective on Bangkok. The hosts were knowledgable and very firendly. Although you will go on bike through the (heavY) traffice in Bangkok it was all safe. It is just different and fun !

Absolutely fantastic!. We would highly recommend this tour, our guide On was brilliant company all day. We got to see such a different side of Bangkok which was brilliant. Initially my husband was not keen about us cycling on some roads but we felt very safe and it actually added to the fun of the day.You must do this!!

Must Do Tour!. We can't stop talking about what a great tour we had today. We went for a ride through the backstreets of Bangkok, places that we would have never been able to see otherwise. We did not see ANY other tourists along the way. The guide was great and very knowledgable. We will definitely come back for additional tours when we return!

a great bicycle route through auto-choked bangkok. with all the cars, motorcycles and skyscapers, i didn't think it would be possible to do much on a bike in bangkok. but abc has found an ingenious route going through narrow streets in traditional neighborhoods and, best of all, a long stretch through what seemed like a jungle preserve across the river. you would never be able to figure this out on your own. a real taste of asia, close-up. the best thing i did in bangkok.

See another side of Bangkok. If you want to see Bangkok from another side than the many cars and lots of people, so try a bicycle trip by ABCWe had a very good guide, and she led us to places we would not otherwise come.The guide was kindly and has a good humor, and she told us a lot of Bangkok.

A must do in BKK. See Bangkok as you've never seen before. It's not dangerous to ride through the streets of sukhumvit or the slums of Chinatown. Only the narrow concrete ways in the jungle are a little challenge. ขอบใจหลายๆ to Jáa our lovely tour guide. CURené

Sweated It Out on the Bangkok by Bike Tour - A Loved It!. My husband and I took Bangkok by Bike's weekend market tour, and loved it. Yes, this is a hot country and, although I am an avid cyclist, I had some concerns about spending the day on a bike. I should not have worried. On, our guide, made sure we were well cared for - and hydrated. The experience of crossing the river by boat with your bike, cycling through the jungle on the concrete over paths, stopping - and sampling delicious foods at the weekend market - is not to be missed. Our guide did an exceptional job of sharing her country, Buddhism and information about Thai culture with us. Plus, stopping at a small. Thai restaurant for Pad Thai was lovely. Take this tour. You will be glad you did.

Great tour, guides are wonderful.. Did this tour after my wife recommended it, we'll deserved. Our tour guide, On (sp?), was gracious and very patient. Really appreciated getting insight from a local and seeing the real side of bangkok and the country right across the river.

Well worth it,. Marshal is half tour guide and half stand up comic who somehow led us safely through the ridiculously crowded streets of Bangkok-- challenging even for a walker ( since taxis freely roam the sidewalks). In and out of alleyways with frequent stops to explain the surroundings and give insights to Thai culture, before going over the river to the quiet side. In the jungle over the river on to an elevated walkway over some water (you definitely don't want to fall in) with the occasional stray dog and 90 degree turns make it exciting but doable by most anybody on ABC's easy to ride bikes. To the big market with commentary and then back to the beginning. It was all good. I've even recommended it to my expat buddies who now call Bangkok home.

Bang Krachao Trip: Could not have asked for more!. This is a great bicycle touring company. The staff is extremely professional, courteous, and do everything they can to make sure you have fun.My husband and I took a private Saturday morning bike tour to Bang Krachao and could not recommend our tour guide or the experience more highly. Our bikes were in great condition and were checked well before we left (we had every confidence in our guide and the bikes, even while riding through busy streets and intersections). All throughout the ride, we were offered information and tips about Bang Krachao, the people, and any ad-hoc questions we had along the way. A trip to the floating market on Bang Krachao was included in the tour, where our guide became invaluable. She picked out lots of different food for us to try (way more than we could eat) all included in the tour price, which is an awesome idea. She was able to explain what we were trying and really bring incredible local food to a place that was accessible to us as first-time visitors. On the way back to the bike office, we did get a bit of a downpour, but our guide was ready and prepared with rain ponchos that got us back totally try. We really can't speak highly enough about this activity.

Great way to see hidden bits of Bangkok. On was a briliant guide I enjoyed every part of this; well paced, good fun and lots of experiences. it was great to find green and quiet space a few minutes from the city. Highlights were exploring the market, crossing the river on a longboat and having time to chat with our knowledgeable guide.

Fun, fun, fun!. We had no plans and accidentally found out about ABC Bike Tour. Sceptical at the beginning with changed our minds with every minute spent on the saddle. Great ride and friendly captain of our group (massive thanks to JA). Highly recommended to everybody who wants to have fun and explore Bangkok.

Great ride but . . .. My wife and I enjoyed this bike tour very much. We have taken bike tours in many cities around the world, and this ranks as the most exciting bike tour. Highlights were walking our bikes over a creaky wooden bridge that looked like it was from "Swiss Family Robinson"; wheeling our bikes onto the dock to take the longboat ride across the river; and of course, riding on the elevated walkways in the jungle/swamp in the "Green Lung of Bangkok." Riding on the elevated walkways (no railings) was exciting and at times a bit scary for me. I am a very experienced cyclist, but I do have a small fear of heights and falling off things. Our personable tour guide, On, confided that a number of cyclists on their tours do fall off the elevated walkways each year, mostly just getting wet, but some with serious injuries, so I would hesitate to recommend this bike tour for the timid cyclist. Also, we got a little hungry during the ride (we did the morning ride which started at 8 AM, so no time to eat breakfast beforehand), but there was no food offered during the ride except for a junk food stop very near the end of the ride. Other quibbles: contrary to what it says on the company website, there was no wifi at their office, and no fruit offered during the ride. Our tour guide On did a great job of getting all the participants to bond as a group and entertaining us during the ride.

Best way to see Bangkok in an afternoon!. A massive thank you to Ja and ABC cycles for such a wonderful experience. I was in Bangkok for a mere 3-days -an extended stopover on my way back to NZ from Europe -and given that it was my first time in Bangkok I was really keen to find a fun and low key way of getting a better sense of the city. Cycle touring is most definitely the way to do it. I was lucky enough to be the only guest so had Ja all to myself -she is such a lovely, friendly, knowledgeable, capable and safety conscious guide. We biked through a range of different neighbourhoods giving me a really good insight into the range of ways and locations that people live. Ja would stop at key points to give me insightful explanations as to where we were about to go, what we were about to see and useful background information. A few highlights for me included seeing three giant monitor lizards foraging on the banks and swimming in the river, a collection of pythons awaiting for relocation away from human habitation, the settlements under the motorways, the boat trip across the river and biking through the plantations on the other side, meeting a few locals, and learning and testing out a few thai words. I can't recommend highly enough. Kob kun kaa! Amelia

A fantastic morning!!. An absolutely great morning with our very patient guide Michael providing an informative and interesting commentary throughout our tour. We saw and rode through parts of Bangkok (just off very busy Sukhumvit Road) that were in complete contrast to that commercial strip and the short boat ride to the other side of the river brought us to the relatively undeveloped rural area we didn't know existed.We took the private tour - not wanting to inflict our rusty bike riding skills (and elderly knees) on younger, fitter riders and we are very glad we did. Having Micheal guide us around was a real bonus.We cannot recommend this tour highly enough and would certainly do another next time in Bangkok. Thank you Michael!!

Outstanding. The staff, especially my guide Ja, were friendly, genuine people with excellent english. it was so nice to get out of the city and spend some time in the peaceful surrounding areas of Bangkok. In Bangkok itself, the tour and the information from the guide meant that you could understand so much more about the people living there which is why I would recommend this to every and any type of person visiting Bangkok.

Amazing cycle tour!. We had a great afternoontour through Bangkok, with a fantastic guide Já! She showed us the real life in Bangkok and told a lot of interesting things about living in Bangkok and Thailand in general. Great opportunity to see the non commercial side of Bangkok. Kop khun kha Já!! Sawadee kha Paulien

Reviews are right on..great experience. Our guide Ja was wonderful. Great navigation from her, nice information, and a great trip. Would definitely go back for another ride. We bike quite a lot but this trip would be manageable for any skill level.

ABC Biking: A Must Do In Bangkok!. Today we had a great tour through Bangkok, with lovely guide Ja!She told us everything about Bangkok, escpecially about how the ordinary Thai liveand get through daily life. The trip to the jungle (and floating market) was part 2 of the trip. Heavenly snacks on the market and a great lunch made this trip worth every penny.Bikes (choice between "citybike" or "mountainbike") are in tiptop condition. Great way to see the other side of Bangkok. Tour is for young and old a must do!

Best experience in Bangkok. What a lovely afternoon in hectic Bangkok, it made everything much more calm. The guide ON, is so funny and beloved, she want to learn everybody, knows your name, ask about the life in Denmark and so on, makes it more familiare.....You have to be a good cyclist to do this trip....

Brilliant day!!. What a fab excursion this bike tour is! I originally baulked a bit at the price but decided to see whether it matched the great reviews it is constantly getting.... and it really is worth it. A fabulous guide, Ja, who, with her infectious personality, made our day an absolute delight: highlights for me were walking our bikes through the local market; crossing the river on a long boat with our bikes all stacked in; cycling along the paths in the 'jungle'; tasting all the delicious foods at the floating market, and laughing all the way home cycling in a torrential downpour.

Just do this!. I was initially worried about the roads in Bkk, the traffic, the motorists but was compelled to try this out after reading the reviews! We took the dinner tour and basically we have a tour guide who brought us around cycling sometimes on the main roads, pavements and back alleys. There is no fixed itinerary with ABC so it really depends on your tour guide. Our tour guide was fluent in English, jovial and takes note of what your food preference before start of journey. We had so many things really, from herbal alcohol shots said to promote women's well being to papaya salad, seafood salad, durian sticky rice, mango sticky rice, noodles, duck rice, coconut, fruits.. So many things! And I must say, the areas she took us to are places where you would not be able to find as a tourist as the stalls are mostly in Thai language only and secluded behind the alleys! Our tour guide was good in helping with the traffic to fixing bicycles to providing you with tissue paper to taking pictures of you :) Go give it a try!
Don't miss this. A tremendous tour, where you see things you proberly wouldn't have seen. Super guidiance, Seems a bit expensive compared to Thailand prices, but worth it!

must do!. All the good things you can read in other reviews.... are true! We did the day tour, the last day of our stay in Thailand. And it was sure one of our favorite excursions! Thanks to Marcel who told us a lot about living in Thailand, about Thai people, culture,..Sure one of the things you 'must do' when you are in Bangkok!

An afternoon of delight. We accidentally found them and by god we were lucky we did...The tour was excellent the riding was comfortable we just enjoyed every minute of the riding..Great bikes great company great routes..a fabulous day exploring another side of bangkok..Riding thru the Eco forest was so scenic..kudos to ABC team...

One of our favourite excursions !!. Given that we hadn't ridden bikes in a long time, we were slightly apprehensive about doing this tour. However, it turned out to be one of our favourite things we did whilst travelling. We did the morning tour, which was perfect because it wasn't too hot yet. Our guide was very friendly and knowledgeable about the area, and she also had great English. Our group was 6 people, which was perfect. It was really interesting to see areas of Bangkok that tourists would most likely not see otherwise. I would definitley recommend ABC Bike tours to anyone who is looking to get off the beaten track and experience Bangkok in a unique way !Be prepared to have the thrill of cycling along some busy Bangkok roads !!

great "private" tour. may 19th 2013, I visited Bangkok with my mom for the first time. and as dutch people we cannot be in Bangkok without a bike-tour! we had a great tour with marcel with just the 2 of us. Marcel took us to the market and told us a lot about the thai people. we enjoyed lunch and we had a great time. we would recommend everybody to take a bike tour with ABC tours!! Thanks a lot for the great experience!warmest regards,Quirina & Tonny
