Loved the cycle tour!. We really enjoyed the cycling tour of Bangkok. It was great fun and informative. It was also an excellent relief from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. We would highly recommend it.

'Must do' Tour. Went on this tour with our bunch of folks who were visiting to play in a soccer tournament.Had a great time winding our way through the back blocks and then over to the island for some 'path' riding and a super lunch.

thank you very much!. Hello everyone! We are from Holland and know how to ride a bike but this was truly different! We had a very good time with " ONN" she is so funny. Nice tour and good to know more about the inside of Bangkok.we strongly recommand this for everyone who's going to Bangkok. Cant miss it!!!Sandor Mijke and the baby :-) morning tour on 14-6-2013

great cycle. did the afternoon tour, the guys are really friendly and welcoming. getting to see some of out of the way areas in bangkok was brilliant. the cycle is easy going with plenty of stops along the way so anyone can really enjoy it. and the photos they post on the website afterwards means u dont have to be too worried about snapping as many pictures as you can and instead enjoy the ride. thumbs up all the way.

A must see tour of Bangkok. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip with ABC bike tours. Greeted with a fresh tea or coffee on arrival, measured up for a well maintained bike then setting out on a tour of the city you wouldn’t normally venture to alone…quite suburbs, narrow lanes, creaky wooden bridges, seeing life beneath the highway, then a trip on a long tail boat before a peaceful ride through the countryside. Take the trip…you won’t regret it

Highlight of our visit to Bangkok. On our April 2013 visit to Thailand we decided to go on a bicycle tour with ABC Amazing Bangkok Cyclist tours and it turned out to be the highlight of our time in Bangkok. Our group of 6 had 2 guides, new bikes, and a wonderful afternoon. It was a great way to see a lot of the area in a short time. We started with a fresh coffee, drove through low, middle, & upper class neighborhoods, walked through a local, bustling market and shared some local snacks, crossed the river on a long tail boat, visited a small shoe factory, drove through the nearby countryside through a banana plantation, and stopped in a roadside hut for pad thai. It was very reasonably priced for all it included, and was just a ton of fun! Our guides were so knowledgable and fun and friendly. We all felt like we got to know each other and were part of something really special.

Cycling trough Bangkok. We were with four friends to visit Bangkok. For two of us it was the first time.It was for me a surprise that a tour on the bike was a possibility.It was a very pleasant thing to do. The two guides Marcel and Ohn did it very well and with lots of humor. They led us trough parts of Bangkok which we don't should see if not do this bicycle trip.The bikes where in good condition, the drinks enough. Especially the market was very nice to view. We had a nice group of people, so all four of us have enjoyed the trip.We can recommended everyone to do this trip if they like to bicycle in Bangkok.

A great Bangkok experience. On a recent business trip to Bangkok I wanted to get out and at least see some of the City, a friend suggested a bike tour and ABC seemed to be one of the few companies that offer half day tours, which was perfect for my needs. From the time I booked I was impressed with the service, a prompt email response, clear and accurate instructions on how to find the starting point and a welcome glass of water and a good coffee on arrival. The bikes are all of a good standard and Michael clearly knows his way around the back streets and alleyways of Bangkok. It was a great four hours and truly a different way of discovering the city.

Fantastic way to see the real bangkok. What a fantastic introduction to Bangkok this tour was, well away from the usual tourist routes. I was apprehensive about visiting the slums, however it was in interesting insight into another side of life but better than that those that lived there seemed so happy with shouts of hello from most doorways and children high-fiving us! The highlight for me was taking the bikes across the river in the long tail boat. Am our guide was great, we had a brilliant tour, thanks guys.

Unforgettable & feeling and overview of Bankkok by bike. Our very knowledgeable and extremely enjoyable guides showed us in 4-5 h easy drive, the different aspects of the daily life of the Bangkok people, from poor to rich, in the City center, pourer suburbs around Bangkok , under highway bridges. Taking a long-boat, we crossed the river and biked further in a kind of jungle, with small concrete road for walkers and 2 wheelers. A lot of people working in the city AND also growing crops on their own land live their quite nice houses. As additional attraction we had a severe rain storm during our ‘jungle’ meal and biked back, in a soaked Bangkok. Besides our 4p family we were joined by the two guides and a very nice couple Rose a Drake.Highly recommend this type of visit to Bangkok, easy and flexible.

FAB Afternoon Tour. We booked this tour for the first day of our holiday in Bangkok and would strongly recommend it to all travellers ( providing they can ride a bike!). It was a great way to enjoy the city and to see the real contrasts of East meets West. We were a small group of 4 and our excellent and knowledgeable guide provided us with really interesting facts and information. We boldly went where no man has gone before ( well not many tourists at any rate). We did wonder about how we would cope cycling in such heat but it wasn't a problem. We had a brilliant afternoon and saw a side of Bangkok which we wouldn't otherwise have been exposed to. It's a must do experience.

On bike in Bangkok. you get very close to real Bangkok - get great guidence and help from Michael to deal with the trafic, people and understanding of the culture. Thanks once again Michael for a perfect afternoon - Kig op Lærke - we have used the phase all days in Thailand with a smile to remind us of the bike tour.

it was GREAT!. I had a great time with ABC. It made my day in Bangkok. We had a small group and a really good speaking English guide who showed us around the good spots of Bangkok. I loved the jungle and the local floating market. I will definitely recommend this tour!

Well Worth it!. I found out about this company by chance and decided to go for it. As an avid bike rider in New York City this was right up my alley.Ahn (An, Ann) was our English speaking leader and took us through the most amazing section of Bangkok, no cars, fumes and annoyances here...back roads, small neighborhoods and a jungle on the other side of the Chayo Praya river with a raised cement bicycle/walking path.This was definitely a highlight of my 3 weeks spent in Thailand. Ahn is a great leader and answered all of my dumb questions that I had about Thailand in general and took the time to explain sights and places in and around Bangkk on my map after the ride when I am sure she just wanted to get the hell out of there. Ahn deserves a raise and a promotion at this company, she really made this experience very cool. I have been promoting this company since this day for 3 weeks now to whomever I meet in my travels as a must do activity when you arrive in Bangkok.I would have to say that you should be a pretty competent bicycle rider. There are some pretty narrow areas on this trip and as a veteran city bike rider I was a little concerned so, I can imagine, Betty from Ohio who has not ridden a bike since 1972 should not do this ride. Strategy negotiating the pathways and not hitting people, market stalls, children and dogs is a necessity.The raised platform in the jungle took some getting used to.Definitely consider this ride if you are an experienced bicycle rider and ask for Ahn to lead your trip!

The backstreets of Bangkok. This tour is a cycling tour on the backstreets and green sides of Bangkok.For comfort it is best that you ride a bicycle well. The good English speaking guide leades you on narrow roads and backroad neighborhoods.The tempo is not very high, now and then there is a stop to explain the Thai life and eat something from a foodstand.It is great value for money and a great tour for people who like to see a 'different' side of Bangkok.

A different way to spend an afternoon in Bangkok. Andrew and I thoroughly enjoyed our 4 hour afternoon cycle in the good company of Marcel and Michael. Although it was hot the cycling was easy and the breeze from the movement almost refreshing.The tour took us through nooks and crannies that we would never have found and once we had crossed the river by longtail boat we discovered lush green trails and peaceful rural living.. Toilet stops and refreshments en route were well thought out and although I hadn't ridden a bike for 40 years I felt safe at all times.

It`s Fun!. We enjoyed it, though the lunch was poor.The guide was lovely and the overall service good. You wouldn`t find this, unless you got the GPS track of someone who did it, and even though its more fun, just to be guided along , not finding your way by yourself.

group jan wulff. 13 people from Denmark with bicycling in Bangkok It was realy amazing. Find out that Bangkok is must more than cars, smoke and dust. Have the most wonderful guide Marcel from Holland - thank you Marcel

Great experience for the entire family. We did the afternoon trip with our family. Our kids were 9 years and 5 years. Our 9 year son is a good biker and our daughter joined on the back saddle of my bike. We saw a side od Bangkok that would have been impossible without the tour. It was excellent organized, the bikes were in good condition and our guides On and Eddy had a great sense od humor. I will recommend it to all our friends. The the best was I organized it on short notice. Michael and his team accommodated us for the following day.

If you think you've seen everything.... As a dutiful tourist I've visited all the "important" sights, like temples, palaces etc. So, what now? Easy: a bike tour. I booked the morning tour. The owner, Michael, was one of our guides. The other was a friendly and funny lady whose name sounds something like "ciao" and which I have no idea how to spell.The tour leads from noisy Sukhumvit road through quiet side streets and shabby back roads, under a highway bridge where some kind of shanty town exists and fat pigs roam free, to Chap Phraya river, which we crossed in a longtail boat. On the other riverside we rode on an elevated walkway through some kind of plantation.I loved every minute of it. We've seen lots of interesting places we never knew existed. Since every tour is somewhat different I will definetely book again when I return to Bangkok. The bikes (Mountain or City bikes) are well maintained, the price is alright, an easy recommendation.

Must do. Ive done a fair share of bike tours as well as some serious self guided mountain biking around the world but this ride is not to be missed. Michael is a wonderful tour guide that makes everyone feel welcome and adds some humor to the ride. Having walked around Bangkok for a few days I was a little nervous about being a biker in the city, but Michael takes you down the side streets protecting you from the fast moving traffic and providing a wonderful view into the lives of the locals. This was one of the highlights of my trip. If I return to Bangkok I would certainly do it again

Amazing tour. We chose to do a morning cycle tour of Bangkok because of our small children (7 yrs and 18mths). This has to go down as one of the most exciting and amazing things we've ever done on our travels with kids. Even though at times we were riding alongside the busy city traffic, we always felt safe and in good hands thanks to our two guides, Michael and Jia. We loved riding through the back streets and alleyways of the real Bangkok and also taking the long tail boat over to the other side of the river and cycling through the serene countryside. Overall a top rate family experience. Highly recommend it!

Truly amazing!. The Lonely Planet Guide for South East Asia recommended this tour. It was a fantastic experience where you get to know other people as well. Young and old can join this tour and the guides are incredible sweet and helpful. Our guide Aon was helpful after the tour and talked with us about Bangkok.If you have the time and money (1070 Baht) this is defiantly a tour you should not miss.

Great bike tour!. My boyfriend and I took the ABC Weekend Tour & Local Floating Market. The office was easy to find (we took a taxi there) and the bikes were comfortable. We left from the office with a group of about ten cyclists and worked our way through the back streets of Bangkok and into Chinatown. Our tour guide was really knowledgeable and had lots of interesting information about the area and the people that live there, and she even taught us some common Thai expressions.The best part of the tour was on the other side of the river as we rode through farmland on narrow elevated pathways. The floating market is definitely where locals shop and our tour guide let us sample lots of great food (including quail eggs, a weird fruit called gac, fresh fruit popsicles and lots more)! We stopped for lunch at a local restaurant and the food (choice of fried noodles or rice) was delicious!We really loved this tour and highly recommend it!

the best experience in bangkok. My wife Julie and I went on an afternoon tour the 15. of january. Our guide was the charming girl "Ohn" and a guy (sorry cant remember his name:-))We had some ideas how this trip would be - and it was everything that we could ever imagine :-) "Ohn" was very good and she learned our names very fast - among others there where Harry from Canada and "ching ching" from Corea - (We think that "ching ching" had a little crush on "Ohn" :-))It was one of our best experiences in Bangkok and I strongly suggest that you book one of there tours. You will never forget it :-)Best regardsJulie and Lars from Denmark

Loved ABC tours! Must do!. We tried ABC tours after a friend recommended the company and couldn't be happier we gave it a go! The tour and our guides were fabulous! Plus the Thai people while riding around we're just so lovely. Now I want to do a bike tour in every country I visit! Thanks ABC!

Best of the 3 bike tours I did in Thailand. This was the first of three bike tours I did and was definitely the most interesting. I think that distinction comes from the fact that you start in the hustling, bustling, smog filled crazy streets of Bangkok and then go to the peaceful, green farmlands across the river. You couldn't have two more opposite atmospheres. Our local Thai guide, who went by her easy name of Nikki, was very informative. She even cracked a few jokes which was impressive in her second language.The biking is very easy. Most of the time you are on paved and flat roads. Some will be scared on the streets of Bangkok as you are riding right next to the traffic. But you are in a large group, so the cars can see you and it's only about 5-10% of the trip.

Better than expected. Very nice guide (Marcel), and you can't complain about the bikes. The guided tour is both interesting because of the stories and the complete other side of Bangkok that you will get to see!

Even for native Thais it's Amazing!. Living all my life in Bangkok already and so, never thinking that I could find anything new on this bustling city. Till one of my foreign friends started telling stories about the bicycle tour with ABC.When I finally had time I booked a private tour with 9 other Thai friends. Mr. Michael was more than helpfull with finding the right date and times for our tour. We had wounderfull guides who helped us chosing the right bikes. During the tour we felt really safe in the traffic due to the proffesionalism which the guides had. but most of the first half we cycled in the backstreet which were a secret to all of us. From small factories till local markets. Our guides knew plenty of information which for us local Thai people was new as well. Later we crossed the river by longtailboat where we cycled in the nature area of Bangkok. All 10 of us never been there and we've been MISSING OUT. What a wounderfull change of scene and surroundings. Fresh nature smell and narrow paths through the jungle which were very fun. We as well included a local lunch which was also very tastefull...Overall.. everything was perfect for a day out! Surely reccommend it and come back again with my family.

A side of Bangkok rarely seen by tourists.. What fun!Think walking tour involving bikes rather than cycle tour. This is not exercise. Rather, the bikes make traversing this city interesting and reasonably brisk. The tour heads along a mixture of busy roads, quiet back streets, lanes barely wider than the handle bars. Vists included the markets, small local shoes factories, food vendors of various types. Along the way locals make you feel very welcome with cheery greetings and laughter.The tour finishes with a local meal in a local area. Well constructed and damn good fun. Do it if you can.

Brilliant morning. Family of 5 (ages 13 to 50) had a brilliant morning tour. Gets you out in to interesting places you wouldn't otherwise get to, lots of fun and the guides are great. It is safer then you think. Fun for all the family, go for it !

Will absolutely come back again!!. Thx Ong for her great hospitality and amazing tour!I had so much fun during 4 hours-ish journey, snaking ard the narrow streets in BKK then we headed into a small jungle after a short long-tail boat ride... well this itin seems to be similar to other bike tour organizers (I had no experience with others tho), what made this different (and amazing) is the friendliness from our tour guide Ms Ong (not sure if i spelled correctly as its in Thai), she gave us great in-depth background and sharing of how local Thai ppl live and the charactor of the city... i love this part.... its the real taste of BKK, honestly even tho i hv been in BKK for over 10 times, i hv never seen sth like this before...Thx and i will come back again!!!
Perfect. Didn't expect cycling could be So intresting! Enjoyed THE day! Brings you to Nice places around Bangkok!

Graet bike tour through the real bangkok!!. We had so much fun! This tour is really one of the best things you can do in Bangkok. Our guide Nicky showed us so many places we would never have seen and we got many informations about the thai way of life in Bangkok from her. She did this with a great sense of humor and we had much fun riding with her through some streets in China town, a big market in chinatown (where we were the only farangs), so-called slums (you will lern about this during the tour), small pathes through the farmes in the jungle and much more.The trip is really easy to manage not exhaustig at all.We enjoyed it a lot and highly recommend it for everbody looking for adventure

What a great bike tour!. The company is owned by a Dutch man but the tour is in English. (Or if you are lucky that the owner is free and your whole group is Dutch I'm sure you will get a Dutch speaking tour.) We were 8 in our group and had two guides to accompany us.The bikes are great. You can choose your own bike, I chose a city bike and my 11-year old son a mountain bike.The first part of the trip was rather exciting cause we had to ride a small part through the bustle and hustle of Bangkok. I wasn't that much at ease cause I was worried about my son but it really is just a small ride.First stop were the small streets behind the main road. There the guide explained about the Thai way of life in Bangkok. Afterwards we "walked" through a market and had a small stop to taste some fruits.Then we rode to the Bangkok river where we visited a temple. For us it was the first temple to see and our first encounter with a monk. We took our bikes on a boat to cross the river. There we drove through the "jungle" . A very nice route along a very small path!There was a floating market where we got some free time to taste some food and take a look at the stalls.At our way back to Bangkok we had lunch in a small restaurant along the way. The trip is very relaxing (not exhausting at all), you get a lot of info about the Thai way of life and the guides are very nice! It was our first sightseeing day in Thailand and it was a hit!

Cycling through the real Bangkok. This is the best introduction to Bangkok i experienced. We toured through the streets that I had not seen in first two days of Bangkok. Hugh places with landscaped jungles to the more typical one room residence. The glimpse of the life styles of the average working person is not to be missed. Riding the bicycle through narrow paths that no tuk-tuk could fit through. Watching a shoe maker at work in his front room. Riding through the jungle on concrete paths above the water. Not to be missed.

Great escape form the tourists. Ok yes I'm a tourist too, but that doesn't mean I want to spend time around thousands of them!The tour is definitely off the beaten track, with a focus on the back streets and alleys, and the stories of the people who live and work there. We cruised (walked our bikes) through a huge and fascinating central food market where our friendly guide "On" bought us some tasty and unusual snacks. We crossed the river in a little boat and cycled through a nearby jungle. Althought the ride doesn't take a lot of endurance, it does require a steady hand and a willingness to bike through very heavy traffic as well as on elevated jungle sidewalks (less than four feet wide) with no helmets. We enjoyed it a LOT and highly recommend it for active people looking for adventure

See the real side of Bangkok. Having visited Bangkok before we decided we would like to do something a bit different this time & this day tour was certainly that.Aon our guide for the day was wonderfull really charming & funny.After a rather hairy start cycling down some very busy roads we entered an area of Bangkok that see's very few tourists & it was great to see how people live & work.We went through an amazing food market & we ate delicous snacks from a street vendor.The afternoon was spent on the other side of the river in a very rural area where she took us for lunch in a local cafe where we had a really good lunch.It was a great value day costing 3500 baht which included lunch, snacks ,water & even sunscreen if required.

Great trip.. Did this trip to offset jetlad after arriving in Bangkok at 6 am. Private tour for 2 cost 3500 baht. Bikes are ok. Tour guide excellent. Tour covers varied areas of Bangkok and certainly areas I wouldnt have visited on my own. Spent a long time in the "jungle" of Bangkok which was awesome for the first hour but a little repetitive after 2 hours.The ride is slow and on flat ground and would not require any fitness. The jungle paths are somewhat narrow and wet and covered in moss, whilst any competent rider will be fine, its probably not for someone who hasnt ridden much.The only downside was the ride through traffic at the start and the end. Personnally not too bothered as I ride regularly in traffic, but I was surprised we were riding without helmets. Our local colleagues were horrified we rode down the major roads stating they would never do it and certainly not let kids do it.
A must for the Bangkok traveller. A great experience showing the life in and around Bangkok! If you want to see how people live and work not in the touristic area's. Great trip for one day.
Must do. I recommend this tour - takes you thru lil lanes and big streets and the fields across the river. Its not tiring at all - good breaks at regular intervals and very fun!!

Something different!. We did the day tour and loved it. Great tour guides who carried everything from water to drink, ponchos in case it rained and sun tan lotion! The tour took us to places we never expected to see in Bangkok - quiet green places! Market was great and we loved trying the local foods. There was no pressure to go fast - in fact one of our group was not a confident rider and they put her at ease. Have a break from shopping and try this!!

Cycling in Bangkok. Our family of 7 persons enjoyed an amazing cycling tour with Michael as guide through Bangkok's small sois, over the river Chao Praya and into the green lungs of Bangkok on the other side of the river.A tour that gave us an insight into the citizens lives, away from the bustling city mega stores etc.Very recommandable.

Exciting biking!. For sporty types who want to see a different side of Bangkok, you will find it on this trip. You will be cycling on the busy roads (depending on your time slot) and 90 degree turns but for those who are willing to brave it out will be rewarded with a really fun day out.I took part on a morning tour for half a day. This included drinks, some small snacks, a short long boat ride ride and a tour guide who was very friendly, knowledgable and funny. She was always interested in the background of the people in the group and alwaya provided information on thai culture.Thank you for a fun day! Thoroughly enjoyed the experience.

Awesome Cycling Experience. A most do activity, it's the way to see the real Bangkok. The guides were informative and very helpful. The bikes are good quality and well maintained....seats v comfy for irregular riders! No problem with photo stops and plentiful drinks and snacks are provided. As they supply everything e.g sunblock, water you do not need to worry about carrying a bag on the bike, all you need is a camera. We did the afternoon trip and it was 4 hours well spent and a lovely alternative to temples, markets and shopping malls. The ride takes you through interesting aspects of the daily life of the city and a boat takes everyone and bikes across the river. The rest of the trip is on a peninsula which is largely park and wetlands so you cycle on raised paths through coconut plantations etc, quite fascinating and beautiful.

Special & Incredible. Booking a morning tour with ABC is one of the best decisions my partner and I have made. At 1000Bht for a morning tour in which water/drinks are included its incredible value to be able to see sights of Bangkok and Thailand you might never have seen even from walking. Our guides Marcel and Nikki were fantastic. Both knowledgable, friendly and funny. Most importantly though they made you feel safe and well looked after. With my experiences of Bangkok roads, I was slightly worried about how I would fare on a bike, but with Nikki and Marcel front and back, I didn't once feel concerned. Cycling through Bangkok is an excellent way of keeping cool in the heat and the cycling is a gentle gentle exercise suitable for a wide range of ages and abilities. The route is flat which adds to the ease of the cycle.On arrival you are provided with water and if you want, a hot drink (the coffee is the best in Bangkok, so if you like your coffee, I advise you take advantage!!). Once everyone has arrived the guides run through a few rules and you choose your bike. The bikes are brilliant for both the road and off track with brilliant suspension and the seats are very comfortable. The first part of the ride takes you through the back-streets of Bangkok offering you a glimpse into the world of Thai's behind the main strips of the City. A long-tail boat ride across the river leaves you in a world apart surrounded by the greenery and silence of Samut Prakan, where you cycle on concrete paths around a metre wide - but don't panic, the thought of it is by far worse than the practice. The long tail boat ride back across the river is a refreshing break before the return to the busy city. Water is provided throughout the journey by ABC and there are plenty of opportunities to take photos of the people and sites you see. If you haven't guessed, I would completely recommend this as a must-do when in Bangkok.Thanks to ABC for such a special morning and experience - we will be back!

Top Tour - See another side of this amazing city. From the easy booking process, the easy to find Location and then ultimately the Tour was all Perfect. I'd been to BKK 4 times previously but had never seen the City from this perspective! Our guide was insightful, humourful (at times a little too direct!) and kept cool in all situations. Brilliant! One of the best things I've every experienced on Holiday.

" Simply Amazing Cycling Ever ". I Have A Cycling Trip On May 10th With A Very Great Offer Khun Michael.An Impressive Welcome By Marcel Was Indeed Amazing.We Are A Group Of 3 And The Trip Starts At 1000-1500hrs. The Tour Is Incredible And Wonderful. Local People Always Welcome Us And Say Hello Along The Way Which Is Memorable. Many Places Outside The Big City Life Are Simply Beautiful.Starting From Business Area in Sukhumvit Down To Slum Area In Klongtoei, Then Head To Pra Pra-Dang To Experience The Nature Life Style. Such A Big Difference That I have Never Seen Before. The Trip Was Super Well Organized and Both Guides, Marcel And Eddy Are Friendly And Caring.I feel So Save For The Whole Trip Even I'm Not Good in Cycling At All. If You Are Seeking To Experience The Real Bangkok, ABC Biking Tour is Highly Recommended.

Loved it!. Our guide Aon was great! She showed us a side to Bangkok I've never seenogre ions trips. An expat friend who has lived in Bangkok for 8 years recommended this tour. What a great recommendation. We took the morning 1/2 day tour and were lucky to only have the 2 of us plus the guide on the tour. Everyone else have already described it accurately. Its great.You need not be fit, however you should be comfortable on a bike and NOT be too confident - go within your limits. There are some narrow elevated concrete paths that you must navigate slowly (balance!). No need to rush! I walked around some corners rather than topple off. Give some braking distance between yourself & the person in front of you.And enjoy the contrasts of greenery & the high density living under the freeways. It's like no other part of Bangkok.

fantastic day out. We did the full day tour of the "green area" of Bangkok. On & Kai were fantastic guides and as we only had a group of 3 we were able to stop where ever whenever we wanted for photo opportunities etc. The whole tour is on the bike no busing to starting point ! After taking the long boat to the other side of the river the fun really started with the feeling you were miles and miles from Bangkok, not another tourist in sight. If you go on the weekend you will be treated to a local floating market where you get to try all kinds of treats. Most of the cycling is on raised concrete pathways with sharp turns every couple of hundred metres. Just makes for an interesting ride ! Lunch provided at a very local open air restaurant which was great. Really easy to find from the web directions and just a great escape from the hustle and bustle that is Bangkok. If this is your first time or 10th time to Bangkok, I think you will aprreciate this "out of the box" experience.

Unique way to see Bangkok for the more active tourist. I joined an afternoon tour after it was recommended by my friend who I stayed with in Bangkok. We had two guides - one local lady whose name I have no clue how to spell, but we were asked to call her 'cha' and a young Dutchman who joined a couple of months back (the company is also owned by a Dutchman). I'm a pretty active traveller, always trying to either do some sports locally or at least hike/bike once to see places in another daylight, and for me this tour was therefore one of my highlights of visiting Bangkok! Biking through the busy Bangkok city traffic, seeing more residential neighbourhoods you'd otherwise not see, and crossing the water to a much greener place, which was as I understood not part of Bangkok itself - but so close, it was amazing to experience the difference.Both guides had plenty knowledge about the places we went to, were very kind and I felt comfortable biking through the city with them. I'd definitely recommend anyone who's fit and confident to cycle in a whole different setting (I always say this, knowing from experience living in Amsterdam, not all tourists on a bike here should be renting one). And if I do decide to visit Bangkok again especially with my significant other who stayed home this time, I will make sure to reserve some hours to cycle again!

An extraordinary great way to experience Bangkok!. It was such an amazing tour! Our brilliant guide Aon was the extra spice that made the trip an absolutely memorable tour. With wit at humor she made sure, that Bangkok and its surroundings were served as a dish of extraordinary taste - with smells and sights you\'d otherwise have a hard time finding on your own.We enjoyed the day tour very much and would recommend ABC at any time. It truly is a great way to experience Bangkok.

How to see a different Bangkok. An excellent way to see parts of Bangkok the tourists don't see. As part of a small group of cyclists, excellently led by our charming, informative and good-humoured guide Aon, I was able to see how ordinary working people lived and worked, tour the local markets and the docks, take a boat ride across the estuary to a rural village, and get totally away from the modern skyscrapers and big department stores. The cycling is not at all strenuous, and lunch, drinks and snacks are all supplied as part of the very reasonable 1500baht fee. Highly recommended.

best way to see real Bangkok. Our family of 4 (essentially grown kids) did the half day tour of Bangkok. After tuk-tuks and crazy markets, this was refreshing, exhilarating, and great fun. Our guide was a university student that showed us Bangkok that works, eats, and lives on a daily basis. Not all for the faint of heart but colorful and hopeful. Across the river to the jungle of Bangkok on narrow walkways and a stop for great food. I thought I would be scared of traffic but felt safer than I do riding in the US because all the different vehicles watch out for each other. You don't have to be that fit, just adventurous. Since this trip, I look for bicycle tours everywhere I travel. Definitely the best thing we did in Bangkok.

An excellent way to see hidden Bangkok!. You don't need to be fit, but you DO need to be confident on a bike, including a little bit of traffic and cycling on narrow walkways above the khlongs. The tour starts just off Sukhumvit soi 26, (nearest BTS Phrom Phong). It takes you through a local market, over the Chao Phraya River and immediately into rural canal life where the postman delivers on his paddle canoe!Great photo opportunities, excellent bikes with good suspension. A terrific family day out as long as everyone can cycle. Highly recommended!

Fun and Scary at the same time!!. I went on this tour with my uncle - he is more into sports than me. Normally I wouldn't have gone on this type of tour as im not into biking and to be honest I'm abit nervous on bikes. Anyhow I was up for an adventure... Michael and his colleague gave us a very friendly welcome and then in a group of about 10 we took to the streets of BKK! Had an adventure through narrow back streets, big roads with big cars! and out of the city too. One part which we were warned about was abit 'scary' to me but an experience all the same. Despite falling off once and almost toppling over another time I had a great day, trying something different with a nice bunch of folk. My bruises (still on my legs) and I say 'fun, interesting and well organised.

Seeing Bangkok Uniquely. This is a unique way to know Bangkok as many people thought Bangkok is only for shopping and food. My family had a great time and experience cycling in Bangkok country side and busy roads. Local guides ON and OI were very friendly and can converse well in English, introducing the lifestyle and places as we cycle; we get to see the countryside and also travel across the Chao Phaya River by long-tail boat. ON and OI took good care of our safety as we navigated and cycled past the busy road junctions, an experience we will remember.
Really unforgettable. This is a perfect way to know a town as Bangkok in a original way you will never forget! Outstanding and tranks!
Great ride. You´ll see some places normal tourist will never see! Mr. Michael Hoes was our guide and was awesome! Food and water are included. Don´t miss it!

Great Riding - Not for the Faint of Heart!. This company is very organized and experienced with coordinating and organizing bike rides through the busy city of Bangkok. We were warmly greeted upon arriving and provided an opportunity to get to know the other riders as well as the group leader. The lunch was delicious and we really got to see a LOT of Bangkok. I felt like I had really gotten to know Bangkok after the tour.The only thing I wish I had been aware of was that part of the ride involved riding on a narrow elevated sidewalk. Underneath the sidewalk was water infested with loud creatures! It made for a more adventurous ride but definitely not for the faint of heart.

The Best Biking Tour in Bangkok "That you MUST DO!!!". Last week I did the ABC DAY tour with my family and friends. It was really REALLY GREAT!!! The city-side with all the different neighborhoods where sometimes unbelievable even for me and I have been living in Bangkok now for over 4 years and never seen these parts which our charming tour guides showed us. Than the nature side with the green area is perfect and you will see the different parts of Bangkok that you never have seen. It is really AMAZING, so you should take the tour with them THE BEST BIKING TOUR IN BANGKOK!!!! I have done some tours with other biking companies, but ABC is far out the most professional, amicable, friendly well I can go on, but the fact is, they are the best biking tour operators in and around Bangkok.I LOVED IT!!!!!for more information go to their website: www.realasia.net and make a reservation.

The best thing we did in Bangkok - hands down. ABC was an amazing experience. Above all of the wats and the palaces in Bangkok, this was by far the best part of our trip. We did the weekend ride to the floating market on a Saturday. It started around 10am and ended around 4:30-5:00pm. Bo was our tour guide, and she was great (funny, personable, spoke great English). While on the ride, you see things that you would never see yourself when walking around the city - it really lets you see what the real Bangkok is and how the locals live their lives. We stopped at a market in Chinatown for a snack, and Bo picked up some things that we would never have picked for ourselves. She taught us what each thing was and how to eat it. Then you go across the river to the floating weekend market and do the same thing. Bo picked out some snacks for everyone and we tried all sorts of great Thai things that you'd never pick out yourself. Then we stopped for lunch and made our way back across the river. Overall it was a great experience and one of the stand-outs of our entire 3 week trip in SE Asia.

New view of Bangkok in the slow lane. We booked for 4 adults on the 10 till 3 tour Turned out to be an unexpected highlight of the week in Bangkok You zigzag the back streets to china town and thro some deprived areas then onto a boat across river for a few hours around the more isolated jungle and swamps Enthusiatic guides lunch and drinks all thrown in

An absolute must-do!. Perfect tour! My wife and I plus our two boys (12 and 7 years old) where guided through Bangkok by the owner Michiel HoesFor us it was important to have him as a guide as our children like to hear inside stories in their mother language. For European standards it is a bargain, but for Thai standards it is quite expensive. Having said that, it is still an absolute must-do when you are in Bangkok.For the children it is a true sensation to cycle in all the small alleys, or cycle over crowded markets or in the peaceful jungle (Bangkchao) across the river. For the parents it was fantastic too ofcourse

If you want to see how peole live in this great city, you have ro do this tour.. An enthusiastic guide showed us the spots you normally would not go to. If you ever rode a bike at home, you can do it in Bangkok as well! Just try itand you will not be disappointed.

See the Bangkok you would never see. An amazing ride through parts of the city we would NEVER EVER have visited, from middle-class neighborhoods to plywood shacks with infants and dogs lying by the entrance. The visit across the river to the now-wild-growing groves felt like being in another world--not 1 mile from Thailand's biggest city. Riding on the elevated walkways through the swamps was a blast. Fun trip, casual pace, lots and lots to see. Just don't ask Michael (the owner and our guide) any questions about the city, the people, or the country. You're going to get a snarky answer designed to make you stop asking. Not sure why.

A great experience !!!!. Thanks to Michael and his team, my wife and I had a great opportunity to visit Bangkok in a completely other point of view than what we can see through Lonely Planet or Guide du Routard. It was such a great experience and we recommend to everyone !

Best "sightseeing" activity I have done in years - great fun!. We would thoroughly recommend doing a bike tour with ABC around Bangkok.. Having seen all the main sights of Bangkok and plenty of temples after multiple trips to the City for work and pleasure, we loved finding something different to do.The tour was interesting and fun, inexpensive and not too strenuous. The tour guides were knowledgeable and good company and made the trip complete. Never knew there was such a beautiful park, lake and jungle just a stone's throw across the river.Definitely recommend ABC and their bike tours to anyone.

See a different side to the city. We did an afternoon city tour with our lovely guide On. The company is very professional and it was a small and friendly group. The bikes are in good condition and the route was easy going. You see so much and a very different side to the normal hectic tourist Bangkok. From little residential lanes to jungle - really interesting. On the way back it was a bit hair-raising cycling in Bangkok rush hour traffic but that's just another side to the city I suppose! Good fun.

A must do for anyone who thinks they know Bangkok. I've been to BKK countless times and usually can't wait to get out after I've had my fill of shopping malls and street food. I wish I had done this years ago. I recommend this not only to tourists but to resident expats as well. A great idea well executed.

I saw a side of Bangkok I didn't know existed. I have lived in Thailand for over 4 years and thought I knew Bangkok pretty well. How wrong I was! I took the full day tour with Amazing Bangkok Cyclist and they showed me more in those few hours than I have seen in all the time I have lived here. I recommend you see it too! Worth every satang!

An excellent day out. We opted for the floating market tour and were not disappointed. Amazing sights, sounds and smells as well as friendly, knowledgeable staff made this tour one of the great highlights of our trip to Thailand. Cannot recommend it highly enough.

Great tour. We went on one of the ABC bicycle tours during our holiday in Thailand, and I can very highly recommend it.We opted for a full day, which took us over the river on the company's own boat. We took in some really beautiful sites and visited spots which I'm pretty sure we would've missed if left to our own devices - the area was incredibly green and picturesque, and provided some great photo ops. A particular highlight was a visit to a local market, which was really interesting and gave us a chance to tuck in to some gorgeous and authentic local food.The guides were helpful, friendly and well informed, and the pace of the tour was just right - we didn't feel as though we were being rushed along, but neither was there any chance of getting bored. I'd very happily have gone again, had we not been leaving the next day!

Blue tour! Awesome!. Joined the “Blue Tour” last Friday – absolutely the highlight of my stay in Bangkok !!!
Highly recommended

The only way you can truly see Bangkok . We went as a group of 3 and our guide Chin could not have been more knowledgeable and patient. You can do Bangkok from way above but you will not see it's true heartbeat that weaves through the tiny alleys and backstreets. You could experience it on foot but one can only cover so many kilometres in two hours... But on the ease of a bike one can cycle 11kms in a mere few hours, winding through the backstreets of Chinatown to the Thonburi. It was nice too to not be on one of 'those' tours where you're taken to vendors and made to feel like you needed to buy something. Go Bangkok Tours felt genuine. It felt credible and legit and Chin's enthusiasm for his culture and city shone for the entire three hours despite the humidity and heat. Definitely recommend and would definitely do it again! Thank you Go Bangkok Tours and thank you Chin.

Well organised and very friendly. A great private bike tour for my two kids (11 and 12) and I through the back alleys of Bangkok. The bikes are in great condition and the guides know these little alleys back to front. The ride was set at a comfortable place and you are well taken care of. From pushing through local markets to coconut ice cream on the side of the road, nothing is too much trouble. After a month in Vietnam and Thailand, my kids still rate this as amongst the best days they had.

Cycling trough bangkok. This is by far the most entertaining and fun way i have ever visited Bangkok. I thought i knew the city but the guide showed me places even i did not know where there. During the tour refreshments and snacks are offered and the guide realy took safty as a number one priority. We felled save all along the tour.

Had a great day with Raymond. We were a party of three - Mum and two kids aged 14 and 15. We did the half day tour with Raymond as our guide. We have been to Bangkok about 10 times, but I have never seen all the small alleyways and temples that we managed to see today. It was good to do something different while in Bangkok. We all really enjoyed the day. The cycling was easy, there were plenty of stops and Raymond gave us interesting commentary. It wasn't rushed at all.While we were out for the day we saw lots of other bike tours with over 20 people in the group. I would hate to do one of those. By keeping it small it means that we could stop in more places without causing major chaos and was far more personal.Would recommend to anyone, even if you think you already know Bangkok.

Best way to see Bangkok. This was our family's most enjoyed activity during our recent holiday in Thailand. We did the four hour tour with our 11 and 14 year old. Raymond was prompt responding to our email enquiries about the tour and the best way to get to his hq. Mr Peter our guide looked after us fantastically making sure we were comfortable on the bikes, kept replenishing our cold water bottles and getting some local snacks as we went through the tour. He was really knowledgeable about Bangkok and we loved all the little alleys that we rode through. We saw a Bangkok up close that we would have never have experienced any other way. Peter looked out for our youngest and our kids especially loved the break to feed the turtles. He then showed us to a little market where we had a delicious lunch. Would really recommend this tour, the bikes were great and you don't need to be a super fit cyclist to do this.
Extremely recommended. A most amazing experience ever! I did 'go red' tour and it was perfect - if you don't ride a bike in Bangkok, you'll never see the real Bangkok.

Perfect way to discover the city . Such a great tour ! We had an amazing time ! The team is awesome and really friendly, Ray has been so kind to us ! Definitely recommend them for a perfect day out in the city !!!

Unique way to see Bangkok. This was a fantastic way to see Bangkok - biking through the alleyways of the city, and busy markets, then alone through temples and parks when everyone else has gone home. A great mix of chaos and calm. Bikes were in great condition, Peter our guide was great, tour was individualised to us and he was always aware of safety and how we were doing. We loved it.

Excellent bike tour . Company is run by a very friendly Dutch called Ray living now for 20 years in Bangkok. I asked for a tour not listed on their Website: the green jungle of Bangkok. They are doing it, just ask for it. It was a very personal tour with Ray himself as I was the only customer for that tour that day. And it was fantastic, very well worth seeing that part of Bangkok. And there was a nice floating market stopover that day too. Ray is a fantastic guide and knows quite a bit. And he had his fun as I jumped from the river crossing boat too early right into the mud which I thought was solid sand .... Mud happens :)So highly recommended as a bike tour company.

Awesome hours in Bangkok. I did the tour without any guide (just GPS) and this was by far one of my best experiences in Bangkok that I had during my numerous visits to the city. The tour shows you a completely different face of Bangkok, away from the tourist crowds and you have the chance to enter into a new world where you will ride through numerous small alleys, markets, along the riverside, see churches, temples and other interesting places not listed on the standard tourist maps. You will drive away from big traffic and the route is not very challenging besides the high temperatures in July.For anyone visiting Bangkok, aiming to see the city from a different perspective than the average tourist, this tour is an absolute must. The staff is very friendly and helpful and you will get an unforgettable experience.

The best thing I did in Bangkok. The tour took a friend and I all over Bangkok to fascinating places that you won't find on the tourist maps. Peter our tour guide was very friendly and knowledgeable. I would highly recommend this trip to anyone who wants to see Bangkok and doesn't mind a few ours of gentle peddling.

Best Bangkok for your Buck. Before even setting foot in Bangkok, we organized our biking tour with the manager, Raymond, over email.His responses were professional, fast, and extensive. We already felt like we were in good hands before we even set off.Raymond is a guy from Holland who is fluent in both Thai and English, so there was no miscommunication or uncertainty in the set up of the tour that we wanted.Furthermore, upon arriving, he gave us ice cold water, fitted the bikes to our sizes, and ensured that the GPS device was functioning perfectly. He gave us an overview of how to use the navigational program and made sure we had his number in order to call him if anything went south. After a quick reminder to ride on the left, (Never forget to ride on the left, people), we were off and running.The GPS unit, as with all of them, is accurate to within about 10 to 12 meters, so every now and then it looked like we were riding through people's shops and houses according to the screen, but what we found interesting is that the Thai people nearby are so used to seeing a bunch of sunscreen soaked newbies clamber about in bikes, that they all pointed us in the right direction when we inadvertently headed off trail, which as the ad says is going to happen. This is true. You WILL get lost at some point, but not hopelessly so. You will just find yourself in a small road a turn or two too soon, or something similar. As adventurous as it would be to have to fight your way out of the docks through Muai Thai bashing street gangs, that's not really going to happen, so don't sweat it.The path that you take is certainly unorthodox, which in my opinion is the best part of the trip. You wind through narrow roads, walking street markets, housing rows, coast along the edge of the river for a while, and take a ferry twice. (We did "Go Gold", fyi). Many times we thought to ourselves, "No, it couldn't possibly lead through there." Which it did. And after riding through fresh fruit stands where natives are bartering for their produce, or watching people wash their clothes in a basin outside their front door, or hearing cries of excitement erupt from several shop doors at once as the tide in a televised boxing match turns, you find it very difficult to wipe the smile off your face.The points of interest on the trip can be great photo opportunities, but we found ourselves actually enjoying the journey and the experience of biking through the back roads just as much as exploring a temple or sampling native cuisine.The self-guided nature of the tour allows you the perfect amount of control over your experience, and while it is technically titled as a "tour", you certainly don't feel "touristy" on your adventure. And in my book, there can be no higher praise.

Great service, friendly owner and a fine bike. I messed this guy (Ray) around about three times, for various reasons (sleeping in, lost cashcard and phone, etc) and every time I emailed him to explain he was both courteous and understanding, and, FANTASTICALLY, because I was having a nightmare trying to get some money transferred he offered to help me because he spoke Thai - wasn't even bothered whether I wanted a bike or not, just wanted to help. Restored my faith in humanity at a time when I'd had 48 hours of progressively tearing my hair out.In the end I got a great, easy-to-ride (never changed gear once) kind of mountain bike with a lock and lights thrown in. And because I was collecting at around 5pm he never charged me for that day, just for two days - and at 600baht (around 12 GBP) it was a bargain.Had a glorious time negotiating the Bangkok traffic all the way from Silom Rd/State Tower junction to Khao San Rd area, twice! (You need to be confident though because the traffic is busy and chaotic.) I loved it.Thanks Ray, you added a bit of true magic to my holiday. Shaun.
Awesome Tour!. We booked a two hour tour which went around all the parts you wouldn't normally see. Peter was a great tour guide! The photos were a great bonus. Would definitely recommend!

Perfect for renting bikes.. I live in Bangkok and had some friends over. I wanted to show them around myself in the Chinatown area, so went to Go Bangkok Tours to rent bikes. The bikes are really good quality and well maintained. The staff gave us good tips on where to go and we even got the i-pad with gps so we could do our own guided tour. Een echte aanrader!!

Great family bike tour!. My 10 and 14 year old kids and I had a great 2 hour bike trip along the Chao Praya river and through Chinatown in Bangkok. Our guide, Sant, was excellent and set a perfect pace through the small streets and back alleys on Sunday morning. There was almost no traffic or cars to deal with which made the tour very relaxing. Much of the tour was on alleyways too small for a car to even pass through. We stopped at a number of interesting sites, churches, temples, etc. and had 2 ferry rides across the river where we could re-hydrate. Sant also bought us all a coconut ice cream from a local street vendor who served it in a coconut shell -- a great treat for all of us! The bikes were in excellent condition and fitted to the proper size before we started off. Bottom line: a great, if unconventional, way to see Bangkok! Highly recommended!

Bike rent. We rented bikes and went off just on ourselves. The bikes are real good quality, we get a map, water and advises. We had a great time! The next times we definitely will rent bikes here again, or participate in one off the guided tours.

Its a great way to see Bangkok. Must do if you are going to see the local in Bangkok. I like it very much. i choose GO RED and its full of cultural and local. We ride in the small alley. The guide is taking us very good photo.

Bike tour of it's finest. You want to bike in Bangkok - go with "Go Bangkok Tours" ! I enjoyed the culture tour with Ray so much, perfect bike, such surprising ways we took, such a lot of places I didn't know yet, visiting Bangkok yearly since 15 years, so relaxing stops in between, beautiful quiet and shadow places and the best was the visit at the small Portuguese bakery, soo much fun and adventure biking through narrow ways and markets. Thank you so much, Ray, will do another tour with you next year....

Great way to see Bangkok. I went on the black evening tour. I wish I'd taken this tour on the first night I was here as its a fantastic way to familiarise yourself with Bangkok, and work out where you'd like to see more of. To start with the welcome was friendly and efficient. The bikes are a bit like Boris bikes (city bikes) which are great for handling the back streets of Bangkok. Our guide was well educated and had excellent English. The tour itself was fascinating. I went down back streets and alleys that I would never have discovered, or felt comfortable walking down alone. It was great seeing the recline Buddha temple complex at night, a stark contrast to the heat and crowds of the day. The 5pm start meant some of the heat was taken out of the day, however the place of the ride led to a cooling breeze without being zealous. Water provided, a lovely experience. Totally recommend, so much better than the tour I arranged through my hotel. Thanks!

'JUST THE BEST'!!. Don't think twice about doing a bike tour with Go Bangkok - JUST DO IT! from the minute I e-mailed an enquiry about booking a tour Ray was extremely helpful. We did the Gold tour and it was amazing, Sand was our guide and he checked out at the start of the day what we were wanting from our ride and we got everything! We cycled in Chiang Mai and on Ko Chang but this was the highlight of our whole trip in Thailand - what a way to see Bangkok" I cannot recommend it highly enough!PS - the bikes are of a really high standard and very comfortable to ride too - also your guide will take photos as you go which you are sent by e-mail at the end of your tour, a really nice touch! Thanks Ray have a great year!
Rent a bike here!. Great bikes, super service, kind owner, beautiful maps,had a great stay on a perfect bike, thank you G0 Bike Tours!

A MUST DO in Bangkok !. We been to Bangkok many times before but this was first time we decided to go on a guided tour. As we love to walk and biking we said - lets try a bike tour. We are so glad we did. If you stay in Oriental or Shangri La Hotel this company is just one block away so very convenient. Great conditions on bikes and great service, it was only the two of us on the morning trip so we could decide where and when we wanted to stop. If you want to see how the Thai people live and work and also learn more about their religion this is a good opportunity to do. Our guide Sand knew the answers of all our questions and spoke very good english. So the five stars goes both to Go Bangkok Tours and to our funny guide Sand. Thanks for making our day.

Best attraction in Bangkok, real must see!. I live in Bangkok many years now and I thought I've seen it all but I was wrong.This tour showed me the "real" Bangkok and its hidden gems. Fun and interesting bicycle tour with routes thoroughly designed. The GuidePad option make you feel fully free and independant, ready to get lost in this urban jungle!It's the best way to explore the city for Bangkok first-timers and regulars.A must see attraction that I recommend for family, friends and couples.

Super, do it!. The owner Raymond was very helpful as we just wanted to rent bikes to go on our own...We liked it that much, that we came back and did a tour with him and Sand (the other guide) to Sri Nakhon Khuan Park and the green lung of Bangkok....Definitely worth the time and money... The gear was in a good maintainance, not the fanciest bikes but well working for that kind of ride... on our travels through SEA we saw worse for crazy amounts of money... this one is a sure shot!So to sum it up - Do it!

Amazing experience to see BKK by bike. Very friendly owner Raymond who helps you to set the bike seat on the perfect height for you. If necessary he might put another seat which matches your own neats. Our tour guide Peter was great and made this trip to an amazing experience. We had a private guided tour (normally max. 6 persons) and it was worth every Bath we paid. Peter is very talkative and friendly. He knows how to make it as convertible as possible for his guests. He even had coins ready for us when we had to use the public toilets. The tour starts/ends in Bangrak and includes different highlights such as the old customs building, flower market Wat Pho and Wat Arun. At the market in China Town we had a little walking tour through the main allies and visited a Chinese temple. You cross the river by boat and cycle through different parts of BKK. Thank you guys for this amazing experience and we will send all our friends to you.

Must-do Bangkok Trip. Me and my wife did the self guided Go Bike tour today and I cant foresee anything on our trip beating this experience. Big up for Raymond the owner who is such n great and helpfull host, really goes the extra mile and willing to help with anything to make it a great experience. If you want to experience Bangkok close and personal amd immerse yourself with the culture, without a doubt, this is the way to do it, cannot recommend it enough.

AWESOME BIKE TOUR. The bike tour was exhilarating!!! I am a mountain bike and roadbike rider as well and this experience has brought my sanity to new heights ;) Its a different kind of thrill riding in chinatown... In and out small alleys, busy streets, temples and main roads alike. Pee Peter, Pee Mai and Nong Sand were kind enough to assist our group and very much eager to explain to us the history behind each stop over. This tour is a must when in Bangkok! Add me on fb: Mimsie Alconcel

The Best Experience you'll have in Bangkok!. Raymond the owner, answers, replies and makes request immediately and willingly to accomodate our group needs and is concerned more for the experience that the tour participants will be making rather than just to make a profit out of them.The guides Peter, Mai and Sand were another story. They are warm and they will show you the Bangkok that they knew, its fun, dynamic, exciting, wonderful! My group cannot find an adjective that will give justice to best describe the experience we have with them. You really have to book and find out yourself!After the tour you will be given a cold towel, cool drinks and a free fish spa to help you relax and settle. Afterwards they will be showing you the pictures that they took during the tour. Saying goodbye to the team was hard because my friends and I really agreed that this is one of the best highlight and experience we had while we are in Bangkok!

Original Bangkok by bike. My wife and I did the Red tour due to our time constraints. First off Ray was excellent, we had stopped by the previous day and booked our tour and provided our bike preferences. We were able to leave our packs there in the morning as we went to the Grand Palace. When we returned we met our guide, Sand, a young engineer. Our tour started with some basic safety instructions and then off we went. Sand stopped a few minutes later to make sure our bikes were comfortable and then our adventure began, off into little side streets and alleys. We visited areas in China town and other locations you will only see on bikes. Sand was very knowledgeable and did great. If we would have found this company sooner would have booked another tour. Great service, bikes in excellent condition and enthusiastic guide. relax after and have the fish clean you feet. Thanks Ray and Sand for a great afternoon and the tip on getting to the train station by taxi.

Fantastic time, amazing service..!!. Hi Raymond, A big big thank you to Jik and Mai and of course to you, for a fabulously fantastic day. Definitely worth the bum aches and wobbly ventures. The ups and downs weaving thru back alleys, over bridges and along main roads! And all the wet markets!! We were very pleasantly surprised no fruits or dried produce came flying our way while cycling thru...The Thai people are superbly hospitable and gentle.. even when Jik stopped smack in the middle of the flower market, dishing out info abt where the flowers came from.. Both your guides were so caring and accommodating. Ensuring all 8 of us get hydrated, given snacks and even history on these snacks. :-) .. Only wish is they had an allen key.. hahahaa. Well done Raymond! Your shop is great, your bikes are great, the guides are great.. and you are great, hands down, this was the highlight of our trip. Thanks a million. and, oh.. I still owe you 1000bht for that pic we took with you .. Here’s a copy btw. Will ask my son pay you when he comes ok? :-)
5 stars!!. Had an amazing experience !!Peter, our guide took the best care of us Definitely recommend go bangkok tours2 thumbs up!!!

Amazing Customer Service. This is the best tour we never took! My daughters (age 9 and 11) and I had booked a bike tour. When we arrived and began the tour the guide, Peter, felt that one of my daughters cycling skills were not up to the level needed to be safe (among other things she did run into a gate and hurt her foot in the first 5 minutes). I agreed with his decision. We returned to the bike shop and they refused to take any money for the tour from us. I will certainly use this company again when my daughter is a more secure rider because:1. When the cab driver could not find the shop Peter personally came to the area where we were (just a few streets over) found the cab and escorted us to the shop. There shop is actually not hard to find and very convenient to lots of other interesting things so before or after the tour you can go do other neat stuff.2. The children LOVED the tame rabbits in the bike shop and the fish foot spa - this would have been enough in itself to make them happy.3. Ray at the bike shop was super helpful arranging other activities for us, including changing our spa reservations and suggested low cost and interesting activities that the children really enjoyed and are still talking about.4. Peter tracked us down at one of the activities we were at (spa) after we left the shop after the "tour" and returned a stuffed animal mascot to us that we had left at the shop by mistake. We have been taking pictures around Asia for a year now with this stuffed animal, so this was really a big deal to us.5. This tour group is very professional and concerned about safety. They also have a fast response time to inquires, reasonable prices, and stellar customer service.I rarely give 5 star reviews - but these guys absolutely deserve it.

This tour is a MUST!. We went on the Go black tour, which allowed for much cooler weather during the hot month of September. Our tour guide was Sand, and he made the experience so humorous and fun, while giving us knowledgeable information along the way. The tour takes you through main roads, back roads, small alleys, behind Temples, and every which way so you can truly see what life in Thailand is like beyond the typical tourist locations. The Temples were so beautiful, my mouth literally dropped. We were also taken on ferries across the Thai river and Sand bought us fun snacks to try along the way. We could not have been happier with this tour and I would recommend it to all. It was easy to find, and Ray and Sand had us laughing from the minute we arrived. SO thankful to them for providing us such a wonderful experience in Bangkok.

Bangkok by Night tour - Beautifull, Active and educational. We did this cycling tour on our second day in Bangkok. Our guide was Peter. This tour is perfect! In the evening it is less hot than during the day. We saw 'Bangkok behind the scene', how the regular Thai live. We visited the flower market, Chinatown and Wat Pho. During the day this temple complex is really crowded. Now we were the only people inside. Peter is a very nice guide! He is very helpful and a truly nice guy. He loves his job and it shows!

Unique experience. Must try!. I did the Go black tour, joined with other 2 travelers, it's awesome. The tour was well - organized. We were taken to the real bangkok, not tourist attraction. We went through various small alleys, streets with food vendors, chinatown, flower and fruit market, some great temples, the river side, etc., and passed the Grand Palace also. 4 amazing hours of real riding, not walk with a bike! We were danm tired at the end LOL.Our guide, Sand, was super friendly, funny, and skillful. The bike was fully equipped. There were free helmets if required. I highly recommend Go Bangkok tour for anyone who looks for amazing unique experience with real Bangkok life. Forget those tuk-tuk and come here.

An Awesome and Amazing Experience!!!!. This is a long overdue review. My bad. Please accept my sincere apology my dear Marisa and Ray. Better late than never :) I was in Bangkok in July 2015 and was really keen to join a bike tour. Was scrolling down the list of bike tours in trip advisor and when I clicked the website of Go Bangkok Tours I was captivated by its "happy and bubbly" music. At that time, there were only 7 reviews but I trusted my guts and dropped an email to them and it turns out to be one of the best decisions. In less than an hour I got a reply from Ray which amazed me (it was nearly midnight when I sent the email). There were few emails here and there and were all answered promptly and clearly by Ray.On the day of the tour, I reached Ray's shop without any difficulty at all. Thanks to the clear video instruction from the website. I was greeted warmly by Ray. It is such a neat and cosy shop. While we were waiting for my tour guide I was "forced" to watch a safety precaution video for the bike tour...not complaining...it was fun to watch. The star of the show is none other than Ray himself. Talented, comical and full of potential. I found out that I was the only one in the tour and was surprised that the tour is still on. My tour guide was a beautiful and lovely lady with a pretty name...Marisa. She is a GEM!!! When you were with Marisa, the whole tour feel like you were cycling with your best buddy. She is very informative, knowledgeable, caring, attentive and an excellent photographer. She was so fun to talk to. The places that she brought me were just awesome. We bike, we travelled by boat and we walked. We had the tastiest fried chicken and the most refreshing orange juices. I learned how to fold the lotus to a lovely shape thanks to the wonderfully patient Marisa. You can never imagine Bangkok is so much more than shopping and eating. So many hidden places to be discovered. So many lanes to be explored. This really is the road less travel....well maybe to me. I have discovered the other side of Bangkok thanks to this wonderful lady and of course Go Bangkok Tour.Thank you for the great fun Go Bangkok Tour.

Experience the hidden backyards of Bangkok in a relaxing bicycle tour. We went with Go Bangkok tours in the morning with the Go Red tour. After a very warm reception at their HQ very near the Sathorn BTS stop, we drove of with guide Peter. Experiencing Bangkok from the saddle of a bicycle is very special! While traffic may seem to be chaotic at some times, the tour is very safe for everyone who can handle a bike. 90% of the tour takes you over squares, markets, back alleys and by temples. Also it was very nice to be in a small group. At Go Bangkok tours they favor small groups over large hordes of cyclists. I would definately book a bicycle tour again at Go Bangkok, and would advise anyone visiting Bangkok to try it from a bicycle.

Go Red Bangkok tour. We had a really nice bike tour with our guide Peter. The tour was very interesting (we took Go Red). It gives a unique, refreshing view on Bangkok that even the locals might not have seen! Peter answers any questions you might have about temples and explains Thai lifestyle as you go along the narrow streets of Bangkok. The organisation is run by a Dutch guy (Ray) who knows his bikes. They only do small groups, as they like to deliver a good service and make people happy. They also have a DIY (fiets 'em zelf) tour without a guide - however I would advise to take the first 1-2 tours with a guide to enjoy cycling the best.

Best Bicycle tour in Bangkok by far. Wow! I have lived in Bangkok off and on for over 10 years, but I have never seen the city like this. Most tourists only see the city from the Skytrain or in a smelly noisy tuk-tuk. Forget about seeing BKK by tuk-tuk, do it with Raymond at Go! I saw sides of the city that I never knew existed. When they say "back alleys" they really mean back alleys. You get to thread your way through all of the sights, sounds, and smells of Bangkok. This tour was an eye-opener for me. I cannot recommend it high enough.

Greatest bicycle tour ever !. Guide with the Guidepad is awesome, just went with my friends on our own and the tablet show us live where we are currently located and where we need to go. Great tour, lots of fun, can just highly recommend it!

An amazing bicycle trip through the heart and soul of Bangkok. Last September we enjoyed our bicycle trip through Bangkok. Our friends that live in Bangkok took us along this trip and we had Raymond as our great and funny guide. So this is what you can expect, when you book a tour at Go Bangkok...As Dutchies we are used to riding a bike, but we have never biked through the kitchens and what felt like open space living rooms of the local people (the Thai are absolutely okay with you doing that by the way : )The trip literally goes through the heart and soul of Bangkok. It was a great way to dive into the Thai way of living. You will see the touristic highlights if you want to, but you will definitely see places that are normally hard to find. For instance a flowermarket, or an indoor food market where all the smells and colors will welcome you. Or the smallest streets of China town, where people are selling literally everything that you can imagine. Yes everything. Or you will bump into a group of young men that our shouting in front of a television, we thought they were crazy. But later we learned that they were so enthusiastic over a game of muay Thai (and they where shouting because they placed bets on the game : ) So keep your camera ready, cause your will have a hard time to keep up with all the beautiful things and people that we have seen.

The real Bangkok. We had met Peter, our tour gide, and he advised us to take a bicycle tour, because we are Dutch and we love to bicycle. This was the best thing we could have done while in Bangkok. We saw Bangkok in a way you would never see when you would book a regular trip. This was awesome! Peter is very friendly, very helpful and fun to be with. He showed us Bangkok, taking us through very small alleys so we could see how the normal people live. We also passed the most highlights of the city. A real recommondation!

Bicycle Tour. We took the 9am cycling tour and had a great time (the tour took 5 hours). The tour takes you off the traffic-congested streets and enables you to experience a unique side of Bangkok. The shop was friendly and offered good accommodation (also, all of the equipment is in excellent shape). The price was reasonable and nothing on the trip was "out of pocket" (including lunch). Our guide was Peter and he was excellent and friendly. He even walked us back to the nearest sky train stop afterwards to make sure we knew where we were going.

The highlight of our stay in Bangkok!. Me and my boyfriend absolutely loved the tour we had with Ray and Peter. We saw a completely different Bangkok - we went through small bustling streets of Chinatown, drove along the river, saw a local market and a park, with locals playing Takraw. Afterwards, we actually changed our evening plans and had a few beers with Ray. Thank you guys so much for an amazing day!

Something different!. I was staying at the Sheraton and wandering around the local area I came across a bicycle rental company in a small alley off Charoen Krung.Having done a bike tour a few years ago I thought... Why not do one again? So the next morning I turned up and found that not only can you get a guided tour you can rent a bike with a tablet pad which has pre programmed routes on it so you can go off on your own and follow the GPS which also has handy notes on the things you can see as you go along!So off I pedaled confident that at least I won't get lost...... Wrong, given my innate nosiness for small alleys I headed off the set route and into the labyrinth of small streets. It was fantastic but now I was lost.... until I looked at the pad and clearly saw a route backonto the trail... It was that easy.I had so much fun and arrived back needing a cold beer but thoroughly happy with my mornings excursion.The pad is easy to use, the bikes are well maintained and with helmets provided. The sights and smells of inner Bangkok are fascinating and bicycles allow you to access even the smallest streets in this ancient area.I'm going back!!

Great fun an awesome way of sightseeing a chaotic city like bangkok. We had an Amazing day out a bunch of friends and fun discovering things differently begun, guides and services are family oriented nothing commercial here just genuine feelings !

Perfect start to our honeymoon. We booked a day trip tour with BKK as we had three days in Bangkok and wanted to make the most of it, Air was our guide and she was great, we were collected from the hotel and taken to the grand palace which was beautiful but very busy, we also went to the reclining Buddha which was also great to see. Along the way we were provided with cool towels and Air helped us bargain with the locals for souvenirs, in the afternoon we had a amazing lunch by the river and Air recommend lots of nice things to try, this was our first trip to Thailand so we welcomed the help although we quickly realised all food in Thailand is amazing. After lunch we took a long tail boat through the back waters of Bangkok and saw the houses where people lived and fished, along the river we saw huge monitor lizards and fed the fish. We also visited the local market where Air showed us the fresh orchids and local fruits A great trip for our first day in Thailand

BKK Tours only way to travel in Thailand. BKK Tours was very responsive to every email I sent. The tour guide, Air, was very informative and fun to be with. Second time I have used them when in Thailand and each time was outstanding tours. Thank you BKK Tours!

Fantastic Tour of Bangkok. We booked a 2 day tour of Bangkok. Michiel promptly responded to my emails and set us up with Poy and our driver, Pop. It was wonderful. We were on a cruise ship and it was a 2 hour ride into Bangkok from the port but Poy entertained and informed us with so many interesting facts and history that the time just flew by. The first day was spent seeing all of the highlights in Bangkok, The Grand Palace, riding in a Tuk Tuk and long tail boat and eating a delicious lunch to mention a few.
