It was extremely hot and humid while we were there and Poy was very conscious of keeping us hydrated with water and cool with frozen towels.The second day we were going to take a tour of the countryside and visit the first Capitol but we changed our minds the night before and decided to go instead to the floating markets. Poy and Michiel were very flexible and revised our day to accommodate our wishes. The floating markets are incredible and something not to be missed.We had 2 terrific days and I would highly recommend BKK Tours.

Fantastic service. We recently did a few tours with BKK and could not recommend them more highly, from the moment we emailed them the communication with Michiel was super promptWe had ms Sea as our guide and she gave us a wonderful insight into Bangkok in our short couple of days, and we had to make changes on the run but the alternatives offered were also greatI will definitely be telling anyone we know coming to Bangkok to get in touch with BKK

Do not miss this company especially solo travelers. I read reviews of several tour companies for solo travelers suggestions and decided on BKK Tours. It was a great choice. I can only reiterate what everyone else has said. Ms Pecht was wonderful. I went to lunch in places that I would not have gone with a big group, I even let her help choose my food and I loved everything. It was like hanging out with a local friend. We even braved a storm running in the rain to see the Golden Buddah. I had a blast for 2 days. Next time I go back Im bringing my family, and I will use BKK Tours again.

Entertainment city. I booked it for the next day and I met Oi in the lobby of my hotel at 8 am. She is a wonderful happy girl who showed me the city the way that just local people can do. We went to the tour by tuk-tuk . So much fun. Tour is so good.

AMAZING EXPERIENCE!. We stopped in Bangkok on our way to Vietnam. We only had one day and I wanted the kids to get a full experience. I was traveling with six 12/13 year olds. I booked a tour with BKK and requested Ms. Sea after reading reviews from other parents. Ms. Sea was amazing and so patient with my kids. The service was great, we visited so many sites, ate street food, gave an offering at the temple, had an authentic Thai meal. The driver had cold water and towels waiting for us after each stop. I cannot say enough about BKK Tours and Ms. Sea. This was our first time in Thailand and because of our experience on this one day was great, we are so eager to return.

Wonderful experience . Just wanted to congratulate Air for her wonderful tour yesterday, we really had a great time visiting floating market, lunch and visiting Wat Po temple. Great company for a wonderful day full of surprises :-) thanks again

Bangkok Day Tour. We had the most amazing day in Bangkok thanks to BKK tours. We were only in the city for one day and wanted to see as much as possible. We would definitely book with them again & recommend to friends and family. We saw so much of the city & our lovely guide was energetic, knowledgable & fun!

OMG - Absolutely Amazing Day. We booked this tour for our day in Bangkok while aboard a Princess cruise. There were 6 of us on this tour and everyone had a fantastic day. We were picked up in a luxury van (seemed more like a limousine). Sorry, I can't remember the lady's name that was our tour guide - but she was amazing!We toured thru the Grand Palace, had a tuk tuk ride, walked thru the flower markets (absolutely breathtaking), had a long tail boat ride and delicious lunch. All of this was included in our tour price. Our tour guide asked us for any allergies and dislikes for foods and then she pre-ordered our lunch. It was so tasty! There was lots of food but it was so tasty that she brought us out more of the dishes that were our favourites. The chicken fried rice served in half pineapple - WOW! I had the Sweet Thai Iced tea - one was never enough and she was always ordering us more drinks - whatever we wanted. That is amazing service! During the tour there were always plenty of bottles of cold water.Our tour finished up at their tour office which is located in the Shangri La Hotel. My only tip would be that if you have mobility issues getting in and out of the long boat would be a challenge. My mom doesn't have any mobility issues, however at 71 years old, it was stressful climbing in and out of this boat.

Great city...Coming back soon.. In my first time in Bangkok I wanted to do different things but also the "must to do" . I was looking for companies in tripadvisor and I found good reviews about BBK Tours. I booked it for the next day and I met Oi in the lobby of my hotel at 8 am. She is a wonderful happy girl who showed me the city the way that just local people can do. We went to the tour by tuk-tuk and by boat . So much fun. She can speak english and like to talk and laugh like me, so she was a great partner. The place where I loved to go most was the flower/food market which made me realize how rich is the Thai cuisine. She was friendly to reply my questions and to explain me about some habits of the people in the city. Terrific tour.

Amazing!!. Sorry I am really late writing this review but I had to do it as this company is just amazing! We had a walking highlights tour with Air...she is the best guide I have ever had the pleasure of! She met us at our hotel in the morning and we had a walking tour and got to see everything! What was happening on the back streets, all the near by temples, use all the local transport, Air would buy local refreshments throughout the day and give us history on anything any everything we saw, we had the best lunch ever with a huge selection on food, it was just an amazing day and no other guides we had in other area of thailand came anywhere near! I was at a loose end one day as my travel companions were all hungover so I emailed Air to see if there was anything I could do that day, she replied to say it was her day off but she would swing by the hotel, collect me & take me along with her wherever she was going! Just goes the extra mile! 100% will use these again whenever I am next in bangkok! Fantastic !

Totally authentic and amazing Ayutthaya. This was such a great tour! I booked more than a month in advance and replies were speedy and informative. Michiel kindly explained to me that they prefer to show tourists places where we can see authentic Thai life--so no Summer Palace for us, although it was in the area where we were headed (Ayutthaya). Still, I don't regret it, because they even tried to work in Chao Phrom market at my request (it was empty for a Sunday, but that was fine--Miss Petch bought us some fresh mangosteen and taught me how the Thai crack them open). Miss Petch was on time, super friendly, and really knew her stuff. She also bought my sister and me some roti sai mai, which was one of the best parts of the Ayutthaya tour. The tour always took us to tourist spots that had little to no people if these places could be avoided; there was also a great 40-minute boat ride along the Chao Phraya river, and a tasty lunch just beside the same river. The van was clean and spacious and Mr. Popcorn was such a good driver--he always had a box of cold water bottles and packets of cool towels ready for us. The views at each of the Ayutthaya temples we were taken to were lovely, but I think Miss Petch's friendliness, quirkiness, and know-how in keeping up my family's energy accounted for much of the joy of this trip. I look forward to booking with BKK Tours again some time in the future!

Very informative. Had a private tour booked and was not disappointed. Amy had local knowledge, we ate excellent food in a local market. She was on-time, and very friendly with excellent English skills. She asked what we liked to see and tailored the tour to our preference. Value for money and will definitely do it again!

Fabulous. We used BKK tours after reading the reviews here and were not disappointed. We had Miss Sea and she was absolutely lovely. We did a half day tour to the railway and floating market and a full day tour of Bangkok highlights.They were quick to respond to my email from the uk and were so easy to book.They arrived early in the morning in a mini van and the tour in tailored to your needs. They provide water and towels after you have been out of the van- needed in the heat. They also buy coffees and snacks as you walk around. Miss sea also ordered our lunch on the full day tour and gave us some lovely things to try.Thank you for showing us Bangkok. You made the whole experience enjoyable.

Everything was perfect. Fabulous 'Bangkok Highlights' trip with the lovely Miss Sea. Our family of 2 adults and 3 children all thoroughly enjoyed our day trip around Bangkok by public transport. Everything was well organised and we managed to cram a lot in because it ran so smoothly. We visited The Royal Palace, Wat Pho and the flower market as well as many other things along the way. We enjoyed a fabulous lunch, which was included, and finished the tour with a fascinating tour of the canals by long-tail boat. Miss Sea was very knowledgeable and having her to guide us took the worry out of finding our way around a foreign city and working out how and where to pay for everything. Highly recommended.

Awesome. This company is awesome. The communication right from the start is fantastic, and the follow-up throughout the planning process is as well. I looked into several companies before booking, as this was by far the best value out of all of them. I did the Bangkok highlights tour - 2 temples, lunch, flower market, and long-tail boat ride. All of which were extremely educational in their own way. The tour guide was extremely knowledgeable, phenomenal at taking pictures for me since I was alone, and always concerned about my needs (food, drink, bathroom). She knew all of the ins and outs to make it as best as possible. It's clear that they take great pride in the city they are displaying.Honestly, I happened to read a review or two before writing this, and I was kind of bummed that people have them a negative review. I'm not sure why you would opt for an air conditioned minivan for this tour. Taking the local transportation of Tuk Tuks and boats was awesome and made it more genuine. I also disagree that you could just go see these sights on your own. You could..... but you would miss out on soooooo much information that the guides have to offer you - not just about the tourist sites, but about the people, culture, and traditions as well.If you want an air conditioned van and generic information, then maybe save your money and just watch History Channel.If you want an authentic experience with a passionate guide who will immerse you into Bangkok life for a day, then do this tour. By the end, I couldn't believe how much value there was in the cost. I would hands-down recommend this to any of my family or friends who ever came to visit. Thank you for a great day!

Kanchanaburi, Sangkhla Buri and Bangkok tours. This is my 5th year of using BKK Tours and again Air was my guide. With considerable help from Michiel I arranged a custom tour to Sangkhla Buri, near the border to Myanmar. Traveling by comfortable minibus from Bangkok via Kanchanaburi I arrived at Sangkhla Buri for a 2 night stay. The chosen hotel was comfortable and next to the wooden Mon bridge. Highlights of this tour were a boat trip visiting abandoned temples and a visit to the Myanmar border at the Three Pagodas Pass. Traveling back to Kanchanaburi we visited Hellfire Pass to walk the 2.5km trail and the following day visited the Erawan Waterfalls, walking to all 7 levels. After a short stay in Kanchanaburi I returned to Bangkok and 2 further day tours with Air. The first was a custom city tour, starting with a visit to 2 small silk factories near the Jim Thompson house. Afterwards we used a public canal boat to visit some smaller temples. The second trip was outside Bangkok by minibus visiting a railway market and 2 floating markets. The railway market was very memorable as we travelled back through the market by train after watching it arrive. I would again highly recommend BKK Tours and the railway/floating markets tour in particular.

Great experience--but way overpriced.. We opted for the minivan because it is rainy season. The tour guide was knowledgable and the driver drove smoothly. We had a good time visiting the temples (2), flower market, and restaurant, but quite honestly, all of that could have been accomplished in a few hours instead of seven. I feel like the tour guide was tasked with maximizing the time spent at each destination because it became very clear early in the tour that $275 for two people going to a handful of places was extremely overpriced. This tour is great for those who have very little knowledge of Thailand, 7-8 hours to kill, and $275 spare change. The fact that we chose the minivan and not the local transport would not have a made a difference in the experience. This tour made us realize that not all Trip Advisor reviews are unbiased. We relied on the reviews to make the decision to go, and we regret it.

Top notch!. We did three tours with BKK with our two teenagers and all all were absolutely fantastic (Bangkok highlights, Ratchaburi and Ayutaya).Thumbs up all around. The whole experience was awesome.Michiel the owner helped me choose the tours according to our schedule and aspirations.The booking process was smooth.The team (Sea, Oi and Est the driver) was very professional and looked after our every need throughout the three days.I can only strongly recommend this company.Thanks for everything guys!

Fantastic Tours with knowledgeable guide. We took the 1 day Bangkok highlights tour and the half day markets tour which took us out of the city. While a little bit expensive, it was ideal for 10 of us (including small children) as otherwise we would have wasted a lot of time figuring our where to go and getting transportation.Our tour guide, Phet was lovely and went out of her way to help us on our tour. At the end of the Markets tour she even stayed with us longer to makes sure we got vegetarian food for lunch and also that we got back to our hotel.I would highly recommend this tour for those who have a short time in Bangkok, although it is a little bit pricey.

Overpriced. We took the full day Bangkok Highlights Tour and opted to have a mini van as our transportation. The van was clean, spacious and the driver very courteous providing us with water continuously. The tour guide Nadia was great, very polite and knowledgeable. However, for the fees of guides you could hire at each location, plus transportation via uber, the cost of roughly $275USD was definitely not worth it. I would recommend researching your own methods of transportation and it would be just as good and more inexpensive.

Private tour of Bangkok. Again, Tripadvisor never fails! We booked this private tour of Bangkok after recommendations from others on here, and after friends of ours had also used the same company. We were met very promptly in our hotel lobby by our guide and spent the whole day learning about Bangkoks history. Even though we packed in so much, we never felt rushed - the pace was just about right! I would recommend BKK tours, all staff were incredibly helpful and polite. Thank you for helping us make the most of our trip to Bangkok.

Great day !. We took a tour with BKK to visit Tha Kha and DS floating markets.. I was afraid there would be a great many people on the markets but as we started out very early it was perfect. Ms Air is really sooo nice and very knowledgeable. We stopped to have lunch and she helped order very good food. The only thing is I wished the restaurant had some people to get the feeling of local life. We were the only customers.But overall we had a great time and the driver was very good.

Superb, Fantastic, Magnificent Tours. Want something truly great try bkk tours. I had read about them on tripadvisor and was a bit sceptical about it. Nothing is this perfect i thought, but boy was i wrong. We booked 2 tours 5 months ahead of time. You need to do so in order to be sure you get them, because they are very popular (and great). 1. tour was Bangkok Highlights with local transport. We saw most of what you need to see in Bangkok and got to ride with alot of interesting transport forms, boats, tuktuk, sky train and the likes. All the time Ms Air made sure we were happy and got Water and food and tastes of Bangkok. If i was to describe in detail what we saw then it would fill several books so i will abstain from that. But everything was described by Ms Air so that we all knew what we were seeing and that in a super way not the boring old historic way.We also tried the Authentic Markets tour and this was yet Again great. I cannot recommend BKK tours enough. Having traveled to Bangkok 7 times these Guys are absolutely the best tour Company and most dedicated people i have met. So much included in the tour that i wasnt expecting. Like lunch, Water, soda, small treats along the way. A boat tour in the floating market. If you want to impress your Family by book a great tour, these Guys are the ones to get hold of. Thank you Ms Air and BKK tours.

BKK Tours.......Brilliant!. What a great choice we made using BKK Tours! A very professional & efficient company whomn I'd highly recommend. I added the half day railway market & floating market last minute from Chang Rai, but Michiel was most helpful and informative and nothing was a problem. Met at our hotel reception by our lovely guide Lucky, the first afternoon & Oi the following day. Both were very knowledgable and made the tours fun and informative. We got to taste, see, travel & more with these lovely guides. Travelling in an air conditioned mini bus to the railway market, cold bottled water is provided and cold refresher towels. We also travelled by tuk tuk and the metro which gave us a real insight! Both tours were excellent. As mentioned we did the railway market & floating market 1/2 day tour and the Bangkok highlights tour. I would thoroughly recommend both. I won't mention too much as do not want to spoil what lies ahead for you! Thank you Michiel, Lucky & Oi for making our stay in Bangkok an enjoyable one.

Great tour of railway market and floating market. We highly recommend the half-day tour to a railway market and floating market. Our guide, M, was very friendly and knowledgeable, and also entertained our kids. We were lucky with traffic and managed to catch the train - we particularly enjoyed arriving at the railway market by train, it's amazing to see the stalls fold and unfold as the train goes by! The floating market tour included a glimpse of the local shacks, not just the pretty market front. We also got to taste some of the market foods!

Best Way to Experience Bangkok. My cousin and I joined BKK tour on the first week of July. We had their Bangkok Highlight and Ayyuthaya Tour, and a customized tour to JJ Market. Our guide was Ms. Phet and our driver was Mr. Ed and they're surely the best pair and were helping us a lot and made our trip to Bangkok very memorable.Ms. Phet was really informative and had a vast knowledge about the history on Thai. She told us in very detail about the history of each places and managed to seamlessly connecting the histories of each places that we visited so we got the whole history of Thai kingdom. She even prepared us on some history background of our next destination to Chiang Mai/Chiang Rai so we could see the connection between what we saw in Bangkok and Ayyuthaya with Chiang Mai/Chiang Rai areas. Her explanation was so detail and she did everything to make sure that we had all our questions answered with the correct facts. She also gave us a lot of insight about the local customs and about the life in Bangkok. When we visited the food market or as we sat for lunches she also told us a lot of things from the food on our table to some fun facts about the place we ate. She was also very good in accommodating our needs throughout the trip, either for some break from the walk to finding the easiest way to accomodate our limitation. The only time she wasn't really fluent with the situation was during our trip to JJ Market. She was also a little bit lost like us and hardly explained anything but for some local desert on the main entrance. But she did help us to bargain and even informed us if it was a reasonable price. Our driver Mr. Ed was also very cheerful and fun. He never failed to greet us cheerfully and readily with some wet towels and cold drinks. He was also always making sure that the car had the air con ready as we stepped in from the heat of Bangkok. Overall we're very satisfied and impressed with this tour and with the guide and driver that assigned to us.

.Book it !. Highly recommended, Mrs Air was fantastic, knowledgeable and very good English, so lovely and funny. we spent the whole day with her on a Bangkok Highlights tour. so many places to see , it was brilliant. if you are in Bangkok only for a short time, just book a tour or two as you will see more than on your own. we wouldn't see one fourth of what we saw in one day. money well spent. included food, transport,snacks and drinks. really enjoyed it, thanks!

Excellent transfer and tour. We booked some transfer services with this company and also the city tour to visit Bangkok, and it was an amazing value for money. Their rate was really competitive and emails were answered very promptly. Highly recommended.

Wonderful Day in Bangkok. My husband and I had a most interesting and enjoyable experience touring Bangkok with Air from BKK Tours. We were on a cruise and took their Highlights on Bangkok Private One Day Tour. They were very prompt, courteous, fluent in English, accommodating, sociable and knowledgeable. We truly felt Air cared about us having the best day possible. Their tour was even more economical than the cruise ship excursions. Thank you Air and BKK Tours.

fun, informative, customized, and superb in every way!. As soon as I confirmed by trip to Bangkok, I immediately contacted BKK Tours so they could create another customized experience for me. Last year, I had the pleasure of accompanying Air on the Bangkok Highlights tour of the Grand Palace, Wat Phra Kaeo and the flower market. I remember feeling like I was exploring the city with a friend who provided a cultural and historical context along the way. This year was no different. In reaching out to BKK, Michiel did a fabulous job of creating a customized itinerary based upon my preferences. He was prompt in his reply and comprehensive in providing multiple options. To my delight, Air was available again this year and took me on a tour of the Damnoen Saduak floating market, Maeklong railway market, and an afternoon in Chinatown. We met in my hotel lobby at 7am and were promptly whisked away in a air conditioned van towards the Ratchaburi province. Along the way, she pointed out the salt farms and we stopped at a coconut sugar farm and we were able to taste the product. So delicious! When we arrived at the railway market, we enjoyed a cup of coffee before strolling along the railway. We were able to view the train's arrival and departure and had plenty of beautiful photo opps. We then made our way to the floating market and climbed into a non-motorized boat which set sail at a very leisurely pace. We were there on a Tuesday, so it wasn't very crowded. This is preferred as I understand that weekends can be very busy. So, if you have the choice, go on a weekday in the morning's. Air discussed the history of the floating market and we stopped by a few vendors based upon my interest. There are many merchants; and, as we strolled along the canal, there is a diverse assortment of food choices and it's fun to see the merchants cook the food in their boats. This was a truly unique insight in to Thai culture and everything you eat will be delightful. Next, Air planned for us to have lunch on our way back to Bangkok. I can't remember the name of the restaurant, but it overlooked a river and the food was incredible. We had traditional Thai Pad Thai, crab with yellow curry, and chicken with cashews. Yum! It's little touches like this that create an experience that is both informative and fun. The van was stocked with cold water, fresh towels, and was so comfortable I was able to put my feet up and recline to rejuvenate as we journeyed from one location to another. Our final stop was Chinatown and this bustling epicenter of Bangkok presented itself in all it's glory. We walked through a market, strolled along Yaowarat Road, and discussed the location and the emergence of Chinese culture in Bangkok. In reminiscing about my experience with Air and BKK Tours, I can honestly say I will always contact BKK Tours when visiting Bangkok if not for another unique tour, but to reconnect with a friend who truly enhanced my trips to Bangkok. Michiel/ Air, thank you from the bottom of my heart. I hope to see you again someday :-)
Great. Took a full day tour with Ms Sea. What a great day we had visiting all the famous sites and a lovely boat trip to be brought back to our hotel. Would definately recommend them.

Perfect in every way. From the tour itinerary, to our guide, Ms. Oi, the plush van and its driver, the Ayutthaya day tour was extraordinary. They allowed us to delay the tour start time so we would be at the ruins during sunset for photo opportunities. Not only was the lighting better, but it was also cooler at the temples. The day was diverse at each unique site - never a dull moment. Lunch on the river was enjoyable as well. Don't hesitate to book this tour with our guide, Ms. Oi. Thanks BKK Tours for an exemplary day!

Most awesome guided tour. If you are at Bangkok just speak to Michelle from Bkk tours who would help plan your day wise schedule and then provide a guide in our case Ms. Air who made our trip the most memorable . We took two full days of guided tours covering Bangkok city and ayyutaya which was fabulous. Ms air was lively, informative and also accommodated slight change in schedule requested by us. Our parents who were old and children was also engaged well in the two daysSufficient water and refresh and all ticketing was taken care as part of packageSo if you are at Bangkok just call in Bkk and speak to Michelle

Great tour and service. . Hello, I just been to the floating market with BBK Tours, and it was a great experience, the service what's great when I was asking for information, there were really good answering my questions, and good response time. I actually quoted 3 different company's, and I stay with this one because they offer me an extra market that was open on weekends, and the other company's didn't even mention it, the driver and guide were on time at my hotel, and we got there on the time we were expected, they actually have a company shirt which give you a better experience, on the quote they told me we will have some test fruits and typical Thai food, which was included. I've been on a different company on Bangkok, and by far BBK Tours gave better service than the other one. And they are a pay pal affiliated company, which is always good.

Awesome experience with Nadia. Had a wonderful day with Nadia our guide. We started at 9am instead of 8 since we arrived in Bangkok from Dallas, TX at 2300.Nadia met us at the hotel took us to the flower market, got us a snack and Thai Iced Tea, then we went to Royal Palace. We then had lunch and went to Wat Pho and ended the day with a private boat ride.Nadia went above and beyond and did an excellent job. She gave us ideas for the remainder of our trip, and made us dinner reservations. We would not have learned as much as we did without her.

Rachaburi Highlights with Oi. Booked a one day Rachaburi Highlights with BKK Tour. Promptly reply on our reservation and you need to pay a deposit via Paypal beforehand. Oi is our tour guide for that day. She came and picked us up at the agreed time. Both driver and Oi were very attentive to our needs. The main reason i booked Rachaburi Highlights was to go to Tham Khao Bin Cave. By the time we went there around 5pm we are the only group of visitors and it was after rain. I have absolutely no regret of visiting because it was a wonderful experience for me. It might get abit thin in air while you walk deeper into the cave. Just make sure you wear comfortable clothes. I will recommend BKK Tour.

Another exceptional tour with BKK. Having done tours with BKK Tours on three previous occasions we felt no need to look anywhere else for our day trip to Kanchanaburi. It was a long day starting at 7am and getting back to our hotel almost 12 hours later but it was most definitely worth it. Our guide Air knows so much about the area and the history of the Thai-Burma railway. It was an incredibly emotional experience visiting Hellfire Pass, the war cemetery and Railway Museum as well as a walk over the Bridge over the River Kwai, a breathtakingly beautiful longtail boat ride down the river and an incredible lunch at a gorgeous spot overlooking the river....one of those hidden gems that only Air seems to know about. There is no way we could have crammed so much into the day if we had tried to organise this ourselves. It is so nice to have a guide to take care of absolutely everything from entry fees, the best order to visit attractions to avoid the crowds, knowing where the toilets are, great photo opportunities, organising cold drinks and snacks from street stalls along the way, not to mention having a wonderful and very skilled driver with an incredibly luxurious and comfortable van (think first class air travel!). We have no hesitation in recommending BKK Tours to anyone who wants a premium private tour experience. It is also an added bonus that BKK Tours will not include any attractions on their tours that exploit animals. We wholeheartedly support their ethical stance.

Best Tour Guide in Thaiiland!. My wife and I did the highlights of Bangkok tour with Ms. Air and it was amazing! She was very accommodating and knowledgeable and knew where all the good spots for pictures were. We beat the crowds and had a very pleasant experience. Highly recommend this tour! Ask for Ms Air!

2 day fantastic touring. My wife and I booked two tours, the Bangkok Highlight and Authentic Ayutthaya tours whilst staying in Bangkok for 3 nights.Our guide was Air who is one of the owners, she shares her love of her country with you and takes you on all sorts of transport for the tours which is a fantastic way to see everything!You are really taken care of and taken on a journey of sight, sounds and tastes of Bangkok.All water is supplied, and lunch was great for us as we wanted to eat authentic Thai food(spicer the better!).Nothing negative to say on both trips and the driver of our 2nd trip Bob was amazing!

Wonderful Bangkok Highlights Tour. Had the most amazing day with Ms Petch and BKK tours. A most professional company with great communication from Michel from the very start. We decided on the Bangkok Highlights tour as we only had one day in the city. We were picked up from our cruise ship in a very nice air conditioned minibus. We were a group of 4 friends so a private tour suited us well as we aren't keen on the much larger organised ship's tours. Best decision we ever made as Ms Petch was extremely knowledgeable and helpful throughout the day. Drove through Chinatown, visited flower market with Tuk Tuk ride and Grand Palace. We then had a trip on a long tail boat up the river/canals and a wonderful lunch ordered by Ms Petch. This was undoubtedly the best meal during our Asia cruise - one of our group is vegetarian and Ms Petch took care to order many dishes to suit everyone's taste. If you are thinking of booking a tour, do not hesitate to go with this absolutely first class company!

Excellent tour experience!. While on honeymoon in Bangkok we decided to book a full day tour of Bangkok Highlights with BKK as we were only in the city for 4 nights and wanted to do as much as possible. When booking the tour we had asked if we could squeeze in a trip to Chinatown as well and they told us that was not a problem, even though it wasn't on the list of tour stops.Our tour guide, Oi, met us in the lobby of our hotel and we headed to Chinatown in a taxi. Here she explained all the different stalls and food and about different Chinese traditions and beliefs. We then headed to Wat Pho, the Reclining Buddha and then on to the Grand Palace. She showed us which Buddha represented our day of birth and different ways of praying as well as being extremely informative and answering all questions we had. As Wat Pho was getting restored while we were there she even took us to meet some of the men working on the feet and they showed us pieces of the mother of pearl they were using and how they created the design, which was a great extra!At lunch she talked us through the best dishes to order and the food was amazing! After lunch we heading on a river boat cruise where we even stopped to feed the fish. We ended the day at the flower and vegetable market which was a great experience.Throughout the day we travelled by taxi, boat, Tuk Tuk and Skytrain which was a great experience. Oi was fantastic! She had so much knowledge about Bangkok and kept us laughing throughout the day. She constantly made sure we had water and cold towels and even bought us a little flower garland at the flower market as congratulations for our wedding!I can not recommend this tour and Oi enough, we loved it!

Simply amazing . We started our tour with miss oi at our hotel. We had no idea what to expect because I literally emailed the bkk office and asked them to set up a two day itinerary michel was fast in replying to all my emails and explained the payment system perfectly we decided to pay on the two different days the fees for those days in cash on the day. Our first stop was china town. It's a must. Then to wat po (lying down Buddha) I've been here 2 times before but Fiona hasn't. oi was really informative and she was also an amazing host. She saw we was struggling a bit in the Bangkok heat. And got us some cold ice towels much appreciated. After this is was off to the grand palace again as informative as possible due to the shear amount of crowds. We got some pics and then went for lunch. Lunch was lovley oi took us out of our comfort zone and ordered some appetisers for us to try. (Really tasty) after lunch we went on to the river on our own private long boat and went down one of the canals again this is a must. All in all the first day was amazing. You can walk round the templesand sights as much as you want without a guide it's pointless. Oi also showed us how to use the sky train and how to get to various destinations on the night time. I feel I've missed so much off this first day review but there was too much to tell. Second day we was picked up at 7am and off to the train market and floating markets then a trip to a palm plantation and lunch. After lunch we went up a temple to see the view of Bangkok a must see. We really enjoyed our time with oi and feel that we got a great guide who knew her stuff but went above and beyond her duty as a tour guide to make us feel comfortable. Anyone thinking of going with bkk tours. You must. Great company to deal with and if the other guides are half as good as oi you are in great hands.

Excellent. We took the most popular highlights of Bangkok in one day tour and it was excellent, in no small part due to our guide Ms Air. The tour itinerary and details are available on their website so no point in repeating them here, let's talk about the service. Ms Air was probably the best part of our tour. Tremendously knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. It was a hot day and the constant stream of cold towels and cold water that she conjured up for us was a life saver. The off the beaten track Klong (canal) tour was something we'll always thank her for. It was an eye opener for me even though I had spent three years in Bangkok earlier. The visit to the markets was nice too. At Lunch , she took care to introduce us to typical Thai dishes that were simply wonderful. All in all, a very good experience and one that I would recommend wholeheartedly.

A weekend in Bangkok. We had a weekend in Bangkok to see the city and booked BKK tours based on favorable Trip Advisor reviews. We saw the reclining Buddha, floating market, railway market, canal tour, flower market and the Grand Palace (the Emerald Buddha was closed) Our guide, Ms.Oi was very pleasant but not very informative. I overheard other guides who seemed to be much more knowledgeable and animated. It was extremely hot which made sightseeing unpleasant. I strongly recomend skipping the Grand Palace. We were pushed and shoved by hoards of Chinese tourists. A man lost his child in the crowd and was wailing uncontrollably. It was dangerous, a diasaster waiting to happen.Overall, the tour allowed us to see a lot of Bangkok in a short period of time but much of it was spent in traffic and fighting crowds.

I would do it again. Great personable tour of Bangkok.I had the most memorable time with Ms Petch as my guide. She was so nice and very knowledgeable.She met me at my hotel and took me all over the city . We visited the Grand Palace, Wat Pho , Flower Market and China Town. Along the way we had lunch and took a long boat through the canals .Fantastic way to to see the city and spend the day. Ms Petch went out of her way to make this one of the best days in Bangkok I've ever had .

A Must Do in Bangkok. We were met at the arranged place at the terminal on time and whisked off for the day in a luxury van. Sky, our guide, sat with us on the way in and was a wealth of knowledge. She was very friendly and happy to adopt any requests. She looked after us in the crowds in the Grand Palace, took us on Tuk Tuk rides and provided a wonderful lunch in a local restaurant. The private long tailed boat ride was an adventure and would recommend this tour for any able bodied adventurers.

Great Tour!. Cie was our tour guide for a tour of Bangkok from a cruise ship. She and the driver met us at the cruise ship terminal on time and had us back on time which is important that we do not miss the ship. The tour was well organized and fun. They treated us well with cold water and cool towels after every stop which was well appreciated as it was hot and crowded at the temples. Saw two temples, lunch, a tuk tuk ride, the flower and fruit market and a boat ride along the river. Cie gave us hints on how to see the temples with minimizing the crowds. Even rented a shirt for my wife who left hers in the van (one that covered the shoulders). Delightful tour. I highly recommend BKK tours.

Unforgettable and Fantastic Memories. The railway market tour was indeed a great addition. Thank you for recommending it to us Michiel. Miss Air has left a fantastic lasting impression on all four of us. She always gave us the best. Be it from delicious snacks to places to be or viewing points. She also took good care of my 69 year old mum and two of my other cousins. Their advice and recommendations are a great help. Thank you team Bkk Tours. We had an awesome experience.

Disabled people need not apply. I contacted BKK tours asking for a person who could meet us at the Asia hotel, take us to the Grand Palace and Wat Pho and then take us back to the hotel. A simple task for a tour operator of any eptitude, I would think. I also said if we went there by car that I would need the trunk to accommodate a wheelchair. They replied that I should go with a wheelchair tour company as it as hot there and I would have a better experience. They did not ask me any questions about my situation. They simply fobbed me off. As it happens, I can walk short distances and only use the chair for long ones. But clearly, they did not want to be bothered. So if you need a walker or a chair for anything, don't apply here.

Authentic Ayutthaya with Miss Petch. We reserved the tour on Thursday; we arrived in Bangkok on a Friday, and only then confirmed our booking for our tour to Ayutthaya on Sunday. I was expecting to not get a good tour on such short notice, but I was proven wrong.Miss Petch of BKK Tours met us at the lobby of our hotel cheerfully and professionally, in good English. On the way to Ayutthaya, she was more than happy to answer our unrelated questions about Bangkok, Thailand and Ayutthaya (eg. how to say "thank you", what education was like, what "Bang" means). Using a map, she gave a rundown of the geography of Ayutthaya and showed what we would be doing for the day and where. Our first stop was Bang Pa-in, which was very peaceful and serene. No crowds at all, unlike the attractions in Bangkok. We went to a temple that looked like a Christian church, which my parents loved (them being Roman Catholic), where we were blessed by one of the monks for health and luck. We then got on a boat down the Chao Phraya river. It was a very peaceful Sunday, with the residents swimming in front of their houses and waving hello as we passed by! At Wat Phanan Choeng, there were a lot of people paying their respects to the giant sitting Buddha, so out of respect we didn't enter the chamber itself (we viewed it from the doors).Our van brought us to lunch at a great riverside restaurant with delicious authentic dishes (try the fried fish, the seafood tom yum and the chicken curry!), and we felt very relaxed and very full.The van shuttled us to each of the ruin sites, which are very well kept. It would seem the Thais treasure their culture very much, as some restoration was going on even while we were there. Miss Petch told us that once there was a big flood and lots of money was poured into keeping the ruins from crumbling. Wat Chai Wattanaram was especially beautiful among the ruins.Throughout the tour, Miss Petch gave us overviews of the various kings, how there have been four capitals, how invaders destroyed the once-grand capital. It was impressive and she communicated very well in English. She was sweet and was even willing to answer our questions about herself. She shared that she especially loved the Ayutthaya tour because it's quite peaceful, and she showed her love for the tour it in the way she talked about the sites. If you are going on this tour, ask for her!Our van was spacious and airconditioned and fully equipped with a chest full of ice and water and towels, which were incredibly important under the hot Thailand summer heat. Bring lots of sunblock, small towels, as well as an umbrella and a wide brimmed hat. Make sure your shoulders and knees are covered, both for the purpose of the temples and so that you aren't too sunburnt! Be careful with your phone as well, as it can overheat if you use it for pictures.

Fantastic day. We arrived in Bangkok on Thursday 7th April and were met by our tour guide, Air, at 8am the following morning for a day trip round the city taking in the Royal Palace, Wat Po, flower market and more. We chose the local transport option which involved travel on the underground, tuk tuk, long tail boat and skytrain. Our group of four were looked after all the way round, after paying for the tour we never paid for anything again all day, water, transport, lunch, juice, more water as needed, everything was supplied.Air was fantastic, funny, engaging, informative. We had a fantastic day, seeing so much more than if we had gone round the city on our own and Air added that special touch.Highly recommend to anyone in Bangkok.

Perfection!. 2nd visit to Bangkok and we wanted to arrange tours before we arrived to save time. Email communications were quick and efficient and booked in the UK without having to pay anything up front which helped. As we were on honeymoon we chose a private tour and it's well worth the extra money. Miss Sea was our guide on both days and she was brilliant. Very polite and kind. The driver was just as helpful and welcoming.Ayutthaya trip was really good although we were out on a VERY hot day! Very informative and beautiful ruins.Kanchanaburi Highlights tour was absolutely fantastic. Despite the horrific past it was very peaceful and respectful. All stop offs were clean and well maintained. Boat trip was really nice and there was a beautiful restaurant that we stopped off for lunch. I asked Miss Sea to order the food as she could speak to the staff to see what was good and had a great lunch in beautiful surroundings.I would highly recommend BKK Tours and really like that they will not do anything to do with animal exploitation. Bonus!Thank you Michiel, Miss Sea and Mr A

Cruise Ship Tour. I took a Holland America cruise (Volendam) and it stopped at Laem Chabang, Thailand. A group of us (i.e. 6 people) booked a private full day Bangkok highlights tour for ฿3300 (or about $100 USDs) pp. The price was all inclusive (i.e. included everything). The tour included pickup/dropoff at Laem Chabang, lunch, tuk-tuk ride, long tail boat ride, and visits to several attractions. Needless to say it was a much better value than any comparable/similiar tour offered by the ship. The van they used was fantastic, it was a modern air conditioned van with a 3-3-3 seat arrangement. and customized interior. Everyone was extremely comfortable in the vehicle. The lunch was in a local restaurant and was excellent. Our guide whose name was "Air" was exceptional too. If you happen to be in Laem Chabang on a cruise ship stop and want to see Bangkok, this is a great alternative to booking a ship's excursion. I highly recommend this company for a "full day tour of Bangkok".

Best Tour!. Poy was our tour guide for the day in Bangkok and she did a wonderful job. She gave us the perfect amount of information about each site, was always ready with water (it was in the 90s), and she introduced us to local food and beverages. It was the perfect day with the perfect mix of both historical sites and local culture. I would recommend BKK to anyone traveling to Bangkok.

Best tour of our Asia trip. Oi was the best tour guide we had on our holiday of Asia. Every little detail was taken care of. We can't praise her enough. It was also the best 2 day tour we went on. We found BBK tours to be excellent. First time in Bangkok. What an experience.

One of best tours anywhere. We have done many private tours and our tour to Ayatthula with Ms. Air was exemplary.She anticipated our every need ( even tissue for the rest room). I originally contacted Michiel at BKK about another tour. He responded immediately and explained why that would not be feasible given where we were docked. In response to my questions and given the fact that we had already been to Bangkok, he suggested this tour and sent me detailed information. Booking was easy and required no deposit. He also assigned us Ms. Air early in the process - before I even had a chance to request her!I felt that BKK went over and beyond providing an excellent tour. Michiel made excellent recommendations of other activities in the area where we docked; Ms. Air actually called our driver for the next day ( a local company) to confirm our arrangements, and offered us use of her wifi which was much appreciated.I was also impressed by how conscientious the agency was. I travelled with the previousposter Zoli who described our day so well. We had told BKK that it was not necessary to provide a guide to both Bangkok and back to the ship. I knew Air was taking the other couple out the next morning in Bangkok and told her she should go back to Bangkok instead of accompanying us back to the which was hours out of her way.Instead, she stayed with us , someone else accompanied the other couples ,and BKK provided complete coverage to everyone.Air was amazing but the funny thing was that everyone we spoke to on the ship who used BKK seemed equally delighted with their experiences!

The best start to our stay in Bangkok. We booked this tour as it was well rated and have never travelled to Asia and were apprehensive about Bangkok especially with our 7&9 year olds. This was the perfect start for us and one day gave us the confidence we needed to explore further. Sea was our guide and could not have been kinder or more knowledgable. She also made sure we had water, cool towels and treats. Lunch was also included in the cost and was fab. She was particularly careful to make sure our girls were safe and looked after. As well as the grand palace and reclining Buddha we had lunch in a hidden local Thai restaurant where Sea gave us great advice which meant we tried things we never would have. In the afternoon we went to the flower market where Sea got us to try traditional Thai foods and explained everything we saw. This is somewhere we would have never gone ourselves. Finally we went on a river and canal tour which was wonderful. Sea answered all questions and was patient and kind and even took us right back to our hotel. She showed us how to use the sky train so tomorrow we will be able explore a bit more. I couldn't recommend this tour higher.

Day trip, Bangkok Highlights. My nieces and I went on a full day tour. All of us liked our guide, Nadia, who is a very nice and knowledgeable person. The tour was well organized, and we saw most of the "sights."

Great. We were on the Celebrity Millenium and booked BKK via their website. Great from start to finish. Fellow cruisers don't be put off with fear tactics of missing the ship etc. BKK are impeccably professional, better than ship tours and at least a 1/3 cheaper.

Fantastic tours. We did 3 tours in four days with Air as our guide. The first day we did the walking tour, Bangkok Highlights. Air meet us at our hotel and then took us on a fantastic tour of the city, covering all the major highlights and temples An original Thai lunch was provided. The long boat tour through the canals was very interestingThe next day we went to Ayutthara. This morning we were met by Air and a driver at the hotel. The van was clean and comfortable. Air knowledge and clear explanations of the ruins we visited were priceless. Again another fantastic meal for lunch, selected by Air.Our last tour was to the Damnoen floating market and railroad market. Our first choice was the Tha Kha floating market, but Michiel advised us that the days we were available to tour the market would not be available. We were not disappointed in visiting the Damnoen market.

Wonderful, well organised and enjoyable. We were on a Celebrity Cruise that overnighted in Bangkok. We have been to Bangkok many times but wanted to see Ayutthaya and then stay the night in a hotel so that we could meet up with friends who live there. We joined a small group organised by a lady on Cruise Critic.We were a group of 6 who were met at the ship by Air, our guide. She was very friendly and spoke English extremely well. A very comfortable minibus awaited us and we were given plenty of cold water and face/hand wipes throughout the trip. Our driver was very safe as it was a long journey from the ship. Plenty of Rest Room stops were also given.We first went to a place where we had to get a cable car across the Chao Phraya and we visited a unique temple that is built like a church and the resident monk is always in for a chat with his visitors. We walked around and saw the monks go about their business. Then we boarded a private long tailed boat and explored the Chao Phraya river on our way to Ayutthaya. We stopped at a restaurant overlooking the river and Air ordered a wonderful lunch for us explaining exactly what we were eating..After lunch we visited the temple ruins in the UNESCO listed historical park of Ayutthaya. We visited Wat Mahathat, Wat Phra Sri Sanphet, and the most beautiful ruin in Ayutthaya at Wat Chai Wattanaram. It was very hot and Air was always making sure that we were ok and slowed down as appropriate. What was really good is that we visited ahead of the big Tour Groups so were able to comfortably walk around. Air gave us a lot of local and historical information and answered all out questions. It was an absolute pleasure to have her as a guide.Now one couple were returing to the ship and ourselves and another couple were remaining in Bangkok for one night. Fortunately we were staying at the same hotel. At the time of organising this trip we contacted Michel to see if we could be dropped off somewhere as Bankok traffic is appauling. We were dropped off at the Airport where another guide from BKK Tours met us from the minibus (unfortunately I cannot remember her name) and took the four of us by train and skytrain and tuktuk to our hotel. I must say the last part on the tuktuk, although a little hair raising was fun. She got our train tickets, paid the tuktuk drivers so we had no worries.The other couple had arranged a morning trip with Air around Bangkok. We remained by the pool as we know Bangkok. Michel had arranged for Air to pick the four of us up from the hotel after their Bangkok tour and the four of us were driven back to the ship with plenty of time to spare.I cannot praise them enough. We had no worries and a very enjoyable and well planned excursion. Air was delightful as was the other young lady who met us at the airport, Would certainly use them again and definitely recommend to others.Thank you BKK Tours for a lovely trip

Wow, wow.........what an awesome tour!. We were on a cruise, and booked this tour (for 4) via email beforehand. Communication with BKK was awesome.....very professional and accommodating, no problems whatsoever! Our guide was Air, and she was fantastic. She was on time to pick us up from the terminal, and easy to identify. Our ride in an air conditioned mini van to Bangkok was extremely comfortable, and Air gave us information on everything we passed on the way. The tour itself was amazing.......Air knew exactly what to do, and quickly got us into the Grand Palace, into Tuk Tuk's, had lunch reserved for us at an amazing restaurant, took us through a market, then got us onto an amazing long tailed boat. We didn't have to worry about a thing all day.........Air did all the planning, and purchased all tickets. There is absolutely no way we would have squeezed all this into a day if we had to do it ourselves! I cant recommend BKK tours enough....from the booking to the actual tour. Thank you so much Michiel and Air!!

Exceeded expectations!. I add my praises of this company! Our Highlights of Bangkok tour made the most of our two day stay. Our group of six traveled in a very comfortable van, where we were greeted with cold water and towels after every stop. Our guide, Oi, was excellent -- charming, knowledgeable, very professional. Only regret is that we did not have more time to spend in this fascinating city and country. BBK tours merits highest recommendations.

Perfect tour of the city!. Since this was our first time in Thailand, and we were only there for a quick stop before heading to Chiang Mai, we wanted to invest in a proper tour to ensure we seen as much as possible in one day and we are so happy we picked BKK tours! Our tour guide, Petch, was so friendly, approachable and had such a passion for the city that we found really infectious! As a couple, we thought maybe it might be a little awkward on a private tour but Petch was so lovely, and made us feel completely at ease in her company. Petch met us at our accomodation, and we visited the Grand Palace/Wat Pho, went for lunch in a little restaurant by the river (the food was amazing!), visited the Flower Market, took a lovely relaxing boat trip along the river (beautiful!) and as it was the Chinese New Year, Petch took us to China Town and it was great seeing all the celebrations! We took various types of transport; taxi, tuk tuk, boat, all of which Petch organised for us without any hassle. The price may seem a little daunting, however includes entry to the temples, transport, lunch (which included quite a lot of food!) and Petch kept us supplied with water throughout the day. It was such a great experience, and we finished the day feeling like we had a real feel for the city. We thoroughly enjoyed our day, and would recommend this tour, and Petch, to anyone looking for a 1 day tour of the city by a passionate, knowledgeable tour guide!

Fabulous Tour of Bangkok. We arrived on the Sapphire Princess and our guide, Air, picked the 6 of us up at the port. The vehicle she used was new, clean, very comfortable, AC worked perfectly and that made the drive to Bangkok very enjoyable. Air is a delight and extremely knowledgeable about the area. She had lunch with us and that gave us time to ask her other questions about the people of Thailand. This is a tour you should not miss. You will be completely satisfied as we were. Thank you Air!

Worth every penny (Bart). We booked this tour after reading reviews on tripadvisor. We were not disappointed.Ms Sea our guide was waiting in the hotel lobby to great us at the arranged time. Using the local tuk tuk transport she took us to the Grand Palace/ Wat Temple.Explaining the history behind the buildings etc. The tickets for entrance to the site were bought by her thus avoiding the long quese. Ms Sea guided us through the site explaining in detail what each building/monument was built for. She also bought cold water and ice cold towels for us. It was crowded but I believe that Ms Sea's knowledge helped us to see the major attractions avoiding some of the bottle necks. She then took us to the flower market, on the way buying some street food for us to experience. Then time for lunch. Ms Sea took us to a restaurant whose entrance you would have never found on your own. Suggesting food and drinks ng to suite our taste. Then to the harbour for the private long tail boat trip. This is the reason I have only marked 4 out of 5. The boat was not allowed to "dock" at the main jetting, so it pulled along at a side jetty. The river was choppy. We had to then climb down into the boat without steps or any other means of getting into the boat. This was an accident waiting to happen. We did manage it, but at 65 and 69 years old it was not for the faint hearted and to be honest I should have refused to board. I do not blame BKK for the conditions but as we were doing the boat trip to see the floating market and we told conditions were to rough/windy on the river to visit the market why did they take us on the river at all? This was the only down side of our day. Would I recommend BKK tours? Yes,without a doubt. Do not visit the Grand Palace without a guide. Ms Sea was delightful, informative and profesional.

Very Informative Tour!. Very informative tour! Air was our tour guide and she was great! She was thorough, very professional and quite approachable, and spoke English very well. BKK delivered in all aspects of the tour and our group of six were very pleased with the tour. We left Bangkok knowing more about it, than we could ever read in books. Highly recommended!

Brilliant!. During our 2nd day in Bangkok we decided to do a tour to see the best the city had to offer. we were greeted by Michiel at our hotel and from that point it was like we were with a close friend. we had a great time and he showed us so much of the city that we would not have seen on our own. i cannot speak highly enough of him. he was great and it was one of the best days of our entire thailand experience. very professional and a really nice guy. a credit to the company. our tour was on 02.02.16 (Craig and Alison)

Best tour company in Bangkok!. The first reason why I decided to go with BKK tours is because they are one of the only tour companies in Bangkok that has made the ethical decision not to provide tours that exploit animals, like elephant camps and tiger temples. I know these types of activities might seem harmless at first glance, but if you are considering visiting such a place, please please do a little more research before going and you'll see how bad they truly are for animals (look up the Phajaan which is the way they train the elephants). So I greatly admire BKK tours for taking this stand and knew they were the kind of company I wanted to support, plus they had great reviews. Everything went very smoothly from the moment I contacted Michiel, he answered all my questions and even gave me some great tips for my stay in Bangkok. I did the Bangkok highlights tour and my tour guide was Nadia. The tour is very flexible and I was able to choose what time in the morning I wanted to start. Nadia was completely amazing and really went above and beyond. I was scared at first that a private tour would be awkward since I was by myself, but it was the complete opposite and I felt like I was just spending the day with a very good friend who's a local and knows all the good spots. I decided to take local transportation which I definitely recommend doing. We took the sky train, Tuk tuks (which were my favorite), taxis, a long-tail boat and it really made me feel like I was getting the whole experience. We hopped on and off the Tuk tuks every time there was something interesting to see. I made the mistake of eating a big breakfast before the tour which I shouldn't have done because Nadia bought me soooo much food and drinks during the tour. We ate a lot of street food which was absolutely delicious (Nadia knows all the good stuff), I had the best fried chicken I ever tasted and many deserts too. For lunch we went to a restaurant and Nadia ordered many different dishes so that we could taste everything. I feel like we did so much during the tour, we visited food markets, the flower marker (where she even bought me a flower), china town, the temples and palaces and the long-tail boat tour. It was an excellent Itinerary for my first time in Bangkok. Nadia also offered to take pictures of me all throughout the tour. I recommend you bring a change of clothes because it gets very very hot during the day and you need long pants for the temples. If you're a picky eater tell your guide so that she knows what kind of foods to order at the restaurant. If your hotel is in the city it's better because I was staying at the airport hotel and transportation got a little tricky, but it all worked out because Michiel and Nadia were so nice and went out of their way. PS - If you would like to spend time with elephants while in Thailand, I volunteered at both Elephant Nature Park and Wildlife Friends Foundation of Thailand, and they are both amazing places that really help the animals. They both offer awesome day tours where you can walk, feed and bathe the elephants but no bull hooks, no chains and no riding. You won't regret it.

Temple Tour. What an amazing time we had with Sea during our Bangkok Temple Tour! She promptly met us at our hotel and we instantly felt in good hands. She not only lead us through the temples and had such a strong background in her Thai history, but we took all kinds of fun forms of transportation throughout Bangkok. We had little adventures along the way, stopped in the flower market, tried some new foods, had a relaxing canal tour, and she even made us reservations at a wonderful Thai restaurant. We would most definitely recommend her and this group for anyone looking for a fun and very informative Bangkok experience.

Memorable and heart rendering. Well, Where do you start, 2 day trips with BKK tours and Ms Air (plus driver day 1) Day 1 off to see Hell fire pass ( death railway) and to see the pain and torment the troops and local people had to go through to build this pass for the Japanese through to Burma was awe inspiring and emotional for us. Then off to the Cemetery where the fallen had been laid and seeing some of the tributes would bring any grown man to tears. We laid our Crosses and bowed our heads in rememberance of those whose life was cut short in building the railway. Then off to the Bridge over the river Kwai, fantastic walking across the new bridge and seeing it all.We then went on a local speedboat ride, wow, wow, wow frightening but exciting and fun. Within this day we stopped for lunch which was lovely, sitting and looking out over the river. Ms Air was very knowledgable and told us so much about each aspect of the tour. The driver was very attentative and kept us refreshed with cold towels and water. What an experience day 1.Day 2 Ms Air met us and a taxi to china town, what a place to see. then tuk tuk to the Grand palace, well so much to see and wonder on the site, then to the reclining Budda, flower and vegetable market, Dinner by the river then a tour by boat to Venice of the east canals seeing monitor lizards and feed the fish, all in all a fantastic day. Ms Air talked us through each visit and we learnt that I was born on a Tuesday so the reclining Budda was mine and my wife born on a Wednesday had 2 Buddas, we learnt so much from our experience. We have so much to share, however we suggest you try for yourself.The price you pay is what it is and no hidden extras.

Wonderful tours by wonderful people. Cannot rate this company high enough. Miss Air and M were excellent guides along with our driver making the tours memorable and fun. If you go to Bangkok and want to see and hear about the wonderful history, book this company. We went on the Bangkok Highlights tour using local transport and the Authentic Ayutthaya tour in a private vehicle. Wonderful.

Superb in every way. Read the reviews for BKK on trip advisor and booked a tour in Bangkok. Was not disappointed. Miss Oi our tour guide was punctual at the hotel. She escorted us to all the highlights of Bangkok and we used nearly all forms of transport. Very friendly and informative, we really had a enjoyable and rememorial day.

Friendly and knowledgeable. Just recently we did 3 back to back day tours with BKK tours. On Day 1 we visited Bangkok 'off the beaten path' including one of the 'slum'; areas which was both eye opening and sobering. On Day 2 we went to the authentic Tha Kha floating market. Forget about the tacky, touristy Damnoen floating market this is the one you must visit. The photography is incredible. On day 3 we went to Ayutthara. Our the places chosen to eat for breakfast and lunch was just amazing, my taste buds are already missing the Thai food.'M' had all the attributes you look for in a good tour guide, knowledge, patience, adaptability & humour. Our driver was great, we especially liked the cold face towel everytime we returned to our vehicle. Finally I would like to mention Michiel. Despite my many, many emails with chaning requests to our customized itinerary, Michiel also answered promptly and displayed patience. The final tour was perfect and exactly as promised. What more could you ask!

Excellent!. We did a tour with BKK Tours to Kanchanaburi and the River Kwai. Our guides Sea and Air made the tour an unforgettable experience. Both are very knowledgeable about the sites and history and were eager to share this with us. But best was all the other information they shared with us about Thailand in general.The tour was excellent and nothing was too much for our guides. Lunch on the tour was one of the best we had throughout our whole visit! Thank you again for a fantastic experience! We can't wait to tour with you again.

Sightseeing Highlights of Bangkok. Very friendly and kind Team. Top conversation and support during booking and before arrival. No problems during the tours.Perfect for friends of history and authentic stories of Bangkok.We enjoyed our time.

Amazing tour!!. My mom and I and two other couples did a two day tour overnight from the cruise ship. It was just amazing. BKK tours picked us up at the pier and it was about a three hour to and from Bangkok from the pier (thus why we decided to stay overnight in Bangkok). We stopped at a coffee stop on our way into city per our request and saw amazing temples and palaces including the Grand Palace. We saw markets including the flower market and got to sample local treats. Lunch was excellent both days. The second day we did Ayutthaya which was awesome. Air took such good care of us. In fact, the night after our first day of touring with her we had a food tuk tuk tour through another company that met shortly after our day tour ended. She was so worried about us making it on time and not getting lost that she wait for us and delivered us to the spot herself. She really went above and beyond to show us what we wanted to see in a way that we saw a ton but didn't feel rushed at all. I can't recommend this tour group highly enough.

2 Great Days. We (6 adults - between 63 - 73) had a fabulous tour lead by Lucky. We spent 2 days with her and enjoyed everything. She picked us up at the cruise port, we spent the night in Bangkok and she got us back to the ship the next day. I would highly recommend BKK and Lucky ( our driver was great and his van was super)

Wonderful tour of Bangkok highlights. BKK Tours was very easy to deal with online and we could pay for our tour by credit card at the end of our tour. Our guide, Oi, was terrific and looked after all our needs and gave us a wonderful tour, picking us up from our cruise ship 2 hours away from Bangkok. Our group of six enjoyed travelling in a luxurious van, by boat and by tuktuk. The company also provided a delicious lunch in a nice air conditoned restaurant as part of our tour cost. This tour was a highlight of our 5 week Asian trip.

2 day tour on Cruise stop. This was a two day tour with an overnight in Bangkok centre.Excellent pre trip communications, Michael was very helpful.Our guide was Miss Air, she was great, so helpful, so knowledgeable with a great sense of humour.All travel to and from Laem Chabang port was excellent.We booked Bangkok Highlights and a tour of Attutaya on day 2, both recommended.Great value, a memorable two days for us. (6 in our party)

Terrific off the beaten path photo tour with BKK. Along with two friends en route to Myanmar for a 10-day photo tour, I spent a day with M from BKK Tours getting to see some wonderful parts of Bangkok I wouldn't have explored on my own. We visited four or five different locations (the Flower Market, Chinatown) that are apparently well known as well as smaller areas where we saw only locals and sampled delicious street food. Our choice of an air-conditioned minivan gave us some breaks from the heat in between stops and we were offered cool bottled water and cleaning wipes every time we got back in the van. M speaks English beautifully and kept us informed and entertained throughout the day. We appreciated his choice of places to visit and his help in getting some great shots. Can't recommend him, and this tour, highly enough.

Bkk highlights and authentic Ayutthaya. We spent two amazing days with this tours. Our guide Petch,is a very nice person and an excellent guide. We learned a lot of culture and history of Bangkok.It's was a great decision making these tours. Thanks a lot BBK Tours

Temple Tour. Highly recommend this tour company. Booked easily on the Internet with great communication from Michiel the manager. Very knowledgeable and lovely Nadia was a great tour guide and enjoyed every moment of my personal tour tailored for me.Reasonably priced for the whole day you are looked after superbly.Thanks Bkk tours.

Recommended A*****. Having a short period in Bangkok and wanting to fit everything in we consulted trip advisor for a tour guide. We were not disappointed with BKK Tours!We had the lovely Ms Parry for the day and she really did keep us entertained. Her knowledge and English language skills were perfect. Loved the story telling in the temples.We really did have a lovely day and would have no hesitation in booking another when we return later this year!Recommended!!

Don't miss this tour!. I was met from my hotel as promised by Ms Oi. I was on my way through to Sydney so only had one full day to spend in Bangkok and didn't want to waste it. I'd never been before. I was met at the hotel by Ms Oi who was lovely, friendly and really knowledgable. Being a one to one tour meant we could have really good conversations about everything we saw and as a result I learned so much. We saw all the usual attractions but the tour of the local markets and streets was the most interesting and memorable and the boat trip round the canals was exciting and fascinating. We shared a really good lunch which was included in the price as were all the fares, entry charges, bottles of water etc. I only spent a day in Bangkok but came away knowing and understanding much more than I would have done in a week on my own. The price was incredible considering what I got for it. Thanks so much! If I come back I will definitely do other tours you offer! I hope so!

A great one day tour with BKK. I had only one day in Bangkok and wanted to make the most of it so I found BKK on TripAdvisor and booked a full day private tour with public transportation. My guide met me on time and was delightful. He was very flexible and knowledgeable and he treated me an excellent and most enjoyable day. I very much enjoyed all of the unique Bangkok sites, the scrumptious Thai lunch, and the boat ride through the canals. I highly recommend this outfit.

Bangkok by Sea, best way to go. My tour of Bangkok was fabulous thanks to my tour guide named Sea. She met me right on time at my hotel and customized my tour based on activities that I had already seen in Bangkok. We saw the flower market or pak klong talad, wholesale veggies and meats market, tasted Thai iced tea and ate some local sweets. Sea brought me to a temple to see the reclining Buddha and the Grand Palace and taught me about the history and religion along the way. We had a great Thai lunch on the river and did some local souvenir shopping after. All and all a great tour, well worth the price.

Day Tour around Bangkok. Did a day tour with this tour company, booked in advance before we arrived. Michiel was great in attending to my request. Travelled with family of 5. The tour guide Petch was great and she did much to make sure we were comfortable. Set of at 7am and back at hotel around 5pm. For those of you who are new in Bangkok, the floating markets are a must. Chinatown was busting with people and I think that's because the Chinese New Year is approaching too. Beware of pickpockets. Had a great lunch at a quaint restaurant by the MaeKlong river. Great Thai food. This is not the Mekong, the Mekong is by the Thailand border. Thailand is just beautiful, in its own way. I would recommend BKK Tour to anyone who wants to sightsee. You don't get to be huddled into a big bus with many other tourists and you can take your time to enjoy the sceneries. After all its a private tour.

Wonderful day with Ms. Air. If you book with BKK and have the pleasure of spending the day with Ms. Air you will not be disappointed!!!! We did the 1 day Bangkok Temple/Boat/Market tour with a private Van. We had a driver in addition to Ms. Air our guide. This is unlike the 2 tours we have done here in Chiang Mai. Our driver is our guide and it takes away from the day to some degree. They arrived on time to our hotel and from the moment we left to the time we got back she was amazing, informative, genuine and attentive to all the needs we had. She was one step ahead of us and made sure all small details were handled so we could fully enjoy our time. Not only did she speak fantastic English she was a real person and you felt you were with a long time friend. The booking of our tour was seamless through email and they responded in a timely fashion. We loved that the flower market we went to was a local market and we were the only tourists there - sure gives you a better feeling for the city! Thanks Ms. Air!! You're fantastic!!!Wish you were with us in Chiang Mai this week as well!

Oi, Oi, Oi! What a treat!. Starting from a quick response time to our email enquiries, to the whole experience, we cannot complain. Oi was our guide for both days of touring we did - the floating markets and then the city tour. She was punctual, friendly, professional, had a great sense of humour ands kept our two teenagers engaged throughout. We had two stress-free days seeing much more of Bangkok and surrounds than we could have hoped to by ourselves. It is well worth the money to be looked after so well especially by Oi. We feel that we have seen the major and best highlights of the city in the company of a very charming lady whose English was fabulous.

Fantastic day out. What a great day. These are private tours around the city of Bangkok – perfect if you are short on time. We arranged for Air met us on December 21st in our hotel lobby at 8 am. She whisked us around the city with ease including all the main sites as well as lunch in an amazing local restaurant. Air was so knowledgeable and was great with our kids also. We took all forms of transport including Tuk Tuk / underground / sky train and a long tail boat. Fabulous tour and very memorable - thank you Air for a great day.

Fantastic tour!. We were visiting Thailand via cruise ship and wanted to make the most of our 2 days in port. After reading many positive reviews of BKK Tours here on TA, I contacted them to book Bangkok Highlights & Authentic Ayutthaya. Michel answered all of my emails (and there were a lot of them!) promptly and courteously. He helped me choose a hotel from several that I found that looked appealing. I also asked him for some advice on restaurants I had come across. He was happy to assist, even having his wife Air make a reservation for us. This extra help was so very appreciated!The day of our tour, Nadia was waiting for us at the cruise terminal, and we were then on our way to Bangkok. Nadia's English was excellent! She spent most of the drive getting to know us and answering questions about her life and Thai culture. We visited the flower market (where we received flower corsages), then took tuk-tuks to lunch, then headed to the Grand Palace & reclining Buddha, followed by a long tail boat ride. During the day, Nadia was always helpful and kind, making sure we had enough food & drinks, providing us with cold towels, and giving us lots of information about what we were seeing. At the end of the day, she pulled me aside to double check if we still wanted to go to Ayutthaya the next day, as the very hot weather was clearly affecting most of our group. We definitely did still want to go, but it was so thoughtful of her to check!Nadia then accompanied us on the SkyTrain to our hotel (Eastin Grand Sathorn). She also recommended a place for my husband & me to get massages and made us a reservation. Finally, she talked to us about proper bargaining if we chose to visit any of the markets that night - both were extra touches that we really appreciated.Day 2, we visited a monastery and met a monk, then took another long tail boat to Ayutthaya to see various sites of the ruins. We were all very impressed with Nadia's knowledge of what we were seeing, and she again took great care of us by making sure we had water/ towels and stopping to get us ice cream.I can't imagine a better tour operator in Bangkok. It is clear that Michel, Air, & Nadia (and I'm sure all the other guides) love what they do. They are knowledgeable, friendly, and really go above and beyond what would be included in an average guided tour. I am so glad we chose BKK and would recommend them to anyone! - Susan & Milton, November 2015

Well Worth the Money. We booked the Bangkok highlights tour for 2 adults via local transportation. Ms. Oi was our guide and boy were we happy.
