She is very knowledgeable of the sites we were visiting and spoke English well. Every detail was taken care of including hotel pickup/drop off, site transportation, food and entrance fees. Ms. Oi even bought us water and cooling towels several times throughout the day to help with the heat. To put the icing on the cake she even helped us barter our first purchase of a souvenir at the grand palace. After our tour ended she sat down with us and a map of the metro/sky train system, she then went over in detail how to get to the most popular destinations. I understand that BKK tours might not be the cheapest tour available but I must say that based on my experience they were worth every single penny. I would recommend them to anyone who is interested in seeing many attractions in one day.

Superb operators with a personal touch. We visited Bangkok in December, and had managed to discover BKK on Tripadvisor in advance which was a real find. Michiel handled all my enquiries promptly and advised on the best tours to suit our interests, timing and family. We therefore booked and thoroughly enjoyed the following tours, with Miss Oi, our guide who was patient, kind, full of interesting facts and great fun!Bangkok half day tour 1pm-4pm. Miss Oi collected us from our hotel on the river in Bangkok and travelled with us by taxi to the flower market where we explored the wonderful creations being made. We then walked through the local fruit and veg markets until we arrived at a pier for a local canal trip by longtail boat - and it was lovely to see the backwaters of Bangkok away from the main transport routes. On our way we saw three asian water monitors, turtles, large catfish, lots of local houses on the water and had our first introduction to the colourful spirit houses.Half day Tha Kha floating market visit - 7h30-1pm. We were advised to visit this rather then the central or other Bangkok floating markets which are very touristy. We were pleased we did. Held only on certain days, we managed to fit this into our limited stay in Bangkok. Arriving in the early morning, we felt honoured to be part of the local tradition of ladies coming along on their wooden boats to 'barter' and do their shopping for local food stuff and produce. No hustle and bustle, not another tourist in sight and just the quiet tranquillity of the canal and laughter of the ladies. We left the market by boat ourselves to explore the neighbouring canals, visiting a nearby palm sugar farm, and just enjoying the wonder of nature we were able to see - monitors, birds, gorgeous flowers, palm trees etc. Following on from Tha Kha, we stopped at the Daemon Saduak floating market.The contrast in this floating market was hard to believe. So busy, touristy, and with a completely different kind of atmosphere and goods being sold. Sad really we felt, and so noisy too - with boats using horrid motors, which weren't used at all and only oars were used to quietly row the boats at Tha Kha. At this market, it was the only time I felt aggressive sales to try and get us to buy something, which was unfortunate. Still interesting to see, but we were all very pleased that this was not our only impression of a floating market - and glad we saw them in the traditional format earlier in the day. We also stopped into the train market, which unfortunately did not have the train running due to repairs - but very interesting to see the tiny space that these market sellers set up in between buildings, with the prospect of having to quickly move their goods when a train would be passing through.Our final tour with BKK, Miss Oi and our driver, was to the historic park of Ayutthaya. This was a full day tour, starting at 8am and returning after 4pm from our hotel in Bangkok. We set off with the usual cheeriness, promptness and all in good form. Our first arrival about 1 1/2 hours later was to the monastery on an island only accessible by cable car. This was quite 'European' in feel and architecture, but quietly serene with Monks going about their business and a haven for a lucky few dogs. From here we went by traditional long tail boat all along the river to a wonderful temple. The temple gave us a good indication of traditional painting on the wooden interior walls - a time consuming job taking years to complete and we saw the artists in action. The temple also included a large gold Buddha being 'dressed' in a ceremony, as well as other artefacts and stories to hear and learn from as we walked about exploring our surroundings. We went onto the ancient 'ruins' as such of the city, visiting two separate sites which were quite spectacular and once again we felt lucky to be walking where so much history, ending with the sacking of the palaces and temples occurred. Many had advised us on our visit to Bangkok, and I'm pleased we decided to leave our tours in the hands of BKK. They were extremely professional from the first enquiry to the very end. Friendly, helpful and so very efficient - we would not hesitate to recommend them to anyone travelling to Bangkok and surrounds! Thank you to Michiel and Oi for making our visit so memorable.

Great Tour!. Wawa was our guide and she was fantastic! From thoroughly explain the history of the Great Palace, Wat Po & the Reclining Buddha, to addressing all questions asked. Wawa spoke fluent English and made the tour very enjoyable and informative! Excellent choice!

I am glad we had them. We counted on BKK to introduce us to Bangkok (Bangkok Highlights tour) and Ayuthhaya (Authentic Ayutthaya tour). Miss Su, our guide, was just amazing. We were a group of three with different interests (photography, culture/history, shopping/relax); still, she managed to satisfy us all. She was prepared to properly answer all of our (countless) questions and had a lot of patience, never losing her smile. Everything was well organized and thought of. Bangkok was the gateway for my two friends who are starting a long journey around South-East Asia. Their first impression could not be better and most of it is due to Miss Su. We definitely recommend BKK services and, particularly, Miss Su.

AMAZING. We spent 2 days with BKK tour with Poy guide. The minivan had air condition and seats were really confortable.The driver was competent and prudent.Poy was really well prepared. She made us try local food that maybe we would not have ever tried alone.She was even really well prepared from the cultural Point of view and really enthusiastic as well.Hearthily recommended!

Felt like Royalty ! Fantastic company !. BKK tours was one of the best things that happened to us in Bangkok. Right from the first point of contact, Michael was prompt and clear in all the responses. We took two tours with them - Bangkok city private tour and one to Ayuthaya. Both were with the charming, knowledgeable and hugely entertaining Ms. Sea. We could have simply left our purses at home ! Ms. Sea met us at our apartment lobby, and took us thru all of Bangkok using public transport. I would highly recommend this method - unless you have very little children or senior citizens in your midst. The lotus folding at the flower market, visit to the spice market ( where I loaded myself with tons of lovely lemongrass, and various local dried and preserved herbs and spices), visits to the Grand Palace and the temples were all very well conducted, and Sea answered all our myriad questions about Thai culture, everyday life, religion, etc. Never was she at a loss for words ! We ae strictly vegetarian, and Sea managed to give a lovely Thai lunch experience after talking to the chefs at the Navy Club where she treated us to lunch. It was delicious and we enjoyed it a lot. She also took so many photos of us together - something we normally never get on our various trips ! Ayuthaya was too good for words. The heritage site, combined with the narration by Sea, plus the visit to the street food market where she gave us samples of various wonderful Thai desserts was awesome. All along, we were offered ice cold water, cold towels, stopped for tea and snacks, and I could also stop at one of the roadside shops to buy some garden ornaments. Once again, we had la delicious vegetarian lunch at a place she took us to. There were NO hidden costs, no nasty surprises. I think this is a very well run company, and Sea became a friend at the end of Day 1 itself !

A wonderful Day with a Brilliant Tour Guide!. If you want to do a tour that lets you experience all of the beauty and intrigue of Bangkok, this is the company you need to book with!When booking, we dealt with the professional and helpful Michel who made sure we were getting everything we wanted out of the trip.Our Guide met us in the foyer of our hotel and immediately we felt comfortable.The Grand Palace and temples were beautiful and the tour down the klongs was amazing and oozed culture.I cannot speak highly enough of our tour guide Nadia. She was full of knowledge, friendly and looked after us the whole way. We we return to Bangkok I certainly hope we are able to book another tour through BKK and with Nadia! Monique and Tim (Sydney, Australia)

Best Bangkok tour you can find!. We had an amazing tour with BKK Tours. From the very first correspondence to the end of the actual tour the experience was first class. I requested Ms. Air based on reviews and she didn’t disappoint. She gave us the best private tour we had in any of our travels, and her personality and knowledge of Bangkok set the tone for our entire vacation. She met us at our hotel on time and with a smile. She remembered I mentioned in my email that my husband had back issues and right away suggested we take a taxi instead of the metro, which suited us very well. Everywhere we went she got us through without a line, chose an amazing restaurant for lunch (we had food restrictions), and even took us to a local shop to get pain cream for my husband’s back. When we came back to our hotel, she didn’t rush off but spent time chatting with us in the lobby and sharing with us her knowledge of Thailand. The experience was amazing and I am recommending BKK to our friends who are going to Thailand soon. Thank you Ms. Air!

Look no further! This is the very best and ethical tour company with excellent communication!. I contacted a few tour companies by email for help with ideas in planning a day tour for 40 people traveling to Bangkok for business. The prompt communication and detailed information on what to include in our tour by Michiel was top notch and so much better than the other companies. Over many emails and my MANY questions, Michiel was patient and continued to help me plan what ended up being a fabulous day for everyone.One important note: when I inquired about going to see elephants as part of our tour, Michiel let me know that they only go to ethical sanctuaries. While there were other elephant ride places to go, he did not recommend them. I was so glad for that advice and happy that there is a tour company that holds the well being of the animals above profits.We were picked up at our hotel by 5 lovely tour guides who were all smiles. Our group was split up into 5 luxury vans stocked with cold water and chilled towels to wipe our faces with during the day as it was very hot and humid. Those towels were heaven on earth! Our group was led by Air who was so sweet, funny and knowledgeable. Her English skills were very good as well. Our tour went to the Railway Market, Damnoen Saduak Floating Market, a stop for delicious and plentiful Thai lunch, Wat Pho and finally a canal tour in Bangkok. Air expertly led us through these locations, informing us with interesting facts along the way and feeding us Thai fruits and snacks. All 4 locations gave our group the perfect overview and introduction to Thai life as we saw both rural and urban life in both authentic and touristy ways.Every single person who went on this tour raved about it. BKK Tours gets my highest recommendation.

Great way to start our Thailand experience!. First contacted BKK from home, and Michiel responded straight away. He was very helpful with any information regarding our time in Bangkok. We were picked up, on time by Ms Sea and her driver. Our tour started by walking through China Town, tasting some of the amazing street food, then we went to the flower and fruit market by Tuk Tuk, where we decorated Lotus flowers to offer at the Grand Palace. We then ate lunch at a lovely restaurant on the river. After lunch we visited the Temple of the Reclining Buddha, followed by a Long Tail boat ride on The Klongs. It was an amazing day, and Ms Sea was a fantastic guide. It was worth every penny and more!! Would highly recommend BKK Tours for anyone's first time in Bangkok!!

Would be hard to beat this level of service!. We were on a cruise last month,Nov 15, and were looking for a company to pick us up from the port and give us a good overview of the city. I eventually booked for 12 of us from the ship. The process from initially booking to being finally dropped back at the port was excellent. As "Staten Islander" has said a few reviews ago, we got picked up in 2 luxury minibuses with lots of space for 6 in each as well as driver and tour guide. In our bus we had Miss Oi for the day. Her English was good and she made everyone feel at ease and encouraged questions. She set the tour at a pace to suit everyone and there was always a cold bottle of water on hand!The temples/Palace grounds were amazing and due to the organisation of the tour we got a short Tuk Tuk ride, a visit to a local market and a river cruise all done either side of a very good traditional lunch where we were "encouraged" to try the local dishes.A very enjoyable and memorable day for all. No hesitation in recommending this company for their professionalism.

Great day tour at Ayutthaya with Michai. We booked a day tour at Ayuthhaya through BKK tours. The owner, Michel was very prompt in answering our questions and flexible to agree the schedule of the tour that we requested. We customize the tour (different starting time, different attractions) .The guide Michai and the driver were very professional and friendly. Michai was very knowledgeable and had great English skills, a guide that I would highly recommend for this tour. The van was comfortable, with good AC and the included lunch was tasty.No shady commercial visits were suggested. We visited extra a local market where Michai bought some snacks for us.

What a tour. While planning, they clearly mentioned all aspects of tour in mails, that left no doubt about anything. Though we were on a short Bangkok highlights tour, we were treated with great professionalism and all our needs were taken care of. Our guide Ms. Air is a very nice lady and full of knowledge, and left none of our questions unanswered. We became very good friends and our 10 months old daughter was too fond of her. BKK tours are very professional with a blend of friendliness in their conduct. Those travelling with young children or special conditions can opt their mini van otherwise I shall suggest to travel by Bangkok's local modes of transportation.

A class act in Bangkok, family run, professional and knowledgeable for an outstanding day tour.. We found this tour group on tripadvisor and it turned out to be the best decision we made on our 15 day cruise when it came to tours. Michael advised us from the beginning on the details of the tour and suggested 3 couples so each would have their own row in the van. Totally comfortable and super roomy by following his advice. Ms. Air was our guide and a true pro. One of the couples on our tour failed to inform us prior to joining the group they had special needs. She didn't miss a beat, so I just hope they tipped her well.The tour was varied between walking, boating & the van. The lunch they arranged was a 10+, large assortment of food, on the water and was included in the price of the tour. It was also a full day tour, not cut short like tours we arranged in other ports.So if you are going to Bangkok or are there for a couple of days, check them out. If you are on a cruise ship, book early (I did over 3 months prior) as they usually sell out when the ships are in port.

Service above and beyond...... : ). Essentially I booked my tour within about 48 hours of arriving in Bangkok. I only had a window of 7 hours to see something unique....and BKK Tours deliveredMichiel re-jigged the 'Meet the locals' tour and it was lead by Mr Michai (this was a private 1 to 1 tour). I have been to Bangkok a few times before and have done all the usual things - and as a photographer and traveller I was looking for something unique. Over the 7 hours we visited a slum area, Mr Michai was very knowledgable and it was great to get an upstanding of what has put these people here and who they are (and it's not what you think...!!!). We also rode the water taxi with locals heading off to work, which was brilliant, walked through a Temple complex you would not know existed, stopped for local coffee, took a 40 foot long boat (private) out around an area that was more like a Cambodian fishing village, then finally a walk through the backstreets of Chinatown to visit another temple.....All within the inner city and by foot....!!! : )A reasonable amount of fitness is required, certainly not stroller friendly....will definitely be in touch when I return to Bangkok next year.....!!!!

Bangkok Highlights 4/12/15. The service provided by BKK tours is indeed commendable! Prior to the tour, Mr Michiel, the coordinator is prompt in his communication via email in ensuring that everything runs smoothly. Our tour guide, Mrs Air is approachable and knowledgeable. She is always ready to share her profound knowledge about history of the holy historic Wat and ensure that our needs are met at all times. Despite the hot and humid weather, my family and I had unforgettable moments at the Grand Palace and other designated places that day. It is indeed an eye opener which provides us with the opportunity to have a better understanding of Thai way of life and their culture. Looking forward to join BBK tours in the near future.

Bangkok highlights. The tour guide Air was very good and very knowledgeable. Our family throughly enjoy the trip. The tour was flexible and she brought us to the four faced Buddha even though it is not in the itinerary upon our request.

A wonderful day seeing Bangkok with Nadiya by all types of public transport.. We cannot recommend BKK and Nadiya highly enough. It was like being with a friend for the day the rapport was instant. The tour was exceptional value for money fully inclusive and highly informative. We used another company the following day for a different tour there was no comparison. We would have no hesitation to recommend BKK and if all the guides are as amazing as Nadiya then wow!

Excellent and Reliable - Great Way to see Bangkok!. Thanks for the TA contributors for recommending BKK Tour! Contacting BKK Tour was the best thing I did for our trip to Bangkok! We thoroughly enjoyed our three day travel with BKK. I will separate my reviews into two parts: Pre-planning phase and touring phase.Pre-travel/planning Phase: Michiel was my best source in providing recommendation for our three day itinerary. He was prompt and thorough when comes to responding to my emails. I simply advised him my travel dates to Bangkok , he provided me with several recommendations for our time there. He is careful and thoughtful in suggesting our itinerary. I was even able to get his opinions on hotels and locations. Even after I settled on an itinerary, Michiel continued to keep in touch until our travel date. Michiel definitely made my travel planning easier and effortless. Thank you Michiel!Touring phase: The three-day itinerary was well organized and fantastic. We had the pleasure of having Ms. Oi as our guide. She was always on time, cheerful, accommodating and professional. And in addition to visiting the sites, Ms. Oi introduced several awesome local foods to us! (And all of them were soooo yummy!) I only wish I had a bigger appetite to try more! While in Bangkok, instead of taking tour buses like other tour companies, Ms. Oi took us to ride the local taxi (tuk tuk) though the crazy streets of Bangkok, and to ride a boat down a canal to see local their living. We had Peter as our driver for two days (one day to the floating markets and one day to the Auytthaya). His car is extremely clean and comfortable. It was 95 degree and muggy during our time there and at every stop Peter provided us with a cold bottled water and a cold towels. It was a very special touch to the BBK tour!I do not have any negative feedback on BKK Tour. BKK Tour made our trip to Bangkok easy and fun! Thank you Mr. Michiel and Ms. Oi! We will definitely contact you again for our next trip to Bangkok (soon)!

Exceeded our expectations!. We travel frequently and always use private guides in new countries we visit. We have been very fortunate with most guides but we must say that BKK tours and especially our guide Air surpassed expectations on our highlights of Bangkok tour. This company offers stellar communication services, thank you Michiel. Air arrived promptly to collect us at our hotel and off we went via local transport to view many highlights of this bustling city. We really felt we had a glimpse into local life as well as seeing the important temples. The ride on the canal and river by longboat was enlightening to view locals homes. We added on the Jim Thompson house and that was an appreciated end to our day.So nice to pay one price and have all the days transport and entrance fees included. Many special touches also included- gold leaf to rub on Budda, bread to feed the fish,and coins to support the ongoing renovations at one temple.As well, a tasty lunch and plenty of cold water to drink on a hot day. Thank you Air for your enthusiasm and pleasant, considerate personality. We truly were well looked after!We wish you and Michiel all the best in this business venture. We have no doubt you will succeed, you strive to be the best and you ARE!!
Day to remember. Just 4 of us. Lucky was very informative. Met at port. Specially enjoyed the boat trip. Timing was perfect. Very good meal. Giant Buddha was amazing. Back to ship in plenty of time.

An Amazing Day We Will Never Forget. We took the Bangkok Highlights tour with Nadia, and it was a day we will never forget. From everywhere I have been across the globe, Nadia was by far the best guide I have had! Her wealth of knowledge and personality was unmatched. The tour itself was also very well designed, and included a delicious Thai lunch, as well as snacks along the way. Choosing the local transport option allowed us to experience Bangkok more like a local would. There is no better way to see Bangkok, and we hope to return to explore more with BKK Tours and Nadia soon!

An absolutely great tour company.. We were in a small group of 12 on a privately arranged shore excursion from out cruise ship. BKK provided two vans and two english speaking guides, both of whom were excellent. They met us immediately and the tour was very well planned and carried out. The vans were comfortable, and BKK provided bottled water. The price was very fair.I would highly recommend BKK tours to you to arrange your tour. I'm sure you'll be pleased you did.

Wonderful Tour. Many Thanks to all at BKK Tours.Including a very special Thank You to Nadia.We had a amazing time on this tour of Bangkok from the very first minute we met with our guide Nadia.This lady puts people at ease straight away with her lovely smile.After leaving the hotel we went straight to the flower market which was full of so much colour and smells.Stopped at a street seller for a snack which was very tasty and filling,then onto the Grand Palace ,Emerald Buddha,Reclining Buddha.Without Nadia we would have been totally lost and would have never known anything about the fascinating history of Thailand.Then had a lovely relaxing lunch by the river with a thunderstorm thrown in for free.Was not able to do the boat ride although we did try with help from 4 Thai boatman but was not to be.lol.The tuk-tuk ride thru Old Bangkok did make up for that thou.After a taxi ride back to the hotel with Nadia and a very friendly driver it was time to say Goodbye until Monday when we are meeting up for the River Kwai Tour.So Thanks once again to BKK and Nadia your the BEST . Kim@Paul.

Full day tour and floating markets - amazing. We did a full day tour of Bangkok with our guide Emmy, and then a floating markets 1/2 day tour again with Emmy.We loved both tours, saw and experienced so much. We were particularly impressed with our guide. She was able to change our programme at the last minute after we informed her we had already visited a couple of sights she intended on showing us. She was also extremely helpful, polite and knowledgable. The company have been extremely easy and professional to deal with at all times and we can't recommend them enough.

Excellent. BKK offers knowledgeable, english speaking guides. Many tours offer hotel pick up and pre paid entrance to see the sites. You will bypass line ups at the site and get a detailed description of what you are seeing from your guides

Best way to experience Bangkok for first time visitors! Thank you Ms. Sea :). We arrived in Bangkok late afternoon, and that evening I managed to book the Bangkok Highlights tour via email with Michiel. Very accommodating and efficient booking service which we very much appreciated. We paid a deposit via PayPal that night to secure our tour, and paid the balance to our guide (Ms. Sea) the next morning, and she immediately sent our receipt through to our email.Ms. Sea was at our lobby to meet us before our meeting time of 8:30am. Which was clear from the start that she was organised. And indeed she was!Ms. Sea provided us with a fun, educational and memorable day. I had mentioned to Ms. Sea that we had gone for a walk around our neighbourhood the night before and also caught the sky train, which we managed to do without any issues. So we didn't catch the train during the tour, so took taxi & tuk-tuks. From the markets, sites, yummy lunch, canal ride...it was very educating and fun. As we were a couple, Ms. Sea tried her best to steer us from larger crowds so she didn't have to raise her voice and so we could hear her...and get unobstructed photos. We highly recommend Ms. Sea and BKK Tours for anyone looking to have a guide show you around this awesome city/country with local insights and to ensure we all follow protocol when visiting sacred places.

Perfect intro to Bangkok!. From beginning to end, perfect experience. After researching, reading many reviews, booked with BKK for our first day in Thailand. We were a bit concerned about our jetlag after arriving at midnight the night before. BKK was very accomodating. Instead of their usual early start time, we planned to start our your at 10:30. Prompt pick-up, Ms.Air was so sweet, informative, and friendly. We usually explore on our own, but, we were hesitant in doing this in Bangkok with our limited time. So glad we had Ms.Air. Bangkok can be intimidating. She fit soooo much into our day. Temples, Palace, canal rides, delicious Thai lunch, intro to Thai customs and way of life,etc....it was a real treat to have her as our own personal guide. A real plus to have a one time payment to her instead of having to constantly pull out money for food,, Tuk tuks, metro, etc. I highly recommend BKK toùrs whether it is an intro to Bangkok or a more specific tour for return visitors.

Best choice we made. Thank you BKK tour and in particular Air for an amazing day. We were a group of 8 with 4 adults and 4 teenagers and we all loved our day out.. The 'pimped up van' was the bees knees with plenty of room and the best air conditioning... With some pre-planning we came up with a bit of everything including a first hand look into ChinaTown, the main Temples and a beautiful cruise through the canals.. Our tour helped us get our bearings and plan the remainder of our time in Bangkok.. Thanks Air you were a delight and we all fell in love with you xx

Excellent Tour. From initial contact to the actual tour, look no further for a tour company when visiting Bangkok and surrounds. Air is so lovely and informative and takes care of your every need. We loved the tour and will do another on our next visit. The snacks were interesting to say the least, the klong tour was amazing. Lunch at the Navy Club was superb.Thank you Air and Michiel for your help.

most memorable day tour... We had most memorable day cruising the canal venice of Asia in Bangkok. The day trip starts at 10am for the 8 of us accompany by Ms. AIR.The first stop was at the flower market many beautiful flowers and amazing flower craft by the vendors.Most exiciting was the feeding of fish near the temple not forgetting huge monitor lizards sun basking at the side of the canal.For lunch she brought us to restaurant that caters to our needs. Not only the food delicious but are reasonably price.The tour to jatuchak market was also very impressive. Above all Ms Air from Bkk tours did a good job in guiding us in Bangkok....land of thousand smiles indeed!

Amazing one day tour! . I had an amazing experience with Miss Sea during Bangkok Highlights and Chinatwon walking tour.If you really want to see and understand the history of the city from a local point of view, this is what you get with this tour. Miss Sea was very polite, with a good English and explains every details you need to know.I chose the public transportation option, it was quite part of the experience. The lunch in a local restaurant was delicious. The views of the flower & vegetable market, Wat Pho, Grand Palace, Emerald Buddha, trip through the canal, were without doubts a lovely experience!

A great day with Miss Oi. We took the full day tour taking in the main temples and long tail boat tour. We asked to have the Golden Buddha added on and this was no problem. Our tour guide was Miss Oi and we sailed through ticket queues and confusing places with few directions and signage. Miss Oi explained local customs such as identifying who our (date of birth) Buddha was and giving the gold leaf to our Buddah which she provided. The canal ride in the rain storm was hilarious and Miss Oi produced raincoats for us. Lunch was lovely and Miss Oi asked what we liked and ordered some similar dishes for us to try. A great day and worth every penny.

Bangkok One Day Tour. We had Ms Sea take us on our wonderful tour of Bangkok. Great sights, excellent insights and we felt thoroughly taken care of. I would recommend this tour whole heartedly. Ms Sea was excellent.

A feast of floating markets . We took the half day that took in the Thaka and Damnoen Saduak floating markets and the Maeklong Railway market. Our guide Miss Oi was a delight: friendly, knowledgeable and she ensured that we had a wonderful morning trying different treats and learning about the exotic produce. The contrasts between the markets made it all the more interesting - Thaka is more like a meeting of old friends and locals who are almost as interested in catching up as they were in selling their wares. A boat ride from Thaka took us through peaceful canals to a home where palm sugar is made the old fashioned way. Maeklong is also fascinating - lots of seafood, meats and other foods crammed into a narrow tract they share with a regular train (which is currently suspended while other developments are done on the line). When the train is operating, traders and customers have three minutes warning to pull back their goods and themselves from the line before the train trundles through. I would highly recommend this tour

Bangkok Highlights. We had the lovely Ms Sea who we couldn't recommended more. She was wonderful with our two girls and we all had the most amazing tour taking took tucks, boats, trains etc. Lots of walking, a full day but absolutely worth it. Thank you

Skip the cruise tour - book with these folks instead!. We were with our tour guide, Air, at the Grand Palace and just one other couple when we saw our fellow Cruiselings go by in a herd. I felt sooooo good! I cannot recommend BKK Tours highly enough. Air is a relaxed and charming tour guide, full of smiles, information and thoughtful details. The heat and humidity was awful but every time we got back in the fabulous luxury 'Bollywood' air-conditioned van, we were offered cold water and cooling facecloths; a god-send! The day was planned so well. The Palace and Reclining Buddha, the amazing flower market, terrific lunch, and an unforgettable longboat ride. Thank you so much to Michiel in the office, who owns the business along with Air, his email communication and Air's guiding on the day was five stars!Do yourself a favour, skip the expensive cruise ship tour and book with BKK Tours for an authentic experience. The port is a long way from town and being treated like royalty and pampered in BKK's fabulous vehicles on the drive is so worth it!

2-Day tour (shore excursion). Booked a 2 day tour in April 2014 (actual date) with BKK tours & had the wife of the team, Air as our guide. We chose the Bangkok full day tour + Authentic Ayutthaya. We were booked into a beautiful, former condo with a view of the city & waterways for our overnight stay (large luxurious tub!). The tour & Country met every expectation & the food provided surpassed it. I had even advised Air that being from the Northwest I was unaccustomed to extended periods of time in high heat & she was very cognizant of finding shade & times out of the sun. You will love this tour.

Highly Satisfied customers.... From my first email to BKK and then our day trip, I felt as if this company really has the wellbeing of their customers at heart. Michiels replies were super quick and very obliging to customize our needs into the time we had. Our guide Nadia, was the most delightful lady really aiming to please us. Ample water was available, had us interact with the flower sellers and folding lotus flowers. Thoroughly enjoyed our TFC from a vendor and a lovely Thai lunch at the Old Navy Club...just too much food. 5* treatment and overall really great value for money

Our BKK tour was one of the highlight of our trip through Asia.. My partner and I were in Bangkok for two days and one night at the end of August 2015. We thought that we would do a tour as our time was brief and we wanted to get a good insight into the city with the time we had. I booked BKK over the internet by email. We were met at the cruise terminal in Laemchabang by Ms Nadia and then driven in a comfortable bus into Bangkok. Prior to arriving all communication with BKK was good, they promptly answered emails, sent a pdf catalogue of their different tours and answered any questions or concerns. On arrival Ms Nadia welcomed us and on the trip to Bangkok, and throughout the two day tour, we were given plenty of cold bottled water and cool refresher towels.The bus was comfortable with tinted windows, leather seats and air-conditioning and plenty of leg room.Ms Nadia was a wonderful guide. You may have heard that the Thai people are gentle and extremely hospitable. Ms Nadia embodied these qualities and she has a great local knowledge and was always willing to share knowledge and information about her city, country and culture. If we had tried to explore Bangkok on our own there is no way we would have seen as much or have gained such insight. The tour was inclusive of lunch and admissions and some other activities (orchid folding at the flower market) as well as some snacks and drinks. We visited the colourful flower and vegetable market, had lunch at the Navy Club restaurant, went to the Grand Palace and the Emerald Buddha and later to the Reclining Buddha. We had a tuk tuk ride through the busy streets and later a tail boat ride along the canals of Bangkok, at one point we stopped to feed some of the many fish that live in the canals. The extensive rivers and canals make one see why Bangkok is sometimes called the Venice of the Orient. The tail boat took us directly to our hotel, the Royal Orchid Sheraton that has it's own pier right on the river. It was a great way to arrive and check into the hotel at the end of a long and busy day. Ms Nadia arrived at the hotel early next morning for the second day of our tour and took us to the amazing Tha Kha Floating Markets a little outside of Bangkok. These are the more authentic floating markets and as such there is a noticeable lack of tourists. I noted only one other small group. The markets were beautiful, women in their boats trading and cooking for market visitors as they have done so for decades. I was able to talk to one of these older ladies with the help of Ms Nadia as translator. We then went on a boat trip through the narrow canals around the plantations and homes in the area. After this we then went to Bangkok to a more touristy and larger floating market. The comparison between the two was interesting. I enjoyed both markets but I think that Tha Kha was my favourite. Ms Nadia took us to a noodle vendor in the markets. This lady prepares the most amazing delicious noodles in her boat, she has been selling bowls of noodles at the markets since she was 13 years old and she is now in her 70s and has become a bit of an institution. Doing this tour through BKK with Ms Nadia and our professional driver was like visiting family in Bangkok and having them show you around. It was great and I would not only highly recommend BKK tours but I plan on doing another tour with them on my next visit to Bangkok.

Very good day tour. Great to book a private day tour with BKK Tours. Almost a day long with tour guide around Bangkok. The boat trip on river and channels was very impressive. I will not forget the good fun when see thousands of catfish jump up for bread at a corner where locals offer fishes, birds,...back to mother nature. Very cultural and I appreciate it. Lunch right on side of river was great, too, with typical Thai's Tom Yum Gung. Yeah, I still remember, thick soup, not light soup as international Thai Tom Yum. And of course a big thanks to Oi, our tour guide.

The best way to see and experience Bangkok. We didn't have much time to see Bangkok so we wanted a guide who would show us the key sites, explain things to us, and keep the children interested in everything around us.Although not cheap, the tour was fantastic. From the initial enquiry we sent to the follow up email afterwards, it was a pleasure to deal with them and nothing was too much effort. Tailored to our needs, Miss Air was knowledgeable, friendly, warm and considerate. She designed the best itinerary for us and filled our day with wonderful experiences, interesting information and fun. She took things at our pace and we never felt rushed or under pressure. Highly recommended!

Perfect if you are on a quick trip in Bangkok. I used the company for 2 1-day trip.Bangkok Highlights and Floating marketsBangkok highlights : The + : Communication and organisation before to the trip with absolutely outstanding. The guide was on time at the hotel and sat down with us to show us the itinerary and payment was made on the day with the price agreedYou get to see the main touristic points of Bangkok ( temples), the guide ( Emmy) really cared about details ( she bought us flowers, water every hour, refreshing towels), the restaurant was good , the boat tour very nice and we even managed to go to China town. She dropped us back to the hotel afterward.the-/+You will get general highlights, do not expect a history class. This tour is perfect if you are in the city for a day and need to see as much as possible with someone who knows how/where to take you. You can go to all these places by yourself if you stay a couple of days. It is an expensive tour but it is hassle free. The floating marketWe had a last day in Bangkok before leaving Thailand and I really wanted to visit the floating markets. I had agreed on an itinerary with Michiel ( the man behind the emails) prior to the trip.+Again, communication was smooth, pick up on time and all the areas were covered. These markets are out of Bangkok ( about an hour driving) and not easy to locate so it is nice to go with a driver.+/-I was sent with a slightly less experienced guide ( this was agreed before). The floating markets were the reason why I booked the trip, I did not really care for the temple or the cave. The first market I visited was very local, less touristy and we enjoyed seeing a coco plantation but I did not feel the buzz or excitement or the floating market there were around 7 boats in total. When we went to the other market that is when I felt the emotion. Unfortunately a tour on a boat had not been agreed and I really had to push and insist to go on a boat there. After asking 2 times, on the 3rd occasion I said firmly to the guide who was keeping on ignoring my request ' we want to go on the boat'. At that time we had a lot of time in front of us. After calling her boss she agreed for an extra charge for the boat which was not an issue for us. The restaurant on that day ( the cabbage and condom) offered good food but was a bit on the old side. My biggest deception was with the ' folk museum/temple' that was scheduled for the afternoon. I really did not get the point of seeing this. The guide could not explain the history behind and it was like seeing an old house with antique furniture in the basement. There was no shadow light show so we were done in 10 minutes. That was it for the day. We drove back to the airport and were there 1 hour before the scheduled end of the tour. On this tour I felt it was not worth the money spent. My recommendation for this tour :if like me you are interested in the floating market then make it clear that you want to spend time there and scrap the folk museum. There is no point in rushing there if you enjoy it. I flew 12 hours to see that and it was done in 30 minutes. Make it clear when you book, The guide has seen it a hundred times but for you it will be unique. Also, there is no real need of a guide here. The tour can be done with a driver only. Even if our guide ( Ms Sea was really friendly and did her best to help)

What an amazing day!. With just two days in Bangkok I knew I needed to book a tour instead of trying to get the most of it on my own. Researching led me to this great company and the experience was stellar! Emailing and booking with Michiel was a breeze. Completely customer oriented I was assisted in choosing the Bangkok Highlights day tour. This was a long private tour but felt like it flew by. The morning of our tour we were greeted at our hotel by Ms. Oi whose warm personality immediately let us know that we had made the right choice and Michiel had booked us a terrific guide. We traveled first to the Wat Pho temple where Ms Oi assisted us in entering the temple as the Thai do. We got our fortune and made offerings to our birth Buddhas before moving into the great reclining Buddha. Ms. Oi offered so much information throughout our tour and made sure we saw things that others might miss like a couple working on a restoration area of the temple on a large Buddha. We finished this tour by walking past an area where a monk was taking offerings from Thai Buddhists in the form of young monk care packages with robes and other essentials. I asked Ms. Oi if it was proper for us to do this and she said less and led us through the ceremony. We made the offering as instructed in the names of our departed loved ones and my son choose his departed grandparents. As we made our offering the young monk blessing us nodded and smiled slightly to encourage us that we were doing it correctly. This memory will live with us forever and Ms.Oi's generous and welcoming assistance made it happen. We went on to visit the Royal Palace and flower and food markets. Ms. Oi had us try a delicious fruit and bought some to send us back to the hotel with. She cared for our thirst and heat by buying us water and an ice towel at the temple. We enjoyed a lovely lunch where her recommendations were spot on and delicious. Our last stop was a long boat ride through the Bangkok canals where we saw many sites and few catfish at a temple. We took tuk tuks, taxis, metro, and long boat on this tour and learned so much about Bangkok and its citizens along the way. When we said goodbye to Ms. Oi at our hotel we were both sorry to see her go and wished we had time for another tour outside the city with her.

A great experience! They went above and beyond.. We did the waterfall tour and combined it with the elephant sanctuary tour. We were picked up in a spacious and comfortable van and the tour guide was very informative and friendly. The waterfall swimming experience was fun and the fish nibbled on your feet. Lunch at a restaurant was included and there was lots to eat. The elephant sanctuary was very memorable. We learned a lot about the animals and prepared food for them. We were able to hand feed these amazing animals. We swam with them in the river Kwai and were able to climb up onto them while we swam. One of our group members lost his glasses in the river and they were miraculously found the following day as the river level had dropped. The tour company owner communicated with our group and made arrangements to meet with us at the airport to drop off the glasses. I will definitely do another tour with this company!

Brilliant tour company . I booked our tours via email before our arrival to Bangkok, the emails I received were clear and very helpful.We did the Bangkok city tour and ancient Ayutthaya, they were both very interesting and well organised tours. Nadia was very knowledgeable and kind during our two days, we learned about the history of both places, customs and tried gorgeous local food, fruits, drinks and temple customs which were all great. On both days we were met in the hotel reception and taken on all modes of transport including a taxi, tuk tuk, long boat, Sky train on the first day and the second day we had a great air conditioned bus and the lovely driver who really looked after us and joined us for lunch which was very pleasant.We had two very full and fun packed days with Nadia and would recommend this very professional company. Thank you Nadia and the lovely driver and Michiel.

Fablous day in Ayuttaya with BKK Tour !. Air and Sea our 2 guides were very professional and knowledgeable about the city, the history and the cuture of Thaïlandwe saw exceptionnal things out of the touristic paths like a school temple with Young monks we could interact with all is included during the day and the mini van is extremely confortable (snacks, fresh towels, lunch, drinks...) If you want to book a tour to discover Bangkok and surroundings do not hesitate to contact BKK tour

Simply the Best. Our first time in Bangkok and BKK tours was an excellent choiceBKK tours - the Best organised tour ever.Nadia - best Host ever, our day with Nadia around Bangkok was perfect, she was really knowledgeable and took us places we would never see alone. "Simply the best, better than all the rest."I would recommend to anyone.

2 days of fun with nadir our perfect host. We had two great days with our host nadia who was always busy busy making sure everything was great for us the whole time and even when my daughter got very hot and faint at the grand palace she got a doctor to look at her and the ambulance actually drove us the river .I would recommend bkk tours to everyone and the lovely nadia was a great host

An excellent tour of Bangkok highlights. I found BKK tours through trip advisor and decided to book with them because of their excellent reviews.I found them thorough and professional right from the start, excellent communication detailing exactly what the tour would entail and the cost.Our tour guide Emma met us at our hotel lobby as advised. we had hired a car to take us around the sights as this was an option given, another option was to see the sights using the local transports but we were worried of getting tired and hot because of the humidity. Luckily for us traffic was not a problem on that day, usually they do not recommend taking a car around as bangkok is known for it's crazy traffic. Emma took us around to see the beautiful flower and veg market,the temple of the reclining buddha, the grande palace, the temple of the emerald buddha and a lovely tail boat ride through the canals of bangkok. Refreshments were provided all day and we also had an amazing thai lunch by the riverside.We stuck to schedule and finished our tour at 4.30pm as indicated.If you are looking for a bangkok highlights tour I really do recommend BKK tours as they are very organised andEmma was so lovely to have as a guide. We had a lovely day and would recommend this one day tour to anyone visiting Bangkok for the first time.

Excellent tour adapted to suit our needs, with good advice on what to do.. We are a family of 4 with 2 boys. We had a tour with Ms Pary. We took the public transport option, Ms Pary adapted the tour to suit our requirements, particularly the use of tuk tuk's which we al, enjoyed. Her English was good and she was happy to answer questions and help us with choices of what for our remaining time in. Bangkok.

Exceptional value for money. My husband and I took the Kanchamburi Highlights tour and it was worth every cent. I very hot and humid conditions we were guided and cared for in the very best manner. Pick up and return were on time, the vehicle most comfortable......the driver appearing with drinks and cold towels whenever we stopped. Lunch was a la carte in a pleasant resort.Ms Air took us to the most important sights in the area, we saw The Bridge from bother the river and the land. I struggled on the walk along the open section of the railway, taking longer than expected but our guide showed patience and consideration. Her knowledge was good and her English excellent. Walking the open section of the Burma Railway was a touching experience and I am grateful to BKK Tours for making it possible

Great Ayutthaya Tour. After checking many websites about the tour to Ayutthaya, we finally decided to take the tour from BKK which we are really satisfied with the service. Right from the first correspondence with Michiel whom always be delighted to answer to all of our questions up to arranging the tour with Oi as our tour guide, who is very acknowledged and helpful in many ways. We would like to thank Michiel and Oi for such a lovely service that BKK Tour provided. Even it is not a big tour company, but they do really cater to everyone's need.

Ayutthaya and Bangkok tours. This is my 4th year using BKK Tours and Air was again my guide. I had booked a 4 day programme that included an overnight stay in Ayutthaya and then 2 day tours from my Bangkok hotel. The overnight stay in Ayutthaya was particularly memorable with a night time tour of floodlit temple ruins free from the usual hordes of tourists. In Bangkok the visit to the Royal Barges Museum, canal tour by long tail boat and local temple visit were very interesting. That evening we had dinner at Eat Sight Story with wonderful views of Wat Arun. Afterwards we visited Wat Po for a nighttime tour of the floodlit temple. On the final day we travelled outside Bangkok to visit the small but interesting Erawan Museum and then the Amphawa floating market including a long tail boat tour. As before the level of service offered by Air and her driver was excellent, from the airport pickup to the end of final tour. Overall I highly recommend BKK Tours.

Great tours in BKK. My husband and I booked three days of tours with BKK. Michiel, the owner, has always been very prompt in answering and he also cared about advising me before the tour that the railway market had temporary no train. Our tour guide was Oi, an extremely sweet and caring girl that provided us many informations and was always trying to improve our experience. All restaurants we went to had very good food. They also proved to be very honest as my husband could not go on a boat tour because of an ankle problem and Ms Oi took the cost of the boat out of the total (not so evident as per separate review of another tour). One more thing that I really liked is that during the tours we often met other BKK tours guide and they were all very nice kind. It seems like they really love their job and aim to provide the best service for their guests. Well done and thank you again Ms Oi!

Excellent Half-Day Tour. Air was really wonderful. We got to see the main sites and get a sense of the local atmosphere. Also, when I was feeling weak because of an on-going stomach bug, Air left the Grand Palace complex to get me some much-needed Gatorade. Truly attentive service.

If Carlsberg did tour guides this would be it . Spent a fantastic 2 days with the lovely Miss Nadia She showed us the sights sounds and smells of this wonderful city and countryside as only a local could and we tried all the local transport too Was great to understand and take part in the Buddhist traditions 'Spending' coins at the reclining Buddha to see if our wishes will come true-mine will! Eating crispy chicken and sticky rice street food sampling Thai tea Awe inspiring temples palaces and waterfalls A delightful afternoon at an ethical elephant sanctuary and a stop at The bridge over the river Kwai

great day out. excellent service from start to finnish, we had oi as our guide for the day, so friendly soon felt at ease with her, and a fun day to see the tourist and not so tourist side of bangkok. we travelled by taxi long tail boat and the crazy tuk tuk .very good tour and i think good value as every thing included

Wonderful!. Our family spent 3 great days with Oi and had an absolutely wonderful experience. She made sure to make the experience relevant to our 12 and 14 year olds by pointing out things that would interest them. She was knowledgable about the sights and was happy to share with us the history and culture of her country. The van service was wonderful as well. Michiel was also very helpful when arranging this trip with suggestions of what would be appropriate for our family. Thank you for a wonderful experience.

Half day market tour. Excellent, professional, and accommodating. We had booked a tour through our hotel the previous day and as a comparison, BKK was less expensive, the tour guide was easier to understand, super bubbly, and SO friendly (thanks Oi!). The floating market tour had a great variety of fruits and some amazing Pad Thai. The railway market was uh, quite the genuine Thai experience. Not for those with weak stomachs! We were glad we ate first! Shout out to BKK for their courtesy in telling us up front the train is not running; we appreciated the professionalism in advance. Oi was so sweet and also took us to the flower market which I highly recommend going to - WOW. Orchids for days! As a tip, we went to the Chatachuk market on our own afterwards and did lots of shopping for souvenirs then which was great. The BKK tour is a fantastic way to learn about Bangkok and experience the markets you wouldn't normally venture out to on your own.

THE BEST TOUR COMPANY – PERFECTION IN EVERY ASPECT!. It is our pleasure to give BKK Tours and Ms. Air our highest recommendation! Our full day tour to Ayutthaya with Ms. Air was the highlight of our stay in Bangkok. We went on other tours in Thailand and BKK Tours totally surpassed all others in their professionalism, knowledge, service, and attentiveness. From the start with booking our reservation (Michiel's responses were quick and he made the process easy) to Ms. Air’s expertise and generous hospitality the entire day – everything was perfect.Throughout the day, we were delighted by the many activities and places that we had the honor of experiencing. At times, we were the only tourists! Along the way, Ms. Air treated us to drinks, snacks, frequent cold towels and cold water which were a welcome relief for the very hot day, transportation in a luxurious minivan, and a delicious Thai lunch with a perfect view of the river. Her knowledge of Thailand’s history was exceptional and her flawless command of the English language was appreciated.Every aspect of this tour was outstanding and there aren’t enough adjectives that I could use to describe the wonderful time that we had. Thank you, BKK Tours and Ms. Air for sharing your love of Thailand by allowing us to experience your history and culture. We appreciate your taking such good care of us and we are grateful that we found your company!

I felt like a rockstar. Nadia was my guide. Super sweet and super knowledgeable. As a first time Bangkok visitor, I was guilty of the following: Day 1: My cell phone would not charge. I told Nadia and she insisted we stop at a cell phone store riding into a town about an hour or so outside of BKK. She assisted me with translating so I could secure enough charge to take pictures of the train and floating markets. Day 2: Partied too hard the previous night and was about a half hour late coming downstairs. She waited patiently. The restaurant by the long tail boat dock was AMAZING!!! OMG. She ordered for us and I was so happy. The only thing I will hold against Nadia is being so sweet she gave me a toothache and making me gain about 2 lbs. with all the food she ordered over the two days we were together. When I return with my children, I will definitely use BKK tours again.

This is THE tour company to contact for your time in Thailand!. Michiel promptly responded to our request for the Bangkok Highlight Tour. He even accommodated us when we needed to change dates due to medical reasons. Oi, our tour guide, was a delight. She was prompt, professional and engaging. She paced the tour in a way that made us feel as though we had time to see everything but not hurried or delayed. We would definitely call on them again upon our return to Thailand. Great time!

A new friend in Bangkok. We've had tours with BKK Tours on two previous occasions - we can't fault their prompt communication, easy customisation of tours, personal attention and outstanding knowledge of this wonderful city. We even keep in touch with Michiel and Air via Facebook. This year they were travelling abroad so Nadia was our guide. Happily for us we now have a new friend in Bangkok! I'd arrived in Bangkok but my suitcase had not. Within minutes of meeting Nadia on the morning of our tour and once she learned of my missing suitcase she was on the phone to my airline acting as go-between. This was really unexpected but shows what an exceptionally genuine and kind person she is. Sensing that I was a bit stressed, Nadia asked us if we would like to go an adventure to some of her favorite places before we commenced the main part of our tour. Of course we said yes, and I won't give anything away (you have to go on the tour for that!) but we were taken to some of Chinatown's hidden gems and secret laneways. Amazing photo opportunities at every turn. We continued on to the Grand Palace and despite the rain it was an incredible day as Nadia taught us so much - her knowledge is amazing. She was always whipping out umbrellas just before the rain came, knew how to avoid the crowds, the best angles for photos. She was always looking out for us, she even offered to buy my husband a rain poncho. After our tour she kept in touch with us daily on Facebook while she continued to make inquiries with the airline. This was such a blessing as we didn't have international roaming on our phones, so when my suitcase was found the airline was able to notify Nadia. I really don't know what we would have done without her. We owe her our deep gratitude for her tenacity and determination.We regard this tour company so highly we are already booked to go to Kanchanaburi in 2016.

BKK best Private Tours in Bangkok. i have been to 5 countries and have used different Tour companies and BKK Tours wins hands down, Nadia & Emmy where amazing making sure everything is goes to plan and look after me every well. if Anyone thinking of going Bangkok you have to use BKK Tours.

Excellent day out!. Our guide was Ms Pary, the whole day was amazing!From the start Ms Pary ensured we were happy with the itinerary and as we had not had breakfast she took us for local coffee and thai breakfast. All the places we visited were amazing and breathtaking, even in the midday heat Ms Pary ensured we were comfortable by supplying us with water and cold towels. She is very knowledgable and speaks brilliant English.The a la carte lunch was really nice, Ms Pary ordered a variety of dishes and we all shared.An amazing day with an amazing guide! Thank you.

Excellent private tours. Our tour guide M was outstanding! He was knowledgable, patient and very considerate to everyone on tours. We never felt rushed during any of the tours. Our driver was always ready with cold water and refreshing cool towels.
Couldn't has asked for a better experience!

Hellfire Pass...Wouldn't go with anyone else.. As many others have mentioned, we were impressed long before pick up time by Michiel's professional email communication. We had every confidence we would be picked up as stated and indeed we were. 7am sharp, there was Emmy in her white and orange BKK shirt in the foyer of our hotel. Dorm our friendly BKK driver was waiting outside with the most ornate, comfortable mini van we have ever seen!! With interesting and sensitive commentary and friendly chat in excellent English, Emmy led us through a very relaxed, non-rushed 12 hour tour out to Kanchanburi War Cemetery, the River Kwai, a walk along the railway, and onto the amazing, sobering, Hellfire Pass. Dorm had cold drinks and freezing wet towels for us at every stop. The lunch was nothing short of spectacular, amazing food whilst we over-looked the river. This was an unexpected highlight. The whole experience left us so satisfied and grateful. We were very pleased with our choice of provider and had actually made our choice based on other Trip Advisor reviews here. (If you like coffee then the 'Amazon Coffee' chain found at various service stations is one to look out for. Get the Amazon Special which is a double shot of java goodness - fantastic). Thanks BKK for making this tour the best part of our trip to Thailand which is exactly what we hoped for.

Excellent tour guide & overall service. We spent a wonderful day with Emmy as our guide and couldn't have been happier with the service she and the driver provided. It was the first day of the Songkran festival so the company prepared us well that we were likely to get wet and advised us to bring a change of clothes so that we could get ready for the flight we were taking right after the tour. I appreciated the heads up and proactive planning. Emmy was wonderful and very thoughtful and knowledgeable throughout the trip - in addition to just being a lovely person to spend the day with. From start to finish the tour was great.

Sightseeing Time Maximized and Enjoyment Multiplied. Before our tour even started, we knew we were going to have an outstanding tour. E-mail correspondence planning the trip was prompt and questions answered thoroughly. Michiel matched our interests with tour suggestions. After reading many recommendations for a guide named Miss Air, we specifically asked for her. Many tour operators promise a particular guide but then make a switch without notifying the guests. As BKK Tours promised, Miss Air was holding the name of our group as we exited our cruise ship.We were led to a very comfortable AC van and introduced to our driver Est. During our two days of touring, he was very attentive, greeted us with cold, wet washcloths, bottles of water, and was always willing to provide assistance getting into and out of the van.Miss Air was what previous reviewers had written. She shared much interesting information, knew when to take us places for best advantage, had a beautiful smile and a sweet personality, very attentive, extremely organized, offered frequent restroom breaks and even went into the facilities to check for cleanliness. Throughout our tour she also provided small courtesies to enhance our enjoyment: opportunity to place gold leaf on a Buddha figure, to throw coins in 108 bronze bowls at Wat Pho to feed the catfish in the canal, and to enjoy take-out sticky rice and mango on the long drive back to our cruise ship.Bangkok Metropolis has a population of over eight million and is one of the world’s top tourist destinations so planning a quick two-day tour for first-time visitors was daunting. Between places we wanted to see and experiences suggested by BKK Tours, we returned to our cruise ship with fantastic memories to last a lifetime. Our sightseeing time was maximized and our enjoyment was truly multiplied. One suggestion: book a tour with this tour company early. There are many good Bangkok tour operators but this one is outstanding.

Awesome tours, great guide! Perfect!. One word - AMAZING! This is simply the best tour experience possible. After looking around at the huge amount of tours on offer we decided on BKK as they were #1 rated on TripAdvisor and now we know why. From the start Michiel was very responsive to emails and designed tours that we requested. Our guide was Air who was outstanding. Her English was great and her knowledge was just perfect. There were 4 of us and we did the Full day Bangkok tour and the Bridge over the river Kwai tour.Full day bangkok tour - This is great if you want to see everything and go by various means of local transport. Because you have a guide you don't need to worry about haggling prices for taxis or tuk tuks. The Long boat ride up the river was great! The tour is private too which just makes it more special. The flower market is great and the temples are amazing. Air has so much knowledge and she has the balance right with letting you explore and gathering you back to tell you information. The River Kwai tour is wonderful, if you are a history lover this is great! It is an emotional tour and very thought provoking. It is a whole day tour. Cool towels and water are provided throughout the day which is very welcome in the bangkok heat! Again Air is a wonderful guide and were so lucky to have her for both days of our tours.We were met at our hotel and picked up by a luxurious mini van. Our driver was also great.Book BKK tours you won't regret it!

Fantastic day. This is one of the best tours I've been on.They came and picked us up from our hotel in a really comfortable mini bus with cold water waiting for us.The tour guide was first class.She spoke very good English and I felt very at ease talking to her.The drive out of Bangkok to our 1st stop was just over an hour but in that time our guide was answering questions and telling us all about Thailand so the time flew.The 1st stop was to the railway market.It felt so authentic to been walking down the railway track with people on each side selling almost anything.Our guide bought some fruit for us to try which was delicious.We were taken to the other side of the market to wait for the train to pass through.It was amazing to watch the sellers at the market prepare for the train to pass through as the warning alarm went off.We then got back to the bus to continue the tour,whee fresh cold water was waiting and a cold towel to help cool down.We then went to the floating markets which I really enjoyed.We were in the boat for about half an hour and there's people on either side and in boats going past you,selling lots of different things.This was a half day tour and cost us about £60 each,which seems expensive but I thought it was well worth it to see something outside of Bangkok that you wouldn't do independently.It was a fantastic day and I really would highly recommend it.

Fantastic Tour of Bangkok. This is quite simply the best tour experience possible. My wife and I researched tours for our stay in Bangkok and select BKK Tours. We saw they were #1 rated on TripAdvisor and now we know why. Michiel was very responsive to email and designed a tour that fit our interests exactly. We asked to begin our tour midday after we arrived so we could rest, and BKK worked around our schedule completely. Our tour guide, Ms. Oi, was friendly, knowledgeable, and always made extra effort to make sure we were comfortable. I was impressed by her detailed historical and cultural knowledge of each site we visited. She struck a perfect balance between letting us explore on our own while giving us all the facts and details we wanted. We were so glad to be on our own and not part of the big crowd. BKK arranged for everything: clean and comfortable transportation, bottled water, and delicious authentic meals. I felt like we experienced things most tours cannot offer. You can't go wrong choosing BKK.

Bangkok Day trip. We cannot recommend this company highly enough. We were looked after by Oi for our day trip, she was the most kind and thoughtful young lady, a true delight who placed our needs first and ensured we had the best of days!

Expensive but fun!. Another great find thanks to Tripadvisor!! Michiel was great from the first email, and kept in touch right up until the trip. The vehicle was very comfy, air con with cold drinks and fresh towels available- all needed for the 1 1/2 trip outside Bangkok. Our tour guide (Ms Emmy) stood in at the last minute to cover illness, even changing her own holiday plans and was very knowledgeable with great English. We did the half day tour to the railway and floating market which at £120 for 2 was quite expensive. Fresh fruit/drinks bought from local vendors during the trip.

Best Tour Company EVER!. We were planning to be in Bangkok at the beginning of our Honeymoon only for a couple days because thats where the main flight came in, however we decided to stay extra days and explore the city! Man am I glad we did that, it ended up being our favorite stop in entire Thailand! (and my wife originally didnt even want to stay at all because she everyone always thinks of "beaches" associated with Thailand but man LOVED it too!). I decided to book BKK tours due to the incredible reviews they have on here and I am soooo glad I booked 2 tours with them! Michiel is Fantastic and was soooo helpful emailing back and forth and customizing the tours we wanted with the days we had available, he also went far and beyond with other suggestions for us for restaurants and etc always extremely fast at responding.We did the Bankok Highlights tours with the Mrs Air and the markets tour with Mrs. Oi and I cant even describe in words how awesome they both were yet so different! Always so sweet, helpful, available for any questions, sooooo knowledgable! By the end of the day I didnt consider them just tour guides but family/friends. I literally would describe Mrs Air as my big sister (always teasing me! ahah) and Mrs Oi as my little sister ahah We had so much fun together and I loved all the personal touches they give and how they adjust the tours depending on weather, how tired we are, and outside things that may happen. Mrs Oi even took us to a coconut plantation that was not part of tour and we got to experience a real traditional Thai meal.. we LOVED that! And Mrs Air was so fabolous explaining us all the history of the temples and took us on a real tour of Bangkok using local transportation and going tru all the markets, explaining us traditions and making us do them.... man we loved these tours and never wanted them to end!!!! Thank you again to all of you...you guys are awesome, keep it up! And for anyone reading this, look NO FURTHER... i took a lot of tours around the world and they are by far the best company I have ever dealt with ALL around.PS your luxury van was sooo cool and awesome, always giving us a cold water and chilled towels everytime we got back in the van... what a touch of class!!!

Great day tours from BKK. Engaged BKK Tours for 2 day trips to Ayutthaya and Authentic Markets (Railway Market & Damnoen Saduak floating market). I extended the Authentic Markets trip with Wat Pho and Wat Arun. I also arranged a one-way airport transfer with them. BKK refunded the admission fees for Wat Arun as the temple is currently under renovations and the entire temple is covered by scaffolding, hence not worth a visit. Michiel replied my emails promptly and offered some discounts for the trips. Really appreciate that! Their luxury van was comfortable and spacious for the 7 of us. Cold water and chilled towels were given a few times throughout the trip. Our guide Ms Oi was friendly & cheerful. She's around our age and happened to be Ethnic Chinese as well, so we have some other common topics. We had delicious authentic Thai food by the riverside for lunch. Instead of pre-ordering the food, we were free to choose what we would like to eat. Ms Oi made some good recommendations and I got to try some food for the first time (mee krob, chicken larb). BKK is very flexible with last minute requests, like changing the drop-off location after the trip. Thanks Michiel & Ms Oi!

Great Personal Tour Guide Service in Bangkok. On a recent trip to Thailand I had three free days in Bangkok before joining up with a group for some scuba diving in Phuket. Based on several tripadvisor reviews I contacted Michiel at BKK tours to arrange for some photography/sightseeing tours. Through our e-mail correspondence we came up with an itinerary for the three days that would give me a great overview of the many sights in the Bangkok area, teach me about the city, its history and its culture, and allow me to visit some terrific temples, markets, ruins and local neighborhoods filled with photogenic places and people.The first day, Michiel and Ms Nez met me early in the morning with an air conditioned van and driver and we set off to visit several markets and temples in the greater Bangkok area. We visited the Tha Kha floating market, the railway market , a palm sugar plantation, the Grand Palace and Wat Phra Kaew temple. Michiel's insights as to how to get the most unique photographs of the people and the sites were excellent. Between every stop our driver met us with the van with air conditioning on, cold towels and bottled water at the ready. The whole day tour included many local snacks, lunch at an excellent local restaurant and all entrance fees.The second day,Ms Nez and I, with our van and driver, headed out to Ayutthaya to visit the modern temples and ancient ruins. We traveled between some sights by private long-tailed boat.The guide's knowledge of local history, customs, the temples and their religion helped put everything in perspective. She served as translator while I sat and visited with the senior Monk at the new temple, an experience I could not have imagined otherwise. Again, lunch and all fees were included.The third day, at my request, my guide, M, showed me around town using local transportation, the local boat services, the skytrain, cabs and tuk-tuks. We visited Chinatown (one of the biggest in the world) and several other neighborhoods. We kept up a running conversation on Thai history, culture, politics and religion. Again photography was easy as M broke the ice with local people and pointed out the best locations for unique shots.All in all this was a great experience and I can't imagine that it could have been better. The fee for the three days was less than I have paid for single day private tours elsewhere and the service throughout was first class. Michiel is a Dutch national married to a Thai woman and they run the tour service together with the help of several local guides. If you want to experience all that Bangkok has to offer in a short visit this is the way to go.

Perfect 1st Anniversary. Right from the first email, Michiel responded and supported us during our trip plans and even went out of his way to recommend the perfect wine for us for our meal. Our guide was his wife Air, who was fun, knowledgable , helpful and very very supportive on the whole tour.We have some amazing memories and photos of our first wedding anniversary thanks to BKK.Air took us for lunch at wonderful Thai / western restaurant , my wife was over the moon she could have steak! Thank you!!!!!!!Weather was 38c and heat was HOT , fresh water on tap, cooling rags and umbrellas really helped with this , all supplied on tour.The van was lovely, thank you to the driver who drove us in Thai traffic ;) I certainly would wouldnt want too!.We went to Ayutthaya which was a stunning place , temples, buddas, we learned a lot of history and even sat in on, and took part in a ceremony with the biggest budda in Thailand.Amazing experience.Thank you so much for a wonderful day.And as promised, see you in the next life air ;)Best wishes Daniel and Lee-Anne.

Excellent Customer service, excellent/fantastic tours and tour guides/drivers. Excellent customer service :Right from the start during the planning stage , Michel responded to all my emails promptly, provided many advise and base on my needs he did came up with an excellent plan & tours for my group of 10 people (including 3 seniors) which we really enjoyed. He even arrange the transport from/to the airport. which was on time. Thus excellent customer service.Excellent Tours and excellent tour guides/drivers :We booked 3 tours ==>1. Bangkok Highlights guided by Ms Nadia2. Authentic Markets (railway market/tha kha for boat tour/damnoen saduak) guided by Ms Oi and Ms Emmy3.Authentic Ayutthaya guided by Ms Oi and Ms EmmyThe tours ==>All 3 tours were very interesting tours and very well run. We see a lot of things, went to many places, tried local snacks/drinks. Lunch were fantastic too with all the local food . They constantly provide several cold water bottles and cool wet towels several times during the tours which I think is a very good feature to keep us all hydrated and cool - a great plus feature of the tours. Overall very excellent tours and very well run too.The tour guides/drivers ==>The tour guides speak good English and very knowledgeable in explaining each tour or places we went and also knows a lot of the history on the places we visit. Very interesting. We did go to all the places as describe on the itinerary. Very accomodating on our needs. I have 3 seniors in their 80's and they have taken so good care of the seniors to ensure that they are comfortable and adjust the space of the tours if need be. Due to the way that they have taken care of the seniors, all the seniors were very very happy with the tours. Really they (guide & driver) took great length to ensure that the seniors are well taken of during the tours and also of course us too. The drivers did a good job on the driving too.Overall BKK Tour company does provide excellent tours and very well run. Highly recommended.Tourist from CANADA.

BKK Tours Bangkok. This was money well spent, owned by a Dutchman, BKK Tours is meticulously organized and well planned. Our Tour guide Mrs Oi was always on time and spoke english fluently.BKK goes out of their way to show you the best sites in and around Bangkok. Tha Kha was a great experience, we paddled our own boat and visited palm sugar plantation, all organized by BKK. only few westerners at this market!Ayatthuya was also a great experience, the entire day was well planned, visited monk village and took the boat to the temple site where Mrs Oi planned a delicious lunch which was included in the cost. BKK is a bit more then other tours but you get what you pay for!
