Great day out with BKK Tours. Everything about this company was good right from the start with easy online booking and payment and very quick replies to questions we had before leaving. We did the Bangkok Highlights Tour with our guide for the day being Nadia, who couldn't do enough to make sure we had a great day. We were a family of 2 adults and 2 kids (12 and 8 year old) and she made sure everyone was looked after, having fun and learning about Bangkok and Thai culture. Everything was included in the price with lots of added extras as you go along. Nadia knew all the behind the scene places to go and was able to avoid the crowds (where possible) in a busy city. She showed us things we would never have found ourselves. Highly recommend BKK Tours and our guide Nadia.

Fantastic Tours. I recently had two tours with BKK Tours. First off, the communication prior to my trip was great. They responded quick, gave advice, and planned great tours. The price is a bit high but with that everything is covered, including meals. On our first day out, Nadia took my wife and I to the historical city of Ayutthaya and the weekend market. Both were great and Nadia really knew her stuff! She was also fun and engaging. She took us to a restaurant for lunch near Ayutthaya which was probably the best food we ate in Thailand. On our second day out, Ms. Air took my wife and I to authentic floating markets, a railway market, and then to Kanchanaburi for Elephant's Word, a refuge for rescued elephants. We had so much fun on this trip! We learned and experienced a lot!I cannot recommend BKK Tours enough. They were great!

Excellent Tour. I chose to use BKK tours after hearing a lot of good things about them, I was not disappointed. Michiel was very helpful through the booking process, offering advice and guidance which helped us to get the best out of the day. The transport arrived bang on time, excellent quality vehicle, with a guide and driver who were both excellent. Our guide as called Chao, as was our driver, They both worked together to give us the best experience possible. Nothing was too much trouble. The level of knowledge and expertise that Chao was able to provide helped us to learn about Thailand, as well as providing a wealth of information about Kanchanaburi. We visited Hellfire pass, a very moving experience. The museum was incredible, a museum with almost no exhibits, due to the fact that the prisoners of war had nothing, and left nothing such was the abuse and neglect that they suffered. The pictures, film and illustrations told you all you needed to know. We then had lunch at a resort on the River Kwai, crossed the famous bridge and visited the Jeath museum, which was a reconstruction of a POW hut. BKK provided unlimited coffee, drinks, lunch, fruit, anything we wanted all at no extra cost. They are not the cheapest, but you definitely get your moneys worth. Don't have any doubts if you want a tour which gives you what you want BKK will do this.

Excellent two days!. We booked months ahead after seeing tour here on trip advisor . Not disappointed our two days with Miss Air we had a great time. The Bangkok highlights very interesting and lunch was delicious - without this tour we never would have tried these dishes. Miss Air likes treats so we got to sample many new things. Our second day Authentic Ayutthaya experienced some unique ceremonies at the Temples, Miss Air was delighted to explain everything ! Highly recommend these tours and this Company great experience!

Exceeded all expectations!!. My husband and I were able to see Thailand in a way we could not have done on our own! Air was an amazing guide, showing us the all the hidden gems along with the major attractions that Thailand had to offer. We got to see Thailands as locals. Air was genuine, friendly, and engaged ensuring that we were always comfortable (I was a little more than 3 months pregnant during our visit) and that we experienced everything we had hoped and more. Leading up to our trip, BKK was timely and clear in our communications, made excellent recommendations regarding hotel and tours, and truly made us feel welcome before we even arrived. During our stay we felt like life long friends were sharing their country and culture with us and not someone we had just met through our tour service provider. There is no other way to see Thailand than through BKK Tours. Thank you Air for an incredible experience and one we will never forget! We look forward to visiting again!

Luxury minivan, very good English speaking tour guide and route beyond touristic path. Starting from the e-mail conversation and arrangement for the tour to ayuthaya, the owner was very helpful and fast to respond to the e-mails. Gave me some tips beyond the purpose of this tour trip, that were helpful. I guess as he said, the balance between his Duch origin and Thai wife makes the perfect balance.The mini van is a luxury one, and our guide was nice explaining all the particularities of the sites visited. Her English was very understandable, not very easy to find in all local tour operators.The lunch was included, in a traditional Thai restaurant.The tour was out of the touristic crowded path, so perfect to us, since we got to know the traditional feeling of some important parts of the history of Thailand. We saw a Buddhist ceremony with local people which was nice. Ayuthaya ruins are a sad but important part of the history of Thailand. Overall it was a nice and reliable day with BKK yours. You can trust them.I advise you try to contact them in advance to arrange your tour because they can get fully booked easily. I was not able to book the Bangkok tour on because they were fully booked 2 months in advance for the day after ayuthaya.Hope you find this review helpful.

Fantastic way to see Bangkok. Bkk tours is a great way to see Bangkok. Miss Emmy was a great host and showed us the temples flower market and explained the culture and history and all our questions. She was great company and made using the daunting public transport a breeze. Lunch was delicious. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend them.

Perfect Tour and service, Get to know BKK like a local - Can only recommend. My husband and I ooked the tour on quite short note, after some research on the net and were not at all disappointed. Air was the perfect tour guide - we got to see all important BKK sights, she is always keen on personalizing our tour and to only show us places we want to see. We would never have tasted the food we tasted on our own and would not have seen the same places without her. Also she had great knowledge about everthing and additionally, it was great fun! More like visiting BKK with a friend rather then with a tour guide. Also the servie was perfect -she picked us up in the hotel, took care for all transportation and entrance fees and we even had our own longtail boat on the river. Thanks a lot Air, for sure we will come back to BKK and then we would only have a tour around with you!

Great Tour Company. We recently completed a Bangkok Highlights full day tour with BKK having arrived off a cruise ship. It is over two hours into Bangkok from where the ship docks, but that did not worry BKK at all. Ms Oi was the to pick us up on time and also dropped us off in time for the departing ship. More than 4 hour turn around for the driver and guide.The van was a luxury van and the driver was amazing, safe and knowlegable of the city. We enjoyed, without rushing, the absolute highlights of Bangkok, temples, shopping, the markets, reclining Buddah and of course, the canals where we took a long arm boat tour that so was so much fun.Ms Oi was an excellent friendly guide with a very good command of English. This was an excellent day that I would not hesitate to recommend to anyone. Perfect from a cruise ship.

Two Great Tours with BKK. The reviews we read on Trip Advisor were really good, so BKK had a lot to live up to. They didn't disappoint.Firstly when booking we found Michiel to be extremely helpful and efficient, recommending different options for their railway and floating market tour without us asking. Both of our guides, Ms Nes and Ms Oi, were a pleasure to spend time with. We got to see and learn so much more than we expected in a short space of time and BKK allowed us to get the most from our short time in Bangkok. Even when we'd finished our Tours Ms Oi's advice allowed us to continue seeing even more. We got to try so many local foods and snacks that we just wouldn't have thought to try if it wasn't for their suggestions. If we ever return to Bangkok we won't think twice about booking another tour with BKK. Their high rating on Trip Advisor is thoroughly deserved in our opinion.

Amazing Tours..... What an experience, BKK Tours made our trip to Bangkok a fantastic success. We visited the following (and more) during our stopovers to and from Europe in January and February 2015.Wat PhoWat ArunCanal tourChinatown Wat TraimitJim Thompson houseGrand Palace Wat Phra KaeoFlower marketWat SuthatAyutthaya We had the pleasure of being guided by both Miss Oi and Miss Pary, these ladies are a absolute asset to BKK tours. Showing us the major attractions (as expected), but also hidden treasures and secret places that tourists would overlook. They became our companions telling us stories and the history of this amazing city while utilizing local Ferries, Tail boats (what a experience) and Tuk Tuks as transport. Having lunch at authentic local restaurants was a real highlight. Thank you Oi and Pary. Correspondence by email with Michiel (owner) was quick, accurate and helpful. If you have only a limited time in Bangkok and want to see as much of this city as you can. Please talk to BKK tours, you will not be disappointed. Thank you Teresa and Michael.
Fantastic tour!!. Ms. Oi was such a fantastic tour guide on the Bangkok highlights tour! We loved every moment of the day we spent with her. I wish we could have done more tours with BKK.

Great way to see Bangkok, just don't eat first. We decided to do the Highlights of Bangkok full day tour our first full day in Thailand. We made one mistake. We ate breakfast at the hotel before the tour. Our tour guide Nadia met us at the hotel and we went off to the flower market. Along the way she purchased food and drinks (included in the tour price) from various stands for us to try. She explained what the flowers were used for and showed us how to fold the petals of a lotus flower. Next we went to Wat Po and the Royal Palace. All very interesting. We stopped for a very good lunch at a place on the river that I believe was called "The Navy Wives Club" or something like that. Also included in the tour. The food was great, but because we had eaten a big breakfast we couldn't eat much of it. Then we rode a long tail boat through the canals for an hour or so. When we got back to our hotel, Nadia asked us what we had planned for the next four days. When I told her that we hadn't decided, she drew out a four day itinerary of things that we should do. Very helpful.

Amazing Day in Thailand with BKK Tours!. We did a full day tour through BKK tours with Nadia and I will say it was the best private tour of my entire life! And that is really saying a lot considering with just came from a private hiking tour of the great wall two days before... Nadia was at our hotel lobby early and was super friendly and professional. She went over our tour before and we used various modes of transport throughout that city... Private Luxury Vans, Tuk Tuk, Subway, Skytrain, taxi, ferry... It was great to travel as the local Thai people do... Nadia started our tour by taking us to a flower market which was amazing and she taught us how to fold a lotus flower. Through out the day Nadia would explain the historical significance of everyplace we were seeing through wonderful stories. She also helped us learn a few Thai phases that were great throughout our travels! Nadia always made sure we were well hydrated by buying waters nonstop for us! She also had chilled towels for us two or three times to help us cool off... I thought that was awesome!!! I have never had a guide that was so friendly, knowledgable, and well prepared. She pulled out sunscreen for me when she noticed that I was starting to get red. That is customer service! She really showed us an amazing view of Bangkok from the Rich to the middle class.... Took us to an amazing lunch, always made sure we were having a great time! I am looking forward to the next time I come to Bangkok as my group will request Nadia again as she is the best!!!

Bangkok Hightlights arch 2015. We were a group of 6 visiting Bangkok on a cruise ship. Air was our guide for the day. She & the driver were waiting at the gates of the cruise terminal for us. We had a wonderful day. Air was very knowledgeable & her command of English was excellent. Would have no hesitation in recommending BKK tours to any travellers to Bangkok.

Best tours we ever had. We booked 2 tours with our guide Nadia, one for Ayutthaya and one for the Erawan waterfalls including the visit of the elephants rescue centre. Both trips were incredible and rich of information. We all enjoyed them and Nadia was so sweet and caring. It was our third time in Thailand but the best tours we've ever had so far.

two days with Ms. Oi were perfect for all ages!. We spent two days with BKK and Ms. Oi. Our party was tricky with two adults, two kids 10 and 12 and my 72 year old mother. Ms. Oi handled us all expertly, keeping the right pace and making it all work. We did Meet the Locals and loved the river boat and canal tours. We also did the Local Markets and highly recommend the Floating Market- do the pad thai there for breakfast! Leading up to our trip, manager Michiel was almost too accommodating with my repeated inquiries, which he handled expertly, promptly and professionally. BKK is a class operation and you should trust them and use them.

1 day Bangkok tour. Mr. Nathan was a fantastic tour guide. He was waiting for us in the lobby of our hotel and after walking us through the plan for the day we went out to our nice, air conditioned van with driver. We did the train market, floating market and reclining Buddha temple. Perfect day although we did get stuck in some crazy Bangkok traffic coming back from the floating market. During the day Mr. Nathan bought us Thai iced coffees, a coconut, authentic Thai snacks and soda from different street vendors along the way. Because this was a private tour we were able to decide how long or briefly we wanted to stay at each location. Lunch was also included.Mr. Nathan was also incredibly knowledgeable about the sites and about Thailand and we learned a lot throughout our day.We were picked up at 7:30 and were back at our hotel around 3pm. We took tons of awesome pictures and I would recommend this to anyone not on a backpacker budget. Worth the price for the comfort and convenience. Also, booking was very easy via email and we just paid cash day of.

PERFECT Tour of Bangkok!!! A MUST!!!!!. Before I express how amazing this tour is let me start with the reservation process. When reserving tours in various countries where there is a language barrier I am sometimes frustrated but that was NOT the case with BKK, they responded to our emails promptly and professionally which set the tone for the level of quality we would receive. We were sent an invoice 2 weeks prior to the trip so it was paid ahead of time.We did the Bangkok Highlight tour with AIR who is absolutely amazing. She is knowledgeable, familiar with all the right people and very determined to make sure you have the best experience. By the end of the day she was like FAMILY!!! We chose not to have a car which I think was much better because we were able to view Thailand as the locals, we took a tuk-tuk, boat, long tail boat and even the train! Throughout the day Air would stop at local vendors and allow us to taste the fresh fruit and boiled coconut juice among other delicacies. The lunch was DELICIOUS!!!! I am a vegetarian and the meal was very accommodating.The Royal Palace was my favorite and we learned that not only is Air a great tour guide but she is an experienced photographer who took some of the most amazing pictures of us!!!Overall it was the perfect tour that gave us a real sense of Bangkok's history as well as life for local Thai people.Thanks Again Air!! We Miss You!!!

Amazing compnay from start to finish. I booked a private day tour to Erawam National Park with BKK. The planning and booking was excellnet and easy with BKK. They were at the hotel lobby for our pick up when they said they were going to be. Air the tour guide was a lovely lady, very warm and friendly and the transfer vehicle, was like a MPV Limo. Immaculately clean. fresh fruit, water and cold towels every time we stopped. Lunch was inc in our package and it was a lovely fresh hot Thai meal over looking the Dam in a restaurant, not a warm soggy sandwich in the car. Air kindly took pictures for us the whole day so we have lots of 'Us' shots, rather then taking them of each other and her knowledge was great too. We had in car entertainment on the way home with nibbles and drinks, bit like a mobile cinema :-) I would definately recommend BKK. They did everything to make our day out as pleasureable and more. They even added a visit to the Kwai Bridge on the way home to stretch our legs, which we had not booked. All in all fab and highly recommeded.

If you want a tour of Bangkok LOOK NO FURTHER. My wife booked us on a private Bangkok tour with BKK after doing plenty of research and on the strength of the BKK trip advisor reviews. We had our tour with 'M' who was simply one of the best guides we have had anywhere in the world. He was engaging, interesting and a pleasure to spend the day with. We visited a large number of locations around the city including the grand palace, temples, markets and the klongs. Anyone who may have concerns about using local transport, don't. It was a fantastic way to get around and provides plenty of options for the guide to get you to the sights as speedily as possible. We used a taxi, sky train, ferries and tuktuks (definitely the best). M always had a plan depending on the traffic and as it's Bangkok there is plenty of that. Lunch was provided in a local restaurant and there opportunities to grab a drink when required as it was very hot. We completed our tour by having drinks sat on the terrace of a restaurant opposite Wat Arun as the sun went down. Perfect. Personal highlights for us were the boat ride through the Klongs, the visit to the Grand Palace, visiting the local markets that you wouldn't normally get the chance to see on a bus tour And The general way we were looked after by M throughout the day. It happened to be wife's birthday on the day of our tour, it really was the perfect way to spend it according to her. I don't believe you could have a better arranged tour of Bangkok and from our point of view, a better guide than we had.Thank you BKK, you made our trip to Bangkok.

Bangkok day tour. Based on the tripadvisor reviews We booked online a full day Bangkok highlights tour .Like a lot of tourists we arrived in the city 6am after a long flight and honestly felt a little overwhelmed by the noise and pace of it all.The best decision we made was to book this tour before we arrived ,our guide for the day was miss Nadia ,she explained that we would be using all modes of transport skytrain, subway ,river boat ,tuktuk,taxi,and feet the thing that makes the tour with Nadia special is the detail,we visited all the major tourists sights with pearls of wisdom all the way but it was the little bits of thai culture and the daily routines that we found so interesting .As we went through the day we were taken to off the beaten track viewpoints and watering holes, everywhere we were greeted with warmth and smiles and by the end of the day we could see why people find Thailand such a great holiday destination as for miss Nadia we both found her to be not only an excellent guide but a very warm and funny person Thank you for such a nice start to our holiday.

Brilliant service. The booking was very easy via several emails which were always answered promptly. Air collected us the first day and did a tour of the temples followed by an excellent lunch at The Navy Club next to the river. Next stop was the flower and vegetable market. We then went up the river on a private long tail boat and saw the housing on the canals. The transport used was underground, sky train and tuk tuk. We paid £130 for this in British pounds on the day.The following day we were picked up by Air and a driver in the most luxurious people carrier we have ever been in. It was fully customised and had wifi. We drove to the market at Tha Kha which was lovely as hardly any tourists were there. She bought us fish stomach soup to try. We then went along the canals on a rowing boat to see a family cocoanut sugar production facility. This was very interesting and informative. We couldn't believe how peaceful this area was. Lunch was at a Cabbage and Condoms restaurant and was very good. Next we went to the train market and saw the train come in. We then had coffee and went back to the tracks to see the train go out again. Our next stop was the prisoner of war cemetery and museum followed by the bridge over the river Kwai. The shopping around the bridge is plentiful and good for the usual tourist tat at cheap prices. It then took 3 hours to get back to the hotel so we fully reclined the seats and tried to sleep. This trip cost £150 and we paid in British pounds on the day.Although these trips were on the expensive side we were more than happy to pay to be taken where we wanted to go with no hassle from scammers and without having to think for ourselves.

Ideal way to see Bangkok. I booked tour from uk as we only had 3 nights in Bangkok on our return journey from New Zealand . No money was paid in advance we received good info about dress code and time we would be met at hotel and who would be our guide Miss Oi . She was prompt and her English was excellent and we had areally good day with her including lunch all transport and info about palaces and temples . Well worth the money as such a big city to try to see unguided

Amazing 2 day tour. I arranged a two day tour for 8 people, on 5th & 6th February 2015, with pick-up at the cruise port from the Celebrity Millennium cruiseship. We decided to tour Bangkok on day one, overnighting in the Shangri-La hotel, and Ayutthaya on day two. During the planning phase Michiel, the owner, was extremely helpful and patient as we had some clear ideas about what we wanted to see in Bangkok. Some of these sights were doable, and some not due to the limited time and we were able to agree an itinery that suited and book our tours with BKK.Ms Air, our excellent and delightful tour guide was there waiting for us when we exited the cruise terminal. After introductions we were on our way in the luxury minivan, with full air-conditioning and extremely comfortable seats. Within minutes we knew the tour was going to be memorable, and it turned out beyond memorable. Nothing was too much trouble for Ms Air, she gave us some of the history of Bangkok and all the sights we would see...all delivered in excellent English....her smile, personality and gracious beauty is a pure delight.In Bangkok we saw things that most tourists would never see, how some of the poorest of the locals lived and Ms Air knew where to pick up the best snacks and drinks for us along the way. We also saw the main tourist sites and a couple of markets, and Ms Air led us carefully through the crowds at every site, always explaining the background and history and answering all our questions....nothing was any trouble. Towards the end of the day, we experienced a private canal ride on a long tail boat, and a tuk tuk ride to get close to our hotel on the river before crossing in a ferry which serviced all the hotels along the river. Amazing, and never to be forgotten, experiences.We travelled up to Ayutthaya the following day, again by luxury minivan to e "European style" temple and then a 45 minute long tail boat ride into the heart of the Ayutthaya Unesco site. It was fantastic, and the luxury minivan was already there to take us on the other parts of the Ayutthaya tour.Lunch both days was provided, and excellent, and at every stop we were given a bottle of ice cold water and wipes etc. to cool down. All of those little touches, as well as the snack food and drinks along the way were so much appreciated by our group.Sadly we had to drive back to the port, and part from Ms Air who had become our close friend as well as guide for those two days. They were the most memorable two days all trip which, for us extended to four weeks in the Far East, and these experiences will be a lifelong memory for all of us.You will not be disappointed....this was a 6-star experience, but the Tripadvisor rating only goes to 5!! Thank you Ms Air, and also to Michael for the pre-tour planning.

Wonderful Intoduction to Thailand. We used BKK tours for 3 days on arrival in Bangkok. The booking process and communication was excellent. Our guide was Ms Nadia and on the first day she guided us around the city using the subway, tuk-tuks, taxis and the sky train. It gave us the confidence to travel around the city on our remaining days in Bangkok. Nadia was lovely and we learnt so much about the temples we saw and their history. We were sorry to say goodbye on our final day. On the second day we visited a floating market, the railway market and Chinatown. We saw very few tourists and the tour was so flexible that we had an impromptu lunch in a restaurant overlooking the river. Our driver this day and the third day when we visited Ayutthaya was Mr S. He was an excellent driver and looked after our needs with water and refreshing towels when we returned to the van. He also joined us for another delicious lunch at a local restaurant. I would have no hesitation in recommending BKK tours and would definitely use them again.

Great overnight stay.. We were on a cruise and arranged an independent overnight trip to Bangkok with BKK Tours. As others have said Michiel was very good with questions and we decided to pay in advance by PayPal rather than risk carrying too much cash with us or having problems with an ATM on the day.Ms Emmy and driver Mr Ed were waiting for us and the visit went like clockwork. Ms Emmy was more like a friend taking us around. Mr Ed was always there with his van when needed.We had to shorten our trip because Royal Caribbean demanded we be back on board by 1500hr so instead of a restaurant trip Emmy and Ed arranged a picnic for us to eat in the van on the way back to the ship.We booked on our own stay at the Banyan Tree Hotel which is very good especially the Moon Bar. We also booked the Banyan Tree Apsera river dinner cruise and that was superb.

Thailand touring.. BKK Tours have to be the best guided tour operation in Thailand. Their mix of Thai and European experience is excellent for visitors to Thailand. From our first email 10 months before we visited Thailand to being dropped back at the hotel after the tour, they were first rate and nothing was to much trouble. We got far more than we thought was possible. We arranged a visit to the Erawan waterfall and then on to the Elephant sanctuary at Kanchanaburi on the River Kwai. Everything was included. The transport was like aircraft first class. Our guide, Ms Air was superb. She spoke perfect English, answered every question, took great pictures with our cameras when we were swimming or feeding the elephants, had a great sense of humour, and a smile from ear to ear. The picnic turned out to be a Thai banquet set in beautiful surroundings, all arranged by Ms Air and all in with the price. On the way back, and not planned, Air managed to fit in a short visit to the Bridge over the River Kwai, just as the sun was setting. It was a perfect day. We cannot speak more highly of this company, they made our visit to Thailand excellent.

Great introduction to Bangkok. From my first e-mail inquiry, BKK was informative, helpful and quick to respond. They sent detailed information before we left home so we knew exactly what to expect and how to prepare (eg clothing for the temple).Miss Emmy was on time at our hotel, informed us about our itinerary and off we went.We went to the Grand Palace, Wat Arun, Wat Pho, long tail boat ride through the canals and Chinatown. Lunch was excellent. We learned how to use all forms of public transportation, which was helpful for the rest of our stay. She also gave us tips on how to plan our shopping day.Miss Emmy was always concerned about our needs. Half of our group was ok with the information at each site she provided, the other half would have preferred more. Overall a great value for money introduction to Bangkok.

My Intro to Thailand. I took the BKK tour of Bangkok today and was extremely pleased. Our guide was "M" and he managed to fit in so many experiences in a day. We never felt rushed but saw the main sites and also markets that we would never have seen on our own. He patiently answered our questions and offered us information about Thai life and customs that will help us enjoy the city during the rest of our stay. A delicious lunch was included (great restaurant we would not have found on our own or even known what to order) as well as all the transportation and long boat ride. This tour is an incredible value. It was our first day in Thailand and the perfect introduction to the city and country. I recommend it without reservation.

Perfect Personalized Thailand Experience!. Our tour with BKK was the highlight of our trip to Thailand. What set BKK apart right away was how responsive they were to our requests and how flexible they were in terms of customizing our tour. We wanted to see the Maeklong Railway Market, but couldn't decide between which floating market to visit during our tour. Michiel worked with us to make an awesome itinerary that allowed us to see both floating markets and the railway market!Ms. Air was an amazing tour guide who immediately made us feel like friends. She explained a lot of the history of the markets to us without overwhelming us with information, and took the time to talk to us about about Bangkok, from current events to restaurant recommendations.The floating market tour isn't specifically billed as a food tour, but Ms. Air bought us a lot of delicious snacks throughout our trip. She seemed to know the best spots and most friendly people at each stop. I ate things on this tour I'd never even think to try that turned out to be delicious - the soup from the traditional floating market we visited may be the best thing I've ever had! Ask her to try the tasty little dessert balls in stapled banana leaves if you visit the Maeklong Railway Market.I'd recommend you book well in advance of your trip because Ms. Air said they book up quickly! I really hope I have a chance to visit Bangkok and take a took with BKK again soon.

Fantastic day trip with Oi. We had an amazimg time with Oi on our tour of Bangkok.We visited Reclining Buddha, The Grand Palace, Flower Market, had a journey down the river on a long boat, enjoyed a tuktuk ride, the sky train and had a nice Thai lunch.Oi was extremely friendly and made us feel very comfortable on the tour. She was great. Ensuring we always had water etc., and at all times making sure we had the best experience possible.She was very knowledgeable about Thai culture and answered all of our questions.I would highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting Bangkok (especially Oi).

Incredible day tour with BKK. We are 4 female friends who travelled to Bangkok for a week of sightseeing/shopping/eating. We chose BKK and booked a full Bangkok Highlights day tour prior to leaving home. What an amazing day we had with Miss Air. We travelled around the city in a luxurious van and stopped at Grand Palace, Wat Pho with the reclining Buddha, flower market & long tail boat ride through Bangkok locks and canal system. Lunch was a highlight at Royal Thai Navy Club (Khun Kung kitchen). We ate a variety of Thai dishes chosen by Air. All very delicious! As we had such a positive experience with BKK we were lucky to book a half day tour during our week stay which took us outside Bangkok (about 1 hours travel each way) to railway market and authentic Tha Kha floating market. Again, a wonderful day day which was hosted by Miss Emi. BKK are a tour company who obviously take pride in creating memorable experiences for visitors to Bangkok. Cannot recommend highly enough! Just do it!

Great tours with BKK. We were so pleased with the quality and service provided us by BKK tours. We were two couples and spent 1.5 days touring Bangkok. We were taken to areas that we would not have seen on larger tours such as a floating market and railroad market outside of the city (not the touristy floating market). Our guide was superb...Miss Parry is her name and she brought a wealth of information . She was attentive and and responded to all our requests including revisiting a park to find a local vendor selling silk! She spoke English fluently and provided just the right amount of information. Thanks BKK tours and Miss Parry..you made our stay memorable!!

Great day tour in Bangkok with Ms Oi. We had a really enjoyable day tour in Bangkok with BKK tours and our tour guide Ms Oi was brilliant. She was very knowledgable about all the locations we visited and made us feel very comfortable in a city we'd never been to before. The highlight of our day was where Oi took us for lunch by the river. It was the best food we ate on our stay in Bangkok followed by a nice energetic trip on the river in which we stopped to feed the fish on the canal. I'd definitely recommend using BKK tours as there booking is really straight forward and their guides are excellent!

Best tour in Bangkok!. The title very much says it all: The Best Tour in Bangkok! I had Oi as my tour guide and she's absolutely amazing. I whole heartedly recommend BKK tour for anyone traveling to Bangkok. I had the full day Bangkok tour. Although Wat Arun was not in the tour at the start, it was included at no extra cost. I am very satisfied with the services and communication.

One day in Bangkok - and this is the way to spend it. We had one day in Bangkok en route to Myanmar and decided to do a photo tour to make the most of our time. We were a little leery of the "we utilise local transportation" concept but tuktuks, ferries, and long-tail boats turned out to be a fabulous way to see the city. "M" was an outstanding guide and always seemed to have a "plan b" if we encountered traffic or lines. It would have taken us three days to see this much on our own.Once we got home and processed all of our photos, we'd forgotten the names of a few temples. I emailed BKK and they responded within an hour. Top notch.

Local experience of Bangkok with a pro!. Just WOW. I can't say enough good things about BKK Tours and our guide, Air! Had a 2-person full day tour of Bangkok that included a longtail boat ride through the local canals, behind-the-scenes at a market, authentic Thai lunch, and comprehensive tour of the Wat Pho and the Grand Palace. Air was totally professional and knowledgeable, engaged us with the kind and funny locals at every point, and flawlessly guided us through the overwhelming maze of Wat Pho / Grand Palace. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a slightly-off-the-beaten-path tourist day in Bangkok, will definitely use them again in the future if I return, and would not have hesitated to pay twice the price for this quality of tour! Thank you so much, Air! You helped make our vacation even more memorable! -Elizabeth and Adrienne

Great Service!. We spent an enjoyable time with Oi on 2 tours in Bangkok.The first was the extreme Bangkok tour - wow! This tour was great, Oi took us to the train station where we boarded a train to the slum areas. The train was interesting in itself with many local people aboard and people moving through the train selling food items. We departed and then walked through a local food market, Oi explaining things along the way. We then walked along a train line through a local housing area, interacted with some friendly locals along the way and really saw how these people live. We visited a local shop and a school and just generally observed everyday life.Next we took a canal boat towards the Grand Palace and finally a tuk tuk to the gate. Oi took us through the palace and was able to explain the various areas and the significance of them.I was a bit apprehensive about this tour and if it would be too confronting for our children (aged 10 and 13) but I had no concerns on the day. It was excellent and a good learning opportunity for the children. I feel it is important for them to see that cities are not necessarily just hotels/shopping malls and tourist attractions.The second day Oi took us by taxi to China Town. We explored local temples and the back alleys of this area. Oi pointed out to us different foods and explained the food preparation to us. It was all very interesting and gave us an opportunity to see things that we would never see if we were on our own. Those back alleys are a whole other world! We then visited the Golden Buddah and again Oi was available to explain the significance of this area to us.Overall 2 excellent days and I would highly recommend taking a tour with Oi and BKK tours!

Learnt so much. just BKK for a day in Bangkok. Loved it and the guide Ms Oi (?) was brilliant with my young kids. Such a great guide and approach. pity I could not get your team for the whole stay her.

Tour of Bangkok with Ms Nadia. We were a party of 4, coming into Bangkok from a cruise. We took the cruise transportation into the city and I had arranged to meet Nadia at our hotel at 11am. Due to traffic, we did not make it to the hotel until about 12:30pm. But Ms Nadia waited for us!! I was so pleased and she took us straight to lunch which was a fantastic experience. Then we toured until about 6pm when she dropped us at our hotel. She was such a good tour guide. So informative and so proud of her city. It was a joy to spend the afternoon with her. We also enjoyed the various forms of transportation that we took during the day - walking, floating taxis, tuk tuks and long boats. i would definitely recommend this tour service and Ms Nadia as a guide in Bangkok. We have very fond memories of the city due to this tour.

Excellent Tour. Booking the Bangkok Highlights tour was easy as Michiel was very accommodating and our queries thru email were responded to promptly.On the day of the tour, our guide Air, was at the lobby at the appointed time. After a short sky train ride, our first stop was the pier where we took the long tail boat ride to the klongs to see how some local thais live. Next stop was the flower market and after a tuk tuk ride we arrived at Wat Pho to see the reclining buddha. After a scrumptious lunch, it was off to the Grand Palace and Wat Phra Kaeo our last stop for the tour.Definitely one of the highlights of our Thailand trip. Everything was thought of during the tour, our comfort and personal needs were always taken care of. Refreshments were always available, lunch was very filling. Best of all, her knowledge of history and country made the tour more in depth. Questions were always answered right away and her explanations made them more interesting. With Air and BKK tours, it was like a friend showing you around. Will definitely book their other tours when in Bangkok.

Amazing!. We had a half day tour of Bangkok with Ms Nadia which was amazing. We took a tuk tuk, the sky train, long tail boat and walked around discovering Bangkok and we really felt like we had an authentic experience. We visited the grand palaces, the flower market, we did a long boat tour of Bangkok harbour and visited some markets - it was fantastic value and Ms Nadia couldn't have been lovelier! We had a brilliant time. I would absolutely recommend BKKTours and I hope to come back and book another tour!

#1 For Good Reason. . Spent the last two days with Air, co-owner of BKK Tours and what an experience!The first day we visited the must see sights around the city traveling by taxi, long boat, tuk tuk and skytrain. She maneuvered us around the crowds at the Grand Palace and various temple buildings. Her knowledge and pride in her country's history added a whole other depth to the tour. On the second day we traveled out of the city to visit some of the more interesting markets including the railroad station, floating, flower and wet markets. Stopping for tastes of the Thai life every where.Air continuously looked out for our comfort, personal needs and appetites. Looking back at the last two days we quickly realized that we would not have come close to scratching the surface of the things to see or do had we tried it alone.Don't try to seek the REAL Bangkok on your own. You need a guide...you need BKK Tours.

Bangkok tour. I met with Air my guide tour and one of the owners of BKK early December 2014. I am not the typical tourist and I try to avoid the "touristy" checkpoint. I asked the lovely and warm Air to take me to all the places in Bangkok that she liked and cared about herself. I can tell you all it was the best day of my whole trip to Asia. Air was sensitive to me and my needs, caring, warm and informative. She brought me to various hidden spots in Bangkok and balanced a "must see" attractions with some hidden and magical spots now one would take you other than a local that knows the place inside and out. She didn't safe any expenses on me and that included amazing breakfast and lunch as well as all other amazing attractions. I cannot express my gratitude to this company and highly, highly recommend.Oren Raz

Great Personalised Tours. We booked 2 tours with BKK Tours - a half-day tour of the Train (Railroad) Market and Floating Market, and a night tour of the Wats, Chinatown and Flower Market. Our guide for both tours, Air, was extremely friendly, knowledgeable and took care of our needs at all times (we had a 70+ elderly mother with us). For the authentic markets tour, we sampled treats at a local market and had great coffee and tea next to the railway tracks before the train came whizzing past. Wow, the train was just 2 inches away from where we were standing! Next part of the journey was climbing onto a local teak rowing boat and brought to a local palm sugar farm. No tourists, no souvenir shopping - just how a local Thai family works on their farm. The night tour was our favourite - we visited Wat Po in its lighted splendor without the crowds, had dinner at a lovely restaurant located just opposite Wat Arun which was also beautifully lighted up, and visited the Flower Market and Chinatown in tuk-tuks, It was a lovely experience! Highly recommended !

Best tour in Bangkok!. My boyfriend and I visited Bangkok for the first time in November. We contacted BKK in advance and reserved a date/time. As the trip approached, Michiel helped us via email to create a custom itinerary based on our individual preferences. We didn't have much time in the city, so we wanted to see a lot all in one day. Our tour ended up being 10 hours long and we went to: - Tha Kha floating market -- located 1 hour outside Bangkok and is authentic, very few tourists - amazing! Our guide, Air, knew all the best (and clean) vendors to sample local foods - Railway market -- located outside Bangkok and is a MUST SEE. Best with a tour guide because you can easily get lost and we did not meet anyone who spoke English. Air took us to the Thai coffee stand - the coffee was amazing!- Lunch at a local restaurant - We dined at a local favorite right on the water. Air helped us select the best dishes (family style dining). We ate with Air and she taught us about local customs and key Thai phrases - Grand Palace -- Also a must see if traveling to Bangkok; Huge place so be ready to walk. Air shared many incredible stories about each temple and other pieces of art. Be sure to wear clothes that cover knees and shoulders. - Reclining Budda -- last stop of the day and we were tired! We didn't stay long but the venue is much smaller than the Grand Palace so you can see this in 30-60 minutes. One of the best things about this tour is that your tour guide will make all your purchases for you with local vendors and with his/her own money. This is included in the total cost of the tour. It is so easy this way - no hassling with money required. BKK tours is the way to go! Best in Bangkok!

Amazing Amazing Amazing. Yesterday me and my boyfriend did the Bangkok highlights tour with Ms Air and had a wonderful time.After reading many great reviews on TP. We decided to contact BKK Tours. Michiel replies were very prompt and helped us with our itinerary.Ms Air picked us up on the dot from our hotel. Straight away we knew we made the right choice in booking with Bkk tours. Ms Air was warm caring and very knowledgeable. The private tour included everything including public transport, delicious lunch and entrance fees. So worthwhile the cost. Me and my boyfriend will always have fond memories of the tour and Bangkok. We recommend this tour to everyone. No point looking anywhere else. Just email Michiel and get ready for an amazing time.

Excellent tour with M. Yesterday my husband and I took a tour of Bangkok with M. We did a private tour with just the two of us and our tour guide M. There isn't much to say except that the tour and M were amazing! We got to see highlights of Bangkok, but also went off the beaten path and went behind the scenes of the flower market, saw where locals shop in the open-air market (really an alleyway), and so much more. The communication between the owner, Michiel, and us was quick and easy. There was no grey areas at all when booking and Michiel was helpful and more than willing to help. Our tour guide, M, was a great tour guide as well. Very friendly and he also gave us good tips about where to eat and the places to go in Bangkok that weren't on our tour. If you're debating on whether this tour is for you, don't hesitate as you will not be disappointed!

Great from a-z. I communicated back and forth a number of times with BKK prior to coming to Thailand. First, the communication was always quick and thoughtful. Ultimately we designed a day trip that fit the specific in interests of myself and brother. The owner did an excellent job. At the last minute however my brother became ill so this trip became solo - not what I planned but you just move forward.I was met by OI promptly at 10 am (my arrival to the hotel was 2 am so that was perfect). We toured all day seeing the sites I wanted to see in the order that worked best for logistics. It was a multi modal day full of interesting sites - smells and sounds. She was also very pleasant to spend the day with which was an added bonus.I would strongly recommend them to others and use again.

Superb in every way.. I found BKK through Trip Advisor reviews and am always slightly suspicious of so many glowing reviews but I can honestly say that this company is truly superb. Firstly, as others have mentioned, it is a joy to have emails answered so quickly and efficiently by the owner, Michiel. We had originally booked 2 full-day tours but, due to an itinerary problem, we ended up returning to Bangkok so quickly contacted BKK to arrange for another day. Luckily we were able to get the same tour guide - Miss Oi - who is the most charming and efficient young lady. The vehicles and drivers used were excellent and everything went 100% smoothly. I will be returning to Bangkok in 4 months and have already booked another day with BKK and Miss Oi! Highly recommend this company. They aren't cheap but you get what you pay for in life!

A Great Day in Bangkok with Miss Oi.................... Again a great Trip Advisor result. We booked via email from the UK and received a fast response with hints on what to do etc. At the allotted hour the lovely Miss Oi was waiting in the foyer of our hotel and away we went on a wonderful day-tour of Bangkok - we travelled by taxis, tuk-tuk and long tailed river boat with lunch included. We saw all we asked to see plus more, but it was our young guide that made the day so special - lots of laughs, and we were sad to say goodbye back at our hotel - thank you BKK Tours.

DEFINITELY THE TOUR COMPANY TO USE!. Located BKK tours via a local newspaper article and after researching them on Trip Advisor four of us decided to book a half day tour. BKK ( our delightful tour guide was a Ms Pary) far surpassed our expectations. We wanted non touristy sites and they obliged. We went to the non-touristy floating market and then took a small boat down canals to a working palm plantation. Lastly we visited a huge native market where twice a day a train comes rolling thru the middle of the market as the vendors quickly pull their goods off the tracks. They picked us up at our hotel and our van was top notch with the driver providing wet towels and cold water. We each pd $60 for the half day and felt it a good price for our exceptional time

The best way to see Thailand. After much research we settled on BKK Tours for our visit to Bangkok and surrounding area. We could not have been more pleased. There was immediate response to our email inquiries. We were able to customize our itinerary and best of all we had a fantastic guide, Ms. Air. She was knowledgeable, fun and full of energy. We loved every minute of our travels with her...from our pick up at the ship, the ride into Bangkok, the excellent tours, great restaurants to sample Thai food and travels to Ayutthaya. She even got "sticky rice" for us to take home! Don't consider any other tour service. BKK is the best!

Excellent. We did 3 tours using BKK, and were very pleased with all 3. Our guides were Pary for Ayuttahya and Floating Gardens, and Air for Meet the Locals. Both are very personable and knowledgeable. They care very much about their clients and the Thai people, culture, history, and sites. Michiel, who handles administration, is unusually quick and efficient. The tours live up to what they are represented to be - a unique way to see and experience things for which you just wouldn't have the same opportunity if you were on your own or with a group. I recommend BKK highly.

Faultless. Like others I researched the Bangkok tour companies carefully. I ignore any reviews with less than 10 ( usually jane60 Hong Kong) and look for people who have travelled a lot. On this basis we chose BKK . Michel was excellent to communicate with and responded quickly and informatively. We had Nadia as our guide, she was fantastic, fun and knowledgeable. Looked after our wellbeing and giving us a great time. The floating market and railway market tour was great, and the highlights plus long tailed boat tour excellent if hot! By the third tour, Chinatown , I became ill and ended up with Nadia taking me to hospital. Not a tour I recommend. She was terrific, helping us all morning till my discharge. Impossible to speak highly enough of her assistance. So thanks Michel and Nadia. Wouldn't dream of using anyone else in Bangkok.

Excellent Tour Company. I did a ton of research to find just the right small and personal tour company to help my family navigate Thailand. BKK was perfect! I knew they would be good based on the detailed information shared during various emails. They are extremely organized and willing to make our trip exactly what we needed. Ms. Pary was our guide for Bangkok and not only was she extremely kind and knowledgeable, but she taught us so much about Buddhism and Thai culture. The only thing to note about Ms. Pary, who we adored, is that while extremely confident and warm, she is a bit soft spoken and if you are a little hard of hearing or with a group bigger than 4-5 I would maybe ask for another guide (but again, we thought she was amazing!). A few days later Ms. Air (the owner) took us 4 hours outside of Bangkok and we enjoyed swimming in the waterfalls, ate a huge and delicious lunch and then had the experience of a lifetime at an elephant sanctuary. We also traveled in style in a big, very clean, comfortable and decked-out van that made the long drive so easy. Air was wonderful and not only taught us a lot but she was also a great photographer so she held on to our camera and took shots while we swam and played which was a great help. And when we accidentally left a pair of sunglasses in the van she very kindly went out of her way to return them to our hotel the next day. If this tour company seems a little more expensive than others, and I'm not sure it is since there are absolutely no add on/surprise fees, I would say it is completely worth it. The price difference is small for such a well run company.

Go with BKK Tours!. We just wanted to thank BKK Tours for the Bangkok Highlights and Ayutthaya tours on the 27th and 30th November. Having undertaken a number of small tours in various countries over the years, BKK tours were were truly fantastic and the highlight of our time in Thailand.Both tours were very easy to book with a simple email and our guide, Ms Parry was the best tour guide we've ever come across. Apart from being extremely knowledgable and accommodating our interests in different foods and Buddhism, Ms Parry provided us with many fantastic and personal insights into Thai history and culture. Ms Parry is also very congenial and an exceptionally nice person. I would definitely recommend BKK Tours!

BKK - BANGKOK'S BREATH OF FRESH AIR. Since I have never booked any type of tour over my many years of global travel, it did not really occur to me that one's tour guide becomes just as much an essential part of the tour as the sites and locations visited on the tour itself. The guide controls the pace, timing, duration, approach and historical background rendered with each stop; she influences the whole experience with her personality, demeanor, attitude and level of enthusiasm; she can make or break a tour by what kind of person she is, both professionally, and in her heart. It was my great fortune to have had the finest guide I could possibly have had. And while I have no others with which to compare her, I am certain I could not have found a more enthusiastic, gentle, caring, considerate, compassionate guide, who also happens to be the co-owner of BKK Tours, along with her husband Michiel. She will breathe life into your Bangkok visit, and her name, appropriately, is Air.I wrote to Michiel and Air after finding them here on Trip Advisor. I asked that we custom-design a one day tour for me, as my time in Bangkok was limited, and my interests very specific. Their communication was superb and their personalized suggestions were a perfect fit. Michiel even did a bit of useful research for me regarding shipping packages within Thailand.Air was waiting for me at exactly the appointed hour, and we ventured forth, creating a wonderful day filled with sites, sounds, smells, and other interactions, with a Bangkok I could not have experienced without her. The time we spent was so comfortable, it was as if I had known her for years.Of course, everyone will do their own research regarding whom to choose as their tour guides in Thailand. But after exploring the many other options available to you, please return to this honest, heartfelt review. BKK Tours is a small company, owned by two lovely people who bring the highest possible standards to their work. As a mature American gentleman, I trust my ability to judge the professional and personal character of others. You will find none higher than Michiel and Air's (and, I'm sure, their other staff) at BKK Tours. Thank you Michiel and Air!

Amazing!. We were in Bangkok for only a few days. Bkk tours made us aTwo day mixed tour schedule. Our tour guide was Pary, and she is simply amazing. She exudes kindness!!! My husband and I had such a beautiful time. We were so well cared for from the moment we met to the moment we left. Pary bought us some infamous street foods, guided us through markets, and even had refreshing towels to help us through the humidity. Simply put, do not go elsewhere. They are all about customer satisfaction and are the best!!I would recommend themTo anyone.

Best service!. We spent great 2 days in Bangkok together with BKK Tours. Our guide Ms.Nadia was fantastic - nice, clever girl and very good guide. BKK Tours service is perfect. We felt amazing 2 days. If you want great service, I recommend this company! Thank's to BKK Tours for perfect private tour!

BKK Tours is Bangkoks Best!. This was the first guided tour our well traveled family has ever taken and it exceeded all our expectations. Our emails were answered immediately, in great detail which was very reassuring as we booked this tour.We traveled to Ayutthaya via a very spacious, cool van with our guide Air and driver. Air was very knowledgable and personable. We enjoyed our conversations with her and learning about not just the historic sites but her explanations of Buddhist traditions along the way.One part that stood out was how she treated our child. She held his hand, watched over him while we took photos and viewed the sites and she was so kind and gentle with him. She is great with children and I'm so glad she was our guide.The lunch was delicious and it was so nice to have someone to explain the dishes and point us in the right direction of such authentic meal. She accommodated all our requests such as getting a real coconut to drink from, and stopping so my son could feed an elephant. The fishtail boat tour was a truly amazing experience to see Thai homes and families outside of the usual tourist area and really get a feel for life in Thailand.All minor details were covered, including ice cold water in the van, and ice cold hand cleansing wipes which were a nice surprise!What a wonderful experience we had and I'm so thankful we decided to take this tour!

BKK Tours, Bangkok Highlights & Ayutthaya tours. We did two full day tours with this company, Bangkok Highlights & Ayutthaya tours. Both tours professionally managed, and as always its the tour guide that makes it fun and memorable ( thanks again Oi ). Be warned, walking around the Ayutthaya historical park is HOT !!

Best in Bangkok. Quickly and efficiently booked before our cruise, our BKK tour guide met us at the cruise terminal in wisked us away in a large, comfortable van. Our guide, Oi escorted to all the top sights in the city, as well as a canal tour. We met the owner at lunch at the Naval Club and enjoyed hearing how he emigrated to Thailand from the Netherlands. The day was well planned and we were kept informed and away from any political unrest. We spent the night at a wonderful Marriott and then visited the Praesart Muesuem, not to be missed. We highly recommend this tour company.

Best experience in Thailand. Our group of 4 booked a floating market tour with BKK and it was amazing!Even before the tour, all my questions were promptly answered by Michel via email, and as we wanted to do the floating market tour he advised for us to go to Tha Ka floating market which is held only on days according to the lunar calendar. We ended up going to Tha Ka, the railway market and had a brief stop at the Damnoen Saduak floating market (as it was raining so Tha Ka was a little quiet). If it wasn't for BKK and our very awesome guide Ms Oi, no way we would have been able to experience such an authentic experience at Tha Ka - there were no other tourists apart from another couple with BKK. The whole day was filled with snacks from various different street food stalls and service was really considerate - even down to the water bottles and hand towels in the van.Totally worth the money and time, and even the early start.

Excellent Tour with BKK. We found BKK through trip advisor and set up a 1/2 day guided tour of some of Bangkok's most notable sights. We were warmly greeted by our guide Pary at our hotel and she proceeded to go above and beyond on our tour. Her English was perfect, her knowledge of the sites was amazing. She knew exactly how to maneuver us through the important sights while skirting the crowds of people. We felt so welcome and very much enjoyed our time with her. We can't say enough good about this tour company! Great job BKK and Pary!

Air made our trip to Bangkok! . We spent 3 days with Air while we were in Bangkok and I was seriously so sad to leave her by the end of our stay. She was such an amazing tour guide and words can't describe how amazing she made our experience. I could easily write a novel on our amazing experience, but I'll keep it short and sweet. I would highly recommend her if you are looking for a tour guide in Bangkok!

Great private tour. We booked just 5 days before we went to Bangkok. Everything was really professionell organized. We got direktly a mail back with the informations wer needed and pur tourguide picked us up at 9.00 am at our hotel. The day was well planned, filled with lots of Information in a perfekt english, wich you can not find in a book. we had a great meal, a private boot tour und saw everything historical important. And the price was fine too. 2000 thb for 9 hours excuding the entrances. Thanks a lot. Max and Sarah

Trust BKK to help you get the most out of Bangkok. We visited Bangkok in the summer with our 3 children and had pre-booked a couple of tours with our travel agent. When we arrived, we loved the city far more than we imagined and felt slightly hesitant about formal tours. After searching on TripAdvisor and reading the many rave reviews about BKK I decided to take a chance and cancel our pre-booked tours and trust Michiel to plan a couple of half day trips. His responses were amazingly prompt, helpful and informative. We didn't want to overload the children with too much culture and opted for a half day trip to the temples and a market followed by another half day to the Railway Market and Floating Market followed by shopping! Our guide Miss Emmy was charming, great with us and the kids, really knowledgeable and fun to have with us. The price was very reasonable for what we did and a private tour and the private air-conditioned car for our trip to the markets was very welcome in the heat and humidity. I would 100% recommend BKK for anyone visiting Bangkok - we really felt that we got a lot more out of our few days by choosing them. Thank you!

Truly Excellent exceeded our expectations. This was the easiest 5* I have given.Right from the very first email, Michiel responded so quickly and answered all my questions. I was booking this tour for eight people so I had lots of things to take in to consideration. We were collected on time by a smiling Ms Gift a true asset. She was so informative and crammed so much into the time we had in Bangkok. We saw so much and ate some very tasty food. From going around the Grand Palace, to the Canal boat tour to going further North to Ayutthaya historical park. It was so wonderful. It's hard to find a negative to the complete tour. If I had to it was trying to fit so much into such a short time because we were on a cruise ship. But that was our fault and not BKK tours. They gave such fabulous value for money. We loved Bangkok and we loved our tour.I would highly recommend BKK tours and would without hesitation use them again when we return to Bangkok. They were simply the best.

Emotional experience, many thanks to BKK Tours. Our tour to Kanchanaburi the War Museum, Hell Fire Pass and the Cemetery Started at 7.am.We were picked up by Air and her driver T in a luxury van. Being our first time in Thailand, Air was a the perfect host, her knowledge and openness to answer our questions on many subjects was fantastic. The War Museum and Hell Fire Pass was emotional for us as my grandfather had worked on this area of the railway and was now buried in the Kanchanaburi Cemetery. Airs knowledge of the workings of the railway was exceptional, The bottles of water and cool face towels supplied by T after we had walked along the pass were a nice touch.On route to the War Cemetery we had a lovely traditional Thai lunch on the bank of the River Kwai.The information gathered at the Cemetery and at the Thai Burma Railway Center next to the Cemetery was invaluable in tracing the journey of our grandfather and the plight of so many others.The final section of our tour was a short Long Boat trip up the river Kwai to the famous bridge. The tour, Air and T, the services provided by BKK Tours were all first class. We are already planning a return trip with friends and will definitely be booking BKK Tours.Mark & Joanne/

HIGHLIGHT OF OUR TRIP TO THAILAND. After reading the excellent reviews on TA & searching through the many companies, I decided on BKK Tours & mailed them. Michiel's reply was prompt despite the time difference & this alone impressed me. So many enquiries go unanswered. I had decided what we wanted to see & although not on his website, Michiel tailored a trip to our requirements. Our guide< my apologies cannot remember her name>, was excellent, probably the best guide we have ever had on all our travels! Our driver was polite & so caring, meeting us with a smile, cool towels & iced water & his vehicle was top notch! All refreshments were included in the price & the al la carte lunch at a restaurant we would never have found on our own, was fanatastic! The best thing was we went to see attractions we were interested in & at no point were we rushed as one so often is. I would recommend BKK Tours to everyone wanting to do a trip in Bangkok. Just the best! Wished Michiel operated from other areas as well.

One of the Best Experiences for a Short Stay in BKK.. Although it has been a while, I had been to Bangkok many times, this was my wife's first trip to BKK. I had to figure a way to see most of the great sites in a day. I checked here on TA and decided to e-mail Michiel at BBK tours, he responded promptly.We decided on a Bangkok Highlights tour as it would cover most of what she wanted to see. Ms. Oi was our guide, she is very knowledgeable with BKK and spoke great English.I won't go into the details of the tour but for the cost of a private tour that included the price of everything including taxi, tickets to landmarks, lunch, Tuk-Tuk's Etc.. this was a bargain. I rarely do any sort of organized tours but this was one I can highly recommend even if this is not your first time to Thailand.

Unbeatable!. We were spending just a few days in Bangkok and decided to use two of them to tour privately with this company, based on the many excellent reviews on TA. We were not disappointed. On the first day we went to Kanchanaburi on the Burmese border to see the Death Railway and the Bridge over the River Kwai, driven by Peter in a luxury van with reclinging seats and cold towels and water in abundance, and a delicious lunch included. The experience itself was sobering, but the overall standard and the lengths gone to by the BKK staff to ensure our comfort were second to none. On the second day we toured Chinatown on foot and by public transport - fascinating to explore and great photo ops. The guide on both trips - Ms Pary - proved herself to be indispensable, very friendly and accommodating, and knowledgable about the places we were visiting. All in all, I would have to say that these were two of the best tours I have ever taken anywhere, with anybody, and I would not hesitate to recommend them if you happen to be visiting this fabulous city.

Amazing experience!. We booked this tour as we were only staying in Bangkok for 2 days and wanted a comprehensive tour to make the most of our stay. We booked the Bangkok highlights tour.We met our tour guide Pary at the port of Laem Chabang which is around 2 hours outside Bangkok. As there was only me and my partner on this private tour Pary made sure that our drive into Bangkok was interesting and covered local history as well as answered out cultural queries with no awkward silences., the flower market, and a nice long tail boat tour to see the local life in the Venice of the East.We started at the flower market due to crazy traffic in Bangkok that morning which was great and we experienced some street food and the best Iced coffee from a little stall which was the best I have ever tasted! After this we got a Tuctuc to the Grand Palace following that we visited Wat Phra Kaeo andWat Pho with the reclining Buddha. Pary was very knowledgeable about all the temples and have us a far greater insight of what we were seeing if we were to do this trip on our own which have us a better understanding of what we were seeing. She also showed us pictures of things to show us how things would be during ceremony's etc.After this we asked if there was any have we could get some gifts and Pary kindly directed us to a less touristy market where we found some bargains. After all that the tour was topped off with a private long boat tour where we fed fish outside a temple. I cannot fault the attentiveness of our guide and I wouldn't hesitate in recommending BKK tours to friends and family or even using them again ourselves. Pary is an absolute credit to BKK tours and my partner and I will always have great memories of this place thanks to her.

Like seeing Bangkok with a friend!. Nadia met us in our lobby, and straight away started chatting. Within minutes we were comfortable with her, and it felt more like a hospitable friend was taking us around than like a tour guide! Nadia led us to the most luxurious mini van and we were on our way to the floating markets and railway market. Nadia was always alert to the needs of both my husband and I and our kids (7 & 9 years), buying the kids ice creams and snacks to try. She even bought the kids a souvenir at the markets for them to take home with them! My daughter became a little unwell during the day and we were able to head back to the hotel a little early. That is the advantage of a personal tour - no waiting with a sick kid on a crowded bus while the tour group forges ahead! When we return to Bangkok we will definitely be back for another tour with BKK!

THIS IS THE WAY TO GO IN BANGKOK!. Travelling as a family of 4 with 2 kids, in my head safety was paramount in the big city. Initially, I contacted a couple of tour options and Michiel's replies were the most professional and prompt. Our guide for the day of Bangkok highlights was Nadia. She was at our hotel lobby far before the time she needed to be, all ready to go. This lady was one of the highlights of our whole trip to Thailand and I cannot speak highly enough of her extensive local knowledge and history of her country. We learnt so much and on our return I made our kids write homework and notes of everything they learned. Yes we learnt far more about Thailand in one day with Nadia, than of our 11 days prior in Phuket. Nadia adapted the trip to suit our requests - after our initial welcome chat - we caught the tuk tuk to the flower market and then to the Grand Palace and Temple of reclining Buddha. We had the most wonderful weather for touring BKK - CLOUDY!!! no hot sun, no rain - perfect! After that we had lunch by the river, then went on our hour long canal tour by long tail (with life jackets, thank you! :) Finally, we caught the skytrain back to our hotel and had a lovely chat with Nadia to conclude. Along the way during the day - Nadia purchases all tickets and you don't need to queue up anywhere at all OR negotiate prices. We parted by having family photos and hugs with Nadia. And as others have said, felt like a new friend had been made. I am so annoyed that I forgot to share our New Zealand nick nacks that we had taken all that way for that purpose so I will attempt to post them over to Nadia. This tour cost us $350 NZD for a full 8hour day with Nadia. If you were keen to arrange and do this all by yourself as a couple without kids or similar to be bothered, it would probably be much less. I would not change a thing - absolutely perfect day out for our family. Thank you Michiel, BKK Tours and the lovely Nadia. DO offer Nadia a tip for her professionalism, absolutely and totally worthwhile.

Great for a brief stopover. I had a brief stop over in Bangkok so arranged a all day and evening tour with BKK. I was assigned tour guide Ms. Oi. She was great, very professional, showed up as discussed and because I was the only one on the tour she was very flexible, if we wanted to stop we could stop etc... Got a very good look at the city in a relatively short space of time. This sort of tour would be easy to do yourself but would take a lot longer and you miss out on all the insider information. Oi spoke very good English and was very helpful with any of the requests I made.There were no "cultural stops", i.e. you are shuffled into some sort of basket weaving place and expected to buy their products after a one hour "demo" etc...There was some confusion as to the use of camera tripods, which puzzled me somewhat, especially as we were paying customers. I was wanting to use a tripod to get a nice picture of a temple from our dinner spot but checking with the restaurant owner had this request denied, also similar result from the Skybar (I think that was what its name was, gives you a nice view of the city from a high-rise). Other than those small issues can highly recommend BKK, they are fantastic.

You can't go wrong with BKK!! . We booked the Bangkok Highlight tour for 9/25. The price is very fair for a personalized tour guide who follows you every where.The highlight tour consists of the visit to the Royal Palace, Leaning Buddha, Lunch at the Royal Navy Restaurant, Flower Market, and a boat ride through the canals. We opted for the regular tour without the private car (which runs only $75) as we wanted to learn how to get around like locals do.There were pleasant surprises on the trip but I won't ruin it for you.It was a hot humid and sometimesWet morning. We tried to get started as early as possible to beat the crowds and we did so. She went at our pace (we sped through the entire tour in about 5.5 hours).The tour guide was knowledgable and was comforting to us as we had trouble with the humidity + heat. (We are from Los Angeles so weather is warm but dry). She purchased water, cooling towels and drinks for us to make sure we were comfortable. At the end of our tour she took us back to the hotel via BTS (bangkok transit system) and showed us how to use it. The next day we mastered on how to get around. I'm so happy with my bookings with BKK!!!!

A Great Tour. You won't go wrong booking with BKK Tours. Booking was smooth and easy. The guide showed up on time and really delivered an excellent tour of Bangkok. Michai, my guide, did a great job showing me the tourist highlights of the city as well as taking me to see some local favorites. Living in the city gives Michai a good rapport with the locals and he was able to help me get lots of good photos of people and sites. He also stopped several times for refreshments and also for a wonderful lunch, all of which is included in the price of the tour.

Must do. BKK Tours are impressive, professional and great.value for your dollar. We did the full day Bangkok tour, then the railway market, floating market and China town tour. Amazing what we saw and experienced in two jam packed days, we could not have done it without our awesome guide Pary. Every detail was taken care of cold waiter, iced towels, lunch entrance fees all we did was enjoy the tour. Highly recommend BKK tours maximised our time in Bangkok. Pary was an informative guide, but most importantly she was a lovely person.

Great start to our holiday in Thailand. We did the Ayutthaya full day and Markets half day tours in the very capable hands of Air. By the end of the two days we had made a new friend - Air is a very knowledgeable and engaging lady. We had a lovely cool mini van and were given lots of water. Both tours were very interesting. If you come to Bangkok you should definitely choose BKK Tours.

Excellent tour, Amazing tour guide!! Ask for Peri!!. So me and my girlfriend went on a two week adventure threw the islands of Thailand and ended in Bangkok(city). I was told by multiple people that Bangkok would not be as fun and I should only spend a few days there. So since we had a limited amount of time I wanted to take a tour to really experience as much of Bangkok as possible. I learned that 2 days was simply not enough time in Bangkok and that I should have taken a tour at the beginning of our trip. Right away she showed us how to talk to/ negotiate with local vendors, taxi drivers, took took driver etc. Even though Thai is one of the nicest and most respectful cultures I've seen. If your a tourist. Just like everywhere else in the world if you don't know better your paying a premium on everything. Ok so about BKK tours. I found them threw trip advisor and as soon as I read the reviews and spoke to the owner mike. I knew this would be the right fit for us. When our guide arrived to pick us I didn't know what to expect, I mean spending the entire day with a stranger in a foreign country can seem overwhelming or at least to me it can. We got so lucky with Peri!!! A local soft spoken, kind hearted person that was so informative and knowledgeable of the local attractions and culture. We went to the local fruit and flower market witch was really cool to see, then went the royal palace witch despite being so hot was an amazingly beautiful place. Peri knew everything!! I love to ask lots of questions and there wasn't a single one she couldn't answer. Honestly I learned more about Thai culture this day then I did the entire 2 weeks before the tour. Then off to a two huge beautiful temples. It's very humbling to see the monks, traditions, the art, the architecture and the culture. All of it is awesome. The big Buddha is a must see. BKK paid for a lot of stuff, snacks, fruit, water, lunch. I almost felt guilty letting Peri pay so much. She was carrying our bags, taking pictures and just being all around pleasant. We got very lucky! Thank you BKK and Peri! Keep up the good work! Until next time :) Michael & Shauneet

Perfect!. We booked 2 daytrips with bkk- tours and they were very intresting and pleasant! (Highlights off bangkok and trainmarket/floatingmarket/ elephantsworld/ river kwai) For both days we had mss Oi as our guide and she did it perfect. Everything was included: dinner, drinks, refrechments when we needed, fruit, ... Thank you a lot for these wonderful days!

Great tour. We did a tour of Bangkok today with Ms Air. The tour was very interesting, and Ms. Air was excellent. Extremely nice and knowledgeable, she patiently answered our many questions, and explained everything. We had a great dayRuty & Mishael

The best tours company. Teresa J White. We booked a tour in Bangkok with BKk tours. Our tour guide was Pary. Well it was like been with a friend on tour. Her knowledge was beyond expectation, her interest and love of her country was impeccable. The tour was 5 stars. We enjoyed the tour so much we decided to do another tour, we organized Pary and again She showed us the same enthusiasm and love history of this great country. I would recommend BKK tours.The reason we went with BKK tours to begin with, while we were still in Australia, I wrote to a few tour companies and BKK were organized, replied to email within 12 hours or less.
