I found them very professional, thanks BKK tours.

Great Intro to Bangkok. We had 2 days in Bangkok and so glad we used BKK tours. Ms. Oi was our guide for both days and we couldn't have asked for a better resource. She taught us so much about Bangkok and the people. She listened to our wish list and gave us 2 days of experiences we'll never forget. We'll be back to Bangkok for sure and will look her up when we arrive. Thanks Oi!

Excellent service and great company!. My parents and I booked the Bangkok Highlights Full Day tour with BKK Tours. The experience throughout, from the initial inquiry phase to the actual tour itself was very professional. We enjoyed the company of Nadia, our tour guide, who was a delightful person to show us around Bangkok. Keep up the good work!

A company to trust in bangkok. My fiancée and I booked the full day highlights of Bangkok tour. Emails were answered quickly and professionally, and the tour was practically booked within 25 mins.We were assigned Ms Nadia as our guide, and by the end of the day we thought we'd hit the jackpot! She was outstanding!!! Our experience with Nadia started with a chat about the plans for the day, as the day progressed, Nadia took the time to really get to know us. When we told her that we had only got engaged 4 weeks ago in Koh Tao, Nadia went from tour guide and photographer, to wedding planner recommending different ideas for our big day, and simply just getting involved with us in a way no normal tour guide would.That is exactly my point, this is not a company of normal tour guides , they're honest, genuine and sincere, and really go above and beyond to make your day great fun!I cant really write anything about the tour that nobody else has already said, however we literally used every mode of Bangkok transport available. River boat, tuk tuk, long tail boat, skytrain, subway, and to top it all off Nadia convinced us to do a short motorbike taxi back to our hotel from the skytrain station nearby. A fantastic alternative bunch of ways to get around the city rather than sitting in heavy traffic for hours!We have left exchanging email addresses with Nadia, under strict instructions to keep in touch and if we decide to get married in Thailand, we now have a wedding planner lol.A great day out that ended with us making a friend. Stop looking and book with BKK Tours!

Couldn't have asked for more..... From prompt emails and excellent customer service as my title states, we couldn't have asked for more. Our tour guide Ms.Oi met us at our hotel. We visited the Wat Pho, the Grand Palace with its royal temple Wat Phra Kaeo (emerald Buddha), the flower market and then took a long tailed boat tour through the canals of Bangkok. The whole experience was amazing; Ms. Oi was really knowledgeable on all aspects of the tour and was happy to answer every question we had. I felt like I learnt so much and really got an insight into the culture. Because the tour is private it is a nice personal touch. No expense is spared, our lunch was paid for, if there was anything we wanted to try or drink whilst on the tour was all taken care of. The highlight of the tour would definitely have to be feeding the catfish on the canal. Hands down BKK tours were excellent and I will be referring them to all of my friends.

Hua Hin, Kanchanaburi and Bangkok. This is my third year of tours with Air at BKK and undertook a more extensive programme, visiting Hua Hin, Kanchanaburi and Bangkok. As this was outside of their usual tours Air and Michiel took the time and effort to put together a custom made programme with detailed itinerary and costings. They also helped with suggestions for hotels and were also happy to accommodate some late changes without any problem. Travelling with a friend Air picked us both up from Suvarnabhumi airport being driving with us in a private minibus to Hua Hin where we spent three nights. During our time there we visited some of Hua Hin's excellent night markets and visited the nearby Khao Sam Yoi Rot national park.From Hua Hin we drove directly to Kanchanaburi (my second visit), where again stayed at the Oriental Kwai Resort. Air had arranged a three day programme of tours, including Hellfire Pass (walking the full trail this time), the Prathat Cave and the Erawan Waterfalls. Erawan was slightly disappointing, partly due to low water levels and partly due to the number of tourists (we visited on a Saturday). After a couple of free days we were driven to Bangkok for four nights and two further tours. The photo tour with Air and Michiel was excellent, both as an introduction to photography and seeing different parts of Bangkok (ranging from a meat and fish market to Wat Arun). The final day's touring with Air visited the wonderfully quiet Suan Pakkard Palace and the impressive Royal Barges Museum. Throughout this year's touring Air was unfailingly friendly and helpful. As others have mentioned it felt was travelling with a friend rather than a tour guide, albeit a very knowledgeable friend. Thanks also to Air for being trip photographer and supplying copies via Dropbox. I would also like to mention the excellent Mr Sak, our minibus driver, who took good care of us throughout. I highly recommend BKK Tours and look forward to using them again in 2015.

Simply Awesome !! You've got to book them. We travelled along with our 3year old daughter to Bangkok recently and used The services to BKK tours to learn about the city. Michiel was prompt in answering any queries in detail via mail and was very kind. We had Nadia as our tour guide, she was very knowledgeable about the city and was very attentive to our needs- asking us if we needed refreshments, she brought a jasmine band for our kid and even helped us by taking care of her while we went to see the grand palace. Even the lil gesture of buying bread for the catfish to feed on...got my lil one all excited. I would highly recommend bkk tours...you really feel your going around the city with a FRIEND. I can go on and on about how well spent our day and experience was. Way to go guys keep up the great work, the next time we are in Bangkok, shall definitely tour with BKK tours.

Like having a local friend to show you round.... We are a family of 4 adults and spent three days in Bangkok, having arranged for BKK Tours to look after us for the whole time. We did the Bangkok highlights tour the first day and then Kanchanaburi and Ayutthaya on days 2 and 3. The experience with BKK tours was simply excellent - they could not have done more to look after us. Throughout the trips we were offered cold drinks, cold towels, ice cream etc. Our guide, Air, was great company and took time to explain things when we needed her to but yet also gave our family the time to move at our own pace. We simply could not have experienced and seen what we did without the local insights and knowledge of a guide like Air - she was able to take us places that we just would not have dared to venture on our own. Great value for money overall, really friendly professional service and highly recommended.

Highly recommended. Oi my guide was a delightful guide and I spent a seamless 9hrs sightseeing Bangkok. Given that my tour was organised at the last minute ie the day before I have only praise for this company and would definitely do another tour with them

Railway Market & Floating Market with Nadia. My husband and I reserved a private tour of the markets during our visit to Bangkok. Nadia took us to see the railway market and the floating market. We had such an incredible experience with Nadia. She was so nice and extremely knowledgable. The markets were definitely worth visiting, and I highly recommend requesting Nadia for your tour! She was great!

Stop looking..... and just book with this 6 star tour company !. Having just returned from two weeks in Thailand last night the first thing I need to do is to spread the word about this amazing organization. It started with efficient and helpful emails in advance to ensure all was perfect and a personalized request could be made....stay tuned ! We had 6 days in Bangkok and 2 of them was in the delightful company of this first class tour group. We arranged a full day Highlights of Bangkok ( see website for details) and what a clever idea to try the many forms of transport available including the subway, tuk tuk, taxi and long boat. We were met at our Hotel, Grande Sheraton on Sukhumvit Road by the beautiful guide Oi who gave us the VIP treatment all day. Cold water, icy cold towels were purchased, she took our photo and a genuine love of knowledge of culture, history and current daily life was shared. My partner had never been to Bangkok before and he became a fan due to Oi's stories. Lunch at the Navy Club, without chilli, was delicious and of course included ! We saw it all including the canals with frenzied fish feeding. The tour on the next day was my highlight of my whole holiday.............to go to the floating market train market ( without train due to its breakdown ! ) and have Michiel the owner make it the photography tour was magnificent. I have done photography tours in Paris, New York and in country Victoria and this was the best ! Who else knows when to arrive at places WITHOUT other tourists.............to arrive without crowds was stunning ! His hints, tips and encouragement and follow up were stunning ! We shot for ages at the floating market, visited a palm sugar farm and then wandered the stalls at the train market. Oi came along too...........stay tuned still ! Mr A the driver, was wonderful with water and towels and who else would sing " I wish I could fly" as we got stuck in Bangkok traffic for nearly 2 hours ! What a superstar ! Ok ...........Oi needs a medal she took me after the photo shoot to Chinatown as I wanted to go shopping for buttons ! I do craft work and wanted buttons and lace and thought a translator would be helpful ! She was magnificent and tried to barter for me, made sure the quality was good and it was like shopping with a friend. We were jam packed in the hot and steamy lanes of Chinatowns shuffling looking in stores for buttons and making a dive when we could. We eventually found a good one and she helped me fossick ! What a superstar ! I even found a camera shaped button with the word Happy on it for Michiel. Nothing is too hard for this company. They are professional, honest, ethical and friendly so please contact me if you need more information. I cannot speak highly enough of them.

Very Professional, Polite, and Honest. I recently visited Bangkok alone, I am a female, on business and I wanted to see the sites without the hassle of all the scammers that you find at the public sites. I also didn’t want to navigate between sites because the taxi drivers can be very difficult about turning on their meters so I decided that I would try a tour company and pay for a private guide. BKK was very professional, polite, and honest from our first communication. Michiel, the Dutch owner, responded to my email request immediately. He sent brochures, prices, and told me that the tour could be altered to my needs. He was very accommodating. I selected the Bangkok highlight tour and it was certainly worth the money. My tour guide took me to additional sites, such as a 200 year old community next to the palace (whose residents were not originally allowed to settle inside the palace walls) and another temple where they had meditation chairs (neither was listed on our list of venues to see). We took a variety of Tuk Tuks (which was unique and so much fun), we ate a local restaurant on the water, and took a water taxi. In general, it was just relaxing because you paid up front and then didn’t worry about money the rest of the day. The tour guide buys you local sweets or other food to try, teas, coffees, etc. so you come away from the tour having experienced many things that you would not have tried on your own. At the temple of the Reclining Buddha, do ask for details about the pictures on the bottom of the foot. I also recommend that you go around to the backside of the Buddha and purchase the 20 Baht cup of coins (most tourist don’t do this). You take each coin and throw it into the metal pots lining the wall. You can express a thought with each toss of the coin or be thankful for something in your life. It is an authentic experience and you come away feeling better for the 20 Baht donation to the temple. BKK tour treats you well; they quote a price and deliver on every aspect of their promise. If you want a hassle-free tour, one where you can just relax, I highly recommend using them.

Best thing we did in Bangkok, a faultless experience from start to end. I had a wonderful experience with this tour company. It started out as a generic inquiry email which I sent to a couple of private tour companies to express my interest in a couple of tour attractions such as floating market, train market and tiger temple.Theirs was the ONLY private tour company to email me back with a very polite email written in faultless English that they are sorry but they have a company policy of not doing tours at the Tiger Temple as they don't agree with the treatment of the tigers at the Tiger Temple. I liked how Michiel, the owner of BKK Tours also took the trouble to include a couple of links in his email on the shockingly unethical practices over at the Tiger Temple. I was enlightened and decided to go with the only company who obviously valued ethics as much as I do.I am so glad I decided on BKK Tours because my husband and I had a fantastic experience with them. We opted for the Train market, floating market, caves and Chinatown tour. Every tour was amazing and offered an introspective look at how the local people live, through the eyes of a local guide.I would love to go back to Bangkok and do other tours with this company. A must-do, in my humble opinion. Bangkok has so much more to offer than just great food & shopping, cheap massages and a vibrant nightlife!

Floating Market and Grand Palace. We reserved 2 days of tour with BKK in Bangkok. Our guide was Oi; She was AMAZING! Our 1st tour was the train and Floating Market. A must see if you have time. We were picked up in a luxurious van filled with ice cold water and ice cold toilettes. The Floating Market was our highlight of this day and entire trip!The 2nd tour we took was a personalized tour to Grand Palace, Wat Arun(the reclining Buddha) and a few other stops we requested including Massage at the Thai temple. Oi was such a great guide. She explained everything in full detail and also showed us how to make an offering and ritual of fortune telling sticks. I would recommend BKK Tours and Oi to anyone traveling to Bankok!

Great guide and nice day spent visiting highlights in Bangkok.. We booked a full day private tour for myself, my husband, and my parents. Our guide was wonderful and spoke English very well. She was informative, friendly, and funny. Her name was Air, but I have no idea how you spell it in Thai. She provided us with information about the locations we visited along with several Thai customs and traditions we were interested in learn about. The canal cruise was a must see because you get to see the Venice of the East along with a lot of wildlife including several monitor lizards on the shore and swimming in the waters. She spent as much time in each place as we wanted and adjusted the tour based on what we had done the previous evening. She took us to a market and bought us several treats to try. Traveling around in the tuk tuks from location to location was a tour in itself. Great day and tour to see the highlights of Bangkok especially when you are only visiting for a short period. I would definitely use this tour company again and recommend them to others.

Made me feel like a VIP!. I was in Bangkok on business and had a weekend to spare. I searched for Bangkok tours and found a few options. I selected BKK because the tour package was all inclusive and individualized - one price covers all admissions, transport, snacks, lunch, everything. I used the website to send an inquiry about booking a city tour. Michiel responded very quickly and we arranged everything by email. My guide, Emmy, was so friendly, energetic, and informative. She showed me a great time around the city. I felt like a VIP being given a private tour of the city!As far as the tour goes, we met in Bangkok and took a river boat to Wat Arun. Then walked to Wat Pho. Stopped for a coffee then toured the Grand Palace grounds and Wat Phra Kaew. We stopped for a delicious lunch at a restaurant on the river then took a canal tour on a long tail boat which ended at the Flower Market. We toured the Flower Market and ended the day with a Tuk Tuk ride to the subway station where I took a taxi back to my hotel. The sites were great - like nothing I've seen before. Thank you Michiel and Emmy!

Great way to see Bangkok. Had a great day being shown the sights by Ms OiShe met us in our hotel and took us on the highlights tourWe were taken to the grand palace and emerald buddha/reclining buddha templesIt was super hot - I would advise wearing some breathable clothing. Ms Oi keep us cooled as much as possible and provided us with water and a cool towelThen to an air-conditioned riverside restaurant for a great lunch and cool beverageThe afternoon took in the flower and vegetable markets and finished off with a boat ride through the canals of BKKMs Oi was a great tour guide and we had a great day seeing the sights of BKK in comfort. All costs during the day were covered in the fee for the tour.The reviews don't lie!

Good tours. Took on 4 tours with BKK. Thus seeing most of Bangkok with them. Bangkok full day city, Ayutthaya, Ratchaburi, Erawan falls...They have a pool of tour guides but of the two who served us, the owner Ms Air was great. Very personable. The other guide was ok. Both spoke English and has no problems explaining the sights.As all the tours were private tours, it was done at the pace we are comfortable with. All the Thai Lunch was great - locations that only the locals would know and bring you to.I would recommend them any day as these are good honest folks providing good service.

Great day in bangkok. We just did a full day tour with Nadia. We are traveling with our almost one-year-old and wanted to get to know the city with a little guidance. Nadia was so knowledgeable and made everything seamless. She was also very aware of the needs of the baby, and even helped us with him a little in order to make our day a bit more relaxing. I also really liked the way they have it set up that you pay one price and that includes transport, admission fees, food, water, etc. it was nice to not have to keep doling out money a day. We have never done a private tour before, but it was awesome!Also, the communication before the tour was thorough and quick. They even sent me an article about traveling to Bangkok with a baby. I highly recommend BKK tours!

Wonderful!. We only had one day in Bangkok and we spent it on a full-day "Highlights" tour with Air. Even before the tour, our experience with BKK Tours was excellent -- Michiel was very prompt and professional in answering emails with questions about the tour and booking. On the day of the tour, it was very hot, but Air did a fantastic job keeping us hydrated, finding us spots in the shade, even buying us frozen towels! Her assistance navigating the sights of Bankgok and her interesting commentary at each of our stops were invaluable. Everywhere we went, everyone seemed to know and love Air, if that is any indication of what an experienced and wonderful tour guide she was. We highly recommend this tour company and will definitely book with them if we ever find ourselves in Bankgok again.

The best tour (and tour guide) we've ever had. We did 2 days worth of tours in June 2014 with BKK: the Bangkok Highlights (full day) and the Floating Market/Railway Market (half day). Our tour guide was a young woman named Nadia.Simply put, this was the best tour we've ever been given, anywhere in the world. We expected a lot for the price we paid... and Nadia surpassed our expectations.On the first day, Nadia picked us up right on time in our hotel lobby. She then took us to the flower market in Bangkok which is filled with incredible sights and smells. She bought my girlfriend a flower bracelet made of jasmine and roses. We then went on to the Royal Palace/Golden Pagoda, an amazing lunch by the river (which was included in the price, unbeknownst to us!), before taking us to the Reclining Buddha. We ended the day with a long boat tour down the river and a visit to Wat Arun. On the second day, Nadia picked us up bright and early and took us to the Tha Kha Floating market. This particular floating market is only open on certain days - and lucky for us, it was open that day. We absolutely loved it. We were the only tourists there and it felt like a truly authentic Thai experience. We sat and ate all sorts of delicious, locally made cuisine, including noodles, soups, chicken, dumplings, deserts, drinks, etc. Don't eat a big breakfast before you go on this tour! We then went down the river on a small boat and visited a coconut farm, which was a surprise and a delight. We got to see how a small family makes coconut sugar for sale, and we even got to try our hand at helping out. The rest of the day was spent at the Railway market (the one where the train goes through the market and all the vendors quickly close up and then re-open). That was pretty cool.On to Nadia: what can we say about her? Simply outstanding. She was very attentive; always providing us with water, cold towels, and buying us little snacks and flowers (she bought us so much stuff, I started to worry that she was being TOO nice! I hope she was compensated by her employer). She would go out of her way to make sure we were happy. What surprised us the most (in a pleasant way) was how much we learned about Thai culture, history, religion, and politics simply by chatting with Nadia. Somehow, she was able to convey tons of information to us in a very straightforward manner and in a very limited amount of time. We learned so much, experienced so much, and even learned how to speak basic Thai, all because of Nadia's efforts. Huge bonus points to her for so often taking our camera and shooting pictures of us together.We took the BKK tours on our first two days in Thailand. What a wonderful way to start a vacation. Thank you Nadia!

Another great experience with our favorite Thailand Tour operator. My first experience with BKK Tours was in 2012, when I did 4 tours with them. This month I visited Bangkok again with my wife and it was another great trip with them. We requested Air and Gift as our guides and the whole experience with them was just wonderful. Michiel (the owner) was very helpful with organizing and gave great advice to us. We were a bit worried because of the current political situation in Thailand but after we arrived we found that all our worries were just groundless. Bangkok and Thailand are very safe to travel. This time we did a tour through Chinatown, visited some markets and a very interesting amulet market with Air as our guide. She is extremely resourceful and will show you places of Bangkok you would otherwise have no chance to see. You will meet the local people and with her help can communicate with them. We also did the Bangkok Highlights tour with her. BKK Tours are very well managed and organized, they will never lead you to "shops" where you are pushed to buy things like some other tour operators in Thailand do. After Bangkok we visited the Train Market and the Floating Market in Tha Kha and Ayutthaya with the wonderful Gift as our guide. Both Air and Gift have many years of experience as a tour guide and you feel like a friend is showing you around. They introduce you to typical local thai food and we visited Restaurants with them where we were often the only non thai guests. The way they talk to the local people is also very nice to see. They treat everyone with respect and you as their guests take profit form this. BKK Tours is not cheap but ... like always in life; quality has its prize. Will be back with BKK Tours? You can bet on it!!

Our friend in Bangkok. I was first attracted to BKK Tours last year because of their ethics in that they won't take tourists to places that exploit animals. What brought us back for another tour this year is that Air is an amazing guide who has such a wealth of knowledge to share.This year we did a tour of the Makkasan slum community and a few less well known but amazing temples, then on to Chinatown. It was an incredibly humbling and emotional experience seeing how people less fortunate than us live in these communities. My main concern before the tour was that we didn't want to be like gawping tourists or in any way disrespectful to these people. I needn't have been concerned as Air is very compassionate and has a wonderful way with people. It was certainly an eye-opening experience we will never forget. We got around on local transport - tuk tuk, train, canal boat and walking. Air was always looking out for us - knowing when to get us out of the heat when we were flagging, pointing out a good camera angle for a photo, reminding us to take napkins from the cafe for the toilet! Everything was taken care of throughout the day - entry fees, transport, drinks, and our lunch which was amazing. So all we had to do was soak up the experience and enjoy. Emails are answered promptly. Tours are easily customised to suit our needs. We have complete trust that we are getting a great service, in fact it is more like we have a friend in Bangkok who is our personal guide. See you next year Air!

Fabulous tour!. We started our honeymoon in Bangkok and as it was our first time in SE Asia (and only having one full day here) we decided to have a private tour. It was brilliant! The lovely Air showed us around and took us on Tuk-Tuk's, the subway, boat and air train. We saw the palace, temples, markets and more and she gave us much detailed information. She was relaxed too (much better than the guide we got in Cambodia later on our holiday!) and made us feel so at ease. She always points out various street foods etc asking us if we want to try anything or asking if we needed water. She bought us iced coffee's in the temple. Lunch was by the river and we could order whatever we wanted, she gave us suggestions of what to try. So much food was brought out we struggled to eat it all! It was a brilliant day and I highly recommend this company. It made for a lovely stress free day!

Like having family in Bangkok.. Our BKK tours were even better than we could have wished for with a more in depth, personal introduction to the Thai culture, food and sights. The city sightseeing tour is a must and should be done early in your visit to Bangkok. Not only do you get a wonderful overview of this remarkable city but you also become familiar (and confident) in navigating around the city using the skytrain, tuk tuks, public boats, and taxis. We hired Michiel to accompany us as a professional photographer/teacher to the floating & train markets. That also, was one of our best decisions as his expertise, tips, tricks are something we can use on future trips to make our photographs more "real" and full of emotion/expression. I highly recommend BKK tours for anyone wanting a 5 star experience in Bangkok.

Amazing guide. Air war an amazing guide. She speaks perfect Englishand knows everything about thai culture, food and history. We spent 2 and a half days with her and it was great. Lunch is included and Air took us to some really great places and insisted that we should try some of everything (truly we had banquets) . She also took us on a boat ride, tuk tuk, taxi, air train, etc and we got to experiment all of thailand street food without a worry. I definitely recommend that if you go to Bangkok you get at least a day with BKK. And, very important, Air is a great photographer and she took loads of them for us.

Ranked #1 with us!. Our BKK tour with Air as our tour guide and Tao as our driver was the best tour of the 10 shore excursions we took in Asia. The correspondence prior to our arrival date was excellent, with Michiel keeping us informed about the local political situation, and the BKK Tours & Photography Facebook page providing us with a glimpse of what was to come. Air was knowledgeable, well spoken, friendly, and customer service oriented, but it was the extra touches that set BKK apart- Air buying us food to feed the fish, and drinks and ice cream to sample after a hot tour, finding us shady spots to stand in when we were hot, smoothly handling all entrance fees and financial transactions, taking our photos, advising us on what to wear and bring, having toilet paper available, and instructing us in local customs and rituals with incense, gold leaf, lotus flowers, prayer pennies, etc. Tao also exceeded our expectations by greeting us at his beautiful, comfortable van with a cold towel at the door and a cold bottle of water at each seat after our stops, and entertaining us with his LED party lights and music on the way back to the port! The first day we drove by Chinatown, visited the Grand Palace and the Emerald Buddha, ate a delicious Thai lunch at the Navy Club, took a long tail boat ride on the Chao Phraya River where we fed the catfish, visited the Flower Market and the Wat Pho Reclining Buddha, and stayed overnight at the excellent Center Point Silom. The second day we rode the van to Ayutthaya, rode a cable car across the river to Wat Niwet Thammaprawat and then another long tail boat ride to Ayutthaya historic park. We then took the van past the Elephant park to Wat Lokayasutha for the Reclining Buddha, then to Wat Maha That, had another nice lunch at Pae Krung Kao floating restaurant and fed more fish, and were returned to the port in a timely manner. Highly recommended!

Great tours with our guide Oi. We booked two 1/2 day tours with BKK Tours while in Bangkok for 5 days recently. We went to the Grand Palace and Temple of The Emerald Budda one day and to the Railway Market and Floating Market the other day. Our tour guide Oi with wonderful on both occasions. Very knowledgeable and introduced us to some yummy treats we probably wouldn't have tried otherwise. Would definitely recommend them!!

'M' - our guide from BKK - simply 'M'arvellous. M' from BKK Tours took us for an adventure around Bangkok for the day travelling by local transport - taxi, tuk tuk and boat. Definately the way to go to avoid massive traffic. Crammed in highlights of Bangkok in one day - Chinatown, Pak Khlong Talad (Flower and vegetable market), Lunch, Grand Palace with Wat Phra Kaeo, Wat Pho, Canal tour and Sunset Wat Arun. 'M' catered extremely well for our love of photography and a 12yo daughter who wasn't feeling the greatest. He quickly varied to day so that we would all enjoy it. Highly recommend BKK tours.

Great tours in and around Bangkok. We stayed in Bangkok for 3 nights as part of our two week trip to Thailand. Michiel organised three perfect tours. We arrivés at the airport on Monday morning and after a delicious lunch we went for a biking tour with Co van Kessel in the very busy and colourful Bangkok. Andy was a great guide, very considered with my mother who was doing great at 75!The next day we went with Miss Air to the stunning Royal Palace, the reclining Buddha and with a longtailboat through the klongs. Her recommendation for diner was also an absolute success.On Wednesday we visited the trainmarket, the floating market. Cemetry to the Burma railway and memorial and bridge on river Kwai. Programmes were busy because of our limited time in Bangkok, though balanced. Miss Air was ,very knowledgeable and great fun to be with. We enjoyed every single moment.Michiel also recommended a tourguide for our stay in Chiang Mai which also turend out very goog.

Day trip to Bangkok from Laem Chabang. We were cruising in SE Asia and Bangkok was high on our list of places to tour. Our cruise docked in Laem Chabang, a long drive from Bangkok, but we did not want to spend a night in the city, but rather just do a day tour. We understood that this would limit what we could see given the transit time to and from the city. We contacted BKK after reading their reviews on Trip Advisor - Michael was able to provide a van, driver and guide for the 6 of us, and kept us updated on the state of the unrest in Bangkok prior to our arrival.We had a wonderful day in Bangkok, saw what we wanted to see, and had a delightful (included) lunch, tour of the palace, long boat ride, etc. Everything was faultless and we heartily endorse BKK for touring in Thailand. They did several different tours for people off our ship, including overnight stays, and everyone was thrilled with their tours.

Thanks for your excellent day tour ,miss Emmy. My group had an amazing day tour with BKK tours and miss Emmy ,she is a great tour guide ,i have done in my life ,very knowledgeable about culture , history and local information with well English spoken ,she made our trip gone very fast .Thanks BKK tours and miss Emmy for amazing time in your city !

Excellent day!. When we first booked the tour with BKK Tours by email, their responses were very prompt. We had an excellent private tour with Ms Emmy who was very friendly and knowledgeable, and our van driver (wish we could remember his name) who was very polite and gave us cold towels and water whenever we returned to the van. We went to the Train Market where Ms Emmy led us around the local market before waiting for the train to come through. Then we headed to the Floating Market and had a very informative and interesting boat ride. Ms Emmy bought some foods for us to sample as we passed by the sellers. Lunch (included in the Tour price) was at a quiet local restaurant right on the river. Heading back into Bangkok, we had a longboat tour on the canal, a jaunt through the flower market, and a tour of the Wat Arun Temple. We were able to change plans on a whim, and both Ms Emmy and the driver were very accommodating. It was an excellent day, and we would highly recommend BKK Tours. A great value for the price. Thank you for making our Bangkok stay worthwhile!

GREAT service!loved every minute!. We went to Ayutthaya & Authentic Markets & River Kwai Bridge with Ms. Nes in 2 day tours and she is a passionate and brilliant guide, very polite and nice to us, looking always to exceed our expectations and in the end we enjoyed every minute. we learnt a lot of Thailand with her, about culture, habits, history, food. First we went to Ayutthaya (a place I always wanted to go) to temples where only the locals go (like the Wat Phanan Choeng in Ayutthaya, that we really loved!), taking all the doubts and explaining us everything!Next day we went to Authentic Markets half day tour and in the afternoon we went to River Kwai Bridge (thanks to Michiel that tailor made this tour for us and he was always very friendly and professional in all the emails since the first contact, even sent me map with the areas we should avoid because of the protests in bangkok ) and was a amazing day too, full of experiences! I also would like to say a big thank you to the driver. he drived very safe and well and he was the best driver in our 2 weeks in thailand, the minivan was very comfortable, clean and he was always giving us fresh towels and water when we come back from the sightseeing. all the meals were included in both days and were very good too. I am very happy I found BKK Tours and if I come back to Bangkok I would like to book more tours with Bkk Tours and Ms. Nes in particular. Great Service!Kob Khun Krap!Obrigado!

Fabulous Tour. The six of us spent 2 days touring Bangkok in a beautiful air-conditioned van with Air from BKK tours. From the minute we met to the airport drop-off, Air was a friendly, knowledgeable and competent guide. We had so much fun travelling around the sites of Bangkok and the Floating and Train Markets. Air immediately made us feel like friends and not clients. Air showed us so much of Bangkok that we wouldn't be able to do on our own. Fantastic experience with a wonderful guide and unexpected extras.Thank you!!!

3 Great Tour Days with BKK TOURS (23rd 24th &25th March 2014). We had such a great time .Can highly recommend these private day tours, booked 3 day tours.Our guide was Mr Chaiya who was so kind and knowledgeable. He gave us the space to wander at our leisure.Transported by Air conditioned 6 seater car, large comfy seats with complimentary cold water and towels made the heat/ journey easier for just me and my son. we could stop when we wanted to and take photos on the journey.We chose the Ayutthaya historical tour, the Kanchanaburi Highlights tour with adjustments...Hellfire pass River Kwai and the larger part of the day at Elephant world which i will remember forever as this was the best bit for me ,to wander amongst the free walking elephants ,making up their food for the elephants who have no teeth due to their previous captivity and feeding them and watching them wander over to the river to bathe , my son went swimming with them and sat bareback on one. We took lots of close up photos , and lastly the Bangkok city tour on day 3... China town, flower market,Wat Arun Grand Palace, Wat Pho.I think we covered a variety of things to see. such good memories.... have told my family and friends about this tour company. Please be assured this is not the average day group tours. This is much much better and well worth paying for. food was excellant

Great Tour Service. We did the 1 day Bangkok Highlight tour seeing the Grand Palace and the Reclining Buddha, then the flower market and toured the river. The tour guide was outstanding and very knowledgable and her english was great. Would highly recommend their services.

Great tour, great guide, fantastic customer service. We took 2 tours with BKK, both guided by Ms Oi. The second tour (railway and floating market) was arranged at very late notice having enjoyed the first trip to Erawan/Kanchanaburi so much. Michiel arranged it with no hassle or fuss and his communication was fantastic throughout!Both trips felt very personal as we were given the opportunity to tailor the itinerary to include what we particularly wanted to do and see. It became apparent to Ms Oi that my boyfriend and I are both foodies and she made a real effort to show us and let us try numerous new foods at the markets/restaurant. Her English was exceptional. The vans were incredibly comfortable and the offer of cold water and towels was much appreciated given the heat. All in all 2 great trips. Thank you BKK!

Bangkok with BKK tours 6th and 7th March. I have copied this short message that I wrote to BKK tours as a way of thanking their company and the terrific tour guide we had for two days."Can you please pass on our huge thanks to Ms Nes for the fantastic service she provided as one of your guides whilst we were in Bangkok for two days on the 6th and 7th March. We thought Ms Nes was absolutely superb in everything she did and very caring as well.It was also nice to meet you and your wife Air at lunch on one of those days. The highlight of the tour for me would have to be the Railway Market that Ms Nes took us to on the second day, which just happened to be my birthday, and totally made the day for the experience of the visit. Thailand, thanks to BKK tours, is now top of my list as a country to revist and I only hope we can use BKK tours again as they made our visit a memorable experience, one not to forget."

Our opinion...the best tour operator in BKK, for train, floating market and Elephants World!. Right from the very first email correspondence, it was obvious that Michiel and the team at BKK Tours knew how to deliver, in providing a professional service. My wife and I used BKK Tours to organise a trip to the Tha Kha floating market and the 'famous' train market, along with transportation for a day at Elephants World in Kanchanaburi.Our market guide Raht and driver Captain A, were nothing but exceptional! They provided us with cold water and towels throughout, along with local snacks to try, it felt like a mini food tour as well! The transport was first class, very clean spacious mini van, with reclining seats. The tour as a whole really did feel like we was being embraced by the real Thailand! The train market, well spectacular! It was also arranged after witnessing the train come through the market, to take a ride to the next station, this was done sitting in the drivers cab! Also we need to mention Air, who we met up along the way, again a true professional, as with Raht and Cpt A, by the end of the tour we felt like good friends, and able to have a laugh, and learning new Thai words along the way!Michiel also kindly arranged for a driver and transport for the day, in order for us to visit Elephants World. We was expecting a standard taxi, how wrong was we! Our driver Mr S was at our hotel bang on time, for the early start, with a vehicle that was way beyond in what we was expecting. His driving was exemplary, stopping for refreshments on the 2 1/2 hour drive. It was the little things that Mr S did which topped off a great day, such as providing us with cold towels, when we finished our lunch, something that no one else was given. He even went out of his way to supply us with Pad Thai for the drive back to BKK, which was a really nice surprise, and certainly not expecting.If you are looking for a tour operator whilst in BKK, I would fully recommend to contact BKK Tours. They may cost a little bit more than what other operators offered, but there is a reason for that, it's called a first class professional service.We would not hesitate in using them again.Raht, Cpt A, Mr S, Air, Michiel and all at BKK Tours...khob khun krap

Excellent. We did the Ayutthaya tour with four of us in the van and couldn't be happier. Beautiful van, excellent guide with excellent English language skills. Every need taken care of and a really well thought out tour. We thoroughly enjoyed it. Highly recommended and worth the money!

Pleasantly Memorable. We did 2 day tours with Ms Oi. She was very informative and made us feel comfortable in an unfamiliar city. Our daughter aged 9 expressed how lucky we were to have such a lovely guide. We did the Bangkok Highlights tour which took us to the temples and flower markets. We travelled by tuk tuk, longtail boat and sky train and were provided with a lovely lunch on the river which was included in the tour price. We could order whatever we liked, but Ms Oi was happy to assist with ordering. She was very patient and kind. We got to see how the locals on the river lived around the canals and had the opportunity to feed the catfish. The second day we did the Authentic Markets tour which was also very good. We visited the train markets where an array of unusual food was on display for sale. We were amazed at how the stall holders moved their wares every time a train passed which is up to 8 times a day. Ms Oi purchased some coconut pancakes and fruit for us to taste which were delightful. We visited the floating markets where Ms Oi purchased a sample of mango and sticky rice for us to taste which was very nice. We were supplied with water and refresher towels throughout the trip and given lots of helpful information to assist with the rest of our holiday. The tours were well worth the cost and definitely the best way to find our way around the exciting city of Bangkok. We would not hesitate to recommend BKK for tours in Bangkok.

Perfect!. We booked 1 and 1/2 days with BKK tours. Fast replies by e-mail. Our first half day was with Oi. She took us (2 adults and 2 kids ages 10 and 13) to the Palace and Wat Pho. It was a very hot afternoon but she made certain we had water and shade. She was wonderful! She taught us so much, bought offerings for us to make, was so patient as we took millions of photos, and then took us on 2 tuk tuk rides because the kids loved it so much! Our second day was with Air. We were in a luxurious van as we were driving quite a bit. We visited the train market where she bought sweets and coffee and made sure we had a prime spot when the train came through. We all loved it! Then we popped by the floating market. Very touristy and probably would skip next time. And then we visited Elephant's World. DO THIS! So very much worth the extra cost and an incredible once-in-a-lifetime experience! It's an elephant rescue. We fed a 75 year-old toothless elephant by hand! Then swam in the River Kwai with the elephants. Wow and Wow! Even though we left our hotel at 7 and didn't return until 7 it was worth it all. And Air took many photos for us and even sweetly gave us an elephant gift. Thanks BKK!!!!

Outstanding. If you want an excellent tour of Bangkok BKK is the company to contact. From our initial enquiry all our queries were promptly and professionally answered making us feel total confident in their commitment to service.The company is run by a married company, Michael and Air, who make a great team. We explained to Michael our interests, likes and dislikes of tours and he put together a bespoke tour designed especially to our needs.We requested Air as our guide and indeed she was a breath of “fresh air”. We saw all the sights we wanted to visit, along with a few “hidden gems”, and were delighted with the treats of local delicacies to try. The Thai lunches were wonderful. Our high expectations were more than exceeded!Nothing was too much trouble for Air. We could change the itinerary as we progressed, move along or slow down as we wished. It was geared totally around our needs.On another note the mini van was state of the art with reclining seats, foot rests, TV, plenty of bottled water and chilled damp towels. Amazing!I think Bangkok would have overwhelmed us if we had tried to do it on our own but with the guidance of BKK, their knowledge and experience we had a wonderful time and were left with fantastic memories. We highly recommend them to anyone.

Shore Excursion with BKK Tours. From the initial inquiry to the last moments of our tour, BKK Tours was fantastic. I booked an overnight shore excursion in Bangkok for one person and found people to join me through Cruise Critic. Michiel was prompt and courteous through our many email exchanges as the tour grew to a comfortable nine people and questions arose. (Two more groups from our visiting ship also booked, so well reviewed is BKK Tours.) Upon arrival BKK Tours was ready and waiting at the cruise terminal as planned.Our guide, Ms Air is a personable and charming hostess. She is knowledgeable and enthusiastic about her country and customs, very organized, and has perfect command of the English language. The food on day one was very nice. Bangkok was extremely hot to us westerners, and our lunch was in a nicely air conditioned space - not much to look at. But that didn't really matter. And Michiel took the time to stop by the restaurant to say introduce himself and say hello - nice touch. BKK Tours organized our dinner cruise with Loy Nova for that evening - a great experience as well. Lunch on day two was outstanding, delicious food by the river with a nice breeze.Our driver was very nice - always smiling. Always accommodating. Bottled water, cold towels - nice, personable touches at every turn.I can't say enough about how wonderful our visit was because of BKK Tours. I would use them again in a heartbeat. Thank you Michiel & Air for making our visit to Bangkok so memorable.Best - Brian in NYC

Brilliant introduction to Bangkok and around. We spent some time emailing BKK Tours in advance planning our 3 day stay in Bangkok (with much help and advice from them). In Bangkok our fantastic, diminutive but energetic guide OI was amazing. We were able to experience so many facets of Bangkok life, food, transport, places of interest. Chinatown, the Railway Market, Bridge on the River Kwai etc. She made the trip so interesting, lively and such fun. The overall performance from planning to execution was excellent. Thank you BKK Tours.

Outstanding!. We spent two days with our tour guide, Oi, and her driver, Mr. A. We were not disappointed! Oi is an absolute delight and extremely knowledgable about Thailand. She clearly enjoys her work (even though it requires very long days)! We took two tours over two days: 1) the Bangkok Highlights day-long tour; and 2), on the second day, the trip out to Ayutthaya. My husband picked the Ayutthaya and it was fabulous. Far fewer tourists there than at other temple ruins (like Ankor Wat). Both days were remarkable and the office manager, Michiel, was great to work with. We had a sense of confidence from the very beginning, and it was well placed. Know that if you book with BKK Tours, your van will be clean with very strong air conditioning and in great working order. Your tour guide will take remarkable care of you, in addition to imparting a lot of local knowledge. And your driver will be superb. Thank you to BKK Tours for giving us a trip to remember in Bangkok!

Best tour guide. Prompt and great email communication prior to holiday. There were three couples in our group and we had the best time. We fell in love with bangkok due to the thorough guide we had in our short stay. Air was the most gracious and informative guide we have ever had. We visited the train market, floating market and river Kwai in one day. The next day we spent with Air again doing the city highlight, flower market tour and a stroll through Chinatown markets. We tried delicious food we would never had attempted if it wasn't for Air introducing us to them. We learned alot about their beliefs and cultures. Thank you michiel for your prompt and informative emails. I new at this point we were going to have a fantastic time in bangkok and we were not disappointed. Air you surpassed our expectations with your knowledge and friendliness. Thank you for our amazing stay in bangkok. It is the highlight of all our holidays

Great Experiance. Based on other reviews we contacted and booked BKK for several day trips in Bangkok. All inquires were responded promptly with great recommendations on what to do on each day. Due to flight delays, we ended up with only one day in Bangkok and needed to change our plans. Michiel was great in recommending how best to arrange the one day we had in Bangkok. Ms. Pary was our guide - she is excellent !!! We mentioned to Michiel that we love experiencing culture through food and wanted to try street food. Ms Pary knew the hidden gems and the resturant we had lunch was excellent (sorry do not remember the name). She placed the lunch order and all was fantastic. The cost for our day tour was all inclusive - entrance fees, food and public transportation.We highly recommend BKK Tours.

Superb two day tour. One of the best tours we have ever taken. Our guide, Oi, was knowledgeable, and extremely attentive. She anticipated our needs and was a perfect hostess. We spent the first day in the Golden Buddha complex and flower market, and the second in the floating market and railroad market. Oi made sure we saw everything and had us taste coconut pancakes, fresh mango and sticky rice, and on the first day she treated us to a great lunch. There was nothing in the two days that was anything less than perfect.

Absolutely the Best!. We contacted Michiel in August re: private tours from our cruise ship while docked in Bangkok. We receive an immediate response with suggested itineraries. We were somewhat apprehensive about independent travel from the ship, but with Michiel's assurances, we booked a full day and half day tours. Prior to our departure, we became concerned about the protests in the city, but because the lines of communication were always open, we knew all would be fine. We were told we would be working with Ms. Oi and were thrilled, having read her reviews on Trip Advisor. She exceeded every expectation. Oi is an energetic and enthusiastic guide who immediately establishes a rapport that makes you feel as though a long time friend is showing you her city. We signed on for the full day Highlights and half day Markets, but Oi made sure she showed us so much more. We engaged in good luck rituals at Wat Ho, enjoyed a sampling of Thai food for lunch at The Navy Department, as well as at the markets, and throughout our time together, an immersion of Thai culture. We hated to say goodbye!

Five glorious days in Bangkok with BKK. Wonderful experience in Bangkok with BKK. Every need was anticipated and taken care of. Our guide made sure our five days were exciting and informative. We got to see not just the highlights of the city and surrounding area but the off the beaten track sites giving us a feel for the Thai culture. We also got to experience all the wonderful Thai dishes which our guide chose for us. We couldn't have been more satisfied with the competent and caring service, all done in a gracious manner. Our trip was unforgettable and we highly recommend the company.

Memorable Last Day in Thailand. When beginning my day tour research, I sent emails to 4-5 tour agencies from TripAdvisor. The email correspondence with BKK Tours was simply amazing. Pricing was comparable to other agencies, but the responsiveness was above and beyond. Before our travels, we were concerned about the protests in Bangkok. I send an email to BKK and they wrote me a very long email detailing out exactly what was happening in the city. After much thought, we decided to still continue with visiting Bangkok.The day was spent at the train market, the floating market and at a few major temples in the city. The train market was timed perfectly as we saw the train go through. One of the highlights of our time in Thailand. If you want an amazing and memorable day in Bangkok - BKK Tours is where to book!

above and beyond expectations. My wife and I had a full day tour with Michai, enjoying the highlights of Bangkok. With limited time in the city we wanted to experience as much as we could and Michai did that and more. Our trip was using local transport and by foot, so this may not be the way to go for older travellers or those with mobility issues. The tour was long, pick up from hotel promptly at 8 a.m. and drop off where desired at 4 p.m. There is a set itinerary but the personal aspect of the tour allows for flexibility where interests demand. For example, Michai did what no other tour guide was able to during our trip which was sourcing a license plate from Thailand as our son collects these from our family and individual trips. Without interruption in our schedule, Michai thoughtfully arranged a minor diversion to the "gadget" market and there indeed was a stall serving our needs! Bravo, Michai! He struck the right balance, giving us as much information as we could have absorbed and allowing some private time also. I think he gauged our level of activity and interest just right. No, its not inexpensive, but considering it is private, all other costs including transportation and lunch etc are included, the benefits easily make it worthwhile.

BKK are the best, look no further. Wow. I read all the reviews about BKK Tours on TripAdvisor and booked three tours with them! They were so responsive and helpful with all of my questions. We ended up taking the Bangkok Highlights tour, the Floating Market tour and the day trip to Ayutthaya. We had Air for our first tour, the highlights tour. It was ah-mazing. Just like everyone writes, she felt like a sister to us after the day was over. We didn't want it to end! She was funny and extremely knowledgable and patient. She gave tips on good places to stand for photos, stuff to eat from the street carts. She interacted with the locals so that they would interact with us. We got to experience every type of means of transport available on this tour: tuk tuks, Skytrain, subway, longtail, walking. I felt like we went to places only the locals would know, we never saw any other touring companies. We were having so much fun she took us to Chinatown which I don't think was a part of the tour! Apparantly Air used to do a bike tour thru Chinatown so she knew back alleys and i felt like we got to see what not any other touring companies would show, and we LOVED it. We told her we hoped 2014 would bring us boyfriends so she made a point to take us to Temples and to Buddhas we could pray to for that. I wish the day never ended. How amazing that one person can touch you so much and give the gift of memories that will last forever. Next time we go to Bangkok we will try to say hi to Air again! Our next two tours were with Oi. The floating market one day and then Ayutthaya the next. Oi is the nicest, sweetest person. She is very knowledgable also and one thing I loved about her the most is she genuinely cared about our well-being, always making sure we were ok, not getting hit by trains, getting us to the front so we can see the ceremonies the best. The floating market tour was the BEST. We went to Tha Kha. It was so beautiful and serene, she bought us food from the merchants. At the railway market she knew all the exotic foods we were looking at. I highly recommend the Floating Market tour if you are going to go to Tha Kha (market is based on lunar cycle). The next day in Ayutthaya, the buildings did all of the "talking", so it was a leisurely day. I wanted to get blessed by a monk so we went to a temple and did. It was a special day! She helped translate so I knew what he was saying. As a bonus at the end we got to feed some elephants. Before we did, she made a point to tell us that BKK was not a fan of supporting riding elephants or having them do circus tricks, and i was not either, so we simply went to see these beautiful majestic beasts up close and feed them. Peter our driver, gets five stars. Always smiling, offering us water, very friendly. I felt like we were all family after it all was said and done and I was so sad when we said goodbye. I would highly highly recommend you use BKK. They aren't like other tours-doubtful I will ever find a touring company as awesome as them. I wish they had BKK Tours in every city.

Great Service and Itinerary. We stopped in Bangkok overnight as part of the Holland America cruise itinerary. Because of physical limitations, we always hire individual tours that allows us to choose our pace and the places to be visited. Michail, owner of BKK Tours, was happy to meet all of our requests. His prompt and literate replies to our emails provided a sense of security and professionalism. Our tour included the Grand Palace, the reclining and jade Buddha, the flower market and lunch at a local restaurant. Gift, our guide, was knowledgeable, professional and delightful. Not only did she provide informative information about the sights we visited, she freely shared insights about the political situation and of life in Thailand. This private tour cost about USD40 more than the cruise shore excursion, which was shared with 30 carefully chosen friends. Worth many time more than that! Highly, highly recommended.

Highly Recommend. We did back to back tours with BKK and had Air as our guide both days. She was wonderful and was way beyond guides we had with other tours in Thailand. We did the floating market and train tour in which she walked us through the market pointing out and buying food for us to try. She introduced us to so many yummy things we never would have tried otherwise. The second day she took us to Erawan and Elephant World which were both unforgettable experiences. She was very knowledgable about Thailand history and taught us a lot about the culture. She took care of everything so that all we had to do was enjoy the trip. The van was extremely comfortable with a tv screen for movies on our long trip to Erawan. I can't say enough good things about BKK.

Great Bangkok Day Tour. We booked BKK Tours: Bangkok Highlights (Full day tour) and were very happy with their service. We contacted a few tour companies to enquire about tours in Bangkok and only BKK were prompt to reply to our initial email enquiry with costs and different itinerary options. They were happy to modify our tour as my wife had some back problems which meant she couldn't do the canal boat tour. Ms Lift showed up at our hotel on time and was an excellent tour guide, providing a very informative and entertaining commentary on all the sites visited. The restaurant we had lunch in had a great view of the river and the food was fantastic. The van provided was clean and comfortable, and the driver friendly. We highly recommend this service and would definitely use them again.

Air is a great guide!. We actually found Air through Tours by Locals, but she owns BKK Tours. She took 3 of us on a 2-day tour of Bangkok from our ship which docked in Leam Chebang. Air and Ess, the driver, were wonderful! Air is a great guide & let us set our own pace as 2 of us have limited mobility. She was very kind, informative, and helpful. The van we were in was beautiful and well maintained. This tour really helped us see and understand a lot in Bangkok. I highly recommend Air as a tour guide.

Best and most professional travel agency in Thailand!. I work for a luxury agency based in Paris and I use BKK Tours for all my clients who go to Thailand.Honestly, they are the best in Bangkok. They offer very personalized private tour with multilingual guides. Everything is perfectly set up in the easiest and most professional way. All my clients were always so happy about the company and trust me I work with very special and VIP clients!!What I like the most in this company is that they will always suggest the best for their client. They will let you in on the best-kept secrets and the very best addresses and things to do, avoiding very touristic tours. I have been many times in Thailand and know quite well Bangkok and every tours they did with my clients was exactly what I would like to do. That's why I would definitely recommend this company and would never use the service of another company for my clients and even for me.Michiel and Air are perfect and so friendly, thanks to them! Talk to you soon guys! ^^

Very personal and unique tour. We just finished a half day tour with BKK to a floating market and market train in Bangkok and had a great time. Air was our guide and gave us some unique experiences that we could not have found on our own. She obviously loves what she does and it translates into an excellent tour. I would recommend this company for any private tour if you want something a little different.

BKK's agent, Michai, deftly kept us highly mobile during current civil unrest. No effect on our site visits as a result.. If you're going to Bangkok, if you're trying to figure out your transportation on how to get to sites from your hotel, you're going to have a challenge in the best of times; however, particularly at this time with the unrest continuing and a 60 day state of emergency declared today, as I recall, you really don't have a chance navigating around protests areas in many parts of the city, including the high dollar hotel areas around Ratchprasong, unless you can navigate trains and river transportation like a native. And, that is precisely why you really are strongly advised to hire a private guide--a native!--to help you navigate this amazing city. We debated in December whether we should go to Bangkok in light of the upheaval, but, Air and Michiel, the owners of BKK Tours, hired for us a young Thai man, Michai Bnchai yo, who speaks English as if it were his mother tongue. And, our tour was set for using public transportation so Michai deftly guided us around the trouble spots after picking us up at our hotel in the Ratchprasong area, with his choosing the trains, metro, and river transportation that would avoid the protests. That would not have been possible if we'd been in a tour with a guide and car driver. Since we were traveling paths new to us, the diversions Michai took us on were actually a reward as we saw more things along the routes than we'd have otherwise had the chance. I will add that our hotel was in the Ratchprasong area where there was a major concentration of protestors. We bought a 1/2 day tour and a full day tour, starting at 1PM our first day when we did- Wat Pho (reclining Buddha)- Flower market- Canal tourOur full day tour started at 9:00am and we did:- Chinatown- Lunch- Grand Palace with Wat Phra Kaeo (emerald Buddha).During the full day tour, I had an accident and fell in a boat. In 15 minutes, thanks to Michai, I was delivered by a "tuk-tuk" to the emergency room at a hospital for 10 stitches; and, within an hour, was back out of the hospital and on our way again. Air and Michiel came to the hospital as well to see how I was doing. They are great people. My wife and I have "adopted" Michai (pronounced "meesha").

Superb! Fantastic! BKK is the Best Tour Company. My husband and I visited Bangkok this past December. Air, our tour guide met us at the cruise ship and we were lucky enough to spend almost 3 days with her. Cities are a combination of the sights and the people you meet. We were blessed to have Air as our guide. Besides the fact that she is totally organized and really knows her subject - she is so genuinely easy to be with. Her English is impeccable - including American slang - Personally, it's all well and good to know your subject- but what is even better is when the tour guide loves her subject as well... the tour becomes really special for the clients.Some must do's ..........Do not miss the floating market and Air's special stop for soup. Do not miss the Railway Market. Do not miss the long boats. Do not miss the Prasart Museum.And thank you-- Air for helping me to purchase a Spirit House. It was hard saying goodbye - it was like spending 3 days with a friend.

Wonderful tour with Ms Oi. We are seniors and had two full days to tour Bangkok. Thankfully we picked a great tour company and Oi was a delightful young lady. She was there in our hotel waiting for us both days. The first day we did the highlights of Bangkok. We used different modes of travel from tuck tuck, taxi, long boat and subway. It was necessary to think fast as the protests had some areas blocked off. At no time did we not feel safe. We are picky eaters but both days Oi took us to restaurants overlooking the water. The food was good and she helped us navigate the Thai menus. My husband doesn't eat vegetables and I can't do spicy or fish. Yes we are an odd lot. The high light was the long boat ride when we stopped at a temple and she gave us 2 bags of buns. This was to feed the cat fish. We could touch them. That day we were dropped off right at our hotel arriving by subway and walking a couple of blocks around the protesters. The next day we went to Anyar Wha by a wonderful van. It was a very posh van and the driver was very good getting us everywhere and picking us up. We enjoyed this more historic tour and again had a wonderful long boat ride. I would not hesitate to book with BKK Tours and MS Oi is a very knowledgeable guide. We were fortunate to have her as our guide. Thank you BKK Tours and Ms Oi for a wonderful if short trip to Bangkok.

AMAZING! Thank you Miss Pary!. This tour made my trip to Bangkok unforgettable. I was traveling alone and was worried about pretty much everything, but communication was a breeze and Miss Pary was right on time, super sweet and spoke perfect english. I was so lucky to have such an incredible guide through Bangkok. You take different modes of public transportation which was a really cool way to see the city - and you also take a long tail boat through the canals on the full day tour which was incredible. All of the temples are beautiful, and lunch was at a DELICIOUS spot - so far still one of the best meals that I've had in Thailand. I requested to see a monk for a blessing, and Pary went out of the way to take me somewhere where this could happen. I would not hesitate to suggest this tour to anyone - you get a tremendous value, and if you're lucky enough to get Pary, an incredible experience.

FANTASTIC COMBO TOUR FOR OUR FAMILY. We have recently visited Thailand with our children and elderly parents. Since we were only there for 2 days, on our way to Australia, we wanted to book a customized tour of the city that would suit our three generations. BKK tours proved to be a perfect choice for us. We couldn't make up our mind between the standard tour of the city (temples) and tour of the markets (floating market, Railway market) out of the city. Michiel offered a combination of the two which was a real bingo! We were picked up in the morning by our guide Ms Gift and a driver. We had a very pleasant ride on a luxury mini-van to the markets some 70 km south of Bangkok. Markets we very exciting - we have never experienced anything like that before. Our son even had a photo taken with a phyton, something to remember for life! Afterwards we returned to Bangkok and had a fantastic lunch by ChaoPraya river. Great choice of food, we loved it all. Our guide, Ms GIft was very informative and helpful throughout the tour. She is very knowledgable and nice person to spend a day with. We visited two temples and a palace and had a tuk-tuk ride in between which thrilled our son. All in all, we had a fantastic day and have definitely decided to come back to Thailand and also try another BKK tour. Keep up the good work, looking forward to see you again!

Great for families, fantastic service and staff. We are a family of 4, kids aged 10 and 12, we travelled in sep/oct last year and found the company via trip advisor. All the reviews were spot on, the company communicated directly and quickly, as our dates weren't set in stone they booked us tentatively and were able to accommodate us even though we changed dates. We did two days with them. Day 1, was the Burma railway and river Kwai, al amazing and the guide (air) very knowledgable. They loked after our every need, toilet breaks and food all very important when travelling ith kids!!! Day 2 we the traditional floating markets, the tourist floating markets, the railway markets and temples. Both days included great lunches in great locations. We all learnt so much about Thai history and politics. Our request as to content for each day were easily accommodated, I'd encourage anyone to book with this great company. I know thy also do tours for people on cruise trips too. We wouldn't hesitate to use them again

Amazing Experience. My wife and I were planning out trip to Thailand for a while, and we knew that we wanted to book a tour for Bangkok where we were able to see everything on our list in an efficient and fun time.We went to Tripadvisor and looked for a company that would offer the tours we were looking for. Luckily we found BKK Tours and they had amazing reviews. Right away we sent them an email and they promptly answer us giving us some options. We told them what we were looking for and they basically made a full day tour where we could see everything we wanted!Our guide was Ms Oi! A super nice lady, friendly and knew everything about some cool spots, food, entertainment and the attractions. She made the experience even better!We did in one day the Train market, the floating market, we stopped for lunch at a really cool spot close to the river (and the food was to die for) and then some temples. Our day was set! We were happy and totally satisfied when we got back to our hotel.Besides that, the tour was super private, only my wife, me , Ms. Oi and our driver .. on a super comfortable van. We totally recommend their services!

First class tour of Thailand. Long story, short: If you're going to Thailand and want to book a private tour, book with BKK Tours.Here's the long story. I booked with a party of 7 for a day tour of Bangkok. We were traveling on a Holland America cruise with a day stopover so we wanted to hit the highlights. Even though four of us had already been to Bangkok, the other 3 hadn't, so it was one of those "we'll probably see the same things like last time" type of trips. I'll hand it to BKK Tours though, with our superb tour guide, Ms. Pary, we saw Bangkok in a whole new way and experienced an entirely different city even while seeing some of the same sites. She was knowledgeable, friendly, went out of her way to make sure we were comfortable and entertained. The van we had for the day was well appointed and the driver was a professional at all times - he was able to easily navigate and was always able to pick us up promptly at all destinations. We did a tour of some of the highlights, stopping through a massive flower market and worked our way to the vegetable market. Ms. Pary even stopped and bought local fruit that a member of our party was asking about so we could try it at lunch. We went on to see the temple of the reclining Buddha (Wat Po), took a tuk tuk ride to lunch, ate by the river, went to the Grand Palace and rode through the canals among other activities. The way our activities were spaced out was great, it was a mix of active, cultural, and relaxed - a pace that was comfortable for our group which ranged from 75 to 25 years old. I think what really makes BKK stand out are the little touches. Michiel was extremely prompt in his emails and put us at ease quickly with the information about the tour, etc. We also always had bottles of water, cold towels at just the right time provided throughout the day. Ms. Pary went out of her way to be interactive in her role as a tour guide. It was refreshing to feel her genuine warmth and desire to share various aspects of Thai culture. One example would be when we were in the Grand Palace, she not only pointed out that the gold leaf decorations on the walls were hand applied, when we came across some workers doing that very work, she asked to borrow some to show us how it looked and how they applied it. Little nuggets like that made the tour that much more personal. My husband and I are a "travel on our own" type of people, but if I had tour guides like Ms. Pary and tour companies like BKK running tours, I'd definitely choose the latter route purely for what we got out of it.

Most Impressive. My husband and I booked with 3 different tour companies over our 12 day stay in Bangkok. Without a doubt, BKK tours stood out from the other two companies. From our quick replies from Michiel at the beginning, our luxury clean mini van with the driver always making sure we are comfortable with the offer of cold water and a cool towel, after each time we arrived back to the van. Ms Oi was our guide for 3 tours , Chinatown, Bangkok Highlights and visiting Ayutthaya. She was very well organised, punctional, very knowledgable, and her english was remarkable. She is a credit to your company. All the little things are included in these tours, like snacks from the street stalls, tipping, lunch ( all day tours ) bottles of water, it just made our tour so relaxing as we didnt have to worry about a thing. I would highly recommend BKK Tours . A visit to Bangkok isn't complete without a tour from BKK, you will not regret it.. Thank you Ms Oi for a remarkable 3 days..

Great experience!. My sister and I booked 2 tours with BKK tours, miss Oi took us out both days. She had fantastic knowledge of Bangkok and everything she showed us. She was great in Chinatown and took us or a family owned coffee shop for a midday break which was much appreciated. We would definitely book with BKK tours again in the future!

Another brilliant trip with BKK Tours. We have used BKK tours several times. This time three of us decided on the Ayutthaya trip. Ayutthaya is about 90 minutes outside of Bangkok and is an UNESCO world heritage site. Two of us the group like taking photographs so we had agreed a later start so that we could take photographs at sunset. Our guides for the day were Air and Michiel the company owners. Air and Michiel are a good team and compliment each other. Michiel is a photographer and is always willing to give tips and support to ensure that guests are able to capture the best photographs. Air's knowledge about Thai history, history culture and venues visited is endless. They are always willing to customise tours to suit customers.Anyway we were collected from out hotel and transported to Ayutthaya in air conditioned transport. We saw many temples and enjoyed a boat trip before going into the historical park and ruins. Once in the park we saw the Buddha head in a tree and a huge reclining buddha and of course were able to take photos of the ruins at sunset. Each time to you back to the transport there is a cold towel and drinking water waiting for you. There was a sound and light festival in Ayutthaya at the time and the company contacted us to see if we were interested in attending. If you do this trip in December then its worth getting a ticket as its really interesting to see the show and the ruins lit up.Whenever, you do a trip with BKK tours its always a very enjoyable and relaxed day and you always learn things about Thailand and in my case pick up tips about photography. Lunch and drinks are included in the trip price Whenever I want to do a trip in Bangkok, BKK tours is always the first choice.

Wonderful!. Booked a two and half day tour with BKK Tours from 19th to 21st December 2013 for my family which consists of 4 adults and 2 children aged 7 and 3. We visited the the Grand Palace, Reclining Buddha, Emerald Buddha, Ayutthaya, train market, local floating market, river cruise, visited coconut sugar farm and tasted local food. Sounds alot things were done and seen, but the tour was well planned, very relaxing and simply wonderful, my family and I really enjoyed the tour, we have seen things that we could not possibly seen if we were to travel on our own. Our tour guide, Ms. Oi is a very nice lady, speaks good English, knowledgable, organized and great with kids too. It feels more like travelling with a family friend rather than a tour guide. The kids have wonderful time and never feel bored at all with the historical buildings. The van that we travelled in was very comfortable, ice cool water and towels were provided making our whole trip even more comfortable. The driver, Mr. Peter is a nice guy that always greet us with a smile.Communicating with BKK Tours via email is an ease, payment can be made online, I highly recommended BKK Tours for any family that needs a tour around Bangkok. Thumbs up!

Great service recovery. We booked a Train Market and Floating Market tour with BKK Tours. We specifically asked to go to the less touristy floating market, which was only open on certain days of the month. Meeting time was 645 am (a really early start for young children!). So we were quite taken aback when the guide told us the driver would be half an hour late, as he had been told the wrong time by the company! It definitely wasn't a great start to our tour, but thankfully the van arrived 20 minutes later. So due to the late start, the tour itinerary was changed and we went straight to the train market instead of to the floating market. Lift, our guide, was warm and friendly and spoke excellent English. She held my little girl's hand when we visited the train market, pointing out interesting things to see. She even stopped at a corner and bought us the most delicious coconut cakes (warm, sweet and fragrant, a must-try and very very cheap!).
