The driver then drove us to another train station so that we could take the train and stand at the back to watch the market stalls unfolding their shades as the train passed through. It was really an interesting and eye-opening experience for the kids!The highlight of the tour was the visit to the brown sugar farm - we took a long tail boat (paddled by a very fit old man!) to see how coconut sugar was made from the nectar of coconut flowers. The kids even climbed up the tree to have a closer look at the flowers. They loved the coconut candy!Throughout, Lift was most obliging and kept plying us with food, snacks and drinks. I later found out that some of the extra food was meant for compensation for the late start to the tour - a kind gesture on their part! The van was comfortable and had a DVD player that kept my kids well-entertained in the Bangkok traffic congestion. Communication via email with the company was hassle-free and payment was easily done online.I had tried writing to Tours with Tong earlier, since they were rated no 1 on Tripadvisor, but no one got back to me. Sure Tours with Tong advised calling instead, but I didn't fancy paying international calling rates just to talk to them. So I decided to go with BKK tours instead, and am very glad it turned out so well. I would definitely recommend them without reservation!

Fabulous Company.. Booked Three trips,Bangkok Highlights,Erawan Waterfall and Authentic Ayutthaya on each trip Air was just awesome, she made each trip enjoyable,unforgettable and totally personal.I cannot recommend this company enough.Every E-mail I sent beforehand was answered promptly and every question answered.If you are looking for a tour company to show you around Bangkok then trust me look no further.Thanks Air you were Brilliant.

Bangkok by BKK - 1 day tour. BKK are so well organised. During internet search BKK provided quick informative replies which gave me confidence.From LAEM CHABANG (port), a 2 hour drive to BANGKOK. BKK provided a luxurious 'people mover' for the 4 of us as well as guide & great driver. Miss Oi was a great guide & no doubt now has many friends worldwide. Bangkok is a marvel, a collision of culture, change & chaos. Really loved the temples & Palace.BKK are very very good, you can't go wrong.

Julie Matthews. Booked a full days tour visiting railway market, floating market, reclining Buddha and emerald Buddha. From the initial organising of the trip to the actual trip it's self the whole experience was flaunt less.Ms Oi was exceptional and we learnt so much throughout the day, not just about the history and culture but also things that only someone with local knowledge could impart.This was without doubt the highlight of trip to Bangkok...Thank You!

Wish we booked earlier. They were booked solid for the bridge over river Kwai private tour, yet they still tried to help us book a tour with one of their freelance guides. We wished we booked sooner. The TA reviews & their prompt & extra mile service tell me we would gave had a fabulous time on their tour. Thanks Michiel!

Outstanding personal service. We booked the one day 'Highlights of Bangkok' tour and were guided by Ms Oi. She was a charming and knowledgeable guide. She arrived promptly at our hotel to pick us up and we had her to ourselves for the whole day. It was very much like being out for the day with a friend.She couldn't have been more helpful and attentive. Everything was included....lunch, refreshments, water, cold flannels, all entry fees and fares. Altogether a most enjoyable experience. and the cost was very reasonable.

Bangkok with Air Oct 31 to Nov 4, 2013. We recently completed 3 1/2 days of tours with Air from BKK tours. But our experience with BKK goes back months earlier with our frequent emails to Michiel, asking questions, getting clarifications, suggestions and making alterations to existing tours to best meet our needs. Michiel was prompt in his responses and no question went unanswered. We arrived after midnight with a tour of Ayuthaya scheduled for the next day. Air suggested leaving later in the AM and include a sunset visit to the reclining Bhudda in Ayuthaya. The fan was well equipped with the driver having cold towels for our face and necks upon each return to the van. In addition to the long tail boat ride, visit with the monks and a delicious river side restaurant lunch, it was a perfect start to our 5 days in Bangkok!Subsequent tours included Bangkok Highlights--an all day tour of the best of Bangkok temples and palace; China Town--unlike any other Chinatown tour, unclose and personal with many locals; and Authentic Markets (Tha Kha floating market--much smaller, not as touristy and far more personal, Damnoen Saduak floating market--very touristy but still fascinating) and then the afternoon Meet the Locals tour with Air.Air is so personable, intelligent, knowledgeable and has a great connection to so many in Bangkok. Her English is excellent, her humor welcome and personality warm. We loved our time with her and also meeting her husband, Michiel.We travel a good deal. BKK tours offers the flexibility, thoroughness and detail, and personal attention that makes a visit to a new and amazing culture comfortable.

Wonderful hospitality. We spent a day with Air on the Highlights of Bangkok tour. My husband had injured his leg just before out visit, so we explained to her that we would need to take it slow and probably not get to see everything. She was wonderful! She took him under her wing, adjusted the tour and our transportation so that he could manage to see almost everything. At a couple of sites, she brought him to a comfortable vantage point in the shade where he could sit and people-watch while she and I explored a bit further. By the end of they day, they had laughingly "adopted" each other as father-daughter. She was delightful, the tour was wonderful, and she kept us well hydrated and fed. Highly recommend her.

Very thoughtful. Prompt, very thoughtful and charming. Our guide Oi was very helpful and accomodating. loved her introduction to local favorites and her checking in with our comfortableness with the heat. The driver and van were very clean and professional when we went out of town. I personally would have enjoyed a bit more history of Bangkok or Thailand, but then again we were a bit jet lagged.

BKK Tours - OUTSTANDING Tour of Bangkok / Ayutthaya!!!!. We were a group of 3 first time visitors to Bangkok and found BKK Tours via TripAdvisor. We had a terrific experience with our guide Air and her husband Michiel!!Michiel handled most of the online communication. He was quick to respond to all of our questions and provided thorough, comprehensive information.We spent 2 consecutive days with Air. We are all native English speakers and were very pleased with Air’s excellent command of the language. Day One was a tour of Bangkok’s Wats, Chinatown and Markets and the following day we explored Ayutthaya.Air was a perfect tour guide. In addition to having an encyclopedic knowledge of the places we visited, she showed us “off the beaten track” places that we would NEVER have seen on our own, and that we probably would not have seen with another, larger tour group. Air seemed to know a lot of the people we met during our two days on a personal level. She was very well received by people in the neighborhoods, Wat security people and even by some of the monks. This “up close and personal” orientation really helped to make our trip extra special!We asked to start our days early, and Air was happy to comply. On Day One, we were introduced to the inhabitants of some of Chinatown’s neighborhoods, walked through the Flower Market, and tasted some awesome Thai coffee – all before 9:00AM!! We then explored the Wats – although we were there on a Saturday, Air managed to time our visits to the various Wats to pretty much avoid a lot of tourist traffic. In addition, she was able to provide us with some great photo opportunities (something that the photographer in our group really appreciated)!On Day Two we took a Long Boat to Ayutthaya. Prior to this, though, we went to a beautiful Wat where we were the only non-monks on campus! One of the most memorable parts of our trip was receiving a blessing from the head monk of this Wat. Again, Air seemed to know this man personally, which made this leg of our trip even more memorable.The trip to Ayutthaya was fabulous – the river scenery was just amazing! Once again, when we arrived at Ayutthaya, we were able to visit the Wats without the bother of a lot of tourist crowds – thank you Air, for working wonders with our schedule!Lunches both days were out of this world! We were expecting a bag lunch or maybe a buffet at some tourist restaurant, but Air brought us to two restaurants that were mostly patronized by locals, and the food was fantastic!!We will definitely be visiting Bangkok again, and our first email will be to BKK Tours. We know Air and Michiel will help us to craft a tour schedule to give us yet another perspective on this beautiful, complex, diverse and welcoming city.We would highly recommend BKK Tours to anyone wanting to get to know Bangkok and the environs!

Fantastic! !. My partner and I took the one day Bangkok tour. Our guide was Nadia, she couldn't do enough for us especially since I wasn't feeling well...a real asset to the company!! Cold drinks,cold ewipes at every stop and a lovely lunch all included. Very interesting tour, Nadia was very informative and I would definitely recommend BKK tours :)

Best tour company ever. we were picked up as a party of eight from the Voyager of the Seas at the port for our day trip to Bangkok By Chao and driver Dan in an amazing mini bus , luxurious interior and great comfort. we had a great day out, at every stop we had cold wipes and cold drinks, Chao spoke very good English and gave us lots of information , we stopped for lunch at a riverside restaurant with excellent food which was included in the price. on the way there and back Chao told us about Thailand and kept us amused with local stories and an attempt to teach us the language. we can thoroughly recommend BKK Tours . Thanks Michiel and Air

Great Tour in Bangkok. I only had one full day to spend in Bangkok and I wanted to see all of the major sights. Booking with BKK was easy and they responded to my inquiries quickly. Ms. Air was fantastic. She picked me up from the hotel on time and asked the driver to take a detour when I mentioned that I wanted to drive through a specific area. The driver was friendly, on time, and kept the bus clean. He always offered hand wipes and water as soon as I got back to the van.We saw the railway market, floating markets, Grand Palace and Wat Pho. Air was so friendly and made me feel very comfortable. She suggested which foods to eat and even bought food that she wanted me to try. She had good relationships with the locals and I really enjoyed the day with her. The Thai lunch was great too - she offered suggestions and we ended up getting a few dishes to share.After my day with Ms. Air, I felt like I had seen and learned a lot about Bangkok. I would defintely recommend BKK Tours and would highly consider booking another tour with them should I be in Bangkok again.

F A B U L O U S. BKK are great, this is our second lot of tours with them and we had requested Miss Oi again. Not only are Air and Michel great to deal with when booking, but Miss Oi is so attentive and fun to have as tour guide. They go out of their way to make your day, they have wonderful drivers who make sure that every time you get back on the bus you have an ice cold water and face towel waiting for you. Every detail of your day is taken care of. The places you are taken for lunch are always really fantastic and unusual. Will definitely use them for a third time when we go again.

Look nowhere else for the best experience you can have in Bangkok. My wife and spent 4 days in Bangkok, a city that is as sprawling and mesmerizing as it is beautiful. Unlike other Asian cities like, say, Hong Kong where English is very widely spoken and you can get around pretty much on your own, Bangkok is simply too complex, too diverse and too exotic for anyone but the most intrepid travelers to navigate on their own. We never take pre-packaged group tours, so we looked into hiring a private local tour guide. There are many to choose from but after much research, fortunately we selected BKK Tours. We couldn’t have made a better choice.Michiel and Air, owners of BKK Tours, are not only top-notch guides, they are also consummate professionals. From start to finish, BKK made everything easy. They return emails and answer questions promptly and effectively. We spent three of our four days with BKK, having chosen the tours we desired from among many options. Even when our flight from Chicago to Bangkok had some unforeseeable delays causing us to arrive a day later than planned, BKK was able to accommodate the schedule change without a problem.Our selections were the Bangkok Highlights Luxury, Authentic Markets of Thailand and Authentic Ayutthaya. These are three must-see components of any trip to Bangkok. It’s not just the sights and sounds and aromas that made each day so special, it was the way we were cared for along the way. Excellent luxury touring vans, special amenities, first-class food and deep insights into the history, culture and people of Thailand. I should also point out that no two trips are alike and BKK Tours was extremely accommodating to customizing our packages based on special interests or needs we had.Lastly, I am an avid photography enthusiast. One option BKK offers is to have Michiel join you as a photography guide, which we opted for. Michiel is not only a top-tier photographer in his own right, but he was also able to give me some tips, teach me some tricks and take me to some hidden places to help make my images really stand out from the run-of-the mill vacation snapshots. I’ve included a few in this review. I can’t overstate how much we enjoyed our stay in Bangkok, and how fortunate we feel to have selected BKK Tours as our guide.

Best tour company I have ever experienced.. BKK impressed me initially with their responsiveness to my enquiries about tours they had to offer. We made arrangements for a group of 8 to be picked up for a one day tour from the cruise port. Our tour guide Chao and driver Dan provided excellent service from 8am in the morning until they returned us to the port at 7pm. The transport was the most luxurious van I've ever seen and very comfortable. Our guide was helpful, informative, open to accommodate our requests whenever he possibly could and lots of fun. The tour included everything - lunch, cold drinks throughout, cold towels when we returned to the van from the heat. Chao even purchased bread for us to feed the catfish in the river. I could not fault anything about the service we received from BKK.

A real five star private tour. I took two tours with them. Nadia was our guide and in one tour Air was assisting her as well. Air, the owner of BKK tour is simply amazing. 5/5. However Nadia deserves a very special mention. She was just awesome amazing out of the world tour guide. She is very knowledgeable, very communicative and adjusts well with the mood of audience. On day 1, we went for Highlights of Bangkok tour. She explained in great deal about Budhism, Ramayan and all history. She talked about everything ranging from religion, history and politics for good time while we were commuting. Overall this gave me a crash course on Thai culture. Our family is vegetarian, the food she ordered was very tasty. Day 2, we went to Erawan fall. The scenery was amazing and so were both the guides. Our kids got mixed with Nadia very much. Even after returning back, they were talking about her. One of the things I typically hate about all inclusive tours is typically they come in riders and waivers with lot of terms and conditions. This was indeed an all inclusive tour with no cost cutting anywhere. They have unlimited supplies of drinks, food, snacks, towels, anything you name it. This tour and guide were not just the professionals. They have the human touch and that's what make them very special. Thank you ladies for making this trip memorable.

A Well Spent Half Day. After reading great reviews, was expecting an impeccable trip. Some times with these kind of expectations we tend to get disappointed even with small issue but we were not, a great company, without any fuss they pre-poned my trip couple of hours. Mrs Air took us through Palace, Temple of Reclining Buddha, Canal Tour while giving us all the relevant information that a tourist like us needs (we were a family of four, with the youngest being 3 year who was throwing tantrums every now and then as any typical three year old on a sunny sweaty day). Mrs Air answered all the questions with calm and ever present smile. We avoided the traffic by taking train, boat, Tuk Tuk etc. I felt its tad bit expensive as the mode of transportation was public, but then the trip and Mrs Air personal care definitely made up for that. Will definitely recommend them.

In good hands. Went for half day tour to Railway and Floating market, Our guide was Air, and to echo every other reviews here, she was great. For a train nerd like myself, Maeklong Railway Market is one of the attractions in my bucket list. And thanks to Air, we manage to secure an awesome spot for photographs and video.She also advised us on what to/not to consume (we almost made a rookie mistake). We definitely felt like we're in good hands. Would highly recommend BKK tours. This is definitely going to be our go-to agency the next time we hit Bangkok again.

Fantastic Tour and great guide !. Could not speak more highly of BKK Tours. Ms Air was our guide, and was extremely helpful and added many personal touches. We were two families and Ms Air brought along Ms Sue, who was also and experienced tour guide. We visited the train markets (great experience) and the floating markets on September 24. Ms Air then took us for lunch and a long-tail boat ride. At all stages, Air was happy to provide anything we wished. From ordering lunch for us, to suggesting street food, to ensuring we knew and understood all aspects of our trip, it was hard to fault. Ms Air was professional, friendly and keen to provide a personal experience. Would highly recommend to anyone. Thanks Ms Air and Sue for a wonderful day! Karen & Graham and Maree & Gary.

An excellent idea to take this guide. We booked a tour guide in Bangkok with thees guys, having a great time along with Mr Chao:). They were very flexible to our requirement to add/ remove touristic attractions, had good ideas when comes to recommending places to visit, to eat and our guide was really a reliable, helpful person.We definitely recommend this tour for the ones that do not have time or patience to look for important visiting sites and want just to enjoy the lovely atmosphere of Bangkok.

Excellent Bangkok City Tour with BKK Tours. I highly recommend BKK Tours. I used this service primarily because they had very good reviews on Trip Advisor and they were able to provide a tour for me despite being a solo traveler. Many other companies I researched required 2 or more travelers. I did the Half Day Bangkok Highlight Tour on August 28, 2013. Ms. Air was my guide. She was an excellent tour guide: friendly, punctual, professional, and very knowlegable. The tour lasted about 4 1/2 to 5 hours: 8a-1p. The tour consisted of everything that was promised: canal tour, use of various modes of transportation in Bangkok, tour of the Grand Palace (my favorite part) and Emerald Buddha. Ms. Air was kind enough to take pictures for me at various points at the Grand Palace. I would have done the full day tour but my flight the day before did not arrive until close to midnight so I was still somewhat fatigued. All in all, I highly recommend BKK Tours if traveling to Thailand.Thanks,Wabu Susberry

Professional guide & driver - highly recommended. Me & my 2 girlfriends from Singapore took a full day tour (7.30am to about 6.30pm), with Miss Oi being our tour guide. We had wanted Air after hearing many excellent reviews about her, but she was not available that day - 30 August 2013. It turned out that Miss Oi is also very good, very attentive, and professional, and knowledgeable in her job. Our tour consisted of a trip to train station market, floating market, Kanachanburi war museum, cemetary and bridge over River Kwai. We had lunch in Cabbage & Condoms which serves good Thai food in a serene quiet ambience. At the floating market, Miss Oi arranged for a smaller boat (& not the motorized type which we felt was noisy) so we could go to the smaller canal to see the living condition of people residing there. We appreciate her thoughtfulness to bring us to less touristic route of the floating market. We like the serene and quietness of this route.Miss Oi and driver were very patient & helpful along the way. One of my girlfriends had diarrhoea and kept going to toilets. At Cabbage & Condoms, my friend Mary decided to just get a cab and head back to our hotel in Sukhumvit Soi 11 which is about 2.5 hours drive away, as she didn't think she could last till end of the tour at 6pm+. Miss Oi help her to call for a cab and leave instructions with the restaurant supervisor before we left for the 2nd half our tour. And yes, the van was very very comfortable. A pretty new van, clean and comfortable chairs.If we ever need to go for another package tour in Bangkok, we will certainly look for BKK Tours, though the price was alittle steep.Highly recommended tour agency.

Fabulous Tours in Bangkok with Oi from BKK Tours. We were extremely happy with the tours we arranged through BKK. We had a short time in Bangkok and wanted to make the most of it so we arranged for one of the BKK guides, a lovely woman named Oi, to pick us up at the airport. Oi took us to our hotel so we could check in and then we were off sight seeing right away. We had a full day visiting many sites using local transportation (great way to get to know your way around the city a little) and a wonderful lunch river side where we had a terrific array of Thai food. The second day Oi took us to the railroad and floating markets outside of Bangkok. Again, we had a great time. Oi was very friendly, informative, and extremely responsive to our interests and needs. In addition, BKK Tours was great to work with - very quick replies with exactly the info we needed. Our tours were excellent value for the price and we can't say enough about how wonderful Oi was.

Used BKK twice and it was superior. I was in Bangkok with my brother and we wanted to visit the River Kwai and do the palace tour. We found BKK on TA and decided to pull the trigger. I am so happy we chose BKK. Nadia was just amazing! She was fluent in English and knew quite a bit about each place that we went to (she studied tourism in University). She was also very cognizant of the fact that we were two farangs in a sweltering environment and was constantly giving us cold water and cold towels. When I go back to Bangkok, I will be using BKK and Nadia in particular again.

Excellent tour guide. This is the second year using BKK Tours with Air as my guide.As I had decided to stay in Bangkok for a week this year I booked a total of four and half day tours, including an overnight stay at Kanchanaburi, on an all inclusive basis.- Bangkok Temples (one day)- Bangkok Chinatown (half day)- Kanchanaburi (two days)- Bangkok - Prasart Museum & Jim Thompson House (one day)From initial enquiry I found the service provided was excellent with Air providing detailed advice on itinerary and hotels in both Bangkok and Kanchanaburi. She was also flexible with timings and able to adapt to events. Timings - at Kanchanaburi I decided I wanted to spend more time at Hellfire Pass and the Commonwealth War Graves Cemeteries so Air reduced the time spent at Erawan waterfalls.Adaptability - when heavy rain and protestors brought Bangkok traffic to standstill Air got me back to my hotel using canal boats and a motorcycle taxi. Air's local knowledge was invaluable and allowed me to see a side of Bangkok that many tourists simply do not experience. The Chinatown visit and Prassart Museum are two places I would not have visited on my own.Overall I highly recommend BKK Tours - they are not the cheapest tour company but the service offered is exemplary.

Wish we could have done more tours with BKK!!. We were in Bangkok for the beginning of our honeymoon and chose to do the half-day tour to Maeklong market followed by a tour of the Tha Kha floating market. The Maeklong market is not to be missed. The array of foods for sale is nothing short of astounding and the train passing through is INCREDIBLE. Ms. Oi was wonderful, she had a wealth of knowledge on every single topic that we asked a question about and bought us a variety of tasty snacks and beverages.The Tha Kha market is also a truly unique experience. We saw almost no other tourists, just lovely Thai women in boats, making delicious food and chatting with each other about the weeks events. We took a boat ride along the river to an old family house, where a sister and brother have been processing palm sugar the old-fashioned way for years (and their family had been doing it for centuries!!!). This was an authentic glimpse into a traditional Thai way of life and the experience was truly invaluable. We will never forget it.Booking was very easy (via e-mail) and professional - the owners communicated in very good english and were highly professional - no down payment necessary, just pay when your tour is done. Ms. Oi was excellent. She spoke English very well and shared a wide variety of interesting facts/tidbits as we were driving around. The transportation too was of high quality. We had a an air-conditioned passenger van just for the two of us! The driver was very friendly and was ready to pick us up at our various destinations.ENTHUSIASTICALLY recommended. Do not hesitate to book with BKK. Amid the hustle and bustle and Bangkok it is invaluable to have a friendly, and knowledgeable tour guide. It was worth every penny and only wish we could have used them for all of our excursions in Bangkok.

Great Introduction to a Fascinating City. I booked BKK Tours to provide an overview tour of Bangkok during a 24 hour layover a group I was leading had on our way to Cambodia in June. Communication with Michiel was outstanding. Everything was handled in a very professional way with great suggestions and recommendations offered. And the service provided met and exceeded our expectations! We had Chao as a guide and he really outdid himself in ensuring that our somewhat jet lagged group of 12 was enjoying themselves! Our only regret was that we had only a day to try and see this amazing city. When we (or I) return, I will definitely give BKK Tours a call. Highly recommended!!

exceeded our expectations. we enjoyed a full day tour seeing both sites in an outside the city. our guide Air spoke excellent English and was very knowledgable. we loved the market on the train tracks and the floating market. we were pleased by the visit to a family palm sugar farm and the real, intimate exposure to life there. we finished off the day by touring the grand palace and then boating through the old Bangkok canals. I highly recommend all of these tour locations. I highly recommend bkk tours and definitely plan on using them the next time we're there.

Highlight of our Bangkok stay!. Great to deal with the from outset - emails answered promptly and clearly, no $ required upfront. Picked up at our hotel by Air and her wonderful driver promptly at 7am and we had the most amazing half day tour to the floating market and railway market. Very, very comfortable van and plenty of cold drinks on hand - like travelling first class! Air is so knowledgeable and speaks perfect English, we learnt so much about Thai culture...we tried foods we would never normally try, we walked down little laneways we would normally be too scared to walk down. These memories will last a lifetime! We are not the type to go on group tours however we have a tendency to feel overwhelmed in big cities so arranging a private tour was a perfect introduction to Bankgok. A private tour may cost a bit more but is absolutely worth every cent as you can go at your own pace and it's easily customised. Air gave us so many tips on how to get around and things to do and see and this gave us the confidence to get out and explore this amazing city. We are already planning a return trip to Bangkok in May 2014 and will definitely book a tour with BKK Tours again - just need to decide which one! Thank you Air!

Thank you Air!. Had a whole day tour with Air as our guide and Peter for our driver. Air is such a sweet and nice lady!! Keeps my 3 kids engaged n entertained throughout the tour. We really had so much fun!Booking with them was a breeze with email answered promptly and they even went out to look for halal restaurant for our lunch! Really appreciate it guys!!Thank you again Air for the wonderful day.

A friend in Bangkok. We organized a one day tour of the major highlights of Bangkok. From the beginning, the service provided by BKK was exemplary. Emails were responded too promptly and clearly. On the day we were met by Ms Oi, who guided us around the sights with knowledge, patience and gentle good humour. She kept my two teenagers happy and engaged (not always easy!) and we laughed and learned and filed our senses with exotic sights, sounds, tastes and smells. Ms Oi helped us to try new tastes in fruit and food as we strolled through the markets and showed us funny games to play at some of the temples. A wonderfully happy day.

Best tour guide ever. My boyfriend and I spent two days touring Bangkok with BKK Tours with Ms. Oi and we had the most amazing experience. No matter what the request, Oi went out of her way to meet our needs. On our first day arriving in Bangkok Oi arrived at our hotel right on time, waited for us to get settled in, and then started our tour. She took us to Wat Pho, the Grand Palace, the Temple of the Emerald Buddha, and a tour of the canal. Although you could see these things without a tour guide it wouldn't be as worth while. As a teacher I loved having a personal history lesson all day long. There was no question that went unanswered. I learned all about the different poses of the Buddha and their meanings, how to tell what region each Buddha is from, countless traditions and rituals of the Thai people, and got to sample many local ways of transportation. While with Oi, I truly felt like a Thai and I felt we experienced not only the grand, common tourist places, but those sites often missed as well. Oi even took us to a store and set us up with a local phone. Oi is one of the friendliest and most interesting people I have ever met. You can tell she loves her job. On the second day of our tours we went to the Makasan slum, a local school, the Golden Mount, the Golden Buddha, and had a visit to Chinatown. The nice thing about BKK Tours was the willingness to change any predetermined schedule to fit your interests. I really wanted to see a lot of local life and I definitely got that chance. We are on a seven week journey through Southeast Asia and so far I have not met any tour guide more knowledgeable, friendly, or helpful than Oi. She truly makes the experience of Bangkok unforgettable.

Great day tour. Me and my husband took the Bangkoc highlights tour with Mr. Chao. It was awesome from the start! We could feel real Bangkoc life while visiting the flower and vegetable markets and by using public transportation to get around. We had all the explanation we needed during the visits to the temples and Chao was very careful to see if we were comfortable during the whole tour. We really recomend the guided tour once it is quite a challenge to get around Bangkoc by yourself and during the tour you can get some valuable tips.

Excellent, exactly what I was looking for. I had a limited amount of time to spend in Bangkok, and I wanted a fast pace, adaptable private tour. I only had just over 60 hours in Bangkok, so very little time. I went with a 2 day tour. I had high expectations and BKK met and exceeded them all. My interests vary from photography, history, modern culture, and food. From prompt, professional service, to taking care of all the little details and a desire to really tailor the tour to my specific likes and interests, everything was ideal. my only regret is not having more time to tour Bangkok. Highly recommended! I look forward to returning some day to explore more.

BKK Tours is absolutely fantastic. BKK Tours in BangkokMy wife and I were recently in Bangkok for 3 days and wanted a tour guide who could show us the traditional sites, the local culture and how everyday life is experienced. I spent much time searching the internet for the best tour guide and easily decided upon BKK Tours. From the very first contact it became obvious that this was the company that would serve our interests the best. We communicated with Michiel and Air, a husband and wife team that demonstrated the utmost professionalism at every level of service. Some of the things that we wanted to see and do were probably considered off the beaten path, but Air made them happen joyfully and with ease. Her English is perfect.On our first day she picked us up in a Tuk Tuk and we could not imagine a better way to start a 3 day tour. After that we were transported by car, driven by Tommy, who too was a true professional in every sense and happens to also be a great guy.Day 2 and day 3 were equally abundant with things to do and see and Air made sure that all of our expectations and priorities were met with a cheerful and wanting to please attitude. The temples and palaces are something that everyone should see at least once, however, if your interests are more varied Air will ensure that all of your wishes reach fruition. We particularly enjoyed the railroad market, flower market, and best of all the floating market. For true adventurers be sure and walk the slums and yes it’s just like the movie. A fascinating look at how happiness can prevail even in abject poverty.We can’t say whether BKK Tours offers the best guide in Bangkok, but I would bet that anyone else could only be as good at best.Thanks again Air for helping to make our stay in Bangkok a truly memorable event. We still think about you and what a wonderful experience you brought to us.Best Regards,Ron and Cindy

EXCITING EXPERIENCE WITH AIR!. My wife and I did two days of touring the temples and our guide was Air Photjaman. Air spoke excellent English and was very courteous and personable - a most excellent guide. Granted, it was oury first time to Bangkok and Air was able to discern the level and depth of tour we were in need of and was able to keep things moving smoothly based on what originally we told her we wanted and what he could see we were really capable of doing! Also special skills with photography, in the end we had an exciting experience with everything very well registered!! Indeed! We hope meet Air again in the future to explore even more the paradise called Thailand!!!

The train line market and floating market half day tour was worth it!. Although a little pricey ($190 AUD for 2 ppl) this half day trip was excellent! The transport was very clean and in time, there was only myself and my husband on the tour so the service was very personal. Ms Oi was an excellent guide and very considerate because it was soooooo hot the day we went. A very worth while trip to escape the hustle and bustle of Bangkok city!

Look no further. There is a very good reason why this tour company are rated so highly....they're brilliant. Air and Michiel know what service is all about. Not just during the tour, but before and they relish feedback after. I say before, because before going to Bangkok I booked a Full-day tour for my wife and I. However the night before I came down with a dose of Bangkok belly. I called Michiel an hour before pick up a little concerned especially after reading a previous complaining review on Tripadvisor. He immediately allayed any fears and asked if we wanted to try to do it another day if we had time. I hoped that I would be better the day after and we booked accordingly. I asked if my wife could join the guide for a half day shopping/market tour. Obviously more enjoyable than hanging around the hotel, looking after a sick husband. She had a great time with her guide, Air and arrived back to the hotel all smiles.Look, I could go on about how good our one day tour was but plenty of people have done that already. Trust them and me it will be great. We had Oi as our guide and she was very good. Very attentive and a real asset to the company.This company know how to treat people and show them a great day or days. 5 out 5

BKK Tours is Top-Notch!. We booked a two day private tour with BKK for Bangkok, with pick-up and drop off at the cruise terminal in Laemchabang. When beginning to research and get quotes from several tour cmpanies in Thailand, not only was the correspondence from Michiel at BKK the most timely it was also the most thorough and helpful. One tour company highly recommended on Trip Advisor did not respond to our inquiries at all.Our two day tour was a private one, with just the two of us, our guide, Air, and our driver. Air was at the port waiting for us as soon as we exited the ship, and lead us to a very comfortable van for the duration of the two days. On the long drive into Bangkok Air pointed out sites en route and gave us some information about Thailand and Bangkok. On arrival in Bangkok we went for lunch at a restaurant in a Yacht Club right on the river. Air ordered for us, taking care to ensure my food allergies and my husband's eating restrictions were accommodated, and we had a very delicious meal of Morning Glory (sauteed vegetable), Grilled Fish with Pineapple and Vegetables, and white rice for us, and Thai Fried Rice with Pork "old style" for my husband. He still dreams about that fried rice...We then went on to the Grand Palace, then took a fun tuk-tuk ride to Wat Pho and the Temple of the Reclining Buddha. After a long afternoon Air and the driver took us to our hotel (which we booked on our own), where she accompanied us inside and stayed with us through check in. We spent the rest of the evening on our own.The next morning Air met us at 10:00 am for some nearby shopping for textiles and souvenirs in a marketplace, then the Jim Thompson House store, and then took us for lunch at a restaurant in a residential neighbourhood on the outskirts of Bangkok. Once again Air oprdered for us, and once again the food was outstanding!! In the afternoon we went to the Prasart Museum on the outskirts of Bangkok, where we had the 6 acres of grounds, buildings and gardens to ourselves! The tour was very in depth and interesting! At the end of our museum tour Air and the driver took us back to the ship without incident.Throughout the entire two days Air was careful about our comfort, with cold bottled water and cold towels available regularly. And even with our resrictive food needs we did not experience any issues or discomfort at all from the restaurant and food choices. We would highly recommend BKK Tours for anyone traveling to Bangkok. Michiel and Air are true professionals who genuinely care about their customers.

Excellent half day tour. Despite having been to Bangkok many times, we still look to find things to do and areas to explore that we haven't seen before. I found BKK Tours very flexible and prompt in answering our communications. We went for a customised tour of Makkasan Slums, Wat Ratchanada (Metal castle), Amulet markets and Ban Bat (monk bowl village). We really enjoyed the train ride and exploring the 'slum' area and seeing the local train station. I think we were too early for the Monk Bowl village as there wasn't really much happening and to be honest, as much as we liked our guide Ms Gift, I don't think she knew anything about the Bowl Village or the 21 step process to making a bowl. As a guide, I would have expected her to have checked this out prior. Loved Wat Ratchanada and will definitely return there to do the walking meditation

Three Great Days. Booked with BKK quick response by e mails excellent and quick. Trip One was the Ayutthaya City Tour. Chau our guide and Peter the driver were waiting in the lobby as promised on time. The Van was super modern and very comfortable and we quickly made our way through the holiday traffic to our first stop the Buddah Temple a great experience and very authentic. Then onto a boat ride up river to the Chinese Temple again a great cultural experience. Lunch was included and we let Chau choose our meal the green curry was a bit too much for me as i was still hungover from the night before.Then a tour around the ruins great history.We decided to book the Train Market and Floating Market both must sees in our opinion.Finally Today we have been to the kwai Experience. I thought the kwai was a little touristy If you want to see the bridge in the movie go to Sri Lanka however the visits to the CWGC Cemetery s were a moving experience and i would recommend you visit and take time to show respect. and Chau and Peter gave us time to visit both cemeterys in the region.The tour started with a visit to Hellfire Pass a must visit i wish now that we had booked more time to visit this moving place. You walk the tracks of where thousands of Dutch Australian and British and Asians lost their lives building the railway to Burma. you can feel the energy and sadness as you walk through the cutting. Lunch followed brilliant lots of Thai dishes to try and the location was magnificent.A boat ride like the James bond movie was included and a visit to a monks museum. Overall i would say that we felt safe comfortable but most of all we gained two friends in Chau and Peter at each stop we were given hand wipes and fresh water great in this heat. lots of local snacks local fruit and coffees were on hand and most importantly our guide spoke good english and understood my northern dialect. We spent time in India and our guide although a lovely chap couldnt speak english and as a result we lost out on local sights on our trip due to poor communication. This was never a problem with Chau. Overall i would highly recommend a trip with BKK. Although on first glance BKK might appear more expensive to other tour groups, But BKK give a personal touch, quality, and a high standard of customer service. thanks Guys

Fantastic Trip - Must Do If you Visit Bangkok. We had an amazing day with Michael which set up a fantastic holiday holiday in Thailand. As we are keen on photography we took the option of having a photography guide and the tips and advice were great. We really enjoyed visiting both the railway market and the local floating market and stopping to see the the salt mines was a real bonus. Equally the transport, organisation and customer service was of the highest quality.We would definitely recommend this trip to anyone visiting Bangkok.

Full day Ayutthaya Tour. We've signed up for the full day Ayutthaya historical city tour and we absolutely love it! Our tour guide, Chau is very knowledgeable and charismatic. The flow of the tour was really good. Time management was spot on. We had a boat ride which was just alright. But when it comes to visiting the Wats and temples of ruins, it just blew us away. The architectures are magnificent and the views are breathtaking. But brace yourself with the heat! Ayutthaya is definitely a place to visit when you are in Bangkok and you should do it with BKK.

Perfect. We used BKK Tours for a day trip to Kanchanaburi over Easter, 2013 and I can not fault their service. Prior to the tour they quickly and politely answered all my questions. Whilst the tour may seem expensive it is a private tour and all meals, drinks, snacks, entry fees and even coffee are paid for. The extra expense to avoid being hustled into a souvenir shop and encouraged to purchase is worth it, in my opinion!Our guide, Ms Oi, was perfect. She was very good at judging our needs and allowing us to move at our own pace. We had a really enjoyable day and I'd have no hesitation in using BKK Tours in the future should we ever return to Bangkok.

Awesome Tour Company. My GF and I spent a week in Bangkok in February. We booked 4 days of tours with this company and all four days were perfect. Our guide was Mr. Michai. He was not only a great guide, but also a great person to be around. He gave us insights that we probably would not get on larger group tours. You know the kind, with someone holding a funny looking flag in the air with 15 people following them around. We got a true taste of what it was like to be in Bangkok. The tours were very laid back and were at our own pace. If we wanted to spend extra time at a location or leave early, it was not a problem. That is something that is important to me. As a photographer I don't want to leave until I have my shot. And I like to explore at a leisurely pace. My GF got sick one day and we had to reschedule a tour from Wednesday to Friday and it was not a problem. The company even recommended a very nice local hospital for us to go to. We were both saddened to hear that our guide (M as we called him) was in an accident. But I strongly recommend that when he is better that you request him. He could not have been any better. Thanks to him and BKK tours, we saw things that we would not have seen on our own. I don't write a lot of reviews, but I just wanted everyone one to know how great my experience was with this company.

A must do to make the most of Bangkok. I arranged our two tours for our 3 night visit well in advance. It was as others have said, not the cheapest of tours but we could not fault the fact we got excellent value for money and absolutely everything was looked after for us without the dreaded need to bargain and barter prices.Our first day was to Ayutthaya and it was a lovely introduction to temples and early Thai history.Our guide (Ms) Nutty was wonderful, over exuberant and over chatty till she settled down and took a chill pill and worked out our needs, then she was just great.We were picked up in an amazingly comfortable van which could have easily catered to another half a dozen people and driven around in style all day. It felt like sitting in an armchair with a birds eye view. Plied with cold, cold water and face towels at every turn.What's not to like?Really had no idea how Ayutthaya was all set out but I think we saw it from every single angle.From the river, by boat and from this style temple to that with the most amazing lunch right on the rivers edge. Probably the best meal we had in Thailand in certainly one of the best spots.We had a day off in between, for the recommended local Wats, then spent our last day doing all the different markets, again with Nutty. What a day!! Loving food as I do it was really amazing.Cannot even remember the names of all the markets.First up was the train market. Unbelievable!Then a lovely quiet, seemed like a local floating market in a coconut plantation, where we also had a boat ride to a coconut sugar processing place run by the same lady for ever.They even stopped for us to feed and see the elephants we had seen on the way there.Then the very touristy market, which was great for photos but walked on further and across a bridge to the local market which was much more about where people live now.We stopped for a beer and met some really interesting people here.I think our last market was another popular spot for locals to go out for a lovely seafood lunch and its just amazing to watch the way cooking is done on a tiny little wooden boat without room to turn around.We finished up all having an excellent foot massage at this market...so needed that!Nutty had managed to feed us up all day on tasty little morsels from all the places we had visited so she used our lunch money to purchase a yummy early dinner before putting us on our train to Chiang Mai in the evening. What great service!We were very impressed and fully recommend BKK tours and would seek them out again if ever we get back to Bangkok.Thanks Nutty!!

BEWARE: Last Minute Cancellations Despite Firm Confirmation and Invoicing Can Leave You Stranded. Despite the glowing reviews, Beware, they may not be doing business in good faith. BKK made a mess of our trip by first gladly taking and confirming our reservations, happy to take our money by invoicing in advance of the trip (fortunately I managed to cancel the payment) and then sending an email (no call despite a Hong Kong contact number) cancelling BOTH trips on different days, claming one guide for a specialized tour had an accident ... no excuse given for the second cancellation.Obviously they do OK tours from teh reviews, but you have to get on one first. The way they handled the cancellation (email no call) wreaks of unprofessionalism. No suggestions for an alternative, no offer to make good another time ... no nothing ....Just be mindful despite booking well in dvance anbd paying, trips may not be available.

Highlight of our Bangkok experience. We booked the highlights of Bangkok far in advance. We had several emails with questions and every email was prompt answered by Michiel. As we arrived late the night before the tour we started at 10 am. Air was our guide. And what a guide she is!! She is very friendly, knows everything and most of all she was very great with our son. My husband does not like big cities but he enjoyed every minute of the day and guess he loved Bangkok and want to come back next year.With this tour you see most of the famous attractions in Bangkok and also the variety of transport was fun (longtail, tuk tuk, taxiboat). Air takes care of everything like food for holy fish, water and other drinks for us, a delicious lunch and snacks. It's very convenient that everything is included.We will be back for other Bangkok or surrounding sights and for sure we book again with BKK!!!Bedankt Michiel en Air!

Good to great. I booked four tours spread out over three days: Tha Kha floating market, Ayyuthaya full day, Chinatown walking tour, and canal tour. Michiel and Air worked with me from the very beginning to set things up. And that was very helpful. For example, in the beginning, they advised me to save some money by catching a longtail from Sathorn Pier to see the canals by myself. But since I chose not to include the railway market in the Tha Kha tour, Michiel and Air came up with the idea that the canal tour could be appended to the Chinatown tour because having a guide along would be helpful. BKK Tours try to differentiate themselves from their competitors by leveraging their detailed knowledge of Bangkok and the surrounding area. For example, most tour operators go to Damnoen Saduak, which essentially kills the place. It is overrun by tourists and their buses and boats by 9AM. Tha Kha is harder to get to and in fact, I learned about it from BKK's website. There was no mention of it in the Rough Guide for Bangkok.A few words about my guide, Miss Oi. Yes, she is knowledgeable, courteous, punctual, etc... But I was most impressed by how early on, she correctly guessed my preferences and subtly tailored the tours accordingly to suit my tastes. People skills are what you need to be a good tour guide. I think Miss Air has enough of them to be a great tour guide.As others have noted in their reviews, BKK pricing is not cheap. But I'm a firm believer in "you get what you pay for". I was not disappointed. In fact, the quality of the service far surpassed my expectation. So if you want to splurge, not in terms of fancy dining and shopping, but in an interesting and thought-provoking experience, BKK tours is for you.

Amazing tours, great guides, great communication, flexibility. My wife and I recently visited Bangkok to photograph the people, culture, top sites in this wonderful city. I contacted Michail and Air as they offered guides with experience in working with photographers. We worked with Oi and Air. Both were very good and focused on helping us find the best places/people for images. They were very knowledgeable and accommodating and very patient. The images we came back with are wonderful and the time with spent with our guides very memorable. Thank you Michaeil, Air, and Oi for the great service! Hope to see you soon on our next trip to Thailand! Filemon & Kelly

Great Tour Guides. We arranged a half day tour around Chinatown, the Wat Arun temple and the Klongs (canals). The website was easy to use and we got a very quick and personal reply. On the day of our tour Miss Oi was on time, courteous, and very professional and informative throughout. The visit to Chinatown was a real eye-opener. We would never have dared go tthrough all the back alleys on our own but with Miss Oi it was a real experience. BKK tours aren't cheap but they do show a side of Bangkok we wouldn't have seen otherwise.

Worth the considerable expense. I did the railway market/floating market tour, it was such a great experience. Tek was my guide, and I paid extra to have Michiel along as photography guide, both were very knowledgable and friendly. They taught me lots about the local culture and gave me some useful hints for the rest of my trip; and Michiel gave me lots of great photography advice, eg teaching me how to ask the locals to let me photograph them up close (which I'd never dared to do before!). I did feel a little odd at first being one person with two guides and a driver, but I'm really glad I had two guides at the railway market, where Michiel gave me hints on how to photograph the train as it was passing through the market RIGHT IN FRONT OF ME, whilst Tek captured it all on video for me.I booked about a month in advance via email, so BKK was able to advise me when the less touristy floating market was open, I'm really glad I visited that one, it was so charming. We also visited a farm where cane sugar is produced, which was fascinating.This tour is very expensive by Southeast Asian standards, but I think it's worth it, particularly as I've paid this much for group tours in Europe! The railway/floating market is particularly worthwhile as (according to lonely planet) getting to the railway market on your own is very complicated!

Excellent Bangkok tours while cruise shop was in port. We were in Bangkok for 2 half days and 1 full day, while on a southeast Asian cruise and used BKK for our private tours, with our small group of 6-8 people, depending on the particular day. My correspondence with the company was a pleasure, with all of my questions, concerns and modifications promptly replied to. Our tour guide for all 3 days was a lovely, knowledgeable and caring young woman named Oi. She was outstanding! The driver was attentive, helpful and careful. We were conveniently picked up and dropped off at the port each day.The first tour was a 1/2 day tour of Chinatown and the night market. The full day tour included the major Bangkok sights. The final 1/2 day tour was of the railway market and an authentic floating market. All of the tours were excellent and gave us a taste of Thai culture. The Bangkok traffic is atrocious, so be prepared for any ride to take much longer than anticipated. I highly recommend the services of BKK, as we were very satisfied.

Great Bangkok City Tour. First time in Bangkok and so very little time to see so much,booked on the Internet with Air before our arrival.The website was very easy to use and so informative,all enquiries were answered promptly.Our tour guide for the day was Chao,he was brilliant,good pick up from Hotel and most informative and friendly a top notch guide.The tour was excellent in that we experienced all forms of transport,which made our later solo outings much easier.The lunch was beautiful and most appreciated after our earlier busy day in the temples and the Palace.To end the tour with the flower markets and the long tail boat ride through the klongs was very relaxing and interesting at the same time.Hope to return soon for a longer stay in Bangkok and will definitely do some more tours.Overall a great experience from a top notch tour company.Will definitely recommend this tour to my friends and family.Thank you for a fantastic day.Malcolm & Wendy Quigley

Photo Tour with BKK was truly the highlight of an amazing 3 week trip to Thailand!!. Right from the beginning, communicating with BKK Tours was easy and professional. We booked a one day Photo Tour with Michiel and Ms. Oi. Having Michiel come along was well worth the extra $$ to have his extremely helpful tips and experience. He assessed my level (which is maybe "moderately experienced amateur") and was able to come up with many helpful tips that I would not have gleaned from a classroom experience. Plus, he knows where the good places are to shoot, and tailors the tour experience for that purpose. He was a patient, kind and effective teacher. Meanwhile, Ms. Oi was giving my husband lots of personal attention, focussing on more facts and information, so that he was also getting a great tour experience. She was very knowledgeable and of course, being Thai, had insights (and the language!) that complemented Michiel's photo knowledge base very well, making this the perfect experience for us as a couple. Also, the minivan truly was luxurious and the lunch we had was quite fantastic! Let them choose for you! In terms of specifics, we went to the market through which the train runs (fantastic!), then on to a floating market (also fantastic!) and a coconut farm (will never forget it!), then lunch, then back to Bangkok where we went to Chinatown (markets etc.), a temple, and to the Buddha factories (the latter wasn't my favourite thing, but depends on your tastes). It was a good spot to practice some panning shots of Tuk tuks though! Wish we'd had time to do the slums with Michiel... maybe next time! After we finished our tour, Michiel sent me a lovely email summarizing a whole bunch of suggestions and teachings (truly a wonderful touch!), as well as some of his own photos from the day. Overall, it was a great experience I'd love to repeat again someday!

Well Worth the Cost!. We were recently in Bangkok as part of a large (35 people) group tour. We thought it was way too big and split off and hired private guides from BKK tours for 2 days. Our internet inquiries were responded to immediately. It was an absolutely great decision. We toured much of Bangkok Highlighs with BKK. The guides were personable and extremely informative. They even customized our tour plan so that we did not duplicate anything that we had already seen as part of the large group tour. It was much better to see the sites at our own pace and to have such great interaction with the guides. We also did the railway market, floating market, flower market and Chinatown tours. Both days we had great lunches at great restaurants (all included in the tour cost). BKK was an easy company with which to do business. They provided absolutely great customer service and very high caliber guides. I would highly recommend BKK to anyone visiting Bangkok.

Rocky start, then wonderful. I contacted the company for tour info as i would be overnighting in Bangkok from a Celebrity cruise. I was answered quickly and responded the same way then there was a lul in the action. The owner Michael, after 2 days finally wrote back(i sent a second note) and let me know that he did not have a guide available for both my days. I had already left the country and was sitting in the Hong Kong airport when his note arrived. When i let him know how disaappointed i was, he apologized and said he would work with me, which he did. He ended up touring with me the second day and we had a great time. His tours and guides are first rate. He did tell me, that he gets so many e-mails and that some people are just "shopping" around and he never hears back.If you decide to use BKK, let him know up front that you are serious and not shopping....you won't regret it.

Good overall experience. BKK organized two tours for us, the first day in Bagkok and the second in Ayutthaya. Both tours were very well organized and touched all the must-see attractions despite the short time available. Our guide on the first day was not feeling well and could not provide high quality service. However, Michiel promptly stepped in and replaced the guide for the next day. That for me was a sign of good management and first customer care. The tours are a bit pricey but include everything, from drinks and refreshing towels, to flowers at the market and ice cream for the children. Overall a great experience.

Kanchanaburi Highlights Tour. visited Thailand with my Father and one of the trips he wanted to do was to go visit the bridge over the River Kwai. Looked at various options and after reading the reviews on both this website and several others travel websites, decided on BKK.Well worth it, did a private tour with just 3 people, Had Oi as our wonderful guide, we got picked up on time in our very nice air conditioned minbus.Even though it is a long drive just about 3 hours the time passed quickly and it gives you a good look at Bangkok and the surrounding. The Hellfire pass walk, River Kwai and boat trip were all worth it.The lunch on the side of the river was ideal and we never felt rushed.Will definately use again

Wonderful private tour of Bangkok. We had only 1 day in Bangkok and BKK showed us a wonderful time. Miss Oi spoke English very well. We saw all the highlights, as the tour information indicated. We didn't get to the Temple of Rising Sun, but still an awesome day. We saw the Grand Palace and the Reclining Buddha before the crowds got too big. She took care of all the entrance fees, which saved us as we know no Thai. She explained the sites with expertise and was patient with our questions. Wonderful lunch. Great boat tour. All around a great day.

Fantastic Day in Bangkok. We organised our trip with BKK before we left for our cruise. Our guide and driver were waiting for us when our ship docked in Leamchabang at 8.00am. It's a 2 hour drive from the port to Bangkok and our people carrier was extremely comfortable and air-conditioned. There were eight of us in our party which was a good number. Our first stop was The Grand Palace which was beautiful and fascinating . We then had a long boat trip around the canals of Bangkok followed by an excellent lunch. Our next stop was Wat Pho after which we visited the Flower Market.Our guide for the day was Mrs Lift who was wonderful, she was extremely knowledgeable and interesting. We would highly recommend BKK to anyone visiting Thailand but especially to cruise passengers

Thank you so much Air!. This is a late review. We had a tour in Bangkok last December 2012. There were 4 kids with us. Air and the driver picked us up on time in our hotel, Glow Pratunam Hotel. Very accomodating, friendly and she even helped us how to go to Bungsamran Fishing Resort. She spoke fluent English too. We enjoyed the train market, floating market and the canal tour. The kids loved the hand feeding of the catfish in the canal.Thanks Air and BKK tours for the unforgettable trip we had.

Great Tour. Booked a tour during a Bangkok holiday. We booked while still in Australia &they emailed results straight away & offered suggestions & set the itenery with our requests. We were picked up from our Bangkok hotel at 7am, we visited the water markets, flower market & canal tours. We had a great day, Air was our guide $ she was beautiful, spoke good english & was very informative. We were impressed how she was so considerate and caring for the local Thai people and has a great repore with them & you could see how they liked her too. We would definitely do one of these tours again & wish them well with the wonderful business they have, they are very caring honest & considerate & not just after our money, this is good value for money, bit more expensive than some other tours but is totally worth every cent. Thanks again Air.

Thank you BKK tours! Michael, Lift, and Nut!. My students and I thoroughly enjoyed our experiences organized through BKK Tours. Particularly the floating market and canal tour. Of course, the Palace is also an amazing site and the railway market an interesting experience! We look forward to return next year!

Good organization, but not top class guide service. We took 2 tours with this Company: Bangkok tour & Markets tour (Railway market & Floating market). Overall OK experience, but not top class, to be honest.We took private sightseeing tours in different countries, so we can compare the experience.The booking experience was easy & fast, communication was good (compared to the Tour with Tong - who did not reply to us for ages).We had Michael as a guide. He was good, giving us some extras in terms of organization (train ride, boat ride - on top of the tour program), but he was not really explaining us anything about Thailand history, culture, etc. (normally you expect that during the sightseeing tour). During the transportation he was keeping quiet or sleeping. His English was not perfect - it was very hard to understand him. Overall tour organization was good, but the guide service was not excellent.

Professional and responsible BKK answer to our prayers. After trying several times - unsuccessfully - to get a confirmation from the No. 1 Trip Advisor rated tour company, I scrolled down and found BKK. Thank heavens! Air, who runs the tour company with her Dutch husband, sent back detailed emails, adding things we wanted to do and setting everything up, specific prices, schedule etc. While BKK may seem more expensive, one of the great aspects of our two days with Air is that we paid for almost nothing (except the massage mentioned below) until the end. At the Railway Market and floating lunar market outside Bangkok - both fascinating - she constantly was buying us coffee and food samples. Lunch in local restaurants is included in BKK tours, and you can order what you want or she will do it for you. She handled admissions tickets to the attractions in Bangkok. I mentioned I'd like to try a massage at Wat Pho (Reclining Buddha), so she scheduled our tour in the morning when we didn't need to wait for a massage - it was 540 Baht ($18) for an hour (plus tip, which was obviously appreciated)...great! Loved the hour-long river tour in the private boat that looks like an oversized gondola. I have some issues with bad knees, so instead of going by public transportation in Bangkok, she arranged for a van - and still managed to hire a tuk tuk for a short ride. We never would have managed to do all we did on our own, nor would we have known how to navigate in Bangkok and its environs. She took us to places we never would have found on our own. Was a wonderful introduction to Bangkok!

Fantastic!. We done the city tour with Air. Picked up promptly and whisked off on a tour of fabulous Bangkok. Air was great, very pleasant, knowledgeable and very passionate. We loved our tour and would definitely use BKK tours if ever in Bangkok again.

Just Wonderful!. Had a pleasant day w/Air. A memorable day for all of us, for the Tanabe Family, thanx to Air. We went on a day tour of the city w/ my family of 4 and my parents, group of 6. From a 9yr old to a 78yr old! I was afraid if my handicapped father could keep up w/ the tour, but Air took care of him very well, it was almost like he was having the MOST fun at all times.When my father SUDDENLY suggested he wanted buy some flowers, Air went all around the shops at the flower market and found him fresh Thai flowers that lasted the longest. Chose a nice box (to store) for him too. and when he SUDDENLY said he wanted vegitable (coriander)seeds, she went looking around for a seed shop for us, and got to buy exactly what he wanted. On the way back from the day tour, again, my father asked Air if she could find a Chinese medicine shop for him, and she found him the exact one he wanted! It was amazing because he had been searching for this traditional Chinese medicine for a long time, and FINALLY, found it thanks to Air! Sorry, Air for all that trouble!!!!I could go on and on for what she had done for us, but there is soooo much we want to thank her for, just can't fit in one page.What I liked about Air, she took care of us like we were her family. She ate w/us, and we were very happy about that too. We got to hear about her life in Thailand, about herself, made us feel comfortable.BTW, the van is very stylish and comfortable! I am so glad we booked for the van! We got to avoid the sun at all times, and this really helped my father and the kids. It's not cheap, but if you are travelling in a group, it's very convenient! It was nice knowing you, Air. My parents, they met in Thailand 40yrs ago (on a business trip), became a nice 2nd honeymoon for them too! Hope to see you again!英語のツアーではありますが、親が通訳してあげれば小さい子供でも楽しめますよ♪簡単な英語で説明してくれますし、内容的に盛りだくさんなので、退屈はしません。あと、プライベートのツアーなので、行きたいところにも寄ってくれます。ハイシーズンの時は特におススメ！ここのツアーは並ばずに優先的に案内されます。値段はちょいと高いけれども、グループで行動するときには、いいですよ。日本人のグループツアーが苦手な方にはと～ってもおススメです。I highly recommend BKK tour to the Japanese tourists too!!!

Great tour when you want to see more than just the tourist stuff. We had only one full day in Bangkok with our two kids (age 10 and 12) and were interested in not only seeing the sights but in getting some sort of insider view of the city. We got exactly that with BKK Tours and Mr. Michai. Everything went smoothly in terms of scheduling the tour, meeting Mr. "M", cost, etc (everything is included, we did not pay for one thing the whole day beyond the tour cost). We enjoyed Wat Pho and the Grand Palace and Mr. M was very knowledgable and gave the appropriate amount of information for our group - he also was happy and able to answer many, many questions we had about the sights but also life in Bangkok, questions about what we were observing, etc. He added a stop to a very "locals" market as we wanted to see that and pointed out all the different foods and navigated us through the market and to a lesser known wat nearby. There were many instances where we really felt we were seeing things we never would have found on our own such as a restaurant (right next to the Grand Palace) that was in a naval facility and there was not one other tourist in sight - nothing fancy, but the food was delicious and it was right on the river. We also enjoyed our tea stop at a "hip" coffee house with local art for sale on the walls and delicious drinks. He also included transport on the oldest transportation mode in Bangkok which was the canal taxi - not the tourist one on the big river, but the one real workers use to get around Bangkok. We really felt we got as much out of our time as possible. And Mr. M was great with my shy kids - gently joking with them and addressing them directly to keep them engaged. Our tour also included the flower market, a long tail boat ride down the river, fish feeding and more.

Great day with BKK Tours!. My husband and I spent a day in Bangkok with Gift. She picked us up promptly at our hotel and showed us the highlights of Bangkok, including the Grand Palace, the Reclining Buddha, a local food and flower market, and a tour of the canals by longboat. Gift was easy to talk to, very personable and shared a lot of interesting information about each site we visited and the history of Thailand. We both felt like we learned a lot of information that we would not have gotten if we'd chosen to see each site on our own. In addition, Gift made sure to take photos of us at each site and we didn't even have to ask, which was great! Everything was covered by the tour cost, which we were able to pay online via paypal before our trip, and it was nice to not have to worry about paying for anything throughout the day. Michiel and Air also did a great job of emailing me back promptly and even suggested some sites that we could see on our own. I definitely recommend taking a tour with BKK and Gift, especially if you have a limited amount of time in Bangkok and want to see as much as possible.

What A Great Day. Looking for a decent private guide for our tour around Bangkok i thought would be difficult. But we came across BKK tours. Booking on the internet and wondering what to expect was the biggest worry. But we were met at our hotel by Ms Oi and our driver. Very friendly and helpful. We took in the train market, the less touristy floating market and ended up at the Bridge Over The River Kwai. Throughout the day our guides made sure we were looked after and allowed us to do as we wanted. All the activities that they had planned for us were outstanding. The highlight being the long tail speed ride on the River Kwai. The transportation was outstanding and we never had to worry about anything. Even when barganing with the locals Ms Oi assisted us in making sure we were not ripped off. All in all it was a fantastic day, mad so by BKK tours.

Best guide in Bangkok. From the first moment we contacted BKK everything went smoothly. We chose to visit the Train Market, an authentic floating market, the Burma Railway Museum and the Bridge Over The River Kwai. Unlike another well known travel company in Bangkok BKK came back with a price that covered everything including tolls, entrance fees and meals etc, this was great as we were on a budget and didn't want any hidden costs. Aire was fantastic, she is so knowledgeable of all the places we went and there were many extras included in our tour that we hadn't expected - like fruit bought for us at the train market, and visit to a coconut sugar farm, also the meal we had at lunch was the best meal we had in all our time in Bangkok. Our tour took 12 hours and was excellent value for money, we are planning the return to Bangkok and will be sure to contact Michil and Aire again. Thank you for a great day

Great guides to Bangkok. We went on a half day railway market and floating market tour with BKK guides. Our guide Ms Oi was wonderful. She took extra care with my 70 year old mother who joined my friends and I for the trip and was ever helpful with any questions we have. We made requests to make unscheduled stops to buy food/things and rest stops along the road and she tried her best to accomodate all our requests. She is ever so generous with buying small snacks for us to try.Michiel and Air were also very prompt in answering all my email questions, and the answers were comprehensive. It was very easy and smooth to make a make a tour booking with them.I have no hesitation to use BKK Tours again for my next day trip in Bangkok.

“unforgettable experience”. BKK Tour, do what they say... We were a group of 10 friends, had wonderful 5 days in Bangkok and nearby. Air and Michiel were very helpfull and friendly all through the experience. Our programme became exellent with their advices. We took “the roads less travelled”, sow more real life and met beautifull Thai people with the best example, dear Air... We felt special, safe and well treated in every way... I would like to have a new trip with them to the country side and share their experiences on photography also...

Fantastic 2 days with Air.. Air was an excellent guide. We toured Bangkok on Day 1 and Hellfire Pass / River Kwai on Day 2. Air speaks excellent English and is very knowledgeable and passionate about the area and culture. The mini Van which Air arranged for Day 2 was excellent, far better than we have seen / used in other locations. Thank you Air for truly making our introduction to Thailand memorable.

Excellent. BKK Tours were great - My father and I only had a few days in Bangkok and wanted to make sure we saw the things we wanted to see. I researched on the Thailand Tourism website for a reputable tour company to show us around Thailand. I found 5 tour companies and one of them is BKK Tours. All fives have reviewed on tripadvisor. Initially, I emailed another companies and got a reply from them. Prior to leaving, I made arrangements for a private tour guide with Michiel & Air, based largely on their positive Trip Advisor reviews. Michiel was always responsive to email and proved to be fully reliable.We did 2 tours (Bangkok Highlights and Railway and floating market (Half day tour). Our guide was Gift for both days. She was sweet, and personable!! On the first day tour, we went to the Maeklong Railway market, which is held on the railway track. When a train is coming, vendors start pushing their tables to the side and the minute the train is gone, everything returns to the initial state. Throughout the tour, snacks and refreshments were provided, as well as cold towels. We visited the Royal Grand Palace, temple of the reclining Buddha (What Pho) and the emerald Buddha (What Phra). Gift was very knowledgeable about Thai history and culture, so I spent a great and instructive day with her. She can adjust to go through some attractions faster than others and was great on-the-fly (I changed what I wanted to do last minute several times). Next day, we had a canal tour on the Klongs, where you can see picturesque scenes of life by the river. We visited the Arun Wat and Jim Thompson House. I also appreciated all the times Gift grabbed my camera and took some beautiful family photos for us as generally I am always stuck behind the camera.I really recommend these people, I've done a lot of tours all around the world but have never met such kind and professional guide.•

Perfect way of seeing Bangkok!. We started our honeymoon in Bangkok and only had one day there. We decided to book a tour guide as we hoped it would be the best way of seeing as much as possible in such a short space of time... and we were right!Our tour guide, Oi (+driver) took us to the Maeklong Railway Market, (seeing is definitely believing here!), Damnern Saduak Floating Market (including private boat), The Royal Grand Palace & The Royal Temple. It was an early start and a relatively long day but believe me, it was worth it! Had we not booked a guide, we wouldn't have had any idea what to see or where to go.BKK Tours were able to put together a day which included all the things we'd wanted to see plus more. Our day included lunch, entrance fees and a tuk-tuk ride. There were no hidden extras. We arranged and booked the tour via email from the UK with ease.All I can say is that if you want someone to show you the highlights of Bangkok, this is the way to do it. Perfect in every way!! Thank you Oi.

Fantastic tour of bangkok, highly recommended.. Please don't hesitate in booking a tour with BKK and if you get the fabulous Oi as your guide you will have a very informative day. We opted for the bangkok highlights tour which if you have never been to the city before is perfect. It combines a mixture of more traditional sightseeing to a couple of the temples with a true insight into how the Thai people work and live. You travel using different modes of transport including a tuk-tuk, tailboat, sky train and metro. It gave us the confidence and knowledge to use them throughout our stay in bangkok. I would do this tour on one of your first days in bangkok and get out early (as they recommend) to experience the city getting to work. Our guide spoke great English and was extremely knowledgeable about the city. We could ask her anything (and did)!
