She also recommended places to go in the evening and what else we should do during our trip.This tour is a bit more expensive than some of the others on offer but is all inclusive of food, entry fees, transport costs, drinks etc which takes the worry out of things and means you don't need to be worrying about paying for things. I would also be good for a lone traveller. Highly recommended!! Thank you so much Oi.

Meet the locals tour. We did a meet the locals tour with Air. I truly enjoyed the tour as a whole.For the first part, we were walking around the slum areas of Makkasan. It was an eye opener as to how people can survive in a difficult environment. Air was very familiar with the surroundings and introduced us to a few of the locals too. We then roamed around the local markets, visited temples, the buddha wholesale market where we got some great bargains on bronze items, flower market and the canals. The place we went to for lunch (included in the tour) was a fantastic place to sample the local food.We also took every form of transport available in Bangkok: train, bts, tuk tuk and river boats. It was a great way to see Bangkok too.BKK responded to every email in a very timely manner and it was a pleasure to deal with them. I believe we had value for money on our tour and am glad we did the tour with BKK tours.

Excellent way to see BKK. We were only in town for two days, and I did my research to enable us to maximize our time. This tour hit the mark! Pat (our guide) was full of interesting information action, and took us to all of the promised sites. Lunch was great....and the boat ride was a highlight. Also provided excellent advice regarding other things to do with our time. I would thoroughly recommend this tour......Only suggestion would be to make it more cost effective for families.....I would like to bring my kids back....but not sure I would pay the per head cost.... Just a thought!!!! :)

I'll be back!. We booked a half day trip with BKK to Maeklong railway market and Thaka floating market and since this was my first time visiting Bangkok and considering first time engaging a tour guide, i was a bit skeptical at first as my perception of local tour guides are just want to earn quick bucks but everything changed when we got to know more of our tour guide along the way as we are intrigued by her affability and humbleness, (even the driver was pleasantly friendly and never fails to smile). We could felt her sincerity as she provides an in-depth informations about the places of interest both factual and in reality consideration. I hope BKK shall maintain such good quality service and definitely this won’t be our last reservation with BKK. I personally enjoyed strolling down the river in a boat and memorable visit to the traditional coconut milk sugar making.Thank you! Air for showing us such an unforgettable experiences.Ding (Malaysia)

An excellent day. I did the Kanchanaburi Highlights tour. It was a personal tour, just me, Ms. Air (the guide) and a driver in an air-conditioned vehicle. We spent time in Hellfire Pass, two museums, the War cemetery and did a short cruise on the River Kwai. It was an excellent tour, adjusted to my personal preferences. Ms. Air was friendly, informative and the perfect guide. It was a long day (about 12 hours from pick-up to drop-off) but an interesting and enjoyable day. I had organized the trip by email before leaving home. I highly recommend BKK Tours.

Thank You BKK !!!!. Where do I begin? Fast and efficient email correspondence from Michiel detailing tours etc. was very reassuring and offered further insight to places and suggestions to customize our day. More expensive than most other tours but well worth paying for. Then onto the tours themselves. My husband and I choose the Authentic Ayutthaya tour with Michiel and Oi which was combined with a all day photography lesson: amazing! The air conditioned van was fantastic and cold drinks and towels were welcomed in this hot and humid climate. This UNESCO site was truly a highlight and made for a memorable days outing.Michiel and Ois' knowledge of the areas visited and my private photo tutorial made for a most informative and entertaining day. Lunch was in a local eatery and the food was superb.On another day, my husband and I enjoyed a meet the locals tour with our guide, Gift.Another interesting day, exploring the city by taxi, and tuk tuk and lots of walking, discovering the real Bangkok. Chinatown, the Golden Buddha, flower market, Jim Thompson House. Superb and another great lunch, this time at the Naval club.These tours, were all inclusive...tour,transport, guides, food, drinks, entrance fees etc.All I can say is THANK YOU ever so much.

Awesome Personalised Tour!. Was looking around for a personalized tour as I am on a trip with my sister and 2 friends so safety is a priority for me. With the good reviews about BKK tour, I decided to engage the service of BKK tour.I had a lot of enquiry as this is my first time in bangkok. However, BKK Tour responded to all my emails very quickly and with loads of valuable information. Their emails response are never slipshod and always filled with information. This definitely help me to plan my tour and the places that I want to go to for the tour. I think I have sent a total of 30 emails to them but they are always very patient! Really appreciated it a lot!On our arrival, I was really afraid that they will forget about our tour as I booked quite early. However, this was not needed. Our guide, Oi reached the hotel promptly before 7am. Though my sister's friends arrive a little late, Oi waited patiently for all of us to arrive at the hotel lobby. Then we proceeded to Maeklong Railway Market! The van ride is about 1hr from our hotel @ Pratunam.After our arrival at Maeklong Railway Market, Oi showed us around the market and all the local foods. It was an eye-opener when the train passes by! Oi also helped us to take wonderful pictures on the railway! Then we had a great train ride to another station which the van is already waiting for us to bring us to Tha Kha Floating Market.Tha Kha Floating Market is a local market which opens on weekends and on special weekdays depending on the phase of the moon. We only see another group of tourists from BKK too. It was really an authentic floating market! We went to visit a sugar plantation (which is really awesome!). We also got to eat some of the snacks available. As my sister and her friend are afraid of dogs, Oi is really nice, she assists to get the dogs away from them. She is really friendly and helpful!Although BKK tour is a little pricey, I will engage them again and refer my friends too due the personalised tour that they provide and their responsive emails!

2 amazing days with Air. On a recent business trip to Bangkok I ended up staying 2 extra days to explore. I booked the full day Bangkok Highlights tour and the Authentic Ayutthaya tour. Air was my guide both days and I had a phenomenal time! It was such an incredible experience to have a one on one local guide show me around her Thailand. Air was great, she met me at my hotel in the morning and took care of every possible detail. All I had to do was follow, look, listen and eat! We traveled via tuk tuk, sky train, long tail boat in Bangkok, exploring the amazing Wat Pho and Grand Palace. We walked around the produce and flower markets and then took a long tail boat tour of the canal. Along the way we sampled food from various street vendors and stopped for a great lunch. At the end of the day she brought me back to my hotel and recommended a nearby place for dinner.The next morning she picked me up in a comfortable van for the trip to Ayutthaya. The van was stocked with water and cold wet clothes (it was super hot out!). We explored the amazing ruins of Ayutthaya, cruised the river on a long tail boat and visited a non-profit Elephant reserve and fed the elephants. We also ate another amazing lunch where I tried things I never would have if on my own.A great thing about both days what that we traveled at our own pace, without having to worry about sticking with a big tour group and rushing to get back on a bus to the next destination.And, since I had to check out of the hotel the morning of the Ayutthaya tour, we brought my luggage in the van and she dropped me off at the airport at the end of the day!Thank you Air!! If I'm ever lucky enough to find myself back in Thailand, I'll be booking another tour with BKK.

Best of Bangkok.. We spent a weekend in Bangkok and wanted to see as much as possible so contacted BKK tours and we were delighted with the friendly response and professional service. We took two tours...an all day overall Bangkok tour on saturday and the wonderful train and floating market tour on Sunday morning. We felt like we had seen the very best of this busy city and were amazed that we had the peace and serenity of the local countryside as well. Of course we had the amazing miss April as our very efficient and delightful guide and her knowledge and English were outstanding and the sweetest, kindest and funniest companion that we could have asked for. We had the tour guide to ourselves and were treated as the the most important people in Thailand that weekend ( apart from their beloved king and queen of course)! Highly recommend this tour company and their amazing team. Bangkok is a city quite unlike any other!

Tha Ka floating market - as Authentic as Authentic gets. We did a 1/2 day railway tour and Tha Ka floating market tour with Ms. Gift. After reading all the positive reviews in TripAdvisor, our expectations were raised. Despite the already high expectations, I'm very happy to say that the tour STILL managed to surpass our expectations!We enjoyed ourselves on the 1/2 day tour - in fact it was the highlight of our holiday in Bangkok. The Tha Ka market, which has "original openings" on only a few days a month based on the lunar calendar, must have been as authentic as authentic gets. This was the real deal. Apart from ~1-2 other small groups, we were practically the only tourists there to experience the charm of the local market & its friendly people. No tourist souvenirs of any sort, just the freshest of vegetables & fruits sold by old ladies in long tail boats. We also had one of our best meals (boat noodles, skewered meat, some sort of omelette, fried bananas) in Bangkok, prepared straight from the boats... simple but very satisfying!The Maeklong railway market and the leisurely boat ride to visit a coconut sugar farm, run by an elderly aunty was just as interesting. We were shown the whole process of collecting the "coconut flower sap", the boiling and the stirring... & to top it off, we also got to sample some delicious coconut sugar.Ms Gift was an excellent guide. She was VERY polite & respectful & connected well with people i.e. with us as well as with the local people. She had interesting stories to tell & made us feel like we had known each other for a long time! The whole tour was relaxing with enough time to snap pictures and take in all the wonderful sights. Really, what more could we ask for? If we do return to Bangkok one day, we would definitely look for Ms Gift again!

Simply the Best!. We enjoyed a fantastic Temple tour with Aire. She is truely a great Guide and a lovely person. She is knowledgeable and is eager to show you her country and all that is has to offer.The weather was very hot and humid during our trip but AIre made sure we had water to drink and found shade so we could take a rest when needed. Her driver was very good and his van was comfortable and air conditioned. Two of the individuals in our party had difficulty walking so Aire. Again she was very helpful and accomodating by making sure that they were able to keep up with her. I would highly recommend BKK Tours and hope to get back to Bangkok for a more extensive tour of Thailand with Aire. We especially enjoyed our Long Boat tour of the canals and our stop at a small local temple. We met a Monk who blessed a beautiful little Buddha that we purchased. The canal tour allowed us to see children at play in the canals as well as observe the living conditions of the thousands of people who live in the houses along the canals.Bangkok is amazing, you will see luxury hotels next to seedy night markets. You can trust Aire to make sure that you enjoy a safe but wonderful tour of her fascintaing country.

Excellent private tour with very attentive guide.. We did our half day railway and floating markets tour in July with Air. She was absoultely wonderful and very accomodating. Railway market was amazing and I would say highlight of the tour. My husband and I were left in awe to see how people moved their shops when the train came and within seconds the train had left, the business went on as usual. We totally loved it. Too bad that the Kha floating market was not open so we settled with the other one which turned into tourist market. (Air has already informed us before we booked the tour) Thank you, Air for those noodle soups. Dave is still talking about it. And we both love a boat ride in the canal and seeing how people's daily lives in those area. We will be back with some northern Thailand tour ;)

1/2 Day Floating Markets.next day 1/2 day Chinatown tour.. I was met by Oi my guide at my hotel in Chinatown and we drove of in really lovely van to firstly go to Maeklong markets. These markets are done on a railway line that is used 4 times a day by a train that terminates at Maeklong Station then 15 minutes later returns back to Bangkok. I was amazed by how everything was moved out of the way of the train. Then put it all back out again while the train terminates at the station. I got some great photos with the train just about touching my face as it went by. We then walked back to the van and then drove on to the Tha Kha markets, These markets are held on weekends but there are also specials ones held on week days with dates that revolve around phases of the moon. As this was a week day it was all the more special as there was only one other tourist there when we arrived. These markets are for the locals and are truly authentic. I had a great time taking photos of all the locals trading from their boats along the canals.Later we went for a paddle in one of the boats which took us to a palm sugar plantation. To me this was the highlight of the day. The lovely lady there had put some cut bananas into one of the vats that the palm sugar was being extracted from. A sweet treat later just for us. We had lunch back at the markets from one of the boats selling food. It was a great morning and I would really recommend this tour, the food and the boat trip.The next day we started later in the morning and went on a walking tour of Chinatown. I had already had a bit of a look around the afternoon before. However this tour was going to take me up a maze of narrow alleyways and lanes. I met a lot of locals here and I got some great shots of them and where they lived. I got to drink iced tea from a plactic bag and had a great time looking around their shared kitchens and shops. Oi was well known by the locals here and they did not mind my intrusion into their daily lives one bit. At the end of the tour Oi took me to a Chinese temple which was a little different from the other temples I had seen. This is another tour I would recommend. In fact I don't think you can fault the range of tours BKK have.

BKK Tours is hands down the absolute best!. If you are doing a little pre-tour checking to determine which Bangkok tour company to help with your site seeing, then stop looking. BKK Tours is hands down the absolute best! No matter what your site seeing preferences are, BKK can accommodate them. If you do not see what interests you on the standard tour packages, then simply ask and Air or Michiel will help you put together a tour package that does, which is exactly what they did for my business associate and me. Three days of customized touring, and not one glitch in the program. Our guides (Air and Gift) were knowledgeable, professional, and absolute delights. They went the extra distance to ensure that we were happy with the tour, including locating monkeys for photo ops, watching for (and finding) exotic birds in the coconut groves, and searching for Monitor lizards in the canals. Your average tour guide will not do that for you! The transportation (a luxury van) was clean, quiet, and cool, and the driver very safety conscious and courteous. The iced drinks and chilled towels that awaited us on our return to the van were especially welcome! The lunches were excellent and prepared by traditional Thai restaurants situated in scenic spots along the river (no worries germaphobes, the facilities were clean and bug free).Our three days of customized tours included too many sites to list in entirety here, so I will limit the discussion to just a few. The JEATH museum, Hellfire Pass, and the Chungkai War Cemetery are definite must sees. Whether you are a history buff or not, young or old, you cannot help but be moved by these sites and the reminder that so many sacrificed their futures in order for us to enjoy our todays. Walking between the tracks on the wooden railway bridges along the River Kwai is a wonderful way to see the river (from above) and the surrounding countryside. You can take the train ride, but then you have to fight for a window seat and the photo ops are more limited. Oh, if you are afraid of heights, then…well, just do not look down!For the naturalist / botanist, the Tha kha Floating Market with a tour of a local coconut grove and sugar farm, the Suanluang Rama IX Botanical Garden, and a canal tour with a visit to the orchid farms should be added to your list of things to see. You will be rewarded with lots of colours, sites, and sounds if you do, including monkeys, birds, reptiles, exotic fruits, and beautiful flowers. Some the locations are in the dense jungle and reached by a rowboat (you do not have to help row unless you want to), while the others are reached by simply stepping out of the van. Remember to wear a hat and sunscreen, but no worries if you forget because the guide will provide you with a shade umbrella.In closing, no matter what your site seeing preferences are, BKK Tours can accommodate them. BKK Tours is hands down the absolute best!Blackwell & Company, LLCKristian C. Blackwell, CPA, CVA, CFEJuly 30, 2012

Professional guide who knows her stuff!. Booked a whole day tour online with BKK Tours and it was the highlight of our Bangkok stay.Our guide Air provided us with a truly amazing Thai experience. Her command of English was extremely good and knowledgeable in all aspects. The husband and wife team were professional with prompt email replies, they were more than happy to accommodate our requests and gave us the choice to pay upfront or on the day.Our day was full-on, starting with the train market, floating market followed by a wonderful authentic Thai lunch set right on a river. Whenever we returned to our spectacularly decked out van, we were handed cold face washers and a cold bottle of water - much appreciated by the four of us.After a most relaxing lunch (included in the price) we made our way back to Bangkok to visit the Grand Palace & Emerald Temple, Reclining Buddha and ended with an amazing tour through the canals on a Longtail boat. I can thoroughly recommend Air without hesitation. She went beyond what we were expecting.Thank you Air and your wonderful driver.

BKK tours worth every cent....and more!. We visited Bangkok for 4 days, 2 of which we booked Air to show us around. We booked online, prepaid and correspondence pre-arrival was excellent. She offered helpful advice on using the fast train from airport to city and getting to our hotel safelyAir was such a great guide, and it was well worth the money investing in a few days of her time. With a young child (9yo boy) she was able to engage him and teach him some the culture and fully immerse us in the experience of Bangkok.Without Air I think we wouldn’t have been able to navigate our way around with such efficiency and get as much out of visit as we did with her.On day 1 we visited an assortment of palace’s and great locations – without her we would have seen some beautiful things BUT not really understood what we were looking at. She gave us history, cultural background and personal insight into Thailand and Bangkok. We did so much I can’t even list them……but it was worth every cent.Day 2 we were chauffeur driven (very polite and courteous man) in an extremely luxurious minivan, with 32” TV and movies to entertain our son on our drive out to Kanchanaburi, war museum and River Kwai. We stopped at various interesting sights along like the salt farms & floating markets along the way.Air gave us lots of advice on how not to get caught by the ‘tourist sellers’, what was and wasn’t a good buy and where we’d get a better price.I would 100% recommend BKK Tours and Air as a guide and it was worth every cent, for all the memories she created for us. When in Bangkok again, we use again.From Sharon, Shayne and Brady

Excellent day tour, tailor made to our request and arrangements went like clockwork. I pre booked a tour with BKK over the Internet before leaving home. I was slightly worried that I had perhaps booked something and paid in advance which would not turn out as advertised, but it was all I could have hoped for and more. We had Air as our guide and she expertly showed us round 'her' Bangkok. She proved to be knowledgable and keen to explain anything she could about Anything we could think to ask. I would definitely recommend a BKK tour.

Best Tour of my Life (so far). Me and my friend stayed just five days in Bangkok and four of those days BKK Tours took excellent care of us. In short; it was the best tour experience we ever made. From the first E-Mail contact till the last Laa gawn everything was just great. I arrived Monday evening at 18:00 and we were picked up by the wonderful Air at 19:00 from the Hotel. Air showed us interesting night spots of Bangkok, we met local people, ate local food and drove with a tuk tuk through Chinatown. Air is a intelligent, charming and funny guide. We never felt we were just customers of her more like a friend. For the next three days Gift was our guide. First day she picked us up on time at the Hotel and we went to Ayutthaya. And same as with Air, she never gave us the "just another customer" feeling. Gift explained all the interesting parts, showed us great photo spots and the way she organized the tour, was that we always avoided the crowds. Again we ate excellent local food in a non tourist restaurant. Full of wonderful experiences and images in our heads we went back to the hotel in the late afternoon and we were sure that day would be the Highlight of "Our days with Gift". We were sure this day in Ayutthaya could not be topped. How wrong we were. Next day; Gift met us at the Hotel before 7:00. We went to Kanchanaburi and on my special request "Elephant World" a sanctuary for old and abused Elephants. Kanchanaburi is famous for the River Kwae and it's bridge. The place is nice and always very hot. We were lucky to have a mini van with air condition with us. After we saw the bridge we went by speed boat to a local restaurant down the river. Again excellent food and relaxing surroundings. After this; Elephant World. This place is just wonderful. And if you are interested in meeting local people or other people from around the world who work there as volunteer and also want to help the Elephants: you must go there!!It's not a tourist place. You have to do some work, get dirty and wet but what you will receive in return is so much worth it. The Elephants you meet here are old and some were abused but Elephant World is a place where they can live happy and free. It's an unforgettable experience to swim with them, see how they play in the water,... On our last day with Gift we went in the morning to the train market, which is an very interesting place and you have the chance to see and eat some very interesting food. This place is a bit too crowed with other tourist and their guides. Some of those other groups don't behave well and disturb the local people. But Gift took also care of them and remind them what they should not to. Gift always interacts very very well with the local people and they look sometimes they are friends. After that we went to Tha Kha floating market. Well I never been to another floating market but this place is just wonderful. No other tourists there except two other BKK groups, so it was like a BKK family meeting. And Gift chatted again in a very relaxed way with the local people there. We went with a old lady on her boat along the river through jungle like coconut and palm tree woods to a house of a very old woman who produces coconut sugar. It's amazing to see that. Those people were all so friendly to us.At noon back to Bangkok were we booked also the "Bangkok Highlights" tour. Saw the Grand Palace and Wat Phra Kaew (temple of the Emerald Buddha). Finished the day with a boat tour through the clongs. In the end we had some time with Gift in a nice restaurant at the river to thank her for the experiences we made.BKK Tours is not cheap but as always; quality has it's prize. If you are looking for a great Thailand experience where you will get wonderful skilled guides, meet local people, eat at places where the locals eat and .... Don't look any further: If you ask yourself which guide you should book. I recommend BKK Tours with all my heart!!Now I am back at my office in Tokyo and just wonder when I can have my next tour with BKK.Kawpkoon Krab and Laa gawn Air and Gift!!

Good personal service..:). We booked a 1 day tour to Mae Klong railway market, Tha Kha floating market, Grand Palace and Wat Pho. We were very happy with the service provided by Ms Oi, our tour guide. At Mae Klong railway market, we waited to see how the stall make way for the train to pass thru, interesting. We were also fascinated by the colourful vegetables sold in the market. Ms Oi bought us some local snacks too. Tha Kha floating market was recommended by Air since it coincides with our travel date. This market only opens on certain lunar dates, and we were lucky to be able to see a authentic floating market compare to the tourist one. We were also brought to see how palm sugar was made. Lunch was at a Navy Clubhouse along Chao Praya river. Overall, we were very happy by the service provided by Ms Oi from BKK Tours,

Very nice half day tour with Air!!!. We booked a half day tour with Air during our stay on Bangkok. The booking was very easy via email and we got immediate answer. Air picked us up from the hotel, perfectly in time and showed us the Grand Palace and went with us on a very beautiful Canal Boat Tour which gave us an idea on the thai way of living, and we saw some fantastic views! We saw 2 metre long lake lizards and fed cat fish in the canels, which was amazing! In the place we had the best introduction of the history of the king and the traditions and religion in bangkok! we couldnt of asked for a better half day, it was totally worth the money and lots of fun, riding in the tuk tuk and on the long tail boats! Thanks for the great tour, we can really only recommend you do this :)

Two Amazing Trips with Air and Michiel. For the first trip, the market tour we were picked up at 7am from our hotel by Air and a driver in a luxury minivan. We drove to Samut Songkram province to the railway market. On the way we stopped at a salt farm Air explained the process. We were able to take some photo's and ask questions of Air.When we arrived at the market we were able to walk through and with Air talk to the vendors. Air knew the best places to stand when the train came through. The whole market was fascinating. We then caught the train back through the market so that we could see the the vendors putting back their goods after the train had passed. The driver met us further down the line and was waiting with cold towels and water. We drove onto Saduak floating market, this was a busy market however Air made sure we saw important sights, we had time to browse and take in the surroundings wandering through the market on foot before going through the market by boat. Air helped me barter for a souvenir and we also had sampled some of the food. We did the "meet the locals" tour for our next trip. Air and Michiel collected us from our hotel and we went by taxi to Hua Lamphong station where we caught the train to Makkasan for a visit to a slum area. Michiel gave me some valuable photography tuition while we waited for train. Once at Makkasan we walked through the market talking to the stallholders before moving into the residential area. We met lots of interesting people and were able to talk with them with Air. After leaving Makkasan we visited a local amulet workshop where we could see large Buddha's being made before going over to Wat Suthat a temple off the tourist beat. The day finished with a trip down the river in a boat back to central area.Food, drinks boat fees,train tickets , tuk tuks were all included in the price of these tours. Throughout both trips Air pointed out things of interest. During the second trip Michiel gave me lots of tips and tuition in photography, while Air continued to point out things of interest to my partner and myself. Air and Michiel are an excellent team, they tailor the tour to your needs and wishes and never rush you along. We had two amazing trips and I would recommend BKK tours to anyone who want to see the sights in and around Bangkok. I would also recommend adding in the photography tuition from Michiel for anyone with an interest in photography. I will certainly do more trip with BKK tours.

The best ever day in Thailand ever, ever, ever!!!!!. Air was fantastic! So friendly and we visited places we would never been able to by ourselves. From start to finish we had a great day, the transport van was 1st class and we had no rush at all. It was just me and my partner and we were treated like stars. Nothing was left undiscovered. BKK tours are the most professional and personal tour company we have ever come across the world, and would recommend to all that vist Thailand, Bangkok. To everyone out there, don't look past BKK tours, as you will regret not using them. 10/10 service and will certainly book again at our next visit. Thanks for all the team, for making Amy and I so welcome on our honeymoon. "dont think about it, just book!!!!!!"

A true local experience. My husband and I recently traveled to Thailand for our 5 year anniversary. Air came highly recommend by another friend who had a great experience with her months prior. We reserved her for 2 days. The first day, she took us on the Bangkok highlights tour. We not only got to see all the sights, but we also experienced Bangkok very locally by taking tuk tuks and river taxis. The highlight for us was not taking a long tail boat through the canals, but eating at the Navy Club restaurant with all locals. It was one of our favorite meals in Thailand! On the second day, Air picked us up to take us on the Market tour. We traveled to Samut Songkhram or the "train market" where Air provided us tastes of local fruits or anything we were interested in trying. Then, we went to the famous floating market and took a long tail boat around. Since it was our anniversary, Air set up a fabulous dinner at the Deck overlooking Wat Arun at sunset. After dinner, she took us out in Bangkok. First, we stopped at Khao San Road where all the backpackers go and got a big bag of crickets for us to try. My husband ate one and she got a picture of him that was priceless. After this experience, we had a drink at a nearby bar followed by another drink at the top of Lebua State Tower. We appreciate the time and planning that went into making our anniversary special. I highly recommend Air and BKK Tours as you feel like a friend. What a wonderful company!

A true 'gift'. I recently (April 2012) had two day tours with of BKK tours from Bangkok. As I was by myself I thought I would benefit from a guide for each day, saving me having to sort things out for myself and leaving more time to take photos, my all-consuming hobby. The first was Bangkok highlights and the second was to Ayutthaya. What can I say? My guide Miss Gift was a delight! She took the time to find out just what interested me and then tailored the day to suit. The first day, hoping on and off different forms of local transport as well a walking (another thing I love) between some attractions, she took care of everything. From beautiful temples to the flower and vegetable markets, lunch at a lovely restaurant over the river, a tour of the 'Venice of the East' canals, she was a constant font of information, as well as a delightful companion. The second day was further afield in a air-conditioned vehicle with a pleasant friendly driver. Again I had a great day with the background and history at each site visited clearly explained in the most interesting manner. We visited temples and ruins, cruised the river and lunched at a restaurant that was 'local'. At all times Miss Gift was concerned for my comfort and again went to great lengths to point out those things she knew I was interested in. I would highly recommend BKK tours to anyone. Miss Gift was truly a gift to this tourist.

Meet the locals... Air was my guide for this great tour. She took me through the slum area of Bangkok, then to tourist free temples. These temples were fantastic, with rows of buddahs and great photo opportunities. We had lunch at the Naval club and then Air took me on a long tail boat ride. The highlight of the tour was stopping at a temple that had been hit by the floods. Air had a gift for the monks there, and I was able to take photos of a temple that one would not normally go to. It was a great tour and Air was a fantastic guide.

Don't hesitate!. I enjoyed a very special day with Air. I was treated like a VIP passenger for a full day of touring to the the train market, the floating market and to experience local life. Every where we went people allowed us into their spaces at a more personal level because everyone we encountered clearly adored her. Because of this and because of Air's great eye and guidance, I captured some great photographs that I will have for a lifetime. This tour was (hands-down) the highlight of my trip.

Amazing Bangkok trip. Having Michiel (our photo tour guide), Air and Gift (Air on our first day and Gift on our succeeding three days) as our guides are amazing. With their in depth knowledge of Thailand, they acquainted us to Thai people's customs and beliefs in such a friendly manner- in an extremely personalized tour, I felt that it was actually our friends who were showing us around. We rode different sorts of transportation going around Bangkok... We ate authentic Thai food and tried local delicacies... We didn't only see, learned and appreciated beautiful palaces, amazing temples and buddhas-- we also somehow connected with the people through them (Air and Gift) that the locals were willing to get their pictures taken with a smile.Air is such a warm company to be with, nice, friendly and kind- that makes her my favorite.  Michiel, my favorite photo tour guide is of course, great! When he learned that I'm just a beginner. He briefly but clearly explained to me the basics in photagraphy and as we go along, he taught me perspective and gave me some tips on how to make my pictures look more appealing. I learned a lot from him considering the limited time we had for discussion as we are scheduled to visit the Markets, Makassan slums, china town, a park for sunset shooting and some places for night photography. He explains, gives instructions and takes a few pictures to set as an example and then, lets us do our own thing patiently waiting until we've satisfied ourselves with our shots.Another favorite tour guide, Gift, paid careful attention to our comfort and made sure we were having fun. It's not just about the cold towels and nice cool van waiting for us after a tour. She took care of us like a friend would, to a friend.i.e, If you are a quiet person (like me), she, makes you feel at ease and engages you to friendly conversations, thus making you more comfortable with the tour-- Now that's just more than tour guiding. That's "Extra Mile" I wish I could enumerate more funny and cool extra mile experience with Gift, but this review will just go on and on..Yes, all three of them are my favorite. They all have different approach in making the tour comfortable and fun and I realized, whenever me and my sister talk about our Bangkok trip- they always play a part in our stories. :)

BKK Tours is AWESOME!. My sister and I love BKK Tours! Our whole Bangkok experience was a lot more richer because of them. Communication is easy and straightforward. They are transparent with their prices, their service is excellent and they are very knowledgeable. Before the tour, we mentioned to them that we are into photography and they took note of it and opened many photo opportunities for us. They are very flexible with their schedule and itinerary too. I would recommend them to anyone. And I would join their tour again. Air, Michiel and Gift, thank you!

Funtastic Photography tour in Bangkok !!!!. Today, would be my 2nd day in Bangkok and I have a great day of enjoying Bangkok. I am choosing to be accompanied and guided by BKKPHOTOGRAPHY.com on my trip today.I found the services are truly awesome !!!I can have a breath taking scenery and also the real perspective of the Bangkok life pulse. Meets the local, having warm conversation with them is one of the best from Air.I really recommend BKKTOURS.com for the Bangkok tours, especially for the photographer whom would like to have a real experiences of Bangkok.Thank you Air.

Fantastic photography tour .... My wife and I spent a day with Michiel Bosch and our guide Oi soaking in the sights of Bangkok ... Michiel's insights as to the best places to photograph and get a feel for the local lifestyle made the trip worthwhile. I would highly recommend BKK Tours for those who want a personalized experience.

Wonderful experience with customized Meet the Locals tour. Air met us at our hotel at 7.00 am. We caught a taxi to the Makkasan station, had a look around at the local food market, and then walked through the slums of Makkasan. This was an amazing experience. Through Air, we spoke to the people who lived there, they were very friendly and some welcomed us into their homes to show us how they live. We visited Jim Thompson's Museum and visited the first silk factory in Bangkok. Truly fascinating to see how silk fabric is made from start to finish. Walking through the streets, we saw a local school, temple with monks, had lunch at a local restaurant. We then visited the Chatuchak market to pick a few treasures! Air assisted us with the bartering which was a great help. On the way back we called in to Chinatown also.This day was one of the highlights of a great trip to Thailand. Air was just wonderful - so friendly, knowledgeable, and nothing was too much trouble. She provided us with refreshments throughout the day. Lunch was included in our tour price. I would highly recommend BKK Tours to anyone wanting to see Bangkok.

Amazing. Best decision to use bkk.. After contacting a number of companies we decided to go with bkk based on the swift responses to emails, the price guide offered and the shaping of itineries to suite what we wanted to see. We did a day in Ayutthaya and a day in kanchanaburri that included markets on the way. We had an amazing time in Bangkok and these tours really made our experience unforgettable. Gift picked us up bright and early and off we went in a lovely mini van. Gift was a fantastic guide, easy going and managed to know what we wanted to find out from each place. Her knowledge and enthusiasm never dimmed through our two days and her photography skills were gratefully utilised! Lunch was included and gift made perfect choices that both of us enjoyed, including a lot of lemonade for us! If/ when we return to Bangkok we would use bkk and ask for gift. A lovely two days spent with a very knowledgable friend. Thank you.

Incredible ~. Before arriving I selected BKK Tours for my introduction to Bangkok. I could not be happier. Our Guide, Air was wonderful! She was able to customize each outing to our likes. We ventured off the beaten paths to local markets, restaurants as well as the must see attractions. Her transportation is a plush, air conditioned conversion, fully stocked with the necessities and an excellent driver (very safe) I would reccomend Air and BKK tours to anyone, since she tailors your experience to what you request. Our morning at the Palace and Temple, her vast knowledge of Thailand's history was remarkable and added so much to the incredible beauty. On a 1 to 10 scale, I give BKK Tours and Air an ELEVEN!

Great way to see BKK in a day!. We only had a day to see the sights....Air picked us up at 7:00 a.m. and it was packed with exposure to Thailand the rest of the day. By the time it was done we were tired but completely happy with the experience. Train market, floating market,boat ride, train ride, palace, reclining buddha and all done with grace and ease! Air took care of everything from paying all entrance fees, to ordering lunch, to helping us bargain for goods!I highly recommend their services!

The Perfect Day in Bangkok. I was with Michiel and Air on the 14th of March for a customized tour. I had a great day with them and the tour met all my expectations. I had the best time ever and have been to Bangkok many times but this day is the only special day I will remember. I will surely take another tour of the many choices they have if I find another chance to go back...

BKK - finally a guide who doesn't take you to buy tourist tat!. BKK Tours is a small, husband and wife, company, employing a handful of local people. This means that you get to deal with 'the boss' rather than a large faceless conglomerate.Air, our guide for the day, turned out to be the co-owner, with her husband , Michaile. BKK has obviously put masses of research into what visitors want when they visit Bangkok. We're short of time, not used to the temperatures and seeking a cultural, historical and contemporary experience all in the space of a day.A tall order, by anyone's standards, but we managed to see so much and all in an imaginative programme which included visits to the historic sites of Wat Pho and the Grand Palace and a trip on one of the famous long tailed boats. But it was the extras that really made a difference - we travelled by tuk tuk, water taxi, Sky Train and even walked, where we had the opportunity to eat some street food with the confidence that Air knew that the vendor was ok and the food was good quality. Air took us to a small temple, which is way off the visitor route which is where we experienced the true tranquility of Buddism.On a practical note, Air collects you from your hotel, provides refreshments and comfort stops throughout the day and takes you to the Navy Club for a very nice lunch, transport and entrance fees throughout your day are all included in the price and she takes you back to your hotel at the end of the day - great service throughout.We really liked the mix of old and new. Air is a qualified guide, she has graduated and has a wealth of knowledge about the history and industrialisation of Bangkok. What we were really impressed with was that she didn't take us to any of the usual 'gem markets', 'silk shops' or other over-priced tourist rip offs. She did, however, take us to the flower market and the vegetable market, which was really interesting, provided some great photo opportunities and allowed us to meet ordinary Thai people in their everyday settings.We would have absolutely no hesitation in recommending BKK Tours - you will not be disappointed.PS ask Air to sing the traditional name of what we today know as Bangkok - you will be amazed!

Interest tour with Air to markets. Air collected us in a limousine at 7am from our hotel. The car was very clean and comfortable and the driving was excellent. We drove to the railway market stopping at a salt farm on the way. Air explained about the salt farm and we took some photos of the work. We went to the railway market and watched the train drive through. Air knew many of the stall holders and encouraged them to pose for photos. My friend likes to take photographs and Air spent the whole tour speaking to people and encouraging good photo opportunities. We took the train to the next station in order to drive through the market and Air arranged for my friend to sit in a seat at the end of the train to get a good view of the vendors putting back their products after the train drove through. We met the driver again and drove to the floating market, this was the touristy floating market as the more authentic one was not open today. The market was very interesting Air knew lots of the vendors again and some good photos to take. We had a boat ride through the market. Air took care of all the drinks and tickets etc as part of the cost of the tour. She also helped us barter for a souvenir and gave advice and information as requested. We had a really lovely tour and have booked another before we return home.

Amazing Chinatown Tour. I did the Chinatown tour in Dec 2011 with Ms Oi. I had visited Chinatown in Bangkok before but hoped a guide would allow me to see more of the local life. Ms Oi was an excellent guide and showed me areas I would never have found alone. I got some excellent opportunities for photo's off the main streets. Ms Oi knew the area well and was able to answer many questions. I really enjoyed the tour and plan to do some more.

Great Tour. We recently took a day tour with Oi as our guide. It was a great day and she was most knowledgable. I can reccommend the tours if its your first time in Bangkok. the only reason i did not give it 5 is that the tour is a bit expensive considering what we got in Chiang mai later. You could do the tour for half the price yourself if you knew where to go and do but then again you would not have the benefit of her knowledge and where to go. Having said that a really great tour and well organised.

Wonderful photography tour. We had a wonderful customized photography tour with Michiel and Oi. We started in the early morning and were picked up with a very comfortable minivan. During the 1h ride to the railway market Michiel explained the first important points of photography. One of us was advanced and the other one was less advanced but he was able to make it interesting for both of us. We can highly recommend this market and the short train ride. In the temples he explained how to take more creative photos and not to miss the wonderful details. Of course we learned also a bit of Buddhism. Afterwards Oi guided us through authentic Chinatown with lots of beautiful spots for example Chinese temples. We would never have walked these little streets or tasted these delicious snacks ... we would have missed all of this without Michiel and Oi. By the way: drinks, entry fees, snacks, lunch - everything was included. That made the tour very comfortable as we could concentrate on enjoying the day.Finally we want to thank Michiel, Oi and our driver Peter for this awesome daytrip, for taking care of us so well, for the loads of explanations about street photography and portraits, and of course for taking photos of us (it doesn't happen often to have pictures from us taken by a professional photographer).We would highly recommend the photography tour option to everybody (beginner or advanced) who wants to improve his photography skills. It's really worth the money.

Fantastic company, wonderful Air ( Photajaman). BKK tours is simply fantastic! Two years ago when I was visiting Bangkok with my son we were lucky enough to have Air (aka: Photjaman) for our guide. She took us around Bangkok the way a local would go. We took the Sky train, Subway, Tuk-Tuk, river boat, and occasionally a taxi. Air is a Thai woman who speaks excellent English and she is extremely knowledgeable about her culture and the touristic locations. She was also very nurturing; she was always ready with a cool towel or bottle of cool water on the hot days. She found wonderful temples to show us and even arranged for us to meet and speak to a Buddhist monk to explain the religion.  Air was supremely attuned to her client’s capacities; she had an innate sense of how much her client can handle on a given day. She is incredibly generous with her time, often extending her tour long after the agreed upon time is over and willing to shorten it if I requested that.. Because of my great experience with her two years ago this year when my wife and I were planning a trip to Thailand, I contacted her to make the arrangements. Now she and her husband have their own tour company BKK tours. My wife needed to cancel the trip, but was ok with my going on my own. I had some reservations about traveling on my own but I decided to do it because I knew I could rely on Air. Air and her husband Michiel arranged a perfect amount of new tours for me. I was met at the airport and taken to my hotel. The next day I had a reorientation day with Michiel who helped me learn how to use the Sky Train for the days I was on my own. I spent many wonderful days touring with Air, learning history, culture and about life in Thailand. Air is one of the best tour guides I have ever had. I am nearly 73 years old and I have traveled a lot. I wholeheartedly recommend her and BKK tours. Richard D

Interesting and entertaining one day Bangkok Highlights tour, with khun Air.. Just got back from a wonderful day out in Bangkok with Air. Everything went smoothly, Air was a gold mine of information about everything we were seeing, but also knew the best ways around the sites we saw. We went to the Bangkok flower market first, which was lovely, the flower arrangements and orchids are just mad. Then to the Royal Palace, to see the Emerald Buddha and the public rooms in the palace (the Throne Room). All the time Air made sure we saw everything and pointed out interesting features we would otherwise have missed. Tickets to everything were included inthe tour price so we never had to wait in line, and Air knew good shortcuts to avoid the crowds. We had lunch at a local restaurant overlooking the river, the restaurant was excellent and the food was lovely - lunch was also included, and we were free to select from the whole (very varied) menu of Thai dishes. We took a tuktuk to Wat Arun (the Reclining Buddha) and walked around a few of the surrounding temples and pagodas, which are beautiful, and then walked round the Reclining Buddha himself, who is just awesome. After Wat Arun, a private longtail boat through the canals across the river from the city, past old wooden houses, hidden temples and gardens. Throughout the day, Air was helpful and a delight to talk to, taking into account specific things we wanted to do and going out of her way to make sure we were comfortable and enjoying ourselves. Thank you so much, Air. I definitively recommend BKK Tours for anyone looking for a more intimate insider's view of Bangkok.
Wonderful day. Can not recommend more highly. Our guide, oi was knowledgable and a joy to spend the day with.  jM Utah USA

Outstanding tour with Gift. Gift, our guide in Bangkok was true to her name today. She took us to the Royal Palace, The Emerald Buddha, the Reclining Buddha and on a river canal trip. She was well informed and entertaining. The tour went like clockwork and the van was comfortable and clean. Gift really made it a wonderrful day and I highly recommend her and BKK Tours.

Absolutely the best decision we made in Bangkok. We were traveling for 16 days throughout Asia and planned most of the details ourselves. Wanting to make sure we got everything we could out of Bangkok- we decided to hire a guide and we are so very glad that we did. We met Air on our first day in Bangkok for the city highlights tour. We loved using tuk tuks and the skytrain to get around- much more of a local feel and so fast and convenient. Air was so knowledgeable about the temples, Grand Palace and history of Thailand. We also enjoyed the Flower Market tour and a longtail boat ride. We had a wonderful lunch at an authentic Thai restaurant (we were the only Americans there). Spending the day with Air gave us real local feel of Bangkok and we saw sights and tried foods we never would have on our own.We also booked the half day market tour with Air for the following day and could not wait to spend more time with her. We absolutely loved the railway market and again tried so many local foods we never would have known about on our own. We visited both the local floating market (Tha Kha) and the touristy Damnoen Saduak-- great way to get a feel for both and see the difference. During the tour of Tha Kha we took a row boat to the Palm Sugar farm and it was absolutely eye-opening and moving; quite an impressionable part of our trip.Overall we had two wonderful days with Air and gained a greater appreciation and understanding for Thailand that we'll forever be thankful for. I wholeheartedly recommend BKK Tours for anyone traveling to Thailand!

A fabulous 1 1/2 days touring Bangkok with a wonderful guide. BKK Tours in Bangkok was the company we chose for a full day plus a half day of private touring in Bangkok while on an asian cruise.. Our guide Gift could not have been better and made sure we saw everything on my list plus some (longtailed boat ride on Chaopraya River and into some canals, Wat Arun, Pho Temple complex which includes the Reclining Buddha,, the Grand Palace with its many buildings, the Flower Market, and a delicious lunch with 5 different dishes). She was very well informed, spoke excellent english, and an absolute pleasure to be with. We traveled by car from ship to city, then by longtailed boat, ferry, tuk-tuk, taxi, on foot, and express boat. Our half day tour took us outside of Bangkok to the Train Market and Floating Market as well as the Royal Handicraft Center before our return to the ship. We also had a chance to sample a variety of foods sold at the markets. The care and flexibility of this company enabled us to make the very best use of our limited time in Bangkok I highly recommend BKK Tours for shore excursions, day tours or extended tours in Thailand.

Fantastic guide, complete flexible tour, will do more tours!. We booked a half day tour to the floating market and the market on the railway. We traveled with 4 adults and 3 very young children, so we needed flexibility. And we got it! The private minivan that picked us up at the hotel was fabulous, the tour guide, mrs. Gift, very friendly and helpful, she loves children and she speaks very good english. The floating market was rather crowded since it's so popular, but mrs. Gift noticed the children were a little upset and she proposed to make a stop and get an icecream for the kids. We could tell her what we would like to see or do, and she would do her very best to make it happen! The railway market was very special to see, and our guide was looking very carefully if it was safe for the children. We had a lovely local lunch at a quit restaurant, where the children could relax a little after visiting the crowded markets. We will surely book trips with BKK tours again when we visit Bangkok.

BKK Tours will enhance your experience & impressions of Thailand!. We discovered BKK (Air and Michiel Bosch) in late 2009 when we did a Google search for Bangkok Tour Guides. We found many who were listed, but only 2 who responded to our inquiries. Somehow, through the friendliness of the BKK response, we decided to go with them. They pulled together a 20-day itinerary that hit all of our points-of-interest...and not just in Bangkok...but in Chiangmai, Chiang Rai and Phuket as well.One doesn't need to spend much time with Air adn Michiel to realize that wonderful friendships have been forged. Air and Michiel love people and people love them! As for their tours...Air's alley walking tour of Chinatown, the boat trip to the sugar plantation, the visits to the many temples and the tours of the various markets were unforgettable. She took us to terrific out-of-the-way restaurants; she took us on longtail boat tours; tours to palaces; tours to temples; day tours; night tours; BKK helped us experience Bangkok in a way that I suspect few others do. Further, BKK set us up with additional guides and scheduled more unforgettable activities in Chiangmai...Tiger Kingdom; elephant tours; walking tours; shopping tours; a Thai cooking class...all experiences that should not be missed. It was the same when we went from Chiangmai to Chiang Rai...and again when we went to Phuket. We finished our trip in Bangkok with Air and Michiel. It was hard to say goodbye as they had made our entire Thailand experience one that will live forever in our hearts and memories. We have traveled extensively throughout Europe, Africa, South America, and other parts of Asia. I simply can't recommend BKK enough. Use them! You'll never regret it!

One of the Best Days of my Life! Really!. I had one day to see Bangkok - my flight was at midnight - and for the first time in my life I hired a tour guide. The best decision I could have made, and unknowingly happened to book probably the best guide in Bangkok. Air is her name and she and her Dutch husband (she's Thai) run their business with obvious attention and love for people and their city. She makes the running around this bustling city easy - the tuk tuk was fun and a quick and cheap way to get around. She sees in your eyes what you want to do and then says "Let's do it!" Nothing is out of the question - your desire is what motivates her. I love Chinatowns in all cities so that is the tour I chose. I loved the nitty gritty part of the city - there is nothing to fear in going into the nooks and crannies (dark alleys!!) with Air by your side. With a smile on her face the whole time - people engaged with us and I had the time of my life. When- not if - I return to Bangkok - I will book another tour with Air. Absolutely, without a doubt. Btw, her price is very reasonable - so think of a tip when you pay up!!

Fab cycle around Bangkok. Had an amazing morning cycling through back streets, Chinatown, visiting temples and making merit, tasting Thai sweets and touring the flower market whilst being entertained by a very knowledgable guide who took lots of photos and took us on a tour that let us sample some of the real Bangkok! Well worth the time and cycling effort!!

Best day in Bangkok. Great tour, would certainly recommend to anyone in Bangkok. The vibe is positve the whole time, we saw great places in Bangkok and learned a lot about the city and the traditions. The guide shared great stories with us making this our best day in Bangkok.

First Bangkok Bike Tour. Pleasant experience exploring Bangkok City and Nature Trial through professional guided cycling tour. Get to see both the urban and rural livestyle of the Thais. Will done to the team of staffs at "Follow Me Bike Tours"
Bangkok 2016. Extremely well organized tour... the best way to discover this city in a very short period of time... Peach was an amazing guide!

Great Day Out. Most enjoyable morning seeing Bangkok away from the tourist scene. Well equipped bikes. Excellent guides who have great enthusiasm for showing you around the varied and fascinating back streets, markets and temples. A memory that will last, thank you.

Amazing experience!!!. We did the Siam Boran tour with our guide Tom and he was awesome! He educated us on some highlights of Thailand and taught us a little bit about Buddhism. I would highly recommend this tour, thank you for such a great experience.. Kapunka!

Excellent Biking in Bangkok. Very Enjoy 4 hours biking in Bangkok. I think I never will go to trod in Bangkok but biking is very wonderful. Beside biking, the tour bring us to go Flower market. And go to Chinese, Thai Temple, moreover, the tourist guide introduce the temple very detail. Wonderful, Exciting and Excellent bike tour.

Simply wonderful.. My bike tour with Peach was a fun, adventurous, and a unique way to experience the city. In my last tour of Bangkok, I hit all of the "must see" attractions. This time, I realized just how much I had missed. The bike tour was great because I got to see the ins and outs of the city while exploring the secret alleys of Bangkok. Peach answered all of my annoying foreigner questions with a smile and sincerity. Thank you Follow Me Bike Tours for an amazing day!

An experience not be missed!. We went on this trip and really enjoyed every minute of it. Whizzing through the narrow alleyways, going through China town, feeding turtles, visiting temples, flower market and lots more. Crossing the river was also an experience. We saw so much more than just walking the streets and really felt well looked after - we were given water and snacks as we went along. It was a very low stress trip. Even when we left our bag on the ferry and the guide went back with my friend to find it! It was one of the best holiday experiences. And very reasonably priced.

Biking in Bangkok. This tour is well worth doing.If you want to see more of Bangkok apart from the nightlife and shopping go for Follow me Bikes.Very little time is spent on the manic roads of Bangkok. It is all through the back streets the markets and alleys of Bangkok. You also cross the river to the quieter more rural side of the city. The route is flat, so if you can ride a bike you can go on this tour!!!
Great bike tour. I can highly recommend this to anyone. Great tour, great bikes (not all tours have good bikes) and very well prepared and guided. I enjoyed this a lot.

Braving Bangkok Cars. You get to see a very intimate view of Bangkok. On some of the narrow alleyways you pass homes and see how the average person lives. Loved going to the flower and vegetable markets and seeing the variety and quantities. Our guides were both very caring and informative. Wish we could have had more time!
Good tour and great tour guide. Teddy has been a great tour guide with enthusiam. The city bike tour riding the small lanes in the neighbourhood, temples and market is a great experience.

great time. this is a really good bike tour in the heart of bangkok, using the back streets and paths we made our way around . loads to see. i think ted was our guide who checked that we were all ok . loads of photos taken. if in bangkok just do it. one of our party reckon it was the highlight of their hoilday.
Great way to see Bangkok!. Fantastic tour of back alleys, neighborhoods, markets, temples and a boat ride. A physical, spiritual and fun way to experience Bangkok!

Best way to know the other side of bangkok. It was arranged at same day and all went good. There have 3 more couples and the whole experience was excelent. You will ride along different parts of bangkok where you can see things you wouldn't and totally worth it. The only advice is to go some minutes early at checkpoint, because is not so easy to find it.

Great ride through the backstreets of Bangkok!. The bike tour is a fantastic way to see Bangkok, lots of back streets and off the beaten track temples. The guide was extremely knowledgeable and I particularly liked the introduction to a traditional peace offering. I would definitely come back and bring other friends/family.

Riding through Bangkok in the Rains !!!. It was such an adrenaline rush, biking through Bangkok one rainy afternoon.Follow Me Bike Tours has given me quite a memory...from the lovely Teddy who was our guide...super attentive, knowledgable and very sweet-natured. I saw a side of Bangkok which I could have seen only while riding the bike in the narrow lanes, straight through the heart of Bangkok. We went to monasteries and Chinese temples and tried Chinese snacks and herbal teas. The best ofcourse, was the Royal Temple. It was breath-taking and such a heart-warming ceremony of folding the lotus flowers and offering it to Lord Buddha. The bicycles are strong and make riding in the rains seem like a cake-walk. If you like trying activities which are a little off the beaten path...do try this and the best people to try it with is 'FOLLOW ME BIKE TOURS' :)

Great way to see Bangkok. My wife and I were guided by Peachaya through the backstreets of Bangkok on very comfortable bicycles with stops for water and snacks along the way. Peachaya was warm and friendly and gave immaculate signals for us to follow. We visited China Town and crossed the river twice on ferries to see the other side. The whole trip took 4 hours.Thoroughly recommend

I would do this again.. Originally, I'd schedule a 6 hours day tour, but when I arrive on a rainy Thursday, the other riders had cancelled (I suspect due to the rain). That was not so disappointing, as I didn't relish a long day on a bike in the the drizzling rain. I was told that I could return the next morning for the 4 hour ride -- good option. The next day, there were a total of 7, with the personable and professional guide, Tong. Although I was apprehensive concerning riding a bike through Bangkok, there were only a couple of instances of waiting to cross a busy 4 land highway; otherwise, the ride took us through offbeat side alleys - with lots to see, along with a nice of tourists (like me). I've visited Bangkok and taken tours before, but next time, Follow Me Bike Tours, will be my first choice. I am a 60+ male, and the ride was very doable and a lot of fun.

Great family day. We did this tour as a family of 5 with Children aged 10 to 15. It was a great morning showing some parts of Bangkok we would not have otherwise seen. It gave us all a better insight into the day to day life in old Bangkok, the flower markets and China Town. The Temples and the Turtles were highlights too. Teddy was a great guide and kept everyone interested in what was around us. Because it was a question I had as a parent I make the following comment. This bike ride did include riding on some busy roads for short distances. I'm not sure I would have wanted to take this ride with younger children because some traffic awareness is required, but with older children and teens we found it fine.This day remains one of our Bangkok highlights. Thank you Follow Me Bike Tours and Teddy.

Fanstastic tour , great tour guide. this the best way to experience the real bangkok and i ve been many times in bkk .  the service from the tour guide felt like 5 stars hotels . makes sense this company is so high ranked in tripadvisor .

Wonderful city tour. going on the bike ride was very relaxing and a lot of fun. You see a different side of things when you bike as opposed to driving as things are slower and you tend to notice a lot more. The tour guide was great and very friendly and safety conscious. Will definitely do it again and take one of the other tours

Get to see the streets of Bangkok. This tour was great and I would highly recommend it. It is not a bike tour where the guide talks at you the entire time. You are pretty much cycling most of the time but it is a very relaxed and easy way to see Bangkok. There are a couple of busy roads but traffic was not an issue.You cycle around to different markets and across the river to make a offering at a temple. This experience was great and I am glad our guide talked us through that. That part was a highlight.Our guide was thoughtfully with water and treats along the way...and plenty of photos that were shared after. All appreciated!
Our Favorite Memory of Bangkok. We did the bike/food tour and loved every minute. We loved getting to see places we never would have without being on this tour. Would suggest to anyone.

Fantastic experience. This tour is fantastic. We saw so much more of Bangkok than we would have managed ourselves. Peach our guide was brilliant. Very safety conscious and kept is watered throughout. Highly recommended.

Very Enjoyable, does what it says!!. Reliable and friendly establishment!I made a mistake in the booking date and showed up 2 days earlier than expected but the staff nicely changed my booking on the spot and a friendly guide made himself available to us with very short notice. The bike ride is safe and takes you to rural Bangkok, as well as cultural and historical site and the beautiful jungle across the river. Must try coconut ice cream!!

Best tour ever!!!. This was the most amazing tour of Bangkok!! I absolutely loved riding the bike in the small alleys and seeing the real people living their lives. It felt like I was getting a special look into how they live. This is what I love most about travel...the different cultures and people. Tom was a great tour guide and took lots of pictures for me. I will say that you need to be VERY comfortable on a bike. You have to pick your bike up a couple times to go up stairs and it is heavy. Also, just a heads up that in addition to the back alleys, you will also be riding on the super busy streets of Bangkok. Best tour ever!

Great tour of Bangkok. For 1,300THB you can't really ask for much better for a 4hour bike tour. The guide was informative and provided us with all the relevant information as well as brought us everything needed on the tour which includes cow tongue, water, boat fare, Thai whiskey and vodka. The tour guide was very encouraging to try new things. The tour seemed extremely local as we were really submerged in with locals, every side road and alleyway was buzzing with residents either washing clothes, playing in the street or in their homes. The only downside of this tour is sheer physical energy needed to complete the tour coupled with the Bangkok heat (and pollution). Other than that, hats off to Follow Me Bike Tours, definitely an interesting perspective on Bangkok.

A great way to explore the less touristy Bangkok . Me and my other half did the half day bike tour that took us through old town and China town etc. I would definitely recommend doing a bike tour if you haven't been to the area before. You see so much more than you normally wouldn't. We went down some really quirky and interesting back streets and saw some beautiful temple that's we may not have found otherwise. Our guide was also great, very knowledgable and genuinely seemed excited to share his experience and information with us. Bikes were in good shape and we got helmets (not always included with other places). Felt really safe riding around even in the craziness of Bangkok and really enjoyed it!

Good trip through Bangkok. We had a very good time althouhj it was raining ;) Everything was well explained and we tried delicious fruits... you can experience China town and drive through small streets where food is sold - definitely worth the money

Twists of Joy. We took the Bangkok jungle tour in the afternoon and I have to say that while a little terrifying in terms of the drops either side of the paths while biking to get to the park, it was pretty fun.I would not recommend this tour for dates or those who are not used to the heat. You do bike along the road, which can be a little intimidating, but the guides are all fantastic and very helpful and friendly.This is definitely not a historical or knowledge building tour, but it is pretty fun. You'll try some new and interesting foods, enjoy the sights and sounds of another side of Bangkok and get to do somethign a little unique. We were the only two people on the tour - so it was basically a private bike tour!

A great way to see Bangkok !!!!. This was fantastic !!The other travelers cancelled so I went on the tour alone with 'Teddy', a 20 something thai and recent graduate of a tourism degree program.In my 4 trips to thailand over the last 16 years (including living there for 3 months) it was the best insider exhilarating experience I've had.We biked for 4.5 hours through back alleys, through markets, across the river and into temples.Water, food, historical information and friendliness was all included in the price.I cannot recommend this more highly.I am going to sign up for the night eating tour or the jungle tour as well.

Afternoon bike tour. Overall a very interesting approach into 'hidden places' of BKK you'll never find yourself. Maybe some more information about the city and its people in addition to temples. Next time we ask for it.

Most Amazing Time!!!. I visited Bangkok in August, so this review is kind of late, but I think that speaks to just how amazing my experience was during my tour. I forgot my tour guide's name, but he was absolutely amazing! The entire tour was one of the best tours I've been on, and it really gave me a much deeper appreciation and understanding of Thai culture. I can't wait to go back to Bangkok just to try this tour again. Thank you!!!

Siam Boran jakayan Tour with Follow me. Great, nice and funny experience really. Lot of fun. Special mention for our guide, kind, professional, and ... lovely -- "All clear !" ;-)I will enjoy again another tour during my next trip to Bkk.All the bestNicolas

Siam Sawan Tour. I would highly recommend this bike tour to anyone staying in Bangkok who wants to sample Thai countryside and rural life, without travelling for hours on a bus. It was certainly one of the highlights of our time in the city.The tour was very well organised, from the clear pre-trip instructions through to the post-ride fish spa and ice cream. By the time we returned to our hotel, Follow Me had already emailed us the photos they took of our tour.Our guide (Tom) was enthusiastic and made sure everyone was safe and happy.Unlike some tours where you are pressured to pay extra for certain activities or buy from a particular shop, with Follow Me everything was included in the upfront tour cost. Tom even bought us some Thai snacks from the market to try, and food for feeding the fish in the park.The tour lasted around 4.5 hours, but had plenty of breaks to see the sights so should be fine for anyone who is reasonably fit. You do need to be confident on a bike, as there are some narrow alleyways and busy roads before catching the boat to the jungle.

Exceptional . Just back from a tour with Teddy! This was a great way to see Bangkok and keep cool at the same time! Totally different experience from what I expected and surpassed my expectations. An absolute must if visiting the city!!

Really good. At first I thought: 4-4.5 hours, I don't think I can make that. But at the end of the tour everyone was fine. The tour was great and diverse. We got a lot of thai snacks and more than enough to drink. What i like most was the weekend market. There were nearly no tourists, the people and the thinks they sold were authentic. Our guide was really nice, relaxed, a cool person. I fully recommend Follow me.
Great fun. On of the most wonderfull things to do in Bankok. Really enjoyed the tour through the alleys. Beautiful, exciting and fun!

Bicycle roundtrip throug Bangkok. I joined a 4 hours bicycle guided tour through bangkok. We travelled through backyards and main streets and it was a great way go get in touch which this fascinating city!

Amazing must do. This is an amazing must do when in Bangkok. we only stayed in town for 2 nights- did the bike tour our first night- and it was super!we opted for the night 6 hour tour; fortunatley it was just the 3 of us-so it felt like a private tour. A perfect way to see the city. (Dont be like me an wear a long flowy dress though!)
Peter was awesome!. Our bike group was just two people and a guide. Peter, our guide was knowledgeable, friendly, and very funny. I highly recommend this tour and would absolutely do it again.

A great way to discover Bangkok. I ended up being the only person booked on my morning tour but my guide Tom was great. I was so happy to discover the real Bangkok and see so many things that I would never had discovered. I cannot recommend this tour enough and thank Tom for his enthusiasm and knowledge
Super tour. superb tour with excellent guide that takes photos of the tour. One of our best memory of Bangkok.. I recommend this tour without hesitation

Very nice tour. If you want experience something local, you should do this.. Very nice tour. If you want experience something local, you should do this. Please bear in mind, this need some physical strength.

Perfect way to visit hidden gems in Bangkok. Really nice reception, Tom our guide, is a really nice friendly guy, who knew a lot, and treated us well. He arranged drinks while we waited for our boat and at the market... He never rushed us, was always concerned about our safety... The bikes were also in great shape... good breaks, great gears, comfortable saddles...In short: best way to get to know Bangkok or the jungle around the city!

Nice ride, great guide, bad saddle. Visiting a town on a bike is a good way to do it nicely and slowly. Nice ride in narrow streets across BKK, very friendly guide. Sadly the saddle of the bike they gave me was of very poor quality and the kind attempt to "fix" it failed, making the whole experience unpleasant.

Bangkok By Bike - City Tour. If your Dutch, your used to biking. Some of us, just love it.I like to use a bike everywhere.The bike is in my opinion the best way to explore a city. Forget Bangkok traffic. Dont worry about getting lost. Just take a guide for the maze that is Bangkok. We drove into places I knew for sure we where just driving through somebodys backyard, but no. Everytime there was some sort of exit leading into another small alley. Such a pleasant experience, I really loved it.So first of all Follow Me has a very nice hideout. Love the ambiance, the people are very kind and our tourguide was excellent. When we arrived we had nothing booked upfront. The lady at the reception just called our guide, who arrived ten minutes later. So we had a private tour for 2. The guide was very kind, gave us very useful information and learned us a some new things on Buddhism in Thailand. He even paid some things for us upfront during the tour. When you run into some Tiger Balm on the Chinese market for example. We are not those typical cheap Dutch, but when you pay 1/7th of the price on Tiger Balm you just have to make that deal, comon!Anyway. If your looking for a good bike tour and Follow Me is close enough? Book it.

City Tour. Had a fantastic morning out on the Follow Me city tour. Our charming and well informed guide took us on a journey which included the hustle and bustle of Bangkok life with all its noisy markets, street food, colours, textures and smells. The tour also included visiting some of the city's finest temples and monuments. Returned after the trip to Follow Me's club house for much needed refreshments including an animated chat with Cracker their rather cheeky and talkative parrot. It was the perfect way to make new friends and see the real Bangkok. We will be back !

Great way to see Bangkok. A great afternoon cycling through the back streets and alleys of Bangkok. This was an excellent way to see the city and its inhabitants. I would recommend this to anyone wanting to see the city and its people.

Top!. We , fam of 4 (52,46,16and 14,booked a private tour. Our guide was Peach. The tour was fantastic! A real good impression of Bangkok and the way of life. Only minus were the snacks. Not suitable for western stomachs.
