Fun and informative. One of the best decisions to go on this tour around the city. Stop off at some Temples to learn about the cultures and also get to ride around some amazing spots in the city. Definitely recommended!

Terrific way to learn about Bangkok. I make it a habit to do bike tours in any new non-American city I visit if they're available. Today's bike tour makes me so happy about this habit. Peach led us through winding alleyways, provided some tasty snacks, gave us insight into Thai culture and Buddhism.Probably the top activity I did in Bangkok--highly recommended!

Unique tour in Bangkok!. Having visited Bangkok numerous times, we felt it was time to try something a little different. We booked the Siam Sawan tour exploring the Phra Pradaeng peninsula for ourselves and our two sons (10 & 12 years old) - definitely a side of the city we haven't experienced! A certain amount of cycling experience is required with the start and finish of the tour traversing congested main roads and numerous narrow alleyways - recommend helmets despite them not being compulsory. The long boat trip to the peninsula and back was something special with 5 riders and 5 bikes on board! However the couple of hours we spent cycling through what is considered the 'lungs of Bangkok' was truly a contrast to the usual city sights. Lush and green with abundant flora and fauna (including a giant monitor lizard, much to the delight of my sons!), we all thoroughly enjoyed this unexpected side of Bangkok. Follow Me Bike Tours also have a lovely 'clubhouse' with a fish foot spa and a resident cockatoo who likes to be fed bananas! Highly recommended for something different.

Super! Away from the crowd! very interesting. Super trip in Bangkok, far from the thousands of tourists. Gives a real view of the thai real life, temples... Very interesting and can be done even under the rain.Nice guides. i really enjoyed the journey!

Fantastic for the family. We had a great half day tour of Bangkok this week. Our children (10 & 7) also enjoyed the tour. Our guide Mathew was easy to understand, great with our children and and shared his personal experiences and knowledge. There is some riding on the main streets for short periods but Mathew kept us all safe. Bikes are in excellent condition and they had bikes of a suitable size for the children too.
Fun in the sun. Great ride thru the streets of Bangkok with some well timed river boat rides. Guide was super knowledgable and helpful!

Great experience. Just what was promised. The route took you through narrow little alleys that you would never find on your own and that were surprisingly beautiful at every turn. Highly recommended for tourists and people who live in Bangkok (like us).

Very relaxing bike tour!. My parents and I did the city tour with our guide Tom. We rode through all sorts of areas that we would never think of, like local neighborhood alleys. The drivers in Thailand are so polite that they let us cross through busy intersections! (amazing!) The bike trip is by far the best experience I ever had in Bangkok. A very well-organized tour, we felt safe with Tom as he took great care of us (treating us herbal teas and dessert) and my parents love to have another bike tour when they travel to another country!Would love to try their jungle bike tour next time! Highly recommend!
Great for families. The jungle tour was great and not really tiring but you have to be a pretty good biker to really enjoy it. You get to feed fish and get a free fish spa. It was also very scenic.

A Great Way to See Bangkok. We rode around on some great bikes through all sorts of areas that we couldn't have seen by walking or taxi. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and made us always feel safe. I especially liked the insight into Thai culture and the lesson on how to prepare a lotus flower for temple offering.About 4 hours & 20km across flat ground, with many well timed stops, the ride was easy. Our guide provided a safety demonstration, drinks and some Thai snacks we picked up at the markets.The clubhouse was a little difficult to find for our taxi, but the people were super friendly (like most Thai people) and very clean when we were there. I thoroughly recommend to young adults and up (it probably wouldn't suit kids as there was a few times when we had to ride on the road).

Lung of Bangkok. We did the Bangkok Jungle tour to visit the green peninsula that is surrounded by the main river. Amazing tour, very silent atmosphere and very different from the normal Bangkok state of mind. Cycled like 30 minutes before entering a long-tail boat to get to the peninsula, and then we enjoyed 2 hours in the old plantation where you cycle on not-so-wide pavements elevated from water. On our way back we visited a Thai museum that displays how (old) houses were created. Very interesting. During the trip our good guide took a lot of pictures, which we were supposed to be able to download from the company website afterwards. Can recommend anytime. This was my 3 trip with them.

Great day in Bangkok!. This was by far the most fun that we had in Thailand :) Our guide Matthew was a great guide, we had a lot of fun and really enjoyed all the information supplied. The way Matthew would calmly stop the traffic so we could cross busy intersections was amazing (Thai drivers are so patient).Everything was well organised. We felt safe through the busy Bangkok streets - what a thrilling ride. Visser Family, George - South Africa

Nice and calm tour through the City of Angels. A perfect conclusion of our 2 weeks in Thailand - biking around the lovely city through areas we have never seen before - after +5 visits to the city.Great for adults and kids alike.

An experience I would advice to anyone who visits Bangkok. We took the bike trip with 3 adults en 3 kids (age between 9 and 11 years old). The bike trip was not as dangerous as the traffic in Bangkok would suggest. We cycled trough silent streets, took a few ferry's, learned some more about the Boedism, visited the flower market, ate some had specialties and most importantly, had a lot of fun. Our guide Matthew was fantastic. He looked after us with the greatest care...thank you, Matthew!

Best way to explore Bangkok in one day. Loved being on the bike and seeing the quiet hidden areas as well as the hectic areas such as Chinatown. I felt we came very close to the locals and Bangkok really surprised me positively.
Had a great time!. Our guide took us through the back streets of Bangkok and we got to make an offering at a local temple - very special and inspiring time:)

Best bike tour ever!. My husband and I took the half day tour in Bangkok last week. It was a great day! Our guides, Peach and Nu were terrific. We enjoyed pedaling down the back streets and walking through the markets. We also loved tasting all of the unique foods we came across as we wandered the markets! This tour is a must during any Bangkok visit.

Best Thing To Do In Bangkok!. I have travelled a fair bit and sometimes I feel like there isn't many new experiences. Well this is a new experience! What a fantastic idea to guide people through the city on bikes! I'm not a tour person, I don't like to see a place from an air conditioned bus, but neither would I be comfortable biking Bangkok on my own. Organized, professional, and charming is Follow Me. I took the Jungle tour to get a break from the noise of Bangkok and was curious where jungle could even be found! My guide Matthew was the epitome of calm confidence with a quiet respect for the inhabitants of Bangkok. The pace wasn't too fast or too slow, but just right. Was the highlight of my trip and an experience that will stand out for me.

Something different to try in Bangkok . The bike tour was a lot of fun. We did the 4.5 hours city and jungle tour. There's s floating market in the jungle part which is frequented by the locals and we were told that even people in Bangkok go there to ship. The route inside the park is very scenic. Mathew, the guide from Follow Me, is very nice, he tells you what to expect and does a great job navigating through the busy streets. He made the ride fun by including a stop to feed the fish, a stop to play the sling shots and treated us to a selection of local street food. The schedule is well organized and the ride is finished with some ice cream and fish spa. If you are done with food and massage rituals in Bangkok, try this - something different. The follow me club house meeting point is tuck at the back of alleys so allow some extra time to get there. There are many 7-11 so be careful (the instruction includes passing a 7-11).

Bangkok City Tour. This city tour was excellent and a great way of exploring aspects of Bangkok that you would not otherwise come across. The guide Matthew was superb both from the aspect of safety and also for the detailed information that he provided. There was so much to see and do - the temples, flower market, backstreets, river crossing to name but a few. A real highlight was learning how to open a lotus flower and fold the petals. We then we're able to present these in the temple. This tour is an absolute must for those who want to experience the heart of Bangkok; you definitely won't be disappointed.
it was great, thank you!. The tour was just great! The bicycle are very good quality. The snacks and the fish spa were perfect! :-)

Great experience. Fantastic way to see the sites of Bangkok. Really fun bike ride with plenty of rest stops and u can enjoy the local foods and drinks. Very safe to consume for westerners. I did the jungle tour, but u see alot of the city in this also. Thankyou to Peach for being an awesome tour guide. Your the best.
Good Tour. Tour and guide were good. Nice overview of the city. Bikes are quite old. Next visit we will try the jungle tour.

Takes you off the beaten path!. This was a great bike tour. We did the "jungle tour" which takes you through "Bangkok slums" and the jungle on a neighboring island. You get to see a part of Bangkok which you may not have seen on your own. Our tour guide, Matthew, was very friendly and took a lot of great pictures of us so we weren't fumbling with our cameras all day! You do have to ride a portion in the city with the traffic so make sure you know how to ride a bike, I wouldn't recommend this to beginners! But other than that it was a very easy bike ride at a comfortable pace!I would go through this company again on one of their other tours.
Excellent Adventure!. 5 Stars! Nat and New (our guides) were friendly, helpful, very accomodating of differing levels of experience and great fun! :D

The best way to see the real Bangkok. I didn't know where to start in terms of discovering Bangkok, and was already 'templed-out' so didn't feel like doing the usual tourist traps. Turns out you can see an awful lot in an afternoon by bike, it was perfect! Lots of chances to try snacks and learn about local people and landmarks. Knowledgable and friendly tour guides. Very safe too, almost all on local side streets and alleyways. Thanks!
very nice experience!. we did the siam tour with our 2 sons (13 and 12)we really enjoyed the places and also all the comment the guide gave us. you go to places u wouldn't go to by yourself

Great thing to do. Booked this trip a few days before we wanted to do it and received a prompt reply with all the details we'd need. It is difficult to find but our taxi driver persevered and gotUs there in plenty Of time. Greeted by lovely staff and offered drinks while we waited. So Lucky that there were only us 2 booked on the afternoon tour so like a private trip with our guide Tom who was knowledgeable and interesting. This is something we've never done before and was recommendedTo us and thoroughly enjoyed it. I'd been ill for nearly a week so was worried but managed fine but was glad It Was A cloudy day. Plenty of drinks offered before, during and after the trip along With stops For snacks. Group sizes are kept to 8Max normally and that's a good idea as we saw much larger groups which would have made it Very difficult to hear everything, toKeep together and I think to enjoy it as much. Everything has been thought of with this company - you can even have a foot fish spa when you return while eating your complimentary ice cream. Great to see parts of Bangkok you wouldn't otherwise see. Deserve every success. Would recommend but advise to be fairly competent with cycling skills to negotiate lumps, bumps and traffic.
Unforgetable experience !. We did the siam tour - it was great, places you wouldn't see .;We also got a lot of information about the culture and religion

Bangkok has much more to offer aside shopping, food or spa. We selected as a group the Siam Sawan bicycle tour and had a great whole morning with our guide Matthew. Biking on busy Bangkok roads can be a bit thrilling but majority of the tour was an narrow and quiet paths. Soon you leave the fancy district of Sathorn area you will bike thru some slum like areas and abandoned suburb. Don't forget your camera as you definitely will see a different Bangkok as explained in your travel book. Don't miss the graffiti train. Crossing Chao Praya River on a long tail boat gives you time to relax and the "Green Lung" of Bangkok is a real bikers paradise with shadow, trees, parks and markets. Some paths are elevated so stay concentrated not to fall into the mud. Matthew organized lot of local snacks to try so we had a great time between activities and culinary experiences. The timing was perfect, sufficient time for pictures, talks or simple to observe. A great team activity and a great way to explore Bangkok form a very different side or angle.
Great experience. Must try.. Very good adventure for our family. Perfect guide, good itenery. Nice people and nice arrangements. Perfect.

Fun way to see Bangkok. Had a great time touring the alleys and hidden streets of Bangkok. Toured the jungles outside of the city as well ... Caution some riding skills required in the jungle.Only constructive criticism would be that I would have liked a little more history while on the tour.

Bangkok from a new angle . This is the most fantastic way to experience Bangkok specially for me a first time visitor. In a professional way our guide took us through this crowed city presenting some of the best attractions of Bangkok. Hidden roads through many areas such as China town, Muslim areas, old Thai town and much more. Experience the river transportation with a bike and entertaining temples, tasting local food and much more. If you want to spend one day in Bangkok and really experience something special you must try this.

Bankok overview on two wheels. Had a great ride. No idea what to expect, as it turned out myself and my daughter were the only ones in the group. Could only have been topped by cooler weather. Mathew was great as a guide and made it really personal. Got to see different parts of the city from the poorest through to the touristy parts. The background and personal attention and detail at the buddhist temple was touching and memorable.

Bicycle tour in Bangkok? You must be mad! Or maybe not!. Five star tour with five star tourguide, Tom.Nice to see Bangkok in another view. Also very fun biking through narrow alleys, almost inside citizens gardens. A boat to the island (don't remember the name) and noisy Bangkok is suddenly gone and you are in a forest! Good stops on the way in BKK and on the Island. Do it!

This is the one thing you must do in Bangkok. If you like to roll up your sleeves and see things you might not otherwise see, then this is the trip tour for you. We did the evening ride, it was cooler, and there was less traffic. My wife had not ridden a bike in 20 years and she never felt unsafe. We just loved this tour and would recommend it to anyone particularly if you only have a few days. Our guide Tom was brilliant; he was knowledgeable and very easy going.

Such a fun experience!. It was a special way to explore the city with the very friendly tour guide to show us different areas that we may not necessarily visit if not lead by a local. It was thrilling to bike on the main road as well as on an island since I joined the "jungle tour". This tour may be more expensive comparing with all other local tours out there. But with the fact that I only got paired with one another person, enjoyed many mini activities in between, and that many beautiful photos are taken on the way by the guide, the expensive price is worth it for me.

Guided Bike Tour through Bangkok. A highlight of our visit to Bangkok and even our 9 year old daughter was able to cope with the tour. Expert guiding and local knowledge as a dimension a tourist would find hard to experience independently. This is a must do activity when visiting Bangkok.

"Must do" when you are in Bangkok. This must be the best way to see this city, if you have 2 days in this city, you should book yourself on a morning-tour. Our guide was informativ, gave us just enough guiding.

Fantastic way to see Bangkok at night. We had a great time on the night tour in Bangkok. Stopping for street food in Chinatown was a highlight and seeing the temples at night with no one around was really peaceful. Also riding through the maze of narrow back streets up close to peoples houses at night was interesting. Great way to see some of Bangkok you wouldn't normally get to see.Highly recommended

An amazing jungle bike tour adventure!. This was an incredible half day. Everything about it was perfect from the get go (the booking, administration, follow up emails). And on the day it got even better. Follow Me Bike Tours just keep giving you stuff! From hats to keep the sun from your eyes, to waters, coffees, teas, soft drinks, flower drinks (yes flower drinks!), homemade coconut icecream, bikes that were really well maintained, boat ferry trips, food to feed the fish and even an end of tour fish foot spa... it just never stopped. The guide (Tom) was fantastic; very engaging with the group (we were a large group of 8) and very knowledgeable on anything we asked him. Definitely well worth the money (and the slightly saddle sore b*m). I will definitely book with FMBT again when next in Bangkok.
Good for Bangkok!. We had great tour with Tom. The city's crowded and bike would be the way exploring it. We could weaved through small alleys, visit many sites and see real Thai's life!

Fantastic way to see Bangkok!. We have been to Bangkok a number of times and have seen the major sites and were looking for something different to do and see. This ticked those boxes. We booked the day before our tour and were able to get an afternoon tour. I initially phoned and then booked online. They were very prompt in responding. I would not suggest booking this close in high season and would advise booking well in advance to make sure you get the day and time that suits you. Matthew was our guide on our Siam Boran tour. He was informative and calm. I was a bit concerned about cycling in the humidity, but this was not a problem at all, neither was the length of the tour - it was comfortably achieved. There were breaks along the way and we visited temples, market, Chinatown etc. It was great going through the narrow alleyways, backstreets, on the ferry etc. We wore helmets, although this is not compulsory. I felt safe riding the entire time. The bikes were good to ride. There were 6 in our group which was a good number. At the finish, back at the Clubhouse, we had water and icecream and also had the option of the fish foot spa. It was an enjoyable time!

Best part of our trip to Bangkok!!!!. If you do any tour or really anything in Bangkok you must do this bike tour, it is absolutely the best way to see Bangkok. I loved seeing Bangkok on a bike but Matthew really was why this tour was so special. He was such a great tour guide and not only showed us the city but also aided in us experiencing Thai culture. I loved that I not only saw parts of Bangkok I would have never found without this tour, but that I also loved learning about and also experiencing Thai culture. This was my favorite thing to do in Bangkok! Also this is not a difficult bike ride if you are worried about getting tired. There are several stops and rests :) I would recommend this bike tour to all my family and friends 100%!!!

Great way to experience Thailand!. We ended up opting for the jungle tour. Riding around in traffic, learning about local history, getting out of Bangkok, and meeting locals. It made the day feel like a real adventure!Pro Tip: Trying going mid week so it isn't crowded.

Excellent ! Highly recommended . Can highly recommend it Real cultural experience enjoyed by us and our teenage sons 4 hours cycling through the streets of Bangkok, sights that many tourists would never experience Our guide Tom was lovely and a pleasure to spend the day with ! Thank you Tom Some very busy roads to negotiate and it tonight my sons a lot about city life on a bike Vicky

Matthew was great!. This was our favorite thing we did in Bangkok! It was a great way to see the city and learn about the local culture. We did the night tour and it was a great way to see some big attractions without the crazy crowds. Matthew was the best guide- He made sure we were safe riding through the city, and got us some great local food to try. It rained on us a little, but Matthew was prepared with ponchos, and we were still able to see everything on the tour. We had the best time! Thank you!

Awesome time on Siam Boran!. We loved the Siam Boran tour in Bangkok! Our tour guide Tom was fun and shared interesting insights about the city. In addition to temples, we experienced some of the inner-workings within Chinatown that we would not have seen walking around the city. A word of caution that the tour does involve biking on some busy city streets, which may feel a bit treacherous! However, our tour guide did a good job of making sure other vehicles were aware of our tour.

Great way to see a different side of Bangkok. Tom our guide was great. Going by bike was fantastic as we weaved through small alleys and off-streets, areas you don't normally get to see via bus or walking tour. The bike was a great way to see the city and I learned a lot from this tour. Tom also took a bunch of pictures for us. Great time.

Best Bike Tour. Awesome tour through back alleys and streets you would never go down alone. Easy ride, Tom our guide was fantastic. Fantastic way to see the real sights of Bangkok from the river , temples and inner city. Absolutely recommend

Best bike tour ever. This is the best tour of Bangkok from the back streets.it will take you trough Chinatown visiting some hidden temple, the guide bought us greens to feed turtle in a Chinese garden and lotus flower and gave us a lesson on folding the flowers for offering in a temple,Great local snacks and drinks Thank you trip advisor for this recommendation!!

Bicycle tour. Wonderful half day bike tour with guide Tao...negotiated roads, back alleys, crossed the river by narrow boat and cycled through the natural beauty of the area known as "the lung" of Bangkok. Highly recommend.

A must try activity in BKK. Nice guide! Well planned bike route! Definitely see the hidden side of this fantastic city! Not matter we are hit the heavy rain during the tour! I feel so adventurous on it!! Even though I already back on my country... If I still have another question about BKK, they will so kind to help you plan your next journey! Love them!! Follow Me :)

BKK Follow Me Bike Tours June 7th, 2016. After reading so many reviews online, i finally chose Follow Me Bike Tours as it seemed to be the most doable and had so many good reviews. Taking the BTS from NaNa stn onwards during morning rush hour was fine but when we had to walk to their location, it turned out we walked one huge round when we could've taken the shortcut through the private gate. Either way, we were lucky enough to find someone who directed us in the right direction and we had time to chk out our bikes and get warmed up. My son, 9yrs old, and i are not avid bike riders and have never ridden bikes on the streets so i was VERY apprehensive about riding on the streets. The back lanes etc were all so narrow that a person wouldn't even be able to stretch out their arms fully! Our guide Tom, was very personable and informative. He took quite good care of us, with refreshment stops, coconut custard sticky rice was awesome etc ... though I did lag behind the pack, he tried to keep us on schedule and we all made it to the very end, and my son LOVED the tour! This was the main reason i chose to do a bike tour because it's a one of a kind learning, yet active experience. Definitely highly recommend. Though I think you guys should invest in a Go Pro for better camera coverage etc for customers. Thank you Follow Me Bike Tours & Tom!!

A great tour. Our tour guide Tom looked after us really well, and took us on a great ride from the clubhouse to the green peacefulness of the lung of Bangkok, getting there and back by boat, visiting a great local market and feasting on local delicacies. A great day, thanks Tom
Memorable experience . Great experience riding in the city. Eye opening. Also very informative tour guide. Mr Mathew. He will tell you the family values of Thai people and Thai family.

Night ride through Bangkok!! . This is was as fun an experience as anyone can have in Bangkok. The weather was perfect and the streets we rode through we're not as busy. Our guide took us to a great spot to watch the sunset along the river and we had some dinner at two amazing local spots near Chinatown. Would totally recommend this to anyone.

Jungle Ride was Amazing. Spent half day following guide Prawit was definitly highlight of the bangkok trip. They arranged in a very good way, started with simple instruction, what to do, what not . Handle each one the fresh water and hat. On the bike ride we took the ferry, several snack stop to try thai tacos, the restaurant next to river for a drink, passing through the rush hour on the street. We have finished my ride with the fish massage at the yard of Follow Me office. It was indeed amazing experience I had and would love to do it again.
Bangkok Bike Tour. Great way to see the inner workings of the city. Safe, informative and fun. Excellent customer service.
Love the tour guide. Very friendly guide to show us the culture. Free photo taking, ice cream and snack tasting made an unique experience in Thailand other than shopping and eating

Lovely way to spend a day in bangkok if you don't mind the heat!. even our local friends in Bangkok couldn't believe such places exist here. We often take cycling tours whenever we visit a new city though Bangkok is a city we visit nearly every year. Had heard about Follow Me bike tours from some friends so decided to give it a try. Very friendly and patient, English speaking guide, Tom showed us around and we got to see the "lungs of Bangkok" as well as visit the local weekend market - a foods paradise. The Siamese fighting fish museum was also a place we had never heard about and was quite a revelation! Must try a couple of rides if the heat doesn't bother you.

Our best day in Bangkok. This was an extraordinary way to see Bangkok. We were amazed by the back streets, side alleys and bustling roads, all seen from bike! Our guide was really knowledgeable and created special experiences along the way for us. This was superb for the adults in our family all the way down to our 9 year old. Thank you, Follow Me!

Fun tour and great way to see Bangkok. We did the Siam Boran Bike Tour. It was a great tour taking us in all parts of Bangkok including the many markets where got to taste traditional Thai food. Riding in amongst the bustling parts of the city was very exciting! We stopped off at a number of temples and learnt about Thai religion and culture. Very grateful of the photos that was taken by our tour guide. They are great! This tour is a must do while in Bangkok!

Outstanding time with Follow Me bike tours. We had a group of 5 on the tour. We had an outstanding time. Mathew our guide was great. I would recommend follow me to anyone and everyone. Thank you for a wonderful day.

Enjoyable afternoon . I booked this tour for my husband and I due to the good reviews on trip advisor, we were not disappointed. I booked directly with Follow Me on their website and I was impressed with their promptness and detailed responses. They even emailed me a map to locate them as it can be tricky to find their base. Upon arrival we were offered cold drinks and given our free caps. They also offered a helmet but it's your choice whether you wear one or not. Our guide was Tao and he was great. Very friendly and knowledgeable. We cycled through back alleys, side roads and even on the crazy Bangkok main roads however I felt safe at all times. Even negotiating the traffic became second nature within a very short space of time. Amongst many sights, we also visited temples and markets. Wat Arun is currently under construction so I don't think they would stop there at the minute but I really wanted to see it so Tao made sure we drove past and popped in. By the end we were shattered and a little drained as you need to keep a high level of concentration on the busy streets however all in all it is an excellent way to spend an afternoon in Bangkok.

A different side of Bangkok. An interesting morning in Bangkok! We visited back alleys and hidden temples, tasted local food, learned about Buddhist traditions and, above all, survived biking through congested Bangkok streets. Our guide Matthew took great care of all of us and was very pleasant and knowledgeable.Highly recommended!

Perfect tour in Bangkok. The whole organisation from the start up to the end was perfect organized.The bikes were also in good conditions.Our guide - Wizz (?) - was a perfect guide. He showed us interesting areas in the centre of Bangkok.We have to say - thanks for the perfect tour / perfect day.

Great walking tour. We decided to do a walking tour for a change and we were pleased to see that Follow Me Bike Tours recently added a half day walking tour to its list. Tom, our guide, was knowledgable, good humoured, and kept the tour going at a good pace especially since we were the only ones on the tour. The combination of river boat ride, temples, Chinatown, flower market and street food was exactly what we wanted. I especially love that Tom took dozens of photos and emailed them to us before day's end. Thanks for a fabulous tour and a great day. Highly recommended!!!
Great Tour. This tour was great and we were able to see the back roads as well as the main road of Bangkok. Matthew, our tour guide, was great and very knowledgeable.

Great way to experience Bangkok. I was incredibly pleased with the customization of the Follow Me bike tour--everything from the photos to document our experience to allowing us to truly partake in Thai culture by eating the food from the markets, make an offering at the temples, take the ferries with weekday commuters, etc. Truly an unforgettable experience. Though the ride is long, hot, exhausting, and sometimes scary (biking through very narrow paths and on the busiest streets of Bangkok), this has to be one of the best ways to experience the city.

Great bike ride!. Enjoyed the bike tour through Bangkok very much! Fortunately we were not on main roads for very long. My favorite part was going through all of the little alleyways -- places I never would have found on my own! Highly recommend the tour!

Siam Boram: laneways, Chinatown, flower market an dmore. An interesting and informative ride through many of Bangkok's laneways and back streets. Views you would not see in a car journey. easy paced ride. Chinatown and the flower market were highlights. As was learning how to eat mangosteen! Great guide. Safety conscious.

Delightful . This bike ride through the back streets of Bangkok is a great way to get a feel of real day to day life in the city. Matthew is such a pleasant guide, he explained a lot about local culture & customs.Snacks provided were super fresh, tasty & unique to Thailand.The safety video before starting the tour is hilarious, a great start to the day!

Best Experience in Bangkok. Great Experience with Follow me Bike Tours. Everything was very organized and the itinerary (I did the night one) give you the chance to visit all the highlights of the city from a different perspective. Matthew helped us into understanding the mentality of Thai people and their vision about their capital which enriched our experience and made it even more special. Great concept and perfect to discover all the secret beauty of such a magical place. Well done!

What a professionalism. I booked the private Siam Boran tour as I had friends over from the Netherlands.In the past I have cycled with another company, but this company was close to my home and reccomended by a friend. It was a nice trip with a great guide, excellent greeting upon arrival and funny intro video about the biking. It so nice to see Bangkok from your bike. During the tour your guide will make pictures and sent it by email to you. I found it very professionel.

Best way to see Bangkok!!!. Are you kidding me? This was the best thing we did to see so much of Bangkok. Our guide, Wit, was super! He showed us so many cool spots and was awesome in answering our all of our questions. Even in the heat of the day this was a great tour. Every food we tried was new to us and something we wanted to try. Please do yourself a favor and book this tour over the others! It made our trip even better than we imagined!!!

Overall Good experience. Nice experience, especially unseen part were also covered e.g. bylanes and ?slum.Food was awesome, we could taste real street food in dinner. Our guide was very polite spoke good English and knowledgeable

Bangkok n Beyond-Adventures Cycling. Our bike tour took us to intimate neigborhoods, landmarks,shrines n temples that I would have missed if not for this tour and our guide,Tom!..He. And the bike tour ROCKED!

Get to know secrect spots of Bangkok. I had the best time - we learned a lot about different aspects of Bangkok that you won't find in any guide, road through beautiful (and suprisingly empty) streets, were treated to different kinds of streetfoods, fed turtles, visited the flour market and learned how to "fold" a tulip. I totally recommend the trip, even on the busy streets I always felt very safe :-).

Lots of fun but a bit pricey . We had a great time on the bike tour. We had a small group, so only my wife and I plus one other solo traveler. The guide was very attentive as it was quite hot and he was always offering to get us cold drinks. For what the trip was, it did feel a little overpriced. I think it would have been fair at 25% cheaper. Because while the trip was enjoyable, it didn't blow me away, but rather just about met expectations. Regardless, we still had a good time! The fish at the end were fun as well.

Amazing Bike Tour. Absolutely recommendable! We had a wonderful bike tour to places we would never have seen without a guide. Very surprising; we really cycled along many roads and pathes wher no cars were. We visited aloso the flower market and a wonderful small temple with a nice park where we fed the turtles. We drank Thai-Tea and Coffee at a booth in a small alley, absolutely amazing. Our guide Tom was perfect! I think he knows everything about Bangkok, the Thais and the Buddhism.We booked via Internet only one day before and got immediately an answer.Take your time to stay some minutes in the club after the tour dangling your feet in the water with the fishes.We will definetly come back.
Excellent!. Wonderful tour of the outskirts of Bangkok and countryside. Guide was great! Highlight of the trip! Highly recommended!

great experienc. lI loved this bike tour around the back streets an alley ways of Bangok. What a great way to experience sights souns and smells of this city. Tom our guide was helpful snd gave a commentryof the places he took us to. Definately a great way to explore the city and I would go again next time I visit Bagkok.

Private Tour. Professional and courteous from the start. Definitely needed their map to locate them but excellent directions provided. Matt was an awesome guide, felt very safe and thoroughly enjoyed the conversation we shared. A great insight into Thai culture and I highly recommend the experience.
Bangkok. nice tour. A lot of knowledge available. Afterward we get a lot of nice pictures. We have seen a lot of Bangkok

The best trip in Bangkok. This is a late review but the memory of this day stats with us. We took the city tour and Peter showed us the time of our lives!! It was also songran which made the day even more special. There wasn't anything Peter wouldn't do to make the day very special. You don't need to be too fit but a basic level of riding skills is needed. Go on this trip!!!

Great Tour. We done the Siam Boran Tour in the morning however the day turned out to be in the 40's and we found the guide just went to fast for us. When asked to slow down his reply was well we will just stick to the itinerary then and we wont get to see anything extra. We had to yell out to him several times to stop as some of our party had fallen well behind (due to the heat). We are in our 50's and do really think you need to be bike ready, by this i really think you need to get some bike fitness in b4 doing this tour. We had some laughs and some near misses with the traffic but i am glad we have done it

Awesome Tour of BKK!. The staff is super friendly and we saw a huge portion of Bangkok. I would say that this is the best way to see Bangkok as you get to see a little bit of everything. Will definitely do this tour again!!

Very Fun Ride. This was an interesting ride, especially for someone new to Bangkok. The route provided a good feel for everyday life in this city.The mechanical state of the bike was not the best. The seat tilt kept coming loose despite being tightened.

Behind the Skyscapers. If there's a better way to see, smell and taste the sites and sounds of Downtown Bangkok, I'm not sure what it might be. Our guide, Matthew, was awesome in safely guiding us through a personal 4+ hour tour that included stops at multiples locales where we were that only tourists, sharing his and his city's history, beliefs all along the way. We could have gone another 2 hours (despite the 100 degree heat). From the back alleys and main streets to the multiple temples and neighborhoods, various markets (flowers and food!) to even a boat ride, we were treated to so much in our short guide. The ride itself is easy, the bikes are decent quality (I mountain bike so I know a little) and the overall experience was simply up close and personal. Get out and see the Bangkok at ground (or bike level)!

Excellent, with a word of caution.. Bangkok is NOT a city for bicycling. That said, Follow Me Bike Tours is very professional. They had a great safety movie on a large flat screen television prior to departure. They also provided neon green caps to each person. The company offers to hold personal items in a secure room. They have a toilet to use in the office as well.It was hot and the tour stopped five times for water & liquids (which was included in the payment). This is NOT a tour for the faint of heart; the traffic was heavy, the surface rough, crossing streets was dangerous, and the 120 degree turns on narrow paths on the bikes was challenging. We participated in the half day Siam Tour that departed at 1:30. We rode through the back alleys that one would not usually view. It gave a perspective of non- 3+ star hotel areas. As people from the USA we had to ride on the opposite side of the road, which also caused some stress. The guide stopped at THE 24/7 hour flower market of the country of Thailand in Chinatown. He offered interesting information on flowers, traditions to the culture, fruits & vegetables. I do recall praying several times to get me back to the home office in one piece :=D. After the flower market the ride was out of traffic and delightful.It was a memorable experience and we highly recommend it with a word or two of caution.(ADVICE on the DIRECTIONS: After you leave the BTS follow the crowd bearing left, past the first steps. Continue until it goes into a ‘T’ (or end). At that point turn right (crossing above the street on the bridge) and go down the first steps on the left. There are 7-Elevens everywhere in Bangkok and you should be on the right side of the street with the turn to the office immediately prior to the first 7-Eleven on the right. We tried to follow the directions provided and ended up walking up and down three sets of steps to get there. It was not a good way to start a 23 km bike ride in hot heat. Hope this helps.

The highlight of our Bangkok visit. We had booked a private tour for our family of four (kids 12 and 9). With Matt as our tour guide, we set out at a nice pace, heading for the river. On the way there, we saw some of the alleys and backroads that we would have never experienced on foot or by car. After crossing the river in a longtail boat (life vests were provided), we entered a whole new world. Quiet, humid, lush landscapes and a beautiful park. So much to see, smell and hear. Returning to the city, we rode on quite heavy-trafficed roads, but there were no problems whatsoever.Experiencing Bangkok this way is recommendable for anyone who can ride a bike. We felt completely safe, both on the streets of Bangkok, on the river and in the "jungle". This will be on the top of our list when we return to Bangkok!
Amazing bike ride. We picked the jungle tour and I got to see a quiet side of bangkok and its greenery. Also to try genuine street food. Thank you Tom for being an awesome guide! We will be back!

Highlight of our stay in Bangkok. I was visiting Thailand with my sixteen year old daughter and this tour was highly recommended to me by a friend who traveled to Thailand a few years ago. My friend basically insisted that we take this tour and thankfully we listened! My daughter and I did the Siam Boran tour with Wit as our tour guide and it was an unforgettable experience. Most of the tour is done through back alleys and side roads but you also got the thrill of riding on the busy Bangkok streets. Besides seeing beautiful sights in Bangkok, Wit introduced us to exotic local fruit and foods along the way while teaching us about Thai culture. For me the highlight of the tour was visiting the Bangkok flower market, where Wit purchased lotus flowers for the group. We then visited a temple where we were taught how to fold the lotus flowers in the traditional Thai way and then left them as offerings.Wit was an excellent guide! Once our tour was over, he helped us in getting a taxi back to our hotel and recommended a fantastic place for us to do some shopping afterwards (Platinum Fashion Mall). Next time in Bangkok we will certainly do this tour again!

Fun Ride in Bangkok. It's definitely an eye open trip. You get to see the other side of Bangkok, pass through small alley and local houses. The guide took good care of everyone and he did well explaining the places and history . Just need to remember to put on a lot of sun block!

Great tour with a great guide. We book a bike tour in every city we visit and this was one of the best. We took the Siam Boran tour with Matthew as our guide. It's a great way to get familial with the city. Most of the tour is done through back alleys and side roads and not on major streets which made the ride much more interesting. Bikes are in great condition. Helmets are offered but not mandatory. Water and snacks are provided during the tour Matthew was great in providing information about the city and local culture. Our only disappointment was that we didn't have more time to take the Siam Sawan Jungle Tour.

Outstanding and great fun.. We were looking for something unusual to do during our time in Bangkok and this really fit the bill. I booked the tour using TA a couple of days prior and they were great in communicating with me via email, including sending very detailed instructions on the best way to get to their clubhouse to start the tour. You really do see parts of Bangkok that we would have never seen, including sampling some street food suggested by our guide, Wit. It was a hot day and my wife and I were the only ones on the tour so we probably got a little extra attention, but I imagine any size tour would get the same type of service. The biking isn't hard but you do have to pay attention because you are going down residential paths and streets. You also get the thrill of some travel on the busy Bangkok streets. Once our tour was over, Wit helped us in getting transportation back to our destination. If you are in Bangkok, this is a great activity to try!

Great fun, courteous and knowledgeable guide. My girlfriend and I did the jungle tour and had a great time with our awesome guide Tom. We had amazing luck that no on else booked a tour that morning so we had a private excursion! Unfortunately even though we left early and returned late we weren't able to complete everything in the set trip itinerary, I think the only way to so is if you ride extremely fast, even then I'm not sure. Definitely recommend this tour though.

Dyer Family Trip 2016. This Bike tour with Wit and Se was perfect. My children are 10 and 14 and honestly I was very nervous with my 10 year old riding in the streets. However, wit made us very comfortable and went at a slow paste. I recommend taking the bts but we took taxi which was very difficult to get the driver to understand where we wanted to go.Near the end I requested for us to take back roads /ally ways for my 10year old .. Overall experience thee best I recommend you do it only if you can ride in traffic.
Brilliant. Great day out. Our guide Matthew was brilliant. Would definitely advise to do this tour. You see parts of Bangkok at you would never normally see.

An alternative way of sighseeing Bangkok. Are you tired of walking around or being a part of a large group where everybody try to get the best out of a sighseeing trip?If you would like to experience a special way to see the real Bangkok - you have found the unique alternative by using this bike trip! We, a family with teenagers/ adults, found Follow Me at the internet. It looked very nice, so we booked a bike ride, half a day from the morning. If you read the description "how to find us" at their webpage it is easy to find the place, especially if you use the SkyTrain.We were welcomed by the crew and we got Mathew as our local guide. The trip was very nice and Mathew showed us a lot of places we would not be able to find by ourselves. Thanks for an superb day in Bangkok, Mathew! We will be back for another of your trips next time we visit Bangkok!

Another kind of Sightseeing! Great city biking tour!. Although it may sound like a crazy idea to go biking in a city like Bangkok with all the traffic and the heat, it is one of the best ways to explore this amazing city! Our guide Matthew was great and very experienced and took us through small alleys, quiet roads and hidden paths so it did not feel like going through the city. He also did a very good job to manage the group of 10 people including a family of 4 who was obviously a lot less experienced in bicycling than the rest (honesly, I was worried they would not make it through the tour, but they did!!!). It was our 5th visit to Bangkok and we saw many familiar areas but also several new locations. Indeed very recommendable! Easy to reach via Skytrain is also a big plus in Bangkok... :-)

Bangkok bike tour. Brilliant! Lovely informative bike tour, felt safe and covered a lot of Bangkok in a short time! I would really recommend this, instructions to get to them perfect, defo go by sky train of you can!

The best thing to experience in Bangkok. Undoubtedly the highlight of our honeymoon. The Bangkok bike tour was more eye opening and culturally enriching than anything else we experienced for the 2 weeks we were in Thailand. You don't need to be a fit cyclist to leisurely follow the group through the small alleys and streets of the city, all you need is common riding ability and a desire to explore and experience something off the well beaten tourist path with an experienced guide. I won't ruin the excitement of the stops and the sites and sounds, but do yourself a favor and don't think twice about booking it. Our guide Tom was fantastic and spoke very good English to point out the significant parts of the ride, and we couldn't thank him enough when it came to an end. Next time in Bangkok we will certainly do it again.

great pleasure for entire family!. Wanted to do a bike tour since quite some time and finally got it with guide Tom who was fantastic. As we were with a small boy and a soon to bee teenage boy we were a bit afraid that the 22km will be too long, but it was no issue at all, as BKK is totally flat. The stops to get off the bikes and discover some sights (flower market, temples, etc.) were just perfect for all. The quality of the bikes was really good.

Excellent bike tour off the beaten track. We really enjoyed our recent Siam Sawan bicycle tour in Bangkok. The whole process was very well organised, we were greeted with friendly staff and well informed of what our tour would include. The guide took photos of us throughout the tour, so I didn't need to worry about pulling my camera out, a nice touch. The trail itself is very pretty. We were fortunate to go on the same day as the local markets, which were incredible, definitely the highlight for me.

The highlight of my trip. Just got back from an amazing day with Follow Me! My friends and I did the jungle bike tour which is about 4 1/2 hours. Definitely recommend! The guides are so friendly and they made me feel very safe the whole way round. It was so lovely to go around side streets and see a different pace of life in this mad city!

Gap Year solo idea :). So when I told my thai friends that I was biking they were all so worried - but there is really nothing to be worried about :) The guide (Matthew?) is great at managing traffic in the city I wasn't worried at all from the start and he made it easier for those who were :) I did the mangrove tour and it was beautiful! Everything was fun! the longtail boat ride, the ride on the island (we saw 3 iguanas!... I think) and biking through the khlong (we met schoolkids ADORABLE) No, I really enjoyed it, it was stress free and new, a great idea :)Although there is a lot of stop and go it seems normal considering its also a tour :)Anyways try this tour out its friendly and gives an adventurous twist to Bangkok!

A fantastic ride around Bangkok Saturday 26th. Good quality bicycles. Photos taken of your trip and sent to you. We cycled through the back streets and saw lots of local people who were all very friendly and shouted hello. Something we would never have done on our own. Wit (our tour guide) was lovely taking us for wonderful street food in China town and Thai tacos. No I can't say it in Thai! Visited a Chinese temple, the flower market, The grand palace, beautiful at night. Had a trip across the river and went to see Wat Arun.If you are visiting Bangkok this has got to be one of the best ways to see it.Thank you Wit.

Last minute decision turned into an adventure!. My boyfriend and I decided to rush to their office on our last full day in Bangkok for a bike tour. We hadn't done too much research but noticed the high reviews. We had a blast, it was a mix between city biking and jungle biking. We got to take a peak into some of the outskirts of Bangkok and the different lifestyles as well. It was awesome that our tour guide took pictures of us so that we could focus on our ride and not put our safety in jeopardy trying to take that selfie. The tour group was small which allowed for more personalization to the tour as well. The biking was challenging but in a great way. There were a bunch of windy, thin roads in the jungle but it wasn't frowned upon if you needed to quickly put your feet down around turns. Because we had taken more leisurely bike tours in the past, we opted out of the helmet and wore flip flops - I would recommend a helmet and sneakers!

Informative, energising and fun!. Green zone tour- started off in busy city, a lot of traffic but very careful guide (Tom) and cars were very good at stopping for us to cross. We stopped regularly for Tom to inform us of various things as we made our way to Lung Island (green zone in Bangkok) via longtail boat across the river. Very quiet and peaceful on the island, despite being in the middle of the city. Also stopped occasionally to taste food along the way (picked straight from the trees or bought from street sellers). A gentle bike ride (approx. 4 hr) with a lot of information, great food tasting and plenty of stops along the way.

Fabulous. Best thing to do in Bangkok. An experience that we are glad to have done and will take in our hearts. We did it with our sons of age 12 to 16 and we all spent a great day together. Matthew has also share with us his philosophy and take us to different places that we shouldn't been able to know otherwise, thanks!!!!

Must do tour. We did the tour with our 4 children. Amazing, both the tour and the guide. A way to see Bangkok in a very different way, seeing how common thai people live and going to places you would never know they exist. Very very suggested.

Great tour!. I really enjoyed the city tour, we went further than I thought we would, across the Chao Phraya river and to a temple where there are more locals than tourists which made it a unique and intriguing experience. I enjoyed the tour and our guide was excellent.

Professional, awesome and fun. My husband and I went for the jungle tour, and had a terrific time. We were the only ones signed up, but fortunately the tour still went. The bicycles were in great shape. Our excellent guide was Tom, and he spoke great English and kept a keen eye on us and our cycling abilities. He was knowledgeable, very friendly and had a fun and pleasant personality.Riding through the jungle area was great. The "Lungs of Bangkok" was an interesting and diverse place. It was a quiet patch of lush nature in the middle of a huge, busy city. It's a good idea to have some reasonable cycling skills to maneuver around some of the tight turns on the skinny raised pathways. We were given plenty of drinks and yummy traditional snacks. The boat ride back and forth was short and well organized.We really appreciated all the photos that Tom took while riding. He was pretty good at that.Riding through the streets of Bangkok, especially in early morning rush hour was exhilarating, a bit freaky, and definitely memorable.I would recommend this tour to others. If I went back to Bangkok, I would like to try another of the Follow Me cycle trips.

Fun way to see the real Bangkok. Super fun, our guide Matthew was friendly, helpful and very informative of every site we visited. We have been to Bangkok many times traveling through to other destinations and was pretty bored with the town, this changed our view and we look forward to returning to take the night tour or jungle tour!

Great bike tour at night. Absolute fabulous way to see unknown sides of Bangkok in bicycle speed. Our tour guide Matthew did a very, very good job and taught us a lot about Bangkok. We felt always safe and enjoyed the ride through the night. Another big advantage of this nightly tour are the moderate temparatures and the shortened traffic. And the best of all: nearly empty temples. Our group has been the only visitors of Wat Pho. No crowds, no pushing, no loud noises instead peace and calmness.Our group was actually only the two of us. So we got a very personal tour with our great tour guide Matthew. Thanks again for your motivated guidance. This tour is a must when visiting Bangkok. We would definitely do it again.

13 Mile Sight Seeing by Bike. Tom our guide was amazing and took us all over Bangkok by bike. He was amazing. We saw temples, flower markets, sampled Thai street cooking, fed turtles, loaded the bikes onto a boat to cross the river, bicycled to China town, sampled icey cold coconut water among the many other things we experienced. It was about a 5 hour day! We ended the trip with soaking our feet and little fish nibbling on them who,e we drank cold water and ate ice cream. What a fabulous trip.
Siam Boran. Great Experience, totally recommend it to anyone wanting see the real Bangkok. The guide was great and knew the place really well.

An amazing trip with high contrasts. We were lucky for being with a small group, 4 people and Aaa, our triple-A guide. He took us to typical neighborhoods you would never discover on your own. The contrast between the old en small houses they contain and the high-tech skyscrapers that surround them, is really amazing

A great evening bike tour through Bangkok. I had a great bike tour during the evening (the Siam Ratree tour) with guide Tom. I was the only one at that time, but they decided to let the tour go through anyway, without any extra charge (even though it was not their policy apparently). Really appreciated that.This tour is a bit longer than the evening tours available at other companies (5-6 hours in stead of 3-4), which I liked. Although it does mean you will be back later than usual.They take you through the narrow backstreets of Bangkok, nice places like the flower market, and a street food dinner in Chinatown (included). You'll get to know what all those stalls actually sell. Since they all got signs in Thai only, it can be somewhat intimidating for a first time tourist. Certainly when some of the dishes include intestines and things like pig blood jelly, haha! :)I was a lot more confident buying food from those place after this!The tour also takes you to places like Wat Po and Wat Arun at night (yes, it's open then!). Much better temperatures than during day time. All in all you get to see quite a lot.Bikes were of excellent quality (mine had several gears, which I liked)Afterwards they send you a series of pictures and videos taken during the trip, also nice!

Great Siam Ratree tour with Matthew . We booked the night biking and food tour with Matthew and had a great time. We did the following:- biked through the back alleys of Bangkok and observed local Thai life- went to Chinatown to see a Chinese Buddhist temple- had dinner in Chinatown- went to a flower market to see all the different flowers for offerings and decoration- went to Wat Pho at night which as quiet and amazing- saw the entire Grand Palace from afar- went to a local temple in Thonburi across the riverMatthew was extremely patient the entire trip, especially since I am not the best biker. He took his time and explained to us the history and backstory behind each attraction. We also got to learn a little more about his life in Bangkok and growing up in Northeast Thailand. Highly recommended tour for those who want something different! We enjoyed biking through the backstreets and seeing some of the more famous attractions at night and without a lot of tourists. Biking experience required - we biked through tiny back alleys and next to mopeds and cars. The entire tour went from 5pm to 11pm but we walked around a bit in between biking. At the end of the night Matthew gave us ice cream too!

Great ride in the jungle!. Matthew was a great guide to show us around and navigate the Bangkok streets. The ride through the coconut plantations showed a different part of Bangkok. We shared some local treats at the weekend markets.

Fantastic Ride. The Follow Me bike tour was a very enjoyable and educational experience. It provided insights into the daily life and customs of the cultural mix of Thai people. Our guide was very knowledgable and continusly provided us with interesting and relevant information. 10/10.

Follow me bike tour. Excellent tour, interesting and fun. I found the guide very knowledgeable and he set the standard for the tour. I regularly ride mountain bikes so did not find the 20km hard at all. I am in my 70's but the young ones managed to keep up. (grin).

You won't regret it :). It was only 3 of us who joined saturday afternoon Bike tour which was great. We got to see the city, slam street in Bangkok(which you would never experience without a local guide) ,water boat , weekend market and very beautiful park.The guide is very friendly and he bought some sweets and snacks from the market so we enjoyed the food too.It was probably only 4 and a half hours ride. I am not a very strong bike rider but It was not tiring at all. When we go back to Thailand again, I will definitely join the tour again.
get nite out in Bangkok. i enjoyed the night biking trip , great way to see bangkok when its not so hot outside , staff was friendly and helpful

Great way to spend the afternoon and wonderful value. My boyfriend and I recently visited Bangkok but we were only there for a few days so wanted to do as much as possible. This bike tour was a great way, not only to to see the city but the back streets too.Our guide, Tom, was friendly and spoke very good English. He was attentive and wanted to make sure we had fun. You get snacks and drinks and he makes sure you are safe.One of our highlights!!

Morning City Tour. I took a morning city tour. It was a great way to get to see the heart and soul of Bangkok. It was physically easy cycling although some bike handling skills where needed to negotiate the alleys and back lanes that we traveled through. Plenty of drink and toilet stops, informative and friendly guides and a very pleasant way to see Bangkok from a different perspective.

Great way to see bangkok. It was fun! I had a great time. It might be the healthiest and happiest way to see the major places in Bangkok.You will see wat pho, wat arun, and few other cool places on bicycle. Best time to go with them is in the evening.

Best way to spend a morning in Bangkok!. I had no idea what I was getting into when I looked up Follow Me Bike Tours on the internet - when I arrived at the clubhouse (not at all difficult to find if you follow the directions carefully), everybody was super friendly, free coffee, water, wifi all make a great impression too!. I had signed up for the City tour (next time I will try the jungle tour too), there were four on the tour this Sunday. Our guide was so knowledgeable, and so kind and friendly. The cultural details we learned were so much more than I had expected. Visits to the flower markets, spice and vegetable markets, Thai temple (rather than one of the more touristy temples) and a Chinese temple were wonderful. We learned how to prepare Lotus flowers for Buddha and sampled local sweet snacks. 20km cycling on well-maintained, quality bicycles was a very gentle pace for almost anyone - this is a sightseeing ride, not designed to be a hardcore cyclists challenge. Thanks for a great half day in this fascinating city.

Great night tour of BKK. Can only recommend the FMB night Bangkok tour as it was so much fun. We were a group of 3 and cycling in the hustle and bustle of BKK can give you the chills but so worth it!Was awesome to drive along the small allieways and back routes and see a very different Bangkok!

What fun!. I've been to Bangkok several times and never seen many of the sights shown to us this afternoon. What a fab tour! Not scary at all and I was able to keep up easily (I'm not a great or regular bike rider!). The back streets and temples with explanations and snacks all the way, including a ferry crossing was good fun and I will make sure I recommend Follow Me if I know someone is travelling through Bangkok.
Fantastic bike ride. A different view of bangkok, riding through the traffic to get to the jungle. Excellent guide and a steady pace.I will do the city tour on my next visit

A great hidden experience!. We chose the Siam Sawan tour and experienced a greener version of Bangkok than we'd seen before. The guide was so lovely and provided us with drinks and snacks all the bike tour. We even got to taste some local treat if we wanted to. The nature at Siam Sawan was amazing, and I really recommend every one to take the trip. The only thing that surprised me was that we rode so much inside Bangkok city before we took the boat over to the jungle, but I didn't mind that. Back at the club house we got ice cream, watched the pictures the guide had taken and enjoyed the fish spa. I personally loved the trip, but since we rode in the traffic between cars for a while, I'm not sure if it's that safe for young children.

First tour in 2015, and this time a Night tour in 2016, Fantastic!!!!!!. First rode with Follow me bike tours in 2015 on the Siam Boran tour, with tour guide Ah. This time I booked myself and some friends in, for the evening tour, and was pleasantly surprised when again our tour guide was Ah. A fantastic night tour, which took on a completely different perspective during the evening. Once again we all felt very safe, and the sights smells, and scenery were spectacular. A wonderful evening Meal In yarrowat (Chinatown), and a really wonderful and relaxing evening's riding. Seeing Wat Po at night without crowds was really impressive and serene, and Ah is so knowledgable and friendly, he really is an assett to the tour company. I hope to bring my wife and son to a tour eventually. Very impressive company and very happy once again.Tim

Bangkok from a exciting and different perspective.. The City Tour on bike was really exciting as one biked in residential areas and markets with ease. The contrast from the skyscrapers and the 1-2 story local houses was spectacular to see as one biked by. The guide was excellent even though there was not much time to stop and take pictures. This was not a problem as the guide provide pictures which was really nice. So a surprisingly different tour of Bangkok from a different perspective.
Excellent Bangkok bicycle tour. The guide is professional in the Thailand history, and friendly to care everyone. The bicycle tour is very nice~ I'd like it !!!

Great thing to do but..... We did this bike tour today having booked online a few days ago. We had a brilliant time but some things were of concern. Firstly the the start point is not easy to find as it is well off the normal tourist route. Our tour guide was ill-prepared. He was not dressed in the usual vivid green Tee Shirt the others had, that made him difficult to spot in busy streets at times. His bike was old and damaged. The other tour left before we did (we were the only 2 on our tour today) and our guide was unaware that he was leading us. He looked confused then seemed to pull himself together and assured us all was well. We set off. It was fine for the first section though his English was limited and at times he slipped into Thai! About an hour in, we reached a temple and stopped for photos etc. He disappeared, bike and all, for over 10 mins without saying a word! There were many other odd instances, small in themselves but we became concerned about his wellbeing. We completed the tour but, on reflection, we wondered about our safety at times. Our guide behaved oddly, especially once we returned to the base, despite our kindness and concern towards him. When we voiced our concern to the two guys in charge, one looked concerned, picked up his phone and walked away from the building. We did not see him again. The second guy was apologetic and walked with us to a road, and hailed a taxi for us. All rather bizarre. A bike tour is a great way to see the real city, the places where the people live, shop, eat and go to school. I will definitely do another, but cannot recommend this tour company on today's showing.

A must do for anyone looking for a unique Bangkok experience. We did the 5 hour night tour on a Friday night in Bangkok. I've been to BKK many times and am used to the usual party scene, which gets old quick. If you are more adventurous and looking for a unique experience this tour is for you! We spent time biking through some of the more popular tourist attractions like Wat Pho and Chinatown but also snaked through some local back alleys for a glimpse into the everyday lives of the Thai people. We were welcomed with smiles, smell of freshly cooked Thai spices and surprises around every corner. Next time I'm in BKK, I will try out the cycle/food tour for sure.

Get to know Bangkok in a special way : history and als way of life of THE locals !. We visites Bangkok for THE 4th time and toke a bike Tour every time. This was our first time with " Follow Me" !Excellent service and OUTSTANDING guide ! Told / showd us a lot of New things About THE way of life of THE local people, their jobs, their religion, their food.......We wil be back next time!

Great Tour!. My girlfriend and I had an amazing time biking around Bangkok. We especially liked going to the jungle. Our guide was personable and very knowledge about things to do in the city. I would recommend this to anyone!

Great way to see Bangkok from a fresh angle. We did the 4,5hrs historical tour with Mathew and a small group of 7 yesterday. It was simply, relaxed and Mathew is a great guide. Don't worry about the traffic, these guys make sure, that nobody gets lost. The fish spa us really nice to experience and will reward the heat you went through before. Catch a taxi and just do it, I'm sure you won't regret.

Interesting way to explore Bangkok. The guided tour by FollowMeBike is a nice way to explore the less traveled part of Bangkok. The guide led us through the old city, markets, canals and temples where we learnt about local history and culture. At the end of the trip, we also get to enjoy the fish spa.

super guide!. We planned to do an afternoon bike tour, we were scheduled to join in with a group of four others, but since this group canceled we got a private tour, with two guides! This allowed us to decide a bit more what to see and where to go. The tour showed some nice place where otherwise you probably wouldn't get to!

Great way to know more about the city. My husband and I had a wonderful experience. Mathew was a great tour guide. We did the tour on our first day, looking back it was good bc we were not that tired yet from all the walking that follows at the main attractions. I liked the explanation/comparison of the Chinese and Thai temples (in a quiet environment, away from the crowds, lotus flower tutorial, going thru some of the neighborhoods and the taste of some local snacks, we got to see the flower market and chinatown during this tour. Thanks

Great tour！. We join the Siam History Tour,it's a 5 hours tour,go visit Siam old area, Tailan and Chinese temple, flower market and China Town. We also take a ferry to cross the river with bike. It's a good tour to know Bangkok's history and belief.

great way to see Bangkok. Several bike tours are offered, and we did their city tour (called Siam Boran). It was lots of fun, and offered a great way to see Bangkok. Over about 4 to 5 hours, we rode through back alleys, city roads, along the river, and through shopping and residential districts. We even crossed the river (by boat).The company provides everything you need, and the equipment is very good. Also the guide who led us was very nice, very informative, and spoke very good English.I can't think of a single complaint, but I can come up with lots of complements. And yes, I give Follow Me Bike Tours two thumbs up!

The best attraction in Bangkok!. Such an amazing experience! We booked the Siam Boran tour and loved it. Our guide was so friendly and this has to be the most memorable thing we've done in a long time. Unfortunately our bike riding skills were a little sloppy so we found it hard at first but once we got the hang of it again, it was not too difficult. Having said that, riding though narrow alleyways, crossing the street in fast moving traffic, and riding next to large vehicles was a little terrifying. This tour is exhausting though so drink plenty of water. Even though it was a morning tour, it starts getting hot around 10.The guide provided us with enough drinks and snacks so we never felt thirsty during the tour. Finding the office was very easy, and I'd recommend using the skytrain to avoid the traffic and rude taxi drivers. There is also a fish foot spa in their office but I didn't try it. Overall a great experience that I would recommend everyone to do. I'll definitely book another tour with Follow Me Bike Tours in the future.

Great tour of the city and scenic park. Ah (sp?) was a terrific tour guide and provided an authentic view of Bangkok as well as the scenic views of the 'island jungle', open market, and a short boat ride

best thing you can do in bangkok. vene if you have only one day - chooose this company. You will get completly different, true and beautifull insights of bangkok. We did the Food & culture tour (6 hours) and were the only one with this choice so we had "our private guide". They even make pictures for you all the time for free. You will see places that are great and you will never find them in any travel guide. Simply the best

Excellent guides, fun tour a bit off the beaten track tours. I went for the jungle tour and had so much fun I came back for the city tour. The guides were knowledgable and sweet and spoke good English. And they skip the major attractions to take you to more quiet places off the guide books. I would recommend taking the afternoon tour rather than the morning - so as to spend the really hot hours when you still have energy. The guides seemed cautious and I felt safe riding through crazy Bangkok traffic! Though most of the tour is in quiet alleyways or in the jungle.

Awesome bike tour. We did the jungle tour few weeks ago with Matthew. It was really nice! most of the tour was just outside of Bangkok. the contrast was really big. It was quiet and peaceful and the nature is really nice!

From the begging to the end all perfect. I found Follow me Bike Tours searching on internet. The booking was online and the confirmation came right away in very well explained email. Before we started our guide showed a short video about the tour and about some safety procedures. I have made many different kind of tours and I'm my experience it's not common to have such a thing.The tour itself was great. It was a nice way to get to know the city. We cycled for very local areas, while our guide Mathew took care of everything. He bought the tickets for crossing the river and snacks in the market. He taught the group how to open a lotus flower while showing us a local temple.Our guide was never pushing us to buy anything whatsoever.When we finished the tour we got ice cream and less then five hours later we got a free link to download the pictures of out tour. Definitely, it was high quality service.

A "Must try" in Bangkok.. We went on the Siam Boran tour on the 26. of January. It was one of the cold days in Bangkok. We started out with degrees below 20, but the sun came out and the sky was clear, so it was a really nice day. Our guide Ae made the tour memorable with his smile and knowledge of Bangkok, the places we visited, Thai culture and history. We were only 4 on the tour, so it was a small group. This meant that we did not have to wait for a big group to pass streets etc. Ae guided us safely through the busy Bangkok traffic. We started on the "city" side and saw lots of places. Chinatown means busy, -and it was, but we had a nice walk down the streets and saw all the sellers. Ae bought snacks that we had later at a small place by the river. Then we crossed the river and went to the more quiet side. It was quite a contrast with a lot of low building and small streets. The pedestrian/bicycle road along the river was very nice. The biking was not hard. You do not need to be very skilled, but of cause you need to be able to ride a bike. If you go for the bike ride alone, you might want to take one of the longer tours. We finished off with ice cream and a cold drink at the clubhouse. All in all a very nice day.

Amazing tour in Bangkok. What a fantastic time in Bangkok. This was by far the best tour that I took. Out guide Peter was phenomenal and so funny. He showed us the local experience and the tourist sites. Simply fabulous,

Fantastic Tour. My wife, my friend and I undertook the nighttime Follow Me tour of Bangkok. What a great experience, our Tour Guides Ah and Tom guided us through back streets and pathways that we would never have found or gone down. It was really interesting to be interacting with locals as we cycled passed their front doors and said hello. We had already been to some of the landmarks during the day but going at night gave a far different perspective. We had dinner in Chinatown amongst the throngs of people and were treated royally by the local street food vendors. What an experience cycling through the traffic of Bangkok, which I thought was going to be terrifying for my wife, but in the whole pedestrians, cyclists, motorcyclists and motor vehicles of all sizes were respectful of us as road users, we felt safe. We had a fantastic time and this is a highlight of Bangkok, so what are you waiting for "Get on your bike!"
Highlight of trip. I was in Bangkok for a short time and this tour was the highlight; fun and informative. (I recommend wearing a helmet)

Bangkok Siam Boran Follow Me. My family did the Bangkok Siam Boran Follow Me route in an afternoon. Overall the experience was excellent! The bikes were good. The clubhouse was lovely. Two detractions were that it was very humidly hot and that the alleys were quite narrow with many bumps, people and vehicles, but it was only the three of us and the guide was amazing, so we could pace our own journey and that was really comforting. The guide was very professional. Although our biking skills were not high, he did not lose patience. He prepared firs-aid kit in case of accidents. He was also enthusiastic, taking us to many interesting places and explaining the culture with regards to where we came from. The package was great, too: The services included were quite considerate; and the route included places ordianary tours wouldn't take you to.

The Best Way to See Bangkok. My friend and I did the city tour - it's an incredible way to really see local life and visit places you wouldn't be able to on foot. Our guide Tom was knowledgable and extremely friendly. I recommend booking a tour on one of your first days in Bangkok so you know where you want to go back and explore more. Thanks so much Follow Me - the tour was the highlight of our trip!
FANTASTIC!. Most amazing trip ever. Great service and great guide. Most important: amazing tour!!!World definately recommend this tour!

Fabulous trip!. I had a great trip - the bike tour was safe, well run, and a ton of fun. We saw a different side of Bangkok that I wouldn't have explored otherwise and got to see a lot of off the beaten path places. Would absolutely recommend.
Great View of Bangkok!. This was a great way to see Bangkok. Our Peter Guide Peter was informative and funny. This was one of our favorite tours during our entire trip to Thailand!
So much fun!. Our guide was very interactive and informative and the sites were beautiful. A fun way to get a taste of Bangkok in just a few hours.

Best way to see Bangkok. We took the city tour on a Thursday afternoon.
