The excellent tour guide took us through Bangkok's backstreets from hotspot to hotspot, such as the Temple of Dawn, China Town as well as a ferry over the river Chao Praya (which was excellent by itself). By using mostly small back streets one really got to see the real side of Bangkok. It was impressive to see. The route the tour guide uses is great. It's a long bike ride but there is so much to see, before you know it the afternoon is gone. The bike tour guide gives you ample time to look at the different sites you visit, provides enough food and drinks along the way and knows things about every stop you make. Overall, I am glad I took this bike tour. I could highly recommend it to anyone! Based on prevous reviews I knew the tour would be great, but the real thing was beyond anything I expected. If you go visit Bangkok, do not mis out on this great tour.

Amazing Local Ride. Event tough we arrived an half an hour to late for the tour someone wated for us to take us to the group without of course missing any of the highlights of the tour. What I most appreciated was that the tour is not the typical touristic thing. The tour guide made this a fantastic and local experience.

Enjoyable tour. Overall a very nice bike tour. Great guide(s). A few more stops would be nice to take in the surroundings. A really good way to see Bangkok on your first visit. I did the Siam Boran and would recommend it. The small groups do make it more personal. It is a bit difficult finding the address of the company. And bike maintenance could be moved up in priority a little. The fish bath is kind of fun.
Absolut a must. We had a great day at Follow me. Perfect bikes and route. And specialfly our guide Mathiew was a gem!You have to tre this If in Bangkok.

Siam Sawan Bike tour. Great tour. Our guide, Ar, was fantastic - knowledgeable, friendly, engaging, sense of humour, safety conscious. Tour covered main roads, back streets, alley ways, narrow raised paths, slums, boat ride, jungles, villages, markets. Had it all and finished with a fish foot spa. Enjoyed every moment. Highly recommended.

Great way to see the city. I LOVED this experience. Our guide, Peter, was charismatic and supportive. He took great pictures along the trip and helped make us feel comfortable. They provided delicious snacks and treats along the way. The tour offered a wide variety of sights, ranging from temples to little ally ways I knew I wouldn't have explored without the tour. The weather was warm, but we stopped often enough that I never felt tired or overwhelmed. I would definitely do this tour again.
Night tour. Very interesting way to discover Bangkok and its different neighborhoods. Peter was a good guide. We enjoyed it very much.

Great way of seeing Bangkok - nice experience. Yesterday afternoon I joined the bike tour which was really great. There were 5 others from Germany, Canada, US and Japan so very international group. Our guide Peter really did a good job and making good jokes during the trip. There was enough time to see all attractions and the bike trout itself was great though backdoor alleys which you would never had found yourself. Great way to see Bangkok from that perspective. Well done.

a must do. I was running late (Bangkok peak hour traffic) the tour had started but one of the guides came back and got me !! I was on the tour with 2 lovely people from London, the tour was great we had. great ride, walked through some markets a ride across the river on a ferry !! the "follow me" team were constantly looking out for us, I feel like I saw the real Bangkok, little alley ways, main streets !! fantastic .

Such an excellent way to see Bangkok. I spent an incredible afternoon cycling through Bangkok with Follow Me Bike Tours, such a wonderful and different way to visit areas of interest. I would recommend this to anyone who would like to try a different way to visit tourist areas with an exceptionally knowledgeable guide.
Very Nice trip with high quality bicycles. We die a bicycle trip the fourth time with this company. Everything is well organised. We had a perfect guide that spneaks very well english

Hands down this should be your first priority when visiting Bangkok :). My wife, 17 year old son and I personally did the ‘Siam Boran’ 4.5 hour bike tour and we have seen more in that time than in 2 days walking through Bangkok. Our guide Peter was very knowledgeable, speak English very well and Peter had a good sense of humor to make the tour even better :-) You get to see everything; from the small alleys to the larger temples, even some flower and food markets and ride thru middle-class neighborhoods. We saw nooks and crannies of Bangkok that we would never have seen on our own. The whole experience was really great and different, but what impressed us most was how well-organized the company was! We will definitely recommend 'Follow Me Bangkok Bicycle Tours' to anyone wanting to truly immerse themselves in the sights, sounds and smells of Bangkok. It was the highlight of our short trip to this fascinating city!

A great way to see a different Bangkok. I went on the 'Jungle Tour' with Follow Me tours. My expectations were quite low, but I have to admit that the guys at Follow me were great. The bikes were well serviced and the guide took us along interesting back roads and event onto a boat. The jungle area we went to was a really interesting park and we even got to see a monitor lizard. If you have been to Bangkok and are looking for something a bit different I can highly commend this. Just remember the following - A good self wicking t shirt (as it will be hot), trainers, shorts, a back pack (mainly for water) and a big grin.

A great way to see central Bangkok's old city. We signed up for the morning Siam Boran tour, and had a great time cycling around the back streets and side lanes, passing by the old Customhouse, visiting Chinatown and the flower market, crossing the river, stopping in to visit some temples and feeding the turtles at one. We saw so much more than we would have via foot or if we had been by ourselves, and our guides (Ah and Noi) did a great job getting us across the busier roads. There were only 9 of us on the tour, which was a manageable number and having two guides meant that there was always one to lead the way and another to keep on eye on everyone and help with the few busier intersections. At the end of our bike rise we enjoyed a foot spa with the cleaner fish back at Follow Me HQ as well as a cheap and tasty lunch that they organised on our behalf (as an extra). A fantastic way to get a feel for the less commercial side of Bangkok if you're short on time like us (and don't want to think too much!), or just do it anyway as a great introduction to the city

Bicycle, bicycle, bicycle.... Great experience, so much fun.We went on a culinary tour and tasted and smelled the 'colors' of Bangkok. A big thanks to 'Peter'!We'll do it again.Accessible for everybody.

Definitely worth trying!. My boyfriend and I did the Siam Boran bike tour and we loved it! It was great way to cover lots of ground in Bangkok and we definitely saw things that we wouldn't have discovered on our own. It was fun to ride through the narrow alleyways where the locals live. We loved the flower market and being able to try some local food along the way. Matthew was our guide and he was awesome!! He took time to really explain things to us and he was just an all-round nice guy! I would definitely recommend this bike tour to anyone looking to explore Bangkok a bit more.

Excellent way to see Bangkok. We had taken a bike sightseeing tour in some other cities earlier and decided to take one during our stay in Bangkok. Even though we had visited the city earlier, the tour provided a new and fresh view to Bangkok. The tour itself was well arranged although there weren't that many stops during the first third of the tour. Our guide Matthew brought nice insights to the life the ordinary people of Bangkok and had also good knowledge of the sights we visited. Recommended!

An excellent way to experience Bangkok. We had taken a bike sightseeing tour in other cities earlier and decided to take one during our stay in Bangkok. Even though we had visited the city earlier, the tour provided a new and fresh view to Bangkok. The tour itself was well arranged although there weren't that many stops during the first third of the tour. Our guide Matthew brought nice insights to the life the ordinary people of Bangkok and had also good knowledge of the sights we visited. Recommended!
Great Night Bike Tour of Bangkok. Great guide , great organisation and equipment. Great experience biking though the real back streets of Bangkok at night.Recommend !!

Great afternoon in Bangkok Countryside. My family took the Siam Sawan Bike Tour in Bangkok. The tour was excellent. The staff were friendly and attentive to the needs of our group. The bikes were in very good shape with available helmets. I would highly recommend this company to use for your bike tours while in Bangkok.

Great leader made a thoroughly enjoyable trip. Very welcoming at reception with added free extras water, internet, feet nibbling fish, ice cream. Leader was excellent and very interesting to listen to on the way round. You need to be competent on a bike in busy traffic for about 20% of the time otherwise you see back streets and alley ways you would not venture down as a tourist. You see Bangkok as it is - potholes and all! Great fun.
Great way to see Bangkok. We had so much fun touring the city by bike. Our guide was wonderful and shared a lot about the culture and history or the city.

Ride to Places You Would Not Normally See. My son and myself joined the Follow Me Bike Tour on the recommendation of my sister. We both agreed that it was a whole bunch of fun. Our bike ride tour guide was enthusiastic and knowledgeable and made the ride so much fun. Thank you FOLLOW ME BIKE TOURS.
Biking tour through Bangkok: Most adventorous!!. Great fun! and something you would never do on your own!But would have loved to spend more time at the stopping places.

Follow Me Bangkok. This was a great way to see the city of Bangkok! We were able to easily find the clubhouse with the provided directions and map. The bikes were in great condition and complimentary water and helmets were provided if desired. Our tour guide was very knowledgable and brought us to some amazing sites throughout the city. Overall a great way to spend the afternoon.

Awesome Experience. We had a great 6h tour. This was the best experience of our Bangkok stay. Seeing the small streets in Bangkok opened up a new perspective on the city. It was just the two of us and our guide. Very glad we booked the long tour. Great street food tasting and lost of nice experience, incl. flower market, a temple, etc.

Best way to see Bangkok. I always wanted to cycle in Bangkok, but never thought it will be possible because of the very busy traffics, but after reading the reviews I decided to do it with Follow me. We started from the club House cycling along the back streets to Chinatown, flower markets, many temples and sites crossing River by ferry. This was awesome and relaxing ride with superb views. It was a memorable ride

Biking was the most fun activity in Bangkok. Biking through Bangkok is a MUST. Through crazy city-traffic, through the slums, then floating over the river in a longtail boat, no no.. it ain't over yet: the trip continues at the other side of the river, where you bike through the jungle over small concrete paths and enjoy the fresh air. It was awesome and safe!Follow me Bike tours is a very relaxed company, and let their guests truly have some fun.We both loved the tour. We shared the tour with a German couple, with only 4 people this was comfy and relaxed. Follow me does only small groups, which is a good thing.The guide did not share a lot of information during the bike trip, but after asking he actually started telling many things. Ask questions would be our recommendation if you consider taking this tour.It is a little expensive, but definitely well worth the money.
Much fun !. The bikes were in really good quality, the guide was great, and picture memories were taken and sent to us after the tour, fun experience !
It is much more than a bike tour in Bangkok!. The whole package makes the difference. I won't tell you more ... just be surprised!Thank you Matthew for guiding us through Bangkok.

Seeing the other side of BKK. Our 3 adult children were visiting us from the states for Christmas. (My husband and I are expats in Thailand). I had previously done an old city bike tour with another company and loved it, so wanted to do it again with the kids. However, that other bike company was closed for the New Year's holiday, so I chose to go with Follow Me Bike Tours. Overall, it was fun and we got to see different things than my previous tour, but our guide (although very sweet and kept us all together) was terribly boring....maybe she was the only one available to work on the holiday, is my guess. We found ourselves ready to keep moving on from one stop to the other after a quick overview at what we were looking at, but she couldn't read the body language, that our group of 7, didn't need all the nitty gritty details. Everything was closed because it was New Year's Day (not her fault, of course), so we didn't have our snacks until later in the ride at one of the temples and everyone was famished. The temples were packed and very busy for the holiday and it was fun being amongst that excitement. We almost didn't see the one place we wanted to see, the Wat Arun (Temple of Dawn), because she said we didn't have enough time. We begged for a quick ride by and she agreed, but then after that, she took us to 2 more stops even though it was getting dark. 3 of the bikes' lights did not work, but fortunately, the back alleys weren't too dark to see our way back to the Clubhouse. This tour was probably the same length as their competitor's, but it seemed much longer. We all got free green baseball caps, ice cream when we returned and lots of pictures of us that our guide took along the way...she emailed them that evening and we were not charged for them. Bikes were not as nice or as good of shape as the competition. Good instructional short video before we left...added humor so it wasn't so boring.

Very good biking trip. This biking trip takes you into all the back roads of central Bangkok, mostly small little alleyways. You get to know Bangkok from a very different perspective. Very knowledgeable guides who love to share their experiences with you! Only negative point (reason for only 4 stars): only one guide for 8 bikers, should have 2 guides, one in the front and one in the back of the group.

Visit a place beyond the craziness of inner-city Bangkok..... My cousin and I took part in the Siam Sawan bike tour with Peter as our guide. It was awesome! The city of Bangkok can be super busy and overwhelming. However, this tour shows you the greener and quieter side of Bangkok. It does exist. The bikes were great. The facilities were awesome. And the tour.....our favorite part of our Bangkok visit!
Great way to see Bangkok. This is a great way to see the city at night. My guide was awesome - knowledgeable and entertaining. If you like biking, this is a must do

A must do!. Great way to see other sides of the city! We booked a private tour as we had children with us and started at 8:30 a.m to end around 1 p.m.With regular stops along the small lanes to experience local life, visit a great Chinese temple (200 years old and famous for prayers for health), the beautiful old customs house (before it become another 5* hotel...), eat some snacks in Chinatown, stop to visit the colorful flower & vegetable market, cross the river to visit a temple with the biggest sitting Buddha on the other side... It started to get hot after 11:30 a.m. and when the kids could not take it anymore (even after a stop to taste a fresh orange juice) our guide offered for some of us to go back by tuk-tuk (that could carry 3 bikes too) while the rest of us went back.It's safe, fun, and small details made a difference: cap, water, fresh fruits provided...and an ice cream when we arrived back quite tired mostly because of the heat!It's a great way to visit the city and to discover some areas I will definitely go back to, by foot.

Great fun, interesting and safe tour. Enjoyed this tour thoroughly, we took the 'Sian Sawan' bike tour, was very interesting to go through areas we wouldn't have discovered by ourselves. Pace was just right, and very well organised company with a good focus on safety on the roads, particularly when Bangkok's road safety isn't one of the best in the world! They said its good for even younger children too.

Follow Me Bike Tours (Bites and Bikes Tour Variation). Having never been on a bike tour before I was not sure what to expect, but it was a great experience. I went on the 'bites and bikes' tour which included about 5 different food stops ranging from a traditional Thai Muslim restaurant to street food I would never have come across down small alleys (that were clearly very popular with locals). The 'clubhouse' is a great place to hangout before or after the ride and the groups all seemed really mixed, lots of European travellers and an average age of about 25, but a few older couples who had no trouble either. The bike riding itself is very easy and you walk across the major roads.Overall: A cheap and cheerful way to see a different side of Bangkok with lots of local knowledge.

Excellent Experience. It is a excellent experience to join the bike tour. The tour guide speaking with good English and he can show us what the life of local Thai. High recommend to join if you would like to explore the local life in Thailand.

Wonderful experience. This is our first time to join the bike tour since my family have been to Bangkok for many times.Thanks for the staffs of follow me bike tour who are friendly and patience. During nearly 5 hours tour, we walked through the local of the Bangkok city where we never visit before. We look forward to take part to the jungle tour when we will be in Bangkok again.

Even more fun than expected. All the other reviews are true, this is a great way to see a Bangkok. We did the Jungle Tour so our cycling time in the city was limited. I never felt unsafe and the guide did a great job of making me feel that way. It was Sunday which also meant traffic was quieter. Going through the slum was nearly impossible to cycle as it was very narrow but it was still interesting to see. We visited a local market and our guide helped us samples lots of tasty snacks. It was great and we tried all sorts of things we never would have without guidance and advice. Overall it was a great day and our guide was awesome. Plus he took photos throughout the day and it was also a nice bonus.

City tour. Brilliant tour. Mostly on low traffic back roads that would be almost impossible to find. You get to see a different side of the city up close and with friendly tour leaders. Best to go in the morning as it can get hot later in the day.

Exciting tour in Bangkok. We chose Follow me because of the excellent reviews on Tripadvisor and we did not regret it at all. We really enjoyed an exciting tour through little alleys, residential areas and many hidden places to see.Thanks to Matthew, our guide, who was very pleasant and inspiring.
Awesome. Original, diverse and adventurous 5 hour discovery of the city. Balanced mix of sightseeing and riding through local life. Am eager to discover the other Follow Me bike tours.

Matthew from Follow me Bike Tou. Wow! This was an amazing experience. We saw all of the sites and a few secret spots. Our tour guide Matthew made us feel safe even on the busy streets of Bangkok. If you were to do one thing in Bangkok besides eat... This is it!!

Insider Tour of Bangkok. Such a wonderful and unique way to see Bangkok. One of our favorite aspects was riding through alleys and witnessing local culture in action - cooking and cleaning outdoors, children playing, etc. There were many additional stops that are too many to list. It would be difficult to experience Bangkok this way otherwise. Our guide was personable, informative and made us feel 110% safe despite the chaotic nature of the traffic. Bonus - our guide took many great photos of our group and the sites we visited as a keepsake. The whole experience was memorable and remains one of the highlights of our two week holiday in Thailand :D Highly recommended!
great experience. Riding around bangkok at night is a great experience, very safe and the back alleyways were particularily interesting. Make sure you got the energy to make 25km!

One of the best tours EVER. Whoever thought up this crazy idea of taking bikes down the main traffic streets of Bagkok, down the market street of China Town (imagine riding a bike along 5th Avenue walkway) through the flower market. around so many back streets seeing the real Bangkok, stoping to feed turtles is a GENIUS !!!! Amazing half day tour and cannot recommend it enough its 22kms over 4 hours so not that strenous but you need bike skills to get around back streets Our Guide Peter was fabulous too - totally made.. but that helps doing this tourNever felt unsafe, but need to keep your wits about and probably not for kids !

Experience Bangkok in a Whole New Way. We spent five hours with Peter, our informative and generous Follow-Me tour guide, getting an inside look at parts of Bangkok we would never have visited on our own. The bike tour was the perfect balance between getting from site to site relatively quickly, seeing Bangkok "up close and personal", and lingering at various sites to "take it all in". We had three people in out party - and we had Peter all to ourselves for the five hours. He made sure we were comfortable, safe, and that this would be a tour we wouldn't soon forget! I highly recommend these guys (and gals)!!

Biking thru bangkok. Enjoy the trip. The different take of the sight and sounds of Bangkok. Riding through the back alleys interesting. Seeing how actual people live their life. The bikes were very good.

Great trip! Highly Recommended. Everything was just perfect.I doubted for taking this tour (as with a map and a bike you can also make your own tours) but still thought, lets try. And it was really more than worth it!> Passing streets which you would not easily find on your own (going trough Chinese tempel/Bhouda tempel/Islametic community/whole sale market/flower market/ and much more)> Strong and good bikes (equipped with all you might need)> But most important: a very good guide! Explaining so many things on the stops were we passed. Not only about the things you see, also about life in Thailand.I highly recommend this tour, it is a perfect way of visiting the city.

Great people and bike route. These guys are great and even waited for us since we where running late before they started the tour. Tour was all around bangkok, the best part was navigating through very tiny small streets on bikes. Really get to see how the locals live.

Bike tour in Bangkok. I joined the Siam Sawan Bangkok Jungle Bike Tour with my wife last week and we got a very good experience to look at Bangkok at a very different angle.We wish to emphasize that the tour guide was taking care of the whole team through out the trip carefully, though we have to ride on busy main roads as well as narrow country paths. We really enjoyed the ride and would like to join their bike tour again when we re-visit Bangkok.

Hidden Bangkok. We booked the Siam Boran tour for our first day in Bangkok. The trip winds its way through obscure back streets and alleyways and gives you a real flavour for how life is really lived in the capital. A great way to get to see areas you would not normally access on the traditional tourist route

Jungle tour. We went on a jungle bike tour. There were only 2 of us. Nice guide but I have done other bike trips in Bangkok and all over Asia and I do have some remarks. There was too much cycling. I know this sounds trite to say this about a bike tour but we stopped almost nowhere. I would choose a smaller part of Bang Krachao and explore it more in depth. Maybe stop at a fruit sell or visit a local temple. Now we just cycled not only on the concrete pathways (great) but also a lot on the main roads of the island. Good, but not as good as it could be.
Siam Ratree. the tour was great, the sites were beautiful at night and not many people were there. It was rather an enjoyable bike tour!

Great Local Experience. I can say the bike tour was very worth the trip!!! I was expecring a simple bike tife around the city but turned out it was an immersion with the route getting us inside the alleys of local Thai residents:) they were very friendly and respectful to bikers! We even had the chance to ride the ferry to get to the other side... Our guide A (pronounced Ahhh as what he said because his name is too long hahaha) was so good in english and we had a great time with him:-) Will definitely be back for Follow Me's other bike tours and recommend it to friends!!!

Crazy - Save - Beautiful!. It's a pleasure to see the quiet areas of Bangkok you would never imagine! Also the tour guides are excellent and you tell you a lot of history and thai lifestyle. Not to forget that you get a lot of giveaways (food, drinks, flowers aso.) = GREAT!!

great way of seeing Bangkok. great guide and trip around the parts of Bangkok you probably wouldn't see if out on your own - Plenty of interesting facts offered up by our guide and the pace was in keeping with the needs of the group - Overall a great experience and well worth the money - Small but important point was the photos being taken along the way by the guide were offered free at the end of the tour - thanks very much for a great few hours
Get close to local culture and life in the shortest time. It is worth to join this bicycle tour if you would like to know more about the local people lives in Bangkok

Can't recommend enough!. I am in Bangkok for only 3 days so I thought this would be a good way of seeing the city in an afternoon. They have several tours to choose from and, in the one I chose, I didn't get to see the hotspots (touristic locations) but it was so much better. I cannot stress this enough, it was really good. We got to see all the little streets and get an idea of how Bangkok really is like. If you do this trip you will find yourself pedaling a lot through backroads and alleyways, seeing real locals doing their thing. You'll stop at several "hidden" gems and will have the time of your lives. This is suited for people of all ages as long as they can pedal. Our tour lasted 5 hours but it is not exhausting because we made several stops and Bangkok is a plain place.FREE beverages were offered to us (before, during and after the trip). Ferry trips were also free.It was my birthday so they went to Dunkin Donuts and actually sang me happy birthday. Amazing touch on their part!! Being a solo traveller, it really moved me. Thank you.Bikes are new and comfortable.I had to sign in to make my first comment on TripAdvisor. Can't recommend them enough!

Great experience to discover Bangkok. The Follow me Team did an excellent job! They arranged the city tour especially for us as we had no other time slot to do it - and this was much appreciated! The bikes were good and we were well instructed before we started. Our guide took us through narrow streets, quiet corners, showed us Chinatown, markets and temples and provided a lot of Information. He guided is very well, took pictures from us and always informed us what's next - so no reason to worry about risks. We totally enjoyed the tour and we can absolutly recommend the Follow Me Team to everyone! We would do a bike tour with them anytime again!

Great tour and way to see the city. I took the Bangkok Night Tour by myself last night (11/19/15) with Ah (if I spelled his name correctly)! He was informative, nice, and spoke English well. I went with two Germans (I'm American), and though I thought 2,000 baht was a lot to pay, but I would say it was totally worth it. You get an idea of the city, the temples, and food/culture. Benefits of this ride and paying 2,000 baht: 1. ALL expenses included. You take a ferry twice (normally you have to pay but the guide will pay this for you) and our guide bought drinks at least 3 times. Water is provided, and ALL food is included. We even got ice cream at the end! You do not pay anything else if you don't want to. You have opportunities to walk (like in china town) and you can buy some things if you want.2. Having a Thai guide who obviously understands culture, language barriers, food and directions!!3. Ah knows Bangkok. You could call this the "Alley" tour of Bangkok. He took us places I would have never gone and through alleys you would never take. 4. It's absolutely safe. I am surprised at how safe I felt in Bangkok at night on a bike. There was NOT one point I felt unsafe. The only thing to look out for is random potholes and low lying roofs. I would say 75% was off the main streets, and 25% on the Main Streets. Traffic was good and not a problem.5. Small tours. Only 3 guys total on our tour. Ah said they only take up to 6 people on the tour. This is much smaller than other bike tours I have done which can be as much as 15 people. Ask your guide questions about Thai culture and you can learn as much as you want.6. Great tour. Good bike. Do it. You won't regret it.

Great way to spend little money and see a lot of Bangkok. Our guide was great - Tiu in Thai and Matthew for the foreigners to comprehend his name!He took us to some neighborhoods that nobody would go alone during the day. As sad as it may be, you are confronted with the true reality of some of these neighborhoods and the harsh reality of one of the most asynchronous and unequal cities of the world.We've been in the flower market - my favourite part - we've been explained a lot about the religion and culture of this country and people. We've done a super cool ritual with a lotus flower that Tiu bought us to use in one of the temples we've visited. We've asked for protection and whatever you'd come up with that you need in your life to the sitting Buddha!Bangkok is far from a beautiful city and charm is something that it surely doesn't have... so you'd better know the reality of it through these guys!4 hours pedaling - sometimes through heavy traffic roads - don't worry though... they make sure you pass in safety - even if Tiu has to stop in the middle of an avenue with his hand raised and stopping the traffic for you :)
Cycling trip around bangkok. Overall left very impressed! The cycling trip was great and something we had fun doing! A must do if you are in Bangkok!

Loved it! Great way to see the less touristy side of bankok. Loved it! We would definitely recommend it. Great way to see the less touristy side of Bangkok and via bike so not only do you get some exercise, but you avoid all the terrible traffic!We would do another one in a heartbeat if we are lucky enough to visit again!

4 Hours bicycle tours. From 8:30 am start, she guided us from the downtown, wearing side streets, through abandoned train track, long tail boat ride to the pier to the island, feeding the fish, tasting Thai snacks, guide very carefully, so we were very much enjoy this half-day cycling tour!

Great tour!. My colleague and I just had 24hrs in Bangkok, and this was the absolutely perfect way to discover the city! The bikes were good, our guide Matthew was super, and his tour took us through charming streets of Bangkok that we would never find on our own. Definitely recommended!

Long day but great fun. We only had a short stay in Bangkok so decided to the longer tour which included a foodies tour in the morning and a bike tour in the afternoon. It was a long day but great fun. The food tour was very informative and we tasted some food that we would not have normally tried. Also went to some hidden restaurants that again would not have found on our own. Did a bit of walking so lots of exercise there. Straight after it finished we were dropped off at the clubhouse and straight into the bike tour. Really enjoyed that riding through the small back alleys where people were going about their daily lives. Great way to experience the real city. The riding was not hard but we clocked up some kms during the afternoon. Our guide was great fun always having a joke and he was also very informative. We could have split the tour into two days but very glad we did it this way. We are both about 60 and managed it fine so that will give you an idea of how hard it is.
Great trip through the city. Cycling is a fantastic way to see and get to know a city a bit better. This tour was no exception. Great!

fantastic day n bangkok. Had a brilliant day with an excellent tour guide. We saw places that we would never have gone to by ourselves. The bikes were good and it gave us an appreciation of Bangkok from the back of a bike.
Follow me bangkok tours. Awesome experience. Friendly staff. Great Bike guide. Clear instructions received including location and hand signals. Everyone should try. Great value for money.

Bangkok at its best. Nearly seven hours out of the heat seeing temples without tourists and real markets. Peter was a lovely guide and this trip is really a must. He was even able to call the Bangkok Department of Rain and have the evening's rainstorm limited to 5 minutes. Great fun: massively recommended.

Unforgettable trip!. I choose trip around old city, chinatown- which took around 4 hours.My guide was Matthew- incredibly nice, polite, helpful and charming person. He managed group of 8 person, was all the time checking if all of us are ok.He was explaining a lot about culture, religion, answered to all question that group had about Thailand. Extremely well prepared trip, good quality of bicycles, water and soft drinks waiting whenever group needs, delicious thai snacks, friendly atmosphere, surprising activities! (You need to go to see;))Much more worth this kind of trip than visiting alone all temples around Bangkok. I will do it again next time! Matthew! Thank You one more time it was amazing morning!
Lot's off FUN!. We had a wonderfull time with our guide Peter!I have been quite a lfew times to Bangkok, but Peter showed us many new placesAnd interesting information about the country . Thank You!

Must do!!. So glad the wife and I did this tour. It was only the two of us and Matthew our guide was amazing, his knowledge of Thai culture was massive and we learnt a great deal. 100% recommend. Matt and Kerry

follow me bike tour Bangkok. A fantastic way to see the city and its hidden laneways - and get some exercise as well. Good quality bikes, friendly, knowledgeable guide and lots and lots to see. Plenty of water available for when we were thirsty.Fun and would recommend to anyone.

Phantastic!. We did a great bike tour through amazing Bangkok with follow me. Our guide Matthew was very friendly. He gave us much information about the city, religion and thai culture. The equipment was perfect, we always felt safe and it isn't exhausting as you may expect.The best you can do in Bangkok!

A great way to see the city!. I really enjoyed my day at FollowMe tours, the guide Matthew was entertaining and knowledgable. They provided a view of the city that most people wouldn't see. I found the traffic a bit daunting at times but I survived ! Fish foot bath and ice cream at the end of the day and I slept like a log.

BestBestBest!!!! Do it.. This tour with our guide Matthew was one of the best tours I've ever did! We were all in all just 3 guests on our tour and our guide showed us an amazing variety of Bangkok's different faces. I wouldn't have seen most of them by my own because didn't know they exists. We went through little tiny backyards and streets and got in touch with the "real" Bangkok. Beside the huge tourist hotspots you'll get a different impression of Bangkok's people and way of life. Very remarkable was Matthews knowledge about the different religions which exist next to each other and together in Bangkok. The whole tour felt individual and special, like created just for us. That IS special:) back to the headquarter you have the chance to close the day with a little funny event, but I don't want to bespeak to much;) all in all highly commendable!

Amazing tour, and please play with the cockatoo!. Ok i don't write a lot reviews but we do travel ALOT! and i can honestly say the jungle bike tour we had with follow me was definitely the best tour we ever had compares to many tours we had around the world. (Definitely not your standard boring tours! And we can't wait to recommend it to our friends if they ever visit Bangkok)An interesting note that made me to write this review:In the bike clubhouse they have a cockatoo parrot, apparently out of boredom and lack of friends, he is plucking his own feathers...(according to the vet).when we finished our tour we started to pay a little attention to him, and discovered what a friendly little chap he is!he loves people rubbing on his head and neck area, you will see how he enjoys it by lowering his head down for you to rub...once you gain his trust, he will try to climb on your arm or shoulder, I keep rubbing his neck and I was asking him'are you ok?' 'Are you happy now?' You can see that he will response to you by nodding his head!!When we had to leave it was hard to say goodbye... we said 'bye bye' and he replied 'bye bye' too! So if you have time after the amazing bike tour, please come to say hello and play with the little guy for a few minutes, maybe we can all help him to feel happier and stop his hair plucking problem!

Different Experience Biking through Bangkok. I've never done a biking tour before but we decided to do this because my husband is prone to blisters in the tropical environments so it's difficult to always be walking for him. I am glad we decided to do this because it was different and active. Our tour guide was Ah, he took us through the city of Bangkok first to the Chinese temple, then the flower market, then China Town, and last to the Temple of Dawn. What's nice is he will take you through the back roads where Thai people drive their motorcycles through town so you see parts of the city where people live that you wouldn't see on a "normal" tour. We had a group of 10 (8 others in addition to us) all from different countries, we are from the U.S., Ah spoke fine English and was very nice. We did have one older fellow who Ah did forget to slow down for, but he always stopped and looked back to make sure we were with him. If you are worried about biking through traffic, it's really not too bas as the Thai people are used to driving around bikers and motorcyclists, as long as you stay to the left and stay with your group you should be fine.
Great tour. Great bicycle tour around Bangkok, perfectly organized. We went on the tour with four kids and four adults and got a new and exciting view of the city - highly recommendable!

AMAZING Night tour. We loved this trip!. Our Tour Guide (Prayoon at Thailandtoursonline.com) arranged this tour for us per our request. The starting location is difficult to find (Uber had difficulty), but the evening tour (5 pm - 11 pm) was fantastic. Our guide purchased food for us to try from street vendors. Delicious. We then got a night time preview of many sites that we saw the next day during our guided tour with Paryoon. After the tour was finished, the guide helped direct our Uber car to the pick up location to take us to our Hotel - JW Marriott. The cost for Uber ride was about $5 USD. very reasonable.The food was fantastic and biking in Bangkok was a lot of fun!
Best thing in Bangkok. Great way to see the quiet side of the city. Peter was an informative, fun and cheerful guide who looked after us very well. Simply ace.

great tour, amazing guide. Very well organized, gives you a perfect way to see the city, super safe and we visited very interesting places, the guide was friendly and informative, also they provide you a spa and ice cream at the end what its a plus.

Another way to visit Bangkok. Most of us normally do at bangkok just shopping,eating,massage,cycling is another different way to see the different bangkok,they will bring you go the place u never been to!and also i never cycling in the busy city like bangkok,this is my another experience,what i can say is Fun and Excited
Great adventure. Perfect trip! We saw a lot of places we wouldn't have discovered by ourself. Good guide, very friendly and helpfull. Bikes in good condition.

Great, easy paced tour. We really enjoyed our 1/2 day tour with Ah as our guide. With the short sections in traffic, 90% of the ride is in the back alleys. We saw more of the true life of the Thai and Chinese people. By parking the bikes a few times, you got to visit the flower market, China town and a few temples. A great day.

Great way to spend your day. We had only 24 hours in Bangkok on a layover and decided to do this tour combined with the food tour in the morning. Was a super fun way to spend the day and get to taste and experience a little bit of Bangkok. I would highly recommend this tour, just make sure you already know how to ride a bike.

Dangerous bikes. everything was about fine during our Sawan tour even we already experience some uncomfort due to the bike conditions. In the middle of the tour, my son wanted to break but the bike fail to operate, my son fail and ended with a broken wrist. No responsabilities was taken by the management. There's much better bike tour company with good standards of maintenance.

Great way to see the real Bangkok. Phet (my guide) is great! There were suppose to be 3 of us but two riders cancelled so I had a private tour. I have been to Bangkok many times but have never seen it quite like this. Phet took me through back streets and alleys and I came face to face with the locals. Phet shared with me history and story of the neighborhoods and he even taught me how to fold the lotus flower for the Buddha. I took the Siam Boran tour and the next time I am back I will definitely try the other longer ride.Once again thanks Phet for looking after me and all the pictures you took while I rode through the city!

Great perspective on Bangkok. We had a wonderful time with our awesome guide, 'Ah'. He was super friendly, funny, and very informative on all sorts of cool history of Bangkok and Thailand. He was a very responsible guide and communicated clearly what our next objective would be, how long we would be riding in traffic, and did a great job taking lots of pictures of our group along the way. Saw some unique and cool parts of Bangkok I don't think we would have ever found unless living here for an extended period of time. Definitely recommend!

FUN. Being able to cycle through the busy streets of Bangkok was one of a kind. There is nothing like it. Going into markets, Boat rides, the backstreet snacks, the busy roads, temples. It is a great experience to embrace yourself with local culture. The tour guide was extremely nice and enriched the whole tour experience.

Great tour, amazing guide. I find that this is one of the best ways to learn about Bangkok, its history and its main religion. I went with a small group where we biked around 20 kilometers. This is really a great way to spend time in a group while learning and enjoying the experience and brushing up on biking skills. It is the perfect time to ask someone about Bangkok and Thailand as well as enjoying the experience and having quite a laugh.My guide was Matthew and he had a great sense of humour, a great character and quite selfless. I will spare you the details but we overall had a great time and he gave us a few consumables as well as great experiences, pictures and a great time.

Great way to see a different side of Bangkok. Loved our Follow Me Tour! We did a 4 hour bike ride and a 4 hour tuk-tuk tour. The bike ride took us through the slums and a jungle. It was a super cool experience and definitely different than anything you would typically find in Bangkok. The tuk-tuk tour was with a different company (which we didn't know when booking). It was interesting and we tried a lot of good food but was a little long. By the time the tour was over, my husband and I were both falling asleep and not really paying attention. The only thing I wish we had known was we were told we were going to see the Reclining Buddha on the bike tour. We visited the grounds on the tuk-tuk tour but the buddha was already closed. We only had one day in Bangkok so we did not see the famous buddha. Would have seen before the tour if we had been told.

Awesome guide, awesome tour. We had a very confusing morning trying to find the tour! Our best advice - buy a cheap sim card, google it, get directions, not for the address - just insert follow me bike tours on your google maps! Take a taxi or the sky train! Other than that we arrive late, and the guys were kind enough to wait. Our guide Peter was super nice and very helpful, he told us awesome stories about thai culture! We did the city tour and we got the chance to visit bkk - it is still a tour but is far from touristic. We end up the tour doing a fish massage for free, so if you are planning this ahead don't spend money on this before :p they also provide water and snacks during the toor. Next time in bkk we will do the jingle tour!

Exhilarating Bangkok experience.. Having visited Bangkok on 3 previous occasions it was difficult to find something different to entertain my Son on his fourth trip. The bike tour was just the ticket. Exciting, exhilarating and informative. We saw parts of the city that we never knew existed and met some genuinely lovely people en route. Cycling through the city streets was not as bad as we thought. Clear and safe instructions from our excellent guide made you forget where you were.....Rama 3 road on a bicycle. After leaving the busy road, we were ambling through back streets and across railway tracks until we reached the river. The long boat took us to the swamp/forest area where the real excitement began. Words cannot fully describe the adrenalin rush of speeding along the narrow pathways above the swamp water. Some basic cycling skill is needed especially with the 90 degree turns....and a lot of confidence. However the rewards are fantastic and you will remember the trip for a long time with some excellent action photos courtesy of your guide. For the ultimate experience, plan a thunder storm for the final hour !!!!.

Behind the scenes. I have done two excellent tours with Follow Me and thoroughly enjoyed each. My favourite part is getting to see Bangkok away from the tourist track and under your own power. Highly recommended!

Excellent experience to see Thailand. Thanks Peter gave us a great time and show us different side of Thailand, all my friend got interesting when they saw the pictures, Peter is a funny guy and can speak a very good English, highly recommend. I join the Jungle Tour, it was so excited when we take the boat trip to the island, kindly remind since Thailand always raining, slippy road and need to be more careful.

Fantastic day in Bangkok. We arrived in Bangkok in the morning and went to the bike tour right in the afternoon. Since it was only the two of us we essentially had a private tour. It was amazing. We cycled around Bangkok and visited places we would have never found ourselves. From the busy streets of Bangkok to slums to jungle and then back. Our guide was incredibly caring and fun - we will remember this trip for a long time.We only had two days in Bangkok and it was

A side of BKK you would never see. Exciting! You get to experience how it's like to be a local while learning more about their culture and history through visiting the different areas of BKK, passing through side streets and main roads. Food and drinks, which is part of the tour, was also very delicious! I'd do it again. Tour guide was very helpful as well in answering all our questions, no communication gap, very informative, and made sure that we everything was okay the whole time.

Seeing Bangkok as locals do.. It was super fun biking around Bangkok. I would definitely recommend this tour to everybody especially to those who loves to explore the city in a different way. We are grateful to our tour guide (im sorry i forgot his name). I was scared at first, but the he made us feel safe while on tour. They provided helmet and cap, and their bike is nice too. I want to take home one of them.
Perfect trip. After a month of vacation in four countries, Peter (our guide) and this adventure remains our favorite!

Can't recommend highly enough. You must do this!. We booked online a few weeks before our visit. Turned out we were the only two to book on our day, so it was a private tour. The guide (can't remember his name unfortunately) was really informative and his English excellent. We booked the Siam Sawan tour which incorporated a white knuckle ride through busy Bangkok streets, then through part of a slum (not as bad as it sounds). Then we boarded a long tail boat to motor over the Chao Phraya to Phra Pradaeng; a lush green forest where people live amongst the Palm trees. Amazing to see this so close to the pollution of Bangkok. From there we went to a conservation park to feed the ginormous fish and on to one of Thailand's former Prime Minister's houses - a great example of a traditional Thai house. Refreshments and snacks were provided throughout, and we were able to stop at any point to ask questions or take photos. Also the guide took a number of photos on his own camera - a week after the tour, a link was emailed over to download. The fish foot spa at the end of the tour and the complimentary tea was a nice touch. I can honestly say this tour was one of the best things I've ever done. If visiting Bangkok you must do it.

Night ride in Bangkok. The ride took place even though l was the only participant. We went through little alleyways that you would not find as a general tourist. My guide was very informative with good English skills. Visiting the temples at night when they were all lit up and no tourists was lovely. We went through the flower market and watched the activity that was buzzing around that area. Well worth it.

Amazing! Loved it. So fun!. This was the best experience. Peter, our guide, was fun, kind, and knowledgable. We had a total blast seeing the city, experiencing the twists and turns of Bangkok roads, and the service was incredible. Peter was seamless getting us fruit, water, feeding turtles, and much more. Great time! I highly recommend. I was to find these tours in every city now!

Great tour, a must do in BKK. We did a great tour (the standard one)j, it was a fantastic experience with a great guide. All three of us had a good time and a lot of fun! Had been to Bangkok 3 times but a bicycle tour is not to be missed!
Siam Sawan. Best Tour Ever! Peter is so funny, we booked the "Siam Sawan bicycle tour"! best experience in Bangkok! Greetings from "Vikrom" and "Sushata" :D

Thrilling. A bit scary but competent guide made sure we made it alive through Bangkok traffic.Worth it for both the adrenaline rush and the beautiful places you will see on the way.Easy enough for someone who hasn't sat on a bike for a couple years, although I did have a bit sore bum after. :)

Fun in the city jungle. Very well organized, very friendly and competent guide; cycling skills are necessary, there are not a lot of attractions along the way, but once you have left the heavy traffic in the city you are able to enjoy the wetland with lush vegetation

The best way to see Bangkok. This is simply a fantastic way to see Bangkok. I've done private tour guides via public transport and other tours but this way simply the best. Riding through tiny back alleys, seeing parts of Bangkok you can only do on foot or bike and being guided by an expert was perfect. I lucked out and was the only person on my city tour so I was treated to a great personal experience with my guide Peter. He was very personable and fun to spend the morning with. 80% of the ride was in back alleys, a small time on main roads (not an issue at all) and then some time crossing the river. Follow Me Bike Tours are a great business, professional, fun and I will be back for another tour later this year.
Follow Me Bike Tour. Excellent tour giving an insight into the real Bangkok, including the "lung of Bangkok" Matthew was an excellent tour guide being very informative and able to have fun
Siam sawan "jungle" tour. It was great. Morning tour is good, because afternoon is too hot. We went saturday, so we visited a local market. It's good too.

I saw bangkok city full details. if you get a boring in tour, the bike tours make you to be excited.you can see a lot of details for bangkok and you can listen detail explanation about scenery from guide

Perfect way to know BKK!. the tour is perfect to know the small streets around chinatown and old bangkok. I was really happy to be able to do it alone with the guide, having the chance to ask a lot of questions and get the best infos from Mathew.

A different view of BKK. Fantastic. It may be a bit confronting in the major traffic if it's your first day in BKK but even as a resident I had a ball. Great guide, good bikes, places I've never seen before!

Amazing off the beaten path adventure. I read many good things about Follow Me and I'm so glad I tried it out. I went on the jungle tour...there were only five of us so a small group. we rode through Bangkok to get to the outskirts near the forest. IridiumGroup through Bangkok is an adventure in itself. Definitely a bit nerve wracking....especially if you're not a confident bike rider. Don't worry though, I did it...I had some mishaps along the way but all in all it was great. I give our guide, Matthew, two thumbs up. He was very nice, spoke English well, and was really knowledgeable about the area and sites we visited. Definitely worth doing.

Super interactive bike tour. An excellent way to see the city. The tour guide was light hearted and knowledgable. Got to see parts of the city I would never of come across if I had not done the tour. Would recommend this to anyone although bare in mind people who are not confident on a bike would struggle or need to go slowly. Those who are confident on a bike will love it.
amazing bike tour. Fun experience! Nice bikes. Safe tour. Rest breaks given. Yummy food snacks in between. Thumbs up!:)

Bangkok's Urban Jungle by Bike = Amazing!. This was my 2nd time attending a "Follow Me" Bike Tour... Also my second time with tour guide "Ahh". What a great experience... We enjoyed the ride through the "slums" of Khlong Toey and then the private long tail boat ride to Bang Khra Chao Bangkok's Green Lung! Ahh was very kind in escorting us slowly through the weekend market there and allowing us plenty of time to taste Thai foods and drinks. As well we really enjoyed playing with the sling shots that one elderly vendor had set up a small target range for, and Ahh even included that price in our tour. The bikes were semi-well maintained, for having lots of customers and tours they definitely showed some wear and tear, but were still completely safe to ride. I recommend the beach cruiser style cushion seat for these longer tours as I rode the mountain bike and my bum is still sore hahaha!Follow Me Bike tours is the best way to see the "Real" Bangkok!

Amazing fun and friendly. We did morning Bangkok tour with two other and had a brilliant time. Guide was amazing and knew the city so well and had an amazing sense of humour which made the trip so much better. We saw sides to the city you would never see ordinarily and cannot recommend this tour to ANYONE highly enough ...

Must experience when in Bangkok!. We had nothing short of an amazing time. We booked a trip the night before, and when we wanted to change the reservation we got an immediate response. When we got there, we were given free snacks and drinks. After explaining the safety guides, we were on our way. We did the citytour by day, and it took us 4,5 hours. Our guide Mathew was wonderful, very good English and explained everything very thorough. We stopped at markets where we were provided with local snacks, we saw temples, we cycled through the slums, we took a boat across the river, and when it started raining we were given caps and coats for free. Fantastic!If you travel to Bangkok, this is a must!

Friendly and professional. I took the biking tour in june 2015 and I was impressed with the quality of the equipment, the professionalism of the guide and the all around quality of the tour, I felt safe even going through the poorest parts of the city. Can't wait to book with them again.

Bike tour of Bangkok. A great morning out, discovering unknown parts of the city by bike. Beautiful temples, gorgeous flower markets and snacks. What more could you want. The clubhouse was a lovely oasis in the heart of the city offering drinks and light meals. The staff were knowledgeable, friendly and humorous and made the day.
Very good. Friendly, well organised, interesting and saw parts of Bangkok you wouldn't see otherwise. Safe riding too.

A ride in Bangkok. Follow Me Bike Tours is a good company with great and helpful staff. The tour gave me what I expected: A different view of Bangkok. I just wished I had more days in Bangkok. I would have used all of Follow Me Bike Tours tours.Thank you for your help.

Fantastic Bangkok City Bike Ride. We recently did the bike tour that starts at 8.30 in the morning. It was absolutely great and the organisation, safety and bikes were first class. Matthew, our guide was very knowledgeable about everything and looked after us well. There was about 8 on the tour. We covered about 20km and cycled through the backstreets, riverside, markets, food stalls, temples and streets of Bangkok. Doing it this way you see sights, smells and sounds you never would ordinarily. The cycling is pretty easy, sometimes on main roads but you are safe at all times. Do not worry about the traffic. As always you must have an open mind whilst in Bangkok but this is an amazing experience. We will be back!!

Great experience with Followme guide Peter!. we did the 5 hour guide tour with Peter on our first day in Bangkok.Visited tempels, church, crossed the river on ferry twice, rode thru small and big streets of Bangkok, seeing all aspects of the people, markets, monuments. We were a family of three. We received great pictures, taken by Peter during the ride! Thanks Peter!Definitely worth doing!

Great way to see Bangkok. We were very well looked after and saw parts of Bangkok we wouldn't have seen. Enjoyed the boat trip across the river and cycling down back streets. If recommend this company for an organised trip, they send you photos af the trip and supply drinks etc along the way.

Friendly and Professional. This tour company made my visit to Bangkok! The guides were friendly and the administrators were professional. I got a great feeling for what life is really like in Bangkok by biking through the narrow city streets with our guide.
Cycling with follow me. Highly recommend. We spent a great morning trip in Bangkok. We Will recommend follow me to my friends.

Great fun and great way to experience Bangkok. Have done this tour twice now. Once w my 11 yr old son and once w my husband. Both times we all enjoyed the adventurous ride around the bustling streets, alleyways, and back canals of Bangkok. The tour company keeps the group sizes small, is very responsible and concerned abt safety, and the guides are in good spirits and have good sense of humor!
Something different in Bangkok. Great guided bike tour in Bangkok in unknown areas of the city (we did "the jungle tour"). Something different from the classic temple, and floating markets visit!

Follow me bike tour. Very friendly people and you go to very nice places. After doing this bike tour, it felt like we had been in Bangkok for weeks. I would really recommend it to other visitors of Bangkok.

A really fun and insightful way to take in the city!. My partner and I were lucky enough to have the lovely Thai guide Peter all to ourselves as he spent 6 hours taking us through the backstreets of the city. It was a very interesting and nice break from the typical tourist traps! Peter enlightened us with what Thailand has to offer, he was very informative yet entertaining the whole day and very thoughtful to our needs. Peter has a good eye for photography too with a multi-tasking game of biking and snapping along the way. Temples, extensive China Town, food and flower markets - we rode through it all!I'd highly recommend for an alternative take on the city, full of local knowledge. No need to carry money, you're taken care of by Follow Me every step of the way and treated to ice cream and a fish foot scrub on your arrival back. Well earned! Cheers guys!

You have to do it!!!. Great tour - we booked a private tour with seven people and had the guide Peter - super funny guy! We explored the outside part of BKK with local market, boat tour with bikes, nice views, nature etc - just do it! you wil be surprised!!! :)

A very nice and fun bike ride in the outskirt of Bangkok!. Follow me bike tours offers a relaxing bicycle tour in a beautiful natural environment. It was a nice escape from the noise and busy city center. The guide was friendly and was taking very good care of us, especially in the local market where he introduced us to some local food. All in all, it was a truly nice tour!
special experience. Helpful guides. Nice place for biking. However, the jungle is suitable for experienced biker only. He!

Bangkok unseen. Good bike tour, very nice guide Peter was funny and took care of everyone in the group. For a historical tour I would like some more historical info but we had a good time. Club house and fish spa are a nice bonus.

Very bad organization, bad conditions bikes , a nightmare in the pollution !. We, as a group of friends and family ( 10 persons ) decided to visit Bangkok in a different way , what s a mistake we did ! After we arrived for the tour, we had to wait for over an hour and half, somes bikes doesnt have brakes, somes with deflated tyres, we refused to ride such a bikes even the owner told us it is normal conditions ! we had to beg for helmet too , we finaly got them, extremely dirty , never mind after 2 hours, we decided not to argue anymore as we wanted to leave for the trip after strucking 2 hours under an iron roof that made felt us like in a sauna ! it was very hard to make our way into the traffic as the departure point is in heavy traffic area, smoke from car exaust were heavy, we finaly get to some kind of tours always struggling to make our way, nothing relaxing, very stressfull, we will always remember this tour, in one word, a nightmare, strongly not recommanded, we experienced a much better in Bangkok at a nearby organization that start near the customs nearby the port where we directly went to a kind of green island, as for this one, no apology were made, we paid upfront and their let us know that we were only tourist and the next group was coming, a kind of get out and quickly, all groups had the same feeling ! Terrible experience
Good experience. Although the Jungle trip is difficult to me ,but the guide is so caring and .Follow me give me an excellent and unforgettable experiences.

Refreshing Tour of Bangkok.. We found the biketour a great way of seeing more of Bangkok. Above all, it is refreshing to cycle with a temperature of 35! Our guide Peter was nice, funny, well informed and a true guide, also to our 10 yr old son. He made sure that we had enough to drink and Thai snacks along the way. When we returned we were served fresh fruit and little fish......

Excellent way to see Bangkok from a different perspective . Leave plenty of time to get to the clubhouse by taxi, traffic around Sathorn can because nightmare. Once there however you will receive an excellent service with great guides and good bikes. All safety aspects covered and a side of Bangkok you wouldn't see any other way. Recommended.

Great way to see the city. We had a great experience with our guide peter who was very friendly and informative. We did the historical bike tour on our first afternoon in bangkok which helped us get some of our bearings and also took us to places that we otherwise would not have gone such as very narrow markets, and the flower markets. He bought us some tasty local snacks from the market which we enjoyed. Peter also tought us some cultural traditions and language which we found really interesting. We would recommend this bike tour to anyone and especially first timers in bangkok. The pace is quite easy and enjoyable and you see much more of the city on bike than you do on foot. Good value for money as there are no hidden charges.
Relaxing and friendly. Cycling in the countryside and the park, friendly guide Peter, friendly Thai people during the trip, funny and relaxing, it was a nice trip, we loved it!

One of our best travel experiences ever.. A fantastic experience, riding round the narrow back alleys, markets, temples and streets of Bangkok. Crossing the river by boat and crossing dual carriageways, stopping all the traffic, added to the experience.All above led by an excellent guide and assistant ensured safety and a memorable insight into Thai culture and Bangkok street life.( Amost forgot, the feet nibbling fish at the end were also bril)

Must do while in Bangkok. The clubhouse is a oasis hidden near Sathon road and BTS Chong Nonsi. We had a very warm welcome. We were offered cold water and hot tea or coffee. The place is very nice decorated with lots of plants. They showed us a funny video about what we were going to do and what was expected from us. Our guide Peter was very nice. He had a lot of information and knew the answers to all our questions. We saw many interesting things. And last but not least he guided us safely through the busy Bangkok streets. He bought snacks and drinks for us halfway. You could get water at any time. It is really nice to explore Bangkok by bike, it goes faster than walking and is also not that warm. The bikes where good too. I am a stewardess so I have done many tours before. But this is one of the best I have done.
Fun way to discover bangkok. The tour was really well organized and our guide gave some interesting info about the places we visited. Plus, the fish spa was just great at the end of the tour!

A day well spent. Tiring but fulfilling! Very accommodating staff who will bring you to must see places and must eat but cheap and delicious thai food. Dave (the owner), his wife and his father were very warm too! Their suggestions for other places to go are worth visiting! I'll definitely follow their bike tours again!
Highly recommend!!!. I had a trip with them guys. Very professional staff. All day trip with Peter:) guide was excellent!!! Safety first. I will be coming back surely!!!
Great way to experience an original visit of Bangkok. Great experience overall : the guide was very attentive to our needs, we had a great afternoon cycling all around Bangkok

Green in the big city. We enjoyed a great morning cycling round Bangkok's "Green Lung" with our guide Peter who was very professional whilst getting us through Bangkok's incredibly busy traffic. A good insight into some places in Bangkok you wouldn't ordinarily venture to on foot. Well worth doing if you can spare half a day!
Emmy ko. Interest and professional staff of yours.But the visit point can do better.And the visitors could group more. Thanks!
Brilliant tour!. Lovely guide, really well looked after. Lots of interesting sights and info. Would highly recommend!

Fantastic way to spend half a day in Bangkok. Three of us joined a morning tour over to the 'green lung'. Staff were super friendly and gave us a proper introduction. The bikes were excellent, properly maintained, and we were also given helmets to wear - I really felt like we were being taken care of.The ride itself was interesting and the guide clearly knew the areas well and gave background information and ensured we always had water to drink and that everyone was ok.Interesting, fun, good value - can't recommend enough!
Awesome!. I would recommend to anyone! Fun tour that takes you through parts of Bangkok you would have no idea to check out!
Amazing!. Peter is fantastic (we did the 4 hr city bike tour) knowledgeable, funny, and this is a great way to see the city!

Best Way to See Bangkok. . We organised a private tour with 10 people. 4 adults and 6 children aged from 7 to 12. It's a little difficult to find the location via taxi but when we got there we were greeted by very friendly staff. We were given a safety talk, fitted for bikes and were on our way. We had three guides, they use the local laneways to get around the majority of the time. This is a fascinating look into how the local people live, especially since you spend a fair bit of time riding past their front door. In the laneways there are also scooters and sometimes cars, but we didn't have a problem negotiating and for the most time they kept out of our way. We visited various temples, the flower market and china town. All of which were interesting.You stop for a rest usually about every 10 to 20 minutes and the majority of road is flat, so it is really never hard going. It was hot on the day we did the tour so riding was better than sitting still at times! We stopped for food and drink, we even stopped for a local snack and drink under a bridge at a local food stand. After a ferry ride home, we honestly felt like we had seen some of Bangkok as the locals do, something as a tourist with young children, you don't often get the chance to do. The kids loved the fish spa and ice cream at the end of a great day. We had a fantastic guide called Ah. I would defiantly recommend this tour! Thank you for giving us a great adventure!

Pretty good. We covered a lot of ground in the city, which is always nice, but the city riding was not optimal, very stop-and-go, on/off sidewalks, maneuvering around pedestrians, etc. there was even a time when we went through a pretty narrow walkway in a market, and I kind of felt like a jerk with my bike making people move. The guide wasn't as informative as I'd have liked. Also on multiple occasions, he'd tell us to repeat a word in Thai, then laugh at our accent. Kind of annoying. But the company was good. I'd suggest doing a ride outside of the city though.

How to enjoy traffic. One of the best way to visit a city like Bangkok and his crazy traffic. We were welcomed by a very friendly and well trained staff that took us around the city trough all small streets with some stops for drinking or for visiting.I really suggest to bike this city with these guys

Great way to see Bangkok. Did a day tour with some friends on a recent stay at Bangkok in May 2015. We did one of the day tours around town. The other positive reviews are definitely spot on. The guide was very friendly and informative. It was a great way to see parts of Bangkok that you wouldn't typically see on the usual tourist routes. Like the Chinese park, with an outdoor gym, cemetery, with some locals sitting at an outdoor bar singing Karaoke at 10:30am in the morning ... some very interesting sites! Pretty easy going on the bike, but the heat gets a bit much later in the day. Recommend!

Definitely worth it!!. Everybody loved it. Saw parts of Bangkok that we would never have discovered. Easy riding for everyone. Peter our guide was knowledgeable and entertaining. They provided plenty of water and fruit. A definite must do!!!!!

Different view of Bangkok. We have a great day with Nut discovering the jungle island close to Bangkok. I recommend this tour because there are bike roads and no traffic. If you are scared of narrow and high roads then do the city tour.

A great Ride. Booked this from New Zealand, was e mailed a map and details on how to get there including Thai translation for a Thai Taxi driver. Arrived, greeted, fitted out for bike and off we went with out guide "Peter".Did the Bangkok city tour, Temples, China Town, Flower Market, River crossings and plenty of time for Peter to explain each stop.Thoroughly enjoyed our morning, well maintained bikes and Peter was great.Reccommended

Great bike tour. We did the Siam Boran tour. Our tour guide Tao was very knowledgeable and my two teenage kids and myself had the best time. I would highly recommend you do this tour. You will see places in Bangkok that you would never find by yourself.

Was nice!. Nice to see the streets of Bangkok while riding a bike! Saw a lot of the different communities in Bangkok, and cycling through the smaller (local streets) is very nice too. :-)I recommend it!

great way to see the real bangkok. peter, our fanstastic guide, was excellent. he brought us to different attractions in Bangkok using the bike lanes and the different alleys in the city. it was scary at first because of the cars and narrow alleys but once we got the hang of it, it became easy. all in all 5 stars to a great bike tour company and bike guide.

A lot of fun. I did this bike tour when my mom came into town, and her and I both loved it. The bikes are comfortable, they provide you with water, and you get ice cream at the end, and you get to stay as long as you want after to have the little fishes eat the dead skin off your feet. Definitely recommend this while in Bangkok. It's fun to go around by yourself looking at things, but it's always better knowing what you are looking at.

Good way to explore BKK.. Awesome way to go around Bangkok and see some of the parts of the City. What I did not like about the tour was that the customisable tour are very expensive and the public tours are like a touch and go to some parts of the city.

Awesome....a must when in Bangkok. I like everyone else researched who should i do the bike tour with and I finally decided with FMBT. We took the BTS but got lost when we were walking to the office. Ended up turning up late but it didn't matter because we were the only two. We had a fantastic guide (sorry forgot his name). Our guide was very informative and funny....went above and beyond to explain and show us the sights. Even showed and taught us how to fold pedals on flowers to leave as offerings at the temple. Because their was only 2 of us we ended up seeing more ;) Book with these guys....you wont regret it

Great off the beated path tour. Matt was a great tour guide that kept a good eye on us while we rode through the alleys and side streets. He took pictures with the Follow Me camera and our own personal camera. We happened to have a tour with just my husband and I which was perfect for our honeymoon. We did this tour after a food tour so it was great to work off all the yummy food we tried that morning. Matt did a great job of explaining the different areas and also teaching us about the Buddhist culture in a very open and informative way. My husband and I truly enjoyed the tour and we highly recommend it to active people that want a tour that is unique.

2nd time around. This was my second bike tour with follow me bikes this time I done the Siam Boran on Thursday 4th June which I thouroughly enjoyed. Our guide was fantastic very knowledgeable about his country. I would highly recommend this tour as you get taken to places I doubt you could ever find on your own. It was hard to believe that you were still in bangkok. To top it all off we had fantastic weather. Next time I am in bangkok I will do another tour. Thank you for a lovely time.

Good fun. Very enjoyable, took the same tour (Siam Boran) as Jonathon who also reviewed. Matthew was the ideal host, very professional and knowledgable but at the same time looking for the bikers to enjoy themselvesPossibly better to do the 8am tour because of the weather but don't let that put you off doing the afternoon tour if you can't make the AM one.

Fun "Insider's" View of Bangkok. We landed in Bangkok at 11 p.m and had booked this tour at 8:30 the following morning - a great way to bypass jet lag! Riding through the back streets and unmapped neighborhoods was a perfect intro to this bustling city. Six hours of exploring local homes, parks, food stalls, temples, the flower market accompanied by water bottles, cultural insights, snacks, an impish sense of humor, more water bottles and even a dramatic thunderstorm, our guide Peter provided it all! This tour was definitely a highlight of our 3.5 weeks in Thailand.Fish spa was a perfect ending. Do it!

Something different. I love bike tours. My wife was new to bike tours but she liked it as well. The tours was well organized and the setting was great. We both loved it and would go again and would have no problem suggesting it to anyone who wanted something different.The location was a little hard to find but if your motivated then this shouldn't be a problem.

Bike Tour - Bangkok. This is a must do. We went yesterday in 30+ degree heat and still had a blast. Tour guides name was Mathew and he did a great job navigating us through the busy streets of Bangkok and the back alleyways. We got to see the 'real' Bangkok, how and where people live. We had a great time - did the 4.5 hour city trip, would love to do the jungle trip next time around. Got to see and do so much, including temple visits, markets and much more. Never hassled by anyone to buy up and learnt so much about Thai culture.

Enlightening. This is a must , if you wish to see more of the real Bangkok. Do not be concerned about riding between the congested traffic, we did the night tour and it was brilliant. Majority of the riding was not on main roads. Both my friend and self are older generation and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Mathew the guide was very knowledgeable and took his time with our slower pace. Six hours may seem a long trip around the city but the time passed very quickly, as there was so many new experiences not before seen.

Perfect!. I contacted 'Follow Me Bike Tours' with my questions and received prompt thorough answers so I booked my bike tour for my first day in Bangkok. What better way to shake off the airport / airplane travel hours, get a little exercise and fresh air while, hey!, seeing some of Bangkok! It was perfect! Our guide was very good natured, fun and safety conscious. We meandered in and out of districts, sights, along the river, across the river, explored some sights, snaked through back alleys, shared some laughs, took lots of photos and returned to our beginning for a bite to eat. Also had a chance to try their fish spa . . . too ticklish for me!I had so much fun I came back the next day to do it again! I did get lost getting there for the 2nd day and they came to lead me there - blush.... Little tip: don't use the 7/11 store as a landmark - they are one or even 2 per block!!!I highly recommend Follow Me Tours. If I get back there I'll join them again!(my trip was really October 2013!! Sorry it took me so long to post this!)

Siam Boran Tour. Amazing team and very well organized tour. Not the typical tour you would expect. You really get to see the "Real Bangkok" and definitely recommended for the travel junkies.
