The best part of the tour, it isn't the typical touristy places, you cycle through the local housing areas, you experience how they live, where they hang out, where they shop, and where they chill. Something you barely get to see in the overly commercialized "Glitz and Glamour" Bangkok. You will encounter many places that you will not necessarily see if you were to do the typical Bangkok must do list or even wonder on your own. The staff of Follow Me tour are extremely helpful, friendly and they provide a holistic and enjoyable service throughout the tour. However i do find their office is a little difficult to find if you follow the map. Easiest way grab a Tuk Tuk or a Taxi to head there. I would highly recommend this tour company and definitely will try the other cycling tours Follow Me offers if i return to Bangkok again.

What an experience. This was the best part of sightseeing that we experience while in Bangkok, a great guide that showed us the life behind the medallion - literally almost driving through locals homes. This is not to be missed while exploring off the beaten track.

Excellent Tour. Other than the part about getting sun burnt and having to reach the venue early in the morning (for the morning tour), it was a very interesting experience! We chose the Sawan Tour to experience the natural trails in Bangkok and it did not disappoint. From cycling in the heavy traffic (abit of a horror) to the natural trail (carrying bike across abandoned train tracks, dirt paths, boating across to an island, wide enough but still slightly daunting boardwalks, off road trails, bird tower, fish feeding etc). Guide was very friendly and knowledgeable too! The brake of my bike went into some problem s along the way and he was willing to exchange his bike for mine too. Bring sunblock along!! The sun in the city is quite unforgiving.

A really good ride with some definitely tricky paths. The ride was really good, and I have to give them major credit for really taking people through streets and neighborhoods most would never explore. The only qualm is I think they could do a better job of really pushing how much sidewalk riding will be done. I didn't have a problem with it, but some riders definitely will. And there's a surprising amount of it, and I even heard a couple of people get upset as we rode by. It seems like some of the sidewalk riding could take place on the roads in more open sections.However, I will say Peter did a fantastic job of leading a safe ride and showing great knowledge at every stop. When I'm back in Bangkok, I'll definitely book another tour/route with Follow Me. But I'll book (and I recommend this), a private tour so I can stop and go at my own pace and not feel bad about wanting to stop for pictures along the path. Pictures of the destination are great, but the real attraction that makes it all special are the neat neighborhoods and communities you cycle through.

Highlight of my stay in Bangkok! Don't miss this!. This tour was so much fun and defiantly the highlight of our time in Bangkok! Our guide Matthew, was the nicest, most humble tour guide I have ever had in my travels abroad. We did the Siam Boran historic tour; the best part was visiting the Wat Kanlaya temple where we offered Lotus flowers and learned about Buddhism. This tour had everything, including a visit to the flower market where we tried fried grasshoppers and some Thai desserts from street vendors with the help from Matthew.Really unique tour and it was great to explore parts of Bangkok I would have never come across on my own, including a ride through the slums. By the end of the tour I felt like I really experienced the "real" Bangkok and left with a much greater appreciation of the city.Thank you for the wonderful experience and I will be sure to share my experience with anyone I know visiting Bangkok!

Great Ride. Choice of 2 different bikes and your choice to wear a helmet which I would advise to wear.This was a Fantastic ride took you to all places around Bangkok city and water ways, through the back streets and alley ways, you will see areas of Bangkok only on a tour like this. Do your self a Favour and go for a ride on this tour you will not be disappointed, I did the day ride and next time in Bangkok will deffinately do the night ride.

Bike tour in Bangkok. Great tour by a great tour guide (Matthew). The tour brought us parallel along the Chao Praya river, through the poorer areas, flower market and Chinatown. There was also ferry crossing to the other side of the river which showed another side of Bangkok (slower pace of life and low rise buildings). It was a great 4 hour trip. Caesar and Doris

Awesome night tour! Highly recommended . Hi, Idid the night tour (6hours) and it was absolutely superb! You meander through the side streets and see real local life, it's fascinating and it's one of the best tours I've ever done. We took in some famous sites along the way and our guide (Matthew) was so knowledgable and a lot of fun. It's easy cycling too with plenty of water stops and one of the best street food dinners in China Town I've had. Do it! You won't regret it! Enjoy!!

A side of Bangkok I would never find alone. After 3 trips to BKK this is the absolute highlight. The tour was lead at a great pace through back alleys, secret passages, gateways giving a cultural insight into the city that I would never be able to find alone. Bikes were brand new, guide was brilliant, I would recommend this to anyone!

Good way to see the local views of Bangkok. We booked this tour the day before of the tour date. Together with us another group of 3 ladies from Japan and Spain. The tour guides is very gentle and polite. We took jungle trip. Its good way to see all the local people from the villages and island. We also visits the local market and temples. It is such as great experiences.

An incredible adventure. I took the jungle tour with 3 other friends earlier this week and it was nothing short of amazing. Our tour guide, Ah, was absolutely perfect: knowledgeable, fun, accommodating, approachable, and never in a rush. Cycling around the city was a little bit intimidating especially during rush hour, but going through the slums of Bangkok was a fascinating experience. The boat ride was a lot of fun and didn't once feel unsafe. It was like real life temple run once we got into the jungle. We had so much fun cycling through the narrow paths in the swamp. Water and snacks were provided, Ah took pictures regularly throughout the tour, and most of the cycle was in shade so the heat wasn't an issue. This has been the most enjoyable day of our trip so far. I would highly recommend Follow Me Bike Tours and Ah!

way to explore the city. This was a fun way to get a tour of the city away from the hectic traffic. You ride down some back alleys and see the neighborhoods of the locals. You get to stop at market and also the big sitting Buddha temple. It's a long ride (about 2.5 to 3 hours stoppong at different spots)but it's worth it after eating all morning with the food tour. It rained on us but we still continued to ride so bring a puncho, if you forget to bring one they will provide one for you. A go pro camera would be the idea camera for this.

Biking food tour was awesome!. My husband and I went on a biking food tour which was so much fun! Going to different temples, biking through back alleys and stopping at various food sites allowed us to see Bangkok in a way that we wouldn't have experienced on our own.Our tour guide was Anh and he took pictures of us throughout the tour which was emailed to us after. The food was great and we got to try some different things. Anh answered all our questions (which was a lot because we were super curious) and we enjoyed his company a lot!I would recommend this to you if you are adventurous!

followme. i have been on four bike tours with Followme over the past two years - each one has been excellent. On each occasion I have gone with different friends and visitors to Bangkok, and they too have gone away having had a great time, and learnt much about the city.
Great cycling tour. Thanks, it was great to see another part of this amazing town! I will recomande you to everybody! Nice people, great guide, good cycles.

Great way to see Bangkok!. Ah! Not only is the sound I made seeing all the the wonderful sites, but was also our fabulous guide's name: Aa! We were greeted warmly and the registration process was painless. The safety video was entertaining and short (good thing). We were offered refreshments upon arrival which was very nice as it was a scorcher. We left early since all were present and headed out. Aa pointed out many things to see and took some fantastic photos for us... FOR FREE! We rode through some beautiful and some not-so-beautiful parts of Bangkok, so we truly saw the real Bangkok. For 4 hours we rode, stopped for photos and refreshments, rode, ferried across the river, rode and visited. And to top it off, beers and a foot-fish spa. Those little guys loved chewing my feet! It tickled like crazy! What a great way to spend an afternoon in Bangkok!
Great way to experience Bangkok. Was great to ride down the small alleyways of Bangkok. Our tour guide was fun and full of knowledge...he was even a Buddhist monk for some time!Highly recommended!

Bangkok must TRY!. Amazing fun and happy!we were 5 brothers join on this bike tour,bike tour let us feel another view of bangkok,we ride through the street,visit thai people temple,flower market,and specially thanks to matthew,the tour guide,nicely and helpful!conclusion,tour bike is must try activity when u visit bangkok!

Nice way to explore Bangkok. A really cool way to explore Bangkok and experience things you wouldn't normally come across, e.g. a Chinese cemetery where the locals sing karaoke (bizarre!) We did the Siam Chiva food tasting bicycle tour which on the whole was great. Our tour guide was friendly, knowledgeable and very pleasant. Our only feedback is that we found this to be more of a cycle tour (which was excellent) than a food tour. The range of food and drinks on offer wasn't great, especially when you consider all of the wonderful cafes, market stalls and restaurants we passed through. Along the route my friend and I ended up venturing to the stalls independently to explore for different foods and drinks to make sure that we didn't miss out. Aside from that thought I can't complain.

An amazing way to see Bangkok!!. We were a group of 9 members and had chosen the Siam Ratree (25km)tour which takes you along Bangkok at night. This was something we were really looking forward to and by the end of the tour all of us were extremely happy with Follow me Tours. Matthew and Aah did an amazing job and at every stage we were well guided. This is not just about cycling but a lot more in terms of culture, food etc. I recommend this tour to all those who are planning a trip to Bangkok.

Nice Tour. We saw the unexpected calmness and beauty, just across the Chao Praya river, of Bangkok. Biking is a Nice way to discover Bangkok. Follow Me BikeTours is doing a good Job and highly recommended.

Great way to See Bangkok!!. Great staff, friendly. Very nice way to see Bangkok at night. Highly recommend this company. This tour should be your ffirst few things to do when you get to Bangkok, as you can then venture out the next day.

Nearly the best part of our whole trip!. Because of the reviews we decided to try it. We were not disappointed from start to end. Took a cab from our hotel, easy for him to find with he map on the site. Equipment good aside from the fact I haven't ridden a bike in 20 years. Easy route with urban views. At one point I felt like I was invading people's private space but they smiled back when we said "sawatee" , or perhaps they were laughing at us? The guide was very nice and cared for our safety as we navigated some traffic areas. The jungle area was great along with the boat ride. We were tired at the end but easy enough for anyone.Never seen or heard of the tiny "fish foot cleaning" thing at the end but it made a great video as my husband screamed like a 10 year old little girl when he first put his feet in.Great activity and would gladly recommend to anyone!

Off the beaten track. We did the jungle tour,and I never thought that I would ride a bike through the busy streets of Bangkok, but felt totally safe with our guide Matthew.Riding through the slums and through the jungle on elevated paths was an awesome experience. The visit to the market was fabulous and we tried food we would not usually have the courage to eat. It was a fantastic tour.
Fantastic day trip in BKK. This is a well organized tour that takes you to the hidden gems of BKK. The jungle tour was amazing! Highly recommend it.

Bangkok and jungle tour. Good and interesting tour through Bangkok and the jungle on the opposite side of the river. We had our son (8) and daughter (11) on the tour and they managed without any problems

The best way to feel Bangkok. We were three couples with our guide Witt. He took us to places we wouldn't be able to see in other way, we had a great time, great experiences, tasted some local food and enjoyed every moment. If I come back to Bangkok I will do it again!. We did the basic tour. Now at home I received to my mailbox photos taken by Witt. What else can you ask for?Ed
Another side of Bangkok. This is a must do! Our guide assured everyone's safety, was very knowledgeable and willing to teach about culture and traditions. Discoveries were made around every corner.

Fantastic tour!. Peter, our tour guide was not only knowledgeable but also a lot of fun and was fantastic with the kids. Highly recommend him! The tour was safe and the riding was easy and we saw things we would never have experienced.

Amazing bike tour through hidden places in Bangkok. My sister and I booked the tour just in the evening before and they answered us in the same hour back. Unfortunately the next day we got there late because of traffic jam and missed the morning tour. But they offered us at the same moment to take part in the afternoon. It turned out that we were the only ones taking the afternoon tour, which was very nice of them still to offer us the tour as a group tour and not as a privat tour. (We booked the jungle tour)We had a really nice and talkative guide speaking in a good english with a lot of humour during the whole tour. He was driving with us through small streets to see how thai people live and giving us a feeling for the real thailand. After that we headed forward to the green island in the middle of bangkok (also called the green lungs of Bangkok). That was fantastic! It felt like beeing outside any traffic and rumour of the busy city. It was so quiet and green over there.During the tour we got always asked of the tour guide if we'd like to have any snack or water to drink. The water and snacks he payed for us (included in the tour fee).At the beginning and the end we had to cross the busy streets in Bangkok which can be quite dangerous driving a bycicle. But I never felt unsave. Our guide gave us very good instructions and informed us always what will happen next and how to behave on the street.During the whole tour our guide took pictures of us, so we hadn't to use once our camera. I could download the pictures already at the same evening after the tour. A big plus from my side.All togehter it was an amazing experience and I'd love to do another tour with them. But be aware that it's better to know how to drive a bycicle for the jungle tour. There are some points where the street get really tight and on the klong there is no handrail on both sides which can be scary for someone who isn't used to drive a bycicle.
Wonderful Bike tour of Bangkok. It is different way to enjoy being in Bangkok. Highly recommended for those who tired of ordinary way to explore Bangkok.

Night tour from 5 to 11 pm. We went out on the night tour, 5-11 pm, we were initially concerned about the length of the tour as we are not regular bike riders, turned out to be one of the best tours we have ever done. The guide was very nice, very professional and very dedicated. The tour included a dinner at Chinatown and many other stops. We had no problem at all with the bike ride and the whole experience was one we will never forget. David

Really interesting and enjoyable half day tour Siam Sawan. Had no idea what to expect, as our friend made the booking. For the first few minutes I wondered what I'd let myself in for, as we negotiated heavy Bangkok traffic. It was all fine though, and our guide was fun, informative and safety conscious. We saw parts of the city that we just would not got to otherwise.If we had had more time in Bangkok, I would have booked the night tour which does sound amazing.Highly recommend !

4-Hour City Tour. My buddy and I booked this last minute. I'm 27 and he is 28 - both single guys. And we went on tour with Matt, and he was seriously awesome. Very well informed, detailed, spoke english well. Was an honest guy. It was endearing really. The actual bike tour wasn't a stroll in the park, but not challenging by any means. We saw parts of the city we would NEVER see otherwise.Highly recommend taking any of the tours. Very well run organization. Feel free to ask any more questions.

Jungle tour. Follow Me staff is very kind and they tell you different and interesting things during your bike tour. I have done City and Jungle tours with them and both were very good and excellent compared to other companies I've used here in Bangkok. Can highly recommend Follow Me Bike Tours :-) !
Best Tour Ever. We booked the night tour, and we had an excellent tour tour spots of Bangkok unknown to tourists. Wat Pho at night was amazing. The bikes were also very good, proper mountain bikes.

Amazing way to see Bangkok!. My 16 year old daughter and I LOVED this tour.... so worth every penny. Our guide was full of information, thorough and flexible, and he did cool stuff like teach us how to fold the petals of the lotus flowers before offering them at one of the temples we visited. The alleys and markets were so memorable. Our guide also took lots of photos and shared them all for download. And he shared various snack samples with us along the way. Foot bath at the end was a great touch too. All in all, it was the best tour I have ever had in any city! Would recommend it 100% positive.

Fantastic tour through Bangkok City.. This was a great way to explore the inner city of Bangkok in a fun and safe way. Our tour guide was the loveliest bloke. The cycling itself was not difficult and is suitable for all ages and fitness levels. Would highly recommend and donut again.
Best day in Bangkok. We did the food and bike tour. Worth every penny. The best day in Bangkok. Great local food. And a great way to see Bangkok on a bike :)

Awesome way to see the city!. Was in Bangkok on business and had one day to see the sights. Signed up for the tour the morning of and was not disappointed. Our tour guide was fantastic and provided a great overview of the sights. Saw several temples, stopped for snacks and lunch and had a foot bath with the fish at the end of the day. Would highly recommend.

The BEST way to see Bangkok!. Loved this tour! So accommodating and friendly. We got to see a lot of bangkok including Chinatown and the Flower market. I would definitely recommend doing this tour to anyone visiting the city. This is a MUST DO!

Fabulous fun, brilliant route, great staff, wonderful experience. These guys are great. The follow me bike tour (I did the Siam Boran tour) was a fabulous way to spend an afternoon in Bangkok. They're professional but still keep things fun, and the bikes were well maintained and comfortable. The route was remarkable, in that you travel a good distance but without having to cycle on busy roads apart from one very short stretch. The rest of the time was along sois and alleyways as well as a stretch along a river path. I've been to Chinatown a few times and we still saw some bits I'd never seen before. Perfect biking in a city that isn't renowned for cycle-friendliness. Tremendous value, together with a friendly, fun and informative host. What more could you ask for?

Bangkok jungle tour. With the friendly parrot on the swing behind us we watched a funny but informative video on bike control and hand signals,the guys were good then in making sure we had a bike that we felt comfortable on ,then it was ready for the off .Other than a little stretch on the main road we took to the side alleys and started to see the real Bangkok that you never see or could find as a tourist.The pace we road at was good and not hard to manage considering we had a long trek to do Our first real break came when we parked up by the river to have drinks provided before our boat trip to the jungle.Whilst we were on the road in parts we spent a lot of the time on a raised cycle path through the jungle bit scary in places on the bends in the path as well as when the locals wanted to pass in the opposite direction but they were good and stopped for us.The other highlight in the jungle was a lovely lake and our guide gave us food for them unbelievable how many fish we saw.Then it was back on the boat to the mainland on one or two busy streets but have to say again the locals were good so no worries When we came home there was 50 pics to download that our guide had taken of us during the trip A just awesome day out will do it again with Follow Me when in Bangkok

Good way to see a different side to bustling Bangkok. The overall experience was very good, organised, relaxed and an enjoyable way to see a unique side of Bangkok. I did the jungle tour and it was pretty easy biking even for someone who doesn't cycle regularly. Visiting the market for lunch was also very good - Thank you

Night Tour was great!. My girlfriend and I booked the night tour after reading a few good reviews on this website. The tour was a great way to see Bangkok in an 'un-touristy' way which included cycling through backstreets, local neighbourhoods and hidden landmarks. We also stopped for streetfood in Chinatown which was amazing and we visited a few temples which looked spectacular at night. We also had a chance to visit a small local bar (way off the beaten track!) and sample a little Thai whisky before heading back. Some of this tour involves cycling main roads but it wasn't stressful or nerve wracking at all. Our guide, Matthew, was really nice and always kept us safe with some simple hand signals. Matthew also took a lot of photos on his phone an emailed them over the following day. Well worth doing.

Wonderful tour of Bangkoks backstreets and green areas. We took the Siam Sawan tour in February 2015 and had a great time exploring the hidden backstreets of Bangkok before taking a boat to a totally different surrounding and biking on small pathways in the middle of a djungle island. Our guide Wit was great - always joking, explaining and taking wonderful pictures of our tour! He introduced us to some delicious local food, taught us some Thai and lots of background information - thanks a lot!It really was an adventure to bike through narrow market streets as well as the chaotic Bangkok-traffic. The whole tour was very well organised, even though we came in on short notice and only asked to book the tour the night before. However the team made it possible and we were offered a tour for just the two of us. We felt safe throughout the whole tour, even in the chaotic traffic, Wit was always keeping an eye on us. The bikes were in great condition and drinks were provided. After the tour we got to relax our feet in the clubhouses 'fish spa', which was a new experience for us and the perfect ending to the tour. A few days later we received another email providing us with all the pictures taken throughout the tour, which really capture the fun we had on the tour. We would definetely book a tour with Follow Me Bike Tours again and also recommend the team to friends visiting Bangkok!

Unique and wonderful experience through Bangkok. Our group of seven had a great time under the guide of Peach. We took the Siam Sawan tour. We felt very prepared for safety and food items as we took off. We enjoyed seeing the variety of sights from urban landscapes through to the neighborhoods/slums, and across the river to the mangrove forest. We enjoyed the floating market and appreciated the freedom the guide gave us to wander around but still keep us all moving. Winding around country roads was fun and we loved the hundreds of photos our guide took of us and delivered promptly. She was very patient with my 8 year old daughter and took lots of precautions for her safety. We enjoyed their garden and take out lunch after the ride!We were a little surprised at how much surface-street time there was in proportion to time in the forest - the way home, the traffic was pretty intimidating. Also, the trip through the slums was very interesting and we felt safe, but it was a bit of a surprise based on the description we read on line. Here's a blog post I wrote about our trip, including lots of images. http://www.oglesandobservations.com/2015/03/09/bangkok-bike-tour-slums-mangrove-forest-market-city/

The best way to see Bangkok. I travelled to Bangkok for business with 2 colleagues. We did the night bike tour. It was fantastic, I'd been to Bangkok before but this is by far the best way to see the parts of Bangkok you wouldn't necessarily see on a walking or self guided tour no matter how good your guide book is. The tour was well organised and I felt safe while on the bike - the guide had a special power for stopping traffic for us to get across busy intersections. The biking was flat and easy - the heat is the only issue.The flower market (which sounded a bit boring to me) was the highlight. I'd recommend this to anyone travelling to Bangkok who wants to see the City from a different view-point.
A Must. It was a very Nice way, to see Bangkok, places we never would have seen. We were only 5 and it was exelent.The guide Ah, he was fantastic..

Great afternoon. We had a great time with our guides Mathew and Peter on March 2015. At first we were hesitant to go on a bike tour through Bangkok, when walking it seemed a little bit dangerous to bike, however we could not be happier that we decided to go! We had a chance for a ride trough little alleys that without this tour there was no chance for us to visit.

A Wonderful Experience. I would like to recommend Follow Me Bike Tours to everyone who is planning to visit Bangkok because for me and my husband this was one of the best experiences that we had in Thailand during our honeymoon in February.This was also the best way to get to know Bangkok because our wonderful guide Peter took us through non-touristic parts of the city and he explained us so many things about Thailand, Thai people, Buddhism and he showed us a big part of the city, a lot of temples, an old Catholic church, the oldest building in Bangkok, flower market where we stopped to take flowers that we brought to the temple later...We crossed the river in a city boat, we had a lot of snacks, we saw a bride and a groom taking pre wedding photoshoot :), we saw beautiful children playing during the school recess, we learned how to make a bouquet of some unknown beautiful flowers :), we got the blessing from the Buddhist monk which was so emotional, we learned so many things about Thai culture and during this amazing tour Peter made hundreds of pictures of us and thanks to him now we have such a great memory forever.We had a best guide ever! Peter was full of information, always with a smile, making jokes, taking care of us all the time and he really made this tour unforgettable.
Tour was excellent and exciting. Saw places which normal bangkok tourists do not see during their StayVery nice guide also, brought us safe through traffic

Amazing Tour. My girlfriend and I did the night tour with Follow Me Bike Tours and it ended up being just the two of us and the guide, so we got a more intimate session, but it was incredible. We saw many areas we hadn't known existed in Bangkok, as well as learning about the culture, seeing beautiful temples, different districts and getting to experience the real street food!Our tour guide Ah (sorry if this isn't how you spell his name) was friendly, helpful and answered any questions we had. He also made sure we had enough food for dinner and enough water during the bike ride, while also taking lots of photos throughout the whole night (Which were promptly sent to us within a few days)!If you want to see Bangkok, this tour is definitely a great choice.

Great tour! . As I was in Bangkok for four weeks I participated in three tours with follow me bike tours. 2 day tours and one night tour. It was really really great. The best way to get to know Bangkok it through cycling through the little streets. Most of all I enjoyed the night tour, were I had the best Pad Thai in my life (in Chinatown).Thanks again to the team! Best wishes from Germany, Lena

Unique experience - highly recommend. My husband and I booked the Siam Sawan bike tour upon a friend's recommendation and it was by far the highlight of our short stay in Bangkok last December. Our tour guide (whose name I have sadly forgotten) was fabulous and with him we were able to see a great deal of Bangkok in a way that we never would have done on our own. We biked through narrow back alleys, neighborhoods, through a local wet market, and even through a temple! We were taken care of the whole time and provided with enough water/drinks to keep us going - our guide was thoughtful to stop on a number of occasions to grab us fresh fruit snacks and cool drinks. And on top of everything, our guide was snapping hundreds of pictures of us while navigating through the city. Was a real treat to come home to over 100 pictures that we didn't have to worry about taking ourselves. I highly recommend Follow Me Bike Tours.

Parts I never would find. This is the first bike tour , we have ever been shown a safety video, so 10/10 The welcome was good, The bikes were good, and plenty of water , orange juice stops , We went to places we didn't know existed , The pace wasn't like some we had been on , it was a good steady pace , from start to finish, if u wanted to take pics, not a problem ,On out return , we were given more drinks and refreshments,Our guid was ah, sorry if I spelt name wrong ,Would definitely recommend,
Go bike with Follow Me Biketours. We had a very nice biketour with this organisation, city and jungle. The tour was exciting as well as relaxing. We would certainly reccomend it.
Very friendly and professional. Tour guard and the admin doing the booking for us are both friendly and speaks very good english. This make the process of taking up this tour very hassel free.

A great way to experience a great city.. My guide was a young lady named "Peach" and that she was! Her enthusiasm and knowledge of Bangkok made this ride both informative and a lot of fun. I especially loved learning about Buddhism from the Thai perspective. Thanks, Peach!

The best thing to do in Bangkok!!. I will start with writing, this is the most amazing experience you can imagine doing in Bangkok !! To see the non-tourists, hidden, exciting and local sides of this huge and very varied city. don't miss it!We took an evening bike tour called "Siam Ratree bicycle tour" with the most wonderful guide - Aa. The tour duration was 6 hours through the whole tour Aa explained to us a lot fascinating facts about the Thai history, Buddhism and the Thai Cuisine. and also took lovely photos of us during the trip that were sent to us the day after.The tour was so exciting, we went through so many small alleys and streets (if you can call it streets), places you can never reach unless you're local and know very well all the small turns and curves. we visited many temples at night time with it special lighting -when its almost empty from visitors. we had a wonderful local dinner at the Chinese market. we visited the 24/7 flowers market and took the ferry with the bikes. and for the top ending we had some kind of rice whiskey shot with locals in a very small booth on our way back.Really unforgettable experience! thank you so much Aa! hope to visit soon again:))Liron & Asaf

Great bike Tours. i've enjoied a lot those bike tours,city and jungle,because staff is very good and funny and they speaking a good english.I suggest To do this Tours because is a good way to visit this big city.

Siam Boran Tour. I did this tour with my wife and had a fantastic time. The cycle ride, although long, isn't too bad as its all very flat. This was a great way to see the city, particularly parts you wouldn't ever normally see as a tourist!

Exciting way to see the sights.. Follow Me Bike Tours was an interesting way to get insight to Bangkok's sites of interest. The guide (Matthew) was knowledgable and attentive. I was a bit nervous riding through Bangkok traffic as I am not an avid biker, however the guide was very safety conscious. I would strongly suggest a tour through this company.
Fun. good fun to ride a bike in Bangkok (jungletour). This Tour certainly requires experience with biking

Nice Way to See Bangkok. You can do a lot of walking or taking the sky train, so it was nice to ride the bike with an excellent guide to keep us safe and show us the back streets. It was a great tour and travelling alone it was nice to meet some fellow travellers. If you have time I would highly recommend this tour. They have done a great job it looking after all the little things. Just make sure to allow yourself enough time to find there location, it is a little tricky.

Siam Chiva. We had such a fantastic time on this tour. The route was interesting and fun - we saw places we not normally have seen on our own or on other tours. Our tour guide was amazing, and the food was delicious. This is an absolute must when in Bangkok. We highly recommend this!

A must for bicycle riders in Bangkok. You love it.. When on the evening tour last week and loved it. Excellent ride, saw many places and small soi's that tourist normally don't find themselves. Good bikes and wonderful and friendly guides that explains many things. Don't miss the "whiskey" at the end.
Great way to see Bangkok. The tour was really good. We saw the backstreets and some interesting sights. The guide was very knowledgeable and took some pictures which they emailed me a few days later.

Excellent tour. Had a great and fun time on the tour. Mathew and Peter where both great fun and very informative. Saw places one would not normally see and at night so no tourist around. Wat pho at night all lit up and just us. Thank you. Will recommend you to all.
Fun tour with adventure!. Matthew was a great tour guide! He was patient with all abilities of riders and was very kind on the tour!

A Great Experience. We took the Siam Sawan tour, which started off on busy Bangkok streets but quickly turned down quieter sois and paths. The company's website is very informative and lived up to its promises. Our guide was very helpful and made the whole experience interesting and informative. We cycled through the narrow paths of Khlong Toei slums, greeted warmly by everyone we passed, and stopped briefly to visit an elementary school, where the children were practising their meditation songs. Two longtail boats - one for cyclists, one for the bikes - took us across the Chao Phraya to the Phra Padaeng peninsula. The narrow cycle paths were a bit too narrow for my comfort but everyone else seemed fine with them and were patient with me when I slowed to a crawl at times. The scenery in the coconut plantations was beautiful though. Then we were out on wider paths in the park, stopping to feed the fish in the lake. Back across the river and onto the busier streets again, we stopped to visit a traditional teakwood house - a calm oasis, incongruously set among the city's buildings. 10 minutes later, we were back at the clubhouse, eating fresh fruit and cooling our feet off in the fish spa. Very worthwhile trip, well organised and efficient - and we really appreciated the free link to photographs taken along the way.

Great way to see Bangkok.. Brilliant tour of Bangkok. We were only in Bangkok for 2 days so this was an excellent way to see as much as possible. Our guide Matthew was lovely and very knowledgable. We did the 6hr tour and time just flew by. I would highly reccomend this place, I don't cycle at home and still found it easy to do.

See BKK on a bike. Once again we had a fantastic time with Follow Me Bike Tours. We had a very pleasant guide on our trip to Siam Boran. It is a bike trip through the challenging BKK traffic, down to the Chao Phraya River. Seeing sights that you would not see on foot. And having a knowledgeable guide by your side is a plus. We saw the old Custom House, Chinatown, took the ferry across the river and was introduced to buddhism by the guide, which was VERY interesting. And then back home through Thonburi, back to the clubhouse. There is never a doll moment going with Follow Me, and you always feel very comfortable. It is a must to go by bike in BKK...the city just grows on you.

Siam Boran. I spent 2 weeks in Bangkok, and Follow Me Bike Tour was absolutely the best acitivty during my stay. The tour was such a deep introduction to all the sides in Bangkok´s everyday life. The guide Wit was very inspiring and knew his city by heart. The attractions we saw were interesting, fun and exciting. I am suggesting this tour to all my friends visiting Bangkok.

A nice half day experience.. I toulk the Siam sawan tour. It was a nice slow strolling bike ride. Our guide showed us a nice authentic Thai style house before taking us out of the busy Bangkok centre.We got to bike through some suburbs and poorer neighbourhoods, passed a train graveyard and got into a little boat to cross the Chao Praya river.It's only a 5min boat ride so do not co cider this a reason to choose this tour.We continued through coconut plantations on a 1meter wide path to a parc.Me personally didn't like the parc all that much as you are riding on a path paved in asphalt throughout the path and I'm more into of roading.In general it's a nice and relaxed ride and a good opportunity to discover Bangkok in a different way.Big thumbs up to our tour guide who did his best to keep us safe and informed.Khap Khun Khrap.

Siam Sawan Bike Tour. Some friends and I booked the Siam Sawan bike tour the night before and we didn't really know what to expect. But the tour was beyond our expectation! Our tour guide Wit did such an amazing job, and we were able to see the behind the scenes of Bangkok in a way that we never could have otherwise. We biked through the back alleys, through local villages, were able to take a ferry across the river to an island and bike through a jungle type of area, and got to visit a local market where Wit bought us some Thai snacks that we so delicious! We were taken care of the whole time and provided with enough water/drinks to keep us going. And to top it all off, they had a fish foot spa (with little fish eating the dead sking off our feet) at the office location for us to spend some time in when we were done biking (this was sooo cool!). I highly recommend Follow Me Bike Tours if you want to experience what Bangkok really is.

A Peach of a tour. Our second flying visit to Bangkok, so tried this as a way to get to see something. It was an inspired choice! We took the morning, Siam Boran ride (historical city tour). Our guide, Peach, took us through a myriad of back streets and cycle paths, along pavements across the river and even through some buildings! Drinks were provided at various stopping points en route. I could pretty much guarantee you wouldn't visit many of the sights if you organised your own trip and you would be worse off for it.Peach was very much in control of everything you did, and even with the notorious Bangkok traffic, you never felt in any danger at any time.A must do Bangkok experience!

So Great!. We are a Danish Family of four who had such a great trip together with our guide Matthew. We were well introduced to the trip, and very well welcomed when we arrived to the office.Matthew took us to Places where we would never have comed, if not going on this trip round a part of Bangkok. Very well planned with small alleys and heavy trafficed roads, and we never felt any danger. Matthew knows a lot of stories and the history of Bangkok. You have to have some skills on a bicycle before going out on this trip. Thanks a lot for a GREAT tour

Bicycle Tour of Bangkok. We had a fantastic day with Follow Me Bike Tours in Bangkok. This is great way to see the the real Bangkok through the back streets and suburbs of the old town.We were lead on out amazing tour by Peach from Follow Me who was a great ambassador and guide. She looked after all of us throughout the 5 hour ride. We rode along the river and through temples, historic buildings,The flower market and a very hectic Chinatown, and got to meet a lot of locals along the way. The pace was easy and the tour is suitable for anyone who can ride a bicycle and wants to see some of the less visited attractions.This was our fifth trip to Bangkok and this was one of the most enjoyable tours we have done.

Fantastic Day out,Friendly,Safe and a great bike tour !!. This was a highlight of my many trips to Thailand. I must say from arrival at the clubhouse to departure in the afternoon, myself and the two other customers were treated very well by our guide Ahh. He mad the tour interesting by giving us information on the places cisited together with a friendly demenour that made the whole trip very pleasant. The tour took us through the various back alleyways of Bangkok, with a small amount of riding on main streets. However the whole time i felt safe and was not in any danger throughout the whole day. Ahh bought sticky rice for us, supplied us with water and in the afternoon purchased some bananas to top us up. When we returned to the clubhouse we were greated with a smile and fresh towels to cool down, together with a fresh fruit platter. What a great overall experience. Thank you for showing me a different side to Bangkok, it is a must do and I will be back !!!

A great way to see the city. excellent from start to finish the booking process was super easy .. the location was easy to find .. the bikes were comfortable and our guide was excellent ..he took us on amazing tour around the back streets of Bangkok we visited temples and markets, he was very informative and friendly always checking if we needed anything .. I have been to BAngkok many times but this showed me places off the beaten track.. a wonderful day out

Great way to see another side of Bangkok. Having been through Bangkok a few times on my travels I wanted to do something a bit different. Follow me was a great tour, I got to see a totally different side of city including the backstreets which were much more interesting (and much less busy) than the standard tourist filled main streets. Great directions so easy to find and very well organised. Best bicycles I've ever used in Asia and I felt totally safe with the guide, and helmets were available. Overall a fab day which delivered in every way. Added plus is that they send you photos after for free. Good value for money too with water and fruit included.

Bangkok like you never seen it before. I first experienced to discover a foreign City by bike once in NYC. Sounds a bit weird..but how about BKK then?Anyone that has ever been to bangkok might not be able to imagine how to get around on bike in this huge city full of traffic. I have been surprised myself - it has been the best decision ever! The Follow me Team offers great gear (treck Mountainbikes) with fat tires that will move you easily around every road and especially the narrow roads you'll take. The tours take you along sites and roads in BKK not even a tuktuk can pass. I experienced BKK in a way that wouldnt have been possible without Follow me Tours: a bike plus fantastic guide, that knows each shortcut, each bicycle way (yes, they exist :-)) and who knows the City as cyclist inside out!It s not the cheapest Operator, but all ferrys, Drinks, Snacks were included, the funny and kind guide as well as refreshments and fish pedicure in the lovely garden at the office for free :-)Dont worry about the crazy traffic, try to see BKK through different eyes.I booked only the half day tour, just because i had to catch my flight the Same day.

Special bikeride aside the regular tourist route. We did enjoy the tour with guide Wiz a lot. Interesting stops on a tour through paths you would normally never see. Especially to mention the food stops. Yum! Highly recommend it to anyone who wants to see a part of real Bangkok. Oh not to forget the Fish spa at the end... Thank you

Third time with this company and they still have a nice operation. The only down side is that finding this place can be challenging if you don't pay attention. Our guide this time was new (less than 2 months) but nice and accommodating. The ride was great for the two 68yo friends with me and I'm more robust so it was fine by me as well. Maybe a bit more detailed descriptions of places would be nice but he was willing to answer any questions so that's not a huge deal. Everyone involved there seems to be nice and cared about folks. This should be one of the very first things you do upon arrival in Bangkok to get the "lay of the land" and to get immersed in the bizarre culture.

Best guide. Peaches was the best. Manuvered us threw Bangkok trafic like it was nothing. We did the jungle tour with a pass threw the "floating market". She had us experience many of the local foods. It was one of our best days of the vacation.
excellent tour. we were all loking forwardto this bike tour ,but none of us had expected that the tour would be such a tremendous success.it was all due to our guide Matthew.

Fun times riding a bicycle round Bangkok.. Amazing tour guide, jokes a minute! Very thoughtful touches, good sights!! I live in Bangkok and even though I had been to some of the sights before it was seen through a different angle riding through Bangkok. I was a bit apprehensive about cycling through the crazy legendary Bangkok traffic but it was very safe and mainly stuck to nice little side streets, were you seen the real inside of Bangkok and how some Thai people live! Definitely a must whether your on holiday or live in Bangkok!

Fantastic Tour. I could not believe how perfectly organized and AWESOME the tour was!1. Email correspondences were fast and efficient2. The direction given to get to the clubhouse from BTS was tourist friendly3. Clubhouse itself, though a little rundown, had a nice homey feeling3. We are given a free cap.4. we are shown a safety video (which i find hilarious), along with hand gestures for 'stop' 'slow down' etc..5. Your guide will choose your bikes for you, and adjust them according to your height. Please do a trial run, check the brakes, your seat as well as the gears.6. Cycling starts. It started out really intimidating, you're super aware of everything and every sounds around you. But after a while, your guide's ease and quiet confidence will rub off on you and you'll start to enjoy the sun/breeze/sights/sounds7. They'll share the pictures on google +, Facebook as well as send a link to your email address :)Don't overthink this, DO IT!

Great way to experience Bangkok. Our bike tour with FollowMe through Bangkok was fantastic. The guide was very good - we got a lot of good information about many thai relations. The bicycles were good and the people at FollowMe were very professional. It was a great way to feel the city. We would definitely love to go on one of the other tours in the future.

Very interesting way to discover Bangkok. My wife had taken a biketour in BBK before and it sounded like a good alternative way to get to see the city. Traffic is a real nightmare in BKK...... Friends of mine who live in BKK had suggested to take bike tour and I liked the idea rightaway.We struggled to find the office of Follow me Bike tours, many others came way too late, so I guess they must do something about that.The tour itself was very good: the pace was ideal, we got refreshments, nice little things to eat on the market, we drove on bikeways just next to the river and we got so see a few interesting temples. The guide was very good as well.Highly recommended.

Must-do in Bangkok. I booked a Siam Sawan bike tour with Follow Me. The shop is located near Chong Nonsi BTS and isn't difficult to find if you follow the directions given. Our guide was Matthew and we were first taken to a heritage museum where he explained to us the history and culture behind the house. Afterwards, we started cycling to the outskirts of Bangkok where we saw the slums. We took a boat to the other side of the river and cycled through the jungles. On our way back, we had to cycle along traffic but our guide always ensured that we were safe. The bikes were in excellent condition as well. After the tour ends at the clubhouse, there is a free fish spa for your feet and there is complimentary coffee and tea at the clubhouse for you to relax. Or you could play with the resident parrot. I strongly recommend this to anyone coming to Bangkok.

Excellent!. Well, Indid not expect the ride to be that good. It was very organized, planned and packed with activities. The guide was really good, knows his stuff and explaining everything.the ride in outside of BKK was awesome, safer and more interesting. It took a while to go out of the city, however, riding in the city was not bad :)We visited a museum, kinder garden, coconut farm, fed the fish and went into a boat.this was my best day in BKKIf you ride abike in BKK you can ride anywhere else.

Great bike tour!. We loved the bike tour with Follow Me. We brought our little girl of 14 months for the ride and it actually went pretty smooth. It was a great way to see a totally different Bangkok, with all the narrow streets and alleys that you take. Loved it!

Great way to discover Bangkok. Absolutly fabolous way to discover Bangkok. The people working at "Follow me Bike Tours" are very professional, motivatied and enthusiastic about their job. Its worth every Bath. I would recommend it to everybody visiting Bangkok for the very first time. And its a lot of fun!

A wunderfull way to see the other side of Bangkok. We had a wunderfull day with followmebike in Bangkok.It´s a good idea to see of norrow trail the other side from a big city.We say thanks to Metthew for a great day.If we have the next holiday in Bangkok we want to have a biketour with followmebike again.
nice tour. A bike tour with follow me bike Tour is an interesting and different way to see bangkok. be carefull in the traffic, but traffic is more peacefull as in europe.

Great way to see the City. Follow me bike tour was a great first day in Bangkok! the guide was friendly, very knowledgeable and spoke English very well! My friends and I did the full day food tour and all involved really enjoyed the day. The tour was a great way to see Bangkok city and experience the hustle and bustle first hand. Would highly recommend!

Nice trip. We joined the "Siam Sawan" bike tour. It's a nice experience about visiting Bangkok by cycling.The tourguide was nice and patient and he took lots of photo for us.I saw many different appearance of Bangkok and that's I never seen before!

Good Bikes, good route, little information. I booked this tour on the phone, the lady was very helpful and spoke good english.When we got there, we had to fill in a form and had to pay, cash only. Then our guide came, showed as a video about how to behave and also gave us instruction himself. The bike we were given, were good and well looked after. Then we set off to the jungle tour.I felled always very safe, with the guide. We went through the village to the pier to set over to the green area of Bangkok and to a local market, with a longtailboat. We also drove through plantations and visited a park.It was all very well, but the guide really only guided us through the tour, we didn't get much information about the culture or the daily life of the people, neither background information to places we visit.That i really found disappointing and was a shame, because that really would have made a big different. But safety, gear and the route were good.

Nice introduction to the city. This tour is an alternative and nice introduction to Bangkok, especially since it takes you to places most tourists do not visit. The guides are locals and knowlegeable.

Perfect way to experience Bangkok. We took the bike tour with follow me and I must say that it was the best decision we took in Thailand The activity in itself was exciting as we moved around thailand's by lanes and markets on a cycle experiencing the sights and smells of the real city. The guide was very friendly and took our photos all along the way. The best part was the warm hospitality of the lady at the office who went out of the way to help us in every single way. There was a complementary fish spa after the tour where we sat and just chatted. Fresh fruits after the bicycle tour was also very refreshing. Overall I would say a must do in Bangkok and only with follow me bike tours.

A different way to see Bangkok! 与众不同的曼谷体验~. 我选择的是Siam Boran行程，主要是在曼谷中穿街过巷，有经过曼谷狭窄的小巷、大马路、搭ferry甚至进入鲜花市场~~行程中，我们的guide还会半途让我们休息，买一些当地小吃饮料让我们尝试。如果你要看看一个不单止是购物、按摩或人妖表演的曼谷，你就应该选择这Follow Me Bike Tour!!I try their “Siam Boran" trip, is a city tour, we mainly cycle on the small street in Bangkok, also take ferry, go to local flower market. Our friendly guide bought some local snack & drinks to let us try. If you want to see a different Bangkok(not only shopping,massage or ladyboy show), you definitely should choose Follow Me Bike Tour!!! P/S: 骑行完毕回到会所后，一定要尝试他们的fish spa！ After cycling tour, went back to club house, must try the fish spa!!!

Best Way to See Bangkok!. We absolutely loved this tour! It is was a fun and unique way to see all of Bangkok. Our tour guide Mathew was sincere and very knowledgeable. We felt safe in the craziness of the city and loved every minute of the tour. Definitely one of the highlights of our trip!

An unexpected great experience in Bangkok. If you are used to ride a bike, this is absolutely a must-do in Bangkok. The guide Matthew could not have done it any better. The flower market, ferry and the temple were great in combination with a guide who knows all the insights and even bought some snacks and drinks for us and flowers for in the temple. He even let us use his phone for an urgent phone call. Thank you again Matthew!

Siam Sawan tour - Discover a world of difference on Bangkok's doorsteps.. After a disappointing morning with another bike tour company (read my other review), I was delighted to join this bike tour.They were helpful and efficient from the first phone call, to directions, to coming out to the main road to meet me when I wasn't sure how to get to their place.And having been on a number of bike tours before, I immediately felt I was in good hands.• Ms Peach, the local guide was great! Well spoken, friendly, knowledgeable, she led the group well, never once slacking with the signals and safety of the group.• The equipment was well maintained and in excellent condition. A sign of a well runned company.• We were provided with food and drink throughout the 4+ hours of the trip, including sampling local fare at the stalls of the canal market.• The first part took us through lovely backstreets and then through neighborhoods which we would never have seen as a visitor, including some fascinating slums, the ghetto of rural migrant workers and families in the Chong Nonsi area near the river.• Then the magic of a boat ride across the river, to a completely different world, taking mere minutes. To the eastern shore of that kidney shaped 'island' which is home to Bang Nam Phueng 'Floating' Market. (It's actually more of a market alongside the canals). There, the ride through communities resident amidst the mangrove swamp, past mini farming plots, raised on mounds above the water line of brackish river water, along narrow raised pathways, is both interesting and refreshing as the hustle and bustle of Bangkok rapidly fade away. The sights, sounds and smells assail your senses - especially the smell!• The stop at the Bang Nam Phueng 'Floating' Market was fun. Happens only on Saturdays and Sundays, it was devoid of tourist at about 3:00 pm. Excellent! Our guide took us through and explained stuff, and bought whatever food and drink we wanted to sample or try!• Then onwards to the eastern shore of the island to check out some cool hotels (4000 baht/night), quaint homestays (400 baht/night), and finally through some lovely trails before heading back. Another boatride and a 15 min ride back to the starting point.• The ride finished with more drinks, fresh fruit and promises to email photos taken during the ride by the guide.I'm looking forward to the new tours in development that they mentioned. I will certainly be looking forward to joining them again for those.High recommended!!!!

Great way to see Bangkok without a rush.... So you want to see Bangkok? A bike is the way to go. Trust me I have a car here and as I wizz by things I always wish I could stop and explore. On a bike you can do just that, and with a knowledgeable guide who speaks both English and Thai you can find new nooks in crannies you never knew existed whether you live in or are just visiting Bangkok. After going on the Siam Boran tour I had a renewed sense of bravery and tried to tackle touring Bangkok's Green Lung on my own. Boy was that a bad idea, I should have signed up for a 2nd tour doing the Siam Sawan route and discovered it with Follow Me Bike Tour's expert assistance. My girlfriend and I got lost riding bikes through the island, and the longtail boat driver almost dropped my bike into the river. Luckily all that was lost was my blinking reflector light, which surprisingly floated in the water.Next time I want to venture out into the wilds of Bangkok for a long bike ride you can bet it will be with the great folks at Follow Me Bike Tours. As an added bonus they even emailed out pictures the tour guide took of the group during the tour.

Best way to see the other side of Bangkok. After reading several good reviews about Follow Me, we booked the Siam tour and we had a great experience. First of all, the people at Follow me were very accommodating. We ordered a taxi through our hotel and 20 minutes later it hadn't arrive yet, and we realized that we were going to be late. We called them up and offer to reschedule without any problem. When we actually went on the tour, we got to bike through the little and narrow streets of Bangkok where most of the people live and also got to see more touristy places. Our guide was very friendly and informative. It was one the highlights of our stay in Bangkok.

Would definitely recommend this!. Great perspective of the city that a tourist would not normally have: biking through many slum housing communities and visiting a more local watt. All was very safe and intriguing. Loved it!

Siam Boran Bicycle Tour - do this as soon as you get to Bangkok. I have cycled for more than 25 years, run a touring company myself and am very experienced biking in cities...... so I can confidentially say that this company is well worth the time and money. I always felt taken care of, safe and never once felt like I was being misinformed. My guide was very proud to show me his city and welcome me to Thailand, from explanations about Buddhism to showing us how to open a lotus flower to introducing us to some local cuisine. For those of you nervous about biking in the city, never fear! We were always safe and there was some amazing back streets that we rode through where it was just you and the scooters. Also the clubhouse was a great place to chill out, with coffee being served in the morning to snacks after the ride. Two thumbs up from this girl!

Great way to explore the backstreets of Bangkok. A great way to spend a morning and see all the back streets. At the start of the tour, staff take you through a safety video and offer helmets if required. You take an alternative route than you would do if you were exploring yourself, crossing the river, going through the markets and China Town. Staff are really friendly an take photos of you throughout the trip and email them to you after. I wasn't a fan of Bangkok but enjoyed this tour.
Great way to explore Bangkok. Friendly guide with extended knowledge of history and religion as well as best places to eat. Fun and perfect duration. You need to know how to ride a bike :)

another way to see Bangkok. I joined the Siam Boran tour. This is my 1st time to see Bangkok in another way. We have a small group of 3. The tour guide is so nice. He is so informative, we knew much more about Bangkok. It is a great experience and worth to try. Highly recommed.

Great half day tour with nice helpful guide. I opted for the half day city tour and it was very nice. We biked in alleys and neighborhoods I would have never been able to navigate on my own. The bike they gave me worked very well. Overall great experience!

Follow Me is the only reason I would return to Bangkok. This tour was the highlight of our two days in Bangkok. People (including the cabbie who took us to the Follow Me office) thought we were crazy for attempting to ride bikes in Bangkok with our 11 year old who previously had only biked in our suburban Illinois neighborhood, but Follow Me had a guide in front of our group and a guide in the back who ushered us safely through narrow alleys, the flower market, across the river on a ferry boat, and even into China Town. I honestly felt bad for the guide in back who had to witness all our near misses and blocked traffic for us when we didn't stay quite far enough to the side! After our tour, I felt like I had truly been to Bangkok. Our guide showed us how to respectfully visit the temples and how to fold the petals of a lotus flower. He also explained much about the Buddhist religion and the history of Bangkok. If you can ride a bike, don't miss this tour!

Don't Miss the Best Way to See Bangkok. I did the Siam Sawan tour, led by Matthew and it is one of my most favorite Bangkok experiences ever. I've been to Bangkok eight times, and I saw a side of the city that I've never experienced before. I felt comfortable and safe at all times. The bikes are very high quality. Drivers are respectful of bikers. The guide took a lot of pride in sharing an insiders view of the city. FMBT also provides photos of your tour at no additional cost. Take this tour on a weekend, when you can go to a local market that only Thais visit. The family atmosphere, quality food and beautiful surrounding park are very special. I will definitely do another tour with FMBT next time I am in Bangkok.

Best way to see the real Bangkok. I've done the afternoon bike tour and it gave me a mush better Idea of Bangkok. You feel it, you smell it and you are part of it. The tour was well organised from the beginning to the end. Safety first and the groups are small. The guide Matthew Uthumma was one of the best tour guides I had on my trip. He speaks good English en can tell you a lot about the city, It is definitely worth the money.

Siam Boran. An unique experience to see the daily life of Bangkok! Was fun to ride in the back alleys, enjoy the flower market and street food. Friendly guide, group was not to big and pace was good! Definitely an activity to do when you're in Bangkok!
Daily, hidden Bangkok!. Great tour to see and watch how people actually live daily in the hidden Bangkok, behind the glamour, touristic views!

Followmebike tour Siam Boran. This was an interesting, exciting and at some time a little bit scary experience. Our guide, Matthew, was wonderful, he had really the capacity of telling you facts in a very fascinating way. We hade the ability of seeing things and areas that we never had seen by bus or car. We can strongly recommend this tour.

Sore butts, but a great day. My boyfriend and I did the food + bike tour. The morning you jump on a food tour with 'Bangkok food tours' and walk around the local district near Saphan taksin train station. You meet at the station which is super easy to get to. We went to 5 restaurants and had 10 dishes, needless to say we were stuffed by the end. Amazing food, we even revisited some of the resturants later in our trip. The guide then takes you to the club house and introduces you to your bike guide. An afternoon was enough for us, not used to riding long distances. You still ride about 20kms!!!! Our guide took us to cool off the beaten path places including the old customs building and temples. You cross the river, which is great fun loading all the bikes on. When we got back to the club house we got ice cream and a free fish bath!!!! We recommend this trip to all our friends

A fun morning out. Excellent tour guide (Matthew). New bikes. We crossed the river to the "green lung of Bangkok", giving us an opportunity to escape the crowded city, and have a glimpse of what village life would have been like. We also went to a great weekend market. I would recommend that any visitors to Bangkok should put this on their itinerary.

New Years Day. We went on New Years Morning 2015 due to time restrictions in Bangkok, but am so glad we did as I am not all that steady on a bike. Had a blast, was an easy ride & got to see some great sights.

A really fun and interesting way to see the city, especially for first-timers.. Follow Me Bike Tours was a really fun day where we got to see some cool sights and rode the backstreets through Bangkok.They have very good customer service - we actually rocked up just too late but they stopped and waited for us to get there - plus our guide (Matthew) had genuine interest in us and had a passion for his work that was evident from the start. A little exxy, but pretty much all the bike tours in Bangkok we found were anyway.Overall it was a worthwhile time and I definitely recommend it for anyone new to the city.

Fascinating view of Bangkok alleyways on crummy bikes. The enthusiasm of Follow Me for showing the hidden gems of Bangkok by bike is amply evident, both at the obscurely hidden HQ and by the tour leaders. The tours give visitors the opportunity to see sides of Bangkok that most locals don't even see, and for that reason it's a real treat. The knowledge and friendliness of the guides make a Follow Me tour well worth the effort. But the condition of the bikes is poor and no tools are evident. Follow Me really needs to pay more attention to maintaining safe equipment.
Great cycling tour. The tour was fun, well organised, and safe. The tour guide was very knowledgeable and friendly. Good quality bicycles.
Very good day to discover Bangkok inside. We had very good moment all together and thanks to our guide we discovered Bangkok, monuments and people.

Wonderful tour of bangkok. Gf and I did the 6 hour Siam Chiva tour with Peach as our guide. It was only us and two others so the tour felt very small and personal. It looked like the 4 hour city tour had 10+ riders so I was very glad we picked this one. We rode through many interesting side streets and back alleys of Bangkok and saw several diverse neighborhoods. We sampled Muslim, chinese, and thai street food so by the end of the tour we were stuffed. The bikes were in good shape and easily handled the varying terrains. A couple of very easy hills otherwise the entire trip was flat. While most of the tour went through quiet streets with little to no traffic there were a couple of busy sections but Peach does a great job guiding the tour and we never felt unsafe. Wonderful introduction to Bangkok and highly recommended.

great way to explore Bangkok. I had booked a morning city tour to temple,flower market and China town,with my family. Our guide was Peach who was a friendly,smiling,passionate and kind guide. She tried her best to answer our question about the city. With bike tour,we been to many small soi or narrow street,which we wouldn't have seen on our own as a tourist. This part was really interesting and fun!The guide also led us to some attractions and gave detailed description of places and histories. Besides that, the guide had stopped twice to buy us some drinks from street vendors.The orange juice was really good and refreshing! Biking for four hours was not tired actually but exercise made us hungry. I would suggest the guide to prepare some snacks on the way(maybe small packaged cookies or cakes) to give the guest. It would be more thoughtful. Overall, I think this is a good experience and fun way to know more about a city. Worth a try!

Peach was a total Peach! Loved the tour!. We did the 6 hour food and bike tour with Peach on 12/26. There were only 4 of us on the tour and it was a fantastic group. We got to see parts of Bangkok that we would never have experienced otherwise. This tour gets you away from the tourists and provides great variety from a nearly empty pagoda to a Chinese temple, street food, long boat ride. It covered so much ground and was totally worth the time and money. Peach was awesome. I admire her for quitting her office day job to do something she enjoys. It comes through. While you wouldn't think Bangkok is a bike friendly city,we took back streets and secret passageways to get around and in the meantime got a glimpse of daily life in some under served areas of the city. It was humbling to see all aspects of the city, not just the sexier tourist areas. Thanks Peach!!

Great experience for the whole family (young children of 4 & 8)!. The entire experience was positive and provided us a great perspective of Bangkok that we would never have had without this tour. Matthew was an informative, passionate and kind guide and the customer service was excellent throughout. Thank you.

Great way to see another side of Bangkok.. My wife and I often take bike tours when we travel to other cities and so eagerly looked forward to taking the Siam Boram tour given the great reviews of tripadvisor. Indeed, our experience was similar to others. It was a great way to see another side of Bangkok as we weaved in and out of narrow streets along with occasional forays on the main roads where you are literally a couple of feet away from motorbikes, cars and tuk tuks. The whole ride was never too strenuous physically as Bangkok is more or less flat so there were so steep areas to negotiate and I never had to use the lower hears, though occasionally we had to carry the bikes on and off the ferryboats and some steps. Our guide Matthew was very professional and took great care of our group of 10. There were stops in the flower market, Chinese temple and Thai temple, among others. At all the stops Matthew explained the history and taught us a lot about Thai culture. He also took photos throughout and the photos were uploaded soon afterwards. When we got back we were also treated to ice cream! Overall, a great experience.I would rate the tour 4 and a half stars rather than 5 as there are still some areas for improvements. The biggest negative is that you never get a sense of where you have been to as no route map is provided. Granted, you cycle pass temples, Chinatown and the Muslim neighborhoods, but in the bigger picture l did not know where all the locations are situated in relation to each other. On a similar bike tour we took in Montreal we were given a simple map that shows the route map and all the locations we passed by. This simple addition will enhance the experience. Another thing mentioned in a previous review was the quality of some of the bikes. They seem to vary as l saw a mixture of new and old looking bikes, so you should choose your bike carefully before setting out.
Siam Boran Tour - Bangkok. This was a great way of seeing Bangkok and some parts maybe I would not have seen on my own....the guide was excellent and the pace of the tour was really good.

Excellent Tour. I've took the Siam Sawan tour and it was really great. We cycled through narrow streets in some areas you would never go if not on such a tour just because you won't find them. After that we took a longtail to Phra Pradaeng the green lung of Bangkok. I' d never ever thought that you can find such a place in Bangkok. At all I can totally recommend this tour to everybody visiting Bangkok and who is a little bit tired of temples.
Do the one in the jungle with Wit. We had a wonderful time. This guys know what they are doing and they do it with fun and knowledge. Dont Miss it if you like bike tours.

Do not miss out!!. What a fantastic way to explore the hustle and bustle of Bangkok!! As a family of three (aged 58, 25 & 26) we did the Siam Boran Tour and loved every minute of it! Our guide was very informative and the bikes were in great condition. We were even given the option of a large comfortable seat which at the end of the day prevented a sore bum after a long day of cycling round the city! Weaving through alleyways and along side the chaotic traffic of Chinatown was exhilarating, and although I felt 100% safe with the guidance of our guide I would recommend making sure your confident in cycling a bike before taking on this tour! If you want to see the real Bangkok do yourself a favour and book this tour!

Amazing, cannot miss!. This biketour really completed out experience in Bangkok. After 2.5 weeks in the islands, the city wanted us and we wanted the city! Friendly people, good organization, our guide was knowledgable and friendly. Everything you need, they give you. Highly recommended and we hope to be back for the jungle 9 hour tour :)

Professional bike tour with the dazzling Peach. Did the Siam Sawan (Jungle) tour on Xmas Day. Loved the city bits. Riding through what looks like chaos to an outsider was great fun and felt, to my surprise, completely safe. The jungle bits were relaxing (if not idyllic), so much so that i felt myself nearly drifting off to sleep whilst riding! Enjoyed the boat rides to and from the jungle, and the visit to the ex- PM's house was very good. But for anyone who hasnt seen the historical sights of Bkk, i would recommend doing a city tour first.The general setup up and welcome is excellent - a good induction video which some other providers don't do, and we were tended to with cold drinks before, during and after the tour.For anyone who is cautious about riding a bike in Bkk, don't be. It is by far the most enjoyable and effective way of travelling round the city, and with a local tour guide, nothing could be easier. You willl need a little bit of riding skill as some paths can be narrow. But, to be honest, most people have learnt how to ride a bike well when they were kids, and you don't forget. The beauty with cycling in Bkk is that there is always a cooling breeze, and whilst it will still be hot, you will feel comfortable.Probably my only criticism, and it's a small one, is that the bikes are not high spec. Whilst they are fit for purpose and they get you round at the sedate pace of the tour, they are not as good as some i have ridden with other companies. Its a small complaint and not enough to detract from a great day out.Just have to say that the highlight of this tour was actually a person. The incredible Peach! A tiny, gracious and softly spoken young Thai woman, with an ability to stop large trucks with a polite but authoritative hand in the air and her beaming smile. It must be stressful leading a group of strangers through the roads of Bkk, but she never once lost her calm or authority. She kept me dazzled and entertained all day. Her commentary was interesting and heartfelt, and she clearly enjoys her job. I would follow Peach anywhere, that's how amazing she is.

Fantastic!!!! A great morning out and about!!!!!. Took the city 4 hour ride and had a great time!!!! Easy pace with lots of stops and an informative guide (Arh) bikes are in good condition and this is well worth the £25 they charge.Enjoy

Very friendly staff. I thoroughly enjoyed this trip with my Fiance. Our guide "Boi" was very patient and friendly. Their restroom facilities were very clean. I was impressed by how they went above and beyond to make us happy. The only negative (which is relative) was the fact that our taxi driver had a hard time finding their establishment because it's located in the alleyways. The reasoning behind the alleyway location is to ensure that you get mostly bike routes. Be alert and mindful of your surroundings and always pay attention to the guide.

A Different Way to See Bangkok. Having lived in Bangkok for the past 9 months I decided to take the Jungle Tour and see a different side of the city. My guide Matthew was very informative, answering any questions I had and the tour went by very quickly because I was enjoying myself so much. It was lovely just to get away from the city and enjoy the quiet of the coconut forests and cycling through the farms listening to bird call. The fish spa at the end was also really good fun- I'd never had one before and discovered I have extremely ticklish soles! Would definitely recommend this to anyone :)

Must do! . Yesterday we did the Follow Me bike tour of Bangkok. It was fantastic! We only had a couple of days in Bangkok and this was such a great way to see so much of this city in a short time. Our guide Arh (sorry not sure of spelling) was excellent, very helpful and friendly. The biking was easy, but this was good because it allowed heaps of time to look round and take photos. A must do if visiting Bangkok!

Not your usual Bangkok experience!. Who knew you could be in the jungle after a very short ride from central Bangkok! I don't write reviews but I had such a great experience with We Follow I thought I should share. The offices are a little hard to find but that's just part of the adventure and when you do arrive you'll be enchanted by the tranquil setting! Our tour guide Ah was very friendly, super chilled but kept a careful eye on us the whole time as we rode through the crazy streets of the city! Once we decanted onto a boat and did a short hop to the island we were in the middle of a beautiful national park! The narrow, elevated walkways are kinda fun to negotiate on the bikes, but take your time and you'll be fine!We also did the cooking class after our ride and had the BEST green curry I've ever had.Such a great day and definitely the highlight of my trip.

Unique, fabulous experience. My husband and I went on the jungle tour on our honeymoon. Having done previous bike tours in Germany (Berlin and Munich) we expected something similar (leisurely biking on beach cruisers to see historical buildings, end with beer). Not so! This tour starts by taking you through the busy streets of Bangkok, including the narrow alleyways of the "economically diverse" parts of town, which is an experience in itself. You then take a long boat ride across the river to the island and bike around beautiful jungle scenery. This tour is more physically demanding than the others we have done. When they say 4 hours, they mean you bike for nearly 4 hours straight. This tour was very well run and honestly one of the coolest things we have done.
