We can now say we gave biked through the hectic streets of Bangkok, something we now know we could NEVER do on our own, despite our previous misconceptions/illusions of grandeur.Thanks Follow Me! for a memorable experience.

Best way to see Bangkok. We had such a good time with Wit on our recent bike trip of the city. Travelling with 2 teenagers this was ideal, Wit took us safely thru traffic, provided tasty snacks and was great at answering anything you asked him! We would have done another tour if time had allowed!!

Fun way to see Bangkok. We did the morning tour with Whit as our guide. He's a great guide, fun and easy going. We learned a lot from Whit, and enjoyed stopping for local treats such as juice, sticky rice and mango, coconut dumplings. Loved riding through the narrow streets. i would recommend Follow Me Bike Tours when in Bangkok. As we were leaving Whit mentioned a spa (Sabai Spa, just around the corner - turn left out of Follow Me's yard, left again and left again and it's just down on the right), where we went and had great Thai massages. If you have time after your Follow Me tour, I would recommend a trip to this spa as well.

If you only do one tour in Bangkok, do this tour.. We did the city tour, which was one of the best tours we've taken in a few weeks of traveling! We got to see the quiet back alleyways of Bangkok, try bites of street food and see some awesome sights. Our guide Wit was professional, safe, funny, spoke excellent English, and it felt like we were being taken care of by a friend. Next time we return, we'd definitely try another one of their tours.

Wonderful way to see Bangkok. Lots of fun! Covered a lot of ground. Chose to do a private tour with a group of friends which I recommend. Well worth the small amount of extra money. This way you can spend more time at what you want to see.

Follow me to the outskirts of Bangkok bike tour. Touring the city and outskirts of Bangkok by bike was an excellent choice! Our guide, Matthew, was accommodating, funny, and had good command of English. He treated us to lots of local food as well! We recommend doing this activity on a light weather (definitely not during Summer).

If you want to see a new side of Bangkok.... This tour is for you! My boyfriend and I had heard about this tour from talking with a couple from New Zealand at a local bar. We immediately booked the tour the next day and we did not regret it. By far, it was one of the highlights of the trip. Our guides Matthew and Ah were amazing — very informative and took their time to show us the true back alleys of Bangkok. We got to see how the real locals live and visited some great sites. I don't want to spoil it all, so all I am going to say is BOOK THIS TOUR, you will absolutely love it. Even if you're not big into biking like myself, they go at a pace that is easy for all. I really enjoyed it.

Bangkok bike tour. Fabulous morning with Whit as our guide. Travelled down narrow alley, along interesting streets, through several markets, beside the river - great stimulation for the senses. And Whit is a really good guide - kept all four of the group together and safe, gave very clear instructions, and gave interesting information about the places that we visited. He also kept us energized by stopping at various street vendors for fresh juices and other treats. And after the ride he took us to the local Spa for a great Thai massage. A wonderful morning.

A great alternative tour of Bangkok. Our tour guide was brilliant: fun, friendly and informative. He had a great young persons insight into the city and took us round the markets, food stalls and temples. This tour was so much more fun than your average tour and we loved it!

Bangkok biker. Excellent way to see parts of Bangkok you would not otherwise see. Great guide. Very friendly throughout. Very clear instruction. I did it on a Sunday when traffic was quieter. Would recommend.
Great way to see the diversity of Bangkok. Second time on this great tour - with our daughter this time. These tours have knowledgable guides and small groups. Bikes are good. Highly recommended.

The only way to see Bangkok!. We booked the Siam Boran tour as we had only one full day in Bangkok and thought this would be the best way to see the city. We were right, 100%! Our guide knew the back alleys and streets of Bangkok like the back of his hand. Right from the time we started from the Follow Me club house to the time we got back (a stretch of 22 kms which took around 4 hrs+), he managed to take us through what we thought we could not have experienced in any other way.Bangkok has its glamor and shopping and malls, but it also has its quaint little streets, small residential areas and super colorful wholesale markets. At times on the main roads meandering throught the traffic and at others going through streets so narrow that if someone came against you, you'd have to hug one of the walls to let him pass - Siam Boran is a tour for every first time visitor to Bangkok to experience the city first-hand.They even got our tired bunch yummy Thai food and drinks at the end of the tour!Highly recommended for anyone who knows how to cycle.

I enjoyed very much. I took the Siam Boran tour on my own but I met a very nice group of people from South Africa there. The tour was very nice, most of the places I knew already, but seeing them on bike looked different. Our guide was very helpful and thanks again to invite us to your temple. I will see you soon for a different tour. Massimo

Excellent biketour and great way to see the other side of Bangkok. We took Follow Me Bike Tours Siam Boran tour on 22nd of November. This was much more than I expected. The tour took almost five hours and it included cycling on the backalleys of central bangkok, visiting a few temples and crossing the river twice with ferry. I would have givent this tour five points, but bikes were a bit rusty and out of date. With those fixed this would have been a five star trip. Our guide was a nice young local lady who knew about all the sights during the trip. HIghly recommended

Nice Tour -beyond touristic szence. First of all, it's an adventure to find the office of follow me bike. If you have no skills of reading maps, your lost.But if you try ask someone nearby, somebody will tell you where the right way is.Otherwise are green flags around the office.After arriving we got a small introduction of cycling in Bangkok. Sights, amenities and safeties. Our tour crossed just a few mainstreets and then followed streets beyond the touristical routes. Afterall we hope to see Mathew again.he guided the group of 6 nations with a natural behavour.

Jungle Tour. My Husband & I enjoyed the tour. We were guided safely through the busy Bangkok streets to Jungle (via boat). The Fish Spa after the long ride is also a plus. My advise for those who want to visit the floating market (on the weekend) is to sign up for the morning tour. Sadly, we didn't get the memo early enough.

I like it !. It was a great experiance. I like cycling but this was different. See local people, houses, market and try snacks. I'm happy I did the tour. I made a video as well. http://gobackpackgo.com/cycling-bangkok-biketour/

Great Tours. We did both the jungle tour and like it so much we came back with Japanese colleagues and friends and did the city tour. Both were amazing and we feel we know so much more of Bangkok now. Will not hesitate to do a tour or two next time we are in Bangkok. Thank you so much Dave, Aor, Matthew and the rest of the team...

Great fun and loved the cooking. Jannine and I had a great cycle Wit and fun cooking with Mathew.The tour was professionally done and Wit ensured our safety and fun experience at all times.I cannot cook.. however Mathew was able to assist me in cooking a great Thai salad which I have cooked at home since :-)Thanks for a great day we will remember :-)

Wonderful tour.. I took the Siam Sawan tour (jungle tour), and it was really wonderful. It leads you to an amazing part of Bangkok which I had never seen, a nice jungle. Everything is organized to perfection, and though I was a little concern about cycling in Bangkok crazy traffic, the guide (Matthew) is really making it easy, taking small quiet roads whenever possible. As Bangkok area is flat, the cycling in itself isn't difficult at all, and you can enjoy the amazing scenery. My advise is to take the tour on a Saturday or Sunday, so that you can enjoy the floating market. Again, Matthew was perfect, explaining all the goods you find there, and had us taste the delicious and vary Thai food.Great experience, highly recommended.

Exceptional experience. Exceptional experience, Bangkok tour by bike is amazing, one passes through streets which we do not even suspect, we tasted the insect cooked, Matthew is the perfect guide, thank you again to you, an unforgettable day, I board also Food Tour the morning we feasted .... a day to do absolutely.

Impressive tour through the suburbs of Bangkok. I did the Sawan tour on November 4, 2014 and very much enjoyed it. Besides me only one more Person joined so that we basically had a private tour with our friendly guide Matthew whose English was perfect. We drove through the Slums and everyone there was just so nice and smiled at us riding by. My favorite part was the ride through narrow streets in the djungle, that was adventurous and lots of fun. You have to concentrate though. This is a tour I can definitely recommend. Next time I will do the Siam Boran tour :-)Thanks again Matthew and Follow me Team for this great Bangkok experience!

Awesome experience! Must do!. This tour was amazing! It takes you through back alleyways, food stalls, a couple of temples, along the river, across the river on a boat with your bike to explore some more, and even on some bustling Bangkok streets (get ready for an adrenalin rush!) Given the small group size, the guide was able to keep close watch on everyone and ensure everyone's safety. As a not-so-avid bike rider, I was a bit weary of doing such a long ride with my 11 yr old son, but it was great! We both kept up, enjoyed the various stops, and found it fascinating as it took you around the inner parts of Bangkok you wouldn't normally wander around. 1 recommendation: bring a mask cuz the streets are a bit smoggy, esp when you're stuck on an alley behind a truck.

Different perspective of Bangkok. This is a great experience . Great guide, off the beaten path experiences. Just not sure that this is suitable for all ages. You have to be very skilled with the bycicle as you will be in the midst of traffic with cars, tuk Tuks, motorcycles, pedestrians, etc in busy hours. But if you are very skilled go for it. Make sure you choose to wear a helmet!!

Great local experience.. The Follow Me Bangkok city tour was a great way see a little beneath the surface of the city. Our guide was great, and took us through alley ways and back streets as well as through china town and the middle of a flower market and then onto Wat Arun. Would highly recommend to anyone who wants to see a little more than the typical tourist route. Maybe let your guide know if you would like to stop to take extra photos along the way, as we kept a pretty good pace, and looking back I missed out a little on that.All in all, fantastic.

Bangkok morning tour. We started our tour in the morning so the heat was bearable, We had a great guide who brought us through neighbourhoods we would never have found on our own. Definitely a great way to see the city. A bonus was that our guide took a lot of pictures during the tour that were made available to us on-line.

Very unusual way to discover BKK without traffic. In a very friendly and secure setting, you will discover BKK through small streets, river banks, some street foods, few temples... Makes BKK more attractive than experiencing traffic jams in taxi.And the fish spa at the end is a good reward.My 11 year old son liked it a lot as well

Nice biking jungle tour in Bangkok !. We did the Bangkok jungle tour biking tour in Bangkok. It was a really good guided tour by our guide Mathew. It started with a little urban tour in Bangkok, than we went trough some "slams" of the city, stopped at a local little school, tip: take some sweets with you, to give to the children over there, they will be very thankful ! Later we took a little boat to the other side of the river, and biked trough a kind of jungle,very green, very quiet & very nice! We also stopped at the oldest salt factory of the town & we visit an old house of a former prime minister of Thailand ! Overall it is a very safe tour & you will see another side of Bangkok!

Siam Boran tour - Excellent way to see Bangkok suburbs. Cycling tour started in the morning so the humidity level was reasonable. Our guide Matthew knew so much about history and religions so he could answer all our questions which was great. Even if we cycled through narrow streets and paths and Bangkok traffic the tour was safe. One of the highlights was when we visited one small Buddha temple. It was amazing! I can highly recommend this to a group of friends or a couple.

Bangkok City Tour. Really good afternoon tour. Matthew, our guide, was very safety conscious when we had to filter into and through the Bangkok traffic. We were impressed with how obliging Bangkok drivers are towards cyclists. Matthew took us down many narrow and fascinating alleyways so that we were not exposed to traffic much of the time. He was very informative about Thai culture.and beliefs.

Siam Boran tour led by Wit - awesome - highly recommended!. A friend and I did the Siam Boran tour, and were lucky enough to only have one other person in our group. We cycled through the back streets and main streets of a variety of areas in Bangkok, including markets, Wats, Chinatown, rode the local ferries and ate bugs (optional of course).Our local guide (Wit), spoke excellent English and went the extra mile to ensure that we enjoyed the trip. Be open to new experiences - eat the silk worms, grasshoppers and crickets at the markets - they are actually quite nice. They have been marinated and cooked so well if you didn't look at them, you could believe they are anything! If you want to get off the beaten track and see things you wouldn't otherwise see, I couldn't recommend this more highly. It was a hot day, but the ride itself is not all that strenuous, and I actually found it cooler on the bike than walking on the street. After the tour we enjoyed (almost - it does tickle) the added bonus of the fish spa and a viewing of the photos taken by our guide (which were promptly emailed to us after the tour).Enjoy!! It was the highlight of our trip so far!

A must do when in Bangkok. Our tour guide Matthew was excellent. It was very relaxed and not too cheesy like some tours can be. It was fun as well as a little hair raising when trying to get through the Bangkok traffic but that made the tour more exciting.

Great experience!. I loved seeing Bangkok this way! Our tour guide was so funny and great! His English was perfect and he told really funny jokes the entire time! He bought us Thai snacks along the way to try and it was so nice! He took us through some great parts of the city I would not have seen otherwise. He did bike a little too fast for me but that is my only complaint. I would tell anyone to do this! I really really enjoyed it!

Awesome experience - highly recommended!. I recently did the Siam Aharn full day tour - the food tour in the morning, and the bike tour in the afternoon. It was a truely fantastic experience! Although I have been to Bangkok many times previously for business, the tour afforded me the opportunity to experience Bangkok in new and fascinating ways. And for what you get, the price of this tour is a bargain!I took the food tour with Mod as our guide. She was great - not only explaining about the different dishes we sampled, but also about offering interesting insights into local Thai culture. She was very engaged with the tour group, and went out of her way to converse, teach, and guide, and to interact with us. We learned not only about the food, but also about the restaurants/shops, as well as their owners. In all, we tried 16 different items - all of which were unspeakably delicious! By taking the tour, I was able to stop in to many small restaurants I previously walked by and was able to expand my love of Thai food - and my sense of adventure. Matthew was our guide for the afternoon bicycle tour. He also did an excellent job of teaching and guiding. By taking bicycles through narrow, unbusy side streets, I saw a different side of Bangkok than what you see from the main streets. It was a fascinating and educational experience. We saw some really interesting things - a festival in Chinatown, the flower market, and a temple but we also did some interesting things, such as opening a lotus flower. The ride was not overly demanding physically but the exercise was nice - after a week of meetings and inactivity, the bike tour was just what I needed!The fish spa for my feet at the end of the tour was a nice bonus treat - i was my first such experience, and it was nice to have it included as part of the tour. The Follow Me company was also quick to send a link to the photos from the trip.I have taken several bicycle tours (Beijing, Vienna, Tokyo), but this was my favorite - I reecommend it highly, but be sure to do the food tour as well!

Simply Outstanding..... Mathew Thanks. Lucky two of us and my 2 1/2 yr old son to have had you for our jungle tour. My son loved fish feeding and lizards. Hope to see you here in India. All guys reading this choose mathew to be your guide. Hope to see you in India. India is not expensive. If you need more of the shengdana chutney let us know we will send it to you.. Hope to see you soon. Love ur fish spa...From Vishal, Maya and Gwaal(baby boy)

Pleasant Experience. Very reliable company, everybody should try without hesitant.I was very happy with the experience. The staff were very welcoming and friendly.The tour guide was knowledgable and nice to took to.if I have any remarks I would say I would prefer to spend less time in temples(for City Tour) and take a brake in the middle of the journey in a comfortable place for a drink or snack.Regardless I found the overall experience very delightful...thanks guys for the nice memory.
The best way to experience the city. Really loved my time with them, thinking about going again tomorrow! What an awesome way to see a city. And the guide was fantastic. Definitely recommended.

Great!. My stay at thailand had been very educational because of follw me bike. It was fun too! We were not able to waste our time coz just in 4 hours weve been to lots of places already. One thing only, we were not able to go to the floating market even it is part of the tour. It was close accdg to the tour guide. If that so, it should be included on the website. That weekdays, floating market is closed. So that we just did not expected it. But over all, amazing tour! :)

Follow them!!!!. It was an amazing, informative and worth wide tour! An unforgettable experience that you must try! The tour guide was remarkable and very professional. He made you feel comfortable and SAFE whist riding on the Bangkok roads. The hospitality at the clubhouse was excellent. All in all its a perfect way to see bangkoks busy, slums and jungle lifestyles in half a day. Thank you follow me team!

Poor safety standards. We have just done one of the Follow me bike tours (charity one) and whilst the tour was very interesting and the guides were good, we were really disappointed by their safety standards. We booked 2 kids on the tour (2 two year olds) and Follow me provided only one fully functional seat for them so I ended up worrying if my child will fall out of the seat during the entire trip or not plus we had to keep her awake to make sure she can hold on etc. The kids helmets were absolutely useless and my daughter (who is used to cycling and loves wearing helmet) couldn't keep the helmet on for more than 10minutes as it was not possible to adjust (read the cheapest supermarket thing which looks like a helmet). This tour would have been easily manageable with kids of any age if Follow Me were to supply adequate seats and acquire helmets of better standard.

Biking the back-streets of Bangkok. This is a fantastic way to explore the city. I went with 2 friends and we were lucky enough to be the only 3 on the tour, so we had the guide all to ourselves! The cycling is not difficult - except down the narrow sois - and even during our very short stints on main roads it felt safe and easy. The tour was well planned and the guide was excellent. We received lots of great photos by email and had an altogether brillian experience. I thoroughly recommend getting out and about with the follow-me team, I can't wait to go on another tour :)

Fun way to see Bangkok. This was a fun way to spend a Sunday morning. We started at 8:30 and rode all around Bangkok stopping at different sights along the way. In total we were out for 4 hours. The tour guide took lots of pictures of the group and then emailed them to us at the end of the day which was nice. I would recommend doing the early ride - the afternoon would be too hot and stronger possibility of getting rained on.

Best part of my Bangkok visit. There is no better way to explore the unseen sights of Bangkok than signing up for a Follow Me bike tour. Dodge the big tourist sites in this city (e.g. Grand Palace, Emerald Buddha) and do this tour instead. My family had a blast with our guide Matthew who was informative and attentive to our poor biking skills. Every nook and cranny we were brought to had a story to it, and you simply learn much more about the culture seeing the back roads and smaller temples of the city. Wish I could experience it again for the first time! Would definitely recommend this to anyone who can put two feet on the pedals.

A great way to get off the beaten track!. We chose the jungle tour. It was a four hour trip of easy cycling. We cycled through city streets, back streets, pedestrian walkways. We also visited a salt factory a crèche in an underprivileged area, an old town house, fed some fish and had a boat ride..... Not bad for a morning! Highly recommended to see behind the obvious Bangkok.

Excellent off-the-beaten-path tour. I took the Siam Aharn tour which is basically a walking food tour in the morning and then a cycling tour in the afternoon. The morning tour started in the Bangrak district. We were taken to 5 different restaurants/cafe/bakeries with the opportunity to try 14 different Thai dishes that ranged from the Northeast to the South. Our guide was a friendly girl who spoke good English and had intimate knowledge of the history of the district. Then she took us to the bike tour hq to get our afternoon session started. After the safety video was shown, we were fitted to the bikes and then we went off to places where no tourists were. We were taken to a beautiful temple which was in a local village, the flower market, the fruit market, hopped on the ferry to go across the Chao Phraya river, cycled through small villages, went along in Chinatown, cycled alongside the river and taught to fold lotus flowers. Our guide Matthew spoke really good English and had answers to all our curious questions.
Great Experience. Congrats to all Follow Me staff... it´s an amazing way to know Bangkok!!!The guide is great, the bikes are ok and I really love the experience.

Great bike tour, well paced, informative and relaxed. This was a lovely bicycle tour through Bangkok, mainly sticking to back streets and alleyways (with no shortage of interesting things to see!) and the occasional main road. At first I was worried that I wouldn't be able to keep up or that the traffic/pedestrians would be too tricky to watch out for, but in the end everything turned out fine. Bangkokians are well atune to traffic of all sorts and staying out of trouble was as easy as keeping left and keeping my eyes open.The guide (Loya) was very friendly and informative, and took us to see some fantastic temples and other sites. The main attractions (for me) were the food/flower market and crossing the Chao Praya river by ferry. While the other participants on the tour were all from one family, I didn't feel sidelined or left out.I took the Siam Boran tour.

Follow Me fabulous fun!. What a great way to see Bangkok! We did the jungle tour but rode throught the city streets first. Our guide Mathew was terrific, we were his little ducklings being guided through the busy city streets. We rode through the slums to the river and caught a long boat to the jungle. The whole experience was fantastic, we always felt safe and the ride was not strenuous at all. Would highly recommend to anyone that would like a different perspective of Bangkok.

Skip the gym, this workout is fun. Have you ever thought that just because you've been to the Grand Palace, mega shopping malls, and all the tourist temples that you've seen it all. Well, you haven't unless you take a bike tour around Bangkok. There are different tours/routes to choose from. I was able to do the Siam Boran tour today with the afternoon schedule at 1:30/1300. As you arrive to the club house, you're greeted by the friendly staff and your guide. I arrived early just to be sure I was in the right area. Luckily a motor bike was able to take me since taxi drivers don't care to find a spot in the alley ways. Before starting, water, tea, and coffee are provided for you. There's a safety demonstration shown before pedaling out into the city. You'll receive a hat as a souvenir that you can wear during the tour so that the guide can easily spot you. Understandable to the heat, it's not offensive if you decide not to wear it. The establishment is clean, the staff speak english and are really friendly which is always a great thing. We had Matthew as our friendly guide with great knowledge about the history of Thailand and Bangkok. If you have any questions you need or want to ask, don't be shy. Matthew seemed very happy to answer any questions. Here are some tips for the Siam Boran tour: *You're going to wish you had a Go Pro camera or a camera mount. I had to take my camera out a few times to shoot footage or take photos. *If you know you're going to be hungry, order food before taking off that way it's there when you return. Other than that, you can be the nice one and buy food for your group while you're out and about. *In China Town or The Flower Market, if you know what you want without holding up the group, get it. I got a huge bag of goji berries for $9 versus a small 2oz bag in Vegas for $9. I have to say this is about a pound of berries I got. *There was no dress code for the temples we went into, however ask before going to the meeting point incase you may want to bring an article of clothing to wear to the appropriate areas. *Use the bathroom before you leave. I'm sure it'd be hard to find a restroom while on tour. *Everyone seemed to have a standard bike seat while Matthew had a padded seat :)...anyway, if you're planning your trip way ahead, purchase a seat pad before taking on the tour (not provided by the tour). *The tour takes last minute reservations/bookings, so don't bum about how you weren't able to get a tour. More than likely you'll get scheduled into one. *If you're searching for the place prior, don't worry about it, they'll send you a map with your confirmation for walking, taxi, or public transportation. Enjoy!

Like cycling through Bangkok's living room . We really enjoyed the Siam Boran tour. You truly get to places you would never see on the usual tourist trail. We have been to Bangkok several times and would highly recommend this experience to visitors. Well organised too.

Follow Me Jungle Tour & Floating Markets. Great to see a different side of Bangkok. An easy bike ride - though due to some narrow paths through the jungle along the canals one should be in good control of his bike - not recommended for novices. Tour finishes off with a visit to the floating markets (only on weekends) where you can taste some authentic Thai food. A great experience.

A Great way to see Bangkok.. This was an excellent tour from start to finish. Very professional. Mathew, our guide was very experienced, friendly and knowledgeable. Taking us completely off the tourist trail and showing us the real Bangkok. Cycling was easy although would recommend that riders had a little experience of cycling as cycling in heavy traffic for a short while. Cycled about 20k, touching on china town, flower markets and thonburi province to name a few areas. Fresh fruit and a fish spa awaited our return. Great fun and Very good value for money. Would recommend

A buzz cycling through peak hour traffic in Bangkok. We enjoyed the city tour which took us through the flower markets, china town, the slums, boat ride and cycling through peak hour traffic in Bangkok was a real buzz. 5 hours was a good amount of time to see a fair bit and we thoroughly enjoyed our hosts. Good job Mathew ;)My butt was a little sore the next day, but that's only because I haven't ridden a bike for years. Totally worth it!

Fun sightseeing tour. We really enjoyed seeing the different parts of bangkok and found the ride surprisingly easy (not too hot, and no hills in bangkok) our guide spoke excellent english and gave us some interesting stories.

Great way to see parts of Bangkok you may not usually get too.. I've been to Bangkok 10 times and done many tours and this one is definitely a fun way to see the city. Our guide Matthew was excellent. Rode through lots of side streets and back alleys, only a small amount of time on main road but felt safe doing this. Was tired at the end of the ride though because of the heat. Would of maybe liked the option of lunch and a cold beverage at the end as many of us commented on how hungry we were when we got back. I think this could of been ordered at the beginning but not sure as it was not mentioned. Cold bottled water was offered throughout the trip and at the end. I would recommend this tour tour to my friends.

Historical tour. The tour was loads of fun! The guide was friendly and enthusiastic, and the route itself is not too challenging. I would however caution first time cyclists against taking this on as there are a couple of sharp turns and narrow passage ways.

Fun and informative. the ride was fun, informative, worth the time and money, and the company were great.i love the route taken because it was an easy ride which you can see how ordinary Thai's people live their life, old temples, huge flower markets and get a chance to try some local fruits.Thai's people are polite and beautiful.thanks to our guide (mr. mathew)Note:the booking and instruction how to get there were easy.pay the fees onsite in Thai bath.use sun screen to avoid sun burn

Fun and Exciting. The guides and the experience was great! The guides were knowledgeable and took care of the group very well. I loved the ride through the streets and small lanes, although I did get a little irritated at the huge crowd in Chinatown which meant we couldn't actually cycle through.

Unique way to see Bangkok. So happy we took this tour we really enjoyed it. I was a bit concerned that my cycling fitness (i have none) would hold up the group & that i may not make it thru the entire tour. Well i really had no dramas the bikes were awesome, easy to ride & i surprised myself that im capable of much more than i imagine. Ive travelled to Bangkok over 25 times & this was the perfect way to see another side of bangkok. Our guide was fabulous he was extremely affable & easy to relate to. I loved how he took pictures throughout our tour & displayed them to us later then emailed them to us. This is such a great idea. I felt like we had been privy to peoples very own backyards & personal spaces. All the locations we stopped at were highlights for me.I loved the club house with the cockatoo & feet eating fish. They even ordered lunch for us upon our return. I cant wait to go back next year & do the jungle tour.Just go do it!

So much to see and have fun doing it!. Our trip with Follow Me Bike Tours was awesome! The tour company has thought of everything you could want/need during a bike tour and you experience some real Thai culture along the way. I highly recommend this company to anyone traveling to Bangkok! Matthew was an amazing guide and very knowledgeable. I highly recommend the Siam tour and enjoying the fish spa and a cold beer after the trek.

See more of Bangkok. What an awesome experience - we've started to do bicycle tours in cities after some great experiences in Paris and this one was excellent. First the company is laid back, friendly and very helpful - everyone from the "base camp" staff to the guide were wonderful. But the tour itself was also a great experience.We did the Siam Sawan tour, which took us out into the back streets of Bangkok and the outer areas, followed by a quick boat ride across the river out into some amazing raised bikeways through the jungle and then finally into a large public park. I had lived in Bangkok many years ago and never saw anything like this.

Different way to discover Bangkok. I've really enjoyed, also if a little bit dangerous at beginning, biking through the streets of this city. In this way you can discover a more authentic side of the city and how really lives the people. thank you
Wunderful. Very good guides and intresting places we visit. Nice that the guide take pictures and send them to you by email. Everything was very proffesional , many thanks

Only way to see Bangkok. One of the best attractions we have done in another country.The only way to see "the real Bangkok". The guides are awesome very informative, not only do you get an excellent bike ride but you learn something on the way. I learnt why the Thai people are so peaceful, because they allow each other to have their own beliefs. I learnt this from the guide taking us to different religious areas along the tour.We felt very safe even along very busy roads, we were supplied with water bottles and even some light snacks as we went.I would highly recommend this tour if you want to see what Bangkok has to offer.Their office/starting point can be a little tricky to find so allow a bit of time for your taxi or tuk tuk driver to work it out.

Great Bangkok Bike Tour. We decided to see a bit of Bangkok via bicycles on Saturday and found Follow Me Bike Tours close to where we were. They were great: good bikes, good service and very informative guides. Tour was a manageable size (11) and good balance of stopping at sights and cycling. Highly recommended!! We'll come back for the Jungle Tour at a later date.

Best day ever . This bike tour is class. You get to see and experience Bangkok in a whole new vision . The guide was lovely and took photos of us all throughout the day. I'd highly recommend this if you have time. Plus a fish pedicure at the end while he showed us a slide show if the pictures he was about to email us. Well done to all involved

Best bike tour in bkk. I booked a tour at follow me for my family visiting thailand, total 10 people including young kids, they came back and reported to me how the guides / managers were very professionals, the trip outstanding, and recommended the tour to anybody visiting bangkok.

See the Bangkok that most tourists miss. I took the city tour: what a memorable trip. 6 of us from places all over the world met to be led through the most amazing back streets, tiny alleys and so is by our guides Mathew and Robin. Those guys were just the most helpful and knowledgable guides ever: they really made the day for us thanks guys. Our group was of varying cycling abilities: no issues at all. We received a very good commentary and saw many of. The major sights including Wat Arun, Chinatown, the flower markets (breathtakingly beautiful), the Chao Phraya river and the old Muslim quarter. Thanks guys for a very different and interesting day at a very reason able price
Adventure. We did a city tour; back alleys, the china town, muslim community, temples, crossing the river.In total 23km and we enjoyed every one meter.Great fun.

Great way to experience Bangkok. We are a family living in Bangkok since July 2013. Everytime we have visitors from Norway we take them on a tour with Follow me, and everyone is more than happy with their tours. The guides are professional, helpful and friendly. We get to see areas of Bangkok you never will experience on foot or by car.We will stay another year in Bangkok, and Follow me will see more of us in the year to come.

A real adventure. We took the Jungle tour, seeing Bangkok briefly and then getting a boat across the river to Samutprakan. We had an incredible time, seeing a good cross-section of close-together attractions, and the guide was very helpful and knowledgeable - he gave us food, made sure we never ran out of water, fixed my bike when it broke, knew the route, kept us safe on the roads, and knew everything we could have wanted to know about the sights we visited.Not recommended for nervous cyclists, as the roads in Bangkok really are terrifying, but the guide was very understanding and there were only a couple of brief stretches on very main roads. Helmets aren't compulsory but they do supply them if you ask, and I would definitely recommend doing that.The guide took photos for us during the trip, which was also helpful as it allowed us to concentrate on the experience (and cycling safely!) without getting distracted by trying to document it.At the end, there was the option of a fish foot spa, which was ticklish and strange, but which I'd recommend just to say you've done it. They also do food, but I think you have to let them know you want lunch /before/ your tour starts. At the end of ours, though, we asked where we could get food and were directed to a very good, very cheap, outdoors but under-cover local food court, which I would definitely recommend asking after as I got a really great Pad Thai there.

Recommended!. It is a great way to explore and get to know the city. Book it early during your stay so you can visit some of the places spoken about in the tour (in our case the skybar). We had a good guide and the route was entertaining.

See Parts of Bangkok you won't be able to find yourself. This is a first rate tour operator. Everything on their website is accurate and the staff is extremely friendly and very organized. I took the Siam Boran half day tour and it was an incredible way to see the city. We rode through local neighborhoods that would have been impossible for me to visit on my own. The guide spoke very good English and gave us lots of local commentary as we stopped at various sights along the way.Best of all they even take pictures along the way and email you a free copy of ALL the pix!Overall, highly recommended... I can't wait to come back and do one of their other tours!!

Such fun!. This was a great way to see parts of Bangkok most tourists rarely see. We went on the Bangkok jungle tour. The bike tour started with cycling through heavy down town traffic. We felt in no danger and our guide with his whistle controlled the traffic. The ride involved crossing the Chao Phraya River by boat to the jungle area called the 'Bangkok Lung' and following narrow walkways.Such fun - book now!
The best Way to visit Bangkok. Easy and funny, you just have to ride a bike. A Way to visit areas of Bangkok you wouldn't otherwise.

Family bike trip. We book a private section as we have a 9 yrs old boy and he just learnt how to ride. It was a great cycling experience riding at the backstreets of Bangkok, and seeing a very difference view of Thailand! I definitely will join it again when I visit Bangkok next year!

Amazing fun. This is a great opportunity to see Bangkok in a unique way. We went on the tour which goes through markets, Chinatown and Temples. We had done a different tour before and my teenage sons were keen to do another. This tour takes you through backstreets, markets, along the river and was the best 5 hours we spent in Bangkok. It is very easy going, so good for all fitness levels! Our guides were great, and you can order food at a good price at the club house. We also used the free fish spa!
Nice trip!!!. Good guide and very helpful. Nice trip, very funny, especially riding narrow roads in the centre of Bangkok.

In Wit We Trust. My girlfriend and I booked the Siam Boran morning tour. Since there was no other joiner, we had a private tour experience with no extra cost. Yay! Thank you Follow Me!Our guide, Wit, was awesome. He speaks good English, has a lot of stories to tell and tips to share, takes great photos, and possibly the best navigator out there. From narrow streets to scary highways, from outskirts to crowded Chinatown, Wit made it safe and enjoyable for us. I definitely recommend this tour, and will probably do it again with friends the next time I go back to Bangkok.

Great memories created on this tour. The Follow me office is really quite easy to find with the map and guide that they provide. There is a really nice restaurant en route full of locals and office workers offering amazing value and great food.Nice well maintained bikes and our guide Jack was great. I really recommend this tour (Siam Borat), yes it requires some effort but it is worth it cos you will see parts of the city you dont even know exist unless you do a tour like this. It was so interesting to see where and how real Thais live in this city of skyscrapers and temples. I would never have cycled around BKK on my own but because we had a guide and kept mainly to the small Soi's it was very safe and a fun but rather exausting adventure in the heat.

Hands on, safe way to see Bangkok!. My friend and I did one of the 5-hr afternoon tours with Wit. We absolutely loved it. We were only In bangkok for a few days so this was a good way to explore the city and see a lot in a small time frame. We were really looked after, stopped frequently for refreshments which were paid for by the company. We were in a group of less than 10 which was great as this gave us time to ask questions if we wanted to. Wit is very knowledgable about many aspects of bangkok, we even stopped and had a wee language lesson as a few of us were curious about the language. Overall great experience and a fun day with many laughs.

“Great adventure”. That was a amazing experience in bangkok , we can see almost places in city , main road , streets , temples , shops , market , ancient building , cutler of the people ,etc . around half a day i don't feel that i am tired , good communication and explanation by the guide. amazing amazing amazing .......... thank u a lot :)

Such an amazing experience. Amazing experience cycling around a city I have never been too. The tour guide was funny and personable and knew her stuff. We must have cycled for about 5 hours in total making our way through little back ally's and over busy roads. Cannot recommend any higher!!!

Great adventure. The staff were amazing and very accommodating. The jungle tour is another way of going around and understanding the city. I recommend this to everyone who wants to have fun and have a little adventure without going outside the city.
Great ride!. Riding through narrow streets and alleys few if any tourists will normally see. A great ride and great fun, but be careful when riding in heavy traffic!

One of the best ways to see the real Bangkok. If you are a pretty confident cyclist, then this is one of the best ways to see the real Bangkok, weaving through the back streets of the city with some unexpected but interesting stops, such as the farmer's market & custom house turned fire station. Our guides Jack & James were super & really made our day enjoyable. Possibly not for the faint hearted, given the various obstacles one might encounter in the lanes, but great fun. Would highly recommend it!

Wonderful experience. We were in a group of 5 with 2 guides. They are very nice and friendly that share lots of stories and experience throughout the day. Being so professional and considerate, I feel quite assured when riding in the city centre of Bangkok. The tour helps us explore the other side of the city where you can ride past narrow streets, across small villages and go around the countryside! Surely good value for money. Only 1200b for all the entrance fees, equipments and refreshment. The nicest thing of the tour is having chance to meet tourists from different places! Simply amazing!

A Different Viewpoint of Bangkok. This cycling tour was a wholly enjoyable experience. It covers the least visited areas of Bangkok by tourist. My children enjoyed themselves so much that this became the highlight of this trip.Wit and James (the two guides assigned) made sure that we are safe throughout, even while we cycle on the horrendous Bangkok major roads. They also shared interesting stories and kept the children entertained. I highly recommend this cycling tour to all.

Great way to see a lot for little effort.. I was worried about taking to a bike in such high temperatures but needn't have worried. The bikes are very comfy with big tyres and big comfy saddles, and the pace was gentle. Furthermore, as you pass down many narrow alleys and squeeze between buildings you are well shaded, and your pace creates some breeze. It might have been nice to stop at a couple more places of interest - we saw 5 over the 4 or so hours, with most of the rest of the time trundling inbetween, but to be fair to the company the offer is on the table to include more stops if somewhere particularly interests you. It certainly was interesting travelling down alleys and backstreets, to see things you'd never find on your own, and the guide was very nice and knew his stuff. I was amazed at how we zigged and zagged from one tiny street to the next sometimes through unlikely-seeming portals - I have to say I don't know the ins and outs of my home city as well as he knows his!Overall, a very enjoyable way to spend a morning.

Welcome to Bangkok. We had a small group of 2 couples and our 2 guides, we have a great tour of the historic side of Bangkok. Our guides were awesome and we had many laughs along the way, I would highly recommend this company and this tour to anyone....actually, I did already to a friend who was in Phuket :-)

Great day!. We did the Siam Aharn tour on one of those typical hot humid days in Bangkok. Biking however, turned out to be much nicer than walking with the breeze. We had a small group of 6 people, which is a nice size to have. After watching a short introduction/instruction video before starting, we were off and started our trip. We rode through lots of neat narrow streets that are impossible to reach by car/tuktuk. It was a great experience driving through all these places you can only reach on a bicycle. We stopped for some delicious mango and sticky rice, went on to visit an enormous inside flower market, some temples, Chinatown, and we crossed the river a couple of times by ferry. Our tour guide was a great guy; friendly, knowledgeable and also interested in the people in the group. Back at the clubhouse we stayed for a chat and went home after a great but tiring day.I truly believe that this is one of the best ways to get to know Bangkok, and would recommend this trip anyone. If possible, plan it at the start of your stay in the city, to get a good sense of direction and lots of impressions and inspiration for the days to come.

amazing tour. We enjoyed the tour overall. The route was great, from narrow streets, to creekside to riverside. It was really fun and exciting. Our guide was very nice. He always reminded us to stay close 'coz it might be dangerous if we're too distant from him. He also asked us where else we wanted to go. I liked that they ask their customers instead of just simply following the itinerary. The only problem with our guide was that he was too shy (I'm not saying all their guides are). He wouldn't take picture unless we asked him to. I think he only took two pictures without us asking him. Anyways, overall it was a great experience. I would definitely recommend it to my friends and I would want to go back and try the other tour, Siam Sawan next time.

Wonderful Ride!. Riding Bikes with Follow Me was an amazing experience. My guide Wit was fantastic company as he directed my tour group through busy streets and tight neighborhoods. I saw parts of Bangkok that I'd never have been able to see otherwise. Our trip to the island was amazing also, we biked through a jungle and saw many beautiful plants and cool animals. The Follow Me guys really know their stuff and I would love to ride with them again!

Long but fun!. We loved our tour and our guide was fantastic. He took us down small alleyways and through interesting neighborhoods that we would never have visited alone. He was helpful and explained all the places we visited. He saved the best for last - Wat Arun. After a long day of bicycling, we finished with our foot soak with the fish that eat the dead skin. My only suggestion is we were under the impression from the website that the tour would be about 3-4 hours and it was more like 6 hours. There were lots of rest stops but that was longer than our butts could handle. They need to clarify that on the website. Otherwise, highly recommended.

Quite an adventure :). My boyfriend and I joined the Siam Aharn afternoon tour, and we were both really happy with it. We got to see the city in a way we would never have been able to on our own, biking through narrow alleys and heavy traffic. It felt like we were truly out on a great adventure.We really liked our guide as well, he was good at making our whole group feel welcome and safe, and he knew a lot about the different places we went to visit. What I also really liked was that our guide took pictures of us during the tour - then we could get them free of charge from follow me's Facebook page. I would definitely recommend this trip!

Definitely worth doing, see the sights and the real Bangkok en route. We had some difficulty getting there as the taxi driver couldn't find it, as such we were at least 30mins late. They kept in contact throughout and waited for us. On arrival we were given water, safety instructions and set up for bikes. The trip was very interesting and the guide was very knowledgable. The route we took went through the back streets and past actual Thai houses. We saw the flower market, china town and temple, the old palace temple wat Arun, the first bank and church. The tour took around 4.5 hours. On return we got fresh fruit and tried out the fish spa. Would definitely recommend.

Half day Bangkok. A great 4-5 hours spent cycling around Bangkok. We had an informative and friendly guide who was very willing to spend extra time explaining the history of the monuments we visited. We felt very well looked after. Lots of drink and snack stops!

See parts of Bangkok you would never otherwise see. This was such great fun. We booked the 'Siam Sawan' tour the day before we took it and they still ran the tour even though it was only my girlfriend and I that booked to go on it. So we effectively had a private tour! Whilst it's quite easy to see the main sights of Bangkok independently, I don't think I would have seen any of the places we visited on this tour without Follow Me Bike Tours. We went through tiny, narrow residential streets and on to Bangkok's 'green lung' island (Prapadeang) by boat. Riding on the raised concrete roads through this virtual jungle in the heart of one of southeast Asia's biggest cities was an incredible experience. The guide truly made this tour though, he spoke fantastic English and was informative and yet amusing too, he felt more like a friend than a guide, even asking us to teach him some English slang words and teaching us some Thai too. The guide buys you all the drinks you want during the tour (which on a day like ours was a lot) and even some local snacks too that were interesting to try, he also bought fish food to feed the seemingly thousands of fish in the lake on the island which is a phenomenal spectacle. The guide is also forever taking pictures throughout the ride which Follow Me Tours then send you via email for free. We had a great time and would highly recommend this company to everyone visiting Bangkok, great fun and very professional.

Bangkok Bike Tour. We had a wonderful day cycling through the back streets of Bangkok and visiting the green island - the Lung of Bangkok - after taking the ferry across. There was just my wife and me, plus our funny, helpful guide. We cycled around for about 5 hours on a Saturday morning and hardly saw any traffic. Follow Me have some great secret gems for routes and they are warm and welcoming. Back at the club house I had my feet cleaned by the face. Superb!

Great way to see more of Bangkok. We just took the half day bike tour with friends visiting us and loved it! It was a unique way to see neighborhoods and markets and we even stopped at Wat Arun. We got a lot of sight seeing in with our friends and exercise along the way! It was safe and the guides were informative and enjoyable. We would def. do another tour with this company.

See Bangkok at a different pace- must do!. I did the Boran half day tour. The tour was a Sunday morning, which is ideal in terms of there being little foot and car traffic, and for the weather, which is cooler early in the day at this time of year. This tour is a fantastic break from walking around temples and markets. My shoes, that normally are comfortable back home, turned nasty on me and left me with big blisters. Spending half a day cycling and then a fish spa (included in tour) was a welcome change.I found the cycling fairly easy though I don't cycle regularly at home (except spin classes, which don't count). The riding isn't overly fast so you don't really exert yourself. The route went along the river so there were plenty of cool breezes and amongst the buildings plenty of shade.A good sense of balance helps as the route can be over lumpy ground and on a few busy roads. Mostly it is back streets, which can be narrow, low and shared with motorbikes and pedestrians. Your guide will warn you of oncoming traffic or overhead hazards, so by the end of the tour you'll be surprised how much extra bike confidence you develop. The guide took pictures for us along the way, including when we passed other famous attractions such as Wat Arun and Khao San Rd. The route took us past some soldiers guarding the central post office building and our guide suggested we get pictures with them! At no point did I feel unsafe, the pictures later showed the soldier I posed with even had a slight cheeky smile!!Ray (the owner) is great and the bikes comfortable. The bikes have big comfortable seats and small phone and camera pouches.Tip: DO NOT WEAR A WHITE TOP. You will definitely ride through puddles of muddy water at some point...which sprays up onto your back from the back wheel.

Great experience!. Bikes are in good conditions and helmets are provided. My first bike tour ever! I feel that it is a bit dangerous to cycle and cross the bustling city streets! Recommend for only those who are really good at cycling.

A special tour for us!. This is Lung.The bike tour that we choose is "Siam Boran", the boss of follow me is nice and don't worry, their bikes are in good condition.Our tourist guide is very nice and initiative, he tell us a lot of things included Thailand history,also he takes lot of photo for us in this bike tour.The tour is about 5 hours and we are so enjoy! Thank you for bring us a good memories and special tour!

Greatest way to see the real Bangkok!. I did the tour through the Old City and China Town. It was absolutely wonderful! More than I could have asked for! Our tour guide was very knowledgable, spoke perfect English, and was a great guide! We wound our way through small passage ways, stopped at wonderful historical sites and markets! I'm so glad I did this! Everyone at this company is great! I asked for somethings to do via chat the day before, and was recommended the Jim Thompson House, which was also fantastic! And they helped me find a cooking school to attend!! This is not a super intense ride, very relaxed pace, even though some of the area's are quite hectic, but you would never see these area's without this tour! You get to see how Chinese-Thai's live, where they work, the old city, wat's (temples), schools, a ferry ride, flower market, and much much more!! I'm so glad I did this!!! Thank you!!

Great way to see Bangkok. In late March I visited Bangkok and only had one full day to see the city before traveling off to Chiang Mai. I chose a 1/2 day city bike tour with Follow Me Bike Tours. The experience was great in every sense: cultural, sensory, active!All of the other guests cancelled the day before and thus I essentially had a private 4-hour tour. My guide was fantastic. She took over 70 photos of my experience, took me around Wat Arun (which was not a part of the itinerary, but at my request), all on top of the actual tour!The tour itself consisted of biking in the alleys/hidden streets in Bangkok, visiting the Chinese Market, Flower Market and crossing the river twice via boat. It was an amazing experience and I highly recommend the tour.Only note here would be, make sure you are a good biker and not afraid of the Bangkok traffic. The tour does it's best to keep you in quieter areas, but it is Bangkok after all and traffic and chaos is not entirely avoidable.

A must for the first day in Bangkok!. My husband and I opted for the Siam Boran historical city tour only because we were only in Bangkok for 2 days. The tour gives you a feel for the real everyday Bangkok allowing you to get under the skin of the city. The 4 hour bike ride is not arduous if you are reasonably fit (due to the hot humid weather) and you should be familiar with riding bikes as the guides set a reasonable pace. Lots of highlights and extras included on this tour. Wonderful friendly and engaging staff!We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves....put it on your list of must dos!

Super fun, great way to experience Bangkok. We only had three days in Bangkok and wanted to see as much as possible and this tour was a great way to see the city. I highly recommend it. Our tour stopped at two temples, as well as rode through China town, the flower and vegetable market. Plus you take a river ferry. You do not need to be in fantastic shape, as the terrain is mostly flat. However, I would recommend being comfortable on a bike, as the alleys are quite narrow and traffic a bit daunting. We did the Siam Boran tour. The tour guide, Wynn, was fantastic. Super friendly and knows those alleys inside out. It was impressive because it felt like a maze! Included in the tour are the drinks and snacks at the stops. We stopped twice. The club house (where the tour starts) can be a bit tricky to find but the detailed map provided by the company is great (and a must to find the place). We booked online with ease and the club house is really nice and clean. Be sure to say hi to the mascot, Cracker the parrot. He is really sweet and friendly. The bikes were in good condition and the guide has all sorts of tools to fix anything that would need it during the tour. Our group had 9 people and was a good size. Our tour guide took pictures the whole time and within a day of the trip we received an email with a link to all of them. There is no additional cost for the pictures, a really nice touch. We were able to leave our bags in the clubhouse, in a locked room, with David (the owner, super nice guy!). I am glad I did because it would have been really hot to have my backpack on for four hours in the sun! The bikes did have a little zipper pouch with enough room for sunscreen and a camera. I would highly recommend this tour, it is a wonderful and fun way to see the city.

Saim Boran. Wonderful trip - far exceeded my expectations.My 15 & 12 year old kids loved it - WARNING - you do need to be confident on a bike as the alleys are narrow and the people & traffic are busy busy - but that's what makes it so great - it is the real Bangkok. 90% of the trip is away from the main roads and the guides assist at all times when crossing traffic - I had no issues at all with safety. Plenty of stops for water, snacks and toilets and out guide Peter and his helper (Mai?) were excellent - full of information, friendly and always offering to take pictures. Wear plenty of suncreen and comfortable clothes as it is a hot & sweaty day. Yes we were tired out when we finished (5.5 hours) but would not hesitate in recommending it - one of the best tourist trips I have ever done in 25 years of travelling.

Funny way to know a city. When I was told to ride a bike in Bangkok I tought it would have been dangerous ( because of traffic ) and boring ( what can offer this city ) but after riding I was so happy , you can see everything by bicycle every single corner where car are not allowed to go. There are many tours and the guides are amazing.

This is a MUST DO activity in Bangkok.. We only had a few days to tour Bangkok and decided that we wanted to get a good overview of the city. We were so happy that we chose this tour. We took our three children, ages 16, 12 & 9, and all three said it was one of their all time favorite activities. Our guide was wonderful and the club house is a very nice, clean, relaxing place to visit, eat and make new friends. This tour is highly recommended!

Great way to see Bangkok. We've done 2 tours with 'Follow Me' in 2 years. Both times were a fun experience and we saw different aspects of what Bangkok has to offer. Plenty of fluids offered to keep us hydrated, and snacks along the way. Happy with our guides, good info about our different locations. Having some cycling experience is a must IMO. We found it really fun, ducking and weaving through little alleyways, riding on some busy Bangkok streets and along paths through forest area, some around a metre and abit wide. Others with little or no bicycle experience may struggle.Before this we've only been on a bike a handful of times in a decade but really enjoyed the experiences

Take the time to do this great cycling tour if you want to see another side to Bangkok. We just finished our Siam Sawan tour. We're completely exhausted but it was a fantastic way to see the hidden corners of Bangkok. We live in Bangkok but find we are often confined to the usual expat or tourist areas so this was a great way to see another side of the city we now live in.With hair-raising drives through busy traffic, windy narrow alley ways and then a boat trip to the Green lungs of Bangkok - an island with coconut and banana plantations plus natural waterways and the like - it was a day of pure adventure. On one hand you will see how local people are living - a lot of poverty and struggles but an important eye-opener nevertheless and then you see vast swaths of greenery like you would never expect to see in Bangkok. We stopped at local shops to refresh ourselves and support local business - we appreciated that. The boat ride across the river - well you do get splashed with some of that polluted water but it is all part of the adventure!Our guide Peter, did a fab job of explaining the sites and sounds of Bangkok - all with a great sense of humour. He also took some fabulous photos along the way so we would have something to remember this great day.If you have half a day spare during your visit to Bangkok, we strongly recommend this tour. It's well worth it.

Loved this ride.... I did the Siam Sawan back in 2012! I also did a similar ride with Grasshopper in 2013. Without doubt the ride with Follow Me was a far superior experience. Go for it, you'll see a part of Bangkok that is quiet, green and lush.

Great experience through the heart of Bangkok. If a leafy bike tour through green parks and along flowering canals is what you are looking for, this is not the tour for you.If you are looking for an unparalleled experience in Bangkok that takes you through the heart of the city, let's you see a side you may not otherwise see and comes with an informed guide, then I highly suggest this tour.I participated in the 4-hour afternoon your on March 26. As it turns out, the other participants cancelled and I ended up with a private tour! I enjoyed most riding in the small, narrow and hidden alleys, lined with people's tin roof homes, the local men pushing carts of fresh fruit from home to home and all the hidden businesses in between. This made up a majority of the tour and required great skill in maneuvering around pedestrians, mopeds and the such.I saw most of the old part of the city, including the Flower Market, Chinatown, the Monks Quarter and Wat Arun. Additionally we crossed the Mekong River twice! To top it off, that evening I received a slide show of the photos the guide took of me that day!

Great thing to do in BKK. We enjoyed very much the Siam Boran (18.02.14) tour with guide Peter and the charming girl (sorry, forgot her name). This was a great experience and a different way to discover parts of the city you would never go on your own. Both guides are very knowledgeable about the history of Thailand and the sites you visit (although we didn't visit what is described on the internet...). At all times we felt very safe and when we had to cross busy roads Peter stopped the traffic with his whistle so that we could cross safely. We definitely will recommend 'Follow Me Bike Tours' to our friends and we will come back as well on our next visit to BKK.Keep on going guys!Sophie & Peter

Just perfect but.... Too nice staff, forcing us to visit them again and again!We have been there with old and young friends ans relative and everybody said that it was an amazing experience. I did it 4 or 5 times and I am ready to do it as soon as friends will visit me again in BKK.

Second time around...still fantastic. First time around to the "green lunges of Bangkok" I went in a big private group, and I felt very safe, despite going through massive traffic and through places I would never have entered without a guide. The guides were so much fun, and very educated and could tell alot of interesting information about the places we went by. A great way to get to know Bangkok. Second time around, I went with my family, and having done the trip once, made it even more interesting. New guides, but still alot of fun and good exercise. I liked the fact that is was only the 4 of us, and 2 guides...I guess that was a rare luxury. I cant wait to do the next tour through Chinatown ;-)

Well done tour. A different perspective of the city and a great way to see local life. In retrospect, it was a good thing that my companion booked this outing and that I did not know any details about the tour and the route. I am a chicken and I feel clumsy on a bicycle and mostly only ride where I have a lot of room to maneuver. This tour takes you through narrow and crowded sidewalks and alleys, through busy markets, across busy roads where motor vehicles travel at near highway speeds and there are no traffic lights and pedestrian crosswalks, and on ferries across the river. I bumped into a few crates and poles, but through it all, our guide, Lora was professional and managed to keep us alive and safe. We also had great tour mates who looked out for each other and by all indications, everyone had a good time. The bikes were in good shape, the pace was just right, with adequate bathroom and water breaks. At the end of the tour, I felt I deserved a beer for making it through and I enjoyed it while getting a fish pedicure back at the clubhouse – weird sensation, but cool experience. While some portions of the ride were stressful for me, there were parts that were enjoyable and relaxing, such as shady streets and the bike path along the Chao Phraya River. I have a few more gray hairs, but loved this experience and thought it was well worth it.

A different and fun way to see Bangkok!. The guides were funny and knowledgeable, but could have explained more along the way. Went to some temples, but the tour is not a tour for the big tourist attractions, but a good way to see the city and some of the narrow streets and markets it's hard to find (or know that you want to find!) on your own!

Don't do it if you're faint of heart. So most of it is just riding a bike through the city with all its traffic, dogs, alleys, etc. I rather enjoyed it because it was exercise and had a thrill of danger, especially when somehow we got behind schedule and was biking home after dark. You get to see the city more up close than any cab ride can get you.The guy is very friendly but this kind of contributed to the lateness of the group I feel like. The "tour" consists of one temple, a flower market, pier, and like 2-3 drink stops. At one point you ride a ferry over the river and back. Kind of sucks having to carry the bike on and off but if you're not fit enough to do that you shouldn't be biking. I enjoyed the tour as it was just an easygoing ride around town. We could have lingered less at stops which would have helped with not going over time so much - you can tell he was a bit nervous at that part. One of my friends actually fell at one point and he had to get his first aid kit out.Oh, they also have the fish that eats the dead skin off your feet - no charge bonus.

The best thing I have done in Bangkok. A unique and wonderful experience - Chinatown, the flower market, the back streets of Bangkok all on a bike ! I am not a natural bike rider and never dreamt that I would love it so much or survive the day. However Peter the guide is considerate, careful and a hoot ! He taught us to fold lotus flowers to offer to the Buddha and introduced us to a side of Bangkok you could possibly never see on any other mode of transport.

Definitely Experience Cycling in Bangkok With Follow Me Bike Tours. Cycling through the Lungs of BangkokMy husband and I have visited Bangkok on several occasions, but we expanded our experiences this time by taking part in an amazing half day cycling tour throughout the city of Bangkok with Follow Me Bike Tours. We knew as soon as we arrived at the tour office and began viewing their introductory video that we were in for a good time. The purpose of the very well produced video was to relay safety guidelines, but it was obvious that the company staff who also starred in the video had a great deal of fun making it, and thus the tone for a good time was set.We expected to be joining a small group of eight or ten others, but we were in fact a group of two, so we had our own personal guide, who took us through a number of locations, including the "lungs of Bangkok", a massive green jungle that the revered King incorporated in the city's planning decades ago. We spent two hours biking in a jungle scape that left us bewildered that we were actually in the centre of a city of twelve million.Our guide also took us through a number of city markets, a former Prime Minister's residence, and the narrow winding pathways through one of the poorest neighbourhoods in Bangkok, where the cleanliness of the district was surpassed only by the friendliness of the residents there. And of course, we couldn't do all of this without navigating our way through a few city blocks of chaotic Bangkok traffic and some wicked intersections - something I still have a little trouble believing we actually did and survived!The bikes were new and all equipment was in excellent shape, our tour included stops along the way where all beverages and food was included, and at the end we were treated to a free fish spa to unwind. The "Green Tour / Lungs of Bangkok" was only one of three tour themes to select from, the others being a historical tour of the city, and a gastronomical tour. Perhaps on our next visit we will select another theme and do it all over again. We often take part in cycling tours in our travels, and have done so in Jamaica, Vietnam, and Bali to name a few, but this is the first time we biked in the middle of an enormous city. Follow Me Bike Tours is a world class biking company that gave us the opportunity to explore this city and see things we had never seen before, yet had us feeling safe, thoroughly engaged, and in good hands the entire time. Do yourself a favour and add this activity to your "must do" list when you are next in Bangkok.

World class must do activity. I am a bicycle tour fan - you get to see more of a city away from the sights while moving between them. I was slightly apprehensive about a cycle tour of Bangkok because of how busy the streets are, but the ride avoided for 95% of the time anywhere approaching a near busy road. We cycled back streets, alleys, temples, ferries and houses. We were a group of 6, all competent and able cyclists and got to see a lot. A few specific points outlined:1) Route was excellent, you get enthralled by the authenticity of the city and flavour. I lost count of the number of kids who high fived us as we went around2) Guide - was amazing, knowledgeable and sincere. She genuinely inquired after each person, and ensured they were shown around and explained what was happening. We would go off piste on questionning sometimes and get full and honest answers3) Organisation - this is a proud and professional company. No short cuts anywhere and a personalised service.4) Bikes - the bikes are robust city bikes perfect for the route. You will not win the tour de france on one, but you can bump up and down the curbs without any issue. I will be back for another ride next time I am in Bangkok.

Great way to see the inside streets . I enjoyed the 4 hour bike tour a lot. It was the Boran tour which visited the back streets which you won't normally go visiting. The most difficult part of riding a bike in Bangkok is of course getting over the fear of passing intensive road traffic, go through narrow streets with lots of pedestrians, and not hitting things placed on or hanging over the street like BBQ stoves, canopy supports, pots of boiling oil. Of course you will face this kind of danger even walking on the streets in Bangkok. So, it is no big deal. However, the trip is certainly not for people who just learned cycling or not confident riding on the street. I would not recommend any kids who are under the age of 12 joining the backstreet tour. However, I need to repeat that it was great fun. I will definitely do another bike tour when I visit Bangkok again. BTW, the physical demand was not great.

to see parts of bangkok not on the map. We had a good 4 hour tour of Bangkok on bikes. The bikes were of good quality and the guide was lovely. We saw parts of the city that isn't on the tourust map such as the old town hall and china town. You will need to be confident on the bike because the route is on busy bangkok roads, river paths, pavements and through very busy areas. We really enjoyed it and felt safe for most of the time (there are some very busy roads to cross and cycling on the main roads can be a bit scary) I'd recommend this tour and would use the company again when we are next in Bangkok

Make this your first activity in Bangkok. I did a combination of the food tour (Siam Aharn) and bike tour (Siam Boran) on my first day in Bangkok, and it was an excellent introduction to the city, its food, and its culture. I would have been cluelessly lost as to what was going on in the markets and temples if I didn’t do the tour. Both of my guides were friendly, funny, and knowledgeable. The food tour takes you to several local restaurants the oldest district in town; hidden gems off the beaten track, with a variety of food (Chinese, eastern Thai, Thai-style halal/muslim, and royal-court style cuisine) that’s very filling and diverse. My favorite dish was “yam pla duk fu”, a unique deep-fried concoction of shredded fish and bread crumbs and peanuts. The bike tour is a fast-paced adventure through the alleys and streets of the old neighborhoods, and you get to see how the local people live. The tour includes a visit to Wat Arun and another local temple with one of the largest Buddha images in the country. And I learned how to make lotus flower offerings, which served me well when I later visited Wat Pho! It be helpful for you to have some prior experience cycling on the streets before doing the bike tour (and the tour website mentions this too). None of the roads we passed were very busy or dangerous, but we did pass through some small alleyways and crowded areas. So you'll want to have some confidence. I think the tour guide will note your level of experience and alter the route accordingly.The fish spa at the tour HQ is cool, too. Make this your first activity in the city; it’s a fine orientation to the variety of Bangkok!

Amazing!. People are incredibly friendly, helpful and very insightful! The day started with a lot of food (very tasty), a little bit of walking and absorbing the culture.Second part was absolutely fantastic! Biking around Bangkok busy streets, small alleys and markets, while visiting wonderful cultural buildings, temples and monuments! It was the best day in Bangkok so far!

Best way to see Bangkok. My husband and I enjoyed many experiences during our three days in Bangkok, but our most fun experience was the Siam Aharn Boran food and bicycle tour. In the morning, we greatly enjoyed our walking food tour with Bangkok Food Tours. Our guide "Mod" was very friendly, knowledgeable, and funny; and we enjoyed all of the delicious food that we got to try during our tour. For as much fun as we had using the food tour, we had even more fun during the bicycle tour in the afternoon. We got to experience a side of Bangkok that we otherwise would not have been able to experience through a regular tour. We would highly recommend the Siam Aharn Boran tour to anyone looking for an extremely fun and unique way to experience Bangkok.

Not for the faint of heart but oh what fun!. If you are looking for a fun, and at times thrilling, way to experience the sights, sounds and smells of downtown Bangkok, Follow Me Tours is for you. We cycled back alleys, narrow lanes. crowded sidewalks and short stretches of busy streets to visit markets, temples and historic buildings. This tour is not for the faint of heart or "balance challenged" cyclist because we were often weaving amongst pedestrians, delivery men and their carts and vehicles during the tour. However, our guide was careful to gear the pace to our cycling abilities and provided an informative and entertaining explanation of the sights en route. We highly recommend this tour for those looking for a fun and unique way to experience downtown Bangkok. was careful to keep the pace within our

Best way to see the city. We did the half day city tour and it was fantastic. Its an amazing way to see the city and our guide was hilarious and spoke excellent English.The whole ride is on flat roads (no hills) but it takes about 15 minutes or so to build up your confidence as this city is like a maze and you are riding through lots of pathways. The office is a little hard to find so make sure you print off the directions.They provided water and took lots of photos, we also stopped about half way through and they also provided more drinks and some little nibbles.Great experience, would do it again and highly recommend it.
