Loved it!. Went to places that one could never reach on any other type of tour. It was an amazingly intimate tour of the city, and quite a delight. The pace was leisurely, and the tour guides were fantastic.

See the real Bangkok. Have to admit when we booked this we had reservations about cycling around Bangkok but how wrong we were in fact this turned out to be one of the highlights of our trip during December. One thing to point out though although you do not need to have competed in the Tour De France! you do need to have a reasonable level of competency on a bike and have a reasonable level of fitness as you do cover quite a distance in very warm conditions through alley ways, markets and much more. However what you are rewarded with is seeing and smelling the real Bangkok close up, it was a marvellous experience something that we will remain in our memory for a very long time, our guide Tom was excellent and at no time did we feel at risk or in any danger.If you have a little spirit of adventure and want to get away from the usual tourist track then consider this different way of seeing this mad city.Thanks to all at follow me for a great day we will certainly try another of your tours if we come back to Bangkok.

An exciting bike tour!. My husband and I booked the Food & Siam Boran bike tour after we read the positive reviews on trip advisor. We did food tours in other cities and thought it would be great to do this in Bangkok. We were not disappointed. My husband emailed Follow Me and they confirmed our reservation and notified us to pay the morning of our tour. Our food tour guide Apple was nice and talked about all the different types of food we would try before we ate it. The portions were generous and everything was delicious expect the goat liver. After the food tour we did a bike tour, which I am so happy we did so we could work off all the food we ate. I had injured my foot prior and the staff was very helpful. I can honestly say we wouldn’t have gone to the destinations we visited on our own but I am happy we did. Riding through alleys were locals live was exciting and it was nice to see all the kids waving and saying hello as you rode by. We ended up taking the bikes across the river on a ferry, ride by the park and watch the locals play, and see how people live. I am so happy we did this; it was a fun and memorable day.

Fantastic experience!. My fiancée and I did a combined food and cycle tour in this amazing city. The afternoon on the bikes was spent with our guide Peter who was extremely friendly & humorous. The tour included lots of backstreets and narrow lanes which were full of locals with the biggest smiles! Truly a fantastic experience in itself. We then took in lots of markets, river crossing and some amazing temples. The biking was all flat so not too exhausting, but some dicey areas on the busy main roads at times...all part of the fun though! I felt the only thing that could be improved on was that I would have liked to hear more facts & history about the sites we were taking in. Overall though we had a truly memorable day & met some fantastic people. Our guide took pictures all day and then sent us the Facebook link afterwards...a really nice touch. Thanks again Peter! What a day!

Amazing day, amazing crew - a very unique experience of Bangkok!. We had such a great day on the Siam Sawan tour! My friend and I loved this experience and got to see many things/ aspects of Bangkok that would otherwise not have been discovered on our travels.Both 23 yr old females and found it an easy ride in terms of fitness- but the windy jungle path and narrow streets did provide a bit of a fun and unique challenge!Peter, the guide, is hilarious and provided us with plenty of snacks and water as well as entertainment and we stayed for dinner afterwards which was cheap and yum.A must do in Bangkok to get a bit of culture and meet new people :)

Fun but NOT easy!. I've been to Bangkok several times and wanted something different plus I love to bike so this seemed like a perfect tour. I've seen all the major sites so the back alleyways was appealing and there isn't any uphill biking, but it's certainly not an easy ride! Most of the tour is very much off the beaten path and as many reviews explain, through very narrow alleyways with sharp turns, loads of obstacles like sleeping dogs in your path, kids playing, low laundry, people cooking their lunch in the narrow paths behind homes, garbage, huge steps to take bikes up and down, congested lines to get on the ferry, impossible to move on a bike through Chinatown and the flower market. I liked it, but its NOT easy and good balance, sharp turning skills and quick reflexes needed! Our guide was good, but his English was difficult to understand. I thought it was pretty funny that we would cross a major street with him in the lead blowing a whistle, like that was going to stop traffic or keep us safe. But it all worked out surprisingly well and everyone seemed to have a good time. I'm not sure I would do it again except the last hour which was along the river on a pretty promenade. Upon arrival back to the "club house" you can relax, which was nice but then you are left to make your way home and in the winter it's dark by 5:30-6pm, so I wished we had ended a bit earlier. I didn't see a tip box anywhere and I felt that it would have been nice for everyone to give a small tip for the hard working guides at the end which I did but individually. Bikes were well maintained and you have your choice of a mountain bike or regular type. Very good website and excellent pre tour communications. Overall fun, if you are game for a real obstacle course!

Don't Miss It!. My husband and I ,both seniors ,took the Sawan trip and thoroughly enjoyed it.This is the way to see the "real Bangkok " ,the way so many locals live and go about their day.We first saw a video with various safety tips and off we went on good bikes with our excellent guide,Peter .Peter was counting heads regularly,kept a reasonable pace,explained where we were going next,what we would see,gave us a taste of local treats and took lots of pics.which he later forwarded to us.He made it all good fun and very interesting.Get very accurate directions to Follow Me Bangkok....Not the easiest place to find.Would definitely go on another outing with the company.One of the highlights of a month long trip to Southeast Asia!S&J Ottawa,Canada.

A good bike tour.. but. I love to do bike tours on the first day of a holiday, it really gives you a good sense of the city and the people. I've done many bike tours in many cities around the world.Follow Me bike tours have really nice guides who go out of their way to be helpful, a relaxing club house and a fish spa for afterwards (weird sensation - little fish nibbling on your feet!!).I'm just not sure that the city is particularly conducive to a bike tour. We spent hours riding around, but I felt like we only saw 3 or 4 major sights and LOTS of time riding through alleys.It's definitely important to see both sides of the city - the major keynote sights + the way normal people live, it just felt a little imbalanced. It may be just due to the fact that there aren't more major sights within cycling distance.We saw a temple, old customs house, Banyan tree, flower market, giant buddha, crossed the river on ferries. There were quite a few food and toilet stops, we even got to eat bugs from a street side stall.It was a good day and I'm glad we did the tour (we did the food tour in the morning), I just felt that in comparison to other cycling tours in other cities there was more riding and less major sights to see.If you have a free day it's still worth doing, and the company does take good care of you.

A perfect way to explore Bangkok. We took the Siam Boran tour with a private guide and enjoyed it very much. At first we hesitated as cycling in Bangkok sounds like a suicide attempt! Despite this we decided to go and we do not regret it. Our guide took us through small backstreets in quarters that we would never have experienced without this tour. Our guide, Tob, was very knowledgeable and told us many things about history and culture during the day. As described on the homepage you should be a relatively experienced cyclist as sometimes you need to navigate in very narrow streets and amongst big crowds of people, e.g. In Chinatown.Afterward we relaxed in the cosy garden for a while and enjoyed the free fish spa to refresh our feet.Highly recommended and we'll definitely do it again if/when we return!

Amazing way to see Bangkok!. The guides were absolutely fantastic, the bikes were good. We got cheap food afterwards and free hats, water and a fish spa. Reasonably priced for everything you see and do. Can accommodate young families as well. Highly recommended :)

The best way to experience Bangkok!. If you want to see bangkok in a new and exciting way, this is definitely the activity to choose. We have been to Bangkok countless times, but with the bike tours we have been on, we have seen parts of bangkok and seen in a way we have never seen it before. The guides are great; very service minded and just generally nice. In my family the oldest participant on the tour was 75 and the youngest was 12 (but we also did it last year), so it is an activity for all ages. This Is the greatest activity you can experience in Bangkok.

Not your typical day tour at all - 100% recommended. I've visited Bangkok previously and like the big, bustling, friendly city - on this trip we decided to see something different and chose this tour. It's an absolute highlight of our holiday. We saw "behind the scenes" Bangkok around alleys that I would have thought never existed. We were cycling by the river, through markets, around temples, on ferries and bridges, down alleys used by locals to get to their houses. One moment we're in the middle of a market and then in a back alley just wide enough for the bikes where locals were just quietly going about their daily business. This felt like Bangkok the way the people live - not the way that tourists usually view it. How they managed to pack that into a few hours I don't know - but if you get the chance you should absolutely take one of their tours. They were easy to deal with before the trip, we had two guides looking after our group, we were safe and well looked after the whole time. The pace of the trip was set by our guide to suit the people on the tour - both guides clearly enjoyed showing off their city to tourists and it was all done in a natural, respectful way. If we go back to Bangkok we will consider doing one of their other tours - that's the best recommendation I could give!

If you only have 1 day in Bangkok do both tours.. I was in Bangkok for 10 weeks and this tour was one of the best things I did. I came back a week later and did the 'out of city' tour. And as it was out of season it was just me and my girlfriend on the tour which was fantastic. They are really nice bunch of guys. They sort out all the drinks and food for you. And it does not feel commercial at all. Whent in 2012 summer

Fascinating & fun. Took the Siam Boran tour - 4.5 hours of fascinating and fast glimpses into different aspects of life in Bangkok. Well designed tour, perfectly paced, with appropriate number of stops for special sites, well-timed banana and water breaks, and a thrilling ride on comfortable 21-speed city or mountain bikes, through the tiny alleyways of Bangkok's denizens, historic Chinatown, the beautiful Assumption Cathedral (building funded by local Chinese), original custom house (now fire station), largest flower market, Muslim Cemetery, the large and elaborately carved Wat Arun, the intimate Wat Kanlaya Namit (where you can ring the bell), and many other interesting local sites that don't make it into the guide books. I loved our brief encounters with the Thais through the sawadee kha's, the high 5's from children, and Happy New Year's from the adults. Simply a magical experience.Our guides, Ken and Rose, had our safety uppermost in mind. As a result, our tour was limited to 6 participants, with guides at front and back to ensure we stayed together and stayed safe. Lead guide Ken did the narration - his English is functional and could be understood most of the time. A patient and nice fellow. One suggestion - guides might mention when bathroom breaks are planned so that we are drinking enough water without fear of being without a toilet for 2-3 hours.In addition, Ken and Rose were only too willing to take photos with our cameras, constantly offering, and Ken as well took many with the company camera. In fact, Follow Me offers to download their photos taken on the tour onto a USB stick if you bring one. That is a unique and value-added service. As is the fish foot nibble experience offered on return.Tips: our tour was full of quick twists and turns and ups and downs, very narrow lane-ways, uneven and sometimes rutted pavement, so you must be comfortable on a bike to fully enjoy it. In a number of spots, you will need to lift your bike up 2-3 steps and in others, to walk the bike through heavily congested pedestrian areas. No need to being water - this is amply supplied and the bikes have water bottle cages. Wear shorts and decent shoes or teva-type sandals (leave your flip flops at the hotel); hats and helmets (if you want one) are supplied. This tour was the most memorable Bangkok experience we have had so far. Highly recommended.

MUST DO Tour of Bangkok. Today was my first day in Bangkok, and I feel so lucky to have experienced a Follow Me bike tour. Why do I feel lucky? I just spent a week in Krabi and was bombarded by t-shirt shops, restaurants, pharmacies and travel agencies. However today, I finally got to experience authentic Thai culture. I LOVED everything about the tour from the introduction video to biking through crowded streets and back alleys. We passed so many people who met our group of five with a smile and "Hello! " I felt that some people were excited to see a group of non-Thai people exploring their neighborhood and they welcomed us. I never felt like our group and our bikes were a disturbance. Our guide, Tom whose birth name is probably much longer as most Thai names are...What's the long version of Bangkok again, Tom?..was great!! He was the guide I'd be waiting for to share some stories about the history and people of Thailand. He knew those back alleys inside and out and remembered everyone's name. His English was perfect and I had no problem understanding him (some Thais speak with a strong accent). My only suggestion would be knowing the names of the different areas/neighborhoods we biked through. It helps as a reference point if someone were to ask me where I went in Bangkok.The tour itself was well organized. My bike was fine. I loved the pouches that were attached for a camera, wallet, etc. I felt like we had well-timed breaks. We stopped for drinks twice and a delicious snack once. I really enjoyed getting on and off the ferry, just to change things up. Lunch wasn't included but offered for a reasonable price at the clubhouse. Fish spa at the end was weird and fun!!Overall, I would HIGHLY recommend this tour if you are the type of tourist who doesn't like touristy things. You'll get some exercise in, too. Thanks Follow Me for making my last day inThailand my best day in Thailand!

Best way to experience Bangkok. This tour is the best way to experience the "real" Bangkok. It is truly mind blowing - we had a blast on our trip minus the rain. FMBT takes you around the back alley ways so you a real sense of everyday Bangkok and its people. I was so glad that I had found this gem ! Highly recommended.

Fantastic experience. Follow me bike tours was a fantastic way to see Bangkok! It wasn't to hard to find, they gave excellent instructions. On arrival we received free bottled water and a cap to wear during our ride! We did the Siam heaven tour and it was amazing! You see Bangkok in such a unique and interesting way. Raymond and Peter were fantastic in every way! Definitely have follow me bike tours on your Bangkok to do list!

Great fun!. Just completed my tour today, i.e. the combined food & sightseeing tour. Registration/confirmation and information by e-mail was very quick. The first half of the tour was conducted by a separate company, and it was a walking tour with an excellent guide, Nussi (rhymes with "sushi"). Starting from the Surasak Station, this tour took us through 5 restaurants and a number of different dishes, all well explained by the very friendly and knowledgable guide. After completion of this part, I was taken by taxi to the Follow Me clubhouse, where the next group was waiting.The bikes were fine and the three (!) guides that accompanied our group were fantastic. They were funny, friendly, laid-back and yet put great emphasis on getting us safely around through tight alleys and sometimes daunting traffic. We were treated to water, fruit and snacks along the way, and even a small dinner back at the clubhouse for those who wanted it. Kudos to Raymond and his team for giving their guests such a warm and friendly welcome to Bangkok.

Great non-commercial bike tour. We did the morning tour, starting at around 8a.m. till 12.30. The tour costs 1.100 Bt. The good part is that's the total price.- bicycle very comfortable- tour go's to places you wouldn't go/ come without a guide. And you don't have to look at your map every 5min for orientation.- guide speaks good English and knowledgeable about culture.- good Thai food at the end and enough water throughout the tour- feed cleaning fishes at location- guide makes a lot of good photos and you can get them afterwards on usb or later by email. We got it directly after the tour. - several friends tip cycle tour bangkok, and it is a very good tip. - only finding the location with GPS was a bit of a challenge, but well worth finding it

Great tour!. This is a perfect way to see Bangkok in a more unconventional way. Our guide Peter did a great job showing us around and in giving us insights in the Thai culture. Material is perfect, groups are no larger then 8 persons and in 4,5 hours we visited many sites in the city we would usually have not seen. We liked it!

Great way to explore bangkok. This bike tour was so great.Very well organized. Peter was really great. He knows how to make a tour really awesome!!We did the jungle tour and that was really amazing to see so much green in a city like bangkok.We went to places where we would never go and we enjoyed it so much.The bikes where great and well maintained and almost like new.It was a superb experience!!!

Good Tour, Shame About Our Hangovers!. Our second bike tour on our recent holiday to Bangkok was with Follow My Bike and after the success of our first night bike tour (with another operator) we were looking forward to this one. The only problem was that we were late, incredibly hung-over and very dehydrated! Despite this we were lucky to find out we were the only people booked in so we didn't miss it. Our guide 'Peter' was only too happy to wait for us to get sorted and then take us out for what became a private tour. I just wish we were a little more socially competent given we were the sole attention of the guide. What started quite awkwardly soon settled and Peter turned out to be very funny. He knew a lot about the city though and painted us some vibrant mental pictures as we biked around the hidden alleyways of Bangkok. 4 hours is a decent amount of time to be peddling around Bangkok and seeing the sights so we were happy to arrive back and settle down with the Thai curry take away they picked up for us! Bonus!

"Places tuk-tuks cannot go". A fantastic way to see Bangkok, with lots of waves and smiles from the locals. Peter, an excellent guide and funny too. Thankfully we did not need our rain covers! Superb experience, shall look forward to completing another tour, when i am next in Bangkok.

Great way to experience Bangkok. My friend and I went on the Siam Sawan tour last week, despite the humid weather and threat of rain we found it fantastic. Follow Me bike tours is a very well run little operation. The clubhouse isa haven in the middle of the city complete with resident parrot and fish tank for foot massage! We felt relaxed and confident. The bicycles are well maintained and they offered different types to accommodate our needs.Off we went, through the back streets of Bangkok, on motorways, to the old President's historic house, along a railway then across the Chao Phraya River on a water taxi. We arrived at Phra Pradeang where we cycled through magroves on elevated paths, saw houses on stilts and fed huge fish. It was really fabulous !Our guide was Tom and he was confident, knowledgeable and friendly, just perfect. We stopped at a local little restaurant for pad Thai, made especially for us, then cycled home.It was the best day, great value for money, a good pace and so interesting. Ill be back for another tour next time in in Bangkok. Thank you !

Wanna Follow you at Follow Me Bicycle Tour Bangkok. Fantastic day out, great guide, great food after the tour and well organized.Highly recommend can't wait to go back for another tour.See you soon..Follow me pls.Pimpajee_WeeNa
Very good!. Lots of fun! Very enjoyable! Excellent guide. You really see parts of Bangkok that you would normally never go to!

Amazing experience.. Great tour of the back streets of Bangkok. Visit places you wouldn't normally go on your own exploring. Our guide, Peter, was so funny and friendly. He was very knowledgeable and kept a keen eye on us. I am not the most confident bike rider but it didn't matter, the route was great, I was not scared once. even a downpour couldn't dampen our spirits. This tour is brilliant value for money. I will never forget the experience. Thanks.

Fantastic tour, incredible Bangkok!. You see Bangkok from a totally different point of view: small alleys and neighbourhoods, the crazy BKK traffic, the riverside, praying monks , Chinatown, churches and funny food and drink stuff. Excellent guide Top!

Food street and bike tour. Amazing, secure, delicious and fun!!!!! I did 2 differentes tours and "Follow me" is perfect. In the morning, we tasted amazing food that only locals could taste because some of them are hard to find!Our guide bought some sausages, bananas and other stuff... so good!! then back to Follow me, we get our bike for all afternoon historical biking, but before to leave in the aventure, we had a full video(max5min) for our one security and on the top for our security 2 amazing guides(Peter and Tom) wich this did not happen in the other tour! This is another way to see Bangkok, far from all seesight for tourist. We were right in midle of how Thai people live!!During all tour, our guides akes us if we wantes water, snacks, fruits, but we were so full from the morning. The perfect end of the day with drinks, food and fish tank for your feet to relax!!! If you are in hotel ask the concierge to find you the info about "Follow me" just because they are secure, fun, and you get what you pay! I will do it again.

Fantastic way to see the real Bangkok!. The bike tour was a great way to see Bangkok. We had travelled to Bangkok before and so had already visited the main tourist sights. The tour was therefore an alternative way to see around. Cycling around the narrow back streets gave an insight into how the people of Bangkok live. One of the highlights was definitely cycling through the streets and markets (both outdoor and indoor!) of china town. Another highlight is visiting Wat Arun - definitely my favourite temple in Bangkok! Our guide was fantastic and knowledgeable about the places we visited. The cycling is not difficult as Bangkok is very flat. Some of the streets you cycle through are pretty narrow though but that just added to the fun of the trip. I would recommend this tour to anyone who visits Bangkok.

Great bike tour!. Excellent bike tour where you get a taste of the real Bangkok as you cycle through a myriad of backstreets, along many of the sights and past the plethora of temples. Tourguide gave great information! Adequate amount of refreshments given. Tour guide took photos throughout the journey, they will be mailed to you for free! Food back at the coach house was average! Free tea and coffee. We were able to chill for a while! We were tired after our active day. Well worth going! Small bag attached to bike where you can fit your camera and personal belonging. Really enjoyable!

go on this tour!. I booked follow me for a private siam sawan tour...to the green lungs of bangkok!....my bike was very modern and in good condition. we started through the side streets and a visit to an old Bangkok house. Then it was travelling through some of the less salubrious parts of bangkok. it was amazing to cycle in the alleyways past people cooking and washing. All the kids were so happy to shout hello and hi 5 us! We then crossed the river by boat to the amazing oasis of the green lungs of bangkok...amazing place! the farm areas were totally unexpected as was the national park. then it was back to the centre by boat and through more back alleys! I really enjoyed the trip!A tiny note of caution for families....the trip through the farm area is on raised concrete paths with a 2-5m drop...so if you are nervous about riding a bike...beware!...but for anyone confidant on a bike it is fine

We booked this and loved it. Ok....Bangkok is flat but you will need some skills to get through this unbelievable maze of a city on a mountain bike. We had only three of us, and two guides. They we very pleasant, informative and entertaining. We rode through streets, backstreets, alleys, over bridges, stair wells...you name it. Not for the faint of heart....there will be traffic...but your guides will protect you and guide you to stately. There are drink stops along the way, fruit tastings, temples, and of course, a river crossing or two. The 4 hour events ends back where you started, with a nice choice of Thai or BBQ....and the most unusual foot massage ever! Everything was sorted out to our liking. The owner and staff are at your service and willing to help you through every challenge. No worries. Do this tour...you'll love it. Great way to experience Bangkok.

Bangkok Siam Heaven Trip. It was a very good experience, riding a bike through the busy streets and country-side of Bangkok. Peter (tour) is very good at explaining attractions, and very understanding of the local. Also, the club has a comfortable and relaxing environment. Thank you Peter, Thank you Follow Me.

Great way to discover Bangkok!. I've been to Bangkok a few times but I've never seen it this way! The quaint food shops, the back roads, and the behind-the-scenes view of the city made it very interesting. Not to mention, seeing the place by riding bicycle in the city is an experience on it's own! I didn't realize we had covered so much distance until our guide told us!The tour I took was a walking food tour + a biking tour after. We had the chance to try different unique cuisines local to Bangkok and all places were good. The bike tour took us through the back roads (biking through markets even) which I would never have seen if not for this tour. It was great to have also biked along the Chao Phraya river.We caught a bit of heavy rain but I didn't think that was a big safety concern and to me, it made it even more exciting! It's great value considering the price I paid. The fee covered meals on the food tour, the bike rental, the refreshments along the way, and even a hearty dinner at the end of the day.Even of you consider yourself just a little adventurous (and you have basic skill in riding a bike) I give you my wholehearted recommendation.

This was the most interesting and fun experience we had in Bangkok.. The tour guide was nice, safe, clear and spoke perfect English. Right after the tour the owner emailed us the pictures of the tour and the pictures were great! It was so interesting to see the back side of the City. I would never had been able to see the city from this prospective.

Great experience. Well organised tour. Participant safety taken seriously. Excellent guide. I went on the Siam Boran tour option. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Travelled through Chinatown, fish market, flower market, spice market, Wat Arun, boat rides. You just don’t get to see some of these areas of Bangkok by walking around. Guide takes photos which you can download from their website. Excellent value. Check out their website.

Could have been much better. We have been to bangkok a few times and this time round, we thought of doing something different. Signed up for the bike tour online and it was fast and easy. The directions given were quite comprehensive except for the part where we need to cross the road using the pedestrian bridge.Bicycles given were ok. However, some were better than the other. The route taken was good. We get to cycle through small alleyways, along the river, and through the markets. This is something you won't experience if you visit the normal tourist areas.My gripe is that if the guide was better, the trip will be much better. It didn't start well when he tried to be funny by telling some silly jokes. The website mentioned that we will get to try some street food but all we got was coke and chips. A trained guide will make a world of difference for such tours.For a different experience, I highly recommend the bike tour but do check whether their guides are experience and itinerary.

Fun Tour & Good Way to See the City. We did a half day bike tour and had a lot of fun. It was a great way to see a lot of Bangkok, which is a massive city. We went to a lot of the key attractions and rode bikes through a lot of different markets. At some points we were going through really narrow paths that I'm surprised the bikes made it through, but it provided a unique experience.

Great tour !. We did the Siam Boran tour. Fully enjoyed Tom's guiding talent trough the Bangkok streets and ally's you'll not find on your own. We enjoyed also the water spa with the fish picking at your feet at the follow me club house. Also the food offered was very nice. Perfect day !Patrick, Katrien, Hannelore, Amaryllis

What a thrilling way to see parts of BKK you likely won't if you don't take this tour. We did the full day food and bike tour, with the morning spent walking around with a knowledgeable guide visiting about 6 different establishments and tasting over 14 different dishes. Don't eat breakfast if you do this tour. Our guide met us at the train station and took us to the bike place when our food tour was done. Was able to relax for a bit before hopping on our brand new bikes complete with new helmets. Peter was our fantastic guide and took very good care of us when it was time to cross the busy streets. We cycled on the streets, in small laneways, through markets and up to the ferries to cross the river three different times. It was thrilling and felt like I was on an episode of amazing race. Plenty of stops for breaks, liquids and toilets. If you like to do things different, like to sweat and get some exercise and just have fun this is the tour for you!

Great fun getting out of BKK. I really enjoyed my Bike tour. Pheter our guide was funny friendly and entertaining. The ride was easy and the scenery was interesting. Lots of narrow (very narrow) laneways and paths and some jungle and markets and a boat ride as well. A great way to escape BKK Malls.The bikes were good Merida Mountain bikes and the meal at the end was fine. Overall a lot of fun and pretty good value.

Bangkok as never seen before.....by me!. Arranged last minute but Follow Me was able to accommodate this 50 year old couple and our 15 year old kids. Phone calls from our hotel's concierge and even our taxi driver were required to ensure we were being taken to the correct address but in the end it proved to be quite straight forward and located in a nice quiet neighbourhood. Their hub has covered area for shade while you wait to go, clean toilet, cold drinks, toe nibbling fish and a charming cockatoo for entertainment. Very clear instructions and safety advice from our excellent guide and then we were off on our 25km adventure lasting 5 hours. I've been travelling to Bangkok for over 10 years on business but have never been exposed to the multitude of fascinating neighbourhoods, historic buildings, temples and markets that we saw today. Cycling through back streets, main roads, narrow alley ways between densely laid out houses, markets, the occasional main road and travelling across the river on small ferries meant that we were able witness real life in Bangkok. Our guide was extremely attentive, ensuring everyone kept up, providing information on each of the stop off points and in general about Thai culture and religion. He made certain we stopped frequently for drinks, entertained all of as we travelled and took lots of photographs to provide a great record of the day.I'd recommend this adventure to anyone.

Follow Me was Awesome!. We took this bike tour yesterday. It was awesome! Our tour guide, Tob, was excellent. He was always aware of where each of us was and our safety. He stopped frequently to make sure we had water, and also made several bathroom stops. The tour is about 4 hours long, you get to see parts of Bangkok you would probably never see or experience. He was very informative, and knowledgeable! I would highly recommend this tour!!

Excellent way to see an other side of Bangkok. Excellent way to see an other side of Bangkok. Follow Me Bike Tours has clearly made the quality choice. High quality bike, that are set to your height on the spot, a guide that speak very good English and knows his way around Bangkok, with great details on the sights. Nice food afterwards, and a very relaxed atmosphere at the rental location. Definately will be back !

Great way to see the city. My family and I booked to do this tour. Very easy to do online and good directions to their club house. We got a very friendly reception and a funny video intro to the tour. The quality of the bikes is good and you can get helmets if you need them. After about 15 minutes my daughter, 15, decided she really didn't like it as the traffic was busy and there are lots of motorbikes on the small lanes. No problem, our guide dropped her bike, and my wife's, and they jumped on the sky train to go back. Point to note though is that you should be confident on a bike.My son and I continued and had a fantastic trip. We cycled through the fish and flower markets, down narrow streets and then across the river on the ferry to Wat Arun. Continuing on that side of the river we cycled through parks and down the river side to get a fascinating view of Bangkok. Top, our guide, was very informative and great at ensuring that everybody was ok and had plenty to drink.Once we got back to the clubhouse we had a light lunch and a chance to use the fish spa which was also a good experience. If you like cycling and want to experience a different side to Bangkok this is a great way to do it.

What a big day!. We had such a great day. Both our tour guides were so happy, enthusiastic and upbeat, they looked after us and talked Tony's about what we'd like to eat/see Nd tailored to tours around tht buying street food we were curious about and giving us their shirts so we could visit temples. What a great way to experience bangkok!

Great Fun!. I did the bike and bite tour in December 2012, sorry guys for being so slack on the review! but I promise I have been singing your praises to anyone who will listen - how it is a "not to be missed activity" when visiting Bangkok. Excellent value for money, friendly knowledgeable guides and the best fun ever zipping around busy Bangkok on a bike.

Fantastic tour!! Our children loved it.. We went on the half day tour with 2 families. Four adults and 4 children, 3at 9yrs and 1 at 7yrs. We had a private tour and it was fantastic. Tom and Top our guides were great, they made sure the children were safe at all times and catered to all our needs. Drink stops, ice cream stops, toilet stops nothing was too difficult. The school we visited was a memorable experience for the children and one they will never forget. The teachers and children were very welcoming and we can't thank the team at Follow Me enough for organizing this for us. The beer at the end just topped off the tour!!!!

Brilliant. I would highly recommend bike riding in Bangkok with Follow Me Tours. Our guide, Top, was so enthusiastic and knowledgeable. One of our party of 4 was nervous about the ride and they were patient and supportive. The sites on the historical tour filled all our senses and Top was happy to explain and adapt the tour as we went along. As others have mentioned the heat and traffic are not a problem. Brilliant way to see the city, including parts we would never have experienced without the experience of the Follow Me team. Thanks.

Easy, relaxing ride. I was a little concerned about riding a bike in Bangkok traffic, but we were only on one busy street for less than a minute. the rest of the ride was side streets, alleys and parks. As someone else mentioned heat is not a problem, the slight breeze from the ride keeps it comfortable and the guide makes sure you have plenty of cold water. There was a refreshment stop as well and a surprisingly delicious lunch at the end of the ride. We were a group of four ranging in age from 7 yrs to 67 yrs. It's a very easy (100% flat) and safe ride for everyone. good bikes and friendly guide (Tap) spoke perfect English. We crossed the river by ferry boat twice to see other parts of the city .Turned out to be a pleasant and fun five hours.

Siam Aharn Boran – Historical, Food & bike Tour. Did the Food/bike tour. Had a great time. Guides were knowledgeable and friendly. A little pricey but they really look after you by constantly asking if you would like additional snacks/water while on the bike tour. They gave us the option to try cow brain on the food tour among all of the other 'normal' cuisines. it was... uhh... interesting but definitely a memorable experience

Awesome. Highly recommend it to anyone up for adventure.. the tour guide Peter and Mishi were brilliant and hillarious... i would do this the first day in bangkok.. it would give you an idea of what to expect and which were the places to go and get authentic thai food.. be prepare to squeeze through traffic and through narrow gutters.. youll see more of real bangkok..enjoy n have fun.

THEE way to see Bangkok. Doing it the Asian way was awesome but the routes taken, information from my guide and the untouristic areas visited really made it top top notch. Fantastic way to see the real Bangkok at work with the stunning temples thrown in to wow you. Be warn tho the routes are pretty tight in places but the guide assured me that if it was too tight just walk but never once got off the bike

Great way to spend a morning in Bangkok. My friends and I were hoping to see a different side of Bangkok, and we were not disappointed. We had a great time biking through neighbourhoods and narrow bike lanes. The mountain bike tread is definitely required!! My only suggestion was to have a few more stops to talk about the history and culture we pass by along the route. Thanks to our guides Peter and Rose for a great day!

Singularly unique view of Bangkok!. My husband and I were so thrilled to see bike tours offered in Bangkok that we went on two of them in two days. The guides were really great and we saw parts of the city that we never would have seen otherwise. I doubt that even expatriate residents ever get out enough to see the inner guts of the city where the working folks live. If you are comfortable riding in narrow spaces and on busy streets next to cars whizzing by, this is definitely an experience not to be missed!

Hot but COOL way to travel around REAL Bangkok. Very good way to travel around Bangkok which is not only famous for shopping and spa. We biked around many places such as temples, wet market, narrow street, local residence area, river crossing. Tour guide - Tob is very friendly and tell us bangkok history. And take good photos for us too! Thanks for everything! I look forward to meet every "follow me bike tour" in the world!!!

Fun afternoon in Bangkok. We did the afternoon bike tour through Bangkok and it was a great way to see many well known and also more hidden sights of Bangkok without having to fight your way through heavy traffic. The guide was great and supplied us with as many drinks and snacks throughout the tour as we wanted. I also found nice that we could sit down at the club house for a meal after the tour and have a chat with everyone, which is a nice way of ending the tour. The guide also takes loads of photos that you can view later on Facebook. As a small suggestion: It might me useful to hand out maps at the beginning showing the route that we are taking as you just get completely lost when your guide leads you through all the side streets. It is nice to know where you are sometimes so that you can visit again another day. Overall great experience, can only recommend

Fun, but very hot!. Follow me is a great concept for seeing the back streets and true nature of Bangkok. The tour I took (Siam Aran), saw us cycling through crazy narrow streets and crazy busy markets. You certainly get to see a lot in four and a half hours. I went out in 32 degrees in the afternoon, our tour guide was amazing we had frequent stops along the way with fresh cold bottled water. Another good feature of the tour is that the guide takes photos along the way, which frees you up to concentrate on cycling through some rather 'interesting' places. Then when you return to the Club house the Follow Me crew offer you a free fish spa and buffet BBQ/Thai dinner.One minor thing that I did not really like was that the photos were made available publicly on facebook. I was not informed that this was the case when they were being taken, only that they would be emailed to us. For privacy reasons, I think maybe it would have been better for them to upload them to a dropbox account or similar and email the link to their guests. Other than that - definitely give this a go if you are in Bangkok, you will have fun. BUT try and go in the morning if you can.Thanks Follow Me Bike Tour - it was great.

Excellent staff. I am not that confident riding a bike, and looking back now, I probably shouldn´t have signed up for a bike tour. But the guides Vincent and Peter were wonderful and patient, one of them always staying behind with me, making sure I was ok navigating the streets of Bangkok, encouraging me and making me laugh. The tour around Phra Pradaeng was great, such a green place, so close to Bangkok! And once we were back at the Club House, a fish spa and a thai curry awaited us. Definitely recommended!

bike tour phuket. the right choice for me to choose a bike tour, because I can see phuket closer and real, go into the village and see the activities of the community, a very interesting tour, the tour guide was very clear in giving guidance and explanation

It's an extraordinary experience to see more in thailand. Thanks so much for providing me a great tour even when there was no one but me joined the tour at my time slot ! The unexpected private tour brought me great insight about Bangkok !

Pob- local celeb. What a great day at follow me, saw things I could never dream of without them. Bit tough to find but the best thing I did in my month in Thai. Pob is an absolute legend, he knows EVERYTHING!!

Perfect way to explore Bangkok. Guide was a bit late, but the tour was just perfect! 4 hours through the most important parts of the countries capital. We visited all major spots. After the tour we had a nice barbecue (included).The tour lasted for 4 hours and drinks were provided by the guide!Dr Fish is nice for the lady bikers amongst us :)

Foodtour and Biketour in Bangkok. We have had a super food tour walking around visiting small restaurants and tasting different kind of thai / indian / muslim foods. The same day in the afternoon we went for a bike tour in Chinatown, along the river, in and arround the flower market. We saw tempels and were introduced to many of the thai customs. We had a very interesting and fantastic day, which I will never forget.

Great way to see Bangkok!. We have been to Bangkok several times but never saw the city like we did with Follow Me Bike Tour. Riding through the alley ways and small roads was a great way to see the real side of the city. Our guides Peter and Rose were informative and made the ride a fun one as well. Nest time in Bangkok will try another one of their tours.

Fantastic exploration of the 'real' Bangkok!. If you want value for money then this is your trip!!! What an afternoon! We wanted to do a tour that captured how the people of Bangkok live. This could not have been a better way to experience it! 5 hours of cycling back streets, alley ways, people's door steps and even the road (that part was a little scary!) but an awesome way to see so much! We did the tour which included the temples and Chinatown. Our guide Tob was so lovely and he had so much knowledge about every aspect of the city. For the equivalent of $30 Aussie for 5 hours of cycling, sights and then to arrive back to a tasty thai meal this was absolutely money well spent!! Well done to the owners of Follow Me Bike Tours ;)

Great Food, Fun Ride. My husband and I participated in the Bites & Bike tour. The bites part was awesome – we had 10 different local dishes in places I would never have walked into on my own. Our guide, Nushi, took care of all the group’s needs. She made sure we all had bottled water, and she took special care to be sure that all dietary restrictions were addressed. Our favorites were the authentic green curry with chicken, the fried catfish, and the papaya salad – YUM! It was particularly well-thought out to have the microphones and headsets. Nushi was very soft-spoken, and Bangkok can be loud, but we heard all her comments loud and clear. We’ll be back.On to the bike tour. Tip - We’d recommend either trying to ensure that you ride only with those you know or have a quick conversation ahead of time. The guides could potentially split groups based on skills – those that like to go can go, and those that need a bit more time won’t feel rushed. It is an amazing tour, but all the stopping and waiting detracted from being head-over-heals for it. We’ve been on a few rides, and this was particularly slow – we’re not speed demons. Either way - We got to see the inner city up close and personal. It was awesome! We were very comfortable riding through heavy vehicle and pedestrian traffic along with cruising through tight alleys with scooters. It was cool. The sweep did an amazing job of blocking traffic and keeping an eye on everyone, but this is no little stroll down a country lane. You need to be alert. We’d go do the tour again tomorrow! (but we had to go home). Back at the clubhouse - you should at least try dipping your feet in the fish pond for a bit of your own “de-scaling”. It’s a new sensation to say the least. The barbecue provided was nice, and having time to recap cool moments with tour mates was appreciated.It would be unfair to not include our only disappointment. I had a flat. No worries – it happens. The guides were equipped with a pump, a patch kit, tire tools, and even tubes. The guides kept trying to pump it back up - when pumping it back up was not the solution, we recommended that the guide change the tube. My husband even offered to help. They did not change the tube, so I asked to swap bikes with one of the guides. The guide told me she was too small for my bike and it would only be another HOUR until we were finished. When we pointed out that the sweep was riding a bike of an identical frame size (and my husband got a bit louder) – they agreed. We were polite, but we had to dig to find out that neither guide knew how to change a tube. Yes, it was a rear tire, but still. My husband offered to change the tube – and we recommended splitting the group while we did the swap. After a quick switch and taking a few photos of my husband’s greasy paws, we caught back up to the other group. It was another Bangkok experience for us to remember and no big deal in the end. Our disappointment was not with the experience, but the lapse in professionalism / safety precautions. A guide should NEVER ask a client to ride on a flat / leak and all guides should know how to take care of basic needs. We still loved it, and would do it again in a heartbeat, but these are balanced reviews – and you may not have someone on your ride that can swap a tube in a few minutes.

WOW what an experince. Exhausting 4 hrs but it was worth it. They provide drinks and food on the way through the old city. Took great pics and very informative tour guide. Then Dinner at the house. Thanks guy's, I needed a history lesson.

Great trip with Follow Me Bike Tours. We had a great experience with Follow Me Bike Tours in Bangkok. It was a great route through Bangkok with 2 nice Thai guides, Tob and Rose. We have seen all the highlights of this great city and went through small streets and marketplaces in Chinatown and the other side of the Chao Phraya River and visited 2 nice temples. We had the afternoon tour and the Thai food dinner was delicious. You should go with this company, owner is Dutch

Great way to see the sights. I did this tour as part of the Bankok bites and bikes tour, it was a great way to spend the day. the tour was carried out on pavemnts and back roads mstly so we were very safe. We got to see things you would not normally visit in Bangkok.

Great experience - seeing a different side of Bangkok. We only had a few days in bangkok and are really glad that we booked on to do the bike tour. You see an entirely different side of Bangok - one that you would not really see or experience otherwise. The tour was professionally organised, the tour guide spoke good english and the whole experience was enjoyable. They even sent us through photos of the tour afterwards - and the free meal and water throughout was a nice touch. The only thing we would say is that we did expect the tour be be more of a "guided" tour - and that we might learn a bit more about the places that we were visiting rather than just ride through them. However, that is our thirst to always know more! Thank you.

Must do...... What a fantastic way to see the hidden jewels of this amazing city. Thank you very much to "Follow me bike tours" to show us Bangkok from a different side. I never thought that I would enjoy it as much as I did. Infact I absolutly loved it and cant recommend it hightly enough.Will come again next time!!!!

A total Bangkok experience. signed up for followmebiketours to experience the different sounds smells and sights of bangkok upclose and personal. It was a 4hr guided tour.Although we were told that the group we went with was bigger than the usual crowd(13 pax!) the guides made sure that noone was left behind. really appreciate their effort! it was fun and challenging at the same time=)

A good way to see another side of Bangkok. So much food, thank goodness for the afternoon bike ride!This was the second part of my day out after the morning food walk with Bangkok Food tours.An excellent afternoon with our guide, Peter, around the back streets/alleys, through markets, along the river and around some temples.Well paced, and a great afternoon.

A peek behind the scene. This was a great way to discover Bangkok, cycling through back lanes, markets, temples, with a friendly and experienced guide. We were part of a group of 8 and had lots of fun spotting the million things that you don't see if you're touring in a tuk-tuk or a taxi or even on foot. We crossed the river on a ferry and visited Wat Arun with an ascent up the main temple tower -- spectacular view. The tour ended with a relaxed lunch back at base. It was all very safe, even the crossing of main arteries.

Best Way to Experience Bangkok. Toured with them September 9, 2012. Tob was our tour guide for the trip. You need not worry about anything food, drinks, snack, pictures and jokes are included in the tour. Very well maintained bikes and good tour guide. You actually get to choose the bike you are comfortable using. You will get to see Bangkok in a different perspective. Very easy to ask questions before and after booking. They even upload your pictures on facebook for you, just need to share the album. You even get a free fish spa for your tired feet and cold towel at the end of the tour. Basic biking skills is needed by that I mean pedal and break :p I actually killed a cone on the first couple of minutes when I was still relearning my bike skills. Wear something comfortable and put sunscreen. Dont forget to enjoy the view... do not worry you tour guide got the photos covered :D

Great introduction to the city. My husband and I arrived to Bangkok in the morning and by 1:30 PM we were on the bikes to explore the city. We booked the Siam Boran-Siam Historical tour. We had an amazing time, our bikes were great and our guide was awsome.The pace was manageable, some of the alleys and corridors and navigating through markets were a bit challenging bit fun. Not once we felt unsafe. We covered so much grounds, we got such a great orientation to the city in such a short time ( 4.5 hours ) Photos were taken by our guide throughout the trip. Back to the office we had pad thai and enjoyed a fish spa.We recommend Follow Me Bike Tours to anyone.

The Bangkok job.. We've done the temples, very impressive, done the river tours, great, shopping, yup. Now what?  Back in the U.K. I admit, I'm a bit of a mamil (that's middle aged man in Lycra) and enjoy a bit of road cycling to try and keep fit. So a cycle tour of the back streets of Bangkok sounded like a cool idea. (Especially as my wife was keen too, as there aren't too many hills in the city) Book first, via the interweb thingy as space is limited, and leave a good bit of time to find the place as our taxi driver got lost.  They supply bikes (obviously) and safety equipment, water and two guides who have a fantastic memory for the back streets and alleyways.  Within moments of leaving base I was lost and following the riders in front only occasionally spotting parts of the city I knew. Twisting and turning through alleys and corridors, through markets and workshops, under bridges, along the river, over the river (on a ferry, silly!) a bit like doing the scene in Milan from The Italian job. (Although in Bangkok and on two wheels, and without the bullion.) The tour we were on lasted about four hours, and we were all starving when we got back. Helpfully a barbecue is included in the price and ready and waiting when you get back. (Free fish spa too!) Great value for around 1000 Bhat each

Nice introduction to Bangkok. This is a fun and interesting way to see the central hidden areas of Bangkok as well as some tourist sites. The guides and owners are pros. The bikes are perfect, they are lightweight, maneuverable and nearly drive themselves. Only those substantially unfit or non-bikers should have any difficulty. Biking is always the best way to explore and this trip is no exception.

Cycling in Bangkok. A great way to visit this city, cycling down small lanes and through market places, well looked after by our guide and co-guide, what better way could we experience Bangkok! We ended our bike trip with a delicious BBQ in the garden of Follow Me Bike Tours!

A great way to see the real bangkok. What a fabulous way to see the real bangkok. We cycled by the river, down extremely narrow side streets where you could /did almost touch locals in their living rooms, through a fruit & veg market, through a flower market and crossed the river by ferry. Our guide Peter was always patient & concerned we were happy & safe. Two days later we are still shattered but so pleased we have the memories & photos from our trip.

The best experience we have ever had in Bangkok. We have been to Bangkok a few times and are not frightened to go off the beaten track and do our own thing. As it was my birthday we wanted something a bit different. We researched this on the web before we left, we made our booking and all we had to do was wait.I got the days mixed up but an email to Ray, the owner, soon got us booked on another day, and it couldnt have been more perfect.We turned up, we were kitted out, watched the safety video and we were ready to rock.Last Mon, 21st Apr, there was my partner, Joe, myself and Tub, so we had a personalised tour. We had the best time in Bangkok ever,...........Tub took us down back streets, that the average tourist would never venture there, took us to temples, fire station, places you cannot imagine.The riding of the bikes on the main roads in Bangkok was really quite exciting, there's nothing to worry about, you go at a steady pace and as along as your sensible, you will be fine, its not a race, its a fun morning.Everyone was so friendly as we rode around, saying "good morning etc"...one of the bits of the tout that took my breath away was that we were riding around, then came through a car lot.........then there was the oldest Chinese temple on the world. now I wasnt expecting that at all.Tub was very easy to get along with, answering questions but also chatting to us too. He was born and bred in bangkok, so he def knew his stuff :-)Plenty of water, drinks etc were provided along the way. yes we were hot and sticky when we finished but we had the best day ever.We returned to lunch, sitting in the coolness of the garden, then a fish spa was a good way to end the day.I would say Ray and his team, have this "just right"Well done to you all, we have had the best time ever and if we ever come back to Bangkok, I would def do the tour againThanks againJudy and Joe

Extremely excellent. We really enjoyed this bike tour. It is great to visit this busy town by bike, riding in small narrow road and crossing the markets. Everything is done by the staff, no need to think about nothing :) They provide water, meal, and even raincoats! We also put the bicycle on the boat to cross the river. Nice place visited, sometimes really hidden! If you go to Bangkok don't miss this occasion to live a really nice experience. It is suitable to everyone. No need to be an athlet!

Best way to experience Bangkok!. The team at 'follow me' provided a fantastic way to see parts of Bangkok that we otherwise wouldn't have seen. We were a little nervous riding to start off with (haven't ridden a bike in traffic ever, and scary enough in a taxi), but the team took great care of us and the ride was heaps of fun. The guides were very knowledgable and friendly. The meal afterwards was also great. Great value for money.

Great experience. We have participated in this tour in March in Bangkok (with 35 degrees outside temperature), and despite the heat this tour was amazing. We (my wife and I) have been to Bangkok several times before and thought we know the city very well, before we searched LocalGuiding for sth different to do this time and found FollowMe biketours who have shown us many spots and faces of the city we have not seen before. The tour was extremly fun and I would always do it again. When coming back to the meeting place the complimentary BBQ and FishSpa are great. However one should be at least in okay shape, to go biking in the heat for 4 hours. Thanks again to FollowMe and also to LocalGuiding for the very smooth organisation (as always). oli

Fantastic way to experience Bangkok. I did the Siam Boran Tour and I can't recommend this tour highly enough! Our guides Tob and Rose were fantastic. Always making sure we were ok, stopping whenever we wanted to take photos and answering all of our questions. It's great value for money. You needn't worry about the traffic. Mostly you are on the back streets and alleys and when you do cycle on busier roads its just for a short time and Tob and Rose are there to look after you. At the end of the tour you head back to their HQ for a delicious lunch and a free fish foot pedicure if you want.

Exciting ride around lesser known sites.. I booked this after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor and I want disappointed. The offices are a little difficult to find but our cab driver saw us safely there. On arrival we were briefed in a beautiful, cool garden and fitted with bikes and optional helmets. My bike frame was probably a bit small for me but it was a very comfortable "sit up and beg" style.Having been in Bangkok a day, I was a little apprehensive about the traffic. I needn't have worried. Our guide went at a steady pace, guiding us through tricky bits and making sure everyone was comfortable. The other road users are very considerate. I am not an experienced cyclist and so I think even confident beginners would enjoy this tour. The tour goes through back alleys and markets, along the river and utilises the ferry. We saw sites away from the main tourist drag that we would not have seen on our own. Our guide was informative throughout. There are plenty of photo opportunities and rest stops and you are supplied with ample drinking water. About 24 hours after the tour we were emailed photos the guide took of us during the tour. There were some great shots. Only added extra that I would have liked would have been a map of the route, highlighting some of the sites to take away with me.Overall, highly recommended.

Brilliant way to experience Bangkok. This is a must do for anyone visiting Bangkok. It is just like the video portrays and will take you through parts of the city you would never get to see as a tourist. Very friendly, well organised, and relaxed with comfortable bikes and all refreshments catered for. Cracker the parrot is an added bonus at the meeting place! For us, nothing in Bangkok can beat this activity - do it!

Brilliant but 4 hours long.. Really enjoyed the experience, all the staff were fabulous and couldn't do any more to help. If u r going on this tour get the name of the street in Thai before u go as the taxi driver will struggle to find it from the English name. I would also take a hat. The only other comment I would make is the tour is approx 4 hours long with plenty of stops though. Me and my wife went and had a brilliant time. Excellent all round.

Perfect way to spend a morning in Bangkok.. Within 5 minutes of the Siam History Tour I knew I had already experienced more of Bangkok than I had wandering the city on my own. Taking us down alleys, through neighborhoods and markets, on the river taxi and past temples our guide explained the customs and culture. He was happy to answer any question that arose. The pace was enjoyable covering much more than I ever could have on foot, but getting us to places other tours would not cover. The fish massage was a unique experience in and of itself with a lovely lunch completing our morning.

Highlight of our trip!!. We did the Siam historical bike tour which was fantastic and the highlight of our trip to Bangkok!! We travelled on main roads, through back streets and markets, took ferry boats accross the river and stopped at various buildings, churches and temples and stopped off for refreshments along the way. Amazing! The guide was really really friendly spoke good English. The information he gave us about Thailand was brilliant. The tour was a fantastic experience that we just wouldn't have got anywhere close to without it. We felt like we got a really authentic experience. I highly recommend doing the tour it's fantastic value for money with a full 4-5 hours riding about, refreshments and also some food at the end. We thoroughly enjoyed it and would happily do it again! Thank you for a fantastic day! X

Worth my time and money. It is really a fantastic way to see some parts of Bangkok. Older guys and kids giving you a high five is a perk :)You can find a video recorded by me here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D727tafH6js&feature=youtu.beThe office is quite hard to find so leave early enough. Around 8 am the area is paralised by traffic (if you travel by taxi it can take a while to get there). We traveled from Democracy Monument by taxi and it took us about an hour.According to other participants, this trip was much better than the other one they tried year before through a different company.If you have no camera make sure to ride for a while just behind the guide as he takes pictures along the way.Water, meal and fish spa is included in the price which nice.

Great tour a great way to see Bangkok!!. We did the 4to5hr Siam history tour which was brilliant. Our guide was excellent with good English and a great knowledge of both Bangkok and Thai history in general. We were only in Bangkok for a day and a half so we were limited with what we could see in that time and I reckon this was the perfect way to get a great snapshot.Definitely recommend

general food tour and excited bike tour. In March, me and my husband had long weekend holiday in Bangkok. We have been BKK too many times, playing tired spa, massage, bar and local food, so this time we would like to have some new attempt.We joined follow me food tour and bike tour for whole day. For food tour, we await in BTS station at 10:00 in the morning, two tour guides took us and we began to proceed through the bazaar, surrounded by chinese thai shops, tour guide took us to see some specialist shops, such as traditional tea, dry food store and so on, but for me, I am little Hong Kong, these are the overseas Chinese shop in Thailand but is not a traditional Thai shop.Go to some store to eat some dishes, I think those are just not very signature Thai cuisine , and there is not much to introduce the history of food, stories, cooking techniques or important information.Overall is good, but the content needs to be adjusted, for example : Thailand papaya salad thai people would like to use which kind of chilly and how to mixed the sauce. look forward to the improvement.For bike tour, So excited about riding on a little street and market. But if you do not like the dust of same as me, I suggest you prepare the facial mask and using it when you riding on main road.

Best way to see a lot of Bangkok in a short time. I agree with everything that everyone else has already said. I would add that biking is a terrific way to get around Bangkok when it's warmer, as you get a breeze and it's much cooler in the little lanes than out on big roads. I highly recommend them.

Must do in Bangkok!!. Fantastic day wandering around the streets of Bangkok! We saw things that we would NEVER find on our own. The guide was outstanding and was very attentive to everybody on the trip. Day ended up with a nice dinner and they shared all the pics they took on the ride. Highly recommend!

Follow Me Bike Tours Bangkok. If you are a traveller not a tourist and you visit Bangkok then you simply must see the city on a bike. Follow Me Bike Tours provide a couple of excellent ways to experience Bangkok. The guide was a local, the bikes were good, the routes were great and the cost reasonable. Afterwards we had a snack and you could refresh your feet in the fish tank!A word of warning, please don't do this if your bike riding skills are a bit rusty........the routes are often on narrow lanes and alleys, or on raised access paths...........and finally in small sections on the main roads. I would thoroughly recommend Follow Me as an adventure when you visit BKK.

Eat well and work it off!. We did a full day tour with Follow Me Bike Tours the other day. The tour consisted of half a day of walking / tasting street food in the city, followed by an afternoon of biking around the congested but colorful streets of the old city. Bangkok is an exciting city and I'm very glad that we signed up for such a tour. We discovered local treasures and also explored the city from a new perspective. Having said that we felt a few things could have been done better:Food tour: The morning exploring food was great and the better part of the day for sure. They told us to show up without eating breakfast. We were hungry when we arrived at the meeting point and it took us another hour before we were guided to the the first tasting So basically until 11 am we had not eaten or drunk anything and had starting getting a headache walking around hungry on the hot streets. This may be ok for some but my friend and I are used to eating a decent breakfast to start the day. Our guide (can't remember her name offhand) was very sweet, informative and friendly. I'd recommend that they either advise us to eat breakfast beforehand, or provide us some munchies to get the morning started. Another bit of false advertising: They told us that we are not required to carry any money as they'll look after food / drinks. Sorry not true We had to buy our own water, coffee etc. We were probably a bit aggravated because we didn't get any food almost until lunch time. Bike tour: The bike tour was fun definitely a great workout. We were unfortunately rushed through busy streets on a hectic schedule and didn't really have time to understand or explore. Plus it was a big group and I think the guide (who was working hard) was over-stretched trying to manage the different skill-levels and having to run off every few minutes looking for folks who had fallen behind. It's great to cover ground but without context or guiding we don't really know what we are seeing. I recommend equipping the guide and the riders with handsets so we can be better informed about what we are visiting. A lot of us could have used a break or two to refuel and recharge, however we didn't appear to have the time to do so. We had a few folks falling off their bikes in the rush to get back ( as it was getting dark). Maybe reduce the length of the tour spending more time at each place (quality over quantity)? After arrival we didn't find the well-anticipated BBQ but were instead asked to order a small thai dish from a takeaway restaurant. No explanations provided. I do recommend the guided food tasting / bike tour as a great way to explore BKK but would urge readers to do their research thoroughly on selecting the right outfitter.

Backstreet Bangkok. This was my third trip to Bangkok and it was thanks to the bike tour that I got to see sights I had never seen before - you get to see the major sights as well as riding through old, typical backstreets and through the heart of the markets.You don't need to be an experienced bike rider or fully fit as the 20 kilometer tour is done at a leisurely pace with plenty of stops for refreshments or to take photos. I would, however, recommend doing the 8 am tour as the temperature was around 38C by the time we finished.Top, our guide, made it easy for us and made sure that riding on the main roads was nowhere near as daunting as feared. He was extremely attentive to our needs and an interesting tour guide as well.The team at the club house were so friendly and helpful and the whole experience is fun and customer centred - a great way of seeing Bangkok, great value for money and an experience you won't forget in a hurry!

Fun! Fun! Fun!. Me and my friend enjoyed the adventure and the exploration of inner Bangkok. We joined the Siam Boran Historical Tour. If we didn't join the tour, we wouldn't know and experience the truth of Bangkok. It was a great four hours time spent instead of shopping and eating! Though we were tired. I enjoyed the visit of Flower Wholesale Market, Vegetable Market, Wholesale market, Chao Phraya along the river ride and Wat Arun. Like! Like! Like!

Unseen Bangkok. Was recommended by friends as we were only in Bangkok for a couple of days. So glad we took them up on the recommendation. The tour was superb and felt we saw a lot of Bangkok we wouldn't have otherwise. The clubhouse is an Eden of its own providing a calming oasis in one of Asia's craziest cities. If it wasn't for the bike tour, we feel we wouldn't have seen much of the city.

Very short tour but full of new experience. I would recommend the tour to those who want to see the opposite site of Bangkok. It just only 4hrs, they will show you the country side of Bangkok.We had ride almost near to 20km but it doesn't m us tired at all. Very good for beginners as well as experience riders. The leader TOB KUN had really took care three of us with full of passion.Next time, i'll come here again and try another route. Well done "Follow Me Bike".

Perfect way to see Bangkok from a different perspective. We did an afternoon cycle tour which was great fun and a fabulous , alternate way to do a bit of sight seeing. The bikes were very comfortable and I am not a regular rider but had no trouble. We cycled for about 4 hours it was not too tiring as we had quite a few stops . We were very fortunate that there were only the two of us which meant we cycled at our own pace . The initial part of he ride through Bangkok city traffic was an experience!! Particularly for myself a " holiday cyclist" , but our guide was very professional and instructed us very well, you just need to do exactly as he does and don't hesitate. Once we were off the main roads it was different again, cycling on elevated concrete paths through the park and through narrow alleyways in the back streets, there was always something interesting to look at. It is a test fir your coordination and balance but heas of fun. I would say the afternoon we spent on this tour was probably the highlight of our time in bangkok and definitely worth doing .

If you only have one day in Bangkok, join Follow Me!. If you only have a day in Bangkok, then this is how to make the most of it. I chose the combined food tour and cycle. The food tour was on foot and we had an excellent guide and enjoyed sampling foods from some great eateries. We were then taken back to base, well-fuelled, to begin our cycle tour. Only three on the tour with a great guide. Cycling in Bangkok is not for the faint hearted but it was great fun, well paced, well organised and a really super way to see life in Bangkok (including some 'off the beaten track' historical sights). We covered a lot of ground, mainly in back streets and alleys. To finish off, dinner is picked up on the way home to eat back at base. Great value and some of my most vivid memories of Bangkok (and I had 10 days there!). Thanks a million guys!

The way to see Bangers. My husband and I did the China Town tour in the afternoon and had an amazing experience. Our guide Top was awesome and such a friendly and considerate guide so well done Top!Hot as hell, but hello....you are in Bangkok!!! So for anyone whinging about the heat, you need to pick a different holiday destination!!!

Excellent tour. We spent a very enjoyable afternoon on our cycle tour. I was a little concerned about coping with the heat and pace of the tour but this proved to be a very uneccesary worry as the breeze when riding our bikes was very welcome and proved much better than walking around plus the pace was easy to manage with frequent stops at some of the more unusual sights and for refreshments. We went through some very " off the beaten track " parts of the city getting some unusual looks from the locals but always followed by a cheery smile and wave. Maybe we were lucky with the group we were with which consisted of a fairly wide age range but I cannot agree with other reviewers that mention that this tour only suits those with experience. The route is flat and easily negotiated, the traffic in some parts was heavy but our guide made sure that we kept safe at all times. Following our trip we had a lovely meal from the local restaurant and a free foot spa to sooth those aching feet.

Great fun way to experience Bangkok. Awesome tour and way to experience Bangkok... simply a MUST DO!One suggestion is to seggregate groups into fit and non-fit. While our group was generally ok, it would have sucked to be stuck with a bunch of people who could hardly ride a bike.Anyway, combine with the food tour in the morning to ensure you have the extra energy :DThanks Follow Me!

Good Fun... if VERY comfortable on a Bike. I did the half day tour with my Wife, who had not been on a bike in a few years, I am quite comfortable on a bike as an avid cyclist and I had a blast. My Wife, not so much. The route we took was far to intense for the average person on a bike, the reviewer that said it was safe for a 4 year old must have had a different route! The other pair on our tour were having about as much fun as my wife.The bikes: I would say that they were probably a little less that 100% safe. The brakes on my bike were far from properly adjusted. The bottom bracket creaked like a rusty door whenever i put a little oomph into the pedals. My wife's bike had smooth tires, which was fine until we rode through, yes through, the fish market! you don't see those pictures on their FB because the guide was more concerned with not hitting any angry locals!All and all I had fun, but as I said I am far from a casual cyclist. This tour would be much more enjoyable if the riders ability and comfort zones were catered too, and perhaps the bikes had a little more maintenance.lunch was provided from a street cart.

Great day out seeing another side of Bangkok. We were a small group cycling to 'the lungs of Bangkok'. Found Follow Me Bike Tours really easily due to an excellent map sent by the Company! Had a warm welcome and a funny intro video to the do's and dont's of cycling in Bangkok, all common sense. We cycled to the home of former PM M.R. Kukrit - really beautiful and very interesting, we were surprised that Jim Thompsons' house appears on all the maps but this one doesn't - so much better and much more interesting and no shop attached! See below for the Itinerary. Our ride leader Tam was amazing - so friendly, informative, helpful and such a nice genuine person, and best of all he took control of that Bangkok traffic! Riding on the roads was fine, thrilling in fact!! It was great to see the villages on stilts that lie across the river. Waving children and smiling and patient [of us!] parents, huge lizzards, tropical vegetation, delicious Pad Thai at a local cafe and cycling all the way made for a great long afternoon. A young man on the trip said 'It's quite intense, isn't it', I was thinking 'challenging'. It's all totally flat, that day the sun was STRONG, also you will need to lift your bike on numerous occasions, the pathways on stilts at time have no walls, and the corners are very tight. For me the Bangkok traffic was nothing, but those tight corners.....! We were a very small group, so it didn't matter. Loved the trip.http://www.followmebiketour.com/cycle-bangkok-siam-sawan-siam-heaven-tour

Food and bike tour. 7 hour guided tour, morning visiting 5 food establishments - wish I'd done this years ago as this was our 4th trip to Bangkok. Lovely food in places we wouldn't have previously gone to. Afternoon bike tour ending with BBQ - we didn't know this bit so had to skip this as we had other arrangements but it looked good.

Great Experience. The cycling tour was fantastic, there was always a cool breeze when riding and I got to see many parts of the city that I would never have been able to explore on any other method of transportation. Great company.
