Great tour, photos, and memories!. Did the morning Food Tour and afternoon bike tour. Such a fun bike tour! I couldnt believe some of the places we went in crazy bangkok! If I didnt have picture no one would believe me!A little pricey but totally recommended!

Great way to experience Bangkok. Really good way to see a different side of Bangkok, its a world away from Siam Square and the Koh San Road!!!A professional outfit with well maintained bikes. Really liked Ray, the guide. Barbecue and foot spa were added extras.Its quite difficult to find so make sure you allow plenty of time.

Glad we did the tour. We are big fans of bike tours so we were excited about this one after reading all the great reviews. We did the morning tour though the back streets and markets and got to see a couple of temples and Chinatown and rode the ferry across the river. The sights and smells were memorable, especially the curries simmering in the back alley kitchens and the fresh flowers in the flower market. It was somewhat of a harrowing ride through the narrow alleys and along the busy streets, but our guide Vincent was able to keep us all together. We enjoyed trying some local food and fresh orange juice and the fish spa was quite an experience. The Thai fried rice with chicken was a tasty end to an adventurous bike ride in Bangkok.

My best day in Bangkok. Due to last minute vacation plans I was only able to travel to Bangkok for 5 days. Because I was traveling alone I almost booked everyday with a tour and the 'Bike and bite' tour was the best by far. In the morning we met at a central location and went on the food tour where I had the most amazing duck I ever tasted, great curries and to die for pastries. Just don't eat breakfast because you will be doing a lot of eating and you don't want to miss out because you are full. Thereafter we took the bike tour which was just as good if not even better. The tour guide was so friendly and relaxed and explained everything very clearly. The bike tour itself was also great because I got to see Bangkok in a way I would have never seen it without the tour. What I liked about the biking tour is that we took a lot of alleyways and back streets. We got to see the REAL Bangkok and how the locals live and not the commercial one and there wasn't a lot of traffic so I felt safe all the way. The bbq and the fish spa afterwards was also great and overall I just had a wonderful experience. Definitely a great way to spend your day in Bangkok, with great food, friendly people and wonderful sightseeing.

Great way to see Bangkok. My boyfriend and I only had two days in Bangkok, and our friends organised this tour for us. I am so glad I did it, it was a great way to see this city in such a limited time frame. We rode through back streets and markets, saw temples and tasted some delicious local food. At the end we had a complimentary fish spa and lunch. I would recommend this tour to anyone at any age. The cycling is easy, as it is on flat ground the whole way. I wore sandals and it was fine!

Awesome full day tour - Cheapest and Best!. Food on the food tour was great, and the bike ride after was a perfect way to finish off the day. We rode through some very cool back streets and got to see a different side to bangkok than that of what a usual tourist would. The bikes are very good too, well maintained with great suspension. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone!

January 2013 Bangkok Follow Me Bike Tour. What a fabulous way to see the city of Bangkok! We combined the afternoon bike tour with the morning food tour and this day was the highlight of our 15-day 4-country tour of SE Asia. We road thru neighborhoods & markets, along & across busy streets, along the river, on ferries, and thru temple grounds. This is not for the faint-of-heart -- but if you have a little biking skills, can keep your bike going forward, can bike-walk (ha!), and have a little sense of adventure, this is a great way to spend a day away from another organized tour. Thanks to our guide Bond, we had a GREAT time! And thanks David for what your company offers -- really fun day!

Memorable Part of Vacation. Loved riding through the back alleys of Bangkok being able to see the city away from the glittering malls and Skytrain. Roosters, ramshackle homes & beautiful views of the Chao Praya River. Loved the food served- such a plus that I have NEVER experienced this during any bike tour!! They served a full dinner after the tour!! INCREDIBLE!!!

Outstanding fun on 2 Wheels. My last day in Bangkok was designed to be fun and I wasn't disappointed. Having never ridden a bike other tha in the gym for 20+ years booking a cycle tour around one of the most congested cities in the world does not sound like a recipe for success. How wrong can you be.Personal fitting of the bike to suit my size, a safety and tour briefing, lots of fresh cold water and a safety helmet and we were off in convoy around the back lanes and main roads of Bangkok.If your coming to Bangkok this is the most important and only thing you must do. So much fun, excitement and insight into everyday life in Bangkok.Safe, exhilarating informative and overall fantastic value.Will certainly do again when I'm next in Bangkok.

Recommend to Anybody. My family and I loved this experience and I would recommend it to anybody who would like to see parts of Bangkok that you would not see on your own. We took our 9 and 11 year olds with us and they found the experience amazing. Tob was a great guide and we felt safe and well cared for at all times.

Outstanding in every way!. Our family of 4 recently had the pleasure of doing the Siam Discovery bike tour through Follow Me Bike Tours. All I can say is "WOW"! The whole experience was incredible. We biked through places that we would never have found on our own. The local snacks and drinks we had also added to the experience. To top it off, we enjoyed our lunch back at the clubhouse and had some laughs trying out the fish spa. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone looking for a little adventure in Bangkok!

Follow me tour (morning). We had a fantastic experience on the morning tour of Bangkok. Tob is a terrific guide, he gives clear instructions, is very aware of safety and customer comfort. We were a group of 6 with 3 children and it was a highly engaging experience for all of us. Nothing was to much trouble, finding rest rooms, stopping for snacks and drinks that were not scheduled, photo opportunities and more.This trip was well worth the money and represents great value. Bikes and bike helmets were in excellent condition - seats were comfortable and they have great suspension. Don't think twice - about booking the office staff were very helpful and accommodating. The fish spa at the end was a lovely treat. We will go back to try another bike tour next visit to Bangkok!

Fabulous Experience!!. We have been to Bangkok many times and have seen a lot of it, but the Sawan bicycle tour with Follow Me was definitely one of the best activities we have ever done. We loved every minute! The bikes are in great condition and most importantly have comfortabe saddles. Our guide, Tob, did such a good job leading us over the busy roads, smallest alleys and along the narrow paths of the "green part" of the journey. He explained everything very thoroughly and we felt safe throughout. We also enjoyed the meal break, very tasty Pad Thai. Back at the club house you can chill out with a beer putting your feet in the fish spa and give Crackers, the cockatoo, a good stroke. We will return for a different tour next time when we are in Bangkok!

Wonderful cycling tour. It's a very good experience cycling in the busy street of Bangkok with a local tour guide. Vincent (tour guide) is good in explaining the attraction and knowing the local well. Besides, the clubhouse environment is cozy and relaxing with fish spa.

So much fun!. We loved our bike tour. It was so much fun riding through Chinatown, the markets, crossing the Chao Prayo on the ferry, visiting temples, riding along the river, stopping for snacks, braving the streeets of Bangkok and arrriving safely back at the clubhouse for dinner and fish spa.

December 26 bike & food tour. Overall a good day, but we were confused as to our day layout. We thought we had bought a cycle while u eat kind of day. In fact it was a morning walking food tasting tour, followed by an afternoon of cycling round the city. By the end of the food tour, we came very close to cancelling the afternoon. Energy levels had dropped and we were not sure what the afternoon would bring. But we persevered and would say the afternoon was the highlight of the day. Tob looked after us and was full of information. Not to say our morning guide wasn't. We were equipped with headsets so we could follow while she talked. We went to some restaurants we wouldn't have tried as day to day tourists. So this will benefit our next trip to BKK. Food was plenty, water/soft drinks for the bike tour were plenty. Fish spa at the end too ticklish! Overall a good day and would return and recommend to friends.Thanks guys, Tob and Nusa (apologies for names mis spelt)

Unforgettable experience. I was looking forward to make this tour for a long time and it exceeded my expectations!!! We had an incredible afternoon cycling around the backstreets of Bangkok with Tob. Water and drinks were always available, people in the street were warm and friendly, we never felt insecure and the staff was great too! We absolutely recommend this tour to everyone! Nobody will regret it! The best what we had done in Bangkok!

How to see a city in 4hrs. Early November and I had a Sunday afternoon to myself without business colleagues chaperoning me. I had previously found Follow Me and decided to do a last minute booking - I used the live chat on the website to talk to Ray to establish availability. Although a little concerned about what to expect at first, I can honestly say this was one the most exhilarating experiences of 2012 for me.Many of the other reviews describe the tour really well and I won't repeat their highlights. I joined a family from Switzerland with their children and I would have no hesitation in bringing my own in the future - they do need to be confident at bike riding but the pace is just perfect and it is such a great way to see the real city - colour, smell, sound, street dogs, poverty and genuine smiling people.It was also the best way to spend 4hr and 2000Bht I could have imagined, and the exercise was free!Ray and your team - thank you for the opportunity to see the city you live in and all good luck with the business!

Unforgettable experience. I arrived at the clubhouse nearly an hour late (my tuk-tuk driver got very lost!) I was feeling jet-lagged and a little overwhelmed after having arrived in frantic Bangkok the day before. Fully expecting to have missed out and to have to rebook for a later date, I was pleasantly surprised to be told there was a guide happy to take me on the Sawan tour right away, despite my lateness. The bike was perfect, and the route was extremely varied and interesting. Highlights include stopping off at a salt factory and being given an impromptu tour, seeing various temples, weaving through the narrow streets of the village communities, a short boat trip, riding through the jungle, feeding the fish, trying pad thai for the first time and seeing the smiling faces of the many locals we met. This was by far the best thing I've done in Bangkok - a great way to get a true feel for the city and its people. Fantastic value for money. I would recommend it to anyone!

A Great tour in The city of angels!!!. I was looking forward to make this tour for a long time and it exceeded my expectations!!! We had an incredible afternoon cycling around the backstreets of Bangkok with tob as our wonderful guide. The heat was intense but water and drinks were always available, people in the street were warm and friendly, we never felt insecure and the staff was very attentive!!! We absolutely recommend this tour to everyone thatcomes to Bangkok!!!! Nobody will regret it!

Absolute MUST DO if you want to see the real Bangkok!. We had such a fabulous day with Tob and Nooshi on the foodie + cycling tour of Bangkok.The morning started off with a walking food tour where you stop off at approximately 5 different locally run restaurants and sample some deeeelicious food that you probably have never tried before (crispy catfish was my fav!) Once we were sufficiently stuffed full of food we headed to the clubhouse to get kitted up for the ride. The bikes are all of a high quality and Tob our guide was professional, informative, gave clear instructions and took heaps of awesome pics! My favourite aspect of the tour was simply riding around the narrow alleys and backstreets (there's so many pot holes, tight corners and traffic to contend with which we found so exciting haha!). The Thai people wave and yell p as you ride along, we had local kids follow us for a bit. It felt like a really authentic experience :) also enjoyed stopping by the markets and temples too.I would note that Bangkok is a big busy city and although the tour is mostly through the side streets which don't have heaps of traffic, at times you will ride on mains roads and through narrow markets so if you know how to handle a bike you will have a more enjoyable time! ;-) enjoy.

Bangkok of the beaten track. This is the must-do-thing when in Bangkok. I only had a few days of free time before my business appointments would start. It was the best choice I made while still at home. Vincent, our guide, showed us the beauty and reality of city life in Bangkok and gave us sufficient time to make photos and capture some of the culture.The reception art the clubhouse was warm and friendly with Ray and his parrot as the excellent host. The choices in bicles was good and all bikes were in perfect condition. I did not feel rushed or pushed in any way. Soon after adjusting the seat of the bike Vincent took the lead and guided us through a maze of small alleys when all of a sudden you drive in to small street markets and get flooded by wonderful smells and colors. In total the experience was excellent and more than worth a second Follow Me tour the next time I am in Bangkok.In short: a half day experience never to forget.

This is the way to see the real Bangkok. What a great day with awesome people! This bike trip will open your eyes to the back streets of Bangkok showing the pretty and the ugly way of life. Professionally run and although I was concerned prior to starting about biking the busy streets of Bangkok, it was much easier than I thought. The only negative feedback is that there wasnt enough time to stop and take photos. As a hobby photographer there were many missed opportunites. The tour leader did take photos as we went along. All round this is a highly recommended trip. You will love it!!

Very revealing way to see the bustling city.. Re: The half day city tour. Overall I recommend this tour as a way to see Bangkok that you will not get on your own. Follow Me is professional operation with good bikes, good guide and comfortable facility. I want to point out some things people should be aware of. Bangkok is very busy with heavy traffic and some air pollution. It is hot. The tour mostly kept to side streets, alleys, narrow foot paths where traffic was not a problem. It also was maybe 5% on busy roads. A lot of it was riding through narrow market streets and stalls where we should not have ridden IMO. These negatives are also pluses as this is the soul of Bangkok. Some of the route was near and through temple grounds and along the river. Very nice. The price is fair and included a terrific lunch back at the stable. (Note: We are old but fit seniors) Recommended. In summary DO IT.

Not everything of Bangkok but both of the touristic and local aspects, Follow me offered!. I joined Follow Me tour at Bangkok and the guide showed me especially where the local people live, which made me remember the memory when I was at elementary school and I ran around narrow, curbed, and tricky road where the adult usually passed through. I had quite memorable experience with his guide, for example, at the area where catholic missionary helped to built, when we passed by the people and greeted them in Thai language, they greeted back to us, the guide showed his favorite stands and gave me snacks or sweets, and so on.It was so adventurous but worth trying to ride on a bike and run around the chaotic roads at Bangkok. In addition, he took special care of us and watched out the roads with hand signal or by noticing when we ran across or along the main road with busy traffic.

Still tasting the food and enjoying the experience!!. We just got back to our hotel after a great day!We did the full day Food & Bike tour - definitely recommended!The food tour was fantastic and our tour-guide Lucy(?) was great!! We walked around a great area with tons of little restaurants and cafes. Leave your doubts at home and just sample it all! It was all delicious and the tourguide provides headsets, so you can hear whether you're near or far! We will definitely be heading back to taste some more of the menus at the places we stopped at....The bike tour was something else, Bangkok is usually hectic from the safety of a taxi, skytrain or tuk-tuk, just imagine it up close and personal on a bike! We were guided through some narrow (read very narrow) alleyways and around the inner city, it was a fun time for sure, but need to have your wits about you at all times!! Lots of stops and drinks along the way, but its 5 hours of biking, so be prepared (flip flops not recimmended!!) and loose comfy clothing that you're ok with gettin a little sticky!I would recommend to friends, family and all others and would do it again for sure!

Best fun ever. A mental afternoon spent in good company whizzing round narrow backstreets, over canals, round temples and through indoor markets on a bike. Totally different to anything I've done before! Nice touch that they provide food afterwards and you can chill with your new-found friends in their garden. Guide was Thai and v informative, loved how he could stop 3-lane traffic with a whistle and a baseball cap!

The right way to see the real Bangkok. Cycling around Bangkok maybe doesn't sound like the smartest idea at first with the mad traffic you see everywhere, but once you get going you realise it is mainly back streets and alleys you're on so not an issue at all.This really is a great way get off the beaten track and see the real Bangkok - just go for it!

A trip to remember. This was the highlight of our Thailand holiday, what a great find. We did the full day trip, with walking and eating in the morning followed by an adventurous bike ride in the afternoon. All the guides were fantastic. We got to try many foods that we would not normally give a second glance, even went back to one of them for tea (but unfortunately closed at 6pm so we missed out), we also got to see so many sights on the bike ride that you would not normally get to see.This was excellent value for money and we would definately do this again and would recommend to everyone coming to Bangkok.Thanks Follow Me

Outstanding value!. We did the 1/2 day city tour and found it to be both a remarkable experience and outstanding value. You see a large amount of Bangkok in a short amount of time, but you see Bangkok in a special way not seen by the tourists traipsing through the Grand Palace and Wat Pho. You experience residential alleyways and the true nature of Bangkok known to residents. Tob, our guide, was fantastic. He took over 40 pictures and emailed them to us. The only challenge with Follow Me is locating their shop. Be sure to print out the directions; they are tucked in a back alley.

Window Shopping on a Bike. The Boran bike tour meandered through the quaint alleys, providing a very different view of the less explored side of Bangkok. It's something that most tourists would not be exposed to. Along the way we experienced the daily lives of local folks who would exchange friendly greetings with you. We enjoyed window shopping as we cycled through the bustling streets of Yaowarat (Chinatown), and into the flower and vegetable markets. The tour also brought us to some lesser known but equally fascinating temples (and a church too!), away from the usual ones that are packed with tourists. Our guide, Tob is tops! He took good care of us, making sure we are well-hydrated during the breaks. At temple stops, he would relate to us the awesome histories behind these holy places. On the side note, Tob is great with kids. Daisy, the little girl in our group loved to hold his hands; her daddy felt left out...ha ha! The tour was fun yet challenging, especially when negotiating some of the narrow alleys and the numerous big and small humps throughout the journey. Fortunately, the bikes are well-maintained and equipped with good suspensions which made the ride more forgiving to my bum. This excellent bike tour is the highlight of my Bangkok trip. Try them and you know why.

Superb value for money & friendly staff - perfect for the lone traveller. . Its tough to find your way around Bangkok! Follow Me save you the hassle with their excellent tours. My only regret is that I spent 3 days in Bangkok before i discovered them. The ride is easy going with plenty of chances for a break.The guides are friendly, knowledgeable and eager to ensure you get the best from the experiance. I cannot reccomend them highly enough, and I'm pretty fussy!!

Good way to see Bangkok. We had a brilliant afternoon out with Follow Me. The tour was excellent value for money, with drinks, snacks, food, fish spa and photos all included in the price! Guides spoke good English and looked after us really well for the duration of the trip.

The real Bangkok. A full day, eating at five sites followed by a tour of temples and alleyways. Crossed the river and saw sights that few tourists ever get to see. You do need to be confident enough to ride in the narrow places and if you aren't this isn't the ride for you. We will remember the day for a long time.

Excellent way to see the not so touristy areas of Bangkok. This was an amazing way to see Bangkok. Our guide was very informative and went at a nice steady pace. It was no problems whatsoever when the couple of times we did enter the hectic main Road system and felt completely safe with our guide. I would highly recommend this tour - our ages - 59, 61, 57 and 58. I rate this as one of our highlights of a 26 day tour around Asia.

great tour through lesser-known parts of Bangkok!. We took the half-day tour and absolutely enjoyed it! Our guides (Vincent & ?) took very good care of us and our 3 kids, we biked through narrow streets, busy markets, crossed the river, enjoyed a local snack and through the whole tour got a different feeling of Bangkok! Upon coming back we got a delicious local dinner and could rest our feet in the fish SPA ;-)!A big thank-you to Raymond, Vincent and the team for this fun filled experience! We can recommend follow me bike-tours without any reservations!

Highly recommend this tour!. Great tour! My husband and I really enjoyed the half day Siam HIstorical Tour with our guide, Vincent. We definitely saw some interesting out-of-the-way places in Bangkok. We are not very experienced cyclists, and we were a little concerned about traffic after witnessing the crazy roadways in Bangkok, but there wasn't much interaction with street traffic on this tour. We had fun; enjoyed the sights and had some great food too. An added bonus were the pictures that were emailed to us the next day to commemorate our trip. Not only was Vincent giving us a great tour, but he was taking pictures all along the way. Thanks for the great memories!

Great bike trip around Bangkok. Spent half a day on a very personalised bike trip around Bangkok with an excellent guide (Kop / Pok ?) - and thoroughly enjoyed the ride. As there were cancellations I was the only person that turned up for the tour but the company was good to its word and sent me out on a comfortable touring bike with an excellent local guide. The tour brought me along many narrow back alleys, into slum areas, wet market / flower market, across the Chao Phrya river on a ferry and of course to a few obligatory Temple and cultural locations. Despite the hot weather there was a cooling breeze when cycling and the going / pace was very easy with no hills or strenuous parts to the tour. Anybody with even a low / moderate level of fitness could easily cope with this. The tour finished back at the clubhouse where dinner and a drink was served. The guys also gave me some excellent suggestions for local bars, music venues, etc., and overall this was an excellent way to pass half a day in Bangkok and see a side that most tourists will never see. The tour leader also took frequent photos and emailed them to me which was a really good and nice touch / bonus. Top marks under all headings
Great tour. What a great way to see parts of Bangkok you would never normally be able to see. We had a great afternoon and excellent value for money.

Best way to spend a Saturday morning in Bangkok.. We did the Sawan Tour with Follow Me Bike Tours and it was just brilliant. All the way from booking it online to completing this delightful ride. We were always kept safe a many options for people who didn't feel confident- like me on the really narrow paths where I just wheeled my bike. We had a wonderful group lead by the lovely Tob and Ray. Thank you again and hope to do more of your tours in the future.

great combination of food and bike tour. we join the full day food tour and bike tour and it was wonderful experience!we eat is 5 different locations, a lot of good food and after all the eating we bike for few hours in the middle of Bangkok with good guides and we saw so many places: markets, temples, small streets, river banks and much for. we stop for more food during the bike tour and at the end we had dinner and fish spa. so much eating and seeing in one day. very special!!!

Great Tour. We did the half day Siam Boran tour with Tob. We had a great time cycling thro the streets and alleyways. A great way to see a bit of Bangkok off the tourist track. Thanks to all at Follow Me Bike Tours.

Great way to see the city. We did the lungs of the city tour and really enjoyed everything about it. There was only the 2 of us and our guide Tob showed us parts of the city that otherwise we would never halve seen. The pace of the tour was excellent giving us chance to see everything. We felt safe on the roads and Tob offered drinks and local foods at every opportunity which were all covered in the tour price. A great way to see the city and we are going to look at booking with them again in Chiang mai.

Great experience ! Worth it. Great bicycle tour!We did a city tour with a very informative and nice guy named Tob!He showd us real local places of BangkokOff the main roadswe enjoyed it very muchthe tour also provides drinks and snacks as we go alongAnd a fish spa and hot meal after we finish the tour!!Great guys, great experienceWourth the time!!

Great trip. Took the Siam Sawan tour.Had a great trip through Bangkok and then out the the 'green lungs'. Guide very good and friendly.Whole set-up well organised with good quality bikes and felt well looked after.

Bangkok by Bike. Last year early November 2011 (towards the end of the heavy floodings) I decided to stay a couple of days in Bangkok on my way back from Hong Kong. Through the internet I found the site of Follow Me Bike Tours and booked a tour through the historical center of the city. The so-called Siam Boran tour. That day, because of the previous floodings, I happened to be the only client. It became an absolutely fantastic experience with the local guide called Top. I did really get to see so much of the city, passing by markets, alleys and palaces. The bike was of a great quality and so was the tour guide. Because I enjoyed the day so much (really from start to finish), I decided to book for the the next day the Siam Sawan tour, which would be outside Bangkok. The next day we left on a longtail boat and crossed the river to arrive in Phra Pradeang cycling through the jungle and a beautifull park. It was a hug contract with the day before, but equally unforgettable. Apologies it took me almost a year to write this post! Your warm welcome at the club house and the 2 days cycling in and around Bangkok deserve a good recommendation!! Many thanks again Ray, Top and team. Looking forward to see you again.All the best, Harold

Superb, great day out !. This was a fantastic day out. We did the "Peddle and Paddle Tour" which consisted of peddling in the morning and paddling in the afternoon, with a fantastic lunch in between.Can't recommend it highly enough, great value too.

Another side of Bangkok. My wife, 2 sons (ages 12 and 11) and I thoroughly enjoyed ourselves with our guide Tob. It was just the 5 of us which was good as we could take a little extra care of the children (you do have to be careful just at a few spots with kids). Tob was great and really took an interest in showing parts of Bangkok we would never have usually seen. We ended up doing 22 kms which was incredibly easy and fun on the comfortable "cruisey" bikes. Dave and the other guys run this very professionally, we highly recommend it - we'll be back to do one of the other tours that Follow Me offers. Thanks guys!

WOW, WOW, WOW IT’S A MUST DO IN BANKOK! Big special THANKS to Mr Top for showing us Bangkok.. My husband and I are frequent travellers to Bangkok and have not seen Bangkok in such a way before. We even have been to some of those places before on car. We must say it is so difference being in the car to being on a bicycle. Mr Top who had excellent English and had so much knowledge of places, took us through small alley ways and see how people living, difference kind of houses; big & small, old & new. Everybody we cycling by say hello and gave us waves and smile. Surprisingly, those small alleys are so interesting; so much to see. We were cycling through markets; fresh food, flowers, gifts, shoes and gadgets, visiting some important landmark such as first Thai bank, old custom house which now is a firemen home stay. Mr Top took us to a couple of local temples as he knew we have been to those big famous one before. One of the temples is Wat Prayurawongsawas Waraviharn, a big white chedi of the temple easily visible from the Chao Phraya River located on Thonburi side of the river. There is a small museum of Buddha images. We went in the Chedi and we amazed how well the temple is maintained. The other one is Wat Kalayanamitr where Long Por Tor, a big Buddha image housed in a big viharn. The temple is well known and popular among Thai-Chinese in Thailand.Ray (the manager) was pleased to hear I raved about the tour after I came back to his office. Ray said “Great to hear the comments came from a Thai person about the tour”. Yes, I’m a Thai but I have not been to those small alleys because I would not have known where those alleys will reach me to, I told him. Well done Mr Top and we will be back again for sure. Cheers,Saifon & Mark

Great different way to explore Bangkok. I really enjoyed the Siam Sawan tour! Tour guide Top (what's in a name) was top! He was easy to follow, knowledgable and made sure everybody was happy.I would definitely recommend the tour, it is a great way to see Bangkok and it surroundings from a different perspective!

Relaxed, safe and beautiful!. Having done several guided bike tours in big cities, I have to say that this is one of the best: best quality bike so far - especially as being not a "every day biker" the confort was important, very knowledgable and friendly guide (Top), completely mastering the itinerary through the backstage of Bangkok - some of the smallest streets, through markets and residential areas, beautiful to see, mixed with some of the big monuments and leaving a full impression of the city. Next time in Bangkok, I'll try the other tour. And of course, not to forget: the treat afterwards at the clubhouse: a nice meal and the fish spa for the feet!

honest business. i met dave, one of the two owners and he's an honest and open minded man. they started business on and a half year ago and i understand why it is working out!i enjoyed that the tour was small with only 4 fellow bikers. the tour guide bap was knowledgable and spoke english quite well. i got tea and water before the tour and spicy garlic chicken when we came back. they also have a fish spa which i tried. you can easily spent some time in the hangout area! i dont understand this one reviewer saying that her partner didnt enjoy it. i mean it is a city tour and you go through small streets but if you ever rode your bike in a city you'll have no problem following your guide while enjoying the 'scenery'all in all a very nice experience! i'dd do it again!

Great way to see Bangkok!. I only had 2 days in Bangkok, so I opted to do this tour for an afternoon. There were only two other people on the tour, so it was very easy to keep sight of the guide and ask many questions. Our guide Vincent was lovely - he always ensured our safety, and gave really good insight into the city. I would not have seen this much of Bangkok had I walked around on my own. Despite the rain and the cycling in traffic, I thoroughly enjoyed the experience and would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants to see the many sides of Bangkok.

Eat well and work it off. I took the combined food and cycling tour. I normally stay away from guided tours, but this was excellent. The food guides in the morning did a great job, and had us "sample" some great food. Every dish was better than the one before, and most of the places were out of the way neighborhood restaurants. Taken together the samples were more than a complete meal. Some of us then worked off the food tour with a bike tour through the back alleys of Bangkok. This is more about the sights you will see than the bike riding, as your feet are pushing you throu a narrow alley almost as often as you are pedaling, but what an experience! Being on a bike gave you access to areas you wouldn't normall see(the back alleys of people's homes) and gave you a perspective of how folks get around. I highly recommend this tour - exceptional quality for a very reasonable price.

A COMPLETELY NEW way to see Bangkok!!!. A 4 hours Bangkok bicycle visit. A complete NEW way to visit BANGKOK!!They will bring you to the big streets, back streets, shortcuts, sight seeing points of BANGKOK city.A EXCELLENT experience in Bangkok!!You must not miss this.

Great tour. A great way to see Bangkok. I loved riding though the narrow, winding streets with lots of friendly locals saying hello. Also riding through the market places was heaps of fun. I'd highly recommended this tour. The guide was great and I was impressed they ran it for just my friend and I. I think they could plan to have a snack a bit earlier as I was starving but I'm sure they would've stopped if I'd asked. I'd love to do the bike and bite one next time but 7 hours is a long time when I'm only in Bangkok for a weekend.

Awesome, cycling through alleyways of Bangkok. Bond (guide) was very knowledgable of the alleyways where we caught sight of how Thai people live and work. Very busy in Chinatown and across the river into the old part of Bangkok. We cycled through a working flower market..... Bond took photos of our group and posted them the following day.After our cycle trip we were welcomed with a BBQ and rested our feet in the fish spa. What an amazing way to see Bangkok from a totally different perspective.Thank you for making great memories of Bangkok for our family

Rain wasn't a pain. Thursday 6th September 2012 I thought I was the only person to turn up for the cycle tour but I wasn't as there were another two guys . There was some rain ok quite a lot of rain but hey ho I was on holiday and I was going on a bike tour. Getting there is a trial but please leave in plenty of time as it is well worth it. Top was magnificent as a guide and very informative and a great personality he made our tour so much fun and the weather was almost forgotten. Even if it is raining it is still most definitely worth doing. We had a lovely meal back at the club house and Top also helped me get to MBK shopping centre. I will definately do another tour next time I am in Bang kok which I hope won' t be too long. Brenda Hollywood

Perfect tour to see Bangkok. We did the 4 hour tour and it was quite amazing. It was well organized and the tourguide was nice. He made a lot of pictures while biking and they will be mailed to you so you can get your own copies. Some streets are realy busy and you need to be careful. When we arrived back at the compound the BBQ was already burning and we had a nice meal prepared by the dutch owner. Totally recommended!

A must for you 'to do list' in Bangkok. Well, what a find!After not riding a cycle since University, I opted for a hidden gem of backstreet Bangkok Tour. Our leader was Vince a supremely knowledgeable and charismatic person.I opted for the Siam Boran Tour.We weaved through backstreets, alleys, as well as glimpsing into the living rooms of ordinary Bankgokians going about their daily lives. We ducked and weaved though lanes with street food sellers tantalizing aromas filling the air. We stopped off at numerous wonderful temples, sampled some treats and also took a trip across the river.The ride was at a comfortable pace and the cycles were in excellent condition.Together with the warm welcome of the owner (Ray) at the Clubhouse, this was the highlight of my trip. Indeed, I booked the Siam Sawan Tour the next day.I shall be back with my family!Congratulations to the Follow Me Team- you have an excellent product to offer!

Thanks Tob!. This was the second part of the Bites and Bike Tour for me. The first part was a food tasting tour around the River City area, which I also highly recommend. After arriveng at the "Follow Me" club house, we were introduced to our guide Tob, who fittied us to our bikes. We were given plenty of water to start off the trip. The bike ride went though mostly back alleyways and small streets that a tourist like me would never enter into. We had a chance to encounter many local residence and see their daily living styles. We made a few stops along the way, and refreshment was provided. This is an experience you won't get by simply hitting all the major attractions yourself. It was a world hidden from most tourists and I'm very glad I joined the tour and had a chance to see it! Among other things, we visited various local markets, crossed the river, and saw 2 temples that tourists don't usually know about or venture to. Our guide Tob was taking pictures of us the whole time. The shots will be sent to us via email, for no extra charge! Towards the end of the trip, it started POURING. A rain coat was provided, but we were only 10 minutes from the club house and decided to just ride it out. Wow, it was a totally awesome experience riding the back streets of Bangkok in the rain! Our hot dinner was waiting for us when we arrived at the Club House.Here's the most amazing part. I left my camera bag with my D700 and 2 lenses on the boat we were riding to cross the river. I freaked out after realizing this. Our guide Tob immediately called the boat operator, and she confirm she picked it up. Phewwww... After guiding us back to the Club House, Tob went off to help me retrieve the camera bag, RIDING FOR OVER AN HOUR IN POURING RAIN! It was coming down SO hard at this point, others in the group couldn't even make it to the BTS station 5 min away. Tob seriously went above and beyond for me. When he came back with my bag, I thanked him and gave him a big tip. He more than deserved it!

Sorry, but could be better. This company is really trying hardGreat club houseWarm welcome from RayWell- maintained modern bikesInsurance and safety helmets provided. All very good so far ... but, the cycling was down lots of very narrow, crowded alleys. My partner found this worrying and difficult, despite being a very proficient bike rider in his youth (a long time ago). Though he expressed his concerns and clearly said that he was not happy with the experience about twenty minutes into the five-hour tour, the guide did not make suggestions as to how he could leave the tour and my partner did not want to spoil the enjoyment for the other two people on the tour. Had there been another guide, he could have gone back with him, or the guide actually should have arranged for him to return to the hotel or club house via taxi. Instead, he was subjected to a ride he hated. We cycled through narrow alleys, with motor bikes, children and animals all around, we cycled through crowded markets, and we constantly had to get off and on the bikes as well as occasionally lift them on and off ferries, and up and down a couple of bridges. The final problems occurred when we had to return along main roads in a thunder storm. Though ponchos were provided, we were soaked to the skin and water swirled around our ankles. I was very relieved that none of us actually came off our bikes, though we did spend quite a long time sheltering in a narrow alley while the guide went off to find the other couple who went missing after he had made a turn off the main road down another narrow alley. He did eventually manage to find them, but I felt throughout the trip that he should take more care ensuring that people were following him - he vary rarely stuck his hand out to show which direction he was about to turn in. I personally didn't mind the narrow alleys, the main road cycling and the rain too much but what disappointed me most was the lack of history on the history tour. The commentary was lacking. Why were the alleys built as they were, who lives in these homes? Where was the religious and cultural history as promised - we got some fleeting references to Catholics and went to see a large Buddah but there was nothing hanging all these fragmented bits together. As suggested in previous reviews, a booklet showing the route and what we may see along it, would help to make up for the lack of commentary. We sat by the river having a drink, kindly provided by the guide, but we had to ask the name of it, and there was the missed opportunity to explain about the different sides and the importance of the river.I've written the above reluctantly but I feel the company has so much potential, and under different circumstances I'm sure there are people who will enjoy these tours and you certainly get a lot for your money. It's really good value and if you are young, fit, enjoy riding bikes in crowded conditions and believe you can get your history well enough from Wikipedia, then I would recommend you to try this .

Another outstanding trip.... This was my second tour with follow me and once again it was outstanding. I have taken many (10+) cycle tours across South East Asia with many companies (Spice Road, Grasshoper etc) and for me Follow Me are the best of the bunch. For me what sets Follow Me apart is1. The quality of the guides - friendly, thoughtful, inclusive and highly conscientious 2. The bikes - Standard mountain bikes as well as more comfortable, large saddled city bikes are offered. All bikes are well maintained and include bells which are important when navigating the busy streets of Bangkok3. The extra service offered - Unlike other companies the Follow Me club house isn't simply a place to start and finish your trip it's also a place where you can relax. I like the fact that before you begin your tour you have the opportunity to sit down have a cup of (free) tea/coffee/water and get to know the rest of your group before you begin your trip. Also once your trip is complete a traditional Thai meal or BBQ is served, once again you can enjoy free tea/coffee/water or you can buy beer/soft drinks for a reasonable price. For me it's nice to sit down a relax after the trip and enjoy a cold beer with your tour buddies.4. The route - this takes you through a variety of small back alleys, markets and roads. It is interesting to see how buildings and people change as you pass through different neighborhoods e.g. China Town and the Muslim area.These little touches for me make a big difference and are the reason why I will always recommend follow me above any other company in Bangkok

A great day exploring Bangkok. My wife and I went on the trip soon after arriving in Bangkok. It was a wedding gift from some good friends back in the UK (we married shortly before moving to Bangkok). The day started with meeting at the BTS at 10am. We then met our guide and began the walking tour part of the day. We were given maps and could ask as many questions as we wanted. We stopped at about five places throughout the morning and into the afternoon, trying dishes such as Thai duck, spicy catfish salad and the traditional green curry. This has been really useful, as since the trip I have been able to try these things again at different places. We also stopped at a few temples on the walking tour, which usually I would have missed. The second part of the day was a cycling tour around the older parts of the city and along the river, stopping at various places of interest along the way. I used to cycle alot in the UK, and thought that it would be one of the things I would have to give up on moving to Bangkok. However, the tour showed me that it is possible to cycle in this city, and that it can be an enjoyable experience. We cycled through Bang Rak, to temples, through the flower market and China Town, then went over the river, and to Wat Arun along with other temples. All in all it was a day very well spent and I would recommend the trips to anybody. There were some in our cycling group that weren't as experienced on a bike, but they found the trip enjoyable and not too taxing. It can easily slot into a day's stopover and allows you to see parts of the city that could be missed. I have been recommending the tour to colleagues and friends since we got back.

See some of the real Bangkok. Had a great time and it is a must do for anyone who can stay upright on a bike. Like it so much we came back for another tour. Nothing's a problem as long as you can ride a bike and David will make sure you are looked after. Will come back and do this again.

Follow me - a superb bicycle tour. it was a nice and awesome experience!! I would never able to see the view, the scene, the local Bangkok in such a different angle by my own. Never regret to join this! Thumbs up!!

Excellent trip, must do!!!. My Boyfriend and I visited Bangkok early September and as we were only there for 2 days we were pushed for time and wanted to see as much as we could! We booked ourselves on the morning tour of the markets and temples and arrived to be measured up for our bikes around 8am, an early start but really worth it!!! We were in a group with another couple, met our guide for the morning and set off on our trip.It was a little scary at first as we rode along some very busy roads, but our guide was extremely attentive too everyone in the group and ensured our safety at all times. After a while we settled in to the ride and our confidence grew.We visited some amazing places, temples, markets, local fire station and through the small streets where the people of Bangkok got on with their busy lives. Every person we came across gave us all a welcoming smile and some stopped to say/wave hello :-) Drinks and snacks were offered throughout the morning, like I said the guide was so attentive!We arrived back at the club house, where a tasty Thai meal were waiting for us (optional western BBQ)We had a fantastic day, best thing I've done in a long time. Thank you very much to the owner and guide for some fantastic photographs and even better memories
Very nice. Me and a friend did 2 bicykle tours today and it was awesome, it realy shows you a different side of Bangkok then What you usualy sees and i would recommend it for anyone.

Bicycle/food tour of Bangkok. This was a fantastic day out, starting with a food tour of Bangkok near the river with 10 different food dishes to sample in different places. This was followed by 4 hours cycling in the afternoon off the main road and into the back streets to see local life. It was a nice easy pace on the flat so suitable for any fitness level. We finished off back at the clubhouse with a small barbecue and use of the fish spa!

follow me for a fantastic experience. If you only do one tour in Bangkok make sure it is this one. My wife and i had a blast as we weaved in and out of small back alleys, through markets and shopping areas over bridges and on the main highways. Very informative guide and a side of Bangkok you would not normally see. A must do.

Fantastic - book now. Only had two days in Bangkok, on my own and first time visit. Did't want to spend hours sweating on some tourist bus neither did I know what I was doing to go exploring on my own. Follow Me Bike Tours seemed a great choice and I was right. I turned up and met the owner, the guide and my group for the day. All really friendly, relaxed and informal but professional at the same time. Had a great time in the afternoon, tour lasted longer than it should have done, we stopped to see extra things and at all times were looked after, extra water, snacks etc. Upon returning to the clubhouse we relaxed for a while with a beer, BBQ and fish spa. All in all a great day out and I saw some of the real Bangkok, 5 star hotels on one side and normal Thai families on the other, going about daily life in this busy bustling metropolis! Also actually getting out and doing a bit of exercise really helped with jetlag and the spaced out feeling after a long flight and travelling. Thanks again, hopefully do it again one day!!

Discover the Bangkok that's usually hidden from view!. This was my third time in Bangkok, but I felt it was the first time I got to see the Bangkok behind the scenes. Cycling takes you to places you don't see when travelling by BTS, taxi or even tuktuk.Don't worry about traffic, or the heat - when cycling you create your own fresh breeze, and the tours guides risk their lives to stop the traffic for you, if necessary - at least that's what it looked like to me! (And don't bother to buy rain coats, followmebiketours will provide plastic capes.)I would especially like to recommend the Bike&Boat combination, which we did: We cycled till about noon, then (when it started getting hot) got in a longtail and cruised the klongs, getting yet another view of Bangkok, and picked up the cycling tour again around 4 p.m. to cycle for another hour and finish with the barbecue at the club house. My daughter especially liked the free fish spa :) Altogether a perfect day!

Amazing way to see Bangkok. This tour was the perfect end to our stay in Bangkok and fully deserves the high rating on trip advisor. The reply to my initial enquiry was very prompt and informative about which tour would be best for us. The clubhouse was barely a 10 minute walk from our hotel and the directions provided were very thorough. All the bikes are very well maintained and comfortable. Dave was very informative and Loya was a perfect guide. The route was just amazing and a real eye opener in terms of sights and smells. The route avoids main roads so was quite safe for my 8 year old, additionally it is very flat and there were plenty of pit stops so it was a very relaxing afternoon cycling around Bangkok. We got caught in a very heavy downpour near the river which extended the tour as we had to wait until it was safe to continue to cross the river by ferry. The tour is very well organised and we even had a choice of a bbq or thai food for dinner back at the clubhouse. The children particularly enjoyed the fish spa! Cannot recommend Follow Me highly enough - we left with an amazing insight into Bangkok.

A New Way to See Bangkok. I have been coming to Bangkok for over 25 years and always enjoy the smells and the street life of the city. Follow Me Bike Tours takes this to a new level. We went on the "historic tour of Bangkok" which takes you through the back soi life and you experience not only the street life and smells but more intimately by riding through their living communities and markets. Amazing that one can still do this....and on a bike! Stopping along the way and crossing the Chao Phraya by ferry, we got some good info and background on the historic sights. To top it off, they served us lunch in their charming garden afterwards! A great way to spend a day in Bangkok other than hitting the malls.

Awesome way to see the real Bangkok!. My wife and I had already been to your typical tourist attractions (Grand Palace, Wat Pho, Wat Arun, etc) and we wanted to get a feel for the rest of Bangkok. After reading up on the various tour companies we decided to try a bike tour. We contacted Follow Me and received a confirmation that afternoon for a tour the next day.The next morning we arrived at the clubhouse and was greeted by Dave (one of the owners), Tob (our guide for the day), and a cup of tea, which we drank as we met the rest of our tour group. Once we were ready we were promptly given a bike and fitted so that we could ride comfortably.The tour took us through side streets of the surrounding neighborhood, taking us to our first major stop, the old customs house. From there we meandered along the river stopping in various neighborhoods and getting a feel for the people, their lives and their culture. Tob gave us wonderful tidbits of information as we travelled to each neighborhood. The pace was comfortable and allowed everyone to ride comfortably.At the end of the tour we made our way back to the clubhouse for a Thai lunch and a fish spa. I had heard about this before, but never experienced it. What an awesome treat after a morning of riding around town. The food was also delicious. During our meal we were able to see the pictures that Tob took along the way. These were emailed to us so we could enjoy the, at home.All in all, Follow Me Bike Tours was a great experience. If you want to see how the Thai live in Bangkok, see hidden temples and markets that stimulate the senses, give them a call and arrange for a tour!

Amazing insider way to see Bangkok. Follow Me Bike Tours-I did two tours in one day in late May 2012.The first city tour was so good went on a second trip to floating market in village.Both my guide and the owner were kind,informative and mellow.So appreciated the real feeling of Bangkok by bike.Effortless and suprising fun experience.It was so hot but rallied regardless as we glided through the maze of rivers, market stalls, railways, hidden paths and narrow nooks that make up the inner beat of the city.I recommended it this week to a friend that had a 2 day layover. Thanks so much for a great time!

What an adventure!. My friend and I signed up for the Food + Bike tour. We initially thought we were gonna be cycling around to eat. But we found out that its a food tour first, and then our guide passes us on to the bike tour. Which was good because we got to really work off all that feasting! The fellars at the Follow Me club house are really friendly and easy to get along with. To my knowledge, Dave runs the business (and cooks a great BBQ!) and to our delight the other guys, Bond and Tob spoke excellent English and so that made for good conversation. We cycled from around 2pm till 6pm I think. We followed a crazy route up the Chao Phraya river that took us from the quiet and quaint backlanes of BKK's housing area, to the busy streets and highways, and even though Chinatown and a wet market! I didn't particularly like having to maneuver my bike through the wet market or Chinatown while having to keep up with the rest... it got a bit frustrating. but I guess it was all part of the adventure. The bike tour gave us a really unique BKK experience as we were able to see many parts of what a typical BKK lifestyle is like, just by being flexible on the bike. I'd say that this tour isn't for the weak hearted though. You gotta be alert at all times for safety and be willing to get a little grubby through the heat and rain (if it rains). We had a simple but delicious BBQ waiting for us when we got back to the clubhouse. A fish spa is available too! Overall, it was a great experience and hopefully you'll get a fun bunch of tourists from all over the globe to tour with like we did!

Great Tour! Lot of Fun!. Great way to see Bangkok. Ive been to Bangkok many times and have seen the sites, but not this way! It was a great way to show my sister and friends around the river area. The included food was great at the end and the guides are all really friendly! Would take more people back here.

Only way to see real Bangkok. Highly recommended way to see a different Bangkok that a as a regular tourist you wouldn't see. Easy to get to "The Club House" via BTS, Good quality bikes, Great hospitality and excellent guides. An excellent way to spend an afternoon soaking up the real Bangkok at an easy pace. The tour takes you down alleys, through markets and via temples.

Loved! See real Bangkok and spend most time off main roads. If have half day def recommend!. My husband and I only had a short time in Bangkok - it gave us a chance to see much of the city and not just the tourist parts. Toh was an amazing guide and gave great info. Pace was fabulous and not rushed. Nice stops along the way. Loved the club house and fish pond. One of the true standout tours.

A different view of Bangkok. We booked an afternoon tour at just over £20 a head - we were allotted a guide, Vincent, and a very comfortable bike, and off we went. The tour took us places we would never have found on our own even with a map. It was fascinating cycling down narrow ways, past (sometimes it felt like 'through') people's houses, down by the railway to a boat crossing of the river and over to a floating market, some brilliant concrete walkways above a swampy area on the island, and into a pretty park where we fed some fish - thence back across the river to a different point and home. It all took about 4 hours, it felt safe, and Vincent was friendly and helpful - as were the folks we cycled past. At the end a simple meal is provided...We would definitely recommend this tour and this company. They were efficient and friendly, and sent us some good photos after the event that Vincent took en route. We have been to Bangkok several times and enjoyed this day more than some of the famous sights like The Grand Palace etc.

Boran bike tour. I did the bike tour today and enjoyed it greatly. It was a perfect way to see the daily life of Bangkok . Our guide Tob was excellent, he really made the trip enjoyable and felt like he knew the back streets like the back of his hand. Follow me clubhouse is a great place to start and end the tour and having lunch and a foot spa was nice also. Thanks guys I will pass this one on.

Awsome way to see Bangkok. This is a great way to see parts of Bangkok you wouldn't normally get to see. The tour guide was fantastic, very friendly and knowledgable. Everyone at Follow Me was very helpful and friendly. I would thoroughly recommend this to anyone wanting to see the real Bangkok. Had a ball!!

Best way to explore Bangkok under the hot sun!. It's not easy to get around the main sights by walking in Bangkok as the weather is really hot. You will get stuck in the traffic even taking a taxi or tuk-tuk. So, cycling is the best way for you to explore in Bangkok.i booked a bike tour few days before for 3 person via email, Ray from Follow Me replied me soon. He allowed me to bring extra person at last even i can't confirm one of my friend's attendance. Follow Me Club is locating somewhere near BTS (Chong Nonsi station). We can easily reach there early morning with the map given by Ray. We even had a simple breakfast which we bought from 7-11 store along the way to the Club.Before we started the tour, they do provide us coffee and tea followed by a simple briefing. We don't need to bring our belongings as every bikes have a small pouch attached. We just put our camera and tissue paper inside the pouch. (They take photo with their own camera for you too.)We had Loya as our guide during the tour. Loya is a charming girl and take good care of us. She brought us to many places which you would never found by yourself. For safety reason, she always insisted to be the first when crossing every busy road. This experience was great, some local people gave their warmly greet when you pass through their houses. You don't need to worry about the hot weather as we cycling through the backstreets and alley. We were given chance to taste some local snacks and cold mineral water too. Unfortunately we had our bike tour on Sunday morning, some shops closed so we can't really feel the crowd when we pass through the Chinatown. Anyway, there were still some morning market that we can see their daylife. Loya brought us back to the club on time. We took a rest with enjoying the fish spa and having the BBQ chicken, burger prepared by Ray. The environment was good and cool.Overall the bike tour is fantastic and interesting, we really had a good time with them. i will join them again if i have chance to Bangkok in the future.

If you only do one thing in Bangkok.... do this trip. Absolutely loved it. A fabulous way to take in the sights and sounds of the back streets and tourist attractions. Very knowledgable and friendly tour guide who looked after us really well. Personal and professional service; a great adventure!

No better way to see Bangkok. This is probably my favorite tour I have ever done. It gives you a unique glimpse of life in Bangkok that you will not see from the main roads and you get to see so much. Bangkok is very flat, so the riding is easy and fun. The staff are very friendly and helpful. A big Thumbs Up to Follow Me Bike Tours, this is great all round experience

Great experience/Know your kids riding skills. Family of 5 (2 adults, kids 14,11 & 6) did half day tour showing back streets of Bangkok. 6 year old who is quite little rode with dad in child seat. It was a real eye opener for the kids seeing how people actually live in Bangkok. There are many stops & our guide Tob provided plenty of refreshments including fresh orange juice, water & coke in a bag. As we were the only ones on the tour we cut it short as the kids became tired & were a bit scared of some of the traffic as you have to ride down a few very busy Bangkok streets. Note this is not a reflection of the tour itself but of knowing your children's riding skills(dad coped an earful). Upon return we all enjoyed a fish spa & BBQ cooked by Dave who was very friendly. Photos of the tour were emailed which was very much appreciated & Dave even sent hd quality photos upon request. As we were about to leave it bucketed down-As the club house is a little off the main drag Tob escorted us to the sky train with umbrellas which was a great touch. Tob was very helpful/friendly/informative guide.

Wonderful experience in Bangkok. We did the downtown Bangkok tour in mid-July 2012 at 8:00 a.m. It took about 4,5 hoursthat went by really fast: The welcome at the clubhouse was friendly, welcoming and professional at the same time, the gear (bikes and helmets) made a very good impression and we started right after welcome drinks and coffee. We were a group of eight plus our two guides. The guides were perfect: locals from Bangkok, good English, quite knowledgeable about the sights and very caring about our safety.The bike ride was lots of fun but you need basic biking skills to navigate around the little streets. However, my wife and I only go biking every couple of months, never do long trips and this tour was NO problem for us at all!Have been to Bangkok three times as a tourist now, and this tour definitely added a new experience. If you generally like riding bikes and are in Bangkok, you absolutely should do this tour!

Amazing tour with an awesome guide!. My boyfriend and I did the morning historical tour with only one other couple from South Africa who were also traveling on vacation. We explored through so many areas (Chinese markets- flowers and veggies, river bike paths, ferry crossing and so much more!) that I never would have seen without this tour. Our guide was so informative and even tried to explain Buddhist concepts in English with me! It was a lovely day with a great meal at the end and a good price. Recommended for everyone!!

Biking and pandan made for a day of great memories. Our guides showed us both tourist sites and places where everyday life was happening. We were well cared for and amazed by the generous spirit of the Follow Me staff.

A great way to see real Bangkok. Thanks to our guide Tob, we got to see life in the tiny alleys and laneways of this part of Bangkok, which I would never have dared to venture down on my own. Riding through the markets was a highlight for me.

You must do this if you have some time......excellent. I had a free weekend whilst on business and selected this from trip advisor. It was a great and different way to see the city, the guides were excellent and always looked out for your safety and well been. Snacks and drinks along the way were most welcome and the perfect finish was the fish foot spa and a tasty BBQ. Thank you.....can not say enough good things about this trip

Must do in Bangkok!!. This has to be a must do in Bangkok, a great way to see the city on well maintained bicycles.We did the afternoon tour with Tob which was good fun and not too hot, met some really nice like minded people who gave us tips on other tours to do. So instead of walking around Bangkok with you guide book in hand and getting lost jump on a bike. Next time we return we will definately be doing it again. Best of luck to Ray and his team. Chris and Sev.

BKK on bicycle.....a must do for visitors. This has to be one of the best down to earth ways to see Bangkok, at it's honest core. You ride through streets, markets, back alleys and along the river, which you would never get the chance to experience if it weren't for Follow Me Tours.The guys that run the business are great, and the guides are truly fantastic imparting a wealth of knowledge on your tour. You have plenty of stops along the way if you want, and you don't even have to take your camera as the guides will take them all for you, and email to for free when your finished!I can't recommend these guys enough, and I'm definitely bringing friends when I return to Bangkok for my next holiday.

Superb way to see sights of Bangkok. An excellent fun afternoon spent cycling around the sights, sounds and smells of Bangkok. Tob was an fantastic guide with a wealth of knowledge. Don't be put off by the heat, the breeze from cycling along made it very comfortable. Highly recommended!!

Amazing, exciting, fun way to see Bangkok!. A great way to see the inside of Bangkok as you wouldn't dare go thru some of the alleyways and tiny streets...who knew they were streets? I had a wonderful time with the other six cyclist and a great thing to do alone or with a group...now after 4 1/2 hours on a bike we came back to have our feet tickled by the little fish! One of the best days I've had on this trip! Thanks to Ray for arranging for me to have a "couch" of a seat for my bike!! Gam & Tob were very accommodating and informative and I highly recommend you do this as soon as you arrive in Bangkok! I hope I have time to do another area with them before I leave. Riding was easy and I'm not a cyclist and the guides help manage the traffic for you....very easy ride, but HOT....recommend that you take a cold cloth from your hotel to help manage the heat....follow Me provides plenty of liquids to keep you hydrated and lots of breaks....the barbecue lunch afterward was a nice friendly touch....this is a Must Do! Excellent English as well!

GO cycling!. Maybe it's because we're Dutch but the best way to see (a part of) a city is on a bike! We had such a great time with follow me! Good guide who takes you to places where you normally couldn't come, very small alleys, fish and vegetable market in the middle of Chinatown. You just cycle trough.. in the Netherlands we would almost be prosecuted for that but in Bangkok it is no problem at all, people are very plolite a relaxed way of cycling. The guide (Tod) tells you a lot about the things you see, gets you drinks and snacks. A relaxed way of spending the time. After the trip (we did 25km in the old town of Bangkok) you get a beer/or soda and have a meal! it was great! We would recommend Follw me to everyone!
WHO DAT approved!. GREAT tour! The best I have taken in Asia. Better then rock climb, elephant jungle and sea kayak.EXCELLENT!

The Bangkok you never see!. The Follow Me bike tour was an excellent trip around Bangkok, seeing both the usual tourist sights and some other things normally not on the radar. Riding was easy, wouldn't be a challenge for most people. Staff are knowledgeable and speak English clearly. Would recommend to my friends.

Great day out - a different side of Bangkok. The leg muscles are a little sore but only grea memories of the half day bike tour. I have lived in Bangkok for 6 years but saw parts of the city I have never seen or would ever have seen if I had not taken the Follow Me Tour. All arrangements we done efficently but with a casual friendliness. Hats off to Khun Tob, the guide for a job well done. His knowledge of Bangkok enriched the morning. Certainly would recommend to anyone visiting.

An experience I'll never forget that created memories to be cherished forever. The best way to be immersed in Thai culture in a. The Follow Me Bangkok bicycle tour is one of the best experiences you'll ever have in your life. David and his team take you on an oddesy through parts of the city that expose you to people, sights, sounds, smells, emotions, and culture that you'll never see in any other way. Professional, fun, exciting, exhilarating, invigorating, joyful, rigorous (not too hard, though), and a great value are all words applicable to the Follow Me Bangkok bike experience. And when it is all over (even in 35c/95f heat, you won't want the bicycling part to end), you're treated to a tasty barbecue cooked personally by David. Then put your feet into their Fish Spa and let the fishy critters tickle your toes and refresh your tired tootsies for an end to one of the best days you'll ever have in your life!!! Whatever you do, don't miss this experience! Nothing in Bangkok will could possibly be as fun as the time you'll have with the Follow Me guides.

Great tour, Eye opening but don't do alone. Tour guides very friendly and knowledgable. Dave, one the partners, was very laid back and a cool guy. I did the food tasting tour in the morning followed by the bike tour. Both were great tours and recommend them both to any one wanting to see the real Bangkok. The food tasting tour food in the morning was very filling. I was so full I could stay for the BBQ buffet at the end o the bike tour. I loved the fried catfish and the nam tok at the third stop - so good!!! The sweets were also nice. The Muslim restaurant certainly took me out of comfort zone. I had the beef curry whih was Too oily and the beef was not edible - too tough. The last restaurant was modern and there many Thais there. The quality was good and prices cheap I would go there again. I had mixed feelings about the bike tour. The tour guide was great, the route we took was just perfect. I saw sides of Thailand that I have never seen - narrow pathways, back alleyways, peoples homes, crocodiles, markets that you wouldn't want to walk through ( but great to ride through :) ), raised walk ways along the chaprahya - we went through places Id never go alone or even with friends. The disappointing part of the bike tour was that I was the only person on it and it was a little slow. Riding through narrow back streets and among slum like areas was uncomfortable being the the only foreigner there. I mean we rode through some dark and very isolated places - places you don't want to be. It made me quite anxious. I saw poor children and people living in squalor, which being a parent myself, was very saddening. The markets were an eyeopener too, smelly places but the food very clean it amazes me to think that these places provide the food used in the hotels I stay in. Being the only person on the tour made BBQ buffet dinner quite unenticing fortunately I wasn't too hungry. The fish spa at the end was a new experience, fun but a bit lonely. I would have liked if tour guide could have walked me to the train station as the club house is quite isolated. On the way back I got the fright of my life by a stray dog which came out of no where and barking loudly... I didn't have rabies vaccinations so was a little rattled though nothing happened. The tour could have been faster as I was hoping to get a workout but that's okay. I was also expecting to see the jungle like areas per the pictures on the website but as I found out this was not on my tour.All in all was a good experience and took me out of my comfort zone, I'd recommend being flexible with dates and do the bike tour with others.

Best thing we did. This tour was recommended to us by a person who had previously done it. We arrived at the club rooms early but were greeted warmly with a cup of coffee. We were soon on our bikes which were very comfortable and off following our guide Tob. Never did we feel unsafe and saw sights of Bangkok we would have never got the chance to see. Tob spoke good English and stopped and explained things as we went along. Such a wonderful experience, a MUST do when in Bangkok.

An absolute must in Bangkok.. I chose this tour based on Tripadvisor reviews. We stayed in BK for 5 days in May 2012 and although we did many great things, this was the highlight. We met at the Clubhouse and were quickly introduced to our bikes and "Tob" our guide (who was fantastic). We set off on our tour, the route for which apparently took months in the planning and research. Our tour took about 4 hours and we are told covered approximately 22 Km. I should say straight away that absolutely none of the pedalling was at all strenuous, we were told that people as young as 5 and old as 90 had done the tour, and I can believe that.The tour took us to parts of Bangkok that we would not ever have seen on our own. Down narrow alleys, through markets, across the river by ferry.....the sights, smells and sounds were amazing. We stopped several times for refreshments as it was very hot.During the tour, Tob took photos of my wife and I as we rode along. On our return to the club house we were fed (a nice chicken and rice dish) and amazingly the 79 photos Tob had taken had already been emailed to my account.....a fabulous touch.I cannot recommend this enough, it's simply the only way to see BK like only the locals do. Many thanks to Follow Me!!!

Great Xperience. Forget about all the other tours. Pick this one. Grand Palace you can do on your own, Follow Me shows and brings best of 'hidden' treasures. You get a good impression of this city, you will not get to know with normal tours. Small streets, markets, numerous stops and what makes the difference: it's personal, honest and with care. Real!! With two kids of 8 and 10 years old, best 'adventure' for everyone in BKK. Great guide, good food afterwards with à smile. Top!

Siam Boran Bike Tour. A great afternoon to spend time away from MBK and Khaosan with the Bike Tour! First thought I must be crazy to cycle at 35 degrees, but it was the right decision and absolutely worth it.It was amazing to cycle the little alleys thru urban Bangkok and see places you would hardly get there on your own.Definately will do another tour next time I'm in Bangkok

Must do for Bangkok trip. I had memorable trip with my wife.If you are in Bangkok you must do this. Amazing is a little word for this tour. Our guide Tob is a great guy... Follow me gives best class service too...

perfect way to discover bangkok. This is my second ride with follow me and it was as exciting as the first, myself and a friend choose the bangkok city tour which is a four hour tour of temples markets and other little treasures around bangkok.Having done this ride before I was expecting the same things but to my surprise the tour had changed a little so I was kept excited throughout plus the weather was a lot kinder on this trip which is why I wanted to do it again.Not wanting to give to much away I will skip to the end. B B Q well deserved and very tasty.thanks guys at follow me I will see you again soon...

Fantastic Historic Bangkok. What a fantastic way to spend a leisurely 4 hours. We rode in places that you would not normally go to,almost in peoples back yards. A great cultural & history lesson on the city of Bangkok. We would recommend this tour to anyone wanting to really get into the culture of the Thailand capital. You don't need to be super fit, just a little confident riding a bike as some of the lanes were very narrow & you may encounter the odd motorbike or Tuk Tuk coming towards you, however in the Thailand way it all just works.

10 thumbs up if i have 10 !!!. Given how much I suck at cycling, it was a huge achievement how I finished a tour with Follow Me! I'm not sure how I did it. Maybe the relaxing club house gave me the first bit of strength. And everyone was nice enough to not laugh at me picking a children's bike. (Feel less nervous on a shorter bike.) Not to mention Tob, our lovely tour guide, encouraged me from time to time with his big bright smile. Anyway, it was not as scary as I thought it would be. The traffic was okay. (It was a sunday, maybe that's why.) I was usually at the back of the line, but Tob would always make sure I was following and that I was doing okay. We got to see some temples, ride on a ferry, drink cola from a plastic bag with ice... how cool is that? Oh, did I forget to mention the fantastic BBQ food prepared for us at the club house after the tour? LOVE IT !In all, it's a great day. I brought home with me some bruises, (I'm sure it's just me.....) together with a lot of lovely pictures and a big smile on my face. Thank you so much, Follow Me, I would definitely come again when I visit Bangkok next time. (If you guys are willing to take me, that is...)HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! IF I CAN DO IT, SO CAN YOU! LOL~~~~~

Great way to see Bangkok. I joined one of the afternoon groups and was in a small group, starting on my own which was fine by me as I had 2 personal guides! I was looked after very well and got to see a side of Bangkok most tourists never would. It was a lot of fun going around the back alley ways of Bangkok and taking in all the sights and smells of a normal day in the city. I would not hesitate to recommend this tour for anyone looking to experience the real Bangkok and you'll be looked after by Ray and his team.

Don't miss it!. We were in Bangkok for 2 days and 1 night. We were told to go on the bike tour from people we met in Koh Samui, and we were so thrilled we did. Professional, yet friendly team. The bikes were first class, Trek bikes, I chose the big comfy seat (no sore bum at the end!).
