The time just flew really quickly, it was such an incredible way to see Bangkok, the sights, colours, smells right in your face. We went through markets down little side streets it was such an adventure. I am not fit and I found this so easy. Even the heat of Bangkok was not a problem. You hardly go on the main roads either so driving with crazy traffic was not a problem. Our tour guide Tob was knowledgeable, and such a friendly beautiful guy. I recommend this tour to anyone who can ride a bike, young or old, dont miss a chance to see Bangkok away from the tourist sites. And such good value!!

Really enjoyed this tour!!!. We setup our Follow Me tour online and received a confirmation email almost immediately. We had no problem in finding the club house and were off and riding through the streets of Bangkok in no time. This is a great way to see the back streets and off the beaten path places. These people are really friendly and informative. I give this tour 5 stars - and I usually don't like guided tours.

So fun you don't even feel the distance or time!. Found this on TripAdvisor and it sounded really interesting. So when I visited Bangkok this March, I knew I had to try it. Joined the 8am Siam Boran tour and had to find my way via BTS from my hotel in Phaya Thai. The map provided was very simple to use and I found my way to the Clubhouse no sweat! Greeted with friendly smiles and coffee, the day started out right!The bikes used are in very good condition and made navigation easy. Treated to the sights, smells and many smiles of Bangkok as we went along the narrow alleys, it was a unique way to see Bangkok and the way people went about their daily lives. Touched alot of areas where we would never see if we went on our own. A considerable level of bike navigation skills is needed as you will be meandering through heavy traffic and very narrow streets/alleys. Other than that, the ride was breezy and relaxing. A friendly and lovely guide topped off the day! Would love to go back for the other tours if I have the chance.

Great trips in Thai :]. I took the Boran and the Sawan trip in 3 days. I will not come back for the Sawan in the morning of my departure date if Follow Me did not give me an excellent experience 2 days before that.  You can have a totally different way travelling in Thailand.  The Boran trip brings you into the local lives of Thai people. You will pass through the wholesales market and different styles of temples in Bangkok.  The Sawan trip let you enjoy the beauty of nature, the fresh air and the peaceful atmosphere which you cannot find in Bangkok. I was so lucky that I can have private tours in both dates. Their great arrangement is highly recommended. Experienced tour guides give you sense of security when you pass through narrow allies, busy roads and even rough roads. They are considerate as they will look after you very well during the trip.  You will gain a lot with an attractive price.  Go and try it!

I Couldn't wipe the smile off my face. My friend and I (from Melbourne) stayed 3 nights in Bangkok and decided to do the Siam Heaven afternoon bike tour. The reason I chose" Follow me "tours to begin with ,was because it was obvious it offered something different , it just seemed like a more personal choice .. after travelling a while you can get sick of the generic tours on offer. We were very impressed with this tour , leaving a lasting imprint to start off 2 weeks in Thailand and must say it was one of the fondest memories we have of our trip,such a fantastic way to see so many different sides of Bangkok. Our guide Vincent was terrific with a great sense of humor and we had a small group of 4 which was just perfect.the 25km ride was a breeze ( and this is coming from someone who isn't too fond of bike riding as exercise) the bikes I'm sure have a lot to do with it .. great suspension , gender personalized and even a comfy seat =) Vincent made sure to take lots of photo's which is fantastic for anyone not keen on taking a camera (there are little bags on the bike if you are keen) these photo's are then emailed to you to look back on .Dinner after the tour was great , even providing for us vegetarians in the group which was very much appreciated and unexpected.I will have no hesitation doing another of "Follow me " bike tours when I return to Bangkok in the future and I highly recommend them as a tour company.. Great Value and Great Fun !!! "which way Vincent"? =)

Combined Food + Bike tour. We took a combined Food + Bike tour.It was food tour in the morning & bike tour in the afternoon.Amazing sites to see! Biking in the narrow streets of Bangkok is a whole new experience! Excellent, well maintained bikes were used. We traveled a total of 22 km, but it was not much tiring. We were served drinks, water, snacks & also a dinner at the follow me guest house. Complimentary Fish Spa is an excellent way to relax after the tour.Points to improve- More briefing required on bike handling before the tour starts.Minor point- The guide needs to improve upon his english & was a bit lacking in knowledge.We promptly received the tour photos.A very good bike tour. Excellent value for money.

Highlight of our trip!. We travelled to thailand in November for our honeymoon and while we were in Bangkok we did this tour. It was by far one of the most memorable highlights of the trip. Book with confidence! The tour is awesome on bikes and it really takes you through the real Bangkok. Not to mention that they send you the pictures taken on the tour by email at no costs. Great tour!
The other side of Bangkok. Ask for the tour away from the traditional tourist route. We went through the places people live, stopped whenever we we would to to how the Thai live.

Awesome tour, a must do in Bangkok!. Well i accidently stumbled on this bike tour when I saw a load of cyclists and asked where to hire bikes from, and one american guy gave me the number for the tour. So I called them up and booked the tour for the next day with my friend aswell. We then arrived at the Follow Me tour place around midday as the tour didnt start until 13:00h. Its a very peaceful club house and we got a feel of the bikes as its a 4hr tour so I chose the one with a comfy seat. They have choices which is excellent. The tour guide was Thai but he spoke excellent English and we rode through the back streets taking in the local life of Bangkok, a far cry from 5 star hotels but i was captivated. Everyone had a smile, rich or poor and they all waving to us while we were riding through busy markets and along the streets whilst stopping off for some fresh mango and pineapple and grilled pork skewers! Awesome! We also visited temples and other places of importance within 4hrs. I learnt a lot. You would not get to see this Bangkok life with hotel tours as they would only take u to tourist hot spots. The tour guide also captured some good fotos of us and we get the fotos emailed to us the next day. After the tour, we went back to clubhouse where we were treated to a fish foot spa (needed after 4hrs riding) and a BBQ. A very tasty BBQ at that with a few Singha beers. The trip organiser was a Dutch guy called Ray. A friendly chap with a weird sense of humour!! The clubhouse was very relaxing and peaceful, and I smoked a nice big Romeo and Juliet cigar. It was just what was needed after a great day. There are a few bike tours in Bangkok but i would recommend Follow Me as a MUST to do in Bangkok. Not just because of the tour itself, but because of the staff, the BBQ after, fish spa and the funny Dutch guy! All this for 1,000 THB! (£20GBP).

Amazing Bicycle Tour!!!!. This is my first trip to Bangkok and what wonderful way to explore the city by bike. You get a first hand taste of all the sights, sounds and smells of the city which is far better than any other mode of transportation avail (tuk tuk, cab, or sky train). I did the Siam Boran - Siam Historical tour which took around 5 hours. The bike ride was super casual and at an easy pace. Basic bike handling skills required... being an avid cyclist this was no problem but be aware that the tour weaves through narrow alley ways, markets and sometimes sharing the road with other vehicles. The tour guide was very helpful and accommodating and we took water/snack breaks along the route as needed. I would highly recommend it and would go back and do the other tours.

having loads of fun!. Another good choice touring around the city!
Spending good time with sunshine, loads of fun! + Nice guide! :)
Highly recommend to friends!

A delightful/marvelous way to discover the "real" Bangkok!. We just discovered Follow Me Tours: spent an eye opening and brilliant day cycling around colorful Bangkok! Safe, Fun, Inspiring, simply great! After 7 months here we feel like we finally got to see the real bangkok. Thanks to Follow Me team who are great and the super guide who made this the best day. We loof forward to bringing our friends and family!

An amazing 22km biking experience. It was a great experience and something I would recommend to anyone. The guides were friendly and spoke excellent English. We got right up close and personal with the locals and Bangkok's infamous traffic. Despite the intimidating traffic, it was a great way to see the local lifestyle and experience the hospitality of Thailand. Be warned, the tour requires a moderate level of fitness and skills on a bike. The path can be narrow, crowded, with 90 degree turns. Overall it's was a great experience; one that I would do again and recommend to others.

Memorable experience. - Excellent bike tour- Interesting route in Bangkok- back allies you would never see on your own- well organized- friendly tour guide- nice club house with beer and free internet connection available- morning tour was not hot- Sunday ideal as there is no much traffic
Good to try!. Recently I have been join the follow me tour, it was a city tour. It was great experience that let me know more of the city!
Exciting, unique and fun :). It was a great tour to experience Bangkok in a very local way...sth different other than shopping shopping shopping. Highly recommended for family!!
Great tour (historic one). I had a great half day with follow me in Bangkok. I reccmmand this tour to anyone. Great way to disover the small roads.

great way to view Thailand but be wary of street traffic. Tob , our tour guide was very adeptat navigating the city terrain that is inner city Bangkok. However, caveat empor, this is a bit of a challenge for those not use to being on a bicycle for approximately fourhours. You will learn a lot about the city's history but just make sure you keep your eyes focused on the traffic all around this great metropolis. Overall a great time but very tired from the bike ride.

Lot of fun. Family with two kids (9 and 14 yo), first trip to Bangkok. After a couple of days doing some sightseeing on our own, we took the half-day bike tour with Follow Me. It was great. We got to see some less known places, small back streets, the flower market, etc... and also recognize some of the places we had already visited and thus form a good picture of what Bangkok offers. Highly recommended.

Fantastic way to see life in the Big Mango. We were a little worried we’d find Bangkok a little overwhelming coming from a country whose population is comparatively small, but doing this tour made visiting Bangkok so accessible. We’d read reviews for other bike tours but what attracted us to Follow Me were the little ‘extras’ like the free wifi, BBQ lunch, fish spa (which I found too ticklish), and amazing ‘action’ photos. We’re so glad we booked with Follow Me, we enjoyed the narrow winding alleys, the ferry across the river, being able to see people going about their daily business, the old customs house now being used for firemen and their families, and seeing Tosakan the tenfaced guardian at Wat Arun. At times it felt like sensory overload, all five senses titillated and assaulted at the same time.Tob our guide took great care of us – he was patient with those of us (me) who are a little slower, knowledgeable, witty, friendly, and sanuk! His photography skills are to be commended too as I’m sure most of the pictures he took were taken whilst cycling and guiding us safely round Bangkok’s narrow alleys and busy streets. As people have mentioned in previous reviews it’s a good way to cover a lot of ground whilst still taking in some of the major sights. Although there were a few busier streets we still felt quite safe, possibly that’s because we’re used to a country that is not kind to cyclists, at least in Bangkok traffic users are more accommodating. Communication when setting up our tour was speedy and informative, the instructions to the clubrooms provided enough detail for us (or rather our motorcycle taxis) to easily find our way, and Follow Me provided helpful instructions on how to get to the BTS for our return trip… and thanks again Ray for sending ALL the high res copies of the pictures Tob took!Next time we visit Bangkok we’re calling in to Follow Me for another trip.NB: the bikes are very comfortable, I have a Dutch Oma bike which is also a very comfy ride but the Follow Me seats are even better, almost tempted if I weren't so attached to upright cycling ;)

Totally worth it. My wife and I took the Siam Sawan tour with Tob, the guide. She absolutely loved to see the other kind of life in the winding backstreets of Bangkok and the park area with elevated pathways. We got an exclusive tour, as we were the only participants in the group. Tob is very attentive and seems to know the area inside out. The traffic was as bad as it ever gets, as it was a Monday morning. However, by following Tob's lead, it felt relatively safe to navigate through those couple of short main street legs before getting to quieter roads.On the way back to the base, we were honored to meet the son of the former prime minister of Thailand, who maintains his father's legacy house. This was quite unexpected, even Tob looked a bit surprised by the encounter. Back in the base, the fish spa was a thrilling experience.If I try to find anything on the con side, perhaps my bicycle could use some adjustment. Did not notice the sticky gears, sliding handlebar and sloping seat before we were under way. It was a minor issue, really, as the pace was easy and the terrain was flat. I ride with bicycle a lot at home, and could have done this trip pedaling with my hands. The narrow allys and sharp corners present some physical challenge to the trip, though.

so good i went back and did it all again.. I initially went on this tour with my younger brothers as a way to see the sights and be active at the same time. We saw so much more than I expected - I feel like I know how people live in Bangkok and have seen the way of life. I had so much fun I went back with another friend a few weeks later. There is no real cycling path in the city tour which can be challenging but was one of the reasons I loved the tour. Thanks to the guys and especially Tob, guide extraordinaire, for a few great days out.

Great fun! See the real Bangkok! Beats the tour bus anytime!. Took the Siam Aharn Boran tour comprising:Morning food walk with Bangkok Food Tours - rated separatelyAfternoon bike tour - Cycled historical sites, temples, Chinatown, etc.Wear shoes - no slippers allowed at Wat Pho temple. Sunblock + sunglasses + hat + light clothing, waist pouch/backpack.The GOOD: Super fun, exciting, great route + guide (Tob). I've been to Bangkok 5-6 times and I think this is a great way to see the 'normal' way of Bangkok life.The BAD: Nothing! If I had to nitpick, I would prefer a softer bike seat - my butt hurt for 2 days. But not taking anything away from the guys, it was worth the pain!Will definitely do it again when I visit Bangkok again in 2013!

Pretty good but a few caveats. I took the Sawan (Prapadeang) tour on a Sunday with 4 other people and one guide. The company was easy to work with and provided a nice facility to relax in as well as a bar-b-q lunch after the half day tour. The instructions on finding the meeting point were reasonably clear. I had been somewhat concerned about the viability of daytime cycling in 30+ degrees in Bangkok but this really was not an issue, the cycling was gentle, the breeze from the air movement was refreshing and we were not very often in unprotected sun. The tour started by going through some interesting backstreets and urban communities before reaching the river for a short boat ride. This was followed by an hour or so along raised concrete pathways though a semi-cultivated banana plantation. While these 1-2 meter-high pathways made progress through a very wet area possible, they do require some basic cycling skill and it is not hard to imagine a novice rider coming to grief. The park itself, the final destination, is elegant and pleasant. A stop at a "traditional Thai house" on the way back was delightful, not least as a picturesque wedding was going on in the gardens. The price was very reasonable, but I would suggest a beginner start with a different tour.

Do this!. The best way by far to see Bangkok. Our guide took us all over Bangkok from one end to the other. We rode for 4 hours and saw so much! We went along narrow alleyways, along major streets, through parks, across the road, across the river and through Chinatown and the markets. It was a little bit scary riding on the main roads with all the traffic but I just worried about myself and let the traffic go round me. After all that time I was still able to walk the next day as the seats on the bikes are very comfortable. We were very lucky as we were the only 2 on the tour so had a personal tour with our guide. We felt really pleased with ourselves whenever we went somewhere later and realised that we had been there on our bikes. We did this tour on our first day in Bangkok and it was a good way to get to know the city.

So much fun. We did the morning city tour and loved it. Recommend doing this on the beginning of your travel. It gave a great overview of the city and was a nice break for our feet! I am not great on a bike and did just fine. It was so much fun to see the city this way. Vincent was our guide and really made this trip special. He took loads of pictures, which were shared with us at no extra cost. We went into a couple boats, into a couple smaller temples, a church and a few other places. It wasn't strenuious as there was a lot of stopping throughout the city. We had a snack about midway of the trip. Great organization, high quality bikes and felt safe. We had a great meal back at the clubhouse. Great experience.

Great Way to Spend Time in Bangkok. Never having been to Bangkok, this was the first thing we did and we loved it. Ranked right up there with seeing the Grand Palace. Our guides were fabulous, the sites we saw were so interesting, and the bikes and clubhouse were fantastic. I was a little worried about traffic, but very little time is actually spent on busy roads, so it was not a problem at all (drivers in Bangkok are really good). We loved touring thru the narrow streets and alleys, along the river and taking the ferry. I felt like we got to see the 'real' Bangkok this way and again, the host and guides were fabulous. You should be in fair-good shape and comfortable with biking to do this trip, as it does take up 4 hours. If we ever get back to Bangkok, I'd do another one of their trips for sure.

Perfect morning in Bangkok with Historical Tour. We enjoyed our tour with Tob every minute! The welcoming at the clubhouse is very nice (cute doggie! & Dave), coffee, introduction, bike selection - here we go! The pace was great, we saw things a normal tourist would NEVER see and we were astonished that we did a tour of 20km without any drama! Tob took great care of us! After the tour there is a little barbeque and you can experience the lovely garden and the fish spa! Hilarious! This company is very recommended by us!

A way to see Bangkok.... A great way to see Bangkok through small lanes and roads. Visiting amazing and beautiful buildings and temples and churches that you would never be able to find on your own without TOB, our bicycle guide. Very challenging and nerve wrecking for me on main roads and negotiating roundabouts but a good experience. My husband and children really enjoyed it - guess they are better cyclists than me!!! It's a must do when you are in Bangkok.

Do this first!. We did a 1/2 day through China town and other sights in Bangkok. We saw so much in 4 hours! We had walked the previous day and not seen 1/4 of what we say on this tour. The whole staff was VERY accommodating, friendly and helpful. Nice equipment, good pace, safety conscious. Vincent (our guide) gave us a great snapshot of Bangkok.

An unforgettable experience-biking off the beaten paths of Bangkok. Both tours (Siam Boran and Siam Sawan) give an authentic insight of daily life in Bangkok-you are biking through bustling markets, narrow lanes, silent streets and beautiful parks. Busy streets are carefully avoided by the cautious tour guide Tob or if necessary he will guide you safely through them. Crossing the river either by ferry or by longtail boat is another highlight of each tour. The bikes are modern and working properly, helmets and water are provided. If you need you can get an insurance for your adventure (remember your passport no). Take a printout of the map of the homepage of Follow Me Bike Tours and follow the clear instructions and you will find them easily. The Siam Sawan tour is physically more demanding and is rather for trained bikers.

Fun ride back to hotel (by taxi). The staffs are very polite and helpful, bikes are cool. especially after an exhausting ride which I gave up after a 2hr ride and they still want me to move on, I just can't man. So Bond took me back to office, but still it was another 1hr ride, I mean holly cow. I will train myself to be at olympic level to reattend this exploration of self discovery of energy level. I mean man, I have to drag myself back on taxi. I suggest moderate level biker to "follow me" instead, get on tax instead. Path r much straight forward than the zic zac pathway

Free delicious BBQ, fish spa and snacks!. No complaints at all, the whole package was very extensive from the moment we arrived to when we left. Included was a complimentary fish spa, beverages on arrival, bike hire, water, and 4 hour bike tour which was the perfect blend of seeing great back road sites while also getting a good workout. When we got back we were greeted with an ice cold refresher towel and were then treated to a delicious BBQ dinner. That wasn't all... during the tour our guide took a lot of photos, and these were emailed to us and also uploaded to facebook so that we can always remember the tour... highly recommend!

Unique way to see the sights of Bangkok. This was truly the best part of my trip to Bangkok. Right from when I booked the tour on their website I got a prompt reply confirming my tour. All the queries asked on email were all answered without any delay. I lost my way to the club on the day of the tour and reached the place 10/15 minutes late but Ray and team made me comfortable and we started the tour thereafter. The Boron tour that I took was great on which you ride trough narrow lanes, markets (fruit, vegetable & flower), many historical sites and cross the beautiful river once over the first bridge of Bangkok and later on a ferry. One of the highlights of our tour was visiting a school on their sports day. I enjoyed watching children participate in different events and their fellow mates cheering them. Our tour Guide was great, explaining everything on our way, helping us cross busy roads with ease and taking many beautiful pictures which were later sent through email and was uploaded on the facebook. After the tour they served superb BBQ lunch let us relax with fish spa. I highly recommend this tour.

Great experience!. I highly recommend this bike tour to anyone who wants to see Bangkok through the eyes of the locals.The tour takes you through alley ways, markets, ferries, temples and on and on. It is the best way to see Bangkok and I would have never seen this side of the city if it wasn't for the bike tour. What was great as well is that you stay away from the busy streets and the obvious 'tourist traps'.The tour guides were fun and spoke english, included in the package was a great barbeque after the tour was over and a fish foot spa, which was a great way to cool off your feet after a day of biking.Great job Follow Me Bike Tours!

Everyone, young and old loved this tour - exciting and fun!. I am a 60 y.o. woman, and travelled with two family members 19 and 22, boy and girl. We all bike for recreational and practical purposes on a daily basis. We took the Historic tour combined with the canal boat tour. What an absolutely enjoyable day. We found the bike trip through back allies, side streets, tiny walking allies between buildings and even places marked for bike paths, just about the most interesting and FUN activity we had ever had ( in our lives!). Requires excellent balance and confidence on a bike - lots of narrow places with curves, twists and turns, but just a wonderful, wonderful experience. Full of insights into cultural aspects of Bangkok. The canal boat ride in the middle of the day was a strong contrast.... quiet, calm and leisurely. We also went into the small "back street" canals around Bangkok. Interesting too - nice combination. The bike ride was on 99% flat terrain, the last 20 minutes through slow-moving but heavy traffic. Maybe not suitable for young children. Ask the tour operators about alterative return routes if travelling with young children. We came back, devoured super delicious BBQ food and I was ready for a new trip, and just soooo sorry I had no more time to do all their trips. Now I am planning my next trip to Thailand, no longer hating Bangkok, just can't wait to do another trip with Follow Me. Our leaders were very confident and able, handled ushering us across zebra crossings in busy streets very well. We felt we were in very good hands. Tour guides spoke English quite well and showed they cared about our well-being. I have been travelling to Thailand for 32 years and have only on one other occassion (Chaing Mai) had anywhere near so much fun in an urban area. I am going to go on the Heaven tour as well as repeat this tour on my next visit!

Fantastic way to see Bangkok. This guided bike tour of Bangkok was great fun (albeit scary at times as we weaved in and out of heavy Bangkok traffic) because we were escorted to tiny streets and alleys around the city we never would have seen otherwise. We saw a local produce market, China own, some temples, a school yard and many other neat things. I loved the way our guide managed to stop heavy traffic using a shrill whistle and he was great at leading us and taking pictures all throughout the day. Aside from the bicycle tour, they also include a stop for snacks, the fee to get on the ferry and a great bbq lunch in a peaceful, serene setting. This is a tremendous value for the money and one I highly recommend. I love that they posted the photos on Facebook and also sent them to us in an email within 24 hours. All around great. A++++
Great Experience. We did the tour with Follow Me Bike Tours and almost were happy, the scenery along the way was great, our guide was informative and well took care us.Thanks

The Best way to see the real Bangkok away from the Malls. I have done the Siam Boran tour 2x in 6 months and would highly recommend it for visitors and residents alike. As a resident of Bangkok it took me to places I didn't know existed, through many narrow backstreets and local communities. They minimise the amount of time on main roads and are very safety conscious with the group. There is always something interesting and different to see around every corner "Top" the Thai guide is so enthusiastic and knowledgeable, really excellent. The bikes are the best I have come across in Thailand-well maintained and comfortable and they will even add a child seat for small kids and have helmets if you want them. They also give you water.I have also been on a similar tour with another company and it was almost 2x the price: the guides were jaded, the bikes were not maintained & even had rusty workings, we spent too much time on busy roads and they did not keep control of the group for safety. Quite the opposite is true for Follow Me.The route is flat all the way for is easy for anyone. The only hairy bit is near the end where it is necessary to cycle along a busy road(unavoidable in Bangkok). When you return they even give you a BBQ lunch (fairly basic and no good for vegetarians, but a great gesture) and you can use their fish spa for free. You can relax at their clubhouse for as long as you like afterwards, in their quiet neighbourhood. Tip: To get there make sure you get the map for the clubhouse as it can be hard to find at first because people keep stealing their signs! It is actually walking distance from Chong Nonsi BTS.

Unique Experience. My partner and I recently did an afternoon bike tour of Bankok with "Follow Me Bike Tours" and we had a great time. We arrived a little earlier but we were greeted by owner and founder Ray who we chatted to forever and he made us feel very welsome. The bikes were in very good condition and they take the time before you leave to measure you up to your bike, adjust the seat, check and service brakes and tyres and ensure you are comfortable and ready to go. Tob was our guide and he spoke great English and is like a human GPS. He was very informative of the attractions and sights and our safety was his number 1 priority. Tob took some great photos of us while riding our bikes weaving in and out of the lane ways, markets and china town and we stopped a few times where Tob brought us snacks and drinks. It really was a Unique experience weaving in and out of traffic, markets and laneways you wouldnt even thought existed. After the trip we arrived back where Tob had brought us Thai food for dinner. I cant say enough about this tour. If you are looking for something different this is a must. You only need a little co-ordination not much fitness as its pretty relaxed pace.

Wow. This was one of the coolest experiences on our trip to Thailand. Prepare to bike on back roads, through markets, along rivers, through temples, next to motorcycles and cars on busy roads, and just about everywhere a bike will fit (sometimes barely).Our guide, Tob, was absolutely outstanding. On a tour like this, you need someone who is control of the situation at all times and Tob pulled it off very well. He was great at explaining the history of some of the sites, as well as stopping here and there to buy snacks and drinks for the group.I will say that this tour undersold the trip a little by saying you only bike on back roads. We hit rush hour on the way back and definitely were biking down some busy Bangkok roads for parts of the tour. I quickly learned that this is not the US where you have a 5-foot wide "bike lane" to ride in - you are inches from cars whizzing by you and can feel the exhaust on your legs. This will be terrifying or exhilarating depending on the person on the bike, but everyone seems to make it through safely. Upon your return to the "clubhouse", you are greeted by a delicious BBQ meal and a fish spa to unwind. Even with the craziness, I highly recommend this tour and Tob as a guide. Its an experience you will not forget.

A special way to see Bangkok city. I used to take Sky Train and taxi for sightseeing Bangkok, but this time by taking a bike, I saw a different Bangkok. The tour I picked is Siam Boran, which took me to a number of temples, church, inside China town, seeing crocodiles and etc... I don't think I can go such many interesting places in 4 hours w/o the effort from Follow Me Bike. Especially a big thanks to Vincent for his extra care on me! I know I was troublesome enough.. sorry to bother and appreciate for your patient :)After the half day tour, Ray and the staff already prepared a nice meal for us. And he especially prepared foods for my veggie diet. How nice they're!I see you just bought a folding bike. I will try it next time :)

Best trip in Bangkok!. Don't walk, but run to Follow Me Bike Tours. It is, without question, the best way to see Bangkok. You'll go through local neighborhoods and tiny streets, mini markets you'd never visit without your guide. Our guide was incredibly knowledgable about the city and the nicest guy. His knowledge of the tiniest side streets was incredible! Absolutely amazing!

See the inside of Bangkok, fun day with great guide.. Friends recommended this tour and I will state it was the best and most fun tour I've done. It took us through places in Bangkok that you just would not find on your own the first time around. Afterwords I felt like I had gotten a true snap-shot of this amazing city. Our guide "Tob" was great and knowledgeable and lots of fun. Next time in Bangkok I'll take the Jungle Tour.

Best tour I've ever taken - hands down. A must do!!!. Follow me bike tours is a really worthwhile way to familiarise yourself with Bangkok. It's a vibrant city with a million backstreets and markets that these guys know like the back of their hands. You'd never experience the real Bangkok any other way. It was genuinely the most authentic, exciting and visceral tourist experience I've ever hand (and I travel a lot). I'm definitely going back again next time I'm there. I really can't recommend it enough.The staff are very friendly and even took pictures of our trip as we cycled the city and gave them to us at no extra cost.Top marks for a fantastic service by fantastic people. It really exceeded my wildest expectations and I couldn't believe how much of an experience you get for what is a really tiny amount of money for the attention to detail and memories you'll make!

Fantastic tour. After visiting Bangkok many times this was a different tour entirely. See what most tourists miss. The guide was brilliant - Tob. What an ambassador for his country and company, with a heart of gold too. The short time on the main road was a little "exhilarating" and the alleys in the markets were tight! All added to the experience. Fabulous photos are emailed to you in record time. A great BBQ after your return too. Super value for money. I can't wait to return to do another tour. This company deserves to do well. Thanks to all!

Great way to see Bangkok on a bike tour, with Follow me. I can't believe that takin a bike tour with " Follow Me Bike Tours" was going to me my favorite part of my trip to Bangkok. but it was. It started with a very well kept facility, anda very pleasant and interesting staff. The owners and guide were most pleasant and a pleasure to meet. The bikes were easy to use with great extra cushion seat, which were comfortable from start to finish. The tour itself was most enjoyable, it showed all the wonders of the city, from the city streets to the jungles,and a boat ride across the river to it's beautiful temples, and most fun to me its markets, all from the seat of bike. I couldnt ask for a better way to view the city of Bangkok. A MUST, if you truly want to view all aspects of the city. Thumbs Up to Follow Me Bike Tour, from Rodger in Virginia Beach, VA. USA

Highlight of our Bangkok trip!. We took the Siam Historical tour while on our honeymoon in Bangkok, with Tob as our tour guide. He took us to places we would not have seen or experienced had we not been guided by a local, and we had a blast! We felt very safe and in good hands, and Tob was very knowledgeable about all of the places he took us too. He also took tonnes of photos during the tour that were emailed to us, which we were very happy about. The tour went for about 4 hours, but it wasn't tiring at all as plenty of stops are made along the way. At the end of the tour, since it was only the two of us (not enough people for the BBQ buffet), Tob went and picked us up a couple of local dishes and rice, which was delicious! We highly recommend Follow Me Bike Tour, it is worth every penny!Side note: it was a bit hard finding the place, we got a bit lost, but printable instructions/map are available on their website which we should have used...

An Unforgettable Experience. Bangkok is a diverse and exciting city but many tours choose to focus solely on the beaten track and shield you from “the real Bangkok”. So my wife and I did a half day tour with Follow Me and it was one of the best things we did in our entire stay in Thailand.Our guide was very friendly, knowledgeable and spoke good English. The owner, Ray, has a real passion for the city and for Thai culture and this comes across in the tour.We cycled through markets, narrow streets and were led to stunning views that we never would have had the opportunity to witness had we not done the tour. We also took the tour in late November 2011 shortly after the flooding. It seems the tourist areas of Bangkok had been protected by the floods and were it not for this tour taking us off the regular tourist trail we would not have seen the true effects of the floods on the city. The image if a lady cooking in her kitchen with water above her knees is an image that affected me and will stay with me forever; without ‘Follow Me’ I wouldn’t have had the opportunity to see another side of this wonderful city. Truly stunning.

Absolutely the best way to explore Bangkok's city culture!. Ray, the owner, and his staff greeted us upon our arrival and offered coffee and water. Our 2 tour guides Tob and Prae did an outstanding job of narrating the trip. They allowed us to take plenty of pictures. The people of Bangkok were extremely friendly, especially if you greeted them. it was a fun experience to ride through the markets and see first hand how the Thai people live and work. I would highly recommend to anyone visiting Bangkok. It was also nice at the end to sit in a peaceful garden. The bar-b-q and friendly conversation at the end were an added benefit. Thanks Ray, Tob, and Prae!

I'm going again, this tour is the best.. I've been on several bike tours 2 in Bangkok and several in Europe. The reason I do the bike tours is because its the best and nicest way to see the city. Trust me I travel a lot! The follow me bike tour is out of this world. Its the second one I've been on in Bangkok. The other company was so bad. I will be putting a review up for them later and they deserve it. With the follow me tours they have a club house where you all meet up and return to. The other tours seem to make you wait at the side of the street where you are getting hassled by locals who seem to think your lost and want to take you else where. Everyone will turn up late and by that time I wasn't keen on doing anything. With follow me bike tours I was sitting at the Club house having some cool water talking with the guide who was making sure I was happy with the bike etc. The tours are very interesting and the guides speak great english. There was one called "Top" i think his name was he was excellent. The bikes seem to be all new and very conferrable. I was happy after the tour we went back to the Club house for the free BBQ really tasty chicken, there was no rush to leave like the other tour companies. There were around 6 in our group we were all happy. I'm going to do another tour with them when I get back from Phuket. Thanks Guys for a great time.
See hidden Bangkok!. Great offer and tours with experienced local guides. You'll see hidden streets and markets wich you'd never see as a "normal" tourist. I had a great time - thanks again :)

Super Experience!. My partner and I decided to give this tour a shot and we were so pleased. It was a superb workout cycling through BKK, visiting famous attractions and hidden places that we don't otherwise get to see. We did the 'historical tour' that started in the afternoon.It took us a bit of effort to find the place, then we phoned Follow Me and they sent a staff to locate us and bring us to their office.Its very thoughtful of them to have refreshments for us when we arrived. After we freshend up and got ready with our bicycles and got goin. The tour guide was very informative and kept filling us with info. The Ride was quite a workout.. (some of them in the group suffered from a 'soar bum' towards the end of the trip lol..) The guide also made sure that we had refreshments along the way and a constant supply of packaged drinking water.On our return to the Follow Me office we were surprised with a barbeque and a fish spa. In all it was a very memorable experience with loads of fun!PS. I would reccommend that the participants of the tour be given a leaflet of the places that they are scheduled to visit prior to the tour. I personally think that it would help reconcile the experience.

Fantastic way to see a different side of Bangkok. We did a full day tour with these guys and had a blast! In the morning we did the half day walking Food Tour of Bangkok city and in the afternoon we did the City Biking Tour. We have been to Bangkok a load of times but this was a different side of the city and a really fun way to see the "real" Bangkok! We covered a lot of ground int the tour & saw heaps of different areas of the city. The guys at Follow Me are fantastic, great bunch of people. The BBQ at the end of the biking tour was well received by all! Thanks for a great day out.Prue & Brian, Australia, Dec 2011.

highly recommended! go go go!. first time trying out a bike tour overseas and it's an excellent experience ... many thanks to ray and his team.-- in case you are not interested in reading any further and want to book immediately ... PRINT THE MAP! PRINT THE MAP! PRINT THE MAP! -- http://www.followmebiketour.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/followmeclubhouse.pdfthe clubhouse was a little bit difficult to find (perhaps placing more signboards along main roads would be helpful). the bikes were in good condition. no worries on the equipments.now for the tour - me and my partner went together for the Siam Historical Tour. we planned for the afternoon bike tour to be on the first day of our travel itinerary but was worried that we might arrive late so sent an email before arrival to check whether we could still join their tour on that day. email response was fast and assuring. however, due to flight delay in Singapore and bangkok jam, by the time we arrived at our hotel, it was already too late for the tour, so we immediately asked the hotel concierge to call and cancel that day's bike tour. when i later personally called to reschedule for a morning tour the day after, i was very surprised at how well they answered our queries (in english) over the phone ... after meeting ray and his partner at the clubhouse (then i understood) =Di initially thought that the tour would be "easy" but i think difficulty level is relative. well, it's easy as in we used roads and not trail, travelled on flats and not slopes but the tough part was the narrow back lanes and motorists (i don't think this is any fault of the tour operators because their tour purpose IS to show the back lanes and minimise the use of main roads) ... so this is more of a expectation guide for others who intend to take up this tour and fully enjoy it - you should be quite comfortable with bike balance and proficient in bike control through narrow passageways, along uneven roads and around tight corners.unfortunately, my partner wasn't so comfortable and we felt bad to be slowing down the whole group, so she decided to head back to the club house after a quarter of the way (led back safely by ray's partner ... so sorry i didn't manage to get your name)along the way, we manage to see many sights (markets, churches, temples, historical buildings, etc) and crossed the ferry twice (once at Tha Thien to go to Wat Arun and second time on return trip back from Tak Sin Pier to Sathorn Pier)during the tour, our guide was great in providing us with opportunity with photo taking and rest stops and explaining the story and significance behind the different places, and everything chargeable was included in the tour (including ferry crossing, snacks, drinks, even toilet entry fees)overall experience - this is truly a great way to see a different side of bangkok (away from all the shopping and massage, etc) and highly recommend others to try it out as well. in fact, i think next time, i'm going to try the bike and food tourour thai guide was tom (i hope i heard his name correctly). conversant in english, friendly and helpful ... in fact, out of all the service providers that we experienced during our bangkok trip, i think he definitely deserved a tip but we forgot about it as we were in a bit of a rush after the tour. if i'm ever back in bangkok for another bike tour, you can expect a double tip from me!suggestions for improvements (my personal opinion)(1) a new route for novice riders (along wider and flatter roads), doesn't need to see that many sights(2) shorten the historic route a little (if the clubhouse location is located nearer to the pier, the route can be slightly shortened). another way is to concentrate on the sights nearer to clubhouse or travel to pier then take use the express boat to make up a part of the river journey(3) specialised maps and notes (can be used as souveniers) - during the tour, we saw so many things that it was bit difficult to know exactly where we were at any point in time. so a specially designed map will be great for review during and after the tour and it will be great if the map also contained small notes about each location passed (things/buildings to watch for) - this will make the overall experience even more enjoyablethanks again to the team at follow me bike tours for the wonderful experience and generous assistance during the tour. it was truly delightful!

It was great! Owner commitment to positive experience shows in many ways.. We arrived a few minutes late and breathless after taxi driver gave up and dropped us off in the wrong area but the reception we received at "Follow Me" was relaxed and "no worries". We were given cold drinks and a quick introduction, told not to worry about payment until we returned, and were on our way in just a few minutes. This was my 8th bike tour in Thailand in 3 years (fantastic way to see the area) but the first time with this company. Some of the things that make this company great are: A) The daily involvement of the two owners B) The fact they have a real facility and do not just meet you somewhere C) The overall friendliness of the staff D) The sturdy bicycles with nice padded seats and not those thin things that dig into you (although they can provide those if you prefer) E) The fact that everyone there speaks English F) Everything is included from admission fees to attractions to river crossing, beverages, snacks, and so forth F) The BBQ feast they provided at the end of our tour. G) The guide takes dozens of candid photos while we are riding and emails them to you after the tour; these are great since they show YOU and your friends having a good time H) Reasonable price for the tour which did not have "extras" tacked on. Our Thai guide spoke great English and was quite friendly and accommodating and would find the answers to our questions if he did not know the answer himself. At no point did he seem hurried or anxious or frustrated with our little group's quirks. My last tour was with a company that provided a different experience and you can see that review posted here as well. I could go into great detail about where we went and what we saw but that is not important as they have different tours and of course every day is different as to what you will encounter even if the route is the same. Bottom line is that this company's commitment to the guest experience is evident in everything they do and it clearly shows. You really need to take SOME type of bike tour while in or around Bangkok!

Fantastic Family Friendly Trip!. We found out about this trip through friends who thought it was great. We went with 2 children (6 and 8 years*) on the Historical Siam (plus Chinatown/ Market) trip and had a great day. The guide was very knowledgeable and took great care of us. We also had a BBQ lunch afterwards - a great way to finish. We would definitely take friends and family on these trips.*Our children have had a lot of practice riding bikes - it is not for new riders.

A brilliant and fun way to see and experience Bangkok!. My husband and I went on the China Town bike tour after a recommendation from friends who live in Bangkok who have done the tour themselves. It was an excellent way to see the City and some of the sights that we not have seen otherwise. I was slightly dubious about cycling on the busy roads but the tour guide made sure we were safe and we were given a helmet to wear so there was nothing to worry about.After the tour we cycled back to the club house where we were fed and watered and were able to us the free fish spa which was a excellent (if a little ticklish) experience.All in all a fab morning out. If I am ever in Bangkok again I would not hesitate to go on one of the other bike tours that are available.

The Only Way to See Bangkok. I would highly recommend Follow Me Bike Tours. A great way to see the city and it's daily life, eat street food, and view many of the temples across town. Ray and the whole team were very friendly, professional. Prompt communication via e-mail. Also for other travelers, we booked the afternoon session and were concerned that it may be too hot--it wasn't. You are often biking down narrow alleys in the shade with a breeze--we felt comfortable the whole time. Good exercise and fun.

Informative and exciting. Great value. From the moment I arrived was greeted with a friendly warm reception . The place has a nice atmosphere. I ended up having a private tour as late cancellations came in. I got a private tour with my young guide who was polite enthusiastic and very infomative reallyKnew his history. We went allover up and down back streets markets including Chinatown plus places of interest. Best trip so far. Some tips1- you dont need to be fit but comfortable on bike 2 - make sure to download map for driver as bit tricky to find. Also have phonenumber for driver.. Overall great tour Highly recommend it

A must-do tour of Bangkok!. If u want to see the real side of Bangkok with the help of an informative guide then this is the tour for you. The pace was relaxed & easy going & the whole tour was great from start to finish. All done in 4hrs & plenty of areas covered easily on bikes. Finished off with a fish foot massage & lunch :)

Best tour , great people , loved it.. Great trip lived it and wil def do again when I get back to Bangkok . A great bunch of lads excellent tour guide had a good laugh and very interesting and fun tour . Thanks.

Absolute must-do while in Bangkok!. This is a fantastic trip, I did the half day food half day bike trip and it was brill! Guides were super friendly and very professional and the route was awesome. You get to see areas that you wouldn't see any other way - the perfect way to see the real Bangkok! Fish spa and dinner a very nice bonus. Book it now!

Great way to see inner Bangkok. What a wonderful time! My wife & I had such a great time peddling on busy streets, alleyways, sidewalks & thru markets. A great way to spend an extra day in Bangkok! Nice Thai BBQ after the ride. Very affordable!

Something different. My friend and I went for the boran bicycle tour together with two Spanish gentlemen on November 8th. I really thought I knew Bangkok quiet well, but this trip brought us to places which we would not have found on our own. We enjoyed riding through busy markets, narrow sois and along klongs. This trip is an absolute highlight for Bangkok visitors!

If you only do one tour in bangkok, make it this one. This tour was one of the most original, insightful, and unique city tours i have ever done in my life. The sights and smells you will encounter along the perfectly laid out route will shpw you a side of bangkok that few foreigners will ever see.Top, our guide, was informative, patient, and friendly. Dave and ron the owners were fantastic,and the tour exceeded all of our expectations.Not to be missed!

I was very excited to see Bangkok by Bike!. It was easier than I thought it would be. Our ride was going through very narrow streets and alley way which is called "Soi" in Thai. I rode a lot around the Venice Beach and Santa Monica beach, but this is something else. You can see the day to day life of Bangkokians. This tour has really made me trying to get back on a bike in order to really commute the city by biking again. It will be better for the environment and our health anyway.

Great way to see another side of Bangkok!. I went already twice to Bangkok and was looking for something new, that was definitely it! Our guide Tob took us from the main streets to the small, narrow back roads and jungle! I had no idea there was a jungle only a few km away from central Bangkok. Very nice Thai lunch at the end and relaxing fish spa.

Don't hestitate!! Book it!!. Such a great idea, easy cycling, moderate fitness suggested, ask for a large comfy sadle!!. Energy snack en route & was well hydrated. Tob was great, caring, informative, amusing but his priority was your safety.We commenced our ride, easilly being guided safely through traffic, to then see deeper into Bangkok, off the tourist route, crossing the river by our bikes being easilly loaded into a long boat, to cross into the royal tranquile park with fun cycle way on a raised concrete pathway over various watery vegetation, back over the river to visit the home of Mr Kukrit Pramojo's historical residence, he was the 13th Prime Minister of Thailand, the home is an amazing visit.The off to the market to organise our lunch, catering for different tastes, back to HQ, our feet refreashed by the fish spa, whilst luch was set out for us.So would recommend this trip, not just for the sights & smells of Bangkok but to learn about the Thai culture. Ask all the questions you were eager to ask!!

Fun day, great way to see Bangkok.. A fun day out where you cover a huge amount of ground, a unique sight-seeing tour.It was very easy to organise, I did so over the phone. We were well kitted out, with the offer of helmets and sound, comfortable bikes.Tob was a pleasant and informative guide. He was conscious of our safety, answered all of our questions and gave us insight into many facts about Bangkok. It was a nice touch that refreshments, drinks and snacks, were included throughout the bike tour.Upon our return, the fish foot spa, lovely BBQ food and friendly and funny conversation were a highlight.A great day out, with nice informal environment for preparation and relaxing after the ride. I definitely recommend this to anyone who can ride a bike!

Just the job!. We very a bit apprehensive about going on a bike tour through Bangkok with our two children (14 and 10) but it was the highlight of our stay in Bangkok. We got kitted out with good bikes, helmets, water and two great tour guides. The tour was absolutely amazing and we saw the real Bangkok. We would recommend this tour to all age groups and especially for people who like to go off the beaten track. The hosts were fabulous and were overwhelmed by the hospitality and the great barbeque the owner put on after we returned from an exhausting but amazing trip. Thanks so much for the great experience. Keep up the good work!

An amazing day!. I was a little worried about doing the tour as I hadn't ridden a bike in years. Despite the old saying I still wasn't convinced. However, this is the best thing ever! I am so glad I did it. During the four hours we went through the back lanes, temples, flower, wholesale and food markets and all with no tourists. People were so extremely friendly. Some parts had a tiny bit of water running through it but it made it so much more fun. What surprised me, as it did in Cambodia, was that everyone was smiling and getting on with work. It was a terrific atmosphere and our guide Tob showed us around so many places that you wouldn't ordinarily see in a tuktuk or car. The four hours absolutely flew by. Not once was I thinking I hope it finishes soon. I am already planning my next trip doing the food tour as you pass so many food stalls. Tob was great and took us some delicacies back to try. Back at HQ we were welcomed with a stunning BBQ with beers! We stayed there for a bit eating and having a laugh. The banter was fantastic as was the food! I whole heartedly recommend this tour. Even for those who feel that they'd be happier on the back of a tuktuk being driven about.

Great way to see the real Bangkok. We went on a morning trip withTop and thoroughly enjoyed it. Comfy bikes and a great guide. There were only the two of us and we went places we didn't even know you could get a bike into- I'll never forget all the amazing smells from the China Town market stalls and shops.Lunch and a foot spa completed a fabulous trip. We'll definitely do another one on our next visit.
Fantastic trip, great hosts !. The guides were entertaining with knowledge about sites we saw and with improvised quips. A well worth it activity.

Relaxed tour in hectic Bangkok. I’ve lived in Bangkok for 12 months now and although I’ve heard of the bicycle tours in the city I had never tried one before. 3 of my friends were visiting from the U.K so we decided to take the plunge and do a bicycle tour.As I live in Sathorn, Follow Me was the natural choice as it’s so close to where I live. We decided to do the Chinatown morning tour. What I was surprised about when we arrived at Follow Me was the garden they have. It’s this awesome oriental garden with a pond and table to chill on before the tour. A total contrast to the huge buildings and busy roads you see in Bangkok.We met our tour guide and he prepped us about what can be expected on the tour. One of my friends was dubious about cycling on any main roads in Bangkok as the traffic can be crazy. She was soon put at ease by the guide and was told we’d be keeping to the back Soi’s (alleys) away from any heavy traffic.After that all I can say is the tour was awesome. We made our way to the river through all these tiny soi’s, hit Chinatown, crossed the river and went to Wat Arun, and apparently the day of our tour we got lucky as there was this Chinese vegetarian festival on. It was ace. Huge incense sticks and our guide (Tob) asked us if we’d like to stop and sample some of the food. Too right!!!! This was totally unexpected.When we got back to the clubhouse we got more food as there was BBQ waiting for us. Follow Me also have a fish spa which I didn’t check out but my friends did and they loved it.All in all a fantastic morning. Totally relaxed and stress free which I wasn’t expecting. I hope to be back for the other tours soon!

Really enjoyable bicycle tour. Together with 6 friends we bought the afternoon tour and we were welcomed with coffee and tea. After signing up for the insurance (included in the price) we selected our own bikes. The very friendly guide took us to place in Bangkok where I have never been before and I already visited Bangkok several times. At first I was afraid we would face a lot of traffic but we went through little streets, alleys and markets. When we came back they owner already started the BBQ for us, which was included in the price! After the BBQ the girls went crazy over the foot spa (included) and we went for a couple of beers, available for a very reasonable price. Was nice to hang around in their garden for a while before we went back to the hotel. My wife and I will certainly do this again! Absolutely worth the money.

Exciting and amazing experience I never can imagine before!. I have spent 4 days in Bangkok for my solo tour first time in my life :PJoining this bike tour is the activity that I was most longing for during this trip. When I arrived the club house I found that it's only me join the tour on this weekday and I feel glad that the tour wont be cancelled and still keep customer being happy. Ray, my 'private' tour guide is nice and helpful. People like me who dont get use to cycle in a city was frghthened by the busy urban street and the very beginning. Luckily that Ray was so caring and considered another route that more suitable for me.The club house is comfortable and there is a cuite kitten calls' Kitty' who welcomed me when I backed (even it's a boy !) The jounery is great and amazing. I enjoyed the bike trip so much and I can say this experience in Bangkok was really unique.p.s. Thank you so much for Ray's photo shooting!
Must-try tour in Bangkok. Great trip, great guides and great experience! Really a good way to discover another side of Bangkok at an accessible price, it's fun and memorable! Thanks followme!

Amazing Bangkok from diffrent perspective!. At the beginning we couldn’t imagine us riding a bike through the streets of Bangkok. The city was too bustling at the first sight. But then, when we started our bicycle trip with Follow me guides, we realized that it could be possible and (!) fun.They showed us the places, which are not accessible for tourists any more. The tight and cozy streets lead us through undiscovered areas, which were typical for the real Thailand. The local people seemed to be happy and greeted us kindly, especially my eight-year old sister who also attended the tour. Except for touring in that areas, we should also cope with riding a bike in the middle of the traffic. It was not as nice as going through the small streets, but it had its own charm. Our two guides did their best to make our ride safe. The guide showed us also some special places like famous temples and China Town. We had also the possibility to experience the life of real Thai school. The kids were amazed by our visit and wanted to have the photo with us. After that we passed the river with the ferry and went sightseeing the previous capital of Thailand.Another thing worth mentioning is our lunch at the market. If there was no person who recommended this ‘restaurant’, we would never stop there. But in spite of the fact that that place looked weird, the food was great. We paid 8 Euro for delicious lunch for eight people!Our bicycle tour lasted for 5 hours. Even though our speed was not high and we did less than 25 km, we were quite exhausted after that. The owner of Follow me company greeted us with the very good barbecue. Beside this, we could also try fish spa at his place.The weather was so kind to us that it started to rain immediately after we had sat in the covered terrace and began to eat.In the evening we could see the photos from our trip on Facebook. We highly recommend the trip with Follow me Bicycle Tours :)

Excellent way to spend an afternoon seeing Bangkok. I have visited Bangkok many times in recent years and had never thought of going on a bike tour. Infact I only realised you could when using tripadvisor to research something else and the link appeared on my screen. I booked the day before by visiting the clubhouse in person and was made to feel welcome, all of my questions were answered before booking. I returned the following lunch time for my afternoon "China town" tour, which started with a drink and a briefing from our tour guide Tobb. Once we selected our bikes we made our way through parts of Bangkok that you wouldnt normally see as a traveller. The pace of the tour is relaxed, certainly not hard work and the guide was very knowledgable and spoke good English. The tour concluded four hours later with a BBQ and a fish pedicure back at the clubhouse which was the perfect end to a good afternoon. I certainly didnt even feel like I had ridden a bike, especially for 20km and for anybody considering this tour but concerned about fitness or the distance there is nothing to worry about, plenty of water and photo stops and a visit to a cathedral and a temple with opportunity to stretch your legs. All in all an well organised tour and a good way to see Bangkok. Within a couple of hours of leaving at the end of the tour, the photos taken by the tour guide had been emailed to me as promised, all included in the price.

Bangkok From Another Perspective. I have been living in Bangkok for the past 4 years now and thought I had seen most aspects of this city. However, after stumbling across the idea of taking a bike tour while surfing the internet, I decided that it might be worth a whirl. Out of all the places I researched, Follow Me seemed to have the best equipment, facilities, perks etc., so I decided to try a tour with them, and I wasn't disappointed. The bikes were top notch, the staff were great, the clubhouse was fantastic, and the free BBQ topped it all off! I enjoyed it so much that I actually went back tried the other tour too.Both tours were great, and it's hard to decide which one I preferred most... They both gave me different views of the city, but the Green Lung tour was the most surprising. Like I said, I have been here for 4 years, and I had no idea that Bangkok had a veritable Jungle nestled in the middle of it! The tour takes you from the clubhouse in the center of the city, over the river by boat and into a jungle! The tour guides were great on both trips, but I guess they came into their own during the China Town trip, as there was much more them to tell us about. Once again, we were treated to a side of the city rarely seen, even by permanent residents like myself! The guides were very knowledgeable and had some nice facts about most of the sites visited.After returning to the clubhouse from both tours, we were treated with a free BBQ in a very communal atmosphere. There was also beer available, which was the perfect relaxant after a long ride!Great tours, fully recommended.Tom

I'd never have thought of it. Whilst taking a long weekend break in Bangkok I got talking to a bloke in the pub (like you do) and he told me of the day he had just had on a bicycle tour. What? Here in Bangkok? In this heat?.... anyway, I found my self the very next morning heading to the base of Follow Me Bicycle Tours and shortly after I was off on the SIam Sawan tour!... The bike was comfortable, well maintained and easy to ride.. The guides were super and very knowledgeable with great English language skills. All in all, an eye opening view of Bangkok and the surroundings. It was all finished off with a free BBQ back at the base and a welcome cold beer!!

Absolutley fabulous and great care. We went on the tour with 2 adults and 2 children and were joined by one woman from New Zealand. We had a great trip, it was almost a private tour. Our guide was great and stopt whenever we asked. Follow me had great gear, new bikes, reals good stuff. No hurry, no quick quick quick because they don't squeeze in two trips a day! Afterwards a fantastic BBQ and a NIPPY FISH-tank. The kids loved it all, including Ray's(owner) little daughter Cloe. What a darling!

Fab, professional and fun bike tour!. Currently Follow Me have two tours - I have been fortunate enough to go on both tours and I am eagerly looking forward to the launch of future tours. A few months ago I went on their Siam Historical Tour with my husband. We got a discounted tour from a promotional website in Bangkok (to help with the launch of the company). They were only just starting up and we went along to find out what it was like. Staff were friendly and professional. The bikes are new and good quality. We had a guide at the front, as well as one at the back to ensure no one got lost. The pace was good and is suitable for most people. I was a bit worried about cycling along the busy streets of Bangkok but our guide looked after us and safely guided us over the busy roads. Occasionally we needed to carry our bikes over bridges and up stairs but our guides were always on hand to help. We stopped regularly to have a refreshing drink and learn a bit about the area from the knowledgeable guides. You don't actually spend that long on the big, main roads. A lot of the tour is spent in narrow alleyways where you can really get to see everyday life in China town. My husband and I enjoyed this tour so much that when we had friends visiting from the UK in May, we came back to do the second tour, Siam Heaven. This tour goes through the slums of Bangkok, before crossing the river (by boat) and cycling through what is known as the 'Lungs of Bangkok'. This is a green area of Bangkok that I never knew existed before, despite living here for 3 years. The air is clean and it's very still and quiet. You ride along elevated, narrow walkways and need to take care with your steering otherwise you might end up in the marsh! My friends also really enjoyed this tour, especially as you get to see a different side to the Bangkok that most tourists experience. My favourite part of the tour has to be the BBQ at the end of the tour. After a hot, sticky but enjoyable bike tour, you go back to the club house where a delicious BBQ is waiting for you. Beers and other drinks are available to purchase and it is a lovely way to end the tour, chatting with staff and the other visitors. They also have a fish spa which is also fun. Thanks Follow Me for two great days out. Looking forward to the next tour and would recommend you to all my friends and family. One of my friend's with children also went on this trip and it was suitable for children too.

I had never seen this side of Bangkok before and I've lived here for 4 years.. Last week some friends and I went on a Bicycle tour of Bangkok. Even though I've lived in Bangkok for several years I was amazed at the parts of the city we accessed and how different it is to the everyday Bangkok that I know and live in.The tour was called Siam Sawan and takes in a part of Bangkok on the other side of the Chao Phraya River called Prapadeang or the "lungs of Bangkok". We crossed the river on a small motor boat and then cycled into what seemed like jungle at first. It was amazing to think that we were only a couple of kilometres from the very centre of the city. On raised concrete tracks we made our way through jungle swamp land teaming with bird and God only knows what else and it was really quite cool and refreshing. Finally emerging in an enormous botanic parkland that seemed to go on forever. On the way back we toured through narrow lanes and Soi's that I would never have been game to venture down alone. All up it was truly an amazing experience, even for my group of mainly, ex-pat friends. I'd highly recomment it to anyone visiting Bangkok.

Great way to see Bangkok & good value for money!. We booked the bike tour a day before and it was great! The bikes are almost new, and the tour-guide and owner are really helpful. We took the morning tour to escape the hot weather, when we arrived we were welcomed with coffee and water ( good to wake up @ 8:00 AM) then we drove into small alleys, and trough local markets, went on the boat, and we saw all kinds of things you would otherwise never see! We tasted local food and drinks on the go and when we got back, a fish spa and BBQ were for us, all included in the price!!Highly recommended!!

An Amazing Day with amazing people. Me and my friend went on a Biking Tour, we did both China town tour and the "green tour" more of a jungle style i loved both of them as they are very different from each other.The China town tour is a very interesting and rich full experience as takes you to many different areas , passing through very small alley , seeing to local people, temples, monument and the famous temple of WAT ARUN...etc . The other tour is for everybody how loves nature absolutely beautiful a "hidden gem" in the middle of the city. The tour guides they are very friendly and helpful with any question that you have.i can recommend this to everyone with families, children, teenagers, friends for a fun and great day out. In the end of the tour you can have a free BBQ and some drinks to relax.

Excellent!!. We (my husband and I) found this Bike Tour via the internet so we weren't really sure what to expect. But but but the moment that we stepped into the Follow Me Bike Tours office, we knew that we're in really good hands and that we were in for a very fun day. The Follow Me office is a beautiful, clean house converted into an office, with a lush garden, a fish pond, and a sitting area in a hut by the garden - which instantly gave me the impression that this office and this tour is managed really well. And I wasn't mistaken. The tour took us to places we've never been to before (we've been living in Thailand for 4 yours now) via Bangkok's side streets, markets, bridges, boats. We passed by the Chinese and Muslim communities, and areas where ordinary Thai people live. We also went to see famous and not so known temples alike, crossed the Chao Praya river, went on a bike path by the river (really beautiful), stopped for some Thai fruit and even had a glimpse of Thais playing Sepak Takraw under a flyover.The above, coupled with the really warm welcome we received from the owner/s and staff of Follow Me, made our day a really memorable one. In fact, we loved the tour so much that we are again booking another tour with them this weekend. :-)

The best way to discover the real Bangkok. We had a great tour last February. Very friendly tourguides and the BBQ in the garden afterwards was also get. If you want to make a biketour in Bangkok, Follow Me is the place to be!
The best bicycle tour i have ever been on, great bicycles,BBq and fish spa!. If you want to discover Bangkok, Follow Me is the Company to visit.

Great bike tour and nice BBQ afterwards. I went on a tour with Follow with a couple of friends. We went on the tour through Chinatown. I live in Bangkok for quite some while but seen things I never saw before. After the whole tour you get your barbeque which is great after all the exercise. You can also make use of the free fish spa which is fun, it tickles. It is great value for your money.

Exciting way to see Bangkok. We went on the Siam Boram tour which took us along many narrow alleyways, through markets including Chinatown, the riverside and visiting a wat, church and pagoda. The tour consisted of about 10 customers and 2 tour guides who were very attentive and informative. It was very exciting throughout and we saw a very different side to Bangkok with much smaller homes along the alleyways plus literally riding through the markets. There were short two boat trips on the main Chaopraya river, adding variety and interest. We were well catered for with bottles of water supplied at the start, fruit and drinks halfway through and a bbq buffet with fish spa at the end. The bikes were good quality, suitable for kids as well and helmets are available for use in the office. Some tips: wear sunscreen and consider wearing a cap as you are exposed to the sun for much of the tour, take a camera- lovely sights during the tour, watch kids on the roads as some drivers are inconsiderate to cyclists and we had a few close encounters during the short time spent on the main roads. During the hot season, the morning tour may be cooler and more comfortable. I wore open toe sandels which proved to be a bad idea when my son did an emergency stop in front of me and my toes acted as a brake against his bike! Ouch! Trainers would have been better. Vegetarians- worth taking something and they are more than happy to cook it separately from the meat for you. Sweetcorn and rice is also provided with the buffet. Finally, it is hard to find...worth the company putting up more signs and keep their phone number handy in case you can't find it (we couldn't and we know Sathorn Road very well). Parking is limited and on the narrow street nearby- may be worth taking a taxi instead.
